name: Westvale Abbey // Ormendahl, Profane Prince
text: "I love what I've done with the place."

name: Screeching Bat // Stalking Vampire
text: Each form she takes is an exploration of the senses.

name: Galvanic Blast
text: Mirrodin has little weather, but it certainly has lightning.

name: Unnatural Selection
text: What nature makes, magic can modify.

name: Furyborn Hellkite
text:
"Careful. A drop of blood here means death for us all."
—Kalek, mountain guide

name: Merfolk Trickster
text: Saved from destruction by one planeswalker's sacrifice, the Eliterate colony forswore the taking of life.

name: Hallowed Fountain
text: A place to relax, if you have the proper permit.

name: Grenzo, Havoc Raiser
text: "You burn. I'll pillage."

name: Dark Nourishment
text: Demons lurk in the shadows of ancient ruins, spreading plague and corruption across the land.

name: Go-Shintai of Ancient Wars
text: It seeks those consumed with rage and offers burning blades.

name: Needleverge Pathway // Pillarverge Pathway
text:
"The oxen here take an almost feline delight in pushing things over the edge."
—Akiri, kor line-slinger

name: Traumatize
text: You won't know what you're missing.

name: Rakdos Cluestone
text:
"Burn. Bleed. Enjoy."
—Cluestone inscription

name: Font of Magic
text: Warnis had always felt a glimmer of potential within herself, flickering just out of reach. That night, as the cultists attacked, it became a torrent of power that was hers to command.

name: Memory Theft
text: In the wilds, the ravens steal far more than baubles.

name: Enlightened Ascetic
text: "I do not reject the gods. I reject their authority, their pettiness, and their arrogance."

name: Magmatic Insight
text: Chief among the tenets of Purphoros is that one must destroy in order to create.

name: Hired Torturer
text: "Follow your passion, I always say. Might as well get paid to do what you love."

name: Juri, Master of the Revue
text: "What a show! We're going to make a killing tonight."

name: Necrotic Ooze
text: It looks like currant jam, smells like death, and tastes a bit like both.

name: Graphic Violence
text: WARNING: THE DOMINARIAN SURGEON GENERAL HAS FOUND THAT SAVAGE BEATINGS CAN LEAD TO CHUMP BLOCKS, LIFE REDUCTION, AND EVEN GAME LOSS.

name: Loyal Sentry
text: His watch ends only when he does.

name: Seasoned Marshal
text: He reads the battlefield like a map, always seeking the shortest route to victory.

name: Ivory Guardians
text: The elite guard of the Mesa High Priests, the Ivory Guardians, were created to protect the innocent and faithful. Some say their actions are above the law.

name: Ambush Party
text:
"Call it a cost of doing business. The best way to protect against thieves is to hire better thieves."
—Eron the Relentless

name: Ichor Shade
text: As oil seeped into their funeral shrouds, Tolvada's dead rose to join the invaders' ranks.

name: Galvanic Relay
text: Abandoned years ago, the experiment continues to iterate upon itself.

name: Demonic Tutor
text: "Mama says it's my imagination, but I know you'd never lie to me."

name: Zof Shade
text: It haunts the remnants of the Helix of Zof, leeching strength from the vast Eldrazi ruin.

name: Segmented Wurm
text:
"If only we could so easily leave behind those parts of ourselves that pain us."
—Crovax

name: Arguel's Blood Fast // Temple of Aclazotz
text: . . . to the lost temple of a bat-god of night, eternal enemy to the Threefold Sun.

name: Divine Offering
text: D'Haren stared at the twisted lump of metal that had been a prized artifact. The fight was getting ugly.

name: Throttle
text:
"The best servants are made from those who died without a scratch."
—Sidisi, khan of the Sultai

name: Goblin Glider
text:
"What's got two arms, one wing, and no brains?"
—Ghitu riddle

name: Deranged Assistant
text: "Garl, adjust the slurry dispensers. Garl, fetch more corpses. Garl, quit crying and give me your brain tissue. If he doesn't stop being so rude, I'm quitting."

name: Chandra's Magmutt
text:
"Is it purebred? No, but it's pure fire."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Progenitus
text: The Soul of the World has returned.

name: Thatcher Revolt
text: The dark times left the peasantry ready to fight with whatever weapons were at hand.

name: Harbinger of Night
text:
Embrace the Harbinger
—Suq'Ata expression meaning "abandon hope"

name: Death Watch
text:
"Watch death wait / Wait, death, watch / Steal breath swiftly / but steal life slowly."
—Suq'Ata dirge

name: Foxfire Oak
text:
"The brethren shall blaze with unnatural fire, and the flame shall consume and purify our rage."
—Treefolk catastrophe myth

name: Serra Avatar
text: "Serra isn't dead. She lives on through me."

name: Skirsdag Cultist
text: "Within blood is life. Within life is fire. Within fire is the path to our masters' glory!"

name: Carrion Rats
text:
"Just what I need—more competition."
—Cabal grave robber

name: Endless Wurm
text: Ages ago, a party of elves took cover to let one pass. They're still waiting.

name: Robe of Mirrors
text:
"Some say you cannot hit what you cannot see. I prefer that you hit what I want you to see."
—Arcanis the Omnipotent

name: Gilded Lotus
text:
"The ancient Necron race has achieved this pinnacle of elegance through their relentless pursuit of utility."
—Tech-Priest Darvin, executed for heresy 1256998.M41

name: Ascendant Evincar
text: His soul snared by an angel's curse, Crovax twisted heroism into its purest shadow.

name: Wu Infantry
text: The first battle of Hefei was Sun Quan's last as a field general. From then on he let his generals command in the field while he directed battle from behind the front lines.

name: Asphodel Wanderer
text: He killed out of hate, so now only hate sustains him. He sought immortality, so the gods gave it to him.

name: Spellheart Chimera
text: Thaumaturges remain silent around chimeras, lest their words conjure even stranger beasts.

name: Ardent Dustspeaker
text: "The Founder Dragons weren't even hatched when this scroll was written!"

name: Syncopate
text: The fire spell stuttered and broke. Its pieces reached Teferi out of rhythm, meaningless.

name: Death Speakers
text:
"The dead may be beyond the law, but speaking the wisdom of the dead will afford no protection!"
—Calmont, Aysen bureaucrat

name: Augmenting Automaton
text: When you have taught an automaton how to build others of its kind, it is a small step to make it build itself.

name: Ertai's Trickery
text: "Don't worry, Gerrard," said Ertai. "I'm sure the crew will come to your rescue as quickly as they came to mine."

name: Flaming Sword
text:
"It's not Talruum crystal, but I must admit—it gets the job done."
—Tahngarth

name: Fabled Path of Searo Point
text:
"Who built such a wonder?"
"It took many hands."

name: Ogre Errant
text: Knights kept returning from Ogre's Pass wearing nothing but bruises, so they decided to just pretend it was on their side.

name: Indigo Faerie
text: "You should see your face right now."

name: Feat of Resistance
text: Dragons are extinct on Tarkir, but Abzan magic still emulates their endurance.

name: Harnessed Snubhorn
text: Survivors put the strength of former war mounts to good use clearing the rubble of Orazca.

name: Mutilate
text:
"They appreciate my handiwork. I hear their joy in every scream."
—Chainer, dementia master

name: Zodiac Rat
text: " . . . Cao Pi, Cao Rui, Fang, Mao, and briefly, Huan— / The Sima took the empire in their turn. . . ."

name: Drogskol Infantry // Drogskol Armaments
text: When he could no longer carry on, he imparted his strength to the one who took up his duty.

name: Maze Sentinel
text: The route has been known for millennia, but only by those with no means to tell it.

name: Killing Wave
text:
"I come looking for demons and I find a plane full of angels. I hate angels."
—Liliana Vess

name: Show of Valor
text:
"As the knight struggled to stand, his squire took up his blade. The foe advanced not a single step."
—Krinnea, *Siege of the Bone Spire*

name: Esper Sojourners
text: The wilder the frontier, the greater the need for a controlling hand.

name: Ghostform
text: "There's no such thing as 'impenetrable.'"

name: Llanowar Mentor
text: "One day the vines of this forest will be as much a part of you as your own fingers."

name: Trap Essence
text:
"Meat sustains the body. The spirit requires different sustenance."
—Arel the Whisperer

name: Stensia Banquet
text:
"We can't win a war on an empty stomach, can we?"
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Karplusan Giant
text:
"They aren't the brightest or the quickest of Giants. For that matter, the same holds true if you compare them to rocks."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Viridian Revel
text:
"Let them have their revel. Soon those who won't submit will be turned. Those who won't be turned will die."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Cursed Flesh
text: A farewell to arms . . . and feet . . . and legs . . .

name: Cadira, Caller of the Small
text: She roams the border between wilderness and civilization, protecting those who need it most.

name: Obsianus Golem
text:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone . . ."
—"Song of the Artificer"

name: Elvish Rejuvenator
text: "As long as its roots still reach the soil, I can heal it."

name: Feldon's Cane
text: Feldon found the first of these canes frozen in the Ronom Glacier.

name: Ethercaste Knight
text: "We coat ourselves in steel every day. What is etherium but the next logical step?"

name: Millstone
text:
"In the lean months, communities lived off a bitterwheat berry so tough that its flour contained more millstone than grain."
—*On the Early History of Keld*

name: Rocket Launcher
text: What these devices lacked in subtlety, they made up in strength.

name: Search for Survivors
text: There's no rest for a Keldon.

name: Contemplation
text:
"How fascinating it is to watch the machinations of one's own mind play themselves out."
—Volrath

name: Naya Sojourners
text: The elves had entered a land like an open grave-an act of fortitude or folly?

name: Despise
text:
"Truth is always a weapon in your enemies' hands."
—Geth, Lord of the Vault

name: Ray of Command
text: "Heel."

name: Storybook Ride
text: The ride is whimsical and fun, except when it's broken.

name: Darkling Stalker
text:
"In this dark place, yes, I *am* afraid of my own shadow."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Zo-Zu the Punisher
text:
"He can cause a lot of pain and do it with no fuss. That's all good, but I just wish he didn't do it to us!"
—Ku-Ku, akki poet

name: Lim-Dûl's Hex
text:
"The weak shall fall. The strong shall remain."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Suspend
text: Time moves in mysterious ways.

name: Stone Haven Medic
text: "These days, soldiers never stick around long enough for a proper healing. They just want me to knit them up so they can hurry back to the fight."

name: Rock Basilisk
text: In the eastern reaches of Jamuraa are arrangements of massive stones. No one knows their origins—for certain.

name: Goblin Flectomancer
text: Rerouting magic through a goblin's brain is the surest way to throw it wildly off course.

name: Experimental Frenzy
text: Turns out coffee is the weird aunt of invention.

name: Testament Bearer
text: She proudly carries the weight of Phyrexia's creed, both figuratively and literally.

name: Bankrupt in Blood
text: "Your spirits can rest in peace, for your debts are paid."

name: Morkrut Banshee
text:
"Let go your grudges, or risk wandering the bogs forever in a murderous rage."
—Hildin, priest of Avacyn

name: Rotted Hulk
text:
The hulk rose from the sea and loomed over the Champion. Pinned beneath the twisting, rotted planks of wood was the body of Kaliaros, the helmsman of her former crew, and beside him the captain, Photine.
—*The Theriad*

name: Nomad Outpost
text: The old woman murmured, her last words too hoarse, too quiet to understand. The Envoy steeled herself, feebly disguising her grief: "The pilgrimage begins at dawn."

name: Scavenger Folk
text: String, weapons, wax, or jewels—it makes no difference. Leave nothing unguarded in Scarwood.

name: Reaver Drone
text: Kozilek's brood infiltrates and deceives. The spawn of Ulamog mindlessly consume.

name: Foul Imp
text: The villagers call it "winged stench."

name: Rapid Decay
text: The grave robbers arrived the day after the burial. They were a day too late.

name: Spirit Link
text: "We are all inextricably linked, souls woven in tapestry."

name: Jawbone Duelist
text: "I have room for a few more teeth in my collection. Who's next?"

name: Illithid Harvester // Plant Tadpoles
text: "Your mind belongs to the Emperor now."

name: Stirring Address
text: "For glory! For justice! For our queen!"

name: Mishra's Onslaught
text:
"Hah. Urza has underestimated my strength yet again."
—Mishra

name: Plated Geopede
text: It prefers a cooked meal, so it will eat you now and lava-bask later.

name: Improvised Armor
text: "I don't care if it's covered in rust, blood, or enemy insignias. If it'll stop an arrow, I'll take it."

name: Lightning Mare
text: When it passes, storm clouds bolt across the land.

name: Mire in Misery
text: Misery loves company.

name: Bloodfire Colossus
text: It took all its strength to contain the fire within.

name: Stone Haven Pilgrim
text: The persistence to overcome obstacles is the most esteemed of kor virtues.

name: Read the Runes
text: "The world is a puzzle, and the mind is its key."

name: Intrusive Packbeast
text: Good at carrying things. Really good at knocking them down.

name: Aurochs
text: One aurochs may feed a village, but a herd will flatten it.

name: Wasteland Viper
text:
"The Gruul embrace all things poisonous and living in the cracks of society."
—Teysa Karlov

name: Sulfuric Vapors
text: It was the dragons who first learned to chase their prey into the vapors before igniting them.

name: Hollowhenge Scavenger
text: After werewolves slaughtered the citizenry of Hollowhenge, other creatures moved in.

name: Indomitable Archangel
text:
"Every sword drawn to defend is an angelic blade, guided to justice by an angelic hand."
—Auriok proverb

name: Verduran Enchantress
text:
"Weave the magic so that it sings to you, and will always fly home . . . ."
—Verduran teaching

name: Ancestral Vengeance
text: The defenses of the Abzan extend well beyond the walls of their fortresses.

name: Meteor Golem
text: The strongest golems are forged from meteoric iron that has been tempered in the heat of an elemental plane.

name: Pernicious Deed
text:
"The tyrannous and bloody deed is done, The most arch deed of piteous massacre That ever yet this land was guilty of."
—William Shakespeare, *Richard III*

name: Seismic Shudder
text:
"The land here seems to go out of its way to kill you."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Deathgaze Cockatrice
text:
"Sometimes I come across a stone finger or foot and I know I'm in cockatrice territory."
—Rulak, bog guide

name: Fortune Teller
text: TODAY'S FORTUNE: TO AVOID CERTAIN DOOM, MAKE SURE TO . . . INSERT ADDITIONAL TOKENS TO CONTINUE.

name: Air Elemental
text: As the ship approached, the jade totem rose high overhead. Power rippled. Eyes of stone glowed and crackled. Out hissed a breath of the world, and a windstorm came alive.

name: Sword Coast Sailor
text: You were born at sea, and your legs are steadiest when the waves are rowdiest.

name: Death Grasp
text: Yawgmoth's greatest joy came from watching one hero defeat another.

name: Seal of Fire
text: After the fourth time Chandra left a place engulfed in flames, she decided to just go ahead and make it her thing.

name: Goblin Goon
text: Giant-sized body. Goblin-sized brain.

name: Protocol Knight
text: "Ingress without proper writ of extraplanar intent? Unacceptable!"

name: Simic Signet
text: For the Simic Combine, its sigil serves not as an emblem of honor but as a trademark. Its familiar image on any biological commodity attests to superb craftsmanship, ingenious innovation, and higher cost.

name: Eternal Witness
text: "I have watched over this land since the first seedling emerged from the primeval soil."

name: Akki Coalflinger
text: No matter where you find them, goblins love rocks.

name: Force of Negation
text: Not even the most scathing critics can break her concentration.

name: Befoul
text:
"The land putrefied at its touch, turned into an oily bile in seconds."
—Radiant, archangel

name: Call of the Wild
text: From a whisper to a roar, the call is heard by all and refused by none.

name: Sinister Concoction
text: An old family recipe for an old family grudge.

name: Behemoth Sledge
text: Those who worship the great gargantuans could hardly be expected to fight with a subtle weapon.

name: Sprite Dragon
text: Size of a pixie, rage of a hellkite.

name: Dunerider Outlaw
text: Tales of the outlaw's cruelty and might grew more embellished with each crime.

name: Sram, Senior Edificer
text:
"Always have the right tool for the job, especially if the job is blasting Phyrexians in the face."
—Monument inscription

name: Snare the Skies
text: A hunter's precision and a durkvine's strength are a potent combination.

name: Mentor of the Meek
text: "Today's the last day you'll fear sewer crocs, Garg. From now on, the sewer crocs will fear you."

name: Fire Elemental
text: Fire elementals are ruthless infernos, annihilating and consuming their foes in a frenzied holocaust. Crackling and blazing, they sear swift, terrible paths, leaving the land charred and scorched in their wake.

name: Rhystic Scrying
text:
"The trick is to ask when no one's listening."
—Alexi, zephyr mage

name: Mind Stone
text:
"Not by age but by capacity is wisdom gained."
—Titus Maccius Plautus, *Trinummus*

name: Sanctimony
text: "The peasants labor for my profit. I approve."

name: Soul Feast
text:
"I smell the tang of a mortal's fresh blood. I hear it sliding wetly beneath its skin. My hunger cannot refuse the invitation."
—Yuri, Sengir vampire

name: Mirror of Fate
text: As the glass shattered, forgotten realities and dead memories came flooding back.

name: Dune Beetle
text: The scouring sands of Shefet polish its carapace, and the ranks of the cursed fill its belly.

name: Violent Outburst
text: Yarn unspooled, squeaky toys de-squeaked, upholstery torn to shreds—it was carnage.

name: Mutilate
text: Liliana developed a fondness for the moment when roaring becomes squealing.

name: Wall of Wood
text: Orcish lumberjacks spent the night sharpening their blades and resting for a day of labor. They awoke to find that the forest had been making its own preparations.

name: Unmake the Graves
text: "I'm raising an army. Any volunteers?"

name: Turn to Mist
text:
"Did you expect me to dodge? How quaint."
—Olka, mistmeadow witch

name: Cremate
text: Death's embrace need not be cold.

name: Wind Dancer
text:
"Flying like a bird does not make you as free as one."
—Volrath

name: Crimson Hellkite
text:
"Dragonfire forged me a warrior."
—Rashida Scalebane

name: Aetherplasm
text: Its fickle form holds hints of a thousand former identities.

name: Consulate Turret
text:
"Our watchtowers are well positioned. Why don't we arm them?"
—Enforcer-Chief Ranaj

name: Wall of Corpses
text:
"I shall make walls of their flesh, and their blood will be my mortar."
—Kaervek

name: Epitaph Golem
text: Many names and many memories bound together in grim purpose.

name: Misshapen Fiend
text: You'd scarcely believe they could fly until they drop out of the sky onto you.

name: Knight of Dawn's Light
text: "Phyrexians destroyed my village, but they cannot break my hope."

name: Exquisite Archangel
text: A living invention born of a grand design.

name: Polluted Dead
text: After the zombie attack, crops withered on the vine, and the thriving village became a ghost town almost overnight.

name: Renegade Demon
text: Confront it at your own peril, for it will confront you for its own amusement.

name: Sunweb
text:
"There is no sweeter music than the wails of a dying dragon."
—Rashida Scalebane

name: Bloodthirsty Aerialist
text: A circus acrobat in life, she kills with such fluid grace that even her victims are awed by her performance.

name: Worldslayer
text:
"If that is what you seek, try looking in craters."
—Fodrus, mastersmith

name: Psychic Strike
text: Until more information could be gleaned about Niv-Mizzet's intentions, Lazav took every opportunity to stall his experiments.

name: Pit Trap
text:
Never forget your feet
—Elvish expression meaning "watch your step"

name: Kynaios and Tiro of Meletis
text: "Look what we fought for. Look what we built together."

name: Sigrid, God-Favored
text: Never alone, never afraid.

name: Thalia, Guardian of Thraben
text: No stranger to monstrous foes, Thalia marshaled surviving cathars, townspeople, and even ghoulcallers into an unbreakable fighting force.

name: Obsidian Giant
text: After a while, ships stopped sailing within his reach.

name: Blackblade Reforged
text: A weapon of evil, redeemed in Gideon's hand.

name: Ranger en-Vec
text:
"The path of least resistance will seldom lead you beyond your doorstep."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Ride Down
text: The Order of Saint Traft cleared the roads of cultists and horrors, opening the way for the villagers to flee Thraben.

name: Shackles
text: Shackles of gold are still shackles.

name: Jori En, Ruin Diver
text: "Some relic hunters have given up exploring and gone to fight the Eldrazi. But I know our work is more important than ever. The secrets we uncover could lead to the world's salvation."

name: Disease Carriers
text: Rath is a disease all its inhabitants carry.

name: Cinder Crawler
text: The crawler doesn't care what gets in its way. It pushes everything into the boiling muck and waits for the meal to cook.

name: Political Trickery
text:
"Politics is a game—move a stone here, move a stone there—except sometimes the stones bleed."
—Shauku, Endbringer

name: Dismissive Pyromancer
text: "Burn. Burn. Keep. Burn."

name: Desertion
text: First the insult, then the injury.

name: Copy Enchantment
text: Simic mages create redundant backups of their experiments to reduce the consequences of catastrophe.

name: Heartwood Storyteller
text: His roots reach deep, nurtured not by soil and rain, but by millennia of experience.

name: Shadowbane
text: Light creates shadow; light destroys shadow. Such is the transience of darkness.

name: Key to the City
text: It would be unfortunate if the key fell into the wrong hands.

name: Engineered Plague
text:
"The admixture of bitterwort in the viral brew has produced most favorable results."
—Phyrexian progress notes

name: Cascading Cataracts
text:
"The rushing water is as the God-Pharaoh. It encompasses all. It nurtures all."
—Temmet, vizier of Naktamun

name: Induce Despair
text: All the angel saw was her doom.

name: Master's Call
text: The need to obey was inscribed on every plate in their bodies.

name: Gnottvold Hermit // Chrome Host Hulk
text: Now they saw the truth. Divisions between Hagi and Torga were meaningless. There was only Phyrexia.

name: Barl's Cage
text: For a dozen years the cage had held Lord Ith, but as the Pretender Mairsil's power weakened, so did the bars.

name: Rootwater Alligator
text: Subduing and skinning an alligator is the first rite of maturity adolescent merfolk must pass.

name: Bounce Chamber
text: It's a raucous, ricochet-ridden romp, loosely based on the molecular movement inside exploding stars.

name: Gaea's Skyfolk
text: The grace of the forest and the spirit of the sea.

name: Rhystic Study
text:
"I'll teach you the leyline paratrigonometrics, no problem. But you need to show me how to make that fiery swirly thing."
—Zimone, to Rootha

name: Jousting Dummy
text:
"Don't let it fool you. Many of us got our first scars from Syr Nobody."
—Syr Layne, knight of Embereth

name: Skyshroud Archer
text: In Rath, arrows are guided not by virtue but by necessity.

name: Sneaky Homunculus
text: Keep watch only for the giants and you'll be eaten by the ants.

name: Tunneler Wurm
text: If an anurid's lucky, it'll find a warm tunnel for bedtime. If a wurm's lucky, it'll find a warm anurid for breakfast.

name: Lightning Spear
text: When wielded, it begs to be released.

name: Prakhata Club Security
text: It's rare that the Prakhata Club closes its doors. It's also rare that Lord Gonti meets with Consul Kambal. What are the odds the two would occur on the same day?

name: Terrain Elemental
text:
"You tread upon the land all the time, yet you seem dismayed when it moves to step on you."
—Nissa Revane

name: Scavenging Harpy
text: Desecrating the dead is a convenient way for harpies to expand their foul collections.

name: Rakeclaw Gargantuan
text: Naya teems with gargantuans, titanic monsters to whom both nature and civilization defer.

name: Scout's Warning
text: "There is no tactic I enjoy more than ambushing the ambushers."

name: Skystrike Officer
text: "Landing zone is clear. Activate and deploy!"

name: Flash Counter
text: "So much for that bright idea!"

name: Undead Servant
text:
"There are always more like you."
—Modriss of Zargoth Fen

name: Steelclad Spirit
text: Some geists imitate the lives they left behind. Others follow the dreams they never realized.

name: Mothrider Samurai
text: When the night blossoms open, the wings of Eiganjo take flight.

name: Duress
text:
"Magic brought peace to the Vastlands but was soon corrupted."
—*The Mystic Age: A Saga of Spells*

name: Antagonize
text:
"The little guy had guts at least. You can see 'em right there between those cobbles."
—Glunk, freelance crusher

name: Monastery Flock
text:
"The arrow strikes one bird down, but the flock remains."
—Jeskai teaching

name: Boon of Boseiju
text: She closed her eyes and remembered the smell of the leaves of Jukai Forest. When she opened them, the buildings of Towashi had grown small.

name: Outnumber
text: Everyone who could still lift a weapon had a part in retaking Sea Gate.

name: Meeting of Minds
text:
"If something seems impossible, you probably haven't tried asking for help."
—Niambi, cleric of Dominaria

name: Selesnya Sentry
text: Ravnicans still tell tales about the Battle of Sumala where four Selesnya sentries held off an entire clan of Gruul warriors.

name: Geomancer's Gambit
text: Telepathy changes minds, necromancy changes lives, but geomancy changes the world.

name: Mugging
text: Scream: muffled. Pockets: emptied. Neck function: never the same again.

name: Yoked Ox
text: The courage of those who work the land is born of long days of labor in the hot summer sun and the cold winter wind. It is the courage of the earth itself.

name: Court Street Denizen
text: "The Boros fight for justice. The Azorius fight for law. I hold the line between, and make sure the people are given both."

name: Bant Panorama
text: Bant's hearts are as pure as its air and as bright as its skies.

name: Diminish
text:
"'That was a narrow escape!' said Alice, a good deal frightened at the sudden change, but very glad to find herself still in existence."
—Lewis Carroll,
*Alice's Adventures in Wonderland*

name: Emerald Oryx
text: After the oryx dies, its flesh returns to the earth, but its emerald bones remain as a tribute to the forest.

name: Trash Bin
text: "I had to wrestle a squirrel for it, but I won!"

name: Desynchronize
text: Before Kaya could pull Teferi's spirit back, the overloaded temporal anchor failed, and he was set adrift in the currents of time.

name: Vigilant Baloth
text: Villagers employ watchdogs as guardians and companions. Druids prefer something a little bigger.

name: Awaken the Sleeper
text:
"Without faith in each other, we truly would have nothing left. Isn't that right, Malach? ...Malach?"
—Darven, Mirran rebel, last words

name: Rapid Hybridization
text:
"We've merged your life essence with that of several creatures at once. You're welcome."
—Speaker Trifon

name: Dreampod Druid
text: "Don't mistake my creations for mere vegetation. They are my children, loyal and fierce."

name: Hapatra, Vizier of Poisons
text: Her subtle smile is suffused with venom.

name: Flaring Pain
text:
"I don't rub salt in wounds. I use sulfur."
—Matoc, lavamancer

name: Lumithread Field
text: Having conquered the Bastion of Suns, the Ota took its light for their own.

name: Icatian Scout
text:
"In these, our final days, I offer this. Though we could not save Icatia, we gave our children time to grow, and love, before it fell."
—Ailis Connaut, diary

name: Aerial Volley
text: Drakes can swerve to avoid a single arrow, but they can't dodge the whole sky.

name: Infuriate
text:
"No shirt, no shoes, no service."
—Marketplace sign

name: Gruesome Realization
text: Mishra was gone—all that remained was a machine wearing his face.

name: Ghastlord of Fugue
text:
"He is a ghost that has never known life."
—*The Seer's Parables*

name: Stormcloud Djinn
text: As fickle as lightning, as slippery as an eel.

name: Dawnhart Geist
text: "Our bodies may lie slain, but perhaps we can still complete the ritual. I'd rather not spend my afterlife in this wretched eternal night."

name: Court of Cunning
text: A throne built on wisdom cannot be toppled.

name: Storm Fleet Spy
text: "They're searching in the same direction we are. And for the same thing, I'll wager."

name: Mons's Goblin Waiters
text:
Poached Rukh Eggs
Rock
Cooked Rock
Unicorn-on-the-Cob
Wormfang Turtle Soup

name: Rampaging Hippo
text:
"Respect is earned through deeds—or the capacity to bite someone in half."
—Sana, former Ahn-crop initiate

name: Nezumi Bladeblesser
text: "It's not one or the other, kami or technology. Both offer power. I will not limit myself."

name: Seed Guardian
text: It is a reminder that spring will always follow winter.

name: Curse of Inertia
text:
"As long as I pull the strings, you will dance."
—Tezzeret

name: Rhox Bodyguard
text: An enlightened soul caged in a body made for battle.

name: Keldon Firebombers
text:
"If there isn't enough of Jamuraa left to stand on, I will still claim it for Keld."
—Latulla, Keldon overseer

name: Goblin Raider
text: He was proud to wear the lizard skin around his waist, just for the fun of annoying the enemy.

name: Commune with Spirits
text: The kami of Jukai Forest accept only the most respectful petitioners.

name: Angler Turtle
text: It is ancient, immense, and irresistible.

name: Guardians of Meletis
text: The histories speak of two feuding rulers whose deaths were celebrated and whose monuments symbolized the end of their wars. In truth they were peaceful lovers, their story lost to the ages.

name: Urza, Prince of Kroog
text: The prince consort was happy to let Yotia's coffers fund his extravagant research.

name: Leafdrake Roost
text:
"The best experiments are those whose successes replicate themselves."
—Yolov, Simic bioengineer

name: Enormous Baloth
text: La sua dieta è composta da frutta, piante, piccoli animali del bosco, grossi animali del bosco, boschi, frutteti, fattorie e piccole città.

name: Dissipation Field
text:
"Strike me once, shame on you. Strike me twice . . . Well, let's just see if you can."
—Kara Vrist, Neurok agent

name: Thornwood Falls
text: Deep in Eldraine's wilds, strange eyelike appendages twined among the vines and faerie lights.

name: Regicide
text: "You're done!"

name: Frenzied Devils
text:
"Devils need no reason to stir up chaos. The chaos itself is their reward."
—Rem Karolus, Fiendslayer

name: Nylea's Colossus
text:
"Those who seek my protection shall receive it."
—Nylea, god of the hunt

name: Guul Draz Vampire
text: "A creature's bloodscent is a beacon that cannot be disguised."

name: Stinging Lionfish
text: Starfish are its favorite prey.

name: Auriok Replica
text: All the loyalty of the Auriok with only a trace of their self-righteousness.

name: Sigiled Behemoth
text:
"Do not mistake a behemoth's assistance for subservience."
—Mayael the Anima

name: Herald of Dromoka
text: The trumpeters of Arashin are ever alert in their watch over the Great Aerie.

name: Bounteous Kirin
text: Even the most benevolent and life-giving of kami joined the war against the mortal world, but only with heavy and sorrowful hearts.

name: Gallowbraid
text:
"If its skin looks like stone, it is only to match its heart."
—Crovax

name: Nyxbloom Ancient
text: Ancient yet ever-young, it is wise and subtle—and cruel and reckless as the spring itself.

name: Smokespew Invoker
text: The Mirari festers in its flesh.

name: Beguiler of Wills
text: "Come, let me free you of the tyranny of thought."

name: Fling
text: Giants believe that tossing redcaps at knights is the best way to deal with both.

name: Moggcatcher
text: "They're not worth much, but they're easy to catch."

name: Artifact Blast
text: The first line of defense against Urza and Mishra, the Artifact Blast achieved widespread fame until an unlucky mage discovered it was useless on the devices the brothers had already created.

name: Bone Saw
text:
"When metal instruments are scarce, a saw constructed from the subject's femur will suffice for a craniectomy."
—Ashnod, research notes

name: Army Ants
text:
"Do not underestimate the power of many against one."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Peppersmoke
text: Like being trapped in a perpetual sneeze, faerie-dust poisoning is both exhilarating and agonizing.

name: Shalai's Acolyte
text: Armed by Multani, she protected the forest from above.

name: Steamflogger Boss
text: "Whip the Xs! Pinch the Os! What we're building, no one knows!"

name: Pathway Arrows
text: Also called "pathway stones," hedron shards can immobilize Eldrazi on contact.

name: Scar
text:
"What is a scar? A sign of courage in the face of danger? A mere trick of flesh? Or a constant reminder of agonizing pain, and the follies of war."
—Illulia of Nighthearth

name: Warfire Javelineer
text: Minotaurs favor magic that manifests as weapons wrapped in flame.

name: Insidious Will
text:
"We meet again, pyromancer."
—Baral, Chief of Compliance

name: Night Soil
text: The Elves gathered huge piles of rot to grow fungus. Out of imitation or forethought, the Thallids did the same.

name: Kjeldoran Royal Guard
text: Upon the frozen tundra stand the Kjeldoran Royal Guard, pikes raised, with the king's oath upon their lips.

name: Flamescroll Celebrant // Revel in Silence
text: "Stand up and fight!"

name: Ironroot Treefolk
text: The mating habits of Treefolk, particularly the stalwart Ironroot Treefolk, are truly absurd. Molasses comes to mind. It's amazing the species can survive at all given such protracted periods of mate selection, conjugation, and gestation.

name: Single Combat
text: Not even a threat to the entire Multiverse could persuade them to put aside their feud.

name: Demon of Death's Gate
text: The locks on the cages of the damned are opened with keys of marrow, sinew, and blood.

name: Fiery Islet
text: Where water is the canvas and lava the paint.

name: Bred for the Hunt
text:
"Looks like we've found the source. Torch it quick, before anything crawls out."
—Sergeant "Ripper" Jackson

name: Your Will Is Not Your Own
text: "Fool. I'll show you how to use that thing."

name: Crossroads Candleguide
text: Do the candleguides' heads turn to follow you as you pass, or is it merely a trick of the flickering light?

name: Bloodfire Mentor
text: The adept underwent months of preparation to withstand pain, until he was finally ready to receive the efreet master's teachings.

name: Garrison Griffin
text: The keen-eyed guardians of Ardenvale are ever on alert.

name: Death Bomb
text: There's no higher honor in Phyrexia than dying for Yawgmoth's glorious vision.

name: Giant Cindermaw
text:
"Don't excavate too far into those canyons. I promised your parents I'd return you in one piece."
—Tocasia

name: Cinder Wall
text:
"The smell of roasted flesh hung over the valley for hours."
—Onean sergeant

name: Goblin Bird-Grabber
text: "I opens my mouth to catches the bugs!"

name: Redwood Treefolk
text:
And would you strip the bark from a treefolk?
—Elvish expression meaning "Are you crazy?"

name: Underworld Coinsmith
text: Coins of the Underworld are shaped from clay funerary masks.

name: Clergy en-Vec
text:
"Faith's shield is hammered out by the blows of unbelievers."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Earth-Origin Yak
text: Deep in the Northern Mountains, the yaks linger silently, channeling the powers of the earth.

name: Blistercoil Weird
text: Azorius lawmages would like to outlaw the creation of weirds, but first they'd have to settle their long-standing debate on how to classify them.

name: Scribe of the Mindful
text:
"The best answers solve more than one riddle."
—Kefnet, god of knowledge

name: Akroma's Vengeance
text: Ixidor had only to imagine their ruin and Akroma made it so.

name: Put Away
text: Kithkin spellbottlers spend half their time preserving old memories and the other half punishing the new.

name: Ground Assault
text:
"Taking down a dragon is easy. All you need is enough space to get in a good swing."
—Narbulg Nine Fingers

name: Honored Heirloom
text: After the Travails, Runechanters set about repairing twisted symbols of Avacyn as the first step in restoring faith in the Church.

name: Dream Cache
text:
Dreams' riches are easily spent.
—Suq'Ata adage

name: Terrifying Presence
text: Elmut had slaughtered vampires, slain werewolves, and destroyed hordes of zombies. Sadly, he never got over his fear of spiders.

name: Phyrexian Broodlings
text: With limited resources and near unlimited time, Kerrick used parts from one beast to build another.

name: Sun's Bounty
text: "Heidar has forced the sun into hiding, but it has not forgotten us."

name: Phyrexian Vindicator
text:
"Behold your inevitable defeat."
—Elesh Norn

name: Flicker of Fate
text: An infinite journey in an infinitesimal time.

name: Executioner's Swing
text: "The contract specified an appendage for a missed payment. Read the fine print: the head is an appendage."

name: Overgrowth
text: Life needs no encouragement.

name: Stonebinder's Familiar
text:
"Hey, my great-great-grandfather had a dog just like that!"
—Dradiel, Lorehold mage-student

name: Lookout's Dispersal
text: Her song plucks the strings of the storm, shifting wind and storm into a harmony that will carry her ship to safety.

name: Bonded Fetch
text: A well-made homunculus grooms the mind of its master, pruning the thoughts that lead to madness. Few loredelvers survive the study of the infinite without one.

name: Warpath Ghoul
text: Ghouls are often found skulking on the fringes of great battles, showing themselves only to snatch the wounded and weak, dragging their victims screaming into the shadows.

name: Circuitous Route
text:
"The shortest path between two points is not always the safest."
—Tamina, district guide

name: Plummet
text: The dragon's noxious breath withered the forest. The whistle of a hundred arrows filled the air. The ground roiled as if shaken by an earthquake. The tyrant fell from the sky.

name: Lambholt Harrier
text:
"This Tovolar is no brainless brute. He sends his howling minions to terrorize a village for months. Sleepless nights and fear take their toll. Only then, when morale is at its worst, does he strike."
—Barnes, village watch

name: Praetor's Grasp
text:
"Wake up, new Phyrexian Planeswalker! You will not be the last."
—Jin-Gitaxias

name: Narcolepsy
text:
"It's so cute when it's sleeping, isn't it? Actually, it's still as abhorrent as ever, but at least it's not trying to kill us."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

name: Stonehoof Chieftain
text: The pounding of his followers' hearts matched the beat of his hooves, and their voices echoed his bellows.

name: Heartless Act
text:
"It's them or us."
—General Kudro

name: Sure Strike
text: "Everyone has a weak spot."

name: Dread Shade
text:
"The forest surrounding the Vess estate became the Caligo Morass, a vast bog stalked by horrors too terrible to name."
—"The Fall of the House of Vess"

name: Tresserhorn Skyknight
text: Kjeldorans who fled battle were exiled to the wastes. Those who strayed near Tresserhorn were pressed into service in Haakon's army.

name: Yomiji, Who Bars the Way
text:
"As I died, I rejoiced. I would see my family again. But then I woke up back on the battlefield. Back in Kamigawa. Back in hell."
—Kenzo the Hardhearted

name: Empty City Ruse
text: Out of time and options, Kongming was forced to bluff at Xicheng. He tricked an army of 150,000 Wei by leaving the city gates open and calmly playing the zither.

name: Gatekeeper of Malakir
text: "You may enter the city—once the toll is paid."

name: Snowfield Sinkhole
text:
"Young Vitima bellowed to the Cosmos, daring the gods to punish her hubris! Well, she got their attention, as you can see."
—Iskene, Kannah storyteller

name: Starlight
text: Stars are like coins dropped into the night: their light buys safe passage.

name: Floodhound
text: Action: This creature is a BLOODHOUND formed entirely of WATER.

name: Malakir Blood-Priest
text: "From your veins to mine."

name: Scrap Mastery
text: "Where a lesser mind sees junk, I see infinite potential."

name: Lifesmith
text: The Sylvok see the artificer as a gardener, preparing the world for hardy growth.

name: Phantasmal Forces
text: These beings embody the essence of true heroes long dead. Summoned from the dreamrealms, they rise to meet their enemies.

name: Mystic Meditation
text:
"Still the mind and quiet the heart. Only then will you hear the Multiverse's great truths."
—Narset

name: Lash of the Whip
text:
"No matter who their fickle hearts worship, all mortals belong to one god in the end."
—Iadorna, death priest of Erebos

name: Divine Offering
text:
"The Phyrexians *are* vulnerable. Do not despair. We will prevail!"
—Juryan, rebel leader

name: Storm Sculptor
text: In his hands, the wind can become a weapon or a means of escape.

name: Knighted Myr
text:
"This one fights like a leonin!"
—Jor Kadeen

name: Renegade Demon
text:
"Have you ever cornered a wounded vampire? That's a walk in the cathedral garden in comparison."
—Tristen, Cathar Marshal

name: Barrage of Boulders
text: Crude tactics can be effective nonetheless.

name: Prismari Pledgemage
text: Many have the talent to create, but few have the courage to share their creations.

name: Arbor Armament
text:
"Llanowar's boughs are ever ready
To unleash an autumn of steel leaves."
—"Song of Freyalise"

name: Pilgrim's Eye
text: Each time it is sent to find a safe haven, it takes longer to return.

name: Cathars' Crusade
text: Avacyn's holy warriors kept hope alive in her darkest hours. Now they will carry that hope across Innistrad.

name: Jace's Defeat
text:
"I had hoped for more from you, Jace. But I expected as much."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Tukatongue Thallid
text: Jund's thallids tried to disguise their deliciousness by covering themselves in spines harvested from the tukatongue tree.

name: Dawnhart Wardens
text: "The balance of day and night is shattered. We must find the Moonsilver Key."

name: Mirror Wall
text:
"Breaking it would be about four hundred years bad luck."
—Nomad sentry

name: Immaculate Magistrate
text: Elves of the immaculate class weave flora into living creatures—sometimes to endorse an elite warrior, sometimes to create a breathing work of art.

name: Cascade Seer
text: "Perhaps you can't see the path, but that doesn't mean it isn't there."

name: Brainstorm
text:
"I reeled from the blow, and then suddenly, I knew exactly what to do. Within moments, victory was mine."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran royal mage

name: Summit Apes
text:
"If you climb Skyfang Peak, avoid the pass. Generations of apes made that trail, and they don't tolerate trespassers."
—Sachir, Akoum Expeditionary House

name: Prodigious Growth
text:
"Look how cute it is now!"
—Vivien Reid

name: Burning Wish
text: She wished for a weapon, but not for the skill to wield it.

name: Read the Bones
text: The dead know lessons the living haven't learned.

name: Soul Parry
text:
"I was called to this world of steel, and it will be my steel that answers."
—Elspeth

name: Balloon Peddler
text: The market festival turned out to be the high point of Jaffy's visit.

name: Karplusan Strider
text: The strider's long, loping gait is an adaptation that allows it to move quickly in deep snow.

name: Feral Shadow
text:
"The nightstalkers are such a minor power in Urborg. Their sad eagerness to elevate themselves makes them willing tools in the plundering of little Femeref."
—Kaervek

name: Eon Hub
text: Its power source is time itself. It absorbs unused minutes and hours, bringing the end of existence always closer.

name: Alluring Siren
text:
"The ground polluted floats with human gore,
And human carnage taints the dreadful shore
Fly swift the dangerous coast: let every ear
Be stopp'd against the song! 'tis death to hear!"
—Homer, *The Odyssey*, trans. Pope

name: Douse
text: The academy's libraries were protected by fire-prevention spells. Even after the disaster, the books were intact—though forever sealed in time.

name: Poison the Blade
text: "Breath of basilisk, sting of scorpion, or medusa's tears? All may be distilled, for a price."

name: Calamity Bearer
text: He'd ignite the World Tree itself if he could.

name: Netherese Puzzle-Ward
text: Each configuration reveals a potential future.

name: Returned Reveler
text: The flesh is dead and the life forgotten, but old habits persist.

name: Crested Craghorn
text:
"Craghorns experience a wide range of emotions: rage, fury, anger . . ."
—Foothill guide

name: Coercion
text:
A rhino's bargain
—Femeref expression meaning "a situation with no choices"

name: Treasure Trove
text:
"Wealth means power; the power to subdue, to crush, to exploit, the power to enslave, to outrage, to degrade."
—Emma Goldman, "Anarchism"

name: Agonizing Memories
text:
"I think little of the foes I've slain. But I'm haunted by the friends I've sent to die."
—The Southern Paladin

name: Battershield Warrior
text: "I need no axe to best these weaklings."

name: Gisa and Geralf
text:
"These fiends are slightly less tolerable than you."
"A sentiment that warms my heart, sister."

name: Death Pit Offering
text:
"Kill them all and feed them to the new recruits."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

name: Spellbook
text: Knowledge knows no bounds.

name: Mentor of the Meek
text: "Today's the last day you'll fear sewer crocs, Garg. Form now on, the sewer crocs will fear you."

name: Zada's Commando
text:
"There's a word for someone who brings too much gear to battle: 'survivor.'"
—Zada of Slab Haven

name: Song of Creation
text: She wept, not from perfect understanding, but from serene gratitude.

name: Aviary Mechanic
text: Pilots take crippled skyships to the Aviaries, trusting Ghirapur's most talented mechanics to get them back into the air.

name: Vedalken Infiltrator
text: "An expert always keeps their tools close at hand."

name: Harpoon Sniper
text: Made from whiskergill bones, merrow spinebows can fire bolts through tree trunks.

name: Thrilling Encore
text: "Welcome to the winning team."

name: Rootwalla
text: If you try to sneak up on a rootwalla, you'll suddenly find yourself dealing with twice the lizard.

name: Hellrider
text:
"Behind every devil's mayhem lurks a demon's scheme."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors

name: Soul Summons
text: Ugin's magic reaches beyond the dragons. The clans have adapted it for war.

name: Bant Battlemage
text: "A night attack will be easy. We'll make an air raid over the Akrasan border. Just get me some flint to light the war torches."

name: Obscuring Haze
text: Whether hunter or hunted, Kathril chooses when it is seen.

name: Selesnya Guildgate
text: The Selesnya welcome all to help them heal the city's wounds. The price, however, is devotion to the guild and a selfless belief in Trostani.

name: Take Up the Shield
text: "You are all part of my pride. As long as I live, I will protect you."

name: Glimpse the Sun God
text: Better to be beneath Heliod's notice than beneath his heel.

name: Jungle Creeper
text:
"You cannot kill it, not for long. It ripens where the ground is soaked with the blood of the slaughtered."
—Atiuru, priest of the Verdant Sun

name: Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite
text: "The Gitaxians whisper among themselves of other worlds. If they exist, we must bring Phyrexia's magnificence to them."

name: Well of Lost Dreams
text: And at the dawn, when dreams slip away, they return to the well to await their next dreamer.

name: Return to the Earth
text:
"Dragons are feared for their breath and their bite, but it is their wings that make them unconquerable. Bring them to earth, and they die like any other beast."
—Kassur, Sultai hunter

name: Ruhan of the Fomori
text: Unfettered by allegiance, driven by war.

name: Debt to the Deathless
text: Some of Orzhov's cruelest collectors remember their debtors by taste alone.

name: Roar of the Crowd
text: One voice is but a pebble to the rest of the world. A thousand voices at once is an avalanche.

name: Syndicate Messenger
text:
"Many wings haunt the skies these days. Few of them bear good tidings."
—Lavinia

name: Sage of Mysteries
text: "I see destruction, suffering, and one tormented glimmer of hope."

name: Angel of Mercy
text: A song of life soars over fields of blood.

name: Onyx Goblet
text: The goblet was a gift from the sphinx Gorael, who hoped humans and vedalken would eventually destroy each other to acquire it, leaving all of Esper to her own kind.

name: Galina's Knight
text: "Are they on our side?" asked Sisay. "If they kill Phyrexians they are," replied Gerrard.

name: Glorifier of Dusk
text: "The blood of the enemy is a sacrament. The strength it gives is proof that our cause is just."

name: Whimwader
text:
"Thought? Deceit? Progress? Now you're just making it hungry."
—Abral, kithkin alchemist

name: Essence Fracture
text:
"Shaping reality is simply a matter of knowing where to apply pressure."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

name: Tarpan
text:
"A good tarpan will serve you, faithful and true. A bad one will kick you in the head."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Iona's Blessing
text:
"Walk now in my light. When the rest of the world closes its eyes, you will still see."
—Iona

name: Inventor's Apprentice
text:
"Everyone starts off making garbage. If you finally make something halfway decent, it'll be the best day of your life."
—Nehra, inventor

name: Escaped Experiment
text: One morning, the test subject decided to perform trials on the scientists.

name: Ardenvale Tactician // Dizzying Swoop
text: In a castle that prizes loyalty above all, the bond between knight and griffin is unmatched.

name: Akki Underminer
text:
"Deep inside the Sokenzan Mountains, a band of akki discovered a cache of ancient items of power. Their ensuing spree of destruction became known as 'The Three Days of Fun.'"
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Deepglow Skate
text:
"Blue, glossy green, and velvet black,
They coiled and swam; and every track
Was a flash of golden fire."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Spore Burst
text: Seeds from Jund don't drift gently on the wind. They get up and stampede.

name: Shaleskin Bruiser
text: Its only predators are the elements.

name: Ringwarden Owl
text: The owls learn of mana from the mages who know it best.

name: Inquisition of Kozilek
text: After the awakening of the Eldrazi, some vampires took it upon themselves to remind the others where their loyalty should lie.

name: Duelist of Deep Faith
text: "There is no hate behind our blades. We kill out of love, and the desire to share Norn's blessings with all."

name: Shizo, Death's Storehouse
text: Centuries ago, Shizo was a verdant field of wildflowers. After 891 samurai died in a single battle on its grasses, it became a haunted moor.

name: Ogre's Cleaver
text: She adopted the weapon of the slave-lord Kazuul, and with it, all his cruelty.

name: capital offense
text: part basket case, all lowercase.

name: Llanowar Augur
text: "I am irrelevant. The future I hold in my hands is everything."

name: Ivy Lane Denizen
text: "Skyknight gear? Well, I have drake-skin gauntlets, supple and fireproof. Or a ceratok chestplate that'll stop a crossbow bolt."

name: Massive Raid
text:
"The Boros lack vision. Give them a convenient scapegoat and they'll be blind to the true threats."
—Lazav

name: Twisted Experiment
text: Gatha showed remarkable prowess in increasing his subjects' stature. Their lifespans, however, were another matter.

name: Boros Recruit
text:
"Look at this goblin, once wild, untamed, and full of idiocy. The Boros have given him the skill of a soldier and focused his heart with a single cause."
—Razia

name: Paralyzing Grasp
text: The Halimar Sea Caves are both the breeding ground of giant squids and the dumping ground of hardened criminals.

name: Sadistic Obsession
text: Not everyone should take joy in their work.

name: Sparring Golem
text: "Part drill sergeant, part training dummy," thought Gerrard. "I hope it can stand up to a real war."

name: Golden Ratio
text:
"When I look around, I see a world defined by patterns that still manages to defy them."
—Kianne, Quandrix dean

name: Merfolk Looter
text: Merfolk don't always know what they're looking for, but they're certain once they find it.

name: Elsewhere Flask
text:
"My husband is clever enough to bottle the sky, and foolish enough to ignore its beauty."
—Queen Kayla bin-Kroog

name: Looming Shade
text: Its form never rests, propelled by some undetectable gale from beyond the gloom.

name: Seeds of Innocence
text:
"I have hidden from the machinations of Zhalfir for centuries. Why should I join *your* campaign?"
—Jolrael

name: Talisman of Progress
text:
"Any Cadian who can't field-strip their own lasgun by age ten was born on the wrong planet."
—Anonymous

name: Shield of the Avatar
text: We are made stronger by those we fight for. Designed by Richard Garriott

name: Worldly Tutor
text: Wisdom is a seed. Nurtured with patience and care, it will bear new fruit each season.

name: Ineffable Blessing
text: "Hallowed be this collection of miscellaneous items!"

name: Wolf Strike
text: Tovolar's howlpack had scattered, but the Dire-Strain survivors were still on the hunt.

name: Champion of the Flame
text: Grand Warlord Radha's challengers are always defeated, but she rewards the most passionate with the Flame of Keld. After that, they burn for her.

name: Manor Gate
text: A barrier that shields privileged eyes from the city's woes.

name: Wild Beastmaster
text: "When they covered the world in city, all they did was give themselves nowhere to run."

name: Crystal Rod
text: Polished by a thousand waves.

name: Padeem, Consul of Innovation
text: "Impress me."

name: Academy Manufactor
text: Automated systems at the Tolarian Academy sort new acquisitions for optimal use, determining which should be studied, eaten, or sold.

name: Scalelord Reckoner
text: The justice of dragons demands more than just an eye for an eye.

name: Wall of Earth
text: The ground shuddered violently and the earth seemed to come to life. The elemental force contained in the vast wall of earth was trapped, bent to its controller's will.

name: Gravebane Zombie
text:
"A zombie's bed must be a lumpy one or he wouldn't leave it so often."
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

name: Ledger Shredder
text: No evidence, no crime.

name: Bamboo Grove Archer
text: "Do not mistake tranquility for domestication. This land is wild, and will always remain so."

name: Keskit, the Flesh Sculptor
text: "Perfection is elusive. Let us try again."

name: Overgrown Tomb
text: The best funeral shroud is the fabric of new life.

name: Needleshot Gourna
text: The first aven scout squad returned from Krosa with disturbing stories. The second returned with disturbing casualties.

name: Shrieking Grotesque
text: Orzhov mage-sculptors bring their stone to life before they carve it. The shrieking begins as soon as the mouths are formed.

name: Death-Priest of Myrkul
text: "The Reaper bids you rise!"

name: Rigging Runner
text: The hook makes him feel brave, and the hat makes him feel fancy.

name: Flaring Flame-Kin
text: A flame-kin is always formidable, but feeding its fire with a sorcerous gift grants it the power to devastate armies.

name: Skywing Aven
text: "I am as the wind that bears me: harsh yet gentle, fleeting yet ever-present. Together we fly beyond imagination."

name: Undergrowth Scavenger
text: It sees a rotting carcass as a good wine which has been aged properly.

name: Impetuous Sunchaser
text: "I will soar higher than the walls of Akros! Higher than the clouds! Higher than Heliod himself!"

name: Combine Chrysalis
text:
"What do you want to be, now that you're grown up?"
—Yolov, Simic bioengineer

name: Enshrouding Mist
text: True faith is letting the blade fall without parry. True cunning is using that moment to strike a deadly blow.

name: Raise Dead
text:
"Life from death is part of the natural cycle. This is merely a shortcut."
—Tojira, swamp queen

name: Shatterskull Giant
text:
"Now I know why they call it Shatterskull Pass. Rocks fell all night like hammers smashing an anvil. It's no wonder the giants are angry all the time."
—Mitra, Bala Ged missionary

name: Unity of Purpose
text: Faced with the novel problem of inspiring an army, Jace asked himself: "What would Gideon say?"

name: Hand of Death
text: Death claims all but the darkest souls.

name: Spell Pierce
text:
"There's a hole in your plan."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

name: Lhurgoyf
text:
"Ach! Hans, run! It's the Lhurgoyf!"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words

name: Amulet of Safekeeping
text: Whether it is magical, lucky, or merely old, it is cherished, and that gives it power.

name: Korvold, Fae-Cursed King
text: Transformed at his own wedding, he promptly ate the banquet, the gifts, and the guests.

name: Flowstone Blade
text:
"Remember the fable of the elf who came upon a cave of gold. In trying to free the largest piece, she was crushed by its weight."
—Karn

name: Pyre Charger
text: His blade was forged over coals of moaning treefolk, curved at the optimum angle for severing heads, and heated to volcanic temperatures by his touch.

name: Aggressive Mining
text: Designed by Markus Persson

name: Foriysian Interceptor
text: A focal point for time rifts, Foriys contends simultaneously with foes both new and old.

name: Overt Operative
text: Saw her coming. Didn't matter.

name: Krosan Warchief
text: It turns prey into predator.

name: Sawtooth Ogre
text: "You will sharpen your teeth on my enemies' bones," Maraxus promised them, and his ogres cheered.

name: Wall of Kelp
text:
"Ya can eat it or ya can weave it, but ya can't fight in it."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate

name: Narnam Renegade
text: "I do not need to pierce your heart to still its beating."

name: Sweltering Suns
text: The Hekma may repel storms and monsters, but nothing holds back the heat of the suns.

name: Squirrel Mob
text:
"I barely escaped with my life. At that number, they could take on Emrakul herself!"
—Samila, Murasa Expeditionary House

name: Ghoulcaller's Accomplice
text: "Once in the box, we're all the same."

name: Fists of the Anvil
text: Gron's mind reeled with possibilities, most of which are best left unmentioned.

name: Staunch Defenders
text:
"Hold your position! Leave doubt for the dying!"
—Tahngarth of the *Weatherlight*

name: Loxodon Line Breaker
text: Loxodons are firm in stature and spirit. No matter the odds, they are always first into battle.

name: Monstrous Growth
text: Get in touch with your inner monster.

name: Mark of Eviction
text: Tharashk the Bold suddenly wasn't himself. Or anyone else, for that matter.

name: Cruel Edict
text:
"No mockeries now for them; no prayers nor bells, / Nor any voice of mourning save the choirs,— / The shrill, demented choirs of wailing shells."
—Wilfred Owen, "Anthem for Doomed Youth"

name: Druid's Deliverance
text: "Selesnya's roots reach deep into the Worldsoul, and we will not be moved."

name: Cliffhaven Sell-Sword
text: "I swing a sword. It's a simple life. A lot of adventurers just see me as some cheap muscle, but if my steel lets them return home with their lives and limbs intact, then I've done my job."

name: Neck Snap
text:
"We merrows need not be disadvantaged when fighting on land. We lack the vulnerability of those who breathe only through their throats."
—Minnarin, merrow reejerey

name: By Force
text: Decepticon warfare: the art of total annihilation.

name: Bog Wraith
text: It moved through the troops leaving no footprints, save on their souls.

name: Aetherblade Agent // Gitaxian Mindstinger
text: . . . but the Chrome Host's methods were far more efficient.

name: Greasefang, Okiba Boss
text: It's hard to say which is more deadly: her bike or her bite.

name: Oketra's Last Mercy
text: To the end, all Oketra did was for others.

name: Early Harvest
text:
"Earth's increase, foison plenty, Barns and garners never empty: Vines with clust'ring bunches growing; Plants with goodly burden bowing."
—William Shakespeare, *The Tempest*

name: Aven Cloudchaser
text:
"At the Reapportionment, Eagle begged to be human. The Ancestor granted half that prayer."
—Nomad myth

name: Propaganda
text:
"The cost of your opposition will be extracted from your wits."
—Nekusar, the Mindrazer

name: Clockwork Servant
text: Some are annoyed by the constant ticking as they clean the cobbles, but to the castle custodians, there's no sweeter sound.

name: Guild Artisan
text: Your discerning eye for value makes you nearly impossible to swindle.

name: Scattershot Archer
text: To train her elves for war, Mayael would drop a sackful of acorns from the tree canopy. Each archer tried to split as many as possible before the acorns hit the forest floor below.

name: Astarion's Thirst
text:
"Stop bleeding. It's distracting."
—Astarion, the Decadent

name: Mox Opal
text: What crossed her mind defied Orthodoxy: could there be perfection beyond *compleation*?

name: Engineered Plague
text: A single germ can kill more soldiers than ten thousand blades.

name: Gust-Skimmer
text: Phyrexian smog clouds choked the skies, threatening creatures who couldn't comprehend the menace below.

name: Spoils of Evil
text:
"Virtue has its rewards, as does its opposite."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Hex Parasite
text: Drawn by power, fueled by conquest.

name: Prosperity
text:
"Wealth is a good thing, compared to poverty—your food is better, your robes are softer, and your companions have bathed more recently."
—Kipkemboi, Kukemssa pirate

name: Scalding Devil
text: Demons massacre. Devils annoy.

name: Servant of Volrath
text:
"Volrath is a harsh master. My reflection is a constant reminder of that."
—Greven *il*-Vec

name: Aliban's Tower
text:
"The people of Aysen built their roads with stones from these wonders. Aliban would be pleased with their ingenuity."
—Baki, Wizard Attendant

name: Vedalken Certarch
text: "An appropriately detailed model is indistinguishable from reality, and much easier to control."

name: Mesmeric Trance
text:
"Magic overused can freeze the mind. Creativity is more important than power."
—Zur the Enchanter

name: Archetype of Aggression
text:
"Did Purphoros bless Maikal because of his rage? Or did Maikal's rage blossom after he'd been blessed? Only the gods know."
—Eocles, oracle of Purphoros

name: Misinformation
text:
"When you cannot rely on your sources, trust your own senses. When you cannot trust those, you must follow your instincts."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

name: Urza's Ruinous Blast
text: Urza poured his love, his grief, and his hatred into the Sylex, and the Multiverse shook.

name: Grimlock, Dinobot Leader // Grimlock, Ferocious King
text: "Me Grimlock no like you."

name: Lychguard
text:
"Only the deathless can truly comprehend the burden of unfailing loyalty."
—Vargard Obyron of the Sautekh Dynasty

name: Land Leeches
text:
"The standard cure for leeches requires the application of burning embers. Alternative methods must be devised should an ember of sufficient size prove more harmful than the leech."
—Vervamon the Elder

name: Priest of the Blood Rite
text: Some will sacrifice everything for but a taste of power.

name: Reflective Golem
text: "We don't cut through Sedgemoor anymore. Can't get five steps without a groff trying to fight its own reflection."

name: Millennial Gargoyle
text:
"You've got to keep your wits about you on the roofs. Not all stones are compliant handholds."
—Iveta, rooftop runner

name: Mental Note
text: Some minds are more open than others.

name: Timber Protector
text: In his presence, an ordinary grove becomes a bastion to turn spells and break armies.

name: Thrull Parasite
text: The hunger of a vampire and the subtlety of a tax collector.

name: Skittering Surveyor
text: Like a cross between a spider and a spyglass, but friendlier.

name: Fallen Angel
text:
"Angels are simply extensions of truth upon the fabric of life—and there is far more dark than light."
—Baron Sengir

name: You're Confronted by Robbers
text: Their only mistake was giving the bard time to speak.

name: Briber's Purse
text: The bigger the hand, the higher the price.

name: Paradoxical Outcome
text: The results of Rashmi's experimentation forced her to consider the possibility that multitudinous realities existed beyond her own.

name: Ferocious Pup
text: The strongest pack has the fiercest pups.

name: Mad Ratter
text: "Gather round and tell me all from the courts and castles."

name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
text: "About, about in reel and rout The death-fires danced at night; The water, like a witch's oils, Burnt green, and blue and white." —Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Joyous Respite
text:
"I have been gifted by the kami with long life. So far, they have not seen fit to withdraw their gift. There may yet be a way to stop the killing without more blood, human or kami, being spilled."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf

name: Mistform Dreamer
text: Devotion, the second myth of reality: The faithful are most hurt by the objects of their faith.

name: Banishing Light
text:
The Champion reached for a stone, and Heliod placed the sun into her hand.
—The Theriad

name: Tranquility
text: Sisay had been restored to her place on the ship, the Legacy had been recovered, and the *Weatherlight* was sailing home to Dominaria. Gerrard focused on the debts he'd settled . . . and on those he'd soon collect.

name: Aysen Abbey
text: Serra's gift to her people: a symbol of faith and hope.

name: Command Tower
text:
"Absolute power is the only true authority. Anything less is a lie told by the weak."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Boltwing Marauder
text: When battling the Kolaghan, consider yourself lucky if lightning strikes the same place only twice.

name: Thunderbolt
text:
"Most wizards consider a thunderbolt to be a proper retort."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Vanguard's Shield
text: Wars are not fought on a single front.

name: Sinister Starfish
text:
"Throw that one back. I don't like how it's looking at me."
—Netos, Meletian fisherman

name: Pulse of the Fields
text: Before religion or civilization, there was order.

name: Heavy Infantry
text: Doors, walls, skulls . . . it matters not. All barriers will be broken.

name: Elven Rite
text: As the bough stretches, so shall you grow. As the roots spread, so shall you thrive.

name: Kjeldoran Escort
text:
"The first caravan has passed safely through the Karplusan Mountains without incident, forging a trade route to Balduvia. Kjeld himself would never have believed it!"
—King Darien of Kjeldor

name: Loyal Cathar // Unhallowed Cathar
text:
"Just fight without fear. Your soul is protected by the hand of Avacyn and will never submit to evil."
—Thalia, to Constable Visil

name: Fiery Intervention
text: Burning something is easy. Choosing a target can be more difficult.

name: Greed
text:
"There is no calamity greater than lavish desires. . . . And there is no greater disaster than greed."
—*Tao Tê Ching 46*

name: Goblin Warchief
text: They poured from the Skirk Ridge like lava, burning and devouring everything in their path.

name: Demon's Disciple
text: Taborax's cultists are the latest in a long history of beings who have desired to see Zendikar torn to pieces.

name: Plated Onslaught
text:
"Witness the glory of true, unwavering unity."
—Ajani

name: Hearthfire Hobgoblin
text: Hobgoblins are best left alone. They sharpen their farm implements far more than is necessary for their work in the fields.

name: Twinblade Geist // Twinblade Invocation
text: She faced down a howlpack alone, saving her town at the cost of her life.

name: Viscerid Drone
text: Not all of Terisiare's flooding was natural . . . .

name: Noxious Field
text: Ultimately, it became a three-way battle: the land attacked both armies.

name: Death Match
text: The Cabal breeds many things for the pit fights, but it never breeds compassion.

name: It Came from Planet Glurg
text: A sludge with a grudge.

name: Holy Light
text:
"Bathed in hallowed light, the infidels looked upon the impurities of their souls and despaired."
—The Book of Tal

name: Foam Weapons Kiosk
text:
"As a safety measure, our foam is made from the softest metals available."
—Randa, day care blacksmith

name: Myr Convert
text: In the embrace of the Mother of Machines, hard work never goes unrewarded.

name: Blind Seer
text:
"I think he sees more than he lets on."
—Gerrard

name: Vodalian Wave-Knight
text: As Phyrexian portals roared open, she whispered a prayer to Svyelun for the strength to cleanse the sky.

name: Woolly Mammoths
text:
"Mammoths may be good to ride on, but they're certainly bad to fall off of!"
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Smite the Monstrous
text:
"The dragons thought they were too strong to be tamed, too large to fall. And where are they now?"
—Khibat the Revered

name: Deep Analysis
text: "The specimen seems to be broken."

name: Elder Mastery
text: Taste his power, hunger for his command.

name: Patchwork Gnomes
text: When building gnomes, dwarves adhere to the highest standards. The gnomes themselves aren't as particular.

name: Shipwreck Looter
text: One pirate's wreck is another's reward.

name: Cursed Totem
text:
"Sorry, Great One, but did I hear correctly? I'm to entrust this powerful artifact to our *worst* researchers?"
—Flesdrim, Cabal servant

name: Golem's Heart
text: The heart of a golem gives life to more than just the iron husk around it.

name: Valiant Veteran
text: "Let them come. We will show them that Argivian steel is stronger than any Phyrexian metal."

name: Volcanic Hammer
text: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.

name: Maggot Carrier
text:
"We do not suddenly fall on death, but advance towards it by slight degrees; we die every day."
—Seneca, *Epistles*, trans. Gummere

name: Mageta's Boon
text:
When the Lion roars, his cubs grow stronger.
—Kipamu saying

name: Trained Armodon
text: These are its last days. Better to grow broad and heavy. Better that the enemy is crushed beneath its carcass.

name: Telling Time
text: Mastery is achieved when "telling time" becomes "telling time what to do."

name: Cyclops of One-Eyed Pass
text:
The Champion armed herself to face the cyclops, heedless of her companions' despair. "How will you defeat it with only one spear?" asked young Althemone. The Champion raised her weapon. "It has but one eye."
—*The Theriad*

name: Vial of Poison
text: There are worse ways to die, but not many.

name: Avacynian Missionaries // Lunarch Inquisitors
text: "We come bearing the tools of confession and absolution."

name: Merciless Eviction
text:
"I once saw the Obzedat moved to action. Since that day, I've been thankful that they're mainly lazy, and dead."
—Aurelia, to Gideon Jura

name: Ill-Gotten Gains
text: Urza thought it a crusade. Xantcha knew it was a robbery.

name: Hulking Cyclops
text: Anyone can get around a cyclops, but few can stand in its way.

name: Ivy Dancer
text: Her ivy locks are a remnant of the wooded wilds now lost to Ravnica forever.

name: Cadaverous Bloom
text:
"It's filthy work, planting them."
—Kifimbo, Shadow Guildmage

name: Basal Thrull
text:
"To create the first Thrulls, I only introduced alchemic elements into the Order's necromancy; Tourach's principles remained unchanged."
—Endrek Sahr, Master Breeder

name: Mistakes Were Made
text: In hindsight, Chandra's Incendiary Experience should never have been built next to Auntie Grub's House of Pitch.

name: Scuttlemutt
text: With five lenses on its "head," it sees the world in a range of colors beyond ordinary perception.

name: Brute Suit
text:
"Send them a message they can't ignore."
—Satoru Umezawa

name: Seedborn Muse
text:
"Her voice is the wilderness, savage and pure."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte

name: Shoulder to Shoulder
text:
"Sea Gate may have fallen, but we still stand. We still fight."
—Gideon Jura

name: Fervor
text:
"We won't sit like lazy gob-slugs waiting for death to come to us. We'll bring death, shiny sharp, to our enemies."
—Krenko, mob boss

name: Loathsome Curator
text: She collects only the choicest of deaths.

name: Goblin War Paint
text:
"The secret to our war paint is hot peppers and stinkbugs. Lots of stinkbugs."
—Skab, goblin secretkeeper

name: Unholy Strength
text: "I don't *feel* any different."

name: Mists of Littjara
text: The Skelle raiders boasted that nothing could stop them, certainly not a bit of fog.

name: Kamahl's Druidic Vow
text: Centuries ago, a barbarian laid his rage to rest.

name: Saw It Coming
text: "How predictable."

name: Beasts of Bogardan
text: Bogardan is a land as volatile as the creatures who live there.

name: Wizard's Retort
text:
"The second mage learned to dissipate blasts of lightning. Threat and response: thus did the study of magic progress."
—Naban, dean of iteration

name: Relic Bane
text: A sword that has seen cowardice in battle exacts the price of honor from its wielder.

name: Leonin Scimitar
text:
"Every scratch tells a story, and every notch has a name. Four generations have held this blade. You shall not disappoint them."
—Initiation of Laena, skyhunter

name: Darksteel Citadel
text: Structures built from darksteel yield to neither assault nor age.

name: Seven-Tail Mentor
text: "I have taught you all I can. Take this blade and rise as my equal."

name: Pacifism
text: "Can't a fella get a moment's peace around here?"

name: Shadow Rider
text: In its world of complete darkness, it has no shadows to fear.

name: Steady Progress
text: "More of that strange oil . . . It's probably nothing."

name: Flameblast Dragon
text: He marks his territory with fire and wrath, etching the mountainside with his charring breath.

name: Shock Troops
text: When goblins blow themselves up, it's called stupidity. When humans do, it's called heroism.

name: Femeref Enchantress
text:
"Then she spread a fine dust over the land, like a butterfly shaking its wing."
—"The Enchantress," Femeref tale

name: Thirsting Axe
text: Sometimes the weapon wields the bearer.

name: Take into Custody
text: "You can tell me what I want to know, or you can talk to the Chief of Compliance. Why don't you make it easy on yourself?"

name: Dizzying Gaze
text:
"When I cut down my angel I only started my fall."
—Crovax

name: Infernal Contract
text:
"East and West meet and angels cry. Unholy power darkens the sky."
—"The Ballad of the Paladins"

name: Sea Legs
text: "When the waves pick up, either you find your feet or you lose your lunch."

name: Disenchant
text:
"Let Phyrexia breed evil in the darkness; my holy light will reveal its taint."
—Serra

name: Phantom Monster
text:
"While, like a ghastly rapid river, Through the pale door A hideous throng rush out forever, And laugh—but smile no more."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The Haunted Palace"

name: Customs Depot
text: A bribe is always faster than filling out paperwork.

name: Omnath, Locus of Mana
text: It gathers against the coming storm.

name: Chaos Warp
text:
「古い魔法の小物を扱うときは注意してください。それが以前に何者だったか分かりませんから。」
—-ロアホールドの学部長、オーガスタ

name: Wall of Fire
text: The erupting flames work as both barrier and weapon.

name: Ire of Kaminari
text:
"Thunder broke the brittle silence over the Araba. A surge of raw energy lifted the soldier's body into the air and briefly, in the heart of the flash, he saw the face of a god."
—*Great Battles of Kamigawa*

name: Cloistered Youth // Unholy Fiend
text: The fiend tormented them by recounting the girl's memories, as if some part of her remained inside that twisted shell.

name: Wellgabber Apothecary
text: "You've discovered that boggarts bite, I see. And will the militia be chasing this lot? . . . Ah, you're staying in town to avoid Nath's hunt. Wise. Now this poultice . . ."

name: Reap the Seagraf
text: The wreck hung on the jagged reef, each night disgorging more of its gruesome cargo.

name: Crawlspace
text: Lord Rondor arrived for battle with sixty war elephants, ten catapults, and two hundred of his finest archers. Then he saw the battlefield . . .

name: Black Lotus
text: 2003 Vintage Championship Winner

name: Rix Maadi, Dungeon Palace
text: Even miles away, if you put your ear to the sewer vents, you can hear the screams and the tempestuous laughter.

name: Johnny, Combo Player
text: "Just wait till I get my Krark-Clan Ironworks, Genesis Chamber, and Grinding Station. Oh yeah, and a second Myr Retriever."

name: Mesa Lynx
text: Its ferocity is tempered by patience, knowing it must wait for just the right moment to strike a killing blow.

name: Bant Sojourners
text: "We must spread Bant's light before we are shadowed over."

name: Fruitcake Elemental
text: Experiments intended to create the perfect holiday emissary resulted in a substance harder than darksteel and a fraction as merry.

name: Goblin War Drums
text: Their eardrums may have given out, but the rest of them never will.

name: Loxodon Mender
text: The Auriok believe that in the hands of a loxodon, no weapon can be broken.

name: Gluttonous Slug
text: No amount of salt will save you

name: Machine Over Matter
text: The Warlord decreed that only someone who could move the statue would be strong enough to marry the princess. So Urza moved it.

name: Birds of Paradise
text: Sages whisper of an undiscovered natural paradise, a tropical island unspoiled by war.

name: Mirror Strike
text:
"Enemies can be your weapons or your shields. Simply show them which they are."
—*The Teachings of Zho*

name: Spitting Sliver
text:
"Our lances' reach had been our saving grace in our fight against the hive. Now even that advantage is taken from us."
—Adom Capashen, Benalish knight

name: Firemane Avenger
text: Firemane Nevena led the victorious assault on the Barbu Rooftop rebels. Now the Gateless have marked her for death.

name: Dark Impostor
text: "Ah, this is a nice life. I can see why you were so desperate to keep it."

name: Salivating Gremlins
text: If an elf can dream it, a dwarf can build it, and a gremlin can eat it.

name: Ley Line
text:
"I can feel the strength of the entire forest."
—Gerrard

name: Hunter of Eyeblights
text: Snokk ran as fast as he could, but the sound of hooves grew ever louder in his ears.

name: Tormod, the Desecrator
text: "Life is but the precursor to a long and successful death."

name: Reap
text:
"Let Volrath choke on his crop of hatred."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Grotag Night-Runner
text: Naturally inquisitive and adaptable, goblins can turn their small stature to their advantage as rogues.

name: Curate
text: "Aha! This must be one of the ancient keys to... No, wait. It's just another puzzle toy."

name: Persistent Petitioners
text: "...cake. The Overmind demands cake. The Overmind also requires that..."

name: Deny the Witch
text: "This heresy cannot stand!"

name: Greenbelt Rampager
text: Subtlety is not a necessary part of sabotage.

name: Nihilistic Glee
text: "All ends in obliteration—love in hatred, life in death, and light in empty darkness."
