text: Iname rejoices in the dawn of a new life, but soon becomes jealous of the simple joys denied him by his station. So the cycle begins anew.

name: Daring Escape
text: As the Adversary's forces descended upon the gala, Elspeth whispered to Giada, "I can get you out of here, but we have to go now."

name: Fortifying Draught
text: "If a seedling can push through solid stone, there's no limit to what I could do."

name: Bonepicker Skirge
text:
"Get away from there! I must rebuild that one for the next bout. Shoo, shoo!"
—Keskit, the Flesh Sculptor

name: Marsh Hulk
text: Now vengeance is his sole purpose.

name: Blightsoil Druid
text: "See the beauty in death: the clean white bones lying in the fertile soil and the brightly colored moonglove sprouting from the fell earth."

name: Zahid, Djinn of the Lamp
text: "I do as I please, little mortal. Do go on about your wishes, though—they amuse me to no end."

name: Clarion Cathars
text: The sound of the trumpet is both warning and comfort: it tells of approaching danger but also reminds the village folk that someone is there to stand against it.

name: City of Brass
text:
"There is much to learn here, but few can endure the ringing of the spires."
—Nulakam the Archivist

name: Graceblade Artisan
text:
"Can you catch a snowflake on the edge of your blade? Her sword has snagged an entire blizzard."
—Zogye, Ojutai mystic

name: Renewing Touch
text: Death just encourages life the more.

name: Sunder Shaman
text: "You take our wilds, we take your city."

name: Summer Bloom
text:
"Our love is like the river in the summer season of long rains. / For a little while it spilled its banks, flooding the crops in the fields."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Paladin of the Bloodstained
text: Closely linked to the Church of Dusk, the paladins of the Bloodstained order are devout to the point of fanaticism.

name: Kessig Prowler // Sinuous Predator
text: In the wake of Emrakul, some werewolves' human forms were lost forever.

name: Atinlay Igpay
text: Isthay iecepay ofay avorflay exttay oesn'tday eallyray aysay anythingay.

name: Elvish Skysweeper
text: The spires of Ravnica are no different from the tall trees of other planes. The elves navigate and protect them just the same.

name: Growth Spurt
text: MORE TO LOVE: Friendly, nature-loving, Bunyonesque SEM seeks SEF looking for a huge commitment. . . . seeks atog prince

name: Spy Kit
text: Imitation is the sincerest form of treachery.

name: Termination Facilitator
text: "You sign. They die. As simple as that."

name: Firebreathing
text:
"Magic's only part of it, my friend. Diet does the rest."
—Suq'Ata trader

name: Mage il-Vec
text: Living below a flowstone foundry produces a disproportionate number of fire mages among the *il*.

name: Atog
text: The bane of all artificers, the legendary Atogs devoured intricate tools to further their own twisted growth.

name: Aven Fogbringer
text: "I cover the land with blankets and it sleeps."

name: Spinny Ride
text: The maximum recommended speed warning system snapped off years ago, but they hadn't encountered problems yet.

name: Usher of the Fallen
text: "I have led ten thousand through these mists and never lost the way."

name: Cankerous Thirst
text: Nothing warms the bark on a chilly day like a draught of elf.

name: Ethereal Armor
text: Metal is scarce, smiths are pricey, and plate mail is heavy.

name: Ambush Viper
text:
"Living creatures seldom impress me. But I like this one."
—Uta Falkenrath

name: Eidolon of Blossoms
text: The emotional echoes of dryad gatherings attract lost souls.

name: Disciple of the Old Ways
text: "Selesnya thinks nature is a pretty plaything. True nature would rip their faces off and wear their skins as trophies."

name: Triskelion
text: Optimally designed for agility, mobility, and lethality.

name: Hideous End
text:
"A little dark magic won't stop me. The worse the curse, the better the prize."
—Radavi, Joraga relic hunter, last words

name: Rogue's Gloves
text: Thievery requires subtlety, from the beginning of the heist to the end.

name: Team Spirit
text: Due to some late-night partying, the chicken missed the group photo.

name: Squee, Goblin Nabob
text:
"Some goblins are expendable. Some are impossible to get rid of. But he's both—at the same time!"
—Starke

name: Cursed Flesh
text: Misery, filth, disease—all things that bring suffering to the world—only make Phyrexians more dangerous.

name: Gelectrode
text:
"Diametrically opposing energies in self-sealed plasmodermic bubbles make great pets!"
—Trivaz, Izzet mage

name: Kitsune Loreweaver
text: "Know your history. The lessons of the past will shield you in times of doubt."

name: Moltensteel Dragon
text: An apocalypse in dragon form.

name: Viscid Lemures
text:
"Lemurs? Is that all? Finally, something harmless . . ."
—Norin the Wary

name: Verdant Automaton
text:
"A perfect fusion of nature and artifice."
—Irsi, Kujar gardener

name: Rally the Righteous
text: Yuri took up the ragged Boros banner, and his brethren, inspired by the act, followed him back into the fight.

name: Sphinx's Decree
text:
"Be still."
—Azor

name: Mischievous Catgeist // Catlike Curiosity
text:
"I never get any knitting done, but I don't entirely mind."
—Lorn, Lambholt innkeeper

name: Rampant Elephant
text: No matter how righteous the cause, it helps to bring along some muscle.

name: Imposing Grandeur
text: The wedding's lavish decorations paled in comparison to the opulence of its elite guests.

name: Honden of Infinite Rage
text: To the sorrow of all, its rage became focused on those who once stoked it.

name: Bonus Round
text: When the twin-spell bonus round begins, the crowd rises to its feet in anticipation of incredible combinations.

name: Sultai Soothsayer
text: The naga of the Sultai Brood made deals with dark forces to keep their power.

name: Summer Bloom
text: Summer sends its kiss with warmth and blooming life.

name: Traitorous Instinct
text: Joining the Worldsoul took years of study and meditation. Severing that connection took the snap of Rakdos's fingers.

name: Strategic Planning
text: "Plans evolved within the tent decide a victory 1,000 li away."

name: Fangren Marauder
text:
"The fangren fight without comfort of any kind. We can ask no less of ourselves."
—Tilien, Sylvok partisan

name: Thraben Gargoyle // Stonewing Antagonizer
text: Nahiri twisted them in shape and bent them to her will.

name: Cradle Clearcutter
text: A thousand years of growth, harvested in minutes.

name: Anurid Brushhopper
text: It's so tough it can frighten *itself* into hiding.

name: Curio Vendor
text: "Step right up! Try your hand! It'll thrill the senses and boggle the mind!"

name: Demonic Gifts
text: It began as a flavor on the tongue, like a bloody morsel of roast boar—but soon the power was a conflagration in her veins.

name: Castle Garenbrig
text: Without Garenbrig's strength, the realm would succumb to the wilds.

name: Corpsejack Menace
text: Weakness is not in the nature of the Swarm.

name: Verdant Force
text: The bower shuddered. The stillness broke. The scurf shifted, and a being emerged from the flowers and ferns.

name: Gustcloak Sentinel
text: Entire platoons have mysteriously vanished from battle, leaving enemy weapons to slice through empty air.

name: Haazda Officer
text: "You two, cover the alley! You, with me! Eyes on windows, balconies, and rooftops. Who knows what a fish-octopus-crab can do!"

name: Restrain
text:
"Hanna would give up her own life before she'd abandon the *Weatherlight*."
—Sisay

name: Hinterland Logger // Timber Shredder
text:
"There's a forester lives up in the highlands. Tried to sell her one of my finest axes at a bargain, but she wasn't interested."
—Old Rutstein

name: Coalhauler Swine
text: Nothing stops industry in Ravnica—certainly not the safety of its workers.

name: Thought Monitor
text: It roams the skies over the Quicksilver Sea, alert for any hint of aberrant thought.

name: Fevered Strength
text:
"The burst of strength brought on by this plague should not be mistaken for a sign of renewed health."
—Kolbjörn, High Honored Druid

name: Burning Palm Efreet
text: Even the lion envies the lark.

name: Pyroclasm
text:
"Leaves more room for the big ones to fight in, you know."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Brassclaw Orcs
text:
"A whole skin is worth a thousand victories."
—Orcish veteran of the Battle of Montford

name: Firesong and Sunspeaker
text: The peaks of Hurloon never fall silent.

name: Gilded Lotus
text:
"The lotus is a potent but ephemeral source of power. To preserve its potency, lacquer carefully with a conductive coating."
—*Hurkyl's Metaphysics, vol. II*

name: Vexing Devil
text: It's not any fun until someone loses an eye.

name: Etched Familiar
text:
"No refunds."
—Chammi, curio vendor

name: Micromancer
text: "Ideas don't have to be big to be great."

name: Vindicate
text:
"I have seen entire civilizations rise and fall. You mortals are but dust to me."
—Sorin Markov

name: Scarred Puma
text: It's not eager to lose the *other* eye.

name: Careful Consideration
text:
"Sages who take the time to verify their sources are rewarded for their diligence."
—Jhoira, to Teferi

name: Gutter Skulker // Gutter Shortcut
text: Some people take that as inspiration.

name: Terminate
text: All suns must set.

name: Vulshok Replica
text: All the fury of the Vulshok with only a trace of their recklessness.

name: Ballroom Brawlers
text: Don't try to cut in. They'll cut back.

name: Mogg Flunkies
text: They'll attack whatever's in front of them—as long as you tell them where that is.

name: Wall of Fire
text: Conjured from the bowels of hell, the fiery wall forms an impassable barrier, searing the soul of any creature attempting to pass through its terrible bursts of flame.

name: Hunger of the Nim
text: Their pain is so great, they can't help but share it with others.

name: Arctic Flats
text:
"A realm once green now ruled by Frost, Where flesh and field both pay its cost. Those dearly loved, forever lost . . ."
—*The Dynasty of Winter Kings*

name: Mardu Roughrider
text: The most ferocious saddlebrutes lead the assault, ramming through massed pikes and stout barricades as if they were paper and silk.

name: Mindleech Ghoul
text:
"This still doesn't make you the brains of the operation."
—Ghoulcaller Gisa

name: Refuse to Yield
text: Her opponent threw her through the window, so she retaliated by throwing the window through her opponent.

name: Gearsmith Guardian
text: Made in its creator's image, though slightly more clangy.

name: Resolute Rider
text: "Respect the wilds? Certainly. Fear them? No."

name: Skyraker Giant
text: She will not be content until hers is the highest head in the sky.

name: Immolation Shaman
text: "Hello, kindling."

name: Charging Binox
text: Arena beasts are bred for flashiness and foul temper. An extra head addresses both requirements.

name: Witch's Vengeance
text: The hex swept through the village, its citizens falling one by one.

name: Psychic Spiral
text: An elocutor forces criminals to confess to the laws they merely intended to break.

name: Burden of Guilt
text:
"Grab an axe and defend the gate! Your despair is an extravagance we can ill afford."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Gilt-Leaf Archdruid
text: "In our hands, the natural world finds more beauty than nature alone could ever provide."

name: Prying Eyes
text: "Citizen! Your crime has been recorded. Cease movement and await arrest, or further penalties will be immediately imposed."

name: Tresserhorn Sinks
text:
"Our land oppressed by silent Cold, We weary wretches, young and old, Pray that Springtime loose his hold."
—*The Dynasty of Winter Kings*

name: Hideous End
text: Death is a generous author, always willing to grant a stirring final chapter.

name: Razorverge Thicket
text: Where evolution meets austerity, primal might bucks against the yoke of hierarchy.

name: Colossification
text: "Talk later. Row now!"

name: Ice Tunnel
text:
"The ice cracked underfoot; strange shapes swam beneath the surface. Who else has walked this blighted path?"
—Iskene, Kannah storyteller

name: Arc Lightning
text: Lightning burns the dragon's path.

name: Piercing Light
text:
"Creatures of the night dissolve like shadows in the light of faith."
—Thalia, Guardian of Thraben

name: Relentless Hunter
text: "I swore to take one head for each member of my family they killed. My task is nowhere near its end."

name: Goblin General
text: Lead, follow, or run around like crazy.

name: Framed!
text: Who knew an 8˝ by 10˝ could feel like a 2˝ by 4˝?

name: Foreboding Statue // Forsaken Thresher
text: Were it not for the cultists' fatal curiosity, the terrible machine might have lain dormant for decades more.

name: Shivan Gorge
text: Both forge and pyre.

name: Shrewd Negotiation
text: "Pleasure doing business with you."

name: Spirited Companion
text: It formed a friendship with several playful spirits, and soon "the pack" was known as the source of much mischief in Eiganjo.

name: Flamespeaker Adept
text: "I see your future, mantled in ash."

name: Sophic Centaur
text: He endures the pain of remembering Krosa as it once was and hopes that a future generation will have need of his memories.

name: Wing Storm
text: A thousand wings beating as one can choke the sky itself.

name: Demonic Appetite
text:
"Morality is just shorthand for the constraints of being powerless."
—Ob Nixilis

name: Audacious Infiltrator
text: "This little critter can turn all of you to scrap in under thirty seconds! Come on, who wants to be the first to go? Try and stop me!"

name: Coral Eel
text: Some fishers like to eat eels, and some eels like to eat fishers.

name: Maro
text: No two see the same Maro.

name: Rugged Highlands
text: The Roil, Zendikar's planewide immune system, rose in full force against the threat of Phyrexian infection.

name: Screamer-Killer
text: Its shriek is unintelligible, but armored bulkheads seem to understand the intent well enough.

name: Gnawing Vermin
text:
"Everyone warns about the sand and the food, but the rats are worse than both put together!"
—Sanwell, letter to his family

name: Disrupting Scepter
text: "True power is controlling not only the hearts of your subjects, but their minds as well."

name: Streambed Aquitects
text:
"We look in the river and see scattered stones. A merrow looks and sees a map of Lorwyn."
—Illulia, flamekin soulstoke

name: Giant Solifuge
text:
"If you'd ever met one, you wouldn't ask me to justify the extra provisions for additional security."
—Lorref, caravan master

name: Muzzle
text:
Clenched teeth do not bite.
—Cho-Arrim saying

name: Eerie Ultimatum
text:
"The ground under our feet is a record of every slight against the world, to be avenged at a time of its choosing."
—Gavi, nest warden

name: Chimeric Coils
text: The energy that infuses the rings with life also melts them away, leaving only useless puddles of slag.

name: Twinblade Slasher
text: Righteous anger hones a humble soul.

name: Vampiric Sliver
text: They draw upon the strength of their hive and of their victims.

name: Inescapable Brute
text: If you think you made it past him alive, he's just teasing you.

name: Watchwing Scarecrow
text: The wings are held in place by wicker rods. The rods are held in place by pure faith.

name: Overwhelming Remorse
text: Tocasia's face haunted his vision. The explosion still rung in his ears. Mishra kept running and never once looked back.

name: Elvish Ranger
text:
"No one may fault an Elvish Ranger's heart, but the simplest frailty may fell even the proudest warrior."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Impatience
text: "I'm going to count to three. Three."

name: Perilous Vault
text: The spirit dragon Ugin arranged the hedrons of Zendikar to direct leylines of energy. To disrupt one is to unleash devastation and chaos.

name: Ahn-Crop Crasher
text:
"Hesitation breeds dissension. To be worthy of the next life, you must never look back."
—Anep, vizier of Hazoret

name: Pyroceratops
text: "I always thought wizards were supposed to have owls or one-eyed cats for familiars, but flaming dinosaurs work, too."

name: Ironclaw Orcs
text: Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan. To say that Orcs in general are vicious, depraved, and ignoble does not do justice to the Ironclaw.

name: Peace of Mind
text: Not all minds touched by the Eldrazi turn to raging psychosis. Some simply withdraw from this world into memories of a better one.

name: Goblin Bully
text: It's easy to stand head and shoulders over those with no backbone.

name: Legion's Judgment
text: "My lance was once wielded by Venerable Tarrian. In his name and by his might, I cast you down!"

name: Agonizing Remorse
text:
「罪悪感は赦しではない。後悔は正義ではない。だたし、苦しむことは正しい。」
—-エクスタス・ナー

name: Sheoldred's Headcleaver
text: The punishment for sedition, like every other crime in the Dross Pits, is execution.

name: Tibalt's Rager
text:
"Find out whose that is. I like its energy."
—Judith

name: Steely Resolve
text: No one in Wirewood understands what is happening. They just know it's unnatural—and coming from Krosa.

name: Soratami Cloudskater
text: "You hide your actions from eyes on the ground, but nothing escapes the clouds."

name: Book Burning
text: The wizard's spellbook was full of burning questions.

name: Arcane Signet
text: All Necrons bear the mark of the Triarch, a brand upon their living-metal skin that binds them to their dynasty.

name: Dungeon Delver
text: You're driven not by a lust for gold or baubles, but by the thrill of danger and the excitement of the unknown.

name: Planar Portal
text: These devices have been known to pull entire worlds through the Æther.

name: Mogg Raider
text: The evisceration of one mogg always cheers up the rest.

name: Blood Artist
text: Great art requires pain... but not necessarily the artist's.

name: Ironshell Beetle
text:
"Why waste time creating weapons? Nature provides us with all we need."
—Centaur warrior

name: Thragtusk
text:
"Always carry two spears."
—Mokgar, Kalonian hunter

name: Hypnotic Specter
text: "...There was no trace/ Of aught on that illumined face..." —Samuel Coleridge, "Phantom"

name: Foreboding Ruins
text: When the Great Rift opened across the Galaxy, many Imperial worlds were lost to Chaos.

name: Underworld Hermit
text: Some souls yearn to escape death. Others are content to feed the wildlife.

name: Spore Frog
text: The end of one life is merely the beginning of thousands more.

name: Deity of Scars
text:
"His skin cuts swords."
—*The Seer's Parables*

name: Flame Rift
text: Crovax hungered for power, and the stronghold devoured the sky.

name: Daring Buccaneer
text: No ancient lore ties the pirates of the Brazen Coalition to the Immortal Sun. But it's a powerful ancient artifact in a city of gold—what's not to covet?

name: Cavalry Pegasus
text:
"It is hope, hooved and winged."
—Cymede, queen of Akros

name: Ghost Ship
text: "That phantom prow split the storm as lightning cast its long shadow on the battlefield below." —Mireille Gaetane, *The Valeriad*

name: Scandalmonger
text: Silence costs extra. Breaking it costs extra still.

name: Seedpod Caretaker
text: His body clicked and hummed—a lullaby meant only for machines.

name: Fortune Teller
text: TODAY'S FORTUNE: YOU WILL REGRET SPENDING YOUR MONEY ON THIS FORTUNE.

name: Sphinx of the Steel Wind
text: No one has properly answered her favorite riddle: "Why should I spare your life?"

name: Cuombajj Witches
text: All things are connected: light to dark, age to youth, blood to blood.

name: Mnemonic Sphere
text:
"Let the Imperials search our laboratories. Will they think to look for secrets in a pretty bauble?"
—Emire, director of the Saiba Futurists

name: Unknown Shores
text: Kozilek's presence warped the land, stripping away layer after layer.

name: Rhox Meditant
text: The weight of her conviction balances on the harmony of her soul.

name: Ether Well
text: "Whoa—my tail will *never* fit through that hole!"

name: Sea of Clouds
text: Skybridges from across Kylem converge at the grand stadium of Valor's Reach.

name: Navigator's Compass
text: The *Weatherlight* can no longer planeshift, but it can traverse Dominaria with ease.

name: Nature's Lore
text: Druidcraft is a simple invocation to spirits of nature, promising a glimpse of nature's secrets.

name: Shivan Dragon
text: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.

name: Swords to Plowshares
text: The smallest seed of regret can bloom into redemption.

name: Crushing Vines
text:
"Your veil's curse won't stop me, deathmage. I have taken down countless night hunters. This dark plane is not big enough for you to hide."
—Garruk Wildspeaker, to Liliana Vess

name: Bribery
text: In Mercadia City, loyalties extend only as far as your purse can stretch.

name: Hammer Helper
text: "Need a hammer? Gotta get your fix? I know a guy."

name: Balduvian War-Makers
text:
"We send our best to battle, but every man, woman, and child will stand against Varchild's butchers."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Spreading Insurrection
text: Everyone wants to be on the winning side.

name: Benalish Cavalry
text: "My people swore to protect Benalia to the end. It is battered, but yet stands, as do we."

name: Fire Elemental
text:
"Fire set free is a fearsome force—destructive, merciless, always hungry. Given direction, it is much worse."
—Jeflin, Vastwood shaman

name: Pia Nalaar, Consul of Revival
text: Renegade turned revolutionary turned rebuilder.

name: Icatian Lieutenant
text: To become an officer, an Icatian Soldier had to pass a series of tests. These evaluated not only fighting and leadership skills, but also integrity, honor, and moral strength.

name: Reality Smasher
text: As easy to stop as it is to comprehend.

name: Ember Shot
text: Dwarves bring poor coal to market, use good coal in their homes, and throw their best coal away.

name: Majestic Heliopterus
text:
"Its rise is like the sun's, a beautiful beginning. Its descent is like the sun's, a frightful ending."
—Huatli

name: Sphinx's Disciple
text: Few dare to brave the Dakra Isles. Those who return are forever changed.

name: Vexilus Praetor
text: There is no greater bulwark than the Praetors of the Adeptus Custodes, the bodyguards of the Emperor of Mankind.

name: Novellamental
text: "The chain fit my neck perfectly, but my heart fluttered with chills as the cool metal came to rest against my chest. I closed the clasp and waited, silent."

name: Dulcet Sirens
text: What are the orders of a king or the demands of a creed next to such melodies?

name: Solidarity
text:
"We must all hang together, or assuredly we shall all hang separately."
—Benjamin Franklin

name: Bounding Krasis
text: Unpredictable as a storm and destructive as a tidal wave.

name: Dwarven Priest
text: "These storied halls are under my protection."

name: Winds of Change
text:
"'Tis the set of sails, and not the gales, Which tell us the way to go."
—Ella Wheeler Wilcox, "Winds of Fate"

name: Giant Trap Door Spider
text:
"So large and so quiet—a combination best avoided."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Sen Triplets
text:
PRESENTED BY ESPER LOUNGE
DOORS OPEN AT 8P.M. - NO COVER

name: Karplusan Yeti
text:
"What's that smell?"
—Perena Deepcutter, Dwarven Armorer

name: Burlfist Oak
text: If a tree fells you in the forest and no one is around to hear it, "does it make a sound" is the last thing you need to worry about.

name: Screams of the Damned
text: It's important to face your inner demons . . . unless they're the kind of demons that can kill you.

name: Craven Knight
text: "I say victory is better than honor."

name: Frostling
text: Its bite will take off more than a toe.

name: Ghostly Touch
text: "Geists wish to make themselves known. I'm merely the vessel for their efforts."

name: Inspiration
text:
"Day 31: I finally succeeded in my time reversal experiment! "Day 30: I might have a problem here."
—Journal of the Prime Izmagnus

name: Benthic Explorers
text: The rising oceans brought new lakes—and new terrors—to Terisiare. The Explorers found their ancient enemies spawning everywhere.

name: Fang of Shigeki
text:
"Let me give you a taste of the poison you've poured into our land."
—Shigeki, founder of the Order of Jukai

name: Sage of Shaila's Claim
text: Even now, Shaila's descendants proudly occupy the greenway that she refused to relinquish to the Consulate.

name: Nimbus of the Isles
text: The people of the Sevick Isles have a unique understanding of the term "ominous clouds."

name: Anurid Murkdiver
text: Aphetto's swamps are alive with the dead.

name: Ward Sliver
text: The first wave of slivers perished from the Riptide wizards' magic. The second wave shrugged off their spells like water.

name: Flameblast Dragon
text: Dragon lords of Jund rule by edicts of flame.

name: Horned Turtle
text: Its spear has no shaft, its shield no handle.

name: Ob Nixilis's Cruelty
text: Trapped on Ravnica with no affection for either side, Ob Nixilis sought gratification in random acts of torment.

name: Lotus Cobra
text: Some snakes are known for their deadly venom, swift strike, or crushing strength. Others are known for their deft handling of garden tools. Nature is beautiful.

name: Air Elemental
text: As insubstantial, and as powerful, as the wind that carries it.

name: Mirri the Cursed
text: A hero fails, a martyr falls. Time twists and destinies interchange.

name: Razor Barrier
text: "We protect our homelands. Why should they not protect us?"

name: Nessian Boar
text: Renata led the best hunters in all of Theros on a quest to bring down the terror of the Setessan wilds.

name: Bellows Lizard
text: As the price of wood and coal rose, smiths found creative ways to keep their forges burning.

name: Sire of the Storm
text: This storm blows gales through the dreams of mortals.

name: Dusk Urchins
text: They spawn from shadow, wreaking chaos until shadow claims them again.

name: Goldnight Commander
text: "One faith, but many hands in victory."

name: Invoke Despair
text: Although officials said it was a sewer failure, the people whispered that it was a warning of night's reach.

name: Apprentice Sharpshooter
text: Innistrad's best archers are trained by the Quiver of Kessig, an order of cathars who specialize in ranged combat.

name: Fervent Denial
text:
"Your tenacity is admirable. And futile."
—Emperor Aboshan

name: Breaking Point
text: "Enough!"

name: Dragonlord Silumgar
text: Silumgar never passes up an opportunity to add to his opulence.

name: Harvest Wurm
text:
The wurm's weave
—Elvish expression meaning "plowed fields"

name: Perimeter Patrol
text: The Fallaji quickly learned that the Kher Ridges held too many caves and valleys to be surveyed from the air alone.

name: Gravitational Shift
text: As they awakened, the Eldrazi reasserted their mastery over all of Zendikar's natural forces.

name: Viridian Claw
text: "Phyrexians can't corrupt what they can't get close enough to touch."

name: Laboratory Maniac
text: His mind whirled with grand plans, never thinking of what might happen if he were to succeed.

name: Death Pits of Rath
text:
"Neither could I forget what I had read of these pits—that the *sudden* extinction of life formed no part of their most horrible plan."
—Edgar Allan Poe,
"The Pit and the Pendulum"

name: Treetop Sentinel
text: Crian's patrols afford him plenty of opportunity to take potshots at the "dirtwalkers" far below.

name: Phantom Whelp
text: It lurks in the mist, waiting for stragglers to fall behind. When the fog clears, nothing remains but footprints.

name: Riptide Director
text: Those who lead others to wisdom become the wisest themselves.

name: Bladetusk Boar
text: Those who dare stand in its path are either brave or mindless. Or in the case of goblins, both.

name: Wielding the Green Dragon
text: Named for the eastern part of the sky, the source of energy and renewal, Guan Yu's crescent-moon blade weighed over 100 pounds.

name: Surrak Dragonclaw
text: Both his rank and his scars were earned in single combat against a cave bear.

name: Conjurer's Closet
text:
"Skeletons? You should be so lucky."
—Gisa, to Geralf

name: Oreskos Swiftclaw
text: The leonin of Oreskos are quick to take offense—not because they are thin-skinned but because they are always ready for a fight.

name: Living Tsunami
text: At low tide it slumbers. At high tide it devours.

name: Elvish Pioneer
text:
"Destruction is the work of an afternoon. Creation is the work of a lifetime."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte

name: Pentagram of the Ages
text: A mirror, a shield, a promise, a great distance, and a kind word—five ways to avoid harm.

name: Zulaport Cutthroat
text: "Eldrazi? Ha! Try walking through Zulaport at night with your pockets full. Now *that's* dangerous."

name: Dreg Reaver
text:
"On our thirty-fourth day of digging, we unearthed a chamber that contained the intact remains of several species long extinct from Grixis. One in particular should make a fine siege engine . . . ."
—Last notes of Shungus Nod, fleshcrafter

name: Zombie Infestation
text: The nomads' funeral pyres are more practical than ceremonial.

name: Sengir Bats
text:
"In the face of every one I see the Baron."
—Daria

name: Matter Reshaper
text: Its powers are simple—mind over matter. Or rather, an immeasurable mind disassembling and reconfiguring matter.

name: Jelenn Sphinx
text: Few among the Azorius have ever spoken with the sphinxes, but all have felt their influence.

name: Paradox Haze
text:
"Keep your pace steady through the haze, lest you step on the heels of your future self or trip the self a moment behind you."
—Teferi

name: Kuldotha Ringleader
text: Being surrounded by goblins is less objectionable when they're fighting *for* you.

name: Serpentine Ambush
text: The merchant did guarantee the new bait would bring in something big.

name: Firecannon Blast
text: Goblins' fearlessness and diminutive size make them the perfect cannoneers.

name: Elvish Lyrist
text:
"Make me thy lyre, even as the forest is: What if my leaves are falling like its own!"
—Percy Bysshe Shelley,
"Ode to the West Wind"

name: Order of the Mirror // Order of the Alabaster Host
text: The Magic Mirror of Vantress showed Catrina a twisted vision of black oil and bloody machines.

name: Nightmare
text: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.

name: Opulent Palace
text: The dense jungle surrenders to a lush and lavish expanse. At its center uncoil the spires of Qarsi Palace.

name: Urza's Incubator
text:
"Stop thinking like an artificer, Urza, and start thinking like a father!"
—Rayne, chancellor of the Tolarian Academy

name: Aesthir Glider
text: An ancient device recovered from a thawing glacier high in the Karplusan mountains.

name: Peel from Reality
text: When House Dimir's secrets are in danger of exposure, the guild takes drastic measures to cover its tracks.

name: Gouged Zealot
text: He can't fear what he can't see.

name: Old-Growth Dryads
text: "The jungle was here before any city. It will be here after the last city falls."

name: Memory Lapse
text:
"Um . . . oh . . . what was I saying?"
—Reveka, Wizard Savant

name: Orazca Frillback
text: The frillbacks of Orazca soak up the sun on their tall spinal fins. They look slow and sleepy—until they catch the scent of prey.

name: Deflection
text:
"You've thrown your net at the wrong fish."
—The Lord of Atlantis

name: Stronghold Rats
text: In the stronghold's dungeons, the shadows hide in the vermin.

name: Cave Tiger
text: The druids found a haven in the cool limestone tunnels beneath Argoth. The invaders found only tigers.

name: Daemogoth Titan
text:
"Of course it offered you power. Demons always do. But trust me—the sweeter the prize, the more ruinous the price."
—Professor Onyx

name: Volrath the Fallen
text: "I stepped out. I did not step down."

name: Root Maze
text:
"We should step up repairs. I think the forest has plans for us."
—Crovax

name: Haunted Ridge
text: Swirling eddies of ash hide crumbling cliffs, treacherous drops, and the slavering maws of unknown evils.

name: Elvish Archdruid
text: "The elves tend the forest, and the forest sustains the elves. My role is to ensure that the cycle continues."

name: Ironclad Revolutionary
text: As the rebellion spread, renegade ingenuity outpaced the Consulate's greatest fears.

name: Rustwing Falcon
text: Native to wide prairies and scrublands, falcons occasionally roost in dragon skeletons.

name: Built to Smash
text: Free from Consulate regulations, renegade-built automatons push performance to the limit.

name: Char
text: If you've never choked on the embers of your own spell, you aren't casting it hard enough.

name: Ultimate Price
text:
"Let him be an example to others who would default on their debts to us."
—"The Cozen," Orzhov assassin

name: Innocent Traveler // Malicious Invader
text: "Aren't you going to invite me in?"

name: Rag Man
text: "Aw, he's just a silly, dirty little man. What's to be afraid of?"

name: Dawnglare Invoker
text:
"What we knew as Emeria, Ula, and Cosi were not divine beings at all, but a cruel trick, and a grave error."
—*The Invokers' Tales*

name: Thallid Omnivore
text: Thelon of Havenwood created thallids as a food source in times of darkness. Thallids did the same with saprolings.

name: Shielded Passage
text: Izzet delved into the depths of Ravnica's past, and Selesnya followed without fear.

name: Greenseeker
text: "A rumor passes among the snakes, whispered by the rushes, inspiring the seekers: the goddess Freyalise is alive in Skyshroud."

name: Take Inventory
text: A place for everything, and everything in its place.

name: Bird Admirer // Wing Shredder
text: Her hunger won't be sated until she's tasted every bird on Innistrad.

name: Updraft Elemental
text:
"It slips through the smallest cracks in the mountain, emerging whole and unfettered. There is nowhere it cannot go, for what can hold back the air itself?"
—Chanyi, Ojutai monk

name: Tormented Angel
text: Falling from heaven is not as painful as surviving the impact.

name: Rootbreaker Wurm
text: As Gerrard made his escape, the wurm covered his flight by helping itself to three great mouthfuls of merfolk.

name: Join the Dance
text: "We can go into the dark hand-in-hand or alone. I know which I prefer."

name: Horncaller's Chant
text:
"The Selesnya are gathering armies. Do you still believe they aren't preparing for war?"
—Teysa, to Isperia

name: Lurking Informant
text: In the undercity, forgetfulness is often encouraged at the point of a blade.

name: Wall of Kelp
text:
"Ya can eat it or ya can weave it, but ya can't fight in it."
—Zeki, reef pirate

name: Maraxus
text: Too chaotic for even the other warlords of Keld, Maraxus has devoted himself to serving as a hired killer for the sinister Volrath. A man fond of his work, he's more than willing to put in those extra hours needed to perfect his craft.

name: Harmonic Sliver
text:
"Since the last sliver arrived, even our mightiest relics splinter into shards as soon as we bring them against the hive."
—Llanach, Skyshroud ranger

name: Soltari Emissary
text: Alone at the portal, Ertai began his meditation. He realized immediately that he was not alone.

name: Transguild Courier
text: Reluctant to meet face to face, the leaders of the ten guilds prefer to do official business through a go-between immune to bribes and threats.

name: Mogg Fanatic
text:
"As if his chest had been a mortar, he burst his hot heart's shell upon it."
—Herman Melville, *Moby Dick*

name: Cloakwood Hermit
text: You've always preferred the company of animals to people.

name: Decision Paralysis
text:
"Eyes see only what is possible. A trained mind can explore the impossible."
—Kefnet, god of knowledge

name: Elvish Hexhunter
text: "All manner of curses, blights, and luckspoils infect Shadowmoor. We stalk them all, one perilous quest at a time."

name: Band Together
text: In times of peril, the vision the ancient paruns had for their city comes into focus.

name: Yavimaya Gnats
text:
"It is our third day of travel on the Yavimaya River, and still these creatures plague us. Davin Lansson, our naturalist, has facetiously labeled them 'gnats,' and the name has stuck."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Air Marshal
text: "Today our blades remember Kroog! May the seven brass gods be with us!"

name: Lightning Volley
text: "We are the motes of rain that join to make the thundercloud. The power of the storm god surges through us!"

name: Skull Prophet
text: "I study bone because that's where truth dwells. One monster knucklebone is wiser than all that damp meat in your head."

name: Southern Paladin
text:
"How can anyone fight so much yet enjoy it so little?"
—The Western Paladin

name: Wild Growth
text: If you stop to listen, you can hear it grow.

name: Bloodbond Vampire
text:
"Let the vampires join us. In this war, we no longer have the luxury of choosing our comrades."
—General Tazri, allied commander

name: Liliana, Death's Majesty
text: Death is no excuse for disobedience

name: Canopy Baloth
text:
"You can almost see it calculating—are we a tasty enough treat to risk the jump?"
—Samila, Murasa Expeditionary House

name: Pay No Heed
text:
"Out of this nettle, danger, we pluck this flower, safety."
—William Shakespeare,
*King Henry IV, Part I*

name: Reef Pirates
text:
"Zeki sails with a dead crew not out of villainy, but pragmatism."
—Baron Sengir

name: Spreading Plague
text: The cruelest strain of plague keeps its hosts alive long enough to return home and infect their families.

name: Rethink
text: "Are you *sure* you want to do that?"

name: Mindlock Orb
text: Rogue mechanists once rummaged through the wastes of the Tidehollow, constructing unauthorized golems to threaten the hegemony of the sphinxes. The orbs put a stop to that.

name: Silent Clearing
text: The expedition's end began the marsh's story.

name: Evolving Wilds
text: There is an immense diversity of life in the Underdark, almost all of which can kill you.

name: Pyknite
text:
"Never cross a Pyknite, if you value your scalp."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Temporal Extortion
text:
"The scythe of time or my blade at your throat—the choice is yours."
—Holux, stronghold racketeer

name: Triton Waverider
text: "You can no more stop me than you can halt the tide."

name: Solitary Hunter // One of the Pack
text: When the howl beckons, he cannot resist the urge to join the others.

name: Ballynock Trapper
text: No matter how large or small, fierce or fleeting, the kithkin have a trap for it.

name: Tajuru Preserver
text: "No more blood shall be spilled to satisfy another's deluded lust for power."

name: Bog Naughty
text:
"The faerie plucked an acorn off the ground. One knight's quest was about to come to a bitter end."
—*Tales of the Fae*

name: Fog
text: It's hard enough to find your way through uncharted wilderness when you can see the tip of your nose.

name: Counterspell
text: The pyromancer summoned up her mightiest onslaught of fire and rage. Jace feigned interest.

name: Durkwood Boars
text:
"And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine: and the herd ran violently . . . ."
—*The Bible*, Mark 5:13

name: Might Weaver
text: "Let my strength harden your resolve."

name: Bottle Golems
text: Reinforcements *and* refreshments!

name: Shiv's Embrace
text: "Wear the foe's form to best it in battle. So sayeth the bey."

name: Evil Comes to Fruition
text: "The plants justify the means."

name: Glitterflitter
text: There are no small parts, only small performers.

name: Run Away Together
text: True love means always knowing what's on the other's mind.

name: Gravecrawler
text: She'll get revenge or die trying!

name: Serra's Embrace
text:
"Lifted beyond herself, for that battle Brindri was an angel of light and fury."
—*Song of All*, canto 524

name: Slaughterhorn
text: The Orzhov clergy would never cross its path, but sending thrull couriers to do so is cheap and entertaining.

name: Firebreathing
text: The mage breathed in life-giving air and breathed out death-bringing fire.

name: Sunken Hollow
text: Abandoned tunnels and bunkers below the hive city have been secretly recolonized and dubbed the "Forbidden Cities."

name: Wildwood Rebirth
text: In Ravnica, there are maladies far more difficult to treat than death.

name: Orcish Spy
text:
"You idiot! Never let the spies mingle with the orcish regulars after completing a mission. Now we'll never get them to fight!"
—General Khurzog

name: Shimmerwing Chimera
text: It swims upon the winds and soars through the waves.

name: Steamflogger Boss
text:
"Don't quit now, we're almost done.
Then we'll build another one!"

name: Foil
text: Among wizards, poor timing is the most consistent mistake.

name: Willow Geist
text: Die beneath a tree, wake up a part of it.

name: Cobblebrute
text: Ravnica's most ancient streets take on a life of their own. A few have decided to move to nicer neighborhoods.

name: Kessig Dire Swine
text: In the quiet of the Somberwald, new horrors stir.

name: Lava Axe
text: From the heart of the mountain into the heart of the mage.

name: Explosive Welcome
text: Rowan and Will were a natural fit in Prismari College, the school of outrageous elemental arts.

name: Distracting Geist // Clever Distraction
text: "I never did enjoy studying."

name: Ancestral Statue
text: The mage awakened the statue in hopes of learning the lost lore of her clan, but the statue was interested only in war.

name: Sol Grail
text:
"Look deep into the Grail, and see there what you desire most."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Sarpadian Empires, Vol. VII
text: The past still lives within its pages, waiting for its time to come again.

name: Sisay's Ring
text:
"With this ring, you have friends in worlds you've never heard of."
—Sisay, Captain of the *Weatherlight*

name: Azure Drake
text: The Azure Drake would be more powerful were it not so easily distracted.

name: Unyaro Griffin
text: The griffin's shadow gives courage to the righteous and dread to the idle.

name: Basal Thrull
text:
Initially bred for sacrifice, the thrulls eventually turned on their masters, the Order of the Ebon Hand, with gruesome results.
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. II*

name: Goblin Commando
text: With a commando around, somebody's gonna get hurt.

name: Monastery Swiftspear
text: She focused her mind on the volcano's fury, and hers erupted in kind.

name: Mutagen Connoisseur
text: Much to the Phyrexians' delight, sheer curiosity drove many to willingly surrender to *compleation*.

name: Lieutenant Kirtar
text:
"His strengths are pride, devotion, and ambition. His weaknesses are the same."
—Pianna, nomad captain

name: Amped Up
text: Space can be a lawless place—far from the praying eyes of electrical inspectors.

name: Root Snare
text: The only casualties were a snapped spear, a lost helmet, and some bruised egos.

name: Experimental Frenzy
text: コーヒーは発明の偏屈な叔母であるのだ。

name: Consumptive Goo
text: Silent as fog and relentless as plague, it is wet, creeping death.

name: Hengegate Pathway // Mistgate Pathway
text:
"I cannot read these runes, yet somehow they seem like a warning. Have we passed unknowingly into a new realm?"
—Ekken, Omenseeker navigator

name: Persistent Petitioners
text:
"...we need seeds, yo."
"Lots of seeds, and..."

name: Roaring Primadox
text:
"They're easy enough to find. Question is, are you sure you want to find one?"
—Juruk, Kalonian tracker

name: Day of Destiny
text:
"Rise like the sun, stand like the mountain, charge like the lion, die as a hero."
—General Takeno

name: Palisade Giant
text: Refusing guild allegiances, she fights for those who can't protect themselves.

name: Nyxborn Marauder
text:
"Callaphe guided them into the
darkness of Hetos, the bleak mire;
Blood-horned minotaurs circled them,
axes aglimmer in shadow."
—*The Callapheia*

name: Aarakocra Sneak
text: "Shhh! I think I hear goblins. And I definitely smell them."

name: Young Necromancer
text: "Who needs imaginary friends when you've got dead ones?"

name: Killer Bees
text: The communal mind produces a savage strategy, yet no one could predict that this vicious crossbreed would unravel the secret of steel.

name: Colos Yearling
text: A steed grows with its rider.

name: Spearbreaker Behemoth
text: Few Nayans dare hunt the gargantuans. They're regarded not as animals but as forces of nature, like landslides or typhoons.

name: Famine
text: "But it was a year of dearth. People were reduced to eating leaves of jujube trees. Corpses were seen everywhere in the countryside."

name: Wall of Wood
text: Everybody knows that to ward off trouble, you knock on wood. But usually it's better to make a wall out of the wood and let trouble do the knocking.

name: Bolt Hound
text: Its spark is worse than its bite.

name: Mindlash Sliver
text: Though Dominaria's queenless slivers lack a single purpose, in some the instinct for self-sacrifice remains extremely strong.

name: Blind Obedience
text:
"Man is a beast and it is good that fear fills him."
—Nagash, Supreme Lord of the Undead

name: Power Conduit
text: Never content, vedalken artificers continually tinker with their creations.

name: Dehydration
text: The viashino used the spell to dry foods for crossing the Great Desert. The Suq'Ata later discovered its use in war.

name: Tenured Inkcaster
text: "Ah, another future archmage for my collection."

name: Wayward Guide-Beast
text: Goblin cavalry tactics consist of pointing a beast in a direction and hanging on for as long as possible.

name: Corrupted Conviction
text:
"For the good of all, those who stand against the harmony of Phyrexia must be cut down."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Extract Brain
text: No thought is as succulent as a secret.

name: Warchanter Skald
text: "Who will be the hero of my tale?"

name: Scion of Halaster
text: Most see the Mad Mage as a deranged menace, but you recognize the genius behind his paranoia.

name: Gruul Guildgate
text: The scarred rubble around the gate is testament to past meetings of the Clans, summits that inevitably devolved into brawls.

name: Fyndhorn Druid
text:
"All struggles ultimately require sacrifice. It's just that some sacrifices are dearer than others."
—Jaeuhl Carthalion, Juniper Order Advocate

name: Sadistic Glee
text:
"First blood isn't as important as last blood."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Battlefield Butcher
text: "Any more giant metal monsters want to try their luck? I'm just getting warmed up!"

name: Befoul
text: The bog's touch means death to all but the darkest of hearts.

name: Wake the Past
text:
"Belong in a museum? I think we should let relics belong wherever they please!"
—Quintorius, Lorehold mage-student

name: Ignite the Cloneforge!
text: "Heroes innovate. Villains duplicate."

name: Errant Doomsayers
text: "Heed my words, traveler. Plagues, war, desolation . . . all mere hints of what is yet to come from Dominaria's vault of horrors."

name: Firebreathing
text:
"Magic's only part of it, my friend. Diet does the rest."
—Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader

name: Goblin Warchief
text: Inspiration comes in all shapes and sizes.

name: Kjeldoran Skycaptain
text: The heartlink between soldier and steed is hatched with the aesthir struggling from its shell.

name: Lure
text: It makes the insignificant conspicuous, the repulsive alluring, and the deadly irresistible.

name: Jaddi Offshoot
text: On Murasa, even the trees grow trees.

name: Blood Servitor
text:
"Please, my friends, help yourselves to the help."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Wandering Troubadour
text: "There's a new ballad waiting to be born around every corner."

name: Talas Scout
text:
"Scouting a battle before you fight it is just good business."
—Jefan, Talas ship captain

name: Agent of the Iron Throne
text: You give your clients what they want at a fair price. What happens after that is none of your concern.

name: Trelasarra, Moon Dancer
text: "Eilistraee teaches us that we are not bound by the circumstances of our birth. We all may find beauty and light, if we have the courage to seek them."

name: Amateur Auteur
text:
The two Eldrazi titans fell
and set the ground a-rumbling!
"How come no one ever listens?"
old Ugin flew off grumbling.
—*ZENDIKAR! The Musical*

name: Phantom Warrior
text:
"The construction of a defense is not accomplished by adding bricks."
—Jace Beleren

name: Molten Rain
text: It came as a cruel answer to the farmers' prayers.

name: Mire Kavu
text: "At this rate," said Sisay, "the next kavu we see will have wings."

name: Smelt
text: The creation of new weapons demands the destruction of others.

name: Wasteland
text:
"The land promises nothing and keeps its promise."
—Oracle en-Vec

name: Crimson Hellkite
text: The hellkites are artists with flames, painting the world with fire.

name: Bone Shards
text: In the Kathari dumping grounds known as the Boneheaps, its not hard to improvise an offense.

name: Coalition Victory
text:
"You can build a perfect machine out of imperfect parts."
—Urza

name: Lu Bu, Master-at-Arms
text: "Dong Zhuo's man, Lu Bu, warrior without peer,/ Far surpassed the champions of his sphere."

name: Hour of Revelation
text: In the first moments, the gate to the afterlife opened, and the people were prostrate in the light of the God-Pharaoh.

name: Crawling Barrens
text: Zendikar is restless.

name: Gaze of the Gorgon
text: Even the dead give way to the mineral gaze of the gorgon.

name: Sacred Fire
text:
"Do not confuse justice with mercy."
—Odric, Order of Saint Traft

name: Poxwalkers
text: Poxwalkers are victims of the Walking Pox, a cruel virulence which rots the infected to death while keeping them conscious.

name: Arcane Sanctum
text: The Emperor is the greatest psyker in Human history. For thousands of years, he has sat immobile in a palace that spans a continent.

name: Silent Skimmer
text:
"I watched it pass at a distance. When I looked back to my companions, Najet was dead."
—Akiri, kor line-slinger

name: Off Balance
text: A heavy weapon deals plenty of damage—but it does have to hit.

name: Kurgadon
text: When it walks through Krosa, trees step aside, leaves take wing, and the ground shudders.

name: Insatiable Harpy
text: Gold coin, battered helmet, broken wrist bone—all have the same value in the eyes of a harpy.

name: Gilded Sentinel
text: The River Heralds fight to keep all others from reaching the golden city. The city has its own defenses.

name: Nekusar, the Mindrazer
text: His enemies wondered if the lich king's brutal death and unnatural rebirth had been his plan all along.

name: Crackling Doom
text: Do not fear the lightning. Fear the one it obeys.

name: Mana Short
text:
"Remove their power, and their will to fight will follow."
—Tolarian wizard

name: Serra Aviary
text:
"Serra, like Feroz, is long since dead. But remember, Daria: her spirit shall survive so long as the Homelands do."
—Taysir

name: Second Harvest
text:
"The cornfields promise a good yield this season."
—Radwick, farmer of Gatstaf

name: Vampire Bats
text:
"For something is amiss or out of place / When mice with wings can wear a human face."
—Theodore Roethke, "The Bat"

name: Sideswipe
text: Hisoka's wizards struggled for years to master the art of redirection that came so naturally to the shamans of Ganzan Pass.

name: Steam Vents
text: Crafted with genius, energized with madness.

name: The Stasis Coffin
text: Tawnos built it to be absolutely impermeable to any force inside. Luckily it worked for any force outside as well.

name: Ivy Elemental
text: For safety reasons, the keeping of houseplants within Ikoria's sanctuaries is heavily discouraged.

name: Conviction
text: It was not the minotaur's shoulders but his soul that bore the heaviest weight.

name: Arterial Flow
text: "It is impious to admit, but I do enjoy pirate blood. Something in the salty tang of it, the spice of rebellion."

name: Benalish Heralds
text: The detailed dispatch could be summarized in four words: "Time is running out."

name: Aethershield Artificer
text: Most smiths shape metal, but some prefer more delicate materials.

name: Orazca Raptor
text:
"If you come across a raptor in the city, stay perfectly still. At least then you'll be well rested when you die."
—Captain Brandis Thorn

name: Dauthi Mercenary
text:
"The Dauthi believe they dignify murder by paying for it."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

name: Night Soil
text: The elves gathered huge piles of rot to grow fungus. Out of imitation or forethought, the thallids did the same.

name: Memory Drain
text: Alythos sat and stared blankly out over the glassy oceans of Nerono, trying in vain to remember what he knew he had forgotten.

name: Reviving Dose
text: Samite healers never mix their pungent elixir with sweetener or tea. The threat of a second dose is enough to get most warriors back on their feet.

name: Run Away Together
text:
"Virtue is virtue, whatever the heart that nurtures it."
—Malacan, Vantress exile

name: Blatant Thievery
text: Centuries of association with the Sun Empire have taught the dinosaurs that shiny things are important.

name: Starnheim Courser
text: Every worthy warrior who arrives in Starnheim is gifted a mount befitting their heroism, a mighty pegasus raised and trained by the valkyries.

name: Hound of the Farbogs
text: As you hear it baying in the distance, you'll feel its breath on your neck.

name: Mountain
text: Your path lies across the Spine of the World, where every cave hides some new danger.

name: Cosmic Horror
text: ". . . [S]creams of horror rend th' affrighted skies." —Alexander Pope, *The Rape of the Lock*

name: Deathmark
text: There are few ways to escape the deathmark: bargaining with a demon, washing in the fabled waters of youth, and of course, death.

name: Arrow Storm
text: First the thunder, then the rain.

name: Sun Titan
text: A blazing sun that never sets.

name: Steadfast Guard
text: The Mercadians were prepared for the guard, but the guard was even more prepared for the Mercadians.

name: Guard Gomazoa
text: It lingers near the outposts of the Makindi Trenches, inadvertently granting another layer of defense.

name: Aftershock
text:
"Every act of destruction has a repercussion."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Undying Evil
text:
"Is it true the evil that people do follows them into death? Let's find out."
—Liliana Vess

name: Feeding Frenzy
text: It wasn't as much a strategy as a dim instinct to drown their prey.

name: Morale
text: "After Lacjsi's speech, the Knights grew determined to crush their ancient enemies clan by clan." —Tivadar of Thorn, *History of the Goblin Wars*

name: Wilderness Elemental
text:
"Don't be so quick to reclaim the thawing lands. They might have acquired a taste for freedom."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

name: Revealing Wind
text:
"The sands obscure the vision of others, but clarify ours."
—Faiso, Dromoka commander

name: Ekundu Griffin
text:
"My goat was a small price to pay for the chance to see the hunting griffin dive and seize it."
—Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader

name: Tyrant of Kher Ridges
text: In war, dragons don't see sides, just side dishes.

name: Volcanic Geyser
text:
"The common folk call it the breaking of the crust or the spilling of fire. Geomancers call it target practice."
—Ryda, geomancer

name: Maniacal Rage
text:
"They tell us the wilds are ours, then they brick them over. They can lie to our faces but not to our fists."
—Ghut Rak, Gruul guildmage

name: Nessian Asp
text: It's not the two heads you should fear. It's the four fangs.

name: Greel, Mind Raker
text: "You're Latulla's gift to me, and I always play with my presents."

name: Sudden Impact
text: Caught red-handed.

name: Condemn
text:
"No doubt the arbiters would put you away, after all the documents are signed. But I will have justice *now*!"
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage

name: Vigean Hydropon
text: Fruits of magic, roots in science.

name: Golgari Guildgate
text: Every part of the gate was reclaimed from forgotten ruins and imbued with new purpose by the Swarm.

name: Skeletal Kathari
text: Undeath doesn't end the kathari's search for carrion; it only removes one corpse from the Dregscape.

name: Alpha Authority
text: Even the bitterest enemies of the Burning-Tree Clan respect the strength of Borborygmos's rule.

name: Dreadwurm
text: Its silent slithering belies its bulk.

name: Arcane Signet
text: It started as a mere drop of water. The Magic Mirror crystallized it into much more.

name: Jedit Ojanen
text: Mightiest of the cat warriors, Jedit Ojanen forsook the forests of his tribe and took service with the Robaran Mercenaries, rising through their ranks to lead them in the battle for Efrava.

name: Arrogant Vampire
text: Charm and grace may hide a foul heart.

name: Wanderer's Intervention
text: Just as Jin-Gitaxias's victory seemed certain, the Wanderer appeared, her blade already in motion. One mighty slash was enough to take the praetor out of the fight.

name: Mystic Skyfish
text: The problem wasn't that fish had learned how to fly. It was that sharks had adapted to follow them.

name: Oathsworn Vampire
text:
"My conquistadors are never slain, merely laid to rest."
—Queen Miralda the Pious

name: Ob Nixilis, the Fallen
text: His spark lost, he plots revenge upon the plane whose corrupting mana fractured his soul.

name: Sphinx's Revelation
text: "Let the knowledge of absolute law inspire you to live a life of absolute order."

name: Burning Anger
text: "With rage as your forge, your hammer can smite anything."

name: Spell Snuff
text: "Good night."

name: Aven Smokeweaver
text: In a world still pained from burns, some are born already scarred.

name: Sundering Titan
text:
"Truth be told, my team had hoped never to see the day it was deployed."
—Consulate engineer's log

name: Ironscale Hydra
text:
"Put down your bows, you fools! Arrows only make it angry!"
—Callia, Hyrax Tower scout

name: Cartouche of Zeal
text: The fifth cartouche is the final affirmation of glory, granted only to the worthy dead.

name: Biovisionary
text: He tired of his fellow researchers and their useless prattling, so he decided to make a network of scholars with whom he could carry a conversation.

name: Gore Swine
text:
"The Mardu are like the gore swine. We are wild, hunt in packs, and rarely clean the blood from our blades."
—Vallash, Mardu warrior

name: Thundercloud Elemental
text: Some days it's better to stay inside.

name: Clever Conjurer
text: "I'm always happy to lend a hand!"

name: Serra Angel
text: Her sword sings more beautifully than any choir.

name: Stun
text:
"They certainly are well protected. Too bad for them they're not well balanced."
—Sisay

name: Glintwing Invoker
text: The Mirari flares in his mind.

name: An-Havva Constable
text:
"Joskun and the other constables serve with passion, if not with grace."
—Devin, faerie noble

name: Horn of Deafening
text: "A blast, an echo . . . then silence."

name: Chromatic Orrery
text: Visitors marvel at its design, unaware of the other world that inspired it.

name: Opt
text:
"Sometimes the hardest choice is between two wonders."
—Gadwick, the Wizened

name: Lost Legion
text: Even death cannot diminish the persistence of the knights of Locthwain.

name: Cruel Edict
text:
"Choose your next words carefully. They will be your last."
—Phage the Untouchable

name: Naturalize
text:
"When your cities and trinkets crumble, only nature will remain."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Baneblade Scoundrel // Baneclaw Marauder
text: "I was a mere cutpurse until I learned the going rate for fresh corpses."

name: Nefarious Imp
text: It listens to all of their plans and plots creative ways to turn them to ruin.

name: Phyrexian Revoker
text:
"These skittering creatures were created to hunt the one true threat to Phyrexia: dissent."
—Venser, journal

name: Seasons Past
text: The seeds of new life take root in the soil of old.

name: Natural Order
text:
"Nature is neither cruel nor kind. It operates on necessity, not sentiment."
—Dina, Witherbloom mage-student

name: Gnarlroot Pallbearer
text: The flames of war consumed most of Argoth's treefolk. Vengeance consumed the rest.

name: Carrion Feeder
text: Stinking of rot, it leaps between gravestones in search of its next meal.

name: Echoing Truth
text: A single lie unleashes a tide of disbelief.

name: Play with Fire
text: Devils find human dwellings to be oppressively cold, dark, and unburnt.

name: Trained Armodon
text: Armodons are trained to step on things. Enemy things.

name: Strands of Night
text:
"I have seen the night torn into thin darkling strips and woven into shapes too bleak for dreams."
—Crovax

name: Sliver Legion
text: An alien from another world, at first glance it looks funny. Maybe scary and also maybe ugly, but mostly funny.

name: Quicksilver Geyser
text:
"Phyrexians are tenacious. That's not the same thing as clever."
—Tezzeret

name: Orzhov Guildgate
text:
"We do not believe in hiding our wealth in the shadows. This is Orzhov, and this is how we reward greatness."
—Teysa Karlov, Grand Envoy of Orzhov

name: Candlegrove Witch
text: "Like a thousand candles fighting back the darkness, we are strongest when we stand together."

name: Shatter
text: The ogre's mind snapped. The bow was next. The archer followed quickly after.

name: Windrider Eel
text:
"The best spot to hook one is right behind the gills."
—Rana Cloudwake, kor skyfisher

name: Siegehorn Ceratops
text: To a siegehorn, there is no such thing as a dead end.

name: Funeral March
text:
"This party is such fun—but it's a shame to mourn just one."
—Irini Sengir

name: Orcish Cannonade
text:
"Crispy! Scarback! Load another volcano-ball."
—Stumphobbler Thuj, Orcish captain

name: Name Dropping
text: Gemini (May 21—June 21) This week is a good time to branch out and meet others. But don't forget your roots. Avoid commitments and open flames.

name: Ursapine
text: A friendly ursapine means a constant supply of sharp spears. An unfriendly one means a constant supply of small holes.

name: Xanthic Statue
text:
"Until you have lived as a statue, do not talk to me of pigeons."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Sun Sentinel
text: "I will not sleep until Orazca is ours once more."

name: Goblin Wizardry
text: "Quiet in the library" soon gave way to larger concerns.

name: Rain of Tears
text: Mercadian elitism is reinforced daily by physical position: their neighbors are literally beneath them and are treated accordingly.

name: Horizon Stone
text: Kruphix once dreamed that he traveled beyond the edge of the world to an unfamiliar land. Curious, he picked up a rock, and awoke to find it had followed him from the dream into reality.

name: Search Party Captain
text: "Werewolves leave messy trails. Easy to follow. Hard to forget."

name: Destructive Revelry
text:
"Stoke a fire hot enough and you'll never run out of things to burn."
—Xenagos, the Reveler

name: Fangren Firstborn
text: In the Tangle, bad is often followed by worse.

name: Endless Cockroaches
text: There is nothing more repulsive than a cockroach—except a cockroach and all its friends.

name: Wipe Clean
text: "The light of the Ancestor will scour the taint of darkness from the land."

name: Flowstone Wyvern
text:
"Where I come from, stone stays on the ground."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

name: Gleemax
text: Help us . . . R&D under mental domination of alien brain in jar . . . only chance . . . Gleemax's blatant disregard for flavor text . . . send help!

name: Ridged Kusite
text:
"It offers but a taste of the power that the shadows have to offer. But even that is a heady wine indeed."
—Ratadrabik of Urborg

name: Landslide
text:
Sometimes the mountain takes.
—Keldon saying

name: Knight of New Benalia
text: The mage-smiths of New Benalia have perfected the art of blending fine steel and enchanted glass into weapons that are both beautiful and deadly. Only elite knights are entrusted with these martial works of art.

name: Sacred Knight
text: "No flame, no horror can sway me from my cause."

name: Primalcrux
text: When nature is backed into a corner, just like its children, it lashes out.

name: Jackhammer
text:
"Subtlety is overrated."
—Mr. Orfeo, the Boulder

name: Hookhand Mariner // Riphook Raider
text: The local gossips swore Nesmith lost his hands in a fight with a werewolf.

name: Argent Mutation
text:
"My world is corrupted beyond cleansing. I must prevent this from happening to others."
—Karn

name: Gatstaf Arsonists // Gatstaf Ravagers
text: The glow in their eyes reveals more than anger or madness.

name: Tempest of Light
text: "Let everything return to its true nature, so that destiny may takes its course."

name: Stromkirk Noble
text: "A responsible king walks among his subjects."

name: Goblin Chieftain
text: "We are goblinkind, heirs to the mountain empires of chieftains past. Rest is death to us, and arson is our call to war."

name: Auriok Transfixer
text: "My grandfather knew enough spells to fill a hundred scrolls. Nowadays, if a spell cannot fight the levelers, it is not even taught to our young."

name: Igneous Inspiration
text: Prismari fosters a burning need to create.

name: Canopy Tactician
text: "Death and life are two ends of the same spear."

name: Trip Noose
text: A taut slipknot trigger is the only thing standing between you and standing.

name: Read the Tides
text: Charts and instruments work fine, but the best navigators aren't above a spell or two to nudge the tides in a more favorable direction.

name: Stroke of Genius
text: After a hundred failed experiments, Urza was stunned to find that common silver passed through the portal undamaged. He immediately designed a golem made of the metal.

name: Manaforce Mace
text: As the shards merged, relics once thought mundane regained forgotten powers.

name: Strangling Spores
text: Imagine a thousand tiny mushrooms cropping up within your lungs.

name: Zombie Cutthroat
text: The single-mindedness of a zombie, the cunning of an assassin.

name: Smite the Monstrous
text: Though the old holy wards and roadside shrines have begun to fail, faith in Avacyn still holds true power.

name: Woodland Stream
text: Two creaking waterwheels herald the approach to Briarbridge through the Ulvenwald.

name: Winding Way
text: Every path leads to discovery.

name: Voidwielder
text:
"He makes up his own laws, and that's dangerous to all who love peace and prosperity. Kill him on sight."
—Mirela, Azorius hussar

name: Rock Slide
text:
"Good ol' rock. Nothing beats rock."
—Rhirhok, goblin archer

name: Cliffgate
text: A partition between the hopeless living and the restless dead.

name: Aether Tradewinds
text:
"The wind smells of misfortune. Check your knots."
—Anitan, Ondu cleric

name: Wild Slash
text: Never mistake deception for cleverness.

name: Zealous Inquisitor
text: "I only return what rightly belongs to another."

name: Make Your Mark
text: Those who do learn from history may still choose to repeat it.

name: Canal Monitor
text: The first goblin tried to swim the canal. The second built a raft. The last and craftiest goblin launched herself from a firecannon and soared over the canal, trailing smoke. All were eaten, but only one was cooked.

name: Wander in Death
text: Forever restless. Forever growing in number.

name: Toxic Deluge
text:
"I am greater than rain and nourishment. I am glistening oil and perfection."
—Yawgmoth

name: Serra Paladin
text:
"Would that I could be a Paladin again, but the dead hold no place among their ranks."
—Ihsan's Shade

name: Mass Manipulation
text: Those who cross the Dimir find enemies everywhere they turn.

name: Grim Lavamancer
text: "Pyromancers are cowards who look no further than the flickering flame on the surface. I alone have the courage to dig to the true power that roils beneath."

name: Goblin Chirurgeon
text:
"Perhaps goblins are good for something after all."
—General Khurzog

name: Damping Field
text: Eventually, mages learned to harness the power of natural damping fields and use it for their own ends.

name: Bloodcrusher of Khorne
text: The Brazen Thunder, foremost of the bloodcrusher legions, are named for the sound they make as they ride into battle.

name: Death Charmer
text: It vents the chill of the grave.

name: Academy Ruins
text: Its secrets once wrought the greatest artifice ever known. Now crabs loot the rubble to decorate their shells.

name: Guardian of Pilgrims
text: Immune to the physical warping caused by Emrakul, geists proved to be some of humanity's most important allies.

name: Thieving Magpie
text: Other birds collect twigs for their nests. Magpies steal jewels for theirs.

name: Aggressive Urge
text: "Our lives, our homes, and all our history are at risk. Do not speak to me of peace."

name: Kami of the Crescent Moon
text:
"He's a lot like me, that masterless little kami... unimpressed by grandeur and never at a loss for a trick."
—Toshiro Umezawa

name: Harbor Serpent
text: Like most giant monsters villagers worship as gods, it proves a fickle master.

name: Mana Crypt
text: An utterly silent chamber, submitted by an artificer who wished to remain anonymous.

name: Yavimaya Ancients
text:
"We orphans of Fyndhorn have found no welcome in this alien place."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Sibilant Spirit
text: She had expected death to roar, to thunder, to growl. She did not recognize it when it came hissing to her side.

name: Hired Poisoner
text: "They don't even feel the cut. I'm ordering a drink in a nearby tavern before anyone notices something's wrong."

name: Aetherize
text: "You can come back once you've learned some manners—and figured out how to reconstitute your physical forms."

name: Surveilling Sprite
text: Their natural curiosity, combined with a knack for trespassing, makes sprites excellent spies.

name: Ivory Mask
text: Made from its wearer's hopes, the mask ensures that those hopes will be fulfilled.

name: Lavabrink Venturer
text: "Take one wrong step out here and you're dead. I take only right steps."

name: Nacatl Savage
text:
"Blades dull and armor dents. Marisi taught us that instinct is the only thing a true warrior needs."
—Ajani

name: Kjeldoran Royal Guard
text:
Honorable in battle, generous in death.
—Motto of the Kjeldoran Royal Guard

name: Court of Ambition
text: Watch your step.

name: Erratic Portal
text: "In Barrin's name!" cried Lyna as Hanna's sword passed through her, "Ertai sends word that the portal is open—but not for long!"

name: Lux Cannon
text: There are few problems that can't be solved by putting a hole in the world.

name: Wee Champion
text: Nobody had ever won the bear, but then again, nobody had ever wanted it quite as much.

name: Leapfrog
text:
"Most compete for insects at street level. Some dwell near Izzet laboratories and ride the thermal updrafts."
—Yolov, Simic bioengineer

name: Lifelink
text: The spoils of war are not measured only in gold and silver.

name: Gruesome Menagerie
text:
"Variety is also the spice of death."
—Cevraya, Golgari shaman

name: Arcbound Mouser
text: It doesn't purr. It hums.

name: Spectral Bears
text:
"I hear there are bears—or spirits—that guard caravans passing through the forest."
—Gulsen, abbey matron

name: Hindervines
text:
"Woodlands and laws. Both grow faster than the Azorius's ability to manage them."
—Suniel the Woodwise

name: Southern Elephant
text: While defending their southern borders, both the Wu and Shu kingdoms fought against the barbarians' trained elephants.

name: Green Dragon
text: Green dragons take special pleasure in corrupting the good-hearted.

name: Rhox Oracle
text: "The further into the future I look, the less certain my vision. Even now, the middle distance is obscured by fire."

name: Braid of Fire
text: The prominence danced before the shaman, a tangle of power and flame—his to unravel.

name: Oblivion Ring
text: A circle of light and a word of confinement.

name: Sootstoke Kindler
text: "Nothing warms my heart better than a spirit kindled with rage."

name: Firestorm Phoenix
text:
"The bird of wonder dies, the maiden phoenix,/ Her ashes new-create another heir/ As great in admiration as herself."
—William Shakespeare, King Henry the Eighth

name: Slaughter the Strong
text: It was a big day for the gravediggers at Cliffside Cemetery.

name: Druid's Call
text: Suffer the little creatures, for they may yet rise up and beat you senseless.

name: Mutagenic Growth
text:
"Sympathy is for weaklings. Whoever survives, wins."
—Benzir, archdruid of Temple Might

name: Shared Animosity
text:
"It is the nature of souls that they burn more brightly together than apart."
—Vessifrus, flamekin demagogue

name: Runic Armasaur
text: The Sun Empire's most sacred sites are protected by more than prayers.

name: Folk of An-Havva
text:
"There are those who accept being told what to do, what to think, and what to say. Then there are the Folk of An-Havva."
—Reyhan, Samite Alchemist

name: Tapestry of the Ages
text:
"Abzan, Jeskai, Sultai, Mardu, Temur—names lost to history, yet worthy of further study."
—Narset

name: Klothys's Design
text: The god of destiny grants her followers vision deeper than sight.

name: Hammer of Ruin
text: By hammer forged, and by hammer undone.

name: Startled Awake // Persistent Nightmare
text: "It seemed so real!"

name: Command Tower
text: Millions of years of history forged, forgotten, and transformed.

name: Battle Frenzy
text:
"One day you, too, shall drink the blood of your foes. It is something to look forward to."
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain

name: Mark of Fury
text: Many Keldon warriors bear the mark of intentional insanity.

name: Corrupted Crossroads
text:
"Look, and see the future."
—Ayli, high priest of the Eternal Pilgrims

name: Rampaging Geoderm
text: The Phyrexian juggernaut found itself crushed between a rock and a hard place.

name: Icy Blast
text: "Do not think the sand or the sun will hold back the breath of winter."

name: Flourishing Hunter
text:
"I would welcome her into my pack with honor."
—Arlinn Kord

name: Shields of Velis Vel
text: Changelings can alter shape based on what the beings around them desire most.

name: Triskelion
text: A brainchild of Tawnos, the Triskelion proved its versatility and usefulness in many of the later battles between the brothers.

name: Heliod's Intervention
text: "I bring a dawn that no night can follow."

name: Brown Ouphe
text: In a strange twist of fate, one of the most annoying creatures in the multiverse was brought to the place where it could cause the most damage.

name: Machinate
text: As long as there are questions to be asked, the vedalken will ask them.

name: Red Sun's Twilight
text:
"Where once there was apathy, Urabrask brought passion, and the Great Work truly began."
—Monument inscription

name: Tainted Strike
text:
"Welcome to perfection."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Coral Merfolk
text: Early sailors thought they were tricks of the mind or perhaps manatees. As more and more ships were classified as lost to "manatee attacks," the truth began to dawn.

name: Dolmen Gate
text: Lorwyn's stones resonate with the place from which they were hewed. Though taken far, still they call to their home when silence is upon the land.

name: Blade Instructor
text: "Watch carefully. The gap between death and victory is thinner than your blade."

name: Winged Hive Tyrant
text: A hive tyrant's synaptic link is the primary conduit through which the Hive Mind enforces its dominance over a hive fleet's lesser creatures.

name: Rampant Growth
text: Upon impact with a planet's surface, a tyrannocyte's bloated belly bursts open, disgorging a horde of Tyranid invaders.

name: Powerstone Fracture
text:
"Move! When the powerstone blows, that behemoth will be nothing but a hole in the ground."
—Ashnod, to Hajar

name: Palladium Myr
text: The myr are like the Glimmervoid: blank canvases on which to build grand creations.

name: Stitcher's Supplier
text: "Let me give you a hand. He won't be needing it; he's left-handed. Also dead."

name: Branchblight Stalker
text: Some Vicious Swarm aspirants hang motionless in the canopy for weeks, allowing poisonous flowers to root in their flesh and weave tendrils through their hair.

name: Otherworldly Outburst
text: A tiny crack is enough to open the mind to Emrakul.

name: Kitsune Bonesetter
text:
"He kept generations whole before the Kami War, and now he turns his century of wisdom to healing the latest casualties."
—Eight-and-a-Half-Tails

name: Pardic Collaborator
text: "We've been taught that strength is everything. So how can an alliance with the strongest be a betrayal?"

name: Mystic Melting
text: The sun-hot glow radiated from the druids, leaving scattered metal in steaming pools as it passed.

name: Thunder Spirit
text:
"It was full of fire and smoke and light and . . . it drove between us and the Efrafans like a thousand thunderstorms with lightning."
—Richard Adams, *Watership Down*

name: Assembled Ensemble
text: Known for their hit single "Your Wait from This Point Is Seven Hours."

name: Cruel Sadist
text: Face of innocence. Hand of death. Designed by Edmund McMillen

name: Whispering Snitch
text: "Sure, I hear things. I hear plenty. But how am I to talk with this parched throat?"

name: Wild Ricochet
text:
"May your day never match your expectations."
—Scriptus Fleen, flectomancer

name: Ivy Elemental
text: In the gardens of the centaurs, many travelers have mysteriously vanished while admiring the elaborate topiaries.

name: Step Right Up
text:
"Ah, the midway, beating heart of the—well, maybe the big top is the heart. If there were two hearts, then the midway—or the lungs. Lungs or stomach!"
—Captain Rex Nebula

name: Last Breath
text:
"Tsk. You'd think those nasty merrows would know how to hold their breath."
—Olka, mistmeadow witch

name: Eladamri's Call
text: Tribal rivalries and petty disputes were laid aside at Eladamri's summons.

name: Soul Strings
text: Everyone is manipulated. It's just more obvious with the dead.

name: Camel
text: Everyone knew Walid was a pious man, for he had been blessed with many sons, many jewels, and a great many Camels.

name: Lightmine Field
text: If you want to kill a lot of goblins, just make sure your defenses look like fun.

name: Shatterskull Smashing // Shatterskull, the Hammer Pass
text:
"The safest way across the Skyfangs is to fly. Shatterskull Pass is a pretty distant second."
—Samila, Murasa Expeditionary House

name: Extravagant Spirit
text: The fewer your possessions, the fewer your worries.

name: Undercity Scrounger
text: "That will pay for another arm extension all by itself! Well, as long as it doesn't explode."

name: Swords to Plowshares
text: WE SHALL MELT THEM IN FIRE.

name: Elvish Archers
text: I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!"

name: Ogre Savant
text: He's an oxymoron.

name: Scoured Barrens
text: As oil seeped from Ikoria's crystals, strange metallic mutations emerged in monsters all across the plane.

name: Screams from Within
text: There's no escaping an enemy that lives inside your head.

name: Staunch Defenders
text: The key to winning any fight is simply staying alive.

name: Spell Pierce
text:
"A fool's fire is quickly quenched."
—Shaper Kumena

name: Aven Reedstalker
text: "Our best chance against the Eternals will be tactics they've never seen and styles they've never trained in."

name: Persecute
text:
"Of all the tyrannies on humane kind The worst is that which persecutes the mind."
—John Dryden, "The Hind and the Panther"

name: Glare of Heresy
text: No foe is more hated than the former friend.

name: Gulf Squid
text: If it could capture the power it wastes, it would be invincible.

name: Fires of Undeath
text: "I drink of those who are worthy of my palate. The rest I burn."
