name: Jace's Triumph
text: His triumph was not in outsmarting Bolas's plan, but in understanding why ultimate power is self-defeating.

name: Tawnos, the Toymaker
text: "Don't thank me. Thank nature for its wondrous designs!"

name: Tavern Ruffian // Tavern Smasher
text: With every arm in sight broken, she turned her attention to the furniture.

name: Street Wraith
text: Most of the spirits that haunt Urborg were once ordinary people, even children, twisted beyond recognition by the swamp's corrupted mana.

name: Dockside Chef
text: The squirming is how you know it's fresh.

name: My Wish Is Your Command
text: "Indulge me. Just one spell. One potentially fatal spell gone horribly awry."

name: Temple Elder
text:
"Give us breath. Give us life. Prepare us for the day we make."
—The Alaborn "Rite of Battle"

name: Viashino Lashclaw
text: "Victory is the greatest motivator of all. So sayeth the bey."

name: Rakka Mar
text:
"The finest pawns are those with pawns of their own."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Juggernaut
text:
"Urza's machines have a splendid habit of excavating themselves."
—Rona, disciple of Gix

name: Despark
text:
"A tale of a tyrant being humiliated and losing all his power? I'm inspired already!"
—Killian, Silverquill mage-student

name: Scholar of the Ages
text: "I study the past to find hope for the future."

name: Veil of Summer
text:
"I won't tell you or anyone else where my son is. Ever."
—Tamiyo

name: Excise the Imperfect
text: "Riddles are but petty diversions. Phyrexia is the only truth."

name: Primeval Titan
text: His silent stare was punctured only by his deafening roar.

name: Blinking Spirit
text:
"Don't look at it! Maybe it'll go away!"
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

name: Leonin Abunas
text: Only leonin clerics who can survive the Razor Fields for one turning of the suns can stand in the Cave of Light.

name: Dwarven Trader
text:
"Their definition of 'fair profit' is certainly novel."
—Reveka, Wizard Savant

name: Goblin Pyromancer
text: "The good news is, we figured out how the wand works. The bad news is, we figured out how the wand works."

name: Highcliff Felidar
text: Once the felidar has marked you as prey, there's no point in running.

name: Lure
text: Her true theft was to steal the soldiers away from their posts.

name: Leering Gargoyle
text:
"Only a gargoyle would take such delight in a thunderstorm."
—Qhattib, Vizier of Amiqat

name: Haunted Crossroads
text: It seemed as if no one wanted them to reach the Henge of Ramos—not even the dead.

name: Serra Redeemer
text: "Heroism is neither a strong arm nor a divine destiny. It is the choice to stand unbowed against impossible odds."

name: Sway of Illusion
text:
"I suggest you take a closer look."
—Tidal visionary

name: Giant Solifuge
text:
"We respect all lifeforms, but this one we respect from a distance."
—Mandor, Selesnya ranger

name: Nevinyrral's Disk
text: Nevinyrral's final act of spite was to make sure all of his magic was destroyed along with him.

name: Stronghold Machinist
text: She stretches the laws of physics until they snap.

name: Veil of Assimilation
text:
"Hear only harmony. See only glory. Speak only truth."
—Atraxa

name: Mask of Griselbrand
text: The legacy of evil lives on.

name: Iridescent Angel
text: She enraptures all, encompasses all, endures all.

name: Swamp
text: Now that you've clearly hit the "marsh" part of Lizard Marsh, you begin to worry about the "lizard" part.

name: Indentured Oaf
text: All it knows is the difference between friend and food.

name: Painwracker Oni
text:
"Blood flows. Blood calls. Blood devours all and only blood remains."
—Ogre chant

name: Robber Fly
text: In pursuit of the juicy fly, Squee stumbled on the hidden hangar.

name: Setessan Skirmisher
text: Bassara, the tower of the fox, houses the elite skirmishers who guard the Nessian Wood against trespassers.

name: Shorecrasher Mimic
text: The Aurora replaced the changelings' innocence with malice and their curiosity with hunger.

name: Drooling Groodion
text:
"The Golgari expand, yes, but I refuse to call their tainted creations 'growth.'"
—Veszka, Selesnya evangel

name: Raging Swordtooth
text: Carnivorous dinosaurs developed a taste for undead flesh, tracking the vampires by the scent of blood on their breath.

name: Atarka Monument
text: Atarka is worshipped and fed by her subjects at Ayagor, the Dragon's Bowl.

name: Tribute to Hunger
text: Marella was delighted. The ball had attracted so many suitors for her daughter, including that handsome stranger. She wondered where the two were now . . . .

name: Pouncing Jaguar
text: One pounce, she's hungry-you die quickly. Two, she's teaching her cubs-you're in for a long day.

name: Fevered Convulsions
text:
"Tell me again why you failed to capture Gerrard, you worthless pile of spine."
—Volrath, to Greven

name: Winter's Grasp
text: Summer is buried there, centuries deep; A crypt of years where seasons sleep.

name: Dissolve
text: "You thought only the gods could stop you?"

name: Render Silent
text: "We have confiscated your spells as evidence. Once we conclude our investigation, you may petition to have them returned."

name: Reincarnation
text:
"You cannot imagine what eyes you may look through tomorrow."
—Aerona, elder druid

name: Teferi's Ageless Insight
text:
"Fine, you know more than me. But do you have to be such a show-off about it?"
—Chandra Nalaar, to Teferi

name: Impeccable Timing
text: When Baral constructed his trap for Chandra, he did not account for the arrival of an enormous leonin wielding a twin-headed axe.

name: Fleshless Gladiator
text: What she lacks in skin she makes up in swagger.

name: Haberthrasher
text: "Brims" Barone's enforcers are always dressed to kill.

name: Airdrop Aeronauts
text: "Supplies inbound. Keep that pressure on."

name: Heartless Summoning
text:
"They won't be winning any beauty pageants, but they'll do the trick."
—Enslow, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

name: Lumengrid Drake
text: Properly outfitted, drakes made perfect sentries for vedalken strongholds.

name: Scholar of Athreos
text: She asks pointed questions of the dead who wait for Athreos, learning of life from those who are about to leave it.

name: Future Sight
text:
"Is the inevitable any less miraculous?"
—Veldka, wandering sage

name: Dominus of Fealty
text:
"Nothing is truly your own. It is his, whether you know it or not."
—*The Seer's Parables*

name: Sisay's Ring
text: "I'm not one for pretty things," said Sisay. "Unless they're pretty useful as well."

name: Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund
text: Don't fear death. Fear Karrthus.

name: Erdwal Illuminator
text:
"When all else fails, follow the geist's lantern."
—Vallon, Thraben inspector

name: Hint of Insanity
text: "Practice makes perfect, but obsession makes better."

name: Restoration Gearsmith
text: All she touches turns to well-oiled, delicately calibrated, perfectly balanced gold.

name: Kasimir the Lone Wolf
text: Popular indeed is the tale of how Kasimir was once a Holy man who renounced his order to take up the sword. But this tale is no more likely than any other.

name: Mist Raven
text:
"When you see a raven, head for the hills. It knows when the ghost-tide is headed in."
—Sved, fisherman of Nephalia

name: Coming In Hot
text: "I have a reckless idea," Koth offered. Chandra grinned and cracked her knuckles.

name: Blastfire Bolt
text:
"Encase yourself in the most elaborate armor, and cower behind the heaviest shield. I would hate for you to feel helpless."
—Korig the Ruiner

name: Fledgling Imp
text: Imps aren't born knowing how to fly—just how to annoy.

name: Shrapnel Slinger
text:
"They may have unlimited mites, but that just means we have unlimited ammunition."
—Urabrask

name: Frost Raptor
text: The Rimewind wizards strove to perpetuate a magical winter. Their unnatural snows birthed unnatural beasts.

name: Martial Law
text:
"The good of society matters much more than the inconvenience of a few."
—Agmand Sarv, Azorius hussar

name: Plague Rats
text:
"Should you a Rat to madness tease
Why ev'n a Rat may plague you..."
—Samuel Coleridge, "Recantation"

name: Conjured Currency
text: A bargain in Keyhole Downs is always too good to be true.

name: Inspiring Statuary
text: Ghirapur's most celebrated inventors have been immortalized in clockwork.

name: Birgi, God of Storytelling // Harnfel, Horn of Bounty
text: Like her well of stories, Birgi's horn never runs dry.

name: Elsewhere Flask
text: One night Oona bottled the sky. The next night she aligned the stars and released it.

name: Stealer of Secrets
text: www.MagicTheGathering.com

name: War Cadence
text: The rhythm isn't a call to arms, but a signal that the goblins have made a new enemy.

name: Weaponize the Monsters
text: Revenge is a path inevitably walked alone.

name: Encrust
text:
"The sea blesses the tiny with the power to fell the mighty."
—Talrand, sky summoner

name: Argivian Archaeologist
text: Fascinated by the lore of ancient struggles, archaeologists search incessantly for remnants of an earlier, more powerful era.

name: Mountain
text: You meant to simply rest in Hundelstone, but the miners have told you stories of whispers in the dark below.

name: Primeval Shambler
text: His mind, like his body, is made up of the swamp's flotsam.

name: Midnight Haunting
text: The path back to the world of the living is murky and bewildering. A geist may not even realize that it's terrifying its own loved ones.

name: Grim Backwoods
text:
"I love what they've done with the place."
—Liliana Vess

name: Command Tower
text: When defeat is near and guidance is scarce, all eyes look in one direction.

name: Mind Stone
text: During biotransference, the Necrontyr lost almost all individuality. What little remained was imprisoned within a living metal form.

name: Curiosity
text: "Surely you know the joy of the hunt, my furry friend. My kind of hunt just takes a different form than yours."

name: Dakmor Ghoul
text:
"Cursed be the sickly forms that err from honest Nature's rule!"
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "Locksley Hall"

name: Pale Bears
text:
"Daughter, on the day you have killed your Pale Bear, then will I give you your true name."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Shrink
text:
"Do not fear adversity. Let your courage be your strength."
—Onatah, Anaba shaman

name: Richard Garfield, Ph.D.
text: And yea he doth spake: "Let there be Magic."

name: Efficient Construction
text: For some of Ghirapur's aerowrights, building thopters is a byproduct of larger construction efforts.

name: Sapphire Leech
text:
"The subject's wings are clearly vestigial. We suspect the gems somehow keep it aloft."
—Tolarian research notes

name: Dismantle
text:
"If only the living were so easily salvaged."
—Memnarch

name: Careful Study
text: Books are like crops—they must be thinned for best yield.

name: Sanctum Custodian
text: Serra told them to guard Urza as he healed. Five years they stood.

name: Soulfire Eruption
text: Forsake flesh. Choose fire.

name: Aberrant Researcher // Perfected Form
text:
"Metamorphosis is a process."
—Laboratory notes

name: Cathedral Sanctifier
text: "Evil will soon be vanquished. What Innistrad most needs now is healing."

name: Entrancing Melody
text: The stronger the will, the more bewitching the song.

name: Archangel's Light
text:
"This is the light of Avacyn. Even in her absence she offers us hope."
—Radulf, priest of Avacyn

name: Paupers' Cage
text: A cage may keep you in, but it does not keep the stones out.

name: Seshiro the Anointed
text: His family was the first to reach out to the human monks. He soon knew as many koans as he did blade strikes.

name: Felidar Sovereign
text:
"If survival is a game, I've seen the winner."
—Hazir, Sejiri cartographer

name: Spectral Hunt-Caller
text: The nightsong begins with a lone howl, but soon swells to a deafening chorus.

name: Venomous Dragonfly
text: A pretty little death is still death.

name: Retraced Image
text: An army from a soldier, a flock from a bird, a school from a fish . . . a profit from an atrocity.

name: Norin the Wary
text: "I have a bad feeling about this."

name: Crossbow Infantry
text:
"He can split a marshfly in two from halfway across the range."
—Onean sergeant

name: Autograph Book
text:
"It was a pleasure to meet me."
—Captain Rex Nebula

name: Skywarp Skaab
text:
"If I wanted all the parts to match, I wouldn't have become a stitcher."
—Barton, stitcher

name: Change the Equation
text: "It's not your fault. Strixhaven taught you an imperfect premise. Okay, the imperfect execution was your fault."

name: Granitic Titan
text:
"That one's not mine. Run!"
—Nissa Revane

name: Weaver of Blossoms // Blossom-Clad Werewolf
text: Living in harmony with nature . . .

name: Pestilent Syphoner
text: The praetors of the other Spheres privately wonder how Sheoldred always has a surplus of glistening oil at her disposal.

name: Tel-Jilad Exile
text: For his crimes, he was made to forget all the trolls' secrets. Now he knows only that he is outcast, but not why.

name: An-Havva Inn
text:
"The Inn was ever a steady source of good cheer and kindness. Greatly do I miss it, now that I am gone."
—Ihsan's Shade

name: Strangle
text: They'd warned him greed would be the death of him. He never thought to take it literally.

name: Seer's Sundial
text: "The shadow travels toward the apex. I predict we will soon see the true measure of darkness."

name: Prized Griffin
text:
"I wrote these tales with a quill made from a griffin's feather. And the winning of that feather is quite a tale itself."
—Chulane, Teller of Tales

name: Divine Favor
text: With an armory of light, even the squire may champion her people.

name: Dragon Engine
text: From a distance, dormant dragon engines can be mistaken for harmless statues. By the time you get close enough to spot the scorch marks, it's too late.

name: Ihsan's Shade
text:
"Ihsan, the weak. Ihsan, the fallen. Ihsan, the betrayer. He has brought shame to the Serra paladins where none existed before. May his suffering equal his betrayal."
—Baris, Serra inquisitor

name: Jund Panorama
text: The sky is the dragon's throne, the seat from which it issues its fiery decrees.

name: Shelter
text: Good strategists seize opportunities. Great strategists make their own.

name: Tend the Pests
text: "I've got a special treat for you today."

name: Lightning Elemental
text: A lightning elemental once killed an entire tribe of merfolk—simply by going for a swim.

name: Bolt of Keranos
text: The breakthroughs granted by Keranos, god of epiphany, can be surprisingly literal.

name: Alena, Kessig Trapper
text: "Halana and I have a bond that'll never be broken."

name: Bristling Boar
text:
"Nicol Bolas destroyed my world. I owe it to Skalla to celebrate all life, no matter how dangerous."
—Vivien Reid

name: Siren Stormtamer
text: He's the calm that hides the coming storm.

name: Urza's Chalice
text: When sorely wounded or tired, Urza would often retreat to the workshops of his apprentices. They were greatly amazed at how much better he looked each time he took a sip of water.

name: Lambholt Pacifist // Lambholt Butcher
text: True peace can't be achieved until everyone else is dead.

name: Damning Verdict
text: "Guilty as charged!"

name: Jhoira's Familiar
text:
"You could say it was my pet project."
—Jhoira

name: Wandering Eye
text: The evincar has many ways of keeping track of his subjects.

name: Voltaic Visionary // Volt-Charged Berserker
text: She spent many years trying to harness chaos.

name: Sea Snidd
text: It always has the home-turf advantage.

name: Undercity Informer
text: "Scandal and slander are never welcome news. That's why I'm never the messenger."

name: Noxious Revival
text:
"Dead or alive, my creations are stronger than Jin-Gitaxias's septic minions."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Introductions Are in Order
text: "Meet my newest minion. Come now, don't be shy—shake her pincer."

name: Excise
text:
"Creation is no great feat. Anything you make, I can unmake in a heartbeat."
—Alexi, zephyr mage

name: Slimebind
text:
"Relax. It's quite harmless. And it will dissolve completely in a month or two."
—Navona, Simic field tester

name: Bojuka Brigand
text: "I don't do tactics. I don't do guard duty. I do damage. Take it or leave it."

name: Murderous Cut
text: The blades of a Sultai assassin stab like the fangs of a dragon.

name: Reduce to Memory
text:
"Do not flinch from studying the horrors of the past. History's most important lessons are cloaked in terror and tragedy."
—Augusta, Lorehold dean

name: Excavated Wall
text:
"Don't be fooled by the quiet. These old stones are trying to talk to you."
—Augusta, Lorehold dean

name: Merfolk Looter
text: In the depths of Rootwater, salvage and sewage differ only in texture.

name: Feast of Blood
text: Imbued in the Ancient Fang were spells far darker than any Dack Fayden would cast.

name: Drown in Sorrow
text:
"The sad truth is that the whip of Erebos is long enough to wrap around all our throats."
—Perisophia the philosopher

name: Stampeding Wildebeests
text: Prayers for rain are answered with the thunder of hooves.

name: Ephara's Radiance
text:
"Civilization is the sum of Ephara's gifts."
—Olexa of the Twelve

name: Loxodon Mystic
text: As the nim storm across the plains, a lone priest stands in their path. At his silent gesture, the battle line breaks, and the tide turns.

name: Fireslinger
text: The most successful entertainers on New Capenna feature an element of medium-to-extreme danger in their acts.

name: Celebrate the Harvest
text: The Harvesttide dance is one of joyous abandon, a last revel before winter nights.

name: Island
text: You're about to disembark to find the harbormaster when you spot a merfolk darting underneath your ship.

name: Sheltering Light
text: Those who wield the power of the sun protect the Empire from darkness.

name: Mistfolk
text:
"Although my official log will state there is no evidence pointing to the existence of the mistfolk, my certainty is lessened by the cursed consistency of the expedition's eyewitness accounts."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Inner-Flame Igniter
text: A light an army can follow.

name: Altar of the Goyf
text:
"What dies grows the [illegible]"
—Clawed-out statue inscription

name: Song-Mad Treachery // Song-Mad Ruins
text:
"They call it the Singing City, but those eerie sounds aren't music. They worm their way into your brain until rational thought is impossible."
—Yavotz, Sea Gate Expeditionary House

name: Goblin Secret Agent
text:
SECRET AGENT
PD042198
LICENSE TO BE KILLED

name: Advent of the Wurm
text: The consciousness of Mat'Selesnya does not always spread in peaceful ways.

name: Tin Street Dodger
text: "That giant didn't even see me, let alone catch me! And I was close enough to smell him! Of course, that's not saying much."

name: Tainted Sigil
text: Sigils corrupted by outsiders do not lose their power, only their purity.

name: Honor the God-Pharaoh
text: In life, they revered a diverse pantheon of gods. Now they revere only the God-Pharaoh.

name: Volrath's Gardens
text: "Watch yourself," warned Starke. "These plants aren't nice when they're hungry."

name: Healer's Flock
text: The sight of a flock overhead is bittersweet. It means many are wounded, but it also means help is on the way.

name: Twigwalker
text:
"Break one in half and you'll get a decent—if gooey—pair of weapons."
—Centaur warrior

name: Leonin Vanguard
text: The best fighters are skilled in both harming and healing.

name: Short Sword
text:
"Sometimes the only difference between a martyr and a hero is a sword."
—Captain Sisay, *Memoirs*

name: Lobe Lobber
text:
"Time for you to meet the brains of this operation!"
—The Big Idea

name: Pilfering Hawk
text:
"Well, at least it left us a mouse in exchange. Er . . . ugh . . . make that half a mouse."
—Binhald, Beskir veteran

name: Annex Sentry
text: There's never a need to change the watch, for the servants of Norn are sleepless.

name: Skemfar Avenger
text: Stripped of their divinity, the elves of Skemfar channeled their rage and sorrow into bloody brutality.

name: Wrecking Ball
text: Rakdos festivals almost leave enough rubble in their wake to hide the bodies.

name: Wild Colos
text: You'll never get a Keldon's goat.

name: Wizards' School
text: The legacy of Feroz lives on.

name: Munda's Vanguard
text: "Do not let yourselves fall now. Zendikar is depending on us—on you!"

name: Avatar of Slaughter
text:
"Diplomacy has solved nothing. Only bloodspill can end this now. Call forth the warbringer."
—Basandra, Battle Seraph

name: Last Chance
text: Li'l Giri defeated the dastardly villain . . . or had he? Find out what is in store for our hero next time!

name: Shrine of the Forsaken Gods
text: The gods known to the merfolk as Ula, Emeria, and Cosi were nothing more than false memories of a monstrous trinity: the Eldrazi titans Ulamog, Emrakul, and Kozilek.

name: Look at Me, I'm the DCI
text: Few understand the DCI's rigorous decision-making process.

name: Torture
text:
"Oh, they scream, right enough, and plead, too—but the Baron keeps no mercy in his vault of horrors."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate

name: Exquisite Blood
text: Even as humans regained the upper hand, some still willingly traded their lives for a chance at immortality.

name: Songs of the Damned
text: Not wind, but the breath of the dead.

name: Inspiration
text: Madness and genius are separated only by degrees of success.

name: Skyknight Legionnaire
text: Millennium Platform, once a monument to peace, was quickly seized by the skyknights for its strategic aerial location.

name: Rank and File
text: "Left, right, left, right . . . hmm. Okay—left, left, left, left, . . ."

name: Brisela, Voice of Nightmares
text: Upon discovering what had become of her sisters, Sigarda could only weep.

name: Setessan Training
text: In the heart of Setessa, the warriors of Leina Tower defend the polis and train its daughters.

name: Bounce Chamber
text: It recreates the peaceful feeling of floating freely in space, just without all that boring peacefulness.

name: Demolish
text:
"When fire is shackled to candle and torch, subjected to insignificance, it finds a way to lash out at its masters."
—Vala, disciple of Purphoros

name: Silk Net
text: Sometimes it's possible to pull a meal out of thin air.

name: Paragon of Modernity
text: No true angels have been created since the founding of New Capenna, but artisans have learned to craft elegant facsimiles.

name: Unbreakable Bond
text:
From now until the crystals stop glowing
—Ketria oath meaning "forever"

name: Brutal Suppression
text:
"They no longer care about their own suffering. Show them something worse."
—Latulla, Keldon overseer

name: Grove Rumbler
text:
"The land will not wait for the enemy to arrive."
—Nissa Revane

name: Will of the Naga
text: The charm of a naga is undeniable.

name: Undergrowth
text:
"The art of war is turning obstacle to advantage."
—Jaeuhl Carthalion, Juniper Order Advocate

name: Nimana Skitter-Sneak
text: "When navigating dangerous terrain, one hundred legs are better than two."

name: Clam-I-Am
text:
The Clams down in Clamville
All scootered and skittled—
"The three is no more!"
The Clam fiddler fiddled.

name: Bonebreaker Giant
text: One thing's for sure—his fists are harder than your skull.

name: Essence Capture
text: The Futurists regard the tradition of kami-bonding as anachronistic and inefficient, striving constantly to surpass spiritual power with technology.

name: Foul Familiar
text:
"Serve me, and live forever."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Gilder Bairn
text: Do the glowing trinkets show it the way home, or do they set a twisted path for someone else to follow?

name: Gravewaker
text: Once every seven years it flies on spectral wings over the moors of ancient battlefields.

name: Yawgmoth's Edict
text: The warping of bodies and souls has become the heart of Yawgmoth's existence.

name: Opt
text: 「最もよく叶う願いは、自らの運命を選択したいという願いだ。」

name: Fateful Showdown
text: Tonight at the Grand Exhibition, witness Head Judge Tezzeret face off against the infamous renegade Pia Nalaar.

name: Ogre Marauder
text: Once freed, the oni demanded more and more sacrifices to appease them. The ogres happily obliged.

name: Bramble Elemental
text: Ravnica is a seamless urban tapestry, each city bleeding into the next. In abandoned corners, however, nature has begun to reclaim what it once owned.

name: Thran Temporal Gateway
text: The portal opens not to the past, but from it. Those who step through discover an unimaginable future.

name: Mark of the Oni
text:
"As more oni walked Kamigawa, more darkness infested its inhabitants' souls."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Crocodile of the Crossing
text:
"Everything in the trial has teeth. You will overcome them, or you will feed them."
—Rhonas, god of strength

name: Priest of Forgotten Gods
text: The Orzhov are not the only religious tradition on Ravnica, nor the oldest.

name: Geier Reach Sanitarium
text: All are welcome.

name: Amped Up
text: Space can be a lawless place—far from the prying eyes of electrical inspectors.

name: Shadow Glider
text: A few bands of kor sought refuge from the Eldrazi in Zendikar's vast cave networks, relying on their ability to survive in harsh vertical landscapes.

name: Drannith Stinger
text: "If you're going to run for cover, you should start now."

name: Circle of Protection: Artifacts
text: "Memnarch shall rage against us. We shall endure."

name: Deliberate
text: "I can't see all that the future holds, but I can keep us one step ahead of death."

name: Antler Skulkin
text: Every skull has a tale to tell, and a skulkin is many dire tales cobbled together.

name: Divine Light
text:
"Phyrexia is an unforgiving place, and I am an angry lord in an unforgiving mood."
—Lord Windgrace

name: Dragon Throne of Tarkir
text: What once soared high above Tarkir is now reduced to a seat.

name: Secrets of the Dead
text:
"The veil between the living and the dead is so very thin that the whispers of the ancients can finally be heard."
—Amalric of Midvast Hall

name: Balduvian Rage
text:
"Let your heartbeat be the thunder in the valley. Let your swords be the lightning on the peaks."
—Lothar Lovisason, Balduvian chieftain

name: Invoke the Divine
text:
"Let go of all that harms you. Cast your burdens into the darkness, and build for the faithful a house of light."
—*Song of All*, canto 1008

name: Sythis, Harvest's Hand
text: Action: We'd like you to design Sythis, a legendary green- and white-aligned female dryad who's closely tied to Karametra, the god of the harvest (p.26)

name: Throne of Bone
text: Tainted by a thousand fears.

name: Enigma Drake
text: Many initiates believe it possesses secrets known only to Kefnet himself. Many have become meals trying to learn them.

name: Stonewood Invocation
text: "Might of ancient wood and stone, Into spirit, flesh, and bone."

name: Park Bleater
text: Once he stopped eating tickets, Bixby was a model employee.

name: Curse of Conformity
text: Whether you'll fit in isn't up to you at all.

name: Ulvenwald Captive // Ulvenwald Abomination
text:
"The Eldrazi are all too practiced at twisting natural into unnatural."
—Nissa Revane

name: Soul Snare
text:
"Shackle the body, and the anguish lasts only until death. Shackle the soul, and the wicked can be punished for eternity."
—Inquisitor Laerin

name: Jeweled Spirit
text: As he knows all the world completely, the world refuses him harm.

name: Propaganda // Propaganda
text:
"Obedience is the true path to happiness."
—Dolorus, magister equitum

name: Ichor Explosion
text: The first explosion that didn't excite goblins.

name: Rockcaster Platoon
text:
"Aven bandits can be sly. You've got to fill the sky with boulders—and then seek cover immediately."
—Knight-Captain Wyhorn

name: Grand Crescendo
text: The roar of applause drowned out the melee raging in the lobby.

name: Titanic Growth
text:
"It is as the Mirrans say: True strength comes from within."
—Ich-Tekik, Salvage Splicer

name: Floodwaters
text:
"It usually appears placid, but don't be fooled. The Luxa River is a snake, and it can swallow you whole."
—Neponem, vizier of Kefnet

name: Wyleth, Soul of Steel
text: "Two things a warrior needs: a strong sword and a strong will."

name: Escape Artist
text: "Not even my shadow knows where I am."

name: Herald of the Sun
text: "Fear neither clouds nor darkness. The light shall overcome them all."

name: Torment
text:
"Volrath has killed me. All that remains of me is the scar!"
—Tahngarth

name: Glissa Sunseeker
text: "There's a secret at the heart of this world, and I will unlock it."

name: Doom Blade
text:
"One little word was all it took. The world shook as I said it. The doom of Zendikar was here at last."
—Ob Nixilis

name: Cliffrunner Behemoth
text: It's revered for its power, celebrated for its grace, and feared for the avalanches triggered by its thunderous feet.

name: Shanodin Dryads
text: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the Dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.

name: White Shield Crusader
text: "Honor your steed and it will carry you to great deeds—and bring you home to tell of them."

name: Othelm, Sigardian Outcast
text: "A friend is someone you'd do anything for."

name: Quandrix Apprentice
text: "The secrets of our world will be mine."

name: Pathbreaker Ibex
text:
"My skills are wasted here."
—Juruk, Kalonian tracker

name: Righteous Charge
text:
"Bravery shines brightest in a pure soul."
—Restela, Alaborn marshal

name: Song of Serenity
text: Heartwood brings peace in great symphonies where dryads conduct the trees through every note.

name: Orcish Lumberjack
text:
"How did I ever let myself get talked into this project?"
—Toothlicker Harj, orcish captain

name: Diregraf Ghoul
text:
"At least this one still has arms and legs. Well, most of its legs."
—Enslow, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

name: Ekundu Cyclops
text:
"Big one I, One big eye. One-eye see Two-eye die!"
—Traditional cyclops chant

name: Bloodborn Scoundrels
text: The ring plays host to some combatants that the spectators love to hate.

name: Vulshok War Boar
text: It must eat its weight in metal daily, or its furnacelike belly will consume itself for lack of fuel.

name: Golgari Thug
text: "What is death?" he asked the raven. "Your next birth," it replied.

name: Skyshroud Blessing
text: "Behold," said Freyalise to Eladamri. "Your Skyshroud home has followed you to Dominaria."

name: Icatian Town
text: Icatia's once-peaceful towns faced increasing attacks from orcs and goblins as the climate cooled. By the time the empire fell, they were little more than armed camps.

name: Peregrine Mask
text: The mask confers both the prowess of a falcon and its loyalty.

name: Switcheroo
text: Say hello to your new friend.

name: Garenbrig Carver // Shield's Might
text: Countless knights of Garenbrig owe their lives to his peerless craftsmanship.

name: Serene Steward
text: "I can give you strength, but you'll have to bring your own courage."

name: Peema Outrider
text: Connected as artificer and invention, bonded as rider and steed.

name: Power Plant Worker
text: Mechanical workers toiled away, tirelessly fueling the impossible.

name: Plaguemaw Beast
text: Phyrexia's spiral of consumption grows ever wider and darker.

name: Joven
text:
"Joven, you're almost as good a thief as I. But Eron hates you even more."
—Chandler

name: Kaervek's Spite
text:
"The end justifies the means. What do I care if I rule over the dead rather than over the living? The dead ask fewer questions."
—Kaervek

name: Pelakka Predation // Pelakka Caverns
text:
"As a child, I was afraid of the dark. Now, I'm afraid of the things I know are lurking in the dark, waiting to bite my head off."
—Sneeflebrix, expedition rogue

name: Flayed One
text: Those suspected of carrying the flayer curse are summarily banished, lest the corruption spread to other Necrons.

name: Centaur Safeguard
text: Swift, strong, and selfless, the centaurs are the shields of the Conclave.

name: Corrupted Grafstone
text: It is all too easy to disturb the Blessed Sleep.

name: Nurgle's Conscription
text:
"In the embrace of the great Nurgle, I am no longer afraid, for with His pestilential favour I have become that which I once most feared: Death."
—Kulvain Hestarius of the Death Guard

name: Baird, Argivian Recruiter
text: "Fear doesn't make you a coward; giving in to it does. Now take up your sword and fight!"

name: Duelcraft Trainer
text: "It's all in the follow-through."

name: Appetite for Brains
text: Just as with a peach, the first bite is always the juiciest.

name: Knights' Charge
text:
"By hoof, wing, or paw. For the realm!"
—Syr Gwyn, Hero of Ashvale

name: Defend the Campus
text: Professors scrambled to push the mage hunters back, leaving the heart of Strixhaven undefended.

name: Wall of Diffusion
text:
"The injury was being caught between this world and our own; the insult was to find walls within."
—Lyna, soltari emissary

name: Firemind Vessel
text: The city mourned Niv-Mizzet's death, but he left behind the components for his rebirth.

name: Wolf in _____ Clothing
text: "And to think, I came in here looking for someone to eat."

name: Mwonvuli Acid-Moss
text:
"Life gives way to death, and death to new life. Nature feeds upon her own decay."
—Ezrith, druid of the Dark Hours

name: Abyssal Specter
text:
"Mystic shadow, bending near me, / Who art thou? / Whence come ye?"
—Stephen Crane, "Mystic shadow, bending near me"

name: Duskhunter Bat
text: The swamps go silent at its approach, but it still hears the heartbeat of the prey within.

name: Unsummon
text:
"You're trespassing in my reality. Ask permission next time."
—Simun the Quiet

name: Curious Killbot
text: "whirrrr . . . beep . . . click . . . click?"

name: Heartstone
text:
"Finding a true heartstone is even harder than finding a true heart."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

name: Orcish Librarian
text: "Us hungry, need food . . . . Lots of books . . . . Hmm . . . ."

name: Wind Spirit
text:
"To visit the sky requires bravery, and thought, and little else. To master the sky requires the binding of its masters, and little else."
—Arnjlot Olasson, sky mage

name: Daysquad Marshal
text: "The night emboldens many monsters, but the mightiest will attack in broad daylight."

name: Roon of the Hidden Realm
text: "Time and space are just new battlefields to be mastered."

name: Fleshtaker
text: A soulless husk of endless hunger.

name: Griffin Canyon
text:
"Where are falling feathers deadlier than falling rock?"
—*The One Thousand Questions*

name: Akroan Skyguard
text: "Trust me. When you have earned a god's favor, you'll know."

name: Pigment Storm
text: When art projects collapse, Prismari students revel in the beauty of destruction. Everyone else runs for cover.

name: Sandstorm
text:
Better to fight the sand for a few hours than to sleep beneath it forever.
—Suq'Ata truism

name: Costume Shop
text:
"The costumes are so realistic! I was mistaken for Nicol Bolas and attacked by a bunch of wizards! Five stars! They eventually let me go."
—*Salzon's Ride Review*

name: Teferi's Honor Guard
text:
"They may seem ceremonial, but their swords are still sharp."
—Kipkemboi, Kukemssa pirate

name: Festering Goblin
text: In life, it was a fetid, disease-ridden thing. In death, not much changed.

name: Jokulhaups
text:
"The raging waters had swept away trees, bridges, and even houses. My healers had much work to do."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Harrow
text: No spot in nature is truly barren.

name: Accumulated Knowledge
text:
"I have seen and heard much here. There are secrets within secrets. Let me show you."
—Takara, to Eladamri

name: Blessed Defiance
text: "If I'm going, I'm taking you with me!"

name: Sudden Edict
text: Intent: This illustration uses an existing visual gag that shows the moments before and after a spell was cast. We'd like you to use this visual gag for a spell that destroys a creature.

name: Simoon
text:
"The black-and-white sacred monkey holds her children to her, and waits."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Frost Lynx
text: It readily attacks much larger prey, knowing retaliation is impossible.

name: Sustenance
text: Like the dryads, the forest itself willingly gives up some of its life for the sake of the future.

name: Dynavolt Tower
text:
"I like that Tezzeret. He has vision the other judges don't. He sees the potential in what we're making here."
—Faiz, inventor

name: Innocent Blood
text: Zombies mourn for the living and celebrate those who will soon be given the gift of death.

name: Feral Maaka
text:
"Lost are the lush meadows and verdant forests, where maaka prowled and lammasu soared. Lost are the wilds, where our hearts were free."
—Daiva, Gruul storyteller

name: Macabre Waltz
text:
"All dead move to the hollow rhythm of necromancy."
—Savra

name: Waylay
text: "You reek of corruption," spat the knight. "Why are you even here?"

name: Embrace My Diabolical Vision
text: "My vision is for the good of everyone. Mostly me."

name: Duskdale Wurm
text:
"Last time, it tore up the Wilt-Leaf, turned Mistmeadow into a mudhole, and made the river jump its banks. On the bright side, we were eating venison for weeks."
—Donal Alloway, cenn of Kinscaer

name: Pounce
text: The drive to hunt and feed is raw instinct for dinosaurs. The trick is simply to channel it in the right direction.

name: Holy Day
text:
"The day of Spirits; my soul's calm retreat / Which none disturb!"
—Henry Vaughan, "The Night"

name: Riverwise Augur
text: "Time flows as the rivers do, toward an unknown sea. The wise know to look downstream."

name: Sea Gate Restoration // Sea Gate, Reborn
text:
"We have much to remember ... and much we can never forget."
—Tazri

name: Purple Worm
text: Underground civilizations maintain magical barriers around their settlements to deter these monsters.

name: Wild Nacatl
text: "The Cloud Nacatl sit and think, a bunch of soft paws. We are the Claws of Marisi, stalking, pouncing, drawing blood."

name: Militia's Pride
text: If you pick a fight with one kithkin, be ready to fight them all.

name: War Horn
text: The reverberations course through the warriors' veins, beat with their hearts, and pound with their footfalls as they charge into battle.

name: Elder Cathar
text: "My greatest hope is that you will surpass me in every way, consigning my name to some forgotten corner of history."

name: Warhorn Blast
text: "Mead down! Swords up!"

name: Severed Strands
text: "I've seen Ravnica's fate. Believe me, I'm doing you a favor."

name: Blightstep Pathway // Searstep Pathway
text:
"The waters smell oddly sweet, but do not be enticed. You don't want to meet what lurks below the surface."
—Solrun, Beskir warrior

name: Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit
text: Martyred for worshipping her ancestors, she now walks among them.

name: Baaallerina
text: Cute as a mutton.

name: Rumbling Ruin
text: The Rubblebelt grows restless.

name: Greed
text: A monster appeared! With a foul claw, it snatched the child and disappeared into the depths of the castle!

name: Reduce to Dreams
text:
"This world is a dream. We cling to our toys like children, but sooner or later we must learn to live without them."
—Sensei Hisoka

name: Nether Spirit
text: Four walls and a roof won't provide safety from that which is buried.

name: Mosquito Guard
text: His aim is as sure as a mosquito's sting, but with none of the warning.

name: Spatial Contortion
text:
"For those without the Planeswalker spark, the merest touch of the Blind Eternities can kill."
—Ugin

name: Inkfathom Divers
text:
"None appreciate sun and shallows like those who have seen the depths."
—Lianda of the Stonybrook school

name: Nightmare
text: The nightmare arises from its lair in the swamps. As the poisoned land spreads, so does the nightmare's rage and terrifying strength.

name: Sundering Vitae
text: Centuries of wind, rain, and roots compressed into an instant of destruction: such is the power of Selesnya.

name: Skittish Kavu
text: Fierce when roused, this breed of kavu is easily distracted by a strong voice or melodic tune.

name: Maggot Therapy
text:
"If this is the cure, I'd hate to see the disease."
—Orim

name: Frost Breath
text: "I'll make ice chimes of your bones."

name: Rivals' Duel
text: They could agree on one thing only: one of them must die.

name: Foul Play
text: The evidence was overwhelming. Tovolar's howlpack was getting bolder, smarter, and stronger.

name: Durkwood Tracker
text: These days, trackers must follow their quarry over years as well as miles.

name: Homeward Path
text:
"Let your heels point you home."
—Ancient blessing

name: Poison the Cup
text: Dark schemes cut down what armies cannot.

name: Backstreet Bruiser
text: "I could show you what's in the case, but it'd be the last thing you ever see."

name: Rise from the Grave
text:
"Don't get too comfortable in there."
—Liliana Vess

name: Zealous Guardian
text: Parapet watchers patrol the outer edges of the doun, signaling to others who wait patiently in shadow.

name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
text:
"The paladins would be wise not to forget about the Pearl Trident. The merfolk warriors have turned the tide of more than one human war … and I have no doubt they shall do so again."
—Onean scholar

name: Personal Tutor
text: Lomelda had spent four semesters on the waitlist for Kasmina's Advanced Polymorphological Theory seminar. She was determined not to miss a word.

name: Warping Wurm
text: Even wurms start out small.

name: Reya Dawnbringer
text: A beacon of hope for a battered army.

name: Ethereal Haze
text:
"Imagine a dove flying through smoke. Does the dove injure the smoke? Does the smoke impede the dove?"
—Teachings of Eight-and-a-Half-Tails

name: Anticipate
text: "You thought I wouldn't see that coming?"

name: Wall of Fortune
text: "You need a six? All right everyone, she needs a six!"

name: Resolute Blademaster
text: "Great steel is born in the hottest forges. Great soldiers are born in war."

name: Serra's Boon
text:
"The light of an angel's glance is warm, but her fixed stare blinds and burns."
—Calexis, deacon of the New Order of Serra

name: Messenger Falcons
text: So many aven had died scouting the distant fronts that the knight-captains recruited Nayan falcons as couriers.

name: Mouth to Mouth
text: Interesting tidbit: Surveys show that the card Ow has one of the most popular pieces of flavor text in the *Unglued* expansion.

name: Ruthless Invasion
text:
"For the survival of our people, every conflict must now end in retreat."
—Pythor, Mirran resistance

name: Volcanic Rush
text:
"The bravest warriors take the shortest path to victory, whatever that path may be."
—Sakta, Atarka hunter

name: Marked by Honor
text: Stand your post for duty. Stand your ground for honor.

name: Starnheim Aspirant
text: "I do not fear death. I know my soul will rise to Starnheim, where I will feast forever among valkyries and heroes. Can you say the same?"

name: Call to Mind
text:
"It's hard to say which is more satisfying: the search for that missing piece or fitting that piece into place."
—Evo Ragus

name: Desecrated Tomb
text: The grave robbers were startled, for the door to the mausoleum was already open.

name: Floodgate
text:
"Quick, Rhirhok—teach me to swim!"
—Makht, goblin casualty

name: Roiling Terrain
text:
"The trembling lands ruptured, leaving an open door for things from below to emerge."
—Screed of the Mul Daya

name: Nature's Ruin
text: One chill blast—the exhalation of the grave.

name: Sudden Impact
text: Most people know better. Goblins only know bigger.

name: Alluring Siren
text: She lures victims with promises of flesh, captures them in a net of deceit, and destroys them in the embrace of the sea.

name: Sphinx of Jwar Isle
text:
"Even if the sphinxes do know the location of every relic, getting one to talk is harder than just searching yourself."
—Sachir, Akoum Expeditionary House

name: Whir of Invention
text: "Magic hat, I'm gonna be frank. What we need now is a twenty-ton tank!"

name: Pulmonic Sliver
text: Like a great bellows it hisses, and its kin, both living and dead, are lifted to safety.

name: Vulshok Berserker
text: He will carve out a legend for himself with his own two hands.

name: Deadapult
text:
"Nothing ruins your day like a blazing zombie."
—Tahngarth

name: Crawlspace
text: "Not so scary when you can't squeeze through the air ducts, are you?"

name: Titan Hunter
text: "Monster or human, my rate's the same."

name: Mistcaller
text: Hospitality is of little concern to those who do not wish to be disturbed.

name: Rescue
text: With just a few seconds to escape, Deryan saved Hurkyl's editions on restoring physical objects from ash.

name: Fact or Fiction
text: Two futures unfurled before the mage, each rife with its own promise.

name: Scuttlemutt
text: Built to shuttle goods from the river, it took off one day carrying a cauldron of dyes.

name: No Rest for the Wicked
text:
"The soul? Here, we have no use for such frivolities."
—Sitrik, birth priest

name: Nivix Guildmage
text: "The only action worth taking is one with an unknown outcome."

name: Daru Lancer
text: Although the Order frowned upon his preparations for the pits, behind closed doors most saw the fights as a necessary evil.

name: The Peregrine Dynamo
text: Jhoira stumbled upon an ally, not just a good source of spare parts.

name: Immolating Gyre
text: "Nice army you had there."

name: Dispersal Shield
text: "Maybe next time."

name: Mold Shambler
text: When civilization encroaches on nature, Zendikar encroaches back.

name: Whipstitched Zombie
text: Pity the tailor.

name: Yavimaya Ancients
text:
"We orphans of Fyndhorn have found no welcome in this alien place."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

name: Slice in Twain
text:
"The hypocrisy of these elves is thicker than steel—destroying 'unnatural metal' with their own enchanted swords."
—Kara Vrist, Neurok agent

name: Tattered Drake
text:
"Drakes embody the worst of Ravnica: great potential, twisted by selfishness and greed."
—Razia

name: Kami of Tattered Shoji
text: It remembered all the shadows lantern-cast upon its paper wings, and sometimes those silhouettes played across its shape again, acting out silent tragedies.

name: Lowland Giant
text: "Faugh!" snorted Tahngarth. "Why would it make a meal of something like you?" Squee looked relieved. "No," he continued, "you'd make a much better toothpick."

name: Clown Extruder
text: The sound it makes is indescribable and unsettling, but it does make a great clown.

name: Rumbling Sentry
text:
"To provoke the mountain is to invite the avalanche."
—Perisophia the philosopher

name: Experimental Aviator
text: "The little thopters seemed lonely up here, so I thought I'd join them."

name: Beacon of Unrest
text: A vertical scream pierces the night air and echoes doom through the clouds.

name: Scorchmark
text: "Have you seen your face? Trust me, this will be an improvement."

name: Rings a Bell
text: Ding, ding, ding!

name: Banishing Light
text:
The Champion reached for a stone, and Heliod placed the sun into her hand.
—*The Theriad*

name: Pyroclasm
text:
"When the air burns, only death breathes deep."
—Bogardan mage

name: Costume Shop
text:
"Chandra's Pyromastery Gloves are not fire resistant."
—Costume warning label

name: Memory Lapse
text: What a lonely agony, the memory of memories lost.

name: Furnace Whelp
text: Baby dragons can't figure out humans—if they didn't want to be killed, why were they made of meat and treasure?

name: Goldenglow Moth
text: Ordinary moths follow it, drawn to its light.

name: Decimate
text: Anarchy comes in many forms: social, individual, Gruul . . .

name: Mogg Maniac
text: Stand clear if he gets an itch.

name: Naturalize
text:
"One touch of nature makes the whole world kin."
—William Shakespeare,
*Troilus and Cressida*

name: Maelstrom Muse
text: She's an inspiration to everyone, even herself.

name: Horned Cheetah
text: "I think she wants us to eat it," said Squee, staring at the oily carcass the cheetah had dragged to their fire.

name: Painiac
text: "You're about to be struck by a brilliant idea!"

name: Hallowed Moonlight
text: Creatures of darkness instinctively hide from the light.

name: Angelic Wall
text: Be at peace, and observe its beauty. Be at war, and feel its justice.

name: Aven Farseer
text: His enemies' trickery and deceit only fuel his righteous anger.

name: Geistflame
text: Innistrad pyromancers find their best raw materials in the fury of the dead.

name: Ore Gorger
text:
"We've stumbled upon a network of caves not on our maps. We can only hope it is safe to spend the night."
—Lost Battalion, message to General Takeno

name: Fate Forgotten
text: When Sarkhan saved Ugin in Tarkir's past, it changed Tarkir's future. The Sultai no longer exist, having been supplanted by the dragonlord Silumgar and his clan.

name: Braids, Cabal Minion
text: "Home is where you can find a decent graveyard and strangers can disappear without awkward questions."

name: Exotic Orchard
text: In the late stages of a Tyranid invasion, sessile organisms take root in a planet's crust, converting its resources into biomass that can be extracted by the Hive Fleet.

name: Sharpened Pitchfork
text: Not everyone can have a sword of blessed silver. Not everyone needs one, either.

name: Spiritual Guardian
text: Hope is born within.

name: Even the Score
text: Those who try to rob the Obscura often leave behind more than they take away.

name: Sarkhan's Catharsis
text: "You once brought havoc to my home and ruined my mind. I'm here to return the favor, Bolas."

name: Elephant Grass
text:
"How have I angered nature that she would imprison me in a labyrinth of grass?"
—Kasib ibn Naji, Letters

name: Bola Warrior
text: The ingredients for panic include equal parts danger, uncertainty, and helplessness.

name: Hunter Sliver
text: Once they get the scent, there is no escape.

name: Blessed Spirits
text: Not all heroes die in armor.

name: Voice of Many
text: His words echo every roar, screech, and howl of the wilds.

name: Food Chain
text: Every predator is something else's prey.

name: Stuffed Bear
text: It takes a taxidermist of unusual skill to cleanly stuff and mount a beast without severing its primal, predatory drive.

name: Cobbled Wings
text: For the necro-alchemist, any puzzle can be solved with intelligence and harvested body parts.

name: Abyssal Horror
text:
"I dreamt of it once. Now I fear it dreams of me."
—Tolarian scholar

name: Eyes of Gitaxias
text: No longer bound by the myopic limitations of flesh, Ekken would truly see the realms.

name: Gobhobbler Rats
text: Lyzolda's pet rats eat better than the average citizen. In fact, they can usually be found eating the average citizen.

name: Thalia, Guardian of Thraben
text: "I am the Guardian of Thraben, and I claim my right to speak before the council."

name: Pillar of the Paruns
text: Built on the very ground where the Ten signed the Guildpact, the tower is a monument to the past and a reminder of who holds power in the present.

name: Lightning Axe
text:
"A gargoyle's meat can be carved with an ordinary cleaver, but for its petrous hide . . ."
—Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar, *The Underworld Cookbook*

name: Farhaven Elf
text: "Verdant bloom does exist. It merely hides for its own safety."

name: Declare Dominance
text:
"If you think yourself a chief, then prove your might."
—Gar-Tun, Mistvalley silverback

name: Scrivener
text:
"History is a potent weapon."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Manamorphose
text: For a moment, objects of pure mana glimmered in the wonderstruck boggart's hands. In the next moment, they were in his mouth, as he chewed contentedly.

name: Tel-Jilad Archers
text: They are extensions of the Tangle, stretching its vines into the furthest reaches of the sky.

name: Dream Thief
text: Awylla's salvaged dreams would finally be put to good use.

name: Anguished Unmaking
text: Sorin had created Avacyn, so it was a cruelty beyond imagining, a pain beyond description, that it fell upon him to end her forever.

name: Trumpet Blast
text: Keldon warriors don't need signals to tell them when to attack, but when to stop.

name: Scourge of Kher Ridges
text: Doom casts its own flickering shadow.

name: Steadfastness
text: Brute force wins the battles. Conviction wins the wars.

name: Imperial Seal
text:
"Your presence at the palace this evening is required."
—Letter from Queen Marchesa

name: Painter's Servant
text: This whimsical automaton helps create beautiful murals, then stands guard as they dry.

name: Ember Beast
text:
Spot one ember beast, attack.
Spot a second, best fall back.
—Dwarven saying

name: Ornery Kudu
text: Debate rages among the viziers whether comparing the kudu's horns to the God-Pharaoh's is blasphemy or reverence.

name: Inner-Chamber Guard
text:
"It seems that each time I visit Lord Konda his guards are more on edge, perhaps even more eager for the war to reach them."
—Masako the Humorless

name: Phyrexian Debaser
text:
"The second stage of the illness: high fever and severe infectiousness."
—Phyrexian progress notes

name: Dream Salvage
text: Awylla tried hard to forget the horrors she had seen, but someone else had developed a keen interest in them.

name: Gargoyle Castle
text: Most knew of the tower's wizard and gargoyle. Few realized which was guardian and which was master.

name: Firestorm Phoenix
text: "The bird of wonder dies, the maiden phoenix,/ Her ashes new-create another heir/ As great in admiration as herself." —William Shakespeare, *King Henry the Eighth*

name: It That Gets Left Hanging
text: "Give me . . . some skin."

name: Orim
text: Trained in the Samite arts, Orim serves as the healer aboard the *Weatherlight*. She is quick with languages and was educated at the same Argivian university as Hanna. A student by nature, Orim keeps a diary of all her new discoveries—both physical and spiritual—during her travels.

name: Ajani's Pridemate
text: Planeswalkers conjured replicas of old allies, reminders of the homeworlds that would fall next if Bolas prevailed.

name: Reprobation
text: There was a time all craven beasts cowered before Avacyn's divine might.

name: Mind's Eye
text: Developed and tested by researchers at the Consulate's House of Knowledge, these devices allow anyone to see with a visionary's eye.

name: Diabolic Edict
text: Greven *il*-Vec lifted Vhati off his feet. "The fall will give you time to think on your failure."

name: Draconic Disciple
text: "If I am to die, I will die in the embrace of immeasurable flame."

name: Lightning Helix
text:
"Mages in the Blood Age would call down actual thunderstorms on their enemies. I bet we can replicate their technique."
—Dradiel, Lorehold mage-student

name: Cho-Manno, Revolutionary
text: "Mercadia's masks can no longer hide the truth. Our day has come at last."

name: Hooting Mandrills
text: Interlopers in Sultai territory usually end up as crocodile chow or baboon bait.

name: Sangrite Surge
text: Some believe the spiky crystal called sangrite is concentrated dragon's breath. Others think it's crystallized life energy. The clans care only about the power it unleashes when crushed.

name: The Unspeakable
text: It is madness that drives men to seek forbidden knowledge, and madness has given it form.

name: Stalking Bloodsucker
text: The pits feed both its thirst for combat and its thirst for blood.

name: Entangler
text: "Tell me again," said Latulla, raising her fist, "how just one woman held back an entire Keldon platoon."

name: Barrin
text: An old and powerful wizard living on the mysterious isle of Tolaria, Barrin is the teacher who trained the young Ertai. He is also Hanna's father, but for reasons known only to the two of them neither acknowledges the other—or their strained relationship.

name: Torrent Sculptor // Flamethrower Sonata
text: He channels his heart's passion into every fiery note.

name: Graveyard Shovel
text: Thanks to Havengul's thriving illegal market for corpses, the shovel that interred a body during the day is usually the same one digging it out at night.

name: Cartouche of Knowledge
text: Cartouches chronicle the initiates' achievements in the trials.

name: Tower Worker
text: Even Urza's most mundane creations shared his obsession with perfection.

name: Yotian Medic
text:
"Go, save as many as you can! The city walls may be rubble, but Kroog will live on in its people."
—Queen Kayla bin-Kroog

name: Elder Druid
text:
"Did clouds dance in his eyes, did thorns play at his fingertips?"
—Shesul Fass, faerie bard

name: Umara Entangler
text: "Sea Gate is gone, the Halimar basin empty. But rebuild the seawall and give these waters time, and they will fill the basin anew."

name: Life's Legacy
text: At the instant of death, the mystery of life.

name: Devour Intellect
text:
"I'll know what you know soon enough."
—Nihiloor, Xanathar Guild spymaster

name: Cursed Flesh
text: A farewell to arms . . . and feet . . . and legs . . . .

name: Reckless Waif // Merciless Predator
text: "Yes, I'm alone. No, I'm not worried."

name: Aquitect's Will
text: There is nowhere on Lorwyn that the Merrow Lanes cannot go.

name: Wall of Essence
text:
"If you cannot turn your enemy's strength to weakness, then make that strength your own."
—Gresha, warrior sage

name: Uncovered Clues
text: The Implicit Maze winds through Ravnica, connecting arcane landmarks of all ten guilds.

name: Hydromorph Guardian
text: In front of every strong leader is a pool of loyal bodyguards.

name: Weight of Memory
text: In lives that have stretched for centuries, there are bound to be a few awkward silences.

name: Adventuring Gear
text: An explorer's essentials in a wild world.

name: Nettle Swine
text:
"I killed one and found bricks and bones in its belly. It had eaten a whole cottage, thatch and all."
—Paulin, Somberwald trapper

name: Jackalope Herd
text: There's little more demeaning than getting your butt kicked by a bunch of bunnies.

name: Avenging Hunter
text: "I will remember my friends. But you? You won't be remembered at all."

name: Cylian Elf
text: From her sunsail tent high above the forest floor, an elf harkener can hear the footfalls of a single creature through the cacophony of Naya's jungle sounds.

name: Argivian Archaeologist
text: Fascinated by the lore of ancient struggles, the archaeologist searches incessantly for remnants of an earlier, more powerful era.

name: Remand
text: "Well, at least all of that arm-waving and arcane babbling you did was impressive."

name: Garth One-Eye
text: A humble appearance belies a master's skill.

name: Oboro, Palace in the Clouds
text: Here the soratami wove their endless plots—graceful, artful, and deceitful, while the unwitting world moved below.

name: Molting Skin
text: "We have learned much from the orochi."

name: Molder
text:
"The forests have succumbed to ruin, but the spirit of Krosa remains alive and vital in these devouring spores."
—Zyd, Kamahlite druid

name: Magnetic Flux
text: After the researcher's astonishing success, his assistants spent six hours finding a way to return the specimens safely to the ground.

name: Phantasmal Abomination
text: Create an illusion so strong that it becomes another's reality, and you can become the master of all.

name: Mutilate
text: "You mortals turn to dust in the blink of an eye. I only expedite your fate."

name: Storm Strike
text: "My shout is thunder and my fist is lightning!"

name: Kraul Warrior
text: The insectile kraul lurk in the tunnels below street level. Many are loyal to the Golgari Swarm, but others follow their own esoteric caste system.

name: Exiled Doomsayer
text: He's desperate to hold back the future because he has seen it.

name: Crumbling Necropolis
text: The squad plunged deep into Hive Pandorial, finding only the shambling corpses of those they came to avenge.

name: Shady Traveler // Stalking Predator
text: Tomorrow a new village, and new victims.

name: Tariel, Reckoner of Souls
text:
"After death you face paradise, damnation, or Tariel."
—Priest's teaching

name: Time Reversal
text:
"Optimists see the world as they wish it to be. Pessimists see the world as it is. Must these roles be mutually exclusive?"
—Evo Ragus

name: Bar Entry
text: "You will either begin or end the ride no taller than this."

name: Esper Cormorants
text:
"The smiths of this land must be mad to reach so far and so high for another creature to decorate."
—Cagen Vargan, Jhessian sea scout

name: Beacon Behemoth
text: When its smoky plumes light Naya's sky, every creature from the smallest pip fawn to the largest rannet heeds the warning.

name: Growth Spiral
text:
「たったひとつのシダの渦から、今まで読んだどんな本よりも深い洞察を得ました。」
—-クアンドリクスの学部長、キアン

name: Dakmor Bat
text: The bat thrives on what underestimates it.

name: Dream Stalker
text: What happens when it is the dream that wakes and the sleeper that fades into memory?

name: Essence Capture
text:
"It's not enough to defeat our foes. We must learn from them, too."
—Vannifar

name: Joint Assault
text:
"By my power, werewolves shall become the wolfir, our allies in combat against darkness."
—Avacyn's Cursemute Decree

name: Vizier of Remedies
text: "You'll need all your strength for the trials to come."

name: Anurid Swarmsnapper
text: Anurids have the problem of airborne invaders licked.

name: Duergar Mine-Captain
text: Duergars are prodigious workers with long memories. Some still fulfill intricately detailed orders given decades, if not centuries, before.

name: Splitting Headache
text: All faeries delve for dreams. But not all wait for their victims to fall asleep.

name: Viscerid Armor
text: A fallen viscerid's only tribute is to be worn by a comrade.

name: Battle-Mad Ronin
text: "I fought fiercely, bravely, and without mercy. Had I not struck down my captain in the heat of battle, I might have become a hero instead of an outcast."

name: Shu Elite Infantry
text: Kongming's first campaign against the Wei kingdom was a rousing success until an arrogant Shu general, Ma Su, foolishly lost the city of Jieting.

name: Sunblast Angel
text: There may exist powers even greater than Phyrexia.

name: Necrobite
text: A servant of Pharika must know countless balms that heal and soothe—and countless more that do the opposite.

name: Know Naught but Fire
text: "Cranial explosions for everyone. Still planning to outthink my dragons?"

name: Sparkmage's Gambit
text:
"A touch of lightning, and anyone can be taught to dance."
—Tobin, sparkmage

name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
text: Are merfolk humans with fins, or are humans merfolk with feet?

name: Thundering Djinn
text: It strikes like a bolt from a brainstorm.

name: Hurloon Minotaur
text: The Minotaurs of the Hurloon Mountains are known for their love of battle. They are also known for their hymns to the dead, sung for friend and foe alike. These hymns can last for days, filling the mountain valleys with their low, haunting sounds.

name: Overgrown Pest
text: If only the biofluctuations students could have seen what became of their prize specimen after its escape.

name: Pulsemage Advocate
text: "Our unity revives our hopes."

name: High Tide
text:
"When the very tides turn against you, it's time to consider retirement."
—General Khurzog

name: Trained Condor
text:
"They're smart enough to understand that war means lots of carrion."
—Griv, condor rider

name: Chittering Rats
text: Bottom feeders sometimes rise to the top.

name: Void Mirror
text:
"A mirror does more than reflect reality—it shapes it."
—Niko Aris

name: Monologue Tax
text:
"Your unsolicited words enrich us all. Please, continue."
—Yold, professor of cryptorelicology

name: Sejiri Shelter // Sejiri Glacier
text:
"This place offers nothing and takes everything."
—Enwor, Sea Gate Expeditionary House

name: Silent Dart
text: "These terms are acceptable to House Dimir. Shall we shake on it?"

name: Three-Headed Goblin
text: It's true that two heads are better than one, but after that you run into diminishing returns.

name: Kothophed, Soul Hoarder
text: Kothophed bestowed upon Liliana eternal youth, carved into her skin as intricate tattoos.

name: Tetsuko Umezawa, Fugitive
text:
"Her talent for slipping unseen behind enemy lines provided information that would prove crucial to Dominaria's defense."
—*Heroes of the Second Invasion*

name: Dakra Mystic
text: Choices are rarely as simple as they seem.

name: Contaminated Aquifer
text: The caves stretch farther than anyone knows, and the terrible legacy of Yawgmoth lurks in every shadow.

name: Elemental Bond
text:
"I want to help Zendikar. Show me the way."
—Nissa Revane

name: Serra Disciple
text: Theologians now believe the Ancestor was another divine form of Serra.

name: Memory Lapse
text:
「我々が忘れてしまった考えはどこへ行ってすまったのだ？かつて知っていたことが思い出せない。」
——タイヴァ校長の日記

name: Defy Death
text: Gisela cornered the murderous demon among the graves of the dead villagers. "A fitting end," she murmured as she raised her sword.

name: Dwarven Pony
text:
"I hear Halina's got a pony that can count to six—and likes to eat meat."
—Chandler

name: Bile Blight
text:
"Hold your bitterness deep within, and there let it fester. Let it roil and squirm and churn, until you are filled with bile so poisonous that all you touch falls to ruin."
—Mortarion, Daemon Primarch

name: Omnispell Adept
text: She memorized every arcane text in the Ismeri Library by the time she was sixteen. Now she quizzes sphinxes in her spare time.

name: Siegebreaker Giant
text: No rampart can withstand the fury of a giant.

name: Nykthos Paragon
text: Action: Start with 190C and design a spirit known as an Eidolon that resembles a human solider carrying a large shield.

name: Brawl
text: Anything can happen when patience is scarce and wine is abundant.

name: Catapult Master
text: "There's no 'I' in 'team,' but there's a 'we' in 'weapon.'"

name: Delighted Killbot
text: "click . . . click . . . whirrrr . . . beep."

name: Seething Pathblazer
text:
"Flamekin death rites are elaborate and spectacular affairs. Their greatest fear is death in obscurity."
—Tollek Worldwatcher, journal

name: Cryptothrall
text: Bound to a cryptek, the cryptothrall exists for one reason: to defend its master to the death.

name: Bee Sting
text: There are few things as motivating as a swarm of bees.

name: Heavy Ballista
text:
"Archers, ballistae—you can't even get near the island of Avenant."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Fear
text:
"Don't fear the darkness. Fear what it hides."
—Remin, venerable monk

name: Bond of Revival
text: "Today we throw off the yoke of death. Either this is an affirmation of the eternal cyclical nature of life, or it's just hilarious—depends on which of us you ask."

name: Sea of Clouds
text: A shoreless sea extends to every horizon, sharing its beauty only with those who can fly high enough to see it.

name: Tattered Mummy
text: The dead who wander beyond the safety of the city of Naktamun crave only to spread their curse.

name: Gravedigger
text: Only a thin layer of dirt separates civilization from an undead apocalypse.

name: Captive Flame
text: "Kills and cooks your food in one easy stroke."

name: Ball Lightning
text: The most frightening storms are those not woven by nature's hand.

name: Village Watch // Village Reavers
text: "You have my word. You'll see no wolf attacks while we're around!"

name: Saheeli's Artistry
text: "From the first touch, I know exactly what the metal wants to be."

name: Agadeem's Awakening // Agadeem, the Undercrypt
text:
"Here below the hedron fields, souls and secrets lie entombed."
—Vivias, Witch Vessel

name: Hermetic Study
text:
"Books can be replaced; a prize student cannot. Be patient."
—Urza, to Barrin

name: Viscerid Armor
text: A fallen Viscerid's only tribute is to be worn by a comrade.

name: Harsh Mentor
text: "Fight through it."

name: Shock
text: "I love this thing! It's my best invention since the boulderfist gauntlet!"

name: Word of Undoing
text:
"It was in Urza's journals that I finally found the secret at the core of the summonings."
—Journal, author unknown

name: Collar the Culprit
text:
"Reports of Gruul rioters in four districts. Start with the big ones and work your way up."
—Libuse, Boros sergeant

name: Shaper Apprentice
text: The River Heralds would wreck a thousand ships to keep intruders from finding the golden city.

name: Hymn to Tourach
text:
"Tourach's power was such that his followers deified him after his death."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. II*

name: Pyre Hound
text: Its growl is the crackling and popping of a wildfire untamed.

name: Warteye Witch
text: Eyeballs that portend unpleasant futures become slimy snacks instead.

name: Rage Reflection
text: Vengeance is a dish best served twice.

name: Medicine Bag
text:
"My medicine bag and I have treated countless wounds and illnesses. But never have I seen so many made so sick for so long. We will *never* eat Squee's cooking again."
—Orim, journal

name: Hymn to Tourach
text: Knowing the hymn's power, the followers of Leitbur carefully guarded their pillaged transciptions.

name: Witness of the Ages
text: It strode through the clash of dragons, the fall of Ugin, and the rise of the khans.

name: Argothian Opportunist
text: "Nature adapts. So should we."

name: Abbey Matron
text:
"The Matrons are kindly souls, but don't ask one for an ale."
—Halina, Dwarven Trader

name: Refresh
text:
Death is a moth that dances toward our inner flame. The brightest fire can singe its wings.
—Nantuko teaching

name: Goblin Settler
text: Be it ever so crumbled, there's no place like home.

name: Tainted Aether
text: Pockets of Æther can be so foul they melt flesh from bone.

name: Air Elemental
text: These spirits of the air are winsome and wild, and cannot be truly contained. Only marginally intelligent, they often substitute whimsy for strategy, delighting in mischief and mayhem.

name: Pyrophobia
text:
"I hate this! I hate fire! I hate you for taking me on this route!"
—Norin the Wary

name: Ritual of Restoration
text: Leonin raising ceremonies take place at the white sun's dawn, the rebirth of artifacts mirroring the birth of a new day.

name: Ravages of War
text:
"Thorn bushes spring up wherever the army has passed. Lean years follow in the wake of a great war."
—Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching, trans. Feng and English

name: Painful Quandary
text: In Mishra's desperation to destroy his brother, he allowed Gix to destroy him instead.

name: You're Ambushed on the Road
text: "Hand over your loot and no one gets hurt!"

name: Anaba Bodyguard
text:
"Not someone to pick a fight with, unless you're fond of pain."
—Halina, Dwarven Trader

name: Kitesail Cleric
text: Too flashy to ignore. Too fast to catch.

name: Kumano Faces Kakkazan // Etching of Kumano
text: Many kami came to demand a secret he did not know, and every one of them fell.

name: Urgent Exorcism
text:
"To show geists pity is to prolong their agonies. Whether they know it or not, they seek the Blessed Sleep, and we are to give it to them."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch

name: Retribution of the Ancients
text: Abzan ancestors died to protect their Houses, and they protect them still.

name: Dimir Guildgate
text: In the cold corridors of the undercity, misinformation unfurls from Duskmantle like a spreading stain.

name: Esper Stormblade
text: Stormcallers came to appreciate the novelty of Jund's volcanic updrafts.

name: Academy Wall
text: Once the Society of Mishra took control, the Tolarian Academy at Lat-Nam became a haven for dark research.

name: Crazed Skirge
text: They are Phyrexia's couriers; the messages they carry are inscribed on their slick hides.

name: Temper
text:
"I don't need a plan, just a goal. The rest will follow on its own."
—Gerrard

name: Furnace Punisher
text: Etch your victories in iron, that the world may celebrate them forever.

name: Ancestor's Chosen
text: "The will of all, by my hand done."

name: Atog
text: The bane of all artificers, the legendary atogs devoured intricate tools to further their own twisted growth.

name: Glimmering Angel
text:
"We turned to see where the blow came from and saw only a distant light."
—Capashen lord

name: Knotvine Paladin
text:
"He is part of a new breed of guardian, one who embraces the best of both his world and ours."
—Mayael the Anima

name: Spectral Sailor
text:
"Any ship that sails on these mean seas for long is bound to pick up a ghost or two."
—Admiral Beckett Brass

name: Major Teroh
text: "I am the holy wind that shall avenge the Cabal's victims."

name: Carrion Feeder
text: It has no respect for the deeds of martyrs, reducing their legacy to a mouthful of flesh.

name: Coffin Puppets
text: The ground won't accept them.

name: Shield Wall
text: The strongest walls are made not of stone or steel but of the focused strength of warriors.

name: Dragonfly Suit
text: Cutting-edge Imperial sentinel mechs patrol the skies over Eiganjo.

name: Vodalian Mage
text:
"Come back, cowards! Everyone knows Merfolk can't wield magic!"
—Pashadar Dirf, Goblin Flotilla Commander, last words

name: Kor Skyfisher
text: "Sometimes I snare the unexpected, but I know its purpose will be revealed in time."

name: Lost Order of Jarkeld
text:
"Let us remember brave Jarkeld and his troops, who perished in the Adarkar Wastes so long ago."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Starstorm
text: Ever since the disaster, the city's survivors viewed the star-strewn sky with dread.

name: Village Messenger // Moonrise Intruder
text: "I'm afraid it's bad news."

name: Ishi-Ishi, Akki Crackshot
text:
"Here fell Ishi-Ishi, King of the Flaming Pebbles, Scourge of the Mountain Kami, Lover of Goats. May his shell never burn."
—Cave inscription

name: Hermit of the Natterknolls // Lone Wolf of the Natterknolls
text: He hates company . . .

name: Bushmeat Poacher
text: "If you've never feasted on Zagoth terror-pig, I got the best price you'll find."

name: Fresh Volunteers
text: Every Cho-Arrim villager is a potential warrior; when they are called, they abandon their peaceful way of life and take up arms to defend it.

name: Cryptborn Horror
text: Although Cryptwitch Merree vanished after a spat with Rakdos, her playthings lingered.

name: Wickerbough Elder
text: "Living scarecrows make a mockery of the natural order. Dead ones make fine hats."

name: Leshrac's Rite
text:
"Bind me to thee, my soul to thine. I am your servant and your slave. I shall hunger for your word and thirst for your blessing. Blood for blood, flesh for flesh, Leshrac, my lord."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Kataki, War's Wage
text:
"Before the war, we prayed to Kataki to sharpen our swords and harden our armor. Without his blessing our weapons are all but useless against the kami hordes."
—Kenzo the Hardhearted

name: Cinder Glade
text: On the volcanic continent of Akoum, bizarre vegetation clusters around gas vents, and jagged mountain peaks rise high into the air.

name: Anax and Cymede
text: Akros's greatest heroes are also its royalty.

name: Faith of the Devoted
text:
"The more I see of this place, the less I want to."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Dragonlord Atarka
text: When she's hungry, no one is safe.

name: Rowen
text: Those who understand the forest are free to harvest its bounty.

name: Inspiring Call
text: "Now is the hour. Ours is the duty. For victory and family—charge!"

name: Breath of the Sleepless
text: Worse than the obscuring mists are the ghastly faces that appear in the glow of spectral lanterns.

name: Sudden Breakthrough
text: Rootha created constantly, passionately, in hopes of impressing her greatest critic: herself.

name: Nightsky Mimic
text: A mimic need only touch a being to learn its shape, but touching usually leads to mauling and messily eating.

name: Lumengrid Warden
text: The wardens keep watch over an endless sea of progress.

name: Goblin S.W.A.T. Team
text: They refer to their methods as "special S.W.A.T. tactics," and no one has lived to correct them.

name: Hero's Resolve
text:
"Destiny, chance, fate, fortune—they're all just ways of claiming your successes without claiming your failures."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Impact Tremors
text:
"If their ears are to the ground, we will make them bleed!"
—Taklai, Kolaghan warrior

name: Jandor's Saddlebags
text:
Your heart's desire is found within.
—Saddlebag inscription

name: War Room
text: A figure is moved on a map, and the tide of war changes.

name: Reave Soul
text:
"Into amethyst, I pour
Envy's shadow, sorrow's gleam.
Lure the one whose scorn I bore
That I may hear one final scream."
—Barrow witch incantation

name: Skophos Reaver
text: "KILL! KILL FOR MOGIS!"

name: Child of the Pack // Savage Packmate
text: Her claws are another matter.

name: Licia, Sanguine Tribune
text: "I give my blood, my life, all I have in exchange for victory."

name: Sword Dancer
text: Most soldiers think of the sword as a weapon. In the hands of Zho monks, swords are also the strongest of shields.

name: Skull of Orm
text: Though lifeless, the Skull still possessed a strange power over the flow of magic.

name: Hall of Triumph
text: Heroes act without thought of glory or reward. Accolades are a consequence, not a goal.

name: Spectral Procession
text:
"I need never remember my past associates, my victims, my mistakes. Innistrad preserves them all for me."
—Sorin Markov

name: Platinum Angel
text:
"Serra built angels from the spirits of fallen warriors, but I believe a more mundane power source might suffice."
—Karn

name: Eliminate
text:
"Cruelty? No. This is necessity."
—Kaervek

name: Sanguinary Priest
text: "Embrace the strength of your Primarch, but deny the Red Thirst, brothers! There is no return from that darkest of paths."

name: Arashin Cleric
text: "We'll have time to put out the fires when those trapped within the ruins are safe."

name: Wildwood Tracker
text: "This one was wearing shoes made of glass. She'll be no ordinary prey."

name: Wolverine Pack
text:
"Give them great meals of beef and iron and steel, they will eat like wolves and fight like devils."
—William Shakespeare, *King Henry V*

name: Ruination
text:
"We have built a wall upon sand. The wall will vanish. The sand will remain."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Storm Spirit
text:
"Come to us, with your lightning. Come to us, with your thunder. Serve us with your strength, and smite our foes with your power."
—Steinar Icefist, Balduvian shaman

name: Afflict
text: When one of the Patriarch's champions displeased him, he would only shake his finger. That was enough.

name: Recuperate
text:
"Rise once more, so you may continue to destroy our enemies."
—Karona, false god

name: Gruul War Plow
text:
"Steering apparatus?! What for? Rip it out, sharpen it, and lash it to the front!"
—Ktank, Gruul plowmaster

name: Duress
text:
"Give of yourself, for compleation awaits the cleansed."
—Nokar, priest of Sheoldred

name: Drudge Skeletons
text:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, they never surrender, and they don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, *Necromancer's Handbook*

name: Exploration
text: The first explorers found Argoth a storehouse of natural wealth—towering forests grown over rich veins of ore.

name: Grapeshot
text: Mages often seek to emulate the powerful relics lost to time and apocalypse.

name: Dread Rider
text:
"What kind of monstrous grave robber leaves the treasures, but takes the bodies?"
—Fjall, Beskir elder

name: Ultimate Price
text: "He's paid his price. Now you pay mine."

name: Wall of Air
text:
When no falcons fly, beware the sky.
—Femeref aphorism

name: Fleshpulper Giant
text: He doesn't hate small folk. He just likes the squishing sound they make.

name: Barbarian General
text:
