"Barbarian tribes with their rulers are inferior to Chinese states without them."
—Confucius, *The Analects* (trans. Lau)

name: Trained Pronghorn
text:
"The desert asked the Ancestor for children, and the antelope were born."
—Nomad myth

name: Ravages of War
text:
"Thorn bushes spring up wherever the army has passed. Lean years follow in the wake of a great war."
—Lao Tzu, *Tao Te Ching* (trans. Feng and English)

name: Disciple of Tevesh Szat
text: "You pray to Freyalise, but she cannot hear your pleas. It is Tevesh Szat who will claim your soul."

name: Sarkhan's Rage
text: The people of Tarkir speak of an ancient legend, of the dragon-man called Sarkhan who was greatest of all khans.

name: Mayor of Avabruck // Howlpack Alpha
text: He can deny his true nature for only so long.

name: Whirling Dervish
text: Amid this whirling hurricane of blades, there is no calm eye in which the hapless can find shelter.

name: Soulknife Spy
text: "My psychic blade cuts the mind and severs thoughts. Even if you survive, you'll never remember I was here."

name: Spelling Bee
text: Just be thankful it wasn't grammar scorpions.

name: Most Wanted
text: Overnight, Elspeth was branded the most dangerous criminal in New Capenna.

name: Crown of Doom
text: Every head it rests upon winds up severed.

name: Puncturing Light
text: "If you refuse to see the light, then you will feel it."

name: Lava Spike
text: It's not the most subtle incantation, but it gets the point across.

name: Oketra's Monument
text:
"The worthy shall respect the worthy. In the afterlife, all will stand united."
—Monument inscription

name: Soulcipher Board // Cipherbound Spirit
text: Rather than consort with demons, the Quietus Cult seeks wisdom from the dead.

name: Soltari Monk
text:
"Prayer rarely explains."
—Orim, Samite healer

name: Serrated Biskelion
text:
"Whereas I was created to protect, the biskelion was created to destroy."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Stream of Consciousness
text:
"All things return to their beginnings. The waters that spill across the Kamitaki Falls flow to sea, only to be returned to her as the rain that joins the mighty river."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf

name: Steamclaw
text:
"There's dead, and then there's *dead* dead."
—Steamclaw driver

name: Leading Performance
text:
"If people are always on the edge of their seats, we can save money on chair backs."
—Myra the Magnificent

name: Serum Visions
text: What would you exchange for a cosmic secret? Any payment is a small price for insight.

name: Stitched Drake
text:
"The best skaabs are more powerful and more beautiful than the sum of their parts."
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Varchild's Crusader
text:
"We could have peace, but Varchild would rather have the maps of the new Kjeldor drawn in Balduvian blood."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

name: Masako the Humorless
text: Konda's servants dared not neglect their duties for a moment under Masako's icy gaze, knowing that what she saw, Lord Konda would hear.

name: Hold for Ransom
text:
"Let's find out how much your friends think you're worth."
—Gino, hired kidnapper

name: Syr Alin, the Lion's Claw
text: "The realm must never yield to the chaos of the wilds."

name: Phyrexian Vindicator
text: Submit and know the Mother's glory. Resist and and know her wrath.

name: Gladewalker Ritualist
text: "We are all."

name: Maelstrom Pulse
text: During the collision of the shards, entire ways of life disappeared without a trace.

name: Knacksaw Clique
text: Most of the Knacksaw clique's skills were hewn from the minds of others.

name: Wanderguard Sentry
text: Created by the vedalken to guard Lumengrid, the drones' empty eyes look beyond the Quicksilver Sea.

name: Coal Golem
text:
"Three such creatures stood burning at the crest of the hill. Only seconds later, the fireball struck our front line."
—Lydia, Countess Brellis

name: Scrubland
text: 2018 Europe Legacy Champion

name: Wretched Anurid
text: The only prince inside this frog is the one it ate.

name: Zebra Unicorn
text:
"I'll capture gentle zebras / for your steeds and fill the stable with every kind of unicorn."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Murasa Brute
text: Some adventuring parties are made up of old friends, their common bonds bolstering them in the face of peril. Other parties simply hire the biggest, meanest muscle they can find.

name: Library of Alexandria
text: 2020 Vintage Champion

name: Scroll Thief
text: I've learned how to disable wards, pick locks, and decode the Agaran language—all before even reading the scroll!

name: Bladed Ambassador
text: Obedience is the armor that turns any blade.

name: Young Wolf
text: The Ulvenwald makes no allowances for youth. Today's newborn is either tomorrow's hunter or tomorrow's lunch.

name: Mine Collapse
text: "Good ol' rock," muttered Rhirhok as the shaking began. "Nice ol' rock . . . ."

name: Ochran Assassin
text: "The dagger is just a distraction. I carry the real killer in a vial at my side."

name: Spoils of War
text:
"This is the fun part!"
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

name: Unmake
text: A gwyllion's favorite trap is the vanity mirror. A bewitched piece of glass traps the looker's soul and does away with the body.

name: Shield Wall
text:
"If not for the wizard, we'd all be dead now. 'Course, it was him that started all this in the first place."
—Onean veteran

name: Caustic Tar
text: A forest fire can rejuvenate the land, but the tar's vile consumption leaves the land forever ruined.

name: Deploy the Gatewatch
text: Gideon and Liliana may not have seen eye to eye, but that did not stop them from fighting side by side.

name: Vow of Malice
text:
"I grant you blades—on the condition that they are not pointed at me."
—Damia, Sage of Stone

name: Blasphemous Act
text:
"Holy places are no longer sanctuary from death, and death is no longer sanctuary from anything."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Akki War Paint
text: Akki paint bright, bold designs on their salvaged Imperial mechs, leaving no doubt as to who they belong to now.

name: Frenzy Sliver
text: The Arturan conjurers took the strange, alien fossil and patterned their own twisted creations in its image.

name: Veilborn Ghoul
text: Liliana's voice carries far, reaching beyond the cold pall of death.

name: Ancient Den
text:
"Halcyon, the floating capital of Thran. The once shining city in the clouds, now lies ruined on the desert floor."
—*Fall of the Thran*

name: Rally of Wings
text: Even the clouds became a field of battle. Known as the Sky Theater, it saw the Eternals clash with squadrons of angels.

name: Rallying Roar
text:
"The sun's strength sings in our hearts! I have never been more proud of my home and my people."
—Huatli

name: Knight Errant
text:
". . . [B]efore honor is humility."
—*The Bible*, Proverbs 15:33

name: Secrets of the Key
text: As Sigarda and Sorin battled, Arlinn and Teferi recovered the key from the Markov catacombs.

name: Dockside Extortionist
text: "It's just business."

name: Wall of Blossoms
text:
"Everything in Nature contains all the powers of Nature."
—Ralph Waldo Emerson,
"Compensation"

name: Force of Will
text: 2011 Legacy Championship Winner

name: Deathcap Glade
text: Deadly mushrooms litter these woods, each waiting for an errant footstep to release its noxious spores.

name: Juggernaut
text: The mighty city of An Karras, with its rich history, built over thousands of years, fell in three hours.

name: Impounding Lot-Bot
text: Not all tickets can be exchanged for prizes.

name: Swift Spinner
text: Its web is woven so tightly that not even geists can avoid capture.

name: Rites of Reaping
text: Don't cross a Devkarin elf unless you long for an early grave.

name: Lightning Talons
text:
"This is going to hurt a lot, but on the bright side, you'll be dead soon."
—Sedris, the Traitor King

name: Bring Low
text:
"People are often humbled by the elements. But the elements, too, can be humbled."
—Surrak, khan of the Temur

name: Archangel of Thune
text: Even the wicked have nightmares.

name: Vanish into Eternity
text: Faced with a blast that would level not only New Phyrexia, but also a dozen innocent worlds, Elspeth consigned it—and herself—to the nothingness in between.

name: Second Chance
text: The greatest gift is the opportunity to right one's wrongs.

name: Maned Serval
text:
"Don't search the ruins of Orn during the day. Nethroi's many eyes will spot you instantly. Don't go at night either. You'll be dinner for the servals. Maybe just don't go."
—Rasai, Indatha hunter

name: Ertai, Wizard Adept
text:
"Was that *it*?"
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Death Cultist
text: Death inevitably seduces all who study it.

name: Hammer Dropper
text: Giants know a solid hit is one part strength, four parts leverage.

name: Gallantry
text: "Forgive me," Mirri whispered. "I thought you a burden, and you saved my life." Hanna quietly accepted the apology.

name: Selective Snare
text:
"How thoughtful of the Legion to train its soldiers to fit our spell's specifications."
—Nefara, Dimir agent

name: Rograkh, Son of Rohgahh
text: Strength is relative.

name: Abyssal Horror
text: It has no face of its own—it wears that of its latest victim.

name: Incubation Sac
text:
"This one needs a bit longer to ripen."
—Glissa Sunslayer

name: Steel Golem
text:
"Although I would give my life to protect Gerrard, my conscience will not let me take another's. There are many who would not hesitate."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Akoum Warrior // Akoum Teeth
text:
"Rock. Lava. Gravity. They're not cruel, but they're not forgiving either."
—Tyrux, expedition warrior

name: Gamble
text: "What's the worst that can happen?"

name: Horror of Horrors
text:
"And a horror of outer darkness after,/ And dust returneth to dust again."
—Adam Lindsay Gordon, The Swimmer

name: Burning Oil
text: Every now and then, a devil's prank can give you a good idea.

name: Soldevi Machinist
text:
"Perhaps this time the power of the artificers shall be used wisely."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Primal Empathy
text: "From this day forward, we confront this world together, lifting each other up."

name: Roaming Ghostlight
text: Some who die senseless deaths return as formless spirits, seeking answers where there are none.

name: Stormcaller of Keranos
text: A prayer answered by Keranos is clear for all to witness.

name: Uktabi Kong
text: "I desire the acquisition of a potassium-rich fruit comestible of *substantial* magnitude."

name: Aid the Fallen
text: "I never liked you. Now get up—we have a fight to finish."

name: Sandstone Warrior
text:
"I used to describe something stable as 'rock solid.' So much for *that* expression."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Sedge Sliver
text:
"There's just one. I'll finish it in a single blow.
—Mercenary *en*-Vec, last words

name: Nira, Hellkite Duelist
text: "Keep rising."

name: Enatu Golem
text: Golems conjured from the debris of Enatu Temple provided a sturdy but expendable first line of defense against the Eldrazi.

name: Alarum
text:
"One timely cry of warning can save nine of surprise."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Dismal Backwater
text: The Invasion Tree's branches snaked through the streets of Otawara, turning Kamigawa's soaring city into a clouded nightmare.

name: Deploy to the Front
text:
"We will descend upon you like a plague of locusts to purge you from our lands!"
—Hirov, commander of the Thousand Swords

name: Natural State
text:
"Killing the Eldrazi is not enough. We must erase all memory of them from this world."
—Greenweaver Mina

name: Wildwood Patrol
text: If you're lucky, the centaurs will give a single warning to leave their territory before driving a spear into you. If you're unlucky, the spear is the warning.

name: Spectral Shepherd
text: The restless geists of common folk often continue their lifelong labors.

name: Ground Pounder
text: People came from miles away just to see the head of the hammer.

name: Talonrend
text: Change is a denizen of Shadowmoor as much as ouphes and noggles are.

name: Bereavement
text: Grief is a razor that slices the soul.

name: Algae Gharial
text: It lurks just under the surface, using the algae-choked tar pits of Jund as both home and hunting blind.

name: Pointy Finger of Doom
text:
"I would have made a 'Spin-The-Bottle' joke if I thought anyone reading this had ever played the game."
—Bucky, flavor text writer

name: Chimney Rabble
text:
"They're violent, headstrong, and wildly unpredictable. It should be amusing to see how Norn's vaunted tactics try to cope with them."
—Urabrask

name: Blustersquall
text: Weather is more predictable than the Izzet.

name: Negate
text: Masters of the arcane savor a delicious irony. Their study of deep and complex arcana leads to such a simple end: the ability to say merely yes or no.

name: Wall of Roots
text: Root systems in Mwonvuli twist through currents of mana rather than soil.

name: Wind Spirit
text:
" . . . [W]hen the trees bow down their heads, / The wind is passing by."
—Christina Rossetti,
"Who Has Seen the Wind?"

name: Swelter
text: No circle has a beginning, but many have foreseeable ends.

name: Mystical Tutor
text: "It's not just what you know. It's knowing where to find what you don't."

name: Carrion Ants
text: "'War is no picnic,' my father liked to say. But the Ants seemed to disagree." —*General Chanek Valteroth*

name: Farrel's Zealot
text: After the fall of Trokair, Farrel and his followers formally broke their ties with the rest of Icatia.

name: Sparkmage Apprentice
text: Pajik was amazed and pleased at his newfound powers. His pet cat Rivin was slightly less enthusiastic.

name: Pacifism
text: Frozen by conscience, Karn did not resist as the moggs carried him to the *Predator*.

name: Valor in Akros
text: They became a single entity, a phalanx in the Temple of Triumph standing against a host of enemies.

name: Scrapdiver Serpent
text: Smart artificers clean up after themselves.

name: Into the Roil
text: "Roil tide! Roil tide! Tie yourselves down!"

name: Destructive Flow
text: Stage two of the Phyrexian invasion included the complete alteration of Dominaria's landscape.

name: Trokin High Guard
text: Battle tempers soldiers as fire tempers steel.

name: Swords to Plowshares
text:
"Peace hath her victories
No less renownd than war."
—John Milton,
"To the Lord General Cromwell"

name: Zodiac Dragon
text: ". . . The kingdoms three are now the stuff of dream, / For men to ponder, past all praise or blame."

name: Militia Rallier
text: "We can wait like helpless children for a hero, or we can gather our courage and *be* the heroes. Who's with me?"

name: Hoverguard Observer
text: It could be made to run silently, but its low hum reminds the Neurok that they are always watched.

name: Adeliz, the Cinder Wind
text: The passionate intensity of the Ghitu tempered by the cool insight of Tolarian training.

name: Sengir Autocrat
text:
"A thankless job, and a death sentence besides."
—Eron the Relentless

name: Sigil of the Nayan Gods
text: As the elves learned the hymns of angels, the knights learned the roars of titans.

name: Tormenting Voice
text:
"Unwelcome thoughts crowd my mind. Are they my own madness, or the whispers of another?"
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Devout Monk
text: Discipline wears many robes.

name: Null Rod
text:
Gerrard: "But it doesn't *do* anything!"
Hanna: "No—it *does* nothing."

name: Keen Glidemaster
text: "Fear is a rational response, but waiting won't make it any easier. Just jump!"

name: Blood Cultist
text: "To immortality."

name: Cobalt Golem
text: Centuries before the first tides of the Quicksilver Sea rose to meet each new sun, Mirrodin's light shone on the golems alone.

name: Feast of Sanity
text: The tastiest morsels are found in the mazes of the mind.

name: Hammer Mage
text: When he's holding the hammers, everything looks like a nail.

name: Advocate of the Beast
text: "I am neither their drover nor their leader. To these majestic beasts, I am simply their herdmate and nothing more."

name: Horned Turtle
text:
"So like men are they: a hardened shell with fragile flesh beneath."
—Selenia, dark angel

name: Blistergrub
text:
"Avoid anything that scuttles, scrabbles, or shambles."
—Opar, veteran guide

name: Charging Badger
text:
"If the hierarchies of nature were determined by ferocity alone, the badger would be lord of the beasts."
—Anthousa of Setessa

name: Tangle Spider
text: They're considered good luck by the elves they don't eat.

name: Glorious Anthem
text: The songs of angels are perceived not as words in the ears but as stirrings in the soul.

name: Opportunist
text: The third time the Oracle glanced suspiciously at him, Starke decided she had glanced twice too often.

name: Arrogant Wurm
text: It's hard to be humble when the whole world is bite-size.

name: Pyroclasm
text:
"Who'd want to ignite things one at a time?"
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Oath of Ajani
text: "Until all have found their place, I will keep watch."

name: Relentless Assault
text: "Mercy? Mercy is for the playground, not the battleground."

name: Static Orb
text: Reduction of energy and motion within the stasis field creates the illusion of slowed time.

name: Fishliver Oil
text: Then the maiden bade him cast off his robes and cover his body with fishliver oil, that he might safely follow her into the sea.

name: Park Re-Entry
text:
"Control to Truss. Chief, the entry scan software is reading babies as hot dogs. Again."
—Glaxxar, engineering assistant

name: Gridlock
text:
"One tiny peg pulled from a single wagon wheel, and an entire district grinds to a halt."
—Lazav

name: Wasteland
text: 2013 Legacy Championship Winner

name: Doubling Cube // Doubling Cube
text:
"Peace through tyranny."
—Megatron

name: Divine Offering
text:
"Suq'Ata believe in trade; Femeref, alms; Zhalfirins, steel. Be warned, Kaervek—now we are joined."
—Sidar Jabari

name: The Brute
text: After years of being bullied, Fergo reaped the benefits of his newfound strength: he never met a man he didn't want to fight.

name: Stonewood Invoker
text: The Mirari pulses in his veins.

name: Sphere of Reason
text: Reason exposes deception.

name: Farsight Adept
text: "I've walked every one of the Teetering Peaks and never set a foot wrong. I can get you to safety."

name: Norwood Warrior
text: "The woods hold peace for those who desire it, but those who seek battle will find me."

name: Rona, Sheoldred's Faithful
text: "Consider yourself lucky. Not everyone is granted the gift of *compleation*."

name: Perilous Shadow
text: There are some shadows that even the Dimir fear.

name: Garenbrig Squire
text:
"Find him a weapon as big as his dreams."
—Yorvo, lord of Garenbrig

name: Mirri's Guile
text: Hanna was astounded. Mirri read every leaf and wisp of breeze like a book of ancient lore.

name: Mysterious Pathlighter
text: For good or ill, most fae can't resist meddling in the adventures of any knight they meet.

name: Razorfield Thresher
text: DANGER! Keep appendages clear of front of machine. And rear of machine. And side of machine. And top of machine.

name: Suspicious Nanny
text: "Afternoon, folks. Lovely day for a stroll with my authentic human baby."

name: Fetid Horror
text:
"Of the six who went down the Uuserk Trail to scout ahead, one returned. She clawed at her eyes and nostrils and sobbed with horror. I was curious about what she saw, but we chose another path."
—Scout Ekemet, final journal

name: A-Mentor's Guidance
text: Kasmina had encouraged the twins to apply. Strixhaven would test not only their magical potential, but also their character.

name: Squee, the Immortal
text: "You gotta be pretty smart to live long as me, but not being able to die helps."

name: Heal
text:
"Sometimes even the smallest boon can save a life."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Demon's Due
text: Ob Nixilis extends his hand not in partnership, but to affirm your subservience.

name: Loxodon Convert
text: Just one drop of the glistening oil can eventually stain even a soul as stalwart as a loxodon's beyond redemption.

name: Infantry Veteran
text: "Swords, to me! We must engage their line to protect our archers and mages. Let no one fail this task!"

name: Appetite for the Unnatural
text:
"I'd just let the monkey have it if I were you. You can make another, but the same can't be said of your fingers."
—Turni, Greenwheel groundskeeper

name: Jeska's Will
text:
"Gather your strength. Prepare yourself."
—Jeska, to Radha

name: Urza's Incubator
text:
"Stop thinking like an artificer, Urza, and start thinking like a father!"
—Rayne, Academy Chancellor

name: Pillage
text:
"The embers of our homes still smolder, and already the villages of Kjeldor burn in retaliation. What they have started, we will finish."
—Lovisa Coldeyes

name: Blood Rites
text:
"The threat of the kami was made worse by the blood rituals of the ogres, who freed terrifying oni to wander Kamigawa unhindered."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Ensnaring Bridge
text: The way out lay across a slender bridge of stone. It was an ancient defense of the Dwarves that could only be traversed in single file.

name: Muck Rats
text:
"Just as some fool said it couldn't get worse, the rats began to show up."
—Foot soldier

name: Shimmering Wings
text: The brighter the wings, the deeper the impact crater.

name: Riven Turnbull
text: "Political violence is a perfectly legitimate answer to the persecution handed down by dignitaries of the state."

name: Adaptive Automaton
text: Such loyalty can only be made.

name: Favor of the Mighty
text:
"What does a mountain fear of a fly? Giants are barely aware of us, let alone afraid."
—Gaddock Teeg

name: Sheoldred's Edict
text: "Congratulations. I am entertained."

name: Baleful Strix
text: Its beak rends flesh and bone, exposing the tender marrow of dream.

name: Cloud Crusader
text: Each crusader bonds with a griffin fledgling while still a child, and the two grow up as siblings.

name: Hysterical Blindness
text:
"The panic is amusing, but the real fun comes when the spell passes and the villagers start looking for a scapegoat."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

name: Face of Divinity
text: Pure souls shine bright as daybreak.

name: Meldweb Curator
text:
"Imagine a giant room, like a library . . . except instead of books, it's filled with body parts."
—Kara Vrist, resistance spymaster

name: Archers of Qarsi
text:
"We think of the naga as creeping cutthroats, slitherers in the swamps. But they are equally at home in the trees."
—Goton, Qal Sisma shaman

name: Ambush Paratrooper
text: "It would be folly to fight a dragon engine head-on. Let's hit it from above."

name: Eagle of the Watch
text:
"Even from miles away, I could see our eagles circling. That's when I gave the command to pick up the pace. I knew we were needed at home."
—Kanlos, Akroan captain

name: Tomb of the Spirit Dragon
text:
"The voice calls me here, yet I see only bones. Is this more dragon trickery?"
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Swords to Plowshares
text:
"Rather than be hunted in the shadows, I choose to face the real enemy. I am not afraid of monsters I can see."
—The Emperor

name: Flowstone Thopter
text: Airborne flowstone isn't less dangerous, only less common.

name: Kentaro, the Smiling Cat
text: "The bonds of bushido will draw the dishonored back someday, and I will be there waiting."

name: Goblin Spelunkers
text: Goblins prefer caves to just about anything else. Caves prefer just about anything else to goblins.

name: Invasion of Tolvada // The Broken Sky
text: Angry ghosts poured through and pummeled the Invasion Tree, filling the heavens with the rhythms of war.

name: Springing Tiger
text: The ground trembled in a violent purr.

name: Grave Servitude
text:
"I no longer believe in a final resting place."
—Shauku, Endbringer

name: Llanowar Envoy
text:
"Cherish this world in honor of the martyrs who saved it. We too must be prepared to give our lives."
—*The Mending of Dominaria*

name: Daunting Defender
text: "I will wield the stone of my homeland as though it were the fists of the Ancestor."

name: Mine Bearer
text: "The Keldons may have explosive tempers, but *I* have explosives."

name: Spitting Earth
text:
"We were ready for an attack from the front, sides, or back—but the mage hit us from below."
—Veteran soldier

name: Cateran Summons
text: Even when recruitment is slow, the guild can always cook something up.

name: Aberrant Researcher // Perfected Form
text: The final pages of the experiment log were blank. Investigators found it abandoned on a desk in the researcher's lab, open, the pages flipping in the wind from a shattered window.

name: Harmless Offering
text: "Such an adorable face!"

name: Furnace Celebration
text: Reduce. Reuse. Wreak havoc.

name: Captivating Crew
text: "We sail. We plunder. Then we dance."

name: Muldrotha, the Gravetide
text:
"My child grew from rot and ruin, yet she bloomed."
—Multani

name: Jalira, Master Polymorphist
text: "You can become anything if I just put my mind to it."

name: Savor the Moment
text: "I do."

name: Might of Oaks
text: Suddenly, she couldn't see the acorns for the trees.

name: Benalish Hero
text: Benalia has a complex caste system that changes with the lunar year. No matter what the season, the only caste that cannot be attained by either heredity or money is that of the Hero.

name: Raze to the Ground
text: First one, then a second, then a third of the ivory towers fell to the invaders, who moved in a circle around the city like an apocalyptic clock.

name: Seasoned Buttoneer
text: Everyone comments on the buttons, but few appreciate the pedals.

name: Zealous Persecution
text:
"Jharic returned from Grixis changed, a haunted look in her eyes. She destroyed them with an unholy glee that made me shudder."
—Knight-Captain Wyhorn

name: Touch and Go
text: Judge's ruling: The interior of the face still counts as the face, so a nose-pick is legitimate grounds for saying "Gotcha!"

name: Amulet of Vigor
text:
"Angels guide me while I wake,
and I will watch for evil's creep.
Angels guard me while I dream,
and I will rest in peaceful sleep."
—Amulet inscription

name: Eternal Warrior
text: Warriors of the Tsunami-nito School spend years in training to master the way of effortless effort.

name: Meddling Mage
text: "Some defy the laws of nature. I dare nature to defy me."

name: Indestructible Aura
text: Theodar strode the battle lines, snatching swords with his bare hands and casting them aside until all cowered before him.

name: Krenko, Tin Street Kingpin
text: "Save that one! She looks rich!"

name: Blistering Barrier
text:
I live without food, stand without leg, wound without force, and am harder to fight than to kill. What am I?
—Femeref riddle

name: Rubble Slinger
text:
"Tear down the city, lie by lie. Then throw it back at the liars, stone by stone."
—Domri Rade

name: Cruel Reality
text: As Gideon watched the initiate murder his crop-mate, his admiration of the city of Naktamun gave way to horror.

name: Graveborn Muse
text:
"Her voice is damnation, unyielding and certain."
—Phage the Untouchable

name: Ashnod's Coupon
text: Limited time offer. Void where prohibited. Limit one per purchase. Valid only in participating duels. This coupon is nontransferable and invalid if shattered, crumbled, detonated, pillaged, or otherwise disenchanted. Cash value less than 1/20 of a cent. Offer not valid in Quebec, Rhode Island, or where prohibited by law or the DCI.

name: Mage Hunter
text: One of the Oriq's most powerful tools is the mage hunter, a vile monstrosity created to seek out and snuff out the arcane.

name: Shadowspear
text: A weapon of darkness for a warrior of light.

name: Ugin's Construct
text: While trapping the Eldrazi on Zendikar, Ugin learned little from Sorin, but he gleaned the rudiments of lithomancy from Nahiri.

name: Daring Piracy
text: Sky pirates often leap randomly into the fray and assume there will be something to land on.

name: Patagia Golem
text: It scattered falcons like a lion hunting among jackals.

name: Dispel
text:
"Civilization will subsume us unless we overwhelm it instead."
—Speaker Zegana

name: Jeskai Student
text: Discipline is the first pillar of the Jeskai Way. Each member of the clan trains in a weapon, perfecting its use over a lifetime.

name: Brainstorm
text: The mizzium-sphere array drove her mind deep into the thought field, where only the rarest motes of genius may be plucked.

name: Weirded Vampire
text:
"Emrakul makes apparent those whom she has favored."
—Runo Stromkirk

name: Famine
text:
"Better to starve to death than be bored to death."
—Liliana Vess

name: Metropolis Reformer
text: With their ancient enemy vanquished, the angels of New Capenna turned their eyes to their former captors: demons.

name: Mending Touch
text:
"The gift of life must be freely given. Anything less would diminish us all."
—Arin, Selesnya healer

name: Setessan Battle Priest
text: "Your god teaches you only how to kill. Karametra teaches me to defend what I hold dear. That is why I will prevail."

name: Fairgrounds Patrol
text: "No signs of any suspicious activity. Yet."

name: Sandblast
text: The sands of Amonkhet can be as much a boon as a bane. It depends entirely on which way the wind blows.

name: Trestle Troll
text: Unwelcome in Golgari colonies, he found his own dark place from which to represent the Swarm.

name: Redcap Melee
text: At first, Syr Fenwick scoffed when he saw his opponents for the final match.

name: Heritage Druid
text:
"Study the great spirits of our age and those of the past. Prune secrets from the branching traceries of our lineage."
—Twila, Gilt-Leaf archdruid

name: Killian, Ink Duelist
text: "When your father is Dean Embrose, second best really isn't an option."

name: Alluring Suitor // Deadly Dancer
text: "May I have this dance?"

name: Loxodon Warhammer
text:
"A crafter must imbue her weapon with part of her soul—something the Phyrexians are incapable of doing."
—Melira

name: Boa Constrictor
text: Its eyes are bigger than its stomach, but its mouth is larger still.

name: Rise from the Tides
text:
"Dear brother, it's sweet that you have chosen to share your toys with Ludevic, but I too have found some new playmates."
—Ghoulcaller Gisa

name: Port Inspector
text: "There may be a few minor additional fees, levies, duties, surtaxes, tariffs, imposts, tolls . . . ."

name: Essence Vortex
text: Masters who sacrifice for servants will receive the gift of loyalty.

name: Paladin of Predation
text: The strategies and politics of the Vicious Swarm are as subtle as Vorinclex himself.

name: Wei Ambush Force
text: The battle of Puyang marked the beginning of the end for Lu Bu. He lost the city—and later his life—to Cao Cao.

name: Naturalize
text:
"And if you threaten me again, your shiny steel trousers will be sprouting daggerthorn vines."
—Iveta, rooftop runner

name: Craterhoof Behemoth
text: It loves to eat all things crispy, crunchy, and cheddar flavored.

name: Thriving Grubs
text: Some passengers ride without tickets.

name: Martyr's Cry
text:
"It is only fitting that one such as I should die in pursuit of knowledge."
—Vervamon the Elder

name: Shrouded Serpent
text: Many travelers have wandered into a fog only to find that it had teeth, claws, and an appetite.

name: An Offer You Can't Refuse
text: Elspeth wanted answers. Xander needed a spy. Their paths were destined to cross.

name: Hijack
text: "Whoa there. Easy. We're just going to take a little detour."

name: Silumgar, the Drifting Death
text:
"No machinations, no puppet strings, no plots. Just pure, sweeping death."
—Tasigur, the Golden Fang

name: Bull Hippo
text: Stay alert: his lumbering may shake the ground itself, but in water, he glides.

name: Alabaster Potion
text:
"Healing is a matter of time, but it is sometimes also a matter of opportunity."
—D'Avenant proverb

name: Mycosynth Fiend
text:
"I wish I could take credit for it, but nature progresses on its own, just the way it should."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Rise of the Dark Realms
text:
"For every living person there are generations of dead. Which realm would you rather rule?"
—Liliana Vess

name: Rampant Growth
text: Upon impact with a planet's surface, a tyranocyte's bloated belly bursts open, disgorging a horde of Tyranid invaders.

name: Goliath Sphinx
text: He makes his home on the tallest mountain in Sejiri, where the vista is as endless as his patience.

name: Barrin's Spite
text:
"Only vengeance matters now."
—Barrin

name: Elemental Augury
text:
"It is the changing of perception that is important."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Blufferfish
text: Lying to a fish is such an unthinkable act, most planets don't even have a law against it.

name: Meteorite
text: "And if I'm lying," he began . . .

name: Phyrexian Obliterator
text:
"Behold blessed perfection."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Intrepid Hero
text: "We each have our own strengths, Radiant," Serra said with a sly smile. "If all of my people were like this one, who would carry your scrolls?"

name: Disruptive Pitmage
text: "Show weakness to hide your strength."

name: Razaketh, the Foulblooded
text: Liliana insisted on coming to Amonkhet to confront one of the two remaining demons to whom she is bound.

name: Thieving Otter
text:
"You're telling me we spent a year securing the sanctuary against pterosaurs, rambeasts, and nightfangs . . . and we were robbed by what?"
—Endris, Drannith magistrate

name: Edgar's Awakening
text: "Here you go. Can't have you sleeping through your own wedding day."

name: Disrupt
text: Teferi wanted no part of Urza's battle plans, but both agreed the Phyrexian portal must be closed.

name: Reckless Rage
text: "Hard to starboard! Starb— Abandon ship! Abandon ship!"

name: Phyrexian Bloodstock
text: It reeks of terror and chaos.

name: Ghostly Visit
text: Cao Cao was haunted to death by the ghosts of the empresses and other high courtiers he had murdered.

name: Demystify
text: "The truth will outshine all lies."

name: Prophetic Ravings
text: "Keep your herons and shrews! You will find nothing in the moon, for the moon is a lie! It has told me so!"

name: Hurricane
text:
"The raging winds . . . , settling on the sea, the surges sweep, / Raise liquid mountains, and disclose the deep."
—Virgil, *Aeneid*, Book I, trans. Dryden

name: Kalonian Hydra
text: Even baloths fear its feeding time.

name: Isao, Enlightened Bushi
text:
"I do not care if he claims no allegiance in this war. Find him, Takeno."
—Lord Konda

name: Champion of the Parish
text: "I stand for every cobbler, tanner, and fool in this town—and they stand for me."

name: Choose Your Weapon
text:
"Move it, Varis, or I'll pick one for you!"
—Ellywick Tumblestrum

name: Citizen's Arrest
text: "What lurks behind the faces of those you think you can trust?"

name: Dream Fracture
text: In her dream, Lola gazed into a mirror. Her familiar features warped, her jaw stretching wider and wider until it cracked and her reflection pulled her into its gaping maw.

name: Stoke the Flames
text: The Atarka shamans roused the fire into a scorching rebuke of the invaders and a beacon of hope for the survivors.

name: Sauroform Hybrid
text:
"Within each of us, the potential for great power waits to be released."
—Zija, Simic mutationist

name: Timetwister
text: 2004 Vintage Championship Winner

name: Imperious Oligarch
text: The rights of ghosts are strictly protected under Orzhov bylaws, and those who enforce them can count on the ghosts' assistance.

name: Set Adrift
text: The envoy spoke, and Sidisi replied.

name: Festival of the Guildpact
text: Everyone knows that violence at the Festival brings the worst of luck, so for at least one day a year arms are laid down in favor of brimming goblets.

name: Pendrell Drake
text: The mages of Tolaria found strange ways to spend their free time. Occasionally they had contests to see whose kite was eaten last.

name: Bloodfray Giant
text: The star performer of the Juri Revue, his shows have fans and blood spilling into the street.

name: Primal Forcemage
text: Their calls unheeded by the withered forests, nature shamans channeled the life force of their brethren.

name: Swarm of Rats
text:
"Rats, rats, rats! Hundreds, thousands, millions of them, and every one a life."
—Bram Stoker, *Dracula*

name: Chromatic Lantern
text: By guild tradition, any puddle of multicolored light on the cobblestones can serve as neutral ground.

name: Thunderclap Wyvern
text: Thunder doesn't always mean rain. Sometimes it means ruin.

name: Battalion Foot Soldier
text: "With me! Break this line and the rest will fall!"

name: Breathless Knight
text: A deadly charge in eerie silence.

name: Worst Fears
text: Elspeth feared that her trespass into Nyx would not go unanswered.

name: Moldgraf Millipede
text: Between stitchers, cultists, and scavengers, corpses are in high demand.

name: Rush of Knowledge
text:
"Limitless power is glorious until you gain limitless understanding."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

name: Bartered Cow
text: At the market, no one heeded Hilda's frantic mooing. The fae curse was turning out even worse than she had feared.

name: Everdawn Champion
text:
"Undefeated in battle, she is the shining future our empire deserves."
—Huatli

name: Somberwald Stag
text: Despite the reemergence of werewolves and the proliferation of Eldrazi, elk numbers in the Somberwald have remained steady.

name: Rakdos Ragemutt
text: Ragemutts pull the chariots of the Butcher Clowns, a trio of wingless, zombified faeries formerly of the Izzet.

name: Graven Lore
text: The runes glow beneath the snow, bearing memories of a time when the old gods ruled the realms.

name: Gravity Well
text: Storms spread throughout Oran-Rief, ripping the skies with wind and rain. Airborne creatures sought shelter where they could.

name: Bootleggers' Stash
text: Labyrinths of tunnels beneath the streets of the Caldaia offer an ample array of discreet routes for enterprising smugglers.

name: Archelos, Lagoon Mystic
text: "Life ... is not ... a race."

name: Oviya Pashiri, Sage Lifecrafter
text: "Inspiration is reciprocal: we all have a responsibility to each other to create."

name: Charging Bandits
text: The fear in their victims' eyes is their most cherished reward.

name: Commander's Plate
text: Not all beautiful things are fragile.

name: Flashfreeze
text:
"Your downfall was not your ignorance, your weakness, or your hubris, but your warm blood."
—Heidar, Rimewind master

name: Horizon Drake
text: Using thermal updrafts and gravity currents, drakes eat and sleep in the air. Some never touch the ground from birth until death.

name: Balmor, Battlemage Captain
text: "Even the most hardened armies are ill-equipped to defend against an onslaught from the sky."

name: Muscle Burst
text: As strong as a centaur's will.

name: Scathe Zombies
text: Luckily for them, it doesn't take much brains to slaughter and maim.

name: Riddlekeeper
text: Fools surrender their sanity to his riddles. Even greater fools try to solve them.

name: Balduvian Horde
text:
"Peace will come only when we have taken Varchild's head."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Elvish Scout
text:
"Even for Elves, they were stealthy little twerps. They'd taken our measure before we'd even seen them."
—Marshall Volnikov

name: Scurrid Colony
text: Scurrid teeth evolved to crack open nuts, but they work just as well for crushing bones if the nest is threatened.

name: Invasion of Belenon // Belenon War Anthem
text: "Just as a flute turns breath into music, we are the vessel through which the Sacred Winds produce glorious justice."

name: Vampiric Touch
text: A touch, not comforting, but of death.

name: Nightmare's Thirst
text: That feeling of something on your chest is usually sleep paralysis. Occasionally, it's something else.

name: Liquimetal Coating
text:
"We've had a breakthrough on the fifth iteration. The subject's skin was entirely replaced within an hour, and he survived a full day after that!"
—Ashnod, to Mishra

name: Kazandu Stomper
text: Elves revere cycles of renewal, but they prefer cycles that don't involve their homes getting smashed.

name: Invasion of Xerex // Vertex Paladin
text: The literal-minded Phyrexians made the greatest mistake possible on Xerex: they tried to understand what they were seeing.

name: Vision Skeins
text: "I could see in the other mage's eyes that he'd thought of it too. Then it became a race to exploit the knowledge first."

name: Archangel Avacyn // Avacyn, the Purifier
text:
"Wings that once bore hope are now stained with blood. She is our guardian no longer."
—Grete, cathar apostate

name: Rhox Pikemaster
text: When the rhoxes charge, everyone else knows which way to run.

name: Gift of Tusks
text: It's an experience you'll never forget.

name: Deathcult Rogue
text:
"The hussars can't catch him, and he evades our traps with ease. I fear he walks unseen even in the halls of New Prahv."
—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

name: Mythos of Brokkos
text:
"The most unexpected weapon that a monster can wield is kindness."
—*Tales of the Ozolith*

name: Chapel Geist
text: Death has bound it with chains of past regrets. Forever it searches for atonement, each kindness removing a single link.

name: Unexplained Disappearance
text: The first thing the mist chills is the mind. Victims never cry out or even murmur in surprise.

name: Ponder
text: Tomorrow belongs to those who prepare for it today.

name: Sunpetal Grove
text: To the Sun Empire, any place where daylight brightens the jungle floor is sacred ground.

name: Quench
text: "When properly invoked, the plasma globule encloses the offensive spell with a satisfying slurp."

name: Metathran Zombie
text:
"Rise, metathran. You shall serve a nobler cause in death."
—Tsabo Tavoc, Phyrexian general

name: Towering-Wave Mystic
text: Thassa's favor followed him to the Underworld. Even the waves of Nerono obeyed his will.

name: Shivan Oasis
text: Only the hardiest explorers survive to eat the fruit.

name: Vivisection Evangelist
text: "May you rejoice in the magnificence of Norn. May your flesh serve perfection."

name: Arcane Laboratory
text: It soon became obvious that some experiments were best overseen by fireproof teachers.

name: Priest of Urabrask
text: Even in New Phyrexia, red mana sparks glimmers of individualism, passion, and freedom.

name: Telepathy
text:
"The question isn't whether I can read minds. It's whether I have yet to find a mind worth reading."
—Ambassador Laquatus

name: Hill Giant
text: Bent on a quest for blood, a giant can storm through a fort's wall as if it were nothing more than a picket fence.

name: Boomerang
text:
"O! call back yesterday, bid time return."
—William Shakespeare, *King Richard the Second*

name: Wojek Halberdiers
text: Tired of Boros interference, the Rakdos unleashed hellraiser goblins, hoping their corpses would weigh down the halberds.

name: Parallectric Feedback
text: "You can't have so many people living so close together, all practicing so much magic, and not expect some feedback."

name: Phytotitan
text: Its root system spans the entire floor of the jungle, making eradication impossible.

name: Scarwood Treefolk
text: To treefolk's sense of time, ages pass as hours. They stood as witnesses to the apocalypse, the years of which they saw as one cacophonous, ultra-destructive moment.

name: Armor of Faith
text:
"Keep your chain mail, warrior. I have my own form of protection."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Skyclave Shadowcat
text:
"Perhaps its distant ancestors were radiant felidars, but no hint of their nobility remains."
—Akiri, kor line-slinger

name: Loam Dweller
text:
"You know its mood by the plants that spring up around it. When it is placid, fields of lilies flow in its wake; when it is angry, every stem has a thorn."
—Isao, Enlightened Bushi

name: Ray of Revelation
text: Webs of illusion unravel in the light of truth.

name: Angel's Mercy
text:
"Until that day I cursed the angels, those uncaring lights in the sky. They rewarded my scorn with the gift of time, every year of which I've spent in devotion to their names."
—Torian Sha, soul warden

name: Barreling Attack
text:
"The trollish game of push-fall inspired this impressive tactic."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Rushblade Commander
text: "I like a quick victory. More time to celebrate."

name: Barter in Blood
text:
"We must all make sacrifices for the good of Innistrad."
—Sorin Markov

name: Champion of Arashin
text: "The blood of Dromoka and the blood of my veins are the same."

name: Stoic Rebuttal
text: Obsessed with the pursuit of knowledge above all else, vedalken can appear to be cold and emotionless.

name: Soratami Savant
text: "To prevent, one must first predict."

name: Kujar Seedsculptor
text: Every leaf, tree, and building in Kujar has been placed to achieve maximum harmony, in accordance with the elvish philosophy known as the Great Conduit.

name: Trapeze Artist
text: Heinrich catches the trapeze only about half the time, but he looks so good falling.

name: Rollick of Abandon
text:
"Embrace every moment, for it could be your last."
—Xenagos, god of revels

name: Goliath Beetle
text: The balance of nature dictates that one day humans will be stepped on by bugs.

name: Krakilin
text:
"A perfect reflection of its world: brutal, fetal, and lacking truth."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Mirage Mirror
text: Most mirrors show your reflection. Others show your potential.

name: Dingus Egg
text: Legend has it that the world was hatched from a dingus egg.

name: Pyrite Spellbomb
text:
"Melt that which was never frozen."
—Spellbomb inscription

name: Commander Greven il-Vec
text:
"Rage is the only freedom left me."
—Greven *il*-Vec

name: Hidden Horror
text: Lifespans are measured by its dreadful length.

name: Armored Warhorse
text:
"When we of the Northern Verge claim a mount, no peasant's nag will do. It must be as strong as our virtue, and must join us of its own will."
—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge

name: Runechanter's Pike
text: As sharp as its bearer's words of faith.

name: Mindwrack Harpy
text: Harpies are among the most detested creatures in all of Theros... and they thoroughly deserve it.

name: Rampage of the Clans
text: "Rage! Rage until the whole world burns!"

name: Wetland Sambar
text: As a test of calm and compassion, a Jeskai monk softly approaches a grazing sambar and offers it a lotus from his or her hand. If the creature eats, the student ascends to the next level of training.

name: Giant Spider
text:
"The wild is always changing, but it does have a few constants."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Broken Bond
text: "I can't bear to see another plane broken before I make my own home whole. I'm sorry, but my watch is over."

name: Warden of Geometries
text: The wastelands disorient even the most experienced scouts, making them easy prey for Kozilek's drones.

name: Rally the Peasants
text:
"If you must go out at night, bring a mob."
—Master of the Elgaud Cathars

name: Crucible of Worlds
text:
"From dust and light She coaxed forth an uncorrupted world. By Her grace we dwell here, free from suffering."
—Song of All, canto 11

name: Dream Cache
text:
"The sanctity of poverty is an invention of the rich."
—Starke

name: Captive Weird // Compleated Conjurer
text: The Furnace Host saw no need for such caution.

name: Misers' Cage
text:
"Let him be imprisoned while his possessions wander free."
—Suq'Ata legal decree

name: Glacial Revelation
text: The harshest environments offer the greatest opportunities for exploration.

name: Sea's Claim
text:
"My vengeance will drown my enemies as my storms drown the desert."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

name: Threaten
text: Goblins' motivational techniques are crude, but effective.

name: Orc General
text:
"Your army must fear you more than the enemy. Only then will you triumph."
—Malga Phlegmtooth

name: Rhonas's Monument
text:
"The worthy shall hone a strong body to endure the boundless energies of the afterlife."
—Monument inscription

name: Llanowar Elves
text:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing

name: Staff of the Mind Magus
text: A symbol of sagacity in bewildering times.

name: Seahunter
text: "They can't feel pain. They just wiggle 'cause they're scared."

name: Rampant Growth
text: Nature grows solutions to her problems.

name: Henrika Domnathi // Henrika, Infernal Seer
text: "Once you've tasted demon blood, you'll wonder why you ever settled for human."

name: Towering Titan
text: "Knock, knock."

name: Stone Kavu
text: To maintain its hide, it consumes a variety of rocks—not to mention a variety of Phyrexians.

name: Flight of Fancy
text: The view from above is an inspiration to the newly winged.

name: Phyrexian Walker
text:
"I have heard terrible tales of black rains, ashen fields, and metal that screams. I have consoled myself that the tales were a myth of some fevered mind. But today I saw a walker—and now I fear the truth."
—Kasib Ibn Naji, Letters

name: Spitfire Lagac
text:
"If you hear a choking sort of cough, it's about to get really hot."
—Raff Slugeater, goblin shortcutter

name: Centaur Glade
text: The Mirari called to the centaurs, and all who heard it were forever changed.

name: Incite Rebellion
text: Nothing breaks the monotony like a good old-fashioned riot.

name: Reservoir Walker
text: Renegade supply lines are, by necessity, mobile and difficult to disrupt.

name: Dragon Hunter
text: "Dromoka has taught me the secrets of her kind, that I might use them in her service."

name: Hatching Plans
text: So wondrous to behold, so delicate and finely crafted—and yet, such a pleasure to smash.

name: Taoist Hermit
text: Taoists chose to be hermits for many reasons, but all shared one unchanging goal: to follow the Tao.

name: Pyrotechnics
text: "Hi! ni! ya! Behold the man of flint, that's me!/ Four lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return." —Navajo war chant

name: Stony Strength
text: "What you build, we will destroy . . . and bury you in the rubble!"

name: Magma Spray
text:
"Jund is a wounded world. Beware its searing blood spilling out onto the surface."
—Rakka Mar

name: Dirtwater Wraith
text:
"The foul entities of the Uuserk swamp had never before dared to spread their influence to the very heart of Zhalfir."
—Hakim, Loreweaver

name: Treasure Trove
text: Karn and Hanna stood over the recovered Legacy artifacts like loving parents over sleeping children.

name: Withdraw
text: "We outnumber them! Charge! Charge! Hey, where'd you guys go? Retreat! Retreat!"

name: Vizzerdrix
text: Its swamp cousin may be meaner, but the vizzerdrix is much bigger.

name: Durkwood Boars
text: "And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine; and the herd ran violently . . ." —Mark 5:13

name: Living Twister
text:
"The ancient places of Ravnica awaken, stirred by the hoofbeats of Ilharg!"
—Nikya of the Old Ways

name: Fathom Fleet Cutthroat
text: "It was a bad evening for you, mate. Now it's chow time for the sharks."

name: Wall of Roots
text:
"Mana grows and changes like the roots of a plant. Like a plant, it must be nurtured."
—Nissa Revane

name: Screeching Sliver
text:
"What wears down my people most, I think, is not the danger, but the endless screeching outside our camp."
—Merrik Aidar, Benalish patrol

name: Mind Control
text:
"Why fight the body when you can dominate the mind that rules it?"
—Jace Beleren

name: Kaervek's Torch
text:
The pulsing heat of the midday Sun burns in the Lion's eye.
—Stone inscription, source unknown

name: Sneak Attack
text: "Keep watch? Why? Nothing going to mess with us. We too big and scary."

name: Armor Thrull
text: Occasionally, an ally balked at wearing a dead Thrull as armor. The priests' whips, however, were usually enough to encourage a more practical outlook.

name: Thraben Foulbloods
text: The famed hunting hounds of House Cecani continue to prove the quality of their pedigree.

name: Spark of Creativity
text:
"To invent is to rebel."
—Pia Nalaar

name: Tanglesap
text:
"The blood of the forest is beholden to no one."
—Nissa Revane

name: Dwarven Catapult
text:
"Often greatly outnumbered in battle, dwarves relied on catapults as one means of damaging a large army."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV*

name: Rafiq of the Many
text: Many sigils, one purpose.

name: Shape the Sands
text:
"Dragons in flight seldom expect company."
—Kadri, Dromoka warrior

name: Price of Loyalty
text: "Most folks got mayhem in their hearts. Just gotta know their price."

name: Hallowed Burial
text:
"I'd rather hear the screams of battle than the quiet that follows."
—Talara, elvish safewright

name: Boneyard Scourge
text: Death arrives on tattered wings and stolen bones.

name: Toils of Night and Day
text:
"The war sent Kamigawa into turmoil. Here it was spring and there winter. For some, time stood still, while for others, moments flashed past like minnows in a pond."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Travel Preparations
text: Visiting a shrine at the start of a journey makes the traveler more likely to finish it.

name: Willow Priestess
text:
"Those of faith are those of strength."
—Autumn Willow

name: Befoul
text:
"When the rampaging kami at Reito had crushed the opposing militia, swarms of minor kami swept over the battlefield to consume all that remained."
—*Great Battles of Kamigawa*

name: Selvala's Charge
text: Selvala's arrival never goes unnoticed.

name: Reckless Abandon
text: The climax of a warlord's career is always death.

name: Expressive Iteration
text: Prismari students dance in the tension between passion and perfection.

name: Wall of Blossoms
text:
"Everything in Nature contains all the powers of Nature."
—Ralph Waldo Emerson, "Compensation"

name: Radiant Kavu
text: When angered or frightened, it protects itself with a burst of blinding light.

name: Stone Rain
text:
"May the forces that took Argoth beneath the waves never come among us again."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Haunting Figment
text: Some bad dreams stay with you forever.

name: Nantuko Tracer
text:
Your past is a map to where you will go.
—Nantuko teaching

name: Michiko's Reign of Truth // Portrait of Michiko
text: Long ago, as the first mortal to bond with Kyodai, Michiko Konda brought an end to the Kami War and guided Kamigawa into an age of truth and harmony.

name: Sleep of the Dead
text: Normally, a cerberus sleeps one head at a time.

name: Allure of the Unknown
text: The light of hope blinded Pantor to the ills of the world.

name: Spellweaver Eternal
text:
"They were once our brothers and sisters."
—Etha, former Rhet-crop initiate

name: Shu Soldier-Farmers
text: During Kongming's campaigns against the Wei, his Shu troops rotated from the battlefront to the fields every hundred days.

name: Censor
text:
"Why so many questions?"
—Temmet, vizier of Naktamun

name: Yeva's Forcemage
text: "Nature can't be stopped. It rips and tears at Ravnica's tallest buildings to claim its place in the sun."

name: Tolarian Entrancer
text:
"Why should I boast? The bards will do it for me—and with music."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Shreds of Sanity
text: A few gnawing thoughts can eat at the mind until nothing else remains.

name: Veinwitch Coven
text: Some Strixhaven study groups are more welcoming than others.

name: Martial Coup
text:
"It is their duty to fight and die so that Humanity might be preserved."
—Lord Commissar Barron Reed

name: Change of Fortune
text:
"We cannot escape change, but with faith and fortitude, we can mold it to our liking."
—Marel, Dawnhart witch

name: Zhang Fei, Fierce Warrior
text: Zhang Fei's uncharacteristic alliance with a defeated Riverlands general, Yan Yan, allowed Shu forces to advance through forty-five Riverlands strongpoints with no casualties.

name: Lazotep Reaver
text: Despite their many forms, the Eternals worked in chilling harmony, unburdened by instinct or emotion.

name: Geier Reach Bandit // Vildin-Pack Alpha
text: The cathars realized they had not tracked her—she had led them here.

name: Hulking Cyclops
text:
"Some say a great cyclops turns the world in its hands, looking down upon it with its one bright eye."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Griselbrand
text:
"Avacyn emerged from the broken Helvault, but her freedom came at a price—him."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Blacklance Paragon
text: The Blacklances travel deep into the wilds, sometimes for years at a time, in search of the lost Cauldron of Eternity.

name: Gold-Forged Thopteryx
text: Worlds apart, Huatli built a device Saheeli would have been proud of.

name: Standstill
text:
"You learn a lot in no time when you're about to get your neck snapped."
—Dack Fayden

name: Wandering Goblins
text: Tired of waiting for a dragon to eat them, some hardy goblins struck out to become meals for the unknown.

name: Half-Elf Monk
text: This fight was over the moment you picked up that clumsy cleaver of a sword.

name: Furtive Analyst
text: Where had she first seen that symbol? She usually took such detailed notes, but her memory of it was like a fading nightmare.

name: Quandrix Pledgemage
text: "The first step toward transcending physical limitations is discarding assumptions about what is possible."

name: Gutter Skulk
text: Upon finding his warehouse infested, Gaven didn't know whether to get an exterminator or an exorcist.

name: Hostile Minotaur
text: The bellow of a minotaur always translates to "charge."

name: Destructive Urge
text: Red sky at night, dragon's delight.

name: Fabricate
text: "The secret to invention is to see something in your mind, then find where it hides in the world."

name: Hail Storm
text:
"If they can't take the hail, they'd better stay home."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skycaptain

name: Radha, Coalition Warlord
text:
"Those mindless drones could never have defeated us. We are Keldons."
—Grand Warlord Radha

name: Mahamoti Djinn
text: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

name: Novablast Wurm
text:
"The sun was born within its coils, but it fled to the sky. The wurm hungers for its child, and the world will bear its loss."
—Screed of the Mul Daya

name: Flesh to Dust
text:
"Another day. Another avenging angel. Another clump of feathers to toss in the trash."
—Liliana Vess

name: Dark Betrayal
text:
"You're just like me: ruthless, cunning, and ambitious. Obviously you're a threat."
—Basarios the Blade

name: Infuriate
text:
"Renata launched a dozen arrows into the minotaur's thick hide, but the monster didn't slow its charge. The fury of Mogis was upon it."
—Luphea of Setessa, *Histories*

name: River Boa
text:
"Sheath your swords! Cudgels only. I see a new pair of waterproof trek boots slithering away."
—Nablus, North Hada trapper

name: Jedit Ojanen
text: Mightiest of the Cat Warriors, Jedit Ojanen forsook the forests of his tribe and took service with the Robaran Mercenaries, rising through their ranks to lead them in the battle for Efrava.

name: Minion's Return
text: As a mortal, Phenax was the first to escape the Underworld. As a god, he brings his pawns along the same dark path.

name: Rolling Thunder
text: "Such rage," thought Vhati, gazing up at the thunderhead from the Predator. "It is Greven's mind manifest."

name: Gruul Guildgate
text:
"Old turf. Powerful turf. Much good blood spilled here."
—Ruric Thar

name: Thoughts of Ruin
text:
"In our war with the kami, we annihilate what is our own. Do they too suffer ruination in their hidden world?"
—Diary of Azusa

name: Illusionary Presence
text:
"We could feel the Shaman's power, as surely as we felt the storm."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Monstrous Carabid
text: What happens when a plane of predators collides with four planes of prey?

name: Shore Up
text: Homarid shells are adapted to the crushing pressure of the deepest depths; on land, their sturdiness seems supernatural.

name: Glissa Sunseeker
text: To seek the truth was her calling. To gain its power was her destiny.

name: Timber Gorge
text: Glaciers, torrential floods, and temporal disturbances came and went. The mountains yet stood, unchanged.

name: Thundercloud Shaman
text: He cares not for the disasters his storm brings as long as his path ahead is clear.

name: Outland Boar
text: The vibrant forest of Peema is awash with aether. Its animals are stronger, faster, and more aggressive than their counterparts elsewhere.

name: Phoebe, Head of S.N.E.A.K.
text: This space intentionally left blank.

name: Briar Shield
text: In all its forms, the forest is the elves' best protector.

name: Kraul Swarm
text: The hive has a long memory. It knows how every member ever died, and to whom it owes the grudge.

name: Tormented Thoughts
text:
"Not all nightmares can be escaped by waking."
—Ashiok

name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
text:
"On dark nights you can still see the light of the Vess girl's lantern out in the Caligo, seeking her lost brother. Those who follow are doomed to join her endless search."
—"The Fall of the House of Vess"

name: Granite Gargoyle
text:
"While most overworlders fortunately don't realize this, gargoyles can be most delicious, providing you have the appropriate tools to carve them."
—Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar, The Underworld Cookbook

name: B.F.M. (Big Furry Monster)
text:
"It was big. Really, really big. No, bigger
No, more. Look, we're talking krakens and

name: Kalonian Hydra
text: Incluso los báloths le temen cuando es su hora de comer.

name: Graypelt Hunter
text: He'll cleave wood and bone alike to carve a path for his allies.

name: Brassclaw Orcs
text:
"The large brass claws worn by some Sarpadian Orc tribes were among the least feared weapons ever known."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV*

name: Whipcorder
text: His bolas whirl like galaxies, but it's his enemies who see stars.

name: Dauntless Aven
text: In the chaos brought by the new gods, swift-winged aven served as pathfinders, leading the last of the people away from the ruins of Naktamun.

name: Phyrexian Atlas
text: Since conquering Mirrodin, Phyrexian engineers have worked tirelessly to transform the plane's original two layers into a more fitting array of nine.

name: Nocturnal Raid
text:
"The finest offering of night is not stealth but daring."
—Tetlok, Breathstealer

name: Jungle Barrier
text: Within silent clearings guarded by living palisades, the natural world guards its most precious secrets.

name: Armory Automaton
text: With no flesh to tire or resolve to falter, the machines soon became the Academy's preferred trainers.

name: Turntimber Symbiosis // Turntimber, Serpentine Wood
text:
"The trees here twist around spikes of mana, feeding off the flowing power."
—Jori En, expedition leader

name: Chromatic Lantern
text:
"Feldon's latest discovery appears to draw upon the same 'memories of the land' my wife studied. How I wish she could see it."
—Writings of Drafna

name: Enchanter's Bane
text: Those who fail to respect power will soon be consumed by it.

name: Mirror Gallery
text: Only in mirrors do heroes find their equal.

name: Grindstone
text:
"All attempts to halt the machine failed. We must find a way to repurpose it."
—Consulate engineer's log

name: Giant Caterpillar
text:
"'I've seen hornworms big as a man's fist,' the traveler said, and nodded soberly when our jaws went slack at his ignorance."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Asceticism
text:
"Let my ignominy build walls thicker than iron and stronger than darksteel."
—Thrun, the last troll

name: Fleeting Image
text:
"It was as if we fought a shadow."
—Onean soldier

name: Mind Funeral
text:
"The soul is only as eternal as I say it is."
—Sharuum the Hegemon

name: Windfall
text:
"To fill your mind with knowledge, we must start by emptying it."
—Barrin, master wizard

name: Call of the Death-Dweller
text: The living fear Nethroi's whispers. The dead heed them.

name: Enlightened Tutor
text: Wisdom is a precious heirloom to be passed down faithfully from each generation to the next.

name: Annex
text: Most refugees left their ancestral homes behind when they came to Otaria. A few decided to bring them along.

name: Bloodshot Trainee
text: "Hrrngh! Someday I'm going to hurl this . . . er . . . roll this . . . hrrngh . . . nudge this boulder right down a cliff."

name: Burning Hands
text: A simple fire spell that grows in intensity along with its caster.

name: Glittering Stockpile
text: The only thing Ziatora desires is "more."

name: Goblin Chirurgeon
text:
"I asked one of my aides how they do it, but all he'd say was, 'Trust me, Mayor, you don't want to know.'"
—Lydia Wynforth, Mayor of Trokair

name: Burnished Hart
text: Forged by divine hands to wander mortal realms.

name: Quicksmith Genius
text: Quicksmiths are eager to jump from one project to the next, relying on flashes of inspiration rather than careful research.

name: Prison Realm
text: After millennia to craft victory, Bolas had eternity to contemplate defeat.

name: Bonescythe Sliver
text:
"Their appendages are sharper than our swords and quicker than our bows."
—Hastric, Thunian scout

name: Kraken's Eye
text: It's seen the wonders of entire worlds trapped in the depths of a bottomless ocean.

name: Fault Riders
text: They turn geological upheaval into tactical advantage.

name: Wretched Throng
text:
"Oh no. Oh no. Oh no. Oh no, again!"
—Beltstad, cathar recruit, last words

name: Goblin Tunneler
text: "The best way over the mountain is through."

name: Diabolic Revelation
text:
"There are some secrets so dark no human mind should ever contain them. Interested?"
—Nefarox, Overlord of Grixis

name: Earsplitting Rats
text: Rats come in one amount: too many.

name: Humble Budoka
text: Each time wanderers entered the forest seeking enlightenment, Dosan was there, waiting for them to arrive.

name: Exotic Orchard
text: Where the rainbow gets its colors and the sun finds its shine.

name: Diabolic Machine
text:
"The bolts of our ballistae smashed into the monstrous thing, but our hopes died in our chests as its gears continued turning."
—Sevti Mukul, *The Fall of Alsoor*

name: Shivan Fire
text: Sometimes Shivan dragons toy with their food. Other times they just cook it.

name: Wrath of God
text: Legend speaks of the lost coastal polis of Olantin, whose inhabitants' hubris enraged the sun god Heliod.

name: Shieldmage Elder
text: "You may fight if I deem your cause worthy."

name: Farmstead Gleaner
text: When it finishes the harvest, you'll have nowhere to hide.

name: Avatar of the Resolute
text: It exemplifies the ideals of the Dromoka: strength, unity, and honor.

name: Ascend from Avernus
text: Smoke clogged the streets and rubble littered the ground, but sunlight shining on the long-lost towers of Elturel was still a beautiful sight.

name: Sliver Construct
text: Slivers destroy those who come close to the Skep, the central hive. Shards of torn metal litter the ground as a warning to any artificers inquisitive about the hive's inner workings.

name: Segmented Krotiq
text: The list of things a krotiq eats is as long as the krotiq itself.

name: Feral Lightning
text: They moved like apes, but a thousand times swifter, prying into every corner, leaving pawprints of ash.

name: Banishment Decree
text:
"Unworthy of consecration."
—Axsh, lesser cenobite

name: Crossbow Infantry
text: The crossbow is the ideal weapon for the lazy Mercadians: just point and shoot.

name: Armorer Guildmage
text:
Zhalfir's destiny rings in tempered steel.
—Armorer Guild maxim

name: My Genius Knows No Bounds
text: "I can see . . . everything. The beginning and the end of time. The raw edges of reality. And now I see exactly how to kill you."

name: Elite Javelineer
text: "Precision is frequently more valuable than force."

name: General Ferrous Rokiric
text: Apearance: A skilled military commander, Ferrous is a new character for you to design.

name: Glaciers
text:
"Even the highest mountain can be ground to dust."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Shield Dancer
text: The harder your strike, the stronger her defense.

name: Coralhelm Guide
text:
"She knows every step of this coastline, both above and below the surface, and she has hideouts all along the way. She will get you there."
—Jori En, expedition leader

name: Cinderbones
text: Not all coals lie quietly in their beds of cold ash.

name: Phyrexian War Beast
text:
"Knowing its origins, how could they have thought they could control it?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

name: Tremble
text: Otaria's frequent tremors are the last stages of Dominaria's recovery from the Phyrexian war.

name: Oblivion Sower
text: The Eldrazi hunger without limit and consume without pause.

name: Trygon Predator
text: Held aloft by metabolized magic, trygons are ravenous for sources of mystic fuel.

name: Puncture Bolt
text: Cinder pyromancers measure their success by counting their enemies' smoking holes.

name: Vastwood Fortification // Vastwood Thicket
text:
"When you understand nature's ways, you're never unarmed."
—Eyza, Joraga guide

name: Marhault Elsdragon
text: Marhault Elsdragon follows a strict philosophy, never letting emotions cloud his thoughts. No chance observer could imagine the rage in his heart.

name: Damia, Sage of Stone
text: Ask your query and be on your way. Just don't look her in the eye.

name: Arms Dealer
text:
"Guaranteed to leave your enemies sufficiently stabbed, bitten, cleaved, or exploded."
—Grezkrick's Emporium motto

name: Riot Ringleader
text: "So the vampires like hot blood, do they? Let's see how they handle ours."

name: Janjeet Sentry
text: Janjeet Observatory is open to the public, but access to the adjoining laboratories is restricted.

name: Invasive Species
text: It's easier to relocate a village that lies in their path than to turn the bugs aside.

name: Whirler Virtuoso
text: The first tentative flaps are like a song to his soul.

name: Goma Fada Vanguard
text:
"Her weapon's impressive, sure. But you should see her wield it."
—Gred, expedition warrior

name: Sylvan Advocate
text: "The land gives of itself. Its abundance provides, even in times of chaos."

name: Gale Swooper
text:
"Be glad the griffin set you back on your feet when it was done with you. My goat wasn't so lucky."
—Arram, goatherd

name: Holy Mantle
text:
"The guilds promise to provide safety. I prefer to make my own."
—Briska, Ninth District freemage

name: Exclude
text:
"I don't have time for you right now."
—Teferi

name: Scute Swarm
text:
"Survival rule 782: There are *always* more scute bugs."
—Zurdi, goblin shortcutter

name: Aetherflux Reservoir
text:
"These estimates are conservative. Its true capacity may be far, far greater."
—Research notes, signature illegible

name: Aether Sting
text: When Gatha fell, he was called to account for each abomination he created.

name: Break Open
text: There are two ways to resolve puzzling situations: thoughtful contemplation or force. After thoughtful contemplation, most barbarians choose force.

name: Swiftblade Vindicator
text: A swiftblade is an artist, each fiery trail of their blades a fleeting masterpiece traced on the air.

name: Viashino Bey
text:
When the bey runs, match his stride.
—Viashino saying

name: Tempest Caller
text: "I *am* the storm."

name: Resupply
text:
"If the scalelords are the brains of Dromoka's army, the supply caravans are its beating heart."
—Baihir, Dromoka mage

name: War Mammoth
text: I didn't think mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.

name: Thundermare
text: Its hooves strike lightning and the thunder follows quickly after.

name: Narnam Cobra
text: Some say tales of the Narnam greenhouse are told to scare the children, but every tale grows from a seed of truth.

name: Winds of Rath
text:
"There shall be a vast shout and then a vaster silence."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Aura Shards
text: Gaea forged her soldiers into self-wielding weapons that struck down all impurities.

name: Warrior en-Kor
text: Only a matter as vital as destroying Volrath could bring together the reclusive Kor people.

name: Marauding Blight-Priest
text: "The vampires never had gods. We followed our bloodchiefs. Now they are gone. What is left? Destruction and death, my friends. That is enough."

name: Brion Stoutarm
text: Boggarts and disturbing bits of boggarts flew through the air with alarming and untidy regularity.

name: Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer
text: "My mind is the spread of the canopy. My heart is the embrace of the roots. I am deathless Llanowar, its fury and its peace."

name: Prismari Apprentice
text: "No one ever created great art by playing it safe!"

name: Strict Proctor
text: "You might believe being dead for centuries has made me more lenient. I think you'll find the opposite to be true."

name: Imperial Aerosaur
text: Its assistance is unnervingly similar to its hunting technique.

name: Persist
text: In the tight-knit doun of Mistmeadow, death is less important than duty.

name: Wall of Tears
text:
"Many have been lost to pity."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Deadeye Quartermaster
text: "Welcome aboard, mate! You're going to need this."

name: Mise
text: Statistically mind-staggering as it might seem, the term "mise" was in fact coined simultaneously by over one thousand Magic players.

name: Shatter
text:
"Such fuss over machines, Gerrard. Remember that you are the prize of the Legacy. Throw away your toys!"
—Orim, Samite healer

name: Rolling Thunder
text:
"Zendikar is always angry, though I've never seen that anger so precisely directed."
—Nablus, North Hada trapper

name: Circle of Despair
text:
"Life is a resource that should belong only to the strong."
—Shauku, Endbringer

name: Wandering Archaic // Explore the Vastlands
text: "Fly the path of nine birds."

name: Voltaic Key
text: The key did not work on a single lock, yet it opened many doors.

name: Divine Verdict
text: Cunning warriors and dim-witted beasts alike fall under the church's harsh judgment.

name: Desolation
text:
"Kill a creature, destroy the present. Kill the land, destroy the future."
—Kaervek

name: Essence Scatter
text: Dependence on luck is anathema to Kefnet's rigorous studies. Those who hope to escape his maze by chance never succeed.

name: Grim Discovery
text: Few among the living understand just how much of their world is shaped by the ruins of the dead.

name: Wit's End
text:
"Your pathetic ideas lie in shambles, Planeswalker. Where is your arrogant pride now?"
—Nicol Bolas

name: Arrest
text: Orim had no memory of the previous night—the first thing she could remember was waking up with the dead guard's blood on her hands.

name: Bloodline Shaman
text: Every creature of the forest has a name, and she knows them all.

name: Territorial Baloth
text: It knows nothing of Eldrazi or Planeswalkers, just that there are new intruders in its territory.

name: Spell Syphon
text: Warrik Brutehexer felt betrayed that his aura favored the depths of the Wanderbrine River over its rightful place, hovering around him.

name: Lifecrafter's Bestiary
text:
"Inspiration is found by looking outward."
—Oviya Pashiri, sage lifecrafter

name: Coal Golem
text: "Three such creatures stood burning at the crest of the hill. Only seconds later, the Fireball struck our front line." —Lydia, Countess Brellis

name: Chaos Warp
text:
"Tzeentch cares not what they were or what they become. Only that they change."
—Kairos Fateweaver

name: Pyrotechnics
text:
"Hi!ni!ya! Behold the man of flint, that's me! / Four lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return."
—Navajo war chant

name: Pulse of the Forge
text: Before wars or weapons, there was anger.

name: Triskelion
text: A brainchild of Tawnos, the Triskelion later proved both versatile and useful.

name: Mire Blight
text:
"Is there anything in Guul Draz that *doesn't* suck the life out of you?"
—Tarsa, Sea Gate sell-sword

name: Deathmark
text:
"Let the final vision of doom be etched upon their unblinking eyes."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

name: Shoot Down
text: Gwenna stayed her hand only once, to save young Harbin's life—a mistake she would never repeat.

name: Homarid Shaman
text:
"The ground grew swampy; hooves and claws sank into the marshy earth. Snarls of rage and bleats of despair echoed through the trees as the waters grew higher and higher."
—Kyliki of Havenwood, "Havenwood Remembered"

name: Fatespinner
text: No one knows what she is watching, but she never takes her eyes off it.

name: Wei Elite Companions
text: Cao Cao was more concerned with capabilities than lineage. He excelled at recruiting and retaining men of talent to serve him.

name: Weather the Storm
text:
"Neither blade nor tempest can assail the serenity of a tranquil mind."
—*The Turrau Carvings*

name: Goblin War Paint
text:
"The Eldrazi may not be intimidated, but if it boosts the goblins' confidence, I see no reason to discourage it."
—Jalun, Affa sentry

name: Goldmire Bridge
text: The path to glory is forged in ambition.

name: Tentative Connection
text: Lukka was ordered to kill a threat. He chose to make a friend.

name: Torture
text: What the vigor of life builds up, agony tears down again.

name: Polymorph
text: "Ahh! Opposable digits!"

name: Kitsune Blademaster
text: Those kitsune trained in the blade preferred to fight with a blade-catching jitte in the off hand, buying them just enough time to deliver the first deadly cut.

name: Copper Carapace
text:
"We will fight as they do: our flesh protected behind metal."
—Tae Aquil, Viridian weaponsmith

name: Swerve
text:
"We can't beat the necromancers in numbers or raw power. We must beat them with ingenuity and timing."
—Rannon, Vithian holdout

name: Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
text:
"We have been patient. We have planned our attack. We are ready . . . *now*."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Alchemist's Refuge
text: Persecuted alchemists fled deep into Kessig's wilds, seeking solitude to continue their ghoulish craft.

name: Abyssal Specter
text: To gaze under its hood is to invite death.

name: Information Dealer
text:
"One wizard is a suspect. Two wizards are a conspiracy."
—Elvish refugee

name: Kwende, Pride of Femeref
text:
"His blades were the ultimate agents of transformation. All Phyrexians who met them were transformed into pieces."
—*Heroes of the Second Invasion*

name: Rubblebelt Runner
text: The sly, stealthy warriors of the Slizt Clan survive by hiding in high ground and ambushing their enemies. Other Gruul call them skulkers and cowards, but only from a safe distance.

name: Simian Brawler
text:
"It's odd to see the apes rip down trees to arm themselves in defense of their forests."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

name: Thorn Mammoth
text: It will come to the defense of all wild things, from the shivering wren to the towering giant.

name: Arcanum Wings
text: Nobles don wings to reach the sky villas of their peers, exchanging them for more fashionable attire upon arrival.

name: Thought-Knot Seer
text: It thinks, therefore you aren't.

name: Quirion Trailblazer
text: "All that matters is the path ahead."

name: Shatter
text:
"I am an artist, a builder, a creator . . . I create the biggest explosions around."
—Krol, goblin furnace-priest

name: Moldervine Reclamation
text:
"The heroes of the past nourish our spirits by their example—and nourish our crops by their decay."
—Jeddeg, philosopher of graves

name: Invasion of Kylem // Valor's Reach Tag Team
text: "Let's give these creeps the old one-two!"

name: Sylvan Scrying
text: One glimpse of an elf's home lasts her weeks away in the wild.

name: Jhoira, Weatherlight Captain
text: As she took the wheel of the *Weatherlight* for the first time in a millennium, Jhoira knew she'd been right to restore the ship. Anything was possible now.
