name: Reaper from the Abyss
text: "Avacyn has deserted you. I welcome your devotion in her stead."

name: Lucky Clover
text: Syr Branigan always remembered to kiss his good luck charm, having lost his foot to wolverines the last time he forgot.

name: Amulet of Kroog
text: Among the first allies Urza gained were the people of Kroog. As a sign of friendship, Urza gave the healers of the city potent amulets; afterwards, thousands journeyed to Kroog in hope of healing.

name: Desert of the Glorified
text: On countless frontier worlds, below silica sand, blasted chalk, or bubbling marsh, slumbering Necrons await.

name: Aeronaut Cavalry
text:
"The ground is where wars are waged, but the air is where they are won."
—Harbin, vanguard aviator

name: Sworn Companions
text:
"The trouble with youths these days is that, in outright defiance of their elders, they refuse to be bought."
—Karlov of the Ghost Council

name: Flow of Ideas
text:
"A system to direct the flow of Ravnica's entire water supply? Thinking a bit small, aren't we?"
—Trivaz, Izzet mage

name: Phyrexian Tower
text: Living metal encasing dying flesh.

name: Curse of Vitality
text: Good health beckons many a vigorous follower.

name: Devastation
text: There is much talk about the art of creation. What about the art of destruction?

name: Darkness
text:
"If I must die, I will encounter darkness as a bride, / And hug it in mine arms."
—William Shakespeare,
*Measure for Measure*

name: Patriarch's Bidding
text:
"Family plots are so convenient."
—Cabal Patriarch

name: Plague Rats
text: "Should you a Rat to madness tease Why ev'n a Rat may plague you..." —Samuel Coleridge, "Recantation"

name: Rune-Scarred Demon
text: The litany of the infernal on his flesh pulses to the beating of his dark heart.

name: Onslaught
text: The last thing to go through the mogg's mind was its teeth.

name: Runeclaw Bear
text: The only honey it wants is the sweet nectar flowing through your veins.

name: Final Punishment
text: The pain of a lifetime—every scrape, illness, and bruise—condensed into a single moment.

name: Thought Scour
text: He had glimpsed the truth of the Multiverse. Now if only he could remember it.

name: Nantuko Disciple
text:
Unanswered prayers are themselves answers.
—Nantuko teaching

name: Ravenous Squirrel
text:
"Nope, no monsters in the forest. Nothing in there but squirrels."
—Joskun, An-Havva constable

name: Earthblighter
text: "A single dedicated mind can bring about the greatest destruction. That, or goblins—goblins work too."

name: Training Center
text: Between matches, combatants practice to stay in peak mental and physical form.

name: Forced Landing
text: The druid knew only one spell, a charm to encourage rapid plant growth. When airborne Eternals invaded her arboretum, she had to get creative.

name: Woodlot Crawler
text:
"We learned something from the Simic. Unfortunately for them."
—Nefara, Dimir agent

name: Sylvan Safekeeper
text:
"How could someone so small cause so much trouble?"
—Nomad sentry

name: Updraft
text:
"The power of flight has but one equal in battle: surprise. Understanding how to use both is the key to victory."
—Arnjlot Olasson, Sky Mage

name: Raised by Giants
text: Your parents taught you that strength can be nurtured and honed, no matter one's size.

name: Zombie Ogre
text:
"On the plus side, Throg no longer thinks he's clever."
—Xanathar

name: Fraction Jackson
text: Bitten by radioactive beebles in a freak algebra accident, young Ricky Robertson discovered he'd gained the ability to harness the awesome power of fractions!

name: Powerstone Shard
text:
"Light passing through a powerstone is refracted by eternity and colored by planar energy. I wonder how the world appeared through Urza's eyes?"
—Teferi

name: Goblin Guide
text: "I've been all over this world. I even remember some of those places."

name: Tablet of the Guilds
text: It is rumored the Azorius paid an exorbitant sum to ensure its symbol would appear at the top.

name: Golgari Locket
text:
"Wear it at all times. It will guide our reanimators to your corpse."
—Mazirek, kraul death priest

name: Defiant Strike
text:
"For twelve days and twelve nights, Somat assailed the monster's shell. On the thirteenth morning, it cracked with the dawn."
—*Heroics: A Book of Fables*

name: Oracle of Nectars
text: When elves find a fount of beauty, they protect it. Where there is beauty, there is hope.

name: Tranquil Path
text: Freyalise bought the planeswalkers the time they needed by clearing a path through the misshapen hell of Phyrexia.

name: Somberwald Spider
text: Stensian vampires encourage spiders near their manors so they can rob the webs.

name: Firebreathing
text:
"And topples round the dreary west,
A looming bastion fringed with fire."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "In Memoriam"

name: Lim-Dûl's High Guard
text:
"Death does not prevent us from service to our absent master. As long as Tresserhorn stands, so shall we."
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn

name: Dreadful Apathy
text: Those whose lives were uninspired are doomed to the wretched tedium of Phylias in death.

name: Chromatic Lantern
text: Used carefully, material has been exposed to the baleful energies of the Warp can be contained to fuel powerful rituals.

name: Search Warrant
text: "And would you care to explain why your satchel is radiating an aura of unstable energy?"

name: Dark Favor
text: When he began to curse what he held holy, his strength grew unrivaled.

name: Censorship
text: Editor's note: There were no suitable flavor text submissions for this card.

name: Feral Hydra
text: It shreds its prey as each head fights for the choicest bits.

name: Accelerated Mutation
text: Its food just got a lot smaller and its stomach a lot bigger.

name: Scion of Ugin
text: For hundreds of years Ugin slept, encased in the cocoon of stone and magic Sarkhan had created using a shard of a Zendikari hedron. As Ugin lay dormant, his spectral guardians kept vigil.

name: Fable of Wolf and Owl
text: The forest grew fangs. The sky spread its wings.

name: Mirrorweave
text:
"Those who are different are untrustworthy, unpredictable. Put your safety in the hands of your own kind."
—Bowen, Barrenton guardcaptain

name: Fear
text:
"Even the bravest of warriors yet knows the dark clutch of fright upon his stalwart heart."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Bounce Chamber
text: The Astrotorium bouncing record is three days, though setting it wasn't strictly intentional.

name: Veldrane of Sengir
text:
"Poor, foolish Veldrane. He goes wherever the Baron wills him. One day, he'll go to die."
—Halina, Dwarven Trader

name: Armored Pegasus
text: Asked how it survived a run-in with a bog imp, the pegasus just shook its mane and burped.

name: Asari Captain
text: "Go! Show them your fury!"

name: Jade Statue
text: "Some of the other guys dared me to touch it, but I knew it weren't no ordinary hunk o' rock." —Norin the Wary

name: Root Maze
text: Pause for the briefest of moments to consider the whorl of brambles, the tangled twist of bark, and the maze has already won.

name: Snarespinner
text: In the rich jungles of Yavimaya, bright colors are the perfect camouflage.

name: Rise Again
text:
"I love those who are eager to serve."
—Liliana Vess

name: Wand of the Elements
text: It gives legs to the earth and wings to the sky.

name: Windborn Muse
text: A single glimpse was enough to compel Captain Velkarne to lay down his sword and take up the poet's quill.

name: Pariah
text: A valiant knight's life has no meaning without honor.

name: Skeletal Wurm
text: Necromancers are judged by the most powerful undead they've ever created. There are those who have animated just a single being, yet are considered the pinnacle of their dark craft.

name: Northern Paladin
text:
"How smooth his face, how sure his thoughts. I look forward to breaking his mighty will."
—The Eastern Paladin

name: Jayemdae Tome
text:
"Knowledge is power."
—Sir Francis Bacon,
*Meditationes Sacrae*

name: Searing Meditation
text:
"When I meditate I see the world as it should be. All that does not fit, I remove."
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage

name: Weirding Shaman
text: All boggarts have an auntie, but they don't all have a mum.

name: Steam Vents
text: Despite being abandoned for millennia, the Thran ironworks still occasionally sputter to life.

name: Lullmage Mentor
text: "Many voices are needed to quiet this land."

name: Earth Tremor
text:
"Every cave-in is Moradin telling you to leave the earth where it is."
—Halgar, dwarven recluse

name: Basilisk Collar
text: Some patriars pay massive sums for exotic pets that can give their posh, predictable lives an edge of danger.

name: Renegade Troops
text: "Across the land rebellions seethed and swarmed / As vicious war lords swooped down on all sides."

name: Ainok Tracker
text: Some ainok of the mountains are accepted among the Temur as trusted hunt-mates.

name: Boldwyr Intimidator
text: "Now everyone knows what you are."

name: Greel's Caress
text: Greel's grin is far less loathsome than his touch.

name: Chill of Foreboding
text: "Wait . . . did you fellows hear something?"

name: Plot Armor
text: "If you've got words, we're going to have words."

name: Whack
text: "It's just business. You understand."

name: Warped Physique
text: The Gruul seek unbounded strength. The Dimir deliver cruel irony.

name: Mana Screw
text: There was no darker or more evil creation in all the multiverse than that of the mana screw.

name: Drowned Catacomb
text: None can tell how many vessels are tangled up on the sea floor—or how much treasure remains unclaimed.

name: Rustvine Cultivator
text:
"All elves aspire to be part of nature. Only Phyrexia can truly grant that wish."
—Glissa Sunslayer

name: Puppeteer
text:
"That's the funny thing about free will. You don't feel any different without it."
—Ambassador Laquatus

name: Plummet
text:
"Let nothing own the skies but the wind."
—Dejara, Giltwood druid

name: Light of Promise
text: The light washed over him, and in the wind he heard the roars of all the pridemates who had come before.

name: Trueheart Twins
text: Shoulder to shoulder until blade must turn against blade.

name: Merfolk Mesmerist
text:
"Don't you think if I saw a half-woman, half-fish with three glowing eyes, I'd have remembered?"
—Drugo, town guard

name: Skittering Invasion
text:
"The brood spread far faster than we could kill it. I fear the worst is yet to come."
—*The War Diaries*

name: Crooked Custodian
text: "Nothing to see here. Just carrying a carpet. Yes, the carpet wears boots. Stop asking questions."

name: Curse of the Swine
text: Another imminent battle subsided in busy snuffling and carefree rooting.

name: Amok
text: Crovax's rage was horrifying. Within moments only blood and shreds of flesh remained of the shapeshifter.

name: Binding Agony
text:
A crash of rhinos in my head
—Femeref expression meaning "a severe head pain"

name: Exploration
text: With every step she took, a new world unfolded before her.

name: Flame Burst
text: As hot as a dwarf's rage.

name: Bloodbond March
text: The Golgari support a vast army because death never ends its soldiers' service.

name: The Haunt of Hightower
text: It drains vitality from those it touches.

name: Knight of the Widget
text: His armor is lightweight titanium alloy, but his will is iron.

name: Fungusaur
text: Rather than sheltering her young, the female Fungusaur often injures her own offspring, thereby ensuring their rapid growth.

name: Glass of the Guildpact
text:
"Counterbalanced forces sustain this city. No faction above others. A beautiful idea."
—Emmara

name: Adaptive Automaton
text: Always on trend.

name: Divination
text: "The stars mark your destiny. May you accept the fate thus divulged."

name: Viashino Racketeer
text: "You may call me a fool, selling this stuff on Orzhov turf. Well, you need to be a little reckless to survive."

name: Skyshroud Poacher
text: "It's OK. They're just elves."

name: Cache Raiders
text: What the current doesn't take, they do.

name: Augmenter Pugilist // Echoing Equation
text: "Any good experiment is repeatable."

name: Inquisition of Kozilek
text:
「久遠の闇の中に住むなど考えられない。精神を打ち砕く奴らに遭遇するなど。」
——タイタン年代記

name: Realmwright
text: There is not a single inch of Ravnica that hasn't been altered at one point or another to fit someone's whims.

name: Ghosts of the Innocent
text:
"Ma said we should offer up blini-cakes and salt to the good ones, but I get that chill up my spine and just shut the door."
—Otak, Tin Street shopkeep

name: Nin, the Pain Artist
text: "Your body is a delicate instrument that tells me truths. These devices help me 'tune' that instrument."

name: Jade Statue
text:
"Some of the other guys dared me to touch it, but I knew it weren't no ordinary hunk o' rock."
—Norin the Wary

name: Sakura-Tribe Elder
text: Slain warriors were buried with a tree sapling, so they would become a part of the forest after death.

name: Mulch
text: Hope is the one crop that can grow in any climate.

name: Hopping Automaton
text: Designed to carry equipment across rivers, the hopping automaton was soon pressed into service in the infantry.

name: Soltari Priest
text: "In Rath," the priest said, "there is even greater need for prayer."

name: Scaled Wurm
text: The wurms become so big, a single scale can be used as a roof for a human dwelling.

name: Goblin Anarchomancer
text: A good Gruul shaman can work a whole clan into a frenzy. A great one will wait until the enemy's nearby.

name: Daggersail Aeronaut
text: "Coming down is the best part!"

name: Traverse the Outlands
text:
"By the time you've seen it all, all have already changed."
—Wandering treant, name unknown

name: Reconnaissance
text: War favors the informed.

name: Rakdos's Return
text: When Lord Rakdos stirred from his slumber, everyone else's nightmare began.

name: Prison Sentence
text: War prisoners were ineffective political pawns, as neither brother cared enough to trade for them.

name: Portal to Phyrexia
text: After five thousand years, the nightmare returned.

name: Compost
text:
"The dead ones joined Tocatztli, the seven-legged, each bloom becoming a star in the night sky."
—*The Song of Origins*

name: Cobbled Wings
text: Flotsam held together by optimism.

name: Basilica Bell-Haunt
text: You can hear their tolling only when your debt is due.

name: Skyspear Cavalry
text: Pray her spear reaches you first. Her griffin is less kind.

name: Master Trinketeer
text: "Let us never forget the joy that lies at the heart of invention."

name: Prizefighter Construct
text: The Scrappers, an underground group with a passion for automaton brawls, had renegade leanings even before the Consulate's crackdown. It didn't take long for them to lend their best brawlers to the conflict.

name: Eunuchs' Intrigues
text: Taking control of powerful court positions one by one, eunuchs eventually brought on the fall of the Han dynasty, leading to the chaos of the Three Kingdoms.

name: Llanowar Tribe
text: "Llanowar remembers the Ice Age, the Phyrexian Invasion, and the Rift Era. So long as we draw breath, we will ensure such disasters never threaten our world again."

name: Blades of Velis Vel
text: "The changing kind suffers as we do. We must join as one to quench our tyrants!"

name: Ember-Fist Zubera
text: When the Honden of Infinite Rage shattered, its attendants swarmed Kamigawa to sow mortal destruction.

name: Breath of Fire
text: Fire leads to more fire.

name: Minister of Impediments
text: When it takes forever to learn all the rules, no time is left for breaking them.

name: Ferocity of the Wilds
text: Knights who excel in tournaments sometimes underestimate threats beyond the realm.

name: Fireslinger
text:
"Remember the moral of the fireslinger fable: with power comes isolation."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Dread Drone
text: Each Eldrazi ancient spawned a lineage of horrors in unfathomable shapes.

name: Gruul Signet
text: Gruul territorial markings need not be legible. The blood, snot, and muck used to smear them are unmistakably Gruul.

name: Welkin Tern
text: Sailors have come to regard them as bad luck, for they falsely bring hope of land.

name: Ruthless Knave
text: "This scum is barely worth the trouble."

name: Jokulhaups
text:
"I was shocked when I first saw the aftermath of the Yavimaya Valley disaster. The raging waters had swept away trees, bridges, and even houses. My healers had much work to do."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Flatten
text: Like their dragonlord, the Kolaghan take no trophies. They find true fulfillment only in the battle itself, in clash of steel and thunder of hooves.

name: Mystical Tutor
text: Wisdom is a well that never runs dry. It offers the most to those with the deepest thirst for knowledge.

name: Prey Upon
text: It is the nature of the strong to survive.

name: Phyrexian Hulk
text:
It doesn't think. It doesn't feel. It doesn't laugh or cry. All it does from dusk till dawn Is make the soldiers die.
—Onean children's rhyme

name: Trove Tracker
text: The best treasures are the least shared.

name: Chime of Night
text: Many sent to serve Davvol carried such instruments, as if to remind him who their true masters were.

name: Angelic Accord
text: As demons are drawn to suffering, angels are drawn to acts of benevolence.

name: Flashfreeze
text:
"Is cold merely the absence of heat, or a force unto itself? Would a display of its power help you decide?"
—Zubarek, Icewinder Magus

name: Dual Casting
text: Hours after the Helvault opened, his powers returned twice as strong as before.

name: Harsh Mercy
text:
"There is no greater burden than choosing who to save."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte

name: Consecrated Sphinx
text: Blessed by the hands of Jin-Gitaxias.

name: Goblin Smuggler
text: "I am but a humble traveler. I have no taste for sneakery nor thiefiness."

name: Mammoth Spider
text:
"If a careless elf ends up caught in a spider's web, we must expect nature to take its course. Do not blame the spider for being a spider."
—Dellin Berting, Tolarian entomologist

name: Craw Giant
text: Harthag gave a jolly laugh as he surveyed the army before him. "Ho ho ho! Midgets! You think you can stand in my way?"

name: Sylvok Lifestaff
text: The druid's lifestaff connects her to generations of bygone Sylvok.

name: Ardent Militia
text: Some fight for honor and some for gold, but the militia fights for hearth and home.

name: Mishra, Excavation Prodigy
text: While Urza read books, Mishra learned to read the desert itself.

name: Sigarda's Summons
text: With Olivia distracted, Sigarda tore free from her bindings and summoned her Host of Herons.

name: Spreading Seas
text: Most inhabitants of Zendikar have given up on the idea of an accurate map.

name: Surgical Skullbomb
text: It crackles with the intellect of a twisted genius.

name: Safehold Sentry
text: "These bracers were worn by my father and by his mother before him. Boggart fangs have shattered on them. Cinder flames have withered at their touch. While I wear them, the safehold will not fall."

name: Confessor
text: "There will be gains for our losses. There will be rights for our wrongs."

name: Guttersnipe
text: "I found a new toy. Wanna play?"

name: Enrage
text: The barbarians call it "touching the soul of the dragon."

name: Soul Barrier
text:
"The Soul selects her own Society— Then—shuts the Door—"
—Emily Dickinson, "The Soul selects her own Society"

name: Gatstaf Shepherd // Gatstaf Howler
text:
"What is worse than a wolf in sheep's clothing?"
—Wolfhunter's riddle

name: Bullwhip
text:
"Pain is a crude way to enforce obedience, but it is cheap and plentiful."
—Volrath

name: Centaur Archer
text:
"Centaurs will kill our aesthir if they can; they've always been enemies. Destroy the horse-people on sight."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

name: Cursebreak
text: No longer the village pariah. No longer taunted and shamed. Sigrun was finally free.

name: Watcher in the Web
text: "Lost in the woods" is an optimistic way to describe a villager's disappearance. "Found in the woods" is frequently more appropriate.

name: Craven Hulk
text: Abandoned at birth, the giant was raised by goats. Ironically, it grew up to be the most cautious member of the herd.

name: Dragon-Style Twins
text: "We are the flicker of the flame and its heat, the two sides of a single blade."

name: Wood Elves
text: But *should* elves?

name: Silver Myr
text: The vedalken saw the myr as toys, unaware of the intelligence lurking behind their empty eyes.

name: Geralf, Visionary Stitcher
text: "Do you like it, Sister? Its dreadful visage was inspired by your own."

name: Cancel
text: Fendros gasped as he watched the spell drip from the ends of his fingers. He moved his foot, afraid to disturb the spot where it lay slain.

name: Ambition's Cost
text: "Of course it can be yours. Anything is possible for the right price. Speaking of which . . ."

name: Aven Battle Priest
text: When the shadow of the aven falls across the battlefield, hope rises in the hearts of the soldiers.

name: Fiendlash
text: A fiery scourge for both flesh and soul.

name: Blood Hypnotist
text: Arvon was ecstatic to offer his blood to such a captivating creature.

name: Esika, God of the Tree // The Prismatic Bridge
text: The beginning of the rainbow.

name: Glittering Frost
text: At last, the storm's rage subsided, leaving silent, frozen beauty in its wake.

name: Heroes' Bane
text: Travelers' tales claim that hydras bite off their own heads to make themselves deadlier.

name: Hardened Scales
text:
"They're herbivores, not prey animals. Go startle one if you want to know the difference."
—Huatli

name: Thorn of Amethyst
text: Mined from a cave in the Dark Meanders, it shines brightest when no one is looking.

name: Think Tank
text: Cephalids seek knowledge not to better themselves, but to best others.

name: Gift of Estates
text:
「家を願い世界を受け取った。」
—-九つの祝福の巻物

name: Carnage Altar
text:
"In these bloodstains I will find the fingerprints of our oppressors."
—Anowon, the Ruin Sage

name: Barrenton Cragtreads
text: "Boggarts are easy to get around. Just toss some mutton in another direction. Giants are a little harder. You have to be quick to avoid their steps. Cinders are the difficult ones, but even they have fears to be exploited."

name: Meteor Swarm
text: Sometimes one fireball isn't enough.

name: Man-o'-War
text:
"Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

name: Immolation
text: Nothing is funnier to a devil than setting someone—anyone—on fire.

name: Hampering Snare
text:
"I want it to look me in the eyes and know the face of the man who put it down."
—Kelsien, the Plague

name: Drunau Corpse Trawler
text: Seagrafs yield an abundance of resources for stitchers and ghoulcallers alike.

name: Urza's Factory
text:
"Though their ideals are leagues apart, Urza's and Mishra's creations have a surprising harmony with one another."
—Tocasia, journal entry

name: Divert
text: "What's the fun of being a wizard if you can't mess with people's heads?"

name: Dwarven Soldier
text:
"Orc must die / Orc must die / Not an orc? / March on by."
—Dwarven marching song

name: Bruna, the Fading Light // Brisela, Voice of Nightmares
text: She now sees only Emrakul's visions.

name: The Ever-Changing 'Dane
text: He could be anyone, anywhere, but he'll never again be "half" of anything.

name: Buccaneer's Bravado
text: Never underestimate the power of panache.

name: Innocent Traveler // Malicious Invader
text: Van Helsing raised his lantern and drew the slide; by the concentrated light that fell on Lucy's face we could see that the lips were crimson with fresh blood.

name: Looming Shade
text: The shade tracks victims by reverberations of the pipes, as a spider senses prey tangled in its trembling web.

name: Minotaur Explorer
text: After the invasion devastated the Talruum and Hurloon tribes, the survivors began to search for other minotaurs.

name: Basri's Aegis
text:
"As long as we survive, we can rebuild."
—Basri Ket

name: Cataclysm
text:
"Keep with you only this much: your mount, your blade, and your wits. The rest you can find, build, or take."
—Horse clans' wisdom

name: Opaline Sliver
text:
"When struck, its hide shimmers through sequences of color—a signaling language I am eager to unravel."
—Rukarumel, field journal

name: Mother of Runes
text: "Don't eat anyone before dinner—you'll ruin your appetite."

name: Trapjaw Kelpie
text: Travelers in these waters leave a bit of themselves behind.

name: Sungrace Pegasus
text: The sacred feathers of the pegasus are said to have healing powers.

name: Legion's End
text:
"With a single word, they were unmade."
—Krinnea, *Siege of the Bone Spire*

name: Thirst for Knowledge
text: "Knowledge is the universal currency of the Multiverse. It is power. It is freedom. It is possibility itself."

name: Grotag Siege-Runner
text:
"I don't think he's bringing in the mail . . . ."
—Nundari, Sea Gate militia captain

name: Raven Guild Initiate
text: The Raven Guild soars on winds of unease.

name: Wing Snare
text: The elves long ago mastered the art of hunting with nets. They call it "fishing the sky."

name: Claws of Valakut
text: "Swords may sunder. Shields may fail. My will is stronger than steel, and my flesh and bone far more deadly."

name: Argothian Sprite
text:
"Make the exhaust vents smaller next time!"
—Urza, notes to his engineers

name: Tranquil Cove
text: Deep-space ports provide temporary shelter for Imperial cruisers on long voyages.

name: Fume Spitter
text:
"Our archers made sport of it as it fumbled its way up the slag ridge. As it collapsed we thought ourselves safe, but the foul thing carried more than necrogen."
—Adaran, Tangle hunter

name: Angelic Page
text: If only every message were as perfect as its bearers.

name: Flowstone Strike
text: Aggression exacts its toll.

name: Squirrel Farm
text:
"And the ignorant shall fall to the squirrels."
—*Chip 2:54*

name: Blight Sickle
text: Its scars cut deeper than its blade.

name: Gretchen Titchwillow
text: "Plant what you wish to see grow. Listen for the stories you want to hear told."

name: Sibsig Host
text:
"They were your friends, your family, your clan. They want only to welcome you."
—Tasigur, the Golden Fang

name: Firefist Striker
text: The flaming fist of Boros holds the promise of both protection and destruction in its grasp.

name: Frogtosser Banneret
text: The Frogtossers thread feathers, bones, and trophies from past raids into their standards, believing they fuel the warren with the anger of its victims.

name: New Frontiers
text: Spreading a blanket of growth to warm a weary world.

name: Supplant Form
text:
"Ice can be shaped to any form, even the whisper of a memory."
—Mytha, Temur shaman

name: Mana Cylix
text: Those who dismiss the cylix as an ordinary wooden bowl are blind to the true measure of its worth.

name: Detection Tower
text: Its light exposes enemies and lays secrets bare.

name: Crusade
text:
"Finally, I understand. Home isn't where you rest. It's what you fight for."
—Elspeth Tirel

name: Foundry Inspector
text: Automaton inspectors ensure that the Consulate's stringent standards for mass production are upheld.

name: Skirk Prospector
text: Deep beneath the ruined continent of Otaria, there's a mine where goblins still work, ignorant of the destruction above.

name: A-Vega, the Watcher
text: One eye sees the past, one the present, and one the future—and none can be deceived.

name: Coils of the Medusa
text: Serpentine locks shape ornate rocks.

name: Blazing Hellhound
text: It tears the flesh from your bones and then swallows the ash with its fiery maw.

name: Crovax, Ascendant Hero
text: Crovax was destined for an angel's curse, but one warped timeline saw the noble redeemed.

name: Dread Warlock
text: "I don't know who to pity more: those who flee from my presence or the damned who can withstand it."

name: Pilfered Plans
text: Mirko Vosk hunted anyone with knowledge of the maze, draining the chances of the other guilds.

name: Lava Dart
text:
"Small outbursts are healthy."
—Koth of the Hammer

name: Brink of Madness
text:
"The fools thought me dead. But I built an empire inside my tomb."
—Kerrick, sleeper agent

name: Hero's Downfall
text: Odric resisted the vampire's curse with all his strength. But after a lifetime of fighting monsters, he was doomed to become one himself.

name: Staff of Zegon
text: Though Mishra was impressed by the staves Ashnod had created for Zegon's defense, he understood they only hinted at her full potential.

name: Candlelit Cavalry
text: "On this night, the dark will fear us."

name: Venomous Vines
text:
"True strength comes from within. The false promise of unnatural power only incurs Krosa's wrath."
—Seton, centaur druid

name: Thraben Sentry // Thraben Militia
text: "Looks like it's going to be a quiet night."

name: Goblin Spymaster
text:
"Infiltrate and infuriate!"
—Goblin Espionage League motto

name: Mind Over Matter
text:
Lyna turned to the figure beside her. "They're gone. What now?"
"As ever," said Urza, "we wait."

name: Unnerving Assault
text: The scales of battle rarely balance.

name: Amnesia
text: "When one has witnessed the unspeakable, 'tis sometimes better to forget." —Vervamon the Elder

name: Strategic Planning
text:
"I can offer only information, young one. What path you choose is up to you."
—Jadzi, Oracle of Arcavios

name: Bearer of Memory
text: Members of the Living Historians don't simply chronicle the past; they embody it.

name: Tinker
text: "What separates us from mere beasts is the capacity for self-improvement."

name: War-Spike Changeling
text:
"Aren't there boggarts enough in Lorwyn? Couldn't it turn into a sheep? Or a sunflower?"
—Olly of Goldmeadow

name: Greater Good
text:
"To examine the causes of life, we must first have recourse to death."
—Mary Shelley, *Frankenstein*

name: Foundry of the Consuls
text: All around the foundry, automatons unhitched themselves from their mounts and pivoted to face Chandra.

name: Savannah Lions
text:
"One alone is fearsome; one among many is unstoppable."
—Benalish proverb

name: Mystical Tutor
text:
"To the tutors, a 'poem of sand' was of little account, a 'poem of ivory,' priceless."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Tor Giant
text:
"What do you do then? Run. Run very fast. Don't stop until you see the camp—or a bigger Giant."
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain

name: Compost
text:
A fruit must rot before its seed can sprout.
—Yavimaya saying

name: Sudden Demise
text: In the Skyfang Mountains, one misstep can mean the end of an entire clan.

name: Prowling Nightstalker
text: Silent as a serpent, twisted as a lone bog tree, evil as Tojira's heart.

name: Slobad, Iron Goblin
text: Once he fought to save Mirrodin. Now he fights to remake it.

name: Shatterstorm
text: Chains of leaping fire and sizzling lightning laid waste the artificers' handiwork, sparing not a single device.

name: Hulking Goblin
text: The bigger they are, the harder they avoid work.

name: Vile Consumption
text: The plague moved faster than an army and was far more deadly.

name: Goblin Trenches
text: The ground rose and formed into thousands of tiny warriors. This fight was far from over.

name: Sleight of Hand
text: "Most people believe magic is only a trick. Why change their minds?"

name: Vedalken Orrery
text:
"My observations of the Multiverse are too valuable not to preserve for posterity."
—Dovin Baan

name: Aftershock
text: Deciding the house's ownership through a wizard duel had sounded like a brilliant idea at the time.

name: Neheb, the Eternal
text:
"This is what glory looks like."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Empyrial Plate
text: A body clad in steel reflects a warrior's resolve.

name: Silvanus's Invoker
text: "Arise, friend, and seize the horizon in the name of the Oak Father."

name: Zamriel, Seraph of Steel
text: Armored in courage and armed with searing light, her legion stands unflinching against the forces of darkness.

name: Menagerie Liberator
text: "The wild are neither your thralls nor your amusement."

name: Gruul War Chant
text:
"We are the heart of the wild, the fire in its eyes, and the howl in its throat. Come, join the battle to which you were born."
—Kroshkar, Gruul shaman

name: Swallowing Plague
text:
"We are recalling all forces from the Takenuma Swamp. We lose men daily to kami attacks, and it seems our defeats only encourage them further."
—General Takeno, letter to Lord Konda

name: Dramatic Reversal
text:
"Nobody asked you to butt in, Jace. But thanks."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: King Suleiman
text:
"We made tempestuous winds obedient to Solomon . . . And many of the devils We also made obedient to him."
—The Qur'an, 21:81

name: Teacher's Pet
text: "First attempt: unsuccessful. Instead of an amphibious chicken, hybridization produced an aquaphobic fish."

name: Command Beacon
text:
"I gazed once into that light. Now it burns in my mind, forever denying me rest."
—Riku of Two Reflections

name: Armory of Iroas
text: Each weapon is as unique as the champion who carried it to battle.

name: Feast or Famine
text:
"The living cannot understand the benefits of death."
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn

name: Vastwood Gorger
text:
"I've known true ferocity and power. Those brazen 'planar-walkers' have no idea what wild really means."
—Chadir the Navigator

name: Dauthi Slayer
text:
"A wisp of life remains in the undergloom of Death: a visible form, though no heart beats within it."
—Homer, *The Iliad*, trans. Fitzgerald

name: Sacred Armory
text: Arrive for worship. Leave for war.

name: Volunteer Reserves
text:
"I'm always a little leery of anyone who offers to kill other people for free."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Hero's Downfall
text: Destiny exalts a chosen few, but even heroes break.

name: Zhalfirin Void
text:
"The wind whispers, 'come home,' but I cannot."
—Teferi

name: Swift Justice
text:
"Having conviction is more important than being righteous."
—Aurelia

name: Bountiful Promenade
text: No pilgrimage to Valor's Reach is complete without a stroll through its celebrated shopping district.

name: Demon's Horn
text: Its curve mimics the twists of life and death.

name: Hardy Outlander
text: You're a born explorer, happiest forging your way through the untamed wilds.

name: Leeches
text:
"Where our potions and powders fail, perhaps nature will succeed."
—Reyhan, Samite Alchemist

name: Aquitect's Will
text:
"You may want to hold your breath."
—Kellyg, merrow aquitect

name: Archon of Redemption
text: Until Emeria is freed, he raises his sword in her name.

name: Portal of Sanctuary
text:
"If you need to disappear for a while, I know a place."
—Bilivus, master archivist

name: Sudden Reclamation
text:
"There is no secret buried so deep that we will never find it."
—Kurtar, Sultai necromancer

name: Mortal's Ardor
text:
"Such deeds should be common fare for such as us."
—Anax, king of Akros

name: Stalking Tiger
text: No one is happy when they notice a tiger.

name: Master Transmuter
text: "Wasted potential surrounds us. Lend me that bauble, and let me see what it can be made to be."

name: Blade Sliver
text: After breaking free from the Riptide Project, the slivers quickly adapted to life on Otaria—much to the dismay of life on Otaria.

name: Skeletal Changeling
text: Though they lack true flesh and bone of their own, changelings imitate either with equal ease.

name: Wistful Thinking
text: "To probe the wonders of the multiverse, to gaze upon worlds unspoiled by blade or spell . . . it's enough to make one weep for the possibilities denied."

name: Horned Turtle
text: It doesn't like having visitors . . . unless it's having them for lunch.

name: Galecaster Colossus
text: Ground bones, broken glass, and splintered shipwrecks make up the sands of his shores.

name: Young Wei Recruits
text:
"To send the common people to war untrained is to throw them away."
—Confucius, The Analects (trans. Lau)

name: Debt to the Kami
text: The masters weren't speaking figuratively when they said guilt could be all-consuming.

name: Setessan Griffin
text: Most griffins must be caught and broken into the service of the polis. Not so in Setessa, where they volunteer.

name: Doomed Traveler
text: He vowed he would never rest until he reached his destination. He doesn't know how right he was.

name: Keeper of the Sacred Word
text: This is not a subliminal message.

name: Bird Maiden
text:
"Four things that never meet do here unite
To shed my blood and to ravage my heart,
A radiant brow and tresses that beguile
And rosy cheeks and a glittering smile." —*The Arabian Nights*, trans. Haddawy

name: Shimmer Dragon
text: The indigo dragon gladly traded a bit of its hoard for everlasting moonlight.

name: Myr Retriever
text: Mephidross gives up treasure easily . . . as long as you take its place.

name: Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind
text: As brilliant as a cut diamond, and with just as cruel an edge.

name: Victimize
text:
"Die. But die knowing that your pathetic life will yield a great bounty for me."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

name: Mirror Image
text: The life of a shapeshifter is one of constant change.

name: Fervent Champion
text: 2018 World Champion Javier Dominguez

name: Acolyte of Bahamut
text: You were on a wayward path until Bahamut showed you that power and kindness can unite beneath the same banner.

name: Teferi's Protege
text: Teferi's legacy lives on in Tolaria through the study of time magic and a tradition of irrepressible mischief.

name: Gate to Phyrexia
text:
"The warm rain of grease on my face immediately made it clear I had entered Phyrexia."
—Jarsyl, Diary

name: Lunar Force
text: "Moonlight offers sublime warmth that brings me a comfort sunlight cannot provide."

name: Shivan Dragon
text: While it's true most dragons are cruel, the Shivan dragon seems to take particular glee in the misery of others, often tormenting its victims much like a cat plays with a mouse before delivering the final blow.

name: Storm Shaman
text:
"Embrace the storm. Its voice shall echo within you, and its fire shall become your touch!"
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

name: Woolly Thoctar
text: One of the most ferocious and deadly gargantuans, the thoctar never sees its worshippers, but it often awakens surrounded by gifts and sacrifices.

name: Fade Away
text:
"Consider the fable of the greedy herder. As her flock grew, so did her weariness; she slept, and the sheep wandered off."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Stag Beetle
text: Its voice crackles with the hum of a thousand wings beating at once.

name: Muscle Sliver
text: The air was filled with the cracks and snaps of flesh hardening as the new sliver joined the battle.

name: Kavu Lair
text: As a dark rain of Phyrexians fell from the sky, fountains of kavu erupted from the ground.

name: Battlefield Raptor
text: It wheeled upward, away from the shrieks and thunder. It reached the point where sky met smoke, and, but with a glance at the horizon, aimed itself and dove.

name: Lodestone Myr
text: When necessary, myr can override and control any artificial object, as can their creator.

name: Tooth and Claw
text:
"Don't spend long examining signs of its passage. That you find them at all means it's still close at hand."
—Varra, Warden of the East Road

name: Kalastria Highborn
text: Each of Malakir's great families boasts a contingent of nulls appropriate to its rank in society.

name: Drowned Rusalka
text: Lurking below the current, she thirsts until others come to drink.

name: Thraben Inspector
text: "If you've been at this as long as I have, nothing can surprise you. That's the hope, at least."

name: Zoetic Cavern
text: Nothing lives within it, yet there is life.

name: Agent of Masks
text: "Two-faced" is an understatement.

name: Fumble
text: A moment of distraction, a lifetime of regret.

name: Kavu Climber
text:
The kavu might be above you
—Llanowar expression meaning "keep an open mind"

name: Rusted Sentinel
text: It has to deliberate a moment on the best way to break your face.

name: Elusive Spellfist
text:
"Learn to see an obstacle from a new perspective. Underneath, for example."
—Chanyi, Ojutai monk

name: Caught in the Brights
text: While hunting aether, a gremlin may ignore other stimuli, including threats to its own life.

name: Outbreak
text: This plague chooses its victims.

name: Deadly Tempest
text: When the winds blow out of the abyss, death is the only harvest.

name: Confiscate
text:
"It is better to take what does not belong to you than to let it lie around neglected."
—Mark Twain, *More Maxims of Mark*

name: Cult Conscript
text: His eternal rest turned out to be more of a quick nap.

name: Horizon Seeker
text: "A five-day climb? Ha! I'll do it in two."

name: Nest Invader
text: It nurtures its masters' glorious future.

name: Inspired Charge
text:
"Impossible! How could they overwhelm us? We had barricades, war elephants,... and they were barely a tenth of our number!"
—General Avitora

name: Congregate
text:
"In the gathering there is strength for all who founder, renewal for all who languish, love for all who sing."
—*Song of All*, canto 642

name: Enlisted Wurm
text: A match for any army—even its own.

name: Cartel Aristocrat
text: "Your life serves a higher purpose now: ensuring the continuation of my own."

name: Dissipate
text:
"This abomination never belonged in our world. I'm merely setting it free."
—Dierk, geistmage

name: Rot Shambler
text:
"If I die, feed me to a shambler. At least that way I'll be doing some good."
—Ryza, Oran-Rief scout

name: Living Terrain
text: Some warriors walk the earth. Others are born of it.

name: Siren's Ruse
text: Deception and misdirection are the heart of the pirate's arsenal.

name: Ill-Tempered Cyclops
text: A cyclops has two moods: angry and asleep.

name: Cunning Sparkmage
text: "I see the weaknesses you hide even from yourself."

name: Ezuri, Stalker of Spheres
text: Who is an enemy but a friend who has yet to accept perfection?

name: Nyxborn Eidolon
text: A body Returned, a soul still lost.

name: Harvest Pyre
text: Corpses destroyed by fire form the most destructive geists.

name: Douse in Gloom
text: The Mardu warrior was overjoyed when Tasigur set him free and granted him passage through the jungle. He failed to notice the Sultai leader's cruel smile.

name: Controlled Instincts
text: Togk Manytooth struggled helplessly as the kathari circled above him. For a warrior, immobilization is a fate worse than death.

name: Siege Rhino
text: The mere approach of an Abzan war beast is enough to send enemies fleeing in panic.

name: Tajuru Stalwart
text: "In its time of hardship, all of Zendikar cries out in pain. Are you listening?"

name: Thorn Thallid
text:
"I don't know which is worse, getting hit with those darts or having to watch them grow back."
—Orcish Soldier

name: Teferi's Imp
text: Made you look.

name: Marchesa's Infiltrator
text: "Secrets, like coins, are easy to steal."

name: Mark of the Vampire
text:
"My 'condition' is a trial. The weak are consumed by it. The strong transcend it."
—Sorin Markov

name: Delver of Secrets // Insectile Aberration
text:
"Unfortunately, all my test animals have died or escaped, so I shall be the final subject. I feel no fear. This is a momentous night."
—Laboratory notes, final entry

name: Steelfin Whale
text: It feeds on metal filings suspended in the water, sieving flecks of precious ore through magnetic baleen.

name: Primeval Light
text:
"Look to the old tomes, those bound in hides and written in yarberry ink. They hold the spells that can free us of the clutter of modern magecraft."
—Dravash, dowsing shaman

name: Synchronous Sliver
text:
"With a twitch of its muscles, its timeline forks. Then, just as quickly, its two selves reintegrate. Causality, strangely, seems not to mind."
—Rukarumel, field journal

name: Shalai and Hallar
text: Between the angel's blade and the elf's bow, few Phyrexians made it as far as Llanowar's canopy.

name: Victory's Envoy
text: Her paean is the clash of spears, her prayer a battle cry.

name: Prowling Serpopard
text: The viziers serving Rhonas, the god of strength, maintain the menagerie of animals employed during his trial.

name: Acidic Soil
text: Phyrexia had tried to take Urza's soul. He was relieved that Shiv tried to claim only his soles.

name: Tenth District Guard
text: "The Tenth has always been my home. This city is constantly embroiled in one crisis or another, but I'm determined to protect my piece."

name: Obelisk of Grixis
text: Like most features of Grixis, the obelisks that remain from the time of Alara now exist only for dark exploitation.

name: Skulking Fugitive
text: In the Cateran guild, being caught is a capital offense.

name: Silverstrike
text:
"Shield yourself with faith. Arm yourself with silver."
—Slayer Kastinne

name: Pathrazer of Ulamog
text: No thought but hunger. No strategy but destruction.

name: Prosperous Partnership
text: Partners in love, partners in life, and partners in crime.

name: Grizzled Angler // Grisly Anglerfish
text: "There's no question that these waters are treacherous, but if there's one thing I've learned in all my years of sailing . . ."

name: Arborback Stomper
text: The power of aether draws creatures to it like a magnetic force, and those that are touched by it are forever altered.

name: Borderland Minotaur
text:
"You have led us to triumph over the forces of Mogis!" said Brygus the Brave, clapping the Champion on the back. The Champion wiped the sweat and blood from her brow. "I count eight graves," she said. "Too many to call this a victory."
—*The Theriad*

name: Herald of the Fair
text: "Welcome, one and all! Right this way! Open your eyes, your ears, and your imaginations to the wonders of the Inventors' Fair!"

name: Marrow Bats
text:
"No matter how far we push into Stensia, undeath will always remain in these lands."
—Terhold, archmage of Drunau

name: Resolute Watchdog
text: A friend in good times, a guardian in bad times, and a savior when all else fails.

name: Mire Boa
text: Mire slime courses through its veins in place of blood. No sooner does it bleed than it opens its mouth to replace the loss.

name: You See a Pair of Goblins
text:
"I have the shot. Shall I take it?"
—Varis, Silverymoon ranger

name: Swathcutter Giant
text:
"Now do you understand what we meant when we said *disperse*?"
—Eksari, Boros patrol leader

name: Magus of the Wheel
text: "You could win a pointy stick! Or a drippy eyeball. Or a little triangle froggy thing. Or some wavy lines . . . ."

name: Crown of Ascension
text: "Wisdom, clear my eyes."

name: Levitation
text: "Why fight over scraps of land when there's so much sky waiting to be claimed?"

name: Kick in the Door
text:
"We tried your way. Now we do it my way!"
—Jym, barbarian of Baldur's Gate

name: Enhanced Surveillance
text:
"Who are the agents of the Dimir? No one and everyone."
—Lazav

name: Femeref Archers
text:
"Bet you can't put it through the eye."
"Left or right?"

name: Aetherspouts
text:
"Don't worry, there's plenty for everyone."
—Vickon, Eleventh Company battlemage

name: Mark of Asylum
text: A paragon of honor, Galo Aher fell to a blast of fire. The Order of the White Orchid was so saddened that they forged a new sigil in his likeness.

name: Goblin Archaeologist
text: Always easily impressed, Durg was about to be blown away.

name: Inquisition of Kozilek
text: You have been found wanting, though not for much longer.

name: Favor of Jukai
text: The land chooses its own champions.

name: Pinnacle of Rage
text: Mount Sulano erupted not in magma but in anger.

name: Netter en-Dal
text: The wizard's vocabulary of mogg profanities increased with every net she cast.

name: Charging Paladin
text: "Hope shall be the blade that severs our bonds."

name: Renegade Wheelsmith
text: Many veterans of the Ovalchase racetrack turned their talents to the renegade cause.

name: Underrealm Lich
text: "You've strayed, overworlder."

name: Eyes of the Beholder
text: In the end, there was nothing beautiful to be seen.

name: Ghastly Gloomhunter
text: Stinking, silent death.

name: Assassin's Strike
text: When Selesnya missionaries moved into the Shanav Quarter, they faced scorn, ridicule, and ultimately martyrdom.

name: Gahiji, Honored One
text: He can stir the gentlest spirit to wild ferocity.

name: Wolfir Avenger
text: Released from a dark curse and bound to a higher calling.

name: Hearthcage Giant
text: The flamekin are mere kindling for his warmth.

name: Doom Blade
text: The void is without substance but cuts like steel.

name: Swiftwater Cliffs
text: In its attempts to mirror Tzeentch's convoluted scheming, the Crystal Labyrinth constantly shifts and rearranges itself.

name: Blood of the Martyr
text: The willow knows what the storm does not: that the power to endure harm outlives the power to inflict it.

name: Bonecrusher Giant // Stomp
text: Not every tale ends in glory.

name: Leech Bonder
text: Some don't know his face, but his pets are a dead giveaway.

name: Swamp
text: At the mouth of the sewer pipe, you realize it's massive enough that even a giant could walk through without stooping. That gives you an idea . . .

name: Mind Rot
text:
"What a pity. You should have written it down."
—Liliana Vess

name: Persistent Specimen
text:
"The jaw bone's connected to the skull bone. The skull bone's connected to the . . . uh . . . hook thingy."
—Garl, sticher's assistant

name: Kederekt Parasite
text: When the smell of passing thoughts piques its hunger, its maw becomes primed with acid and a taste for brains.

name: Metathran Elite
text: If the eyes are windows to the soul, their souls are not of this world.

name: Lantern Bearer // Lanterns' Lift
text: Val didn't know what the silent geist was offering . . .

name: Urza's Engine
text:
"Humans and machines working together can be fearsome indeed!"
—Arcum Dagsson

name: Thraben Standard Bearer
text: The uncorrupted rallied under Thalia's leadership and Sigarda's banner.

name: Infectious Horror
text: Not once in the history of Grixis has anyone died of old age.

name: Empyrean Eagle
text: All the birds of the skies are the spirit's brood, gathered for safety under its wings.

name: Drakuseth, Maw of Flames
text:
"Spread out, you idiots! Spread out!"
—Marsden, party leader, last words

name: Homing Lightning
text:
"I see countless worlds. What makes them think I can't find them in just one?"
—Ral Zarek

name: Dread Linnorm // Scale Deflection
text: A serpent's cruelty, a dragon's appetite.

name: Ageless Guardian
text: Ancient ruins dot the world of Arcavios, most older than Strixhaven itself and many still guarded by soldiers from the Blood Age, centuries after their deaths.

name: Font of Agonies
text:
"No worthwhile reward is easily gained."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Hearth Kami
text:
"Every treachery, great or small, begets a spirit that rages at the injustice. Given the opportunity, each will return that treachery to its owner tenfold."
—Sensei Hisoka

name: Squee, Goblin Nabob
text: "General?!" Tahngarth roared. "General *nuisance*, maybe."

name: Harbor Guardian
text:
"Our guardian levies a tax on all traders. Wise travelers pay with a minimum of fuss."
—Qhattib, Vizier of Amiqat

name: Hellfire
text: "High on a throne of royal state . . . insatiate to pursue vain war with heav'n." —John Milton, *Paradise Lost*

name: Throatseeker
text:
"I just felt a drip. It must be about to rain."
—Stoneway Market vendor, last words

name: Relic Robber
text: "Here, you take it!"

name: Mana Reflection
text: The greatest wonders of nature are found in the smallest saplings straining toward the canopy.

name: Vulshok Sorcerer
text: Vulshok sorcerers train by leaping into electrified storm clouds. Dead or alive, they come back down with smiles on their faces.

name: Mox Emerald
text: 2009 Vintage Championship Winner

name: Scion of the Wild
text: It has a hundred thousand extinctions to avenge.

name: Defenestrate
text: The chaplain would perhaps have found some small comfort had he known that the replacement window would be named in his honor.

name: Boomerang
text:
"O! call back yesterday, bid time return."
—William Shakespeare, King Richard the Second

name: Wicker Witch
text: When there were no more crows to scare, it focused its efforts elsewhere.

name: Cleric of Life's Bond
text: "No gods. Only each other."

name: Stonewise Fortifier
text: Ephara taught some mortals to feel every vein in marble as though it flows with their own blood.

name: Anaba Spirit Crafter
text:
"The Spirit Crafters sing of all our people. They sing of those lost, of those found, and of those who are yet to be."
—Onatah, Anaba Shaman

name: War Behemoth
text:
"The Houses always hope for peace, but we always pack for war."
—Gvar Barzeel, krumar commander

name: Gorilla Shaman
text:
"Frankly, destruction is best left to professionals."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Reality Anchor
text:
"See how you like it."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Sagu Mauler
text: The Sagu Jungle's thick undergrowth conceals even the largest predators—if they wish to remain hidden.

name: Invincible Hymn
text: Bantians believe those who are born into the highest caste and live a life of discipline and virtue can ascend to become angels.

name: Ulvenwald Observer
text:
"I tell you, the trees were closing in! It's by the grace of the Heron alone that I made it out of the Ulvenwald!"
—Ricton, traveling merchant

name: Beloved Beggar // Generous Soul
text: Charity is rare on Innistrad, but kindness is always repaid.

name: Firewake Sliver
text:
"They are here, and they are hungry. And what they do not eat, they burn. Yavimaya is lost. We must leave now for Skyshroud."
—Edahlis, greenseeker

name: Boggart Birth Rite
text: Auntie excitedly held up the squalling newborn. "This one looks like Byoog! Maybe he'll tell us what he saw and felt in the beyond."

name: Doomed Dissenter
text: There is only one fate left to those banished from the God-Pharaoh's city.

name: Drudge Reavers
text:
"The surface of the land is blanched with salt, but the soil beneath is reddened with death—a fertile ground for necromancy."
—Lim-Dûl the Necromancer

name: Fencer's Magemark
text:
"The first blow is the most important. It often negates the need for a second."
—Agrus Kos

name: Werebear
text: To become is to understand.

name: Solemn Recruit
text: "I can no longer sit in my workshop and ignore the events outside. My hammers strike for the people of Ghirapur."

name: Oran-Rief Survivalist
text: "I'm strong enough to survive alone. I'm smart enough to want companions at my side."

name: Lure
text: Jukai Forest was known for its secrets, which drew in many wayfarers and wizards. But it was those same secrets that kept most of those seekers from ever being heard from again.

name: Falkenrath Marauders
text: No slinking in the dark for them, no luring whispers. They claim their prey in the speed and glory of the hunt.

name: Desecration Elemental
text: Its precious corpses dance like puppets to attract mindless nim prey.

name: Chicken Egg
text:
"That's a lotta nuggets."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Force of Will
text: "Your artillery will burn itself out before I allow my focus to waver."

name: Ezuri, Stalker of Spheres
text: "Ah, my old friends. Have you decided at last to stop clinging to the past and join me in the grand pursuit of perfection?"

name: Morphic Pool
text: No one really knows how deep the waters go beneath the Undercity, nor what amorphous horrors lurk within.

name: Ice Cave
text: Even the oppressive cold of the cave could not temper Eladamri's ire.

name: Scald
text:
"Shiv may be surrounded by water, but the mountains go far deeper."
—Fire Eye, viashino bey

name: Chronic Flooding
text: With the Izzet occupied elsewhere, many of their public works fell into disrepair.

name: Hero's Blade
text: The best swords are forged with dragonfire.

name: Grim Lavamancer
text: "Fools dig for water, corpses, or gold. The earth's real treasure is far deeper."

name: Ertai
text: After serving his apprenticeship under Barrin of Tolaria, Ertai graced the *Weatherlight* crew with his presence as the ship's "resident" wizard. He realizes that few recognize his greatness—but then how could they, when they lack his insight and wisdom?

name: Foundry Screecher
text:
"My creations still can't match the dive speed of those floppy-winged mammals. Maybe I should enter one of them in the Fair."
—Viprikti, thopterist

name: Pooling Venom
text: The land can only hold so much poison before it begins to bite back.

name: Herald of the Dreadhorde
text: Amonkhet's dead flowed into a new world in service to their God-Pharaoh.

name: Rakdos Locket
text:
"This trinket will gain you admittance to some painfully exclusive gatherings."
—Exava, blood witch

name: Regeneration
text:
"Why should death always have the last word?"
—Llanowar druid

name: Ghostly Sentinel
text: Mystics of the Stone Havens call upon the spirits of fallen heroes to defend the refuges.

name: Gilded Light
text: "Whoever survives the first blow lives to land the second."

name: Vectis Agents
text: With their life energy suppressed under their etherium enhancements, thieves from Esper found it surprisingly easy to explore the ruins of Grixis.

name: Benalish Knight
text:
"We called them 'armored lightning.'"
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Ovinize
text: The crocodile's failed attack left it feeling both hungry and sheepish

name: Leatherback Baloth
text: Heavy enough to withstand the Roil, leatherback skeletons are havens for travelers in storms and landshifts.

name: Giant Growth
text:
"Imagine being scared of pixies. Just smoosh them under your boot!"
—Kerish, Urzan mechanist

name: Folk of An-Havva
text:
"This town's only for good folk. The rest can go to the city."
—Joskun, An-Havva Constable

name: Nantuko Elder
text:
Plant a field with wishes, and you will grow more wishes.
—Nantuko teaching

name: Conifer Strider
text: Atarka's presence thaws the glaciers of Qal Sisma, forcing its elementals to migrate or adapt.

name: Role Reversal
text: Uthlon the Wise scandalized sphinx society, hooting the answers to riddles as he rampaged through Tin Street. Grangle, on the other hand, sat for hours, deep in thought, largely ignored by fellow goblins.

name: Rage Nimbus
text: The settlement knew there was something strange about the cloud when the old priest Mandli suddenly grabbed an axe and ran screaming into the hills.

name: Remodel
text:
6 PM (23) This Old Grove 98055
A rusted masticore makes a beautiful addition to any garden.

name: Walking Corpse
text:
"What does it mean when the dead feed on the dead? When no new life emerges, but only more death? Is it not an endless spiral into annihilation?"
—Jeddeg, philosopher of graves

name: Sky Swallower
text: Would you trade the world for such a pet?

name: Bitter Reunion
text: The peace summit proved the grudge between Urza and Mishra could end only in blood.

name: Merfolk Seer
text:
The sea leaves no room for tears.
—Zhalfirin adage

name: Hymn of the Wilds
text: Many attempt to speak with nature. Selvala speaks less, and nature answers more.

name: Yore-Tiller Nephilim
text: When it awoke, the worms of the earth hissed in a chorus of beckoning.

name: Duress
text: "Your nightmares inspire me, Dack."

name: Skygames
text: Both Boros and Azorius scout the games in hopes of recruiting the finest athletes.

name: Gorgon's Head
text:
"You slew the gorgon? Show me."
—King Igalus, last words

name: Planar Overlay
text: The Phyrexians don't want to conquer Dominaria. They want to remake it.

name: Omen of the Forge
text: "My time will come, when all the world will be reforged in the fires of my invention."

name: Infest
text:
"It is from Phage that this evil springs, and to her it shall return."
—Akroma, angelic avenger

name: Illusion of Choice
text:
"Please vote with a clear head and vigilant heart, knowing each voice is meaningful regardless of the outcome."
—Ottavio d'Oro, Electoral Committee Speaker of Paliano

name: Surge of Righteousness
text: Though she stood alone, she struck with the force of an army.

name: Beast in Show
text: "We've not seen one of these on the podium for many seasons. Such magnificent posture and the perfect amount of telltale odor."

name: Guildsworn Prowler
text: "Of course it's part of my plan. Who do you think started the bar fight?"

name: Hero's Downfall
text: "This is the end... for all of you!"

name: Kjeldoran Dead
text:
"They shall kill those whom once they loved."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Purge
text: For the first and last time, the horrific creature experienced terror.

name: Temporal Eddy
text: As the temporal fractures spread and time itself slowly fell apart, visitors started to appear from across the past and future, and those native to the present began to disappear.

name: Angel of Finality
text: "Better the dead depart utterly than be enslaved."

name: Scorch Spitter
text:
"Yes, she can be a nuisance. But at least my tea never gets cold."
—Marlan Farthwald, innkeeper

name: Smite the Monstrous
text: After watching the kor in battle, Gideon understood the difference between working together and working as one.

name: Proper Burial
text: Properly honored dead gain the peace of the grave and freedom from the call of the Ghost Quarter.

name: Vivid Flying Fish
text: The rainbow seen above the Great Lake of Cloud Dream just after the rain is nothing but the vivid-colored flying fishes' ritual dance.

name: Dogged Pursuit
text: Kaya had stalked countless horrific foes, but never one that killed with such callous precision and twisted creativity.

name: Hydroblast
text:
"Heed the lessons of our time: the forms of water may move the land itself and hold captive the fires within."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran royal mage

name: Living Terrain
text: Keldons were accustomed to rugged terrain, but they never expected it to be aggressive.

name: Paladin en-Vec
text: "I do not consider myself a hero. I know only what the Vec teach: justice must always be served and corruption must always be opposed."

name: Cram Session
text: The only thing more delicious than a top grade is Gyome's signature cake.

name: Dryad Greenseeker
text: "The land already knows its destiny. I simply ask it to share the tale with me."

name: Phyrexian Gargantua
text:
"Of course I'd rather it hadn't skinned six of my best wizards, but as nightmare fuel goes, it's a truly inspired design."
—Braids

name: Runeclaw Bear
text: The magic of the elves leaves its mark on the forest. The magic of the forest leaves its mark on the animals who live there. The animals of the forest leave their mark on all who trespass.

name: Final Reward
text: Those who earn a glorious death are given the highest honor. They are carried on funeral barges through the gate to the afterlife.

name: Presence of the Wise
text: "Humbly I bow. Silently I wait. Deeply I listen."

name: Ertai's Scorn
text: "You're not so special, Karn. Anything that has been assembled can be disassembled."

name: Jund Battlemage
text: "Of your blood I will make my mead, an offering to the thirsty jungle."

name: Roil's Retribution
text:
"We can use their hunger to lead them into danger. If we're already prey, we may as well be bait!"
—Yon Basrel, Oran-Rief survivalist

name: Tower of the Magistrate
text: Like the city, weakest at its foundation.

name: Havengul Runebinder
text: "So many corpses, so little time."

name: Ordruun Veteran
text: "My father was Gruul, but I chose the precision of the legion over the fury of the pack."

name: Long-Term Plans
text: "Wait, it'll come to me in a minute."

name: Armageddon
text: A bloody dawn broke over a scabbed and tortured world.

name: Soul Warden
text: "One does not question the size or shape of the grains of sand in an hourglass. Nor do I question the temperament of the souls under my guidance."

name: Vagrant Plowbeasts
text: Plowbeasts of Naya escaped their harnesses in droves, content to snack on the conveniently cultivated fields of Eos and Valeron.

name: Carrion Ants
text: "War is no picnic," my father liked to say. But the Ants seemed to disagree.

name: Phyrexian Altar
text: Offerings must first be freed from the prison of their own skin before they're welcomed into the Flesh Singularity.

name: Voyager Staff
text: Voyager staffs are sought by those hoping to find an escape from the sprawling glut of Ravnica.

name: Ihsan's Shade
text:
"Ihsan, the weak. Ihsan, the fallen. Ihsan, the betrayer. He has brought shame to the Serra Paladins where none existed before. May his suffering equal his betrayal."
—Baris, Serra Inquisitor

name: Jungle Barrier
text: A massive pull of mana caused all of Dominaria to pause —Multani had transplanted Yavimaya to Urborg's edge.

name: Blood-Chin Rager
text: Kolaghan blades rarely stay clean for long.

name: Dust to Dust
text:
"All this nonsense made by mages
Rusts and crumbles through the ages."
—Aline Corralurn, "Inheritance"

name: Labyrinth of Skophos
text: For centuries, the minotaur polis of Skophos was unknown to humans. It remains unexplored.

name: Key to the City
text:
"Presented to the Chief Artificer in recognition of his unparalleled service to Yoria."
—Rusted plaque

name: Ball Lightning
text:
"Life, struck sharp on death, Makes awful lightning."
—Elizabeth Barrett Browning,
"Aurora Leigh"

name: Slash Panther
text: It runs an endless circuit along the ruined roads of the soon-to-be-forgotten Mirran civilization.

name: Loxodon Warhammer
text: The relics of the God-King are many, but no other inspires as much awe in his faithful or dread in his foes.

name: Dragonmaster Outcast
text: "Cast out by my tribe, I am a pariah trapped in this mammal's carcass. Only my true kin hear my cries."

name: Harmonious Archon
text: First among equals.

name: Obliterating Bolt
text: In desperation, Pero called on his memory of a lightning storm that nearly killed his family. When he opened his eyes, only smoke and dust remained.

name: Watchers of the Dead
text: They are tasked with protecting the entrance to the embalming chambers.

name: Crypt Rats
text:
"Once I dreamt of death, but now it dreams of me / And only rats and rotting flesh can hear my silent plea."
—Mundungu chant

name: Burning Fields
text:
"In raiding and plundering, be like fire, in immovability like a mountain."
—Sun Tzu, *Art of War* (trans. Giles)

name: Inundate
text: "For years, the landfolk have emptied their refuse into the waters. It's time to return the favor."

name: Uncle Istvan
text: Solitude drove the old hermit insane. Now he only keeps company with those he can catch.

name: Hunt the Hunter
text:
"A grudge is a tattoo worn on the inside."
—Setessan warrior saying

name: Aeronaut's Wings
text: Volunteers rarely questioned why the airborne battalion always seemed to be recruiting.

name: Boon of Safety
text:
"Saving a stranger's life is an excellent recruitment method. Luckily, peril is so easy to come by."
—Falco Spara

name: Treasure Cruise
text: Countless delights drift on the surface while dark schemes run below.

name: Echoing Calm
text: A single light unleashes a hail of cleansing.

name: Arcane Encyclopedia
text: Knowledge itself is neither good nor evil. Just as the wrong book in the wrong hands could doom all existence, the same book in the right hands could save it.

name: Hieromancer's Cage
text: Law protects but also contains.

name: Sorin's Thirst
text:
"I see you're out of the wall."
—Nahiri

name: Bursting Beebles
text: Like thousands of others, the beebles quit Magic for several years following the release of the *Mercadian Masques* set.

name: Relic Axe
text: "It's light as a feather, but it hits with the force of a boulder. A very sharp boulder."

name: Silhana Ledgewalker
text: Street folk call them "spire mice," but behind the mockery is an unspoken envy of the ledgewalkers' skill at avoiding harm.

name: Engulf the Shore
text:
"The tides have begun to ignore the moon."
—Tamiyo's journal

name: 1996 World Champion
text: It takes great sacrifice to make it to the top.

name: Doomed Artisan
text: "Remember me not as I am, but as I should have been."

name: Selfless Glyphweaver // Deadly Vanity
text: She cast a spell to purge all weakness. When the ink cleared, she stood alone.

name: Hero of Leina Tower
text: "You cannot achieve greatness if its seed has not already been planted in your heart."

name: Slab Hammer
text: Neither subtle nor pretty.

name: Liberated Dwarf
text: Freed from their chains, these dwarves are bound only by honor.

name: Maniacal Rage
text: Only by sacrificing any semblance of defense could Gerrard best Greven.

name: Lava Coil
text:
「司令官、ディミーアのスパイを捕らえ、その遺灰を監禁しました。」
――ウォジェクの警備兵、クラム

name: Merfolk Observer
text: "The structure gets bigger every hour, with hedrons coalescing even deep under the surface. If I could only get inside . . . ."

name: Curse of Bloodletting
text: It is the demon's mark, an infernal claim on the flesh of the guilty.

name: Ulamog's Crusher
text:
"Ulamog is dead, and his brood is dying. Some of them just don't know it yet."
—Nirthu, lone missionary

name: Defang
text: Once vampires are disarmed, they're given wooden swords and forced to assist in the training of Midnight Duelists.

name: Eyes in the Skies
text:
"What root and branch cannot reach, our winged friends will attend to."
—Zunak, Selesnya strategist

name: Stabbing Pain
text:
"You can take the fight out of nearly any creature if you know where its soft spot is."
—Guttor, flesh-warper

name: Ghoulcaller's Bell
text: The bell's chime heralds the rise of the unhallowed from the grave and the fall of their victims into the earth.

name: Pierce the Sky
text: Llanowar elves conceal their ballistae in the upper canopy of the forest, ready to clear the skies of any intruder.

name: Elvish Promenade
text: The faultless and immaculate castes form the lower tiers of elvish society, with the exquisite caste above them. At the pinnacle is the perfect, a consummate blend of aristocrat and predator.

name: Frenzied Goblin
text: The upside to not thinking about the consequences is that you'll always surprise those who do.

name: Lead Astray
text:
"Never underestimate our enemy's strength, brutality, . . . or stupidity."
—Commander Eesha

name: Hackrobat
text: "They all want to see me fall."

name: Goblin War Drums
text: The goblin idea of music is to hit something with a stick.

name: Tolaria
text: "Fairest Isle, all isles excelling,/ Seat of Pleasures, and of loves . . ." —John Dryden

name: Treasure Hunter
text: "The treasures of the ancients belong in museums, not in the grubby hands of grave robbers."

name: Gaea's Herald
text: The elves' battle cries cut paths through the Æther, guiding those who would stand in Gaea's defense.

name: Rock Star
text: Born to, and of, rock.

name: Toshiro Umezawa
text: Though only looking out for himself, Toshiro ended up saving all of Kamigawa.

name: Heightened Awareness
text:
"It startles me how alive one feels on the edge of death."
—Barrin, master wizard

name: Ezuri's Brigade
text: Riding ravenous, ever-growing vorracs is almost as dangerous as fitting them with saddles.

name: Severed Legion
text: No one in Aphetto answers a knock at the door after sundown.

name: Mizzium Meddler
text: Energy surges in Izzet labs are opportunities for experimentation.

name: Circle of Dreams Druid
text: The realms protected by druids of the Circle of Dreams are gleaming, fruitful places, where dream and reality blur together and the weary can find rest.

name: Wipe Away
text: An eyeblink later, all that remained of the tree-beast was the breeze of its momentum.

name: Serra's Sanctum
text: A fragile cocoon of dreaming will.

name: Sly Spy
text: The Agents of S.N.E.A.K.—Sinister Nerds Eliminating All Knowledge.

name: Caustic Rain
text:
"Looking out the great windows of Vitu-Ghazi at the foundry stacks belching their smoke to the sky, I wonder when the sky will take its vengeance."
—Heruj, Selesnya initiate

name: Infiltrate
text: Getting in was the easy part. Getting out proved to be more difficult.

name: Ghitu Slinger
text: If you survive a slinger attack, the slinger wished you to live.

name: Stormrider Spirit
text: Thunder isn't all that follows lightning.

name: Well of Lost Dreams
text:
"A wish can be controlled. Dreams are for more chaotic, and ungoverned by rationale."
—*Hurkyl's Metaphysics, vol. II*

name: Undead Augur
text:
"To see past the veil of death, cross it."
—The Red Book of Mezdrithalik

name: Rhox Faithmender
text: Rhoxes who live long enough to retire from war lend support with their extensive knowledge of combat injuries.

name: Anger of the Gods
text: Hazoret's disappointment at initiates who fail their final trials can manifest in terrible ways.

name: Akki Blizzard-Herder
text:
"It remains unclear whether the akki shamans could in fact create storms or simply predicted them."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Spark Trooper
text: Izzet-designed conductors atop Sunhome charge empty sets of armor that give form to the fluctuating elementals.

name: Jolrael's Favor
text:
"War destroys; nature renews."
—Jolrael, empress of beasts

name: Glacial Fortress
text: Ships blown north in their voyage across the Stormwreck Sea become trapped in the unmelting ice.

name: Nature's Revolt
text: The land rises up to defend against those who would spoil its beauty.

name: Laccolith Titan
text: Proximity guarantees injury or death.

name: Curious Homunculus // Voracious Reader
text: Good books make you savor each word.

name: Chieftain en-Dal
text: The clearest commands are practical examples.

name: Soulquake
text: The Maelstrom sent a wave of raw mana through the battlefield, carrying off the fighting and fallen alike.

name: Vampire Sovereign
text:
"Your service shall be rewarded."
—Queen Lian

name: Signal the Clans
text: Gruul clanfolk obey few rules, but all feel bound to answer the call of the horn.

name: Blood Money
text: For the patriar class, wealth is in the blood.

name: Reality Heist
text: Kaito grabbed the chip, hoping it held answers.

name: Lightning Bolt
text: The sparkmage shrieked, calling on the rage of the storms of his youth. To his surprise, the sky responded with a fierce energy he'd never thought to see again.

name: Twisted Experiment
text: After six days in the hands of the Gixians, what remained was utterly unrecognizable as the person it once was.

name: Fortune's Favor
text: Uncertainty has its own allure.

name: Lord of Atlantis
text: A master of tactics, the lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

name: Curse of Bounty
text: Flavorful aromas beckon many a salivating maw.

name: Confiscation Coup
text: "Citizens, do not resist. This is for your safety. Tezzeret bids you to surrender your inventions. Now."

name: Phyrexian War Beast
text:
"Knowing its origins, how could they have thought they could control it?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Nausea
text: "Was it something I said?"

name: Sidisi's Pet
text: The Sultai distinguish between pet and slave by the material of the chain.

name: Humble
text: Through failure we learn our finest lessons in humility.

name: Whirlwind Denial
text:
「彼らがあなたの宮殿を荒らそうとするなら、あなたが嵐にならなければなりません。」
—-帝国魔術の手引き

name: Turn the Tables
text: "Your arrogance is my best weapon."

name: Sea Spirit
text:
"It rose above our heads, above the ship, and still higher yet. No foggy, ice-laden sea in the world could frighten me more."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Generous Gift
text: The best presents are impossible to regift.

name: Tower of Fortunes
text: The ur-golem etchings begin by celebrating Mirrodin's creator, a golem of almost limitless power. They end by cursing its protector, a being called Memnarch.

name: Font of Fortunes
text: Drink deep, and your thoughts will flow freely.

name: Barrage of Expendables
text: Goblin generals don't distinguish between troops and ammunition.

name: Unspeakable Symbol
text: The symbols are spread throughout Aphetto, marking sites where minions of the Raven Guild and the Cabal can seek refuge.

name: Whirlwind of Thought
text: As Narset struggled to meditate, tiny dragonlings spiraled around her, conjuring thoughts of ancient clans.

name: Goblin Roughrider
text: Astride the bucking creature, Gribble hurtled down the mountainside while his Grotag brethren cheered. It was at that moment that legend of the Skrill Tamer was born.

name: Pendrell Mists
text: As insubstantial—and as insistent—as appetite.

name: Gorilla Chieftain
text:
"In the soil of leadership sprout the seeds of immortality."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper

name: Charge
text:
"Honor rides before us. All we have to do is catch up."
—Danitha Capashen

name: Yasharn, Implacable Earth
text: In its hoofprints, barren dust becomes fertile ground.

name: Balshan Collaborator
text:
"Power, gold, crackers—every bird has its price."
—Chainer, dementia master

name: Groffskithur
text: It growls not to threaten, but to summon.

name: Cruel Grimnarch
text: The gospel of lies sounds sweetest when whispered by many mouths.

name: Firja, Judge of Valor
text: She is both shepherd and reaper, and her judgment is final.

name: Illustrious Historian
text: The most distinguished Lorehold professors are eligible to receive extended tenure, even beyond the limits of their own mortality.

name: Merfolk Mesmerist
text: www.MagicTheGathering.com

name: Springbloom Druid
text: "New growth applies a healing poultice to wounds long scabbed over."

name: Propaganda // Propaganda
text:
"Why rebel? The system can be changed from within."
—Dolorus, magister equitum

name: Wojek Apothecary
text: "A few arrows aren't enough to pierce your faith, soldier. You'll be back on the battlefield by sun's dawn."

name: Enraged Killbot
text: "click . . . whirrrr . . . beep . . . click!"

name: A-Psionic Snoop
text: She knows your next move before you do.

name: Exert Influence
text: "I can't control its mind—I'm not even sure it has one. But I can dominate its will."

name: Spectator Seating
text: The loudest and most heartfelt cheers come from the cheap seats.

name: Drinker of Sorrow
text: It strikes at your soul, heedless of your prayers.

name: Scour from Existence
text:
"Our people and our very lands disappear as if they never were. We no longer fight for glory, or honor. We battle now for the right to exist."
—General Tazri, allied commander

name: Blessed Reversal
text: Even an enemy is a valuable resource.

name: Cunning
text:
". . . Dry-walkers die
We feed on sweet flesh . . . ."
—*Rootwater Saga*

name: Advanced Hoverguard
text:
"They are like their vedalken masters: untouchable, aloof, and omnipresent."
—Bruenna, Neurok leader

name: Horizon Canopy
text: The day is born within its branches.

name: King's Assassin
text: Fear is as effective a weapon as the blade.

name: Patient Rebuilding
text: Nicol Bolas would not rest until he was restored to his former glory.

name: Glint-Sleeve Artisan
text: "Shine bright, bolts tight."

name: Ancient Carp
text:
"Why eat now what could one day grow into a feast?"
—Ojutai, translated from Draconic

name: Vindictive Lich
text: Its essence divided into three curses.

name: Wilt
text: Nothing returns from the nightmare nests of Indatha unscathed.

name: Mausoleum Guard
text: "Ghoulcallers trying to get in, geists trying to get out . . . . This duty is never dull."

name: Disciple of the Sun
text: Heart of a titan, faith as bright as the dawn.

name: Collective Unconscious
text: "The beasts of the wild are my senses. It is through their eyes that all knowledge shall come to me."

name: Assembly-Worker
text: With their factories long destroyed, some of Mishra's creations still toil in remote areas, endlessly performing and reperforming their last orders.

name: Disperse
