text: Most casualties of the power struggle between vedalken and Neurok didn't die on the field of battle; they merely disappeared.

name: Greater Tanuki
text: The kami permit few mortals to dwell in Jukai Forest, but the clever, playful tanuki are welcomed as friends and guardians.

name: Hymn to Tourach
text:
"The eerie, wailing Hymn caused insanity even in hardened warriors."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. II*

name: Oversold Cemetery
text: It was a profitable scheme, at least until the dead began to object.

name: Earth Elemental
text: Its voice has the tremor of deafening thunder, its blow the force of an avalanche.

name: Aethertide Whale
text:
"To survive up here, I've learned when to use my harpoon and when to just enjoy the view."
—Kadhu, skywhaler

name: Scaled Herbalist
text: "I could help you, or I could eat you for lunch. I haven't decided yet."

name: Insatiable Gorgers
text:
"Drink deeply, for there is no tomorrow!"
—Anje Falkenrath

name: Veteran Armorsmith
text: "Courage is a proud and gleaming shield. It does not bend or hide from sight. To fight with courage, we must forge in steel."

name: Firewing Phoenix
text:
"When a phoenix nests in a volcano, we rejoice, for it means a hundred years of war."
—Golmak, Keldon warlord

name: Cloudreach Cavalry
text: "It's easy to lose sight of hope until you gaze out from my vantage point."

name: Gnarlwood Dryad
text: As Emrakul's influence radiated across Innistrad, evacuation from Kessig's remote villages became increasingly difficult.

name: Asylum Visitor
text: "The ravings of the mad are laced with eldritch knowledge."

name: Ghitu Fire-Eater
text: The Ghitu believe their race was born of fire, and it's an honor to return to it.

name: Scorn Effigy
text: It remembers every wound it has seen or suffered—and nothing else.

name: Sage of the Inward Eye
text: "No one petal claims beauty for the lotus."

name: Witch's Web
text: Ever since the ritual, Ryla didn't have an appetite at the dinner table, but her long walks in the forest always seemed to satiate her hunger.

name: Stalwart Pathlighter
text: "Festival's just ahead. You're almost there!"

name: Amethyst Dragon // Explosive Crystal
text:
"At least it's a beautiful way to die."
—Erinis, gloom stalker

name: Snap
text: It doesn't matter if the mind or body cracks first. They both have to go.

name: Assault Zeppelid
text:
"Show them to Razia and then to the Azorius sky marshals. We could create a fine bidding war—enough to fund the final stages of Project Kraj."
—Momir Vig

name: Skyswirl Harrier
text: The great birds dive through the sky, wings skimming the aether streams, to fall upon their unsuspecting prey.

name: Forge of Heroes
text: History is not delicately woven. It is hammered with fire.

name: Which of You Burns Brightest?
text: "Let that be a lesson to you, your family, and everyone you've ever known."

name: Plumeveil
text:
"It was vast, a great sheet of soaring wings, and equally silent. It caught us unawares and blocked our view of the kithkin stronghold."
—Grensch, merrow cutthroat

name: Timberwatch Elf
text: "If you ever want to leave this forest, now's the time."

name: Benalish Trapper
text: "I'm up here. You're down there. Now who's the lower life form?"

name: Highland Giant
text: Though slow-witted and slow-moving, they are quick to anger.

name: Tower of Champions
text: The ur-golem runes tell of the transformation of Mirrodin's warden from silent guardian to merciless god.

name: Surtland Flinger
text: Victory before camaraderie.

name: Azorius Ploy
text: Azorius military tactics, like their legal tactics, capitalize on delay and nullification.

name: Brambleweft Behemoth
text: Life will find a way, or it will make one.

name: Verduran Enchantress
text:
„Sie verlangt keinen Gehorsam. Doch die Natur lauscht ihrer Bitte, und die Antwort enttäuscht nie."
—*Enzyklopädie von Endres*, „Naturzauber"

name: Sagu Archer
text: His arrows whistle like a serpent's hiss.

name: Brushstroke Paintermage
text: He gives credit where credit isn't due.

name: Galloping Lizrog
text:
"I might have overfed him."
—Gulistan, Simic biomancer

name: Consume Strength
text: As Multani's troops invaded Urborg, the decay of the swamp became a feast for the living.

name: Tidal Warrior
text: The tide of battle favors those who can swim.

name: Raging Kavu
text: Yavaimayae necesse mille annis fuit ut illa aluerent, sed modo momentum necesse fuit ut illa pretium probaverent.

name: Pianna, Nomad Captain
text: Some find inspiration in their swords. Others find it in their leaders.

name: Exoskeletal Armor
text:
"We use only what we need—but in times of strife, our need becomes great."
—Centaur warrior

name: In Garruk's Wake
text: Beyond pain, beyond obsession and wild despair, there lies a place of twisted power only the most tormented souls can reach.

name: Mind Stone
text: The stones, like their holders, were drawn to each other. United, their true power awoke.

name: Exhaustion
text: The mage felt as though he'd been in the stasis suit for days. Upon his return, he found it was months.

name: Parch
text:
"Your porous flesh betrays you."
—Fire Eye, viashino bey

name: Fade into Antiquity
text:
"Memories fade and wither with time. If we do not nurture the garden of history, we may once more wander blindly through barren lands."
—Reki, founder of the Living Historians

name: Catalog
text:
"Without order comes errors, and errors kill on Tolaria."
—Barrin, master wizard

name: Phyrexian Tower
text:
"Yawgmoth is dead, and his citadels lie empty. But there will always be some who seek power at any price."
—Karn

name: Blackmail
text: Even the most virtuous person is only one secret away from being owned by the Cabal.

name: Abrade
text: The desert is a voracious beast, devouring both flesh and stone.

name: Satyr Enchanter
text: "The threads of magic that protect this place were woven by my will."

name: Vitalize
text:
"After waking to the magic of Llanowar, no dreams can compare."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Doomskar
text: The realms crashed together, with Bretagard at the center of the calamity.

name: Icatian Town
text: Icatia's once peaceful towns faced increasing attacks from orcs and goblins as the climate cooled. By the time the empire fell, they were little more than armed camps.

name: Phantom Warrior
text:
"Fishtails infest the water, and mists walk the land. Give me simple solid rock any day."
—Tahngarth of the *Weatherlight*

name: Lullmage's Domination
text: "One spell to quiet the Roil, one to quash the will. The principle is the same."

name: Carefree Swinemaster
text: "C'mon, Boodigan, let's go see what kind of treasure this place has!"

name: Mageta the Lion
text: In the jungle of war there is always a Lion.

name: Snakeskin Veil
text:
"Never reject the kindness of a serpent. It will not be offered twice."
—Druidic manuscript fragment

name: Elvish Archers
text: "I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, 'Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!'"

name: Binding Grasp
text:
"What I want, I take."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran Royal Mage

name: Favorable Winds
text: Long thought to be extinct, flocks of gryffs reappeared with Avacyn's return.

name: Coretapper
text: It converts the faintest surges of power from Mirrodin's core into usable energy, providing endless power for Memnarch's creations on the surface.

name: Provoke
text: Mirri did not have time to think, only to react.

name: Feed the Clan
text: The Temur believe three things only are needed in life: a hot fire, a full belly, and a strong companion.

name: Might of the Nephilim
text:
"Send a runner to Tin Street, and tell 'em the delivery has been . . . uh . . . held up."
—Bonmod, caravan rear guard

name: Renegade Tactics
text: "Nothing against you. It's just that waiting for Consulate clearance was never really my thing."

name: Sign in Blood
text:
"It's always my brightest students who make the worst decisions."
—Shaile, Silverquill dean

name: Hallowed Fountain
text: Two statues stand watch over the entrance to Valor's Reach, celebrating its twin founders—and its first champions.

name: Digsite Engineer
text: "Dig over there, you bolthead!"

name: Gaea's Cradle
text: 2014 Legacy Championship Winner

name: Spawnbroker
text: "The trick isn't setting up the bad trade. It's making each side think it got the better deal."

name: Avalanche Tusker
text:
"Hold the high ground, then bring it to your enemy."
—Surrak, khan of the Temur

name: Guiding Spirit
text:
"Retainer of eternal Sun! Life flash again upon thy wings."
—"Song to the Sun," Femeref song

name: Thrull Retainer
text:
"Until the Rebellion, Thrulls served their masters faithfully—even at the cost of their own lives."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. II*

name: Hyperion Blacksmith
text:
"The smith a mighty man is he/ With large and sinewy hands./ And the muscles of his brawny arms/ Are strong as iron bands."
—Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, The Village Blacksmith

name: Bumper Cars
text:
"Pulled a Captain Nebula"
—Crew expression meaning "an out-of-control car has caused great damage to the surrounding area"

name: Nomad Mythmaker
text: Nomads weave tales thicker than tapestries.

name: Brainstorm
text:
"I reeled from the blow, and then suddenly, I knew exactly what to do. Within moments, victory was mine."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran Royal Mage

name: Endless Atlas
text:
"While we slept, our inferiors infested the worlds that belong to us. Now, we awaken once more."
—Szarekh, the Silent King

name: Tinybones, Trinket Thief
text: Big distractions mean tiny nuisances can slip by unnoticed.

name: Dread Return
text:
"Bolters, flamers, plasma—we hit the xenos with everything, and it just kept coming."
—Captain Uriel Ventris

name: Karametra's Favor
text: The harvest god's cornucopia contains the fruits of the fields, the forest, and beyond.

name: All in Good Time
text: "Take a moment. Ponder the depths of your insignificance."

name: Zombie Trailblazer
text: Some zombies are natural-reborn leaders.

name: Maddening Cacophony
text: Jace traced Nahiri to the Singing City, but the magic of the ancient ruins threatened to overwhelm his mind.

name: Argent Sphinx
text: A great mirage, a dream of wings and silver.

name: Quillspike
text: While it's true that a quillspike does heal the sick, it's just because it finds them tastier that way.

name: Goldhound
text: The staccato clatter of its metal claws on pavement is unmistakable.

name: Makindi Stampede // Makindi Mesas
text:
"The ground is rumbling. Better hope it's just the Roil!"
—Kreq of Sunder Bay

name: Titanium Golem
text: Centuries before the first blades of the Razor Fields chimed in the wind, Mirrodin echoed with the golems' footsteps.

name: Bristling Boar
text:
"I can bring down anything in Zagoth, but for some quarry the ratio of fight to meat is too high."
—Master Hunter Chevill

name: Oath of Liliana
text: "I'll keep watch. Happy now?"

name: Scrapheap Scrounger
text: Some machines refuse to accept their own obsolescence.

name: Sever Soul
text:
"The mortal world is a grove of sweet fruit, and I am ready to harvest it."
—Fallen angel

name: Well of Discovery
text:
When you have given everything, then you are capable of anything.
—Well inscription

name: Power Matrix
text: As he repaired the ship's planeswalking engine, Karn saw for the first time how he could catalyze the *Weatherlight*'s evolution.

name: Arcum Dagsson
text: "Artifice sundered the world. It shall not again wreak such sorrow."

name: Sunder from Within
text: Trapped for eons within the sacred gong, the kami boomed and clanged to a deafening tempo as they destroyed their erstwhile prison.

name: Tromp the Domains
text: Ground into the footprints of the ravaging herd were clumps of salt from Benalia, moss from Llanowar, dust from Hurloon, and ash from as far as Urborg.

name: Ancient Craving
text: Knowledge demands sacrifice.

name: Sliver Queen
text: Her children are ever part of her.

name: Elven Riders
text:
Sometimes it is better to be swift of foot than strong of swordarm.
—Elven proverb

name: Killer Instinct
text: "Take the bridge, men! Victory! Victory is ou— Retreat! RETREAT!"

name: Grazing Whiptail
text: Often found browsing on the upper canopies of Ixalan's jungles, whiptails are known to absently bat away anything foolish enough to interrupt their meal.

name: Ancient Animus
text: Multani's mind grasped for consciousness as rage itself rebuilt his body.

name: Parapet Watchers
text: A kithkin doun is not so much a town as a fortress, built to withstand the constantly besieging darkness. Only those most watchful and trustworthy are tasked with guarding its walls.

name: Breath Weapon
text: "In the name of Tempus, Lord of Battles, you will die honorably in righteous fire."

name: Furnace Celebration
text: Nothing impresses goblins more than something that's bound to kill them.

name: Mishra, Tamer of Mak Fawa
text:
"With the Brotherhood of Gix whispering in his ear, Mishra's drive to prove himself was slowly twisted into an insatiable hunger for power."
-*The Antiquities War*

name: Blinking Spirit
text:
"Don't look at it! Maybe it'll go away!"
—Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician

name: Descendant of Soramaro
text: "Soramaro speaks through me. Listen! And I will tell the wisdom of the ancestors."

name: Simian Spirit Guide
text:
"It's rarely worth questioning where the mana comes from. Just be grateful."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Guardian Lions
text: Approach in peace or not at all.

name: Invasion of Arcavios // Invocation of the Founders
text: No professors, no grades, no room for mistakes.

name: Avizoa
text: "Maybe we can trap them with bait," thought Tahngarth, eyeing Squee.

name: Explore
text: An explorer's reward is a view of tomorrow's possibilities.

name: Bile Blight
text:
"Hold your bitterness deep within, and there let it fester. Let it roil and squirm and churn, until you are filled with bile so poisonous that all you touch falls to ruin."
—Morarion, Daemon Primarch

name: Peak Eruption
text:
"Early olive buds? A good omen. Flock of crows? Not so good. Mountain exploding? Bad. Very, very bad."
—Hira, street oracle

name: Jalum Tome
text: Most books simply deliver knowledge. This one expects some in return.

name: Wayfarer's Bauble
text: Anrakyr the Traveller awoke from his slumber with a singular goal: to rebuild a united Necron galaxy.

name: Nature's Blessing
text:
"Be open to the blessings, whatever their form."
—Kaysa, elder druid of the Juniper Order

name: Phantom Monster
text:
"While, like a ghastly rapid river,
Through the pale door,
A hideous throng rush out forever,
And laugh—but smile no more."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The Haunted Palace"

name: Tarkir Duneshaper // Burnished Dunestomper
text:
"Obey the teachings of the dragonlords, for they provide all. They grant us magic and safety, and in return we offer respect."
—Baihir, Dromoka mage

name: Kitsune Diviner
text: She who once led prayers honoring the kami adapted to use her influence to stay them.

name: Maulfist Squad
text: "Nice invention there. Looks real fragile."

name: Vampire Aristocrat
text: "I admit, I am a creature of the city. The sights, the nightly excitement, the abundance of fine drink . . ."

name: Estrid's Invocation
text: Enchanters add layer upon layer of complexity to the world around them.

name: Winter Orb
text:
"When once winter has ahold,
Not willingly does she withdraw
Her icy touch, wistfully caressing—
The deepened air sleeps its cold."
—Aline Corralurn, "Late Thaw"

name: Hengegate Pathway // Mistgate Pathway
text:
"I've never seen mist so unnaturally thick as this—where does the sea end and the sky begin?"
—Ekken, Omenseeker navigator

name: Sundown Pass
text: Riders chase the fading light recklessly through the mountains, desperate for one last glimpse of day.

name: Village Rites
text:
「同僚たちは血の時代の野蛮さを避難しているが、俺は無限に続く戦争の魔法から学べることは多いと思っている。」
——シルバークイルの学部長、エムブローズ

name: Spawning Bed
text: Young Eldrazi crawl forth from the dust, compelled by a greater will.

name: Hawkeater Moth
text: Each day at dusk the birds above the canopy grow silent.

name: Northern Paladin
text:
"Look to the north; there you will find aid and comfort."
—*The Book of Tal*

name: Platinum Emperion
text: It ignores such insignificant forces as time, entropy, and death.

name: Rotten Reunion
text: Aunt and Uncle Greyfield loved dinner guests.

name: Judge of Currents
text: Though the currents of the Lanes shift every year, the merrow never lose track of where they are or where they are going.

name: Shrink
text:
"May you decrease like coal upon the hearth . . . Evaporate like water in a pail, Become as little as a linseed-grain . . . And so diminish that you come to nothing."
—Anglo-Saxon curse

name: Corpse Knight
text:
"With each knight that rode out from the bone-white keep, the queen's soldiers felt their courage failing."
—Krinnea, *Siege of the Bone Spire*

name: Bosom Buddy
text: "Step 1: I believe in a power and toughness greater than myself . . . ."

name: Chart a Course
text: While other pirates prowl for treasure, Captain Parrish plunders secrets.

name: Curse of Chaos
text:
"Let them cry for mercy. The only one who can hear them is me."
—Siglind the Conqueror

name: Wizard Mentor
text: "I hope you took notes before it exploded."

name: Colossal Majesty
text:
"Might doesn't just build empires. It protects them."
—Inti, Sun Empire knight

name: Demon Bolt
text:
"Burn them from the sky."
—Varragoth

name: Goblin Matron
text: A mother only a child could love.

name: Make Obsolete
text: Yesterday's marvels are today's antiques.

name: Fellwar Stone
text: "What do you have that I cannot obtain?" —Mairsil, called the Pretender

name: Dakkon Blackblade
text: "My power is as vast as the plains, my strength is that of mountains. Each wave that crashes upon the shore thunders like blood in my veins." —*Memoirs*

name: Distress
text: "Of course I'm sure I've gone mad. The little man who crawled out of my eye was quite clear on this."

name: Go for the Throat
text:
"Pray that night is upon us, for if this twilight is the work of the Necrons, we are all dead men."
—Address by Lieutenant Krakow prior to the Bloodmoon Massacres

name: Touch and Go
text: Judge's ruling: The interior of the face still counts as the face, so a nose-pick is legitimate grounds for saying "Gotcha"

name: Gaea's Herald
text: "Gaea sings with the voice of nature rampant: a thousand howls, chitters, and cries, and none of them can be ignored."

name: Empyrial Storm
text: An inspiring and glorious ascent.

name: Slagstorm
text:
"As long as we have the will to fight, we are never without weapons."
—Koth of the Hammer

name: Ominous Roost
text:
"One raven is a bad omen. Two are a curse. I don't know what this is, but it can't be good."
—Verna, priest of Sigarda

name: Qumulox
text: Even the clouds bend themselves to Memnarch's will, eager to swallow those who oppose him.

name: Exotic Curse
text:
Fouler than a necromancer's kiss.
—Jamuraan expression

name: Eyetwitch
text: Oculomancers see the ideal potion ingredient. The bats don't see it that way.

name: Kjeldoran Outrider
text: "I listen to people. He sniffs the wind. And we both sense something big coming. Something very big."

name: Symmetry Matrix
text:
"Achieving perfection is simple. Watch, I'll do it twice."
—Mishra

name: Crafty Pathmage
text:
Follow the pathmage
—Otarian expression meaning "escape quickly"

name: Universal Solvent
text: A few drops could dissolve the webs of Lolth herself.

name: Legion Vanguard
text: It takes guts to be a trailblazer.

name: Ravenous Rotbelly
text: The patrol found the graf empty save for a few well-chewed bones.

name: Unified Front
text: The kor's pride in their independence has given way to a strong sense of community that embraces all of Zendikar.

name: Kaijin of the Vanishing Touch
text: When it's finished, all that's left of you is a ripple on a still pond.

name: Colossus of Sardia
text: From the Sardian mountains wakes ancient doom: / Warrior born from a rocky womb.

name: Gruul Nodorog
text:
Petting the nodorog
—Gruul expression meaning "making a really big mistake"

name: Seat of the Synod
text:
"Full of immense beauty and power, the falls at Orleason inspired the empire's greatest dreamers."
—*Fall of the Thran*

name: Jaya's Firenado
text:
"For all their supposed advances, the Phyrexians still aren't fireproof."
—Jaya Ballard

name: Uncontrolled Infestation
text: The grounds of the Riptide Project are now populated only by slivers, broken beakers, and the lonely screeching of gulls.

name: Sparring Construct
text: The trainers were a gift of gratitude from the wizards of Tolaria West to the knights of New Benalia for their aid during the Talas Incursion.

name: Mistform Sliver
text: Taking the form of a junior researcher, the first sliver slipped out of Riptide.

name: Rebuild
text: The first step in any artificer's scheme is to take inventory.

name: Wheel of Sun and Moon
text: Every life ends, but life itself never does.

name: Golgothian Sylex
text: From their earliest educations, the brothers had known that no human contrivance could stand against the true masters of Dominia.

name: Carbonize
text:
"There's no coming back from that."
—Jaya Ballard

name: Lone Rider // It That Rides as One
text:
"Horse and rider are often of one mind."
—Ulda, Gavony Rider

name: Hagra Mauling // Hagra Broodpit
text:
"I think we somehow got turned around."
—Doros, expedition guide

name: Earthquake
text: They fell screaming into the depths of the chasm like so many pebbles tossed down a well.

name: Knockout Blow
text: "Subsequent efforts to deconstruct this facility will be punished with increasing severity."

name: Stitch in Time
text: Quyzl was told by his mentor to "make more time" for his studies.

name: Liu Bei, Lord of Shu
text:
"Only wisdom and virtue can truly win men's devotion."
—Liu Bei

name: Phyrexian Delver
text: Because the dead have no will to resist.

name: Mirran Spy
text: Accurate information is a precious commodity in times of war.

name: Smallpox
text: Take away a few things, and a rebellion may ensue. Take away everything, and the oppression will be accepted as fate.

name: Ogre Taskmaster
text: Three little goblins, enjoying their brew. One bumped an ogre, and then there were two.

name: Unnatural Endurance
text:
"Eldrazi don't die easy. Sometimes they don't die at all."
—Yon Basrel, Oran-Rief survivalist

name: Burning Vengeance
text: Mist is the geists' sorrow. Wind is their pain. Fire is their vengeance.

name: Keep Watch
text: "I see their moral dilemmas. I see their raw courage. I see their self-sacrifice. I see our victory."

name: Ravenous Chupacabra
text: Opening Orazca unleashed more horrors than just the Immortal Sun.

name: Inspired Charge
text:
"For the lands you have lost and the beauty that remains, for freedom and the future, we must hold nothing back!"
—Gideon Jura

name: Dead Reckoning
text: Many venture out to hunt for treasures. Others lie in wait to hunt the hunters.

name: Captured by the Consulate
text:
"At last, the infamous Pia Nalaar."
—Tezzeret

name: Pyromancer's Goggles
text: The strongest mentorships kindle the passions of both student and teacher.

name: Tribute to the World Tree
text:
"The Tree was the heart of our world. It made me what I am and pulled me back from the brink of death. I won't allow it to be forgotten."
—Esika, god of the Tree

name: Bramble Sovereign
text: "Within this grove, you belong to me."

name: Tranquil Cove
text: The sky darkened and the seas turned to oil as the gods of Theros themselves fell to New Phyrexia.

name: Armored Cancrix
text: Creatures displaced from time still turn up every year, stranded by the temporal disaster that once swept across Dominaria.

name: Cathodion
text: Cathodions repair the Great Furnace by soldering parts of themselves to the mechanism. Eventually, they become one with the machine.

name: Minister of Pain
text: Draconic words need not be shouted. A whisper will suffice.

name: Dragon Mask
text:
"With no further options, I was forced to don the mask."
—Rashida Scalebane

name: Rebuild the City
text: The Phyrexian design had to go, but the materials could be put to good use.

name: Phantom Warrior
text:
"Only when I saw my enemy walk through all my defenses, untouchable as the moon in the sky, did I truly know what it is to be afraid."
—King Ixes

name: Plummet
text: "You are the grandest of all," said the archdruid to the trees. They became so proud of bark and branch that they suffered no creature to fly overhead or perch upon a bough.

name: Faerie Vandal
text: "Greedy vault guard, wouldn't share. Now there's Halo in your hair!"

name: Weight Advantage
text: When immovable object turns to unstoppable force, it's best to just get out of the way.

name: Legacy Weapon
text: Whether lives or precious artifacts, no price was too high to stop the Phyrexian invasion.

name: Wall of Reverence
text: The lives of elves are long, but their memories are longer. Even after death, they do not desert their homes.

name: Council's Judgment
text: When its power is threatened, the council speaks with a unified voice.

name: Blight Pile
text:
"Keep your distance. It may be broken, but it's far from benign."
—Stenn

name: Martyr's Bond
text: "One life at a time. That is how the world will be saved."

name: Battle Strain
text: The pits swallow the weak as predators swallow prey.

name: Tajuru Warcaller
text: Her rallying cry reaches far beyond the Tajuru elves, inspiring all those who hear it.

name: Fyndhorn Pollen
text:
"I breathed deeply, and suddenly I knew not who or where I was."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Palladia-Mors, the Ruiner
text: Sister of Nicol Bolas. Survivor of the Elder Dragon War. The most vicious of her kin.

name: Embereth Shieldbreaker // Battle Display
text: "Courage is the only shield I need."

name: Snow Devil
text:
"Give me wings to fly and speed to strike. In return, the glory I earn shall be yours."
—Steinar Icefist, Balduvian shaman

name: Returned Phalanx
text: They lived in different nations and fought in different eras, but as the Returned, they link arms as one.

name: Festive Funeral
text:
"Even as we mourn the last, we look to the next with joy. Hopefully, my new suitor will bring the Cauldron home."
—Ayara, First of Locthwain

name: Dreamborn Muse
text:
"Her voice is insight, piercing and true."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

name: Loran of the Third Path
text: As a scholar, she saw the sylex not as a weapon, but as a key to the past.

name: Serpent's Gift
text: Venom is nature's way of redressing the imbalance between weak and mighty.

name: Maw of the Mire
text: As the chapel was dragged under, the bell in the tower rang until the murky depths forever silenced its toll.

name: Hyena Pack
text: With carrion a rarity in the Broken Lands, the hyenas that stalk the deserts hunt in packs.

name: Nightguard Patrol
text: "The Wojek defend the laws. We defend the people."

name: Tenacious Hunter
text: The crocodiles of the Broken Lands, long used to feeding on undead flesh, eagerly flooded into Naktamun for a taste of something fresher.

name: Stupefying Touch
text: Just because your eyes are open doesn't mean you're awake.

name: Mental Agony
text: "His mind is feeble. Feed him to the bats."

name: Thriving Bluff
text: As eons passed, the rock wore away, revealing the rich colors at the mountain's heart.

name: Workshop Elders
text:
"Fear not what's under the bed. The toys are watching."
—*Beyond the Great Henge*

name: Fiery Emancipation
text:
"One day the mountain's fire will rise up to burn away our chains and end this age of oppression."
—*The Molten Prophecy*

name: Thermokarst
text:
"Finally we understand the lesson of our home: loss begets renewal."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Inventive Iteration // Living Breakthrough
text:
"While they squabble below, let us rise above."
—Emire, director of the Saiba Futurists

name: Gush
text: Don't trust your secrets to the sea.

name: Stormblood Berserker
text: Blood is holy to those whose god is War.

name: Hidden Horror
text: If the presence of evil were obvious, it wouldn't be nearly as dangerous.

name: Dutiful Attendant
text: The dragon who eats the last head in the basket is entitled to the servant's.

name: Mind Bend
text:
"The world, I've come to realize, is a blank canvas on which to paint."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

name: Spiteful Bully
text: Like most creatures bent on total destruction, they rarely bother to double-check their targets.

name: Elvish Champion
text: "We've endured your slights to Gaea with the grace of tolerance. Now behold the grace of our ferocity."

name: Befuddle
text: The trick to talking sense into Keldons is getting them to hold still.

name: Nightveil Predator
text:
"Three daggers left in an angel's back, three enforcers with memory loss, three keys stolen from my own belt—and you talk of peace?"
—Tajic, to Aurelia

name: Selesnya Cluestone
text:
"Break it if you must. The loss of one relic is nothing next to the value of enriching us all."
—Suniel the Woodwise

name: Helm of the Host
text: Forged out of flowstone for the queen of Vesuva.

name: Genesis Ultimatum
text: No human eyes have ever witnessed the birth of an apex monster.

name: Tower Geist
text: Jenrik's tower is served by those who once sought to enter it uninvited.

name: Jaya's Immolating Inferno
text: Centuries ago, a pyromancer's spark ignited a fiery conflagration.

name: Dovin's Veto
text: "I see you've learned nothing, Chandra. You'd still put a match to something rather than understand it."

name: Phosphorescent Feast
text:
"Mushroom Queen sits among her spores, Enjoying life and avoiding chores."
—Ibblian pixie ditty

name: Secure the Wastes
text:
"The Shifting Wastes provide our clan eternal protection. It is our duty to return the favor."
—Kadri, Dromoka warrior

name: Imagecrafter
text: When Otarians learned not to trust wizards, the wizards learned to adapt.

name: Righteous Avengers
text: Few can withstand the wrath of the righteous.

name: Inspired Idea
text: Stitching is an ever-evolving field, with each new advancement reaching a new height of horror.

name: Pale Wayfarer
text: As it wandered Shadowmoor, it did not remember its crime—only its shame.

name: Jade Mage
text:
"We are one with the wild things. Life blooms from our fingertips and nature responds to our summons."
—Jade creed

name: Coastline Chimera
text: Seeing a chimera overhead foretells good fortune, but only because seeing one any closer foretells dismemberment.

name: Favored of Iroas
text: "The promise of victory fills my heart. There is no room for fear."

name: Volley Veteran
text: "Fill the sky with stuff!"

name: Leonin Den-Guard
text: No one under the four suns can elude the watchful eye of the den-guard.

name: Exuberant Wolfbear
text: Sometimes the *eludha* is a sacred harmony of souls. Sometimes the bonder grabs some fur and holds on tight.

name: Bladeback Sliver
text: Slivers can turn a last stand into a stunning victory.

name: Phantom Beast
text: As insubstantial as fear, and as dangerous.

name: Somberwald Sage
text: "You can face any danger when all of nature is on your side."

name: Markov Crusader
text: The surviving members of the Markov bloodline drove through a crush of horrors to reclaim their ancestral home.

name: Soilshaper
text: It spoke with the voice of nature, but its words were curses spat upon humankind.

name: Bile Urchin
text:
"The two youths argued and tempers flared. One youth opened his mouth to utter a vile curse, but what he spat out instead was a kami of poison and filth."
—Sensei Golden-Tail

name: Tribal Unity
text: Kamahl left the violence of his former life behind him, but he still believes in the power of muscle.

name: Auriok Survivors
text: "We are Mirrodin's children. We will reclaim her—one scrap at a time, if we have to."

name: Arbor Elf
text: The Mul Daya elves reject their Tajuru kin, calling them arrogant tree-binders who think the roots serve the canopy.

name: Overgrowth
text: Tyranids flourish in any climate, dominate any ecosystem, crush any resistance.

name: Demolish
text: What took months for human hands to carve took just seconds for the dinosaur's tail to ruin.

name: Kill! Destroy!
text: Getting "Gotcha'ed" again and again.

name: Save Life
text: Who consistently managed to win.

name: Snake Pit
text:
If the ground is smooth, the way will be rough.
—Deepwood saying

name: Norwood Riders
text: "Trade my moose? Sure—when I find a *horse* that can spear ten goblins at a time!"

name: Serpentine Curve
text:
"Math bites."
—Bim, Lorehold mage-student

name: Senate Courier
text:
"This Dovin Baan came from nowhere. Watch him. Read his letters. He is more than he appears."
—Lazav

name: Dawnfeather Eagle
text:
"It came to rest upon the angel's arm, and then the weight of their gazes fell upon me."
—Aeronaut's journal

name: Sengir Vampire
text: Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal.

name: Tribal Flames
text:
"Fire is the universal language."
—Jhoira, master artificer

name: Razortooth Rats
text: They'll chew through armor, flesh, and bone. They'll even chew through each other if they're hungry enough.

name: Rakdos Guildgate
text: Maze-runners who pass through the Rakdos gate leave behind their scruples and a significant amount of skin.

name: Jungle Shrine
text: The people of the Sun Empire worship the sun in three aspects: the creative sun, the sustaining sun, and the destructive sun.

name: Giant Growth
text:
"Sometimes Mowu is content to gnaw on a bone. Sometimes he wants the whole skeleton."
—Jiang Yanggu

name: Gargoyle Sentinel
text: The beating of a gargoyle's wings on the air is like the cracking of stones. Intruders who rouse a gargoyle are certain to hear the cracking of bones.

name: Rally for the Throne
text:
"If you're as loyal as you claim, now is the time to show it."
—Queen Linden of Ardenvale

name: Aetherflux Reservoir
text: While most power is used for ordinary, everyday tasks, one shouldn't underestimate its potential for the extraordinary.

name: Vengeful Rebel
text: Some aetherborn joined the rebellion for profit, others for the sake of their freedom, still others for revenge.

name: Goblin King
text: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok . . . ."

name: Swords to Plowshares
text:
"The so-called barbarians will not respect us for our military might—they will respect us for our honor."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter,
leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Warrior en-Kor
text: Only a matter as vital as destroying Volrath could bring together the reclusive kor people.

name: Stone Spirit
text:
"The spirit of the stone is the spirit of strength."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

name: Greater Good
text:
"There's wisdom to be gained in death—whether it be one's own or someone else's."
—Jarad, Golgari Lich-Lord

name: Blood Crypt
text: Life is a show, and death its final performance.

name: Dwarven Weaponsmith
text: "Work with zeal as hammers peal! Melt, anneal, and pound the steel!" —Old Dwarvish forge-chant

name: Nissa's Chosen
text: Once, Nissa selected worthy fighters to defend the Joraga. Now, she gathers forces to defend all of Zendikar.

name: Illusionary Wall
text:
"Let them see what is not there and feel what does not touch them. When they no longer trust their senses, that is the time to strike."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Fabrication Module
text: Inspiration leads to design.

name: Goblin Elite Infantry
text: They talk a good fight.

name: Tangled Islet
text: Many of Terisiare's islands are merely extensions of the root system of the Yavimaya magnigoth forests.

name: Slitherwisp
text: Fear is its habitat, sanity its prey.

name: Virulent Wound
text: Sadly, the extent of Gerkk's healing knowledge was "don't pick at it."

name: Regeneration
text:
"Faith in Freyalise has given me the gift, not the curse, of unprecedented longevity."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

name: Soldevi Sentry
text:
"A dreadful invention. What ease is there under the watchful eye of cold steel?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Orcish Veteran
text:
"Orcs often greeted promotions to Icatian battle with anguished wails and pleas for mercy."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI*

name: Wishful Merfolk
text: She yearned to walk on dry land so she might take her vengeance there.

name: Enduring Bondwarden
text: "I will be with you. Always."

name: Structural Assault
text: After the attack on the Vantoleone, the fragile balance of power shattered completely, and the city descended into chaos.

name: Shrill Howler // Howling Chorus
text:
"A werewolf's howl is terrifying, to be sure. But this . . . this was a chilling sound I somehow felt. I fear what will reply to it."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

name: Rhox War Monk
text: Rhox monks are dedicated to spiritual growth and learning, and most bear the sigils of many students. However, they do not gladly suffer fools or those who disagree with their carefully wrought dogma.

name: Ribbons of Night
text:
"My favorite meal is angel's flesh, slain in agony and iced with black vinegar."
—Aszala of House Dimir

name: A-Cobbled Lancer
text:
"Don't worry everyone—I hear hoofbeats! The Gavony Riders are coming to save us!"
—Adin, Moorland villager

name: Rakshasa Gravecaller
text: Debts to rakshasa linger beyond death.

name: Secure the Scene
text:
"You know it's a great show when the Azorius arrest the props, too!"
—Judith, the Scourge Diva

name: Port Town
text: A haunted fog known as the Nebelgast shrouds the cities along Nephalia's coast.

name: Blightstep Pathway // Searstep Pathway
text:
"Our brave Tuskeri brethren blaze new trails, and we follow, mapping the routes of those who survive."
—Solrun, Beskir warrior

name: Jungle Delver
text: "There is no power too great to be used in the defense of our ancestral lands."

name: Dragon Roost
text: Dragons erupt from peaks of chaos and flow from rivers of molten rage.

name: Harmonic Prodigy
text: Focus: The musician-wizard.

name: Sick and Tired
text: The Phyrexians' only interest in organic life is discerning its weakness.

name: Angel's Mercy
text: "I understand your fears. I pity your doubts. I absolve you of both."

name: Yavimaya Ancients
text:
"The Ancients teach us that if we can but last, we shall prevail."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Steel Overseer
text: In an unusual foray into the humanoid form, Venand Kapur—known as the Gearherder—built this automaton to keep watch over his clockwork herds.

name: Dire Fleet Neckbreaker
text: The buccaneers scaled the sides of buildings as easily as they boarded enemy ships.

name: Join Forces
text:
"Okay—you take the sixteen ragers and the hulk on the right. I'll take the ten defilers and the plaguelord on the left. Ready?"
—Danitha, to Radha

name: Memnite
text: Reminders of Memnarch's reign still skirr across Mirrodin, reminiscent of his form if not his power.

name: Mudbrawler Raiders
text: To reach the ravine of the Wanderbrine River, they were told to take the shortcut "through the mountains." They took the directions literally.

name: Balloon Stand
text: Buy enough balloons and it turns into a ride.

name: Maniacal Rage
text: "Remember me?" Tahngarth roared. "Now I'll repay you for my stay on Rath!"

name: Mishra's Workshop
text: 2020 Vintage Champion

name: Answered Prayers
text: Angels cannot ignore pious pleas.

name: Hedron Matrix
text: The hedrons awoke along with the Eldrazi, forming superstructures that radiated overwhelming magic.

name: Winter Blast
text:
"Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!"
—William Shakespeare, *King Lear*

name: Deflection
text: The golden rule of revenge: Do unto others what they tried to do unto you.

name: Taunting Arbormage
text: "Eyes on me!"

name: Vampire's Kiss
text: Young vampires gorge themselves at every meal, but their elders have learned to savor the smallest bite.

name: Fettergeist
text: The choices of the living will tether them in death.

name: Akroma's Vengeance
text: "Many must die for the one who should not have perished."

name: Our Market Research Shows That Players Like Really Long Card Names So We Made this Card to Have the Absolute Longest Card Name Ever Elemental
text: Just call it OMRSTPLRLCNSWMTCTHTALCNEE for short.

name: True Love's Kiss
text:
"Be careful, dear. Some people deserve their curses."
—Marawen, barrow witch

name: Surrakar Banisher
text: Surrakar grab things they *don't* want.

name: Nahiri's Binding
text: "This is my world, Jace, down to its very bones."

name: Into the Story
text: The boundary between real and imaginary is as thin as the page, and just as easily torn.

name: Wildwood Geist
text: The geists that dwell in the deep forests of Kessig are as untamable as the woods themselves.

name: Windscouter
text: These nimble ships were designed for hit-and-run tactics.

name: Darkbore Pathway // Slitherbore Pathway
text:
"The Cosmos Serpent carved these tunnels, and his echo remains, a twisting aura of ferocity and boundless growth."
—Haugar, Kannah wayfinder

name: Consume the Meek
text:
"Why does it destroy? It does, and to talk of reasons wastes time and breath."
—Nirthu, lone missionary

name: Slip Through Space
text: The Eldrazi twisted in a direction that had no name, and a frontal assault became a panicked rout.

name: Soul Feast
text: Evil often dines alone.

name: Gangrenous Goliath
text: Cabal clerics don't heal the sick—they heal the dead.

name: Moldgraf Monstrosity
text: The border between life and death is as thin as a layer of topsoil.

name: Morbid Plunder
text: Even the dead are raw materials for the Phyrexian vision of perfection.

name: Ogre Leadfoot
text: When the goblins need more scrap for the Great Furnace, they simply let the ogres loose and follow in their wake.

name: Mirari
text:
"It offers you what you want, not what you need."
—Braids, dementia summoner

name: Déjà Vu
text: History is the study of repetition.

name: Fyndhorn Druid
text:
"Honor those who honor Fyndhorn above themselves."
—Kolbjörn, High Honored Druid

name: Confront the Past
text: "Why, Gideon? Of all people, why save me?"

name: Wrap in Flames
text: Bright flames quell the darkest nightmares.

name: Eligeth, Crossroads Augur
text: "There's no better place to divine the future than at a nexus of branching presents."

name: Flame Lash
text: "This is just my warm-up."

name: Vigilant Drake
text: Awake and awing in the blink of an eye.

name: Linvala, Keeper of Silence
text: Those who seek to disturb the harmony of life will see their instruments taken from them.

name: Elvish Champion
text:
"For what are leaves but countless blades To fight a countless foe on high."
—Skyshroud hymn

name: Hypnotic Grifter
text: "All is calm. All is well. You know me to be a trusted member of your family, and I would like to discuss the contents of our safe."

name: Stromgald Cabal
text: When the alliance between Balduvia and Kjeldor deprived Stromgald of easy victories, its agents were forced to fuel their rituals with their own flesh.

name: Sultai Skullkeeper
text: A skullkeeper is the first to arrive after the palace archers strike down intruders, probing their brains for choice bits of knowledge.

name: Tundra Fumarole
text: The only thing that smells worse than troll is burnt troll.

name: Zombify
text:
"The first birth celebrates life. The second birth mocks it."
—Mystic elder

name: Gurmag Angler
text: If everything in the Gurmag Swamp hungers for human flesh, what bait could be more effective?

name: Kabira Takedown // Kabira Plateau
text:
"Down below's where things go to die."
—Kreq of Sunder Bay

name: Gaseous Form
text:
"It's hard to hurt anyone when you're as transparent as your motives."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Sage of Lat-Nam
text: Though it was laid to waste by the brothers, many schools of magic trace their origins to the College of Lat-Nam, including the first Tolarian Academy.

name: Spellgorger Weird
text: Freed from their respective labs, the two weirds formed a partnership, feeding on the arcane energies of war.

name: Aysen Bureaucrats
text:
"I would say that our bureaucrats are no better than vipers—but I shouldn't insult the vipers."
—Murat, death speaker

name: Flay
text: The Keldons would never admit it, but Greel unsettles them, too.

name: Keymaster Rogue
text: "This one opens the grate outside Zelzo Base. This one is for Ismeri Library. This one is for an invisible door . . . No, I've said too much."

name: Rampaging Monument
text: "Be advised: suspect is nine stories tall, marble hair, answers to Saint Gusztav."

name: Natural Affinity
text: As long as the dryads are a part of the forest, the forest is a part of the army.

name: Dreadwaters
text: Stray into the Morkrut and it may rise to claim you.

name: Warleader's Helix
text:
"There is no time to remedy our enemies' ignorance. Blast it out of them."
—Aurelia

name: Flametongue Kavu
text:
"For dim-witted, thick-skulled genetic mutants, they have pretty good aim."
—Sisay, captain of the *Weatherlight*

name: Soul's Majesty
text: An avatar he sculpts of wisdom and strength.

name: On Thin Ice
text: He cursed the wind. He cursed the cold. But by stepping on the ice, he cursed himself.

name: Tiger Claws
text: Cho-Arrim martial artists emulate the beasts of their home.

name: Wood Elves
text: Secure in the embrace of wood, they want no part of Eladamri's war.

name: Sanctum Prelate
text: *Whispered Memories*, by Johannes Voss

name: Disposal Mummy
text: Without the viziers to oversee their actions, some anointed went to extreme lengths to fulfill their directives.

name: Azorius Charm
text:
"The rules of logic and order have already made the choice for you."
—Isperia

name: Loyal Pegasus
text:
"Even if I should die in the saddle, she will not let me fall to the ground."
—Hypatia of the Winged Horse

name: Utvara Hellkite
text: The fear of dragons is as old and as powerful as the fear of death itself.

name: Volcano Imp
text: Its claws cut faster than a flame flickers.

name: Crypt Angel
text: Once an angel, now an abomination.

name: Deathleaper, Terror Weapon
text: Created to break will and bone with equal ferocity.

name: Burning-Tree Shaman
text: Gruul shamans are bent on punishing the civilized. Any act more complex than rubbing sticks together or eating with utensils is met with the stinging burn of their magic.

name: Phalanx Leader
text: His soldiers etch his words on the insides of their shields, their inspiration always in sight during battle.

name: Doubtless One
text: "Share your devotion with me."

name: Liliana's Scorn
text: "We're done here."

name: Tower of Murmurs
text: Etched on its surface are warnings from a long-lost race of ur-golems pushed to the brink of extinction.

name: Primeval Titan
text: When nature calls, *run*.

name: Paired Tactician
text: "If we fight as one, nothing can stand in our way!"

name: Furnace Skullbomb
text: It burns with the passion of an unbound creator.

name: Surge Node
text: Without a foe to focus on, the machine priests had time to indulge in new sciences.

name: Guardian of Vitu-Ghazi
text: It stands sentinel to the great City-Tree, home of the Selesnya Conclave.

name: Skeletal Scrying
text: His family was a small price to pay for the dark gifts that called to him.

name: Locthwain Lancer
text: For years she believed persistence meant hunting for the Cauldron of Eternity. Now she knew it meant never giving up the fight against a world gone mad.

name: Restless Dreams
text: Braids dreams of dark rebirth.

name: Simian Spirit Guide
text:
"All my spells smell like burnt hair lately."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Pendelhaven
text: "This is the forest primeval. The murmuring pines and the hemlocks . . . / Stand like Druids of old." —Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, "Evangeline"

name: Birgi, God of Storytelling // Harnfel, Horn of Bounty
text: "This is a tale to make all Kaldheim tremble..."

name: Searing Flesh
text: Zemoo found out the hard way that "inflammable" and "flammable" mean the same thing.

name: Gollum, Patient Plotter
text: "They'll take it, steal my Precious. Thieves. We hates them."

name: Skeleton Ship
text:
"The sea gives up her dead as easily as the soil."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Hidetsugu's Second Rite
text: Hidetsugu never relinquished a grudge. He let it burn within him, gathering ever greater intensity until the final moment of vengeance.

name: Warrior's Honor
text:
"No person was ever honored for what he received. Honor has been the reward for what he gave."
—Calvin Coolidge

name: Force of Vigor
text: The vines overgrew the construct, snapping gears and soaking up aether.

name: Mystic Compass
text:
"And *I* say north is where I *want* it to be!"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Epic Proportions
text: From mite to mighty.

name: Wit's End
text:
"Some images are so powerful that one glance burns them into your mind forever. Come, let us gaze on nothingness."
—Szadek

name: Altar's Reap
text:
"The demons don't care if we mutter niceties and act out ceremonies. Just kill him."
—Bishop Volpaig, servant of Griselbrand

name: Rackling
text: "This may hurt a little."

name: Serrated Scorpion
text: Each scorpion's venom is unique, thwarting sanctuary healers' attempts to develop an antidote.

name: Spreading Flames
text:
"Hang on. I'm just tidying up."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Blockade Runner
text: "I need to get back to Mercadia City," said Sisay. "We can get you there," the vizier answered. "Easily."

name: Seizan, Perverter of Truth
text:
"In its hatred for the mortal realms, it fought on the side of the invaders, heedless of its own eventual fate."
—Records of the Living Historians

name: Might of Old Krosa
text: Sometimes even humble forest creatures were gifted with mighty emanations from the past.

name: Lord of Extinction
text: The forlorn cries of the dead combine to make its laugh.

name: Butcher's Cleaver
text: Outside the safety of Thraben, there is little distinction between tool and weapon.

name: Eerie Procession
text:
"Though in years past speculation was not encouraged about the strange ways of kami, now we must understand their motivations, if such is even possible to the mortal mind."
—Lady Azami

name: Coral Trickster
text: They wait in darkened depths, laughing eagerly.

name: Worn Powerstone
text:
"Power comes in many shapes. But real power does the shaping."
—Abaddon the Despoiler

name: Voice of Reason
text:
"Next to Grace is Reason, and Reason must be retained. If the web of Reason comes unwoven, madness will escape."
—*Song of All*, canto 167

name: Decommission
text: "A key weakness in the design is its vulnerability to repeated, forceful blows."

name: Aim for the Head
text:
"Works every time."
—Halana, Kessig ranger

name: Ritual of Hope
text: "Tonight, we can be anything."

name: Tranquility
text: The plagues robbed Dominaria of all but its dreams. Eladamri hoped dreams were enough.

name: Silt Crawler
text: If they could replenish the land instead of draining it, Jamuraa would be teeming with them.

name: Labyrinth Minotaur
text:
"I doubt any labyrinth minotaurs still live—but then we minotaurs are stubborn beings."
—Onatah, Anaba shaman

name: Saw in Half
text: The audience always loves it, but volunteers are divided.

name: Equilibrium
text: In Rath, there are only so many souls to go around.

name: Clip Wings
text: It is a grim duty to save the world from those created to protect it.

name: Spontaneous Combustion
text: "Heat of battle" is usually a metaphor.

name: Consume the Meek
text:
"Others ask why the Eldrazi destroy. I ask why they preserve."
—Ganda, Goma Fada deserter

name: Rats' Feast
text:
"That does it—I quit!"
—Cabal grave robber

name: Pheres-Band Thunderhoof
text: "Flesh and bone or star and shadow. It makes no difference to my club."

name: Wild Might
text: The hunted can become the fiercest hunters.

name: Warrior's Charge
text: It is not the absence of fear that makes a warrior, but its domination.

name: Dosan's Oldest Chant
text: As Dosan's chant grew in volume, a second, deeper voice rose up in harmony behind it, strong enough to shake the earth and yet vibrant enough to fill the spirit.

name: Massive Might
text:
"Run! It's coming for us! Eventually!"
—Yaster, Havengul shopkeeper

name: Terramorphic Expanse
text:
"The Phyrexian's monuments of today will be nothing but dust tomorrow. With enough tomorrows, so will their rule."
—Koth

name: Squall
text:
"May the winds blow till they have wakened death. . . ."
—William Shakespeare,
*Othello*

name: Vilis, Broker of Blood
text: "You can sign, or you can spend your life imagining what might have been yours."

name: Silundi Vision // Silundi Isle
text:
"Feel the current? Rough waters lie ahead."
—Jori En, expedition leader

name: Roller Coaster
text: They say you leave a piece of yourself behind on Garruk's Wake. The janitorial bots can tell you that's absolutely true.

name: Thalakos Seer
text:
"You see our world when you shut your eyes so tightly that tiny shapes float before them."
—Lyna, to Ertai

name: Ondu Cleric
text: A cleric's true balm is the confidence he inspires in his compatriots.

name: Trapmaker's Snare
text: "Trapmaking is an art. The trap is a corporeal riddle, a battle of wits between its creator and whatever it lures inside."

name: Ojutai Interceptor
text: "Though I may soar, I could never fly as high as the dragons."

name: Skeletonize
text: Fire burns away both flesh and freedom.

name: Destructor Dragon
text: After countless attacks on the Salt Road where it passes through the frozen tundra, the Abzan began to refer to the area as Atarka territory rather than Temur lands.

name: Wind-Kin Raiders
text: Small aeronaut societies like the Wind-Kin had little to lose by siding with the renegades, and much to gain.

name: Warlord's Axe
text: To split wood with it would be sacrilege. This tool has but one purpose, and that is war.

name: Flameblade Adept
text:
"Allow zealous flames to light your path and the glory you seek will be revealed."
—Hazoret, god of zeal

name: Inquisitor Exarch
text:
"Skin is the prison of the blessed and the stronghold of the heretic."
—Argent Etchings, plate 64, passage 17

name: Abnormal Endurance
text: Tenacity prevails when hopes die.

name: Arcbound Ravager
text:
"Top-performing automaton combatants are to be seized and modified for service."
—Confiscation directive

name: Disenchant
text: "From legend it was forged, and to legend it returns."

name: New Perspectives
text: Understanding is a matter of perspective.

name: Sudden Insight
text: A lucky draw from the Deck of Many Things gave Voltusk an inexplicable flash of understanding that he spent the rest of his life trying to repeat.

name: Timely Interference
text: Students fled with their research as Tolaria fell to the Phyrexians.

name: Cruel Tutor
text: The more you pay for the lesson, the better you'll remember it.

name: Null Brooch
text:
Give away everything so others have nothing.
—Brooch inscription

name: Sea Gate Colossus
text:
"When you are battered and exhausted, look up and be inspired by its resolve."
—Tazri

name: Daring Apprentice
text: "I've seen my master do this a hundred times. How hard can it be?"

name: Craterhoof Behemoth
text: Its footsteps of today are the lakes of tomorrow.

name: Sure-Footed Infiltrator
text: "I've yet to discover the ruin that can keep me out."

name: Wheel of Torture
text: "I'd like to buy a bowel."

name: Young Pyromancer
text: "Why do they say you shouldn't play with fire? Fire is the best thing to play with!"

name: Porcelain Zealot
text: "There is a single, glorious truth, etched in the hearts of the faithful. Join in unity, or be washed away."

name: Hazduhr the Abbot
text:
"Soon, Serra will return and choose the Abbot's successor, else we are lost."
—Gulsen, Abbey Matron

name: Fanatical Devotion
text: The Oracle told Eladamri he would save his people by abandoning them. His followers adopted that ideal.

name: Blur of Blades
text: Samut battled her way through the hordes, shouting the names of those who'd died in her crop and those she hoped yet to save.

name: Goblin Lore
text:
"I done forgot more than you'll ever know, pipsqueak."
"Yeah—that's your problem."

name: Zephyr Winder
text: It twines through the roiling cloudscape feeding on the energies of nascent storms.

name: War Mammoth
text: I didn't think Mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.

name: Shockmaw Dragon
text: Dragons of the Kolaghan brood are always on the move. They are the driving force behind the Mardu's nomadic way of life.

name: Breeding Pit
text: The thrulls bred at a terrifying pace. In the end, they overwhelmed the Order of the Ebon Hand.

name: Laquatus's Creativity
text: One never knows when inspiration will bubble up.

name: Call In a Professional
text: For the next week, Park Heights smelled of burnt oil paint and brimstone.

name: Heart of Ramos
text: Ramos bled, and there was fire.

name: Consume Spirit
text:
"You clerics brag about your strength of spirit, yet I take away the tiniest fragment, and you crumple like a rag doll."
—Sorin Markov

name: Tragic Slip
text: Linger on death's door and risk being invited in.

name: Return from Extinction
text: The First Sliver calls. The dead answer.

name: Cogmentor
text:
"Cogs on cats / Cogs on dogs / Cogs on hats / And cogs on cogs."
—*Song of the Cogmentor*

name: Dimir Spybug
text: Just assume every conversation is on record.

name: Undo
text:
"Oft have I wished to undo past deeds, but never did I imagine they would be undone for me."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

name: Nyx Herald
text:
"A piercing call, bright as the stars, rang out across the valley, calling the Pheres band to war, to blood and savagery."
—Luphea of Setessa, *Histories*

name: Servant of the Conduit
text: "Creation without connection to nature is just manufacture."

name: The Rack
text: Invented in Mishra's earlier days, the Rack was once his most feared creation.

name: Brighthearth Banneret
text: The banner symbolizes the goodwill of the Brighthearth. Their emissaries bring the mastery of fire to other races.

name: Spell Pierce
text: For all their planning, Tamiyo and Kaito were unprepared to face the full power of a Phyrexian praetor.

name: Nature's Claim
text:
"The timeless, tireless jaws of nature shall one day devour us all."
—Sildark, artificer of Omu

name: Frostveil Ambush
text: Hunters' methods vary from simple and brutal to elaborate and brutal.

name: Worn Powerstone
text: Even a fragment of a powerstone contains within it not just energy, but space—vast dimensions trapped in fragile crystal.

name: Bull's Strength
text: As the iron bars of the portcullis parted like reeds, the defenders of the keep suddenly felt much less secure.

name: Commander's Insight
text: No amount of solitary studying can replace a master's tutelage.

name: Implement of Combustion
text: A dream of fire lies coiled inside, waiting for its glorious awakening.

name: Diviner's Lockbox
text:
"I see it taunting me whenever I close my eyes."
—Nayrex Slipfinger, master thief

name: Restore the Peace
text:
"You can always count on the Azorius to ruin a party."
—Massacre Girl

name: Aether Adept
text: Some mages do their best work in solitude. Others do their best work creating it.

name: Laboratory Brute
text: It keeps intruders out and experiments in.

name: Battle Hymn
text:
"A church is just wood and walls. A congregation is the faithful praising the angels."
—Kolman, elder of Gatstaf

name: Complete Disregard
text:
"We returned to the field and found poor Len, every detail of his final moment perfectly cast in that awful dust."
—Javad Nasrin, outrider captain

name: Akroma, Angel of Wrath
text: "No rest. No mercy. No matter what."

name: Raiyuu, Storm's Edge
text: "The tempest is the only ally I need."

name: Retribution of the Meek
text:
"Tread upon the meek, and they shall wound your feet and make you crawl."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Sigiled Sentinel
text: "Alara has been broken before. I will not let it break again."

name: Mourning Patrol // Morning Apparition
text: "It's creepy out here, isn't it, boy? I always feel like someone's watching us."

name: Tethmos High Priest
text: "Death is tyranny. Like all tyranny, it must be opposed."

name: Highspire Mantis
text: Its wings produce a high-pitched, barely audible whirring sound in flight. Only Jeskai masters are quiet enough to hear one coming.

name: City of Traitors
text:
"While we fought, the il surrendered."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Craw Wurm
text: The most terrifying thing about the Craw Wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

name: Ovalchase Dragster
text: It'll either crash or win the race. Possibly both.

name: Sea Sprite
text:
"No one can catch what won't be caught."
—Kakra, sea troll

name: Crashing Drawbridge
text:
"The Northern Beacon flared, and even before the drawbridge finished its descent, the knights charged out."
—*Legend of the Gilded Knights*

name: Nomad Decoy
text: If you can take something from a nomad, it's probably bait.

name: Lord of the Accursed
text: The Curse of Wandering leaves only hatred.

name: Gerrard's Command
text: "Unless you like the idea of becoming some goblin's lunch, get up and move!"

name: Desperate Farmer // Depraved Harvester
text: Once he'd tasted that dark power, there was no turning back.

name: Sunastian Falconer
text: Sunastian has roots in both sorcery and swordplay; he has learned never to depend too heavily on the latter.

name: Deft Dismissal
text:
"With spy thopters all around, how can the consuls be so blind to Tezzeret's manipulations?"
—Gideon Jura

name: Coiling Oracle
text: Members of the Simic Combine adapt themselves to suit whatever role they feel drawn to.

name: Honorable Scout
text: "I've faced your kind before. This time I'm ready for you."

name: Lotus Petal
text: "Hard to imagine," mused Hanna, stroking the petal, "such a lovely flower inspiring such greed."

name: Hovermyr
text: Originally created to harvest blinkmoths, the hovermyr are now the silent observers of a dying world.

name: Wei Scout
text:
He will win who, prepared himself, waits to take the enemy unprepared."
—Sun Tzu, *Art of War* (trans. Giles)

name: Kambal, Consul of Allocation
text: He has "friends" in places both high and low, and all seem to owe him favors.

name: Overlaid Terrain
text: One must reap before one can sow.

name: Far Traveler
text: You have traveled to many places, over mountains and across seas, but a new journey always calls.

name: Sedge Troll
text: The stench in the hovel was overpowering; something loathsome was cooking. Occasionally something surfaced in the thick paste, but my host would casually push it down before I could make out what it was.

name: +2 Mace
text: The weight of this magic weapon falls heavy on the wicked.

name: Magma Jet
text: Some Akroans make the dangerous pilgrimage to the volcanic temples of Purphoros, where oracles known as flamespeakers glean omens from lava.

name: Skirge Familiar
text: The first Yawgmoth priest to harness their power was rewarded with several unique mutilations.

name: Raze
text: The viashino believe that the oldest mountains hate everyone equally.

name: Deny the Divine
text:
"A great wave crashed, and a mighty wind blew out the stars."
—*The Cosmogony*

name: Unleash Fury
text: Might doesn't make right, but it does win the fight.

name: Zealots en-Dal
text:
"Great chains shall free our warriors."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Tigereye Cameo
text:
"An elvish adventurer unearthed this stone in Jolrael's jungle. Now it's truly fit for display in one of her palaces."
—Isel, master carver

name: Cowardice
text: Gerrard was the Mercadian soldiers' greatest hero; they followed him blindly. When he left, they stumbled around blindly.

name: Brindle Boar
text:
"Tell the cooks to prepare the fires. Tonight we feast!"
—Tolar Wolfbrother, Krosan tracker

name: Chorus of Woe
text: When nightstalkers sing, nothing in creation sleeps.

name: Amorphous Axe
text: A weapon forged for every hand.

name: Rime Dryad
text:
"The Dryads told us to stay, as no new horrors would come when it was so cold. Three of us left anyway. The rest believed their lies, and their skeletons weren't found until the thaw."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Spawning Pit
text: Nothing is wasted on New Phyrexia.

name: River Merfolk
text:
"Dwelling in icy mountain streams near Goblin and Orcish foes, the River Merfolk were known for their stoicism."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. V*

name: Skyhunter Patrol
text:
"They are the first to raise the alarm when the levelers attack, and the first to risk their lives to defend the pride."
—Raksha Golden Cub, leonin kha

name: Familiar Ground
text: More than any other battlefield, the forest gives the advantage to those who know it best.

name: Xenosquirrels
text:
"Hey Glaxxar, did you remember to seal the vents on the seat belt control module?"
—Truss, chief engineer

name: Maraxus of Keld
text:
"I have no master. I am chaos."
—Maraxus of Keld

name: Storm the Vault // Vault of Catlacan
text: Swimming in coins proved harder than they'd hoped, but dancing was a jingling delight.

name: Vendetta
text:
"Consider my debt to your kin paid in full."
—Idrol, Guul Draz assassin

name: Magnifying Glass
text: Knight-Inquisitors of Saint Raban delve deep into mysteries best left unexplored.

name: Nine-Ringed Bo
text:
"We received an anonymous letter suggesting that Kumano holds a secret to defeating the kami, but he is nowhere to be found."
—General Takeno, letter to Lord Konda

name: Epicure of Blood
text: "Fleshy, with just a hint of leather. A fine vintage."

name: Nav Squad Commandos
text: Funded by the Azorius to keep current maps of the undercity, the Boros nav squads survey even the most unsavory areas.

name: Grappling Sundew
text: Some rooftop gardens attract bees; others capture dragons.

name: Bog Raiders
text: Zombies are the perfect marshland fighters—they don't need to breathe and they don't care what they step in.

name: Scythe Tiger
text: Instead of adapting to its environment, it adapts its environment to itself.

name: Jubilant Skybonder
text: She was born unable to walk. Through the *eludha*, she was able to fly.

name: Chief Engineer
text: An eye for detail, a mind for numbers, a soul of clockwork.

name: Argivian Restoration
text:
"The Argivian University taught me two things: always look to the past, and never dismiss what appears useless."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

name: War Chariot
text:
"I wouldn't advise using it with a Woolly Mammoth, but it's quite appropriate for many other beasts."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Herbology Instructor // Malady Invoker
text: "How dare you leave before my lesson is done!"

name: Stonybrook Angler
text: "Water is in the air, the trees, and the earth. Understand its motion, speak its language, and the subtle currents that flow through all living things will fall under your command."

name: Benevolent Bodyguard
text: "My destiny is to save others so their destinies may be achieved."

name: Disappearing Act
text:
"Baral took my family from me back then. I'd do anything to face him now."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Mogg Jailer
text:
Hey, wake up!
—Mogg secret password

name: Horn of Plenty
text:
"This horn is an exact replica of the fabled Horn of Ramos, except mine is more lavish."
—Mercadian magistrate

name: Llanowar Cavalry
text: For the first time, elves welcomed Benalish soldiers into the forest with something other than arrows.

name: Quicksilver Amulet
text: Those who examine the amulet too closely have been known to become part of its ornate carvings.

name: Hinterland Hermit // Hinterland Scourge
text: He tried to live far from those he could hurt . . .

name: Might of Oaks
text:
May your weapon be no sword forged. May your armor be no metal wrought.
—Elvish saying

name: Plated Geopede
text:
"Kor armorers buy the scales and claws. Elf oracles buy the rest."
—Nablus, North Hada trapper

name: Dark-Dweller Oracle
text: Eyes are unnecessary for seeing the future.

name: Curse of Disturbance
text: Sounds of life beckon many a restless soul.

name: Eladamri
text: Proud, shrewd, and charismatic, Eladamri has a commitment to his people that is absolute. The guerilla war he wages against Volrath has convinced him that the only way to liberate the Skyshroud elves is to lead *all* Rath's refugees to freedom. So be it.

name: Megrim
text:
"You can run from your pain, but you will tire before it does."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Wistful Selkie
text: Selkies call to a sea they never swam, in a tongue they never spoke, with a song they never learned.

name: March of the Returned
text: The Returned have no memory of the Underworld or of their former lives. The golden masks they wear are the last gifts of the selves they left behind.

name: Balthor the Stout
text:
"I like to think of him as concentrated barbarian."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

name: Bloodthrone Vampire
text: www.MagicTheGathering.com

name: Regenerate
text: "This wound shall be like the chills of winter: swiftly forgotten when spring shoots rise."

name: Bladebrand
text: "One knife, two knives, three knives, four—which will drop you to the floor?"

name: Blessed Wind
text:
"The fourth wind of ascension is Anointer, deifying the worthy."
—*Keld Triumphant*

name: Ancestral Recall
text: 2013 Vintage Championship Winner

name: Thriving Rats
text: In Ghirapur, even the lowliest residents live in lavish surroundings.

name: Drana, Kalastria Bloodchief
text: "If our former masters would have us kneel again, they shall feel our defiance slashed across their membranes."

name: Aphetto Dredging
text: Phage became both executioner and savior, helping others to the same rebirth she had found.

name: Merfolk Sovereign
text: "We are not an empire, and I am not a queen. But I speak with the shout of the rivers and the whisper of the clinging mist."

name: Blighted Gorge
text: The land is dying, but it will not go peacefully.

name: Peacewalker Colossus
text:
"Peace? Its sole purpose is fear."
—Saheeli Rai

name: Ambition's Cost
text: The waters of wisdom are as dust in the mouth of one who thirsts for power.

name: Ondu Inversion // Ondu Skyruins
text:
"At first rumble you'd best hold on tight and pray to any gods you still hold dear."
—Nys Dal, Sea Gate trapfinder

name: Batterhorn
text: Novice shopkeeps spend hours deciding how best to display their wares. Veterans focus on portability.

name: Corpse Blockade
text: There are laws against it, but the dead have no one to complain to and the living are too frightened to investigate.

name: Thunderfoot Baloth
text:
"Odd. I didn't see any lightning . . . ."
—Herreth, poacher, last words

name: Hunter's Prowess
text: To be counted among the warriors of Setessa's Leina Tower, you must not fear death, only failure.

name: Banisher Priest
text: "Oathbreaker, I cast you out!"

name: Angel of Retribution
text: Bitter vengeance never glowed so bright nor sang so sweet.

name: Sakura-Tribe Elder
text: He'd chosen a sunlit clearing with open skies and an ample brook. All that remained was to find a worthy sapling.

name: Deputized Protester
text: Butcher's training, warrior's heart.

name: Slinking Serpent
text: It winds its way through undergrowth as easily as it swims through shallows.

name: Angelic Page
text: If only every message were as perfect as its messenger.

name: Fanatical Fever
text:
"Let go your fury, and hone your anger. Become the fist of Freyalise!"
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Icatian Town
text: Icatia's once peaceful towns faced increasing attacks from Orcs and Goblins as the climate cooled. By the time the empire fell, they were little more than armed camps.

name: Goblin Chirurgeon
text: The Chirurgeons patched up their fallen comrades with a gruesome mix of twisted limbs and mangled flesh.

name: Avacynian Priest
text: Moorlanders speak in awe of the priests' talent for arriving just in time to drive off the wicked things that prowl the ravished parish.

name: Rotting Regisaur
text:
"Now, *that's* a zombie!"
—Modriss of Zargoth Fen

name: Possessed Skaab
text: A stitcher's attempt at a skaab with a soul.

name: Makindi Stampede // Makindi Mesas
text:
"They say the wind carved out these canyon walls. But the floor was hammered flat by hooves."
—Kreq of Sunder Bay

name: Goblin Snowman
text:
"Strength in numbers? Right."
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

name: Squee
text: The smartest—and only—goblin cabin boy aboard the *Weatherlight*, Squee has learned that intelligence and common sense are very different things. This matters little, however, since he has neither. Fortunately, he doesn't know what he's missing.

name: Hermetic Study
text: "At last! I have discovered a way to weaponize one of Tolaria's most abundant resources: horseshoe crabs."

name: Chandler
text:
"Never brag about the latest wonder you've created, students. Chandler might be listening."
—Reveka, Wizard Savant

name: Blind Creeper
text: It shuns everything except its next meal.

name: Font of Mythos
text: Those who drink from Malfegor's cup are tainted with hunger and stained with lies.

name: Nullmage Shepherd
text: The Skelle spent days carving runes and erecting their scorn poles. The herd crushed them to splinters in seconds.

name: Wall of Brambles
text:
Sleeping in brambles
—Elven phrase meaning "plagued by guilt"

name: Errant, Street Artist
text: Few know her face, but everyone knows her work.

name: Embiggen
text: "Flea circus? No, flee circus!"

name: War Flare
text:
"No sun or fire can warm my blood quite like a war flare."
—Urut Barzeel, Mardu hordechief

name: Marsh Lurker
text: From the mists it rises, into the mists it retreats; through the mists it walks, fearless and unseen.

name: Vorapede
text:
"If you think you've killed one, guess again."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Kwende, Pride of Femeref
text: Descendant of a vanished land, student of a forgotten general, and master of blades no smith could forge anew. He honors them all by living a life worthy of song.

name: Rod of Ruin
text:
"My masterpiece is complete—and so shall be my triumph."
—Saldrath, master artificer

name: Beloved Chaplain
text: Nomad and Nantuko, eagle and elephant; all the birds and beasts are charmed by his quiet dignity.

name: Ghirapur Orrery
text: This detailed model allows the edificers to examine the city from every angle.

name: Corrupt
text: "Most wise, most thoughtful, most powerful qadir," said the Gixian, "we offer whatever help we may give in your illustrious name."

name: Crippling Fear
text: Panic spread like wildfire as the demons of Immersturm poured into Bretagard, slaughtering as they came.

name: Nature's Spiral
text: Snail shell, fern, tornado—the world connects all things in form.

name: Seeker of Slaanesh
text: War is a dance. And they're looking for partners.

name: Keldon Vandals
text: Keldons divide all their spoils into two groups: trophies and catapult ammunition.

name: Cragcrown Pathway // Timbercrown Pathway
text:
"The greatest danger on the path is a failure of nerve."
—Enwor, Sea Gate Expeditionary House

name: Syncopate
text: "Fool! Can't you see the tide has turned against you?"

name: Nephalia Seakite
text:
"Keep one eye on the cliff road or you may fall to your death. Keep one eye on the sky or your death may fall on you."
—Manfried Ulmach, Elgaud Master-at-Arms

name: Rise of the Dark Realms
text: Lock your doors... they're coming home

name: Alpha Guard
text: "Whimsy overflow in sector G! The gremlins are rampaging and the beetles are on fire!"

name: Fear
text:
"Even the bravest of warriors yet knows the dark clutch of fright upon his stalwart heart."
—Lim-Dûl the Necromancer

name: Celestial Purge
text:
"This new chaos confounds us. We must fling it into our winds, our storms. These we can control."
—Bezzit Plar, Esper stormcaller

name: Molten Tributary
text: Though dangerous, Shiv teems with both life and mana, making it a tempting destination for ambitious mages.

name: Blightcaster
text: "Your flesh is unprepared for my gifts."

name: Brokers Veteran
text: One last job before he retires.

name: Skyhunter Cub
text: Every young leonin wishes to become a skyhunter, for they soar closest to the suns.

name: Crackle with Power
text: Will gasped as Rowan drew from the raw power of the Strixhaven Snarl. For a moment, she was luminous, transcendent, terrible.

name: Rhystic Study
text: Friends teach what you want to know. Enemies teach what you *need* to know.

name: Bearded Axe
text: Every dwarven artisan spends the first hundred years of their life forging a single weapon and infusing it with runic magic.

name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
text: Just because they have a club doesn't mean they're organized.

name: Rust Goliath
text:
"You know those seedpods cluttering the eastern approach? I've got an idea . . . ."
—Calle, Urzan sergeant

name: Swell of Growth
text:
"Nissa is not the only one with a deep connection to Zendikar's primal elements."
—Kiora

name: Swan Song
text:
"The most enlightened mages create beauty from violence."
—Medomai the Ageless

name: Karn's Bastion
text:
"I can't protect everyone here. But those I can, I will."
—Karn

name: Yahenni, Undying Partisan
text: "The time for subtlety is over, darling."

name: Merrow Witsniper
text: "The world above the waterline must be monitored—and, when necessary, adjusted."

name: Fling
text: It's raining rats and moggs.

name: Sabertooth Mauler
text:
"I hope the idiot who introduced these creatures to the jungle was their first meal."
—Opar, veteran guide

name: Rushwood Dryad
text: Rushwood is a living jewel that reflects its dwellers' hearts.

name: Hour of Reckoning
text:
"Ravnica, like a hedge, must be pruned, leaving only leaves of verdant uniformity."
—Niszka, Selesnya evangel

name: Supersize
text: You want "mise" with that?

name: Word of Binding
text: "That was the worst experience of my days, standing there helpless as they killed my whole troop." —Maeveen O'Donagh, *Memoirs of a Soldier*

name: Coordinated Assault
text: It's hard to shout "Shields up!" with a javelin in your chest.

name: Stone Rain
text:
"What rainbow could possibly come of this rain?"
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Bloodrock Cyclops
text:
"There are only fifty words in the cyclops language, and ten of them mean 'kill.'"
—Ertai

name: Vampiric Rites
text: For vampires, blood carries more than life. Memories long eroded from the minds of bloodchiefs can be reclaimed from the veins of their sired kin.

name: Gimbal, Gremlin Prodigy
text: You are what you eat, and everything he'd eaten was brilliant.

name: Clear the Stage
text: "Make way! It's time for the final act!"

name: Apostle of Invasion
text: "Be not afraid of the holy chorus. Join in rapturous harmony."

name: Reduce to Ashes
text:
"Before they can go to their final rest, the wicked must be purified by fire."
—Harra the Adjudicator

name: Saruli Caretaker
text: "I hold the seed of our new beginning."

name: Go-Shintai of Lost Wisdom
text: It seeks those driven by curiosity and offers enlightenment.

name: Chandra's Fury
text: "I asked if they wanted to do things the easy way. I meant easy for me."

name: Mad Prophet
text: "There's no heron in the moon! It's a shrew, a five-legged shrew, with a voice like whispering thunder!"

name: Kodama of the South Tree
text:
