"The monks of the South Tree had always reveled beneath their kodama's friendly gaze. During the Kami War, this gaze became fierce and full of hate."
—"Poem of the Five Trees"

name: Briar Hydra
text: Flora and fauna alike rose to Yavimaya's defense.

name: Anticipate
text: Bonder and bonded move in unison, intuiting each other's next move.

name: Thunderfoot Baloth
text: If you hear it, it's too late.

name: Keldon Warlord
text: What if they threw a war, and *everybody* came?

name: Spirit of Malevolence
text: Great evil weighs on the soul.

name: Mage Duel
text: "Remember the rules. No spells to the face!"

name: Goblin Warchief
text: Not since the days of Pashalik Mons have the Rundvelt goblins been so united or effective.

name: Mystic Monastery
text: When asked how many paths reach enlightenment, the monk kicked a heap of sand. "Count," he smiled, "and then find more grains."

name: Iron Lance
text:
"The only way to get Mercadians to fight on the front lines is to give them really long weapons."
—Gerrard

name: Soltari Lancer
text:
"In times of war the victors rarely save their best for last."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Snarling Wolf
text:
"Oh, thank the angels. It's not a werewolf, just a regular wo—"
—Bruno, Ulvenwald guide, last words

name: Air Servant
text:
"Wind is forceful, yet ephemeral. It can knock a dragon out of the sky, yet pass through the smallest crack unhindered."
—Jestus Dreya, *Of Elements and Eternity*

name: Abbey Gargoyles
text:
"Though Serra has not been seen for twenty years, her gargoyles still watch over our city and punish the guilty."
—Gulsen, abbey matron

name: Extinction Event
text:
"Nature is more merciless than any hunter I've ever known."
—Zai, nightsquad captain

name: Cenn's Tactician
text: "A well-trained force brings peace . . . which brings more time for training!"

name: Bladed Bracers
text: Forged from the rubble of the Helvault.

name: Warclamp Mastiff
text:
"One bite from that dog will send you to the healer's tent for days."
—Watchmaster Finn of An Karras

name: Elvish Hunter
text: The Elves never had a standing army; when battle came, they pressed Hunters, Scouts, and Farmers into a surprisingly effective militia.

name: Shield Sphere
text:
"My soldiers know that they need never fear for their protection."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

name: Repel
text:
"I have a hunch we'll be seeing that one again soon."
—Ambassador Laquatus

name: Grapeshot Catapult
text: Recent research suggests these creatures were invented by Urza's and Mishra's original master, Tocasia, and that both brothers used them.

name: Dryad's Favor
text: She grants knowledge of the ways to traverse the forest's invisible connections.

name: Deserter's Quarters
text: In Akros, the penalty for running from battle is one night's stay in the Deserter's Quarters.

name: Disrupt Decorum
text: Dinner and politics don't mix.

name: Ashmouth Hound
text: Its fiery paws make it easy to track, which is very useful when you want to go in exactly the opposite direction.

name: Prodigal Sorcerer
text: He wastes his amazing talents on proving how amazing he really is.

name: Idyllic Tutor
text:
"If one's life is blessed, solutions to all life's problems will appear at the right moment."
—*The Book of Kith and Kin*

name: Dutiful Thrull
text:
"They are useful, but there's little satisfaction in supplication that throws itself under your heel."
—Jozica, Orzhov enforcer

name: Stiltstrider
text: Impossibly tall, improbably elegant.

name: Phyrexian Vault
text:
"The secrets of Phyrexia are expensive. You will pay in brass and bone, steel and sinew."
—Kaervek

name: Doomskar Oracle
text: "Giants and monsters loom on the horizon, and the elves plan to murder our gods!"

name: Lava Storm
text: They say lava conquers all.

name: Arm the Cathars
text: Faith is a cathar's greatest weapon, but a sword of blessed silver is a close second.

name: Juvenile Gloomwidow
text: Gloomwidow venom is particularly virulent during the spider's first years, when it does most of its hunting near the forest floor.

name: Llanowar Dead
text: Just as leaves fall from the branches of a living tree, so too do the dead leave the elfhame.

name: Spire Garden
text: The village's name was long forgotten, its crumbling ruins a monument to the fragility of civilization.

name: Mindslaver
text: It's a helm that leaves the head at its most vulnerable.

name: Goblin Assassin
text: The more victims he kills, the more likely he is to get the right one.

name: Archon of Falling Stars
text:
"The archon fell like a star from the sky, meeting the rising sun at the horizon's edge."
—*The Cosmogony*

name: Gift of Strength
text: The Nessian Wood is never without defenders.

name: Retether
text: The rifts reach into infinite time streams, bringing the divergent products of alternate pasts into the present.

name: By Invitation Only
text: The red envelopes guarantee safe passage through the Lurenbraum barrier. Olivia left strict instructions: no invitation, no entry, no exceptions.

name: Grizzly Bears
text: Don't try to outrun one of Dominia's Grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

name: Gate Hound
text:
"Ditri, I leave this checkpoint in your capable teeth."
—Kitov, nightguard patrol

name: Fortune Teller
text: TODAY'S FORTUNE: ON YOUR DEATHBED, YOU WILL REGRET NOT EATING MORE PIZZA. (This fortune brought to you by our sponsor Saheeli Pie Pizzeria, located on the boardwalk next to Teferi's Time Twister. Bring this fortune to get 15% off any purchase.)

name: Goblin Gathering
text: Two's a party. Three's a felony.

name: Selfless Savior
text: She raised him from an orphaned pup and gave him a life of love. With his last act, he thanked her.

name: Rakdos Guildgate
text:
"My servants take pains for your pleasure, and take pleasure in your pain!"
—Rakdos

name: Silverskin Armor
text: Partisan spies warned that no armor would protect the body from Phyrexian infection. Neurok strategists took that as a challenge.

name: Merfolk Looter
text:
It belongs to the merfolk now.
—Shipwreck prayer

name: Demonic Hordes
text: Created to destroy Dominia, Demons can sometimes be bent to a more focused purpose.

name: Shattered Perception
text:
"You must shatter the fetters of the past. Only then can you truly act."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors

name: Last Kiss
text:
"Romanticize it, glamorize it, call it what you will. To me, it will always be carnal, bloody murder."
—Ayli, Kamsa cleric

name: Woebringer Demon
text: Each soul he devours adds its hunger to his own.

name: Razia's Purification
text: Only the chosen ones are spared.

name: Dread Slaver
text: Half a brain rules the mindless.

name: Tuknir Deathlock
text: An explorer of the Æther, Tuknir often discovers himself in the most unusual physical realms.

name: Vampiric Tutor
text: "I can tell you what you wish to know. But first, there is the matter of my fee."

name: Esper Battlemage
text: She can heal the flesh, or exploit its many weaknesses.

name: Flying Crane Technique
text: There are many Jeskai styles: Riverwalk imitates flowing water, Dragonfist the ancient hellkites, and Flying Crane the wild aven of the high peaks.

name: Sulfur Falls
text: Skirsdag cultists meet behind a waterfall's curtain and plot with demonic forces.

name: Thraben Exorcism
text: Chandra, Teferi, and Arlinn sought clues to the Moonsilver Key's whereabouts while Kaya dispatched the spirits obstructing their path.

name: Debtors' Knell
text: One moment, conscious only of a sense of repose. The next moment, hearing the trudge of his own footsteps. He sighed and squinted into the glare ahead.

name: Brood Monitor
text: The tenderness of a mother. The pity of a mantis.

name: Font of Fertility
text: Drink deep, and know the path to the heart of the wilds.

name: Sage's Row Denizen
text: "I offer you wisdom untainted by false loyalty, learning free of any guild's agenda."

name: Diabolic Intent
text: Gix pierced his disciples' minds and savored their experiences as he took in their knowledge.

name: Ancient Ziggurat
text: Built in honor of Alara's creatures, the ziggurat vanished long ago. When Progenitus awakened, the temple emerged again.

name: Wall of Vapor
text:
"Walls of a castle are made out of stone,/ Walls of a house out of bricks or of wood./ My walls are made out of magic alone,/ Stronger than any that ever have stood."
—Chrysoberyl Earthsdaughter, *Incantations*

name: Bathe in Dragonfire
text: The scent of cooked flesh lingers in the charred landscape of Tarkir.

name: Viashino Cutthroat
text:
"You guys go on ahead. I'll catch up with ya."
—Vark, goblin scout, last words

name: Loyal Gryff
text: Silverstreak had lost her rider, but not her instinct to help humankind.

name: Birds of Paradise
text:
"The gods used their feathers to paint all the colors of the world."
—Yare-Tiva, warden of Gramur forest

name: Urabrask the Hidden
text: When the Mirran resistance arrived, the furnace dwellers looked to Urabrask for guidance. His decree stunned the others: "Let them be."

name: Tidings
text:
"Though the letter was many pages long, I could tell all I needed to know from one look at the messenger's face."
—Barrin, master wizard

name: Soul Parry
text:
"I was called to this world of steel, and it will be my steel that answers."
—Elspeth Tirel

name: Incremental Growth
text:
"Tie a mouse under a bridge, and your cabbages will triple in size."
—Kithkin superstition

name: Leonin Sun Standard
text: The commander tells the troops where to go, but the standard reminds them why they're there.

name: Phyrexian Reclamation
text:
"Your sacrifice has been noted and deemed insufficient."
—Qal-Sha, priest of Norn

name: Southern Elephant
text: Neither predator nor prey, the elephant chooses its place in the battle.

name: Sole Performer
text: Elven tap is the official language of three very obnoxious planets.

name: Trolls of Tel-Jilad
text: "The secret of this world weighs upon us, and we have been shaped by time and duty to bear it."

name: Bassara Tower Archer
text: Setessan warriors of Bassara Tower are known for their guerrilla tactics and skill with the bow. Interlopers into the Nessian Wood do not get far.

name: Mnemonic Wall
text:
"It augments anamnesis. What is so confusing about that?"
—Perisophia the philosopher

name: Skull of Orm
text: Though lifeless, the skull still possessed a strange power over the flow of magic.

name: Return to Nature
text:
"Yes, nature is stronger. You don't see little buildings sprouting on trees."
—Emmara

name: Moment of Triumph
text: "The time of salvation is at hand. Dusk washes over the world, and the Legion will rise immortal!"

name: Lurebound Scarecrow
text: It's a fool's race to run if all is lost if it be won.

name: Kitsune Ace
text: "Oh, sorry—were we racing?"

name: Serpent of Yawning Depths
text:
"Gleams like moonlight on water drew us through the storm and toward our doom."
—Siona, captain of the *Pyleas*

name: Yawning Fissure
text: The mapmaker scowled. He sighed, unrolled his parchment, and painted a large black blob where the Eternal Meadow was once marked.

name: Barbed Shocker
text: Fervid shamans willingly submit to shockers in hopes of glimpsing the fortunes of the future.

name: Homicidal Seclusion
text:
"Damned crows and their endless squawking . . . blocks out the voices in my head . . ."
—Hermit of Hanne Hall

name: Doubling Cube // Doubling Cube
text:
"Freedom is the right of all sentient beings."
—Optimus Prime

name: Force of Negation
text: "Try, if you must."

name: Bilious Skulldweller
text:
"Watch your footing around here. Anything you might step on probably has teeth."
—Kara Vrist, resistance spymaster

name: Sustaining Spirit
text:
"Faith is our greatest protector."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Orcish Veteran
text: Unsuccessful in their early battle for Montford, the orcs quickly tempered their bloodlust with cowardice.

name: Thoughtcast
text: Vedalken eyes don't see the beauty in things. They see only what those things can teach.

name: Prismatic Ending
text: Right before his demise, he experienced a shattering revelation.

name: Enduring Renewal
text: That which lasts longest serves best.

name: Shattered Dreams
text: Victims are lucky if they remember ever having had what was lost.

name: Oracle's Attendants
text: The future isn't sacred, but its speaker is.

name: Memoricide
text: "You claim wisdom, yet I see nothing in here but tawdry wishes."

name: Life Insurance
text: All the money in the world won't buy back a pulse.

name: Evacuation
text:
"Once I supply the breeze, you'll see your warriors for the smoke they truly are."
—Alexi, zephyr mage

name: Aesthir Glider
text:
"Sacrilege! A noble ally in life, made nothing more than a glorified kite in death!"
—Arna Kennerüd, skycaptain

name: Phyrexian Tribute
text:
"In your final breath you still have something to offer Phyrexia."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Displacement Wave
text: The sea respects no boundaries, least of all the coast.

name: Hidden Ancients
text: The only alert the invaders had was the rustling of leaves on a day without wind.

name: Vorel of the Hull Clade
text: "I used to hurl rocks and eat scraps of meat burned over a fire. Look at what I've become and tell me Simic does not hold infinite possibility."

name: Goldmeadow Dodger
text: "I've gotten close enough to a giant to smell his breath, but none has ever so much as spotted me. I wonder how long my record can extend?"

name: Serra Avenger
text:
"Those who endure in the face of suffering, those whose faith shines long in evil days, they shall see salvation."
—*Song of All*, canto 904

name: Changeling Sentinel
text: There's nothing more unsettling than locking blades with something that looks just like you.

name: By Gnome Means
text: There's no race like gnome.

name: Counterflux
text: For a moment, it seemed as if Powder's invention had really worked.

name: Kolaghan Warmonger
text: Conflict is a constant. Only the enemies change.

name: Long-Forgotten Gohei
text: Long ago, the priests would wave the gohei to call down the gods. Now it lies forgotten, but the spirits still feel its pull.

name: Storybook Ride
text: You leave the ride either entertained or an elk. Usually the latter.

name: Incarnation Technique
text: "Draw out your fear, but don't let it control you. You're in charge now."

name: Thalakos Mistfolk
text:
"They are 'between' in every way."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

name: Gluttonous Slime
text: On Jund, everything eventually ends up in something else's stomach.

name: Calming Verse
text: The chattering forest fell silent as the otherworldly song began.

name: Jetmir's Garden
text: The parklike Cabaretti grounds offer rest, food, and the perfect place to shake off a tail.

name: Ravenous Rats
text: Nothing is sacred to rats. Everything is simply another meal.

name: Bane Alley Blackguard
text: "I'm in the field of procurement, and business is good. The guilds want all kinds of maps and relics these days, though what they want them for I'm not quite sure."

name: Sandstorm
text: Ravaged by decades of war, the land struck back with primal, blinding fury.

name: Yawgmoth's Bargain
text: He craves only one commodity.

name: Cave-In
text: One fleet was gone; others were poised.

name: Torrent of Lava
text: The mountain's voice shouts us all down.

name: Aerial Assault
text:
"Oh, you must be mistaken. Hawks are solitary hunters, you see."
—Bunder Diedreck, ornithologist

name: Kaervek's Hex
text:
"If the curse does not strike you dead, question your soul."
—Kaervek

name: Tragic Lesson
text: Though Kefnet's followers feverishly searched his last words for some final riddle, they found only the gurgles of a dying god.

name: Fire-Belly Changeling
text:
"My ears say it hisses. My fingers say it burns."
—Auntie Wort

name: Divine Offering
text: These tears of pain I weep to the skies, Not bitter drops, but water made divine. Each gem of sorrow slips, no longer mine, But proffered thus to echo other cries.

name: Primal Rage
text: "Charge!" A great cry went out, and countless elves and Vec soldiers charged up the mountain. Their fury and passion hid the fact that they were horribly outnumbered.

name: Plummet
text: Scavengers follow in Skysail's shadow, feasting on the carcasses of monsters that attacked the floating city.

name: Overwhelm
text: The Conclave acts with a single will, expressed by countless warriors.

name: Sanctum of Fruitful Harvest
text:
Beneath bright blossoms
Verdant with spring's rich bounty,
The soul blooms in song.

name: Autochthon Wurm
text: The trainer awoke to begin the journey from the wurm's tail to its head. The sun was setting when she arrived.

name: Thwart the Enemy
text:
"Your prey is in my custody now. Withdraw."
—Vivien Reid

name: Dogpile
text: There is no shelter from this storm, its rain of fists, or the thunderous cackles of bloodlust.

name: Fleet-Footed Monk
text: "Hesitation is for the faithless. My belief lends me speed."

name: Air Bladder
text: Random mutations among Rootwater merfolk were common—and disturbing.

name: Make a _____ Splash
text: The largest dunk tank in forty-seven galaxies.

name: Rootpath Purifier
text: "Holiness is not found in a druid's words, or even the rituals of Titania's court. It is found here, in the mud, where Gaea bares her soul, unshackled by ceremony."

name: Myr Moonvessel
text: Memnarch created the myr with three qualities in mind: dependability, controllability, and disposability.

name: Heartbeat of Spring
text: "You were right, Ixalan is a paradise," said Saheeli. "Mostly because you're here."

name: Deadly Dispute
text: "That's a pretty ring! Trade you my knife for it."

name: Sphinx Sovereign
text: "What rises without legs, whispers without a voice, bites without teeth, and dies without having life?"

name: Dryad's Caress
text:
"I awoke to the face of beauty, my body fully healed. In that moment I knew my destiny was the Conclave's to shape."
—Rogad, Selesnya initiate

name: Gideon's Defeat
text:
"Gideon, how easy it must be to play the protector when you think yourself untouchable. How wrong you are."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Addle
text:
"I'll wring out your tiny mind like a sponge."
—Urborg witch

name: Gilt-Leaf Seer
text: Desmera blinded her seers so that her beauty would be the last image burned in their memories. The act only deepened their insight.

name: Manifold Key
text:
"Locks want to be opened, and treasure wants to be free."
—Nayrex Slipfinger, master thief

name: Howl from Beyond
text: Whether it howls for hunger or for joy, you're in trouble just the same.

name: Bloodforged Battle-Axe
text: Spilled blood always begets more of the same.

name: Ambition's Cost
text:
"Conquering your first world is the hardest, after all. My power grew as I moved from world to world, taking anything that would make the next taking easier."
—Ob Nixilis

name: Coursers' Accord
text: Bleak rumors reached Trostani's ears. She decreed that no one should travel alone.

name: Rewind
text: Sometimes you just have to go for it.

name: Mizzium Transreliquat
text:
"What is it? Um . . . what do you *want* it to be?"
—Juzba, Izzet tinker

name: Drudge Beetle
text: The Street Swarm is the labor class that drives the Golgari's endless cycle of life and death.

name: Courier's Capsule
text: In ages past, Esper couriers bore messages written on ornate scrolls. The medium has grown more sophisticated, but the principle remains the same.

name: Lost Hours
text:
"Your thoughts do not interest me nearly as much as the absence thereof."
—Gorghul, augur of skulls

name: Flowstone Wyvern
text:
"Where I come from, stone stays on the ground."
—Tahngarth of the *Weatherlight*

name: Pharika's Chosen
text: The serpents' dens built into statues of Pharika serve not only to consecrate her temples, but as a hidden line of defense.

name: Leafkin Avenger
text: "My roots are ash, my heart a smoldering ember. What I could not protect, I will avenge."

name: Megrim
text: "You can run from your pain," explained Gerrard to Crovax, "but take it from experience: you will tire before it does."

name: Generator Servant
text: Infinite potential given finite form.

name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
text:
"About, about in reel and rout The death-fires danced at night; The water, like a witch's oils, Burnt green, and blue and white."
—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Stonehands
text:
"Trust in the power of stone. Stone is strong; stone shatters swords; stone breaks bones. Trust in stone."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Thalia, Guardian of Thraben
text: "I serve the soft light of the moon that holds back the terrors of the night. I serve the bonds between us, driving out the fear that would break us apart."

name: Roast
text: The wave of lava seared cloth from skin, skin from flesh, and flesh from bone.

name: Khalni Ambush // Khalni Territory
text:
"If you wander into the Khalni Garden without knowing the signs of a scythecat's territory, you're not going to live long enough to learn."
—Raff Slugeater, goblin shortcutter

name: Retract
text:
"Secrets are meant to remain secret."
—Memnarch

name: Coercion
text:
"There's very little that escapes me, Greven. And you will escape very little if you fail."
—Volrath

name: Dreadwing
text: Dreadwings spring from lofty perches to surprise kathari in midflight. They smother their prey and then consume it as they glide gently toward the ground.

name: Wall of Dust
text: An ever-moving swarm of dust engulfs and disorients anything that comes near.

name: Boros Cluestone
text:
"In case of fire, treachery, citywide riot, political upheaval, or worldwide societal collapse, break glass."
—Cluestone inscription

name: Seedborn Muse
text:
"Her voice is wilderness, savage and pure."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte

name: Battle-Rage Blessing
text:
"Since when is it cheating to give one side an unfair advantage?"
—Braids

name: Decimator Web
text: Mycosynth grew unfettered beneath the black lacuna, metastasizing into a matrix of noxious energy.

name: Luminous Bonds
text:
"Article 5.8.2. Ensure proper restraint of any and all arms, legs, claws, jaws, tails, tentacles, and tendrils as appropriate."
—*Azorius Arrester Procedure*, Appendix B

name: Katilda, Dawnhart Prime
text: "The angels may have abandoned us, but Ghrin-Danu has not."

name: Swiftgear Drake
text: Inspired by fishing raptors, Tawnos designed the drake's talons to seize prey with overwhelming speed and precision.

name: Stone Quarry
text: In Gavony, headstones come only from quarries that have been blessed by chaplains.

name: Simic Guildgate
text:
"Mystery is beauty. Within the unknown we plumb revelation."
—Vannifar

name: Kefnet's Last Word
text: In his final moments, Kefnet reached into the minds of those around him, desperate for logic within the consuming chaos.

name: Zalto, Fire Giant Duke
text: Fire giants love to fight on a large scale, and Duke Zalto is one of the greatest warmongers of his age.

name: Order of Leitbur
text: Followers of Tourach regarded all other religions equally: with open contempt. Not so the followers of Leitbur, who made it their mission to eradicate the Order of the Ebon Hand.

name: Adamant Will
text: "I refuse to die before I see the sun rise again."

name: Princess Twilight Sparkle
text: "Friendship isn't always easy, but there's no doubt it's worth fighting for!"

name: Polukranos Reborn // Polukranos, Engine of Ruin
text: Freed from the Underworld, the World Eater resumed his endless feast with reckless enthusiasm.

name: Sunken Hollow
text: On the continent of Tazeem, rushing waters plunge through narrow canyons into mist-cloaked lakes.

name: Leaden Myr
text: The myr are like necrogen: a transformative force unconcerned with the changes they wreak.

name: Consume Spirit
text:
"Your blood, your marrow, your spirit—all are mine."
—Mayvar, minion of Geth

name: Noose Constrictor
text:
"More rope may not be necessary."
—Kep, Lunarch inquisitor

name: Oji, the Exquisite Blade
text: They walk the Path of Kensei with perfect balance.

name: Mind Stone
text: What is mana but possibility, an idea not yet given form?

name: Delraich
text: It wears the souls of its victims like jewels on a chain.

name: Supply-Line Cranes
text: They are trained from hatching to deliver aid where it is needed most.

name: Yavimaya Hollow
text: For all its traps and defenses, Yavimaya has its havens, too.

name: Yedora, Grave Gardener
text: "Even in death, we never stop growing."

name: Consume Spirit
text: Mephidross changes all who dwell there, taking their lives and adding them to its own.

name: Unified Will
text:
"We're glad to be of service—to be an audience to your failure."
—Maizah Shere, Tazeem lullmage

name: Robot Chicken
text: Why did the chicken cross the road? To die in the name of science.

name: Famished Paladin
text: Loyal to his queen, slave to his thirst.

name: Scatter Arc
text: "Should your chosen emissary be able to fluctuate triharmonic pentodes, however unlikely, I shall shunt excess negavolt radicals."

name: Lowland Basilisk
text: Unlike their cousins, Rathi basilisks turn their victims into puddles of flowstone.

name: Compelling Argument
text:
"How can there be doubt in the presence of such blessings?"
—Ukhat, vizier of initiation

name: Elite Guardmage
text:
"Be careful. You'll have more than Dovin to contend with if you hope to breach New Prahv."
—Lavinia, to Chandra Nalaar

name: Hardened Scales
text:
"Naga shed their scales. We wear ours with pride."
—Golran, dragonscale captain

name: Uktabi Efreet
text:
"The Uktabi efreet and I have something in common: both of our mothers wanted to give us back."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Stoic Champion
text: His outer calm belies his inner fury.

name: Bag of Tricks
text: From fuzzy to ferocious in an instant.

name: Venom Sliver
text:
"We attacked with arrows dipped in poison. The slivers that did not die began to change."
—Hastric, Thunian scout

name: Echoing Ruin
text: A single misstep unleashes an avalanche of ruin.

name: Zombie Brute
text: Measure its determination by the screams of its prey.

name: Saddleback Lagac
text:
"A good lagac will carry you through thick and thin. A bad one . . . well, it's a tasty dinner."
—Raff Slugeater, goblin shortcutter

name: Augury Adept
text: Moonstones grant limited foresight but unlimited advantages.

name: Hissing Miasma
text: All that remains when the fog finishes are neat piles of polished bones, like acid-etched glass. Orzhov servants collect them to make altar chimes.

name: Quirion Explorer
text:
Fight with a friend at your back, steel in your hands, and magic in your veins.
—Quirion creed

name: Clay Revenant
text: Tawnos built his clay statues for durability, not knowing they'd keep fighting long after the war.

name: Rhystic Circle
text: The circle buys time—an important commodity in battle.

name: Phyrexian Juggernaut
text: Where nature impedes, Phyrexians overcome.

name: Secret Salvage
text: There is no shortage of illegal salvage in Ghirapur, nor of those who are willing to profit from it.

name: Moorland Drifter
text: It has no apparent purpose or direction. It simply drifts, buoyed by breezes both tangible and otherworldly.

name: Fiery Hellhound
text: There's nothing more exciting than a game of fetch the still-beating heart.

name: Rage Extractor
text: New Phyrexia is an engine that both consumes and creates malice.

name: Mindmoil
text:
"My criticism of the Izzet is that their impulse for learning seems too much like impulse and too little like learning."
—Trigori, Azorius senator

name: Wall of Hope
text:
"What cage would you rather be inside of than out?"
—Daru riddle

name: Warm Welcome
text: "Welcome to the family. Chef Rocco sends their congratulations."

name: Borderland Behemoth
text: Giants share nothing but their fury.

name: Demon of Loathing
text: Hatred is a potent ally, but an insatiable master.

name: Tallowisp
text: Isolated on its little candlewick, the kami never heard of the crime that drove its comrades to war.

name: Fire Giant's Fury
text: So ended the feast, the hall, and the clan.

name: Deadhead
text: "I'm back from the Dead," the zombie moaned. "And they were far out, man."

name: Naiad of Hidden Coves
text:
"Wave-borne, he watches over secrets of the shore."
—Psemilla, Meletian poet

name: Trailblazing Historian
text: Spells once used to traverse Lorehold excavation sites were swiftly repurposed to keep the students one step ahead of the Invasion Tree's grasp.

name: Barren Glory
text:
"The only perfect world is an empty world, with no one to sin or wage war."
—Tarran, magus of the disk

name: Part Water
text:
". . . and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left."
—Exodus, 14:22

name: All Suns' Dawn
text:
"When the fifth sun rose, Mirrodin saw its first true dawn."
—Inscribed on the skin of Thrun, the last troll

name: Bogstomper
text:
"They are gentle herbivores, despite their size. Approach cautiously, and hum a tune to let them know you mean no harm."
—Vivien Reid

name: Putrid Goblin
text: Too stupid to survive, too dumb to die.

name: Scout the Borders
text:
"I am in my element: the element of surprise."
—Mogai, Sultai scout

name: Llanowar Elves
text: Hardened by their life in the haunted Llanowar Forest, these fierce beings are outcasts among elvenkind.

name: Dismal Backwater
text: Armageddon has become a site of holy pilgrimage for the Orks: a planet where the fighting never stops.

name: Syndicate Infiltrator
text: The mansion's vaulted ceilings provided the perfect cover for an ambush.

name: Behold the Unspeakable // Vision of the Unspeakable
text: Even as her students' minds succumbed to madness, Azami's obsession with the kami of forbidden knowledge only grew.

name: Goblin Offensive
text: They certainly are.

name: Winged Words
text: Magic written across the sky falls like rain on thirsty ground, bringing forth wisdom in its season.

name: Naga Vitalist
text: "The lands of the God-Pharaoh are suffused with his breath."

name: Rest in Peace
text: "I will keep watch."

name: Survivors' Bond
text: "And what did we learn? Never taunt a porcuparrot!"

name: Mysterious Tome // Chilling Chronicle
text: The villagers pored through the old storybook, hoping that one of the tales within might hold some clue to saving the fading sun.

name: Elvish Warrior
text: Tan grácil como el ciervo saltando el arroyo y tan mortal como el lobo emboscando del otro lado, los guerreros élficos son los ojos del bosque al igual que sus garras desnudas.

name: Morgue Burst
text:
"Let him in. He's on the list."
—Olrich, Rakdos club owner

name: Lethargy Trap
text: Suddenly, Zurdi didn't care about treasure, glory, food . . . or the drakes circling above.

name: Eiganjo Uprising
text: Two different visions of freedom clashed at the gates of the Imperial Palace.

name: Typhoid Rats
text: Kidnappers caught in Havengul are given two choices: languish in prison or become rat catchers. The smart ones go to prison.

name: Deathbloom Thallid
text:
"Nature is not always gentle or kind, but all life begets life."
—Marwyn of Llanowar

name: Thought Distortion
text:
"The skull is rigid, but the mind is so deliciously supple."
—Eromena the Mind Render

name: Cursed Totem
text:
Pass me from soul to soul / soldier to herder, herder to beast, beast to soil / until I am everywhere. / Then pass me those souls.
—Totem inscription (translated)

name: Akroma's Devoted
text: Akroma asked for only one thing from her troops: unwavering, unconditional loyalty.

name: Volatile Fjord
text:
"I watched with my own eyes as Jari Eagle-Caller fell from these cliffs, only to be snatched from the air by a giant bird!"
—Iskene, Kannah storyteller

name: Guardian of the Ages
text:
"At my feet, invasions end."
—Statue inscription

name: Phyrexian Boon
text:
"Phyrexia's touch is painful to all but the blackest of hearts."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Colossus Hammer
text: "There's only one way to be sure it's really dead."

name: Energy Bolt
text: Life and death are two faces of the same coin.

name: Sewerdreg
text: They hardly have form, dripping through pipe and grate with the slip and stench of flowing sewage.

name: Azorius Arrester
text: "You have the right to remain silent. Mostly because I tire of your excuses."

name: Part the Veil
text: At the waterfall, the border between the humanoid and the spirit worlds was weakest. The kami moved across it with ease and at will.

name: Littjara Glade-Warden
text: In every tree, a restless spirit.

name: Duct Crawler
text:
"Boss told us to try and train 'em. Trained it to attack—it ate Flugg. Trained it to run fast—it got away. Success!"
—Dlig, goblin spelunker

name: Bright Reprisal
text: Vampires know blood and the systems that carry it. And they know exactly where to strike to set it free.

name: Twins of Maurer Estate
text:
"Children, where are your parents?"
—Reig, wandering monk, last words

name: Public Execution
text: Though the executioner did not speak, the villagers got the message.

name: Surrakar Banisher
text: Surrakar grab things they don't want.

name: Straw Soldiers
text: The overnight appearance of miles of "armed" Wu forts at Guangling frightened a much vaster Wei force into fleeing for their lives.

name: Mox Emerald
text: 2021 Vintage Champion

name: Accumulated Knowledge
text:
"Learn not only from the failures of the past, but also from its triumphs."
—Isperia

name: Lava Burst
text:
"Overkill? This isn't a game of Kick-the-Ouphe!"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Andradite Leech
text:
"Older specimens are completely encrusted with gems, which serve as both armor and weapons."
—Tolarian research notes

name: Shinka, the Bloodsoaked Keep
text: The glow from within looks inviting, but woe awaits whomever finds out who stokes the fire or what simmers in the pot.

name: Rise to Glory
text: A hero dies, and a legend arises.

name: Civic Gardener
text: "I've told you knuckleheads a hundred times: You can kill 'em here, but bury the bodies somewhere else. If you disturb my prized azaleas again, you'd better dig a second hole for yourself!"

name: Hamletback Goliath
text:
"If you live on a giant's back, there's only one individual you'll ever need to fear."
—Gaddock Teeg

name: Skullport Merchant
text: "Buy something or move along."

name: Thunderbreak Regent
text: Attracting a dragon's attention may be the last mistake you make.

name: Hipparion
text:
"Someone once said that Hipparions are to Warriors what Aesthir are to Skyknights. Don't believe it."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Vodalian Arcanist
text: The Vodalian Empire tends to be insular. The scholarly Volshe caste are the exception, using education as an antidote to xenophobia.

name: Imperial Edict
text: Frustrated with Cao Cao's control of the imperial court, Emperor Xian secretly issued an edict condemning him, using his own blood as ink.

name: Proficient Pyrodancer
text: When she performed, she was on fire, but in a good way.

name: Telekinetic Sliver
text:
"Slivers are guided only by simple instinct. Advance the hive, and you will be welcomed. Impede the hive, and you will face unrelenting opposition."
—Freyalise

name: Veteran's Voice
text:
"Teach by example. If your students do not survive, they were not worth the lesson."
—General Varchild

name: Soul Nova
text: Within seconds, the nim was consumed in blinding sunfire. Afterwards, only a puddle of molten iron remained.

name: Panic Attack
text:
"What do they see in the throes of panic? I'm not sure I want to know."
—Kezim, prodigal pyromancer

name: Rusted Relic
text:
"We consider rust a curable disease."
—Tarrin, Hammer-Tribe shaman

name: Underworld Connections
text: If you're looking for it, it's available. The question is how much you're willing to pay.

name: Blossoming Sands
text: The Copper Host brought a hideous mockery of new life to Amonkhet's death-cursed desert.

name: Brainstorm
text:
"Infinite ideas flow through the Multiverse, waiting for an open mind."
—*The Biblioplex: An Introduction*

name: Nobilis of War
text:
"A great siege is a banquet to him; a long and terrible battle, the most exquisite delicacy."
—*The Seer's Parables*

name: Bogardan Hellkite
text: Cleansing the world, one breath at a time.

name: Solar Blaze
text:
"The primary weapon is nothing more than light. It shows them what they are, and they burn of their own accord."
—Aurelia

name: Voracious Typhon
text: A typhon's escape from the Underworld makes armies flee and kingdoms fall.

name: Affa Guard Hound
text: Once a welcoming hub for explorers, Affa became a place of guarded tongues and quick defenses.

name: Anger
text:
"For its time as a mortal, Anger chose a shell of boiling rock."
—Scroll of Beginnings

name: Pack Mastiff
text: Their loyalty is not to any master, but to the pack.

name: Edgar, Charmed Groom // Edgar Markov's Coffin
text: "Our kind has taken my gift for granted. It is time to correct that folly."

name: Phyrexian Revoker
text:
"To be in the presence of a revoker is to be truly alone."
—Kara Vrist, Neurok agent

name: Resistance Fighter
text:
"My soldiers fought without hesitation, died without doubt."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Zur the Enchanter
text: "Now they always say 'Congratulations'"

name: Angel of the Dire Hour
text: She arrived like a meteorite, and the enemy fell in a shock wave of holy vengeance.

name: Back to Nature
text:
"Nature is a mutable cloud which is always and never the same."
—Ralph Waldo Emerson, *Essays*

name: Baral, Chief of Compliance
text: In light of his zealous defense of Kaladesh, the Consulate was willing to overlook any previous transgressions.

name: Daybreak Combatants
text: After weeks of unending darkness, a glimpse of dawn was all the people of Stensia needed to rekindle their will to fight.

name: Devastation Tide
text: It's hard to argue with a force made of divine will.

name: Nature's Lore
text: "Greetings, tired traveler."

name: Aether Tide
text: The tide of magic brought them here. Now it would take them home.

name: Pendrell Flux
text: Devoured by the mists, Tolaria was stuck in time, trapped between two eternal heartbeats.

name: Sharuum the Hegemon
text: To gain audience with the hegemon, one must bring a riddle she has not heard.

name: Sanctify
text:
"Olivia Voldaren has faith only in herself. We answer to a higher calling."
—Thalia, Guardian of Thraben

name: Annul
text:
"Many giants have tried to crush me with their hammers. You'll never stop me with that little toy."
—Stigur of the Omenseekers

name: Abeyance
text:
"I'm too modest a wizard to reveal the full extent of my abilities."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Sunhome Stalwart
text: "Before I let you wield one of these, let's see you dodge one!"

name: Void Snare
text:
"I've tried so many variations on how to get rid of annoying things that it's hard to decide which one I like best."
—Ashurel, voidmage

name: Goblin Chariot
text: The hardest part of his training is learning not to eat the boar.

name: Blood Artist
text: "Great art can never be created without great suffering."

name: Fugitive Wizard
text:
"The law has its place—as a footnote in my spellbook."
—Siyani, fugitive mage

name: Kruin Striker
text: Unhappy with the creation of the wolfir, Rorica broke with her order and led a crusade against the "reformed werewolves."

name: Aetherblade Agent // Gitaxian Mindstinger
text: The Consulate of Kaladesh had always valued his particular talent for extracting information . . .

name: Stormchaser Mage
text: Roilmages' tactics are as chaotic as the energies they channel.

name: Ramosian Lieutenant
text: "Give me your hand and I will give you victory."

name: Order of the Ebon Hand
text: A true follower of Tourach took pride in achievement to the exclusion of other concerns.

name: Darksteel Relic
text:
"It's the last thing we can call our own."
—Minhu, Mirran resistance

name: Sharding Sphinx
text: Whether mechanical or biological, life finds a way to propagate itself.

name: Necromancer's Assistant
text: Zombies and necromancers agree: easy access to brains is preferred.

name: Reality Hemorrhage
text: Tarek could not tell whether he was losing his blood or his mind.

name: Kazandu Mammoth // Kazandu Valley
text:
"It doesn't obey me. It cooperates with me."
—Triel, Kazandu tuskcaller

name: Kessig Wolfrider
text: "It's a perfect partnership. My village is safe from wolf attacks, and she gets to eat any vampires we catch."

name: Extinction
text:
"I once had an entire race killed just to listen to the rattling of their dried bones as I waded through them."
—Volrath

name: Learn from the Past
text:
"I've been told my whole life that the great Ojutai holds all knowledge, but I wonder what our forebears knew."
—Narset

name: Azorius Keyrune
text:
"The higher the mind soars, the greater its understanding of the law."
—Isperia

name: Spined Thopter
text:
"I appreciate the depravity of noble designs turned to devious ends."
—Tezzeret

name: Keening Apparition
text: Some souls are too damaged to be of use to the Orzhov.

name: City of Brass
text:
"Enter this palace-gate and ask the news
Of greatness fallen into dust and clay."
—*The Arabian Nights*, trans. Burton

name: Decimate
text: Tormented by her own existence, Karona turned her wrath on the world that had birthed her.

name: Victory Chimes
text: The favored noisemaker of goblins ever since the wardens cracked down on explosives.

name: Sanctum of Eternity
text: Come and rest here, beyond the constraints of space and time.

name: Way of the Thief
text: A true shortcut isn't a way other people don't know; it's a way other people can't go.

name: Stormchaser Drake
text:
"Blasted drake's interfering with the conductivity again. Garl! Go chase it away."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

name: Tin Street Hooligan
text: "Rauck-Chauv's like a holiday! Only it isn't on the calendars, and instead of dancing you knock people flat, and instead of giving gifts you break stuff."

name: Horrible Hordes
text: Few are able to underestimate the hordes.

name: Benalish Infantry
text:
"My favorite part of getting into the infantry was getting out again."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Centaur Omenreader
text: The wisdom of the omenreaders is legendary. Creatures travel for miles through icy peril to seek their counsel.

name: Wind Drake
text:
"But high she shoots through air and light, Above all low delay, Where nothing earthly bounds her flight, Nor shadow dims her way."
—Thomas Moore, "Oh that I had Wings"

name: Thunder Dragon
text: Sometimes primitive cultures attributed natural phenomena to monsters. Sometimes they were right.

name: Rishadan Cutpurse
text:
The bigger the purse, the greater the fool.
—Rishadan saying

name: Silverfur Partisan
text: Silverfurs are the last remaining wolfir.

name: Neurok Prodigy
text: "Why should I be bound by rules when I can see so far beyond them?"

name: Scuttling Butler
text: Porter, cleaner, and bouncer all in one.

name: Premature Burial
text:
"This soil knows well the taste of the dead. Give it the hunger for a living meal, and it can become a deadly ally."
—Ezrith, druid of the Dark Hours

name: Forgestoker Dragon
text: The Akroans fashion their helms to honor the dragons, not to protect against them, as that would be of little help.

name: Goblin Mountaineer
text: Goblin lairs sit high in Jund's mountains. This gives the goblins easy access to the sacrificial peaks above and lets them build up a head of steam before attacking prey down below.

name: Mesa Enchantress
text: She shepherds mysteries and dust as others would a flock of sheep.

name: Prologue to Phyresis
text: "Please, for science, tell me how it feels. Leave nothing out."

name: Azorius Herald
text:
"As peace should be—gentle yet unstoppable."
—Augustin IV

name: D'Avenant Archer
text: Avenant's archers are also trained as poets, so that each arrow is guided by a fragment of verse.

name: My Laughter Echoes
text: "Groveling already? I'm just starting to enjoy myself."

name: Skirk Prospector
text:
"I like goblins. They make funny little popping sounds when they die."
—Braids, dementia summoner

name: Bloodsworn Steward
text: "My liege will lead and I will follow—to the battlefield, to the grave, and beyond."

name: Adventurous Impulse
text:
"Her quest began as all quests do, with one small step in an unexpected direction."
—*The Explorer's Testament*

name: Skyship Plunderer
text: Escapes should always be daring.

name: Ridgeline Rager
text: While armies battled across Jamuraa, beasts stalked the high places looking for victims.

name: Deathcurse Ogre
text: After their worship of oni began, only a few of Kamigawa's ogres remained in the bitter cold of the Tendo Peaks. Most were drawn to the darkness of Takenuma.

name: Skyhunter Patrol
text:
"We leonin have come to rule the plains by taking to the skies."
—Raksha Golden Cub

name: Stranglehold
text:
"Control the Halo and you control the whole city."
—Jetmir

name: Swaggering Corsair
text: "I'm about to make you famous. From the golden city to High and Dry, they'll talk about how fast you died!"

name: Incremental Blight
text: Shadowmoor's main crops are rot, slime, and despair.

name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
text: The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt Goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.

name: Spinny Ride
text:
"The ship spinning out of control was spot-on, but no one shouting, 'Nebula! You fell asleep again!' or openly weeping? Too unrealistic."
—Captain Rex Nebula

name: Loxodon Anchorite
text: The loxodon ascribe religious superiority to those born albino, believing them to be spiritually pure.

name: Ravenous Demon // Archdemon of Greed
text: "The price is paid. The power is mine!"

name: Skyclave Pick-Axe
text: For use on cliffs and other faces.

name: Horobi, Death's Wail
text:
"Wherever it went, death came to Phyrexians and Kamigawans alike."
—Records of the Living Historians

name: Harbor Bandit
text: He always drops a little trinket into the bay as thanks to the merfolk who taught him all his best tricks.

name: Luminous Bonds
text: "Your part in this fight is done, vampire. Get used to your thirst."

name: Storm-Kiln Artist
text: A captured elemental makes for a potent, albeit unstable, power source.

name: Voice of Truth
text:
"Above them all is Truth, and Truth must be set free. If the wings of Truth are clipped, the voices will fall silent."
—*Song of All*, canto 167

name: Witch of the Moors
text: Many hands for many evils.

name: Tightening Coils
text: Having gone to the trouble of stealing a bident from a god on another world, Kiora was eager to test its capabilities.

name: Feral Contest
text: The instinct for survival makes enemies of all.

name: Thrashing Brontodon
text: It cares more about preserving the herd's territory than about preserving itself.

name: Reap the Past
text: The ground cracked and unleashed a thousand years of history at once.

name: Tormenting Voice
text: Kargan tribal lands rarely have issues with goblin raids. Coincidentally, they also rarely have issues keeping their dragons fed.

name: Inferno of the Star Mounts
text: The ancient dragon Imvaernarhro has earned his fiery nickname.

name: Condemn
text:
"No doubt the arbiters would put you away, after all the documents are signed. But I will have justice now!"
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage

name: Spirit Weaver
text: "Let my hope be your shield."

name: Tandem Takedown
text:
"I take no pleasure in this, but Vadrok might."
—Vivien Reid, to Lukka

name: Channel
text:
"As long as you are breathing, you always have something more to give."
—Valentin, Witherbloom dean

name: Swamp
text: The old wizard's experiments destroyed the castle centuries ago. So why does some of the rubble look recent?

name: Mindstatic
text:
"It's always satisfying to stymie the best efforts of a rival, but the reactions of the Gruul are particularly amusing."
—Bori Andon, Izzet blastseeker

name: Goblin Grappler
text: Daru soldiers learned it's better to have a clean death from a sharp blade than to tangle with a goblin's rusted chains.

name: Captive Weird // Compleated Conjurer
text: Izzet researchers agreed to keep the unusual weird contained until they understood the extent of its powers.

name: Perilous Predicament
text: Comrades in life. Comrades in death.

name: Mathas, Fiend Seeker
text: "All will know of your crimes."

name: Diabolic Tutor
text: The best ideas often come from the worst minds.

name: Path of Anger's Flame
text:
"Walking the path of the kami only leaves you with singed feet."
—Soratami saying

name: Olivia's Dragoon
text: Displays of Voldaren bloodlust are not restricted to glamorous banquets and lavish parties.

name: Platinum Angel
text: She is the apex of the artificer's craft, the spirit of the divine called out of base metal.

name: Woodland Stream
text: Countless streams flow into the nine rivers, and the nine rivers flow into the Great River. The River Heralds guard them all.

name: Fate Transfer
text:
"The cinders find strength in suffering, the elves in beauty. But if you make an elf suffer, he gets weaker. I wonder what happens if you make a cinder beautiful?"
—Hrugash, leech bonder

name: Frontier Bivouac
text: Disillusioned with the Imperium, the population of Chancer's Vale turned to other, hungrier powers for meaning.

name: Carven Caryatid
text: So-called "old wood" is rare in deforested Ravnica. Statues carved from it are said to house the last of the ancient nature spirits.

name: Gods Willing
text: Honor the gods of Theros, and they will return the favor.

name: Hobbling Zombie
text:
"I see someone tried to stop you, my pet. How delightful."
—Ghoulcaller Gisa

name: Cogwork Spy
text: Paliano's creations provide ample opportunities to plot the downfall of a neighbor.

name: Fluxcharger
text: One part mizzium, two parts elemental energy, eleven parts danger.

name: Overrun
text: Nature doesn't walk.

name: Gruesome Slaughter
text: Though Gideon arrived at Sea Gate too late to prevent the massacre, he still had enough time to lead its survivors to relative safety.

name: Gaseous Form
text:
". . . [A]nd gives to airy nothing/ A local habitation and a name."
—William Shakespeare, *A Midsummer-Night's Dream*

name: Trash Bin
text: To be honest, it's not much dirtier than the ball pit.

name: Chaos Confetti
text: And you thought that was just an urban legend.

name: Wojek Embermage
text: "Your brother's crimes are your crimes. You stood by and lent support, so you too must face judgment."

name: Nomad Outpost
text:
"Only the weak imprison themselves behind walls. We live free under the wind, and our freedom makes us strong."
—Zurgo, khan of the Mardu

name: Sinister Sabotage
text:
"We have intel that some guilds have fallen under an invader's influence. Until we're sure, no venture succeeds."
—Lazav

name: Pull from Tomorrow
text:
"I do things in my own time."
—Etha, initiate of Rhet crop

name: Backup Plan
text: "In the market for an alternative, friend?"

name: Grim Tutor
text: nothing is sacred.

name: Sunder
text: The flow of time was disrupted; like a flooding river it rose from its banks. Tolaria was drowned in an instant that stretched toward infinity.

name: Swordwise Centaur
text:
The girl who would become the Champion of the Sun hacked furiously at the practice dummy. At last she stopped, breathing heavily, and looked up at her instructor. "So much anger," said the centaur. "I will teach you the ways of war, child. But first you must make peace with yourself."
—*The Theriad*

name: Disciple of the Vault
text: He stands in the shadow of his lord, Geth, drinking in the dark energies of the Vault.

name: Memory Lapse
text: "Eri phar phesta . . . um, phistor . . . er, phistara . . ."

name: Blitz Leech
text:
"Fools wear armor against it as if the worst it could take is your blood."
—Gavi, nest warden

name: Feroz's Ban
text: Feroz is gone, but what remains is his final gift to his people: the right to be left alone.

name: Basal Thrull
text:
Although my later designs were much more sophisticated, Basal Thrulls were no less a success."
—Endrek Sahr, "Thrulls"

name: Cloaked Siren
text:
"That is not the voice of the wind singing on the stones."
—Callaphe the mariner

name: Bone Dragon
text: Its roar is the clatter of a thousand bones.

name: Mirror Image
text: "Do I really look like that? I'm . . . beautiful!"

name: Lava Axe
text: Swing your axe as a broom, to sweep away the foe.

name: Scare Tactics
text:
"Fear rules those weak enough to accept it."
—Greven *il*-Vec

name: Goblin Chariot
text: They have to replace the wheels, they have to replace the boar, and sometimes they have to replace the goblin.

name: Vertigo
text:
"I saw the wizard gesturing, but I didn't guess his plan until my Aesthir cried out and went into a dive."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

name: Vraska's Contempt
text: It wasn't long before the taverns of High and Dry were full of whispers about the new captain who could turn a person to stone with a glance.

name: Chance Encounter
text: The more unlikely the victory, the more memorable the success.

name: Chaosphere
text:
"I dance the nothing dance, / Feet in the air, knives in the ground."
—Femeref chant

name: Shoal Kraken
text: It eats the things that eat the things that are drawn to the light.

name: Alesha, Who Smiles at Death
text: "Greet death with sword in hand."

name: Runaway Trash-Bot
text: One day it might roll over your foot, the next day your entire house.

name: Jazal Goldmane
text:
"As my kha, he is the source of my inspiration. As my brother, he is the embodiment of my aspirations."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Hobgoblin Captain
text: Hobgoblins do not fear death, for those who fall in battle have gained glory eternal.

name: Dovin's Automaton
text: It was made for battle, but that doesn't mean it's unsophisticated.

name: Apprentice Necromancer
text: A mage willing to dedicate his life to his craft.

name: Demon's Grasp
text:
"Take what solace you can in the knowledge that you will not be here to witness Zendikar's demise."
—Ob Nixilis

name: Keening Stone
text:
"The new prototype utilizing a rotational axis is marvelously effective: it makes me want to tear my own ears off."
—Ashnod, to her assistants

name: Assault Strobe
text: When breaking someone's face once just isn't enough.

name: Regeneration
text:
"A touch of vine sap in the blood, and the flesh knits as quickly as new roots twining."
—Freyalise

name: Liliana's Triumph
text: Her triumph came not from escaping her death, but in claiming her independence.

name: Sunblade Angel
text: At Feather's command, squadrons of battle angels swarmed out of the *Parhelion II*, unsheathing blades made of molten dawn.

name: Noble Elephant
text:
"Proud am I, / strong am I, / courageous in defending my children / and fierce in punishing what stands in my way."
—"So the Elephant Speaks," Zhalfirin song

name: Negate
text:
"Eventually, everything returns to silence."
—Zarra, lullmage

name: Throne of Empires
text:
"With this throne, unite your nation."
—Throne inscription

name: Secret Rendezvous
text: Strixhaven's five colleges encourage natural rivalries among the students, but some bonds transcend all barriers.

name: Thran Golem
text: The golems of the ancient Thran still draw power in ways that baffle the artificers of today.

name: Ribbon Snake
text: All snakes slither. Only this one soars.

name: Evil Eye of Urborg
text:
"Edahlis, what *is* that thing? We should have stayed in Yavimaya . . . ."
—Aznaph, greenseeker

name: Flagstones of Trokair
text: Dust-spiked winds eroded the stones, but the ground where they had stood still holds power.

name: Explore
text: The Tyranids advance inexorably across the galaxy in their living Hive Ships, with one singular goal: to consume all.

name: Thrill of Possibility
text: "Reality is always much duller and grayer than what your imagination can conjure."

name: Silver Scrutiny
text: Karn's creation allowed him to monitor events across Dominaria—and everything he saw worried him.

name: Moonglove Winnower
text: Winnowers live to eliminate eyeblights, creatures the elves deem too ugly to exist.

name: Skittering Skirge
text: The imps' warbling cries echo through Phyrexia's towers like those of mourning doves in a cathedral.

name: Woodborn Behemoth
text: It carries the hopes of Zendikar's embattled wilds on its mighty boughs.

name: Foundry Helix
text: Steel never forgets the strike of the forge.

name: Elvish Pathcutter
text: In harsh times, the strongest currency is cooperation.

name: Witch's Oven
text: The wafting smells are both scrumptious and suspicious.

name: Hobblefiend
text: Bedbugs aren't the only things you need to worry about biting you at night.

name: For the Emperor!
text: They all took up the cry, the missionaries, the pilgrims, the sisters of the Orders Militant. The forces of Chaos melted before the fire of their faith.

name: Spurnmage Advocate
text: "Our unity humbles our foes."

name: Eliminate
text:
"It takes so little energy to erase a person. It's almost like the universe doesn't care that they existed at all."
—Extus Narr

name: Prodigal Sorcerer
text: Occasionally members of the Institute of Arcane Study acquire a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

name: Vengeance
text:
"It is the duty of the strong to oppose any who threaten the weak."
—The Southern Paladin

name: Anurid Scavenger
text: Krosa's topmost bottom feeder.

name: Skyscribing
text:
"All clouds should be so organized."
—Isperia

name: Wrangle
text: Gremlins are loyal to nothing but their next meal.

name: Baral, Chief of Compliance
text: "The echo of silence is music to my ears."

name: Nucklavee
text: It loathes all tastes but two: spells and flesh.

name: Maze of Ith
text:
"Let the interlopers scurry like trapped rats until they exhaust themselves. They are no threat to us."
—Ith, High Arcanist

name: Temple Garden
text: In the gardens of the Conclave, order and beauty are the roots of power.

name: Noble Purpose
text: Fighting for the right reason is itself a source of strength.

name: Organ Hoarder
text: The stitcher died years ago, but her dutiful assistant still keeps the laboratory well stocked.

name: King Harald's Revenge
text: "We will destroy the pretenders and reclaim the divinity of the Einir."

name: Nurturing Peatland
text: New life is born within its shadows.

name: Punish the Enemy
text:
"When justice descends, the servant will burn with the master."
—Aurelia

name: Zombie Fanboy
text: The real advantage of being a zombie gamer? No one notices the stench.

name: Stir the Grave
text:
"Your lungs may not draw breath, but while your hands can grip a sword, you will be useful to me."
—Nighteyes, nezumi necromancer

name: Fertilid's Favor
text: The denizens of Lorwyn were accustomed to resisting darkness.

name: Frantic Search
text: It took the banning of temporal manipulation at Tolaria West to teach its students the value of time.

name: Eager Construct
text: Loyal to a fault, it anticipates its master's every need.

name: Beacon of Immortality
text: The cave floods with light. A thousand rays shine forth and meld into one.

name: Symbol of Unsummoning
text:
". . . inviting the soul to wander for a spell in abysses of solitude . . . ."
—Kate Chopin, The Awakening

name: Pyroclasm
text:
"Leaves more room for the big ones to fight in, you know."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Everlasting Torment
text: When night fell, the plane itself was scarred.

name: Shock
text: The tools of invention became the weapons of revolution.

name: Kitsune Riftwalker
text: The wake of his passage shoved aside the influence of the kami.

name: Basandra, Battle Seraph
text: "Why listen to the mumblings of wizards when the lash speaks true?"

name: Dragon Whelp
text: "O to be a dragon . . . of silkworm size or immense . . ." —Marianne Moore, "O to Be a Dragon"

name: A-Lier, Disciple of the Drowned
text: Beneath the waves, lost gods stir in their slumber.

name: Elvish Visionary
text: "From a tiny sprout, the greatest trees grow and flourish. May the seeds of your mind be equally fruitful."

name: Platinum Angel
text: In its heart lies the secret of immortality.

name: Fire Servant
text:
"Elemental fire shimmers with rose hues and, unlike terrestrial blazes, smolders long after it's extinguished."
—Jestus Dreya, *Of Elements and Eternity*

name: Battle Rampart
text:
"I will build no sanctuaries. The safety you seek can be won only by the sword."
—Yannash, outpost builder

name: Incite Hysteria
text:
"The Boros say they want to bring order to Ravnica. Funny then, how well they use chaos."
—Trigori, Azorius senator

name: Rorix Bladewing
text: In the smoldering ashes of Shiv, a few dragons strive to rebuild their native land. The rest seek any opportunity to restore the broken pride of their race.

name: Benevolent Ancestor
text: Although the door is flimsy and the lock pathetically small, Josuri's family never fears the night outside.

name: Nema Siltlurker
text: In one gargantuan bite, it will swallow not only you but also the riverbank you were standing on.

name: Rona, Sheoldred's Faithful
text: While many fought valiantly to preserve humanity, Rona wished only to strip hers away.

name: Corpse Appraiser
text: "Scarcely a mark. A true work of art!"

name: Faith Healer
text: The power of faith is quiet. It is the leaf unmoved by the hurricane.

name: Transmogrify
text: "I'd like to introduce you to the new and improved me."

name: Grumgully, the Generous
text: "Does it matter what it is? Take it and be grateful!"

name: Pilgrim of Justice
text: "I would die a thousand deaths before I let you harm another."

name: Thicket Basilisk
text: Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the Basilisk's power.

name: Scour All Possibilities
text: Searching the future for answers often leads to further questions.

name: Dispersing Orb
text:
"Like the seas, the Æther is fickle and ever-changing. If we can control one, we can master the other."
—Riptide Project director

name: Pheres-Band Centaurs
text:
"Poets speak of your unrivaled speed," the Champion said to the assembled centaurs, "but it is plain to see that your true strength lies in your unwavering loyalty to one another."
—*The Theriad*

name: Cabal Ritual
text: The Patriarch is long dead, but his name still stains the lips of cultists.

name: Mahadi, Emporium Master
text: "Welcome to the Wandering Emporium. Feel free to browse the bazaar. We have everything a lost soul could want, need, or afford."

name: Axebane Beast
text:
"Imagine a gigantic pine cone that's extremely territorial and always in a foul mood."
—Zhosmir, urban huntmaster

name: Disdainful Stroke
text:
"The skald boasted that he could outsing the sea. Cosima heard him, and drowned his village with a single wave."
—*Longbeard Saga*

name: Barkchannel Pathway // Tidechannel Pathway
text:
"Trust in the path, and it will bear you to safety."
—Inga Rune-Eyes

name: Orcish Farmer
text:
"Yes, the farmers keep our soldiers fed. But why do they have to make every battlefield a pigpen?"
—Toothlicker Harj, orcish captain

name: The Surgical Bay
text: In Jin-Gitaxias's domain, strange and terrible experiments iterate toward perfection, unbound by ethics.

name: Wild Hunger
text: Otto the Hunter was filled with many grand ambitions. The snake was filled only with Otto.

name: Blazing Blade Askari
text: "This can't be Jamuraa. We could not have failed her this badly . . . ."

name: Unsummon
text:
"It's nothing personal. I'd just prefer if you weren't."
—Ashurel, voidmage

name: Death Wind
text:
"I am a dragonslayer for Lord Silumgar. There is no dragon save him whom I fear."
—Xathi the Infallible

name: Marble Titan
text:
"Strapping on nine hundred pounds of armor every morning would make any warrior cross."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Due Respect
text:
"A display of humility is required of those who still possess such frailties."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

name: Birds of Paradise
text: Long ago, birds of paradise littered the skies. Thanks to the city's sprawl, most now exist as pets of society's elite.

name: Spoils of Blood
text:
"There are always leftovers."
—Derecht, flesh carver

name: Dwarven Soldier
text:
"Let no one say we did not fight until the last . . . ."
—Headstone fragment from a mass grave found in the Crimson Peaks

name: Guardians of Oboro
text: "The palace is closed to outsiders."

name: Skyshroud Vampire
text:
"If it tastes one drop of elvish blood I will cast it from the shroud to see it burn."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Hibernation
text: On its way to the cave, the armadillo brushed by a sapling. It awoke to find a full-grown tree blocking its path.

name: Noggle Ransacker
text: Noggles live purely by what they can scavenge. There is not a single thing a noggle eats, wears, or uses that did not once belong to another.

name: Empty the Pits
text: The Sultai would rebuild the empire on the backs of the dead.

name: Fyndhorn Elder
text: "It is useful to be able to speak to the trees. But it is truly wondrous to be able to listen to them."

name: Standing Troops
text: They fight so closely together a mouse couldn't slip past their guard.

name: Loose Lips
text: Your sentence can't be longer than this one.

name: Pitfall Trap
text: Each spike is poisoned—the trapmaker's idea of mercy.

name: Griffin Protector
text: The drums of war stir the hearts of all who fight for righteousness.

name: Ghostly Flame
text:
"Walk slowly when in the nether world, and seek that which calls."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Scissors Lizard
text: Nothing beats the lizard's shear power.

name: Otepec Huntmaster
text: "Forward! Let the Burning Sun's light guide you to deserving prey!"

name: Pyromancer's Goggles
text:
"I hope to meet Jaya Ballard someday. I think we'd get along."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Inspiring Statuary
text:
"In the early days, Urza's wondrous automatons were seen as symbols of hope and courage."
—*The Antiquities War*

name: Chain Devil
text: To these fiends, there's no symphony more beautiful than the melodies of rattling chains and ripping flesh.

name: Rat in the Hat
text: While the gremlin, beeble, and squirrel infestations wrecked havoc on the park, Roxi was able to spin the numerous rat colonies as a "robust recycling program."

name: Flashfreeze
text:
"Nature? Fire? Bah! Both are chaotic and difficult to control. Ice is structured, latticed, light as a feather, massive as a glacier. In ice, there is power!"
—Heidar, Rimewind master

name: Spire Garden
text: From thrilling combat to unparalleled vistas, Valor's Reach has it all.

name: Burn Away
text:
"Your corruption will burn, serpent, until there is nothing left to defile."
—Asmala, bloodfire mystic

name: Wild Guess
text: No guts, no glory.

name: Heart of Light
text:
"There is a shining in the mortal heart that even the kami cannot reach."
—Sensei Golden-Tail

name: Mournful Zombie
text: Treated with a powerful mix of herbs and potions, its wrappings have a remarkable preservative effect, even for the living.

name: Mortus Strider
text: Dimir's best agents hide from death itself.

name: Valor
text:
"The cracks widened, the shell crumbled, and Valor spread throughout the land."
—*Scroll of Beginnings*

name: Harrier Griffin
text: Moon Market merchants sell a bottled scent to cutpurses and other criminals. Those doused in the liquid become "griffin bait."

name: Fugitive Wizard
text: The College of Lat-Nam is often forced to expel students whose experiments grow too risky or too cruel.

name: Angelic Purge
text: "We must save you from yourselves."

name: Sundering Titan
text:
"Give the schematic to the younger brother. Tell him that it will surely keep Argoth's resources out of Urza's hands."
—Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

name: Marauding Boneslasher
text: With the Hekma destroyed, the wandering dead that sought entrance to Naktamun had free rein to lay waste to the city.

name: Azra Bladeseeker
text: "Never get too attached to a weapon. You must allow a better one to find its way to you."

name: Mage's Attendant
text: Crime sometimes makes unlikely allies into lifelong friends.

name: Eye of Nowhere
text:
"Once we prayed to the kaijin for safe voyage. Now we only pray that we can escape their gaze."
—Hayato, master sailor

name: Empyreal Voyager
text: "For years, I studied the aethersphere from afar, but it was not until I touched the aether for myself that I came to know the power contained in the swirling sky."

name: Smoldering Marsh
text: The continent of Guul Draz is a geothermal swampland reeking of heat and decay.

name: Azorius Locket
text:
"Mandatory lockets enable the tracking of all Senate personnel for improved security and efficiency."
—Dovin Baan

name: Vedalken Blademaster
text: Vedalken have six thin, agile fingers on each hand, giving them unparalleled dexterity.

name: Torpid Moloch
text: Market hucksters sell molochs for use as watchdogs. Of course, that's all molochs do. Sit around . . . and watch.

name: Fencer Clique
text:
You may as well try to swat a faerie
—Flamekin expression meaning "that's impossible"

name: Heliod's Pilgrim
text: The blessings of Heliod are apparent for all to see.

name: Orb of Dreams
text:
"Behind the eyelids, a flickering flame. Beneath the dream, a flickering sorrow. Can peace find you in this sleep When all the world is tossed by war?"
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Dragon Roost
text: A powerful mage created the roost to guard a portal between the planes. The mage is long gone, but dragons still keep watch at the gate.

name: Depths of Desire
text: Pockets full of gold, lungs full of brine.

name: Cadaverous Knight
text:
Grieve for the soul in death dishonored.
—Shadow Guild saying

name: Unlucky Witness
text: The guard took a midnight shift to earn a promotion. Unfortunately, so did the assassin.

name: Plow Under
text:
To renew the land, plow the land. To destroy the land, do nothing.
—Druids' saying

name: Thelonite Druid
text:
"The magic at the heart of all living things can bear awe-inspiring fruit."
—Kolevi of Havenwood, elder druid

name: Fresh-Faced Recruit
text:
"Hold on to your ideals. They'll be tested more than your armor or the edge of your blade."
—Tajic

name: Demolish
text:
"Pound the steel until it fits. Doesn't work? Bash to bits."
—Dwarven forging song

name: Rabid Bite
text:
"You should have seen the look on *both* their faces."
—Morkamp, Lambholt innkeeper

name: Concealing Curtains // Revealing Eye
text: Specifics were kept secret, but word quickly spread that the show was a must-see.

name: Mental Journey
text: "My wandering mind has always been an asset."

name: Elite Spellbinder
text: Paulo Vitor Damo da Rosa, World Champion XXVI

name: Empress Galina
text: Few diplomats can resist the charm of Her Serene Highness's imperial seal.

name: Undead Executioner
text: Heartless killer in life, brainless killer in death.

name: Tzaangor Shaman
text: Tzeentch's beastmen twist reality as they themselves are twisted.

name: Heartbeat of Spring
text:
"It is true that we monks hold the key to paradise, but most don't understand that the paradise we guard is the one within."
—Diary of Azusa

name: Balduvian Frostwaker
text: "Whether frozen or fertile, the land is our ally. It awaits the call to battle."

name: Incinerate
text: "Who said there are no assurances in life? I assure you this is going to hurt."

name: Universal Automaton
text:
"Within minutes, the strange device was indistinguishable from the other upon my workbench."
—Tocasia, journal entry

name: Veteran Motorist
text: He's set to compete in every race at the Fair, and he plans to win them all.

name: Chandra's Revolution
text: Chandra was driven by her anger, directed particularly at the man who had taken her father from her.

name: Flamescroll Celebrant // Revel in Silence
text: "Sit down and listen."

name: Devilthorn Fox
text: On expeditions through Ashmouth, the hunters of Devilthorn Lodge rely on the cleverness of foxes to counteract the mischief of devils.

name: Conjurer's Ban
text: Orzhov faithful file past to have their minds purged of "impure" desires. There, the guiltwardens eliminate any thoughts of hope or self-sufficiency.

name: Fade from Memory
text: Proper burial is a luxury Otarians can no longer afford.

name: Phantasmal Form
text: Within each of us lurks the fathomless.

name: Flowstone Slide
text: It may look like soil, but its nature is malice.

name: Two-Headed Cerberus
text: The left head keeps the right head starved as motivation to track new prey.

name: Vengeant Earth
text: When Zendikar's defenders faltered, the Roil rose up to shake the invaders from its back.

name: Paragon of the Amesha
text: "Let my lance sing with the voices of angels and the heathen cower before my shield, for I will teach this land the meaning of honor."

name: Goblin Recruiter
text: "Next!"

name: Scholar of Stars
text: "The path of the stars is as reliable as the instruments that measure them."

name: Thirsting Bloodlord
text: "A whole life, full of memories and experience, love and sorrow, drained drop by drop into this bottle. Could any feast be more glorious?"

name: Honor Guard
text: The strength of one. The courage of ten.

name: Spinal Villain
text: "Striking silent as a dream,/ Cutting short the strangled scream . . ." —Tobrian, "Watchdragon"

name: Throttle
text:
"Victim discovered at dawn with mouth agape and eyes bulging. No evidence of blood loss or dismemberment. Severe bruising around the neck."
—Vallon, Thraben inspector

name: Silver Raven
text: Wings take flight on whispered wind.

name: Cabal Archon
text: "You are weak. I am strong. The protocol is obvious."

name: Goring Warplow
text: Built to crush walls and wills in equal measure.

name: Dusk Legion Duelist
text: "We sailed to Ixalan guided by a promise—the Age of Everflowing Blood. No machine will take that from us."

name: Lightning Rift
text:
"Jealous of storms, Vadrok took lightning from the sky and buried it deep under the earth. It still rumbles there, longing to escape."
—*Tales of the Ozolith*

name: Vampiric Tutor
text: True power is achieved through blood and sweat. But mostly blood.

name: Natural Connection
text: "Zendikar will not surrender, and neither can we."

name: Samite Healer
text: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

name: Unnatural Predation
text:
"Domination by the strongest—that is all that matters in the Tangle now."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Promise of Loyalty
text: "It's us against the world. Forever."

name: Vampire Interloper
text: The Voldaren have begun demanding blood offerings from the villagers in their territory. Their agents arrive from the sky to collect the ceremonial bowls in eerie silence.

name: Sandsower
text: It drifts through the streets as a breeze of collective sighs, wilting the bustle with dreams and heavy eyelids.

name: Confront the Unknown
text:
"Never flinch from the truth."
—Thalia, Guardian of Thraben

name: Urza's Tome
text:
"Truly understanding even one volume can be a life's work."
—Naru Meha, master wizard

name: Twisted Embrace
text: Evil kami are drawn to mortals who share their grim fascinations.

name: Metallic Mastery
text:
"All will be reforged in the fires of glory."
—Urabrask the Hidden

name: Catacomb Crocodile
text:
"I am sewer-king!" said Rat. "I am quick and cunning and I know every tunnel."
"No, I am king!" said Zombie. "I am cold and deadly and no rot can harm me."
Then Croc came and ate them both.

name: Incubator Drone
text: The touch of an Eldrazi brings life and death in turn.

name: Tahngarth's Rage
text:
"Taste my horns!"
—Tahngarth of the *Weatherlight*

name: Saddle of the Cavalier
text:
". . . and I will need an equally righteous but slightly smaller saddle for my space hamster companion."
—Minsc, beloved ranger

name: Rabid Bloodsucker
text: She haunts the streets, wings spread wide, with carrion on her breath and blood in her eyes.

name: Bonded Construct
text: Loyal to a fault, it heeds its master's every command.

name: Grizzly Bears
text:
"We cannot forget that among all of Dominaria's wonders, a system of life exists, with prey and predators that will never fight wars nor vie for ancient power."
—Jolrael, empress of beasts

name: Wonder
text:
"The awestruck birds gazed at Wonder. Slowly, timidly, they rose into the air."
—Scroll of Beginnings

name: Defense Grid
text: It lights up the sky, beckoning enemies only to repel them.

name: Cephalid Pathmage
text: Pathmages can open doors that aren't even there.

name: Grim Tutor
text: You see a lock, I see an invitation.

name: Meandering River
text:
"Everywhere you look, this world is healing from its wounds. Aren't you ready to do the same?"
—Jhoira, to Teferi

name: Bloodshed Fever
text: Cinder mages enjoy seeing their victims in the throes of bloodlust—and seeing the regret that inevitably follows.

name: Empty the Warrens
text:
"They'd pour out of the warrens to make war (and to make room for the littering matrons)."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV*

name: Cleanfall
text: During the war, the rites of purification were still effective, but the kami, not the kitsune, chose what to cleanse.

name: Bequeathal
text:
"On my death, I give you this treasure: the knowledge that life is hard, yet too soon past."
—Dal funeral rite

name: Mountain
text: As you pause mid-climb to catch your breath, you'd swear you can hear a heartbeat pulsing deep within the mountain.

name: Tide Drifter
text: It didn't do much, but the residents of Sea Gate gave it a wide berth all the same.

name: Dead Ringers
text: "Beautiful, isn't it?" crowed Crovax. "They fought together. Now they will die together."

name: Angelic Field Marshal
text: Her presence on the battlefield can transform an unruly mob into a disciplined army.

name: Sword of the Chosen
text: One shard of Selenia yet remained.

name: Frazzle
text: The chant was interrupted, the components cooked, and Zok worried that it was his brain he smelled smoking.

name: Burning Sun's Fury
text: Ixalan greeted Phyrexia with a defiant roar.

name: Duh
text: Will players understand that the creature is being crushed by two parentheses? Not a chance.

name: Venser's Journal
text: A Planeswalker's chronicle spans worlds and civilizations, each page a lifetime.

name: Forest
text: You know that hiexel bark produces a lot of smoke when burned, but why would Rilsa Rael need so much of it?

name: Command the Dreadhorde
text: Liliana seized the reins of Bolas's vast army, gritting her teeth behind the Chain Veil.

name: Dryad Sophisticate
text: From Tin Street to the Outcast Mansions, she walks unbidden and unbound, her graceful silence never shaken by the riot of city life around her.

name: Borderland Marauder
text: Though she is rightly feared, there are relatively few tales of her deeds in battle, for few survive her raids.

name: Cephalid Inkshrouder
text: Cephalids shrink from the harsh glare of scrutiny.

name: Prayer of Binding
text: When a Phyrexian agent cannot be killed, they must be contained.

name: Phosphorescent Feast
text: The boggarts gorged themselves until their bellies glowed.

name: Slith Bloodletter
text: Goblins fear the slith, believing they are children banished from the womb of the Steel Mother, deep within Kuldotha.

name: Bronze Calendar
text: Every page holds a month, every date a numeral.

name: Make a Wish
