text: It's the pinnacle of utter destructiveness.

name: Feral Prowler
text: Once favored companions, many cats were left to fend for themselves.

name: Resurgent Belief
text: No god on Theros ever truly dies as long as there are those who still have faith in them.

name: Vassal Soul
text: For the Azorius, the opportunity to serve the law is too great an honor for death to interrupt.

name: Explore
text: The Tyranids advanced inexorably across the galaxy in their living Hive Ships, with one singular goal: to consume all.

name: Revenant Patriarch
text: "The Golgari raise the bodies of their dead to serve. We raise the spirits of our dead to lead."

name: Twinscroll Shaman
text: "May your wretched name never grace the annals of history, you ignorant buffoon!"

name: Undergrowth Stadium
text: To get to Valor's Reach, competitors must first make a name for themselves in the smaller arenas.

name: Scorch Rider
text: "Lava flows where it pleases. I'm just happy to be along for the ride!"

name: Orcish Artillery
text:
"Ready . . . aim . . . fire!"
"Ow!"

name: Relic Sloth
text: When it comes to transporting priceless, delicate artifacts, safety is more important than speed.

name: Soldevi Sage
text:
"To hide the truth is more than folly—it is fatal."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

name: Displace
text: "I'll see you soon, Subjects 25 and 26. I've got a good feeling this time!"

name: Magefire Wings
text: Giving a thing wings does not take away its fear of flight—or its fear of fire, for that matter.

name: Tolarian Terror
text: Afterward, a number of treatises on sea serpent morphology were swiftly revised.

name: Spiteful Squad
text: "Don't you know first-years pay a toll to walk through here?"

name: Nirkana Revenant
text: Hate is an everlasting wellspring from which it is eternally sustained.

name: Awakener Druid
text: The druids of Mazar treat each seedcone with respect for the warrior it will become.

name: Check for Traps
text: "Relax. I'm a professional."

name: Standing Troops
text: The less you have, the harder you fight for it.

name: High Priest of Penance
text: "All I require is faith, loyalty, obedience, trust, and complete and utter devotion."

name: Kongming, "Sleeping Dragon"
text: "Such a lord as this—all virtues' height—Had never been, nor ever was again."

name: Anurid Brushhopper
text: It's so tough it can frighten itself into hiding.

name: Elder Druid
text:
"I am older than any Elder Druid before me, and still no child has been born with the Mark to take my place. When will the wheel turn?"
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Late to Dinner
text: Mood: A friendship that can outlast death.

name: Brontotherium
text: Lucky victims get run over. Unlucky victims get run through.

name: Tempered in Solitude
text: Many master samurai make pilgrimages deep into the Sokenzan Mountains, where they train and meditate in silence, hoping to commune with a lava kami.

name: Elven Riders
text:
"Sometimes it is better to be swift of foot than strong of swordarm."
—Elven proverb

name: Kor Blademaster
text: Every kor blade is imbued with the skill of a thousand generations.

name: Demolish
text:
"This is why I hate settlements. They lull you into a false sense of security."
—Yon Basrel, Oran-Rief survivalist

name: Paraselene
text:
"Moonlight has a way of showing all things as they truly are—for better or for worse."
—Zilla of Lambholt

name: Wild Elephant
text:
"I will tell my father's stories . . . . How the elephants trampled the leopard cub, and its father, though he knew, killed nine goats instead."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Gloomwidow
text:
"An unexpected ally."
—Rem Karolus, Slayer of Angels

name: Beckoning Will-o'-Wisp
text: Follow the light at your own risk.

name: Flametongue Kavu
text:
"If you look past the giant claws, nasty teeth, and horrible breath, they're actually kind of cute."
—Shanna Sisay

name: Ali Baba
text: "When he reached the entrance of the cavern, he pronounced the words, 'Open, Sesame!'" —*The Arabian Nights*, Junior Classics trans.

name: Verduran Enchantress
text: Each spell has its own song, and the enchantress knows the dance for each.

name: Ecstatic Awakener // Awoken Demon
text: "Great Ormendahl, I kneel before you, a fragment of your will, a servant of your tyranny. I beg you, release the strength within me!"

name: Kaseto, Orochi Archmage
text: "Our revered ancestor Seshiro gave us wisdom greater than poison and fangs."

name: Pestermite
text: The fae know when they're not wanted. That's precisely why they show up.

name: Weird Harvest
text: Krosa's distorted groves bear strange fruit.

name: Telethopter
text: After losing several of the devices to midair collisions, Greven forbade moggs from operating telethopters.

name: Wall of Swords
text: The air hummed with the scissoring sound of uncounted blades that hovered in front of the invaders as though wielded by a phalanx of unseen hands.

name: Revolutionary Rebuff
text: By the time a Consulate sanction becomes official, the renegade quicksmiths have already found a way to circumvent it.

name: Boros Locket
text:
"We pass these along to our fellow soldiers to recognize deeds of valor. It won't stay with you for long."
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage

name: Furnace Brood
text: Furnace air crackles with magmatic cackles.

name: Boomerang
text: Early Jamuraan hunters devised a weapon that would return to its source. Tolarian Aethermancers developed a spell that skipped the weapon entirely.

name: Giant Strength
text: "O! it is excellent/ To have a giant's strength, but it is tyrannous/ To use it like a giant." —William Shakespeare, *Measure for Measure*

name: Fleeting Image
text: Horas swore off drinking, but after meeting the creature a second time he decided he'd better start again.

name: Evolving Wilds
text: Every world is an organism, able to grow new lands. Some just do it faster than others.

name: Xathrid Slyblade
text: Designed by Rob Pardo

name: Hard Evidence
text: The investigator felt a pinch on his ankle. When he looked down, something glittered in the sand.

name: Corrupt Court Official
text:
"I wouldn't call what they have here a justice system. More like an auction."
—Elspeth

name: Permeating Mass
text: Woodland geists concluded that Emrakul would be unable to warp the denizens of the forest if the geists got there first.

name: Betrayal
text:
"Sometimes a burden can be borne only on the shoulders of a willing enemy."
—Suq'Ata aphorism

name: Western Paladin
text:
"Expect nothing but scorn, flattery, and lies. And never turn your back on him."
—The Northern Paladin

name: Goblin War Drums
text:
"The Goblins' dreaded War Drums struck terror into the hearts of even their bravest foes."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV*

name: Zodiac Dog
text: ". . . Jiang Wei alone still strove with might and main: / Nine times more he fought the north-in vain. . . ."

name: Maeve, Insidious Singer
text: Her haunting tune drowns out the percussion of snapping masts.

name: Firemantle Mage
text: "Come on, you twisted things! Don't you want to get acquainted?"

name: Contingency Plan
text:
"Improvisation is for those who failed to prepare."
—Jace Beleren

name: Shauku's Minion
text:
"My minions serve me in the light; I serve no one."
—Shauku, Endbringer

name: Sphere of Safety
text: Brushing hair against your face

name: Anointed Deacon
text: Inspiration is red as rubies, flowing like honeyed wine.

name: Battlefield Forge
text:
"As Terisiare's mines ran dry, scrap metal became increasingly plentiful."
—*The Antiquities War*

name: Deeproot Warrior
text:
"We breathe from our soul and bones to give strength to the jungle. The jungle breathes from its roots and rivers to give strength to us."
—Shaper Falani

name: Wall of Ice
text:
"And through the drifts the snowy cliffs
Did send a dismal sheen:
Nor shapes of men nor beasts we ken—
The ice was all between."
—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Call for Unity
text: The "leaking spire" stands for liberation from Consulate control.

name: Soldier Replica
text: It fights with inhuman vigor.

name: Onulet
text: An early inspiration for Urza, Tocasia's onulets contained magical essences that could be cannibalized after they stopped functioning.

name: Birthing Boughs
text: Changelings can't remember where they came from. They just know it wasn't a cradle.

name: Giant Cockroach
text: If the sun ever hit the swamp, where would these scurry to?

name: Dragonlair Spider
text: Swarms thrive in its nest, feeding on leathery bits of discarded wing.

name: Sol Ring
text: Lost to time is the artificer's art of trapping light from a distant star in a ring of purest gold.

name: Deflecting Swat
text: Archmage attacks are little more than annoyances to Kalamax.

name: Hum of the Radix
text: The elves learned long ago that anything left here slowly vanishes. Now it is a sacred site where the dead are laid to rest and where unnatural magic is erased forever.

name: Esperzoa
text: The more metal it digests, the more its jelly will fetch on the alchemists' market.

name: Rishadan Port
text: Rishada is the gateway to free trade—but the key will cost you.

name: Hagra Sharpshooter
text: "It's hard to find their weak points, but I very much enjoy the discovery process."

name: Cyclopean Giant
text: A tomb-eye may remain shut for centuries. It opens when it sees a world as twisted and hollow as the wretch beneath its lid.

name: Emrakul's Influence
text: Hordes of Eldrazi and cultists swarmed over Thraben's defenses, and the members of the Gatewatch found themselves overrun.

name: The Elderspell
text: The path to power is often paved with atrocities.

name: Sly Spy
text: The Agents of S.N.E.A.K.—Skilled, Notably Efficient Assassin-Kickers.

name: Spinehorn Minotaur
text: "If you think twice, I'll cut twice."

name: Skyhunter Skirmisher
text:
"Take the deadly grace and strength of the leonin, combined with a pteron mount capable of rending a foe in two and armed with notched steel. That is a skyhunter—and why Taj-Nar has never fallen."
—Raksha Golden Cub

name: Blazing Archon
text:
"Through the haze of battle I saw the glint of sun on golden mane, the sheen of glory clad in mail, and I dropped my sword and wept at the idiocy of war."
—Dravin, Gruul deserter

name: Ebon Dragon
text:
"The dragon wing of night o'erspreads the earth."
—*Troilus and Cressida*, William Shakespeare

name: Sludge Monster
text: Tracking it isn't the hard part.

name: Trufflesnout
text: Its exploits are the stuff of legends among local chefs and fuel for nightmares among the forest thallids.

name: Garruk's Gorehorn
text:
"It certainly takes after its master: big and brutish, and you can smell it from a mile away."
—Liliana Vess

name: Iron Star
text: Forged by a thousand flames.

name: Breaker of Armies
text:
"There are some who have lost everyone and everything. They actively seek out the Eldrazi, eager for the smallest measure of vengeance."
—Munda, ambush leader

name: Glimpse of Freedom
text:
"Freedom lies in accepting a single path."
—Nyklos, Meletian philosopher

name: Zuran Enchanter
text:
"We are Kjeldorans no more."
—Zur the Enchanter

name: Harmattan Efreet
text:
"One moment I was walking along the beach, and the next I was high in the air, staring into a hideous smiling face."
—Tarub, Suq'Ata sailor

name: Tolarian Kraken
text:
"It's contemplative, resourceful, and original. Everything else aside, it's the perfect student."
—Naban, dean of iteration

name: Dissension in the Ranks
text:
"It came on as quickly as taking in a breath of air. Cathars who had fought shoulder to shoulder were at each other's throats. They were not themselves."
—Halmig, Order of Saint Traft

name: Unyaro Bees
text: With no jungle left to contain it, the "plague of daggers" spread across Dominaria.

name: Inferno
text: "Any scrap of compassion that still existed in my soul was permanently snuffed out when they cast me out into the flames." —Mairsil, called the Pretender

name: Roadside Reliquary
text: Travelers who leave an offering may pass freely through the forest kami's domain.

name: Tanglebloom
text: The bloom contains no seeds. It's meant only to nourish the forest's inhabitants.

name: Windseeker Centaur
text: Loyal and passionate in battle, the Windseeker tribe roams the Green Lands near the Honeyed Sea.

name: Imaginary Threats
text: Liliana always knew Jace's illusions would come in handy.

name: Nicol Bolas
text: Dominaria's most ancient evil.

name: Orcish Cannonade
text:
"No ready! No aim! Just fire!"
—Scarback Plagg, orcish captain

name: Grimlock, Dinobot Leader // Grimlock, Ferocious King
text: "Why you think Grimlock stupid? Me not stupid. Grimlock smartest Dinobot."

name: Irontread Crusher
text: "We've been through a lot together."

name: Sea Gate Wreckage
text: Once a center for knowledge, Sea Gate now serves as a reminder of what was lost.

name: Elven Riders
text: "Wirewood cannot hide great size. Only with speed and skill can we survive here."

name: Swarm of Rats
text:
"Rats, rats, rats Hundreds, thousands, millions of them, and every one a life."
—Bram Stoker, *Dracula*

name: Angelic Intervention
text: Elspeth shone like a sixth sun, inspiring hope in the Mirrans and terror in New Phyrexia.

name: Skirge Familiar
text:
"The skirges screech along with the bone saw. It makes a terrible racket, but they seem to enjoy it."
—Keskit, the Flesh Sculptor

name: Sacred Excavation
text: The anointed work the mines without pause, their cartouches instilling them with tireless purpose.

name: Cheering Fanatic
text: "Punch 'em, kick 'em, bite 'em, beat 'em! Burn 'em all and we'll defeat 'em!"

name: Morselhoarder
text: It scours the hills for living matter, savoring even the tang of poisonous fungi.

name: Harmless Assault
text: After encasing it in a paralyzing beam of light, the angel studied the Eldrazi as a child would study a bug, curiously and without fear.

name: Havoc Jester
text: To the Rakdos, screams of delight and screams of terror are one and the same.

name: Mountain Bandit
text: Penniless and far from home, many former Yellow Scarves and other soldiers became bandits to survive.

name: Submerged Boneyard
text:
"Long after the land has given up the last of its secrets, there will still be mysteries in the depths of the sea."
—Kiora

name: Phyrexian Ghoul
text: Phyrexia wastes nothing. Its food chain is a spiraling cycle.

name: Juniper Order Rootweaver
text: "What Phyrexia takes, the grace of Freyalise shall replenish."

name: Elvish Lyrist
text: To an elf, magic and music are the same.

name: Beseech the Queen
text: Those who hear her go mad with inspiration.

name: Daring Sleuth // Bearer of Overwhelming Truths
text: "No matter the cost, I must discover the source of these strange happenings."

name: Greatsword of Tyr
text: In the light of its gleaming blade, the faithful shine and the wicked cower.

name: Stun
text:
"I concede it was a cheap shot, but it was the only one I could afford."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Sanctum of Shattered Heights
text:
Rage smolders within,
An all-consuming wildfire
Burning fear to ash

name: Dromar's Attendant
text: "Dromar is the wings of the ur-dragon, sweeping away all opposition."

name: Seacoast Drake
text: Seacoast drakes have been known to follow ships for hundreds of miles, waiting to snap up garbage, bait, and the occasional sailor.

name: Sporeweb Weaver
text: It spins its web throughout the undercity, strange growths sprouting in its wake.

name: Martial Glory
text:
"Yes, Boros tactics are unparalleled. But when your comrades are dying around you, inner strength must carry the day."
—Gideon Jura, to Aurelia

name: Goretusk Firebeast
text: As a youth, Kamahl took one for a pet. His hair has yet to grow back.

name: Fortuitous Find
text: An aetherborn wastes neither time nor treasure.

name: Kor Spiritdancer
text: She reaches beyond the physical realm, touching the ideals from which all creatures draw their power.

name: Sacred Ground
text: The land will never betray those who gave their lives for it.

name: Blackcleave Cliffs
text: Where the Oxidda Chain mingles with the Mephidross, oil-suffused metal crumbles away, leaving walls of blackened bones.

name: Stonespeaker Crystal
text: It whispers words spoken centuries ago, coaxing wisdom from the ghosts of civilizations past.

name: Sicken
text: Urza dared to attack Phyrexia. Slowly, it retaliated.

name: Bramble Elemental
text: In abandoned corners of Ravnica, nature has begun to reclaim what it once owned.

name: Dark Supplicant
text: Cabal clerics serve two masters: their patriarch and their god.

name: Mountain Yeti
text: The Yeti's single greatest asset is its unnerving ability to blend in with its surroundings.

name: Oppression
text:
"Defeating an enemy is not nearly as satisfying as watching one suffer."
—The Western Paladin

name: Apes of Rath
text: Monkeys three, monkeys through.

name: Strands of Undeath
text:
"Why limit yourself to mortal law when you can outlive those who enforce it?"
—Czaric, Orzhov prelate

name: Rakdos Guildgate
text:
"Slip in the back if you don't want to be recognized. Don't worry—we'll make sure you're never found!"
—Judith

name: Bastion Inventor
text: "This armor transcends the limitations of mere flesh and bone."

name: Temple of Epiphany
text:
"Hail the Children of the Stars!"
—Magus Lucea Kane

name: Phyrexian Hulk
text:
It doesn't think. It doesn't feel.
It doesn't laugh or cry.
All it does from dusk till dawn
Is make the soldiers die.
—Onean children's rhyme

name: Marang River Prowler
text: The currents of the Marang wash away both tracks and blood.

name: Peace of Mind
text:
"What can a peasant get for free that an emperor can never buy?"
—Dal riddle

name: Balduvian Conjurer
text:
"The very lands of Balduvia are alive."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

name: Gristle Grinner
text:
"There it was, clawing the ice as it chittered and clicked its teeth. We fled in horror before it unearthed its grisly meal."
—Aevar Borg, northern guide, journal entry

name: Zombie Goliath
text:
"Removing the encumbrance of useless brain tissue grants several advantages: a slight increase in mobility, a response of revulsion and horror from the enemy, and, in the case of large specimens, room for passengers."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

name: Cloud Spirit
text:
Clouds are the soil, dreams are the crop.
—Kor saying

name: Draconic Lore
text: The wyrmling studied the ancient carvings and dreamed of a day when her own exploits would be immortalized in stone.

name: Samite Alchemist
text:
"The wisest of Aysen dwell not in the Abbey, but in the laboratory."
—Taysir

name: Kongming, "Sleeping Dragon"
text: "Such a lord as this—all virtues' height— Had never been, nor ever was again."

name: Nature's Way
text: Many elves incorporate the beauty of nature into their inventions. Very few capture its savagery.

name: Magmaquake
text:
"Where will you run when I punish you with the very ground you flee on?"
—Nicol Bolas

name: Splendid Genesis
text:
She discovered with great delight that one does not love one's children because they are one's children but because of the friendship formed while raising them.
Gabriel Garciá Márquez

name: Ghoulish Procession
text: It was a family reunion to die for.

name: Wildest Dreams
text:
"I opened my mind to the immensity of the wonders around me. It was only then that I could see the Great Conduit."
—Rashmi, aether-seer

name: Famished Ghoul
text: Memories have distinct tastes. Its favorites are the sickly sweetness of lost love and the bitter smokiness of cruel murder.

name: Malakir Soothsayer
text: "Your blood whispers secrets your mind could never comprehend."

name: Snuff Out
text: Squee watched his Kyren cousins fall with a mixture of sympathy and relief.

name: Hapatra's Mark
text:
"If you fear poisons, it is because you are ignorant of them."
—Hapatra, vizier of poisons

name: Ancient Lumberknot
text: The soft creak of trees in the wind is not always cause for comfort.

name: Stonerise Spirit
text: The carved cliffs of Pillardrop thrum with the sounds of ancient spirits rising from the past.

name: Claws of Gix
text: When the Brotherhood of Gix dug out the cave of Koilos they found their master's severed hand. They enshrined it, hoping that one day it would point the way to Phyrexia.

name: Nahiri's Resolve
text: "Zendikar is *my* home!"

name: Archivist
text:
"Sit down and read. Educate yourself for the coming conflicts."
—Mary Harris "Mother" Jones

name: Naturalize
text:
"Better to let the sword go than to lose the arm with it."
—Captain Lannery Storm

name: Goblin Flotilla
text: Exceptionally poor sailors, Goblins usually arrived at their destination retching and in no condition to fight.

name: Anchor to Reality
text: The Wanderer sighed in relief as the Reality Chip tethered her wayward spark to Kamigawa.

name: Foresee
text: Wind time's watch, and watch time unwind.

name: Horned Sliver
text: A bristling wave of slivers broke against the *Weatherlight*'s timbers.

name: Torch Fiend
text: Devils redecorate every room with fire.

name: Goblin Ski Patrol
text:
"AIIIEEEE!"
—Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician

name: Stench of Decay
text:
"Disa is dead, and I am left. I shall allow no others to succumb to this pestilence."
—Kolbjörn, High Honored Druid

name: Dragon-Scarred Bear
text: Bears are a delicacy for the Atarka. The few that remain are the toughest of their species.

name: Spreading Rot
text:
"What is this foul presence that defies the sun's cleansing rays?"
—Itzama the Crested

name: Flame Fusillade
text:
"A single item acting as lantern and lance? Now *that's* military efficiency."
—Brev Grezar, Boros lieutenant

name: First Volley
text:
"We searched their bodies for signs of the blades that had killed them, but found nothing more than scorched flesh."
—Tender-Hand, kitsune healer

name: Propeller Pioneer
text: "The sky isn't the limit. It's the starting point."

name: Fists of Ironwood
text: Saprolings add the three and the four to the "one-two punch."

name: Apocalypse
text:
"There is a future in which I can see only mist and a single shadow."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Bog Imp
text: Think of it as a butcher knife with wings.

name: Petrahydrox
text: It departs through the streets' fissures with a sound like gravel pouring into a pond.

name: Utility Knife
text: "Hold on a second, I have just the thing."

name: Skyknight Legionnaire
text: Squadrons of skyknights are available for deployment around the clock, capable of reaching any district in the city within minutes.

name: Crash the Party
text: The profits from that night barely paid for the damages.

name: Staunch Defenders
text:
"The key to winning any fight is simply staying alive."
—The Southern Paladin

name: Three Dreams
text:
"Choose one to heal, one to harm, and one to grant you the prudence to use them."
—Miotri, auratouched mage

name: Steelshaper's Gift
text: Some blades seek their own wielders.

name: Winged Shepherd
text:
"When the Hour of Promise arrives, the God-Pharaoh will tear down the Hekma, for its protection will be needed no longer."
—*The Accounting of Hours*

name: Lorehold Pledgemage
text: "The weight of history can empower you or it can crush you. It's your choice."

name: Drake-Skull Cameo
text:
"A strange skull was turned up by an Ephran farmer's plow. I traded a copper ring for the 'ox skull.' It resonates of the sea and danger."
—Isel, master carver

name: Runed Stalactite
text: When a changeling adopts a form no other changeling has taken, a rune appears in the caverns of Velis Vel to mark the event.

name: Unnatural Growth
text: With the cycles of day and night unspooled, the twisted sway of the moon only grew. And grew.

name: Dash Hopes
text:
"Focus an enemy's mind on what's already gone, and it's easier to take away more."
—Holux, stronghold racketeer

name: Limits of Solidarity
text:
"When the time comes, only one of you will be honored by my spear."
—Hazoret, god of zeal

name: Pestilent Haze
text:
"Your crops will rot. The air itself will turn against you. You will suffer as I have suffered."
—Karaz, outcast

name: Alseid of Life's Bounty
text:
"Dawn-kissed, he nourishes the golden grain."
—Psemilla, Meletian poet

name: Spiteful Visions
text: Knowledge brings the sting of disillusionment, but the pain teaches perspective.

name: Ambulatory Edifice
text: The Mirran forces thought they'd vanquished their foes . . . until a nearby monument got up and started stalking toward them.

name: Icatian Infantry
text: The Icatian army easily repelled early surprise attacks by the Orcs on border towns like Montford.

name: Goldenhide Ox
text: The temptation to take the ox's golden hide is as irresistible as it is fatal.

name: Reassembling Skeleton
text:
"They may show up with the wrong thigh bone or mandible, but they always show up."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

name: Vanquish the Weak
text: When Atraxa first arrived, the people of New Capenna rejoiced at the sight of such a grand angel. Then the slaughter began.

name: Mirran Safehouse
text:
"Melira helped me design it. Those who are infected by the oil cannot cross the threshold. We should be safe inside."
—Koth

name: Darksteel Forge
text:
"It is as if this world has been expecting our blessings."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

name: Agrus Kos, Wojek Veteran
text: Lieutenant Kos has never met a group of recruits he could not inspire or a mob he could not quell.

name: Flowstone Hellion
text: Volrath leaves no stone untrained.

name: Squirming Mass
text: Only the coldest hearts and the strongest stomachs can stand against it.

name: Drowned Secrets
text: Beneath Ravnica's streets runs a layer of tunnels, then caverns and waterways, then terrors and nightmares.

name: Joint Exploration
text: The Tolarians had the maps, but only the Yavimayans knew how to read them.

name: Blessing of the Nephilim
text: "Before the first stone was laid or the first elf-child born, the power of the nephilim was gathering. Let that power be spread by my hands."

name: Crew Captain
text: The Riveteers are as good at raising buildings as they are at razing them.

name: Callous Giant
text: "The invasion has awoken slumbering mountains," noted Urza. "Good. We can use all the help we can get."

name: Bog Wraith
text: 'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae My mate did meet an early grave; 'Twas nothing left for us to save In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.

name: Goblin Trailblazer
text:
"Why are we following the goblin? Can he even read that map?"
—Daphne Vail, *Diremore* first mate

name: Unholy Hunger
text: Liliana viewed the attention of the angels as a testament to her power. Even so, they were an annoyance.

name: End-Raze Forerunners
text:
"Smash this city to pieces."
—Domri Rade

name: Silent Assassin
text: She feels no need to disturb her victim's slumber.

name: Snake of the Golden Grove
text: Some fruits are best left ungathered.

name: The Unspeakable
text: The rumors are horrifying; the truth is worse.

name: Wing Commando
text: "The welds are weaker at the top."

name: Thorn Elemental
text: Rain from this storm leaves you pinned to the ground like an insect.

name: Cosi's Trickster
text: She watches the chaos created by the Roil, seeking strength in the patterns of anarchy.

name: Malfegor
text: A demon cannot be trusted, and a dragon will not be ruled.

name: Ezuri, Renegade Leader
text: The infamous Ezuri commands the highest bounty the vedalken have ever placed upon an outlaw.

name: Rule of Law
text: Appointed by the kha himself, members of the tribunal ensure all disputes are settled with the utmost fairness.

name: Willow Faerie
text:
"Swift as the wind and harder to catch— that's the Faeries for you."
—Daria

name: Zombie Cannibal
text: Nothing is sacred to the undead—not even their own kind.

name: Sea Gate
text: An efficient route from a smuggler's ship to a patriar's manor.

name: Craw Wurm
text: The most terrifying thing about the craw wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

name: Leyline of the Void
text: Where treachery and oblivion converge.

name: Predatory Rampage
text:
"It is the fate of the weak to fall."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Subcontract
text: Martha was in and out in exactly two minutes—thirty seconds to administer the poison plus a minute and a half to properly refold the napkins.

name: Summoner's Bane
text:
"I don't need to have the perfect plan. My foe just has to have an imperfect one."
—Jace Beleren

name: Trumpet Blast
text:
"Do you hear that, Sarkhan? The glory of the horde! I made a legend from what you abandoned."
—Zurgo, khan of the Mardu

name: Grasp of the Hieromancer
text:
"There is power in abandon, but far more in control."
—Warden Hixus, to Kytheon

name: Endure
text: The Aurora had lessened the kithkins' kindness, deepened their paranoia, and dulled their sense of pain.

name: Common Cause
text: Mercadia City's troops are at their best when they have no enemy to fight.

name: Soltari Foot Soldier
text:
"Children of the Ruins, raised to be warriors, know that life begins when another speaks their names."
—Soltari *Tales of Life*

name: Cloistered Youth // Unholy Fiend
text:
"I heard her talking in her sleep—pleading, shrieking, snarling. It was not my daughter's voice. That is not my daughter."
—Ekatrin, elder of Hanweir

name: Raging Spirit
text:
"Its burning power is more elusive than shade on the Unyaro Plains, more perilous than the horn of a rhino."
—Akin, seasoned askari

name: Raven Wings
text:
"There are some places even our ships cannot travel. I would know their secrets too."
—Inga Rune-Eyes

name: Dark Suspicions
text:
"After four thousand years, you learn to plan for betrayal."
—Urza

name: Umbilicus
text: It was the explorers' only tether to reality.

name: Chief of the Foundry
text: The foundries of Kaladesh run like clockwork under the supervision of their formidable overseers.

name: Defiant Salvager
text: "I didn't survive that crash just so I could fall to the likes of you."

name: Acidic Slime
text: It fears no sword and leaves no bones behind.

name: Jace, Vryn's Prodigy // Jace, Telepath Unbound
text: "People's thoughts just come to me. Sometimes I don't know if it's them or me thinking."

name: Ensoul Artifact
text: Too often, some self-described genius comes up with a "labor-saving device" that ends up creating far more work.

name: Your Puny Minds Cannot Fathom
text: "I have seen far beyond this imperfect world, into a tomorrow that doesn't include you."

name: Lavastep Raider
text: Goblins were first to see the potential of hedrons in the fight against the Eldrazi, for the magical stones came ready-made with pointy bits.

name: Bloodthrone Vampire
text: "What I need is your blood. What I don't need is your permission."

name: Nightshade Harvester
text: "Anywhere the moonlight touches—that's my garden."

name: Arrester's Zeal
text: Law is the light of civilization.

name: Tajuru Beastmaster
text: "My mount needs neither reins nor bridle. We both share a common purpose."

name: Zendikar's Roil
text:
"I was wrong. Zendikar isn't after me. It isn't after any of us. It's not evil or vengeful. It's magnificent . . . but it's in pain."
—Nissa Revane

name: Scorched Earth
text:
"Fire cleanses as well as destroys; that is the nature of change."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: In the Web of War
text:
"In desperation, Konda sent warriors to parley with the ogre-magi. No one knows whether they were slaughtered at Shinka or if they even reached its bloodstained walls."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Can't Stay Away
text: Death is no impediment to dinner.

name: Felidar Guardian
text: The loyalty of a felidar is hard won but worth the effort.

name: Creeping Trailblazer
text: The destruction of a wildfire with the tenacity of a jungle vine.

name: Jungle Wurm
text: Broad as a baobab—and about as smart.

name: Expedition Lookout
text: Skills honed on perilous treasure hunts helped Zendikar's adventurers stay a crucial step ahead of their Phyrexian foes.

name: Sly Spy
text: The Agents of S.N.E.A.K.—Silent Ninjas Evading Any Kapture.

name: Anaconda
text: If you're smaller than the anaconda, it considers you food. If you're larger than the anaconda, it considers you a lot of food.

name: Kediss, Emberclaw Familiar
text: Kediss loves molten metal, searing flames, and head scratches.

name: Dakmor Scorpion
text: A scorpion this big you won't find curled up in your boot. Maybe *around* your boot, but not *in* it.

name: Dragon Blood
text: A single drop turns skin to scale and fist to claw.

name: Deny Existence
text: When all logical solutions fail, try an illogical one.

name: Enthralling Victor
text: If you stare at the sun for too long, you'll lose your ability to see clearly.

name: Skull Catapult
text:
"Let any who doubt the evil of using the ancient devices look at this infernal machine. What manner of fiend would design such a sadistic device?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

name: Zagoth Crystal
text: From the fertile muck of Zagoth, everything—animal, botanical, and crystalline—grows with rugged beauty.

name: Nightfire Giant
text: Nightfire turns the greatest weakness of the undead into formidable strength.

name: Bloodscent
text: To study the predators of the Tangle, two people are required: one to watch from above, and one to run like hell.

name: Hunting Pack
text: There is no "I" in "team," but there is definitely "meat."

name: Ethersworn Shieldmage
text: "See, children of metal? Already your bodies are rejecting harm. Continue on our path, and perfection will be yours."

name: Daily Regimen
text: What self-indulgence tears down, discipline builds up again.

name: Akki Drillmaster
text: "What part of 'hayaku ikee!' did you not understand?"

name: Colossodon Yearling
text: The colossodon's hard outer shell stops many predators, but with a gentle flip from a dragon, it quickly becomes a meal in a bowl.

name: Skymarcher Aspirant
text: "I was born to glory."

name: Hyrax Tower Scout
text: The scouts of Hyrax Tower keep watch at the edge of Setessan territory, protecting the polis from inhuman monsters and enemy armies.

name: Rooting Moloch
text: Their feeding habits leave them with gizzards full of tumbled gems.

name: Arcane Sanctum
text:
"We must rely on our own knowledge, not on the dogma of the seekers or the mutterings of the sphinxes."
—Tullus of Palandius

name: Brawn
text:
"'I have arrived,' bellowed Brawn, and the plane shuddered."
—Scroll of Beginnings

name: Shackles
text: "It could be worse," said Gerrard, looking around. "Well, maybe not."

name: Oathsworn Giant
text: The town stands on his ancestors' former burial grounds. Even with the graves long gone, he continues his determined vigil.

name: Boreal Druid
text: Some creatures are bound to the cold by Rimewind magic. Others seek it out, adapted by two thousand years of the Ice. The Boreal, where Heidar's frigid sway is strongest, is home to both.

name: Elvish Scrapper
text: "The stories tell of a distant time when machines overran the forests, destroying everything that lived. That time will not come again."

name: Unnatural Aggression
text: The battle served as a grim reminder of what a final victory for the Eldrazi would mean.

name: Sandwurm Convergence
text: Cantankerous and territorial, sandwurms claim even the skies above their dunes.

name: Giant Spectacle
text: The giant-decorating contest at the migration festival is a tradition that may have started as a dare.

name: Pyrrhic Revival
text: They found themselves alive again, still bearing their mortal wounds.

name: Faerie Noble
text:
"Faeries talk all in riddles and tricky bits, 'cept the Nobles. Now, *there's* some straight talkers."
—Joskun, An-Havva Constable

name: Goblin Grenade
text:
"Without their massive numbers, the Goblins could never have launched such a successful offensive."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI*

name: Ritual of Rejuvenation
text: "Nothing is more sacred than the gift of blood. Blessed are the vein that empties and the heart that is renewed."

name: Fearful Villager // Fearsome Werewolf
text: Come nightfall, they were the ones fleeing in terror.

name: Elturgard Ranger
text: Since the fall of Elturel, they've walked the Sword Coast from Tethyr to Icewind Dale, eyes always on their prey.

name: Merrow Reejerey
text: ". . . that's when I reeled in a human about yay big."

name: Bladebrand
text:
"The pain of searing iron and razor edges pales beside the pleasure of performance."
—Judith, the Scourge Diva

name: Radha, Coalition Warlord
text: "Enough warm-up. I'm coming for you, Sheoldred!"

name: Weatherseed Elf
text: "My grandmother once told me the future of our world was inside the Weatherseed. When I touched it, I knew she was right."

name: Hidden Path
text:
"Where moments before we were lost beyond hope, the strange, floating lights showed us the way and restored our morale."
—Vervamon the Elder

name: Goblin Glider
text: The goblins call the gliders "death from above." Everyone else calls them "clods in the clouds."

name: Vigil for the Lost
text: "As she grew cold in my arms, I swore an oath that her funeral pyre would be dwarfed by a bonfire of our enemies."

name: Sea Monster
text: Water is life. Or perhaps it is just something to wash it down with.

name: Auriok Steelshaper
text: They put their safety in his hands. He puts sharpened steel in theirs.

name: Man-o'-War
text: Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch.

name: Devourer of Memory
text: It slips silently through the still waters of the Labyrinth of Memories to feed.

name: Test of Endurance
text: "I could do this all day."

name: Illusory Angel
text:
"Yes, she is made of pure belief—but I hardly see why that makes her unique."
—Reith, master illusionist

name: Captain's Call
text:
"Argivia's walls may run on powerstones, but its real power comes from its people."
—King Darien XLVIII

name: Radiant Essence
text:
"Her beauty was the beauty of the Sun at midday, deadly to those who underestimated her strength."
—Azeworai, "Kenechi's Dream"

name: Ashling, the Extinguisher
text: The Aurora had transformed her into a relentless force of destruction.

name: Timberland Guide
text: Hiring an experienced wilderness guide isn't cheap, but it costs less than a search party. Or a funeral.

name: Ghost Quarter
text: Upon scattering her grandmother's ashes, the Envoy was bathed in a warm spectral glow.

name: Certain Death
text: Some spirits cling to one person, feasting on the growing fear until a final moment of all-consuming terror.

name: Putrid Warrior
text: "I do not like it," said Grizzlegom, "but I will take every soldier I can get."

name: Skewer the Critics
text: Going to a Rakdos show is dangerous. Trying to leave early can be fatal.

name: Ludevic's Test Subject // Ludevic's Abomination
text: After several frustrating experiments, the visionary Ludevic realized he needed to create a monster that fed on torch-wielding mobs.

name: Dimir Doppelganger
text: "Fear not. Your life will not go unlived."

name: Onyx Mage
text:
"We wield death and darkness, powers that make lesser mages tremble in fear."
—Onyx creed

name: Myr Quadropod
text: Each myr was designed to fill a specific role. This one, for example, was designed to stomp on other myr.

name: Highland Berserker
text: He gets paid by the axe.

name: Lightning Greaves
text: The boots demonstrated many strange magical properties, but the most remarkable was their ability to withstand Westley's ferocious chewing.

name: Unleash Shell
text: The new cannon's destructive power more than made up for its unpredictable blast radius.

name: Elvish Healer
text:
"The Kjeldorans keep the Orcs at bay and we train their healers. Most human bargains aren't as fair."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

name: Illusionary Servant
text:
"Illusion is a handy but fragile medium. Use it only in a pinch, or against the dim-witted."
—Jace Beleren

name: Spore Frog
text: A progenitor of tadpoles and allergies in equal measure.

name: Emerald Dragon // Dissonant Wave
text: Emerald dragons hate prying eyes, and they have a host of ways to deter them.

name: Scrapheap
text: Junk heaps have rats, but scrapheaps have goblins.

name: Ravages of War
text:
"Thorn bushes spring up wherever the army has passed. Lean years follow in the wake of a great war."
—Lao Tzu, *Tao Te Ching*, trans. Feng and English

name: Enrage
text: "You wouldn't like me when I'm angry."

name: Refurbish
text:
"There's no reason to buy a new one when I've got the tools to fix the one you've got."
—Ripu, repair specialist

name: Thoughtseize
text: The mind is a fragile thing. Remove the smallest fragment, and the whole thing starts to fall apart.

name: Martyr's Cry
text: "It is only fitting that one such as I should die in pursuit of knowledge." —Vervamon the Elder

name: Scornful Aether-Lich
text:
"With no flesh, there is no pain, no hesitation, no emotion of any kind. He is crafted perfection."
—Tezzeret

name: Ritual of Soot
text: Only the patrol's armor was found, so tainted with the acrid smell of sudden death that it could never be worn again.

name: Fiendish Duo
text: Half the size, double the mayhem.

name: Lambholt Elder // Silverpelt Werewolf
text:
"Be wary of the seemingly gentle souls. The weak here were slaughtered long ago."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors

name: Inner Fire
text: "Heart of Sokenzan, I call to you! Lend me your fire."

name: Jokulhaups
text:
"I was shocked when I first saw the aftermath of the Yavimaya Valley disaster. The raging waters had swept away trees, bridges, and even houses. My healers had much work to do."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Trigger Happy
text: Whenever you copy a triggered ability, you may do a little dance.

name: Accursed Centaur
text:
"The Cabal mocks the natural order. For its minions, death is just a pause between duties."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte

name: Umara Wizard // Umara Skyfalls
text:
"You see a waterfall. I see a way up."
—Ko Dari, expedition wizard

name: Pieces of the Puzzle
text: "The clues have begun to reveal a truth I hesitate to accept."

name: Storm Crow
text: Storm crow descending, winter unending. Storm crow departing, summer is starting.

name: Allied Strategies
text: Each commander looked at the others and wondered who would be first to break the alliance.

name: Talisman of Hierarchy
text:
"We shall wage this war with undaunted faith and courage. We shall not take one step back."
—Lord Marshal Toshenko to the Vostroyan 16th

name: Misguided Rage
text: Only when the anger passed did Varv realize he had burned down his home, destroyed his weapons, and killed his friend Furt.

name: Cerodon Yearling
text: The unit of measurement used to chart a cerodon's growth is "persons consumed."

name: Maddening Hex
text: Much more painful than mere regret.

name: Cinder Storm
text: Any pyromancer can summon fire with a thought. The trick is putting it out.

name: Skyclave Cleric // Skyclave Basilica
text:
"Well, she can jump farther than I can."
—Aelah, expedition cleric

name: _____ Goblin
text: The Astrotorium has never been a place for self-restraint.

name: Armageddon
text: War destroys more than just the land. War destroys hope.

name: Sworn Guardian
text: For the River Heralds, the Immortal Sun is an object of terror and devastation. The idea that anyone would retrieve it for their own use is utterly abhorrent.

name: Baithook Angler // Hook-Haunt Drifter
text: Even in death, he casts his lines, forever fishing for reasons long forgotten.

name: Gaea's Gift
text: When it came to fighting an army of trees, even Mishra's best generals were stumped.

name: Duergar Assailant
text: Some duergars dismiss the world above as a fable. They react violently when their comfortable illusions are dispelled.

name: One with the Machine
text:
"When I grafted the Planar Bridge into myself, I felt my Planeswalker spark flare beyond my body. The Multiverse was my plaything. It felt . . . incredible."
—Tezzeret

name: Icy Manipulator
text: Ice may thaw, but malice never does.

name: Empty-Shrine Kannushi
text: "Crease the folds, bend the paper, turn the spirits, shield the soul."

name: Woodland Stream
text:
"Bolas's power on this plane can't be absolute. Look around you."
—Nissa Revane

name: Staff of Nin
text:
"I have attuned the staff to your screams so that only I may benefit from your pain."
—Volux, disciple of Nin

name: Bearscape
text: They built a refuge with their bear hands.

name: Ruinous Intrusion
text: The gourd carving was supposed to take place *after* the feast.

name: Hanna's Custody
text:
"I protect the Legacy with my life if necessary, for its purpose is far more important than my own."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

name: Recover
text: "Wisdom from the past is best gathered directly from the source."

name: Bloodchief's Thirst
text: "We are free. It is our duty to live well."

name: Wall of Mist
text: The seafloor is flecked with the bones of fools who dared to sail into the mist.

name: By Force
text:
"Dissent? Your gods can't even begin to comprehend the dissent that's about to happen here!"
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Red-Hot Hottie
text: She was winning the Dominarian "Are You Hot?" competition until disaster struck during the wet T-shirt round.

name: Boros Guildgate
text:
"It is our duty to protect all those in need. But the other guilds have never shown themselves worthy of that protection."
—Tajic

name: Squirrel Dealer
text: "You see that sheen on the fur? The glint in their eyes? Top quality. These are the real deal."

name: Torrent of Fire
text: Dragon fire melts any instrument designed to measure it.

name: Battle Hurda
text:
"Murasan hurdas were too aggressive to tolerate a harness, so we put them on guard duty. Now the bandits can't get within spitting distance of us."
—Bruse Tarl, Goma Fada nomad

name: Tome Anima
text: Sometimes knowledge takes on a life of its own.

name: Mind Stone
text:
"Except our own thoughts, there is nothing absolutely in our power."
—Rene Descartes, *Discourse on Method*

name: Penumbra Spider
text: When it snared a passing cockatrice, its own soul darkly doubled.

name: Kindly Stranger // Demon-Possessed Witch
text: "I'm not afraid out here, for I know that a higher power protects me."

name: Armored Skaab
text: Literally made for battle.

name: Nyx Infusion
text: A balm or a poison depending on how it is administered, and to whom.

name: Desecrator Hag
text: Loose earth is not a burial but an appetizer.

name: Nomadic Elf
text: "I've journeyed across Dominaria. Phyrexians are everywhere. Plague is everywhere. There's no place left to hide."

name: Dig Through Time
text: No matter how deep the treasure is buried, Hunter can always sniff it out.

name: Kor Dirge
text: Every new evincar cements their power with a culling as the weak are purged anew from Rath.

name: Vindictive Mob
text: Many minds, a single madness.

name: Boros Swiftblade
text: When the Boros Legion attacks, swiftblades enter the fray first. They pick off the archers and mages, softening the enemy front before the flame-kin and giants go in.

name: Gone Missing
text:
"Sometimes it's best for the lost to stay lost."
—Herzag, mayor of Havengul

name: Bog Serpent
text:
"We thought it was a fallen tree trunk. Then it ate Snod."
—Sneed, goblin barkwright

name: Savage Surge
text:
"I thought its back was turned!"
"A centaur has two backs!"

name: Grim Captain's Call
text: When the battle is over, the bitterest foes at last find common ground.

name: Steel-Plume Marshal
text: The defenders watched in terror as the flying V split apart into a bristling battle formation.

name: Disenchant
text:
The scepter of power is fragile in a calloused hand.
—Cho-Arrim saying

name: Mystic Remora
text: The bond between spellcaster and familiar allows the mage to detect even the smallest of magical ripples—and use them to their advantage.

name: Lyzolda, the Blood Witch
text: Sacrificial rites take place before an audience of cheering cultists, each begging to be the next on stage.

name: Tamiyo's Journal
text: Entry 546: There's more to Avacyn's madness . . .

name: Kenku Artificer
text: Though her words may be unoriginal, her creations are anything but.

name: Undercity Necrolisk
text: In its territory, living is an affront.

name: Thalakos Sentry
text:
"Ill luck and poor geography caught the Thalakos between us and the Dauthi."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

name: Grotag Thrasher
text: The goblin fancied himself a rider. The lizard was happy with its new flail.

name: Angel of Glory's Rise
text: "Justice isn't done until undeath is undone."

name: Maestros Diabolist
text: "Where did I find my horned friend? Now there's a story worth telling. . . ."

name: Fertile Ground
text:
"The love of nature . . . is a furious, burning, physical greed. . . ."
—Mary Webb, *The House in Dormer Forest*

name: Tyrranax
text: It outnumbers you one to many.

name: Master Healer
text: Behind his eyes is the pain of every soldier his hands have healed.

name: Phyrexian Purge
text: Only those who have nothing have nothing to fear.

name: Jinxed Idol
text: "Please, honored friend, take it with my compliments. I insist."

name: Gamble
text:
"STUFF AND SUNDRIES AND MUNITIONS!"
—Breeches, gunner of the *Belligerent*

name: Serpent-Blade Assailant
text: "Kaldheim's cosmos was never yours to corrupt."

name: Monstrous Growth
text: Some cats are born fighters; others need a little persuading.

name: Sigiled Skink
text: The runes seem to come alive as it moves, rippling like slow flames across its scales.

name: Will-Forged Golem
text: The modular nature of the automaton's design makes assembly perfectly intuitive.

name: Sigil of the New Dawn
text: The sigil represents an honor that endures beyond death.

name: Campus Renovation
text: Reconstructing the past is Lorehold's specialty.

name: Smelt
text:
"Looks like that wasn't darksteel after all."
—Koth of the Hammer

name: Trickster Mage
text: "If it ain't broke, I'll break it. If it *is* broke, I'll fix it."

name: Khalni Gem
text: A fragment of ancient power lost in the heart of Ora Ondar.

name: Restless Dead
text:
The rich's heirs often thank them after death . . . but preferably not in person.
—Suq'Ata epigram

name: Ram Through
text: The castle's mages had devised effective counters to every form of siegecraft, but had no answers to gorilla warfare.

name: Valor of the Worthy
text: "If I am to die, let it be a hero's death!"

name: Benthic Giant
text:
"Some fates you can see coming for you, plain as day, and there's nothing you can do about them."
—Callaphe the mariner

name: Instruments of War
text: Perfect for keeping time at a battle or a ball.

name: Staff of the Flame Magus
text: A symbol of passion in indifferent times.

name: Wei Strike Force
text: At the battle of Chang'an, Ma Chao defeated the two generals Cao Cao sent to guard the pass but was forced to flee when Cao Cao's trickery turned his own ally against him.

name: Azorius First-Wing
text: With a steady diet of lawbreakers, Azorius griffins inevitably develop a resistance to the contraband magic that taints much of their prey.

name: Ticketomaton
text:
"Please do not engage in debates on the nature of reality with the robot staff."
—Astrotorium sign

name: Drake Familiar
text:
"Falconry? A fine sport I suppose, if you're attracted to the frailty of birds."
—Trivaz, Izzet mage

name: Midnight Arsonist
text: Killing the slayers was self-preservation. The fire was just for fun.

name: Starfield Mystic
text: "The realm of the gods opens before me!"

name: Goblin Grenade
text:
"I don't suppose we could teach them to throw the cursed things?"
—Ivra Jursdotter

name: Tidespout Tyrant
text: The stadium tests more than just fighting skill. For example, swimming ability.

name: Razorfoot Griffin
text:
"Do griffins fight to defend their homes or purely for sport?"
—Sisay

name: Awakened Amalgam
text:
"The fools have done it."
—Tishana

name: Merrow Grimeblotter
text: Grimeblotters spend so much time in the Dark Meanders that they're able to bring a piece with them wherever they go.

name: Juju Bubble
text:
"If my heart had a lid, I would lift it and show you my joy."
—From Suq'Ata wedding ceremony

name: Power of Fire
text: The cinders believe their flame was stolen by one they call the Extinguisher. All who now wield fire draw their desperate wrath.

name: Oculus Whelp
text: Even before Phyrexia's forces arrived on Tarkir, Silumgar's draconic brood had a discerning eye for valuables.

name: Fairgrounds Warden
text: "You're coming with me."

name: Incendiary Sabotage
text: "All of those Consulate safety measures undone with one simple tweak."

name: Smite
text:
"The mighty rely solely on their strength. They are shocked when we do the same."
—Tars Olan, kor world-gift

name: Pillage
text:
"Were they to reduce us to ash, we would clog their throats and sting their eyes in payment."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Lantern Bearer // Lanterns' Lift
text: . . . but she knew it would be rude to refuse.

name: Devour in Shadow
text:
"Feel the burn of the mists. Master them. They will devour your enemies."
—Geth, keeper of the Vault

name: Dorothea, Vengeful Victim // Dorothea's Retribution
text: "Every day a Voldaren draws breath is a day I cannot rest."

name: Incendiary Flow
text: "What's your plan?" Gideon asked. "Are you serious?" Chandra replied.

name: Rogues' Gallery
text: Between the five of them, they'd committed every crime on the books and invented a few new ones.

name: Hissing Iguanar
text: It's pretty cute—from a distance.

name: Bird Maiden
text:
"Four things that never meet do here unite
To shed my blood and to ravage my heart,
A radiant brow and tresses that beguile
And rosy cheeks and a glittering smile."
—*The Arabian Nights*, trans. Haddawy

name: Phyrexian Tower
text:
There was one great tomb more lordly than all of the rest; huge it was, and nobly proportioned. On it was but one word
DRACULA.

name: Prismatic Omen
text: For a brief eternity, the truth refracted across a thousand futures.

name: Virulent Sliver
text:
"They actually have venom, not poison. If they were poisonous, a single drop would—IT BURNS! IT BURNS!"
—Riptide researcher, last words

name: Diamond Faerie
text:
"That such delicate creatures could become so powerful in the embrace of winter is yet more proof that I am right."
—Heidar, Rimewind master

name: Smoldering Werewolf // Erupting Dreadwolf
text:
". . . heck, I'd settle for anything that even resembled a werewolf."
—Raf Gyel of the Quiver of Kessig

name: Tidal Bore
text: The dry riverbed became a raging torrent, and the Cho-Arrim claimed their prize.

name: Sneak Attack
text: "Nothin' beat surprise—'cept rock."

name: Vulshok Berserker
text: He experiences every emotion with passion and repays every slight with vengeance.

name: Alaborn Cavalier
text:
"Course he ran! *I* wouldn't want to stare down that barrel, either!"
—Alaborn soldier

name: Quicksand
text: Not all deaths are etched with mythic meaning and iconic glory.

name: Almighty Brushwagg
text:
Laughed at the brushwagg
—Hunters' expression meaning "died unexpectedly"

name: Inquisitor's Ox
text: Many fields now lie fallow in Gavony, as the oxen have been confiscated to perform other duties.

name: Bag Check
text: "As long as there's no outside food, you're good to go."

name: Caustic Tar
text:
"Twisted magic, twisted fate, Force the land to ooze with hate."
—Cabal chant

name: Invasion of Karsus // Refraction Elemental
text: The crystal landslide stirred over the shattered forms of the Machine Legion vanguard, and then it rose and rearranged itself into an avenging colossus.

name: Mindless Null
text: Only a bloodchief can create vampires. The rest sire nulls, who become mindless beasts in their former bodies.

name: Vodalian Soldiers
text:
"Vodalian rank is displayed by the colors and patterns of their skin. Beware the color red; that is the badge of the empress's favor."
—Corbio, pearl diver

name: Awe Strike
text: Stunned by the mere presence of the leonin kha, the nim raider quickly fell to its knees.

name: Sure Strike
text: "I packed three more electroconduits into each test wand. You'll experience a brief tingling sensation."

name: Ajani's Sunstriker
text: "Ajani goes where he is needed most and in his name we keep his lands safe."

name: Zephid's Embrace
text: Spells will shun you, as will everyone else.

name: Flame Javelin
text: Gyara Spearhurler would have been renowned for her deadly accuracy, if it weren't for her deadly accuracy.

name: Gnat Alley Creeper
text: Despite its diminutive name, Gnat Alley is the longest street in Ravnica. Mile after twisting mile, it threads its way among the broader, safer thoroughfares like a parasite.

name: Boon Reflection
text: Kithkin healers chant the clan songs of both their parents over the broth to double its curative effect.

name: Primal Might
text: The shaman looked at the world through Ghalta's eyes and understood that everything else was his prey.

name: Rest in Peace
text: Lucy had chased every ball, chewed every stick, and rolled in every puddle. She lay down in the sun, content at last.

name: Archaeomancer
text: "Words of power never disappear. They sleep, awaiting those with the will to rouse them."

name: Mistmeadow Vanisher
text: Thanks to the thoughtweft, kithkin mages knew the instant one of their own was in danger.

name: Fruit of the First Tree
text: "I will be the ancestor my descendants call upon for aid. On that day I will take up my sword for my family once more."

name: Shivan Dragon
text: While it's true most Dragons are cruel, the Shivan Dragon seems to take particular glee in the misery of others, often tormenting its victims much like a cat plays with a mouse before delivering the final blow.

name: Hold the Gates
text: "We grew up on these streets. We know them better than any Boros grunt from Zelzo."

name: Rite of Harmony
text: Nature bends to the witches' call.

name: Rushwood Herbalist
text: When generals gather their armies, healers gather their herbs.

name: Moon Heron
text: The heron is the symbol of the archangel Avacyn. The fact that such spirits still fly gives the church hope that its founder may one day return.

name: Wolfkin Outcast // Wedding Crasher
text: The villagers feared him. The cathars scorned him. Only in the wilds did he find a family that accepted him.

name: Branching Bolt
text:
"Lightning lives in everything, in living flesh and growing things. It must be set free."
—Rakka Mar

name: Really Epic Punch
text: It smarts more than the average bear.

name: Survive the Night
text: The longest nights are measured not in hours, but in heartbeats.

name: Aradara Express
text: It glides around the city, a sublime combination of elegance and utility.

name: Lightning Elemental
text:
"A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave, He passes from life to his rest in the grave."
—William Knox, "Mortality"

name: Kami of the Waning Moon
text:
"For a moment, Reito's defenders regrouped. Then wailing kami reappeared to send them scattering like flocks of frightened birds."
—*Great Battles of Kamigawa*

name: Vermiculos
text: Mirrodin's artificial environment requires its own predators, scavengers, and senseless forces of nature.

name: Carnivorous Death-Parrot
text: Save a kill spell to deal with this guy.

name: Culling Dais
text:
"Forswear the flesh and you will truly see."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

name: Dauthi Marauder
text:
"The Dauthi came from beneath the Ruins one night, and the darkness cast them in the best possible light."
—Soltari *Tales of Life*

name: Benthic Djinn
text:
"In all my years I've only met one mage who successfully trapped a djinn—and none who tried and failed."
—Talibah, embermage

name: Brink of Disaster
text:
"You always have a choice. That doesn't mean you always have a good choice."
—Alubri, Guul Draz gatekeeper

name: Brightmare
text: A ray of hope in the darkest night.

name: Atog
text: On Dominaria, a scavenger. On Mirrodin, a predator.

name: Livonya Silone
text: Livonya's own nature is a matter of mystery. Nothing is known for sure, merely rumors of unearthly stealth, and unholy alliances.

name: Jace's Archivist
text: "This is a sacred duty. Master Beleren's trust has bought an eternity of my loyalty."

name: Gavony Silversmith
text: More than heat and the strength of his arm, it was his faith that gave the blade its unyielding edge.

name: Ward of Bones
text: Mages dare not attempt magic in its grotesque presence.

name: Cinder Elemental
text:
"The old gods awoke and sent fingers of fire to see what was left of the old ways under the endless city."
—Daiva, Gruul storyteller

name: Rhox Charger
text: "Momentum is a great ally."

name: Frilled Sea Serpent
text:
"Reel it in. No, wait! Throw it back!"
—Gertrude, deep-sea angler

name: Fearless Halberdier
text: "I spent some time in the Legion, but I'm done taking orders all day."

name: Titania's Boon
text: When the winds rock the trees, listen for voices in the creaking of the trunks. If you hear your name, you are one of the Goddess's chosen.

name: Skeletal Snake
text: They watched as the snake shed layer after layer until only cold bone remained.

name: Mtenda Lion
text:
"The lion drank that lake right up! In thanks, he gave Siti the power to speak with lions and make them leave the goats alone."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Leeching Sliver
text:
"Seeing one slowly devour one of my party begged the question—do they know what cruelty is?"
—Hastric, Thunian scout

name: Aura Mutation
text:
"Life can be found in all things, even things unnatural."
—Multani, maro-sorcerer

name: Arms of Hadar
text: Burning slowly into annihilation, the elder evil Hadar grants fearsome powers to warlocks willing to help satiate its dark hunger.

name: Rally the Ranks
text: Halvar united the spirits of all the clans into a single, devastating force.

name: Honored Crop-Captain
text: Her words inspire action. Her actions inspire victory.

name: Ancient Runes
text: Ertai volunteered to open the portal. He figured he owed it one.

name: Varragoth, Bloodsky Sire
text: "I waded through a river of fire to bring death to Bretagard."

name: Plea for Guidance
text: On Theros, the dove is a symbol not of peace but of discovery. Quick wings herald the arrival of a revelation.

name: Deeproot Waters
text: A visit to the Deeproot Tree and its ancient spring replenishes a merfolk's connection to nature.

name: Morningtide
text:
"The spirits of the righteous shall rise into the sky. Even dirtwalkers will fly like aven."
—Major Teroh

name: Ideas Unbound
text: The apprentice stared in puzzlement. "But Master, you finished writing those spells just yesterday. Don't you remember?" The jushi's heart froze.

name: Barkhide Mauler
text: Anywhere else they would be hunted for their skins, but in Wirewood, they are safe.

name: Aardwolf's Advantage
text:
"My Abattoir Ghoul deck is unbeatable. Wait, 1996 World Champion?"
—Johnny, to Spike

name: Pincher Beetles
text:
"No fair Since when does a bug get ta munch on *me*?"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

name: Extract from Darkness
text: If you want to wreak havoc above, sometimes it's best to look below.

name: Annex
text: You should see how small the map is.

name: Arachnogenesis
text: Every movement is a summons —even your screams.

name: Fortunate Few
text: "...Is it over?"

name: Yargle, Glutton of Urborg
text: When Belzenlok's lieutenant Yar-Kul grew too ambitious, the Demonlord transformed him into a maggot. The frog that ate the maggot grew and grew, until a ravenous spirit burst from its body.

name: Covetous Dragon
text: Gatha survived as long as he did by giving all Keld's predators exactly what they wanted.

name: Despark
text:
「屈辱を受けてすべての力を失った暴君の話？ それだけで刺激的だよ！」
——シルバークイルの魔道生徒、キリアン

name: Angelic Captain
text: As the soldiers beneath her raised their voices, the angel spread her wings, their span seeming to cover the sky.

name: Evolving Wilds
text: Without the interfering hands of civilization, nature will always shape itself to its own needs.

name: Breeding Pit
text: The Thrulls bred at a terrifying pace. In the end, they overwhelmed the Order of the Ebon Hand.

name: Tar Pit Warrior
text:
"The cyclops shrugged off savage blows, but casual insults made him weep."
—Azeworai, "The Cyclops who Couldn't"

name: Painted Bluffs
text: Centuries of scouring sands have carved and polished the rocky terrain of the Shefet.

name: Desperate Ravings
text: Her mind was quite gone, yet she spoke nothing but truth.

name: Spined Sliver
text:
"Slivers are evil and slivers are sly; And if you get eaten, then no one will cry."
—Mogg children's rhyme

name: Zenith Chronicler
text: It watches through the never-ending day, motionless save for the unsettling, twitching dance it performs as each sun reaches its apex.

name: Battered Golem
text: A dent marks every year of service, and it has as much rust as glory.

name: Fireslinger
text:
"One pain is lessened by another's anguish."
—William Shakespeare, *Romeo and Juliet*

name: Palace Sentinels
text:
"One who ruled willing subjects would need no such protection."
—Adriana, Captain of the Guard

name: Boulderfall
text:
"Defeating the Meletians was not so difficult. I needed only to move a mountain."
—Eocles, oracle of Purphoros

name: Trinisphere
text: Designed to restrain petty thoughts, but used to repress entire empires.

name: Devotee of Strength
text: When Rhonas fell, his followers stirred with newfound strength—a final gift from a god they thought indomitable.

name: Jwari Shapeshifter
text: "The best expedition would be an entire team of me."

name: Devastating Dreams
text: Kamahl dreams of storms of fire.

name: Overwhelming Stampede
text:
"I trust the instincts of any beast over the advice of any human who presumes to be an expert in the art of war."
—Rinshel, elf insurgent

name: Kederekt Creeper
text: Bloated with venom, it crawls Grixis looking for victims to ooze onto.

name: Raging Kavu
text: "Yavaimayae necesse mille annis fuit ut illa aluerent, sed modo momentum necesse fuit ut illa pretium probaverent."

name: Pyroblast
text:
"Just the thing for those pesky water mages."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Caress of Phyrexia
text: "I am weak. Make . . . me . . . ideal."

name: Ghostfire Blade
text: If you fear the dragon's fire, you are unworthy to wield it.

name: Wall of Junk
text: Urza saw the wall and realized that even if he tore every Phyrexian to pieces, they would still resist him.

name: Persuasion
text: "Protocol demands that you bow down before me. I always stand on protocol."

name: Axiom Engraver
text: "I will not rest until the truth of Phyrexia is inscribed across the Multiverse."

name: Uthden Troll
text:
"Oi oi oi, me gotta hurt in 'ere
Oi oi oi, me smell a ting is near,
Gonna bosh 'n gonna nosh 'n da hurt'll disappear." —Traditional

name: Loxodon Punisher
text: The loxodons believe punishment comes in two steps: pain and atonement. They carry a weapon for each.

name: Rain of Salt
text: Here, rain does not wash the land; it desiccates it.

name: Monstrous Growth
text: The nightstalkers' little game of tease-the-squirrel suddenly took an unexpected turn.

name: Wall of Swords
text: Just as the evil ones approached to slay Justina, she cast a great spell, imbuing her weapons with her own life force. Thus she fulfilled the prophecy: "In the death of your savior will you find salvation."

name: Deadly Recluse
text: Even dragons fear its silken strands.

name: Unliving Psychopath
text:
"The victim bears the marks of the 'Ktozok Impaler'. . . but he was executed years ago!"
—Gorev Hadszak, Wojek investigator

name: Zuran Orb
text:
"Obsession is Zur's one flaw as a magic user. His total preoccupation with immortality has become an affliction for his otherwise brilliant mind."
—Jodah, Archmage Eternal

name: Berserk Murlodont
text:
"The harder we press forward, the harder Krosa pushes us back."
—Aven scout

name: Thrive
text: The most successful of Simic creations is cytoplasm, a living, symbiotic substance that feeds off genetic rhythms and strengthens its host in return.

name: Emeria Angel
text: When the earth shudders, the sky overflows.

name: Stern Constable
text: "I'm sure you have a story. Everyone has a story. You can tell it to the bars."

name: Flare
text:
"I strive for elegance and speed in my work."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Sabretooth Tiger
text:
"I fear anything with teeth measured in handspans!"
—Norin the Wary

name: Kor Bladewhirl
text: The high-pitched whirl of a hook is the only battle cry she needs.

name: Eiganjo Free-Riders
text:
"The air filled with dust and the sound of wingbeats. The mothriders had joined the fray."
—*Great Battles of Kamigawa*

name: Bird Maiden
text:
Four things that never meet do here unite
To shed my blood and to ravage my heart,
A radiant brow and tresses that beguile
And rosy cheeks and a glittering smile."
—*The Arabian Nights*, trans. Haddawy

name: Shed Weakness
text: To prepare for the Trial of Strength, nagas shed their old skin—and with it their scars, their doubts, and their fears.

name: Faithless Looting
text:
「どうやってそれを手に入れたのだ？ いや、気にするな。答えは聞きたくない。」
—-ロアホールドの学部長、プラーグ

name: Nekrataal
text:
"I have seen the horrors Kaervek has freed. My betrayal is certain—but of Kaervek or of Jamuraa, I cannot say."
—Jolrael

name: Jetmir's Fixer
text: When you lose Jetmir's trust, his family makes sure you lose everything else.

name: Daring Demolition
text: Living so close to death gives the aetherborn an unusual perspective on risk.

name: About Face
text: The overconfident are the most vulnerable.

name: Shimmering Mirage
text:
"Oh, is *that* all you need? Why didn't you just say so?"
—Reef shaman

name: Ramirez DePietro
text: Ramirez DePietro is a most flamboyant pirate. Be careful not to believe his tall tales, especially when you ask his age.

name: Enthusiastic Study
text: "If the pen is mightier than the sword, just think what a giant tome could do!"

name: Tectonic Rift
text:
"You will kneel before me, even if I have to split the earth under your feet!"
—Ash Kronor, Keldon warlord

name: Divinity of Pride
text:
"She spoke of mystery and portent, of such unfathomable things that my mind screamed for pity."
—*The Seer's Parables*

name: Reclamation Sage
text: "What was once formed by masons, shaped by smiths, or given life by mages, I will return to the embrace of the earth."

name: Diabolic Machine
text:
"The bolts of our ballistae smashed into the monstrous thing, but our hopes died in our chests as its gears continued turning."
—Sevti Mukul, The Fall of Alsoor

name: Corpse Churn
text:
"The distraction of your life has ended. Now your service begins."
—Kalitas, thrall of Ulamog

name: Symbol Status
text:
"Everyone break into teams. Weaponry, you're with me. Nature group, meet by the palm tree. Stoneworks and metalworks, follow the anvil. Everyone else, gather around the giant V."
—Sword of Kaldra

name: Evangel of Synthesis
text: "Forge the future in metal and oil!"

name: Carrion Wall
text: A wall built from the bodies of the enemy will never lack building material in times of war.

name: Greenhilt Trainee
text: "Our ancestors adapted to this world of metal. Just as they did, we will adapt to this world of evil."

name: Browbeat
text:
"Pained defiance or shameful surrender—every reaction is a pleasant surprise."
—Tibalt

name: Shimmering Grotto
text:
"This is the price of being last in the food chain. We must keep our places of beauty hidden away instead of displayed for all to see."
—Hildin, priest of Avacyn

name: Wall of Stone
text: The ground itself lends its strength to these walls of living stone, which possess the stability of ancient mountains. These mighty bulwarks thwart ground-based troops, providing welcome relief for weary warriors who defend the land.

name: Blazing Volley
text:
"Don't ask me what to do if you miss. They're stingdrakes. Don't miss."
—Orthion, Lavabrink captain

name: Sparktongue Dragon
text: Fools believe that Kolaghan's brood follows lightning storms. The wise know that it is the other way around.

name: Goblin Motivator
text: Small words stoke large flames.

name: Lunk Errant
text: "One's plenty," observed the merrow. "Way too plenty," agreed the boggart.

name: Bonded Horncrest
text:
"You don't tame a horncrest. You convince it that it's easier to destroy something else."
—Amautl, knight of Atzocan

name: Blessing of Belzenlok
text:
"My heart is not mine, it is Belzenlok's. All hearts are his, and all blood."
—"Rite of Belzenlok"

name: Dismantling Blow
text:
"What cannot be destroyed will be bound, but do try to destroy it the first time."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors

name: Cloudheath Drake
text: A permanent storm rages over the plain of Cloudheath, and drakes ride its currents—two reminders that some elements of Esper will not be controlled.

name: Cursed Monstrosity
text:
"Run away! It's an . . . um . . . run away!"
—Nomad sentry

name: Sun Sentinel
text: Just as the sun rises at dawn and the days lengthen in the summer, the Sun Empire has awakened after long years of quiet.

name: Kinsbaile Cavalier
text: Ambidexterity is common among kithkin. The thoughtweft links the minds of the left- and right-handed, giving each the knack of the other.

name: Winter's Grasp
text: Winter settles on the land, and the land prays it will wake.

name: Darksteel Ingot
text:
"It reflects the purity of Mirrodin-that-was."
—Koth of the Hammer

name: Spell Rupture
text:
"Like water, mana will drain from an inferior vessel."
—Jalan Tosk, Simic forcemage

name: Reclusive Taxidermist
text: All druids seek to preserve nature, but some go about it in rather unusual ways.

name: Overgrown Estate
text: The decay of Crovax's ancestral home matched the state of his soul.

name: Oread of Mountain's Blaze
text:
"Flame-wrapped, she dances a burning swath amid the clouds."
—Psemilla, Meletian poet

name: Start from Scratch
text: "I don't care what they think!" Rootha snapped. "I know I can do better."

name: Silverback Ape
text: His true majesty is not in his silver, but in his size.

name: Regress
text:
"Once cast, a spell can be undone. But once revealed, a secret can never again be kept."
—Pontifex, elder researcher

name: Feast of Flesh
text:
"Starving an army that feeds on its enemies is a sound strategy."
—Garza Zol, plague queen

name: Nullmage Shepherd
text: The shepherds work in secret, seeking out abominations against nature and returning them to earth and dust.

name: Peach Garden Oath
text:
"We three, though of separate ancestry, join in brotherhood . . . . We dare not hope to be together always but hereby vow to die the selfsame day."
—Peach Garden Oath

name: Leather Armor
text: Lightweight, flexible, and protective.

name: Quirion Dryad
text:
"Never underestimate the ability of natural forces to adapt to unnatural influences."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Emberwilde Djinn
text: A hefty price is no guarantee of quality merchandise.

name: Cone of Flame
text:
"Mine is not the warmth of compassion."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Godsire
text:
"Lay sacrifice to the godsire that it may spare us, but save some for his progeny who also will hunger."
—Syeena, elvish godtoucher

name: Unruly Mob
text:
"Who says werewolves are the only ones who can hunt as a pack?"
—Kolman, elder of Gatstaf

name: Owlin Shieldmage
text: "Aim higher next time."

name: Benalish Sleeper
text: Even he didn't know what he was until he felt his skin shifting and splitting, his mind overtaken by a chaos of whispers.

name: Vendetta
text: Starke knew the voice was Takara's, but the venom was Volrath's.

name: Squee's Toy
text: As the horrors closed in on Gerrard, Squee trembled and clutched his toy for comfort. He didn't know where it came from or why it was so warm, but he was glad he'd kept it near.

name: Boseiju Reaches Skyward // Branch of Boseiju
text: Though they razed the surrounding forest, the builders of Towashi left Boseiju unscathed, shaping the city around the ancient tree.

name: Water Elemental
text:
The water that a ship sails on is the same water that swallows it up.
—Chinese proverb

name: Despark
text: Liliana whispered to whatever consciousness Oketra and Bontu had left. "You are the gods. He is the usurper. You know what to do."

name: Scarland Thrinax
text:
"There is only one way of life in Jund: feed on the weak until you are cut down by something stronger."
—Jorshu of Clan Nel Toth

name: Work a Double
text: Ig and Burf discovered the technique by accident when Burf reached for his hammer and missed.

name: Frenetic Ogre
text: The best thing about ogres is that they never try to sneak up on you.

name: Drop Tower
text: In space, no one can hear you repeatedly beg to get off the ride.

name: Rimebound Dead
text:
"Tresserhorn is ours now. Dredge the lake and bring me all the bones you find. We'll build you a new army, the likes of which Terisiare has never seen."
—Heidar, Rimewind master, to Haakon

name: Stromgald Cabal
text:
"Kjeldor must be supreme at any cost."
—Avram Garrisson, leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Nature's Kiss
text:
I cradle my rage even as the earth cradles my dead kin.
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Spellbreaker Behemoth
text:
"Some think its immunity to countermagic evolved because of the constant mage attacks on Naya. I think it just ate a bunch of wizards."
—Broka, drumhunter

name: Beetleback Chief
text: Whether trained, ridden, or eaten, few goblin military innovations have rivaled the bug.

name: Mortal Flesh Is Weak
text: "I certainly would have accepted my offer of eternal life. But if you choose death instead, who am I to argue?"

name: Chandra's Outrage
text: Chandra never believed in using her "inside voice."

name: Mother of Runes
text: "Even if the heavens should fall or the earth split beneath your feet, I will keep you safe."

name: Firebolt
text: Reach out and torch someone.

name: Deeptread Merrow
text: "My success at navigating the Dark Meanders irritates the Inkfathom school. They consider themselves peerless divers, but I try to remind them that they cannot own commodities like bravery and cunning."

name: Triskaidekaphile
text: She's always willing to lend a hand. It just won't be her own.

name: Draugr Recruiter
text: "You cannot stand against us, but when you fall, you will stand with us!"

name: Sphere of Grace
text: Grace repels darkness.

name: Smallpox
text:
"Great losses often bring only a numb shock. To truly plunge a victim into misery, you must overwhelm them with many small sufferings."
—Ratadrabik of Urborg

name: Psychic Miasma
text:
"A mind may be steeled against madness, but all battlements fall in time."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

name: Gnawing Zombie
text: On still nights you can hear its rotted teeth grinding tirelessly on scavenged bones.

name: Drowned Secrets
text: Beneath Ravnica's streets runs a layer of tunnels, then caverns, then waterways, then terrors and nightmares.

name: Reaper King
text: It's harvest time.

name: Bloodthrone Vampire
text: Some humans willingly offered up their blood, hoping it would grant the vampire families the strength to stave off the Eldrazi.

name: Impulse
text:
"I've always made snap decisions. I'm just better at making the right ones now that I'm older and wiser."
—Teferi

name: Plague Beetle
text: It is the harbinger of disease, not the carrier.

name: Naturalize
text: The remains of ancient civilizations litter the run-down land.

name: Meddling Kids
text: These kids know their four-letter words.

name: Imprisoned in the Moon
text: Only one vault was great enough to hold Emrakul.

name: Town Gossipmonger // Incited Rabble
text: Rumors are sparks: gather enough of them and something's going to catch fire.

name: Empty the Warrens
text:
