Kicking the warren
—Argivian expression meaning "causing trouble"

name: Elderwood Scion
text: The Sunbriar druids believe that every life begins in its heart and ends under its hooves.

name: Balduvian Barbarians
text:
"Barbarian raids were a concern to those living in the northwest provinces, but the Skyknights never dealt with the problem in a systematic way. They thought of the Balduvians as an 'amusing model' of their forebears' culture."
—*Kjeldor: Ice Civilization*

name: Balduvian War-Makers
text:
"Those mewling Barbarians will cower before my righteous steel!"
—General Varchild

name: Brazen Scourge
text: Driven by an insatiable hunger, gremlins never cease feeding. They can destroy a lifetime of work in just a few moments.

name: Heart Sliver
text: Gerrard looked all around for the source of the mysterious pulse, and at that moment the slivers boiled forth from the crevasses.

name: Gorilla War Cry
text:
"The only 'art' these beasts possess is the art of noise!"
—Jaya Ballard

name: Martyr's Cause
text: Dying is a soldier's talent.

name: Broken Fall
text:
"I think I used up all my good luck and all my bad luck in the same fall."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Introduction to Prophecy
text: Final grades are posted on the first day of class.

name: Ink-Treader Nephilim
text: When it awoke, the mirrors of the world reflected only darkness.

name: Ghost Ship
text:
"That phantom prow split the storm as lightning cast its long shadow on the battlefield below."
—Mireille Gaetane, *The Valeriad*

name: Basal Sliver
text:
"Fascinating . . . These creatures display the paradox of tenacity and purposed self-destruction I have sought to breed into my thrulls."
—Endrek Sahr, master breeder

name: Volcanic Strength
text: His blood boiled over, and he erupted with fists of stone.

name: Mistform Ultimus
text: It may wear your face, but its mind is its own.

name: Minotaur Skullcleaver
text:
"Their only dreams are of full stomachs."
—Kleon the Iron-Booted

name: Nature's Will
text: The frogs' friendship wasn't necessary for survival, but it did come with generous servings of strawberry crumble.

name: Clattering Skeletons
text: Those who die in the dungeon become its guardians.

name: Kytheon's Tactics
text: "Seal the gate. This is our fight now."

name: Darksteel Axe
text: Heavier than it looks, tricky to wield, guaranteed to last.

name: Demonic Lore
text:
"The greatest works of literature leave the reader forever altered."
—Nevinyrral, Urborg tyrant

name: Nephalia Drownyard
text:
"Some see a coastal disaster. I see a fully-stocked seagraf."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

name: Siege Behemoth
text:
"Hold the line, hold the li—"
—General Srok, last words

name: Martyrs' Tomb
text:
Honor the brave who fought,
Honor the dead who fell,
Honor the world they saved.
—Memorial inscription

name: Temple Garden
text:
"Where the roots reach, there the temple rises."
—Niszka, Selesnya evangel

name: Play of the Game
text: The most sensational plays send everyone home breathless.

name: Aven Archer
text: Aimed by the eyes of eagles, their arrows never miss the mark.

name: Rummaging Goblin
text: To a goblin, value is based on the four S's: shiny, stabby, smelly, and super smelly.

name: Gravecrawler
text:
"Innistrad's ghoulcallers are talented enough, but let me show you what someone with real power can create."
—Liliana Vess

name: Spirit of Resistance
text:
"Our victory must come from all of Dominaria, or it will not come."
—Urza

name: Strength in Numbers
text:
"The hermit dies. The outcast dies. The lone wolf dies. Only those who stick together survive this world."
—Uros, Pendelhaven elder

name: Venomous Changeling
text: It doesn't contain venom. It is venom.

name: Mossfire Egg
text:
"Can you feel your instincts overwhelm your reason?"
—Watnik, master glassblower

name: Bay Falcon
text:
"Wear the falcon's feathers in your hair— be fast as the falcon, bright as the Sun."
—"Rise on Wings," Zhalfirin song

name: Ranger's Guile
text: In the remote corners of Kessig, protection is found in secret powers unknown to the Church of Avacyn.

name: Excavation Technique
text: "Stand back. This part gets messy."

name: Phyrexian Hulk
text: An invasion weapon of ages past, the glistening oil contained the blueprints of countless atrocities.

name: Atogatog
text: It relishes old-fashioned family meals.

name: Gorilla Chieftain
text:
"Oh, no—not *you* again?!"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Glass Golem
text: Izzet artificers have learned to steer their beautiful constructs clear of Boros warhammers—and the opera house.

name: Flame Channeler // Embodiment of Flame
text: At the edge of night, on the cusp of winter, the allure of fire grows ever stronger.

name: Dragon's Claw
text:
"If there is a fire that never ceases to burn, it surely lies in the maw of a dragon."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Ancient Brontodon
text: It is taller than all but the tallest trees, and older than all but the oldest.

name: Whispergear Sneak
text: Spy for today. Plan for tomorrow.

name: Barbed Batterfist
text: "Finally, a safe way to punch the rotters in the face."

name: Grim Roustabout
text: He'll point you to your death row seats.

name: Fan Bearer
text: Rest sometimes requires the right prompting.

name: Song of Blood
text: Purraj sang slaughter and danced death.

name: Karoo Meerkat
text:
"Be like the meerkat, my daughters: ever vigilant, true to your own, and wary of strangers."
—Nabil Alamat, Suq'Ata merchant

name: Stone Rain
text: The return of Ramos was foretold by devastating natural disasters and unnatural storms.

name: Ray of Distortion
text: "Now your staff is as twisted as your soul."

name: Forgotten Lore
text: In ashes are the gems of history.

name: Sliver Hivelord
text:
"This is the source, the line unbroken since the calamity that brought such monsters to our shores."
—Hastric, Thunian scout

name: Into the Maw of Hell
text: Few entrances lead to where demons and devils lurk. Unfortunately, they occasionally open new ones.

name: Shadowheart, Dark Justiciar
text: "Shar's will shall be done. As sure as night will fall."

name: Return to Battle
text: "Swallowing his eye, the valiant Xiahou Dun fought on; / But Cao Cao's vanguard, its commander wounded, could not hold out for long."

name: Grinning Demon
text: It's drawn to the scent of screaming.

name: Akroan Phalanx
text: Shields up, spears out, heels set, hearts firm.

name: Disruptive Student
text:
"Teferi is a problem student. Always late for class. No appreciation for constructive use of time."
—Barrin, progress report

name: No Mercy
text:
"We had years to prepare, while they had mere minutes."
—Kerrick, sleeper agent

name: Shoal Serpent
text:
"It's like a reef that runs aground on ships."
—Jaby, Silundi Sea nomad

name: Bloodcrazed Goblin
text:
"A single drop of blood draws their attention, then they strip your bones clean before you have time to die."
—Jamias, hermit of Telfer Peak

name: Fool's Tome
text: Squee: "What's that?" Ertai: "It's a magical book." Squee: "Am I smart enough ta use it?" Ertai: "You could say that."

name: Gus
text:
"Now I lay me down to sleep—
What are *you* starin' at?"

name: Skycloud Expanse
text: Legend says a mighty angel appears to pilgrims in need who reach this lofty height.

name: Unfulfilled Desires
text:
"Like Day from Night, / I'll live my life apart from you, just glimpsing you across the sky, / because you cannot change, my dear, and nor can I."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Wu Light Cavalry
text: A cunning strategist, Cao Ren tricked Zhou Yu by letting him enter Nanjun. Zhou Yu thought he was capturing the city until Cao Ren's arrows rained down upon him.

name: Daring Thief
text: Honesty is the first casualty of war.

name: Cruel Ultimatum
text: There is always a greater power.

name: Distorted Curiosity
text: "Free will was an illusion so perfect it fooled even me. I know better now."

name: Char
text: Izzet mages often acquire their magic reagents from dubious sources, so the potency of their spells is never predictable.

name: Prey Upon
text: Nature exists in balance: river and jungle, sky and sea, predator and prey.

name: Sinew Dancer
text: He spreads word of the Argent Etchings to a captive audience.

name: Grazilaxx, Illithid Scholar
text: "You studied hard. How delicious!"

name: Unlawful Entry
text:
"Glaxxar, Security Bot 254 has wandered off. After lunch, throw on a spacesuit and go find it."
—Truss, chief engineer

name: Nacatl Hunt-Pride
text: "We must hunt and kill the dragon before it can return to raze our ancient city."

name: Karplusan Forest
text: Between jagged, snowcapped peaks, the dense bands of hardy evergreens provide the perfect cover for roving bands of orc and goblin raiders.

name: Regathan Firecat
text: It stalks the Regathan highlands, leaving behind melted snow, scorched earth, and the charred corpses of would-be temple robbers.

name: Frenetic Raptor
text:
"How do you stop a raptor from charging? No, seriously! Help!"
—Blarg, goblin jester

name: Searing Rays
text:
"This is a battle of pawns, for the highest stakes imaginable."
—Urza

name: Guided Strike
text:
"May the Ancestor strengthen my hand and guide my blade."
—Nomad war prayer

name: Feebleness
text: Just a small touch of magic can harness the debilitating power of Urborg's poisonous winds.

name: Crown of Awe
text: "Honor, guide my step."

name: Mudhole
text: "Doing okay back there, Tarv? Tarv?"

name: Anje Falkenrath
text: "We all hide a little madness behind our sophistication, do we not?"

name: Guild Thief
text: She puts some coin in the Guild's pocket and sends a message at the same time.

name: Vegetation Abomination
text: The animal and vegetable categories kind of merged over time.

name: Expedition Envoy
text: The unofficial motto of every expedition house is "ready for anything," a phrase whose significance has been amplified since the emergence of the Eldrazi.

name: Wakestone Gargoyle
text: Its pulsating cry shatters bonds of iron, granite, and servitude.

name: Goblin Psychopath
text: The destruction he causes is nothing next to the chaos in his mind.

name: Scattered Thoughts
text: Stitchers delegate the most important tasks to assistants with a good eye for detail.

name: Sungold Barrage
text: Heida allowed herself a moment of satisfaction as she watched the beast fall, then turned to seek another foe. It would be a long, long night.

name: Goblin Locksmith
text:
"He's got more finesse than most goblins. He smashes windows with his fist rather than his forehead."
—Arrester Polgar

name: Wild Mammoth
text: "Sit. Heel! Down! HELP!"

name: Harrow
text: With each defeat, the hive learns. With each victory, it grows.

name: Knights of Thorn
text:
"With a great cry, the goblin host broke and ran as the first wave of knights penetrated its ranks."
—Tivadar of Thorn, History of the Goblin Wars

name: Verduran Enchantress
text: Some say magic was first practiced by women, who have always felt strong ties to the land.

name: Heroic Intervention
text:
"Stay close, and their wrathful flames will not harm you."
—Galea

name: Call of the Conclave
text: Centaurs are sent to evangelize in Gruul territories where words of war speak louder than prayers of peace.

name: Brago, King Eternal
text: "My rule persists beyond death itself."

name: Jarad's Orders
text: "The Izzet are searching for something. Discern what or die trying."

name: Utvara Scalper
text: He wages war wherever the wind carries him.

name: Flickerwisp
text: Its wings disturb more than air.

name: Manaplasm
text: Urak froze when he heard it. That was his first mistake. He turned and cast a dramatic ward spell. That was his last.

name: Command Tower
text: There is a place apart from this world, a rift where pretense falls away and champions find their glory.

name: Centrifuge
text: Originally, the rotors were used exclusively as particle accelerators for engine fuel, and they probably still should be.

name: Chrome Replicator
text: Who would you trust to watch your back more than yourself?

name: Krosan Beast
text: The true Fist of Krosa is big and furry.

name: Some Disassembly Required
text: Now all they needed was a jolly, happy soul.

name: Tablet of Epityr
text: Originally considered the work of Urza, this tablet was created by forgers seeking to imitate Urza's masterpieces.

name: To Arms!
text:
"The call came, spell-borne through mortar and stone to the ear of every soldier. The call came, and the advantage was ours."
—Lodusz, captain of the watch

name: Feywild Visitor
text: Fey energy clings to you, a shimmering reminder of your otherworldly travels.

name: Intimidator Initiate
text: Don't stand in his way, for his way is full of pointy things and fire.

name: Warded Battlements
text: In dire times, even a place of refuge can become a weapon of war.

name: Perish
text:
"There will come a time when the voices of soil and seedling will sing only laments."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Dreams of Steel and Oil
text: Mishra's nightmares of Phyrexia rang with screams of agony and groans of twisted metal. The sounds stayed with him long after he awoke.

name: Binding Grasp
text:
"What I want, I take."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran royal mage

name: Martyr of Dusk
text: "Should I fall, take up our standard and carry on. The Legion must always prevail."

name: Oversoul of Dusk
text:
"Some say she hid the sun herself, a desperate act to save it from its ultimate extinction."
—*The Seer's Parables*

name: Silent Arbiter
text: Scholars say that arbiters exist on every world, created by an unknown hand to enforce justice.

name: Lobber Crew
text: It's easier to just aim at everything.

name: Smoldering Egg // Ashmouth Dragon
text: A dragon is born. A province burns.

name: Commander's Insignia
text: At the general's triumphant return, renewed strength surged through the soldiers' ranks.

name: Teyo's Lightshield
text: Teyo gifted his shields to as many allies as possible, knowing he could not always be there to protect them himself.

name: Ethersworn Sphinx
text: Intent: Most Esper sphinxes have minimal filigree enhancement, but this sphinx has been extensively enhanced.

name: Eron the Relentless
text:
"Eron would be much less of a hassle if only he were mortal."
—Reyhan, Samite alchemist

name: Venerated Rotpriest
text:
"This was once a peaceful spring, but I wouldn't advise taking a sip."
—Melira

name: Preening Champion
text: On Kylem, the omens of impending invasion went largely unnoticed, drowned out by the everyday fanfare of Valor's Reach.

name: Inquisitor's Snare
text: Driven by their paranoia, kithkin inflict on their foes all the agonies they believe would have been inflicted on them.

name: Three Tragedies
text:
"As the kami passed over the village of Mita, the inhabitants relived their three most grievous tragedies. Some cried. Some raged. Some were driven to madness. But the next morning, none possessed the will to fight."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Explosive Vegetation
text: Torching Krosa would be pointless. It grows faster than it burns.

name: Dinrova Horror
text:
"Welcome to the Dimir Public Offices. Not responsible for death or loss of property. Basement off-limits."
—Sign outside Dinrova Building

name: Spellshock
text: A snap of fingers, a snap of teeth.

name: Wall of Swords
text:
"When I said we needed more swords to protect the realm, this was not quite what I had in mind."
—Olander, tactician of the Northern Verge

name: Pacifism
text:
"Fight? I cannot. I do not care if I live or die, so long as I can rest."
—Urza, to Serra

name: Seismic Assault
text: Earth arms itself with fire.

name: Leonin Lightbringer
text: "It's hard to fight for the future if you can't see the way forward."

name: Brassclaw Orcs
text:
"Modern Sarpadia's swarming with thrulls. It's a testament to the orcs that they've survived there so long."
—Elbieta, Argivian scholar

name: War-Trained Slasher
text:
"That's my girl. Just don't eat it—wouldn't want you getting an upset stomach again."
—Jalina, Ikorian bonder

name: Jackknight
text: "My sword is at your service, as are my scissors, corkscrew, and bottle opener."

name: Sentinel Dispatch
text:
"Unusual. Security also worth stealing."
—Dack Fayden

name: Dripping Dead
text: It oozes death from every pore.

name: Aerial Engineer
text: The best of their trade know every bolt of their rigs, stem to stern.

name: Spinny Ride
text:
"If a species will pay to be moved in a circle, I will find a way to let it."
—Myra the Magnificent

name: Tireless Missionaries
text: If they succeed in their holy work, their order will vanish into welcome obscurity, for there will be no more souls to redeem.

name: Harsh Sustenance
text: The Shifting Wastes provide refuge to those who know where to look for it.

name: Stone Rain
text: There goes the neighborhood!

name: Brood of Cockroaches
text:
"It's like waking on a bed of a thousand olives during an earthquake of subtle force."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Standing Army
text: They're the chair-men of the bored.

name: Grasp of Darkness
text: On a world with five suns, night is compelled to become an aggressive force.

name: Augur il-Vec
text: "If it would end this exile, my life is yours."

name: Pendulum of Patterns
text: Its elaborate designs reveal secrets of aether's flow.

name: Lorehold Campus
text: Mage-students obsessed with the secrets of the past choose Lorehold, the college of archaeomancy.

name: Ballot Broker
text:
"Merchants and politicians differ only in name."
—Queen Marchesa

name: Psychic Rebuttal
text: "I know what you're thinking," Jace whispered in the mage's mind. "It's not going to work."

name: Rank Officer
text: It recruits the fresh and tosses the rotten.

name: Woodlurker Mimic
text: A mimic's disguise fools its victims just long enough to draw them within range of its venomous tentacles.

name: Fangblade Brigand // Fangblade Eviscerator
text: As long as the sun is up, you'll only lose your purse.

name: Freewind Falcon
text:
"That does it! I'm going back to hunting chickens!"
—Rhirhok, goblin archer

name: Thought Monitor
text: Mood: An efficient, well-designed machine.

name: Pilgrim's Eye
text: Charting the Spine of the World is best left to the disposable.

name: Ludevic, Necro-Alchemist
text: "How does one become a self-taught genius? Naturally, it requires brains."

name: Treetop Rangers
text:
"If you can't catch them, cut the trees down from beneath them. Force them to fight on our terms."
—Mishra

name: Children of Korlis
text:
"We have a proud history of self-sacrifice. But it is easy, in these bleak times, to find one among us who is eager to die for any cause."
—Tavalus, acolyte of Korlis

name: Headless Specter
text: No tongue to chant, yet the forsaken hymn still emanates from its body.

name: Dry Spell
text:
"Wherever water is lacking, all things suffer."
—Autumn Willow

name: Cunning Survivor
text: Initiates who had been through the Trial of Knowledge learned to see everything as pieces of a larger puzzle.

name: Cancel
text: "Let me try one of Kefnet's puzzles. This one was too easy."

name: Nature's Lore
text:
"It is in our nature to recognize beauty, but to repeat it—ah, that is another feat altogether."
—Hannah of Verdura

name: Reversal of Fortune
text: "Why learn hundreds of spells when you can learn only one and use it to steal hundreds?"

name: Niblis of the Urn
text:
"I never had the nerve to open that bottle. I'll bet you're wishing right now you hadn't been so curious yourself."
—Old Rutstein

name: Barroom Brawl
text: "I'll see your three dragons and raise you two fists!"

name: Blind-Spot Giant
text: Among the solitude-loving giantkind, teamwork is unusual. But he appreciates hearing the occasional "Swing down and to your left."

name: Omenspeaker
text: Her prophecies amaze her even as she speaks them.

name: Vectis Silencers
text: Even on Esper, there are those who eschew the use of magic in favor of simpler methods.

name: Ophiomancer
text:
"There are dark, ancient arts that fascinate even me."
—Sorin Markov

name: Thermo-Alchemist
text: "Madness can't touch a mind ignited by genius."

name: All Will Be One
text: The Invasion Tree broke through the Blind Eternities and sent Phyrexian perfection coursing across the Multiverse.

name: Banehound
text:
"I wish I could train a pack of them for hunting in the undercity. But I'd never dare turn my back, and I hate to think what I'd have to feed them."
—Zhosmir, urban huntmaster

name: Angel of the God-Pharaoh
text: The angels did not deceive. From the start, they were clear their allegiance was to the God-Pharaoh and to him alone.

name: Meteor Crater
text: Legend has it that meteor craters are haunted by the ghosts of those who died on impact.

name: Aviation Pioneer
text: "They say perfection is unattainable, but they said that about flight too."

name: Farseek
text: "How truly vast this city must be, that I have traveled so far and seen so much, yet never once found the place where the buildings fail."

name: Coastal Tower
text: A beacon in the night, a dream in the fog.

name: Agony Warp
text: Life's circle has become inverted in Grixis. The same energy is endlessly recycled and becomes more stagnant with each pass.

name: Ostiary Thrull
text: Orzhov churches don't pass the plate for collection. They charge for admission.

name: Plated Sliver
text: Overcoming extinction has only made the slivers more determined to live.

name: Oona's Prowler
text: Deep in Glen Elendra blossoms Oona, queen of the faeries, nourished by secrets and pollinated by stolen dreams.

name: Court of Bounty
text: To grow is to triumph.

name: Chainbreaker
text: Scarecrows deemed too malevolent to roam free are shackled to boulders or dolmen stones. Their animosity usually outlives the chains.

name: Deadly Rollick
text: Otrimi was disappointed at how quickly its new friend got tired and stopped playing.

name: Realmbreaker's Grasp
text: The Invasion Tree wasn't merely a conduit through which to breach planes. It was a living, writhing extension of Phyrexia's will.

name: Safehold Elite
text: Not even death will keep her from her mission.

name: Firebreathing
text:
"Cradle your rage close to your heart and nurture your grudge with hatred that you may unleash upon your foes a dragon's fury."
—Tomor, dragonspeaker shaman

name: Memory Lapse
text:
"Oh, I had a conscience once. But alas, I seem to have forgotten where I put it."
—Chandler

name: Skirsdag High Priest
text: "Thraben's pleas fall on deaf ears. Ours do not."

name: Rakalite
text: Urza was the first to understand that the war would not be lost for lack of power, but for lack of troops.

name: Goldwardens' Gambit
text: At Neyali's command, they took position. At Otharri's signal, they struck.

name: Canyon Minotaur
text:
"We'll scale these cliffs, traverse Brittle Bridge, and then fight our way down the volcanic slopes on the other side."
"Isn't the shortest route through the canyon?"
"Yes."
"So shouldn't we—"
"No."

name: Pointed Discussion
text: Small talk is a dying art.

name: Vampiric Feast
text: It's not always gold the thief is after.

name: Charmed Griffin
text: Are you sure you can afford such a luxury?

name: Kavu Recluse
text: Few ever see this particular breed of kavu, which hides in forests of its own making.

name: Elvish Pioneer
text: "Destruction is the work of an afternoon. Creation is the work of a lifetime."

name: Crowned Ceratok
text: The best way to calm a rampaging ceratok is to wait until it dies of natural causes.

name: Olivia's Bloodsworn
text: "As we muster for war, I have little patience for lethargy or recalcitrance."

name: Phyrexian Obliterator
text:
"Show me what Norn's sycophants are hiding under all that pretty porcelain."
—Sheoldred

name: Squee, Goblin Nabob
text:
"If Yawgmoth meant Squee's immortality as a curse, no one ever told Squee."
—Karn

name: Screeching Bat // Stalking Vampire
text: The bat has such clarity of hearing that simple sounds become symphonies.

name: Branded Brawlers
text:
"The sword or the lash. Choose."
—Akul, Keldon whip sergeant

name: Deathmark
text:
"I hope it's true that every snowflake is unique, because I never want to see one like this again. Now clean up that body."
—Thangbrand Gyrdsson, Kjeldoran patrol

name: Fissure Wizard
text: He might call up a burst of lava or a raging hellion from Akoum's volcanic depths. Or he might just fall in.

name: Ratcatcher
text: An ogre's poisonous stench is like fine Kashkaval cheese to the noses lowest to the ground.

name: Screamreach Brawler
text: "My dragonlord's lightning will dance upon your bones!"

name: Hardy Veteran
text: For the Sun Empire, the Immortal Sun is a symbol of national identity. When they reclaim it, the Empire will flourish once more.

name: Stolen Vitality
text: "There's nothing like a good meal to really lift the spirit."

name: Kadena, Slinking Sorcerer
text: "The only constant in life is the unknown."

name: Fangren Pathcutter
text:
"Tracking a fangren pack is easy. Catching up to one is fatal."
—Viridian scout

name: Quicken
text: A skilled Izzet chronarch can carry out an epic vendetta between the fall of one hourglass grain and the next.

name: Uncaged Fury
text: The cage is a crucible for the rage that builds inside, refining it into something pure and terrible.

name: White Knight
text: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the knight had just laid waste.

name: Murasa Rootgrazer
text: Few other creatures so closely embody Murasa's rapid cycles of growth.

name: Totem-Guide Hartebeest
text: It is hunted, but not for the kill. The magic within draws others to its presence.

name: Acquisition Octopus
text: You can never have too many arms.

name: Sungrass Prairie
text: On Otaria, peace and harmony are rare. Places that provide both are cherished.

name: Daggerback Basilisk
text:
"Petrifying gaze, deadly fangs, knifelike dorsal spines, venomous saliva . . . Am I missing anything? . . . Toxic bones? Seriously?"
—Samila, Murasa Expeditionary House

name: Wall of Roots
text: Sometimes the wise ones wove their magic into living plants; as the plant grew, so grew the magic.

name: Dark Heart of the Wood
text:
"The soil here is rich with the rotting dead, and the sun's fingers barely penetrate the dark canopy. Plant our brethren here. This shall be our sanctuary."
—Savra

name: Phantom Monster
text: "While, like a ghastly rapid river, Through the pale door, A hideous throng rush out forever, And laugh—but smile no more." —Edgar Allan Poe, "The Haunted Palace"

name: Fire Elemental
text: It treads on feet of coals and strikes with the force of a volcano.

name: Defy Gravity
text: Magical or not, it's still a cloud.

name: Forsake the Worldly
text: "Why cling to these trappings? They are but tools and affectations. True wealth can be possessed only in the afterlife."

name: Gruesome Deformity
text: She wanted to inspire terror wherever she went. The demons happily granted her wish.

name: Wirewood Guardian
text: Tall as a tree and probably related.

name: Shield Sphere
text:
"My Soldiers know that they need never fear for their protection."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

name: Icatian Scout
text:
"Scouting is the art of balancing the need to go undiscovered with the need to get all the information you can. It's only by Leitbur's good grace that I'm still alive today."
—Ailis Connaut, *Diary*

name: Goblin Turncoat
text: Modo was great at making friends . . . into shields.

name: Griptide
text: When the sea god Thassa wishes to speak with a mortal, she does not issue a summons or grant a vision requesting a visit. The sea simply brings her guest before her.

name: Robaran Mercenaries
text: "We learned from the best. And the worst. Pretty much whoever was available."

name: Soldier of Fortune
text:
"Loyalty to coin alone is loyalty nonetheless."
—General Varchild

name: Companion of the Trials
text:
"The fiercest loyalties are earned in battle."
—Gideon Jura

name: Extricator of Sin // Extricator of Flesh
text: After the end, a new beginning.

name: Turn Aside
text: "It's not my job to ask our leaders about their experiments at the Knowledge Pool. It's my job to make sure they can continue performing them."

name: Apex Altisaur
text: It brings belligerence to new heights.

name: Myr Scrapling
text:
"They're useful creatures, but quite replaceable. I find it best not to get too attached."
—Pontifex, elder researcher

name: Wirewood Herald
text: The goblins laughed as the elf ran away, until more came back.

name: Loch Korrigan
text:
"Don't look upon still waters without first breaking the surface. The korrigan will catch you with her gaze and drag you to your death."
—Kithkin superstition

name: Akroan Conscriptor
text: "The time to serve is now."

name: Radiant Flames
text: The fires of Zendikar are always hungry, and there is much on which they can feed.

name: Frogmite
text: At first, vedalken observers thought blinkmoths naturally avoided certain places. Then they realized those places were frogmite feeding grounds.

name: Mind's Dilation
text: Infinite wisdom cannot be contained within a single mind.

name: Canyon Jerboa
text:
"Move, you wretched thing! You're scaring the hurdas!"
—Bruse Tarl, Goma Fada nomad

name: Confound
text: "Did I know Szat would betray us?" Urza asked quizzically. "I was counting on it."

name: Lifespinner
text:
"The husk splits like a madman's smile And mystery steps forth."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Ebon Drake
text: The deadliest killers serve only those who are not afraid to die.

name: Hunters' Feast
text: Those who kill a jawspur rhino must prepare spells to lift the carcass—even a dozen hunters can't lift its bulk.

name: Sweep the Skies
text: A gleam of refracted light is often the only warning.

name: Anhelo, the Painter
text: Every work of art is a hit.

name: Clock of Omens
text: Most clocks measure time, but a few measure everything.

name: Elvish Archers
text: The archers have a reputation for attacking without warning. They claim that the first arrow *is* the warning.

name: Yurlok of Scorch Thrash
text: The gifts of Jund never come without a price.

name: Trailblazer's Boots
text: It's much easier to list the places they *haven't* been.

name: Defy Gravity
text: On every plane in the Multiverse, there is magic, and someone is using it to fly.

name: Spined Fluke
text: Its spines are prized as writing quills by the priests of Gix.

name: Iron League Steed
text: The Iron League prides itself on its metal-shaping techniques.

name: Foothill Guide
text: "Like any pests, goblins must be repelled quickly or they multiply."

name: Serra's Guardian
text: She watches over the city just as Serra watches over all.

name: Renewed Faith
text: Skepticism fades in the face of the miraculous.

name: Artifact Blast
text: The first line of defense against Urza and Mishra, the artifact blast achieved widespread fame until an unlucky mage discovered it was useless on the devices the brothers had already created.

name: Banewasp Affliction
text: The consuming undeath of Grixis terrifies the survivors of Vithia, but its fauna is just as fearsome.

name: Tamiyo's Logbook
text:
"We are opening a new chapter in the one true story of Phyrexia. Someone must record it for posterity."
—Tamiyo

name: Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer
text: "The world calls and I answer."

name: Pangosaur
text: Only Rushwood is vast enough to swallow this creature whole.

name: Plague Beetle
text: No one knows whether they were named for the disease they carry or for the speed at which they multiply.

name: Ainok Tracker
text:
"The ainok are wild dogs, not fit to join us around the fire."
—Surrak, the Hunt Caller

name: Syphon Soul
text: As Phage drank their energy, a vague memory of Jeska stirred. Then she lost herself again in the joy of her victims' suffering.

name: War's Toll
text: Razia, archangel of war, demands total commitment.

name: Merfolk Mistbinder
text:
"The mist clothes us when we are bare, hides us when we are alone, and unites us when we are together."
—Nirit of Pashona's band

name: Crash
text: Gerrard shook his head as the ground rushed to meet him. "This," he thought, "is not the start I was hoping for."

name: Minamo's Meddling
text: Like storm water through the segments of bamboo, the spell followed the links of magic. Then it destroyed them.

name: Pardic Miner
text: "Punch and drag, Toss the slag, Sift the soil, Leave the spoil."

name: Goblin Researcher
text: Slonk was struck by lightning twenty-seven times before he got the idea. Another forty-three hits and he'd perfected it.

name: Disinformation Campaign
text:
"People would sooner savor sweet lies than chew plain truths."
—Lazav

name: Force of Negation
text: Not even the most seathing critics can break her concentration.

name: Phyrexian Arena
text: A drop of humanity for a sea of power.

name: Amulet of Unmaking
text:
Trade to trade, not to keep.
—Suq'Ata motto

name: Time Walk
text: 2022 North America Vintage Championship

name: Illness in the Ranks
text:
"Selesnya denied us tribute. Let's show them the error of their ways."
—Milana, Orzhov prelate

name: Kyoki, Sanity's Eclipse
text:
"Kyoki, Eater of Minds, Corrupter of Thoughts, Bringer of Madness, Lord of Fear. Return, by our blood, and walk again."
—Ogre chant

name: Live Fast
text: "When you have the chance, take it. Laugh, sing, dance. Don't allow the night to end."

name: Fountain Watch
text: The Cho-Arrim didn't rely only on a secret location to protect their Fountain.

name: Oblivion Ring
text: A circle of sugar and a word of forbiddance.

name: Kelsien, the Plague
text: "Aim for an eye. Better they never see you."

name: Incinerate
text:
"Yes, I think 'toast' is an appropriate description."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Elite Cat Warrior
text: "Hear that? No? *That's* a cat warrior."

name: Rograkh, Son of Rohgahh
text: Rograkh couldn't bear to watch his father pillage his own people. Not when there were so many other people they could pillage instead.

name: Venom
text: "I told him it was just a flesh wound, a wee scratch, but the next time I looked at him, poor Tadhg was dead and gone." —Maeveen O'Donagh, *Memoirs of a Soldier*

name: Terraformer
text: "This feels a little more like home."

name: Spikewheel Acrobat
text: "Every street's a stage, and every screaming bystander's an audience."

name: Mind Whip
text:
"A mind in agony is a sparrow without wings."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Falkenrath Perforator
text: "Lady Anje sends her regards. I'll carve the rest of her message into your skin."

name: Swans of Bryn Argoll
text: Any being that harms them quickly learns its lesson.

name: Ragamuffyn
text: They cut the stitches and give her sips of her brew. Then they sew her up again, and she's back to stirring.

name: Showstopper
text: The audience quickly realized a few things: it wasn't a magic trick, there wasn't candy in there, and they'd need new clothes.

name: Heliod, the Radiant Dawn // Heliod, the Warped Eclipse
text:
"*Compleat* the god, *compleat* the plane."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Overgrown Tomb
text: Cradle of the Golgari's new kingdom. Grave of those who wronged its queen.

name: Vampire Neonate
text: One day, they may be paragons of deadly elegance. For the moment, they possess nothing but thirst.

name: Tenacity
text: Thalia established the Order of Saint Traft in an effort to bring together cathars who would stand against the corruption of the Lunarch Council.

name: Goblin Cohort
text: Akki shells provided good protection when downhill charging became headlong tumbling.

name: Teferi's Drake
text:
"We threw dried fruit to the drakes that rode the air, streaming along the *Weatherlight'*s side as we sailed amidst the clouds."
—Sisay, Captain of the *Weatherlight*

name: Log Flume
text: "Thanks for riding, and be sure not to leaf anything behind! Just some tree humor for you."

name: Salt Road Patrol
text:
"Soldiers win battles, but supplies win wars."
—Kadri, Abzan caravan master

name: Reckless Reveler
text:
"The gods of Theros are born of the expectations and beliefs of mortals. If I have found godhood, what does that say about their true desires?"
—Xenagos, god of revels

name: Lynx
text: Rarely seen, hardly heard, never caught.

name: Rosemane Centaur
text: "I long for peaceful times, when I may tend to my garden instead of our borders."

name: Jetting Glasskite
text: The bolt struck with a flash, and there was a terrible sound, as of glass shattering, but the creature was unharmed.

name: Thunderbolt
text:
"My next aerial design will use less metal."
—Hadaken, alchemist of Nephalia

name: Meandering Towershell
text: The wait is proportional to the weight.

name: Royal Falcon
text: Hunter by instinct, weapon by training.

name: Back for More
text:
"How can you be sure you pierced its heart? Do you even know where its heart is?"
—Trundan, Indatha poacher

name: Beckon Apparition
text: When a graveyard is full, the gwyllions rattle the tombs and unleash the spirits into the sky.

name: Burst of Energy
text:
"I stand ready to die for our world. Who will stand with me?"
—Radiant, archangel

name: Starke of Rath
text:
"I know to whom I owe the most loyalty, and I see him in the mirror every day."
—Starke

name: Pack Leader
text: He will be your loyal champion, and his pack your protectors. All he asks for is a full belly, a spot by the fire, and all the love in your heart.

name: Descend upon the Sinful
text: Above the cries, a phrase rang out: "You will all be saved."

name: Theft of Dreams
text: Energy is never lost, only transformed.

name: Wall of Wonder
text: So confusing is the Wall's appearance that few of its victims even see it move.

name: Savage Twister
text:
"Nature is the ultimate mindless destroyer, capable of power and ferocity no army can match, and the Gruul follow its example."
—Trigori, Azorius senator

name: Priest of Titania
text: Titania rewards all those who honor the forest by making them a living part of it.

name: Insatiable Appetite
text: He ate them out of house and home and shed and barn and flock and herd.

name: Mishra, Artificer Prodigy
text: A sojourn through time gave dark inspiration to one gifted young mind.

name: Bellowing Aegisaur
text: Its roaring challenge is punctuated by the slam of its tail on the earth, rousing the herds of the plains.

name: Mardu Heart-Piercer
text: "Those who have never ridden before the wind do not know the true joy of war."

name: Scryb Sprites
text: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the scryb were very funny anymore.

name: River Hoopoe
text:
"It's a cruel thing to give such a sad song to such a colorful creature."
—Sana, former Ahn-crop initiate

name: Reminisce
text: Leave the door to the past even slightly ajar and it could be blown off its hinges.

name: Time Ebb
text:
"Gone today, here tomorrow."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Rith's Attendant
text: "Rith is the claw of the ur-dragon, scattering seeds of devastation."

name: Aegis Automaton
text: The streets of Ghirapur have become dangerous. It's good to have a dependable companion.

name: Thrull Retainer
text:
"Until the Rebellion, thrulls served their masters faithfully—even at the cost of their own lives."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. II*

name: Boulder Salvo
text:
"If someone claims the sky is falling, I listen."
—Yon Basrel, Oran-Rief survivalist

name: Blizzard Elemental
text: Students who had seen Rayne argue with Urza were certain she had summoned it to make him seem warmer by comparison.

name: Vex
text:
"The druids would be better off if they spent more time in the lab and less time watching trees grow."
—Pontifex, elder researcher

name: Floodwater Dam
text: Viscerid dams may be of living creatures as well as bones and mud.

name: Hypnotic Specter
text:
"…There was no trace Of aught on that illumined face…."
—Samuel Coleridge, "Phantom"

name: Icatian Phalanx
text: Even after the wall was breached in half a dozen places, the Phalanxes fought on, standing solidly against the onrushing raiders. Disciplined and dedicated, they held their ranks to the end, even in the face of tremendous losses.

name: Haazda Snare Squad
text: They've been probation officers, army grunts, bounty hunters—anything to make their district safer.

name: Duress
text:
"Don't worry. I'm not going to deprive you of all your secrets. Just your most precious one."
—Liliana Vess

name: Thassa's Devourer
text: When mortals claim there are places Thassa cannot reach, the sea god laughs.

name: Krovikan Fetish
text: Some Krovikans find strength in the ears and eyes of their victims and wear such fetishes into battle.

name: Dictate of Erebos
text: "I take no pleasure in your suffering, but it is necessary. Once you accept your fate you'll find eternity more tolerable."

name: Fade into Antiquity
text:
"Are the gods angry at our discontent with what they give us, or jealous that we made a thing they cannot?"
—Kleon the Iron-Booted

name: Alabaster Kirin
text: The appearance of a kirin signifies the passing or arrival of an important figure. As word of sightings spread, all the khans took it to mean themselves. Only the shaman Chianul thought of Sarkhan Vol.

name: Firebrand Ranger
text: A skilled ranger can glance at the mud on your boots and tell where you last camped.

name: Eight-and-a-Half-Tails
text: "Virtue is an inner light that can prevail in every soul."

name: Frostburn Weird
text: Many chemisters are oblivious to the innumerable machinations of their guild, instead focusing obsessively on creating the perfect weird.

name: Searing Spear
text: Sometimes you die a glorious death with your sword held high. Sometimes you're just target practice.

name: Sylvok Replica
text: All the zeal of the Sylvok with only a trace of their conservancy.

name: Crawlspace
text: The goblins did not understand their attraction to the mana rig. They simply knew it was where they belonged.

name: Armored Ascension
text:
"Why enchant feathers to make them sturdy when we can enchant shields to make them fly?"
—Braenna, cobblesmith

name: Blazing Salvo
text: Barbarians equate courage with the ability to endure pain.

name: Voidslime
text: "Cyclonic Ri—fplfmplfmlfblthpfmnsnffl!"

name: Lodestone Golem
text:
"Progress update: the problem of the slagheap blocking the entrance seems to have solved itself."
—Mine supervisor's report

name: Prakhata Pillar-Bug
text: Not a mote of dust escapes the dutiful cleaners that keep the exclusive Prakhata Club immaculate.

name: Skyhunter Prowler
text:
"If what I have seen comes to pass, we will need our guardians more than ever."
—Ushanti, leonin seer

name: Mischievous Poltergeist
text:
"The past is a ghost that haunts you from the moment it exists until the moment you don't."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Into the Wilds
text:
"Wonders hide where the trees grow thickest."
—Mul Daya proverb

name: Joraga Auxiliary
text: "Before the battle, I heard them take an oath near the ruins of Sea Gate. I hope they inspire others to keep watch."

name: Dark Prophecy
text: When the bog ran short on small animals, Ekri turned to the surrounding farmlands.

name: Search the Premises
text:
"To halt these lurid practices, Geralf must be found and made an example of."
—Inquisitor Delmund

name: Vengeful Warchief
text: "Try to steal from me and I'll add your skull to my collection."

name: Sparkmage Apprentice
text: Sparkmages are performance artists of sorts, but pain is the price of admission.

name: Memory Plunder
text:
"Vengeance is the echo of the victim's own crime."
—Grensch, merrow cutthroat

name: Shield Mare
text: When it passes, order defeats chaos.

name: Dread Charge
text:
"As equal were their souls, so equal was their fate."
—John Dryden, "Ode to Mrs. Anne Killigrew"

name: Alloy Golem
text:
"We turned old weapons into new warriors."
—Jhoira, master artificer

name: Dread Specter
text:
Whatever follows life is incurable.
—Zhalfirin aphorism

name: Jaya's Greeting
text: "We have visitors? Well, it'd be rude not to give them a traditional Keral Keep welcome."

name: Hound Tamer // Untamed Pup
text: "You and me, we're not built for captivity."

name: Curse of Surveillance
text: For every eye gouged out, two blinked open.

name: Eviscerator
text: It roamed the time bubble like a captured animal. Kerrick knew he must soon find a way to unleash it on Tolaria or destroy it.

name: Ghitu Chronicler
text: "What fire forged, fire remembers."

name: Giant's Grasp
text: "Behave and you'll be a fine pet. Bite me and you're ammunition."

name: Ojutai, Soul of Winter
text:
"When I battled Ojutai, I realized my learning had only begun."
—Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest

name: Shock
text:
"To this day, I have no idea if the heavens were obeying him or attacking him."
—Ral Zarek, research notes

name: Gravepurge
text:
"The Blessed Sleep? Ha! Wake up my lovelies, there's work to be done!"
—Gisa, ghoulcaller of Gavony

name: Wall of Vines
text: Like all jungle plants, the vines must fight and claw for sunlight. Once their place is secured, they grow strong, sharp, and impenetrable.

name: Pit Trap
text: Yotian soldiers were designed to fight, not watch their feet.

name: Warthog
text:
"Too much work—it takes a long time to break them in, and more than a few recruits."
—Grebog, goblin swine-rider

name: Sigil of the New Dawn
text:
"We lay our dead to rest in a beautiful bed, in hopes that the Ancestor will think it a fit cradle for the next life."
—Mystic elder

name: Depart the Realm
text: "My home calls to me, I must go."

name: Novice Knight
text: Even the greatest hero begins with nothing.

name: Repentant Blacksmith
text:
"For my confession they burned me with fire
And found that I was for endurance made."
—*The Arabian Nights*, trans. Haddawy

name: Armored Scrapgorger
text: "Eat. Sort. Eat. Sort. Eat."

name: Fiery Cannonade
text: Wary of the ferocious dinosaurs, the Legion of Dusk built up the walls of their fort—just in time for the pirates to burn them down.

name: Ghalma's Warden
text: A special unit guards the loxodon artificer known as Ghalma the Shaper. They are armed and armored in her finest works of silver and steel.

name: Dockside Extortionist
text: "A small price to keep such pretty things safe!"

name: Wonder
text:
"It fell silently from the sky and broke the surface without a ripple. Was it even here at all?"
—Fisherman's journal

name: Noble Steeds
text:
"They are fighters as fine as any Knight they carry."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skycaptain

name: Zagoth Mamba
text:
"It's just a snake. A many-eyed snake with venom that turns your blood to smoke, but still, just a snake."
—Kinnan, bonder prodigy

name: Walking Wall
text:
"The fortress is not what it seems."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

name: Reclaim
text: The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.

name: Spike-Tailed Ceratops
text: The conquistadors surrounded the dinosaur only to find that it had outflanked them.

name: Merciless Executioner
text: Kommandos differ from usual Orks. They still want to kill you. They just want to surprise you before they do it.

name: Winds of Change
text: "'Tis the set of sails, and not the gales,/ Which tells us the way to go." —Ella Wheeler Wilcox

name: Inkfathom Infiltrator
text: No one can navigate the dank maze of Shadowmoor's rivers better than the cruel and covetous merrows. They use the currents to steal—and to steal away.

name: Supreme Verdict
text:
"I'll grant that the siege engines are gone, but do you think that might have been a bit of overkill?"
—Sergeant Malsworth

name: Leave in the Dust
text: The daredevil racers of the Derby Crows, long at odds with the Consulate, were quick to join the renegades in open revolt.

name: Inkwell Leviathan
text:
"Into its maw went the seventh sea, never to be seen again while the world remains."
—Esper fable

name: Pygmy Allosaurus
text:
"I don't understand the appeal of keeping these things as pets, unless you want your children eaten."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Blood Bairn
text: The travelers were warned to watch out for children on the road.

name: Teremko Griffin
text:
"When we're aloft, I love to lean over the *Weatherlight*'s railing and watch the patterns the griffins' shadows make on the clouds below."
—Sisay, Captain of the *Weatherlight*

name: Goblin Mime
text: Pretending to be inside an invisible box was easy enough for Brug. It was finding the invisible door that caused him problems.

name: Vastwood Fortification // Vastwood Thicket
text:
"Never underestimate the ferocity of the imperative to thrive."
—Eyza, Joraga guide

name: Tomik, Distinguished Advokist
text: "Some bend the law. I tie it into knots.

name: Soul Snuffers
text: They once sought to unite with the flame of transcendence. Now they seek only to extinguish the lights of others.

name: Phyresis Outbreak
text:
"It is amusing that the fleshlings believe we are at war. In truth, they are nothing but scurrying pests to be eradicated."
—Azax-Azog, the Demon Thane

name: Fencing Ace
text: His prowess gives the guildless hope that they can hold out against tyranny.

name: Tyvar the Bellicose
text: "Today, we become gods again."

name: Sun-Crowned Hunters
text: One alone is dangerous, and they are never alone.

name: Latch Seeker
text: It seeks a tomb that will hold it, a coffin that will give it rest.

name: Knotvine Mystic
text: The elves of Naya were the last to acknowledge the massive shift of mana in their world.

name: Biowaste Blob
text:
"The Simic will be fined for contaminating the waterways. In the meantime, seize that blob!"
—Arrester Polgar

name: Dross Crocodile
text:
"As soon as it surfaced, we could all smell it. Its rancid breath reeked of half-digested carrion and its own rotting innards."
—Dafri, Auriok champion

name: Conquer
text:
"Why do we trade with those despicable elves? You don't live in forests, you burn them!"
—Avram Garrisson, leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Tourach's Canticle
text: The same hymns Tourach sang to praise the Ebon Praetor would later be adapted to glorify Tourach himself.

name: Seraph of the Suns
text:
"Angels? My feelings remain unchanged."
—Liliana Vess

name: Headstrong Brute
text:
"Watch your backs, keep your blades at hand, and let the orc go first!"
—Captain Brandis Thorn

name: Immolating Glare
text:
"The sun can warm your skin or blister it, nurture your crops or wither them, light your path or blind you. She is a fickle friend, but a far worse enemy."
—Nazra of the Stone Havens

name: Ogre Arsonist
text:
"All of Ravnica's looking for you, Dack, from the Wojek on down."
—Maytov

name: Sleight of Hand
text:
"Gambling with mages never is."
—Remin, venerable monk

name: Borborygmos
text:
"It's easy to see why those Gruul dirtbags follow him—the only orders he gives are 'Crush them!' and 'We eat!'"
—Teysa

name: Ring of Renewal
text: To the uninitiated, the Ring of Renewal is merely an oddity. For those fluent in the wielding of magic, however, it is a source of great knowledge.

name: Liliana's Mastery
text: "There are so many of them. It seems they've just been waiting for someone to serve."

name: Sylvan Library
text: 2021 Legacy Champion

name: Talisman of Resilience
text:
"The continual rise of the downtrodden is as inevitable as vines usurping a forest."
—Vraska

name: Tawnos's Tinkering
text: While his master tried to surpass nature, Tawnos aimed to capture its beauty.

name: Sudden Shock
text: Arc mages aren't known for their patience.

name: Kher Keep
text:
"They're still here?! The cockroach may have finally met its match."
—Teferi

name: Orzhov Locket
text:
"It looks expensive, doesn't it? You have no idea..."
—Milana, Orzhov prelate

name: Raise the Draugr
text: "King Narfi calls. We go to war!"

name: Vault Skyward
text:
"The edges of the Quicksilver Sea run dark with the spread of the Mephidross. Two more aerial passes before I can be sure what I'm seeing . . ."
—Lafarius, Neurok sky agent

name: Dragonlord's Servant
text: Atarka serving-goblins coat themselves with grease imbued with noxious herbs, hoping to discourage their ravenous masters from adding them to the meal.

name: Tel-Jilad Outrider
text: "When the levelers come again, we shall be ready for them."

name: Armored Transport
text:
"If only our jails were as secure."
—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

name: Mutant's Prey
text: Every street corner is a hunting ground, every citizen potential prey.

name: Alela, Artful Provocateur
text: "Rankle's pranks are child's play. My games will topple kingdoms."

name: Magus of the Vineyard
text: Battered and beaten by years of salt and claw, he never ceased to walk, and to seed. Only now, in this time of rebirth, do his seeds take root.

name: Absorb
text: "In your misguided attempt to subvert the law, you have eloquently explained why the law must exist."

name: Goblin Cannon
text: Goblin cannon crews are known not for their aim but for their ability to dive for cover.

name: Shimmering Wings
text:
"Wings are but fins for swimming the sky."
—Empress Galina

name: Timetwister
text: 2021 Vintage Champion

name: Goblin Raider
text: He's smart for a goblin. He can do two things: hit *and* run.

name: Fluctuator
text: Fiko summoned only atogs for three straight sessions. The tutor couldn't decide whether to punish his failure or praise his consistency.

name: Hellkite Overlord
text:
"The dragon has no pretense of compassion, no false mask of civilization—just hunger, heat, and need."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Razaketh, the Foulblooded
text: From Razaketh, Liliana gained sway over the living. Weak mortal souls became her playthings.

name: Vivien's Jaguar
text: Each of Vivien's arrows is an invocation of a species.

name: Fiery Temper
text: "Let the flames ignore the sinless."

name: Eldrazi Temple
text: Each temple is a door to a horrible future.

name: Belle of the Brawl
text: Locthwain knights take pride in being the last ones standing in a fight or on a dance floor.

name: Fable of the Mirror-Breaker // Reflection of Kiki-Jiki
text: Blessed by Keiga, the Tide Star, Kiki-Jiki would one day master the art of duplication.

name: Cut of the Profits
text: Everybody is worth their weight in gold.

name: Strongarm Tactics
text: "If you can't pay your gambling debts, you just might be tomorrow's main attraction at the Grand Coliseum."

name: Archivist
text:
"Words—so innocent and powerless are they, as standing in a dictionary; how potent for good and evil they become to one who knows how to combine them!"
—Nathaniel Hawthorne

name: Kill-Zone Acrobat
text: Her circus training proved surprisingly valuable on the battlefield.

name: Might Makes Right
text: An oath of fealty sworn with a handshake.

name: Sage's Dousing
text:
"Curse these merrows and their meddling! Since coming near the river, I can't so much as sneeze without being soaked."
—Ashling the Pilgrim

name: Fractured Sanity
text: The body grows stronger under stress. The mind does not.

name: Imperial Oath
text: Those chosen to guard the Imperial Palace are not only unrivaled warriors but also lionhearted champions of the Imperial cause.

name: Sickle Dancer
text: "I lead, destruction follows."

name: Traveler's Amulet
text: The rider set off into the eerie mist, swaddled in armor and laden with amulets.

name: Arcane Signet
text: As part of their indoctrination and training, a psyker learns to focus their mental strength through a psycho-reactive staff.

name: Snakeskin Veil
text:
「大蛇の親切は決して拒否してはならない。それは二度と施されることがないのだから。」
—-ドルイドの写本の欠片

name: Aysen Highway
text:
"Tread the roads of righteousness, Murat, lest you lose your way and be consumed."
—Baris, Serra Inquisitor

name: Phyrexian Arena
text: A spark of resistance against a tide of corruption.

name: Symbiotic Wurm
text: The insects keep the wurm's hide free from parasites. In return, the wurm doesn't eat the insects.

name: Unravel the Aether
text: Thaumaturges of Theros have learned to weave their magic into the world around them, but it can be pulled apart strand by strand.

name: Landbind Ritual
text:
"Honor this place, for our children's children will stand here and speak these same words again."
—Ayli, Kamsa cleric

name: Eron the Relentless
text:
"Eron would be much less of a hassle if only he were mortal."
—Reyhan, Samite Alchemist

name: Famished Foragers
text: Furious to find the workshop empty, the starving vampires flew into a frenzy.

name: Shoving Match
text: Rishadan barkeeps know something the Mercadians have yet to learn: if you keep pushing, someone will eventually push back.

name: Gossamer Phantasm
text:
"Belief matters more than truth. Every moment, belief in imaginary things alters lives while truth sits unnoticed and waits."
—Hakim, Loreweaver

name: Snap
text: "I believe life is a series of choices, and you just made the wrong one."

name: Knight Exemplar
text: "We slew the last dragon ages ago. Now we fight the *real* monsters."

name: Blanchwood Armor
text:
"Braid her branches, life fulfilling Goddess loving, Goddess killing."
—Citanul chant

name: Elixir of Immortality
text:
"Bottled life. Not as tasty as I'm used to, rather stale, but it has the same effect."
—Baron Sengir

name: Grave Peril
text:
"Sometimes the grave does not wait for death before relishing its feast of flesh and bones."
—Ezrith, druid of the Dark Hours

name: Royal Herbalist
text:
"Just as an Herbalist heals a wound, so must we heal the rift between Balduvia and Kjeldor."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

name: Battleground Geist
text: Not content to nudge vases and chill drawing rooms, some geists muster spectral armies to claw at the hearts of the living.

name: Reliquary Tower
text:
"Let the others bicker over their little worlds and stars. I have an empire of knowledge, and it encompasses all others."
—Trazyn the Infinite

name: Morkrut Necropod
text:
"There's not enough salt in all of Nephalia to wither that thing."
—Ghoulcaller Enslow

name: Merciless Resolve
text: "You sought to anger me, Nahiri. Soon you will see how well you have succeeded."

name: Squall
text:
"To-night the winds begin to rise . . . The rooks are blown about the skies . . . ."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, *In Memoriam*

name: Sylvan Yeti
text: The deeper the wood, the greater its strength.

name: Capricious Efreet
text: "You wish for great destruction? It is done, my master."

name: Consuming Sinkhole
text:
"What will not yield will be consumed."
—Ayli, high priest of the Eternal Pilgrims

name: Dragon Engine
text:
"How is it the legged engines seem so much more alive than their wheeled counterparts? Simply, they were born, not made."
—Mishra

name: Earth Elemental
text: Los elementales de tierra tienen la fortaleza eterna de la piedra y la resistencia de las montañas. En contacto primordial con la tierra que habitan, contemplan las cosas a largo plazo y desprecian la prisa impetuosa de las criaturas mortales de vida efímera.

name: Paper Tiger
text: The tiger is always quick to fold.

name: Skyshroud Elf
text:
"It is our duty to endure."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Kor Cartographer
text: Kor have no concept of exploration. They return to homelands forgotten.

name: Omen Hawker
text: After years of fabricating visions for naive customers of the Obscura, Stafano was flummoxed by the nightmarish scenes that played out unbidden in his mind's eye.

name: Skyknight Vanguard
text: "Jump! NOW!"

name: Halfdane
text: Hail from Tolaria the ever changing 'Dane.

name: Sliver Overlord
text: The end of evolution.

name: Putrefy
text:
"We are all decaying, always in a state of near-death. One moment without breath and we begin to break down."
—Cevraya, Golgari shaman

name: Wrench Mind
text: What is the sound of one head snapping?

name: Tsabo Tavoc
text: "I might almost pity my enemies—if it wasn't so amusing to watch them die."

name: Consulate Dreadnought
text:
"It's like they planted another Bastion right in the middle of the harbor."
—Bes Tavani, Bomat merchant

name: Benthic Biomancer
text: "I am my life's work."

name: Bull Hippo
text:
"How could you not hear it approach? It's a hippo!"
—Argivian commander

name: Slaughter-Priest of Mogis
text: "Mogis is pleased by this offering. Bring him more!"

name: Ricochet Trap
text: In his last seconds, Remhas regretted using his most powerful spell.

name: Gratuitous Violence
text: Only the Cabal could make a fight to the death more deadly.

name: Angelsong
text: Clash of sword and cry of beast fall mute when angels sound the call to prayer.

name: Elite Arrester
text: "Hold it! I need to see your papers."

name: Root Greevil
text: The root of all greevils.

name: Ethersworn Canonist
text: "The noble work of our order is to infuse all life on Esper with etherium. Our goal will be reached more rapidly if new life is ... suppressed."

name: Tainted Indulgence
text: Their toast to good health went immediately, horribly awry.

name: Torment of Scarabs
text: Like a carpet unrolling for their god, the scarabs poured out from the necropolis.

name: Viashino Pyromancer
text: "I trained with the Ghitu, and I respect the fire as they do."

name: Hematite Golem
text: Centuries before the first peaks of the Oxidda Chain rewrote the laws of magnetism, the golems patrolled Mirrodin's featureless surface unhindered.

name: Grixis Illusionist
text: "It's simple, really. If they can't find us, they can't kill us."

name: Crystalline Resonance
text:
"As a boulder diverts a stream, the crystals bend life around them."
—Rielle, the Everwise

name: Whirlwind Adept
text: The Flowing Staff technique does not differentiate between offense and defense.

name: Pteron Ghost
text: Defending to the death isn't always enough.

name: Gods' Hall Guardian
text: Not a single rat has been seen in Istfell since the gods moved in.

name: Three Visits
text: Those who love the woods only wish to spread its majesty.

name: May Civilization Collapse
text: "This should halt the spread of your insolence."

name: Hollow Warrior
text: Though it moves like a living thing, anyone can tell it lacks a soul—not to mention mercy.

name: Monstrify
text: Gackt came to regret keeping his pet toads on his head.

name: Imperial Subduer
text: "Cease your pathetic struggling."

name: Twincast
text: Imitation is the most dangerous form of flattery.

name: Infuse with Vitality
text: Dina raised her cup to Killian's lips, and for the first time in his life, he knew compassion.

name: Burning-Tree Emissary
text: Those who regard the Gruul as savage simpletons underestimate the subtle power of their shamans.

name: Unforge
text: Compared to the fire of the forge, the strength of steel is nothing.

name: Aether Spellbomb
text:
"Release that which was never caged."
—Spellbomb inscription

name: False Demise
text:
"Fool! Never believe they're dead until you see the body!"
—General Varchild

name: Chromatic Sphere
text:
"Let insight and energy be your guides."
—The Blind Seer, to Gerrard

name: Wall of Mulch
text: Mulch is the fabric of life in the forest. Plants live in it, they die in it, and then they become part of it, feeding countless generations to come.

name: Shanna, Purifying Blade
text: Shanna had heard Sisay's legend all her life. Now it was time to forge her own.

name: Rakdos Augermage
text: "Great minds bleed alike."

name: Taurean Mauler
text: The power of a waterfall. The fury of an avalanche. The intellect of a gale-force wind.

name: Teferi's Tutelage
text: "Tarassel's sixth law of temporal recursion is easy to understand as long as you know the first seven."

name: Inheritance
text:
"More than lessons may be gained from the past."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Magma Giant
text: Its open mouth is a furnace blast that blisters the skin. Its smoking fists are meteors that split the earth.

name: Charcoal Diamond
text: Every facet a portent of Kelemvor's inevitable judgment.

name: Fractured Sanity
text: Action: We'd like an epic, abstract illustration of a fantastical moon (not the real-life earth moon), which has cracked open.

name: Relic of Legends
text:
"If the worst parts of history can repeat themselves, it stands to reason that the best parts can as well."
—Teferi

name: Regenesis
text:
"When you get right down to it, the difference between death and life is just a membrane-enclosed environment maintained by a metabolic process."
—Gulistan, Simic biomancer

name: Aven Squire
text: When the meek charge into battle, courage becomes infectious.

name: Mana Drain
text: "I suppose you've never heard of conservation of energy."

name: Dark Offering
text:
"Our greatest hope has become our enemy's greatest triumph."
—Court counselor

name: Bloodtithe Collector
text: For the more refined vampire, breaking a victim's will is far more satisfying than simply taking their blood.

name: Drogskol Shieldmate
text: "I will join you so that you will not yet join me."

name: Hollowhenge Overlord
text: The ruins of the town were a notable upgrade from the wolves' forest den.

name: Auriok Sunchaser
text:
"Grant me loft. Grant me light. Grant me the accuracy I need to kill all who threaten Bladehold."
—Prayer to the Whitesun

name: Dread Statuary
text: The last reliable landmark in Tazeem just walked away.

name: Ignoble Hierarch
text: Intention: Do a mirror image of the Noble Hierarch card, only this time with a goblin.

name: Collective Blessing
text: Senators of Azorius often hired agents to spy on the Selesnya. They were told to record every spore and root they saw, as each could become a deadly foe.

name: Reyav, Master Smith
text: His impromptu demonstration of the portable energy shield attachment both saved lives and increased demand for aether-powered multi-tool gauntlets tenfold.

name: Lush Growth
text: Naya's bounty spills over upon itself. Each leaf and flower struggles against the next with thrashing thorns, acidic pollen, and strangling roots.

name: Unstable Footing
text: A long way down is shorter than you think.

name: Johtull Wurm
text:
"To bring her down we must be on all sides at once—leave one avenue open and we'll all be dead."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Mox Emerald
text: 2015 Vintage Championship Winner

name: Boros Guildgate
text:
"The more trust breaks down, the more we must throw open the front gates."
—Aurelia

name: Vanguard of Brimaz
text: "The humans and their gods never blessed me. Only the pride deserves my allegiance."

name: Forced Fruition
text:
"Petals within petals within petals, tadpole. The truth lurks below an opulence of illusion."
—Neerdiv, fallowsage

name: Voldaren Thrillseeker
text: "The end is always nigh. Let's have some fun!"

name: Ghitu Fire-Eater
text:
"They are called 'Mi'uto,' which means 'one use.'"
—Jhoira, artificer

name: Djinn of the Lamp
text: Once they learn the trick of carrying their own lamps, they never touch the ground again.

name: Tidepool Turtle
text: Prized by wizards as a mobile scrying pool, it bears visions drawn from the depths of the sea.

name: Cunning Strike
text:
"The opponent who blocks the path, becomes the path."
—Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest

name: Argivian Avenger
text: Unable to settle on just one versatile being, Urza decided to create myriad adaptable machines.

name: Beast Walkers
text:
"The Beast Walkers do a great service to Aysen. As humans or as beasts, their heart is yet to Serra true."
—Baris, Serra Inquisitor

name: Razorfield Rhino
text: Adapted to tread on razorgrass, the rhino proved adept at treading on Phyrexians as well.

name: Simic Cluestone
text: Simic symbols are among the most intricate and fragile, yet few vandalize them for fear of the strange lifeforms that might be released.

name: Thaumatic Compass // Spires of Orazca
text:
"... a cryptic objective."
—Jace Beleren

name: Aethersnatch
text: "You were saying?"

name: Minotaur de Force
text: "If I ever need a haircut, I just fall a little to the left."

name: Prizefight
text: Underweight, underpaid, underestimated.

name: Jorn, God of Winter // Kaldring, the Rimestaff
text: "Wherever snow falls, I am home."

name: Thassa's Ire
text: The sailor had never seen a god before. Now she had gazed upon Thassa. Shortly she would see Athreos, and then she would meet Erebos.

name: Lys Alana Huntmaster
text: From the highest tiers of Dawn's Light Palace to the deepest shade of Wren's Run, the silver notes of the horn shimmer through the air, and all who hear it feel its pull.

name: Unsummon
text:
"Don't you have somewhere else to be?"
—Sharuum the Hegemon

name: Griffin Rider
text: After fighting alongside the griffin riders, older knights of Thune learned to admire a mount that could rip an enemy to shreds in seconds.

name: Sakura-Tribe Scout
text:
"Scouts of the Sakura Tribe spent two years wandering the forest to learn every leaf and tree. That knowledge was called upon during the Kami War to ensure the orochi's survival."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Magus of the Arena
text: The magus still hears the roar of the crowds. They're gone, but the will to compete remains.

name: Fey Steed
text: Ride into legend.

name: Invasion of Ergamon // Truga Cliffcharger
text: Throughout Ergamon's wild Truga Jungle, predator-prey relationships stopped until every last invader was crushed to dust.

name: Marsh Boa
text: Though a powerful constrictor, it prefers simply to drown its prey.

name: Serra Advocate
text: An angel's touch can prepare a soldier for battle more than a thousand military drills.

name: Blind Obedience
text: "By the time your knees have worn through your robe, you may have begun to learn your place."

name: Phantom Carriage
text: Passage to the abyss is free, but the return trip will cost you.

name: Hunding Gjornersen
text: "You would never guess, at the terrifying sight of the man, that Hunding was as charming a companion as one could wish for."

name: Wrong Turn
text: Its bewildered bellow was met with a stern "shh."

name: B-I-N-G-O
text: There was a farmer, had a hound . . .

name: Angelic Quartermaster
text: "Stand strong. We will reclaim the dawn."

name: War Priest of Thune
text: "Let nothing take away from the purity of swords clashing or of arrows taking flight toward the breast of evil."

name: Sightless Ghoul
text: It blindly marches on Thraben's gates, guided by its master's direful will.

name: Talas Warrior
text: The sea is in their blood. Literally.

name: Icy Manipulator
text: A model of Mirrodin in both shape and spirit.

name: Target Minotaur
text: "Not again!"

name: Scrapskin Drake
text:
"The cathars killed my skaabs down below. Let's see how high their swords can reach."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

name: Zada, Hedron Grinder
text: "A hedron holds magic for a thousand years—or less, if need be."

name: Horribly Awry
text:
"We are nothing but dust to them—our bodies, our actions, even our words."
—Jori En, expedition leader

name: Rain of Tears
text:
"These rains cannot quench; they carve the land's face like a scalpel on flesh."
—Crovax

name: Spellbane Centaur
text: "No mage's deception can harm those who keep nature balanced."

name: Gristleback
text: Loyal in battle, hearty in stew.

name: Crossway Troublemakers
text: "Lady Anje said no violence at the wedding. She never said anything about the journey there!"

name: Carnival Carnivore
text: Somehow only the third-most dangerous ride in the park.

name: Creature Guy
text: There once was a player named Quinn, . . .

name: Canal Courier
text: The most effective roadways in Paliano aren't roads at all.

name: Gideon's Reproach
text: On Amonkhet, Gideon lost both his sural and his faith in himself. But he can still throw a punch, and he still knows a bad guy when he sees one.

name: Kuldotha Cackler
text: You would laugh too if you just burned through a tyrranax's stomach.

name: Kess, Dissident Mage
text: "Once more, with killing!"

name: Excavation Mole
text: It makes molehills out of mountains.

name: Marble Titan
text: It entered the temple with all the pomp and decorum of a rock hitting a goblin's skull.

name: Seaside Citadel
text: For wisdom's sake, it was built high to gaze on all things. For glory's sake, it was built high as a testament of power. For strength's sake, it was built high to repel all attacks.

name: Goblin Sledder
text: "Let's play 'sled.' Here's how it works: you're the sled."

name: Briarpack Alpha
text:
"One of my greatest teachers."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Merchant Scroll
text: A rare find, suitable for the most discerning collector.

name: Gargadon
text: Intent: Magic has made a Grater Gargadon and a Lesser Gargadon (see ref). We want you to design the "average" Gargadon.

name: Miasmic Mummy
text: Its breath doesn't assault the senses. It pollutes the mind.

name: Nightmare Moon // Princess Luna
text: "The night. . . will last. . .forever!"

name: Monumental Corruption
text:
"Funny, I always though the Phyrexians were a heartless lot."
—Kaya

name: Dark Sphere
text:
"I was struck senseless for a moment, but revived when the strange curiosity I carried fell to the ground, screaming like a dying animal."
—Barl, Lord Ith

name: Knight's Pledge
text: "As long as my faith persists, so shall I."

name: Jeska, Warrior Adept
text: "My brother and I both come from Balthor's forge. Kamahl has a temper of fire. I have a temper of steel."

name: Culling the Weak
text:
"The blood of the weak shall be the ink with which we scribe great Yawgmoth's glorious name."
—Stronghold architect, journal

name: Doomfall
text:
"This place has outlived its usefulness."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Wyluli Wolf
text:
"When one wolf calls, others follow. Who wants to fight creatures that eat scorpions?"
—Maimun al-Wyluli, diary

name: Snakeform
text: Losing his possessions distressed him, but the lack of limbs was strangely liberating.

name: Venerable Monk
text: His presence brings not only a strong arm but also renewed hope.

name: Farideh, Devil's Chosen
text: "A pact is a tool, not a damnation."

name: Eyeless Watcher
text: Every Eldrazi in Ulamog's lineage is an extension of the titan's will.

name: Leaden Myr
text: The Moriok saw the myr as fellow scavengers, never knowing just who the myr were scavenging for.

name: Prophetic Prism
text:
"The five suns may have dimmed, but their light still guides us."
—Thrun

name: Seedguide Ash
text: "May you shade three generations of seedlings."

name: Orcish Spy
text:
"You idiot! Never let the spies mingle with the Orcish regulars after completing a mission. Now we'll never get them to fight!"
—General Khurzog

name: Vernal Bloom
text: The sun breaks, the beasts stir, and the forest awakens to stand against its enemies.

name: Revitalize
text:
"A potion is no substitute for a skilled surgeon, but it will hold your bits in."
—Torricks, battlefield medic

name: Spire Tracer
text: Cartographers on Ravnica chart not just the horizontal, but also the vertical.

name: Abrade
text: The Falkenrath progenitor was a vicious falconer, and the line is quick to remind others of its heritage.

name: Soldevi Steam Beast
text:
"Dagsson saw the steam as life-giving—until his followers felt its scalding touch."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Lost Leonin
text: Mirrans were broken down and rebuilt, made to be loyal servants of the force they had fought.

name: Mass of Ghouls
text:
"An army has filled the valley, but it's not like any army I've ever seen. There are no tents, no fires, no horses . . . just a sea of bodies, writhing and moaning, as if a pestilent village were sent to invade us."
—Onean scout

name: Into the Core
text:
"They believe they're driving us back, but we're leading them to their doom."
—Kethek, furnace stoker

name: Ovalchase Daredevil
text: "Let me guess. You thought I was dead."

name: Exhaustion
text: Tired doesn't even begin to cover it.

name: Tower Gargoyle
text:
"Esper, like any work of art, can be truly appreciated only from a distance."
—Tezzeret

name: Honden of Cleansing Fire
text: To the sorrow of all, its fire was turned toward those who worshipped it.

name: Elvish Hydromancer
text: "Water remembers every living thing that it has ever been a part of. We need only bring that recollection to the surface."

name: Masumaro, First to Live
text:
"In the waning moments of war, humanity's most ancient ancestors return. But whose side shall they make their own?"
—Isao, Enlightened Bushi

name: Illicit Shipment
text: Whatever the Maestros had ordered, it wasn't anyone's business, including his.

name: Legion Lieutenant
text: "We long ago abandoned the things that make humans weak: friendship, marriage, family. All that remains is the strength of our devotion."

name: Grafdigger's Cage
text:
"Best bury them right. We don't want any gruesome encores."
—Constable Trosk

name: Makeshift Mauler
text:
"It always amazes me what perfectly good things people throw away."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

name: Seasoned Hallowblade
text: "I don't know that I'll win every fight. But I have faith, and that's carried me this far."

name: Sea Monster
text: "Abandon ship!"

name: Spineless Thug
text: What it lacks in backbone, it makes up for in cruelty.

name: Vanishing
text:
"Careless, like a child with fire, so was I with time."
—Teferi

name: Niambi, Faithful Healer
text: "My father will be happy to see you."

name: Indulging Patrician
text: "Just a nibble for now. I wouldn't want to ruin my appetite."

name: Croakid Amphibonaut
text:
"I designed the Astrotorium's jetpacks to be lightweight and inexpensive. Nobody mentioned reliable."
—Truss, chief engineer

name: Savannah Lions
text: The traditional kings of the jungle command a healthy respect in other climates as well. Relying mainly on their stealth and speed, Savannah Lions can take a victim by surprise, even in the endless, flat plains of their homeland.

name: Mold Adder
text: The more you struggle against its coils, the tighter they get.

name: Tuskguard Captain
text: One quiet word sets off the stampede.

name: Crypt Lurker
text:
"Even the rats refuse to set foot inside. I fear to think what might be waiting in there."
—Gravedigger's journal

name: Hunted Ghoul
text: Even after Hanweir was saved, Gisa's lost ghouls would shamble through, still following the twisted orders of their imprisoned master.

name: Raging Kavu
text: It took Yavimaya a thousand years to breed them, but it took only seconds for them to prove their worth.

name: Fiery Bombardment
text: It kills two beasts with one thrown.

name: Bane's Invoker
text: "The Lord of Darkness elevates only those who serve."

name: Maelstrom Archangel
text: There is no world where angels fear to tread.

name: Exquisite Firecraft
text: Chandra's gift set her apart and others aflame.

name: Royal Trooper
text:
"Fortune does not side with the fainthearted."
—Sophocles, Phaedra

name: Righteous Aura
text:
"There is a great difference between pain and injury."
—Cho-Manno

name: Barbarian Riftcutter
text:
"Riftcutters are suicidal anarchists, waving those lightning axes around so much that the walls are as likely to fall as their foes."
—Heruj, Selesnya initiate

name: Springjack Shepherd
text: "Better for a doun to lose its cenn than its springjacks."

name: Murder
text: "It's not work if you enjoy it."

name: Goblin Rally
text: You don't so much hire goblins as put ideas in their heads.

name: Goblin King
text: To become king of the Goblins, one must assassinate the previous king. Thus, only the most foolish seek positions of leadership.

name: Animate Library
text: Sometimes the books hit back.

name: Grey Knight Paragon
text:
"Our will shall be our weapons, our faith shall be our armour."
—Canticle of Absolution

name: Makindi Patrol
text: Working with his noble mount, he notices every form on the horizon, every scent in the air, every tremor in the earth.

name: Mind Control
text:
