"Every primitive mind has a motive. Easy to find, and eminently exploitable."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

name: Knight of Meadowgrain
text: "By tradition, we don't speak for two days after battle. If our deeds won't speak for themselves, what else could be said?"

name: Kor Haven
text:
"Find shelter where none but the angels can reach you."
—Kor saying

name: Sandbar Crocodile
text:
"We've run aground sandbars before, but today, a sandbar ran aground us."
—Kipkemboi, Kukemssa pirate

name: Terror of the Fairgrounds
text:
"Consider this a high alert, people. Permission to destroy on sight. Either we take it down or it'll take down the Fair."
—Pav, gremlin watch

name: Dismissive Pyromancer
text: "Burn. Burn. Keep. Burn".

name: Spitfire Handler
text: "Wait 'til Toggo sees this!"

name: Abzan Skycaptain
text: "A tempest is coming. Turn your faces toward the wind!"

name: Might of Alara
text: The combined strength of all five planes spawned creations none had seen before.

name: Go-Shintai of Hidden Cruelty
text: It seeks those with hate in their hearts and offers vengeance.

name: Torch Gauntlet
text:
"Good morning, children. Please open your aether valves and ignite your gauntlets."
—Rakib, Ghirapur schoolteacher

name: Archangel Avacyn // Avacyn, the Purifier
text: Pray.

name: Wayward Giant
text:
"The giants follow the flow of aether, and twice a year it leads them through here. Lesson learned. More clearance is needed."
—Sram, senior edificer

name: Skola Grovedancer
text: "From the ashes of last night's revel, I bring the dawn on new growth."

name: Storm Shaman
text:
"Let the lightning be your warning, and the thunder your battle cry."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Eager First-Year
text: Today, she learns the basics. She'll knock out advanced theory later this week.

name: Tendrils of Despair
text:
"Because I am incapable of tears does not mean I have no need to shed them."
—Karn, silver golem

name: What's Yours Is Now Mine
text: "Vow your allegiance to true power."

name: Scooch
text:
"What? No, that's ridiculous! Of course the rat doesn't work for the park. I've never seen it before in my life!"
—Monoxa, midway manager

name: Grim Bounty
text: Freed from the need to pay tribute to the dragon, the villages gladly paid the dragon-slayers instead.

name: Serra Angel
text: When she flies above the good, they consider themselves blessed. When she flies above the wicked, they consider themselves dead.

name: Chalice of Life // Chalice of Death
text: The bitter taste of life's only certainty.

name: Viashino Warrior
text:
"When traveling the Great Desert avoid wearing the scales of lizards, for the Viashino rule the sands and look poorly on the skinning of their cousins."
—*Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert*

name: Soulcatcher
text: "Their spirits walk the winds and fill my soul."

name: Crazed Goblin
text: Because fighting is easier than figuring out what else to do.

name: Rites of Flourishing
text: "Dance, and bring forth the coil! It is an umbilical to Gaea herself, fattening us with the earth's rich bounty."

name: Wee Dragonauts
text:
"The blazekite is a simple concept, really—just a vehicular application of dragscoop ionics and electropropulsion magnetronics."
—Juzba, Izzet tinker

name: Abandon Hope
text: As Gerrard's form vanished into the maw of trees, Hanna mouthed a silent plea, mourning a crushed dream.

name: Martyr's Bond
text:
"Our lives are connected by divine law. The truth of this will be made evident in time."
—Zedruu the Greathearted

name: Boldwyr Heavyweights
text: Even if giants bring nothing else on a journey, they bring attention.

name: Weaponcraft Enthusiast
text:
"No, I don't believe they have the proper permits for those, but I'm not going to be the one to ask."
—Caru, Consulate warden

name: Secluded Glen
text: Protected by glamers and guile, Glen Elendra harbors the elusive Oona, queen of the fae.

name: Rhox Veteran
text: "Battle is all about where you stand. Never stand in my way."

name: Smash
text: Ravnica's laws protect not its citizens but its industry. Aging equipment is destroyed rather than restored, to bring more money into the factories' coffers.

name: Bazaar Trader
text: "No need for a hurda? How about these maps to recently discovered tombs? Or these vials of invisible potion? Very fancy . . ."

name: Myr Convert
text: Humble, obedient, and tireless, myr require little modification to excel as servants of Phyrexia.

name: Ruby Leech
text:
"Its gems didn't stop pulsating until they were completely removed."
—Tolarian research notes

name: Recumbent Bliss
text: Kithkin somnomancers enjoy the peaceful dreams wafting from their victims.

name: Relentless Assault
text:
"Flog and Squee / Up the tree / See the army / Flee, flee, flee."
—Goblin nursery rhyme/war cry

name: Discourtesy Clerk
text: Myra doesn't pay the vampires to smile—but only because guests found it off-putting.

name: Narwhal
text:
"Who needs a spear? Ya break off the horn, and ya stab the fish with it. Easy!"
—Kakra, sea troll

name: Expropriate
text: Few things are more valuable than time or money—and Leovold has plenty of both.

name: Loran, Disciple of History
text: Urza and Mishra may have been Tocasia's most famous students, but Loran was the true heir to her legacy.

name: Angel's Herald
text: Rigorous faith and belief are rewarded on occasion, and richly so.

name: Dross Hopper
text: Bred in the vicious Mephidross, dross hoppers learned to eat quickly and escape faster.

name: Bog Imp
text: On guard for larger dangers, we underestimated the power and speed of the imp's muck-crusted claws.

name: Iron Myr
text: The goblins didn't think of the myr at all, which allowed the myr to observe everywhere unhindered.

name: Kuldotha Forgemaster
text: The goblins say it used to be larger, before it began to stoke the Great Furnace with pieces of itself.

name: Whalebone Glider
text:
"It's no Ornithopter, but then I'm no Urza."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: War Tax
text: The worst thing about being a depraved pirate is having to work with a bunch of depraved pirates.

name: Bramblefort Fink
text: No matter the cruelty of Oko's jokes, he's always guaranteed the sycophant's laughter.

name: Slag Fiend
text:
"Seal the furnace vents. Admit no others. We'll tend our forges without their tainted ways."
—Decree of Urabrask

name: War-Wing Siren
text: Once she sang sailors to their doom. Now she leads them to glory.

name: Nature's Claim
text:
"On this plane, the use of magic can provoke a ferocious reprisal from nature. Whoever the Eldrazi were, their relics left Zendikar forever enraged."
—Jace Beleren

name: Oskar, Rubbish Reclaimer
text: "So many fools think throwing something away is the same as disposing of it."

name: Indulgent Tormentor
text: The promise of anguish is payment enough for services rendered.

name: Ogre Warrior
text: Assault and battery included.

name: Inga Rune-Eyes
text: Her fleet bore countless survivors to safety, slipping swiftly through strange currents no Phyrexian could track.

name: Setessan Petitioner
text: "Cypress leaves for family, larkspur for protection, amaranth for a bountiful harvest."

name: Keeper of Progenitus
text: He watches over the valley where Progenitus sleeps, culling signs from its steaming breaths.

name: Colossapede
text:
"If it is bigger, you must be faster. If it is stronger, you must be sharper. Anything less, and you will never seize a place in our God-Pharaoh's perfect afterlife."
—Rhonas, god of strength

name: Vengeance
text:
"Until I've gnawed their flesh and exterminated their clans, my humiliation will not be effaced."
—Liu Bei, on the death of his oath-brother Guan Yu

name: Vampire Slayer
text: When Kaya saved her village, Berit realized even vampires could be killed. When she brought one down herself, she realized she had found her calling.

name: Delif's Cone
text:
"Where is it written that beasts must cause pain?"
—Delif, *Ponderings*

name: Whiptongue Hydra
text:
"Where'd all the birds go?"
—Kaldrin, jungle sightseer

name: Soldevi Heretic
text:
"It cannot be! Soldev crushed, and my machines to blame?"
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Swiftwater Cliffs
text: Kaladesh's wondrous inventions and glowing aether were of utmost interest to Jin-Gitaxias and his Chrome Host.

name: Last Breath
text: In time, all things turn to dust. Some things just take less time.

name: Crumbling Ashes
text:
"I was there to watch my brothers' quenching. I drew the slightest warmth from their dying rage."
—Illulia of Nighthearth

name: Silverquill Silencer
text: "I am very much in the mood to start handing out expulsions."

name: Dark Inquiry
text: "Your mind is no longer yours to waste."

name: Ankle Shanker
text: The stature of the fighter matters less than the depth of the cut.

name: Aurora Champion
text: Many combatants at Valor's Reach wield glowing weapons to distract their enemies and delight the crowd.

name: Greatsword
text: The only blow that matters is the killing blow.

name: Tergrid, God of Fright // Tergrid's Lantern
text: When Tergrid was a child, her shadow tried to kill her. Only her lantern keeps it at bay.

name: Nevermore
text: "By the law of Avacyn, the following thoughts, words, and deeds are henceforth disallowed."

name: Artful Looter
text: PRICELESS PIC PILFERED Painting Found Abandoned in Graveyard Merfolk Decry Wizards' Treatment

name: Black Carriage
text:
"The Baron's drivers are also driven."
—Chandler

name: Cloud Key
text:
"A key only unlocks a door. Its wielder must choose whether to cross the threshold."
—*Hurkyl's Metaphysics, vol. II*

name: Akroan Jailer
text: He ensures escape attempts are just that—attempts.

name: Fangren Hunter
text: Big ones hunt the elves, so the elves hunt the small ones to keep them from getting big.

name: Willow Faerie
text:
"The Autumn Willow cannot be everywhere at once—that's what her grandchildren are for."
—Gulsen, Abbey Matron

name: Wanderer's Twig
text: For every tree who falls, there are countless sprouts waiting to rise.

name: Information Booth
text: Since the majority of the park's business model is based around aimless wandering, this is not where Myra stations her best people.

name: Ezuri, Renegade Leader
text: Great hero or grand betrayer? The truth of Ezuri's legacy is clouded by the fog of legend.

name: Temporal Mastery
text: Time is a marvelous plaything.

name: Glissa's Courier
text:
"So, the survivors from Oxid Ridge are on the move. Let them come and witness predation in its purest form."
—Glissa

name: Reckless Cohort
text: "You have a family. Mine died at Sea Gate. You go to yours, and I'll go to mine."

name: Sky Terror
text:
"Wherever the Threefold Sun shines, great wings may go."
—Emperor Apatzec Intli III

name: Cathartic Reunion
text: The chasm of years and worlds collapsed under the power of their embrace.

name: Disentomb
text:
"Stop complaining. You can rest when you're dead. Oh—sorry."
—Liliana Vess

name: Fear
text: "Booga booga booga!"

name: The Lost and the Damned
text: The gods of Chaos bestow gifts of mutations upon their champions. Too many of these gifts transform their bearer its mindless, writhing chaos spawn.

name: Hanabi Blast
text: The most powerful of akki fire spells were developed at the cost of blood, toil, tears, sweat, and usually a nose or two.

name: Blade Historian
text: "So you see, the reckless battle strategy of the Kathorran orcs was effective, but ultimately proved to be a double-edged sword. As did their double-edged swords."

name: Etherium Astrolabe
text:
"Speculation is foolish when the tools of certainty are available."
—Cinna, vedalken consul

name: Heat Ray
text:
"There was clearly a scream. I'm not sure if there was a mouth."
—Sachir, Akoum Expeditionary House

name: Hidden Gibbons
text: When these apes want something, it's a matter of gibbon take.

name: Necrosavant
text:
"Ah, I remember my first death."
—Zarkuu, necrosavant

name: Glittering Wish
text: She wished for gold, but not for the strength to carry it.

name: Soul's Attendant
text: In truth, her own faith was gone, trodden in Ulamog's wake. She pantomimed the blessing in the hope that it would inspire others to continue to struggle.

name: Errant Minion
text: Abandon not your faith when others abandon you.

name: Dream Prowler
text:
"To think that some find sleep a restful state."
—Volrath

name: Denizen of the Deep
text:
"Don't be silly, grandfather. If the tides were caused by some monster drinking the ocean, wouldn't more ships go missing?"
—Leda, Vodalian Youth

name: Curse of the Pierced Heart
text:
"May your veins weep, and may every vampire take notice."
—Stensian curse

name: Crush Dissent
text:
"All I ask is complete obedience."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Nissa's Triumph
text: Her triumph came not from destroying the unnatural, but from fostering life.

name: Unseal the Necropolis
text: On Amonkhet, Phyrexia found a ready-made army of horrors waiting for a new master.

name: Flowstone Salamander
text: The Furnace of Rath is periodically illuminated by their sparkling yawns.

name: Filigree Sages
text: "We of the Sanctum Arcanum have pondered every word on every page of the Filigree Texts. If you can't say the same, don't bother speaking."

name: Brand of Ill Omen
text:
"Let those who bear the brand receive no shelter, no kindness, and no comfort from our people."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Botanical Plaza
text: Public parks are a favored meeting spot for those considering a shift in allegiance.

name: Vengeance
text: Bitter as wormwood, sweet as mulled wine.

name: Offer Immortality
text: "Give all you are to Phyrexia, and you will receive more than you could have ever desired."

name: Goblin Mountaineer
text: The only thing worse than a goblin is a goblin that knows his way around.

name: Pashalik Mons
text: The thunderhead that leads in the storm.

name: Creeping Bloodsucker
text:
"If a vampire were feeding on you every night, wouldn't you have bite marks? Stop wasting my time."
—Donya, village healer

name: Supreme Phantom
text: A king's knowledge does not vanish when the heart stops beating.

name: Ghost Quarter
text: Deserted, but not uninhabited.

name: Incandescent Aria
text: As the assassins converged on Kitt Kanto, she struck a high note and held it, unbroken, for nearly a minute. When the room fell silent, she was surrounded only by rose petals falling gently to the floor.

name: Priest of Ancient Lore
text: "We are a product of our ancestors, the apotheosis of countless noble generations. Speak their names with reverence, and they will guide your path."

name: Summit Prowler
text:
"Do you hunt the yetis of the high peaks, stripling? They are as fierce as the bear that fears no foe and as sly as the mink that creeps unseen. You will be as much prey as they."
—Nitula, the Hunt Caller

name: Elvish Hunter
text:
"As the climate cooled, many elves turned to thallid farming for food, while the hunters honed their skills on what little game remained."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*

name: Topan Ascetic
text: Monks from Topa wander all of Bant, encouraging the Unbeholden to find their place in society through honorable combat.

name: Thriving Isle
text: All the wonders of the natural world in one breathtaking microcosm.

name: Medicine Runner
text: Elvish healers carry vials of the balm known as dawnglow, reserving it for those wounds that herbs cannot treat.

name: Island
text: After careful study, you've determined that the giant ruins served to track the movement of the planets ... and they will soon align once more.

name: Sol Ring
text: It took the reclusive Venya Sangmi a lifetime to realize her childhood vision: a band of sunlight made solid.

name: Endless Whispers
text: Those who find death under the black sun's shadow cannot escape its pull.

name: Relic Runner
text: Her knack for tampering with wards got her kicked out of the academy, but they also got her back in.

name: Soul of Emancipation
text: Light poured from every crack as the sleepers awoke from their long stone slumber.

name: Kronch Wrangler
text: Looking over two city blocks of destruction, he could only cackle with pride.

name: Phantom Wurm
text: It died with the forest, yet both linger on in twisted form.

name: Aesthir Glider
text:
"A fine example of the rewards of artifice: a thoroughly obedient steed with wings of Soldevi steel."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Curious Herd
text:
"If you don't break camp as you leave, you'll return to find it broken for you."
—Jonald, mission naturalist

name: Butcher Ghoul
text: Without a mind, it doesn't fear death. Without a soul, it doesn't mind killing.

name: Harmonize
text:
"Animals commune with their environment without the need for language. Theirs is a fundamental connection that surpasses flimsy words."
—Vivien Reid

name: Renegade Doppelganger
text: To truly know a creature, slither a mile in its tentacles.

name: Clown Extruder
text: "CONGRATULATIONS. IT IS A CLOWN."

name: Animate Wall
text:
"When you have been bitten with fangs of granite, you start to long for the ivory sabers of tigers."
—Norin the Wary

name: Isolated Chapel
text: Serra's blessing lies strongest upon Sursi, where her holy chapels are untouched even as the Cabal encroaches.

name: Aura Gnarlid
text: Kill a gnarlid with your first blow, or it'll cheerfully show you how it's done.

name: Braid of Fire
text: "To a trained mind, the cold is but a momentary distraction."

name: Goblin Roughrider
text: Astride the bucking creature, Gribble hurtled down the mountainside while his Grotag brethren cheered. It was at that moment that the legend of the Skrill Tamer was born.

name: Freed from the Real
text: When a strong mind moves, form and energy shift to heed it.

name: Razortip Whip
text:
"It no longer surprises me what shows up in our raid of a Rakdos revue."
—Janik Bara, Wojek captain

name: Lightning Wolf
text: These thick-furred wolves have adapted to Stensia's storms, channeling their energy into bursts of supernatural speed.

name: Devout Invocation
text: A prayer to bring demons to their knees.

name: Razorjaw Oni
text: It gnashed its teeth, and the battlefield filled with the screech of blade striking blade.

name: Primal Bellow
text:
"A might spell can be handy against baloths, giants, kraken, the Roil—or if you lose your bearings in the woods."
—Chadir the Navigator

name: Paladin en-Vec
text: "Our belief shall be the lance that pierces Volrath's heart."

name: Raff, Weatherlight Stalwart
text: "This old ship has seen a lot, but she's not done yet."

name: Melesse Spirit
text: Like a laughing knife, immaculate and sharp, is the Melesse.

name: Essence Harvest
text: Captain Lewenheart uncovered evidence of a demon cult among the clergy. The Skirsdag never gave him a chance to prove his case.

name: Demonic Hordes
text: Created to destroy Dominiaria, demons can sometimes be bent to a more focused purpose.

name: Swiftfoot Boots
text: One who wears magical *boots of striding and springing* can jump astounding distances.

name: Voracious Cobra
text: There's no known antidote for the cobra's venom . . . or its appetite.

name: Spell Pierce
text: "If you make me spill my drink, you're buying me a new one."

name: Vampire Noble
text:
"No emergency is so dire that it cannot be dealt with elegantly."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Aysen Crusader
text:
"A renegade rallying the rabble does not a true Crusader make."
—Irini Sengir

name: Krosan Constrictor
text:
"It's a slithering, coldblooded menace. I've gotta respect that."
—Braids, dementia summoner

name: Baldur's Gate
text:
"Of course I know what 'eponymous' means! It's a little horse."
—Krizz, gate guard

name: Staying Power
text: Mongo's fleas no longer bothered him. But the family of goblins that had moved in behind his left ear was starting to get really irritating.

name: Cascading Cataracts
text:
"The power that flows here cannot be denied. But where is the source?"
—Nissa Revane

name: Abjure
text: Mirri's hackles rose as Ertai continued expounding his virtues. "If that arrogant brat doesn't shut up soon," she growled to herself, "I'm going to have to kill him."

name: Rhuk, Hexgold Nabber
text: Never get between a goblin and the closest shiny object.

name: Aven Augur
text: "I have seen the future. It does not include you."

name: Void Winnower
text: "I used to think penthouses were for jerks but I'm starting to see the appeal."

name: Quarry Hauler
text: They labor beside the anointed, constructing the vast monuments of Naktamun.

name: Springmantle Cleric
text: Hope and courage bloom in her wake.

name: Vintara Elephant
text: Trained with the aid of rhystic magic, they become uneasy in its absence.

name: Crabapple Cohort
text: Seven wives made seven pies from seven apples, each plucked from its branches. Now bare and bitter, it comes to exact its price: one apple, one bone.

name: Blackbloom Rogue // Blackbloom Bog
text:
"If you ever want to get back up, do what I say."
—Exena, expedition rogue

name: Wild Ricochet
text: "I knew that trick long before your great-grandmother's great-grandmother was born."

name: Burning-Yard Trainer
text: "For every scar I've received, I've given ten back."

name: Island
text: The ship's captain promised she'd get you safely to the Netherese ruin, but *she* is the one who just washed overboard.

name: Space Marine Scout
text: Through blood and battle, scouts are forged from raw recruits into the Imperium's finest.

name: Boon Reflection
text: Twice brewed and twice blessed, the remedy restores both body and mind.

name: Master Healer
text: Her heart holds the pain of every soldier she's ever healed.

name: Deadly Plot
text:
"Open grave available, only one previous tenant."
—Sign on cemetery gate

name: Obeka, Brute Chronologist
text: "I'm bored with now."

name: Devilish Valet
text: Nobody thought twice about checking their weapons at the door, until they were informed there was no weapon check at the door.

name: Quick Fixer
text: Myra doesn't believe in stopping rides for minor inconveniences like "they need to be repaired."

name: Yuan-Ti Fang-Blade
text: "The air is sweet with the taste of your fear."

name: Muck Rats
text:
"Just as some fool said it couldn't get worse, the rats began to show up."
—Alaborn soldier

name: Deadbridge Goliath
text: Some Golgari insects live for centuries—and they never stop growing.

name: Legerdemain
text: Squee tucked the warm ball in his pocket and slipped a pebble in its place. "Glok," he mumbled, and hid.

name: Mobilize
text: A rested mind is the sharpest weapon.

name: Wedding Invitation
text: RSVP at your own risk.

name: Samurai Enforcers
text: From the moment they swore their oaths, they belonged to their lord, sword and soul.

name: Kessig Cagebreakers
text: "They put bars on these noble beasts and then wonder why werewolves target our towns."

name: Goblin Chieftain
text: "It's time for the 'Smash, Smash' song!"

name: Magus of the Wheel
text: "Fate is not as fixed as you might think."

name: Karn
text: Both part of the Legacy and an individual in his own right, the silver golem Karn is haunted by a single, terrible incident: while serving to protect the young Gerrard, Karn accidentally took the life of another. Wakened from years spent as a statue, the golem has vowed to never kill again as he rejoins Gerrard.

name: Quiet Speculation
text:
"The best foresight is hindsight."
—Empress Llawan

name: Double Dip
text: In a duel and taking a lickin' . . .

name: Biting Rain
text: On Innistrad, it is seldom wrong to stay indoors.

name: Thran Forge
text: "This will work," Gerrard called to the elves as he used the forge to strengthen the aboroth, "but if it doesn't, we won't survive to care."

name: Stampede
text:
"We could see the horizon blacken with the great beasts, but it was too late. The icefield offered no immediate safety, but luckily most of us reached a crevasse in which we could take cover."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Magus of the Mind
text: "I'll show you what you truly desire."

name: Far Out
text: Memories that will technically last the rest of your life.

name: Runeclaw Bear
text:
"Nature has grown tired of the impositions of men and will begin to outfit its creations with tools for bloody instruction."
—Hadi Kasten, Calla Dale naturalist

name: Alaborn Grenadier
text:
"Ever proud, ever vigilant."
—Grenadier motto

name: Ohran Viper
text: The ohran viper is not cold-blooded. Its veins course with the same antigelid venom used to kill its prey.

name: Cinder Storm
text: When the sky's rain has turned to fire, what will put it out?

name: Golgari Guildgate
text:
"Shut the gates. In the Underrealm we will outlast the coming doom."
—Vraska

name: Terra Stomper
text: Sometimes violent earthquakes, hurtling boulders, and unseasonable dust storms are wrongly attributed to the Roil.

name: Spiteflame Witch
text: Cinder beliefs revolve around the Path of Sorrow, a spiritual descent into oblivion. They don't mind taking others on their journey down.

name: Shimmering Glasskite
text: A child's whisper could crack its shell, but not even an oni's scream could penetrate it.

name: Yeva, Nature's Herald
text: "I can call an army to my side in the blink of an eye. Best not blink."

name: Cranial Archive
text: The greatest idea the zombie ever had in its head wasn't even its own.

name: Bonecaller Cleric
text: The bell's unearthly chime slips into the ears of the dead, waking them rudely from their eternal slumber.

name: Nature's Lore
text: From the cracks in the stone, she reads stories of the past. From the swirling vines, she glimpses visions of the future.

name: Crusader of Odric
text: "We are Odric's sword. We strike without fear, for his mind has divined how our foe will be slain."

name: Commander's Sphere
text: "The heavens augur weal . . . for me. Woe for you."

name: Vela the Night-Clad
text: Vela snuffs out every trace of Krond's reign, leaving pure nightfall in her wake.

name: Plague Drone
text: High-ranking plaguebearers of Nurgle's realm ride into realspace mounted upon Rot Flies—colossal daemonic insects whose appearance is so repugnant it scars the mind.

name: Tangle Spider
text: Only rumors have ever escaped its web.

name: Undertaker
text: The weight of death is heavy but not immovable.

name: Rend Spirit
text:
"The battle at Ganzan Pass was a testament to human endurance. The untrained and frightened group escaped three legions of kami, leaving more than their share of slain foes in their wake."
—*Great Battles of Kamigawa*

name: Soulshriek
text:
"The flesh is a casket for the soul."
—Shauku, Endbringer

name: Battering Sliver
text: Covered with hard shell-like plates, these slivers burrow through solid rock to carve out new nests for their hives.

name: Aurora Griffin
text: Though a fierce fighter, its true value is that it inspires beleaguered forces.

name: Toxic Iguanar
text: There are no "weak" creatures on Jund. Even the smallest can strike a deadly blow.

name: Master Thief
text: Possession is ten-tenths of the law.

name: Deathless Knight
text:
"Headed to the wilds? Beware the dead riders who serve the Shadow Queen."
—Scalan, Edgewall innkeeper

name: Vodalian Soldiers
text:
"Stalwart Soldiers, you stand against the Homarids for Vodalia and for honor. Your homeland cries out for protection, and the moment has come. Now let your valor shine, and sound the cry to battle. Victory to Vodalia!"
—Marshall Volnikov

name: Vivid Revival
text: Golgari crops bloom in strange soils, touched only by long-traveled light.

name: Wave Elemental
text:
"Consider the wave: how weak the mother yet how strong the child."
—Tywanna, Shaper Guildmage

name: Meglonoth
text: When the shards merged, Mayael found herself the general of Naya's mightiest army.

name: Cacophodon
text: When a cacophodon is angry, the whole jungle knows.

name: Somberwald Vigilante
text: He has nothing left but his resentment.

name: Kor Skyfisher
text: www.MagicTheGathering.com

name: Thermal Navigator
text: It takes off with a roar of superheated wind, startling wild pterons as they survey the ground below.

name: Ceremonial Groundbreaker
text: Construction in New Capenna is imbued with tradition and ritual.

name: Undead Gladiator
text: The Cabal loves encores.

name: Lagonna-Band Elder
text: "The best lessons are not the ones I teach. They are the ones the pupils realize for themselves."

name: Brilliant Plan
text: At Red Cliffs, Kongming and Zhou Yu each wrote his plan for defeating Wei on the palm of his hand. They laughed as they both revealed the same word, "Fire."

name: Ferris Wheel
text: After a certain point, it becomes more of a prison than a ride.

name: Crack the Earth
text:
"As the war progressed, the destruction the kami caused became more widespread and less predictable."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Shock
text:
Lightning tethers souls to the world.
—Kor saying

name: Kavu Climber
text: The appearance of the first kavu surprised Multani. As they continued to emerge, he no longer had any doubts about Yavimaya's ability to defend herself.

name: Out of Bounds
text: The wardens watch for illegal tactics and protect spectators from the occasional rogue fireball.

name: Sliver Legion
text: Hidden within the clicking, chittering swarm is a unique mind, still young, but growing more aware as time passes.

name: Remove Soul
text: Nethya stiffened suddenly, head cocked as if straining to hear some distant sound, then felt lifeless to the ground.

name: Kari Zev's Expertise
text: "I was made for this!"

name: Eureka Moment
text: "At first, the equations were simply numbers. But in those numbers, I saw a story, and in that story I saw a pattern, and suddenly it all fit together!"

name: Wildfire
text:
"Shiv hatched from a shell of stone around a yolk of flame."
—Viashino myth

name: Streetbreaker Wurm
text: The Orzhov run a construction unit whose only business is rebuilding the wreckage left in the wake of wurms. When business is slow, they pay Golgari carnomancers to lure the wurms to the surface.

name: Inheritance
text:
"More than lessons may be gained from the past."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Spelltwine
text: "Two spells are more than one."

name: Mystic Zealot
text: Nomad youths aspire to one of two roles in the tribe: priest or warrior. Their secret dream is to become both.

name: Wayward Soul
text:
"No home, no heart, no hope."
—Stronghold graffito

name: Seek the Horizon
text: The Temur call the flickering lights the Path of Whispers, believing that they lead the way to ancestral knowledge.

name: Bandage
text: Life is measured in inches. To a healer, every one of those inches is precious.

name: Wind Drake
text: A smaller cousin to the dragon, drakes are often seen at the side of powerful wizards who use them as airborne eyes and ears.

name: Devoted Paladin
text: "I swore a sacred oath to protect the weak and punish those who threaten them. As long as I draw breath, I will protect you."

name: Aegis of the Meek
text:
"With this marvel, even the weak have a fighting chance!"
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Hot Springs
text: Warmth is life; heat is peace.

name: Fang Skulkin
text:
"Everything falls apart. But living things fall apart in the most fascinating ways."
—Mowagh the Gwyllion

name: Kheru Bloodsucker
text: It stares through the empty, pain-twisted faces of those it has drained.

name: Sibsig Icebreakers
text:
"I almost envy them. They can't get frostbite."
—Kirada, Silumgar enforcer

name: Dross Prowler
text:
"I would never have believed that on a world with four suns there could exist a place so dark."
—Glissa Sunseeker

name: Nexus of Fate
text: Sarkhan wandered into a tomb and back in time.

name: Vault Skirge
text: From the remnants of the dead, Geth forged a swarm to safeguard his throne.

name: Loreseeker's Stone
text: Mages come from far and wide to bathe in its wisdom.

name: Cinder Wall
text:
"Easy. All ya gotta do is push somebody into it."
—Squee, goblin cabin hand, scouting report

name: Incurable Ogre
text: Each mutation causes the incurables to look vastly different from one another. They are left with only one thing in common: their insatiable lust for the slaughter.

name: Escape Protocol
text: Sanctuaries harnessed the glowstones' natural reaction to monsters to create a warning system.

name: Hoard-Smelter Dragon
text: He collects the precious metals, and then converts the rest to propellant.

name: Flourishing Fox
text:
"Day 1: These fox pups have really taken to me.
"Day 4: Big. So big. Need additional security."
—Jonald, mission naturalist, research notes

name: Rolling Temblor
text: When demons open a path to your front door, it's time to move.

name: Mind Burst
text: As haunting as a zombie's curse.

name: Stampede
text:
"When are beasts like a river?"
—*The One Thousand Questions*

name: Burgeoning
text:
"The plants said, 'We will fight the stone with root and stem and seed. We are patient. We will win.'"
—Skyshroud myth of the forest

name: Blessed Light
text: Enchanted by mage-smiths and blessed by priests, Benalish windows let in light and cast out darkness.

name: Open the Gates
text:
"If you don't have a destination in mind, the route is all that matters."
—Tamina, district guide

name: Deadly Wanderings
text:
"Seclusion is only an option for the strong."
—Sorin Markov

name: Icebind Pillar
text:
"Oh, Valki. I'm disappointed in you. How could the god of lies be so gullible?"
—Tibalt

name: Chronosavant
text: "In my dreams, I hear the voices of my future selves who have died in times yet to come. I use that knowledge to avoid those dark futures and continue my search for peace."

name: Fearsome Awakening
text: On Tarkir, dragons emerge from enormous tempests, phenomena tied to Ugin's very presence on the plane.

name: Azure Mage
text:
"We draw our power from the infinite ocean of the mind, where all manner of things can be conceived."
—Azure creed

name: Combo Attack
text: Success at Valor's Reach requires not only individual skill but also the ability to merge that skill with a partner's.

name: Naturalize
text: If you want to destroy something lifeless, make it live.

name: Karametra's Acolyte
text: "The wilds are a garden tended by divine hands."

name: Silent Attendant
text: "The answer to life should never be death; it should always be more life, wrapped tight around us like precious silks."

name: Eyeblight Cullers
text:
"As long as eyeblights exist, the hunt will never end."
—Miara, Thorn of the Glade

name: Eternal Witness
text: Our lives are etched on our bodies, memories illustrated on skin.

name: Sustainer of the Realm
text: You may break her shield, but you'll never break her spirit.

name: Sanctified Charge
text: You need only raise your spear to receive this blessing.

name: Citanul Stalwart
text: The endless grind of the Brothers' War had fouled Terisiare's land and blackened its skies. Argoth's defenders were determined to protect their isle from the same fate.

name: Graven Abomination
text: Ironically, the statues had been constructed as a warning.

name: Triskelion
text:
"Why do bad things always come in threes?"
—Gisulf, expedition survivor

name: Steam Augury
text: Keranos is a fickle god, delivering punishment as readily as prophecy.

name: Flame-Blessed Bolt
text:
"I noticed you were short on party favors, so I brought my own."
—Higa, slayer-captain of Gatstaf

name: Opt
text: The crystal pulsed with the power of Teferi's Planeswalker spark. Had Jhoira given him a blessing or a curse?

name: Eidolon of the Great Revel
text: Xenagos reveled while Theros burned.

name: Brassclaw Orcs
text:
"Brassclaws were typical Orcs—quick to laud their own prowess in battle, quick to jeer at their opponents, and quicker still to run away when things started to look slightly dangerous."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV*

name: Blade-Blizzard Kitsune
text: In the time it takes most to master one blade, he mastered two.

name: Thopter Foundry
text:
"Etherium is limited. Innovation is not."
—Tezzeret

name: Kindly Ancestor // Ancestor's Embrace
text: "You look cold, dearie."

name: Silumgar Monument
text: Silumgar dominates his clan from a fortress on the Marang River, where he rests upon piles of treasure.

name: Aether Flash
text:
"You can't get there from here. Well, you *can*—it just won't be fun."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Shattering Blow
text:
"Aurelia seems too eager to solve her problems by delivering them to oblivion."
—Prime Speaker Zegana

name: Abyssal Gatekeeper
text:
"There are two ways for me to pass this gate. One involves you remaining conscious."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Dwarven Lieutenant
text:
"Dwarven officers were tireless in battle, moving up and down the lines to rally their troops and boost morale."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV*

name: Fiery Justice
text: When the rebels couldn't breach the castle to kill Lalor the Obstinate, they tried a more internal approach to depose the pretender king.

name: Karplusan Hound
text:
"Don't worry, they don't bite. They much prefer setting people on fire."
—Jaya Ballard, to Chandra

name: Ambassador Laquatus
text:
"He smiles with poisoned lips."
—Empress Llawan

name: Overwhelmed Archivist // Archive Haunt
text: Cleaning up his life's work was his afterlife's work.

name: Gloomwidow's Feast
text: Each night, gloomwidows cull fresh prey for their ravenous hatchlings.

name: Skeleton Archer
text:
"Soul, flesh, even eyes—none of these are strictly necessary for deadly precision."
—Modriss of Zargoth Fen

name: Combine Chrysalis
text: Action: Please design a Simic device that turns smaller creatures into big flying beasts.

name: Sever Soul
text:
"With the proper tools, even the Great River can be dammed."
—Ta-Spon, Cho-Arrim executioner

name: Synapse Sliver
text:
"Species XR17 feeds upon the mental energies of its victims. This explains why the goblins remain unaffected."
—Riptide Project researcher

name: Raptor Companion
text: A raptor will follow any order as long as that order is "hunt," "kill," or "go for the guts."

name: Guttural Response
text: Wort had a raiding-bellow that could shatter steel, melt auras, and slice countermagic in half.

name: Elves of Deep Shadow
text: Cast out of the Conclave generations ago, these elves found a home in the corrupted districts of the Golgari.

name: Ancient Spider
text: It outlived both king and castle.

name: Hold the Line
text: "Forgive me, Master Kami, but in the interest of my people I must halt your advance."

name: Farbog Explorer
text: "I'd slog through a thousand swamps to help one soul find rest."

name: Reckless Endeavor
text: Which burns more fiercely? Your ambition, or the flame?

name: Six-y Beast
text: Is it six?

name: Shambling Suit
text:
"The young squire gripped her sword as the clanking stranger emerged. It was no knight that had come to challenge her."
—*Beyond the Great Henge*

name: Axegrinder Giant
text: The angriest of giants are often the most skillful weaponsmiths. Their grudges fuel endless sessions at the forge, all the while growling ferociously to themselves.

name: Icatian Infantry
text:
"Never Surrender"
—Motto carved into a fragment of an Icatian wall

name: Kyler, Sigardian Emissary
text: "Even when the angels succumbed to madness, Sigarda stood strong. She is hope."

name: Geosurge
text:
"The mountains have been corrupted. Otherwise, they would not lend me their fire so easily."
—Koth of the Hammer

name: Mana Leak
text:
"The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy."
—Volrath

name: Now You See Me . . .
text: With enough showmanship, even mundane items like playing cards or molecular teleporters can produce a mesmerizing spectacle.

name: Exotic Orchard
text:
"It was a strange morning. When we awoke, we found our trees transformed. We didn't know whether to water them or polish them."
—Pulan, Bant orchardist

name: Wary Thespian
text: The Cabaretti performance had veered off-script ... so how were the acrobats still moving in perfect unison?

name: Bladestitched Skaab
text: The surviving militia members reunited with their fallen comrades sooner than they'd hoped.

name: Pain Magnification
text: The Rakdos make sure their victims remember their pain—or at least give up a little bit of their sanity in order to forget.

name: Jenara, Asura of War
text: Wounded soldiers looked up, grateful for her appearance. But she passed over them, her eyes firmly on their foe.

name: Smallpox
text:
"Great losses often bring only a numb shock. To truly plunge a victim into misery, you must overwhelm him with many small sufferings."
—Ratadrabik of Urborg

name: Boundless Realms
text:
"Planeswalking cannot be taught. Either you see the doors or you do not."
—Nissa Revane

name: Cryptic Cruiser
text:
"The seas are no less imperiled than the dry lands. This fight is mine as much as it is yours."
—Kiora, to Gideon Jura

name: Niblis of the Breath
text:
"Why do the dead remain among us? Where is Flight Alabaster to lead them home? Where is Avacyn?"
—Eruth of Lambholt

name: Shield Bearer
text:
"You have almost completed your four years, my son. Soon you shall be a skyknight."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

name: Gleaming Barrier
text:
"Gold without freedom might as well be lead."
—Angrath

name: Rampaging Cyclops
text: Keldon warriors take advantage of the cyclops's inability to focus on more than one thing at a time.

name: Your Fate Is Thrice Sealed
text: "I can't abide laziness. Arise, forces of nature, and serve your master!"

name: Grim Tutor
text: As blood touched the empty page, it formed words that seared themselves into the wizard's mind.

name: Only Blood Ends Your Nightmares
text: "But nothing will end your regret."

name: Firebreathing
text: "And topples round the dreary west A looming bastion fringed with fire." —Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "In Memoriam"

name: Bog Raiders
text:
"Let weak feed on weak, that we may divine the nature of strength."
—*Phyrexian Scriptures*

name: Dwarven Armorer
text:
"The few remaining pieces from this period suggest the Dwarves eventually made weapons and armor out of everything, even children's toys."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV*

name: Warlord's Elite
text: "The Warlord thinks we've gone soft, does he? The Fist of Progress will prove him wrong!"

name: Narcomoeba
text:
"What bait do you cast to catch a dream?"
—Ravnican riddle

name: Basilica Skullbomb
text: It shines with the conviction of a zealous acolyte.

name: Thraximundar
text: His name means "he who paints the earth red."

name: Aven Gagglemaster
text: An aven's gear is enchanted to avoid weighing them down during aerial maneuvers.

name: Rocco, Cabaretti Caterer
text: They wouldn't admit it, but some people join the Cabaretti just for the food.

name: Monastery Swiftspear
text:
"No sign of movement. Looks like we've got the element of sur—"
—Gaiza, Mardu raider

name: Angrath's Marauders
text: Captain Angrath cares less about treasure than mayhem. If he can't leave Ixalan, he'll burn the plane down.

name: Eye to Eye
text: True, Gargox had blinded himself for life, but the glass eyes never lost.

name: Seer of the Last Tomorrow
text: "The truth? It's been here all along. The Hours as we understood them are lies."

name: Heirloom Mirror // Inherited Fiend
text: "Well done, young fool, well done! Now for your reward."

name: Ramses, Assassin Lord
text: "Why butcher an army when you can slash a single throat for the same result?"

name: Tidal Surge
text:
"It is nature that gives us our boundaries and nature that enforces them."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: The Abyss
text:
"An immense river of oblivion is sweeping us away into a nameless abyss."
—Ernest Renan, *Souvenirs d'Enfance et de Jeunesse*

name: Martyr for the Cause
text: "If I am to die in service, there is no more worthy fight than this."

name: Watchdog
text: Its growl is a long, rumbling grind of gears and clockwork, its bark a blast of hissing steam.

name: Relearn
text:
"Barrin taught me that the hardest lessons to grasp are the ones you've already learned."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Jedit Ojanen of Efrava
text: The cat warriors recognized this Jedit's face, but not his fierce loyalty to Efrava.

name: Pensive Minotaur
text:
The Champion and her companions marched through the night, but the battle was over before they arrived. In the middle of the carnage sat a solitary minotaur, lost in what seemed to the Champion to be thought.
—*The Theriad*

name: Tolarian Academy
text: The academy worked with time—until time ran out.

name: Foundry Assembler
text:
"They never tire, they never complain, and they never ask questions. Build more."
—Ivash, Consulate inventor

name: Bloodflow Connoisseur
text:
"Death not for survival but for vanity and pleasure? This is the decadence I sought to curb."
—Sorin Markov

name: Augury Raven
text: Some ravens collect shiny baubles; others hoard omens and secrets.

name: Boar Umbra
text: "From in here, everything looks like dinner."

name: Branchloft Pathway // Boulderloft Pathway
text:
"The path is stable. It's the gusts all around it that are a bit 'whoosh—oops—bye.'"
—Kreq of Sunder Bay

name: Bane of Progress
text: It sees shaped stone and carved wood as mutilations.

name: Exclusion Mage
text: Successful battles start with knowing who's worth fighting.

name: Trained Cheetah
text: "[King Mulu's cheetahs] came riding on the winds, charging, with fangs bared and claws flexed."

name: Michiko Konda, Truth Seeker
text: Michiko could not sit idly by while Kamigawa suffered for her father's actions.

name: Silundi Vision // Silundi Isle
text:
"From the hedron fields of Agadeem to the Faduun of Jwar Isle, the islands of the Silundi Sea offer one mystery after another."
—Jori En, expedition leader

name: Ghirapur Guide
text: Fairgoers were delighted to find that even outside the fairgrounds, Ghirapur was a city of wonders.

name: Barrow Witches
text:
"Taste the sweetness, breath for breath. Keep the balance, death for death."
—Barrow witch incantation

name: Consign to the Pit
text: First your whole life flashes before your eyes. Then you have considerable time to reflect on every regret as you plummet.

name: Monster Manual // Zoological Study
text: The detail really makes the monsters jump off the page.

name: Dowsing Dagger // Lost Vale
text: The pirates had ventured into the interior for treasure. They found something far greater.

name: Cultivate
text: "The black lotus rises from adverse conditions and produces a rare bloom. We grow the lotus to remind us to look to the future despite the suffering of the present."

name: Llanowar Wastes
text:
"The sylex blast marked not only the end of the war, but the end of Dominaria as most knew it."
—*The Antiquities War*

name: Cradle of Vitality
text: Naya's trees grow tall and sturdy. Their foliage intertwines to form dewcups, rainwater pools where the elves gather to celebrate life.

name: Mask of Law and Grace
text: The archangels zealously drove Serra's light into every corner of their new home as if their creator still commanded them.

name: Ardent Militia
text: Some fight for honor and some for gold, but the militia fight for hearth and home.

name: Honor the Fallen
text:
"May the River claim Cho-Manno's body, wherever it lies."
—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer

name: Ominous Sphinx
text: The sphinxes began to speak only after the Second Sun aligned. They whispered dire warnings, though no one listened.

name: Magma Rift
text:
"Lighting a fire needs kindling and heat. You be the kindling. I'll bring the heat."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Vampire Bats
text: "For something is amiss or out of place/ When mice with wings can wear a human face." —Theodore Roethke, "The Bat"

name: Lurking Roper
text: "You see, stalac-*tites* grow down from the ceiling, while stalag-*mites* reach—AAHHHHHHHHH—"

name: Reliquary Tower
text:
"The tower isn't the structure itself. It is all of us, and the wisdom we share. It grows ever upward, a stone for every new arrival."
—Archmage Vintra

name: Kjeldoran Phalanx
text:
"There's nothing I like better than watching a street full of soldiers kicking down the doors of the guilty and the impure."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Monk of the Open Hand
text: His mind is a tranquil meadow, his fists a raging storm.

name: Arcane Teachings
text: Dwarves may teach at the speed of stone, but their results are solid.

name: One With the Wind
text:
"River and sea, jungle and sky. Water flows freely between the two halves of the world. We are creatures of the water."
—Shaper Tuvasa

name: Make a Stand
text: For a moment they stood tall, all fear forgotten.

name: Spatula of the Ages
text: At last Urza's powers were focused through the incredible artifact. "Who wants pancakes?" he asked.

name: Oculus
text:
"In its gaze I saw no mercy, no recognition that I was worthy to exist."
—Kara Vrist, Neurok agent

name: Elite Skirmisher
text: Some adopted the tactics of the leonin to combat the ferocity of the minotaurs.

name: Incremental Growth
text: The bonds of family cross the boundaries of race.

name: Harvest Hand // Scrounged Scythe
text: The harvest is never finished.

name: Ticking Mime Bomb
text: Silent, but deadly.

name: Vivify
text: Near the Krosan border, farmers keep watch over their fields lest the sod get up and wander away.

name: Balance of Power
text:
"To empty your mind is to fill your grave."
—Lat-Nam teaching

name: Specter of the Fens
text: Foul specters hunt down those who try to back out of a deal with a daemogoth.

name: Lantern Kami
text:
"Snuffing the light of a lantern without saying a small prayer is bad luck. Though its flame can only singe, its soul can repeatedly visit misery on one's house."
—Teachings of Eight-and-a-Half-Tails

name: Jade Guardian
text: The River Heralds believe that jade gives weight to their magic.

name: Avarice Amulet
text: Designed by Penny Arcade

name: Benefaction of Rhonas
text: It falls to the gods to help all become worthy of the afterlife.

name: Candlelight Vigil
text: Selesnya guildmages do not sleep so the rest of the Conclave can.

name: Dimir Cutpurse
text: Other guilds demand tolls from those who travel their territories, but not House Dimir. It takes its share secretly, one coin purse at a time.

name: Ghired's Belligerence
text:
"Harmony is no longer an option."
—Ghired, Conclave exile

name: Bumper Cars
text: The cars are serviced every ten thousand bumps or every four hours, whichever comes first.

name: Mesa Falcon
text:
"The faith of Serra is borne on wings of hope."
—Gulsen, abbey matron

name: Natural Spring
text: Mirri listened intently, even as Hanna held the healing water to her lips. Would the sound of the spring drown out the elves' approach?

name: Cyclops Electromancer
text: Every storm has an eye.

name: Dwarven Catapult
text:
"Often greatly outnumbered in battle, Dwarves relied on catapults as one means of damaging a large army."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV*

name: Razorfin Abolisher
text: Once you have been marked by the merrow, you are not long for their waters.

name: Sewer Rats
text:
You lie down with rats, and the rats run away.
—Suq'Ata insult

name: Living Lightning
text: Not all storms come from the sky.

name: Emeria's Call // Emeria, Shattered Skyclave
text:
"Iona no longer guards this place. We do."
—Kasla, Emeria shepherd

name: City of Traitors
text: 2019 North America Legacy Champion

name: Rolling Stones
text: Walls collapse and kill people all the time. Some are just more aggressive about it.

name: Lu Meng, Wu General
text: As the Wu chief commander, Lu Meng conquered Shu-held Jingzhou in 219 by disguising soldiers as merchants on boats filled with hiding troops.

name: Scion of the Swarm
text: Vampires are now masters of their own fates, commanders of their own legions.

name: Defensive Stance
text:
"It isn't for fighting. It's for when the fighting's gone bad."
—Kara Vrist, Mirran resistance

name: Armored Wolf-Rider
text: Wolf-riders of Selesnya apprentice from a young age. Each rider raises a wolf pup from birth to serve as a mount, hoping that one day the two will share the honor of guarding the Great Concourse.

name: Breath of Malfegor
text: The blood of the demons quickened as their master rose over the battlefield. The blood of the angels also quickened: here was the chance to finally end the war started millennia ago.

name: Fickle Efreet
text: Flame chooses its own course.

name: Subterranean Scout
text: When things get ugly above ground, goblins resort to alternate routes of passage.

name: Unburden
text:
"Ambition requires clarity. If you have any doubts, they must be abandoned."
—Bontu, god of ambition

name: Ardent Militia
text: Knights fight for honor and mercenaries fight for gold. The militia fights for hearth and home.

name: Rally the Ancestors
text:
"The family is a tree, and in times of need, every branch can be a weapon."
—Daghatar the Adamant

name: Goblin Racketeer
text: "It, uh, fell off a cart?"

name: Octoprophet
text: In every swirl of the tide, it sees the awakening of things yet to come.

name: Syphon Flesh
text: Necromancers deal in commodities far more precious than gold and grain.

name: Kazuul, Tyrant of the Cliffs
text: Warning to those who scale the cliffs without paying tribute: it's a long way down.

name: Harried Artisan // Phyrexian Skyflayer
text: Soaring in Realmbreaker's embrace, he finally understood what perfection was.

name: Mournwhelk
text: It hoards Lorwyn's rare sorrows.

name: Enfeeblement
text: Crovax had witnessed Selenia lead the *Predator* to the *Weatherlight*. As the battle raged on deck, he felt his strength melt in the heat of her betrayal.

name: Auriok Windwalker
text: Each generation, a handful of Auriok girls are allowed to visit the Cave of Light. They return riding the wind and brandishing steel.

name: Riveteers Ascendancy
text: "We are this city, down to its bones."

name: Rustvine Cultivator
text: Feel the joy of losing yourself to feed the land.

name: Team Pennant
text: Choosing a college based on Mage Tower results is discouraged, but not unheard of.

name: Avaricious Dragon
text: Waste follows want.

name: Call of the Wild
text: Thinking of dinner made Squee realize that the forest was probably thinking the same thing.

name: Stromgald Crusader
text: "The White-Shielders think their code justifies their actions. In truth it only binds their hands."

name: Invasion of Mercadia // Kyren Flamewright
text: Inspired by tales of the legendary hero Squee, many young Kyren goblins strove to emulate his magical skill and courage in the face of danger.

name: Trash for Treasure
text: Goblins generally have two possessions: one per hand.

name: Tears of Valakut
text: When Kozilek destroyed Sea Gate, distant Valakut could not contain its grief.

name: Boomerang
text: A lie always returns; be careful how you catch it.

name: Meteorite
text:
"Material at dig site 165-beta confirmed to be of Null Moon origin. Immediate excavation assistance requested."
—Tolarian field dispatch

name: Thrill-Kill Assassin
text: As the bounty on Massacre Girl rose, so did the number of imitators.

name: Planar Collapse
text: With heavy heart, Urza doused one world's light to rekindle another's.

name: Manakin
text: Hanna regarded Squee sternly. "Because it's *not* a toy, no matter how much it may look like one," she said, taking the manakin from him.

name: Ghastly Discovery
text: Korrigans, spirits bound to sources of water, shriek when they come upon their own drowned corpses.

name: Tree Monkey
text:
"They serve the world best on a platter with shallots and onions."
—Talas sailor

name: White Knight
text:
"When good men die their goodness does not perish, / But lives though they are gone."
—Euripides,
*Termenidae*, trans. Morgan

name: Parallel Lives
text:
"There will come a time when the only prey left will be each other."
—Ulrich of Krallenhorde Pack

name: Man of Measure
text: You need to be this tall to play this card.

name: Whiptongue Frog
text: Their favorite food? Wind dancers.

name: Trumpeting Armodon
text: These are its last days. But it will not go quietly.

name: Fauna Shaman
text: "I call upon both predators and protectors, for now is a season of war."

name: Goblin Guide
text: When the landmarks themselves get up and move, goblin intuition beats any map.

name: Hooded Brawler
text: Nagas wielding twin daggers excel at the fighting technique known as the Bite of Rhonas.

name: Kor Halberd
text: An ancient weapon for a modern war.

name: Valiant Guard
text: As the outsiders invaded Bant, soldiers who once saw sigils as the highest marks of glory began to see the scars of battle as tokens of equal worth.

name: Steadfast Unicorn
text: Only the good-hearted may set foot in a unicorn's domain.

name: Evolving Wilds
text:
"It's not hard to grasp that this land does not belong to us."
—Gavi, nest warden

name: Might Sliver
text:
"The colossal thing rumbled over the ridge, tree husks crumbling before it. The ones we were already fighting howled as it came, their muscles suddenly surging, and we knew it was time to flee."
—Llanach, Skyshroud ranger

name: Toxic Nim
text: The nim have become roving killers marshaled by whichever thane holds tenuous leadership.

name: Persistent Petitioners
text: ". . . we demand a repeal of those ridiculous sumptuary laws. Additionally . . ."

name: Scalebane's Elite
text:
"With Rashida's blades, my guiding vision and the luck of the blessed, today we will free Mangara!"
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Hunted Wumpus
text: Just one can feed a dozen people for a month.

name: Scrounger of Souls
text: Yell for help, and that may answer.

name: Sram, Senior Edificer
text: "If it's broke, I'll fix it. If it isn't broke, I'll break it, and then I'll fix it again!"

name: Might of the Old Ways
text: Brimming with power from their disrupted ritual, the Dawnhart witches lashed out at the werewolf intruders.

name: Zhur-Taa Ancient
text: Many Ravnicans think of nature as orderly groves and elf-tended rot farms. They haven't seen the Gruul wilds.

name: Disdainful Stroke
text: "You are beneath contempt. Your lineage will be forgotten."

name: Mental Discipline
text: Barrin drowned his doubts about Urza's project by delving ever deeper into its details.

name: Sungrass Egg
text:
"Has your peaceful nature led you on a crusade?"
—Watnik, master glassblower

name: Wing Puncture
text:
"If I were the air, I wouldn't taunt the ground. It has the weight advantage."
—Konnos, Sylvok sage

name: Hex
text: When killing five just isn't enough.

name: Angelic Edict
text: The Boros built a prison in the sky where Azorius statutes couldn't restrict their sense of justice.

name: Fierce Witchstalker
text: While the realm has laws, in the wilds there are other ways of balancing power.

name: Scapegoat
text: "Enjoy your deception, Vuel," Gerrard said as Volrath's features melted from the dead shapeshifter. "I'll count this one as practice."

name: Mage Hunters' Onslaught
text: Extus stood before his alma mater for a moment, remembering first his studies, then his vengeance. At his command, the mage hunters unfolded.

name: Sunlit Marsh
text: Even the poisoned land around the Stronghold blossomed with new life in the wake of the Great Mending.

name: Sanctimony
text: "To forgive our enemies is to forgive ourselves."

name: Nimbus Maze
text: To find its center is to find one's own.

name: Outrage Shaman
text: A boggart's mind is a tinderbox of volatile thoughts, hungry for a spark.

name: Lone Rider // It That Rides as One
text:
". . . but until this morning, I'd never seen them be of one body."
—Ulda, Gavony Rider

name: Serra's Embrace
text: The touch of Serra's angels bears hopes aloft and empowers noble causes.

name: Snapping Gnarlid
text: All of Zendikar's beings sense the upheaval that accompanies the Eldrazi.

name: Virtuous Charge
text: "The empire belongs to no one man but to all in the empire. He who has virtue shall possess it."

name: Sinew Dancer
text: To resist the embrace of the Flesh Singularity is to reject unconditional acceptance.

name: Doomgape
text: It eats and eats until the juiciest morsel it can find is itself.

name: Warehouse Thief
text: Wealthy patriars make up the vast majority of both his victims and his customers.

name: Crossbow Ambush
text:
There is no drake that flies faster than a crossbow bolt.
—Vec saying

name: Mystic Archaeologist
text: The delight of discovery drives the pursuit of knowledge.

name: Enchantress's Presence
text: "The wise learn from successes as well as mistakes."

name: Thunderstaff
text: Jort the Thunder-Mad spent his life perfecting a way to harness the power of the heavens.

name: Herald of the Pantheon
text: The distinction of bearing the gods' banner is nothing compared to the glory of being closer to Nyx.

name: Once More with Feeling
text: If yo . . . ted.

name: Wakening Sun's Avatar
text:
"Kinjalli's encompassing rays herald new life in the moment of the sun's dawning."
—Chitlati, Lightning Rider

name: Quicksilver Gargantuan
text:
"You know you have achieved true power if the sea itself seeks to emulate your greatness."
—Vy Covalt, Neurok agent

name: Eladamri's Vineyard
text: The mushroom wine made Gerrard's head spin, and his stomach soon followed suit.

name: Yoked Ox
text:
It was in fields of grain, not fields of battle, that the Champion learned to bear the yoke of duty to the gods. She worked the land long before she was called on to defend it.
—*The Theriad*

name: Burning Prophet
text: "This day will end in death, but not the one you hoped for. This day will end in victory, but not the one you expected."

name: Flash Flood
text: Many people say that no power can bring the mountains low. Many people are fools.

name: Epiphany at the Drownyard
text:
"Is this what you found, Tamiyo?"
—Jace Beleren

name: Timecrafting
text: Oddly, an unstable time stream makes wizards want to tinker with it even more.

name: Kiku, Night's Flower
text:
"A wanderer has told me of an assassin in the Takenuma Swamp who uses her dark arts to animate her enemies' shadows against them. A wild tale, but it explains much."
—Diary of Azusa

name: Grimclaw Bats
text: Even on a world of metal, there are those who thirst for blood.

name: Beneath the Sands
text: Though buried and muffled, nature's whisper still called to Nissa.

name: Opt
text: The crystal pulsed with the power of Teferi's planeswalker spark. Had Jhoira given him a blessing or a curse?

name: Ministrant of Obligation
text: When the price of your sins comes due, the Church of Deals is there to collect.

name: Encroaching Wastes
text: Every world is a work in progress, constantly reshaped by time, disasters, and even the powerful magic of Planeswalkers.

name: Thraben Valiant
text: "Once more into Devil's Breach, soldiers. I want another devil tail for my collection."

name: Havoc Demon
text: A cry of pain as it enters this world. A chorus of screams as it leaves.

name: Mind Warp
text: The hardest of wizards can have the softest of minds.

name: Plains
text: You've traced the tensions in Ten-Towns to the dwindling reindeer populations ... but what has been hunting them?

name: Seize the Day
text:
"I wish I could say it gets easier, kiddo, but I'd be lying."
—Vander

name: Pillardrop Warden
text: A giant statue of a dwarf is still a giant statue.

name: Fog Bank
text:
"The union of sea and sky makes a perfect cover."
—Talrand, sky summoner

name: Bumper Cars
text: The engineers figured out a way to make the crashes power the ride itself. The energy surplus alone is enough to run the deep fryer.

name: Yixlid Jailer
text: "I have an eternity to know the souls who are bound here, to behold their every facet. But moments from now they will be gagged and masked, and they shall be known by none other."

name: Valkyrie Harbinger
text: Where she flies, the Light of Starnheim shines.

name: Kazandu Mammoth // Kazandu Valley
text:
"The elves stick to the trees. Here, where the trees welcome the sky and leave room for grazing herds—this is our land."
—Triel, Kazandu tuskcaller

name: Organic Extinction
text:
"Technology evolves faster than a blade can swing."
—Arima, lead inventor of the Futurists

name: Thunder Wall
text:
"The Lemures had barely taken wing when the sky roared with thunder. The swarm of little beasts wavered, divided, and fell, crashing to the earth."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: High Market
text: If it can't be had here, it can't be had on any world.

name: Divine Sacrament
text: Their whispered prayers rally the nomads better than any war cry could.

name: Grandmother Sengir
text:
"Rarely have power and madness been so delightfully wed as they have in our dear grandmother."
—Baron Sengir

name: Favorable Winds
text:
"Like ribbons of wind and wisdom the coatls fly, twisting mystery into truth, shaping the clouds to suit their inscrutable will."
—Huatli

name: Volshe Tideturner
text: Ships suspected of carrying Sheoldred's agents have a tendency to drift far off course as they sail through the Voda Sea.

name: Mistmeadow Skulk
text: Doyo suspected the boggarts of brewing a plot against his crop, so he scythed away his grain to clear the sightlines.

name: Tonic Peddler
text: "The price is written at the bottom of the cup."

name: Steady-Handed Mook
text: A mook's life span is just long enough to get just good enough to get careless.

name: Shifting Sky
text:
Master the sky and you rule everything beneath it.
—Metathran saying

name: Chainer's Edict
text: The pits have their own form of mercy.

name: Welkin Guide
text:
"Those talons really dig into your skin, but it's better than being dropped."
—Rafiq of the Many

name: Kaysa
text: Kaysa speaks as the elder druid, but Yavimaya recognizes only one voice: its own.

name: Multani, Maro-Sorcerer
text:
"To make peace with the forest, make peace with me."
—Multani, to Urza

name: Blood Divination
text: Predicting the future is a messy business.

name: Seize the Initiative
text: The time between spotting a leonin shikari and feeling its claws is just time enough to draw your last breath.

name: Thraben Watcher
text:
"Fear not the angels' constant eyes,
E'er on watch from lightless skies;
Eternal vigil we will keep,
Protectors of the Blessed Sleep."

name: Cleaver Skaab
text: Furious and unable to separate, the bitter rivals consoled themselves by splitting everything else they saw in half.

name: Manticore Eternal
text: While most Eternals were initiates who completed the trials, Bolas had plans for some of Amonkhet's other denizens.

name: Compulsive Research
text: "Four parts molten bronze, yes . . . one part frozen mercury, yes, yes . . . but then what?"

name: Guardian Seraph
text: Her gaze prevents the petty sins and her sword punishes the rest.

name: Heartfire
text: The mage looked within and realized there was still one piece of fuel to burn.

name: Tavern Swindler
text: "Only a chump stops after one unlucky loss. You're not a chump, are you?"

name: Sylvan Anthem
text:
The harsher the winter, the more glorious the spring.
—Yavimaya saying

name: Alpine Meadow
text:
"Here perished Rognar the Reckless after his hundred-day battle with the Ironmaw Dragon. We raised these stones to mark his resting place."
—Iskene, Kannah storyteller

name: Ninja of the New Moon
text: The night is the greatest ally of all.

name: Ulvenwald Mystics // Ulvenwald Primordials
text: ". . . and embrace the ancient ferocity of the undying Wild."

name: Mossfire Valley
text: Plant life in the valley changes for the worse as runoff from dwarven forges contaminates the water.

name: Merchant Scroll
text:
"There's no trade without trust."
—Eron, the Relentless

name: Pious Evangel // Wayward Disciple
text: "My faith guides my hand . . ."

name: Planar Bridge
text:
"Rashmi's design was just the beginning. We are most eager to see what the High Consul has planned for it."
—Consulate engineer's log

name: Time Stretch
text:
"I swear, I just wanted a few extra hours to do my homework!"
—Petro, novice chronomancer

name: Serum Snare
text: "I bring a message from the Autonomous Furn—argh!"

name: Bandage
text: Takara shook with guilt. She knew the last image her father had seen was her sword flashing toward him.

name: Barbarian Horde
text: Only twenty years after the Sima clan united the empire, invading barbarians divided it again.

name: Endless One
text: It embodies all possible meanings of the word "infinite."

name: Suq'Ata Lancer
text:
"Never stop 'til you see your lance come out the other side."
—Telim'Tor

name: Armadillo Cloak
text:
"Don't laugh. It works."
—Yavimaya ranger

name: Troublesome Spirit
text: As erratic and turbulent as a summer squall.

name: Passwall Adept
text: "My doors are called trespassing, my signatures, forgeries. They don't respect my talents, and I don't respect their labels."

name: Duergar Cave-Guard
text: Duergars who grow too large to live in the tunnels are sent topside to defend the entrances from intruders.

name: Crown of Fury
text: "Passion, fire my heart."

name: Basal Thrull
text:
Initially bred for sacrifice, the Thrulls eventually turned on their masters, the Order of the Ebon Hand, with gruesome results.
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. II*

name: Parallax Inhibitor
text:
"The best I can offer is a temporary reprieve."
—Belbe

name: Foundry Inspector
text:
"Delicate resonance detectors could scan the assembly lines for metallic impurities, loose bolts, and freak occurrences of sentience."
—Tawnos, proposal for overseer prototype

name: Guardian of Ghirapur
text: She was hope incarnate, an incandescent bulwark against the tide of machines.

name: Plains
text: Venturing beneath the desert sands, you've discovered an alien power pulsing with inconceivable energy.

name: Ageless Entity
text: Tel-Jilad's sworn protectors are the trolls, yet more fearsome protectors were created by the Tangle itself.

name: Crippling Chill
text: In the silence of the ice, even dreams become still.

name: Patchwork Gnomes
text: One wizard's trash is another wizard's roving gang of abominations.

name: Yoke of the Damned
text: The demon's yoke is part leash, part noose.

name: Spectral Reserves
text:
"My predecessors taught me of duty and commitment. It seems they have more to teach."
—Wendin, veteran cathar

name: Tree Monkey
text: The vines and branches of the jungle canopy are all the wings it needs.

name: Paradise Druid
text: "There are many kinds of duty, and mine is to see our world grow and endure."

name: Patch Up
text: "Don't tell me who sent you or who you work for. The less I know, the better."

name: Mild-Mannered Librarian
text: She had always believed in the transformative powers of great literature.

name: Kashi-Tribe Warriors
text: The orochi and the monks had always had an unspoken agreement: live and let live. But when the kami began raging, some warrior youths began questioning that agreement.

name: Gulping Scraptrap
text:
"Does anyone else hear that horrible crunching sound?"
—Jace

name: Plagiarize
text: "Are you thinking what I'm thinking?"

name: Estwald Shieldbasher
text: The door to her home survived the fires of the Malignus. Now it's her greatest weapon.

name: Death Ward
text:
"Sometimes, a soul is not ready to complete its journey to the next world."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Essence Leak
text:
"We define the boundaries of reality; they don't define us."
—Teferi

name: Flowstone Wall
text: The rebels assaulted the wall, never suspecting the wall would assault back.

name: Brilliant Plan
text: At Red Cliffs, Kongming and Zhou Yu each wrote his plan for defeating the Wei on the palm of his hand. They laughed as they both revealed the same word, "Fire."

name: Badlands
text: 2016 North American Legacy Champion

name: Adun Oakenshield
text: ". . . And at his passing, the bodies of the world's great warriors shall rise from their graves and follow him to battle." —*The Anvilonian Grimoire*

name: Kor Duelist
text: "Swords cannot reach far enough. Chains cannot strike hard enough. An eternal dilemma, but a simple one."

name: Mysterious Tome // Chilling Chronicle
text: But every story ended the same way: the countryside was captured in the icy grip of winter and darkened by eternal night.

name: Goblin Warrens
text:
"Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late."
—*Sarpadian Empires*, vol. IV

name: Jolrael, Mwonvuli Recluse
text: "Humans bring nothing but suffering and deceit. They are not welcome in my forest."

name: Cosmic Horror
text:
"Then flashed the living lightning from her eyes,/ And screams of horror rend th' affrighted skies."
—Alexander Pope, The Rape of the Lock

name: Needleverge Pathway // Pillarverge Pathway
text:
"Once you really trust the rope, you'll learn to sleep standing up."
—Akiri, kor line-slinger

name: Fateful End
text:
"Everything will be put back in its proper place."
—Klothys, god of destiny

name: Goblin Replica
text: It destroys with unthinking glee.

name: Defile
text: The only shortcut in a bog is to the bottom.

name: Cemetery Reaper
text: Every grave cradles a recruit.

name: Aluren
text:
Squee bounced up and down. "I sees a horsey, an' a piggy, an' a—"
"If you don't shut up," hissed Mirri, "you'll see a kidney and a spleeny."

name: Freyalise Supplicant
text:
"We have joined with the Druids of the Juniper Order. Our faith is one."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

name: Fugitive Druid
text:
"If the druids are so devoted to their trees, I will carve them coffins from their precious heartwood."
—Volrath

name: Cogwork Librarian
text: Why wait for answers?

name: Scaled Hulk
text:
"Say, what rhymes with 'run for your lives'?"
—Ku-Ku, akki poet

name: Hushbringer
text: "Let's begin this conversation again, and this time you will only listen."

name: Training Grounds
text: Under the master's eye, skills are honed sharper and spells cut deeper.

name: Sigardian Zealot
text: "We fight together! In Sigarda's name, ready your weapons!"

name: Soaring Show-Off
text: Some spectators love an underdog, but others are just as happy to support a proven winner.

name: Heartfire Immolator
text: "I'd rather go out in a blaze of glory than fade away and be forgotten."

name: Yukora, the Prisoner
text: It took ninety-nine monks to weave the spell that trapped Yukora. Upon the death of the ninety-nine, the spell was broken, and the demon returned to the mortal world seeking vengeance for its imprisonment.

name: Searing Blood
text: Purphoros's blessing: sometimes a boon, sometimes a bane. Always ablaze.

name: Death Stroke
text: For a sharp second, Selenia froze, and Crovax's blade found home, As the angel shattered like glass, Crovax felt his mind collapse—the curse had been fulfilled.

name: Gorilla Berserkers
text:
"Their fury is their greatest weapon."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Success!
text:
"Those who witness my work often question its necessity. I've never understood that."
—Dr. Julius Jumblemorph

name: Avalanche Tusker
text:
"Hold the high ground, then bring it to your enemy"
—Surrak, khan of the Temur

name: Douser of Lights
text: The party of Rakdos revelers cackled and capered as the thing approached. It hissed, and they jabbed their torches at it, giggling when it recoiled. Then, one by one, the torches went out—and the screaming began.

name: Windbrisk Raptor
text: It awakened to gloom-fouled skies and responded with a righteous rage that shook the heavens.

name: Crucible of Worlds
text: By isolating liquid aether at room temperature, foundry hand Jitya Reyath has given us a glimpse of raw aetheric matter—the very stuff of the cosmos.

name: Pithing Needle
text: Phyrexians spent countless hours unsuccessfully trying to harvest and recreate blinkmoth serum.

name: Wildsize
text: Two times the size, four times the smell.

name: Razor Swine
text:
"They aren't helping the forges. Send them to the surface."
—Furnace boss, sector 12

name: Goblin Wardriver
text:
"A true warrior fights with whatever's handy."
—Qerk of the Secret Warren

name: Pillar of Flame
text: May the worthy spend an eternity in Blessed Sleep. May the wicked find the peace of oblivion.

name: Centaur Battlemaster
text:
"A herd is only as strong as its weakest. Our weakest just killed his third minotaur raider—today."
—Braulios of Pheres Band

name: Kor Celebrant
text: "The landbind ritual connects us to our sacred sites. More importantly, it binds us with every other kor who has visited here, through countless generations."

name: Wall of Lost Thoughts
text: Those who intrude upon the Dimir seldom remember that they have done so.

name: Lunarch Mantle
text:
"A boon from the angels should never be cast aside."
—Manfried Ulmach, Chief Inquisitor

name: Oath of Kaya
text: "So everyone gets what they truly deserve, I will keep watch."

name: Masterwork of Ingenuity
text:
"The crucible yields what you have forged in your mind. You need only reach in and draw the masterwork forth."
—Wahara, Keeper of the Crucible

name: Glint-Eye Nephilim
text: When it awoke, it shook the plane with the thunder of its craving.

name: Holy Strength
text:
"May angels fly at your back. May your blade cleave the darkness."
—War blessing of Serra

name: Annihilating Glare
text: By gaze, sting, and claw, Vraska will see the will of Phyrexia done.

name: Emrakul's Evangel
text:
"In times like these, be particularly wary of those who claim they can save your soul."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

name: Aysen Bureaucrats
text:
"I would say that our Bureaucrats are no better than vipers—but I shouldn't insult the vipers."
—Murat, Death Speaker

name: Throne Warden
text: "Rulers come and go, but my allegiance belongs to the throne."

name: Rip Apart
text: Torn from history. Torn from memory. Torn from reality.

name: Goblin Caves
text: The stench of countless generations of unspeakable activities was enough to loosen both our footing and our stomachs.

name: Splendid Agony
text:
"Wherever you are in the city, you can feel the presence of the God-Pharaoh. Take comfort in that."
—Ukhat, vizier of initiation

name: Spined Basher
text:
"How cute. Does it do any other tricks?"
—Braids, dementia summoner

name: Yedora, Grave Gardener
text: She whispered ancient rites over the fallen, bidding their essences return to the land before they could be repurposed by the machines.

name: Puppet Conjurer
text: He scowls at his imperfect creation, then crushes it to scrap. He salvages the etherium and begins anew.

name: Arbalest Elite
text: There are few things as satisfying as a good, healthy thunk.

name: Tithebearer Giant
text:
"I've always said full war chests win wars, but I didn't mean by bashing enemy skulls with them."
—Teysa

name: Cyclonic Rift
text: "Oh, *that's* what that switch does!"

name: Black Dragon
text: Black dragons revel in the collapse of humanoid kingdoms.

name: Command Tower
text: In the late stages of Tyranid invasion, vast capillary towers funnel biomass to the Hive Ships waiting in orbit.

name: Hulking Bugbear
text: Bugbears move with surprising speed for their size and bulk, a fact that has led to the demise of many unwary adventurers.

name: Spellseeker
text: Mages and warriors recruited from across Kylem display their skills at Valor's Reach.

name: Abyssal Specter
text:
"Open the gates, and bid them enter."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Cinderhaze Wretch
text: Thick smoke billows and twists to form disturbing faces that cackle and click their teeth to the popping embers.

name: Tranquil Domain
text:
"An ancient court mage unified the houses into guilds to serve Zhalfir above their own interests. Even during the civil war, the guilds stood together, a testament to the wisdom of Teferi."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Nature's Lore
text: Nature's secrets can be read on every tree, every branch, every leaf.

name: Mesa Cavalier
