text: In the fight to defeat Phyrexia, the courage of Benalish knights is matched only by that of their pegasus steeds.

name: Settle Beyond Reality
text: Two taken, two judged, one returned.

name: Wrath of Marit Lage
text:
"Marit Lage lies frozen in a glacier's heart. Still her dreams take form in our world, stealing the heat from our souls."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Orah, Skyclave Hierophant
text: "The Skyclaves are our inheritance."

name: Villagers of Estwald // Howlpack of Estwald
text: You can spot a werewolf-infested town by its lack of butcher shops.

name: Ashnod's Cylix
text: Few remember that Ashnod's defilement of Terisiare's resources outstripped even that of her peers.

name: Aven Fisher
text: The same spears that catch their food today will defend their homes tomorrow.

name: Architects of Will
text: This secret society of mages manipulates the beliefs and opinions of others.

name: Nantuko Husk
text:
"The soul sheds light, and death is its shadow. When the light dims, life and death embrace."
—Nantuko teaching

name: Carrion Wurm
text: Since it eats only carrion, sometimes it needs to make some from scratch.

name: Indentured Djinn
text: It's not always clear who's the master and who's the servant.

name: Perilous Vault
text:
"As the years passed, Urza turned his focus from the Thran to worlds beyond his own, seeking any spell or technology that might break the Phyrexian scourge."
—*Urza: From Prodigy to Planeswalker*

name: Snickering Squirrel
text: "In this line of work, you've got to know how to squirrel things away. Quite literally, in my case."

name: Hagra Diabolist
text: "When exploring the darkest regions, wickedness can be the best accomplice of all."

name: Daybreak Charger
text: It's often mistaken for the coming dawn as it gallops across the horizon.

name: Forced Worship
text: Imprisonment teaches revenge. Hobbling teaches resignation.

name: Invasion of Moag // Bloomwielder Dryads
text: Against the implacable will of Phyrexia, the dryads of Moag raised a shield of living summer.

name: Putrid Leech
text: It reacted to Naya's overabundant food supply by growing additional mouths.

name: Savage Gorilla
text: These omnivorous gorillas have no qualms about a diet composed of equal parts fruit and Phyrexians.

name: Thopter Shop
text: Rushed repairs once sent a thopter back to combat with a mechanic's still-warm lunch in the gunner's seat.

name: Akroma, Angel of Wrath
text: Although she wore Nivea's kind face, her heart held nothing but vengeance.

name: Nightstalker Engine
text: Part metal, part bone, and all death.

name: Icatian Scout
text:
"Let it be known that Ailis Connaut acted with honor and bravery in the defense of the town of Montford, risking her life to scout the enemy's position . . . ."
—Proclamation granting knighthood

name: Congregation at Dawn
text: "It is fitting that we meet in the first hour of light, for we are called by the Conclave to pierce a threat of darkness."

name: Haunted House
text: To build Sorin's Haunted Mansion, every detail of Markov Manor was painstakingly recreated, from the floating laser ghosts to the robot space gargoyles.

name: Healer of the Glade
text:
"Grief and rage and nightmares fade
Where hope and comfort make their stand."
—*Lament for Bala Ged*, stanza 4

name: Tolarian Sentinel
text: "It is not just our people I try to rescue. It is our culture, and our hope that we can return to greatness."

name: Seachrome Coast
text: Where the Quicksilver Sea laps over the Razor Fields, the landscape reflects the suns' fading hope.

name: Power Word Kill
text: Aramil issued a long, heroic challenge, then the lich felled him with a single word.

name: Ravaging Blaze
text: In time, not even the fire monks could keep up with Chandra.

name: Shadow Lance
text: Shadow lances are crafted from harvested souls. The more wicked the sinner, the keener the blade.

name: Cabaretti Ascendancy
text: "Whatever you're looking for—food, family, Halo—we've got the best in town."

name: Ancient Ooze
text: The ooze has always been. The ooze will always be.

name: Repay in Kind
text: Sorin has gathered grudges for centuries, patiently awaiting the day he can exact the perfect vengeance.

name: Shock
text:
「今もなお、天は彼に従っていたのか、彼を攻撃していたのか、私にはわからない。」
—-ラル・ザレックの研究記録

name: Aysen Bureaucrats
text:
"All the tortures of my vault of horrors pale in comparison to dealing with those petty Bureaucrats."
—Baron Sengir

name: Whispers of the Muse
text:
"I followed her song only to find it was a dirge."
—Crovax

name: Cenn's Tactician
text: The choke point was the plan, but devoted camaraderie was always her strategy.

name: Evolution Sage
text: "To care for yourself, cultivate the world. To care for the world, cultivate yourself."

name: Howling Banshee
text: Villagers cloaked the town in magical silence, but their ears still bled.

name: Dark Heart of the Wood
text: Even the Goblins shun this haunted place, where the tree limbs twist in agony and the ground seems to scuttle under your feet.

name: Ixalli's Keeper
text: The people of the Sun Empire worship the sun in three aspects. Ixalli is the Verdant Sun, who fosters growth in all things.

name: Angelic Armaments
text: Forged in dark hours from the flame that would not die.

name: Cunning Breezedancer
text:
"That which is beautiful in form can also be deadly."
—Ishai, Ojutai dragonspeaker

name: Barter in Blood
text:
"In the game of conquest, who cares about the pawns if the king yet reigns?"
—Geth, keeper of the Vault

name: Ronom Serpent
text: With the spread of Rimewind's sorcerous winter, snow dwellers reclaimed their places atop the food chain.

name: Oblation
text: "A richer people could give more but they could never give as much."

name: Ineffable Blessing
text: "Hallowed be this assortment of diverse things!"

name: Unsettled Mariner
text: The call of the sea shapes many souls.

name: Chainwhip Cyclops
text:
"You say this Tenth District, not Rubblebelt. But where smash happen, that Rubblebelt. Rubblebelt state of mind."
—Urgdar, cyclops philosopher

name: Kavu Predator
text: In a withered world, the scent of healthy prey is enough to drive a predator to frenzy.

name: Hunt the Weak
text: He who hesitates is lunch.

name: Rad Rascal
text: "Rent a scooter and be just like Devil K. Nevil! Just don't go faster than the speed limit. Or jump over anything. Or catch on fire. Or break every bone in your body multiple times. Other than that, just like him!"

name: Return to Action
text:
"You're hurt? Too bad. You stop fighting when I say, and not a moment sooner."
—Satoru Umezawa

name: Wand of Vertebrae
text: Made by the mad for the work of the wicked.

name: Shrink
text:
"Do not fear adversity. Let your courage be your strength."
—Onatah, Anaba Shaman

name: Wild Instincts
text: Nissa had only the space of a heartbeat to react, her instincts steering her blade.

name: Jedit's Dragoons
text: After Efrava was destroyed, the cat warriors scattered across Dominaria. Those who followed Jedit's example were strong enough to survive the ravages of apocalypse.

name: Nivmagus Elemental
text: When it escaped, the experimenters hesitated. It would cause untold havoc, yet they wished to see it in action.

name: Kindly Stranger // Demon-Possessed Witch
text: "It looks like you could use some protection of your own."

name: Krovikan Elementalist
text:
"The Elementalists' talents could be useful if turned to other purposes."
—Zur the Enchanter

name: Steelbane Hydra
text: Many an ancient treasure has been reduced to jagged caltrops by its snapping jaws.

name: Intrepid Hero
text: A fool knows no fear. A hero shows no fear.

name: Stampeding Wildebeests
text: The most violent and destructive storms in Femeref occur on cloudless days.

name: Stocking Tiger
text: Just hope yours isn't full of coal golems.

name: Thundering Giant
text: The giant was felt a few seconds before he was seen.

name: Shimmer Myr
text: It evades Phyrexians by hiding in the spaces between seconds.

name: Veteran Armorer
text: "Give me a sword and I'll kill a few enemies. But give me a hammer and a fiery forge, and I'll turn the tide of battle."

name: Bloodline Necromancer
text: "The veil of death hides little from our kind."

name: Sunweb
text: Sometimes the wings of fallen dragons refuse to give up the sky.

name: Cursed Ronin
text: "You are fortunate, my enemy. You have paid the price but once. I never stop paying."

name: Ikra Shidiqi, the Usurper
text: "Now the scaled ones rule Tarkir."

name: Dark Banishing
text:
"Will not the mountains quake and hills melt at the coming of the darkness? Share this vision with your enemies, Lim-Dûl, and they shall wither."
—Leshrac, Walker of Night

name: Ruthless Instincts
text: A single battle affects countless others.

name: Thought Erasure
text: "It's truly the highest honor, isn't it? To be remembered? Pity for you."

name: Furious Reprisal
text:
"Now that's the Chandra I've been waiting to see."
—Liliana Vess

name: Lure
text: When setting a snare, success depends not on the quality of the trap, but the quality of the bait.

name: The Ozolith
text: As it twists, so does all life around it.

name: Font of Progress
text:
"Drink deeply of the truth, and become *compleat*."
—Tamiyo

name: Holy Day
text:
"Today there is feasting and peace across our land, but the war has not ended. Tuck away your bloodlust. You'll need it tomorrow."
—Karrim, Samite healer

name: Divination
text:
"The key to unlocking this puzzle is within you."
—Doriel, mentor of Mistral Isle

name: Goblin Firebug
text: Most goblins leave behind a wake of destruction. A few goblins take one with them.

name: Havengul Skaab
text: An abomination so violent that the other fiends tremble at the sight of it.

name: Attempted Murder
text: Squawks was quick to establish the social pecking order.

name: Nimble Mongoose
text: One thread connected all the travelers' stories: the ferocity of the mongoose.

name: Acidic Slime
text: "The merchant said their newt extract was cauldron safe!"

name: Dromoka Dunecaster
text: "The dragonlords rule the tempests of the skies. Here in the wastes, the storms are mine to command."

name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
text: The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.

name: Uthden Troll
text: "Oi oi oi, me gotta hurt in 'ere, Oi oi oi, me smell a ting is near, Gonna bosh 'n gonna nosh 'n da hurt'll disappear." —Traditional

name: Branchsnap Lorian
text: Lorians treat trees and prey the same way: by ripping them limb from limb.

name: Unworthy Dead
text:
"Great Yawgmoth moves across the seas of shard and bone and rust. We exalt him in life, in death, and in between."
—*Phyrexian Scriptures*

name: Chant of the Skifsang
text: The skifsang, seafarers of Nephalia, craft spells like other sailors craft nets—making them strong enough to snare even the deadliest catch.

name: Soul Charmer
text: She seeks the warmth of the living.

name: Dross Scorpion
text: They skitter out of the mists to consume fresh kill before Mephidross has a chance to corrode it away.

name: Lightning Strike
text:
"Storm on the horizon, cap'n!"
—Grick Doobin, last words

name: Starlight
text:
"Even in the darkest night Stars and angels still shine bright."
—Onean children's rhyme

name: Sultai Banner
text: Power to dominate, cruelty to rule.

name: Frontline Sage
text: The battle was won in the commander's head before the first weapon was drawn.

name: Valley Dasher
text: Mardu riders' greatest fear is that a battle might end before their weapons draw blood.

name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
text:
"About, about in reel and rout
The death-fires danced at night;
The water, like a witch's oils,
Burnt green, and blue and white."
—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Quarry Beetle
text:
"The ruin of the past is the topsoil of the future."
—Sokar, former Nef-crop initiate

name: Adarkar Valkyrie
text: She doesn't escort the dead to the afterlife, but instead raises them to fight and die again.

name: Kiddie Coaster
text: The only ride not explicitly mentioned in the Astrotorium waiver.

name: Vector Asp
text: Phyrexia's machines take inspiration from nature. Twisted, disturbing inspiration.

name: Courtly Provocateur
text: "My one regret is that I have mastered an art that leaves its audience unable to applaud."

name: Damnable Pact
text:
"Silumgar's mind is a dark labyrinth, full of grim secrets and subtle traps."
—Siara, the Dragon's Mouth

name: Hunter's Ambush
text: First you lose your enemy's trail. Then you lose all sense of direction. Then you hear the growls . . .

name: Mirari's Wake
text: Its passage through history is marked by warped desires and insatiable greed.

name: Chromatic Lantern
text: Used carefully, material that has been exposed to the baleful energies of the Warp can be contained to fuel powerful rituals.

name: Fact or Fiction
text: "Slimefoot, I know I said I wanted to grow our repository of knowledge, but this isn't what I had in mind."

name: Mold Folk
text:
"Corpses of those slain by russet mold grow new moldies. Not the legacy most of us aspire to."
—Elminster

name: Extinguish All Hope
text: Phenax offers the hope of life, while Pharika grants the solace of death. Between them stands Erebos, who promises nothing but eternity.

name: Evolving Wilds
text:
"We don't make mistakes, just happy little accidents."
—Bob Ross

name: Wizards of the _____
text: Magic is the name of the game.

name: Flux Channeler
text: "Inform our allies in the Tenth and throw the circuit. It's about to get weird."

name: Nissa's Renewal
text: Her connection to the plane restored, Nissa felt the power of Zendikar surge through her.

name: Rainbow Crow
text: Children claim no two feathers are exactly the same color, then eagerly gather them for proof.

name: Imposing Visage
text: With the horrible mask, Lagfrak the Low terrorized the countryside. But then he met Il-Chunt, the mask's model . . . .

name: Storm God's Oracle
text: The lives of Keranos's chosen are brief and brilliant as lightning.

name: Slayer's Cleaver
text:
"Don't stop chopping until the pieces stop wiggling."
—Rem Karolus, Slayer of Eldrazi

name: Screeching Phoenix
text: Its wings are a heavenly inferno that sets the world ablaze.

name: Undiscovered Paradise
text: Jolrael's choice of homes was far better than her choice of allies.

name: Gray Ogre
text: The Ogre philosopher Gnerdel believed the purpose of life was to live as high on the food chain as possible. She refused to eat vegetarians, and preferred to live entirely on creatures that preyed on sentient beings.

name: Akki Rockspeaker
text: The lava-proof shells of akki evolved over centuries, as akki pranks almost always got seriously out of hand.

name: Glacial Wall
text:
"There is no confusion as to the boundary of the archmage's territory."
—Ippin, master cartographer

name: Game Plan
text: Plan for victory, or prepare for defeat.

name: Drown in Ichor
text: Sinking into the Dross is neither a gentle death nor a quiet one. But once the necrogen takes hold, it is inevitable.

name: Ulvenwald Oddity // Ulvenwald Behemoth
text:
"Obviously it's dangerous, but I've never seen anything like it. This could be an entirely new species! I say we follow it."
—Halana, Kessig ranger

name: Geothermal Bog
text: There are still a few places where the natural dangers outweigh even those posed by Phyrexian sleeper agents.

name: Scroll of Avacyn
text: Words to bless the eye that reads them, telling of a future beyond the reach of fear.

name: Uncage the Menagerie
text: The destruction of Rhonas's monument released his collection upon the city.

name: Corrupted Harvester
text:
"Before the blessed assault begins, we must seek specimens that are well-adapted to our way of . . . life."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Goblin Spy
text:
"Isn't he on our side?"
"Yep."
"Why's he spyin' on us?"
"Don't ask."

name: Terrus Wurm
text:
"We follow it through its tunnels, and where it dies, we farm."
—Mihas, spore druid

name: Predator, Flagship
text:
"The scourge of Skyshroud is airborne once more."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Circle of the Moon Druid
text: Druids of the Circle of the Moon are fierce guardians of nature who haunt the deepest parts of the wilderness.

name: Kalonian Tusker
text:
"And all this time I thought *we* were tracking *it*."
—Juruk, Kalonian tracker

name: Deadeye Tormentor
text: Despite their noble heritage, the pirates of the Deadeye Fleet are known for underhanded tactics and despicable trickery.

name: Goblin Furrier
text: Clambering up and over the powdery slope, the goblin chanced upon a small furry thing. There they regarded each other: the goblin and his new pair of earmuffs.

name: Curfew
text: ". . . But I'm not tired!"

name: Nectar Faerie
text:
"The unpredictable fae are just as likely to provide a blight as a boon."
—Desmera, perfect of Wren's Run

name: Defend the Celestus
text: Witch, werewolf, and cathar stood shoulder to shoulder around the Sungold Lock at the center of the ritual, ready to stop Tovolar's assault—or die trying.

name: Metathran Soldier
text: Just as Serra crafted angels of light and faith, Urza constructed an army of sorcery and power to resist the coming invasion.

name: Festival of Trokin
text: Everyone loves a good sale.

name: Echo Storm
text: An organized and methodical reproduction.

name: Kiln Fiend
text: It traps an explosion within its stony skin.

name: Vampire Spawn
text: Unsuccessful vampire hunters often wind up as ravenous spawn.

name: Segovian Leviathan
text:
"Leviathan, too! Can you catch him with a fish-hook/ or run a line round his tongue?"
—*Job 40:25*

name: Elvish Archdruid
text: He knows the name of every elf born in the last four centuries. More importantly, they all know his.

name: Thran Lens
text:
"Every device in the rig is evidence of Thran enlightenment. All mana was the same to them, whether from rock or water, growth or decay. Can you imagine such unity of vision?"
—Urza, journal

name: Custodi Lich
text:
"Keeping order is a task too important to relinquish in death."
—Abrado, Custodi priest

name: Triton Cavalry
text: The tritons broke the surface, and the Nyxborn broke ranks.

name: Succumb to Temptation
text: "Restraint is for the meek."

name: Last-Minute Chopping
text: "Dear brother, I couldn't forget you if I tried, and I *have* tried."

name: Kami of the Hunt
text:
"Don't worry, Jiro. The kami would never attack us this close to home . . . . Jiro?"
—Hoto, temple guardian, last words

name: Razortooth Rats
text:
"Men and rats both hunger: we for our playthings; they, for us."
—Crovax

name: Cinder Barrens
text: A mudflow swallowed the lowlands years ago. All that remains are a bottomless mire and an endless rain of ash.

name: Surgespanner
text: They ride on waves of Æther, washing out anything that might pollute the Merrow Lanes.

name: Silver Bolt
text:
"When a werewolf charges, you'll only have time for one shot. Best make it count."
—Captain Eberheart

name: Acid Web Spider
text: Its web is an excellent source of found copper for the daring or the stupid.

name: Earth Elemental
text: Earth Elementals have the eternal strength of stone and the endurance of mountains. Primordially connected to the land they inhabit, they take a long-term view of things, scorning the impetuous haste of short-lived mortal creatures.

name: Join the Ranks
text: Expeditionary houses are notorious for their rivalries. But when adventurers meet in the wilderness, the instinct for mutual survival outweighs petty grudges.

name: Charging Rhino
text:
"Is it wrong to go straight for what you want? Sneaking is for cats and goblins."
—Tahngarth of the *Weatherlight*

name: High Tide
text:
"Close the walls! Retract the docks! The homarids are coming!"
—Benson, Argivian sentry

name: Joraga Visionary
text: "If you only follow where the paths lead, you merely go where others have gone before you."

name: Stronghold Discipline
text:
"Crovax never passes up an opportunity to cause widespread misery."
—Belbe

name: Arcane Melee
text: Debates between wizards are never purely academic.

name: Inspiring Vantage
text: Ghirapur is a beacon of inspiration, attracting the most brilliant minds on Kaladesh.

name: Solve the Equation
text:
"Whoever Tezzeret is working with is after more than the Emperor."
—Tamiyo

name: Kiora's Follower
text: "She may call herself Kiora but I believe she is Thassa, the embodiment of the sea and empress of the depths."

name: Qasali Slingers
text: All things will crumble, whether by time or by force.

name: Spinal Centipede
text: The Golgari adorn themselves with the exoskeletons of iridescent insects. It's only fair the insects do likewise.

name: Vedalken Mastermind
text: The vedalken see other beings from a cold distance, as either experimental subjects or objects of study.

name: Reckless Ogre
text: There is no such thing as a regiment of ogres.

name: Awesome Presence
text:
"I shape my weapons from the fears of my enemies."
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn

name: Potion of Healing
text: Magic can knit the body back together, but the courage to fight on comes only from within.

name: Promising Duskmage
text: "Your technique is sloppy, but there is talent there. Do it again, and keep your right arm in position this time."

name: Demonmail Hauberk
text: It comes off as easily as your own skin.

name: Hollow Dogs
text: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.

name: Survey the Wreckage
text: Goblins and architects seldom get along.

name: Crested Sunmare
text: Galloping past darkness and malaise, she simply says, "Neigh."

name: Compelling Deterrence
text: "So much for neighborly hospitality!"

name: Basri's Solidarity
text:
"The will to fight and act as one is not limited to a single world. Oketra's teachings are universal."
—Basri Ket

name: Luxurious Libation
text:
"Crisp, flavorful, and energizing. Perhaps the most elegant offering of Halo in Park Heights. Five stars."
—Conzuelo, restaurant critic

name: Wild Griffin
text: Farmers typically keep their flocks at thirteen sheep—one to distract the griffins while they take the other twelve to market.

name: Kindred Charge
text: For goblins, quantity is quality.

name: Manalith
text: Planeswalkers seek out great monuments throughout the Multiverse, knowing that their builders were unwittingly drawn by the convergence of mana in the area.

name: Armistice
text:
We all must profit for peace to last.
—Mercadian saying

name: Treasonous Ogre
text:
"Everything comes with a price. Especially revolution."
—Grenzo, dungeon warden

name: Anointer of Champions
text: "Arise. You have been anointed by the light. Go forth and fight without fear, for you shall be victorious."

name: Sapling of Colfenor
text: Her plans may yet bear fruit.

name: Sadistic Augermage
text: "Don't worry. I know the drill."

name: Bog Elemental
text:
"When the bog walks, the wise run."
—Erissa, bog witch

name: Shared Summons
text:
"In times of need, the forest creates its own protectors."
—Vivien Reid

name: Rest for the Weary
text: Zendikar is a brutal taskmaster, but sometimes it offers unexpected solace.

name: Fodder Tosser
text:
"In event of siege, load copiously with: hot oil, cannonballs, caltrops, rubble, old swords, mess-hall leftovers, chamber pots, broken chairs, salt, cousin Furt . . ."
—Trebuchet instructions

name: Epic Confrontation
text:
"You've let yourself grow old, and your light is dimming. Shall we talk one last time, or must I slay you now?"
—Mishra, to Urza

name: Graceful Adept
text:
"When you have mastered my lessons, it will seem as though the whole of the world has opened up to your mind and nothing is beyond your grasp."
—Lady Azami

name: Spectral Shield
text:
"What can be a stronger shield than concealment? Have you ever defeated an enemy you didn't know existed?"
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Bloodpyre Elemental
text: Elementals born of Jund are as cruel and unstable as the plane itself.

name: Elderfang Ritualist
text: Her fingers stiffened as the shrouded corpse stirred. Her final, ragged breath was one of triumph. "Return, my chosen, and grant our people victory!"

name: Koma's Faithful
text: "Great Serpent, hear my song! We wait, our faith unshaken, for your glorious return."

name: Volcanic Rambler
text: It moves through lava with the force of an erupting volcano.

name: Banners Raised
text: After the destruction of the Helvault, fearful mobs soon became fearless battalions.

name: Blood Glutton
text: "Some savor the hunt. I savor the kill."

name: Accomplished Alchemist
text: "Tincture of murkroot and lizard feet? Simple. One that doesn't taste like murkroot and lizard feet? I'm working on it."

name: Manifestation Sage
text: The first thing a Quandrix mage learns is the laws of metaphysics. The second thing is how to break them.

name: Numai Outcast
text:
"Beware the blade of dishonor. It kills more silently than war, more quickly than age."
—Sensei Golden-Tail

name: Greed
text:
"There is no calamity greater than lavish desires. There is no greater guilt than discontentment. And there is no greater disaster than greed."
—Lao Tsu, *Tao Te Ching*, (trans. Chan)

name: Exorcist
text: Though they often bore little greater charm than the demons they battled, exorcists were always welcome in Scarwood.

name: Compulsive Research
text:
"Every Planeswalker remembers the first time their mind touched the staggering vastness of the Multiverse."
—Kasmina

name: Forcemage Advocate
text: "Our unity renews our strength."

name: Quest for the Goblin Lord
text: A shrine to unchecked desire.

name: Invasion of Amonkhet // Lazotep Convert
text: As the lazotep covered his body, he heard Norn's voice fade from a deafening clarion to a distant whisper.

name: Elvish Eulogist
text: "No matter how adept our artistic skill, our effigies can never hope to capture the vibrant beauty of a living elf. Perhaps that is truly why we mourn."

name: Heartwood Giant
text: Wind in the trees is soothing, but the same can't be said for trees on the wind.

name: Jirina Kudro
text: "Strength is what keeps us alive. Compassion is what keeps us human."

name: Thalia, Guardian of Thraben
text: "Thraben is our home and I will not see it fall to this unhallowed horde."

name: Desecration Plague
text:
"The gods think of us as insects. Perhaps there is wisdom in that."
—Perisophia the philosopher

name: Knight of Stromgald
text:
"Kjeldorans should rule supreme, and to the rest, death!"
—Avram Garrisson, leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Dragon Fodder
text: Atarka goblins meet their demise as readily as their Temur counterparts did, but usually under big, winged shadows.

name: Bogardan Rager
text: In the erupting heart of Bogardan, it's hard to tell hurtling volcanic rocks from pouncing volcanic beasts.

name: Hive Stirrings
text: Sliver young are sorted into clutches according to their potential and their future role. Human scholars can only guess how those are determined.

name: Cloven Casting
text: "Let us flee to the deep jungle. Our city is no longer safe—and I suspect neither is the fallback retreat."

name: Groundskeeper
text: "While the church thinks in terms of legacies, others think in terms of eternities."

name: Swinging Ship
text:
"I feel just like Kari Zev! Ragavan, set a course for Lathnu!"
—Vorthos, Steward of Myth

name: Echoing Return
text: A single ambition unleashes a legion of horrors.

name: Primeval Force
text: It has germinated in the earth for thousands of years. Finally it wakes to the battle's call.

name: Rotted Hystrix
text: Vorinclex had no grand plan. The oil did its own work, evolving creatures into worthy predators.

name: Cleansing Wildfire
text: Every rebirth looks like a death.

name: Trophy Mage
text: "The tools of the past will help us forge the future."

name: Builder's Bane
text: There is only so much a person may be buried with.

name: Cleansing Screech
text: "Crackle" and "pop" are the most wondrous sounds.

name: Beacon of Unrest
text:
"Rise and serve me once more."
—Trazyn the Infinity

name: Eyeblight Assassin
text: "Boggart blood disgusts me almost as much as the foul creatures themselves."

name: Snapsail Glider
text: Built from a reconfigured thresher, it charges with light reflected off the golden plain, ready to take to the air in case of danger.

name: Mesmeric Sliver
text:
"Wait, where am I? Who am I? And what are you?"
—Skyshroud secretkeeper, last words

name: Watcher Sliver
text:
"I have spied them, wandering and watching—but for what? I fear they watch for us."
—Yonat of Amrou

name: Smite
text:
"You've got your childhood wish at last. Now you get to die."
—Gerrard, to Volrath

name: Sevinne, the Chronoclasm
text: "The best moments are worth reliving."

name: Heroic Defiance
text:
"Wear courage as your armor. Wield honor as your blade."
—Gerrard

name: Seize the Spoils
text: "Grab what you want and burn the rest. Leave nothing behind."

name: Faldorn, Dread Wolf Herald
text: "Cities are a blight on the beauty of nature."

name: Elven Ambush
text:
"No elf can match a Tuskeri in combat. Why not charge?"
—Knorjolvin, Tuskeri raider

name: Vedalken Entrancer
text: Their denial reaches far into your future.

name: Barbed Field
text: Wherever they went, the Keldons transformed the land into a weapon.

name: Diminish
text: Everything seems a little less ferocious when it's running from a house cat.

name: Bontu's Monument
text:
"The worthy shall strive for greatness. Supremacy in life leads to supremacy in the afterlife."
—Monument inscription

name: Ooze Garden
text: Jund has little necromancy. Instead, the flesh of its dead gives rise to algal fiends.

name: Xantid Swarm
text: When they land on you, all you can think about is tearing them off.

name: Jubilant Mascot
text: The competition is but one aspect of the spectacle.

name: Thorn Thallid
text:
"The cooling climate forced the Elves to experiment with new food sources."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. I*

name: Springsage Ritual
text:
"Every evil destroyed is a strike against the enemy."
—Erold, Gatstaf springsage

name: Gird for Battle
text:
"You won't need the sword drills, your shields, or my blessing. You'll fight for Sunhome with the truth in your heart."
—Aurelia

name: Varchild's War-Riders
text:
"What tries to crush our spirit only strengthens our resolve."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

name: Segovian Angel
text: When Worzel summoned Segovian angels to fight Thomil's Gargantikari gnats, the ensuing battle numbered among the Multiverse's least destructive.

name: Mystic Veil
text:
"Magic is my thread, my will the needle. I weave over you as if you never were."
—Poetics of Hanan

name: Morgue Toad
text:
"The toads of Urborg aren't fast, powerful, or pleasant, but they have their uses."
—Ertai

name: False Demise
text:
"Far too many of our missing 'dead' seem to be turning up in Varchild's ranks!"
—King Darien of Kjeldor

name: Razor Boomerang
text: Few can catch it without losing a finger.

name: Mortivore
text: The light sigh of its breath whistles through its bones.

name: Silkweaver Elite
text: Elvish weavers use spidersilk to make everything from tapestries to rappelling ropes.

name: Martyrdom
text:
"The only true immortality is in dying for a cause."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Kumano's Pupils
text:
"Long before he reluctantly joined the war, stories spread of Kumano's followers winning victories against the kami."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Gixian Infiltrator
text: "Terisia City's fall is inevitable. My master's plan runs as sure and steady as the oil in my veins."

name: Creeperhulk
text:
"I saw the devastation when the juggernauts crashed the walls of An Karras. Then I got to thinking."
—Janji, sylvan druid

name: Woodland Champion
text: "Every footfall on the forest floor is a heartbeat sending strength into my veins."

name: Assimilate Essence
text: "You have no viable escape vector. Cease your resistance and accept perfection."

name: Lancers en-Kor
text: Nearly all sets of Kor twins are trained as lancers.

name: Awaken the Ancient
text: Some days you stand to greet the horizon. Other days the horizon stands to greet you.

name: Lash of Malice
text:
"The strongest shadow spells come from disdain for someone else, not frustration with yourself."
—Embrose, Silverquill dean

name: Graveshifter
text: "Why throw away a perfectly good identity?"

name: Demonic Taskmaster
text: Subservience to greater power is the only law in the pit.

name: Fugitive Wizard
text: Many wizards came to the Riptide Project hoping to return home with answers. Most, however, wouldn't return home at all.

name: Hornet Sting
text: It was only then—to his infinite sorrow—that Gork realized hornets don't make honey.

name: Prey Upon
text: The Somberwald has become a hunting ground for the Dronepack, the group of werewolves that have succumbed to the flesh-twisting power of Emrakul.

name: Stealer of Secrets
text: The Dimir would hire her, if only they knew where she lived. The Azorius would condemn her, if only they knew her name.

name: Graxiplon
text:
"Attempts to revive this ancient species have not been entirely successful, but results indicate potential for future development."
—Riptide Project researcher

name: Unbender Tine
text: Creations made in madness may contain great power. The path to that power is as labyrinthine as the creator's mind.

name: Pouncing Jaguar
text: One pounce, she's hungry—you die quickly. Two, she's teaching her cubs—you're in for a long day.

name: Esper Charm
text:
"Thoughts are commodities. Someone will pay a good price for them. Even ones as simplistic as yours . . ."
—Ennor, mentalist

name: Cleansing Beam
text:
"Justice is toothless without punishment. Righteousness cannot succeed without the suffering of the guilty."
—Razia, Boros archangel

name: Alabaster Leech
text:
"Its stones seem to serve a healing function, but removing them intact is an exhausting process."
—Tolarian research notes

name: Bite Down
text:
"Yavimaya takes care of herself; the kavu are evidence of this. What does your Coalition offer that the forest cannot provide?"
—Jenson Carthalion

name: Vodalian Hypnotist
text: "Deceit is the heart of war."

name: Anaconda
text: You'll never find an anaconda in a swamp. It will always find you first.

name: Blightspeaker
text: One croaked sermon spreads propaganda and plague.

name: Krovikan Scoundrel
text: The few surviving humans of Krov would have welcomed the return of winter and its sterilizing cold. They often peered northward, hoping that the snow's edge had reached their infested city-tomb.

name: Untamed Might
text:
"Beasts kill for their very survival. If you would have their strength, you must know their desperation."
—Konnos, Sylvok sage

name: Drainpipe Vermin
text: When times are tough, the poor eat the rats. When times are tougher, the rats eat the poor.

name: Spawning Grounds
text: It's the only water source in miles of desert, but the local tribes avoid it at all costs.

name: Steel Sabotage
text:
"You are hopelessly obsolete, my brothers. Come and join the Great Work."
—Rhmir, Hand of the Augur

name: Temporal Adept
text:
"Of course she's at the head of her class. All of her classmates have disappeared."
—Tolarian renegade

name: Blisterstick Shaman
text: A productive warren requires a good deal of prodding.

name: Park Heights Pegasus
text: The burglar turned, bowed, and dropped from the ledge onto her waiting mount.

name: People of the Woods
text:
"Their rain of arrows left only myself alive, cowering within a tree hollow. They did not even come out to loot the bodies."
—Vervamon the Elder

name: Sea Gate Restoration // Sea Gate, Reborn
text:
"We carry on the legacy of those who defended our world by continuing to unearth its secrets."
—Tazri

name: Lost Order of Jarkeld
text:
"Let us remember brave Jarkeld and his troops, who perished in the Adarkar Wastes so long ago."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Mondronen Shaman // Tovolar's Magehunter
text: "Tovolar, my master. Gather the howlpack, for the Hunter's Moon is nigh and Thraben's walls grow weak."

name: Gather the Townsfolk
text: In the memories of those they lost lies the strength needed to defend their city.

name: Crash of Rhinos
text:
Love is like a rhino, short-sighted and hasty; if it cannot find a way, it will make a way.
—Femeref adage

name: Electrify
text: "Some hid from the storm. I embraced it and learned its name."

name: Tuvasa the Sunlit
text: "My people have always been here, and here we shall remain."

name: Goblin Sky Raider
text: The goblin word for "flying" is more accurately translated as "falling slowly."

name: Prowling Pangolin
text: "Wait, are *we* the decoys?"

name: Suppression Bonds
text:
"A master of hieromancy can see the advantage in any scenario."
—Warden Hixus, to Kytheon

name: Vitalizing Cascade
text:
"Water is like breathing—necessary for life."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Yellow Scarves General
text: Zhang Jue, leader of the Yellow Scarves rebellion, was a Taoist master and tutored his soldiers in those arts.

name: Totally Lost
text: At least this was better than that week at the Juri Revue.

name: Attended Socialite
text: "Say hello to my little friend."

name: Make an Example
text: As the Adversary's influence grew, the conflicts between families escalated.

name: Molder Beast
text:
"A trail of scrap metal can lead it into an ambush. But take care not to overfeed it."
—Adaran, Tangle hunter

name: Fat Ass
text: Our lawyers say no matter how funny it would be, we can't encourage players to eat the cards. Hear that? Whatever you do, *don't* eat the delicious cards.

name: Spined Wurm
text:
"I wouldn't stand in front of that wurm, son. 'Course, I wouldn't stand behind it neither. In fact, standing anywhere near that wurm's not much of a plan. Running, now *that's* a plan!"
—Wandering mage

name: Recollect
text: "The bones of the past will tell their tales—if you know how to speak their language."

name: Feral Abomination
text:
"If you manage to get to the heart of the bog, you'll find things there that make zombies seem downright lovable."
—Byaras, backwoods guide

name: Makeshift Battalion
text: Their ranks are thin, their formation is improvised, their weapons are borrowed, and you'd best get out of their way.

name: Narset, Enlightened Exile
text: They called her unique insight a "gift." Then she saw the truth, and suddenly it was a "threat."

name: Xira Arien
text: A regular guest at the Royal Masquerade, Arien is the envy of the Court. She appears in a new costume every hour.

name: Spread the Sickness
text: Life is ephemeral. Phyrexia is eternal.

name: Seething Song
text: Vulshok mana rituals echo the day when the red sun burst through Mirrodin's surface to take its place in the heavens.

name: Triton Shorethief
text:
At sunrise, the Champion and her companions awoke to find their supplies gone and Brygus, their sentry, dead. Carefully arranged piles of ornamental shells gave a clear warning: go no further.
—*The Theriad*

name: Eternal Witness
text: Gaea needs no book to record every act.

name: Green Sun's Zenith
text: As the green sun crowned, Phyrexian prophecies glowed on the Tree of Tales.

name: Shu Cavalry
text: In establishing the Shu kingdom, Liu Bei's forces fought against Ma Chao at Chengdu. Eventually, Ma Chao surrendered and became one of Liu Bei's Tiger Generals.

name: Dokuchi Shadow-Walker
text: Don't fear the blade, fear the shadows.

name: Oran-Rief Invoker
text:
"The world was not hostile to us—we were beneath its notice, and presented no danger."
—*The Invokers' Tales*

name: Liliana's Elite
text:
"You have to admit, Gideon—he has great form."
—Liliana Vess

name: Taiga
text: 2017 European Legacy Champion

name: Ripscale Predator
text: As Ravnica's wilds expanded, even advocates for nature had to confront fiercer natural threats.

name: Ironroot Warlord
text:
"Alone, it's a fortification. At the head of its troops, it's a battering ram."
—Skerk Hobnett, wilderness guide

name: Helm of Awakening
text:
"This little prize will cover your head, your spells, your bets, and your behind!"
—Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader

name: Winterflame
text:
"The mountains scream with the dragons' throats."
—Chianul, Who Whispers Twice

name: Predator's Strike
text: If you hear it coming, you're not its prey.

name: World-Bottling Kit
text: YOUR AD HERE

name: Swamp
text: The sudden sinkhole was surprising enough, but nothing could have prepared you for the ancient city that was hidden underneath.

name: Boomerang
text:
"Returne from whence ye came. . . ."
—Edmund Spenser, *The Faerie Queene*

name: Countersquall
text:
"The essence of every world, every spell, and every thought is power. Nothing else matters, because nothing else exists."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Endangered Armodon
text: These are its last days. It is doomed to be remembered only until the hunters hunger again.

name: Forsaken Monument
text:
"We shall forever roam."
—Ayli, high priest of the Eternal Pilgrims

name: Three Visits
text:
"Trying to meet a worthy man in the wrong way is as bad as closing the door on an invited guest."
—Mencius, a Chinese philosopher

name: Universal Solvent
text:
"A few drops of this, and the trickiest problems simply melt away."
—Thamaz, Weldfast inventor

name: Infuse with the Elements
text:
"Zendikar has given us the weapons to wage war on the appropriate scale."
—Najiya, leader of the Tajuru

name: Elven Cache
text: Elves know where to harvest the best of the forest, for they planted it there themselves.

name: Restock
text:
"We hid such stockpiles all over Rath. We should continue that practice here."
—Lin Sivvi

name: Backup Agent
text: "My sources say the Beamtown Bullies were spotted in the Mezzio. Keep your eyes sharp and stay close to me."

name: Horizon Canopy
text: The great leaves are resilient underfoot. Heavy steps do not bruise them, but release a sweet and spicy scent.

name: Unearth
text: No matter how deep you bury it, some evil refuses to stay dead.

name: Tragic Slip
text: She never would've guessed that her last word would be "Whoops!"

name: Samut, Vizier of Naktamun
text: "Try to keep up, Djeru. We have lots of work to do."

name: Disciple of Grace
text: Dread was as foreign to her as the landscape ahead.

name: Akoum Hellhound
text: Hellhound packs roam the Spikefields, basking in the harsh sunlight and lighting the night with their flames.

name: Leap of Faith
text: The finest maneuvers take place in three dimensions.

name: Jamuraan Lion
text:
The lion blinked
—Femeref expression meaning "situation avoided"

name: Stoneshaker Shaman
text: There is no place in Ravnica for stagnation, no room for lands unfilled and untilled.

name: Haazda Marshal
text: Ravnica's convoluted power structure often boils down to who can muster the most swords on a given block.

name: Timmy, Power Gamer
text: "Just wait till I get my Leviathan . . . ."

name: Sea's Claim
text:
"Who's the crazy one now!?"
—Torgle, mountaintop boatmaker

name: Skycloud Expanse
text: From Otaria, the sun above meets the sea below at a glittering horizon.

name: Grand Arbiter Augustin IV
text: The Arbiter is a conduit of justice, a will so disciplined that it dispenses justice without ego or remorse.

name: Rite of Oblivion
text: Revenge is a circle without end.

name: Rhythm of the Wild
text: Some view Domri's unlikely ascent as a sign of Ilharg the Raze-Boar's imminent return.

name: Fear
text:
"The horror! The horror!"
—Joseph Conrad, *Heart of Darkness*

name: Escaped Null
text: Left masterless by Kozilek, it wandered the wilds, raving in its ceaseless hunger.

name: Anticognition
text:
"I think not."
—Flekon the Mindcensor

name: Strangling Soot
text:
"What good is your blade without your breath?"
—Greht, Gathan warlord

name: Prey Upon
text:
"Light up the dark to find your way, and the dark may seek you out."
—Zalin the Gutter Bard

name: Metalworker
text:
"At this rate I fully expect to be replaced by a clockwork golem by year's end."
—Barrin

name: Kindle the Carnage
text: "Start knockin' heads, boys, and don't stop 'til the ragamuffyn sings!"

name: Faerie Trickery
text: The fae are so quick and their life spans so short that it's difficult to get retribution for their pranks.

name: Village Ironsmith // Ironfang
text: Each night, he abandons the trappings of civilization.

name: Compulsory Rest
text: The pain of death is nothing compared to the pain of failure.

name: Killer Whale
text: Hunger is like the sea: deep, endless, and unforgiving.

name: Spire Monitor
text: Each monitor is given an eye for each spire it is to guard.

name: Ophiomancer
text: Her writhing, boneless movements are unsettling to humans, but hypnotic to her serpent brood.

name: Vampire Outcasts
text: Some vampires reject the decadent trappings of their kind. Once they turn feral, no amount of blood will satisfy their hunger.

name: Rapacious Dragon
text:
"Surely it won't notice if I take—"
—Theria the Sly, last words

name: Tangle Golem
text: The longer it weaves through the twisted vines of the Tangle, the more it adopts their hidden strength.

name: Storm Caller
text: He became elder shaman when his predecessor was mysteriously struck by lightning on a cloudless day.

name: Wanderbrine Rootcutters
text: Most dirtwalkers only know of the vicious merrows that dwell in the shallows. They can't begin to fathom the wickedness that skulks in the Dark Meanders.

name: Isolation Cell
text:
"Attrition is the answer. Starve them, and let their despair be their undoing."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Elvish Mystic
text:
"Life grows everywhere. My kin merely find those places where it grows strongest."
—Nissa Revane

name: Steel Squirrel
text:
Q: Where does a mechanical squirrel hide its nuts?
A: In a bolt hole.

name: Powerstone Minefield
text:
"We have fought this far and lost too much. We will not turn back."
—Grizzlegom

name: Thran Golem
text: Karn felt more secure about his value to Urza when he realized he didn't need regular trimming.

name: Steelclaw Lance
text:
"A traditional lance is fine for the Burning Yard, but in the wilds you need a nastier bite."
—Kenver, Embereth weaponsmith

name: Cryptic Gateway
text: Its lock changes to fit each key.

name: Bonesplitter Sliver
text: As the time streams grew more and more unstable, Dominaria's creatures struggled to adapt. The intense pressures led to many dead ends but also to lethal new forms that appeared as suddenly as the ashen rains.

name: Spy Eye
text:
"That pigeon knows something, and we will find out what."
—X

name: Scatter the Seeds
text: From the seeds of faith, great forests grow.

name: Hinterland Hermit // Hinterland Scourge
text: . . . but the monster within was a tireless hunter.

name: Taoist Mystic
text: By appearing in places miles apart at the same time, Zuo Ci exhibited the mystic's ability to "shrink the land."

name: Argentum Armor
text: Mirrodin's creator still lives, still shapes metal, and still commands world-shaking power.

name: Mindbreak Trap
text:
"Life is a maze. This is one of its dead ends."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

name: Staggering Insight
text:
"Only cowards flee from the truth."
—Perisophia the philosopher

name: Garrison Cat
text: After much arguing, the soldiers decided to keep it, on the grounds that it killed enough mice to count as an honorary monster slayer.

name: Journey to Eternity // Atzal, Cave of Eternity
text: Every journey has its inevitable end . . .

name: Charging Rhino
text: The knights of Troinir Keep took the rhino as their emblem due to its intense focus when charging down a perceived threat—a trait they discovered on a hunting excursion.

name: Dimir Cluestone
text: It waits in the chill of the undercity, holding nameless secrets for those who dare to touch it.

name: Reborn Hope
text:
"In darkness is kindled the fiercest hope."
—Hadran, sunseeder of Naya

name: Firebreathing
text:
"And topples round the dreary west A looming bastion fringed with fire."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "In Memoriam"

name: Exemplar of Strength
text: "No one is born worthy."

name: Wurm's Tooth
text:
"The great wurm bit down on me. Instead of being crunched bloody, I slid into the space where its tooth was missing. One tooth—a boon most potent, indeed."
—*The Tall Tales of Oleander*

name: Arm with Aether
text: "Anything we can do to hurt the Phyrexian invaders is worth dying for."

name: Wei Infantry
text: Wei won the battle of Hefei when Zhang Liao defeated Sun Quan and then foiled a Wu scheme to incite rebellion.

name: Sinister Waltz
text: For one evening, the dueling bloodlines channeled their feuds into elaborate footwork.

name: Kitesail Apprentice
text: Carving lines through the sky, kite sailors map trails for the pilgrims below to follow.

name: Safe Passage
text: With one flap of her wings, the angel beat back the fires of war.

name: Resculpt
text: Critics were struck first by the elemental's surprising grace, and then by its fists.

name: Priority Boarding
text: The Astrotorium's express lane is practically its own ride.

name: Overgrowth
text:
"Let the forest spread! From salt, stone, and fen, let the new trees rise."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Mox Ruby
text: 2021 Vintage Champion

name: Hamlet Captain
text: "I would fear this fight, bloodsucker, were I alone."

name: Rubblebelt Boar
text: Some Gruul druids believe that boars are spawn of the great Ilharg, the mighty Raze-Boar who will one day rise and level the city.

name: Fault Line
text:
We live on the serpent's back.
—Viashino saying

name: Training Grounds
text: For those who survived, being prepared for the next crisis became one of the greatest virtues.

name: Greater Good
text:
"One day, an Autobot shall rise from our ranks and use the power of the Matrix to light our darkest hour. Until that day, till all are one."
—Optimus Prime

name: Organ Grinder
text: It knows what makes you tick. It knows how to make the ticking stop.

name: Clockwork Fox
text:
"It might just be my greatest invention yet: A lovable pet that *decreases* the need for chores!"
—Jan Jansen

name: Arrest
text:
"We will prove your guilt. We don't arrest the innocent, you know."
—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

name: Recollect
text:
"The bones of the past will tell their tales—if you know how to speak their language."
—Savra

name: Stormwild Capridor
text: After a disastrous day of battle, Lavabrink's lightning mages were recalled.

name: Prophetic Prism
text: "The explorer who found it got a bad deal when he sold it. He merely got rich."

name: Furycalm Snarl
text: A seething locus of reverent rage.

name: Touch of Invisibility
text: Cephalids specialize in things unseen, be they politics, betrayal, or themselves.

name: Staunch Defenders
text:
"Hold your position! Leave doubt for the dying!"
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

name: Hundroog
text:
"New links are being added to the food chain on a daily basis."
—Riptide Project researcher

name: Ezuri's Predation
text: "Those who do not submit will be consumed."

name: Crystal Golem
text:
"Once, a wealthy king commissioned an artificial creature to be crafted from the royal treasury, thinking it a clever ploy to have the jewels guard themselves."
—Azeworai, "The Golem's Wish"

name: Reflect Damage
text:
From you to me, so me to you.
—Femeref children's taunt

name: Spirit of the Hearth
text: Thieves know that a snarl in the night means, "Rob another house."

name: Stitch in Time // Stitch in Time
text:
"I believe the spell to have a 50% failure rate. I must be careful, lest I lose my sanity to the unbending force of pure, untempered time."
—Journal of Sigbar the Cautious

name: Flame Rift
text:
"You might want to step back."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Nylea's Colossus
text:
"Those who seek my protection receive it."
-Nylea, god of the hunt

name: Goblin Sleigh Ride
text: "What fun it is to ride and sing a slaying song tonight!"

name: Knight of the New Coalition
text: Raised in a long tradition of heroes, every Benalish knight knows the day might come when they will be called to face Phyrexia.

name: Flamekin Bladewhirl
text:
"The elves may try to confine us, but they will learn that our blazing spirit can never be suppressed."
—Vessifrus, flamekin demagogue

name: Leering Emblem
text: The banner was not a symbol of victory, but a herald of the carnage to come.

name: Drowner Initiate
text: Nothing satisfies a merrow as much as drowning what it cannot have.

name: Imperial Seal
text:
"Oh, for heaven's sake, of course it was a death threat! What did you think was in an envelope like that, a wedding invitation?"
—Magistrate's assistant

name: Obscura Storefront
text: In volatile times, a sense of certainty is in high demand.

name: Chub Toad
text:
Chub toad, chub toad At the door. Run away quick Or you'll run no more.
—Traditional children's rhyme

name: Death Wind
text: Leukin stared at the smoldering angel feathers. "Run!" he screamed to his patrol. "We don't stand a chance!"

name: Flame Spill
text: Fragile, floating Skysail suddenly seemed like an appealingly safe place to live.

name: Liliana's Contract
text: She sold her soul to four demons for powerful gifts.

name: Escape Velocity
text: "Not even death can catch me now!"

name: Ethersworn Adjudicator
text: Esper mages devised their weapons to be so devastating that war seemed unnecessary.

name: Wasteland Scorpion
text: All but the gods fear the scorpion's sting.

name: Buoyancy
text: Saprazzan merfolk become legged on land, but some find it quicker to bring the water with them.

name: Touch of Brilliance
text: Acting on one good idea is better than hoarding all the world's knowledge.

name: False Peace
text: Mutual consent is not required for war.

name: Boot Nipper
text:
"I have a number of hyper-specific phobias and this somehow hits all of them."
—Aaru, Zagoth lumberjack

name: Gibbering Barricade
text:
"Who needs stone walls when you can hide behind an impenetrable barrier of screaming nightmares?"
—Braids

name: Darkmoss Bridge
text: The path to power is forged in ruthlessness.

name: Undying Rage
text: Radha was born in Skyshroud, but her temper is undeniably Keldon.

name: Averna, the Chaos Bloom
text: "Nature is a dance. Master it, and the world can keep no secrets from you."

name: Gold Myr
text: The leonin thought of the myr as omens, never imagining the sinister fate they foretold.

name: Wave-Wing Elemental
text:
"Do you see? All of Tazeem strains at its tether."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem roilmage

name: Dead Revels
text: You're only as dead as you feel.

name: Patrician's Scorn
text: Lady Farisa's contempt of tawdry kitsch grew even more infamous after her death.

name: Lightning Stormkin
text: "I strike in the same place as many times as necessary."

name: Plague Rats
text:
"Should you a Rat to madness tease Why ev'n a Rat may plague you . . . ."
—Samuel Coleridge, "Recantation"

name: Juggletron
text: It's all fun and games until it drops a guest. Then it's a misdemeanor.

name: Angel's Mercy
text: Angels appear before both the blessed and the cursed, though most don't know which they are until they feel either the angel's kiss or her sword.

name: Bloom Tender
text: Beauty is a seed, waiting to blossom under her capable hands.

name: Radiant Purge
text: The Shifting Wastes are Dromoka's domain. She will not tolerate intruders.

name: Gryff Vanguard
text:
"Ghouls smashed the door, but I heard the call of the gryffs and knew we were saved."
—Ekka, shopkeeper of Hanweir

name: Cower in Fear
text:
"You will fully understand fear when you discover it is the final thing you put your faith in."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Act on Impulse
text: "You don't want to know what happens after I put on the goggles."

name: Go for Blood
text: Lukka's bond provided not only friendship, but also the most powerful weapon in his arsenal.

name: Fretwork Colony
text: The swarm leaves behind a flawless pattern that only occasionally threatens the structural integrity of the wood.

name: Unburden
text: Cabal initiates enter training full of hopes and fears. They graduate with neither.

name: Black Lotus
text: 2017 North American Vintage Champion

name: Drop Tower
text: "I can see the next star system from here!"

name: Experimental Overload
text: Explosions aren't necessarily failures, just a different kind of success.

name: Restock
text: What looked like a retreat was actually a replenishing.

name: Blood Frenzy
text:
"When Torahn bellows, none survive—not even the warrior whose horns he rides."
—Talruum adage

name: Spectral Sailor
text: "Permission to haunt aboard, cap'n?"

name: Act of Treason
text:
"The Sultai take our dead, so we shall take their living!"
—Taklai, Mardu ragesinger

name: Baral's Expertise
text: "Get out of my way."

name: Elven Fortress
text:
"The size of the obvious Fortress walls often misled foes. Actually, the Elves enchanted the forest itself to provide the first line of defense with tangling vines and stinging thorns."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*

name: Murk Strider
text: If you can see it, it's too late.

name: Seraph of Dawn
text: She parts the clouds so sunlight can reach even the darkest lairs and duskiest tombs.

name: Raptor Companion
text: The abundance of foes in Orazca means the raptors no longer need any orders.

name: Fertile Ground
text: The true strength of nature is not the raging storm or the charging rhino, but the inexorable vitality of life.

name: Rampant Growth
text: Rath forces plants from its surface as one presses whey from cheese.

name: Manticore of the Gauntlet
text: In the training ground known as the Gauntlet, initiates are pushed to practice more destructive techniques.

name: Llanowar Scout
text: Llanowar elfhames occupy different heights within the great forest. Elves of the Loridalh and Kelfae hames can see neither earth nor sky.

name: Back from the Brink
text: On Innistrad, death is just a career change.

name: Fan Favorite
text: "Pathetic! I've heard more noise in a monastery. Let me hear you, Valor's Reach!"

name: Night Market Lookout
text: The Consulate rarely cracks the coded announcement of a night market's location before dawn, and enforcers are taken care of if they wander too close.

name: Sun Clasp
text:
"Open when darkness threatens."
—Amulet inscription

name: Cliffhaven Vampire
text: "My people are no longer slaves to the Eldrazi, beholden to the past. We will determine our own future."

name: Altar of Dementia
text:
"It is not that you will go mad. It is that you will beg for madness."
—Volrath

name: Shadowblood Ridge
text: Gnolls make offerings to sinister forces in the shadow-drenched chasms.

name: Marsh Threader
text: "Give me a sturdy rope over the advice of any so-called expert. I can thread the dark wilds better than anyone."

name: Sandstone Warrior
text:
"I used to describe something stable as 'rock solid.' So much for that expression."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Zodiac Tiger
text: ". . . Three kings no more—Chenliu, Guiming, Anle. / The fiefs and posts must now be filled anew. . . ."

name: Crimson Kobolds
text: "Kobolds are harmless." —Bearand the Bold, epitaph

name: Alchemist's Greeting
text:
"Impressive."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Sell-Sword Brute
text: "Killing is easy. Just wrap your hand around the haft, and wrap your enemy around the blade."

name: Arcane Encyclopedia
text: A quill from the First Reader at Candlekeep, the spectacles of the Most Holy Servant of Gond, a woven bookmark from the Caleph Arcane of Calimport: readers always leave something of themselves behind.

name: Stitch in Time // Stitch in Time
text:
"According to the strange journal I found, the spell succeeds half the time. Why, if I cast it twice, that's a guaranteed success!"
—Rantings of Sigbar the Wild

name: Sphinx of New Prahv
text: Azorius sphinxes are loyal to the precepts of the law, not to any particular guildmaster—even one of their own kind.

name: Sunken Hope
text: While Dominarians fought for their world, Rath stole it from under their feet.

name: Scourge of Numai
text:
"Where a once-proud human city stood, only the ruins of Numai remain, deep amid rotting bamboo and plagued by oni."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Thalia, Heretic Cathar
text: "Salvation will not be granted by the Lunarch Council. It must be earned—at the edge of a sword, if necessary."

name: Loyal Gyrfalcon
text: It's tethered not to keep it from fleeing but to keep it from eating everything in sight.

name: Infernal Idol
text:
"The courier's death was regrettable, but then again, she was warned not to touch it."
—Lord Xander

name: Feldon of the Third Path
text: "She will come back to me."

name: Distant Melody
text: Even before Teferi heard Wrenn's call, a few Zhalfirins were roused from sleep by a strange, otherworldly song.

name: Fervent Denial
text: "I prefer a reality in which you are not."

name: Acorn Catapult
text: The Kalonian word for "ammunition" is the same as the word for "bait."

name: Mox Pearl
text: 2006 Vintage Championship Winner

name: Su-Chi
text: Flawed copies of relics from the Thran Empire, the Su-Chi were inherently unstable but provided useful knowledge for Tocasia's students.

name: Nut Collector
text: "I'll call you Reginald, and you're Mimi, and you're Tank, and you're Bobo..."

name: Guilty Conscience
text:
Those who most feel guilt don't need to, while those who most need to feel guilt never do.
—Order proverb

name: Stalwart Shield-Bearers
text:
"Hold fast the line! Either we stop them here or we wake up in their guts!"
—Tala Vertan, Makindi shieldmate

name: Plaguecrafter
text: "My power is generosity, in a way. I give my survivors an appreciation for their lives."

name: Drawn from Dreams
text:
"From a sea of infinite possibilities, our choices create the future."
—Mu Yanling

name: Shieldmate's Blessing
text:
"Even land dwellers may call for Emeria's grace in times of need."
—Emeria's Creed

name: Vindicate
text:
"Don't mourn for me. This is my destiny."
—Gerrard

name: Thrill of Possibility
text:
"Remember all the great heroes who were careful and never did anything risky? Me neither."
—Syr Carah, the Bold

name: Spark Mage
text: The Pardic Mountains are known for their spicy cuisine.

name: Transgress the Mind
text:
"Fear of the unknown can be a wonderfully innocent thing, relatively speaking."
—Anowon, the Ruin Sage

name: Sonorous Howlbonder
text: The call of the wild is rarely a solo.

name: Convicted Killer // Branded Howler
text: None are more dangerous than those who have already been sentenced to death.

name: Huatli's Snubhorn
text: Don't make the mistake of thinking blunt horns can't kill.

name: Leech Fanatic
text: "Everyone thinks that leeches maintain a strictly sanguivorous diet, but in fact, most freshwater leeches are carnivores. Wait, where are you going?"

name: Open into Wonder
text: The one thing the Gatewatch didn't expect to find on a plane ruled by Nicol Bolas was perfection.

name: Jester's Sombrero
text: "¡Yo quiero Kormus Bell!"

name: Prismite
text: It didn't budge when the portal opened, nor when the ancient gods emerged. It came to life only when all ten guilds came together to face a common threat.

name: Groundskeeper
text: Whereas the rebels fight to defend the land, they work to renew it.

name: Mystic of the Hidden Way
text: "There are no obstacles, only different paths."

name: Basilisk Gate
text: The eastern passage into the city is filled with reminders that the patriars are literally looking down on you.

name: Yew Spirit
text:
"I wonder what dwelled in the primordial forests before humans existed."
—Elder Rimheit

name: Pitchburn Devils
text: The ingenuity of goblins, the depravity of demons, and the smarts of sheep.

name: Slither Blade
text: Some naga initiates move as silently the suns' reflections on the water.

name: Seal Away
text: An ancient nemesis rendered harmless long ago.

name: Deserted Beach
text: Drownyard floods and unnatural frost made the once peaceful boardwalk deceptively treacherous.

name: Intruder Alarm
text: Mirri was startled by Volrath's apparition—it had no scent.

name: Knights of Thorn
text: "With a great cry, the Goblin host broke and ran as the first wave of Knights penetrated its ranks." —Tivadar of Thorn, *History of the Goblin Wars*

name: Journeyer's Kite
text:
"From the clouds, you can see as far as the distant horizon. It's a reminder of the infinite possibilities of everyday life."
—Noboru, master kitemaker

name: Cathodion
text: Instead of creating a tool that would be damaged by heat, the Thran built one that was charged by it.

name: Curse of Opulence
text: Jingling coins beckon many an eager hand.

name: In Bolas's Clutches
text:
"Your contract is in default. You belong to me now. Serve, or die."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Third Path Savant
text: As Mishra's army bore down on Terisia City, Corlo felt his focus, his patience, and his willpower twine together. With a deep breath, he plucked answers from the air.

name: Goblin Psychopath
text: He never wastes energy distinguishing between friend and foe.

name: Orcish Farmer
text: There is no natural disaster quite like orcish farming.

name: Coldsteel Heart
text: The Phyrexian death machine awoke, its coldsteel heart imbuing it with sinister new power.

name: Deep-Sea Serpent
text: Sailors fear the deep-sea serpent; others thank the gods it has no legs.

name: Lightning Visionary
text: "The gods don't speak to mortals with gentle entreaties. They speak with thunder and fury."

name: Demolish
text:
"For every inch of land they take from us, we take it back or we burn it. Give them nothing."
—Aurelia

name: Dream Pillager
text: Its wings shimmer with dreams absorbed from its enemies.

name: Wings of Hubris
text: Dalakos's invention worked . . . until it didn't.

name: Feast of the Victorious Dead
text: To hear them tell it, they charged bare-handed into New Phyrexia and beat up Elesh Norn all by themselves.

name: Rootwater Matriarch
text: In the harsh depths of Rootwater, the charms of surface dwellers are quite useless . . . except as lures.

name: Tumble Magnet
text: Magnetic devices that keep massive golems and structures standing can also be used for the opposite purpose.

name: Sunblade Elf
text: "We patrol the steppes to keep enemies from the forest verge."

name: Bloodcrazed Neonate
text: While elder vampires select their meals with care, the newly sired frenzy at the first whiff.

name: Lurking Evil
text:
"Ash is our air, darkness our flesh."
—*Phyrexian Scriptures*

name: Cephalid Facetaker
text: Few think to look past a familiar face and a friendly smile.

name: Long-Finned Skywhale
text: The aethersphere is home to the most wondrous beings on all of Kaladesh, although the dangers of traversing it mean that not much is known of them.

name: Slinking Giant
text: "I need a better hiding place."

name: Rootbound Crag
text: Cliffs echo and branches quake at the roar of life.

name: Ajani's Chosen
text: "United, our roar will level mountains."

name: Rotting Fensnake
text: Its venom sacs are long gone, but its crushing strength is somehow greater than ever.

name: Thrashing Mudspawn
text: It just obeys you. It doesn't *like* you.

name: Genesis Hydra
text: Designed by George Fan

name: Talara's Bane
text:
"Your thoughts betray you."
—Illulia of Nighthearth

name: Shardless Agent
text: "The left blade is a for a swift, painless death. The right blade for a long, lingering one. The choice is mine."

name: Timber Gorge
text: Near the Western Seas lies Mount Zhaoyao—a forest of stones that reaches the clouds, a bountiful land of wondrous treasures and strange animals.

name: Suntouched Myr
text: As the fifth sun joins the other four, new abilities awaken in the creatures of Mirrodin.

name: Lich's Caress
text: A lich must consume mortal souls to feed its eternal life.

name: Ramosian Revivalist
text: The Ramosian tradition is alive, but its namesake has long since been forgotten.

name: Staunch-Hearted Warrior
text: As soon as she faces a monster, she begins composing its epitaph.

name: Baithook Angler // Hook-Haunt Drifter
text: Geor was determined to stay out until he got a bite from something big.

name: Wall of Water
text: A deafening roar arose as the fury of an enormous vertical river supplanted our serenity. Eddies turned into whirling geysers, leveling everything in their path.

name: Talrand's Invocation
text: After Talrand conquered the depths of Shandalar, his ambitions drove him skyward, joined by servants whose drive and curiosity equaled his own.

name: Assassin's Trophy
text: A power vacuum for the Azorius. A keepsake for Vraska.

name: Quirion Sentinel
text: All elvenkind stood against Phyrexia. The Quirion nation deployed its most spiritual adepts, who wielded the power of their native soil.

name: Thought Vessel
text: Unlimited potential needs only a spark of ambition.

name: Fighting Drake
text: Scholars in their ivory towers call them "sharks of the sky." Scholars on the road don't call them at all.

name: Frantic Inventory
text: "Another village, another angry mob. Why do I even bother unpacking?"

name: Bond of Insight
text: "Together we can unlock secrets no one has even dreamed of. I might even let you remember some of them."

name: Silumgar Butcher
text: Silumgar takes pride in the diversity of his sibsig.

name: Inspiring Unicorn
text: There are two lives: the life you live before you see a unicorn, and the life you live after.

name: Doomwake Giant
text: Crippling fear precedes it. A foul stench accompanies it. Death follows in its wake.

name: Mirror-Shield Hoplite
text: In the shield's gleaming surface, the Phyrexian saw a reflection of what it once had been, and paused.

name: Fowl Play
text: "I feel like chicken tonight!"

name: Auriok Glaivemaster
text: "Give me a bit of steel and I'll deliver it into the hearts of my enemies."

name: Greataxe
text: "If you're so mighty, scaled one, then why are you dead?"

name: Arc Lightning
text: Lightning burns its own path.

name: Goatnap
text: "The steering horns ain't steering!"

name: Iroas's Blessing
text: The blessing is not the strength itself, but the knowledge of how to use it.

name: Grounded
text:
"We've tracked Ludevic's monster across four provinces. When it lands, make sure it stays put."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig, to Halana of Ulvenwald

name: Walking Corpse
text:
"Feeding a normal army is a problem of logistics. With zombies, it is an asset. Feeding is why they fight. Feeding is why they are feared."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

name: Skycloud Expanse
text: Most denizens of the Imperial hive city live and die without ever setting foot inside the towering skyscrapers of the ruling class.

name: Umbral Mantle
text: It harnesses the power of night in a land where daylight fears to show itself.

name: Titanic Bulvox
text: With natural laws abandoned, excess thrives.

name: Flowstone Charger
text: A mane of flowstone and a mien of fury.

name: Yavimaya, Cradle of Growth
text:
"Multani's heart is a seed, and all of Yavimaya is its flower. There is as much life here as in the rest of Dominaria together."
—Karn

name: Essence of the Wild
text: Wander too far into the wild and it may take you for its own.

name: Sea Serpent
text: Legend has it that Serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?

name: Ramosian Sky Marshal
text: The Cho-Arrim fell from the sky onto Mercadia City like a vengeful rain.

name: Ruin Crab
text: To an explorer, a priceless treasure. To the crab, a rock to call home.

name: Marrow Shards
text:
"We are a single entity. Dissenters must be sutured into the Orthodoxy."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

name: Swords to Plowshares
text:
"Hunger is no different from any other foe; defeat it in the Emperor's name, and save Humanity."
—Motto of the Argi-World Viridia IV

name: Giant Octopus
text: At the sight of the thing the calamari vendor's eyes went wide, but from fear or avarice none could tell.

name: Villagers of Estwald // Howlpack of Estwald
text: Estwald's citizens don't dislike outsiders—they taste just fine.

name: Ghostly Flicker
text: Sometimes it's useful to take a break from existence.

name: Myr Reservoir
text: A mana well as bottomless as the myr are tireless.

name: Animal Sanctuary
text:
"No owners allowed."
—Sanctuary sign

name: Duress
text: The Voldaren torture pits are so expansive that prisoners have a nasty tendency to be forgotten for years.

name: Knight of the Kitchen Sink
text: "Whew. For a minute, I thought I'd forgotten the melon baller."

name: Archangel
text:
"My mother once told me angels sing their swords' names with each strike."
—Sisay, Captain of the *Weatherlight*

name: Nim Abomination
text: It is one of the oldest nim, steeped so long in the Dross that it has lost all vestiges of humanity.

name: Rootless Yew
text:
"We are bound to wander this forest forever. Sometimes I think it wanders with us."
—Ogni, Kannah scout

name: Hypersonic Dragon
text:
"Even this primitive specimen of my kind is impressive."
—Niv-Mizzet

name: Backslide
text: Some things are better left unknown.

name: Splinter Twin
text: "I know just the person for that job."

name: Steadfast Paladin
text: "When I made my oath to Moradin, I left selfishness and cowardice behind. Every battle, I make that commitment anew."

name: Wall of Frost
text:
"I welcome it. The pasture is cleared of weeds and the wolves are frozen solid."
—Lumi, goatherd

name: Tunnel Ignus
text: Fight mischief with mischief.

name: Wring Flesh
text:
"You shouldn't be so attached to something as fragile as flesh."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

name: Spell Blast
text: Call it the thinking mage's version of brute force.

name: Talon Trooper
text: "The volcanic winds make a maze of the skies of Jund. If we mean to invade, we must first learn their invisible paths."

name: Claws of Wirewood
text: They say the forest has eyes. They never mention its claws.

name: Vapor Snag
text:
"This creature is inadequate. Send it to the splicers for innovation."
—Malcator, Executor of Synthesis

name: Rowan's Battleguard
text: "This sword is Sunrise. The other is Dawn. They mark the beginning of my days but the end of yours."

name: Repentance
text: "The cannon wasn't aimed at you!" pleaded Vhati. "I'm not sure which is more pathetic," replied Greven, "your judgment or your aim."

name: Seraph of the Sword
text: "Only when my sword lies idle shall I rejoice."

name: Sarinth Steelseeker
text: "This metal junk is ugly, but it's got its uses."

name: Blossoming Bogbeast
text:
As subtle as a bogbeast
—Witherbloom expression meaning
"crude and clumsy"

name: Furnace of Rath
text: The furnace awaits the next master who would stoke the fires of apocalypse.

name: Vow of Torment
text:
"Peace is a privilege you haven't earned."
—Tevesh Szat

name: Mother of Runes
text: "Each of them is my child, and no harm will befall them while I yet breathe."

name: Nath's Buffoon
text: Smik learned the elvish dance quickly enough. The most difficult, yet most important step was to stay out of Nath's sight until called to perform.

name: Jester's Cap
text:
"Know your foes' strengths as well as their weaknesses."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

name: Invasion of Lorwyn // Winnowing Forces
text: The Phyrexian appearance was so offensive that perfects and eyeblights worked together in unprecedented kinship to destroy them.

name: Overbeing of Myth
text:
"She walks among us unseen, learning from our imperfections."
—*The Seer's Parables*

name: Empowered Autogenerator
text: Magic, unlike physics, has no unbreakable laws.

name: Shrieking Affliction
text: A gargoyle's voice reaches pitches that will shatter glass and warp bone.

name: Desperate Charge
text: "Lieutenants dishonored, corpses carted home; The general raises troops again to take revenge."

name: Rivalry
text: The goblins revered it; the viashino defended it. Only Urza understood it.

name: Coiling Oracle
text: Snaking remnants of nature directed by a body of thought and progress, the oracles embody all that is Simic.

name: Time Out
text: Anyone other than a goblin would've gotten only a hand caught in the cookie jar.

name: Angel of the Dawn
text: She sings for all those who have been silenced.

name: Crypt Creeper
text: To unearth its dinner, it inters itself.

name: Sunbathing Rootwalla
text: A rootwalla's prey includes anything or anyone that wanders into view.

name: Epic Confrontation
text: No matter the timeline, some legends will endure.

name: Swiftfoot Boots
text:
"There is great wisdom in rushing headlong into combat . . . if you're prepared."
—Kenjek, captain of the Thousand Swords

name: Angel of Suffering
text: "If you wish for blessings, mortal, ask your demon masters. We've given enough to your kind."

name: Kulrath Knight
text: Mounted cinders circle the blasted peak at Kulrath, hunting the Extinguisher.

name: Duress
text: "Change your mind, or I'll change it for you."

name: Dark Remedy
text:
"Writhing tendrils of darkness stitched him back together. Though his will and body both were broken, the necromancer's magic would not let him rest."
—Krinnea, *Siege of the Bone Spire*

name: Fervent Champion
text: 2018 World Champion Javier Domínguez

name: Coiling Oracle
text:
"Nature was slowly heading in the right direction, but we know how to achieve faster results."
—Vorel of the Hull Clade

name: Idle Thoughts
text: Inspiration strikes the uncluttered mind.

name: Whisper of the Dross
text: "Live or die, you serve the Steel Thanes now."

name: Shatterskull Minotaur
text:
"We just pay him and point him at problems."
—Aro, Sea Gate adventurer

name: Portent of Betrayal
text: Mogis can fan a small flame of resentment into an inferno of madness.

name: Conjurer's Closet
text:
"Tomorrow wears yesterday's face."
—Kordel the Cryptic

name: Spellkeeper Weird
text: They worked well as a team, but they knew it couldn't last forever.

name: Order of the Stars
text: As stoic as the marble halls, as unblinking as the stars upon their shields.

name: Species Specialist
text: "I don't have anything against Snapdax. I'm just more of a dog person."

name: Hymn to Tourach
text: Knowing the hymn's power, the followers of Leitbur carefully guarded their pillaged transcriptions.

name: Coercion
text: "Human tenderness is simply weakness in a pretty package."

name: Boomerang
text: "O! call back yesterday, bid time return." —William Shakespeare, *King Richard the Second*

name: Scab-Clan Charger
text: "The only roads I wish to see are those beaten flat by wild hooves."

name: Sage's Row Savant
text: The streets of Ravnica are full of former guild members now using their institutional skills for personal gain.

name: Barren Moor
text: Millennia of constant warfare have left many planets with very little worth fighting over.

name: Urborg Justice
text:
"It is a narrow line between justice and vengeance."
—Crovax

name: Thran Golem
text: As a beaver's teeth grow unchecked without regular use, so does the golem's armor grow without regular battles.

name: Enchanted Evening
text:
Tempest ends and water stills
Gently reinventing the shape
Of all things.

name: Cho-Manno, Revolutionary
text:
"Mercadia's masks can no longer hide the truth. Our day has come at last."
—Cho-Manno

name: Voracious Vampire
text: The purest devotion isn't the Blood Fast itself, but the craving that follows.

name: Thought Courier
text: It is telling of the vedalkens' culture that they trust human couriers more than their own comrades.

name: Shu Grain Caravan
text: Keeping a million-man army fed was no easy task. Grain and rice caravans were the lifeblood of the empire.

name: Distorting Lens
text: The magistrate seems to prefer a distorted perspective of reality.

name: Soulscour
text:
