"I have seen the end of times, a future in which all our kind are torn from this world."
—Ushanti, leonin shaman

name: Drownyard Amalgam
text: When human corpses are in short supply, stitchers get creative.

name: Tormented Soul
text: Those who raged most bitterly at the world in life are cursed to roam the nether realms in death.

name: Nip Gwyllion
text: Once your life and all your worldly possessions have been surrendered to her, a gwyllion can be surprisingly civilized.

name: Young Red Dragon // Bathe in Gold
text: For most, deadly. For a dragon, decadent.

name: Serra Ascendant
text: Faith in Serra is its own reward.

name: Rotting Legion
text: Zombies have one speed: shamble.

name: Denizen of the Deep
text: According to merfolk legend, a denizen of the deep swallows the horizon at the end of each day, bringing on the cold blanket of night.

name: Krark-Clan Stoker
text: Fallen enemies are fed to the scavengers. Fallen friends are thrown into the Great Furnace, their souls returned to the Great Mother.

name: Rite of Flame
text: Deep beneath the ice, beneath the soil and the rock, Dominaria's fire still burned hot.

name: Nourish
text: Gelfruit grows abundantly wherever Sylvok druids live, as if the Tangle knows that humans are not as hardy as the beasts or as nimble as the elves.

name: Chimeric Staff
text: A snake in the grasp.

name: Devouring Hellion
text: There's no crisis a hellion can't make worse.

name: Citywide Bust
text:
"Oh, you fellas are going to love the lockup. Excellent gruel. Very low ceilings."
—Libuse, Boros sergeant

name: Cold-Water Snapper
text: For generations, the inhabitants of Orvada have hungered for turtle soup. For generations, the turtles have frustrated their ambitions.

name: Sweet Oblivion
text: When memory is torment, oblivion is bliss.

name: Hisoka's Defiance
text: "With every passing day, the kami shape our world to suit their will. I, for one, would not see them succeed."

name: Unquestioned Authority
text: After Gideon cleansed the Ninth District, none of the ganglords challenged the Boros.

name: Kavu Scout
text: The kavu evolved for centuries deep inside Dominaria, and some can draw from its strength.

name: Crag Saurian
text: It follows the strongest leader—the one with the longest whip.

name: Scarblade Elite
text: "Rejoice, eyeblight. In your last hours above the earth, those who bury you will finally make you beautiful."

name: Cumber Stone
text:
"The stone is more potent than ever. The flesh that creeps into our land will become even more slovenly and weak."
—Niclavs, archmage of Esper

name: Devastating Summons
text: Things born in magma are always angry.

name: Frontier Guide
text: "The elders say Zendikar has no safe, peaceful places. How would they know? They've never looked."

name: Cabal Stronghold
text: The seat of Belzenlok's power, the Stronghold serves as the gathering place for the Cabal as their dark influence spreads from Urborg.

name: Talisman of Curiosity
text:
"The pain of exploring is less than the pain of not knowing."
—Tamiyo

name: Mirror-Sigil Sergeant
text: "If I had many lives, I would give them all for Bant."

name: Vent Sentinel
text:
"Zendikar fortifies itself against the Great Threat, making sentries of sky, sea, and stone."
—*The War Diaries*

name: Hunting Grounds
text: In the heavy hush of Krosa, drawing on mana is like ringing a dinner bell.

name: Mistral Charger
text: Some sky steeds break from the thundering herd to ride free on the open winds.

name: Blood Aspirant
text: It's a small step from revel to bloodbath.

name: Relic Putrescence
text:
"Until we shed the curse of sentience, we must endure its grotesque handiwork."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Ruin Ghost
text: The Forsaken Ones haunt the ruins that flicker in and out of the spirit realm. Such sites are hard to find and even harder to loot.

name: Laccolith Grunt
text: They leave a trail of ash and sorrow.

name: Beacon of Destruction
text: The Great Furnace's blessing is a spectacular sight, but the best view comes at a high cost.

name: Rogue Kavu
text: "I know how this one feels," said Urza. "It's not like others of its kind and has been shunned for its differences."

name: Dregs of Sorrow
text: Crovax gazed on the dead, and for one dark moment he saw a banquet.

name: Dreadhound
text: It herds souls toward eternal torment.

name: Salvage Scout
text: "I'm not saying it's dangerous work. I'm just saying don't sign up if you have plans for your seventieth birthday."

name: Saffi Eriksdotter
text: In the blink of an eye, she strode from deep snow to dusty waste. From the crease of light behind her, a voice rang hollow: "Saffi, wait for me . . . ."

name: Myr Sire
text: For the Phyrexians, death is not an end, nor a one-time occurrence.

name: Seismic Wave
text: "Step carefully, Imperial. Even the earth rises against you."

name: Charging Troll
text: They stop for nothing, not even the end of a battle.

name: Satyr Hoplite
text: "Xenagos has become what he once despised: a tyrant and an oppressor."

name: Ritual of Steel
text:
"Our soldiers are blessed with lizard scales as hard and cold as steel."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Gelatinous Genesis
text: Even as the world was left cracked and gory by the marauding Eldrazi, new life began to drip from its wounds.

name: Talara's Battalion
text: The safewright Talara protects a delicate woodland waterfall. She has vowed to send wave after wave of warriors to slay any who would dare disturb its beauty.

name: Ragged Recluse // Odious Witch
text: Her cauldron refilled, she settled in to wait for the next unsuspecting traveler to knock at her door.

name: Shepherd of Rot
text:
"My priests swore loyalty to the Cabal not until death, but beyond it."
—Cabal Patriarch

name: Village Cannibals
text: Some have endured the horrors of Innistrad by becoming the worst monsters of all.

name: Akki Underling
text:
"I lost my hounds in the war and thus found myself employing akki as servants. I found their training to be remarkably similar."
—Kensuke, houndmaster

name: Mutavault
text: Some changelings born at Velis Vel never return, but their essence never leaves.

name: Aerial Maneuver
text:
"When you put all of yourself into an attack, without fear or hesitation, in that instant you may attain greatness."
—Predak, Gateless freemage

name: Vault of the Archangel
text:
"For centuries my creation kept this world in balance. Now only her shadow remains."
—Sorin Markov

name: Venomous Hierophant
text: "Many have sought snake-twined Pharika's panacea. Do you wish to share their fate?"

name: Grim Return
text: The necromancer's touch strips away memory and loyalty, and only strength and malice remain.

name: Nerf War
text:
"I'll tell you one thing—it's not nothin'!"
—Garj Grabclaw, goblin sergeant

name: Vine Gecko
text:
"It's cute now, but those things tend to get a lot bigger when you're not looking."
—Fahar, expedition wizard

name: Shadow Guildmage
text:
To keep the dead so others may live.
—Shadow Guild maxim

name: Sunscorched Desert
text: The only relief in sight is a mirage.

name: Gilded Drake
text: Buyer beware.

name: Wandering Champion
text: "Learn from your enemies, but do not tolerate them."

name: Armillary Sphere
text: The mysterious purpose of two of the rings had eluded Esper mages—until now.

name: Biogenic Upgrade
text:
"To survive exceptional times we must adapt by exceptional means."
—Vannifar

name: Leyline Immersion
text: When Nissa tapped into Zhalfir's leylines, she was shocked to feel not a piece of Dominaria, but a plane all its own.

name: Hall of Tagsin
text: The Thran's machines were not dead after all, merely dormant . . . and waiting.

name: Molten Sentry
text: Some take after their father, Stone, some after their mother, Fire.

name: Unhallowed Phalanx
text:
"In case any of you new recruits were wondering, this is why we don't use mass graves anymore."
—Kerren of the Mausoleum Guards

name: Looter il-Kor
text: Unable to touch items of value, he goes forth to steal secrets instead.

name: Deathgrip
text:
"Every forest is carpeted with the corpses of a thousand trees."
—Baron Sengir to Autumn Willow

name: Ghostfire
text: Only those gifted with the eye of Ugin, the spirit dragon, can see his fiery breath.

name: Leonin Armorguard
text: Well suited are the nacatl to a coat of steel and forge-tempered claws.

name: Pardic Arsonist
text: Otaria's epidemic of insanity didn't affect certain barbarians—but no one noticed.

name: Bull Rush
text: "It's gone mad! Loose the chains and save what you can!"

name: Psychic Drain
text:
"Gold can be reearned, goods restored. The moroii steal youth, more precious than either, and once gone, it's gone forever."
—Berta Suszat, civic healer

name: Frozen Shade
text: "There are some qualities—some incorporate things,/ That have a double life, which thus is made/ A type of twin entity which springs/ From matter and light, evinced in solid and shade." —Edgar Allan Poe, "Silence"

name: Natural Spring
text: The dying ask for water because they know it contains life.

name: Moment of Heroism
text: "My faith is stronger than fang, claw, or mindless hunger."

name: Hisoka, Minamo Sensei
text: "By all rights we should have perished in the Kami War. Our perseverence is a tribute to mortal ingenuity. And perhaps a few forgotten secrets found in the nick of time."

name: Cragganwick Cremator
text: Each night that his bowl fills, a village mourns.

name: Master Decoy
text:
"A skilled decoy can throw your enemies off your trail. A master decoy can survive to do it again."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Woodcutter's Grit
text: The magic used by Kessigers is known for its practical applications.

name: Predatory Sliver
text: No matter how much the slivers change, their collective might remains.

name: Boreal Shelf
text:
"Who will stay the Tyrant's hand, As ice and woe both grip our land? The helpless feel his frozen brand."
—*The Dynasty of Winter Kings*

name: Deadly Alliance
text: "He could handle any one of us, but he's no match for all of us!"

name: Tidal Surge
text: Four little goblins, trapped by the sea. One teased a serpent, and then there were three.

name: Qasali Ambusher
text: The surprise of a battle cry can be as deadly as a blade.

name: Elvish Lyrist
text:
"Make me thy lyre, even as the forest is:
What if my leaves are falling like its own!"
—Percy Bysshe Shelley,
"Ode to the West Wind"

name: Log Flume
text: "Keep your hands and feet inside me at all times and enjoy the glubbbbrbb! Glbbglubb! Glb!"

name: Kjeldoran War Cry
text: King Darien's breath crystallized and fell to the frozen battlefield, but its command carried true to all soldiers of New Argive.

name: Gravedigger
text: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

name: Specter's Wail
text: As he gritted his teeth to focus through the pain, Tahngarth glanced at Takara. She seemed completely unaffected.

name: Fevered Visions
text: The mind can only expand so far before it flies apart.

name: Mistform Mask
text: Trust, the fifth myth of reality: Every truth holds the seed of betrayal.

name: Mist Leopard
text:
"I can't claim to hunt all creatures. There are some things in the jungle that simply can't be hunted."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Ensnaring Bridge
text:
"I expected a fight, but I didn't expect it from the building itself."
—Gerrard

name: Ichthyomorphosis
text: Tycthis's military career was a flop.

name: Plundering Predator
text: You can gather a tidy fortune if you can avoid getting clobbered by falling treasure.

name: Blood Rites
text: In war, the best leaders are open to all tactics.

name: Orcish Paratroopers
text:
IOU one parashoot
—Urk, mogg fanatic

name: Font of Vigor
text: Drink deep, and be restored.

name: Pendelhaven
text:
"This is the forest primeval. The murmuring pines and the hemlocks . . . / Stand like Druids of old."
—Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, "Evangeline"

name: Hooded Kavu
text: The spread of its hood eclipses all hope.

name: Dreamcatcher
text:
"Be careful where your mind wanders. Even in the quietest moments, the kami are listening, and your thoughts give them shape."
—Lady Azami

name: Dauthi Jackal
text:
"All dauthi are jackals, regardless of breed."
—Lyna, soltari emissary

name: Spontaneous Artist
text: Graffiti of the "leaking spire" symbol is found wherever the renegades have been.

name: Hell's Caretaker
text: You might leave here, Chenndra, should another take your place . . . .

name: Arcanis the Omnipotent
text: He has journeyed where none have been before. Now he returns to ensure that none follow.

name: Talisman of Conviction
text:
"The sun banishes darkness every morning. I too will rise with such assuredness."
—Huatli

name: Think Twice
text: "Either I know just the spell I need, or I'm about to."

name: Creeping Mold
text: The deadliest force on Mirrodin isn't the largest organism—it's the smallest.

name: Bloodcurdling Scream
text:
"I have all the weapons my enemies have—and far deeper rage."
—Tojira, swamp queen

name: Wirewood Symbiote
text: It drinks fatigue.

name: Frozen Shade
text:
"There are some qualities—some incorporate things,
That have a double life, which thus is made
A type of that twin entity which springs
From matter and light, evinced in solid and shade."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "Silence"

name: Misery's Shadow
text: In the ruins of Kroog, only anguish thrived.

name: Armory of Iroas
text: From a distance the weapons look pristine, but in fact they are tarnished and dented, each as unique as the champion who carried it to battle.

name: March from the Tomb
text: They came from all walks of life, from every part of Zendikar, and they returned with one unifying cause.

name: Fatal Mutation
text:
"You wear that shell as a mask. Now it's your coffin."
—Cabal cleric

name: Terashi's Cry
text:
"The sun kami is terrible to behold. When its temper flares, best seek shade and pray for forgiveness."
—Sensei Golden-Tail

name: Siege-Gang Commander
text: "You with the red shirt! You're up next."

name: Akroan Mastiff
text: Even when many of the soldiers who guarded Akros were called away, its safety was never in doubt.

name: Centrifuge
text: The back of each ticket features a map to the lost and found.

name: Granite Gargoyle
text:
"While most overworlders fortunately don't realize this, Gargoyles can be most delicious, providing you have the appropriate tools to carve them."
—The Underworld Cookbook, by Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar

name: Screeching Griffin
text: They were master fishers, but their seas are now the streets and their catch, the goblins that run pell-mell from the screeching in the sky.

name: Authority of the Consuls
text: Citizens are free to do as they wish, within the confines of the Consulate's laws.

name: Spire Mangler
text: Its mandibles can leave a rider in the clouds astride a headless griffin.

name: Oona's Gatewarden
text: "So now you've seen Glen Elendra. Take a good look. It will be the last thing you'll ever see."

name: Marchesa's Emissary
text: "The Black Rose doesn't tolerate weeds."

name: Elvish Champion
text:
"For what are leaves but countless blades To fight a countless foe on high."
—Elvish hymn

name: Sentry of the Underworld
text: When Athreos gathers the newly dead to be ferried across the Five Rivers That Ring the World, he sends skeletal griffins to fetch those who stray.

name: Mystic Gate
text: The gate of every kithkin doun is a cunning trap, intended to spill visitors into an oubliette from which there is no escape.

name: Hierophant's Chalice
text: In the Rite of Redemption, nobles take the same vows as Elenda, the first vampire, and make the same eternal sacrifice.

name: Prismatic Omen
text: In times of portent, the land sculpts itself in accordance with the sigils burned on the sky.

name: Fortune Teller
text: TODAY'S FORTUNE: THE REST OF YOUR LIFE WILL BE FULL OF FUN AND HAPPINESS—ALL SIX HOURS OF IT.

name: Lavalanche
text: Alara's burning blood cannot be contained by mere earth and stone.

name: Fallaji Vanguard
text: "The Burnished Banner will show the Warlord that the Suwwardi Marches belong to the Fallaji!"

name: Breathstealer's Crypt
text:
"Far too many soldiers have died in their beds."
—Telim'Tor

name: Glimpse the Unthinkable
text:
"I am confident that if anyone actually penetrates our facades, even the most perceptive would still be fundamentally unprepared for the truth of House Dimir."
—Szadek

name: Festering Evil
text: Evil is never absent, only hidden.

name: Mascot Interception
text: Far from the trappings of royalty, Rowan and Will found inspiration from the most popular sport on campus, Mage Tower.

name: Bribe Taker
text: In New Capenna, it's survival of the richest.

name: Raugrin Triome
text: Raugrin meets the sea with jaws wide, its coast spiked with teeth of crystal and granite.

name: Azor's Gateway // Sanctum of the Sun
text: As soon as Jace laid eyes on the great sphinx's chamber, the shards of memory began sliding into place.

name: Honden of Seeing Winds
text: To the sorrow of all, its winds found sin in the hearts of those who once learned from its wisdom.

name: Disfigure
text: "Brave scar or unfortunate tale? It all depends on your pain threshold."

name: Run Amok
text: Keld faced an apocalypse to fulfill a dire prophecy. Now Keldons have nothing left to believe in except themselves.

name: Haunting Hymn
text: The hymn's melody has persisted since Tourach's time, but the words changed to invoke the phobias of each listener.

name: Divine Reckoning
text: Survival of the purest.

name: Territorial Maro
text: The Coalition was more than just treaties and alliances: it was the soul of a world rising up against the invading tide.

name: Boros Reckoner
text:
"Imagine a thunderstorm that's also a tactical genius. That's him."
—Dars Gostok, Firefist captain

name: Raking Canopy
text:
"Raven's Run has awoken, and ravens will no longer cry in its branches."
—Roon Ghastbark

name: Time of Heroes
text: No one spoke. There was no need. The threat of the Eldrazi presented a simple choice: lay down your weapons and die for nothing, or hold them fast and die for something.

name: Tricks of the Trade
text: "Pathetic. You might as well have protected your treasures with a paper box and some string."

name: Gruul Guildgate
text:
"Beyond this gate there are no citizens, only predators and prey."
—Domri Rade

name: Scragnoth
text: It possesses no intelligence, only counter-intelligence.

name: Embraal Gear-Smasher
text: "A well-made wrench is a versatile, indispensable tool."

name: Blitz Hellion
text: Alarans commemorated its appearances with new holidays bearing names like the Great Cataclysm and the Fall of Ilson Gate.

name: Brainstorm
text: The Changer of Ways often sends glimpses of possible futures to his most loyal acolytes, visions that would destroy lesser minds.

name: Bountiful Promenade
text: Servants tend to the garden meticulously, ensuring that Upper City residents aren't bothered by the messier parts of nature.

name: Deranged Outcast
text: Cast out by his village, he now takes grim offense at refugees who seek shelter in his forest.

name: Kiku's Shadow
text:
"Me? No, I'm not going to kill you. I won't even lay a finger on you. I promise."
—Kiku, Night's Flower

name: Perilous Forays
text:
"*This* is the place? This map has got to be wrong . . . ."
—Svania Trul, wayfinder novice, last words

name: Kopala, Warden of Waves
text: "I know these waters better than you know yourselves."

name: Enslaved Dwarf
text: Captive dwarves always regain their freedom, either through escape or through a desperate, fiery death.

name: Battle at the Bridge
text:
"This is bigger than you. All of you."
—Tezzeret

name: Tidespout Tyrant
text: He unmakes the world in his own image.

name: Fireblade Artist
text: "Let's find out what kind of audience you are. Festive? Fearless?"

name: Fall of the Gavel
text: "My ruling is final. Order is upheld. Justice is done."

name: Giant Strength
text:
"O! it is excellent / To have a giant's strength, but it is tyrannous / To use it like a giant."
—William Shakespeare,
*Measure for Measure*

name: Karplusan Wolverine
text:
"They're not easily trained. Fortunately, they already know how to kill."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

name: Sram's Expertise
text: "It's important to always have the right tool for the job. This one is for picking my teeth."

name: Thrash of Raptors
text: They glide through the undergrowth, drawn to sounds of disturbance. They attack in unison and all share in the kill. And then they move on.

name: Erratic Cyclops
text:
"The League accepts no responsibility for former members and the damage they may cause."
—Maree, Izzet chamberlain

name: Maraleaf Rider
text: They both hunger for battle.

name: Daru Warchief
text: His victories speak for him.

name: Crystal Quarry
text:
"How tragic that greed eclipses beauty."
—Seton, centaur druid

name: Moss Viper
text: Nylea watches over all the creatures of the forest except for the snakes. Blessed by Pharika, they can take care of themselves.

name: Grave Exchange
text:
"It's a cold, dark journey either way."
—Eruth of Lambholt

name: Water Elemental
text: Unpredictable as the sea itself, Water Elementals shift without warning from tranquility to tempest. Capricious and fickle, they flow restlessly from one shape to another, expressing their moods with their physical forms.

name: Rampant Growth
text: Lord Windgrace dedicated his life to restoring Urborg to its former glory.

name: Angelic Harold
text: The voice of an angel. And the face of an angel. And the legs of... you get the idea.

name: Phyrexian Obliterator
text: Take everything from them. Lives. Flesh. The very ground they walk on. Only then will your victory be compleat.

name: Bog Wraith
text: She died in this swamp, and so will you.

name: Dawning Angel
text:
"As the sun rose behind the Bone Spire, an angel appeared over the charnel fields, bringing a surge of new hope."
—Krinnea, *Siege of the Bone Spire*

name: Funnel-Web Recluse
text: It thrives on a steady diet of hastily disposed-of evidence.

name: Witty Roastmaster
text: If you're lucky, you'll walk out with just your ego singed.

name: Onakke Ogre
text: The ogres you know are nothing like the Onakke. Possessing both intellect and industry, they had brute strength without being brutish.

name: Akki Ember-Keeper
text: "Follow my lantern, little ones."

name: Demolish
text: Nothing of nature nor of mortals can stand forever.

name: Volcanic Dragon
text:
"That's no ordinary eruption!"
—Grazlash Stonehold, last words

name: _____ Balls of Fire
text: Employees were instructed to refer to meteor showers as "impromptu fireworks."

name: Order of the White Shield
text:
"Shall we turn away a worthy soul because his parents were peasants? I think not."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Imperial Ceratops
text:
"The music of blades against its silver armor merely inspires it to bellow more full-throated melodies."
—Huatli

name: Markov Waltzer
text: "I'll lead."

name: Savannah Lions
text: The traditional kings of the jungle command a healthy respect in other climates as well. Relying mainly on their stealth and speed, Savannah Lions can take a victim by surprise, even in the endless flat plains of their homeland.

name: Krenko, Tin Street Kingpin
text: "After the people flee, but before the enemy arrives—that's grabbin' time."

name: Semblance Anvil
text:
"The forges consumed all and still screamed for more."
—*The Antiquities War*

name: Angrath's Ambusher
text: Orcs have been enemies of the Legion of Dusk since it was formed, and the entire race has been declared anathema.

name: Thran Golem
text: Even after thousands of years, the wondrous creations of the Thran guarded the lost empire's secrets with single-minded devotion.

name: Ascendant Acolyte
text: "Limits exist solely to test the will."

name: Door to Nothingness
text:
"All memory of your existence will be wiped from reality. You will die, and no one will mourn."
—Memnarch

name: Ruinous Minotaur
text: Not every intelligent being is interested in treasure and lost knowledge . . . or even the basics of speech.

name: Preordain
text: In a Multiverse of endless possibilities, Aminatou decided to experience all of them.

name: Knight of the Kitchen Sink
text: "Whew. For a minute, I thought I'd forgotten the garlic press."

name: Sylvan Basilisk
text:
"We're not sure what one looks like, so to be safe, nobody look at anything until we're out of here."
—Parbold Drix, veteran explorer

name: Gomazoa
text: To explorers, "point man" is a polite way of saying "gomazoa fodder."

name: Blot Out
text: After the invasion, many wanted to leave a life of violence. But once you're a Reckoner, you die a Reckoner.

name: Two-Headed Giant of Foriys
text: None know if this Giant is the result of aberrant magics, Siamese twins, or a mentalist's schizophrenia.

name: Gearseeker Serpent
text: Its collection is vast, yet each ship has a special place in its heart.

name: Arcanis the Omnipotent
text: "Do not concern yourself with my origin, my race, or my ancestry. Seek my record in the pits, and then make your wager."

name: Deadbridge Shaman
text: Ending her life won't end the infestation.

name: Fling
text: About halfway to the target, Snukk vowed that he had been tricked for the last time.

name: Flurry of Horns
text: A minotaur does not distinguish between human, satyr, and triton. They are all meat.

name: Nemesis Phoenix
text: A flame as bright and merciless as the sun.

name: Tidal Wave
text:
"The floor of the sea is paved with the shattered remnants of vessels that navigated its surface unwelcomed."
—Thassa, god of the sea

name: Juggernaut
text: The goblins built it far larger than the cave opening, but to their glee, it smashed into the mountainside, ripping itself a new exit.

name: Marrow-Gnawer
text: Marrow-Gnawer united three nezumi gangs when he slew their leaders in a single night. Now they call him their first lord.

name: Reflecting Pool
text: Does it reflect the future that once was or the past that can never be?

name: Gallia of the Endless Dance
text: "There's no success like excess!"

name: Kraul Stinger
text: He listens to the sounds of battle filtering down from above, waiting for silence, waiting for his time to claim the streets.

name: Erg Raiders
text: Their skills are extensive, and their appetite for battle just as vast.

name: Alpha Kavu
text: Kavu leaders instinctively protect their herds from harm.

name: Renegade Map
text: "We have safe houses in every zone, but you'll never find one without this."

name: Ollenbock Escort
text: "Stay in the light. I don't know what lurks in those shadows, and I'd like to keep it that way."

name: Mana Echoes
text: When the ground is saturated with mana, even the lightest footstep can bring it to the surface.

name: Beyeen Veil // Beyeen Coast
text:
"All you minnows in the murk, come to my light."
—Jejenar, Silundi lullmage

name: Ambuscade
text: "Spent a lifetime learning from predators. Picked up a few tricks."

name: Golgari Cluestone
text: Golgari mold collects whispers, intelligence that is later harvested by Jarad and his high chancellors.

name: Reshape
text:
"Today's paperweight, tomorrow's leveler."
—Bruenna, Neurok leader

name: Eiganjo Exemplar
text: Imperial samurai undergo strict training, honing their skills and purifying their spirits in the hope that they will prove worthy of a kami's blessing.

name: Seismic Assault
text:
"In a war for survival, Dominaria itself became a weapon. The malice is gone, but the danger remains."
—Jhoira

name: Creakwood Ghoul
text: Some eat the living. Some eat the dead. It eats the past.

name: Sengir Bats
text:
"They are the eyes of the Baron, and they know your fears."
—Ihsan's Shade

name: Arcane Signet
text: Countless xenos cults dwell unseen within the Imperium, lurking just beneath the surface.

name: Cut a Deal
text:
"Abandon your selfish ambitions and become one with the Flesh Singularity."
—Elesh Norn

name: Revitalize
text: Esika alone knows how to distill the essence of the World Tree into the Cosmos Elixir, a magical substance which grants the Skoti god-family immortality.

name: Vivisection
text: Phyrexians research with the grace of surgeons and the finesse of butchers.

name: Electrostatic Infantry
text:
"That's not exactly what I had in mind when I said 'charge,' but I like your enthusiasm!"
—Balmor, battlemage captain

name: Unnatural Restoration
text: "If you don't reassemble me immediately, the Mother of Machines will notice my absence, and this entire layer will face her wrath!"

name: Voltaic Key
text: The missing piece to every puzzle.

name: Nature's Lore
text:
"Every seed planted is another lesson the forest can teach us."
—Arathel, elvish queen

name: Cryptolith Fragment // Aurora of Emrakul
text:
"I felt compelled to take the twisted stone, and I abandoned my horse's burden to accommodate its weight. Now, its continued glow illuminates my home and warms my mind."
—Garner Kroft, Moorland farmer

name: Serum Visions
text: Future, past, and present become one in the blink of an eye.

name: Bull Cerodon
text: It holds motionless vigil, watching Naya in silence through the screen of the whitecover. When it senses anything amiss, it launches forward with the uncanny sound of torn fog.

name: Goblin Mountaineer
text: Goblin mountaineer, barely keeps his family fed.

name: Dinosaur Hunter
text: "Aye, the foul beast chomped me, but I got away. You'd best believe when I find it again, it won't get away so easy."

name: Dispense Justice
text: The Accorders never strike first, but they always strike back.

name: Flame Sweep
text:
"I have calculated that a dragon in flight, in a single strafing run, can cover an area of—"
—Thaedus the Clever, last words

name: Lens of Clarity
text:
"Water shifts and confuses, but as ice it holds the stillness of truth."
—Arel the Whisperer

name: Stoic Ephemera
text: "Life is fleeting, and so is death. Only the oath is eternal."

name: Crumble
text:
"Ashes and dust; dust and ashes. Hope it works before it smashes."
—Argivian children's rhyme

name: Inferno Fist
text: "I've never been above throwing the first punch."

name: Commander's Sphere
text: "The fate of one is shared by all."

name: Squeaking Pie Sneak
text:
"Why do our pies squeak? It's all the faeries, mice, and prickly-hogs we stuff inside."
—Borb of the Squeaking Pie warren

name: Scroll of Griselbrand
text: Words no eyes should see, telling of things no sane mind could fathom.

name: Safeguard
text:
"I'm amused by wasted effort when it's not my own."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

name: Steelclad Serpent
text:
"From the highest towers to the deepest sea, all life must be touched by etherium."
—Lodus of the Ethersworn

name: Spur Grappler
text: Grapplers hunt in packs, driving their victims over steep mountain cliffs.

name: Staff of the Letter Magus
text: A symbol of _________ in _________ times.

name: Serpent Warrior
text: A hiss before dying.

name: Channel the Suns
text: To some the birth of the fifth sun was a sign of doom. To others it was a sign of salvation. But to all it was a sign.

name: Kami of Whispered Hopes
text: Nashi knelt reverently before the kami and envisioned his family reunited.

name: Reprisal
text:
"A tiny flame is enough to dispel the night."
—Elspeth

name: Deal Damage
text: Until he got singed . . .

name: Repel the Vile
text:
"You are a guest in this realm, and you've overstayed your welcome."
—Yui, Imperial intercessor

name: Slave of Bolas
text: Nicol Bolas doesn't distinguish between servants and victims.

name: Impulse
text:
"Controlling time ensures you need never look impulsive again."
—Teferi

name: Belligerent Brontodon
text: Predators try to separate the young, old, or injured from the rest of the herd. The alternative is crushing defeat.

name: Lightning Runner
text: "Catch me if you can."

name: Prized Unicorn
text:
"The desire for its magic horn inspires such bloodthirsty greed that all who see the unicorn will kill to possess it."
—Dionus, elvish archdruid

name: Shock
text:
"The beauty of it is they never see it coming. Ever."
—Razzix, sparkmage

name: Hell-Bent Raider
text: He doesn't slow until his spear is weighted with corpses.

name: Early Frost
text: Under its mists, the earth sleeps.

name: Bonds of Mortality
text: Jace discovered the leyline pattern needed to anchor Ulamog and Kozilek to reality, but it was Nissa who could trace it on her world.

name: Heidar, Rimewind Master
text: "The umber stain of the Thaw will be bleached away. Once again the world will be sharp, white, perfect!"

name: Gravedigger
text: In Amonkhet's ever-shifting sands, nothing stays buried for long.

name: Ensnaring Bridge
text:
"Why build a bridge that needs to be guarded?"
—Elvish champion

name: Feral Incarnation
text: Nature is itself wild—in all its forms.

name: Oxidda Golem
text: The longer it patrols the smoldering crags of the Oxidda Chain, the more it adopts their fiery temper.

name: Professor of Symbology
text: "A language isn't dead until we stop learning from it."

name: Sphere of Law
text: Law smothers anarchy.

name: Bog Smugglers
text: They slide over the bog like oil across glass.

name: Manalith
text: Planeswalkers seek out great monuments throughout the Multiverse, knowing that their builders were unknowingly drawn by the convergence of mana in the area.

name: Ashnod's Battle Gear
text: This horrid invention clearly illustrates why Mishra's lieutenant was feared as much by her troops as by her foes.

name: Line Cutter
text: Waiting is for chumps with flimsy spacesuits.

name: Umezawa's Charm
text: "Be ever loyal to your own best interests."

name: Invoke the Winds
text:
"Are you seriously telling me your heavy combat mech . . . blew away?"
—Risona, leader of the Asari Uprisers

name: Nymris, Oona's Trickster
text: Mischief is its own reward.

name: Second Wind
text: Vindr stormchasers believe that the same ancient forces that move the winds can also move mortal minds and hearts.

name: Whisperer of the Wilds
text: She speaks only in whispers but can be heard over the fiercest storm.

name: Orzhov Enforcer
text: "You'll pay what you owe, with your money or your life."

name: Izzet Guildgate
text: Enter those with the vision to create and the daring to release their creations.

name: Notorious Assassin
text: He wears his infamy like a fine silk shirt.

name: Omen of Fire
text:
"Let Balduvia burn to warm Kjeldor's hearth!"
—General Varchild

name: Sinister Possession
text:
"You caught something on a cold night's stroll? No, I'd say something caught you."
—Mezim Magrah, civic healer

name: Gnottvold Recluse
text: Fed up with webs impeding travelers in other realms, Kolvori banished the giant spiders to Gnottvold, where their webs snare only the occasional rampaging troll.

name: Glyph of Life
text: Any wall can be battered down, but at what cost?

name: Surrak and Goreclaw
text: Two titans of Tarkir carved a swath through Phyrexia's elite.

name: Shu Defender
text: Confronting Cao Cao's army at Steepslope Bridge, Zhang Fei bellowed, "I am Zhang Fei of Yan! Who dares fight me to the death?" Cao Cao's army cowered and fled.

name: Viridian Acolyte
text: "We have no sun to guide our dead, so I tend the prismatic flames of the spirit fires that show the souls their way. When I die, I hope there is one left to guide my spirit home."

name: Kyren Sniper
text: Kyren goblins always act behind the scenes—even in battle.

name: Disciplined Duelist
text: Brokers agents defend their charges by all means available, from intricate logic to blunt force trauma.

name: Weaver of Currents
text: "Your waters sustain the living and carry the dead. Mighty Luxa, let your power flow through me!"

name: Genesis
text: Not dryad, centaur, or avatar but life itself.

name: Luminescent Rain
text: Storms in Lorwyn don't patter on village rooftops, but rather drench the clachan in rays of amber light.

name: Serra Zealot
text:
"The humans are useful in their way, but they must be commanded as the builder commands the stone. Be soft with them, and they will become soft."
—Radiant, archangel

name: Crested Sunmare
text:
"It is evidence that some pure corner of the world must still exist."
—Djeru, former Tah-crop initiate

name: Glimpse the Future
text:
"No simple coin toss can solve this riddle. You must think and choose wisely."
—Shai Fusan, archmage

name: Welder Automaton
text: Most of the constructs the renegades used against the Consulate weren't originally intended for combat. But some didn't require much modification.

name: Stonehorn Dignitary
text: It did not escape the ambassador's notice that the sound of war drums could also marshal the city to attention.

name: Bird Maiden
text:
"Four things that never meet do here unite
To shed my blood and to ravage my heart,
A radiant brow and tresses that beguile
And rosy cheeks and a glittering smile."
—The Arabian Nights, trans. Haddawy

name: Neurok Spy
text: From the murk of Mephidross to the heart of Kuldotha, the vedalken send their servants forth to gather knowledge from every inch of Mirrodin.

name: Raka Disciple
text: "The strong can also be subtle."

name: Cancel
text: "I decide what stands in my way."

name: Pearl Shard
text: Leonin folktales claim it was brought from beyond the sky by the first kha.

name: Colossal Might
text:
"Never corner a barbarian. You become the path of least resistance."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Smothering Tithe
text:
"Oh, how I love gold. I'd eat and breathe it if I could."
—Leland, tax collector

name: Spincrusher
text: It rolls with the punches.

name: Mukotai Ambusher
text: The Mukotai Reckoners specialize in stealth and subterfuge.

name: Twin Bolt
text: Kolaghan archers are trained in Dakla, the way of the bow. They utilize their dragonlord's lightning to strike their target, no matter how small, how fast, or how far away.

name: Dragonscale Boon
text:
"When we were lost and weary, the ainok showed us how to survive. They have earned the right to call themselves Abzan, and to wear the Scale."
—Anafenza, khan of the Abzan

name: Feral Animist
text: "Channeling the rage of the beast is the easy part. Explaining why you woke up with no memory in a pile of mangled lawmages—that's trickier."

name: Tolarian Drake
text: Many have been lost just in staring at its wings. What's seen differs from account to account, but madness is always part of the story.

name: Zada, Hedron Grinder
text: To her delight, she was able to fully realize the explosive magical potential of hedrons.

name: Sly Spy
text: The Agents of S.N.E.A.K.—Spies Nimbly Eluding Adversaries' Knives.

name: Keening Stone
text: As it spins, dead voices shriek in an ever-increasing cacophony, rending the mind asunder.

name: Marang River Skeleton
text: The gurgling of the Marang conceals both footsteps and screams.

name: Shelkin Brownie
text: Leave a bowl of milk on your doorstep each night for the brownies, or they'll cause you no end of mischief.

name: Wasp Lancer
text:
"I doubt that faeries understand how short their lives are, compared to the rest of us. If they did, would they so readily charge into battle, heedless of the danger before them?"
—Awylla, elvish safewright

name: Markov Warlord
text: "What use is a stake or holy symbol in the hands of a coward?"

name: Goblin Tunneler
text:
"You never know what's going to be in goblin tunnels. Even in the best case, there will still be goblins."
—Sachir, Akoum Expeditionary House

name: Hordeling Outburst
text: Kolaghan goblins rush into battle to satisfy their desire for violence as well as their desire not to be eaten.

name: Snorting Gahr
text: There's little advantage to surprising the gahr.

name: Vodalian Hexcatcher
text: "You're just one more pollutant to be removed from the sea."

name: Timber Gorge
text: Tazeem's embrace is harsh, but for those that call it home, nothing else will do.

name: Uthden Troll
text: "Oi oi oi, me gotta hurt in 'ere Oi oi oi, me smell a ting is near, Gonna bosh 'n gonna nosh 'n da hurt'll disappear." —Traditional

name: Web of Inertia
text: Cephalids specialize in lose-lose situations.

name: Sign in Blood
text: Little agonies pave the way to greater power.

name: Glory Seeker
text: The turning of the tide always begins with one soldier's decision to head back into the fray.

name: Leonin of the Lost Pride
text: Leonin band together in the Underworld, taking solace in their strength until, at last, both pride and self are forgotten.

name: Spectacle Mage
text: "It would be a crime to withhold my light from the world."

name: Carnivorous Moss-Beast
text: Ranger wisdom dictates that when fleeing from a moss-beast, you must stay calm, find your bearings, and run south.

name: Dawn Elemental
text: It was midnight on the Daru Plains, yet it seemed the sun was rising.

name: Riding the Dilu Horse
text:
"All men have their appointed time; that's something no horse can change."
—Liu Bei, after being told that the Dilu brings its master ill fortune

name: Mind Rot
text:
"The Ojutai are my favorite victims. They have so much knowledge to lose."
—Asmala, Silumgar sorcerer

name: Narcomoeba
text: It was created by the Iquati as a living memory—one that objects to being forgotten.

name: Bloodrite Invoker
text:
"The brood lineages unfolded across the world, each patterned after one of three progenitors, each a study in mindless consumption."
—*The Invokers' Tales*

name: Practical Research
text: The twins each researched spells to defeat Extus in their own way. Will hit the library. Rowan hit everything else.

name: District Guide
text: "The route is direct but challenging. Incidentally, how are you with heights?"

name: Vile Rebirth
text:
"'Here lies our beloved Gartu, the gentlest of all men.' Ooh, I love irony."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

name: Goblin Swine-Rider
text:
"May you get the mount you deserve."
—Suq'Ata curse

name: Smother
text:
"I can't hear them scream, but at least I don't have to listen to them beg."
—Phage the Untouchable

name: Steal Strength
text: With each grunt of pain from Haddad, Greel's grin widened.

name: Weave Fate
text: Destiny is a flickering path among tangled possibilities.

name: Ghitu Journeymage
text: The Ghitu of Shiv are as fierce and uncompromising as their volcanic home.

name: Tymora's Invoker
text: "May Lady Luck smile upon you some other day, pal."

name: Wind Spirit
text:
"To visit the sky requires bravery, and thought, and little else. To master the sky requires the binding of *its* masters, and little else."
—Arnjlot Olasson, Sky Mage

name: Take Flight
text: Though neither brother cared to admit it, flying the ancient thopter was their last happy moment together.

name: Vizkopa Vampire
text: Orzhov vampires look for allies in unlikely places in case their new guildmaster turns on them. The fate of the Obzedat is proof of Kaya's power and her hatred of the living dead.

name: Transluminant
text: "Forget yourself. Forget your city. Forget your homes, your families, the debts and obligations that hold you to this world."

name: Cathar Commando
text: "Honorable tactics are for honorable foes. These werewolves are preying on innocent travelers. I'll stab them in the back while they sleep if I have to."

name: Weather the Storm
text: "Quell your ego and anywhere can be as calm as a hurricane's eye."

name: Radiating Lightning
text: As the Cabal legions pushed into Shiv, they learned not to stand so close together.

name: Plated Seastrider
text: The Neurok buried entangling cables just under the Quicksilver Sea. One seastrider harvest can provide an army's worth of armor and shields.

name: Righteousness
text: Sometimes the greatest strength is the strength of conviction.

name: Dead Weight
text:
"Dungeons and cages offer far too little sport."
—Relio Voldaren

name: Jace's Sentinel
text: "We drove the Sun Empire out of the forest long ago, and we will not let them return."

name: Crypt Rats
text:
Beware anything born among the dead.
—Tolarian saving

name: Triumphant Reckoning
text: "We have defied fate. Our destinies are our own."

name: Giant Octopus
text: The only thing that flows faster than water is fear.

name: Cobbled Lancer
text:
"Don't worry everyone—I hear hoofbeats! The Gavony Riders are coming to save us!"
—Adin, Moorland villager

name: Alaborn Musketeer
text: Muskets gave the Alaborn army an advantage it had long lacked—air defense.

name: Pandemonium
text:
"If we cannot live proudly, we die so!"
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Flame Spirit
text:
"The spirit of the flame is the spirit of change."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

name: Kjeldoran Elite Guard
text: The winged helms of the Guard are put on for pageants—but taken off for war.

name: Icatian Lieutenant
text: To become an officer, an Icatian soldier had to pass a series of tests. These evaluated not only fighting and leadership skills, but also integrity, honor, and moral strength.

name: Altar of Dementia
text:
"My dreams have brought more visions from our master: an altar, exquisite and perfect. We must build it at once."
—Writings of Artonac, priest of Gix

name: Verity Circle
text:
"Here, there is only truth."
—Barvisa, Azorius emissary

name: Weaselback Redcap
text:
"I would rather cast myself into the abyss than let my blood stain the cap of those monsters."
—Syr Alin, the Lion's Claw

name: Jorn, God of Winter // Kaldring, the Rimestaff
text: As the sagas tell it, Jorn collects a sliver of ice from every realm he visits.

name: Imperial Outrider
text: Her mount's hollow crest can produce a trumpeting warning that carries for miles, summoning more knights to her aid.

name: Gore-House Chainwalker
text: If the pig's blood drips on you, you're next on the chain.

name: Dormant Grove // Gnarled Grovestrider
text: As the natural cycle of day and night grew twisted, old powers stirred deep in the Ulvenwald.

name: Gaea's Bounty
text: The forest grew back so quickly that lumbering machines were suspended in the treetops.

name: Elbrus, the Binding Blade // Withengar Unbound
text: There are not enough lives on Innistrad to satisfy his thirst for retribution.

name: Fell the Pheasant
text:
"A keen eye and steady hand are essential for defeating most foes, including hunger."
—Syr Grenphire, knight of Garenbrig

name: Jolrael's Centaur
text:
"What need have I for cavalry when I can have horse and rider both in one?"
—Jolrael

name: Tavern Scoundrel
text: "No refunds. I cheated you fair and square."

name: Ashnod's Transmogrant
text: Ashnod found few willing to trade their humanity for the power she offered them.

name: Faerie Seer
text: "The patterns of crossing ripples reveal the future to those who know how to read them."

name: Evolving Wilds
text: The Sun Empire bends nature—rivers, mountainsides, dinosaurs—to its unyielding will.

name: Pit Trap
text:
"These traps are truly a symbol of great cruelty and sinister cunning."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Canopy Spider
text: It keeps the upper reaches of the forest free of every menace . . . except for the spider itself.

name: Thornweald Archer
text: Their arrows are tipped with basilisk eyes and fletched with cockatrice feathers.

name: Invasion Plans
text: Gerrard studied the globe as Mirri kept watch. Suddenly, his eyes widened. "This is Dominaria!"

name: Night Soil
text: Some said killing the thallids only encouraged them.

name: Alpha Myr
text: First to charge, first to fight.

name: Eelectrocute
text: The midway's games aren't so much rigged as they are insulated and grounded.

name: Goblin Shrine
text: "I knew it weren't no ordinary pile of—you know." —Norin the Wary

name: Mardu Banner
text: Speed to strike, fury to smash.

name: Ashes to Ashes
text:
"All rivers eventually run to the sea. My job is to sort out who goes first."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

name: Tempered Steel
text:
"Death shall prevail as long as our will falls to rust. May necessity anneal our resolve."
—Ghalma the Shaper

name: Giant Spider
text: While it possesses potent venom, the giant spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.

name: Kargan Warleader
text: From rebellion against the Akoum Skyclave to fighting the Eldrazi titans, the dragon-riding Kargan tribes have never missed an opportunity to defy the odds.

name: Stingerfling Spider
text: The juiciest prey is that which grows lazy, thinking itself beyond the reach of danger.

name: Whirling Catapult
text:
"Direct confrontation never was to the orcs' taste."
—General Varchild

name: Inexorable Tide
text:
"See how gratefully this world accepts our blessings."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

name: Primordial Ooze
text: The thick, moving mass from the beginning of evolution swallows and digests the animate and inanimate as it unthinkingly strives to continue its existence.

name: Spitting Image
text: Spitting is the customary greeting between a creature and its magical impostor.

name: Cinder Glade
text: All orbital bombardment did was till the soil.

name: Overwhelm
text: "Let the song of Selesnya be heard above the rhythm of our thundering hordes!"

name: Illusionary Terrain
text:
"The drawing of maps is fruitless in the west near the ice walls; the very earth is formless."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Bone Saw
text: In a world where death is always violent, cruel weapons are as common as rocks.

name: Steamflogger Service Rep
text: It's more like a hard day of lunch with a work break between shifts.

name: Ghostly Prison
text: Destroyed in one of the first battles of the Kami War, the town of Reito still grieved.

name: Oracle's Attendants
text: They follow the prophecy to each new prophet, guarding the future from the present.

name: Bladebrand
text:
"The pain of searing iron and razor edges pales beside the pleasure of performance."
—Judith

name: Flawless Maneuver
text:
"Captain, your units are the tip of our spear. There is zero room for failure."
—Jirina Kudro

name: Profane Memento
text:
"An angel's skull is left too plain by death. I made a few aesthetic modifications."
—Dommique, blood artist

name: Repercussion
text: "Tyrants will always suffer consequences. My favorite are the fiery ones."

name: Spare from Evil
text:
"As long as we can utter a prayer or lift a weapon, we have the power to fight back."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Dearly Departed
text:
"Never forget our ancestors. They have not forgotten us."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch

name: Fortune Teller
text: TODAY'S FORTUNE: AVOID CHANDRA'S INCENDIARY EXPERIENCE AROUND 11:37.

name: Corrupt Official
text: His favor comes at a high price.

name: Molting Snakeskin
text: Flesh wounds are meaningless to those who discard their flesh so readily.

name: Sunspire Gatekeepers
text: "You will pass with respect, or you will not pass at all."

name: Poultice Sliver
text:
"Its broad claw suggests a chitinous shield, but in fact it conceals glands that secrete a remarkably swift healing agent."
—Rukarumel, field journal

name: Ferocious Zheng
text: Known for their glowing horn and stone-rattling roar, zheng are the fiercest predators in the forest. Few survived before Jiang Yanggu came.

name: Karfell Kennel-Master
text: Trapped in a realm of dead flesh and scarce hunting, the ravenous wolves of Karfell follow the Dread Marn to warm game.

name: Erase
text:
"Don't trust your eyes, for mages are skilled in deception. Trust only in your faith. It will wipe everything clean."
—Lila, Erunian priest

name: Grave Endeavor
text: Not alive, not dead, but definitely furious.

name: Campaign of Vengeance
text:
"There is no saving this world, not anymore. But we shall be its bloody vengeance."
—Sorin Markov

name: Halo Hunter
text: Hanging on the walls of his lair, the fallen halos cast his depravity in everlasting light.

name: Jeskai Windscout
text: They range from Sage-Eye Stronghold to the farthest reaches of Tarkir.

name: Commanding Presence
text: "In every one of you I see a hero's heart."

name: Get a Life
text: Gimme five! (Or whatever you got.)

name: Mind Rot
text: Not every thought is a good one.

name: Igneous Elemental
text: Volcanic violence made manifest.

name: Evolving Wilds
text:
"Spend too much time scanning the shadows for evil and you'll never see the beauty our world has to offer."
—Katilda, Dawnhart Prime

name: Rib Cage Spider
text: Everything it sees it considers food—and with that many eyes, it's not liable to miss much.

name: Utter End
text:
"I came seeking a challenge. All I found was you."
—Zurgo, khan of the Mardu

name: Blood Moon
text: the same astrological influences that govern individuals apply to companies, which are, after all, composed of people and legally considered person-like entities.

name: Abomination of Llanowar
text: "Run!" screamed its living mouths. "Come!" cried its dead ones.

name: Null Rod
text: Gerrard: "But it doesn't do anything!" Hanna: "No—it does nothing."

name: Sparring Mummy
text: Aspiring to earn their place in the afterlife, acolytes train every day against those who fell short of that glory.

name: Crowd Favorites
text:
"The rabble likes them. Make sure they win, then book them for tomorrow."
—Cabal Patriarch

name: Last Chance
text: "I only had time to read half the spell, but I'm pretty sure this will work!"

name: Nexus Wardens
text: The Summer Nexus is a holy grove in Setessa where the starfields of Nyx glitter in the shadows.

name: Demogorgon's Clutches
text: The good will be corrupted, the kind will be devoured, and all will be dragged into the bottomless Abyss.

name: Lifespring Druid
text: "The land is not dead, merely sick. I will nurse it back to health."

name: Spitting Earth
text:
"There are times solid ground gives precious little comfort."
—Talibah, embermage

name: Heron's Grace Champion
text: Sigarda was the last uncorrupted archangel, but she would not have to fight alone.

name: Goblin War Drums
text:
"Defending the outer trenches, we strained our eyes in the darkness. All we could hear was the Drums' terrible pounding. Dobbs, on my right, broke first. Soon we were all heading for the walls."
—Corporal Peter Douglas, courtmartial testimony

name: Mogg Sentry
text: Tortured with magic by their masters, the moggs are enflamed by the smell of sorcery.

name: Mesmeric Orb
text:
"I now believe the strange orb was some kind of Thran security device. Supporting this theory, I can no longer recall where I found it."
—Tocasia, journal entry

name: Vengeful Dreams
text: Teroh dreams of his enemies' doom.

name: Elf Replica
text: It hunts with unnerving ferocity.

name: Dwarven Grunt
text:
Hard as stone and twice as stubborn.
—Dwarven compliment

name: Brood Keeper
text: "Come, little one. Unfurl your wings, fill your lungs, and release your first fiery breath."

name: Not Forgotten
text: Visit the dead, and they may return the favor.

name: Rush of Adrenaline
text: Scarecrows only go so far in sending the message to stay away.

name: Whiptail Wurm
text: It's hard to say for certain which end is more dangerous.

name: False Demise
text: "Go down there and fish him out. Maybe his hide will fetch a price."

name: Territorial Dispute
text: Bit by bit, Mercadia City had forced the Cho-Arrim from their ancestral lands. They would be pushed no further.

name: Ambitious Aetherborn
text: Aetherborn who are unwilling to accept the decomposition of their bodies invent ways to preserve and augment themselves.

name: Triton Shorestalker
text: "Who will miss you, drywalker? A wife? A child? Perhaps they will blame the sea for your fate, and teach future generations to stay far away from it."

name: Shrapnel Blast
text: To the Krark Clan, every artifact has a trigger and a barrel.

name: Bloodied Ghost
text:
"Only a knife left for a fortnight in the hollow of a ghastbark tree can inflict a wound so grave."
—Kithkin superstition

name: Final Fortune
text:
Want all, lose all.
—Zhalfirin aphorism

name: Brokers Ascendancy
text: "This is the beginning of a beautiful friendship. And more importantly, a profitable one. Now sign here."

name: Hypnotic Specter
text:
"...There was no trace/ Of aught on that illumined face..."
—Samuel Coleridge, "Phantom"

name: Armor of Faith
text:
"Keep your chainmail, warrior. I have my own form of protection."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Reckless Crew
text: "Boat's burning! Row faster!"

name: Cliffside Rescuer
text: "Keep going! I'll buy you time!"

name: Word of Blasting
text:
"Walls? What walls?"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Necrotic Sliver
text: Though Volrath is long dead, the slivers have become everything he wanted them to be: mindless instruments of destruction and despair.

name: Seraph of New Capenna // Seraph of New Phyrexia
text: The angels had vowed to protect New Capenna. She was determined to uphold that vow, no matter the cost.

name: Lorescale Coatl
text:
"The enlightenment I never found in etherium I have found traced in the coatl's scales."
—Ranalus, vedalken heretic

name: Welkin Tern
text: It stops flying only as its life comes to an end.

name: Powerstone Engineer
text: "Well there's your problem—resonance leak lowering output by thirty percent. I can patch that up."

name: Obsessive Stitcher
text: No one is as dedicated to perfection as a stitcher working on their latest masterpiece.

name: Lava Flow
text: People ran as never before at the thought of being buried and cremated at the same time.

name: Boing!
text: Sometimes the Astrotorium's stunts look dangerous because they absolutely are.

name: Cemetery Recruitment
text: "There's a smoothness to my magic here that I don't find on any other plane."

name: Pongify
text: Some spellcrafting mistakes go on to become spells of their own.

name: Tower Drake
text: Young tower drakes quickly learn to maneuver among Benalia's many spires.

name: Foul Imp
text: The imp, unaware of its own odor, paused to catch its breath . . . and promptly died.

name: Vampiric Link
text: The familiar's fangs deliver the master's bite.

name: Traumatize
text: He was left with just enough memory to understand what he had lost.

name: Grand Abolisher
text: "Journey..."

name: Avalanche
text:
"The pass was completely blocked by the avalanche; we're forced to turn back. Nevertheless, we've gone farther and seen more than any before us."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Vizier of the Scorpion
text: His blessing is a curse.

name: Dovin's Dismissal
text: "We're finished here."

name: Mystic Visionary
text: "The aven are heralds of divinity. The greatest glory is to join them in the sky."

name: Praetor's Grasp
text: Sheoldred weaves every thread of information into a noose to hang her enemies.

name: Metalwork Colossus
text: "I've come to save the world!"

name: Thundersong Trumpeter
text:
"Hear that? Those notes mean we've arrived at Sunhome! Let our allies' hearts soar and our enemies' hearts shatter at the sound!"
—Klattic, Boros legionnaire

name: Dragon Arch
text: In their hunger for the arch's power, mages often forget that it only makes dragons easier to summon. It doesn't make them easier to control.

name: Vaporkin
text:
"Mists are carefree. They drift where they will, unencumbered by rocks and river beds."
—Thrasios, triton hero

name: Zuran Spellcaster
text:
"A mage must be precise as well as potent; cautious, as well as clever."
—Zur the Enchanter

name: Yawgmoth's Vile Offering
text: Centuries ago, a mad god offered a simple trade.

name: Levitation
text: Barrin's pride in his apprentice was diminished somewhat when he had to get the others back down.

name: Collector Ouphe
text: "So this orb I got back at Spherecon 1993. It looks a lot like the '94 version but it's actually rounder."

name: Blessed Wine
text:
"Out there, there are spirits, but here, there is wine."
—Blessing for the bounty of Kjeld

name: Psychic Vortex
text:
"Tolaria floats upon a wheel of fortune."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Jetting Glasskite
text: The bolt struck with a flash and there was a terrible sound, as of glass shattering, but the creature was unharmed.

name: Dawnglow Infusion
text: Dawnglove bloom is a potent nostrum, but the dawnglow brewed from its sap is nothing less than life itself.

name: Moment of Defiance
text: "Well? What are you waiting for? Let's not keep the buzzards waiting."

name: Graverobber Spider
text: Cloaks woven from its webs are durable and waterproof but said to bring on nightmares.

name: Bamboozling Beeble
text: Myra bought beebles because they were cheaper than rubber ducks. Now the infestation is her largest expense.

name: Sizzle
text:
"Of course you should fight fire with fire. You should fight *everything* with fire."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Astral Slide
text:
"The hum of the universe is never off-key."
—Mystic elder

name: Hissing Iguanar
text: Viashino thrashes keep iguanars as hunting companions, giving them wounded captives as playthings.

name: Riftsweeper
text: "Beings of the rifts are not natural. No longer will these abominations tread upon the body of Gaea."

name: Dockside Extortionist
text: The fine print is illegible scribbles, but it *is* legally binding.

name: Necrite
text: Was it the sight, smell, or aura of the Necrite that killed so effectively?

name: Rabid Elephant
text: When in doubt, stomp.

name: Gruul Spellbreaker
text: She displays her scars with pride.

name: Surrender Your Thoughts
text: "Or, if you prefer, just surrender."

name: Blood Reckoning
text:
"There is no greater folly than standing against me."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Costly Plunder
text: No lock of iron is a match for Vraska's will of stone.

name: Zombie Outlander
text: The ripe smell of life drifted into Grixis. The dead caught the scent and with reckless hunger followed it back into Jund.

name: Venerable Lammasu
text: Lammasu are the enigmatic travelers of Tarkir, soaring high above all lands in all seasons. None know their true purpose, but they often arrive on the eve of great conflicts or turning points in history.

name: Hero of the Dunes
text: History forgot her name but not her victories.

name: Kodama's Reach
text:
"The soul of Jukai reaches far beyond the forest's edge."
—Shigeki, Jukai visionary

name: Azorius Justiciar
text: "Your potential to commit a crime warrants further investigation."

name: Salt Marsh
text:
Only death breeds in stagnant water.
—Urborg saying

name: Dawnbringer Charioteers
text: "Nyx may belong to the gods, but the skies of Theros are ours."

name: Winter Eladrin
text: "If you want a warm welcome, you'll have to seek it elsewhere."

name: Flutterfox
text:
"The white fox grinned. 'How about a bet, dragon? If I win, the skies are mine.' After he stopped laughing, the dragon agreed."
—*Tales of the Fae*

name: Argothian Pixies
text: After the rape of Argoth Forest during the rule of the artificers, the Pixies of Argoth bent their magic to more practical ends.

name: Dual Shot
text: "Through me the rage of Tilonalli burns twice as bright."

name: Dwarven Demolition Team
text: Foolishly, Najib retreated to his castle at El-Abar; the next morning he was dead. In just one night, the dwarven forces had reduced the mighty walls to mere rubble.

name: Lair Delve
text: "The fiends have fled. Well, good riddance. Nothing I like more than an empty lair."

name: Murderous Compulsion
text: "Thank you. This blade becomes so hot in my hand, but your blood has quenched it."

name: Blooming Marsh
text: A retreat to nature can inspire even the most jaded inventor.

name: Invasion of Ikoria // Zilortha, Apex of Ikoria
text: Phyrexia's largest goliaths stormed Ikoria, ready to challenge the world's great monsters. Zilortha was unimpressed.

name: Uktabi Orangutan
text: The hierarchy of the Uktabi Jungle hinges mostly on who can keep Prince Kibo entertained.

name: Banewhip Punisher
text: "If I die, it will not be alone."

name: Overcome
text:
"Forward! Until the horizon is ours!"
—Khemses, charioteer

name: Command Tower
text:
"The war will be decided here, where the planet's defenses are strongest."
—Marneus Calgar

name: Merfolk Skyscout
text: "Emeria is a pleasant lie, a figment to hide Emrakul's hideous face. I can only hope to uncover a truth that lies deeper still."

name: Emeria Captain
text: "The gifts of the past must find their way into deserving hands."

name: Manor Skeleton
text: Lungs dried to parchment wheeze blasphemies within a cage of bleached bone.

name: Mind Rot
text: Many an inventor has collapsed under the pressure to create a flawless design.

name: Wildfire
text: Fire is always at the top of the food chain, and it has a *big* appetite.

name: Arc-Slogger
text: A shuffling sound and the smell of ozone follow the slogger as surely as its electric tail.

name: Primevals' Glorious Rebirth
text: Centuries ago, five dragons conquered death to rule the living.

name: Ravenous Skirge
text: Hunger is a kind of madness—and here, all madness flourishes.

name: Derelor
text:
"The derelor's greatest contribution to the Ebon Hand was the inspirational effect its creator's execution had upon the other thrull breeders."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. II*

name: Bladed Ambassador
text: "Let those thanebound dissenters prattle about their dead god. I serve the Mother of Machines, and in her name I carve out their heresy."

name: Martial Coup
text: Their war forgotten, the nations of Bant stood united in the face of a common threat.

name: Knight of Stromgald
text:
"Kjeldorans should rule supreme, and to the rest, death!"
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Defense Grid
text:
"Woven together, strands of aether can form a mesh of surprising stability, though such a network tends to pull power from nearby devices."
—Consulate engineer's log

name: Righteous Indignation
text: "You are the disease that plagues Mercadia. I am the healer's knife that will cut you out."

name: Orc General
text: "Your army must fear you more than the enemy. Only then will you triumph." —Malga Phlegmtooth

name: Grizzly Ghoul
text: The hunters spent the evening celebrating their kill and the rest of the night running from it.

name: Greven il-Vec
text: As a ruthless leader for Volrath, Greven *il*-Vec serves his lord by commanding the flying ship *Predator*. Greven has attained his powerful rank through a series of underhanded schemes and assassinations, the majority of which were blessed by Volrath himself.

name: Chronomaton
text: On the third night, the villagers destroyed their clocks. The sounds of whirring gears and chiming metal held only dread for them.

name: Strider Harness
text:
"Because the giant, implacable death lizard wasn't scary enough already."
—Captain Brinely Rage

name: Rakdos Keyrune
text: The Rakdos use it for everything you can think of and plenty more than that.

name: Night's Whisper
text: The air seems full of specks, floating and circling in the draught from the window, and the lights burn blue and dim. What am I to do? God shield me from harm this night!

name: Remove Soul
text: When your enemies are denied soldiers, they are denied victory.

name: Flamecast Wheel
text: Beware the gifts of an ill-tempered forge god.

name: Greater Sandwurm
text: On Ikoria, sandwurms never lie dormant for too long. In some regions, "no activity" is the greatest sign of danger.

name: Vial of Dragonfire
text: Designed by an ancient artificer, the vials are strong enough to hold the very breath of a dragon—until it's needed.

name: Lightning Talons
text:
"The victim was either clawed to death or struck by lightning. Possibly both."
—Pel Javya, Wojek investigator

name: Species Gorger
text:
"We raised eelhawks to control the squidflies, then waspcrabs to prey on the eelhawks. Now what do we do with all these waspcrabs?"
—Gulistan, Simic biomancer

name: _____-o-saurus
text:
"Petting in the petting zoo is not advised."
—Astrotorium waiver

name: Ixidor, Reality Sculptor
text: "Reality has exiled me. I am no longer bound by its laws."

name: Sinkhole
text: High walls, a sturdy keep, a strong garrison . . . they made no difference. In a matter of moments, the city was lost.

name: Magmaroth
text: Sand into glass and flesh into ash—such are the markers of its domain.

name: Skittering Heartstopper
text: It flows like water over the forest floor, as deadly as the swiftest current.

name: Obsidian Battle-Axe
text: It's the flint that sparks a warrior's rage.

name: Hivestone
text: Rath's evincars used hivestones to control the slivers, but the overlay put their power into unwitting hands. Now the stones make not masters, but slaves.

name: Rathi Dragon
text: Wrap the flame as twine, Kingdoms will be thine.

name: Scrapbasket
text: Once a tool of kithkin farmers, scarecrows of all shapes now skitter and lurch across Shadowmoor, animated by residual rustic magics.

name: Kamahl, Pit Fighter
text: In times when freedom seems lost, great souls arise to reclaim it.

name: River Heralds' Boon
text: "We are kin to the trees, and their strength is our own."

name: Sudden Substitution
text: "Bow before the might of—wait, what?"

name: Voice of the Woods
text: "Ancient ones, I call on you, your wisdom and your power, your will to claim again all that is rightfully yours."

name: Goblin Tinkerer
text:
"Can they *do* that?"
—Imwita, Zhalfirin artificer, last words

name: Curiosity
text: Li'l Giri tracked the robotic villain with silent steps. Just as the monster was about to eat the child . . .

name: Hinterland Harbor
text: In places where the sea meets the trees, it's easy to forget the darkness that rules most of Innistrad.

name: Vance's Blasting Cannons // Spitfire Bastion
text: With a broadside assault, Captain Vance carved the cliffs to form her new home.

name: Eat to Extinction
text:
"Kroxa devours what he may—not for sustenance or pleasure, but because it is his nature. He is unending hunger given form."
—Klothys, god of destiny

name: Lowland Oaf
text: "I don't know why the little one was so mad. He said to put him down, and I put him down."

name: Phyrexian Plaguelord
text:
"The final stage of the illness: delirium, convulsions, and death."
—Phyrexian progress notes

name: Upriser Renegade
text: "My streets, my rules. You picked the wrong neighborhood for a fight."

name: Soul of the Rapids
text: With Kumena in control of the Immortal Sun, the rapids rose from their riverbeds and the waterfalls took flight.

name: Cloud Elemental
text:
"You know you've angered the gods when the clouds turn against you."
—Sisay, Captain of the *Weatherlight*

name: Essence Pulse
text:
"There is nothing so invigorating and stubbornly belligerent as the pure energy of life."
—Valentin, Witherbloom dean

name: Canyon Lurkers
text: The broken Qal Sisma foothills make poor terrain for cavalry, but a perfect setting for ambushes.

name: Aven Windreader
text: "The tiniest ripple tells a story ten fathoms deep."

name: Kitesail Scout
text: "The wind in one's hair, the sun on one's back, the joy of open skies . . . the next generation of kor must know this kind of peace."

name: Explosive Entry
text: Kaito and Tamiyo charged headlong into Jin-Gitaxias's secret lab, unaware that the praetor was eagerly awaiting their arrival.

name: Battlegate Mimic
text: Mimics don't need perfect disguises. They need only the perfect victims: the naive, the young, or the poor of sight.

name: Network Disruptor
text: "Just as I suspected. They thought they'd hidden the terminal, so they got lazy with the encryption."

name: Afterlife
text: Facets of life, reflections of the soul.

name: Youthful Scholar
text:
"Too dumb, and you end up a sibsig. Too smart, and you end up a meal. Mediocrity is the key to a long life."
—Mogai, Silumgar noble

name: Celestial Unicorn
text: When all hope fails, its light remains.

name: Limestone Golem
text: Dwarves have been known to take pickaxes to their own creations, hoping to discover treasures within.

name: Expel
text: Quintorius was a daydreamer, far happier digging through history books than practicing battle tactics. He agreed with the military academy on only one thing: he did not belong in their ranks.

name: Lawless Broker
text: Kaladesh's illicit marketplaces are known as "night markets," but if you know who to ask, you can find what you're looking for at any time of the day.

name: Ulamog's Crusher
text:
"Whatever the Eldrazi's purpose is, it has nothing to do with something so insignificant as us."
—Nirthu, lone missionary

name: Krark's Thumb
text:
"I can think of *one* goblin it ain't so lucky for."
—Slobad, goblin tinkerer

name: Merciless Executioner
text: He enjoys his work, for he sees only the worst Abzan criminals: those who betray their own kin.

name: Storm Shaman
text:
"Embrace the storm. Its voice shall echo within you, and its fire shall become your touch!"
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

name: Dreamscape Artist
text: He's mastered the art of sleight of land.

name: Samwise the Stouthearted
text: "You've hurt my master, you brute, and you'll pay for it."

name: Pouncing Lynx
text: "I don't understand. He's normally so well behaved!"

name: Gorilla War Cry
text:
"Theirs is the art of blood."
—Jaeuhl Carthalion, Juniper Order Advocate

name: Pili-Pala
text: It wasn't really expected to fly. Then again, it wasn't expected to move, either.

name: Pyrokinesis
text:
"Anybody want some . . . *toast*?"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Clown Car
text: It runs on laughing gas.

name: First Sliver's Chosen
text: The most tenacious members of the hive instinctually guard the First Sliver.

name: Loyal Drake
text:
"Doves and pigeons are too subtle. When I send a message, I want it to have some teeth."
—Aeschel, royal diplomat

name: Rakdos Headliner
text: Mood: Unrestrained violence in a festival atmosphere.

name: Gold Myr
text: The myr are like razorgrass: numberless metal figures, reflecting each other's light.

name: Sixth Sense
text: Instinct yields the truest insight.

name: Vicious Hunger
text: Only the most ravenous soul feeds on the health of the weak.

name: Furious Rise
text: Klothys set out to mend the destiny of Theros, her fury guiding every stitch.

name: Blight Keeper
text: It withers fruit and flesh alike.

name: Hammerheim
text:
"'Tis distance lends enchantment to the view,/ And robes the mountain in its azure hue."
—Thomas Campbell, "Pleasures of Hope"

name: Mortician Beetle
text: To the soldier, war is famine; to the scavenger, a feast.

name: Static Orb
text: Time passes, time crawls; Time doesn't move at all.

name: Lunarch Veteran // Luminous Phantom
text: "Even in our darkest times, Avacyn's light still guides us."

name: Jace's Scrutiny
text: "Just a collage of images: cryptoliths, the sea, a tangle of shipwrecks."

name: Kaalia of the Vast
text: "I'll have my revenge if I have to call on every force from above and below."

name: Squelching Leeches
text: Setting foot in their muck is an open invitation.

name: Capashen Knight
text: He protects Benalia as much with his reputation as with his force of arms.

name: Burn the Accursed
text: Nothing remained but a few drifting embers and the smell of smoldering hair.

name: Meditate
text:
"Part of me believes that Barrin taught me meditation simply to shut me up."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: T.A.P.P.E.R.
text:
"'Technologically-Advanced People-Pleasing Entertainment Robot', eh? Nice hat. Would be a shame if something happened to it."
—"Brims" Barone, midway mobster

name: Charging Griffin
text: Four claws, two wings, one beak, no fear.

name: Desperate Stand
text: At the Akroan gates, hoplites revived the tactics of Kytheon Iora's infamous irregulars.

name: Plasm Capture
text:
"Everything serves a purpose. Even you."
—Vorel of the Hull Clade

name: Serpent's Soul-Jar
text: The coils spiral like time itself, carrying spirits back around from death to reawakening.

name: Evolving Wilds
text:
"Don't you ever wonder what lies beyond the Hekma? Beyond the reach of the gods? Beyond the horns on the horizon?"
—Samut, initiate of Tah crop

name: Edgar, Charmed Groom // Edgar Markov's Coffin
text: "It is in the hold, perhaps in one of those boxes. I'll unscrew them one by one and see. You work the helm."

name: Starstorm
text:
"They're beasts! What are they going to do, bomb us from orbit?"
—Platoon Commander Cyrus Jalili, Prandium Defense Auxilia

name: Arrest
text: Getting caught was bad enough, but being rolled to the the detention center was by far the worst part.

name: Taste of Paradise
text:
"Any who drink of Freyalise's bounty drink the mead of rebirth."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Patriarch's Bidding
text:
"There's some new darkness in the air tonight. If I were you, I'd stay home and lock the doors."
—Ferrick, village warden

name: Snapping Sailback
text: Lurking beneath the murky waters of Ixalan's rivers, sailbacks can rip a meal off the shore in the blink of an eye.

name: Elfhame Palace
text: The elfhames are the closest thing to "civilization" the elves allow themselves.

name: Temple Garden
text: Karametra's worshippers know that one must plant countless seeds to ensure a bountiful harvest.

name: Argothian Swine
text: In Argoth, the shortest path between two points is the one the swine make.

name: Battletide Alchemist
text: "I do not heal. Healing means that the pain has already been felt. To stop suffering, one must prevent the world's wounds altogether."

name: Attunement
text:
"The solution can hide for only so long."
—Urza

name: Time Ebb
text:
"Yesterday you were just a figment of your master's imagination. I liked you better then."
—Shai Fusan, archmage

name: Stigma Lasher
text: The Extinguisher's curse lasted long after her departure.

name: Orcish Veteran
text: Orcs are not exactly known for their valor—although most Orcs have seen countless battles, only a handful have actually fought in them.

name: Brainstorm
text:
"The secret is simply to know what you're going to do before you even see the possibilities."
—Porlema'ko, mind mage

name: Vance's Blasting Cannons // Spitfire Bastion
text: Now instead of a ship, Ripley Vance commands a fortress.

name: Slith Ascendant
text: Instinctively drawn to the light of its "mother-sun," each slith follows that sun's path around Mirrodin.

name: Beast Within
text:
"Kill the weak so they can't drag the strong down to their level. This is true compassion."
—Benzir, archdruid of Temple Might

name: Crypt of the Eternals
text: The dead entered as worthy. They exited as Eternals.

name: Spiked Baloth
text: If a baloth isn't hungry, it's dead.

name: Duress
text:
"Your voice. Pushing me. Picking me up . . . when all the colors were black."
—Jinx

name: Waking Nightmare
text:
"Once each year, the oni and other evil spirits paraded through villages to disturb mortals' sleep. During the war, this parade became a nightly event."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Blight-Breath Catoblepas
text: Wherever it walks, famine follows behind.

name: Vicious Hunger
text:
"Blood is foul, the flesh dross. My ascendance thirsts for life itself."
—Crovax

name: Tangle Angler
text: A plague on the curious.

name: Maddening Wind
text:
"It is Freyalise, walking on the world."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Disciple of Perdition
text: "Could you please spare some of your blood for my precious little tree?"

name: Blackcleave Goblin
text:
"Bitten? Save time, amputate now."
—Lephar, loxodon surgeon

name: Slaughter Specialist
text: From every kill, a gruesome trophy.

name: Seton, Krosan Protector
text: "Survival of the fittest is not only the law of the pits, it is the law of nature. That is why I fight."

name: Dutiful Return
text: When Malakir's surgeons failed, its death-shamans took over.

name: R&D's Secret Lair
text: "Let them complain. As long as the addictive ink is working, we can do anything we want." PLAY AT YOUR OWN RISK
