text: Wine and balm for the confessions of the repentant. Razors and irons for the confessions of the unrepentant.

name: Serra Avatar
text: Though Serra is long dead, her legacy of grace and kindness will live on forever.

name: Helionaut
text: Hope kept the defenders aloft, but only courage kept them in the fight.

name: Soul Feast
text: You are who you eat.

name: Wand of the Worldsoul
text:
"May Mat'Selesnya bind our hearts as one."
—Selesnya prayer

name: Conquer
text:
"Why do we trade with those despicable elves? You don't live in forests, you burn them!"
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Territorial Gorger
text: Inventors have been known to capture gremlins with the intent to release them in a rival's workshop. More often than not, that plan backfires.

name: Towering Thunderfist
text:
"Nothing ruins a party like one of those big killjoys bursting through the door and setting all the guests free."
—Ruba, Rakdos cultist

name: Fodder Cannon
text: Step 1: Find your cousin. Step 2: Get your cousin in the cannon. Step 3: Find another cousin.

name: Mark for Death
text: Everyone roots for the little guy, but nobody bets on him.

name: Concordia Pegasus
text:
"A kick from its hooves is like a bolt of lightning. I'd know. I've been hit by both."
—Rencz, Izzet chemister's aide

name: Predatory Focus
text: Instinct blood-tinted his world until he could see only one thing clearly: his prey.

name: Thirst
text: The first of the Thousand Deaths.

name: Selenia, Dark Angel
text: "I am light. I am dark. I must give my life to serve; not even death can release me."

name: Flow of Maggots
text:
"The very earth seemed alive and made a sound like the writhing of the damned."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Ghoulcaller's Chant
text:
"The living are born small and weak. The dead rise ready to serve. The choice is obvious."
—Gisa, ghoulcaller of Gavony

name: Murderous Betrayal
text: In darkness, the assassin sneaked into the village and destroyed what Eladamri loved most: his daughter.

name: Grim Wanderer
text: There is a stillness that walks with him, the quiet that follows great tragedy, when even the mourners are too exhausted to weep.

name: Hell Mongrel
text: It feeds on shadows, fear, and blood.

name: Telepathic Spies
text: Most spies sneak into enemy camps. These spies sneak into enemy minds.

name: Bolt Bend
text:
"Give them everything you've got . . . and some things you don't."
—Ral Zarek

name: Sunhome Enforcer
text:
"Law soothed his savage heart. Where fury once burned, the enduring flame of order now shines."
—Razia

name: Browbeat
text:
"Even the threat of power has power."
—Jeska, warrior adept

name: Jaws of Stone
text: When giants find their mountain homes infested, they have a whole range of solutions.

name: Turn to Frog
text: "Ribbit."

name: Stasis Cocoon
text: Though the grip of a golem is strong, the grip of Auriok magic is far stronger.

name: Healing Salve
text:
"The Femeref look only to the Sun for healing; they have never truly understood life's cycle."
—Kifimbo, Shadow Guildmage

name: Encampment Keeper
text: Paladins of the Sanctum Seeker order are an adventurous lot, venturing into the wilds with monstrous mastiffs at their side.

name: Disenchant
text:
"I implore you not to forget the horrors of the past. You would have us start the Brothers' War anew!"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

name: Watchful Giant
text: Loitering is not only illegal but unwise, since those who stay too long in one place are apt to be stepped on.

name: Scaldkin
text: The Temur believe that scaldkin are born when eruptions melt the frozen whispers of sleeping ancestors.

name: Garth One-Eye
text: Mood: A powerful, quirky, curious man.

name: Season of Renewal
text: Pavement ripped like paper as the ancient kami awoke from her long slumber beneath the city.

name: Professor's Warning
text: Professor Onyx urged the twins to prepare for the dark mage Extus, sounding very much like someone familiar with the rise of tyrants.

name: Iron Tusk Elephant
Dragonstorm
text: Dragons come not in packs or in herds but in storms.

name: Consecrated Sphinx
text: "I can only glimpse the future. These little ones will bring it about."

name: Touch of Death
text:
"What was yours is mine. Your land, your people, and now your life."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Perimeter Captain
text: "We stand between the jaws of chaos and the mantle of order."

name: Wall of Vipers
text:
What wall can never be climbed, but is always scaled?
—Nakaya riddle

name: Aerie Mystics
text: They are cautious with their body language and facial expressions. Any stray movement could betray the positions of the troops they protect and cost many lives.

name: Eldrazi Temple
text: It housed a congregation of broken, screaming souls.

name: Cabaretti Initiate
text:
"Now there's a fellow who knows how to have a good time!"
—Jetmir

name: Portable Hole
text: "They fall for it every time."

name: Steam Frigate
text:
"Is it merchants or is it pirates?"
"It's Talas—there's no difference."

name: Fraying Omnipotence
text: The Great Mending that healed the Multiverse also unraveled the threads of Nicol Bolas's power.

name: Prowling Felidar
text: On occasion, felidars leave meaty "gifts" outside the tents of explorers they consider worthy.

name: Scourge of Nel Toth
text:
"May all the cairns of Jund be toppled."
—Meren of Clan Nel Toth

name: Dispel
text:
"I said we should destroy the Eldrazi. Ugin wanted to return them to stasis. Ugin's arguments were . . . unconvincing."
—Jace Beleren

name: Processor Assault
text: Ulamog's processors trail behind him, converting ruined matter into furious energy.

name: Gaea's Avenger
text: After the destruction of Argoth, Gaea was willing to instill a portion of her own powers into some of her more vengeful followers.

name: Chilling Shade
text: Rimewind necromancers caught travelers in mystical blizzards then trapped their spirits in the mist of their final frozen breaths.

name: Evolving Wilds
text: The Eldrazi may be ruthless, but Zendikar is relentless.

name: Pewter Golem
text: Centuries before the first chimneys of Mephidross belched clouds of toxic gas, only the golems' movements stirred the air of Mirrodin.

name: Corrosive Gale
text:
"Wipe Sheoldred's spies from the sky. She'll see the result of our vision soon enough."
—Glissa

name: Myr Custodian
text:
"Myr will go where the work is. We always have. We always will."
—Urtet, Remnant of Memnarch

name: Keepers of the Faith
text: And then the Archangel Anthius spoke to them, saying, "Fear shall be vanquished by the Sword of Faith."

name: Secret Door
text: The way opened before him, and the dust of centuries stirred in the air.

name: Skitter Eel
text:
"Life has no mistakes, only experiments."
—Yolov, Simic bioengineer

name: Sabertooth Wyvern
text: Most creatures grow out of their baby teeth, but sabertooth wyverns grow into theirs.

name: Kumena's Speaker
text: "The same power that drives the river ever onward flows through the roots and branches—to me."

name: Vessel of Volatility
text:
"To be honest, I'm not quite sure what's going to happen."
—Renna, Selhoff alchemist

name: Emergency Weld
text: Scurrying repair bots quietly turned the tide of many battles, patching damaged automatons back into fighting form.

name: Exotic Pets
text: Investigators observed that Altonio's beloved fish were thriving after his disappearance.

name: Rampaging Ferocidon
text: All raptors are aggressive, but ferocidons seem to enjoy their prey's pain.

name: Incinerate
text:
"Never taunt an embermage, 'What are you going to do about it?'"
—Akin, seasoned askari

name: Bedlam
text: Sometimes quantity, in the absence of quality, is good enough.

name: Fire Urchin
text: Rain runoff in the Smelting District is known to spontaneously burst into flame.

name: Demon's Herald
text: "May these deaths be the first of many."

name: Battlefront Krushok
text: Krushoks clear debris from fertile fields, fallow fields, and battlefields.

name: Deadbeat Attendant
text: Some people will hire anyone with a pulse. Myra isn't that picky.

name: Concordia Pegasus
text: In the cloudy skies and dim light of autumn, a flash of white wings is a reminder that better times lie ahead.

name: Raging Goblin
text: Charging alone takes uncommong daring or uncommon stupidity. Or both.

name: Ascendant Evincar
text:
"Things are going to change around here."
—Crovax

name: Stasis Cell
text: The Simic created the cells to preserve their experiments. The Azorius put the cells to use on the guilty.

name: Lightning Helix
text:
"Rage is not the answer. Rage followed by fitting vengeance is the answer."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Tomik, Distinguished Advokist
text: "Some bend the law. I tie it into knots."

name: Goblin Grenade
text:
"According to accepted theory, the grenade held some kind of flammable mixture and was carried to its target by a hapless goblin."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV*

name: Glory Bearers
text: "We are bearers of the ancient light, keepers of sun-crowned Heliod's blessings. Fight, and the light will protect you!"

name: In the Trenches
text: The battlefield became so pockmarked with craters and trenches that casualties were regularly attributed to "fell in a hole."

name: Paralyzing Grasp
text:
"Obviously, the Firemind's mission is worth more than a few goblins."
—Pelener, chamberlain of Niv-Mizzet

name: Academy Researchers
text: They brandish their latest theories as warriors would wield weapons.

name: Warden of the Woods
text: Weak and strong alike seek shelter beneath its branches.

name: Seal of Doom
text:
"A basilisk's gaze is effective, but disposing of physical remains is a tiresome task. It's far more discrete to dissolve one's victim entirely."
—Szadek

name: Nova Cleric
text: "Our noblest thoughts are our very first and our very last."

name: Nameless Inversion
text: Just as a changeling's influence can have dramatic effects, so too can its sudden withdrawal.

name: Quandrix Campus
text: Mage-students who see beauty in patterns and equations choose Quandrix, the college of numeromancy.

name: Thrill of Possibility
text: "Right now, in these first moments of creation, it is simultaneously nothing and everything."

name: Spinneret Sliver
text: Each new generation of slivers evolves to assimilate the strengths of the prey upon which their progenitors fed.

name: Heart Warden
text:
"In Llanowar, we tend the forest's boughs and branches. In Yavimaya, we are a part of them."
—Rofellos of Llanowar

name: Weary Prisoner // Wrathful Jailbreaker
text: "Your guard attacked me. He got what was coming to him."

name: Chronostutter
text: Timing is everything.

name: Rakdos Guildgate
text: Enter and indulge your darkest fantasies, for you may never pass this way again.

name: Predatory Hunger
text: Hunger growls, never purrs.

name: Barricade Breaker
text:
"The Consulate sought to crush us. Let's give them a taste of their own medicine."
—Venkat Dasai, renegade commander

name: Enduring Sliver
text: Time has ground mountains to sand, but the slivers ever remain.

name: Crimson Kobolds
text:
"Kobolds are harmless."
—Bearand the Bold, epitaph

name: Cleric of Chill Depths
text: "Before my people turned to false gods, we built a glittering city beneath the northern sea ice. The magic of ancient Benthidrix lives in me!"

name: Extra Arms
text:
"Perhaps extra heads would have served them better."
—Foothill guide

name: Diabolic Edict
text: Greven il-Vec lifted Vhati off his feet. "The fall will give you time to think on your failure."

name: Faerie Formation
text: The throng flitted from castle to castle, leaving a trail of star-crossed love, damaging rumors, and missing heirlooms in their wake.

name: Kill Shot
text:
"In the assassination trade, no one lives to make more than one mistake."
—Anhelo, the Painter

name: Cursecatcher
text: "Of all the things that can be stolen, opportunity is the most valuable."

name: Flying Men
text: Saffiyah clapped her hands and twenty flying men appeared at her side, each well trained in the art of combat.

name: Kin-Tree Invocation
text: The passing years add new rings to the tree's trunk, bolstering the spirits that dwell within.

name: Tragic Fall
text: Every final journey begins with a single misstep.

name: Grim Haruspex
text: "Your enemies may be cowardly, my lord, but one should never call them gutless."

name: Arctic Foxes
text:
"Those Foxes are wily, swift, and ferocious. They are the warriors of the snows."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Novellamental
text: "This pendant was my grandmother's legacy. I sought solitude among the trees as moonlight danced on their branches, her gift safe in my hand."

name: Volcanic Strength
text: The mountains bend to no one.

name: Killing Glare
text: A casual glance into a dark corner may be your last.

name: Anaba Bodyguard
text:
"They who challenge a minotaur enjoy the taste of their own blood."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Kessig Flamebreather
text: "Hunter's fire" was meant for slaying monsters in the Ulvenwald, but that never stopped Ralen from showing it off.

name: Obsianus Golem
text:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone . . . ."
—"Song of the Artificer"

name: Hope Against Hope
text: "I have given my life to the church, my soul to Avacyn, and my heart to the people."

name: Gift of Estates
text:
"We asked for a home and received the world."
—*Scroll of Nine Blessings*

name: Capashen Standard
text: Benalia has no need for peacocks to serve as symbols of vanity. The Capashens strut more proudly than any bird.

name: Worldly Tutor
text:
"Aselbo soon had the rhino eating from his palm and the snake waiting at his heels."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Terror of Towashi
text: Takumi knew where all the bodies were buried. After all, he'd buried most of them.

name: Simplify
text:
A blossom's petals close inward to shut out the frost.
—Nantuko teaching

name: Lifeblood Hydra
text: Pharika has written her secrets on its bones so that only the worthy may discover them.

name: Woodland Changeling
text: Changelings cannot resist the draw of a new shape, even if doing so would be in their best interests.

name: Tishana's Wayfinder
text: "There is always another way."

name: Toothy, Imaginary Friend
text: Go ahead, tell it that it isn't real.

name: Well Done
text:
"What's the big deal? I've been on fire eighty-one times. Twice just while sleeping."
—Devil K. Nevil, daredevil extraordinaire

name: Mandible Justiciar
text: While one mouth feeds, the other chatters mindless paeans of Elesh Norn's glory.

name: Storm Front
text: The calmest day on Rath would be thought a storm anywhere else.

name: Loamdragger Giant
text: Giants sleep soundly and long, sometimes for long enough that a crust of earth and moss grows over them. But inevitably something disturbs their slumber, and they wake unhappy.

name: Akki Avalanchers
text: Among Godo's hordes, "beware of falling rocks" came to mean "akki live nearby."

name: Unruly Mob
text: "We survived the Travails! Killer angels! Horrors from beyond the moon! Now some big werewolves think they can scare us? Let 'em try."

name: Aardwolf's Advantage
text:
"My Abattoir Ghoul deck is unstoppable. Wait, 1996 World Champion?"
—Johnny, to Spike

name: Righteous Charge
text: "In the name of peace, moderation, and decency—wipe them all out!"

name: Timberland Guide
text: "Can you build a fire? Track a deer? Identify killer trees? Then you'll never survive Kessig without me."

name: Twinblade Geist // Twinblade Invocation
text: Since her passing, many more travelers have made it home alive.

name: For the Family
text: The Cabaretti cultivate an image of harmless hedonism, happy for the other families to underestimate their formidable firepower.

name: Dictate of the Twin Gods
text: Iroas and Mogis are as different in appearance as they are in personality.

name: Toxic Abomination
text: Deep in the forgotten reaches of Urborg, ancient Phyrexian monstrosities shamble endlessly, putrid ichor leaking from their rusted forms.

name: Declaration in Stone
text: The message was clear to Sorin—Nahiri had paid Markov Manor a visit.

name: Pitiless Gorgon
text: "The reign of the Swarm begins. Let us rise now and dress ourselves in vengeance."

name: Reef Pirates
text: Relentless as the tides, souls dark as a moonless night. Bloodshed on their minds, and greed burning in their hearts like molten gold.

name: Turbulent Dreams
text: Laquatus dreams of seizing control.

name: Expendable Troops
text: No doubt in their minds, no fear in their hearts.

name: Offspring's Revenge
text: All they found in the hunter's camp were tiny paw prints and a lot of blood.

name: Retributive Wand
text:
"The last blast is the biggest."
—Sargis Haz, artificer

name: Imperial Seal
text: "If Heaven has placed it in your hands, it means that the throne is destined to be yours."

name: Skyswimmer Koi
text: Once they swam alone among the clouds, but now the people of Kamigawa have built high enough to reach them.

name: Patron Wizard
text:
„Achte immer auf die Schatten der alten Meister. Sie waren vor dir da und werden noch lange nach dir da sein."
—Aus Donatos gesammelten Weisheiten

name: Soldevi Heretic
text:
"In the arms of tragedy, there is little comfort in being right."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Ubul Sar Gatekeepers
text: There are many gates into the undercity, but few ways out.

name: Reviving Dose
text: As healers battled each plague, they learned more about the next.

name: Golden Hind
text:
"It is not yours to hunt, mortal. Be content with its beauty alone."
—Nylea, god of the hunt

name: Wicker Warcrawler
text: It's the twisted creation of a kithkin diviner who dreamed of very large crows.

name: Elvish Vanguard
text: "Our lives are woven together like the trees' branches over our heads, forming a canopy that protects us all."

name: Binding Mummy
text: What the gods decree, the mummies enforce.

name: Shu Foot Soldiers
text: Liu Bei lost many men at the battle of Runan because of his lack of strategy. It wasn't until he met Kongming that he began to truly succeed as a leader.

name: Charging Monstrosaur
text: "I knew I should have stayed with the boat. Always stay with the boat!"

name: Rain of Gore
text:
"Stay indoors, away from what seeps over the thresholds. This is the Demon's work, and only ill can come of it."
—Belko, owner of Titan's Keg tavern

name: Lightning Reflexes
text: "Inhale. Kill. Exhale."

name: Lymph Sliver
text: Its skin remains in a flowing, liquid state that keeps its body coated with potent restorative lymph.

name: Rod of Ruin
text: The good news is it's so simple a goblin could use it. The bad news is it's so simple a goblin could use it.

name: Uktabi Faerie
text:
Victim of the two-toed faerie
—Suq'Ata expression meaning "broken"

name: Opt
text:
"The wish most often granted is the wish to choose one's own destiny."
—*Aethershrine*, inscription

name: Kobold Overlord
text: "One for all, all for one; we strike first, and then you're done!" —Oath of the Kobold Musketeers

name: Centaur Veteran
text: He wears his scars like badges of honor, warning his foes that he's not easily defeated.

name: Snakeskin Veil
text: "Does a serpent roar and chase its prey? No. A serpent waits silently for oblivious prey to draw near."

name: Night Market Aeronaut
text: "Death might come tomorrow, but today—today I am alive."

name: Noble Stand
text: Soldiers will always endanger their lives to defend many other lives.

name: Jaddi Lifestrider
text: Nature's arms encircle all who are willing to draw close.

name: Battle of Wits
text: There is no loftier ambition than the pursuit of knowledge.

name: Atarka, World Render
text:
"Her hunger knows no limit. Left unchecked, she would feast on all of Tarkir."
—Yasova Dragonclaw

name: Ornery Goblin
text: "Nobody ever listens to my complaints! Not even when I use the listening stick."

name: Farbog Boneflinger
text:
"Here are some bones for you to choke on, dear brother!"
—Gisa, to Geralf

name: Blood Sun
text: As the struggle raged for control of the Immortal Sun, the world grew dark under a blood-red sky.

name: Mox Opal
text: The suns of Mirrodin have shone upon perfection only once.

name: Bishop of Rebirth
text: "In the death of the foe lies the resurrection of the faithful."

name: Kithkin Billyrider
text: "Brother, guide my right hand. Sister, my left. Rest well, my kin, but Lorwyn still needs me. I will not be joining you quite yet."

name: Shared Triumph
text: "Win together, die alone."

name: Strike It Rich
text: A few coins soon grow into an obsession.

name: Tel-Jilad Stylus
text: Etched on Tel-Jilad's trunk is an entire history of Mirrodin—except for an expanse near the ground scrubbed smooth by an unknown hand.

name: Countersquall
text: Each of the twenty-three winds of Esper is named and chronicled, and every possible interaction with the flow of magic is exhaustively detailed.

name: Loyal Subordinate
text: Zombies work best when they're fed appropriately, so it's prudent to let them eat on the job.

name: Feast on the Fallen
text:
"As our numbers dwindle, the ranks of the dead grow ever stronger."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Essence Depleter
text: When Kozilek emerged at Sea Gate, his brood lineage swarmed to the surface.

name: Cavalcade of Calamity
text: Let the Dimir worry about witnesses. For the Rakdos, screams count as applause.

name: Legions of Lim-Dûl
text:
"I have seen the faces of my dead friends among that grim band, and I can bear no more."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Ritual of the Machine
text:
"Rumors persist of dark deeds performed in the depths of Soldev. When will Dagsson heed the danger therein?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

name: Dark Banishing
text:
"Ha, banishment? Be merciful, say 'death,' For exile hath more terror in his look, Much more than death."
—William Shakespeare, *Romeo and Juliet*

name: Remedy
text:
"These things will protect you while I'm gone, remind you of my love for you."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Tortured Existence
text:
"There are terrors lurking in the unseen corners of us all."
—Crovax

name: Nalathni Dragon
text:
These small but intelligent Dragons and their Olesian allies held back the tide of Pashalik Mons's hordes of Goblin Raiders.
*DragonCon 1994*

name: Dauthi Embrace
text:
"The Dauthi army grows by screams and bounds."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

name: Surge of Zeal
text:
"If only my poxes were as infectious as their zealotry."
—Savra

name: Thief of Blood
text: Her hunger will not be denied.

name: Shriekgeist
text: Wounds of the flesh are easy to heal. Wounds of the mind may never be undone.

name: Novellamental
text: "My heart filled with warmth, and I felt my feet lift from the ground. Suddenly, I was free—free to soar, the homes beneath me shrinking to specks on a map."

name: Waterspout Djinn
text:
"Fly us higher, out of its storm."
—Sisay, Captain of the *Weatherlight*

name: Moon-Eating Dog
text: The most nimble of creatures, it chases the most sacred luminence.

name: Carnivorous Plant
text:
"It had a mouth like that of a great beast, and gnashed its teeth as it strained to reach us. I am thankful it possessed no means of locomotion."
—Vervamon the Elder

name: Wrecking Crew
text: They built the neighborhood. They know its weak points. They know all the hiding places. When they come for you, they'll find you and bring the roof down on your head.

name: Ayara, First of Locthwain
text: Mourning shifts seamlessly to celebration as she chooses her next suitor.

name: Riot Piker
text: He doesn't care whether he's rioting about trade rights or just having a drunken brawl. He wakes up every morning eager to smash some heads.

name: Imposing Visage
text:
"I can't believe they expect me to fight with this rabble. A Goblin in a big mask sends 'em running for cover."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Go for the Throat
text:
"Pray that night is upon us, for if this twilight is the work of the Necrons, we are all dead men."
—Address by Lieutenant Krakos prior to the Bloodmoon Massacres

name: Phyrexian Lens
text:
"There's nothing I wouldn't give to achieve victory. Can you say the same?"
—Tsabo Tavoc, to Gerrard

name: Sickening Dreams
text: The Patriarch dreams of vile plague.

name: Grabby Tabby
text: The milk bottle toss is closed until the rules can be amended.

name: Sower of Temptation
text:
Moth to my light, cease resistance.
Hand over the reins to your mind.

name: Soldevi Adnate
text:
"People love to follow fools; they don't feel so alone then."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Apprentice Wizard
text: Aspiring wizards must demonstrate basic levels of willpower and mental discipline to even be considered for an apprenticeship.

name: Spined Wurm
text: It has more teeth than fit in its mouth.

name: Divine Retribution
text:
"To the undiscerning eye, justice and vengeance can look the same."
—Rashida Scalebane

name: Artifact Possession
text: Any black mage could coax a Thraxodemon to inhabit a magical device.

name: Gossamer Chains
text:
"Harah swung his sword mightily, but still the air held him fast."
—Azeworai, "Kenechi's Dream"

name: Hydradoodle
text: Less housebroken than housebreaking.

name: Courage in Crisis
text: "Thanks to my father, I know how to fight. He also showed me why I must."

name: Grisly Survivor
text: No cartouches to earn. No afterlife to enter. Only the glory of a well-struck blow and the growing pile of felled enemies at her feet.

name: Thriving Rhino
text: As unpredictable as aether, and just as hard to contain.

name: Jackal Pup
text:
"Cry havoc and let slip the dogs of war."
—William Shakespeare, *Julius Caesar*

name: Fyndhorn Elves
text: „Wir können den Wald ebenso wenig verlassen wie die Sterne den Nachthimmel."

name: Urza's Power Plant
text: Artifact construction requires immense resources.

name: Urban Daggertooth
text: Stop, smell the roses, eat the peoples.

name: Fallaji Chaindancer
text: She was eager to show the invading Yotians how she earned her nickname, "The Sandstorm of Tomakul."

name: Meteor Shower
text:
"Eenie, meenie, minie, moe . . . oh, why not all of them?"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Resplendent Mentor
text: Thoughtweft gives new meaning to the phrase "common knowledge."

name: Cunning Nightbonder
text: "We are each other's shadow, fleeting yet always present."

name: Elite Cat Warrior
text: "Hear that? No? That's a cat warrior."

name: Magus of the Mirror
text: "Behold! The image of the enemy and all that she has. Trust your envy, and take it."

name: Phytohydra
text:
"Look at this creature, so like the Conclave it serves. Cut one head and it grows two. Damage it and it flourishes."
—Veszka, Selesnya evangel

name: Obsianus Golem
text:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone..."
—Song of the Artificer

name: Spear Spewer
text:
"Okay, maybe the 962nd spear will be the one that gets 'em!"
—Kreech, ballista operator

name: Prophetic Prism
text: To understand Ravnica, one must first understand how each guild contributes to its stability.

name: The Fall of Lord Konda // Fragment of Konda
text: For his transgressions against the kami, Lord Konda's immortal body was turned to stone, then shattered into a thousand still-living pieces.

name: Jungle Troll
text:
"You eat plants; I eat plants. You eat beasts; I eat you."
—Drulvurg, troll king

name: Vengeance
text: A bullet renders all sizes equal.

name: Rampart Crawler
text:
"Not even the magistrate in his lofty tower is out of our reach."
—Cateran overlord

name: Shadows' Verdict
text: The shadows of death fall over everyone in the end.

name: Thriving Ibex
text: Textiles at the Inventors' Fair feature threads from every corner of Kaladesh.

name: Prodigal Sorcerer
text: Occasionally, members of the Institute of Arcane Study acquire a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

name: Phyrexian War Beast
text:
"Deal with the spawn of Phyrexia cautiously; only with time may we control them."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Kitchen Imp
text: "Order up! Ooze aspic and jellied anurid eyes!"

name: Looming Hoverguard
text: Although mute, hoverguards get their message across loud and clear.

name: Trap Runner
text: "How could I catch her when the trees conspired to stop me?"

name: Thallid Soothsayer
text: Some of the thallids that escaped into the fens of Urborg began emulating the Cabal's bloodsoaked rituals in their own peculiar way.

name: Weakness
text: "For strength to have any meaning, there must also be . . . you."

name: Sabretooth Tiger
text: "Here, kitty kitty. Here, kitty kitty. Aaaaugh!"

name: Shatter Assumptions
text: Rigid minds are the first to break.

name: Rain of Blades
text: Some say they are the weapons of heroes fallen in battle, eager for one last chance at glory.

name: Moon-Blessed Cleric
text: Selûne guides her devotees with majestic wisdom and grace.

name: Training Grounds
text: "Practice alone will not bring perfection. The practice itself must be perfect. Again!"

name: Crimson Manticore
text: Noted neither for their good looks nor their charm, manticores can be fearsome allies. As dinner companions, however, they are best left alone.

name: Withering Gaze
text: "Nature cares not for the knowledge to be gained from its study. Better to bleed it dry, lest its potential be wasted on lizards and leaves."

name: Elvish Ranger
text:
"How can any human hope to match our skills? We are children of Fyndhorn, and its sap runs in our veins."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

name: An-Zerrin Ruins
text:
"The An-Zerrins have served me well, ever since I first killed them."
—Baron Sengir

name: Cackling Flames
text:
"I like a little entertainment with my dinner."
—Rakdos

name: Mummy Paramount
text:
"It appears some mummies have begun to observe a hierarchy all their own."
—Elekh, vizier of embalming

name: Sek'Kuar, Deathkeeper
text: The orcs believe Sek'Kuar still lives in the Karplusan Mountains, gathering his dead army, intent on revenge.

name: Serra's Emissary
text: Where swords fail, faith transcends.

name: Monastery Mentor
text: "The past does not determine our present."

name: Bee Sting
text:
Busy as a bumblebee, blistered as a goblin.
—Alaborn saying

name: Jungleborn Pioneer
text: "We fought so long to hide this place. Let us be first to learn its wonders!"

name: Village Survivors
text: As their villages fell to werewolves, fleeing refugees discovered they too had remarkable survival instincts.

name: Cancel
text: Zendikar's volatile mana is the basis for many spectacular spells—and some equally astonishing failures.

name: Steward of Valeron
text: Knight-stewards guard the Sun-Dappled Court, a grove of immense, sculptured olive trees that represent Valeron's twelve noble families.

name: Kasmina's Transmutation
text:
"Hop away now, little Eternal. Go eat some flies."
—Kasmina

name: Jermane, Pride of the Circus
text: "Don't worry about me, folks! This beauty was well-fed by my predecessor."

name: Zodiac Snake
text: "Thrice Xuande's ardent quest led to Nanyang, / Where Sleeping Dragon unveiled Han's partition: . . ."

name: Sabretooth Tiger
text:
"Daughter, it is now your turn to hunt the Tiger, and make a blanket of its fur."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Silvercoat Lion
text: Hunters of every species on the savannah, silvercoats disdain camouflage in favor of total dominance of the food chain.

name: Haunted Cloak
text: Bear the weight of so many spirits and you'll surrender civility and restraint to savagery and instinct.

name: Spurred Wolverine
text: After a few painful experiences, goblins learned not to pick their noses around the beasts.

name: Dauntless Survivor
text: "I've got a little surprise for you, beasties! Come and get it!"

name: Rushed Rebirth
text: Witherbloom students learn to see death not as tragedy, but as opportunity.

name: Rashida Scalebane
text: It is not by the blood of dragons that Rashida measures victories, but by the sum of children who no longer wake from nightmares of scales and fire.

name: Sporeback Wolf
text: The mushrooms growing in the wolves' fur possess curative properties incredible enough to tempt many alchemists into risking their lives to track one down.

name: Jaspera Sentinel
text: The arrows of the elvish elite strike as true and deadly as the fangs of the Cosmos Serpent they revere.

name: Shady Traveler // Stalking Predator
text: The stranger spoke to no one, and the townspeople gladly returned the favor.

name: Topple the Statue
text: Bolas cared little when his statue fell, thinking it a useful distraction, underestimating the surge of resolve it gave his opponents.

name: Arcus Acolyte
text: "Archery requires holding an enormous amount of tension and making it look effortless."

name: Hunter's Edge
text: The hunt ends. Lunch begins.

name: Orzhov Racketeers
text: "Looks like you need protection."

name: Lingering Phantom
text:
"True power never dies, but lies awake, waiting for its name to be spoken."
—*The Eldest Reborn*

name: Run Out of Town
text: Better to depart in haste than be dearly departed.

name: Cateran Kidnappers
text: Recruits aren't always volunteers.

name: Tome of the Guildpact
text:
"Reading it has given me a glimpse of what makes this deeply flawed city so very magnificent."
—Dovin Baan

name: Scion of the Ur-Dragon
text: "I am the blood of the ur-dragon, coursing through all dragonkind."

name: Fire Elemental
text: Fire Elementals are ruthless infernos, annihilating and consuming their foes in a frenzied holocaust. Crackling and blazing, they sear swift, terrible paths, leaving the land charred and scorched in their wake.

name: Macabre Mockery
text: The Rakdos put the "fun" in "funeral."

name: Lignify
text: Bulgo paused, puzzled. What was that rustling sound, and why did he feel so stiff? And how could his *feet* be so thirsty?

name: Leaping Lizard
text:
"I never question the Autumn Willow about her motives, not even when she turns people into lizards. It's her way."
—Devin, faerie noble

name: Ironroot Treefolk
text:
"'I'll show you how to handle the treefolk!' the giant bragged, and he strode off into the forest. Two days later he returned, his face masked in sap and a nest behind his ear. None dared ask who won."
—Azeworai, "The Treeling"

name: Sanctum Weaver
text: The arrival of spring's first flowers is a sacred occasion to Karametra's acolytes, who fill the Setessan woods with song in celebration.

name: Feast or Famine
text:
"We are not yet free of Lim-Dûl's terrors."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Imaryll, Elfhame Elite
text: The elvish kingdoms of Llanowar are united in their distrust of outsiders.

name: Pikemen
text: "As the cavalry bore down, we faced them with swords drawn and pikes hidden in the grass at our feet. 'Don't lift your pikes 'til I give the word,' I said." —Maeveen O'Donagh, *Memoirs of a Soldier*

name: Ponder
text: Eternal Weekend 2022 Legacy

name: Locket of Yesterdays
text: Every hour, at the turning of the glass, its owner had whispered to the locket, seeding it with secrets. This would be her legacy, her memory, if the rifts should take her.

name: Paradigm Shift
text:
"Barrin always said that reality is relative. 'The world,' he cautioned, 'is but pieces of one's perception.'"
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Icatian Infantry
text: Although they had long been concerned about the Order of the Ebon Hand, the Icatians faced an even greater threat from Goblin and Orcish raiders.

name: Mountain Goat
text:
"Folklore has it that to capture a Mountain Goat is a sign of divine blessing. I just know it's a sign that dinner is on the way."
—Klazina Jansdotter, Leader of the Order of the Sacred Torch

name: Nostalgic Dreams
text: Seton dreams of life renewed.

name: Trollbred Guardian
text: His favorite food is kraul.

name: Soltari Trooper
text:
"Dauthi blood is Soltari wine."
—Soltari Tales of Life

name: Foul Orchard
text: The stench of rotting meat lures flies, goblins, and young raptors.

name: Kessig Malcontents
text: Discontent is a powerful weapon in the hands of a mob.

name: Mind Spring
text: Fragments of thought refract and multiply, surging in a geyser of dizzying insight.

name: Order of the Ebon Hand
text:
"There are intriguing similarities between the Order and Icatia's Leitbur religion, suggesting the two had a common origin."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI*

name: Captain Sisay
text: Her leadership forged the *Weatherlight*'s finest crew.

name: Chrome Cat
text:
"I always say, 'If it's breathing, it's lying.' Luckily my friend here does neither."
—Lord Xander

name: Contaminated Bond
text:
"My favorite curses are those that manifest slowly, blackening the soul in ways the victim cannot hope to understand."
—Erissa, bog witch

name: Flowstone Mauler
text: Once these horrifying creatures were perfected, there was no need for armodons.

name: Juzám Djinn
text:
"Expect my visit when the darkness comes. The night I think is best for hiding all."
—Ouallada

name: Saberclaw Golem
text: The warriors of the Blade Tribe charged the golem, twenty strong. They returned numbering ten . . . and a half.

name: Frostweb Spider
text: Its white webs glitter, mimicking the frost on the tree's branches.

name: Visions of Beyond
text:
"The past is the foundation for all that exists in the present. We merely reconstruct what our ancestors have already discovered."
—Sachimir, Sage of Memories

name: Embalmer's Tools
text:
"They might be dead, but these mummies are masters of their trade."
—Jace Beleren

name: Vedalken Infuser
text: "All plans begin as dreams. I intend to awaken them."

name: Order of Whiteclay
text: Made from the clay of burial mounds, the face paint of the priests is a sign of their respect for those whose rest they interrupt.

name: Bonded Herdbeast // Plated Kilnbeast
text: Though both had lost their families, the *eludha*—the spiritual connection between the monsters of Ikoria and their human bonders—gave them something greater.

name: Urza's Incubator
text:
"Our recruitment drives are bringing in fewer fresh troops every day. We need a new strategy."
—Urza, to Tawnos

name: Boiling Seas
text: What burns the land, boils the seas.

name: Rock Badger
text: The Kyren goblins created most of the inverted mountain's tunnels simply by driving the beast before them.

name: Untethered Express
text: Rules and rails are made to be broken.

name: Satyr's Cunning
text: It's hard to keep a satyr down, even in the Underworld.

name: Master Splicer
text: With Phyrexia's victory at hand, each sect began perfecting its vision.

name: Qasali Pridemage
text: An elder in one pride, of the Sigiled caste in another.

name: Well of Lost Dreams
text: Some say the knowledge lost during the Ritual of Rebuking is returned through the well's waters.

name: Idol of Oblivion
text: "Arise, great one, and cleanse the world of our enemies!"

name: Spidersilk Net
text: "Dragons are our betters, but we will fight them if our dragonlord orders it."

name: Death Pit Offering
text:
"Kill them all and feed them to the new recruits."
—Crovax

name: Curator of Mysteries
text: To consult a sphinx is a test in patience. Perhaps that's the point.

name: Nighthaze
text:
"To evade the brood lineages, one must be made dark to all the senses."
—Traga, Zulaport runner

name: Cast Down
text:
"We simply cannot tolerate a petty thief among the servants. I'm afraid I'll have to let you go."
—Rog, steward of House Rillyn

name: Nantuko Mentor
text:
That which grows without roots cannot be uprooted.
—Nantuko teaching

name: Bounty Agent
text: "Lately I've seen the biggest bounties of my career—and for the biggest names."

name: Chandra, Gremlin Wrangler
text: "Sure, I could set things on fire by myself. But teamwork can be fun, too."

name: Horned Sliver
text: A bristling wave of slivers broke against the *Weatherlight's* timbers.

name: Overburden
text: The Kipamu League knew what Keld refused to acknowledge: the land could support no more.

name: Fiery Hellhound
text: Once a barbarian army has conquered a region, their shamans summon hellhounds that keep undesirables out and prisoners in.

name: Woolly Spider
text:
"We need not fear the forces of the air; I've yet to see a Spider without an appetite."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Dega Disciple
text: "There is no true equity of power. There is only more and less."

name: Mobilization
text: Newcomers to Otaria find themselves at the bottom of the heap. In the pits, they at least have the chance to climb atop a heap of bodies.

name: Viashino Skeleton
text: Underneath the Dregscape lay the remains of creatures long extinct from Grixis.

name: Giant Mantis
text:
"I hate insects of every sort. The only mercy is that they are generally small."
—Mwani, Mtenda goatherd

name: Drench the Soil in Their Blood
text: "Are they dead yet? No? Then my previous order stands."

name: Madcap Skills
text: The larger the crowd, the harder it is for them to run away.

name: Sorin's Thirst
text: "All your steel won't protect you if your will is weak."

name: Awaken the Bear
text: When Temur warriors enter the battle trance known as "awakening the bear," they lose all sense of enemy or friend, seeing only threats to the wilderness.

name: Soul Bleed
text: Whether the end comes swift or slow, it always comes too soon.

name: Fusion Elemental
text: As the shards merged into the Maelstrom, their mana energies fused into new monstrosities.

name: Temple of the False God
text: Those who bring nothing to the temple take nothing away.

name: Flummoxed Cyclops
text:
"A cyclops thinks slowly but strikes quickly. Try to keep it thinking."
—Brigone, soldier of Meletis

name: Angelic Shield
text:
"If only an angel's wings could shelter us all."
—Barrin, master wizard

name: Planar Disruption
text: New Phyrexia's planar defenses scattered the Planeswalker strike team on arrival. Elesh Norn knew they were coming.

name: Drogskol Reaver
text: Wracked and warped with anguish, it obsessively seeks out other souls to hoard within its eternal prison.

name: Wild Jhovall
text: Jhovalls sharpen their claws on trees—or on Mercadians, if no trees are handy.

name: Runic Repetition
text: "What some call obsession, I call the quest for perfection."

name: Blinding Angel
text: "Their eyes will shrivel and blacken before faith's true light."

name: Mardu Scout
text: The Mardu all enjoy war, but only the goblins make a game of it.

name: Warped Researcher
text: New insights yield new senses.

name: Suspicious Shambler
text: It was the perfect disguise—at least until its stomach started moaning.

name: Brace for Impact
text: Flesh can be tempered by spellcraft and forged ever stronger by the hammers of foes.

name: Infectious Host
text:
"Lost man, dead man, knocking on the door. Cankerman, soreman, knock no more."
—Ravnican children's rhyme

name: Coal Stoker
text:
"The day is mine! I sent three such creatures against my foe, then watched as my magefire popped her soldiers like overripe spleenfruits."
—Dobruk the Unstable, pyromancer

name: Door to Nothingness
text: Only a monster could create such a door. Only a fool would open it.

name: Death's Presence
text:
"We traffic in flesh, not souls. Still, it's a shame to let anything go to waste."
—Cevraya, Golgari shaman

name: Trumpet Blast
text: The sound of the trumpets lights a fire in the hearts of the bold and snuffs the courage of the cowardly.

name: Imperial Recruiter
text: A passionate recruiter will win a war before the first arrow flies.

name: Contempt
text:
"Predictable little man. In all these years you taught me so much yet learned so little."
—Volrath, to Starke

name: Festival
text: Only after the townsfolk had drawn us into their merry celebration did we discover that their holiday rituals held a deeper purpose.

name: Roughshod Mentor
text: He didn't hear the cries of the treefolk whose branches he snapped or of the elves caught underfoot. He had eyes only for the path ahead.

name: Sulfurous Mire
text:
"In my youth, we used to best each other at hopping rabbit-fast between the lava spouts, the burning tar spattering our legs."
—Iskene, Kannah storyteller

name: Wind Dancer
text: The sky is her stage.

name: Fling
text: Never flinch. Never falter. Never fear.

name: Combat Medic
text:
"Without Combat Medics, Icatia would probably not have withstood the forces of chaos as long as it did."
—*Sarpadian Empires*, vol. VI

name: Death Frenzy
text: The crocodiles' putrid jaws swallow everything but the screams.

name: Fleeting Distraction
text:
"To distract an archmage would take incredible power. But for a simpleton, something sparkly will do."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

name: Rebbec, Architect of Ascension
text:
"She sees beyond technology to what it enables."
—Glacian, powerstone engineer

name: Symbiotic Beast
text: The insects found a meal in the carrion of the beast's prey. The beast found a spiffy new hairstyle.

name: Frilled Sandwalla
text: It basks atop the rubble of Rhonas's monument, which still pulses with latent power.

name: Illusory Angel
text:
"In a daze, I woke and looked upon the battlefield, where I could swear my dreams were laying waste to the enemy."
—Letter from a soldier

name: Thrull Champion
text:
"Those idiots should never have bred Thrulls for combat!"
—Jherana Rure

name: Chain Reaction
text:
"We train for the improbable, like lightning striking the same place twice, or striking everywhere at once."
—Nundari, Sea Gate militia captain

name: Thalia, Guardian of Thraben
text: "Thraben belongs to the living. I will not rest until it is cleansed."

name: Crush Underfoot
text:
Five-toed grave
—Kithkin phrase meaning "a giant's footprint"

name: Claim the Firstborn
text:
"The deal was struck and the favor had been done. And so, under the cover of night, the debt was paid."
—*Tales of the Fae*

name: Grafdigger's Cage
text:
"If you wind up in one of mine, you can be sure as silver it will be your last."
—Grafdigger Wulmer

name: Ichor Elixir
text: The corrupted essence of Kaldheim's World Tree became the seed from which New Phyrexia's Realmbreaker grew.

name: Elenda, the Dusk Rose
text: Her centuries-long search is ended.

name: Pyroconvergence
text:
"The Izzet are an equation that turns lunacy into explosions."
—Leonos, Azorius arbiter

name: Screeching Harpy
text:
"They are called 'fowl' for a reason."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Krark's Thumb // Krark's Thumb
text: As a child, Slobad fashioned a music box out of the wayward digit. Its simple tune was his sole companion on many lonely nights.

name: Turn to Dust
text: Mirrodin's inhabitants must be prepared for anything—including suddenly being unprepared.

name: No Quarter
text: As Gerrard and Greven neared each other, the moggs caught between them realized they should flee.

name: Malfunction
text: "They don't make them like they used to."

name: Dragonloft Idol
text: The idols were forged during the time of the Khanfall, when the dragons came to rule Tarkir and its people aligned themselves with the five dragonlords.

name: Tower of Calamities
text: The ur-golems concealed one of their towers out of fear that its power would be abused, and in anticipation of a time when its power would be sorely needed.

name: Llanowar Elves
text: Whenever the Llanowar Elves gather the fruits of their forest, they leave one plant of each type untouched, considering that nature's portion.

name: Sky-Eel School
text: They swim on tides few can see, away from a threat few yet understand.

name: Icefall
text: As the Thaw met Terisiare, mountains shed their icy skins, crushing homes and hopes alike.

name: Moan of the Unhallowed
text: For a ghoul, every village is a buffet and every disaster is a reunion.

name: Angelfire Ignition
text: "My angel is the flint, and I am her steel."

name: Emmara Tandris
text: When Selesnya needed a champion, Emmara put the ranks of her guild before herself—making her the perfect choice.

name: Tolarian Winds
text: Afterward, Tolaria's winds were like the whispers of lost wizards, calling for life.

name: Kjeldoran Skycaptain
text:
"If we do our duty and uphold our honor, Kjeldor shall stand for a thousand years."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

name: Gerrard's Wisdom
text: A picture is worth a thousand swords.

name: Sheltering Boughs
text:
"We're not at odds with the woods. How could we be, when we share so many enemies?"
—Marel, Dawnhart witch

name: Skred
text:
"This close to Rimewind Keep, no avalanche is nature's doing."
—Ukoten, centaur chieftain

name: Fungal Bloom
text:
"Thallids could absorb energy from the forest itself. Even Elves were at a disadvantage in fighting them."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*

name: Forfend
text:
"Suddenly there stood a fortress protecting the clachan, its walls hewn of valor and mortared with honor."
—*Clachan Tales*

name: Savvy Hunter
text: None of the other villagers dare venture into the wilds, so she feeds the whole hamlet herself.

name: Treasure Map // Treasure Cove
text: Half the treasure is the glory of finding it.

name: Golgari Rotwurm
text: Like corpse-worms through a carapace, rotwurms slide through the hollowed bones of the undercity.

name: Charge Through
text:
"What a move! Lorehold gets caught flat-footed, and Witherbloom barrels ahead."
—Cremik, Mage Tower commentator

name: Ghosts of the Damned
text: The voices of the dead ring in the heart long after they have faded from the ears.

name: Satyr Rambler
text: A satyr is bound by nothing—not home, not family, not loyalty.

name: Rootwalla
text: They make terrible pets ... unless you don't like your other pets.

name: Kessig Recluse
text: Its silk is highly prized, but then again, so is your life.

name: Harmonize
text: "Words lie. People lie. The land tells the truth."

name: Oracle of Dust
text: Whatever it is searching for, it will stop at nothing to find it.

name: Storm Fleet Aerialist
text: "Only one thing beats the freedom of the sea: the freedom of the sky."

name: Vineglimmer Snarl
text: A verdant paradox of primal logic.

name: Darksteel Ingot
text: The lich poured his soul into a new phylactery. True immortality was finally at his fingertips.

name: Narrow Escape
text: He could find no strength left to budge, no power left to fight, no will left to live. Luckily, they could find him.

name: Wood Elves
text: Through the waves of Eldrazi attacks, the Murasan jungles seemed to regrow as soon as they were destroyed.

name: Gust Walker
text: "I'm never unarmed."

name: Dune-Brood Nephilim
text: When it awoke, it spawned nameless thousands to herald its arrival.

name: Burning Earth
text:
"Your world is formed from the same power that wraps my burning hand around your throat."
—Shrazik, lavamancer

name: Tolarian Serpent
text:
"When the fishtails' threats of magic didn't move me, they set their pet on us."
—Tahngarth of the *Weatherlight*

name: Nature's Revolt
text:
"One day the land will don the semblance of flesh and challenge even the plowshare's blade."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Rip-Clan Crasher
text: If you breathe, she will fight you. If you breathe fire, she must fight you.

name: Gutwrencher Oni
text:
"Blood drips. Blood sings. Blood devours all and only blood remains."
—Ogre chant

name: Slash the Ranks
text: The generals each surveyed their devastated forces. Then, slowly, they turned to each other and raised their swords.

name: Star of Extinction
text:
"The visions haunt me. I see the end of the world, brought on by the search for the Immortal Sun."
—Shaper Pashona

name: Waker of Waves
text: On the open sea, there is nowhere to hide.

name: Death's Approach
text:
"It's cold in the grave, and the dead crave your warmth. Who are you to deny them?"
—Strava, Dimir mage

name: Flourishing Defenses
text: Many horrors take the bait of brave elf volunteers walking alone, only to fall to the blades of rescuers lurking nearby.

name: Devouring Light
text: "Even your shadow is too foul to tolerate."

name: Malach of the Dawn
text:
"The sun rises, but the world still feels dark. Pray for the arrival of the malachim—they'll bring Dawn to the world and to our hearts."
—Sister Betje, *Miracles of the Saints*

name: Kinjalli's Sunwing
text:
"There are moments when I feel I could fly like the sunwing. Far away I would soar, but always a golden gale pushes me back."
—Huatli

name: Renewing Dawn
text: Dawn brings a new day, and a new day brings hope.

name: Dross Crocodile
text: The necrogen may have taken its sight, but it can still taste the fear of its prey.

name: Lose Calm
text: A lifetime of discipline forsaken in a moment of rage.

name: Skyclave Geopede
text: Wrenched from the ground like a dirt-caked rock, the ancient Skyclave wriggled with life.

name: Jubilant Skybonder
text: She was born unable to walk. Through the eludha, she was able to fly.

name: Hurloon Minotaur
text: The minotaurs of the Hurloon Mountains are known for their love of battle. They are also known for their hymns to the dead, sung for friend and foe alike. These hymns can last for days, filling the mountain valleys with their low, haunting sounds.

name: Gatekeeper Gargoyle
text: Each night it visits a different guildgate around the city, digging its talons into fresh stone.

name: Goblin Trashmaster
text: "Folks 'round here are too in love with their contraptions. Does them some good if we smash one every so often."

name: Blood Curdle
text: Fear pierces the strongest armor.

name: Vampire Envoy
text: "Zendikar will fight until it has bled its last."

name: Debilitating Injury
text: Weakness exists within all who are not dragons.

name: Essence Symbiote
text: The Ozolith's appearance spawned a new era of wild mutation on Ikoria. Some creatures hunted different prey, lived in new habitats, and thrived on mutation itself.

name: Reinterpret
text:
"With just a little added flair, your work could be truly spectacular. Let me show you."
—Nassari, Prismari dean

name: Wind Drake
text: Drakes prowl the skies of Kaladesh, waiting for the perfect moment to strike.

name: Grim Monolith
text: Part prison, part home.

name: Headstone
text:
"Your headstone is the last page in the book of your life."
—Murat, Death Speaker

name: Brazen Dwarf
text: "My grandmother saved the life of a brass dragon, and in return she was given a glimpse of the fire in its heart—a glimpse she passed down to me."

name: Negate
text: "As one, nature lifts its voice to tell you this: 'No.'"

name: Bull Aurochs
text: The aurochs herd is content to graze—until the bull provides the dissenting urge to charge.

name: Seed Spark
text:
"If you ask me, those root-lovers value mindless dogma over progress."
—Trivaz, Izzet mage

name: Soul Feast
text: As no one has ever accepted a second invitation to Davvol's table, the evincar often dines alone.

name: Jayemdae Tome
text:
"Knowledge is power."
—Sir Francis Bacon, *Meditationes Sacrae*

name: Dirtcowl Wurm
text: Few of Rath's rivers follow a steady course, so many new channels are carved for them.

name: Steady Aim
text: The archer's heart broke seeing her compatriots die far below, but she held position until the enemy was in range.

name: Farrelite Priest
text: Although their methods were often brutal, Farrel's followers believed in the preservation of justice and virtue.

name: Letter of Acceptance
text: The letter unfolded, inviting the twins to Strixhaven. Will saw a chance for arcane study. Rowan saw a chance for power.

name: Marble Diamond
text: The essence of sunlight to brighten the way.

name: Defiler of Souls
text:
"Stray not into sin, lest you face the doorman of an insatiable tomb."
—Prayer of Asha

name: Blue Sun's Zenith
text:
"The Origin Query will wait. We must ensure we survive to return to it."
—Pelyus, vedalken ordinar

name: Legion Angel
text: "We are many, and righteous."

name: Seeker of Skybreak
text: Seekers spend their lives protecting a home they rarely visit.

name: Ramunap Excavator
text: "This world was once so much more than the confines of Naktamun."

name: Sacred Ground
text: The knight knelt and prayed, first for the sanctity of his land and second for the strength to repel its invaders.

name: Burglar Rat
text:
"Even rats hoard their treasures. Are your precious things so different?"
—Izoni

name: Spelleater Wolverine
text:
"The monster that scares me the most isn't the biggest."
—Taelya, Lavabrink pyromage

name: Venarian Glimmer
text: Dream of nothing, and wake to a dream come true.

name: Psionic Sliver
text: They evolved the ability to concentrate their neural activity into a single pulse, causing a disruptive but usually suicidal blast of psionic energy.

name: Elvish Spirit Guide
text:
"We are never without guidance, if we but seek it."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Luminous Broodmoth
text: It soars through currents of moonbeams to give hope to the forsaken.

name: Court of Grace
text: A righteous sovereign makes for a blessed realm.

name: Track Down
text: Scents fade and footprints wash away, but some trails can never be erased.

name: Wonder
text:
"The awestruck birds gazed at Wonder. Slowly, timidly, they rose into the air."
—*Scroll of Beginnings*

name: Divine Transformation
text: Glory surged through her and radiance surrounded her. All things were possible with the blessing of the Divine.

name: Repeal
text:
"Your deed cannot be undone. You, however, can be."
—Agosto, Azorius imperator

name: Vorstclaw
text:
"Where'd the werewolves go? Maybe *that* got hungry."
—Halana of Ulvenwald

name: Field Creeper
text: As it walks across the fallow field, its awkward, loping gait matches the rattling in its head to create a haunting rhythm that chills the bones.

name: Entomb
text:
"I'll return once you've ripened."
—Ghoulcaller Gisa

name: Corpse Traders
text: Those without breath can't complain.

name: Provoke
text:
"Never start a fight you can't finish."
—Padril, council guardian

name: Farseek
text: "Once we have claimed this planet, we will claim the stars."

name: Keeper of Keys
text: For the right price, he'll unlock your path to the throne.

name: Steam Vents
text:
"A massive new Izzet building project with an unstated purpose? Probably fine."
—Zija, Simic mutationist

name: Heated Debate
text: "While you were wasting time with abstract equations, I mastered ancient Oggyar fire magic. Your move."

name: Languish
text: Life is such a fragile thing.

name: Lady Evangela
text: "When milady was young, the sight of a rainbow would fill her soul with peace. As she grew, she learned to share her rapture with others." —*Lady Gabriella*

name: Giant Growth
text:
"Here in Fyndhorn, the goddess Freyalise is generous to her children."
—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order

name: Burning Sun's Avatar
text:
"Tilonalli's searing rays carry the spark of life's eventual destruction as all light fades."
—Chitlati, Lightning Rider

name: Dreg Recycler
text: Bodies too damaged to survive phyresis are collected and broken down into useful raw materials.

name: Coerced Confession
text:
"Ask the right questions in the right way and truth is inevitable."
—Lazav

name: Clear a Path
text: "Why do guards always look surprised when we bash them?" asked Ruric. "I think they expect a bribe," said Thar.

name: Obsianus Golem
text:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone . . ."
—Song of the Artificer

name: Demonic Tutor
text: Liliana learned the secrets she sought, but at a price that was etched on her fate.

name: Hyalopterous Lemure
text:
"The lemures looked harmless, until they descended on my troops. Within moments, only bones remained."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Negate
text:
"You cannot be an Ojutai monk. They prize wisdom and skill, and you have neither."
—Siara, the Dragon's Mouth

name: Whispering Shade
text: It glides through the shadows until it reaches yours.

name: Hanweir Watchkeep // Bane of Hanweir
text: He scans for wolves, knowing there's one he can never anticipate.

name: Sentinel Tower
text: The built-in obstacles force competitors to think three moves ahead.

name: Azami, Lady of Scrolls
text: "Fashion belongs to those with the luxuries of style and taste. I have both."

name: Stonebrow, Krosan Hero
text: Moments after a fickle rift dropped Stonebrow in the waste of his beloved Krosa, he took up his axe in rage-blind vengeance.

name: Noyan Dar, Roil Shaper
text: After many years as a lullmage, Noyan Dar turned his talents from allaying Zendikar's fury to the considerably easier task of rousing it.

name: Wirewood Hivemaster
text: "Most insects have been drawn to the Mirari. But all that remain in Wirewood are under my care."

name: Basri's Acolyte
text: Basri carries on his god's legacy, spreading her teachings throughout the Multiverse.

name: Lumengrid Warden
text: The Neurok, like the vedalken, are on a constant quest for knowledge. It is their currency, their trade, their life.

name: Owlbear
text: Many people believe a misguided wizard created the first owlbear, but others insist that these creatures have always dwelled in the Feywild.

name: Barrin, Master Wizard
text:
"Knowledge is no more expensive than ignorance, and at least as satisfying."
—Barrin, master wizard

name: Charmed Stray
text:
"There's something peculiar about the cats today."
—Janoc, Tin Street tinker

name: Devouring Deep
text: "Full fathom five thy father lies;/ Of his bones are coral made;/ Those are pearls that were his eyes;/ Nothing of him that doth fade,/ But doth suffer a sea-change/ Into something rich and strange." —William Shakespeare, *The Tempest*

name: Castle Sengir
text: Where hope has no champion, evil rules all.

name: Arc Lightning
text:
"It is vain to look for a defense against lightning."
—Publius Syrus, Maxim 835, trans. Lyman

name: Angelic Blessing
text: A peasant can do more by faith than a king by proclamation.

name: Elvish Fury
text: Fail to respect the forest and you will fertilize it.

name: Resolute Strike
text:
"If you practice something often enough, it becomes part of you. That's why we train, and that's why we survive."
—Tasha, Graypelt veteran

name: Rishadan Port
text: 2020 Legacy Champion

name: Sabertooth Nishoba
text: They sneer at the terrestrial dangers found on peaks and shores, eager to prove themselves against new and even mightier foes.

name: Zodiac Dog
text: ". . . Jiang Wei alone still strove with might and main: / Nine times more he fought the north—in vain. . . ."

name: Shipwreck Singer
text: Her melody melds death and beauty with such artistry that even the gods weep to hear it.

name: Act of Treason
text: Seen through Rakdos eyes, a cruel betrayal is a hilarious stunt.

name: Zhur-Taa Goblin
text: Among the Zhur-Taa Clan, goblins are the first to enter battlefury. When the battle is over, the survivors are still frothing at the mouth, looking for someone to hit.

name: Sunken Field
text: The land is heavy with promise, the harvest ripe with betrayal.

name: Morbid Curiosity
text: "Every creation carries a piece of its creators. Their knowledge, their dreams, their soul. That is the best part."

name: Growing Rites of Itlimoc // Itlimoc, Cradle of the Sun
text:
"The true treasures of our world are found in the wild places, where Ixalli's light shines brightest."
—Huatli

name: Shadow Sliver
text: These slivers, trapped between worlds since the Rathi overlay, are among the last to claim direct lineage from the lost Sliver Queen.

name: Battlegrowth
text: "I would gladly die for the forest, but I'm much better at killing for it."

name: Shivan Hellkite
text: A dragon's scale can be carved into a mighty shield, provided you can procure a dragontooth to cut it.

name: Murder
text:
"Pave your path to the throne with yet another body if you must, Sarevok. It will make your stolen godhood no less false."
—Gorion, wise mentor

name: Kindercatch
text: In the forest villages of Kessig, parents feed their children wormwood and other bitter herbs, hoping to make them less palatable to things that roam the night.

name: Swarm Surge
text: The Eldrazi rampaged across Zendikar in a tide of chittering, heaving flesh.

name: Nimblewright Schematic
text:
"While it is certainly a unique touch, Jan, does the mustache really need to be there?"
—High Artificer Andar Beech

name: Jungle Shrine
text: On Naya, ambition and treachery are scarce, hunted nearly to extinction by the awe owed to terrestrial gods.

name: Twinshot Sniper
text: "Pierce the heart and pierce the head, even the mightiest fall down dead."

name: Hollowhenge Spirit
text: Some spirits mourn. Others terrorize.

name: Rebuff the Wicked
text:
"I cannot teach you their brand of magic, but I can teach you how to defend against it."
—Tavalus, priest of Korlis

name: Armageddon
text:
"'O miserable of happy! Is this the end Of this new glorious world . . . ?'"
—John Milton, *Paradise Lost*

name: Dungrove Elder
text: All the trees of the forest are his army, and every leaf his shield.

name: Feast of Blood
text:
"The best part of a wedding is the cutting of the cake, followed closely by the cutting of the cake decorator."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Wyluli Wolf
text: "When one wolf calls, others follow. Who wants to fight creatures that eat scorpions?" —Maimun al-Wyluli, *Diary*

name: Sultai Emissary
text: To the Sultai, Ugin's power was just one more resource to be exploited.

name: Dingus Staff
text:
"A sharp conscience is the weapon of the soul."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

name: Puncture Blast
text: Gnarltrunk didn't remember having quite that many knotholes.

name: Mass Mutiny
text:
"What say you, my most trusted advisors? . . . Advisors?"
—Edra, merfolk sovereign

name: Mind Sludge
text: When you get into the swamp, the swamp gets into you.

name: Shivan Reef
text: The boiling seas around Shiv provided a welcome layer of protection for the reclaimed Mana Rig.

name: Siege Mastodon
text:
"Defending the citadel is easy. I just take these big fellows outside the main gate and let the enemy take a good long look."
—Mastodon keeper

name: Blind with Anger
text:
"I can post only the most honorable and strong-willed samurai to defend your stronghold. I have seen what can happen to lesser men."
—General Takeno, letter to Lord Konda

name: Cosmic Horror
text: "Then flashed the living lightning from her eyes,/ And screams of horror rend th' affrighted skies." —Alexander Pope, *The Rape of the Lock*

name: Strongarm Monk
text:
"His companions are wise to follow him, for his foes dare not stand in his way."
—Zhiada, Dirgur protector

name: Supply Caravan
text:
"We each have a weight to carry on the road to the afterlife."
—Oketra, god of solidarity

name: Sol Ring
text: "Every bead tells a story. They speak of the obstacles we overcome. They speak of the communities we build, the milk we offer our friends, and the land that feeds our people. We weave meaning, tradition, and strength into everything."

name: Loyal Apprentice
text: Those with knowledge are wise to listen to those with imagination.

name: Falkenrath Noble
text: "I often think on how excited they must feel to be chosen as my prey."

name: Viridian Joiner
text: "The Tangle reaches out to itself constantly, forming new connections. We must follow its example."

name: Skyshroud Claim
text: The forest's constant struggle is to keep the spreading flowstone at bay.

name: Wall of Fire
text:
"Struggle, and you will only fan the flames."
—Talibah, embermage

name: Mourning Thrull
text: During their ascent to spirithood, patriarchs of Orzhova shed both flesh and emotion. This earthly slag is collected and formed into thrulls.

name: Amareth, the Lustrous
text: "Come closer, dear, and let me see that bauble. I've got a match for it somewhere..."

name: Night Terrors
text: Innistrad is a place where dreams invade the mind and mere shadows exact a terrible toll.

name: Liliana's Standard Bearer
text: The purple banner of the House of Vess is a symbol of death wherever it's flown.

name: Drooling Ogre
text:
"Is it the stomping kind or the munching kind?"
—Slobad, goblin tinkerer

name: Gluttonous Cyclops
text: The cyclops had learned to never eat a shepherd. Instead he gently flung the "pit" aside to grow a new flock.

name: Tasha's Hideous Laughter
text: The raging behir reared back, opened its terrible maw . . . and collapsed in a fit of horrifying giggles.

name: Searing Wind
text:
"The first wind of ascension is Forger, burning away impurity."
—*Keld Triumphant*

name: Goblin Fireslinger
text: A rock between your eyes hurts. A burning rock between your eyes ruins your whole day.

name: Lim-Dûl's High Guard
text:
"The guard will forever stand ready. For them, death is merely an inconvenience, not an ending."
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn

name: King Cheetah
text:
If you find yourself and a friend being chased by a King Cheetah, you have but one chance: Trip your friend.
—Suq'Ata wisdom

name: Ayara, Widow of the Realm // Ayara, Furnace Queen
text: Ayara cherished her new machine servitors just as much as she once did her many suitors: not at all.

name: Puppet's Verdict
text:
"What was heads again?"
—Mercadian magistrate

name: Azure Fleet Admiral
text:
"Your concern for my safety is touching, but as long as your gunners remain reliably erratic, I see no reason to change course."
—Admiral Yelise, to Commodore Axurik

name: Contentious Plan
text: Niv-Mizzet had perfected a plan, but he had no control over the mortal minds who had to agree to implement it.

name: Sakura-Tribe Elder
text: There were no tombstones in orochi territory. Slain warriors were buried with a tree sapling, so they would become a part of the forest after death.

name: Unchained Berserker
text: Sathros turned his restraints to revenge.

name: Hunting Grounds
text:
"Don't be silly. Panthers don't hunt in packs!"
—Jego, disgraced archdruid

name: Lingering Tormentor
text: The bogeyman doesn't disappear when you close your eyes.

name: Skyward Eye Prophets
text: They lament the doom that is coming to Bant without realizing the part their own leaders have played in it.

name: Crypsis
text: Tritons borrow the camouflage of their oceanic prey to become predators on land.

name: Ley Druid
text: After years of training, the Druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

name: Abyssal Nocturnus
text:
"I fear to keep an open mind, for there are those who would use it as a door to my soul."
—Voka Schlak, Mauzam Asylum inmate, diary

name: Pegasus Courser
text: A pegasus chooses its rider, bearing the worthy into the clouds and tossing all others to the ground.

name: Merfolk of the Depths
text: When giant sinkholes opened across Ravnica, they revealed buried oceans and the merfolk, once thought to be extinct.

name: Aggressive Mammoth
text:
"Approach from behind. That way, if it does charge, at least you aren't in front of it."
—Vivien Reid

name: Occult Epiphany
text: In a single unending moment, a hundred lifetimes of knowledge coursed through his unraveling mind.

name: Lavinia, Azorius Renegade
text: "I told Jace that Ravnica would fall apart if he didn't take his responsibilities seriously. I didn't want to be right."

name: Echo Inspector
text: The rendezvous took place hours ago, but the Obscura agent read the residue with ease.

name: Borborygmos
text:
"It's easy to see why those Gruul dirtbags follow him—the only orders he gives are 'Crush them!' and 'We eat!'"
—Teysa Karlov

name: Ring of Gix
text: Not every cage is made of bars.

name: Kjeldoran Skycaptain
text:
"If we do our duty and uphold our honor, Kjeldor shall stand for a thousand years."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

name: Convolute
text: "Let's see how badly you want what you came for!"

name: Flamewave Invoker
text: Inside even the humblest goblin lurks the potential for far greater things—and far worse.

name: Syphon Essence
text: The third step in creating a skaab requires draining the body of blood and replacing it with *viscus vitae*, a mixture of angel's blood and lamp oil.

name: Emergent Growth
text: "By accepting my smallness I am vast."

name: Goblin Champion
text: The stories of his heroics are inspiring, though none of them are remotely true.

name: Spore Frog
text: Gromp spores can be distilled into a variety of powerful chemical agents, or added to tea for a disastrous afternoon in the city.

name: Graven Cairns
text:
"Here did the Extinguisher steal the light from the world. Here will we sacrifice her to bring the Great Rekindling to our people."
—Illulia of Nighthearth

name: Honden of Night's Reach
text: To the sorrow of all, its dark reach grasped and crushed those who guarded its silent vigil.

name: Omniscience
text:
"The things I once imagined would be my greatest achievements were only the first steps toward a future I can only begin to fathom."
—Jace Beleren

name: Soul Barrier
text:
"There's more than one way to skin an Ouphe—or thwart a mage."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran Royal Mage

name: Cradle to Grave
text:
"As the fell soil's appetite grows, it gulps down passersby upon their first footfall."
—Ezrith, druid of the Dark Hours

name: Chandra's Triumph
text: Her triumph came not from achieving her ideal self, but from rejecting the idea of perfection.

name: Judith, the Scourge Diva
text: At the end of the show, she stands alone on a stage brilliant with blood.

name: Emberhorn Minotaur
text: "My stride will break only against the twin points of Hazoret's spear."

name: Taunting Challenge
text: Incensed by their opponents' unrelenting taunts, even wise generals were known to rashly lead their troops into battle—often to disastrous defeats.

name: Reverse Engineer
text: The Hold, an illegal research facility in a derelict merchant ship, became a wellspring of renegade intelligence.

name: Witch's Cauldron
text: The best recipes start with reliable cookware.

name: Timely Ward
text: Behind every general who leads from the front is a nervous mage with a spell at the ready.

name: Windstorm
text:
"We don't like interlopers and thieves cluttering our skies."
—Dionus, elvish archdruid

name: Blood-Cursed Knight
text: "The bloodlust shall not control me, for my oath is my greatest compulsion."

name: Frost Bite
text:
"Don't wander far—it's a bit nippy out there!"
—Leidurr, expedition leader

name: Tenth District Legionnaire
text:
"The Tenth is under heavy attack, but it's being handled. I sent Mileva."
—Tajic

name: Elven Lyre
text: Scholars are uncertain whether it was the actual sound or some other magical property of the elven lyre that transformed its player.

name: Mightstone
text: While exploring the sacred cave of Koilos with his brother Mishra and their master Tocasia, Urza fell behind in the Hall of Tagsin, where he discovered the remarkable Mightstone.

name: Galvanic Bombardment
text: Geist-powered devices have no shortage of fuel.

name: Jinx
text:
"What wizards upset, the land soon rights."
—Gemma, Willow Priestess

name: Geist of the Lonely Vigil
text: The flicker of candlelight and the echo of hymns told the villagers that the monastery wasn't truly abandoned.

name: Manalith
text:
"Though the afterlife, the city, and even the God-Pharaoh himself were one great deception, the ideals championed by the gods remain true."
—Djeru, former Tah-crop initiate

name: Giant Strength
text: "Crovax seems filled only with shadows," thought Orim. "Where does his strength come from?"

name: Lifetap
text:
"Keep a green tree in your heart and perhaps the singing bird will come."
—Chinese proverb

name: Yavimaya Enchantress
text: From each seed, a world. From each world, a thousand seeds.

name: Gavi, Nest Warden
text: A mother's love transcends species.

name: Sandcrafter Mage
text: With heat, sand can form a delicate work of art; with pressure, an impenetrable bulwark.

name: Viashino Slaughtermaster
text: "I'll fight two at once, and then lick their guts from my blades."

name: A-Sewer Crocodile
text:
"Quick, let's hide in the sewer!"
—Ginsi the Thief, now deceased

name: Commander's Authority
text: "Wear her symbol with honor, a sign of faith upheld and honest deeds bravely done."

name: Stone Golem
text: The sculptor, like most artists, put his heart and soul into his work. But the newly awakened golem decided it wanted its creator's other, more tangible parts.

name: Blinkmoth Infusion
text: Power begets power.

name: Invigorating Boon
text: The Mirari's echoes rang in the scouts' minds long after they had returned from the Krosan Forest.

name: Kithkin Shielddare
text: The nova glyph is a potent symbol. A shield embossed with it can resist the force of even the most determined giant.

name: Mana Confluence
text: Better places poured prismatic dreams into the world, rendering it anew.

name: Fungus Sliver
text:
"When a sliver of this breed enters the hive, the others claw each other in frenzied fits, thereby ensuring their rapid growth."
—Rukarumel, field journal

name: Viashino Weaponsmith
text: Within the rig settlement, those who have mastered the making of weapons earn highest honor.

name: Gamble
text: As she triggered yet another trap, Chira realized that what she thought was the goblin word for "easy" probably wasn't.

name: Rogue Elephant
text:
"When are trees like grass?"
—*The One Thousand Questions*

name: Canyon Wildcat
text: "Relative of yours?" Ertai teased. Mirri simply sneered.

name: Return to Nature
text:
"Even steel and stone return to Ghrin-Danu in time."
—Katilda, Dawnhart Prime

name: Poison the Well
text: Wells that provide clean, unhaunted water are rare enough to be worth building an entire town around.

name: Unsummon
text: Mages routinely summon creatures from the Æther. It's only fair that they occasionally throw one back.

name: Viridian Shaman
text: She stands as a living symbol of the natural world and an enemy of the forces that threaten it.

name: Scryb Sprites
text: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the Faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.

name: Aetherize
text: No berzerker charge can stand against the psychic might of the Hive Mind.

name: Necrobite
text: An undead snake doesn't bite in self-defense. It hungers as any zombie, never sated.

name: Vessel of Ephemera
text: Geists seeking redemption must first be given the opportunity.

name: Mudbutton Torchrunner
text: The oil sloshes against his skull as he nears his destination: the Frogtosser Games and the lighting of the Flaming Boggart.

name: Drudge Skeletons
text:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, *Necromancer's Handbook*

name: Rescue
text:
"Urza, I've discovered more promising students than you and my husband have, combined. And I haven't lost a single one."
—Rayne, Academy Chancellor

name: Verdant Sun's Avatar
text:
"Ixalli's fertile rays enliven us all. Each of us is a testament to the sun's strength and love."
—Chitlati, Lightning Rider

name: Mutavault
text: Some worlds possess a hidden core where life's essence constantly surges.

name: Merfolk Seastalkers
text:
"Do they seek knowledge or wealth? Are they bandits or benefactors? It depends on who is chanting the tale."
—Nikou, Joraga bard

name: Serendib Efreet
text: Summoners of efreeti remember only the power of command, never the sting of regret.

name: Cryptolith Rite
text: The chant was incomprehensible, but its power was unmistakable.

name: Journeyer's Kite
text:
"Measure the angles carefully. Note the gauge of the paper. By your sixth birthday, I expect a flying prototype."
—Tawnos, letter to Harbin
