name: Civic Saber
text: Those without a guild signet often display a different form of protection.

name: Urza's Power Plant
text: Urza threw himself into his research, pushing the boundaries of both possibility and morality.

name: Inescapable Blaze
text:
"The Izzet are blamed for every little disaster, which is unfair because we only cause most of them."
—Mizzix of the Izmagnus

name: Abattoir Ghoul
text: Death took his humanity but not his skill with the knife.

name: Mercurial Pretender
text: The king went off to find himself. Imagine his terror when he succeeded.

name: Labyrinth Minotaur
text:
"I doubt any Labyrinth Minotaurs still live—but then again, we Minotaurs are stubborn beings."
—Onatah, Anaba Shaman

name: Omega Myr
text: Last to charge, last to fall.

name: Angel's Feather
text: The angel represents divine perfection; even the smallest feather is imbued with beauty and benevolence.

name: Woodland Mystic
text: "I sing to the branches, and they reach to the sky. I sing to the leaves, and they open to the sun. I sing to the roots, and they dig their fingers deep. I sing the song that creation sung."

name: Murder of Crows
text: Even more than carrion, they crave the last words of the dying.

name: Jhessian Balmgiver
text: "You have two choices: heed my advice now or need my healing later."

name: Krosan Grip
text:
"On a world where time was torn asunder, destruction ruled the minds of all."
—*Multiversal Metahistories*

name: Gingerbrute
text: The unlabeled vial was not vanilla extract after all.

name: Stone Golem
text: The sculptor, like most artists, put his heart and soul in his work. But the newly awakened golem decided he wanted his creator's other, more tangible parts.

name: Akroan Crusader
text: An Akroan soldier's worth is measured by the number of swords raised by his battle cry.

name: Firefright Mage
text: After millennia of advancement in goblin military theory, Toggo VI realized that almost everyone is afraid of fire.

name: Rhox
text: It's as solid as the club in its hand—and about as subtle.

name: Entangling Vines
text: Every living thing has roots in nature. Sometimes nature gets its roots into you.

name: Verdant Force
text:
Burl, scurf, and bower
Birth fern and flower.

name: Kytheon's Irregulars
text: Kytheon and his irregulars worked outside the law to bring justice to the streets of Akros.

name: Blur Sliver
text: They move in a synchronized swarm, turning entire squads into heaps of bloody rags and bones in an instant.

name: Ash Barrens
text: Deserts of industrial ash surround the hive cities, covering the surface of the planet with an unstable, corrosive skin.

name: Sanitarium Skeleton
text: His mind was lost long before his flesh.

name: Gravepurge
text:
"Lord Silumgar has given you a second chance to please him."
—Siara, the Dragon's Mouth

name: Renari, Merchant of Marvels
text: "Sure, you can get one elsewhere ... if you want a knockoff that'll break the first time you use it."

name: Riptide Laboratory
text: Working with the best of intentions, its researchers unwittingly unleashed a plague of troubles upon Dominaria.

name: Guardian Augmenter
text: After years of research, he finally unlocked the formula for a perfect punch.

name: Curse of Predation
text:
"Hunters feed on the fear of their prey."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Lotus-Eye Mystics
text: Every action has a foreseen purpose.

name: Ashnod's Battle Gear
text: This invention shows why Ashnod was feared by her troops as well as her foes.

name: Roc Charger
text: Rocs' innate fearlessness makes them ideal mounts for emergency response.

name: Iron Apprentice
text:
"I needed an extra set of hands, so I built one."
—Kenji, Sokenzan artisan

name: Thoughtseize
text:
"Knowledge is such a burden. Release it. Release all your fears to me."
—Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver

name: Crown of Suspicion
text: "Darkness, hide my fear."

name: Horobi, Death's Wail
text:
"Wherever it went, death came to Phyrexians and Kamigawans alike."
—*Records of the Living Historians*

name: Sarkhan's Dragonfire
text: "I am most myself when I am least human."

name: Archetype of Courage
text:
"It has been my experience that soldiers most fervently follow generals who lead by example."
—Elspeth

name: Unstable Obelisk
text: Its collapse is like the lashing out of a long-dead civilization that resents being forgotten.

name: Kiln Walker
text: If it possesses an ability to understand and appreciate life, it has never shown it.

name: Pygmy Giant
text:
"487. You're welcome."
—Bucky, flavor text writer

name: Inertia Bubble
text:
"I wouldn't want you to hurt yourself."
—Bruenna, Neurok leader

name: Jeering Homunculus
text: Mklthd had always hated crowds . . . and they had always hated him.

name: Reliquary Tower
text: When the aven scouts located the tower in Esper, the Knights of the Reliquary set off on a righteous crusade to recover their lost treasures.

name: Kami of the Painted Road
text: In ancient times, precepts of kami law were inscribed onto bridges as a gesture of respect. During the war, humans regarded them as warnings of where not to travel.

name: Lathnu Sailback
text: Travelers to Lathnu, high on the Devra Cliffs, need not fear the political strife of Ghirapur . . . but they have other dangers to worry about.

name: Lexivore
text:
Plucking the chicken
—Elvish expression meaning "flinging the monkey"

name: Voldaren Bloodcaster // Bloodbat Summoner
text: "Humans throw rice and release doves at their weddings? How quaint."

name: Raging Bull
text:
"Sometimes the bulls win, and sometimes the bears win. But the bulls have more fun."
—Anonymous

name: Sage's Row Denizen
text: "Forget what you have learned from other teachers. I bring you the truth."

name: Kithkin Greatheart
text: Sometimes a curious giant singles out a "little one" to follow for a few days, never realizing the effect it will have on the little one's life.

name: Gix
text: Through ruthlessness and raw ambition, Gix rose through the Phyrexian regime to the exalted rank of praetor. Even while overseeing many of Phyrexia's most important undertakings, Gix continues his own quest for supremacy . . . for in Phyrexia, the weak become fodder for the strong.

name: Sultai Scavenger
text: Since they guard armies of walking carrion, Sultai aven are never far from a meal.

name: Seething Song
text: If your flesh can withstand the flame, the spirit of the dragon will burn within your soul.

name: Terramorphic Expanse
text: Take two steps north into the unsettled future, south into the unquiet past, east into the present day, or west into the great unknown.

name: Bubble Matrix
text:
"This device was commisioned by a king who desired peace. Unfortunately, the royal artificer was also the king's jester."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

name: Hateful Eidolon
text: From the echoes of a violent life, a terrible foe is born.

name: Mogg Conscripts
text:
"Torahn's horns! They've seen us. Now, statue, you must fight to save yourself!"
—Tahngarth, aboard the Predator

name: Blanchwood Treefolk
text: The massive Argivian attack on their rooted kindred was a declaration of war to the treefolk.

name: Infernal Harvest
text:
"I offered you eternal life; I just didn't say *where*."
—Shauku, Endbringer

name: Argivian Phalanx
text: New Argive welcomed the kor people when they were displaced by the Rathi overlay. The kor repay that kindness with fierce loyalty.

name: Changeling Outcast
text: A mercurial face sows distrust. Distrust reaps a lonely life.

name: Carry Away
text: Stealing goblin weapons would be easier if the goblins were smart enough to let go.

name: Meandering River
text: Clouds and mists cover the lake as though it were a dreamland. When the wind rises, the mists disperse, opening great vistas of rippling reeds.

name: Silkwrap
text: Better scarves than scars.

name: Plague Witch
text: "I can ail what cures you."

name: Blowfly Infestation
text: When the giant Tollek Worldslayer fell, a corruption erupted from his corpse to carry on his name.

name: Jade Avenger
text: Action: Show a frog samurai who is a master swordsman. Skilled and agile, he stands about four feet tall and wields a daisho (see ref).

name: Seshiro the Anointed
text: Armed and dangerous.

name: Battlewise Aven
text: Experience is a good teacher, not a kind one.

name: Blood-Toll Harpy
text: When harpies demand a toll to cross through their territory, consider yourself lucky if they permit payment in coin.

name: Forerunner of Slaughter
text:
"While we delay, they're on the move. They will not wait as we bicker. We are losing this war by moments as our goal slips beyond our reach."
—Gideon Jura

name: Divine Verdict
text: "Guilty."

name: Getaway Car
text: For those who need to make a quick departure without attracting undue attention.

name: Watery Grave
text: Few believe Duskmantle exists. Fewer find it. None live to bear witness.

name: Mardu Hordechief
text: The horde grows with each assault.

name: Burrog Befuddler
text: Students who seek river herbs in Doradur quickly find themselves slightly damp and thoroughly surrounded.

name: Cystbearer
text: Phyrexia strives to simulate natural life, but it can't resist improving on the design.

name: Marwyn, the Nurturer
text: Midwife to mothers and leader to all.

name: Novijen, Heart of Progress
text:
"The unnatural pressures of life in this city are best withstood by lifeforms that adapt with unnatural swiftness."
—Momir Vig

name: Beast Whisperer
text: "Despite its ghastly appearance, the Ravnican murder budgie makes quite an erudite conversationalist."

name: Warning
text:
"The folk of the Karplusan Mountains are impossible to ambush."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Confidence from Strength
text:
"Prepare for battle!"
—Jiang Yanggu

name: Wandering Stream
text:
"Dominaria touches us all."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Wall of Denial
text: It provides what every discerning mage requires—time to think.

name: Kithkin Rabble
text: If even the slightest hint of panic enters the thoughtweft, bakers, potters, and even medics drop their spoons and salves to take up arms.

name: Mark of Mutiny
text: The flame of anger is hard to douse once lit.

name: Split the Party
text: Don't.

name: Gideon's Avenger
text: "The good don't sit and wait for the evil to act. They prepare to defend. They prepare to punish."

name: Fyndhorn Brownie
text:
"I've been insulted by drunks in a hundred inns, but never as skillfully or annoyingly as by those blasted brownies."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Novice Dissector
text: "The professor said to first extract the venom glands, then the acid sac. Next up, the . . . meeping organ?"

name: Deathknell Berserker
text:
"Sven felled the elf with an arrow through the chest, but moments later, the corpse rose with a sneer to fight again."
—*Longbeard Saga*

name: Steward of Valeron
text: www.MagicTheGathering.com

name: Order of Leitbur
text:
"Trained to battle the followers of Tourach, the Order of Leitbur was not as successful in later conflicts with Orcish and Goblin raiders."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. I*

name: Peace Talks
text:
"By the tongues of a thousand serpents, this time I do not lie."
—Ahmahz il Kin, Suq'Ata diplomat

name: Sigiled Contender
text: "All right. Warm-ups are over."

name: Okiba Salvage
text: "Some fool would rather throw a whole mech away than repair one hydraulic actuator? It must be my lucky day."

name: Storm the Seedcore
text: In that moment, the fate of countless worlds rested with one dryad and a handful of the bravest Mirrodin had to offer.

name: Renegade Demon
text: Trapped in Immersturm, it bloodies its blade not for ideals or territory or power, but simply to pass the time.

name: Confiscate
text:
"The surface world contains nothing I cannot take."
—The Lord of Atlantis

name: Wight
text: Wights want the world to resound with echoes of their own cruel hatred.

name: Unwilling Recruit
text: Frorn didn't want to be kept, but he didn't want to be thrown back either.

name: Wirewood Channeler
text: "Your words are meaningless. The rustling of leaves is the only language that makes any sense."

name: Sol Ring
text: The relic had been kept for years in a place of power, of community, and of friendship—distilling magic from the light of love.

name: Leinore, Autumn Sovereign
text: She keeps the festival's revels from faltering, infusing the witches' rituals with hope.

name: Grim Poppet
text: Beware a scarecrow bearing gifts—especially sloshing vessels of acid.

name: Mesa Pegasus
text: Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the Mesa Pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a Mesa Pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.

name: Expose Evil
text:
"Only the pure stand tall in the light."
—Sigarda

name: Drudge Skeletons
text:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—*Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook*

name: Dawn Gryff
text: After facing so many horrors, the survivors of Videns parish couldn't comprehend the hope that the gryff represented.

name: Karador, Ghost Chieftain
text: "Death tried to uncrown me. But now I return, king of a greater realm."

name: Bolrac-Clan Crusher
text: Jaharg discovered that the shapes and symmetries so pleasing to the sculptor's eye also yielded a well-balanced bludgeon.

name: Flycatcher Giraffid
text: Poachers use the harvested tongues to snare pests, plumb caves, and scale tall buildings.

name: Nahiri's Sacrifice
text: Nahiri's last free breath became a defiant roar as she tore apart Sheoldred's Coliseum.

name: Wild Defiance
text:
"When civilization reaches out its greedy hand, take it off at the wrist."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Pillarfield Ox
text:
"May starving fleas birth a thousand generations on your stubborn hide, cow!"
—Bruse Tarl, Goma Fada nomad

name: Mire's Toll
text: As the bridge snapped, Berko was sure he heard the swamp laughing at him.

name: Fact or Fiction
text: "Every choice is a joy."

name: Kyren Glider
text: Mercadia's Kyren goblins are the opposite of Dominarian goblins: they're smart and cowardly.

name: Revenge of Ravens
text: Syr Tasdale declared that he never wanted to see the witch Ygretta again. Her familiars quickly granted his request.

name: Putrid Leech
text:
"The Golgari would say that life comes from death and death comes from life. But sometimes, death comes from the dead."
—Vraska

name: Balduvian Barbarians
text:
"Barbarian raids were a concern to those living in the northwest provinces, but the skyknights never dealt with the problem in a systematic way. They thought of the Balduvians as an 'amusing model' of their forebears' culture."
—*Kjeldor: Ice Civilization*

name: Moss Monster
text: After the battle, an eerie silence gripped the forest. The losers' remains were lightly dusted with green.

name: Battlefield Promotion
text: "Welcome to the Legion. You saved a district—now let's go save the world."

name: Abandon the Post
text: You don't have to outrun the werewolf; you only have to outrun your fellow guard.

name: Charix, the Raging Isle
text: Zendikar's seas are deeper than anyone can fathom.

name: Working Stiff
text: Oh, does your nose itch?

name: Living Wish
text: The best wishes include the will to tame their consequences.

name: Broken Dam
text: Using nature to their advantage, wise Three Kingdoms generals often let dammed rivers loose to destroy their enemies.

name: Life and Limb
text:
"It was a sight of pain and awe—a twisted forest, migrating across the salt plain in search of richer soil."
—Edahlis, greenseeker

name: Jangling Automaton
text:
"We always look upon our first creations as masterpieces, no matter how awful they are."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

name: Pirate's Prize
text: Nothing warms the heart like plunder.

name: Battlefield Forge
text: Golf Sucks Now And Has Always Sucked

name: Mantle of the Wolf
text:
"Be fearless, for a furious rebirth awaits you."
—Nylea, god of the hunt

name: Explosion of Riches
text: "You've got how much gold there?"

name: Penumbra Kavu
text:
"These kavu are so stubborn they even refuse to die."
—Tahngarth

name: High Ground
text: In war, as in society, position is everything.

name: The Dross Pits
text: In Sheoldred's domain, the Steel Thanes wage a never-ending war in her long shadow.

name: Puppeteer
text: "Getting people to do what you want is merely a matter of telling them what they want to hear."

name: Uril, the Miststalker
text: It strides through the whitecover, mists in which even gargantuans can hide.

name: Ambitious Farmhand // Seasoned Cathar
text: "The cathars have taught me many things, but I will never forget the hard, honest work that first callused my hands."

name: Spoils of the Hunt
text: "Every coin helps rebuild the town they destroyed."

name: Nether Spirit
text: It roams in both the worlds of the living and the dead but belongs to neither.

name: Mayhem Devil
text: Despite their stake in the city's survival, Rakdos cultists are loath to pass up any opportunity to sow chaos.

name: Balduvian Barbarians
text:
"From the snowy slopes of Kaelor, To the canyons of Bandu, We drink and fight and feast and die As we were born to do."
—Balduvian tavern song

name: Caller of Gales
text: "Some merfolk choose to rest their fins in the water. I believe wisdom exists not only where we were born but where we were told not to go."

name: Moment of Craving
text: "The time of condemnation is at hand. Dusk washes over the world, and I consign you to eternal darkness!"

name: Mischievous Chimera
text: Some curiosities are best left alone.

name: Summon the School
text:
"When merrows talk, listeners grow fins."
—Kithkin saying

name: Street Sweeper
text: The sweepers roam endlessly, scrubbing away the refuse—and anything else too slow or too clumsy to get out of their way.

name: Scepter of Empires
text:
"With this scepter, smite your enemies."
—Scepter inscription

name: Fungusaur
text: Rather than sheltering her young, the female fungusaur often injures her own offspring, thereby ensuring their rapid growth.

name: Plague Mare
text: When it passes, those who sleep dream of sickness and death.

name: Lead Golem
text: Slow and heavy swings the club.

name: Replication Specialist
text: "Step one is innovation. Step two is production. Sometimes step one is optional."

name: Totem Speaker
text: "Elves and beasts are tied together, and I am the knot that binds them."

name: Draconian Gate-Bot
text: "YOU MUST BE THIS TALL TO RIDE. YOU HAVE TEN SECONDS TO COMPLY."

name: Thornbow Archer
text: "I will not rest until the stench of eyeblights is eradicated from these woods."

name: Flash Foliage
text:
"This undemanding vegetation takes root in a mote of dust but grows incredibly quickly."
—Simic research notes

name: Greater Basilisk
text: Bone, stone . . . both taste the same to a hungry basilisk.

name: Nested Ghoul
text:
"The chest cavity is cleared of useless meat. I know just what to do with the space."
—Gyed, Vault Priest

name: Sculpting Steel
text: Perfected by the kinetic sculptor Shanti Makam, these self-assembling metal strands can be coaxed into any shape imaginable.

name: Flooded Grove
text: At full moon, the river seeps over its banks and crawls through the woods like a blanket of serpents.

name: Graven Cairns
text: Shamans of Kar-Sengir claim that their sun sets because it can no longer bear the gaze of those pain-carved cliffs.

name: Sculpting Steel
text: An artificer once dropped one in a vault full of coins. She has yet to find it.

name: Greater Forgeling
text: Few have seen the inner workings of Ravnica's furnaces, but neighboring districts catch brief glimpses in the horrors that escape the flames.

name: Bold Impaler
text: Burning with hatred for Nahiri, the Voldaren and Markov forces assaulted the warped Markov Manor with a collective fury not seen in centuries.

name: Well-Laid Plans
text: "I knew this day would come," said Urza. Looking at the destruction, Barrin sighed, "You don't have to revel in it."

name: River Boa
text:
"But no one heard the snake's gentle hiss for peace over the elephant's trumpeting of war."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Akoum Warrior // Akoum Teeth
text:
"I'm not cruel, but I have no patience for your mistakes."
—Tyrux, expedition warrior

name: All That Glitters
text: A faerie's glee at her trove quickly fades to contentment, then to boredom, then to an urge to steal more.

name: Demystify
text: The Singing City was silent, the pathway stones were still, and the winds of the Howling Spire ceased.

name: Dance of Shadows
text: "Only one man survived, barely sane. He got out two words before collapsing: shadows' shadows."

name: Aerathi Berserker
text: Ærathi children who show promise are left to survive for a year in the wilderness. Those who return are shown the way of the Berserker.

name: Phyresis
text:
"Perfection is at hand. You have been freed of weakness and made *compleat*."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Striped Bears
text:
"The bear is never cautious—which is why it wasn't born a human."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Beast Whisperer
text: "The tiniest mouse speaks louder to me than all the festival crowds on Tin Street."

name: Fatigue
text: "Mind if I just lie down right here for a few weeks?"

name: Hibernation
text: The deep sleep of winter is not always restful.

name: Wasteland
text:
"I will show you fear in a handful of dust."
—T. S. Eliot, "The Waste Land"

name: Lammastide Weave
text: "A ribbon torn will ward away dark dreams."

name: Consume Spirit
text:
"Youth is wasted on the young. So I help myself to some of it from time to time."
—Sifa Grent

name: Brine Shaman
text:
"The shamans of Marit Lage do her bidding in secret, but they do it gladly."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Vodalian Knights
text: Fear the knight leaping from the water into the air, weapon ready.

name: Fyndhorn Pollen
text:
"I breathed deeply, and suddenly I knew not who or where I was."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

name: Disemvowel
text: Without vowels, no one can hear you scream.

name: Filigree Crawler
text:
"The most harmonious designs are based on relationships found in nature."
—Venand Kapur, the Gearherder

name: Flaming Fist Officer
text: "Got the remaining citizens to safety! These miscreants have an appointment with my spear."

name: Highland Lake
text:
"A place like this makes me wonder if there's more to life than blood and treasure . . . Nah."
—Boyl Bucksalt, Storm Fleet swab

name: Hall of Mirrors
text:
"Finally! Something that can capture all my good angles."
—Captain Rex Nebula

name: Hatred
text:
"I will flay the skin from your flesh and the flesh from your bones and scrape your bones dry. And still you will not have suffered enough."
—Greven *il*-Vec, to Gerrard

name: Okina, Temple to the Grandfathers
text: If a land can be said to have a heart, Okina is the heart of Kamigawa.

name: Darksteel Citadel
text: Panopticon, forge of the Darksteel Eye, home of Mirrodin's keeper.

name: Pollywog Symbiote
text: It always knew it was destined to be more than a frog.

name: Dream Coat
text:
"Adopt the character of the twisting octopus, which takes on the appearance of the nearby rock. Now follow in this direction, now turn a different hue."
—Theognis, *Elegies 1, 215*

name: Gurmag Swiftwing
text:
"Anything a falcon can do, a bat can do in pitch darkness."
—Urdnan the Wanderer

name: Break Asunder
text: "No good will come of this."

name: Flooded Woodlands
text: Freyalise's tears bring life and renewal, though they also bring trouble.

name: Cultist's Staff
text: The head of the staff doubles as a brand to anoint the newly inducted.

name: Balduvian Bears
text:
"They're a hardy bunch, but I'd still bet that they just slept through the worst of the cold times."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Goblin Masons
text: "Goblins build with true zeal—and anything else within arm's reach."

name: Deadshot Minotaur
text: "May the earth rise up to meet you."

name: Gilanra, Caller of Wirewood
text: "Something mighty stirs in the forest. Can't you feel it?"

name: Heroes of the Revel
text: Brashness is close enough to bravery.

name: Kamahl, Fist of Krosa
text: "My mind has changed. My strength has not."

name: Defiant Elf
text: "I lost one home when Yavimaya was destroyed. I will not lose another."

name: Enforcer Griffin
text:
"A company of infantry is trapped behind the lines. We need to strike hard and fast to free them, or the casualties will be horrific. Send the griffins."
—Tajic

name: Creeping Corrosion
text:
"We will reveal the futility of their heresy by showing them how fragile their relics are."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Oakshade Stalker // Moonlit Ambusher
text: Even when he strikes, the only sound is the snap of jaws through bone.

name: Stensia Innkeeper
text: "The perils of the road, you say? Don't worry. You won't have to face those again."

name: Release the Dogs
text: They charge into battle and out for their morning walk with the same exuberance.

name: Thassa's Intervention
text: "I bring a flood that nothing can withstand."

name: Cloud Sprite
text: The delicate sprites carry messages for Saprazzans, but they refuse to land in Mercadia City's filthy markets.

name: Curiosity
text: All Mirri wanted to do was rest, but she couldn't ignore a nagging suspicion as she followed Crovax's skulking form.

name: Shipwreck Moray
text: Shipwrecks do wonders for the local fauna, providing both shelter and aether.

name: Surrak, the Hunt Caller
text: "The greatest honor is to feed Atarka."

name: The Fall of Kroog
text: As retaliation for the Warlord's ambush at the peace summit, Mishra leveled Yotia's capital city.

name: Ketria Triome
text: Nowhere on Ikoria are monsters more integral to the landscape than Ketria, where the river itself will stand up and roar.

name: Golem Artisan
text: Better living through metallurgy.

name: Urborg Elf
text: The elves of Urborg are as deadly and capricious as the swamp itself.

name: Baloth Gorger
text: A baloth only cares about the many things it eats and the few things that eat it.

name: Twinning Glass
text: It takes two to craft a mirror: a practiced metalsmith to silver one side and her own hazy reflection to polish the other.

name: Holy Day
text:
"Will history remember this as the day demons arrived or the day saviors arrived?"
—Barrin

name: Illuminated Wings
text: For a moment, Urza thought not of war and destruction, but of the freedom of the skies.

name: Saprazzan Outrigger
text: The Saprazzans excel at both tactics: hit *and* run.

name: Arcum's Astrolabe
text: Though the Time of Ice has ended, its relics still slumber in New Argive.

name: Dire Wolves
text:
"It's amazing how scared a city kid can get at a dog. Now, of course, I'd cross Terisiare alone, and keep no watch if I had a pack of greys hanging on my flanks as I went."
—Oddveig Ulfsson, caravan scout

name: Piru, the Volatile
text: Chasms of dueling energies course within her.

name: Treacherous Link
text:
"You cannot possibly know the toll your alliances will exact from you."
—Barrin, to Urza

name: Vulturous Zombie
text:
"When something dies, all things benefit. Well okay, just our things."
—Ezoc, Golgari rot farmer

name: Anarchist
text: "I'll take that. You won't need it when the revolution comes."

name: Trailblazer
text:
"Our Elvish Hunter Taaveti led us swiftly along hidden paths through the dense forest. We caught the Orcs from behind, and completely by surprise."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Bartizan Bats
text: At night, bats will feast on whatever is drawn to lanterns and streetlights.

name: Wayfaring Giant
text: Its stature and stride increase with each step it takes.

name: The Mycosynth Gardens
text: As the Invasion Tree grew, its branches pierced through the world's silent core.

name: Centaur Nurturer
text: "I call upon the vigor of the grasses, the hopes of the flowers, and the dreams of the trees."

name: Channeled Force
text: Few monsters challenged Narset after they sensed her power.

name: Ranger's Longbow
text: With the right weapon, a fearsome beholder is nothing more than a big floating bullseye.

name: Grapeshot Catapult
text: For years scholars debated whether these were Urza's or Mishra's creations. Recent research suggests they were invented by the brothers' original master, Tocasia, and that both used these devices.

name: Goblin Lackey
text: "Danger" was supposed to be babysitting, so "Little Angel" became the newest member of the team.

name: Narrow Escape
text:
"A good explorer has to be as slippery as a gomazoa, as tough as a scute bug, and luckier than a ten-fingered trapfinder."
—Arhana, Kazandu trapfinder

name: Primeval Herald
text: When they call, nature answers.

name: Dwarven Berserker
text: "I may be small, but I can kick *your* butt."

name: Giant Growth
text:
"Only the most effective tactics stand the test of time."
—Gamelen, Citanul elder

name: Woolly Loxodon
text: Even among the hardiest warriors of the Temur, loxodons are respected for their adaptation to the mountain snows.

name: Genesis
text:
"First through the Riftstone was Genesis—and the world was lifeless no more."
—*Scroll of Beginnings*

name: Innocence Kami
text: Her voice was light, her substance music.

name: Fog Elemental
text:
"It's the perfect sentry. Those who should pass can go right through it."
—Teferi

name: Erebos's Intervention
text: "I bring a death none can escape."

name: Vedalken Humiliator
text: "And who will stop me? You?"

name: Oath of Gideon
text: "For justice and peace, I will keep watch."

name: Urabrask's Anointer
text: Will you be the flame which burns the world, or merely be consumed as fuel?

name: Goblin Medics
text: Dorik was unshakably confident, having learned medicine from the finest butcher shops in Yotia.

name: Dragonsoul Knight
text: The farther he roamed from Jund and its dragons, the more he felt their essence in himself.

name: Hanweir Garrison // Hanweir, the Writhing Township
text: "We're ready for anything!"

name: Mind Raker
text: It consumes any dreams of victory.

name: Daraja Griffin
text:
"And the flamingos said, 'Get out of our nest—we can't be seen with the likes of you!' So, the griffin ate them."
—Azeworai, "The Ugly Bird"

name: D'Avenant Trapper
text:
"Go swiftly, clever arrow, and teach
The philosophy of stillness."
—D'Avenant verse

name: Zhalfirin Shapecraft
text: Patient and observant, the people of Zhalfir lurked beyond the veil of time until their moment came to finally strike at Phyrexia.

name: Aether Shockwave
text:
"The strain upon the veil between worlds began to show near the end of the Kami War. Strange happenings that neither side could control lashed out across Kamigawa."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Sandbar Serpent
text: Treacherous and unpredictable currents around Tolaria earned the nickname "serpent wakes."

name: Return to Nature
text:
"Long after the magic wore off, the mice still dreamed of glorious galloping."
—*Tales of the Fae*

name: Shipwreck Dowser
text: Lost at sea doesn't have to mean lost forever.

name: Rite of the Serpent
text:
"From your death, new life. From your loss, our profit."
—Kirada, Qarsi overseer

name: Uthden Troll
text:
"Oi oi oi, me gotta hurt in 'ere, Oi oi oi, me smell a ting is near, Gonna bosh 'n gonna nosh 'n da hurt'll disappear."
—Troll chant

name: Frozen Solid
text:
"Guard, fetch me a mallet."
—Heidar, Rimewind master

name: Living Wall
text: Some fiendish mage had created a horrifying wall of living flesh, patched together from a jumble of still-recognizable body parts. As we sought to hew our way through it, some unknown power healed the gaping wounds we cut, denying us passage.

name: Volcanic Dragon
text: Speed and fire are always a deadly combination.

name: Old Gnawbone
text: The ancient green dragon Claugiyliamatar is often seen with a mangled corpse dangling from her mouth.

name: Whelming Wave
text:
"I can see why this appeals to Thassa."
—Kiora

name: Havengul Lich
text: Fusing intelligence with the power of undeath requires inspiration of the darkest kind.

name: Mirror Entity
text: Unaware of Lorwyn's diversity, it sees only itself, reflected a thousand times over.

name: Bomber Corps
text: "Subtlety is for lawmages and spies."

name: Words of Worship
text:
"The faithful don't succumb to terror, nor are they ruled by passion. They adhere to order, for order is life."
—*Volume I, The Book of Faith*

name: Raving Visionary
text: "Fear not, child. Open your eyes and witness Keranos's truth!"

name: Soul Swindler
text: "Three tries to decide your fate! Fabulous prizes! Probably no untold torment!"

name: Adaptive Snapjaw
text:
"Eh, needs more toad."
—Gulistan, Simic biomancer

name: Tattered Haunter
text: When the Nebelgast recedes, there are often stragglers.

name: Giant Spider
text:
"After everything I've survived, it's hard to be frightened by anything anymore."
—Vivien Reid

name: Reprisal
text:
"The meek shall fight as one, and they shall overcome even the greatest of foes."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Phytoburst
text: Phytohydras are banned as houseplants in many residential spires. If left unfed, they find their own exit—usually at the cost of extensive property damage.

name: Territorial Scythecat
text: Standing between a scythecat and its prey makes you the appetizer.

name: Shapesharer
text: One good mimic deserves another.

name: Stomp and Howl
text:
"Mizzium may be impervious to fire, but obviously certain other things can . . . modify its form."
—Ivos Koba, indrik handler

name: Altar's Reap
text:
"I will secure my revenge on Zendikar one soul at a time."
—Ob Nixilis

name: Belbe, Corrupted Observer
text: "Those who wish to become evincar must first cast off the shackles of compassion."

name: Knight of the Pilgrim's Road
text: "To be a knight, Gideon, is to be the shield for the meek against the cruel."

name: Flowstone Overseer
text: The rebels couldn't see where the roar was coming from. Then they saw it was coming from everywhere.

name: Sanguine Guard
text:
"Father of Machines! Your filigree gaze carves us, and the scars dance upon our grateful flesh."
—*Phyrexian Scriptures*

name: Voiceless Spirit
text:
"I'd rather take on a neckbiter or moonhowler any day. Oh well, looks like I'm going to end up parrying with empty air half the night."
—Saint Trogen, the Slayer

name: Wooded Bastion
text: The elves of Wilt-Leaf Wood continually expand the palisade surrounding the sanctuary. They hope to one day enclose the entire forest within its walls.

name: Goblin Berserker
text:
Goblins don't know the meaning of the word "tactics"
—or the word "meaning," for that matter.

name: Granite Grip
text: "Let me introduce you to Rocky."

name: Zephid
text: Once you've seen one, you'll understand why spells won't go near them.

name: Hunger of the Howlpack
text:
"Werewolves are an unholy mix of a predator's instinct and a human's hatred."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

name: Rotting Mastodon
text: Mastodons became extinct long ago, but foul forces of the Gurmag Swamp sometimes animate their decaying remains. The Sultai happily exploit such creatures but consider them inferior to their own necromantic creations.

name: Lay Waste
text: Skirk Ridge had survived earthquakes, mudslides, and meteor showers. Then the goblins moved in.

name: Trench Stalker
text: It can hear a panicked heartbeat from a thousand paces away.

name: Michiko Konda, Truth Seeker
text:
"Watch over my father. Tell him I'm safe, but I won't come home until I find out how to bring him back to his senses, and Kamigawa is again at peace."
—Michiko, letter to General Takeno

name: Belligerent Sliver
text:
"The slivers became adept at provoking a fear response in other species."
—Hastric, Thunian scout

name: Fiddlehead Kami
text:
"Like a riddle, it unwinds. Like a green wind, it reaches out. Like a sudden guilt, it seizes."
—Snow Fur, kitsune poet

name: Mage il-Vec
text: Living below a flowstone foundry produces a disproportionate number of fire mages among the il.

name: Grip of Phyresis
text:
"Even your blade knows who will triumph here."
—Atraxa, Praetors' Voice

name: Hordeling Outburst
text:
"Leave no scraps, lest you attract pests."
—Mardu threat

name: Ajani's Pridemate
text:
"When one of us prospers, the pride prospers."
—Jazal Goldmane

name: Doubling Chant
text: What's scarier than one of every beast in the forest?

name: Deepwater Hypnotist
text:
"Watch the waves too long, and you may never look away."
—Meletian proverb

name: Balduvian Horde
text:
"Peace will come only when we have taken Varchild's head."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

name: Magma Hellion
text: The stadium is well-stocked with hazards to force the action if combatants show too much caution.

name: Simic Locket
text:
"Like our guild itself, this locket can stand for many things. You must discern what it means for you."
—Vannifar

name: Diffusion Sliver
text:
"The hive shimmered, and its walls seemed a living mirror."
—Hastric, Thunian scout

name: Humiliate
text: "Aw, what's that? No comeback?"

name: Demolish
text:
"To truly defeat a skaberen, you must destroy not the monster but the lab."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors

name: Fevered Strength
text:
"The fever clouds the mind as it energizes the body. Both will pass in time."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Tropical Island
text: 2019 Europe Legacy Champion

name: Sygg, River Cutthroat
text: "It's not a matter of deserving. It's a matter of strength. The power to hold versus the power to take."

name: Serra Advocate
text: An angel's blessing prepares a soldier for war better than a thousand military drills.

name: Neverwinter Dryad
text: Its life force entwined with its tree, a dryad is an elusive and solitary being that wishes only to be left alone.

name: Bump in the Night
text: It's not just the wind. It's not all in your head. And it's *definitely* something to worry about.

name: Pride of the Perfect
text: Like moonglove's flowers, the greatest beauty often masks the greatest dangers.

name: Wings of the Cosmos
text: The wolf's startled yelp changed quickly to a howl of elation as she soared over her envious packmates.

name: Angelic Benediction
text: "Only the bravest are worthy of our blessing."

name: Stormfist Crusader
text:
"As she reached the pinnacle, lightning flashed and her eyes blazed with newfound power."
—*Legend of the Gilded Knights*

name: Druid of Purification
text: "Return to the earth and the wind."

name: Alert Shu Infantry
text: Kongming's predecessor helped Liu Bei win the battle of Fancheng by recognizing and defeating Cao Ren's use of the dreaded "Eight Gold Locks" formation.

name: Tidal Surge
text:
"'Twas when the seas were roaring With hollow blasts of wind . . . ."
—John Gay, "The What D'Ye Call It"

name: Martyr of Sands
text: "Only in our vulnerability is there true power, and that power is life itself."

name: Shimatsu the Bloodcloaked
text: Their dominion over dark and destructive forces twisted the oni into beings of pure malevolence.

name: Bronze Cudgels
text:
"These were made when Michiko was young. Wield them wisely."
—Chiyoko, Jukai elder

name: Redirect
text:
"It's actually quite simple, but since you've only recently begun to walk upright, it may take some time to explain."
—Jace Beleren, to Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Copperhoof Vorrac
text: Like all forest beasts, it lives by one rule: if there's no room to grow, make some.

name: Enormous Energy Blade
text: "Heavy? Maybe for you."

name: Cruel Celebrant
text: "Whichever side wins, I'm sure the banquet will be superb."

name: Scarab Feast
text:
"The face of mediocrity is wrapped in anointed linen. Aspire to a better end."
—Epnokep, vizier of Bontu

name: Longbow Archer
text:
"If it bears wings, I will pin it to the skies over Tefemburu."
—Roya, Zhalfirin archer

name: Ivory Mask
text: "I did not choose my role, Orim," said Cho-Manno patiently, "and I suspect Gerrard did not choose his."

name: Strength of Arms
text:
"We fight not for Avacyn, but for her ideals; not for the church, but for its people."
—Thalia, Guardian of Thraben

name: Manaforge Cinder
text: Cinder mystics set traps for sluaghs and other spirits of flame, seeking to extract the secrets of the fire their own hearts have lost.

name: Ride the Avalanche
text: The mountain will build your cairn of snow and ice and stone.

name: Chill
text:
"Temper, temper"
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Thirst for Knowledge
text: Raissa transformed herself into a vessel for the Watchword Codex, allowing the arcane lore to flow through her body.

name: Soul Swallower
text: Being engulfed is just the beginning of the nightmare.

name: Visionary Augmenter
text: "It's a multifunctional radial extension system with superlateral, force-amplifying rigging. Of course it will win."

name: Geode Rager
text: Its crystalline core refracts light into chaos.

name: Gravewaker
text: It glides on silent wings across the midnight sky, and a dread host rises to follow.

name: Grindclock
text: Pray you never hear it chime.

name: Sower of Temptation
text: One glamer leads him far from home. The next washes away his memory that home was ever anywhere but at her side.

name: Go-Shintai of Boundless Vigor
text: It seeks those with untamed spirits and offers wild strength.

name: Headwater Sentries
text: "The elders say that if the intruders discovered the secret of the golden city, it would mean an end to our people."

name: Nix
text:
"There is no shortcut to work done true and well. The Creators learned this to their sorrow, the first time they made the world."
—Githri the Prisoner

name: Gloomwidow
text: The abandoned towns on the moors didn't stay empty for long.

name: Crow Storm
text:
Storm crow lonely, boon for a birder.
Storm crows together, likely a murder.

name: Yavimaya Dryad
text: The parched earth still shielded those few souls with the heart to call it home.

name: Nimble Innovator
text: "A failure is simply another opportunity for improvement. Just wait until you see what I come up with next."

name: Infectious Inquiry
text: "I give you pain, you give me information. A simple trade, is it not?"

name: Prismatic Lens
text: It bends not light but mana, aligning its chaotic currents into the sharp angles necessary for the mystic's purposes.

name: Regal Bloodlord
text: Those of esteemed birth earn a most esteemed death.

name: Voidslime
text:
"It is technically an ooze, but its lifespan measures only seconds. In that short time, its appetite for magic is extraordinary."
—Simic research notes

name: Task Force
text: They are the reflection of Rushwood's glow on the edge of a wooden sword.

name: Dark Confidant
text: Greatness, at any cost.

name: Unwinding Clock
text:
"The partisans have unearthed a strange artifact. None know its origin, but it gives them hope of a life beyond."
—Elspeth's journal

name: Eyekite
text:
"This one will need direction. After all, each of its eyes is larger than its brain."
—Cyla, Lord of the Aerie

name: Access Denied
text: The Saiba Futurists guard their secret experiments with ever-evolving networks of cutting-edge defensive technology.

name: Practiced Tactics
text: Each individual has their own crucial role to play.

name: Lightning Greaves
text: After lightning struck the cliffs, the ore became iron, the iron became steel, and the steel became greaves. The lightning never left.

name: Predator's Rapport
text:
"Other guilds say the Gruul are savages, no better than the beasts we live with. I say we've found friends who won't stab us in the back."
—Domri Rade

name: Regal Unicorn
text: Unicorns don't care if you believe in them any more than you care if they believe in you.

name: Stinging Hivemaster
text: From within its form, a single word echoed forth: "Devour."

name: Ghor-Clan Bloodscale
text: At mealtimes, the Gruul customarily omit such niceties as using forks or killing the entrée.

name: Dispeller's Capsule
text:
"I find its symmetry pleasing. It rids our world of offensive refuse while disposing of itself."
—Dolomarus, Proctor of the Clean

name: Gateway Plaza
text: Guild leaders focused their magic on the portal scar. Where the Chamber perished, a parun could be reborn.

name: Swarm Intelligence
text: The Locust God's children were numberless, relentlessly eating away every trace of the city's protection.

name: Corpse Explosion
text:
"Well, that's one way to scatter her ashes."
—Calvey, funeral director

name: Blinding Light
text: An angel's sword impales only the body; her righteousness penetrates the soul.

name: Deviant Glee
text: "You just need the right incentive to fulfill my dreams."

name: Razorclaw Bear
text:
One razorclaw is three bears too many.
—Elvish saying

name: Miracle Worker
text:
"Those blessed hands could bring surcease to even the most tainted soul."
—Sister Betje, *Miracles of the Saints*

name: Bloodline Culling
text: "Forget your human ancestors. You're part of my family now."

name: Jadzi, Oracle of Arcavios // Journey to the Oracle
text: To find Jadzi, one need only wander.

name: Enslaved Scout
text:
"Her soldiers' hatred for the Goblins is tempered only by their need for what the Goblins alone hold: knowledge of their mountain home."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

name: Ingenious Skaab
text: Heads and shoulders above the rest.

name: Kuro's Taken
text: Simple bargains are the most tempting, and oni bargains are the simplest of all: eternal life for eternal service.

name: Torture
text:
"It helps pass the time until you die."
—Grandmother Sengir

name: Kobold Taskmaster
text: The Taskmaster knows that there is no cure for the common Kobold.

name: Obzedat's Aid
text:
"The Obzedat have revived you with purpose. Don't squander their blessing."
—Teysa Karlov, Grand Envoy of Orzhov

name: Blazing Volley
text: The arrows fell like fiery rain, and for a moment, the sky itself seemed to burn.

name: Ever-Watching Threshold
text:
"You think they know we're here?"
—Orlo, goblin raider

name: Flight
text:
"Those who claim to know the world in its entirety rarely have the requisite perspective."
—Ulmarus the Wise

name: Hypervolt Grasp
text: Zap on. Zap off.

name: Godless Shrine
text: Judgment without hope.

name: Grizzly Bears
text: Don't try to outrun one of Dominaria's grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

name: Steamflogger of the Month
text: The perks aren't great.

name: Vitalizing Wind
text:
"The fifth wind of ascension is Exalter, fulfilling Keld's destiny."
—*Keld Triumphant*

name: Falkenrath Pit Fighter
text: In the arena, vampires set aside all pretense of honor or civilization and fight like the predators they know themselves to be.

name: Goldmeadow Stalwart
text: The thoughtweft ties a clachan together. Sharing each other's hopes and fears, all the village's citizens spring into action upon the first threat to any one of them.

name: Kor Outfitter
text: "We take only what we need to survive. Believe me, you will need this."

name: Dakkon Blackblade
text: The Blackblade determines not who is right, but who is left.

name: Granger Guildmage
text:
Leave no mouth agape, no stomach unfilled.
—Granger Guild maxim

name: Shaman of the Pack
text: To the elves, her spear is a compass; to the boggarts, a harbinger of doom.

name: Overgrown Armasaur
text: It embodies the riotous growth of the jungle, where creatures crowd upon creatures, where roots sprawl and vines swarm.

name: Ersatz Gnomes
text:
From jungle to sea, from sea to stone, from stone to field, from field to bone. What am I?
—Zhalfirin riddle

name: Split the Spoils
text: "That half is yours. These halves are mine."

name: Teysa Karlov
text: While Kaya is guildmaster, Teysa waits patiently at the center of the Orzhov web of power.

name: Memory Lapse
text:
"Where do our forgotten thoughts go? I knew once, but I can't remember."
—Director Taiva, journal entry

name: Moss Diamond
text: Every facet a promise of Chauntea's bounty.

name: Duskshell Crawler
text: They often perch on street lamps, causing the poles to buckle under their weight.

name: Kozilek's Pathfinder
text:
"We didn't know where it came from or where it was going. All we knew was that we did not matter."
—Akiri, kor line-slinger

name: Quilled Wolf
text:
"I know a ranger that thought to make a cloak of its hide. He ended up losing an eye for his trouble."
—Raf Gyel of the Quiver of Kessig

name: Will of the All-Hunter
text:
"It's Snapdax. You'd have a better chance of breaching a wall with a slice of bread."
—Krek, daysquad captain

name: Razaketh's Rite
text: "The blood ritual is complete. The end approaches."

name: Pixie Guide
text: Pixies are well known as pranksters, but some delight in more helpful magic.

name: Cerulean Sphinx
text:
"About the sphinx, I have mixed feelings. Their wisdom I crave, but their secrecy I can't tolerate."
—Szadek

name: Gravelighter
text: It appears only to those whose lives are ending, welcoming them to their fate.

name: Tiana, Ship's Caretaker
text: "Nothing is too broken to mend."

name: Sky Scourer
text:
"The Eldrazi are nothing if not thorough."
—Jace Beleren

name: Jackal Pup
text: The first morning after acquiring her familiar, the wizard awoke with fleabites and mange.

name: Slice in Twain
text: The magic of the River Heralds is so great that even a single shaman can fend off a pirate landing party.

name: Tangled Florahedron // Tangled Vale
text:
「バーラ・ゲドが再び成長し始めると、自由奔放な驚くべき形の新たな命が花開いた。」
――バーラ・ゲドの案内人、ドーラル

name: Jackal Familiar
text:
"Let the gray-hairs keep their ravens and drakes. My familiar will be a reflection of me: bloodthirsty, with a predator's instinct."
—Taivang, barbarian warlord

name: Leyline Prowler
text: It feeds on the dark energies that course through the deep world—and on any other creature lured by the leyline's pull.

name: Deadly Insect
text:
"Beautiful, indeed—but one sting could fell a Giant in a heartbeat."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Flame Channeler // Embodiment of Flame
text: Never again would she fear the dusk.

name: Chatter of the Squirrel
text: Some rumors are just plain nuts.

name: Wedding Announcement // Wedding Festivity
text: Vampires from every bloodline mingled together, all swelling with pride to be seen at the event of the century.

name: Storm Shaman
text: She speaks with the voice of the winds, and the earth trembles.

name: Phantom Wings
text: Many kami could fly, which put some warriors at a distinct disadvantage. The mages of Minamo took it upon themselves to correct that imbalance.

name: Caustic Tar
text: The spite of the Cabal turns meadow into mire.

name: Slith Strider
text: A slith's form and function are determined by the color of the sun under which it's born.

name: Witch's Mist
text:
"Hear us, Overmother. Let the strong thrive under your gelatinous hand, and let the weak writhe under your serrated heel."
—Prayer of the devoted

name: Golden Wish
text: She wished for nobility, but not for a nation to honor it.

name: Attune with Aether
text: "I've never seen a world where aether weaves through every aspect of nature."

name: Ambassador Laquatus
text: "Life is a game. The only thing that matters is whether you're a pawn or a player."

name: Yargle, Glutton of Urborg
text: Consuming even a single drop of the oil would spell doom for most living things. But Yargle was not most living things, and he ate enough to clean up most of Urborg.

name: Gearshift Ace
text: Some display their trophies at the Hall of Mechanists. Others display their talent in the streets of Ghirapur.

name: Persistent Petitioners
text: ". . . a decreased duration of synodic months would be most welcome. Also . . ."

name: Executioner's Capsule
text: There is always a moment of trepidation before opening a message capsule, for fear of the judgment that might be contained within.

name: Pheres-Band Raiders
text: "Who can deny the call to battle when it sings in our blood?"

name: Path of Peace
text:
"When the sword becomes a burden, let the warrior lay it aside that another with a truer heart might take it up."
—Radiant, archangel

name: Ruthless Winnower
text: "I count the usurpers with my dagger, one death blow at a time."

name: War-Torch Goblin
text:
"In a town shaped by the subtle machinations and political intrigue of its guilds, it's reassuring to see a goblin waving his torch and screaming about some nonsense or other."
—Agrus Kos

name: Elvish Piper
text:
From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.
—Elvish teaching

name: Exalted Dragon
text: If dragons excel at anything more than vanity, it is greed.

name: Obsianus Golem
text:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone . . . ."
—Song of the Artificer

name: Expedition Diviner
text: Wizards' spells twist the fabric of reality to channel elemental energies, peer into the future, and even calm the Roil.

name: Fleshmad Steed
text: More disturbing than the unknown is a distortion of the familiar.

name: Demon's Jester
text: They knock 'em dead, with or without the punch line.

name: Wall of Omens
text:
"I search for a vision of Zendikar that does not include the Eldrazi."
—Expedition journal entry

name: Order of Leitbur
text:
"Trained to battle the followers of Tourach, the Order of Leitbur was not as successful in later conflicts with orcish and goblin raiders."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. I*

name: Gemhide Sliver
text:
"The land is weary. Even Skyshroud is depleted. We must find another source of mana—one that is growing despite our withering world."
—Freyalise

name: Dwarven Driller
text:
"Drill the planet, it's no trouble: Mining granite, making rubble."
—Dwarven drilling song

name: Ali Baba
text:
"When he reached the entrance of the cavern, he pronounced the words, 'Open, Sesame!'"
—*The Arabian Nights*, Junior Classics trans.

name: Izzet Guildgate
text: Every laboratory buzzes with new experiments, each a piece of Ral's ambitious project.

name: Bramble Sovereign
text: Life runs wild amid the tanged branches.

name: Greed
text: What is a sliver of one's soul compared to unimaginable wealth?

name: Twitch
text: Battles are won in nuance.

name: Malakir Familiar
text:
"They are deadly, and they are loyal. We can spare them a little blood."
—Harak, Malakir bloodwitch

name: Lithomantic Barrage
text: Nahiri's rage shattered hedrons into deadly, burning ruin.

name: Siege Wurm
text: The Rubblefield was once among the wealthiest districts in Ravnica. All it took was a single wurm to reduce it to ruins.

name: Ecstatic Awakener // Awoken Demon
text: Bones cracked, flesh split apart, and the screams of euphoric agony gave way to unholy laughter.

name: Secret Plans
text: Rakshasa trade in secrets, amassing wealth from their careful revelation.

name: Transmogrant Altar
text:
"The human body—like any other machine—can be stripped for parts."
—Ashnod

name: Liliana's Steward
text: Servants at Vess Manor are chosen for their strong work ethic and respectful demeanor. Being alive is not required.

name: Take Heart
text: In the quiet before a battle, Boros soldiers whisper prayers that steady their nerves and focus their minds.

name: Chromatic Star
text:
"This item is not from . . . now. It reflects a sky no longer ours and gleams with hope that does not exist."
—Tavalus, acolyte of Korlis

name: Squirrel Sovereign
text: For rule of the Aldering Forest, Numstail stole the acorn from Nestwind, who stole it from Brankie, who stole it from Lightroot, who stole it from Leafpaw, who stole it from Darkfur . . .

name: Scoured Barrens
text: The weapons deployed to drive the Traitor Legions into the Eye of Terror were so destructive that some planets still have not recovered.

name: Colfenor, the Last Yew
text: "To reach my age, you must know when to bend with the winds and when to stand tall."

name: Defiant Strike
text:
"Stand where the whole battle can see you. Strike so they'll never forget."
—Anafenza, khan of the Abzan

name: Hellraiser Goblin
text: Don't let him lead the soldiers, but by all means let him lead the way.

name: Obelisk of Naya
text: Centuries have passed since the plane shattered, yet the obelisks of each shard faithfully serve their long-forgotten purpose.

name: Lightning Helix
text:
"Rage is not the answer. Rage followed by fitting vengeance is the answer."
—Ajani

name: Tectonic Hellion
text: Hellions measure their meals in mountains.

name: Werebear
text: He exercises his right to bear arms.

name: Seismic Elemental
text:
"Trying to stop it would be foolish. If you feel it coming—run!"
—Sergeant Ryda

name: Writhing Necromass
text:
"We sent three of our best legions! You're telling me no one came back?"
—Tori D'Avenant

name: Fortified Rampart
text: The refuge's defenses allow new recruits to see lesser Eldrazi up close, steeling their stomachs for what's to come.

name: Coma Veil
text: Etherium does not know sleep. Only magic can teach it the resting state of cold steel.

name: Zephyr Sprite
text: "I've never understood why so many beings lumber around on the ground. There are three dimensions, yet they use only two."

name: Naturalize
text:
"The scholars wept when we destroyed the hedron. I had no such pity. What would this world be like had we done so sooner?"
—*The War Diaries*

name: Dakkon Blackblade
text:
"My power is as vast as the plains; my strength is that of mountains. Each wave that crashes upon the shore thunders like blood in my veins."
—Dakkon Blackblade, *Memoirs*

name: Melt Terrain
text: Just as the most finely wrought metal can warp and rust, so too does Mirrodin buckle under pressures from without and within.

name: Zodiac Ox
text: ". . . Cao's abdication changed the face of all; / No mighty battles marked the Southland's fall. . . ."

name: Painful Memories
text:
"It is terrible how one brief action can live forever in memory."
—Jolrael

name: Fledgling Griffin
text:
"We're making progress, but its desire to explore still far exceeds its ability."
—Amadi, Halimar griffin-master

name: Sangrite Backlash
text:
"Sangrite is the dragon's beating heart. Little wonder, then, that so many fools' chests burst trying to contain it."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Doran, the Siege Tower
text: "Each year that passes rings you inwardly with memory and might. Wield your heart, and the world will tremble."

name: Cenn's Heir
text: His home clachan's familial spirit bolsters his own, but he will be ready to preside over the town as cenn only after he learns to project that strength to others.

name: Prized Unicorn
text:
"Friend and foe alike are irresistibly drawn to its beauty—the good, to their lasting reward, and the evil, to their brief and painful regret."
—Vivien Reid

name: Cinder Barrens
text:
"I do as I choose with what is mine. And it is all mine."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Guardian of Solitude
text:
"It seemed an easy thing, to step into the nothingness, to fall, to die. But then, for an instant, I saw it, eyes filled with endless sorrow, and I turned back to face my pain."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Ramosian Commander
text: "Cho-Manno guides your spirit. I guide your sword."

name: Blightning
text: In the spirit of inquiry, Tibalt applied a battery of agony spells. They yielded nothing on the vampire's whereabouts, but the screams were reward enough.

name: Renowned Weaver
text: "You think your weaving as beautiful as mine? Let me show you the true meaning of the craft."

name: Deathcap Cultivator
text: The old hermit would never say what he fed his mushrooms, and people learned not to ask.

name: Honey Mammoth
text:
"And I thought *I* had a big sweet tooth."
—Gannet, Skysail zoologist

name: Gatekeeper of Malakir
text: "You may enter the city-once the toll is paid."

name: Cogwork Assembler
text: Duplication is neither thievery nor flattery. It is efficiency.

name: Soldevi Digger
text:
"This ceaseless device has helped uncover marvels unreachable by mere flesh."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Seal of Primordium
text:
"I am the simplifier, the root that drags all artifice to earth."
—Seal inscription

name: Dwarven Trader
text:
"They wouldn't sell their own families—at least, not for cheap."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate

name: Kyren Negotiations
text: Kyren goblins always speak in questions and never allow wrong answers.

name: Skull Catapult
text:
"What manner of fiend would design such a sadistic device?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

name: Oppressive Will
text: When Minamo was abandoned, its younger students found themselves thrust into a war beyond their skill with talents beyond their control.

name: Lazotep Chancellor
text:
"Cease all psychic attacks pending intel on enemy countermeasures."
—Dimir communiqué

name: Jolt
text:
"There's nothing like a sudden shock to clarify one's thoughts."
—Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader

name: Luxa River Shrine
text: Without the God-Pharaoh, there would be no Luxa. Without the Luxa, there would be no life.

name: Pheres-Band Tromper
text: Trompers are the most feared warriors of the Pheres Band. Anger is their lifeblood. It sustains them and gives them purpose.

name: Mammoth Growth
text: Thus the longhall became a flathall.

name: Fire Shrine Keeper
text: Though grimed with the dust of centuries, the ancient shrine was not unguarded.

name: Serpentine Kavu
text: Under Yavimaya's peaceful facade beat the hearts of many savage beasts.

name: Trench Wurm
text:
"Their arrival marks the end of Yawgmoth's subtlety."
—Urza

name: Dryad's Revival
text: "Pleased to meet you, Seven."

name: Black Knight
text:
"The chill, to him who breathed it, drew / Down with his blood, till all his heart was cold."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, *Idyls of the King*

name: Goldenglow Moth
text:
"Little moth, fluttering bright, What luck will you bring tonight?"
—Benalish children's rhyme

name: Stormcrag Elemental
text: The storms of Tarkir awaken more than dragons.

name: Nivix, Aerie of the Firemind
text: Niv-Mizzet's genius and vanity reverberate throughout the mirrored halls of Nivix.

name: Dragonborn Champion
text: "I was raised on stories of my ancestors, and I want to write my own pages in the tales."

name: Dualcaster Mage
text: "It has been my experience that disasters like to strike in pairs."

name: Rain of Filth
text:
"When I say it rained, it was not small drops, but a thick, greasy drool pouring from the heavens."
—Urza, journal

name: Soul Read
text: It's easy to be two steps ahead when you can see their every thought.

name: Coalition Honor Guard
text: Giving little thought to their own defense, they carried the flag that united their army.

name: Pentagram of the Ages
text:
"Take this item, for instance. How would it destroy us, Relicbane?"
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Ashes of the Fallen
text: The ashes of the dead mingle with the soil, and both become as one.

name: Chorus of Might
text:
"In each of us is the strength of all of us."
—Trostani

name: Glittermonger
text: Street corners in the Mezzio are a tantalizing bazaar of the fantastic, the illicit, and the fake.

name: Pyric Salamander
text:
When you've been chased by a dragon, you run from every lizard.
—Suq'Ata saying

name: Centaur Archer
text:
"Centaurs will kill our Aesthir if they can; they've always been enemies. Destroy the horse-people on sight."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

name: Hoverguard Sweepers
text: They only appear in emergencies, and emergencies never last long.

name: Stonehands
text:
"Trust in the power of stone. Stone is strong; stone shatters swords; stone breaks bones. Trust in stone."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

name: Mage Slayer
text:
"When the wielder is strong enough, any sword will do."
—Kresh the Bloodbraided

name: Blinding Light
text: Let the unjust avert their faces and contemplate their peril.

name: Parish-Blade Trainee
text: The recruits trained in eternal night, fueled by the hope that they might one day see the sun again.

name: Infernal Pet
text:
"Here, my pet. Another little light for you to snuff out."
—Kzarakh, Immersturm gamekeeper

name: Pale Rider of Trostad
text:
"What's worse than being alone on the moors at night? Try *not* being alone."
—Nadila Maas, moor chaplain

name: Sisters of the Flame
text: We are many wicks sharing a common tallow; we feed the skies with the ashes of our prey.

name: Stun
text:
"I concede it was a cheap shot, but it was the only one I could afford."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Hieroglyphic Illumination
text: "The answers are here. This is the way through the trial."

name: Zephyr Charge
text:
"All armies prefer high ground to low and sunny places to dark."
—Sun Tzu, *Art of War*, trans. Giles

name: Ancient Silverback
text: The Phyrexian killing machines couldn't have known the seriousness of their mistake in wounding the ape—they'd never seen it angry.

name: Monoxa, Midway Manager
text: "Can we get this ghost 11% spookier?"

name: Kor Castigator
text:
"He told us not to worry, and he walked into the cavern. The swirling mass of Eldrazi parted to admit him, then closed in his wake."
—Akiri, kor line-slinger

name: Sphinx of Enlightenment
text: "I would be a fool if I taught you everything I know."

name: Statute of Denial
text: "Pyrotechnic activity of any sort is strictly prohibited. It is irrelevant that today is a holiday."

name: Hallowed Ground
text:
"On this site where Kjeld's blood was spilled, let none raise a fist or deny a beggar."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Viridescent Wisps
text: In the wisps that night, the once timid boggart saw all the terrible, bloody things he was capable of. And it was glorious.

name: Krark-Clan Grunt
text: The more weapons a goblin breaks in battle, the more respected he becomes.

name: Rapid Hybridization
text: It's like the cycle of reincarnation, just significantly more abrupt.

name: Liliana's Specter
text:
"The finest minions know what I need without me ever saying a thing."
—Liliana Vess

name: Daghatar the Adamant
text: "Our victories will protect a thousand generations."

name: Sauté
text:
"Selecting the proper beeble is the key to a good sauté. The pinker the fur and the heartier the yelp, the more succulent the beeble will be when you pop it in your mouth."
—Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar, *The Underworld Cookbook*

name: Iron Golem
text: Once an iron golem is set to a task, it won't turn aside until that task is complete or it has been destroyed.

name: Grindstone
text:
"Memory is a burden that wears at the soul as weather wears at stone."
—Crovax

name: Down for Repairs
text: Safety twelfth.

name: Groundswell
text: "This world will not be tamed."

name: Invasion of Azgol // Ashen Reaper
text: Eternal hatred fuels eternal fire.

name: Ironclaw Orcs
text: Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan.

name: Voices from the Void
text: As Grixis collided with the rest of Alara, the worlds began to hear the hateful whispers of the forgotten dead.

name: Illusionist's Bracers
text: It's easy to believe you're a god when you're twice as powerful as everyone else.

name: Secret Base
text: The League of Dastardly Doom takes the word "headquarters" very seriously.

name: Keeneye Aven
text: "I have no need of a map. The continent itself guides my way."

name: Auriok Siege Sled
text: Everything in its path is either pushed aside or ground under.

name: Ashen Monstrosity
text: There was a dull thunder at the vanguard, then shocked cries in the midst of the column. Moments later, Takada, last of the rearguard, faced the kami alone.

name: Overrun
text:
"You want to know your enemy? Look at your feet while you trample him."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

name: Cloudkin Seer
text: "I can see which way the wind is blowing."

name: Castle Raptors
text: "Each place we see is as ruined and lifeless as the last. So here we stay, because this ruin is *ours*."

name: Hunt the Weak
text: Natural evolution is often at odds with industrial progress.

name: Thaumatic Compass // Spires of Orazca
text:
"Clearly, it indicates the aetheric azimuth of . . ."
—Jace Beleren

name: Luminesce
text:
"The White Shield is not the burnished metal you lash to your forearm but the conviction that burns in your chest."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Mirrodin Avenged
text: "You were my mistake. I will forever bear the weight of your horrors, and of your end."

name: Ghor-Clan Rampager
text:
"The Simic come from the cold slow depths. How could they understand the fire in a wild heart?"
—Kroshkar, Gruul shaman

name: Beast Within
text: "Monsters dwell in every heart. We only think civilization tames them." ―Euphemia, Nexus watcher

name: Encrust
text:
"Barnacles are the sea's final defense."
—Garild, merfolk mage

name: Royal Assassin
text: Trained in the arts of stealth, royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

name: Runeclaw Bear
text: Bears aren't always as strong and as mean as you imagine. Some are even stronger and meaner.

name: Swinging Ship
text:
"A good ride should always feel like something has gone terribly wrong."
—*Salzon's Ride Review*

name: Voldaren Duelist
text: "I have yet to find my equal."

name: Drillworks Mole
text: The Flaming Fist soldiers prepared to face a bulette, or worse, but the cause of the rumblings turned out to be much more benign and bizarre.

name: Rat Colony
text: Wreckage from the Phyrexian Invasion provided the rats with a seemingly unlimited number of breeding grounds.

name: Polymorphist's Jest
text:
"The flies were bothering me."
—Jalira, master polymorphist

name: Reflecting Pool
text: Gale stared into the pool and saw a stranger. The similarities were uncanny, but it was not him.

name: Ogre Gatecrasher
text: A popular game among ogres is to see how many revolutions a head can make before it pops off.

name: Nikya of the Old Ways
text: "The hooves of the Raze-Boar will trample the weak—and their city—to dust!"

name: Mask of Avacyn
text: It hides the face and protects the soul.

name: Red Cliffs Armada
text: By the battle of Red Cliffs in the year 208, the Wu kingdom controlled more than 7,000 warships on the Yangtze.

name: Tropical Storm
text:
"After the storm, I found a sea turtle dying on the sands, a blade of grass driven through its shell."
—*Travelogue of Najat*

name: Stern Proctor
text:
"I preferred the harsh tutors—they made mischief all the more fun."
—Teferi, third-level student

name: Star Compass
text: It doesn't point north. It points home.

name: Onakke Javelineer
text: With the ways between worlds thrown open, the Chain Veil's foul magic seeped from a vault deep within Ravnica all the way to Shandalar's dormant masters.

name: Harrowing Journey
text:
"There are always fools who attempt to traverse Kruin Pass before sundown and every time they wind up in a race for their lives."
—Old Rutstein

name: Wishmonger
text: "It's not what you ask for, but how you ask for it."

name: Loathsome Chimera
text:
"I see... elk? And lion? And... teeth! A lot of teeth!"
—Teraklos of Meletis

name: Rewind
text:
"Time flows like a river. In Tolaria we practice the art of building dams."
—Barrin, master wizard

name: Into the Fire
text: The rest of the Gatewatch retreated. Chandra and Wrenn went in blazing.

name: Cloud Key
text: The musical sound of its turning triggers the tumblers of revelation.

name: Warden of Evos Isle
text: On Evos Isle, the swift and formidable aven enforce the will of the ruling sphinxes.

name: Loxodon Warhammer
text:
"Tusks to splinter skulls. Steel to shatter scale."
—Warhammer inscription

name: Soul Shatter
text: The Kargan tribes share legends of the victory their ancestors won over the Akoum Skyclave, and its horrendous cost.

name: Samite Censer-Bearer
text: Samite alchemists extracted aromatic traces of healing minerals from the residue of the receding salt dunes.

name: Puncturing Blow
text:
"Neither the false God-Pharaoh nor his bugs will decide our fate."
—Samut, former Tah-crop initiate

name: Manifold Key
text:
"Finally! It was worth the price to never have to fiddle with lockpicks ever again."
—Davvry Mineshadow, thief

name: Scorn-Blade Berserker
text: "Before I fall, I will taste the blood of Sarulf himself!"

name: Spikeshot Goblin
text: The path of a goblin shaman is a journey through a thousand ways of hurting people.

name: Scaled Behemoth
text: Surviving an encounter with it is proof enough that an initiate is ready for the Trial of Strength.

name: Selesnya Guildgate
text:
"We leave our gardens open, so all may know wonder, but guarded, so all may know peace."
—Emmara

name: Marsh Viper
text:
"And the seraphs sob at vermin fangs In human gore imbued."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The Conqueror Wurm"

name: Vandalblast
text: Our hero struck with a flash of steel, slicing the monster's claw and freeing the young girl from its grasp!

name: King of the Pride
text:
"Glorious, to walk again across the savannah with my beloved."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Aeolipile
text:
"Although fragile, the Aeolipile could be quite destructive."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. I*

name: Goblin Matron
text: There's always room for one more.

name: Vanquish the Weak
text: Open conflict between expeditionary houses—or even individual adventuring parties—is discouraged, but "accidents" happen.

name: Rugged Highlands
text: Defense laser emplacements are usually located at high altitude, where the rarified air does little to impede their range of destructive efficacy.

name: Smell Fear
text:
"It's fun when they run a little."
—Wasitora, Nekoru queen

name: Feral Abomination
text:
"Urborg used to be lovely—scenic volcanoes, respectable lich lords. Since the Cabal came with their nightmares and thrulls, it's all gone to the worms."
—Mister Lostspoons, Skulltown gossip

name: Might of Oaks
text: "Guess where I'm gonna plant this!"

name: Sanctum Gargoyle
text: As their supplies of etherium dwindled, mechanists sent gargoyles farther and farther afield in search of salvage.

name: Highspire Infusion
text:
"If nothing else, the Inventors' Fair taught us that we're only beginning to discover aether's true potential."
—Kershan Danil, Highspire artisan

name: Smothering Tithe
text:
"I await your donation."
—Dasha, Orzhov priest

name: Rofellos
text: Gerrard's longtime friend and fellow student under the maro-sorcerer Multani, Rofellos is an excellent warrior and excellent company. Though adept at both magic and swordplay, he's far more comfortable with a flagon in his hand and a good companion at his side.

name: Elite Javelineer
text:
"Precision is frequently more valuable than force."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Chorus of the Conclave
text: "We are many, yet one. We are separate in body, yet speak with a single voice. Join us in our chorus."

name: Thorntooth Witch
text: The crone's boughs creaked as she spoke. "You look peaked, little one. Come, sip from my warm brew. It'll have you blooming in no time."

name: Body Double
text: "I am who I pretend to be."

name: Expose to Daylight
text:
"Lies cannot long withstand the harsh light of day."
—Lavinia

name: Destructive Force
text: The end of the world rarely comes quietly.

name: Canopy Gorger
text: The settlement's defenders were glad to have such a massive, ferocious creature join the fight—but less glad to see it flatten their homes along the way.

name: Pseudodragon Familiar
text: Pseudodragons are favored companions of wizards, prized for their cunning and curiosity.

name: Moaning Wall
text: Before the monuments, before the first trials, before Naktamun itself, Bolas culled the plane of its adults in order to rebuild it for his own designs.

name: Eruth, Tormented Prophet
text: "The blood is the life! The blood is the life!"

name: Cunning Wish
text: The foolish wish for that which they desire. The cunning wish for that which they require.

name: Stone-Throwing Devils
text: Sometimes those with the most sin cast the first stones.

name: Village Rites
text:
"My colleagues revile the barbarity of the Blood Age, but I believe we have much to learn from the magics of endless war."
—Embrose, Silverquill dean

name: Deathbonnet Sprout // Deathbonnet Hulk
text: They grow up so fast.

name: Persecute
text: "I want every last one of these tree-hugging, earth-loving, pointy-eared weaklings out of here. Now!"

name: Warstorm Surge
text: Khorne's sole desire is to drown the galaxy in a tide of slaughter. To conquer and kill every living thing, until there is nothing left but spilled blood and shattered bone.

name: Crucible of Worlds
text: Greatness is forged in fire and fervor.

name: Megrim
text:
"Pain is both a tool and a craft. Like any tool, it must be sharpened. Like any craft, it must be practiced."
—Hooks, Cabal torturer

name: Trustworthy Scout
text: "Don't worry. If you lose me I'll be right behind you."

name: Hobgoblin Bandit Lord
text: In a hobgoblin's view of the world, the weak owe tribute and fealty to the strong.

name: Cleanse
text: The clouds broke and the sun's rays burst forth; each foul beast in its turn faltered, and was gone.

name: Breathstealer
text:
"As a child, I slept with a cloth over my face, to hide from the spirits that might pull the air from my lungs."
—Mosi, Femeref weaver

name: Archmage Emeritus
text: Some emeritus professors return from their wanderings periodically to share tales of the mystical wonders of Arcavios.

name: Foam Weapons Kiosk
text:
"I'm sorry, ma'am. Sometimes a real sword just sneaks its way in there."
—Randa, day care blacksmith

name: Farfinder
text: "Take us home," she whispered, and the fox's eyes began to glow.

name: Broken Wings
text:
"Fynn climbed the highest peak and waited, still and silent, until the falling snow had hidden him entirely. When the great eagle flew past, the hunter's aim was true."
—*Saga of the Wisdom Seeker*

name: Circuit Mender
text: Inspired by industrious silkworms, its maker crafted it to restore the broken pieces of the world.

name: Darkslick Drake
text: At the edge of the Mephidross, Phyrexia's influence seeps into life and land.

name: Sorcerous Sight
text: Do not react; anticipate.

name: Carrier Pigeons
text:
"It's true I ask no fealty of the flocks—but surely we are more than mere beasts."
—King Darien of Kjeldor, in a missive to General Varchild

name: Fractured Powerstone
text: The Thran learned to capture mana, but power inevitably escapes its bonds.

name: Pulse Tracker
text:
"You can't think your way out of this, Jace. Thought implies life, and life requires a pulse—music to a hunter's ears."
—Vraska

name: Aeronaut Tinkerer
text: "All tinkerers have their heads in the clouds. I don't intend to stop there."

name: Bookwurm
text: It takes "devouring a book in one sitting" to a frightening extreme.

name: Patagia Tiger
text: Lukka looked out from the parapet and saw not a monster to be put down, but a fierce kind of beauty.

name: Choose Your Champion
text: "It seems the fate of the world rests on your shoulders, feeble child."

name: Murderous Spoils
text: Scavengers are always the first to pay their respects.

name: Ambush Party
text:
"Fair fight? I'll take survival over chivalry any day!"
—Tor Wauki, Bandit King

name: Empyrial Archangel
text: Her wings are the prayers of the devoted; her sword, the despair of the vile.

name: Curate
text: "*Kathorran War Chants, Vol. III*? That doesn't even belong in this wing!"

name: Dismiss
text:
"There is nothing you can do that I cannot simply deny."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Hipparion
text:
