"Someone once said that hipparions are to warriors what aesthir are to skyknights. Don't believe it."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Lupine Prototype
text:
"Ludevic saw it in a dream and set to work immediately, every detail already known. Can such genius be taught?"
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Thirst for Discovery
text:
"This is your only warning, alchemist. The secrets of the sea are not yours to behold. Lord Krothuss will not be so merciful next time."
—Runo Stromkirk

name: Deadeye Plunderers
text: "Keep your friends close and your enemies within range."

name: Corrosive Mentor
text: Guttering cinders stoke their dying flames by snuffing out the lights of others.

name: Waterkin Shaman
text: "They come to drink, to bathe, and—I believe—to play."

name: Dead Reveler
text: He's the unlife of the party.

name: Elder Land Wurm
text: Sometimes it's best to let sleeping dragons lie.

name: Griffin Protector
text: Griffin flocks still patrol the skies above the Zhalfirin void, as though they are waiting for their old home to reappear.

name: Zephyr Falcon
text: Although greatly prized among falconers, the zephyr falcon is capricious and not easily tamed.

name: Irradiate
text: The blast ignores the cage of metal but devours the flesh inside.

name: Healing Leaves
text: The elves of Llanowar don't trust in alchemy. They rely instead on pure herbs harvested from the forest's sacred heart.

name: Indomitable Ancients
text:
"Odum and Broadbark were the only beings mighty enough to challenge the giant Moran the Destroyer. Their battle lasted a hundred dawns, until Moran became so exhausted that he fell into namesleep. He awoke as Moran the Gardener."
—*The Tale of Odum and Broadbark*

name: Idyllic Beachfront
text: In the tradition of the original Tolarian Academy, every Tolarian campus is built near a body of water.

name: Crosswinds
text: Harbin's ornithopter had been trapped for two days within the currents of the storm. When the skies cleared, all he could see was a horizon of trees.

name: Viashino Sandstalker
text:
"Some believe sandstalkers to be illusions; those with scars know better."
—*Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert*

name: Pointy Finger of Doom
text: Nails and destruction on point.

name: Pie-Eating Contest
text: The pie was outstanding. The cobbler tasted like shoes.

name: Enraged Giant
text: When fighting spilled over into Giant's Walk, the aether weapons and swooping airships angered the normally placid creatures.

name: Lim-Dûl's Cohort
text:
"Join me in the place of power, you risen dead. Join me where the waters weep and the trees have no hearts."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Book Devourer
text: "Not my first edition of *The Advokist and the Urchin*!"

name: Seekers' Squire
text: Dusk follows the light.

name: Mountain
text: As you make camp near the ancient ruin, you hear the sound of drums echoing in halls where no dwarf has lived in generations.

name: Repair and Recharge
text:
"Throw the bodies out. They'll just weigh down the frame."
—Rolf, Argivian mechanic

name: Flare of Faith
text: "I fell to my knees. I called out to Sigarda. And then I saw my tormentors blaze with blessed sunlight."

name: Selesnya Sagittars
text:
"What's their strike range, you ask? Let's put it this way: sagittars aim their bows using *maps*."
—Otak, Tin Street shopkeep

name: Archangel
text: The sky rang with the cries of armored seraphs, and the darkness made a tactical retreat.

name: Intangible Virtue
text: In life, they were a motley crew: farmers, lords, cutpurses, priests. In death, they are united in singular, benevolent purpose.

name: Jace's Erasure
text: "You should try to clear your mind of idle thoughts. And if you can't, I will."

name: Seedtime
text:
The hippo grows wings to fight the condor.
—Nantuko teaching

name: Deeproot Elite
text: "You think I stand alone? I have the forest at my call, the waters at my back. I outnumber you."

name: Godo's Irregulars
text: Godo trained their muscles and honed their skills, but he left their hearts wild and empty.

name: Webweaver Changeling
text: Eight legs carrying endless phobias.

name: Assault Griffin
text:
"Fine soldiers guarded the northern front. They waited for two-legged foes and left the skies unheeded."
—General Avitora

name: Sleek Schooner
text: The pirates had left the open sea behind, but they were still in their element: reckless adventure.

name: Risen Sanctuary
text: When one of the great guardians arises, it sweeps enemies aside like chaff yet takes care not to crush a single insect underfoot.

name: Goblinslide
text: Goblins, like snowflakes, are only dangerous in numbers.

name: Underworld Sentinel
text: Deathless soldiers called phylaskia guard the borders of the Underworld.

name: Magus of the Will
text: "These eyes have shown me the flaws of flesh."

name: Invigorating Boon
text:
"Bright spores coalesced in empty air. Seedlings burst through barren soil. Genesis had arrived.
—*Scroll of Beginnings*

name: Cursed Minotaur
text:
"Look! That is why we must never waver. That is what awaits us if we fail."
—Djeru, initiate of Tah crop

name: Undergrowth
text:
"It is the work of sorcery. Burn it!"
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Vivien's Crocodile
text:
"Regardless of where they come from, crocs are usually able to find their way home. For this one, home is me."
—Vivien Reid

name: Archwing Dragon
text: Swifter than an angel, crueler than a demon, and relentless as a ghoul.

name: Prowess of the Fair
text: An elvish duel is a thing of beauty: the warriors' grace, the crash of steel, then the artful spray of blood.

name: Toxin Sliver
text: It doesn't need to use its venom—it just needs you to know it can.

name: Scared Stiff
text: The horrors of Sorin's Haunted Mansion scared Hurrk half to life.

name: Sibilant Spirit
text:
"Relax. I'm sure it's just a snake hissing."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Wall of Ice
text: "And through the drifts the snowy cliffs/ Did send a dismal sheen:/ Nor shapes of men nor beasts we ken—/ The ice was all between."/ —Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Marble Gargoyle
text:
"Once past the stony exterior, the meat is exquisite and can be stuffed with thallids or simmered in a broth of manticore venom."
—Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar
*The Underworld Cookbook*

name: Serra's Blessing
text: "Rise, and I will show you how to run without flagging, fight without raging, and fly without wings."

name: Birds of Paradise
text: Its brilliant plumage painted streaks of color across a sky long darkened by war.

name: Sakura-Tribe Elder
text: Slain orochi warriors were buried with a tree sapling so they would become a part of the forest after death.

name: Purify the Grave
text: Some priests speak in whispers of the Helvault, a silver prison of unpurged evils.

name: Pact of the Titan
text: Born of fire, destined for battle.

name: Brainstorm
text: 2012 Legacy Championship Winner

name: Ebony Rhino
text:
"That Rhino would fetch us a tidy sum, Joven. Perhaps it's time to make it ours."
—Chandler

name: Pendelhaven
text: The limbs of Pendelhaven extend as far as the meek roam, and reach as high as they strive.

name: Defile
text:
"Agresto, bring up the rear . . . Agresto?"
—Sergeant Dremark Eigen, last words

name: Jerrard of the Closed Fist
text: Once, the order of the Closed Fist reached throughout the Kb'Briann Highlands. Now, Jerrard alone remains to uphold their standard.

name: Tamiyo's Journal
text: Entry 711: There's more to Avacyn's madness . . .

name: Animating Faerie // Bring to Life
text: A true puppet master has no need for strings.

name: Cleansing Nova
text:
An opal that holds limitless fire ... my love.
Leaving the world anew
With its cleansing embrace.

name: Martyrdom
text:
"Martyrs are cheaper than mercenaries, and a far better investment."
—General Varchild

name: Abuna Acolyte
text: "You can break nothing I cannot mend."

name: Lingering Death
text:
"Looks bad. I don't know if he'll make it through the night."
—Cabal cleric

name: Welding Sparks
text:
"The fires of invention burn in all of us. I fight for the freedom to unleash those flames."
—Pia Nalaar

name: Sift
text:
"Twice I have let the Legacy slip away. Never again."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Trial of Zeal
text: "Eternal glory awaits you, my child."

name: Smoldering Werewolf // Erupting Dreadwolf
text:
"Never thought I'd see the day I'd be wishing to see just a plain old werewolf."
—Raf Gyel of the Quiver of Kessig

name: Spined Wurm
text:
"As it moved, the wurm's spines gathered up bits of flowstone, which took the shapes of dead villagers' heads. Each head spoke a single sound, but if taken together, they said, 'Alas for the living.'"
—Dal myth of the wurm

name: Soulreaper of Mogis
text: "We offer to Mogis the blood of the weak, and in return he makes us strong."

name: Khalni Hydra
text:
"In ages past, bargains were struck and promises were made. Now we must collect on our debt. Begin the hymns."
—Moruul, Khalni druid

name: Bubbling Muck
text: The muck claims a hundred living things for each meager treasure it spews forth.

name: Flame Wave
text:
"I hear the roaring of a wave whose waters are red and whose mists are black."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Dhund Operative
text: Baral's spies always have the latest technology.

name: Marauding Knight
text: "They ride our trails as if they were designed to," said the guard. "They were," replied Gerrard.

name: Clash of Wills
text:
"The mind of an Eldrazi is a puzzle that can never be solved. The trick is to make sure a piece goes missing."
—Jace Beleren

name: Vow of Wildness
text:
"Savagery is the birthright of every creature that draws breath—or wishes it could."
—Karador, Ghost Chieftain

name: Talruum Piper
text: When the Talruum began to play, the dragons fell from the sky to squash the obnoxious noise.

name: Winds of Change
text:
"'Tis the set of sails, and not the gales, Which tells us the way to go."
—Ella Wheeler Wilcox

name: Thing in the Ice // Awoken Horror
text:
"It serves as evidence of the ancient power of the deep, a reminder that the sea is the only thing worthy of reverence."
—Runo Stromkirk

name: Leyline of Lifeforce
text: Where sovereignty and flesh converge.

name: Upwelling
text: Once again, Kamahl felt the full force of the Mirari's pull, but he had learned much since the last time.

name: Ride Down
text:
"I will wash you from my hooves!"
—Mardu taunt

name: Totally Lost
text: Fblthp had always hated crowds.

name: Twisted Image
text:
"True strength is in the mind, for the body is too malleable a form."
—Politus, vedalken emisar

name: Ashenmoor Liege
text: Cinders carry an ancestral grudge that makes them slow to trust and quick to retaliate.

name: Wren's Run Hydra
text: The boggart hopped carelessly among the roots . . . until the roots woke up.

name: Plated Spider
text: Most spiders wait patiently for their prey to arrive. Most spiders aren't forty feet tall.

name: Runewing
text: In the hands of the open-minded, a runewing quill writes wisdom of its own.

name: Underground River
text:
"The war polluted the land, turning what had once been fruitful fields into fetid morasses of mud and rusted corpses."
—*The Antiquities War*

name: Necrogen Censer
text: Moriok necromancers actively spread necrogen, encouraging the transformation from Mirran to nim.

name: Rats of Rath
text:
"These creatures offer new challenges in the scrutiny of entrails."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Foxfire
text:
"Only the foolish fear foxfire."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Boggart Sprite-Chaser
text:
"Auntie pointed out to the faerie how much mischief a flying boggart could wreak, and a beautiful new friendship was born."
—A tale of Auntie Grub

name: Carapace
text:
"Now *that's* a fashion statement."
—Devin, faerie noble

name: Yule Ooze
text: It loves having family for dinner.

name: Stonehewer Giant
text: "No matter how strong, an unarmed fighter is no more than a fool."

name: Bristling Boar
text: The spikes of bone protruding from its hide serve primarily as protection, but as they accumulate bits of foliage from the surrounding forest, they also provide camouflage.

name: Cling to Dust
text: In bleak Tizerus, all hope crumbles in your grasp.

name: Wind Drake
text: Air currents whip through the city corridors, creating wind tunnels that accelerate urban drakes toward their prey.

name: Clifftop Retreat
text: Where cathars learn to fight not only demons and vampires, but ignorance as well.

name: Engulfing Slagwurm
text: Its teeth exist only for decoration.

name: Entomb
text:
"Oh, don't worry about that one. I'm saving him for later."
—Liliana Vess

name: Prophet of Kruphix
text: "Time is fluid as a dance, and truth as fleeting."

name: Avenging Huntbonder
text: "I teach the cubs how to kill the two-legs quickly, and why it's best for the pride."

name: Nettle Sentinel
text: Though Shadowmoor's monster-haunted wilds beckon, she never leaves her post.

name: Kazuul, Tyrant of the Cliffs
text: Warning to those who scale the cliffs without paying tribute: It's a long way down.

name: Autumnal Gloom // Ancient of the Equinox
text:
"When the leaves fall and the nights grow cold, look elsewhere for firewood."
—Ola of Lambholt

name: Raugrin Crystal
text: The vegetation in Raugrin is dull, but that only makes the towering crystal structures gleam brighter.

name: Hammerfist Giant
text:
"Oh sure, they buy a lot of ale, but I always find myself needing to rebuild after the giants have paid a visit."
—Belko, owner of Titan's Keg tavern

name: Hedron Archive
text: The vaults of the Necron Dynasties contain all manner of esoteric artifacts, most forged long before many of the younger races even existed.

name: Angelic Gift
text: "Zendikar will triumph this day, and our armies will fly with angels."

name: Faith's Reward
text:
"I thought the wind was ushering me to my final destination, but it lifted me to my feet and I fought on."
—Idrus, war priest of Thune

name: Blood Celebrant
text:
"Their blood is the nectar that nourishes the Cabal."
—Phage the Untouchable

name: Knight of the Keep
text: "What good is loyalty to the crown if we are not also in service to those less fortunate? I fight for all of us."

name: Cathar's Companion
text:
"Unwavering and loyal, they represent stability in uncertain times."
—Rem Karolus, Slayer of Angels

name: Mother of Goons
text: "Word to me."

name: Cylian Sunsinger
text: "The sun shines bright upon the strong."

name: Hedron Crawler
text:
"It's endearing, in a mystical, pointy sort of way."
—General Tazri, allied commander

name: Ugin's Nexus
text: All at once Sarkhan's mind fell silent.

name: Heartwood Treefolk
text:
"In all my years in Llanowar I never understood where trees fit in. They are revered by elves and watered on by dogs."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Charnelhoard Wurm
text: Jund's dragons hoard only sangrite crystals. Its wurms aren't so picky.

name: Mosscoat Goriak
text:
"Goriaks are as stubborn and hardy as I'd expect of a large herbivore in a wetland habitat. But I never expected them to have such beautiful voices!"
—Vivien Reid

name: Swarmyard
text: Each winter, squirrel elders tell tales of the fabled Nut Hoard of the Fallen Oaks. Each spring, young squirrels leave home in hopes of finding it.

name: Leovold, Emissary of Trest
text: "I'm sure we can come to an arrangement."

name: Torbran, Thane of Red Fell
text: A dwarf's grudge runs deeper than the mountains' roots.

name: Mind Flayer
text: "Shed your thoughts and let my will flow through you."

name: Weigh Down
text: The draugr often drown intruders. Years later, their corpses rise from the depths to join the ranks of the Dread Marn.

name: Demonic Rising
text: Which is the greater folly, summoning the demon or expecting gratitude from it?

name: Meteor Shower
text:
"Eenie, meenie, minie, moe . . . oh, why not all of them?"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Sneaking Guide
text: "I swear, it's a shortcut."

name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
text: Most human scholars believe that Merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from Merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

name: Improvised Armor
text: "I trust what I make for myself. Do you trust more what is made for you by another?"

name: Grip of Chaos
text: When the world is consumed by chaos, the skilled and the foolish are on equal footing.

name: Trade Routes
text: Like the price of goods, the value of the routes was renegotiated daily.

name: Ingenious Artillerist
text: "Sure, you can help me calibrate the aiming mechanism. Stand over there."

name: Norwood Ranger
text: Some trees bear deadly fruit.

name: Lord of Atlantis
text:
"'We have no legs,' the warrior spat, 'for we have finished running.'"
—Vodalian folktale

name: Madrush Cyclops
text: Death comes in the blink of an eye.

name: Polluted Mire
text: As the continent sank over the course of eons, the tomb complex slowly flooded. The sleeping Necrons, their stasis crypts corrupted, never awoke.

name: Study Break
text: "You've been cramming all night. You're taking a nap whether you like it or not."

name: Crash Through
text:
"Uni! Uni! I knew you'd come back!"
—Bobby

name: Déjà Vu
text: The past is a mirror of the future.

name: Azure Drake
text: Little dreamt could seem so cruel As waiting for the wings outspread, The jagged teeth, the burning eyes, And dagger-claws that clench to nerves.

name: Guardian's Magemark
text: The soldier moved with fluid poise, his awareness extending far beyond five senses.

name: Rookie Mistake
text: "Stop locking your knees as you strike! Now stand up and try again."

name: Leyline of Lightning
text: Where storm and spellcraft converge.

name: Familiar Ground
text:
"I'd rather fight on foreign soil. That way, if I lose I can blame it on the terrain."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Thirst for Knowledge
text: Lymph, the fluid essence of blinkmoths, is prized by wizards for the rush of intellect it provides.

name: Fallen Angel
text:
"Why do you weep for the dead? I rejoice, for they have died for me."
—Fallen angel, to Serra

name: Armed and Armored
text: The dwarves of Axgard seldom have reason to leave their impregnable underground kingdom—but when they do, they go in force.

name: Flame Blitz
text: "Blast it, not again!"

name: Nettletooth Djinn
text:
"The few of us who survived were denied entry to our camp for two days—so like the pox were the marks we bore."
—*Travelogue of Najat*

name: War Elephant
text: "When elephants fight it is the grass that suffers." —Kikuyu Proverb

name: Hazy Homunculus
text: They hide in dreams and whispers and faraway thoughts.

name: Serum Visions
text: Serum was once derived from Mirrodin's blinkmoths, offering visions of inspiration. Now it is pulled from Phyrexian inkmoths, yielding visions of perfection.

name: Merrow Bonegnawer
text: Banished to the Dark Meanders for hideous crimes, some merrows find a taste for the darkness . . . and the dead.

name: Marchesa's Smuggler
text: "Watch your head . . . and your back."

name: Ledev Guardian
text: "I've raised her since she was a pup, and she's raised me since I was a recruit."

name: Savannah Sage
text: "Now is not the time for your light to fade."

name: Angelheart Vial
text: It holds a whisper from Iona: "Persevere."

name: Midnight Assassin
text: The broad avenues and graceful spires of Park Heights are the playground of the affluent. After nightfall, they also make a fine hunting ground.

name: Constricting Tendrils
text: Priests of Bant protect their temples with traps more elaborate than any mosaic floor.

name: Deathless Ancient
text: "Ancient one, we have reached the promised shore. The Immortal Sun is near. Drink and awake."

name: Penumbra Wurm
text: Its ferocity cannot be contained in one lifetime.

name: Crypt Incursion
text: The Golgari maze-runner Varolz hungers to prove his fortitude in battle, and his trail of victims feeds other hungers.

name: Pilgrim of the Fires
text: The most skilled Jeskai artisans can craft imposing golems with such precision that they will last an eternity—the time believed necessary to master the Fires of the Jeskai Way.

name: Covert Operative
text: Some spies seek clarity. Others seek transparency.

name: Minion Reflector
text: To crack a mirror is to provide an opening for the reflection to escape.

name: Grizzled Outrider
text: "Sure, a horse might be faster. But I'd like to see a horse take the head clean off a troll in one swipe!"

name: Seachrome Coast
text: Where indoctrination meets inquiry, currents roil restlessly beneath the surface.

name: Wings of Aesthir
text:
"For those of courage, even the sky holds no limit."
—Arnjlot Olasson, Sky Mage

name: Amrou Seekers
text: The paradise of Amrou Haven had become a field of cinders. Its people struggled to survive, hoping to see visions of its past in the strange storms that quickly passed.

name: Goblin Clearcutter
text:
"Did you know that wood burns even better than rocks?"
—Toggo, goblin weaponsmith

name: Helm of the Gods
text: Its blessings are as numerous as the stars of Nyx.

name: Fury Sliver
text:
"A rift opened, and our arrows were abruptly stilled. To move was to push the world. But the sliver's claw still twitched, red wounds appeared in Thed's chest, and ribbons of blood hung in the air."
—Adom Capashen, Benalish hero

name: Brooding Saurian
text:
"I have been trapped in the lizard's lair for days. It seems to regard me as its child and will not let me leave."
—Aevar Borg, northern guide, journal entry

name: Mystical Tutor
text: "Now, did I file that away under 'C' for 'Combo' or 'F' for 'Finisher?'"

name: Sluggishness
text: Vark decided to lie down and think of a good excuse to quit working.

name: Mind Unbound
text: The creations of the hand are confined by reality. The creations of the mind know no such limits.

name: Epic Struggle
text:
"If our foes will not listen to words, perhaps hooves and claws will make them take notice."
—Seton, centaur druid

name: Null Profusion
text:
"Some say that time is cyclical and that history inevitably repeats. My will is my own. I won't bow to fate."
—Volrath

name: Brass Squire
text:
"I admire it. Few pull off pluck and subservience at the same time."
—Ezuri, renegade leader

name: Paranoid Parish-Blade
text: The mind is perfectly capable of creating its own monsters.

name: Briar Patch
text: As easily as the dryads could close a fist, so could the branches and underbrush entangle.

name: Kheru Dreadmaw
text: Its hunting instincts have long since rotted away. Its hunger, however, remains.

name: Demotion
text: There's no greater honor than joining your chosen guild, and no greater shame than failing it.

name: Privileged Position
text:
"We in the Conclave have a saying: 'When you hold a shield, lend your shield.' The strong must never forget what they owe to the weak."
— Niszka, Selesnya evangel

name: Emcee
text: The ogre appealed the match loss and got it downgraded to a warning.

name: Havengul Laboratory // Havengul Mystery
text:
"Today, we make history. Today, we make contact."
—Dr. Martin Brenner

name: Artisan's Sorrow
text: Some seers read bones or entrails. Others just like to break things.

name: Painful Truths
text: As the Eldrazi spread, no secret that could give Zendikar's defenders an advantage was considered too dangerous to seek.

name: Invasion of Ixalan // Belligerent Regisaur
text:
"Careful. Its vision is based on fear, and it can smell movement . . . or something like that."
—Gregor, amateur zoologist

name: Honor-Worn Shaku
text: Before being presented to its lord, each shaku is blessed by every hero of every region within that lord's domain.

name: Alley Grifters
text: One distracts the victim, the other extracts the valuables.

name: Sea Gate Oracle
text: "The secret entrance should be near."

name: Peerless Samurai
text: "I fear I have run out of worthy opponents."

name: Samite Herbalist
text: "Spiritual wholeness is not something you can give to yourself: it is attained only through the divine blessing of healing another."

name: Myr Retriever
text: Mephidross gives up treasure easily... as long as you take its place.

name: Boartusk Liege
text: The boar leads its rider to victory in battle, but it doesn't know how close it is to becoming the victory feast.

name: Curse of Death's Hold
text: "May you and all your kin waste and wither until your clan is no more!"

name: Old Fogey
text: "These kids today with their collector numbers and their newfangled tap symbol. Twenty Black Lotuses and twenty Plague Rats. Now that's *real* Magic."

name: Desperate Lunge
text: Ravnica held its breath as the hero of the resistance—their last hope—flew through the sky, his dark sword ready to strike a god.

name: Triumph of Ferocity
text:
"Rid me of this curse, witch, or die with me."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Boros Battleshaper
text: Leaders shape the minds of their allies. It takes a master to shape the minds of enemies.

name: Goreclaw, Terror of Qal Sisma
text: You don't want to know how she got that name.

name: Primal Druid
text: "The power of the woods is only ever borrowed."

name: Soldevi Golem
text: Slow and steady wins the race.

name: All Is Dust
text:
"The emergence of the Eldrazi isn't necessarily a bad thing, as long as you've already lived a fulfilling and complete life without regrets."
—Javad Nasrin, Ondu relic hunter

name: Eiganjo Castle
text: Since the war began, the castle's walls mark the only place on Kamigawa where no kami has ever set foot.

name: Noxious Ghoul
text: Plague and death wrapped in one convenient package.

name: Fraternal Exaltation
text:
... and when you want to go explore, the number you should have is four.
—Sandra Boynton

name: Strionic Resonator
text: Nobody knew what the relic did, only that it was growing louder.

name: Hunted Lammasu
text: The lammasu ruled the velds before the city grew. Now they roam Ravnica's skies, but their ancient enemies have not forgotten them.

name: Angelic Wall
text:
"The air stirred as if fanned by angels' wings, and the enemy was turned aside."
—Tales of Ikarov the Voyager

name: Faerie Guidemother // Gift of the Fae
text: No one is so lost that a faerie can't find them.

name: Beacon of Destiny
text: "We all borrowed life from the Ancestor to exist in this world. Today, I repay that debt."

name: Hoisted Hireling
text: Zarv no longer trusted the kitten posters telling him to "hang in there."

name: Crafty Cutpurse
text: Possession is eleven-tenths of the pirate code.

name: Memory Crystal
text: Hues of recollection flicker like facets of a gem.

name: Master Decoy
text:
"A skilled decoy can throw your enemies off your trail. A master decoy can survive to do it again."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Complaints Clerk
text: The longest lines in the park.

name: Tree of Perdition
text: There will be no absolution.

name: Planar Birth
text:
"From womb of nothingness sprang this place of beauty, purity, and hope realized."
—*Song of All*, canto 3

name: Daring Skyjek
text: "The hard part isn't landing in the saddle. The hard part is leaping before you see it."

name: Dead of Winter
text:
"At last, silence."
—Tevesh Szat

name: Goblin Brigand
text: Like a loaded cannon—point and shoot.

name: Tyrant's Machine
text:
"Though tempered differently, all wills can be broken."
—Inquisitor Kyrik

name: Riverglide Pathway // Lavaglide Pathway
text:
"Don't fear the heat. Just let it lift you up."
—Amandi, kitesail expert

name: Hungry Mist
text:
"If the air must feed, let it take the self-righteous."
—Murat, death speaker

name: Prowling Caracal
text: A hunter in the city requires the utmost cunning to survive. It must pounce only if the kill is certain, and leave the remains where no one will see.

name: Brute Strength
text: "Oketra had our crop build an obelisk to prove the power of working together. But I am stronger without the weak."

name: Fires of Invention
text: "Just tell us how many you want and get out of the way."

name: Murderer's Axe
text: Though the first who raised it in a fit of passion is long dead, the axe still carries memories of bitter scorn.

name: Vital Splicer
text:
"For every one that falls, ten shall rise. The revelation of New Phyrexia is at hand."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Jirina, Dauntless General
text: "Our strength lies not in our walls, but in our people."

name: Rakdos Shred-Freak
text: "If there were such a thing as a soul, I think it would be behind the gallbladder but above the kidneys."

name: Ravaging Horde
text: Upon his return to the capitol after taking soldiers to loot a nearby peaceful town, the prime minister, Dong Zhou, boasted of it as a victory over bandits.

name: Shimmering Wings
text:
"I leave words like 'impossible' to the rabble. Whatever I can imagine, I can create."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

name: Wall of Stone
text: The Earth herself lends her strength to these walls of living stone, which possess the stability of ancient mountains. These mighty bulwarks thwart ground-based troops, providing welcome relief for weary warriors who defend the land.

name: Burrenton Shield-Bearers
text: Soul and bones, kithkin are woven into their clans. They fight fiercely and without self-interest.

name: Aegar, the Freezing Flame
text: Though Phyrexian machines could adapt to extremes of heat or cold, they never figured out how to adapt to both at once.

name: Vengevine
text: Leave but a shred of root and it will return, bursting with vigor.

name: Jace's Phantasm
text: In the abstract memories of the Iquati, Jace found interesting ideas to improve upon.

name: Acolyte Hybrid
text: Too obviously xenos in form to blend into human society, the acolytes haunt the dark places beneath industrial sprawls.

name: Master's Rebuke
text: "You have always been a promising student, but your arrogance far outstrips your prowess."

name: Lure
text:
"When setting a snare, success depends not on the quality of the trap, but the quality of the bait."
—Geyadrone Dihada

name: Fog Elemental
text:
"I've seen fog so thick you could cut it, but none that could cut me."
—Tahngarth of the *Weatherlight*

name: Shifting Sliver
text: Once the last few slivers the Riptide Project controlled were dead, there was nothing to keep the island from being completely overrun.

name: Rain of Thorns
text: When the forests became havens for evil, the archmages devised new ways to cleanse the wilds.

name: Steadfast Sentry
text: "Get up, slugabeds! We've got company, and they're not dressed for a party!"

name: Shrieking Mogg
text: You have to admire its enthusiasm.

name: Slith Predator
text: Born amid the molten metal of the Great Furnace, the slith have more than adapted to the perils of a metal world.

name: Agonizing Memories
text: In the aftermath of war, when the slaying is long done, the greatest miseries come home to roost.

name: Civic Guildmage
text:
To condemn the innocent you must first condemn yourself.
—Civic Guild maxim

name: Battlefield Medic
text: "Death never stops to rest. Neither can we."

name: Regal Caracal
text: Someone had stolen his cushion. When he found the perpetrator, he would feed them to the crocodiles.

name: Nylea's Forerunner
text: Where its feet tread, the thunder of many others will follow.

name: Monstrous Hound
text: "Stay."

name: Aether Tunnel
text: If you can't find a doorway, make one.

name: Deadbridge Goliath
text: Some Golgari insects live for centuries-and they never stop growing.

name: Hover Barrier
text: As whispers and rumors increased, so did the demand for fail-safe barriers.

name: Refocus
text: "Before you can open your third eye, you must prove you can open the first two."

name: Chemister's Insight
text: "My specialty is theoretical universal limits and ways to circumvent them."

name: Disdainful Stroke
text: "Laws apply only to those who lack the vision to see past them."

name: A Reckoning Approaches
text: "The gates open to my new era."

name: Guild Globe
text:
"Hopefully Ravnica will prove harder to break."
—Karn

name: Inordinate Rage
text:
"In my years wandering this land I've seen a veritable menagerie of fantastic creatures, but one that has eluded me thus far is the fabled 'easygoing minotaur.'"
—Ko, expedition wizard

name: Hermit Druid
text: Seeking the company of plants ensures that your wits will go to seed.

name: Anafenza, the Foremost
text: Rarely at rest on the Amber Throne, Anafenza always leads the Abzan Houses to battle.

name: Reckoner's Bargain
text: Restricted auctions are held once a year at the Dragon's Lair—the sacred, neutral meeting ground of all Reckoner gangs.

name: Ravenous Daggertooth
text: A daggertooth's triumphant roar makes all the sounds of jungle life fall silent.

name: Terashi's Verdict
text: It was as though the sky opened its eyes and found what it saw displeasing.

name: Scour the Laboratory
text: "The answer's in here somewhere!"

name: Walking Dead
text: The Walking Dead are the remains of freakish experiments by the Necromantic Lords.

name: Ray of Enfeeblement
text: Erigan cried out in pain as a hideous weakness settled into his bones.

name: Smog Elemental
text:
"The skies used to be my refuge, a place of peace away from the chaos below. Now, with every flight, death seems to follow me like a shadow."
—Writings of Cica, Skyjek scout

name: Clockwork Gnomes
text:
"Until I came to the Floating Isle, I never had to oil the servants."
—Baki, wizard attendant

name: Malcator's Watcher
text: Each of the Gitaxian sectives watches the others, looking for any hint of imperfection.

name: Detainment Spell
text: Bind the mind rather than the wrist, and you stop the intent to harm before it starts.

name: Yargle and Multani
text:
"I've heard much about you from my daughter," Multani rumbled. "There was a time when I'd balk at your aid, phantom, but she has shown me the merit in Urborg's strange ways."
"Gnshhagghkkapphribbit," replied Yargle.

name: Blow Your House Down
text:
"You think these walls will protect you?
My, you have a dim view of the power of the wilds"
—Marawen, barrow witch

name: Rathi Dragon
text: Wrap the flame as twine Kingdoms will be thine.

name: Ranging Raptors
text: They cover their territory like a tide of teeth and claws.

name: Explosive Apparatus
text:
"Souls are volatile things. When compressed and loaded into a handheld device, their destructive potential is quite impressive."
—Dierk, geistmage

name: Burning Sands
text:
"Pain teaches lessons no scholar can."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

name: Immobilizer Eldrazi
text: It denied the Zendikari the chance to stand and die fighting.

name: Dark Maze
text:
"Stray not into the path of darkness, or be lost forever."
—Baki, Wizard Attendant

name: Mtenda Herder
text:
"All animals—even humans—can be herded. The trick is to make them think they choose their own destination."
—Mangara

name: Evil Presents
text: 'Tis better to give than to receive.

name: Orzhova, the Church of Deals
text: Unlike most churches, at Orzhova it's best to pray before you arrive.

name: Oriq Loremage
text: Nothing can quell the Oriq's thirst for the forbidden secrets of the past.

name: Diabolic Tutor
text:
"Show them. Show them how hot your fire can burn."
—Liliana Vess, to Chandra Nalaar

name: Manabarbs
text:
"I don't know why people say a double-edged sword is bad. It's a sword. With two edges."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

name: Bone Harvest
text:
"Only fools believe they will face my armies but once."
—Kaervek

name: When Will You Learn?
text: "Don't fret, infants. It wouldn't have worked anyway."

name: Ambition's Cost
text: "Knowledge demands sacrifice."

name: Stonework Puma
text:
"We suffer uneasy ground, unstable alliances, and unpredictable magic. Something you can truly trust is worth more than a chest of gold."
—Nikou, Joraga bard

name: Lord of the Undead
text: "I confer with Death itself. What could you possibly do to injure me?"

name: Vesuva
text: It is everywhere you've ever been.

name: Goblin Airbrusher
text: Once he'd worked out which end of the thing the paint came from, he was promoted to shirt duty.

name: Lifecraft Awakening
text: "It was made, yes, but that does not mean it cannot grow."

name: Warden of the Eye
text: The wardens guard the sacred documents of Tarkir's history, though they are forbidden to read the words.

name: Loam Lion
text: ゼンディカーでは、今日の草原は明日の密林であり、狩場も天気と同じぐらいにすぐ変わってしまう。

name: Necroblossom Snarl
text: A hungry lair of flourishing rot.

name: Lava Axe
text: It can chop down a redwood in a single stroke. Your sternum isn't going to fare any better.

name: Thicket Crasher
text:
"Tread too hard in the forest and it will tread on you in return."
—Vivien Reid

name: Library Larcenist
text: "I specialize in missing manuscripts, pilfered poetry, and lifted letters."

name: Research Thief
text: The Futurists eagerly supplement their research with their rivals' closely guarded secrets.

name: Soul Snare
text:
"Shackled the body, and the anguish lasts only until death. Shackle the soul, and the wicked can be punished for eternity."
—Inquisitor Laerin

name: Umbra Mystic
text: "I have found the courage to face death—twice, if I must."

name: Kelpie Guide
text: Kelpies are drawn to paradoxes, making them ideal companions for Quandrix mages.

name: Flight of Equenauts
text: "Yes, there's competition between our equenauts and the Boros skyjeks. At least they think it's a competition."

name: Hardened Scales
text: As the fusillade of lasgun fire bounced harmlessly off the carnifex's carapace, the creature roared and advanced.

name: Warren Instigator
text: "Danger! Danger! Come out of the safety of your holes!"

name: Hazerider Drake
text:
"The hazerider danced in the thunderstorm and sang to its music."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Dark Ritual
text: "Eye of twilight, give us sight. Take our offer, give us might. Make our power tears of night."

name: Counterspell
text:
"Your attack has been rendered harmless. It is, however, quite pretty."
—Saprazzan vizier

name: Ichor Wellspring
text:
"Our glorious infection has taken hold."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

name: Saltwater Stalwart
text: Every attack is a test of your defenses. Every hit marks the map of your defeat.

name: Phantom Ninja
text:
"Ninjas can run across water, pull ladders from pockets, kill with a kiss, and slip between bricks. Pack of lies, I say."
—Benden, teahouse gossip

name: Retrieve
text: The roots preserved the armor for a hundred years, safeguarding it for a traveler in need.

name: Return to Dust
text: Some timelines forever fray, branch, and intermingle. Others end abruptly.

name: Pledge of Unity
text:
"No one hero will save this day. Today we must all be heroes."
—Gideon Jura

name: Goblin Blastronauts
text: The goblins really put themselves into the fireworks show, despite Myra's pleas to stop.

name: Moriok Replica
text: All the secrets of the Moriok with only a trace of their corruption.

name: Blur
text: "It's as much of a trick of the mind as it is a trick of the eye."

name: Crop Rotation
text: "Hmm ... maybe lotuses this year."

name: Gravity Sphere
text: On the morning of the Battle of Gal-Shan, the Sorcerer's cry rang out: "Let no bird fly, let no creature take wing, let all the battle join as one."

name: Sign in Blood
text:
"You know I accept only one currency here, and yet you have sought me out. Why now do you hesitate?"
—Xathrid demon

name: Bazaar Trademage
text: He traded a lamp for a scepter, the scepter for a ruby, and the ruby for a simple rug.

name: Tale's End
text:
"When you are gone, will anyone remember your story?"
—Unknown

name: Ironclaw Buzzardiers
text: They warn the army of danger as they squawk past in swift retreat.

name: Crushing Vines
text:
"Your veil's curse won't stop me, deathmage. I have taken down countless night hunters and this dark plane is not big enough for you to hide."
—Garruk Wildspeaker, to Liliana Vess

name: Soltari Lancer
text:
"In times of war the victors rarely save their best for last."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Healer of the Pride
text: "No life is without meaning. No living thing is too small to be strong."

name: Rampaging Rendhorn
text: Tumult is its natural habitat.

name: Mana Cannons
text:
"I hate the smell of charred Phyrexian, but it sure beats the alternative!"
—Jaya

name: Sanctum of Calm Waters
text:
Truth lurks in the depths,
Invisible from the shore.
Knowledge inundates.

name: Horseshoe Crab
text: In the final days before the disaster, all the crabs on Tolaria migrated from inlets, streams, and ponds back to the sea. No one took note.

name: Valakut Awakening // Valakut Stoneforge
text:
"My ancestors reshaped the world to their vision. I have a few ideas of my own."
—Tars Olan, stoneforge mystic

name: Armory Guard
text: The Dimir agents watched from the shadows. "Eight hours, and I've yet to see him blink," Nefara hissed. "I suggest we find another way in."

name: Watchful Naga
text: The forked tongue of the naga is sensitive to drifting scent trails from the past, present, and sometimes even the future.

name: Trial of Strength
text: "Instincts to guide. Strength to overcome."

name: Hired Blade
text: "If you want them dead, buy some poison. If you want them to have the worst day of their life before dying, then let's talk price."

name: Sphinx of the Second Sun
text: He watches in silence as the shadows shift, bringing Amonkhet ever nearer to the Hour of Revelation.

name: Strip Mine
text: Unlike previous conflicts, the war between Urza and Mishra made Dominia itself a casualty of war.

name: Boulderbranch Golem
text:
"Artifice is not the only form of creation."
—Titania

name: Skarrg Goliath
text:
"They bind us with their laws. We free ourselves with nature's fist."
—Nikya of the Old Ways

name: Pradesh Gypsies
text:
"A mysterious people indeed. Their origins are as secret as their traditions."
—Lord Magnus of Llanowar

name: Mental Misstep
text: "Paws."

name: Nimble-Blade Khenra
text:
"In the Hour of Glory, the gods and the untested will prove their worth before the God-Pharaoh."
—*The Accounting of Hours*

name: Joven's Tools
text:
"If that thief Joven ever shows his head around here again, make sure he leaves without it."
—Eron the Relentless

name: Lens Flare
text: The key for surviving a war is never becoming its focus.

name: Boil
text:
"It is a slaughter, the death of a sea. Never speak of it again."
—The Lord of Atlantis

name: Feast of Dreams
text: "We gave the gods the power to war against us. It is time we took that power back."

name: Gray Merchant of Alphabet
text: Like any young zombie, Gary dreamed of escaping the underworld to join the circus.

name: Mastermind's Acquisition
text: Another piece of a nefarious puzzle.

name: Rakshasa's Disdain
text: "Every failure, every death only makes my strength greater."

name: Shapers of Nature
text: Shapers adapt nature to fit their needs and then return it to the way it was, leaving no trace of their passing.

name: Dromoka's Gift
text: The simplest gift from a dragon can be a revered accolade for a human warrior.

name: Glyph of Doom
text:
"He knows he has a short span of life, that the day will come when he must pass through the wall of oblivion . . ."
—William Faulkner

name: Smelt-Ward Ignus
text: "Come in, yes? Is warm!"

name: Hornswoggle
text: Being a merciful pirate, she saved the vampire's gold from falling overboard.

name: Sigiled Paladin
text: Each sigil marks the recognition of a great deed and signifies a duty owed to the one who granted it.

name: Sprout
text: Centuries of temporal strife had stripped Dominaria of its natural defenses, but nature fought back with armies constructed of little more than grime and sunlight.

name: Spirit Link
text:
"I regret feeding Kaervek's hunger for power—far better to live with animals innocent of such ambitions."
—Jolrael

name: Two-Headed Giant
text: He watches the pass in both directions, and all must pay his toll.

name: Jeskai Sage
text: "The one who conquers the mind is greater than the one who conquers the world."

name: Recover
text: As Barrin exhumed his daughter's body, he finally realized the full price of his faith in Urza.

name: Goblin Shortcutter
text: "I'm not running away! I'm figuring out the best routes."

name: Keeneye Aven
text: "I have no need of a map. The very continent itself guides my way."

name: Radjan Spirit
text:
"Crawing, crawing, For my crowse crawing, I lost the best feather i' my wing For my crowse crawing."
—Anonymous Scottish ballad

name: Secret Base
text: The location of S.N.E.A.K. HQ is a closely guarded secret.

name: Misthoof Kirin
text: It heralded Sarkhan's return to Tarkir's present.

name: Dawn Evangel
text: Is there a greater promise than the glory of the sunrise?

name: Millikin
text: The toymaker frowned in bewilderment. None of his creations had ever sneezed before.

name: Goldnight Redeemer
text: The Host sings of Avacyn's return without a single verse about its own suffering.

name: Krosan Wayfarer
text:
"The Krosan Forest lives, and druids are its seeds."
—Seton, centaur druid

name: Whirlwind
text: Urza tried to rule the air, but Gaea taught him that she controlled all the elements.

name: World Shaper
text: "The Great River will not be tamed."

name: Phyrexian Hulk
text:
"They are convenient in having no souls, but less so in having no spirit."
—Volrath

name: Fire Diamond
text: Every facet aglow like iron in Moradin's mighty forge.

name: Thoughtrender Lamia
text: Some predators can sense fear in their prey, but the lamia is drawn to madness.

name: Corrupted Resolve
text:
"Flesh is a sickness that infects Phyrexia."
—Avaricta, Gitaxian sective

name: Spontaneous Mutation
text: When the body turns, the mind soon follows.

name: Meteor Storm
text: The storm wasn't an omen. It was the fulfillment of one.

name: Stone Quarry
text: Entire valleys have been formed by mummies laboring to find veins of lazotep.

name: Hammerfest Boomtacular
text: It's less "music" and more "straightforward hearing damage."

name: Cloudstone Curio
text: With innovative stabilizing techniques, Suja Pavani brings this piece of the sky itself to the Inventors' Fair.

name: Zephyr Falcon
text: Although greatly prized among falconers, the Zephyr Falcon is capricious and not easily tamed.

name: Slimefoot, the Stowaway
text: As Jhoira restored the *Weatherlight*, a mushroom growing in its hold unexpectedly became her first crew member.

name: Sentinel Sliver
text: Through its watchful gaze, all slivers may see.

name: Vortex Elemental
text: The sea is always hungry.

name: Chicken à la King
text: During the Chicken Revolution, the king managed to keep his head while the others—well, just ran around.

name: Plague Rats
text: "Should you a Rat to madness tease Why ev'n a Rat may plague you. . ." —Samuel Coleridge, "Recantation"

name: Giant Spider
text: It's not far into the trap, as the crow flies.

name: Dromad Purebred
text:
"I have seen much from the back of my dromad, most of it terribly wrong. The more I see, the more I am convinced of the rightness of my path."
—Heruj, Selesnya initiate

name: Mycoid Shepherd
text: As pure mana flooded across the shards, it brought a sense of unity even to Jund's vicious food chain.

name: Yotian Tactician
text: "Time for the Iron Alliance to remind the qadir's army how inhospitable the Sword Marches can be."

name: Puresight Merrow
text: Stripped of his sight, he was free to see only the ideal.

name: Rishkar's Expertise
text: "Control the Great Conduit? You might as well try to divert a river with your hands."

name: Anger of the Gods
text: Haszoret's disappointment at initiates who fail their final trials can manifest in terrible ways.

name: Pair o' Dice Lost
text: The Astrotorium is a zero-waste facility, meaning it deals with zero of its waste.

name: Reverent Hoplite
text: "Zeal is the sharpest blade, and piety the strongest shield."

name: Maze Behemoth
text: It returned to the leylines as quickly as it had appeared, leaving only broken bodies to mark its passage.

name: Dragon Engine
text: Those who believed the city of Kroog would never fall to Mishra's forces severely underestimated the might of his war machines.

name: Defiant Strike
text: "My family was saved thanks to a single Boros soldier. It's why I joined the Legion. I will be the protector now."

name: Water Servant
text:
"This creature has innate perceptiveness. It knows when to rise and when to vanish into the tides."
—Jestus Dreya, *Of Elements and Eternity*

name: Serra Angel
text: 天使は過去の自分を夢のように思い出していた。自分の歌が牧草地を支えたこと。自分の刃が闇を追い返したこと。自分の翼がずっと自分を運んでいたことを。

name: Ancient Den
text: Taj-Nar, throne of Raksha Golden Cub, destined leader of the leonin prides.

name: Boomerang
text:
"O! call back yesterday, bid time return."
—William Shakespeare,
*King Richard the Second*

name: Grim Initiate
text: Beneath each gleaming mineral shell rots a once-proud warrior of Amonkhet.

name: Capital Punishment
text:
"I did offer them a choice . . ."
—Queen Marchesa

name: Dark Ritual
text:
"From void evolved Phyrexia. Great Yawgmoth, Father of Machines, saw its perfection. Thus the Grand Evolution began."
—*Phyrexian Scriptures*

name: Zodiac Monkey
text: It lives mainly on fruit, leaves, and the occasional nose.

name: Ivory Tower
text: Valuing scholarship above all else, the inhabitants of the Ivory Tower reward those who sacrifice power for knowledge.

name: Nut Collector
text: "Come, come, my hungry little friends! There's plenty for everyone."

name: Kithkin Harbinger
text: Her ears are open to even the softest voice.

name: Bonepicker Skirge
text: Even the most insignificant creature can be perfected.

name: Wind Shear
text:
"As the winds abated, there was a shower of dragonscales, then nothing more."
—Azeworai, "The Unruly Wind"

name: Torbran, Thane of Red Fell
text: "I like problems that can be solved with an axe. And it turns out, when you have an axe, that's most of them."

name: Inspired Charge
text:
"Impossible! How could they overwhelm us? We had barricades, war elephants, . . . and they were barely a tenth of our number!"
—General Avitora

name: Insatiable Souleater
text:
"We thank the souleaters for culling our sick so that the strong may earn their triumphs."
—Drones' hymn of gratitude

name: Singe
text: Burnt flesh. Blackened soul.

name: Countervailing Winds
text: The Eternals had long since mastered every technique taught during the trials.

name: Goring Ceratops
text:
"Follow her footsteps and she will show you the way."
—Itzama the Crested

name: Balloon Stand
text: "MY PRIMARY FUNCTION IS TO FOLD INFLATABLE TUBES INTO JOY."

name: Truce
text:
Not all victories require defeat.
—Onean idiom

name: Raise the Alarm
text: "The nim raid our homes without warning. We must defend our homes without hesitation."

name: Quilled Slagwurm
text: Vorinclex removed its teeth so it wouldn't waste time chewing before moving to the next kill.

name: Hajar, Loyal Bodyguard
text: "I've stood by Mishra's side from the beginning. I will not abandon him now."

name: Yotian Dissident
text: "I joined this war to protect my homeland, not to destroy someone else's."

name: Plague Beetle
text: No one knows whether they were named for the diseases they carry or for the speed at which they multiply.

name: Ritual of Subdual
text:
"That which does not bend to the will of Freyalise shall surely break."
—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order

name: Icequake
text:
"When the earth shakes, and their animals are swallowed up by the ground, perhaps they will think twice before attacking again."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Megrim
text: Memories cut from the mind can cut right back.

name: Fumarole
text:
"Too many of us have died in the explosions that wrack these hills."
—Klazina Jansdotter, leader of the Order of the Sacred Torch

name: Defender of Chaos
text: Some knights will not follow orders—only disorder.

name: Thermal Glider
text:
"The Mercadians are too busy looking down on us to see us coming."
—Cho-Arrim rebel

name: Flowstone Kavu
text: The kavu adjusted easily to the Rathi overlay, incorporating the invasive flowstone into their own adaptable forms.

name: Grave Pact
text:
"The bonds of loyalty can tie one to the grave."
—Crovax

name: Grixis Charm
text:
"So many choices. Shall I choose loathing, hate, or malice today?"
—Eliza of the Keep

name: Thundering Rebuke
text:
"Fire is too imprecise for my tastes. I'd rather rely on a single, well-placed bolt of lightning."
—Lyrus, Sea Gate wizard

name: Skysnare Spider
text: The only thing more ill-tempered than a griffin in a web is the spider that must subdue it.

name: Funeral Pyre
text:
"Raze the body. Raise the soul."
—Mystic elder

name: Evolutionary Escalation
text: Survival is a constant competition from which both sides can benefit.

name: Tajic, Blade of the Legion
text: "I run the maze alone, but I fight with the full might of the Legion."

name: Obscura Initiate
text: Obscura initiates are required to bring a gift of information. They are judged on both how useful it is and how hard it was to obtain.

name: Deadly Allure
text: What could be more irresistible than death?

name: Bull Elephant
text:
Four gray trees and a long, coiling snake. What am I?
—Zhalfirin riddle

name: Rogue's Gloves
text: Professional pilferers prefer proper preparation.

name: Ghoul's Feast
text:
"Sumptuous, carefully fermented, and served with a silky ocular puree. You simply must try a bite."
—Varina, Lich Queen

name: Tormented Thoughts
text:
"Not all nightmares can be escaped by waking."
—Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver

name: Ashenmoor Cohort
text:
"None will concede a place for us in this world. If it is not for us, neither shall it be for them. We rest not until they choke in its cold ashes."
—Illulia of Nighthearth

name: Jasmine Boreal
text: "Peace must prevail, even if the wicked must die."

name: Conclave Naturalists
text: "Your swords and wards have no power here."

name: Indomitable Will
text:
"None of you are yet samurai. Defend your homes with honor, die for your cause, and perhaps then you will be worthy of the word."
—General Takeno

name: Vulshok Splitter
text:
"Not my style, but it'll get the job done."
—Nahiri

name: Fyndhorn Elves
text:
"Living side by side with the elves for so long leaves me with no doubt that we serve the same goddess."
—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order

name: Nature's Chant
text:
"Plant every sword. Embrace every soul."
—Trostani

name: Grim Tutor
text:
One who goes unpunished never learns.
—Greek proverb

name: Ob Nixilis, Unshackled
text: Designed by Brad Muir

name: Moss Kami
text: Kami manifest in the form of whatever they embody in the physical plane. Some tower in the shape of moss or bark, while others take forms beyond mortal imagining.

name: Swiftfoot Boots
text:
"There is great wisdom in rushing headlong into combat ... if you're prepared."
—Kenjek, captain of the Thousand Swords

name: Energy Flux
text: Karn said nothing—he just grasped the powerstone and squeezed tightly. The wild flashing ceased.

name: Disfigure
text:
"Let this serve as a reminder of your failure."
—Exdratha, bog witch

name: Forest
text: You continue to mutter and complain as you trip over yet another gnarled root. From behind the nearest tree trunk, something mutters back.

name: Tergrid's Shadow
text: Tergrid, god of fright, never acknowledges her own shadow . . . or its murderous deeds.

name: Blockbuster
text: Vendors hung cords heavy with roots and laid out boxes of salted meat, unaware of the fiery disaster swiftly approaching.

name: Orchard Spirit
text:
"Pick not the rotten fruit, but neither touch the best. Leave those as an offering for our unseen guests."
—Radwick, farmer of Gatstaf

name: Fate Foretold
text: The tale of her life was already written, but that didn't mean she could predict the ending.

name: High Tide
text:
"May Svyelun and her tides favor you."
—Traditional merfolk blessing

name: Gideon's Lawkeeper
text: "The essence of a lawful society is swift deterrence."

name: Words of Wilding
text:
"Instinct is undaunted by terror, unchained by logic. It is the path from which all other paths diverge."
—*Volume V, The Book of Life*

name: Searchlight Geist
text: It rises with the fall of darkness, seeking souls to extinguish.

name: Aerialephant
text: Everyone wants to talk about the elephant in this room.

name: Brushland
text:
"Urza fortified every thirty miles on the path to Tomakul, creating a network of trenches the brothers would trade for decades."
—*The Antiquities War*

name: Evolution Vat
text: The vats are self-contained worlds, bubbling and churning with unnatural speed, boiling down eons of change into moments.

name: Seven Dwarves
text:
"The gleam of rubies and my brothers and sisters by my side . . . what more could I want?"
—Brognold the Third

name: Incite Insight
text: After a hundred failed patent applications, Cornelian was stunned to find that no one had ever created a steam-powered autonomous ice cream delivery system. He immediately designed a gnome with scoops for hands.

name: Anurid Barkripper
text: When it croaks, so do you.

name: Goblin Chirurgeon
text:
"Perhaps Goblins are good for something after all."
—Attributed to General Khurzog

name: Goblin Festival
text: "What are we celebratin' again?"

name: Eidolon of Obstruction
text: Death turned admirable conviction into pointless intransigence.

name: Goblin Rimerunner
text: Rimerunners set off avalanches to immobilize foes as well as to create more challenging slopes.

name: Vandalblast
text: Beauty is in the eye of the exploder.

name: Skylasher
text:
"It preys on those who would spy on our lands, so we never prey on it."
—Kroshkar, Gruul shaman

name: Yavimaya Enchantress
text: Her roots connect her to the forest's wishes.

name: Befuddle
text: "The trick to talking sense into Keldons is getting them to hold still."

name: Underground Sea
text: 2016 European Legacy Champion

name: Valor in Akros
text: There's no stronger armor than the bravery of those beside you.

name: Colossus of Sardia
text: From the Sardian mountains wakes ancient doom: Warrior born from a rocky womb.

name: Barkweave Crusher
text:
"Phyrexia may be ancient, but Gaea is eternal."
—Queen Allenal of Ruadach

name: Final Payment
text: There's nothing quite like the feeling of paying off a large debt.

name: Stronghold Zeppelin
text: As long as the stronghold controlled the sky, the rebels were doomed.

name: Gisa and Geralf
text: "These fiends are slightly less tolerable than you." "A sentiment that warms my heart, sister."

name: Soul Link
text: They danced like puppets to a tune only Yawgmoth could hear.

name: Swords to Plowshares
text:
"The blademaster turned his fury to his new foes: root rot and cabbage slugs."
—*Myths and Miracles, Vol. VII*

name: Spellgorger Barbarian
text: The epidemic insanity had a lasting effect on certain barbarians—but no one noticed.

name: Dry Spell
text: A fist of dust to line your throat, a bowl of sand to fill your belly.

name: Dark Ritual
text:
「ファイレクシアは虚空から生まれた。 機械の父、偉大なるヨーグモスはその完成された形を予見なされた。 かくして『偉大なる進化』が始まった。」
———ファイレクシア経典

name: Locthwain Gargoyle
text:
"As the traitor hurried across the courtyard, its eyes snapped open. It was time to pay the queen a visit."
—*Beyond the Great Henge*

name: Tower Defense
text:
"The drakes are practice. We may one day need to bring down a sky swallower, or maybe even Rakdos himself."
—Korun Nar, Rubblebelt hunter

name: Moonlace
text: Once a vision of constancy in the sky, the moon had long been hidden from view by the haze that chokes the heavens. The very sight of it had become a sign that change was in the air.

name: Vedalken Ghoul
text: For four nights following Ennor's death and the reclaiming of his etherium, its recipients were found slain, the etherium ripped from their bodies.

name: Frozen Shade
text:
"There are some qualities, some incorporate things, / That have a double life, which thus is made / A type of twin entity which springs / From matter and light, evinced in solid and shade."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "Silence"

name: Selfless Savior
text:
"I never had the chance to say 'thank you.' Or 'goodbye.'"
—Sarvag, eulogy for a friend

name: Negate
text: Teferi gave them time. Karn gave them a chance. But it was Melira who paid the ultimate price to free Ajani from Phyrexia's grasp.

name: Lithoform Blight
text: Heedless of Nissa's warnings, Nahiri repeated history.

name: Hymn to Tourach
text: The priests plead for your anguish and pray for your despair.

name: Thrasher Brute
text: Some competitors fight for glory or money. Some just like hitting people.

name: Mortal's Resolve
text: The Fates tried to cut her string but found the thread had turned to iron.

name: Equilibrium
text:
Seek balance in all things—as long as the scales are weighted in your favor.
—Vodalian saying

name: Ancient Kavu
text: Those with the ability to change their nature survived Phyrexia's biological attacks. Everything else died.

name: Phantasmal Dreadmaw
text: Action: Using the original art of Colossal Dreadmaw as inspiration, design an illusionary version of the dinosaur.

name: Tidy Conclusion
text: Aetherborn patrons use any means necessary to secure victory for their protégés.

name: Bred for the Hunt
text: Some see the world as a place of infinite wonder and knowledge. Some see it as an infinite dinner plate.

name: Divination
text: "Ask of Keranos that you may understand the stars that mark your destiny. Implore Erebos that you may accept the fate thus divulged."

name: Mentor of the Meek
text: "In these halls there is no pass or fail. Your true test comes with the first full moon."

name: Herd Gnarr
text: Long ago, the solitary gnarr was a sign of good luck. Now they have become wild pack hunters, a sign of impending danger.

name: Ghoulflesh
text: The body dies in stages. First the skin, then the muscle. The brain is last, much to the victim's dismay.

name: Mind Rot
text: What wizards fear most is losing their minds.

name: Hardened Berserker
text:
"Just let him loose and follow the charge."
—Yikaro, Atarka warrior

name: Stoic Angel
text: Even the most battle-hardened soldiers pause in her presence for a moment of introspection.

name: Seeker of Skybreak
text:
"We shun them not for their dream but for their refusal to let such a noble dream die a noble death."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Self-Inflicted Wound
text:
"Worse than watching the cruelest deed is watching it done by your own hand."
—Baihir, Dromoka mage

name: Vexing Gull
text:
"May the skies be clear of gales and gulls."
—Meletian prayer

name: Counterspell
text:
"The duel was going badly for me, and Zur thought I was finished. He boasted that he would eat my soul—but all he ate were his words."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran Royal Mage

name: Naya Charm
text: Deep in nature's core lies a potential unsullied by greed or civilization.

name: Sphere of Truth
text: Truth tempers fanaticism.

name: Viashino Firstblade
text:
"All that steel doesn't make them slower. It makes them bolder."
—Tajic, Blade of the Legion

name: Anoint with Affliction
text: Many vatkeepers use necrogen etchings to judge the value of their aspirants. If the wounds rot and fester, the recipient is not worth further effort.

name: Court Cleric
text:
"The healers of Bant are second to none. I owe then a great deal for their tutelage."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Prairie Stream
text: Stripped and blasted by millennia of war, every planet eventually looks the same.

name: Djeru's Resolve
text: "When I wish to be strong, I train. When I wish to be wise, I study. When I wish to rest, I start again."

name: Vivisurgeon's Insight
text: "Experimental Log 290: Leaving the subject's pain receptors active appears to yield an unprecedented combination of incoherence and hyperawareness."

name: Giada, Font of Hope
text: The source of the Cabaretti's Halo turned out to be a single teenage girl.

name: Woolly Spider
text:
"We need not fear the forces of the air; I've yet to see a spider without an appetite."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

name: Tyrant's Scorn
text:
"The hero with the magic sword slays the dragon? Not this time."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Child of the Pack // Savage Packmate
text: Her face shines with youthful innocence.

name: Dryad Militant
text: "We will defend the Worldsoul from Izzet 'progress' at any cost."

name: Lionheart Maverick
text: "Your signet is no symbol of power. It marks only your need for numbers to aid you. What do you do, guild-rat, now that you face my blade alone?"

name: Moss Diamond
text: The essence of life to heal the world.

name: Revive
text: Gerrard's heart ached, recalling the living wreath Mirri laid for her dead kin. No such memorial was left for her in Rath.

name: Etched Monstrosity
text: Now etched only with the scars of phyresis.

name: Chandra's Pyrohelix
text:
"Now that I've dealt with your little toys, I can focus on the real problem: you."
—Chandra Nalaar, to Dovin Baan

name: Red Cliffs Armada
text: By the battle of Red Cliffs in the year 208, the Wu kingdom controlled more than seven thousand warships on the Yangtze.

name: Belbe's Percher
text: Long and powerful, these birds were used to carry messages to and from the evincar.

name: Wings of Velis Vel
text: Changeling magic grants unusual wishes.

name: Sly Instigator
text: "Me? I'm just an innocent bystander!"

name: Questionable Cuisine
text: May contain soy. May contain a deep void, chillingly hoarse and howling without voice. May contain gluten.

name: Rashka the Slayer
text:
"Rarely be the prey so haughty as to hunt the hunter."
—Baron Sengir

name: Azorius Skyguard
text: "These new thopters are all well and good, but four eyes are better than none."

name: Wall of Heat
text: At a distance, we mistook the sound for a waterfall . . .

name: Kessig Wolf
text:
"Don't be afraid when you hear the wolves howl. Be afraid when you don't hear them at all."
—Saint Trogen, the Slayer

name: Gonti's Machinations
text: "I am confident that all our enterprises can benefit from this little revolution."

name: Razorfin Hunter
text: No one knew if they'd been lurking under the sea all along, or if they'd been created by the Phyrexian overlay.

name: Radiant Grove
text: Yavimaya's inhabitants are dedicated to protecting its unspoiled jungle from the scourge of artifice.

name: Serene Remembrance
text: While Lazav schemed and Niv-Mizzet researched, Trostani sought the future in the whispers of the past.

name: Rhystic Shield
text: A shield for one is good. A shield for everyone is even better.

name: Frozen Aether
text: Gjornersen entertained his followers by taking bets on which would move first—the drowsing land wurm or the frozen goblins.

name: Recurring Nightmare
text:
"I am confined by sleep and defined by nightmare."
—Crovax

name: Shambling Swarm
text: Chainer's madness personified, it exists only to slaughter the innocent.

name: Young Pyromancer
text: Immolation is the sincerest form of flattery.

name: Thought Harvester
text:
"I never thought I'd miss the gomazoa."
—Trinda, Hada spy patrol

name: Lozhan, Dragons' Legacy
text: She channels myth and memory into waves of deadly arcane force.

name: Vulpine Goliath
text:
"With a diet of hydras, giants, and massive serpents, anything would get that big."
—Corisande, Setessan hunter

name: Restless Bones
text:
"We mourn our dead. We shroud our dead. We bury our dead. Too often, it seems, we must kill our dead again."
—Grazda, veteran armorer

name: Helica Glider
text: It could subsist on seeds but its preferred fare is your face.

name: Master Decoy
text: A skilled decoy can throw your enemies off your trail. A master decoy can survive to do it again.

name: Pernicious Deed
text:
"The tyrannous and bloody deed is done,
The most arch deed of piteous massacre
That ever yet this land was guilty of."
—William Shakespeare, *Richard III*

name: Phyrexian Reclamation
text: Death is no excuse to stop working.

name: Make Yourself Useful
text: "To think you've spent years honing your body only to die like this."

name: Pillardrop Rescuer
text: Gentle hands of stone whisk the careless from the crumbling ruins of Pillardrop.

name: Afflicted Deserter // Werewolf Ransacker
text: The rising of the first full moon eliminated any doubt as to the horrible truth lurking within.

name: Haazda Exonerator
text: "This aura threatens the sanctity of your soul. Wrenching it free won't be easy on either of us. If you're ready, we'll begin."

name: Goblin Gaveleer
text:
"When everything looks like a nail, you really need to get yourself a hammer."
—Krol, goblin furnace-priest

name: Genesis Chamber
text:
"As the experimental population grows, so do the number of myr. It's a perfect equilibrium."
—Memnarch

name: Voice of Duty
text:
"Next to Law is Duty, and Duty must be obeyed. If the frame of Duty is broken, none shall weave life's fabric."
—*Song of All*, canto 167

name: Seagraf Skaab
text:
"Your recent work is an inspiration. I have the utmost respect for your approach, and your craft is impeccable. At your convenience, I would be honored to collaborate on a project."
—Ludevic, letter to Geralf

name: Port Town
text: The Imperium's most peaceful worlds serve only to arm and supply the others.

name: Searing Spear Askari
text: When the other soldiers of Zhalfir fall, the askaris will yet stand.

name: Inspiring Cleric
text: "The Immortal Sun will bring us true eternal life to replace the everlasting shadow of undeath."

name: Hall of Mirrors
text: For a smaller fee, you can pop in quickly to try on a pair of jeans.

name: Kitesail
text: "Just like dodging stampedes in the Makindi Trenches back home!"

name: Orcish Artillery
text:
"So they want to kill my men? Well two can play at that game."
—General Khurzog

name: Fire Ants
text: Visitors to Shiv fear the dragons, the goblins, or the viashino. Natives fear the ants.

name: Mind's Dilation
text: Depart yourself; one mind is too small a vessel.

name: Diabolic Tutor
text: The wise always keep an ear open to the whispers of power.

name: Poppet Stitcher // Poppet Factory
text: It may have been a mistake to give them minds of their own.

name: Ember Beast
text: The only livestock that will survive for long in the Smelting District, ember beasts serve many functions—none of them willingly.

name: Tel-Jilad Chosen
text: "It is my honor to keep safe Tel-Jilad's secrets, not to know them."

name: Impatience
text: Ask a Keldon to hold his temper and you'll be left holding your guts.

name: Tar Snare
text: The amorphous, magically animated residue known as the Fathom Sludge lurks in the Hagra Cistern, attacking its prey with pseudopods and dragging it down to be digested.

name: Torment of Venom
text: The Scorpion God's sting sends venom strong enough to poison blood, bone, and spirit.

name: Littjara Kinseekers
text: Like calls to like, and none are forgotten.

name: Earthshaking Si
text:
"For reasons unknown to me, herds in the Arrow Bamboo Forest have become more and more agitated."
—Jiang Yanggu's travelogue

name: Shrivel
text:
"Have you ever killed insects nibbling at your crops? I think that's what the Eldrazi believe they're doing to us."
—Sheyda, Ondu gamekeeper

name: Skullmead Cauldron
text: Once tasted, the flavor of skullmead lingers in the throat, a secret brand of guilt for those who partake in forbidden pleasures.

name: Every Hope Shall Vanish
text: "Oh, I think I *will* get away with this."

name: Wavebreak Hippocamp
text: Tritons search for omens in its wake.

name: Midnight Banshee
text: Many have heard the beginning of its low, sustained shriek but few the end.

name: Aggressive Instinct
text:
"Mowu was wary that day, as though he sensed the danger ahead."
—Jiang Yanggu's travelogue

name: Bosh, Iron Golem
text: As Glissa searches for the truth about Memnarch, Bosh searches to unearth the secrets of his past.

name: Hellkite Punisher
text:
"We'll pay no more tribute to that tyrannical lizard. A new age starts today!"
—Mayor Kadrim, now deceased

name: Mulch
text: The land knows no difference between the graves of commoners and nobles.

name: Suffocating Fumes
text:
"Yesterday it was flying tigers and crumbling bridges. Who knows what today will bring?"
—Dol, Lavabrink quartermaster

name: Chill to the Bone
text:
"Thick hides and layered armor won't help when I freeze you from the inside out."
—Heidar, Rimewind master

name: Sunken Hope
text:
"I don't concern myself with my enemy's hopes. Hopes follow the tides. They will retreat soon enough."
—Ambassador Laquatus

name: Feline Sovereign
text: Dogs beg. Cats lay claim.

name: Baneslayer Angel
text: Some angels protect the meek and innocent. Others seek out and smite evil wherever it lurks.

name: Treefolk Mystic
text: Urza's wards fell from him like autumn leaves as he entered the dreaming grove. He awoke imprisoned in living wood.

name: Breakneck Rider // Neck Breaker
text: Only the most skillful riders brave the Breakneck Ride through Kessig.

name: Sonic Assault
text: He heard stars and saw thunder.

name: Ill-Gotten Inheritance
text: "The suffering of others is not my concern."

name: Heliod, the Radiant Dawn // Heliod, the Warped Eclipse
text:
"*Compleat* the faith, *compleat* the god."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Stony Silence
text: The relic's purpose? Its design? Whatever the intent, it is now a mere curiosity that breaks up the horizon.

name: Petting Zookeeper
text: Calling it a "petting zoo" really saved on the cages.

name: Duct Crawler
text:
"The mountain's ducts will be like organ pipes, amplifying the glorious roar of the dying."
—Stronghold architect, journal

name: Martyred Rusalka
text: Rakdos cultists hanged her for sport in the township square. Her ghost now stands vigil at what has become known as the Tree of Weeping.

name: Stoneforge Acolyte
text: "The stone speaks. We are merely interpreters."

name: Necra Disciple
text: "The darkness merely hides the light."

name: Staff of the Ages
text:
"We found this staff useful on our visit to this very commission. Would Relicbane prefer we had been slain by Lim-Dûl's horrors?"
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Dross Skullbomb
text: It seethes with the ambition of a ruthless gladiator.

name: Stitchwing Skaab
text:
"Amazing, isn't it, how scraps can come together to create such a wonder?"
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Undying Malice
text: Few take kindly to being put in their place, especially if their place is the grave.

name: Haze Frog
text: Its breath leaves its prey too drowsy to struggle.

name: Disowned Ancestor
text: Long after death, the spirits of the Disowned continue to seek redemption among their Abzan kin.

name: Echoing Decay
text: A single fear unleashes a torrent of nightmares.

name: Wall of Omens
text:
"What will be has always been."
—Wall inscription

name: Mana Maze
text:
"Those who know only one path to victory can never hope to triumph."
—The Blind Seer

name: Kiora's Dambreaker
text:
"When your enemy flees, send the sea to pursue them."
—Kiora

name: Reality Ripple
text:
"Can you prepare for the unexpected? No, you cannot. You can prepare only to be surprised."
—Teferi

name: Ambitious Assault
text: In the clangor and chaos of the akki attack, few even noticed the frogs on their heads.

name: Hostile Takeover
text: Ob Nixilis smiled. It had been over one thousand years since his last conquest.

name: Satyr Grovedancer
text: "Some of my kin dance for themselves, without greater purpose. Nylea gives me purpose, and with it strength."

name: Rot-Tide Gargantua
text: Now that it doesn't need to breathe, its hunting ground extends well beyond the sea.

name: Into the Void
text:
"The cathars have their swords, the inquisitors their axes. I prefer the 'diplomatic' approach."
—Terhold, archmage of Drunau

name: Flood of Tears
text:
"I have wept such a torrent as to scour the land clean."
—Mu Yanling

name: Tajuru Pathwarden
text: "My people blazed these pathways long ago, before the Eldrazi came. We will ride them long after the Eldrazi are gone."

name: Field Marshal
text: The Knights of Stromgald struck Darien's Roost from two sides. They would have caught Kjeldor in a pincer attack were it not for Darien's tacticians.

name: Tobias Andrion
text: Administrator of the military state of Sheoltun, Tobias is the military right arm of the empire and the figurehead of its freedom.

name: Passageway Seer
text: "I'm certain there's a shortcut here . . ."

name: Heckling Fiends
text: Their language may be a cacophonous agglomeration of chittering snorts and mad barking, but the message they send is all too clear.

name: Displacer Kitten
text:
"Isn't she the cutest thing you've almost seen?"
—Doen, purveyor of exotic pets

name: Blood Host
text: It would be ill-mannered to decline his invitation. It would be ill-advised to accept it.

name: Ancestor Dragon
text: It is said that Yinglong gave birth to the qilin and the phoenix, and after them, all the hairy and winged beings in the world. Thus it is known as the Ancestor Dragon.

name: Soldevi Sage
text:
"Our underground archives grow daily, as our excavators and sages alike dig to uncover hidden wonders."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Skittering Monstrosity
text: Most living things were weakened and stunted in the ruinous aftermath of the Phyrexian invasion, but a few grew more horrid than ever.

name: Lovisa Coldeyes
text: "A massacre? It is a mercy we grant them. This way they won't freeze to death."

name: Flames of the Blood Hand
text: Many ogres extracted blood oaths from the oni they summoned. Others simply extracted blood.

name: Titanic Growth
text: The pup looked over the treetops, eyeing the man who just yesterday had kicked her. Suddenly, her hunger was infused with pure delight.

name: Phyrexian Arena
text: A whisper of authority rises over a cacophony of grinding machines.

name: Champion of Rhonas
text: The only way to finish the Trial of Strength is with a basilisk scale in hand.

name: Plague Stinger
text: It leaves its victims one sting closer to phyresis.

name: Silver Seraph
text: A symbol of hope for hopeless times.

name: Reckless Assault
text:
"How will you fight an enemy that cares nothing for itself?"
—The Blind Seer

name: Bitter Revelation
text:
"Here you lie then, Ugin. The corpses of worlds will join you in the tomb."
—Sorin Markov

name: Goblin Bombardment
text: With one motion, a pest is removed and a scourge inflicted.

name: Self-Assembler
text: It sees itself in all of its creations.

name: Rally
text:
"Stand your ground, troops! This shall be our finest hour!"
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox, last words

name: Wanted Scoundrels
text: "Trust me. The reward's not worth it."

name: Shunt
text: Aranghil held her fury in her heart, hard and bright as a ruby. With its razor edge, she rewrote the laws of battle.

name: God-Favored General
text: Someone had to be first to attack, but he was not alone for long.

name: Saiba Cryptomancer
text: "Good luck getting through a class-seven proxy ward, creep."

name: Rigging Runner
text: "Prepare to be boarded! Or don't. I'm coming over either way."

name: Necratog
text: The necratog can always dig up a meal.

name: Nemesis of Reason
text: Words describing it fail. Pages relating it shrivel. Tales recounting it end.

name: Catalyst Elemental
text: As the hyperstormic generator crept past redline, a being emerged from the arc.

name: Elvish Scout
text: Although the Elves of Havenwood lived in isolated villages, their swift communications allowed them to act as a single community.

name: Hydroblast
text: Fire can be savage, but it is fickle. Water is always true, its flow steady and world-shaping.

name: Monstrous Onslaught
text:
"Regards from Peema."
—Rishkar

name: Speedway Fanatic
text: If her vehicle even has a brake, she couldn't tell you which pedal it is.

name: Kindle
