text: Hope of deliverance is scorched by the fire of futility.

name: Tawnos
text: Tawnos brings a childlike wonder and an inherent skill to Urza's studio and bridges the wizardry of the workshop with the grandeur of the royal court. His speed and flexibility quickly earned him promotion from apprentice to master artificer.

name: Armor Thrull
text:
"The worst thing about being a mercenary for the Ebon Hand is having to wear a dead Thrull."
—Ivra Jursdotter

name: Devout Chaplain
text: "By Avacyn's decree, we shall cleanse these relics of their demonic past."

name: Mortipede
text: Mortipede pheromones choke the streets with sickly sweetness, luring the rash and unwary into its waiting jaws.

name: Quicksmith Spy
text: "Let's just broaden its surveillance lens."

name: Mercy Killing
text: "We will give you the peace you seek, though you may not yet know you seek it."

name: Blood Knight
text: His is the fury of the wildfire, the boiling blood of the volcano. He fights you not because you've wronged him, but because you're there.

name: Forsaken Sanctuary
text: In the galleon's grand cathedral, conquistadors swore vows of faith. In its wreckage, they swore vows of revenge.

name: Living Wish
text: He wished for growth, but not for a way to control it.

name: Gerrard, Weatherlight Hero
text: Gerrard's final act ensured his legacy would never die.

name: Mercurial Transformation
text: "For sun's sake, I just want a crab!"

name: Acridian
text: The elves of Argoth were trained to ride these creatures, even when their mounts traveled upside-down.

name: Panharmonicon
text: All who listen hear their own song, a unique melody played just for them.

name: Iron Myr
text: The myr are like rusted metal: gleaming purpose hidden by a thin disguise of debris.

name: Piety
text: "Whoever obeys God and His Prophet, fears God and does his duty to Him, will surely find success." —The Qur'an, 24:52

name: Cloakwood Swarmkeeper
text: When he's threatened, the forest buzzes and the air hums with dragonfly wings.

name: Bloom Tender
text: "What, these old things? They were just lying around, gathering dust. I figured I might as well put them to use."

name: Sliptide Serpent
text: It's futile to fight something you can see only in the corner of your eye.

name: Dead Drop
text:
Got a diving lesson
—Sultai expression meaning "was fed to the crocodiles"

name: Bubbling Beebles
text:
"Chancellor Rayne canceled the annual beeble roast. I should have married a crueler woman."
—Barrin

name: Horizon Seed
text: In peaceful times, these beings escorted the honored kami to their new shrines. In the Kami War, they became the medics of an unstoppable army.

name: Teysa, Orzhov Scion
text: "Spend your life betraying me if you wish. I'll simply take it up with your ghost."

name: Inkfathom Witch
text: The murk of the Wanderbrine concealed unseemly rituals designed to bring out the worst in merrowkind.

name: Carrion Howler
text: They chase tirelessly after the bone-carts that speed along the streets of the Plague Quarter.

name: Vectis Dominator
text:
"I appreciate the artistry of the telemins, but the creatures of the other worlds provide a much more dramatic performance."
—Ennor, mentalist

name: Infernal Contract
text:
"East and West meet and angels cry.
Unholy power darkens the sky."
—"The Ballad of the Paladins"

name: Phantom Monster
text: Is it an amalgamation of faded memories or the projection of a half-remembered dream? Neither answer offers any comfort.

name: Breezekeeper
text:
"He blows a gust across the cliff to vanish in a breath of wind."
—"Song of the Wind Being"

name: Eccentric Farmer
text: "Careful now. Don't want to get the seeds stuck to your feelers like last time."

name: Bloodhall Ooze
text: A drop of blood spilled from the first dragon.

name: Ferocious Tigorilla
text: From a certain perspective, it's an inspiring story of overcoming obstacles.

name: Cessation
text:
"The face of Light will shine upon them, and they will know war no more."
—*Song of All*, canto 918

name: Wasteland
text:
"The land promises nothing and keeps its promise."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Run Amok
text:
"A Tuskeri never shrinks from battle! Quite the opposite in fact."
—Arni Brokenbrow

name: Wave of Reckoning
text: Inner conflict can defeat a soldier more quickly than any army.

name: Unchecked Growth
text:
"That energy was once granted to growing things. Now the kami keep it for themselves, releasing it in sudden floods that overwhelm flesh and foliage alike."
—Sakiko, Mother of Summer

name: Knight of the Kitchen Sink
text: "Whew. For a minute, I thought I'd forgotten the tea cozy."

name: The Iron Guardian Stirs
text: "It would be disappointing if you were unable to overcome this simplest of defenses. Hilarious, but disappointing."

name: Imperiosaur
text:
"An ancient, powerful force has overtaken the valley. I sympathize for its former inhabitants, but I rejoice for the land itself."
—Olanti, Muraganda druid

name: Dromar's Charm
text:
"Wisdom can be summed up in two rules: Control what you can. Eliminate what you cannot."
—Dromar, the Banisher

name: Dromosaur
text: They say dromosaurs are frightened of dogs, even little ones. There are no dogs in Shiv. Not even little ones.

name: Dragon's Eye Sentry
text: Even the humblest guard of Ojutai's strongholds ponders the puzzles of the Great Teacher's lessons.

name: Hymn to Tourach
text: Knowing the Hymn's power, the followers of Leitbur carefully guarded their pillaged transcriptions.

name: Absolute Law
text: The strength of law is unwavering. It is an iron bar in a world of water.

name: Midnight Covenant
text:
"Not all mortals fought the kami. The ogres revered the oni, while some humans made pacts based upon empty promises."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Blue Elemental Blast
text: "Contrary to popular wisdom, I find it's best to fight fire with its opposite."

name: Snow Mercy
text: WARNING: Shake gently. Contents may cause choking, hypothermia, and/or planar invasion.

name: Koll, the Forgemaster
text: Using tyrite from a fallen Cosmos monster, Koll forged a weapon to awe Halvar himself.

name: Static Orb
text: The warriors fought against the paralyzing waves until even their thoughts froze in place.

name: Mogg Sentry
text: Nothing makes a mogg madder than having to wake up.

name: Planar Bridge
text:
"It is finished. Now the real work can begin."
—Tezzeret

name: Gaea's Will
text: With every end, a new beginning.

name: Nezumi Bone-Reader
text: Four generations ago, old Split-Tail stole a bundle of scrolls from the Minamo School. Soon after, the first nezumi shamans were born.

name: Churning Eddy
text:
"Magic is like the tide—both ebb, both flow, and both serve my whims."
—Empress Llawan

name: Wolf of Devil's Breach
text:
"How can werewolves be considered abominations next to such creatures?"
—Arlinn Kord

name: Unexpected Windfall
text: Fortune favors the fortunate.

name: Vampiric Rites
text: Scions of the Markov line take particular pleasure in the perversion of humans' holy rituals.

name: Leshrac's Rite
text:
"Brackish water, dark and blind Heed my will, to you I bind."
—Opening passage of Leshrac's Rite

name: Blot Out the Sky
text: A drop of ink is a nuisance. A torrent of inklings is a menace.

name: Crimson Acolyte
text:
The faithful will walk through streams of fire and emerge unscathed.
—Crimson acolyte creed

name: Mawcor
text: Neither head holds a brain—that's located somewhere in the chest—but four eyes aim much better than two.

name: Enhanced Awareness
text:
"Study the topography of your enemies, and you will have a map to victory."
—Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest

name: Tainted Well
text:
"No, *you* get the water. I ain't thirsty."
—Squee

name: Guardian Kirin
text:
Followed the kirin
—Ojutai expression meaning
"died a hero's death"

name: Darksteel Mutation
text: Infinitely powerless.

name: Watermarket
text:
Shopping List
Lamp-hand attachment
X-ray contact lenses
Discount death ray
Two-headed hammer
Kitten-fish

name: Lizard Warrior
text: Don't let its appearance frighten you. Let its claws and teeth do that.

name: Bitterblossom
text: In Lorwyn's brief evenings, the sun pauses at the horizon long enough for a certain species of violet to bloom with the fragrance of mischief.

name: Ohran Frostfang
text: Silent as a snowdrift. Inexorable as an avalanche.

name: Withering Boon
text:
"Life for life: this is the immutable law."
—Panya, Granger Guildmage

name: Dictate of Karametra
text: "I refuse to let the folly of mortals endanger the home I made for them."

name: Righteousness
text:
"I too shall be brought low by death, but until then let me win glory."
—Homer, *Iliad, Book XVIII*

name: Wall of Shields
text:
"It's the pokey bits that hurt the most."
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

name: Distress
text:
"They say the eyes are the windows to the soul. I like to break windows and take what's inside."
—Braids, dementia summoner

name: Gorilla Warrior
text: They were formidable even before they learned the use of weapons.

name: Dissatisfied Customer
text: The mirrors weren't fun for everyone.

name: Command the Storm
text: In the wake of Niv-Mizzet's disappearance, Ral found himself leading the guild. He had dreamed of this day, but couldn't help feeling like a pawn in someone else's game.

name: Stymied Hopes
text: When a god's will is against you, the day never ends well.

name: Font of Ire
text: Drink deep, and find your vengeance fulfilled.

name: Carnival of Souls
text: "'Davvol, blast those elves.' 'Davvol, transport those troops.' No one cares that today is my birthday."

name: Reparations
text: "Sorry I burned down your village. Here's some gold."

name: Inkrise Infiltrator
text: "They can't follow your footprints if you never touch the ground."

name: Nefashu
text: Where the nefashu pass, blood rolls like a silk carpet.

name: Kraul Raider
text: The kraul once skulked in the outskirts of Golgari society, but with Vraska's rise, they became valued forces of the Swarm.

name: Cursed Totem
text:
Pass me from soul to soul, / soldier to herder, herder to beast, beast to soil / until I am everywhere. / Then pass me those souls.
—Totem inscription (translated)

name: Tusk and Whiskers
text: Weighing in at a combined thirteen thousand pounds and two ounces.

name: Mirozel
text: The mirozels are the only stars in Rath's opaque skies.

name: Tidal Kraken
text: To merfolk, pirates are a nuisance. To pirates, merfolk are a threat. To the kraken, they're both appetizers.

name: Smart Ass
text: "I don't get it. Why doesn't anybody like me?"

name: Stream of Unconsciousness
text: Dreams are tempting because one is so powerful in them. Dreams are dangerous because that power is a lie.

name: Havoc Devils
text: For devils, burning things is the highest form of comedy, diversion, and artistic expression.

name: Dutiful Replicator
text:
"Careful. Leave it running for too long and it'll turn the whole building into angels."
—Tawnos

name: Slate Street Ruffian
text:
"Merciless to the point of psychosis. Let's give him a job."
—Zelinas, Orzhov recruiter

name: Karfell Harbinger
text: "This is a realm of the living. King Narfi's legion is coming to change that."

name: Profane Transfusion
text:
"Those that fall short of perfection can still contribute to the Great Work."
—Keskit, the Flesh Sculptor

name: Epicenter
text: Sometimes destruction is Dominaria's way of rebuilding. Sometimes it's not.

name: Cancel
text: "What you are attempting is not against the law. It is, however, extremely foolish."

name: Laccolith Whelp
text: They don't feed; they stoke.

name: Wind Drake
text: Orim regarded Gerrard coolly. "You are like the drake," she said, her expression unchanging. "It works hard to maintain its position, but to us it seems to glide along effortlessly. You *must* do the same."

name: Novice Occultist
text: All across Gavony, in shuttered bedrooms and locked barns, young people seek the answers their elders failed to provide.

name: Elvish Piper
text:
"From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more."
—Elvish teaching

name: Meloku the Clouded Mirror
text: He loved his cities in the clouds. When he traveled to the lands below, he brought many reminders of his home.

name: Lagac Lizard
text: Tracing their ancestry back to Zendikar's earliest forms of life, lagac lizards have seen the comings and goings of planeswalkers and the Eldrazi, and the rise of the vampire clans, none of which has changed them one bit.

name: Wolfcaller's Howl
text:
"Knowledge is a stain that only instinct and ferocity can cleanse."
—Drarg, wolfcaller

name: Mesa Chicken
text:
"Lo lord of layers proudly comb-crested
Hero to hens father to feathers
Crowing sun-caller weaver of wattle
Elder to eggs."
—*Rooster Saga*

name: Mob
text: Not all monsters fight with teeth and claws.

name: Rocket-Powered Turbo Slug
text: Did you go through all the trouble to unscramble this?

name: Urban Burgeoning
text: The ruins of Old Prahv became a wildspace, although all birdsong was silenced by lingering Azorius magic.

name: Profane Tutor
text: As Dakkon forged the Blackblade for Geyadrone Dihada, he unwittingly forged himself into her schemes.

name: Personal Sanctuary
text:
"There is a place deep within my soul where no foe can intrude and no tyrant can conquer."
—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge

name: Dwarven Nomad
text:
A dwarf's life belongs as much to the land as to the dwarf.
—Creed of the Stonethrow Clan

name: Urabrask the Hidden
text: |DYsYf,mrodnCWrRvEDk,moACSEDFtLsun,DY,DYrbreLhSEGVABeeCC,t_oZSm. |DY,DeLmhuCsaYzyp/~proLYw,co.

name: Eye of Ramos
text: Ramos wept, and there were seas.

name: Clickslither
text: The least popular goblins get the outer caves.

name: Drudge Sentinel
text: The Cabal assured the Seven Houses that hostages receive all the food and rest they require.

name: Archon of Cruelty
text: Malice spreads on wings of tyranny.

name: Ulvenwald Mystics // Ulvenwald Primordials
text: "With this ritual, we cast aside our fragile humanity . . ."

name: Feast of Worms
text:
"The dust beneath our feet was once part of a mighty civilization. Shall we too provide the path for a future generation?"
—Sensei Golden-Tail

name: Magnetic Theft
text: Among the Vulshok, the most prized blades are those that killed their original owners.

name: Duelist's Heritage
text: The best techniques outlive their creators.

name: Azorius Aethermage
text: In her single metasphere are bound the records of every Ætheric transaction since the time of Azor.

name: Olivia's Midnight Ambush
text: "And you were almost finished with that ritual, weren't you, darling? How very rude of me. To make it up to you, I'll send you an invitation to my wedding."

name: Yet Another Aether Vortex
text: It puts the "vortex" in "flavortext."

name: Dust Stalker
text: The only traces it leaves are silent gusts and prodigious amounts of wreckage.

name: Truce
text:
"The people of Aysen feed us, and we don't kill them. That's my kind of truce."
—Eron the Relentless

name: Anarchy
text:
"The shaman waved the staff, and the land itself went mad."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: O-Kagachi, Vengeful Kami
text: At his behest the Kami War began to regain That Which Was Taken.

name: Lord of Change
text: The Lords of Change are Tzeentch's greatest servants. The most powerful of them wield fragments of his power over destiny.

name: Orcish Cannoneers
text:
"It's a thankless job, and you'll probably die in an explosion. But the pay is pretty good."
—Toothlicker Harj, orcish captain

name: Mountain
text: As you explore the slums of the Outer City, you keep hearing rumors of a den of werewolves in the caves below Dusthawk Hill.

name: Behold the Beyond
text: There is power in the abyss, in blackness more profound than the darkest dreams.

name: Irenicus's Vile Duplication
text:
"You will serve me better in this form."
—Jon Irenicus

name: Fire-Omen Crane
text: If you can see it clearly, you're already on fire.

name: Kessig Naturalist // Lord of the Ulvenwald
text: "Far from home, little one? I know the feeling."

name: Planar Despair
text: All of Dominaria recoiled as Yawgmoth and his retainers arrived.

name: Rancor
text: Hatred outlives the hateful.

name: Prince of Thralls
text: "There are none alive that I cannot crush. There are none dead that I do not command."

name: Disorder
text:
"Then, just when the other guys were winnin', the sky threw up."
—Jula, goblin raider

name: Selesnya Keyrune
text: A mark of unity when you want one; a fierce guardian when you need one.

name: Mystic Redaction
text: "I'm sorry, but this information is classified."

name: Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger
text: A force as voracious as time itself.

name: Tempest Drake
text:
"Its speed will be equaled only by the swiftness of my enemy's fall."
—Kaervek

name: Arcbound Prototype
text: It flickered to life, saw itself alone, and began to build.

name: Sudden Impact
text: The *Predator* roared like an unruly beast, and the *Weatherlight* suddenly listed. "No!" screamed Hanna.

name: Fighting Chance
text: A stroke of luck can smite an army.

name: Corrosive Ooze
text: Nothing tastes finer to an ooze than a priceless family heirloom.

name: Tremor
text: Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?

name: Ashnod's Altar
text:
"Blood fluting needs to be deeper.
Additional hooks needed for nerve
rigging. Surface stippling could be coarser.
—Ashnod, design notes

name: Gideon's Reproach
text:
"Suddenly, Gideon was there with us, clearing the way so that we could escape."
—*The War Diaries*

name: Leyline of Singularity
text: Where renown and solitude converge.

name: Serra Angel
text: Born with wings of light and a sword of faith, this heavenly incarnation embodies both fury and purity.

name: Radha, Heir to Keld
text: "Keep coming, weaklings! I'm just getting warmed up."

name: Tazeem Raptor
text:
"It's good to see the eagles circling the Lighthouse once again."
—Tazri

name: Inspire Awe
text: Nylea appeared amid the howl of a hundred beasts.

name: Hungry Hungry Heifer
text: Mooo.

name: Arc Runner
text: The storms of the wastelands form quickly and hit hard. Few have anything to do with rain.

name: Faerie Tauntings
text: Beneath the fae's constant pranks runs a subtler undercurrent of mockery: the influence of Oona, their hidden queen.

name: Racecourse Fury
text: Close finishes are settled by who can dismount and get to weapons first.

name: Prying Questions
text: What remained of the Lunarch Inquisition found new ways to extract confessions.

name: Vampiric Tutor
text: Wisdom is a throne, a seat of power that only the strong are worthy to occupy.

name: Brilliant Restoration
text:
"We have done our best to heal this land together, but now I must entrust the future to my sister. She will carry our dreams onward into the sunrise."
—Michiko Konda's journal

name: Marshdrinker Giant
text: When giants rise from their long slumbers, they rarely remember how fragile the waking world can be.

name: Goblin Bushwhacker
text: If you need a job done quick and extra stabby, call "McChoppy."

name: Elvish Mystic
text: "I ask you, one who has returned to arms of nature, what dreams await in the slumber of death?"

name: Disappear
text: If at first you don't succeed, run away and hide.

name: Savai Thundermane
text: A crackling roar is the last sound many hunters hear.

name: Mother of Runes
text: She will not touch a weapon, yet she is the greatest protector her people have ever known.

name: Lantern of Insight
text: Each eye sees a different possibility for tomorrow.

name: Slimy Kavu
text: Its slime liquefies the ground as efficiently as its fangs shred prey.

name: Elvish Hunter
text:
"As the climate cooled, many Elves turned to Thallid farming for food, while the Hunters honed their skills on what little game remained."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*

name: Mage's Guile
text: "Next time, don't bother."

name: Still Life
text: The centaurs' simple magic can undo a basilisk's gaze, but only for a short time.

name: Thundering Ceratok
text:
"I thought this was a civilized plane. How are there so many feral beasts?"
—Dovin Baan

name: Lightning Bolt
text:
"My, how shocking."
—Barrin, Tolarian archmage

name: Guttersnipe
text: He wants to watch Ravnica burn, one soul at a time.

name: Mnemonic Deluge
text: Past, present, and future surged through the wizard's mind, bringing a flood of possibilities.

name: Elephant Guide
text: Nature's strength outlives the strong.

name: Rootgrapple
text:
"All the sylvan secrets of this world are etched between my rings. The skinfolk's metal aberrations can rot between my roots."
—Colfenor, the Last Yew

name: Vizzerdrix
text: A bored wizard once created a vizzerdrix out of a bunny and a piranha. He never made *that* mistake again.

name: Infuriate
text:
「複雑な魔術と優れた戦術をもって決闘する魔道士もいる。一方で、とにかく怒りに任せるだけの魔道士もいる。」
—-フェラドルンの魔術師の秘密

name: Skarrgan Skybreaker
text:
"The sky isn't falling—it's being thrown at us!"
—Otak, Tin Street shopkeep

name: Carrion Ants
text:
"'War is no picnic,' my father liked to say. But the ants seemed to disagree."
—General Chanek Valteroth

name: Flowstone Infusion
text: The rumor that contact with flowstone would reveal Phyrexian sleeper agents was spread mostly by Phyrexian sleeper agents.

name: Ironclad Slayer
text: The best weapon is the one at hand.

name: Farbog Revenant
text: Spiteful geists rise from the muck of the Farbogs, eager to lure travelers to their doom.

name: Prized Amalgam
text:
"Ludevic's laboratory is a veritable wonderland. I have never felt so inspired."
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Jagged Poppet
text: Few puppets are so willing.

name: Psychotic Fury
text:
"Rage, my servants. Our ancient power is renewed in blood."
—Rakdos

name: Homing Sliver
text:
"Where did *you* come from?"
—Otarian hunter, last words

name: Doomed Necromancer
text: Many necromancers share the same last words—the ones that conclude the undeath ritual.

name: Peregrine Drake
text: That the Tolarian mists parted for the drakes was warning enough to stay away.

name: Boreal Centaur
text: Those who used reindeer as beasts of burden knew to avoid the centaurs, who raged at the enslavement of their spirit-kin.

name: War Report
text: Underling Ethu's 263rd report read simply "Yes, my lord. Overwhelmingly, my lord." This marked the end of the Mirran-Phyrexian War.

name: Watery Grave
text:
"Aye, ships go missing in the Stormwreck Sea all the time. That's why we don't call it the Calmsafe Current."
—Captain Lannery Storm

name: Elvish Lookout
text: Like a masterful quilter, Yavimaya stitches together patches of color to warn its denizens of threats.

name: Crash of Rhino Beetles
text:
"When the herd moves, so should you."
—Yon Basrel, Oran-Rief survivalist

name: Garruk's Packleader
text:
"He has learned much in his long years. And unlike selfish humans, he's willing to share."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Dimir Signet
text: An emblem of a secret guild, the Dimir insignia is seen only by its own members-and the doomed.

name: Legerdemain
text: Squee tucked the warm ball in his pocket and slipped a pebble in its place. 'Glok,' he mumbled, and hid.

name: Kindled Fury
text:
"It is most honorable to use every part of the animals we kill . . . especially if we use them to annihilate our enemies."
—Surrak, the Hunt Caller

name: Molten Nursery
text:
"Some detours just aren't worth it."
—Raff Slugeater, goblin shortcutter

name: Amaranthine Wall
text: Neither its appearance nor its temperature varies as the years pass, an eternal testament to the forces that shaped Dominaria.

name: Thrakkus the Butcher
text: Somehow he never seems to run out of meat.

name: Port Razer
text: "Smash and grab, loot and burn, then it is the next town's turn!"

name: Forest
text: Before the elf queen will aid you, you must find a way to cure the strange rot afflicting the roots of the ancient trees.

name: Goblin Oriflamme
text:
"It was difficult to tell whether the piles of gore within their warrens were mere trash heaps, sacred altars, or warnings."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV*

name: Territorial Roc
text:
"Such lesser creatures must be purged from the sky. What use do they have but to help channel the lightning of our mighty dragonlord?"
—Gvar Barzeel, Kolaghan warrior

name: Tremor
text:
"Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?"
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

name: Bull-Rush Bruiser
text: There will always be a spot at Valor's Reach for headlong violence.

name: Inspiring Captain
text: "Time to show the foe our true mettle."

name: Conjurer's Bauble
text: It is the moment of discovery, the triumph of the mind, the reimagining of past glory.

name: Bog Wraith
text: The bodies of its victims are the only tracks it leaves.

name: Crude Rampart
text: Success is one part inspiration, nine parts desperation.

name: Outrider of Jhess
text: The island nation of Jhess is under constant siege from Valeron on the mainland. Riders traverse the coastline, always on the lookout for sails or aven.

name: Volcanic Salvo
text: Seeing it coming a mile away is little comfort if you can't get out of range in time.

name: Dungeon Map
text: "Wait, is that a secret door? I can't tell for sure . . . there's some blood in the way."

name: Ivory Crane Netsuke
text: It is said that the feathers of a crane are clouds, plucked and sewn together by the hands of the kami.

name: Pardic Lancer
text: He gets to the point right away.

name: Otherworldly Journey
text:
"The landscape shimmered and I felt a chill breeze. When my vision cleared, I found myself alone among the corpses of my fallen friends."
—Journal found in Numai

name: Taunting Elf
text: The safety of the village depends on the beast thinking with its stomach.

name: General Marhault Elsdragon
text: Driven by rage, directed by his emperor's claw.

name: Knight of New Alara
text: "I embrace all of Alara, Grixis as much as Bant. Let my former home call me traitor. I do this not for accolades, but because it is right."

name: Meeting of the Five
text: For years, the five families ruled New Capenna in uneasy peace, and the city prospered.

name: Zephyr Spirit
text: A spiteful force exists on Ravnica that binds these ghosts to the land of the living but forbids them to touch it.

name: Essence Extraction
text: The "gifted" among the aetherborn can draw the life essence of other living beings into themselves.

name: Grisly Salvage
text: To the Golgari, anything buried is treasure.

name: Urborg Drake
text: Relentless as the sea, remorseless as death.

name: Sanguinary Mage
text: New cults rising in Nephalia have found allies in the Stromkirk bloodline, whose progenitor worships ancient and terrible forces.

name: Stalking Tiger
text: Throughout Chinese history, generals have often been referred to as tigers for their fierceness, strength, and bravery.

name: Gaze of Adamaro
text: Wherever it looked, it saw destruction—the wake of its own gaze.

name: Flame Elemental
text: Storyteller: By my hand in the fire, this story is a tale of power. Listeners: May it give you strength.

name: Shatter the Sky
text: When the gods go to war, mortals pay the highest price.

name: Dandân
text:
"Catch good today. Start replacing crew tomorrow."
—Faysal al-Mousa, fisher captain, log

name: Bramblesnap
text: A bramblesnap is formed by grafting together thirteen different plants that already hunger for meat.

name: Venerable Knight
text: "May this blade guide you on your great journey, as it did me on mine."

name: Painful Lesson
text:
"You wish to remember this lesson? I will write it down for you."
—Senifet, vizier of Bontu

name: Hidden Herbalists
text: In the cellars beneath Narnam House, a strange and deadly garden grows.

name: Knight of Infamy
text: "Your laws, like your bones, were made to be broken."

name: Ballista Watcher // Ballista Wielder
text: "Careful, this thing's dangerous. Wouldn't want anyone getting hurt."

name: Venerated Teacher
text: "The unfathomable is upon us, students. I have no doubt you will rise to the occasion."

name: Tremor
text:
"Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?"
—Naimag, Femeref philosopher

name: Pallimud
text: The old Vec tell tales of a beast that fed on scraps but turned its nose up at the lavish banquet they set in its honor.

name: Shatterskull Recruit
text: Saved from certain death by the kor, he considers himself bound to them by an unbreakable blood oath.

name: Siren Song Lyre
text: A siren once tried to steal it out of jealousy but was caught by the song of its strings.

name: Aetherborn Marauder
text: "I don't know what that is or who it belongs to, but it's shiny and I want it."

name: Ivory Cup
text: Blessed by a thousand prayers.

name: Scute Mob
text:
"Survival rule 781: There are always more scute bugs."
—Zurdi, goblin shortcutter

name: Hardened-Scale Armor
text: A pangolin's scales are resistant to all sorts of damage and weaponry. Desire for them threatens to drive the pangolin to extinction.

name: Kolaghan Aspirant
text: She answers the call of the Crave, the desire for battle sated only by bloodshed.

name: Murder
text:
"No matter how busy my schedule gets, I always try to take time for that personal touch."
—Queen Marchesa

name: Skillful Lunge
text:
"Valor is a currency of the living that serves us well."
—Cosper Lowe of the Silbern Guard

name: Rakdos Headliner
text: Caution: Audience in front row may have throats ripped out.

name: Blackmail
text: In addition to killing peasants, punishing subordinates, and raising an army of nightmares, Braids somehow found time for her favorite hobby: petty extortion.

name: Aphetto Runecaster
text: "The ignorant fear change; the wise use it as a weapon."

name: Costume Shop
text:
"Sold out I'm afraid, but Wrenns Three through Six are on sale."
—Lonak, sales manager

name: Stromkirk Mentor
text: The lineage of Runo Stromkirk is known for producing some of Nephalia's greatest fencing masters.

name: Titanic Ultimatum
text:
"Retribution is best delivered by claws and rage, with both magnified."
—Ajani

name: Suleiman's Legacy
text: With Suleiman's ascension to power, the djinn and efreets of ancient Rabiah learned humility.

name: Peek
text: In an empty castle far to the south, Li'l Giri found a child sleeping soundly. All was quiet until suddenly . . .

name: Shadowbeast Sighting
text:
"Werewolves leave tracks. Vampires leave wrung-out corpses. This is something else."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald

name: Erratic Visionary
text: An Izzet experiment begins with a "what if," gets approved with a "why not," and concludes with a "eureka!"

name: Wargate
text: Bant mages still call to the heavens for aid, but angels are not the only ones who answer.

name: Lava Coil
text:
"Commander, we caught the Dimir spy and took her ashes into custody."
—Kramm, Wojek security officer

name: Disciple of Bolas
text: "Lord Bolas has shown me how each miserable little life holds untold resources."

name: Furious Bellow
text: Minotaurs sometimes pretend to be lost in a battle rage, leading their opponents to underestimate their cleverness.

name: Call to the Netherworld
text: The ritual was normally performed only by horrors and pit spawn. Lesser mages had but one sanity to crack in the casting.

name: Aggressive Sabotage
text: Squee's orders basically came down to "attack the squishy parts."

name: Pulse Tracker
text: Pulse trackers terrorize adventurers, driving them through the jungle toward certain death at the gates of Malakir.

name: Ogre Resister
text: He didn't have a word for "home," but he knew it was something to be defended.

name: Kaito's Pursuit
text: Kaito knew every rooftop in the city, and closed in quickly on his quarry—but he knew nothing of the Planar Bridge until it was already too late.

name: Fate Unraveler
text:
"Never forget that the life you've built can be undone by a single loose thread."
—Perisophia the philosopher

name: Tempest Djinn
text: The first to arrive on Dominaria from their distant home, the marids are the oldest tribe of djinn and the most respected by storm and sea.

name: Tree of Redemption
text: The executioner's tree in Thraben Cathedral holds the power to absolve more than the souls of the hanged.

name: Desert Sandstorm
text: While pursuing the remnants of Yuan Shao's forces into the Wuhan Desert, Cao Cao was temporarily turned back by a fierce sandstorm.

name: Darksteel Forge
text:
"Did it have this shape upon Mirrodin's creation, or did some inconceivable force shape the unshapable?"
—Pontifex, elder researcher

name: Flash
text: No tactic transforms a battle like a well-timed carnivore.

name: Frog Tongue
text: "But *why* can't I get one?" sniveled Squee. "All da bugs here got wings."

name: Abzan Falconer
text: The fastest way across the dunes is above.

name: Reprieve
text: As Faramir and Éowyn stood so, their hands met and clasped, though they did not know it.

name: Primal Rage
text: Ferocity and cunning accounted for half the victory. Gravity accounted for the rest.

name: Samite Healer
text: Why does a Samite heal? You might as well ask why a bird flies.

name: Woeleecher
text: One head senses the curse. The second loosens it from the soul. The third drinks it as an invigorating mist.

name: Wind Spirit
text:
" . . . When the trees bow down their heads, The wind is passing by."
—Christina Rossetti,
"Who Has Seen the Wind?"

name: Glitterfang
text:
"Through the veil's rip spilled hundreds of minor kami, rushing over the battlefield like embers from a kicked campfire. Then they were gone."
—*Great Battles of Kamigawa*

name: Forest
text: You're on your way home when you spot the gates of a strange city . . . one that isn't on the map and wasn't here when you traveled this path four days ago.

name: Time Sieve
text:
"I pray that I am never considered useless or old."
—Sharuum the Hegemon

name: Island
text: As your ship clears the edge of Waterdeep harbor, you notice pirate sails on the horizon. What has made them so bold?

name: Archaeomender
text: "Just as a broken relic can be mended, a shattered history can be made whole."

name: Negate
text:
"It is fascinating to see how the people of this plane replicate magical techniques without a natural gift. Also frustrating."
—Jace Beleren

name: Agent of Erebos
text: Erebos's minions hunt the Returned and warn those who consider the same folly.

name: Omnibian
text:
"This creature has hyperevolved chameleonic abilities. It no longer mimics its surroundings, instead forcing them to take on its form."
—Simic research notes

name: Jump
text:
"Humanity has always envied the power of flight. So we took it."
—Scytha, aeromage

name: Darigaaz's Attendant
text: "Darigaaz is the breath of the ur-dragon, burning away the burdens of mortality."

name: Errantry
text:
"There is no shame in solitude. The lone Knight may succeed where a hundred founder."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

name: Sinew Sliver
text: As the muscle cords of the creature twitched, Hanna saw an unsettling unanimity in the others' rippling flesh. She didn't know what it meant, but she urged Sisay to keep the ship at a safe distance.

name: Knight Errant
text:
". . . Before honor is humility."
—*The Bible*, Proverbs 15:33

name: Sarkhan's Triumph
text: Sarkhan gazed on the world around him, the dragons sweeping through its skies, and joy kindled like a fire in his soul.

name: Sister Repentia
text:
"I shall seek the Emperor's forgiveness in the darkest places of the night."
—Oath of the Penitent

name: Freewind Equenaut
text: Confront her, and feel the hooves of her steed. Ignore her, and feel the sting of her arrow.

name: Thriving Grove
text: Far from human eyes, birds flit between vivid blossoms in a hidden paradise.

name: Artful Takedown
text: Dimir assassinations are choreographed like dance routines. Each challenge is anticipated and countered with graceful ease.

name: Hamlet Captain
text: "Bloodsuckers, howlers, monsters from the beyond . . . it doesn't much matter. I won't have to face them alone."

name: Elspeth's Devotee
text: "For her, I would gladly die again."

name: Spawning Breath
text: Death by death, Kozilek's lineage spread.

name: Spoils of Adventure
text: Survival itself is no small reward.

name: Master Splicer
text: Phyrexian artificers remove the flesh they no longer need and use it to bring their unholy creations to a greater semblance of life.

name: Nim Replica
text: It kills with unfeeling malice.

name: Fetid Imp
text: Many Deaths are distasteful, but only a few are truly repugnant.

name: Maze of Ith
text: 2020 Legacy Champion

name: Nahiri's Warcrafting
text: "Zendikar must be broken before it can be saved."

name: Revered Unicorn
text:
"I felt unworthy even to dream of it."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

name: Arcane Teachings
text: Not all knowledge is learned from parchment.

name: Mind Knives
text: To dodge the unerring knife, one must be free of thought.

name: Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth
text:
"Yawgmoth's corpse is a wound in the universe. His foul blood seeps out, infecting the land with his final curse."
—Lord Windgrace

name: Skyclave Aerialist // Skyclave Invader
text: Together with her beloved falcon, she had explored every waterway on Zendikar, from the Tazeem highlands to the inland sea.

name: Pelakka Wurm
text: It eats what it wants to eat—which is anything that moves.

name: Tormenting Voice
text:
"The voice has grown louder, its accusations angrier and more insistent. By morning, it will likely drown out all else. I fear what I will do."
—Letter discovered in an abandoned estate

name: Punctuate
text: "Ooh—right in the colon."

name: Millikin
text: "Another failure," grumbled the toymaker. She slammed the door with such gusto that she failed to notice the eyes watching her.

name: Bog Gnarr
text: Not all of Dominaria's defenders were nourished by the light.

name: Obelisk of Jund
text: Volcanic ash-winds batter it, climbing vines overwhelm it, dragonfire roasts it, and yet it still stands as a testament to a forgotten world.

name: Hot Soup
text: "Comin' through!" Designed by James Ernest

name: Spike Jester
text: For the Rakdos, "suicidal charge" and "good showmanship" are one and the same.

name: Barbed Sliver
text: Spans of spines leapt from one sliver to the next, forming a deadly hedge around the *Weatherlight*.

name: Elven Lyre
text: Scholars are uncertain whether it was the actual sound or some other magical property of the Elven Lyre that transformed its player.

name: Bloodlust Inciter
text: "To victory! To glory! To eternity!"

name: Nyxborn Courser
text:
"Storms drove them westward to Ketaphos; wide plains shimmered in starlight.
Centaurs greeted them, offering gold-hued apples and grain-cakes."
—*The Callapheia*

name: Persuasion
text: There's no telling what an accomplished mage might collect.

name: Chill
text:
"Temper, temper."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Spellbook
text:
"Everything the wise woman learned she wrote in a book, and when the pages were black with ink, she took white ink and began again."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Fa'adiyah Seer
text: "My visions don't show me home. They show me where home is yet to be found."

name: Hand of Silumgar
text: Silumgar trains those whom he favors in his magic, granting them the ability to spread his disdain across the land.

name: Pegasus Charger
text:
"The clouds came alive and dove to the earth! Hooves flashed among the dark army, who fled before the spectacle of fury."
—*Song of All*, canto 211

name: Steeple Roc
text:
"Sometimes it forgets to loosen its grip before taking flight. I lost my roof that way."
—Ecaban, Boros scout

name: Leopard-Spotted Jiao
text: This strange beast has the hide of a leopard, the howl of a dog, and the horns of an ox.

name: Shatter
text: Today it's a miracle of architecture, a marvel of stained glass, a symbol of the Legion's power. Tomorrow, driftwood.

name: Body Dropper
text: "Kill count? I lost track years ago."

name: Holy Light
text: "Bathed in hallowed light, the infidels looked upon the impurities of their souls and despaired." —*The Book of Tal*

name: Mantle of Webs
text:
"Why does everything the Golgari touch end up sticky?"
—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

name: Crystacean
text: It loves blending into its environment, ambushing prey, and long scuttles on the beach.

name: Mirror of Life Trapping
text: Quenton barely had a second to admire his exquisite handsomeness before reality collapsed around him.

name: Blanchwood Armor
text:
"Before armor, there was bark. Before blades, there were thorns."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Zodiac Rabbit
text: ". . . The world's affairs rush on, an endless stream; / A sky-told fate, infinite in reach, dooms all. . . ."

name: Tome Raider
text: "Humans are so forgetful. Every page I steal becomes a secret they can't remember."

name: Breakneck Rider // Neck Breaker
text: He can't outrun what he is.

name: Portcullis Vine
text: Nature's way of saying "take the long way home."

name: Fanatical Firebrand
text:
"The Brazen Coalition is a firecannon pointed at our enemies. Goblins like him are the spark to its powder."
—Admiral Beckett Brass

name: Caged Zombie
text: "Six consecutive life sentences" takes on a new meaning when necromancy is involved.

name: Jukai Naturalist
text: He had heard rumors of the cities—the constant noise, the stagnant air, the tainted water—and he had no wish to learn if they were true.

name: Markov Dreadknight
text: The destruction of Markov Manor made the surviving members of the bloodline more dangerous.

name: Whippoorwill
text: If the Whippoorwill remains silent, the soul has not reached its reward.

name: Nyxborn Triton
text:
"He is Thassa's. I could not sway him."
—Kiora

name: Angel of Renewal
text: "No more fear. No more failure. No more death. No more!"

name: Cryptoplasm
text:
"If left in the enemy's shape too long, it might be lost to them."
—Vy Covalt, Neurok agent

name: Dark Offering
text:
"Our greatest hope has become our enemy's greatest triumph."
—Restela, Alaborn marshal

name: Unexplained Vision
text: Rowan and Will exchanged a baffled glance. Could the stag in the vision lead them to their father?

name: Sunbaked Canyon
text: Since the river ran dry, travelers wander where fish once swam.

name: Imprisoned in the Moon
text: An unlikely jail for an impossible inmate.

name: Out of the Way
text: "You bore me."

name: Divine Arrow
text: Outside Drannith's walls, where collateral damage is of no concern, the Coppercoats are free to use more potent methods.

name: Arctic Treeline
text:
"When the Light of Starnheim shines here, every frost-edged needle glitters with the reflected glory of the Cosmos."
—Iskene, Kannah storyteller

name: Tyrranax Atrocity
text: While some predators specialize in speed, size, or deadly venom, the adaptive tyrranax see no need to limit themselves.

name: Reclaiming Vines
text:
"This world tires of its long occupation."
—Nissa Revane

name: Furnace Strider
text: With the Quiet Furnace closed to all other factions, Urabrask's smiths were free to build anything their creativity demanded.

name: Those Who Serve
text:
"The dead perform all the work here—farming, building, teaching, even embalming their fellow mummies. The living need do nothing but train. What system could be more perfect?"
—Temmet, vizier of Naktamun

name: Approach My Molten Realm
text: "It's a dragon-infested lavascape of notorious peril. Make yourselves at home."

name: Excoriate
text: The demon had flown past the reach of Erebos's whip but not the point of the sun god's spear.

name: Bartizan Bats
text:
"Bats are welcome to eat thousands of my pets. I have multitudes more that will ultimately eat the bats."
—Izoni

name: Sirocco
text:
"Blow, fiery wind, / strip illusion from the eye. / Blow, fiery wind of truth."
—Femeref chant

name: Alluring Scent
text: Doom rarely smells this sweet.

name: Kodama's Reach
text: In the purrennial garden, the catnip blooms furever.

name: Soul Shepherd
text:
"The sidar who raised me had a saying: 'The first step into death is the hardest.'"
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Blighted Cataract
text: Once, water ran here. Now only dust and ash fall from the clifftops.

name: Moonlit Wake
text:
"As long as Rushwood glows, no life is ever truly lost."
—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer

name: Clifftop Retreat
text: The sunlight falls pristine on the temple at Epityr, softened by the remembered shadows of angelic saviors' wings.

name: Besmirch
text: The whitest robes stain best.

name: Merchant's Dockhand
text:
"If you can build it, we can move it."
—Bes Tavani, Bomat merchant

name: Mind Harness
text: Centuries ago, Mangara won the loyalty of the Quirion not by ruling their minds but by supporting their independence.

name: Enemy of the Guildpact
text: Guilds often exterminate those who saw or knew too much. Some vindictive souls retain their knowledge, using it in the afterlife to crush the guilded and the vile bargain that gives them power.

name: Bull Hippo
text: The merfolk may rule the waters, but hippos have never had much respect for authority.

name: Knight of Obligation
text: He can calculate interest to six decimal places even in the midst of a deadly duel.

name: Giant Warthog
text:
"When the Ancestor saw the cruelty her human children were capable of, Her fury shook the world. From this outburst sprang the warthogs."
—Nomad myth

name: Viridian Zealot
text: "I will fight only the way nature intended—and nature intended us to win."

name: Dusk Imp
text: It despises humans and squirrels and beasts and dwarves and cephalids . . . well, it despises just about everything.

name: Tamiyo's Epiphany
text: Tamiyo wished only to observe the war, but she soon realized neutrality was not an option.

name: Tezzeret's Ambition
text: "To achieve what none have achieved before, one must dare what none have dared before."

name: Swords to Plowshares
text:
"The so-called barbarians will not respect us for our military might—they will respect us for our honor."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Seashell Cameo
text:
"Today a seashell fell from the empty sky here in Kinymu, a hundred leagues from the sea. I'm torn—shall I carve a woman or a bird?"
—Isel, master carver

name: Glorious Anthem
text: Each victory adds a new verse.

name: Silvergill Adept
text: "If you keep to the shallows, you'll never learn the secrets of the depths."

name: Lord of the Undead
text:
"I confer with Death itself. What could you possibly do to injure me?"
—Lord Dralnu

name: Killer Cosplay
text:
"Ach! Hans, run! Get the camera. He's adorable!"
—Steffi Bobsdotter, next words

name: Slippery Scoundrel
text: "I'd rather be caught red-handed than leave empty-handed!"

name: Nimana Sell-Sword
text:
"He asked if I had work for him. No wasn't the right answer."
—Samila, Murasa Expeditionary House

name: Chittering Skitterling
text: What cannot be remade will be unmade, one scrap at a time.

name: Tangle Asp
text:
"I have no fangs, yet I constantly bite. I have no scales, yet I slither through you. What am I?"
—Riddle of the viper's venom

name: Sol Ring
text: An arcane device with the power to rouse armies, raze enemies, and reward emperors.

name: Sigil Tracer
text: "The reflection is true. It is you who are distorted and false."

name: Gargoyle Flock
text: They dive screaming on defensive lines, sowing chaos before the main assault begins.

name: Thassa's Bounty
text:
"Was this gift cast adrift for any to find, or did Thassa guide the currents to bring it to me alone?"
—Kenessos, priest of Thassa

name: Stronghold Biologist
text: He twists the laws of nature until they scream.

name: Takenuma Bleeder
text: "I prefer to weave my magic through oni blood, but yours will do in a pinch."

name: Henge Walker
text: Everything that inhabits Garenbrig is affected by the wild magic flowing through the Great Henge.

name: Tolarian Geyser
text: "If they don't drown, perhaps they'll rust."

name: Unyaro Bee Sting
text:
"Much can be learned from the bees about dying for a cause."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Rabid Wolverines
text: Is there any other kind?

name: Square Up
text: Sometimes the most radical thing you can do is think inside the box.

name: Sudden Strength
text: The Mirari's magic transformed the Krosan Forest—and its inhabitants.

name: Hurkyl's Recall
text: This spell, attributed to Drafna, was actually the work of his wife Hurkyl.

name: Proud Wildbonder
text:
"You're little now, yes, but one day your footsteps will make mountains tremble."
—Gustin, wildbonder

name: Skullslither Worm
text: As larvae, they burrow into a host's brain to feed upon it, growing until they're large enough to burst free and seek out larger prey.

name: All Shall Smolder in My Wake
text: "It's my goal to find the melting point of every substance."

name: Opposition
text:
"Urza says he's sane. Perhaps, but measures of sanity among planeswalkers are hard to come by."
—Barrin

name: Syphon Soul
text:
"Her lips suck forth; see, where it flies!"
—Christopher Marlowe, *The Tragical History of Doctor Faustus*

name: Slippery Bogle
text: Bogles are very tasty if you can get the skin off. It's getting a blade on them that's the problem.

name: Gallantry
text: The courageous accomplish more in a single moment than the cowardly do in a lifetime.

name: Izzet Locket
text:
"Remember to discharge your locket every seven hours. Unless you prefer the spontaneous aether overload, of course."
—Daxiver, Izzet electromancer

name: Needletooth Raptor
text: It hatches with its ferocity fully grown.

name: Rugged Highlands
text: Defence laser emplacements are usually located at high altitude, where the rarified air does little to impede their range of destructive efficacy.

name: Bower Passage
text: In the darkest hours, some denied Avacyn. Now the Kessig wilds are their only haven.

name: Oath of Teferi
text: "For the lost and forgotten, I will keep watch."

name: Hama Pashar, Ruin Seeker
text: "Someone took the time to carve these inscriptions. The least we can do is care enough to read them."

name: Noble Hierarch
text: She protects the sacred groves from blight, drought, and the Unbeholden.

name: Temple of the False God
text: Chaos renegades always seek to deface and destroy effigies of Imperial piety, replacing them with blasphemous symbols of the Ruinous Powers.

name: Burnout
text:
"GOTCHA!"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Serene Heart
text:
"If magic is your crutch, cast it aside and learn to walk without it."
—Teferi

name: Dragonrage
text:
"Dragons in the skies of Tarkir—for the first time, it feels like my home."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Fairgrounds Trumpeter
text: The louder the elephant trumpeted, the more the crowd cheered. And the more the crowd cheered . . .

name: Panic
text:
"If you'd been there, you would've run from that deer, too!"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Fall of the Hammer
text: It is unwise to insult the god of the forge. It is also unwise to stand near anyone else who has insulted him.

name: Ghost Ship
text: Going down with the ship is just the beginning.

name: Shinka Gatekeeper
text:
"Understanding is not a virtue of the ogre. Do not seek to reason your way into Shinka Keep."
—Kiku, Night's Flower

name: Pop Quiz
text: "Today is hydromancy? I thought it was amplimancy! I studied for amplimancy!"

name: Yavimaya Wurm
text: When the gorilla playfully grabbed the wurm's tail, the wurm doubled back and playfully ate the gorilla's head.

name: Pyrotechnics
text:
"Take inspiration from your enemies, and make their strengths your own."
—Alesha, Who Smiles at Death

name: Grudge Keeper
text: "Your defiance is noted."

name: Pin to the Earth
text:
"Mortal strength, like mortal hope, is so easily crushed."
—Thassa, god of the sea

name: Ajani's Welcome
text: "You cannot defend others if your own well-being is neglected."

name: Fallen Cleric
text: The most terrifying zombies are those with just a hint of their old selves left.

name: Bishop's Soldier
text: Vampires, the noble class of old Torrezon, are guided by their dual loyalties to church and crown.

name: Sylvan Safekeeper
text:
"He has been to the heart of the wood. Did you truly expect to wield power over him?"
—Oakhide druid

name: Looming Shade
text: On darkness feeding, in nightmares breeding.

name: Chaotic Backlash
text: The concept of thoughtweft fascinates the Nighthearth cult. Imagine, bringing agony to an entire people by torturing just one.

name: Hell's Caretaker
text: "The rules are clear. If you want to leave, you need only convince another to take your place."

name: Dragon Egg
text: Dragon birth lairs are littered with treasure to entice the young from their eggs.

name: Callous Dismissal
text:
"They make it clear we are nothing to them."
—Lavinia

name: Pack's Disdain
text: Like the sun to a flower, the adoring gaze of the tribe is sustenance to an elf. To be shunned is to wither.

name: Kobold Drill Sergeant
text: "Joining this army is easy, boy. Just survive your first battle."

name: City of Brass
text:
"Enter this palace-gate and ask the news Of greatness fallen into dust and clay."
—*The Arabian Nights*, trans. Burton

name: Celestial Purge
text:
"They say only the good die young. Obviously, you are one of the exceptions."
—Delrobah, cleric of Ivora Gate

name: Scourglass
text:
"Soon I will sleep, eyes closing to a world tarnished with flesh, and then wake to a polished vision."
—Sharuum

name: Swords to Plowshares
text:
"Hunger is no different from any other foe; defeat it in the Emperor's name, and save Humanity."
—Motto of the Agri-World Viridia IV

name: Unwind
text:
"A problem is only a problem if you don't have the tools to correct it."
—Jhoira

name: Lull
text: Tayil stood and breathed in the scent of wet earth. For a moment, he was home in his father's village, the battle but a distant dream.

name: Cease-Fire
text: When the crimson fades from the magical embers, a final wisp of smoke will rise. Soon after, hostilities will begin anew.

name: Vow of Flight
text:
"Soaring is wasted on the winged."
—Edric, Spymaster of Trest

name: Nameless One
text: "Open your mind to me."

name: Island
text: As you sail past the imposing Seatower of Balduran, you realize that breaking your friend out of that prison will be much harder than you thought.

name: Captain's Claws
text: Forged for victory in a time of despair.

name: Glissa, the Traitor
text: Once Mirrodin's brightest hope. Now Phyrexia's cruel champion.

name: Sanguine Sacrament
text: "As the sun sets to make way for dawn, so we turn to darkness to bring about the coming salvation."

name: Wizard Replica
text: It responds with unnatural precision.

name: Night Soil
text: Some said killing the Thallids only encouraged them.

name: Desert Cerodon
text: The endless expanse of desert surrounding Naktamun sometimes yields threats that the gods themselves must answer.

name: Plummet
text:
"Still, the pterodon chasing the clouds from its skies must bow to the great forest below."
—Mahuiz, Sun Empire archer

name: Mystic Skull // Mystic Monstrosity
text: Under the light of an unnatural moon, it walked out on legs of straw with joints of hinges ripped from the barn doors.

name: Drider
text: Though their forms embody Lolth's image, driders are those unfortunate drow who have failed the Spider Queen.

name: Eternal Witness
text: She remembers every word spoken, from the hero's oath to the baby's cry.

name: Psychosis Crawler
text:
"Perhaps drawing the impossible monster will lessen the burden my memory must bear."
—Jarsyl, diary

name: Ogre Taskmaster
text: He doesn't have to be smart—his masters only ever give him one command.

name: Gilded Lotus
text:
"The perfection of the lotus reminds me of my hopes for this world . . . and my failures. I will not rest until I've atoned for them."
—Karn

name: Rising Waters
text: Rising waters, sinking hope.

name: Blood Artist
text:
"Vanya Falkenrath's paintings are astonishing. How does she manage to achieve such rich crimson hues?"
—Stefan, art critic

name: Orbs of Warding
text: One orb to guard the body, one to protect the mind, and one to shield the soul.

name: Wayfarer's Bauble
text: Druids hold certain plants to be sacred and use their leaves and wood as a spellcasting focus.

name: Clay Statue
text: Tawnos won fame as Urza's greatest assistant. After he created these warriors, Urza ended his apprenticeship, promoting him directly to the rank of master.

name: Heroes' Reunion
text:
"You helped save my people from a Phyrexian fate. Did you think I wouldn't return the favor?"
—Eladamri, to Gerrard

name: Ophidian
text:
"I will ... tell thee more than thou hast wit to ask."
—Christopher Marlowe, *Doctor Faustus*

name: Healing Salve
text:
"Xantcha is recovering. The medicine is slow, but my magic would have killed her."
—Serra, to Urza

name: Fumarole
text:
"Too many of us have died in the explosions that wrack these hills."
—Klazina Jansdotter, Leader of the Order of the Sacred Torch

name: Dreadfeast Demon
text: By the sixth day of darkness, the lake was more blood than water.

name: Sylvan Anthem
text: Action: This is an abstract illustration that celebrates green creatures.

name: Skullclamp
text: Only the most pious and devoted Imperial servants are granted the posthumous honor of becoming servo-skulls.

name: Deadly Brew
text: No one ever asked what was in Dina's concoctions, so long as they worked.

name: Claim of Erebos
text: Priests of Erebos give an occasional reminder to mortals who have forgotten their mortality.

name: Parasitic Strix
text: After finding no sustenance on the edges of Grixis, it turned to the skies of Bant.

name: Floodhound
text: The thief doubled back twice, doused herself with perfume, crossed the ocean, and still woke up with her pursuer close on her heels.

name: Phyrexian Boon
text:
"Dagsson should have paid attention to the lessons of Phyrexia before attempting to create a mechanical utopia."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Windborne Charge
text: The merfolk call the sky goddess Emeria. The kor call her Kamsa. The two races agree on little except that she offers many blessings to the faithful.

name: Selesnya Signet
text: The symbol of the Conclave is one of unity, with tree supporting sun and sun feeding tree.

name: Needlepeak Spider
text:
"It's a testament to the forests' devastation that giant spiders now make their homes amid Dominaria's barren spires."
—Aznaph, greenseeker

name: Noble Vestige
text: Most spirits are chained to this world by their despair, but he remains tethered by his hope for better days.

name: Ember Hauler
text: Not every job in the goblin army is glamorous. Actually, *no* job in the goblin army is glamorous.

name: Shadowstorm
text:
"You've not seen a storm until you've seen the kind that roars between worlds."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

name: Imi Statue
text:
"Just looking at it fills me with dread . . . . Yet since it arrived, I've done little else. My blades have dulled and my business has failed, and still I cannot look away."
—Keisaku, master swordmaker

name: Aphemia, the Cacophony
text:
"Sing, beauty. Sing for death, and for the dead."
—Ashiok

name: Shrapnel Blast
text: It requires immense pressure to imbue an item with magic. If the spell is broken . . .

name: Snapping Drake
text: Foul-tempered, poorly trained, and mule-stubborn, the drake is the perfect test of the master's will.

name: Tectonic Break
text: Only the foolish and the rich build their houses where the land is thin and the ocean is near.

name: Selenia
text: Once a guardian of Crovax's estate, Selenia was freed from her magical bindings by the wealthy noble. Instead of remaining at his side, the angel chose to venture out into the world. For reasons unknown to Crovax, Selenia now serves the evil Volrath in his home realm of Rath.

name: Deathreap Ritual
text:
"All who set foot in Paliano are pawns in someone's play for power."
—Marchesa, the Black Rose

name: Fyndhorn Elder
text:
"Do we know what we're doing? Yes—the will of Freyalise."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

name: Goblin Brawler
text: Perhaps he shuns technology. Perhaps he appreciates nature. Perhaps he doesn't know the difference.

name: Bog Wraith
text: Knowing Takenuma Swamp to be dangerous, Hisata set wards to warn him of predators. He never imagined that his murderer would pass through them unhindered.

name: Mtenda Griffin
text:
"Unlike Zhalfir, the griffin needs no council to keep harmony among its parts."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Creeping Mold
text: Mold crept over the walls and into every crevice until the gleaming white stone strained and burst.

name: Regrowth
text:
「何世紀も続く競争がアルケヴィオスを破壊した。しかしひとつの種が、長い再生の道を歩み始めた。」
—-神秘の時代：呪文物語

name: Blood Feud
text: Succession is a matter of blood, and by blood it is often decided.

name: Aven Trooper
text: The very skies seethe with the aven's hatred for the Cabal.

name: Gonti's Aether Heart
text: Despite the magic that sustains Gonti's life, the crime lord is often described as heartless.

name: Stone Rain
text:
"Thus, Bruk the Skyhammer earned his epithet and won the war, all in one fiery moment."
—*Compendium of Warspells*

name: Endless Scream
text:
"I have made Crovax weep; now I will make him scream. The pain will not end, but will bind him to me."
—Volrath

name: Hibernation Sliver
text: Mogglings have been known to play ball with hibernating slivers, completely unaware of their true nature.

name: Villainous Ogre
text:
"The war saw the ogres emerge from their caves, reeking of blood, with the power of oni in their veins."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Talisman of Indulgence
text:
"Embrace your hunger, your lust, your desire. The universe is ours for the taking!"
—Sanctifer LeVay, Cult of the Sacred Union

name: Ampryn Tactician
text: "It's all a game. You shouldn't get too attached to the pieces."

name: Gemstone Array
text: Outside, it reflects the suns' light. Inside, it harvests the suns' power.

name: Free from Flesh
text: He finally understood that phyresis was not an ending, but a new, perfect beginning.

name: Deepwood Drummer
text: His drums echo Deepwood's heartbeat.

name: Tormenting Voice
text: A mocking laughter echoed in Ugin's mind. How many centuries had he slumbered, stricken, while Nicol Bolas moved unchallenged among the planes?

name: Vorstclaw
text: Roots reach deep, and sometimes they tap into things better left undisturbed.

name: Caustic Caterpillar
text:
"That was a Consulate spy thopter. Leave the caterpillar to its meal."
—Pia Nalaar, renegade inventor

name: Stern Judge
text: "How to punish the guilty is up to the Ancestor. Deciding who merits such punishment is up to me."

name: Barbed Wire
text: A steel snake with ten thousand teeth.

name: Debilitating Injury
text:
"If weakness does not exist within the Temur then we shall force it upon them."
—Sidisi, khan of the Sultai

name: Aspect of Hydra
text: "Even alone I outnumber you."

name: Mercenary Informer
text: The problem with rebels is that they so quickly reject authority.

name: Djeru's Renunciation
text:
"I was promised an afterlife, not this. Samut was right. The God-Pharaoh lied."
—Djeru, former Tah-crop initiate

name: Thrashing Brontodon
text:
"Count yourself lucky it only broke your kitesail. Get that close to the nest again and it'll be your face."
—Huatli

name: Brago's Representative
text: On Fiora, no matter is settled until King Brago offers an opinion.

name: Bog Raiders
text: Those who live amid decay must expect scavengers.

name: Advanced Stitchwing
text:
"Improvement is a consequence of practice."
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Devious Cover-Up
text: Widow Weber's new scarecrow seemed to attract more crows than it scared off.

name: Bloodthrone Vampire
text: "The underclass often forget that they are not tenants, or servants, but property."

name: Oashra Cultivator
text: "Like fruits in the field, we will be harvested when the season is right."

name: Savage Swipe
text: Nine generations of metalworking skill are no match for nine hundred pounds of rage.

name: Golgari Guildgate
text:
"Jarad was a friend to the Devkarin. Now we slink through neglected tunnels, befriending those who crawl them."
—Izoni

name: Pitiless Plunderer
text: "Shame to let good gold go to the grave."

name: Greater Sandwurm
text: A sandwurm can lie in wait beneath the sands for years until the slightest tremor alerts it to the presence of prey.

name: Bone Splinters
text: Vastly outnumbered, the Zendikari found creative ways to even the odds.

name: Child of Night
text: No guilds—that is her rule. The House vampires unnerve her. The Combine would dissect her, the Legion burn her, the Conclave "cure" her. The shadows are all the family she needs.

name: Crop Rotation
text: "The end of my cycle draws near. Rise up, young sprouts, and take root in my place."

name: Reprocess
text: Everything will find its use in Phyrexia. Eventually.

name: Fleshbag Marauder
text: Grixis is a world where the only things found in abundance are death and decay. Corpses, whole or in part, are the standard currency among necromancers and demons.

name: Burn the Impure
text: Flame doesn't kneel to Phyrexia.

name: Serendib Sorcerer
text: "Even a dragon is humble as a kitten if it thinks itself a slave."

name: Sigil of Valor
text: With each honor he earns, Gideon paves the path to his redemption.

name: Shimian Night Stalker
text:
"When churchyards yawn and hell itself breathes out/ Contagion to this world."
—William Shakespeare, *Hamlet*

name: Lyev Decree
text: The Azorius have so many codes and statutes that you're always in violation of one of them.

name: Krark's Other Thumb
text: Krark was the kind of goblin who'd lose his thumb in a wager and come right back with "Double or nothing!"

name: Copper Longlegs
text: Its webs are not true silk, but woven from thousands of delicate mycosynth strands.

name: Aladdin's Ring
text:
". . . The magician drew a ring off his finger . . . , saying: 'It is a talisman against all evil, so long as you obey me.'"
—*The Arabian Nights*,
Junior Classics trans.

name: Bloodthirsty Blade
text: The weapon wields the hand that holds it.

name: Feral Thallid
text:
"Born and bred of fungus, thallids were nearly impossible to kill."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. I*

name: Moaning Spirit
text: The dead sing their own lullabies.

name: Negate
text: "The ancient kor were a clever bunch with a taste for nasty traps. Spikes, poison, fire pouring forth with no warning . . . I've seen and disabled them all. If you intend to raid a Skyclave, you'd be wise to hire me on."

name: Champion of Dusk
text: "Drench these golden streets in the blood of our enemies."

name: Dune Mover
text: The shifting, unpredictable sands were deemed a disobedient affront to the Flesh Singularity.

name: Heartwood Dryad
text: To snare what lies between worlds takes the patient reach of trees.

name: Tavern Ruffian // Tavern Smasher
text: She dispatched every challenger with a sickening snap of bone.

name: Ghalta, Primal Hunger
text: The earth walks, strongest of all.

name: Meletis Charlatan
text: "Every object has an echo in the Æther beyond the world. Every idea has a shadow that can be brought to light."

name: Griffin Aerie
text: When griffins started nesting atop the northern tower, the castellan worried they'd be a nuisance. Instead, they took the entire castle under their protection.

name: Burgeoning
text: The first vine shows the others where to grow.

name: Rupture
text: All creatures have an inner fire. Releasing it can be dangerous.

name: Exclusion Ritual
text:
"Your desires have become our discretion."
—Izathel, priest of the Annex

name: Thorn of the Black Rose
text: If bribery and intimidation fail, Marchesa turns to her favorite form of persuasion.

name: Enemy of Enlightenment
text:
"Evil flourishes where ignorance thrives."
—Perisophia the philosopher

name: Omnath, Locus of Mana
text: From the Roil emerged a ravenous primordial being of pure mana.

name: Earth Surge
text:
"Some gardeners sing to plants. I tell them stories—stories of how they once ruled the world, of the mortals who destroyed their kind, and of revenge."
—Bougrat, druid of the Cult of Yore

name: Gluttonous Zombie
text: Greed and gluttony led him to death. Now they are his greatest assets.

name: Horned Troll
text:
"If I says it's a troll, it's a troll. Goblins is always right in Mercadia."
—Squee

name: Disenchant
text:
"There are harsher ways to learn the meaning of the word 'no.'"
—Rashida Scalebane

name: Hagra Crocodile
text: The creatures of Zendikar are opportunists, eating whatever is available to them. Like goblins. Or boats.

name: Mammoth Spider
text:
"The good news is that the migrating drakes are no longer a problem."
—Bell Migellic, Azorius hussar

name: Dwarven Reinforcements
text: "Orders? We don't wait for orders!"

name: Zombie Goliath
text:
"Phirax of Blood Ridge has sent a war giant at us? What, do I have to spell it out for you? Kill the giant, scoop out its skull, and drive it back to Blood Ridge. Honestly, what kind of necromancer minions are you?"
—Keren-Dur, necromancer lord

name: Krosan Druid
text: "Druids endure disaster as seeds endure winter. Now Krosa blooms once more."

name: Vastwood Gorger
text:
"A long and difficult incision revealed that all vital organs are housed in the head, save for a long chain of stomachs, forty in all, leading from its throat to the end of the tail."
—Mulak Ffar, *Vastwood Biodiversity*

name: Swirling Sandstorm
text: As dust swept out, vultures swept in.

name: Sudden Spinnerets
text:
"What's natural on Ikoria continues to delight me."
—Vivien Reid

name: Enduring Scalelord
text: Only the sun that beats down upon Arashin's walls could shine more brightly.

name: Corrupted Conscience
text: Karn's creation is now his master.

name: A-Fates' Reversal
text: A doom denied—or, perhaps, delayed.

name: Godhead of Awe
text:
"What she saw crawling upon this world repulsed her. Yet she could not tear her gaze away."
—*The Seer's Parables*

name: Merfolk Sovereign
text: "Be like the sea: flow around that which is unmovable; for everything else, crash into it unrelentingly."

name: Strength of Isolation
text: Don't mistake isolation for safety.

name: Words of Wisdom
text: Knowledge can't be kept in a bottle or sealed in a box. It yearns to be spread and shared.

name: Bazaar Krovod
text: The Hauler's Collective wields great influence over the Ravnican merchant class. Without it, little moves in the city.

name: Epiphany Storm
text: In Meletis, certain oracles are trained to be divine lightning rods, receiving countless visions in an instant.

name: Phyrexian Rager
text:
"I believe many worlds will bow to Phyrexia. Mirrodin is merely the first."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Evolving Wilds
text: Parts of Faerûn still churn with the magic of arrogant Netherese archmages long dead.

name: Marauding Raptor
text:
"Stand still and try not to look like prey!"
—Skerk Hobnett, wilderness guide

name: Mungha Wurm
text: Cities have crumbled under its weight.

name: Hellkite Whelp
text:
"They play by spitting fire at each other. Don't be offended if one gives you a love-scorch."
—Esfir, Rakdos dragon wrangler

name: Flamekin Brawler
text: When he hits people, they stay hit.

name: Rakdos Cackler
text: Devil-blades and dripping blood make music Rakdos never tires of hearing.

name: Goblin Grenade
text: Don't underestimate the aerodynamic qualities of the common goblin.

name: Hurl Through Hell
text: No one returns unchanged.

name: Rhox Pummeler
text: When all you have is a warhammer, every face looks like a nail.

name: Spellseeker
text: Not content with mere answers, she hunts for the truth.

name: Elvish Hunter
text:
"Elves often tipped their arrows with a drug that caused a deep but harmless sleep."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*

name: Master of Diversion
text: Choose your battles carefully. For example, avoid the big guy.

name: Mogg Salvage
text: Three moggs, one treasure, too bad.

name: Wild Wanderer
text: "We all began in nature, and nature is where we belong."

name: Gateway Sneak
text: "I've been through every guildgate in this city, and no one sees me come or go."

name: Ancient Ziggurat
text: Leylines branch out from its foundation like roots from a tree. These draw mana from every region and welcome all living things into its verdant chambers.

name: Turn the Tide
text:
"Let their mindless armies come and face the might of genius."
—Varil, Neurok partisan

name: Cruel Revival
text: Few Cabal fighters fear death. They fear what follows it.

name: Old Guard
text: "You say you're capable of flying. You got any proof of that?"

name: Frost Trickster
text: The most important skill in a Mage Tower match is keeping one's cool.

name: Woodland Stream
text: Waterways carve their routes through the land to reflect the paths the aether streams cut through the clouds.

name: Halt Order
text: An artificer's least favorite mind-missive may be "I regret to inform you that the funding for your project has been cut."

name: Soul Channeling
text: Driven by masters more terrible than the Mercadians could imagine, the dark overseers would pay any price to keep their shipwrights working.

name: Illuminate History
text: "Look at the detail in this stonework! Professor, our assumptions about early Kathorran tool use may not be correct."

name: Glimpse of Nature
text: Dosan sat in repose for many hours. He made no motion, no sound at all. And as he sat, nature revealed itself to him.

name: Sigardian Savior
text: "Begone, moon-cursed! These folk are no prey of yours."

name: Karsus Depthguard
text: He stood his ground in the Mirrored Depths, his roar of defiance echoed by a thousand crystalline reflections.

name: Abbey Matron
text:
"The Matrons still say Serra is coming back. I bet she never even existed."
—Murat, Death Speaker

name: Mobilization
text: Wars are won with strength, valor, and numbers—especially numbers.

name: Viscera Seer
text: In matters of life and death, he trusts his gut.

name: Carrion
text: King or herder, the maggots care not.

name: Aladdin's Ring
text: "After these words the magician drew a ring off his finger, and put it on one of Aladdin's, saying: 'It is a talisman against all evil, so long as you obey me.'" —*The Arabian Nights*, Junior Classics trans.

name: Gerrard's Battle Cry
text: Gerrard grinned and drew his sword. "This won't be a fair fight," he called to his crew. "They should have brought a second ship!"

name: Seat of the Synod
text: Lumengrid, site of the Knowledge Pool, source of vedalken arcana.

name: Art Appreciation
text: There's no defending against public opinion.

name: Recalibrate
text:
"Trial 991: Still encountering issues with accidental aetherization. Maybe if we widen the dimensional matrix to 0.7?"
—Izzet research notes

name: Council of Advisors
text: Sun Quan's long and successful rule in the years 199 to 251 was due to his ability to choose and foster talented advisors and generals.

name: Altar's Light
text:
"The altar does nothing; the device is crushed under the weight of its own impurity."
—Ushanti, leonin seer

name: Phyrexian Espionage
text:
"Even if they're hunting for sleeper agents, who looks twice at a bird?"
—Rona

name: Lat-Nam's Legacy
text:
"All the knowledge of Lat-Nam could not protect its sages from the Brothers' War."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Aggravated Assault
text: Despite being more cunning than most Orks, Kaptin Badrukk still recognizes that some plans just need more dakka.

name: Gaea's Herald
text: "I bring word from Gaea. Fight on! She will never allow her children to die alone."

name: Natural Spring
text:
"Jewels cannot be eaten nor gold drunk. What civilization trades, nature simply provides."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Spiteful Shadows
text:
"Let us remind these human cattle why they fear the shadows of this world."
—Aldreg, Skirsdag cultist

name: Shadow of the Grave
text:
"Death has seeped into every part of this plane. I can feel it on my skin and taste it like sand in my mouth."
—Nissa Revane

name: Ancient Grudge
text: If there's anything a werewolf hates, it's a collar-especially Avacyn's Collar, the symbol of her church.

name: Mox Amber
text:
"A crystallized moment in time from the Mending Era, first discovered during the Ice Age. A temporal conundrum, even to the great scholar himself."
—*The Discoveries of Feldon*

name: Urza's Guilt
text: Deep in Yawgmoth's realm, Urza stopped dead in his tracks and rubbed his soot-filled eyes. "Mishra?"

name: Joraga Bard
text: Adventuring bards recite *Chanter's Epics*, never-ending tales that keep their comrades' minds alert to danger.

name: Kolvori, God of Kinship // The Ringhart Crest
text: Kolvori's love for her family knows no bounds.

name: Heartless Hidetsugu
text: Hidetsugu held over a dozen oni in blood oath. At his touch, rocks scorched. At his word, cities burned.

name: Marsh Gas
text:
"Comes right outta th' ground. If ya can smell it, it's too late."
—Keevy Bogsbury

name: Starlit Angel
text: To soar as high as hope, to dive as swift as justice.

name: Harm's Way
text: Even when fate is already written, there's always time to change the names.

name: Moor Fiend
text:
"Let them close the gates of Krov from dusk until dawn if they so choose. It matters not. My fiends shall yet rend their flesh from their bones."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Boggart Loggers
text: Auntie Flint lent axes to Nibb and Gyik, thinking they'd share their experiences with her. She's still waiting for them to come back.

name: Village Ironsmith // Ironfang
text: Each morning, he repairs the front door.

name: Silent Sentinel
text: It serves a justice higher than the whims of the gods.

name: Vodalian Soldiers
text:
"The cooling climate introduced a new threat to Vodalia: the Homarids. Once a minor nuisance, they thrived in the changing environment. Their ceaseless attacks strained Vodalia's defenses to their limit, eventually overwhelming the empire."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. V*

name: Giant Growth
text:
"Here in Fyndhorn, the goddess Freyalise is generous to her children."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Magic Missile
text: A tried-and-true favorite of many wizards, whatever their school.

name: Scapeshift
text:
"Changes far greater than the turning of the leaves await us at season's end."
—Colfenor, the Last Yew

name: Tangled Florahedron // Tangled Vale
text:
"As Bala Ged regrows, new forms of life blossom with unfettered wonder."
—Doral, Bala Ged guide

name: Broodmate Dragon
text: Frozen in fear, the goblins stared upward at the circling hunter-and were promptly eaten by its diving mate.

name: Thieving Magpie
text: Other birds collect twigs for their nests. Magpies collect jewels for theirs.

name: Tilonalli's Skinshifter
text: "I am the ferocity of the Burning Sun. I am hide and feather, fang and claw."

name: Ral's Reinforcements
text: "Good thing maintenance never got around to decatalyzing the bithermic plasma displacement conduits!"

name: Autumn Willow
text:
"We must shake her limbs and rattle her brains."
—Grandmother Sengir

name: Guardians of Akrasa
text:
"Only by the bravery of those who put loyalty above glory is our home kept safe."
—Elspeth

name: Bold Plagiarist
text: "I know a good idea when I see one."

name: Orochi Merge-Keeper
text: One day the spirit and mortal realms will be one. Until then, she faithfully guards the sites where they merge.

name: Goblin Mime
text: Mung noticed a few clouds gathering in the sky. Perhaps today he could perform his "walking against the wind" routine.

name: Ur-Golem's Eye
text: It still stares accusingly at Memnarch, though millennia have passed since he separated the eye from its body.

name: Stormscape Familiar
text: Each Stormscape apprentice must hand-raise and train an owl before attaining the rank of master.
