"Krosa the great. Krosa the enduring. Look to the forest, and it will share its bounty."
—Zyd, Kamahlite druid

name: Mishra's Bauble
text:
"The secrets of my great-uncle's heirloom lie in the world where it was forged: the grease-stained wastes of Phyrexia."
—Jarsyl, diary

name: Wandering Wolf
text: Humans still feared wolves, though no connection between them and the curse of lycanthropy had ever been proved.

name: Undercity Upheaval
text: Light shone on parts of the undercity for the first time in centuries.

name: Wildfire Devils
text: Devils sow grief and harvest glee.

name: Thunderous Snapper
text: While humans hear only a deafening roar, the fae hear music of breathtaking beauty.

name: Information Booth
text: "Sir, this may be the information booth, but I cannot answer ontological questions. It would be arrogant to assume I could describe the true nature of reality. Also there's a line."

name: Rabid Bite
text: A healthy felidar is voracious yet regal. A rabid felidar is nothing more than appetite lashed to frothing jaws.

name: Ravenous Harpy
text: A harpy's hoard is a filthy, bloodstained pile of trinkets and corpses.

name: Snow Hound
text:
"If you're starving, eat your horses, your dead, or yourself—but *never* eat your dog."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: The Brute
text:
"Union may be strength, but it is mere blind brute strength unless wisely directed."
—Samuel Butler

name: Bottle Gnomes
text:
"I am reminded of the fable of the silver egg. Its owner cracks it open to see what jewels it holds, only to discover a simple yellow yolk."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Seismic Assault
text: The flowstone seemed for a moment to assume Greven's rage—it lunged like a wild beast at the *Weatherlight*.

name: Seer's Lantern
text: A light to bring hope in dark times.

name: Neglected Heirloom // Ashmouth Blade
text:
"There is a rich history in a blade like this."
—Old Rutstein

name: Fog
text:
"More armies have been lost in the confusion of the jungle mists than to any battle."
—Jolrael

name: Mind Rot
text:
"The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them."
—Volrath

name: Sheltered Aerie
text: Dromoka's scalelords patrol the skies over Arashin, offering her people safety from the harsh world.

name: Magus of the Library
text: The ancient books slowly crumbled, their secrets turning to dust. But their every word sings within the magus's head.

name: Tramway Station
text: A ten-minute ride can take you to the luxury of Park Heights, or the grit of the Caldaia.

name: Miraculous Recovery
text: "I am the rock of the polis. Death only strengthens me."

name: Deconstruct
text: "Nothing in this world, not even magic, likes to be caged."

name: Kaervek, the Spiteful
text: "Defy me and I will burn the flesh from your bones. Betray me and I will steal the breath from your lungs."

name: Windstorm Drake
text: Drakes become especially voracious as they prepare for their autumn migration, hunting the city's thoroughfares from dawn to dusk.

name: Veteran Brawlers
text: Death awaits them on both fronts.

name: Caustic Caterpillar
text:
"The rare and beautiful butterflies inspire the design of our thopters. The larvae, however, are a different story entirely."
—Kiran Nalaar, Ghirapur inventor

name: Descendant of Kiyomaro
text: "The blood of Kiyomaro flows in my veins. He did not let Eiganjo fall and neither shall I."

name: Anointer of Valor
text: Light streaked down from the heavens, and a voice whispered in the soldier's ear: "You shall not fall today."

name: Vampire of the Dire Moon
text: "This place suits me: craven authorities and plentiful prey."

name: Soul Partition
text: Teferi's body couldn't travel through time far enough, but with Kaya's help, his spirit could.

name: Timeless Dragon
text: It has flown the sky for eons without ever touching ground.

name: Yisan, the Wanderer Bard
text: Designed by Brian Fargo

name: Ondu Champion
text:
"Put a minotaur at the head of an army and suddenly all the soldiers act like they have horns."
—Gideon Jura

name: Wormfang Turtle
text: Chainer's admirers keep his dreams alive.

name: Clam Session
text: "Duke, Duke, Duke, Duke of Pearl . . . ."

name: Threads of Disloyalty
text:
"Over time, Konda grew ever more suspicious, fearing even his most loyal allies were being manipulated by unseen hands."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Blighted Bat
text: Amonkhet's dual suns don't allow for the darkness of night, so bats are most active under the gloom of the frequent sandstorms.

name: Griffin Dreamfinder
text: Some griffins are able to pluck mystic auras from the Æther that are hidden from other mortals.

name: Forgotten Cave
text: In the hearts of mortals, in the pages of ancient lore, in the deep, forgotten places of the universe . . . Chaos waits.

name: Defeat
text:
"Wars are decided one life at a time."
—Gvar Barzeel, Kolaghan warrior

name: Mowu, Loyal Companion
text: Wherever Yanggu goes, Mowu follows—sometimes at his side, sometimes obscuring him from view entirely.

name: Bennie Bracks, Zoologist
text: His enthusiastic curiosity puts even the most fearsome of beasts at ease.

name: Loxodon Hierarch
text: "I have lived long, and I remember how this city once was. If my death serves to bring back the Ravnica in my memory, then so be it."

name: Blue Sun's Twilight
text:
"Where once there was ignorance, Jin-Gitaxias brought knowledge, and an age of progress dawned."
—Monument inscription

name: Sanctum Guardian
text: "Protect our mother in her womb."

name: Pyrotechnics
text:
"Hi! ni! ya! Behold the man of flint, that's me! / Four lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return."
—Navajo war chant

name: Cannibalize
text: "Mine."

name: Bountiful Harvest
text: Following the sun's cycle, harvest season comes once a year—unless the druids bid the sun behave otherwise.

name: Earnest Fellowship
text:
"The world has enough strife as it is. Where would we be if we turned against each other?"
—Pianna, nomad captain

name: Jilt
text:
"You're not my Hanna!"
—Gerrard, to Yawgmoth

name: Mirrorwood Treefolk
text: It doesn't need a bite. The bark works just fine.

name: Elegant Entourage
text: "Terribly sorry, but this is a private party, and your name isn't on the list."

name: Thrashing Frontliner
text: With Urabrask in hiding, the masterless Furnace Host was unleashed on the Multiverse to spread mayhem and destruction.

name: Alpha Tyrranax
text: Hunger seized the tyrranax, and the Sylvok's vision quest ended in disaster.

name: Treetop Scout
text: At home among the swaying, supple branches of the treetops, some scouts live their entire lives never touching ground.

name: Winds of Change
text: Sometimes, a butterfly flapping its wings is insignificant.

name: Town Sentry
text:
"So he gots a sword. Big deal."
"Yeah, it's a big deal—it's a big sword!"
—Two goblins outside the gates of Trokin

name: Akroan Line Breaker
text: The enemies' shields are the first to shatter, and their battle line is never far behind.

name: Highland Lake
text: With the fate of Innistrad uncertain, some seek solace in remote areas.

name: Gigantoplasm
text:
"I appreciate things that exceed expectations."
—Mizzix

name: Bloodshot Trainee
text: "Just think how strong I'll be if my arms don't tear off!"

name: Slagwoods Bridge
text: The path to action is forged in confidence.

name: Armor Thrull
text:
"The worst thing about being a mercenary for the Ebon Hand is having to wear a dead thrull."
—Ivra Jursdotter

name: Sphinx Mindbreaker
text: Riddles draw you in, paradoxes hold you fast, and answers shatter your perceptions.

name: Soulbound Guardians
text: The kor's most righteous dead are given the greatest reward: an eternity tied to the land they so cherish.

name: Pillarfield Ox
text: These stubborn and unpredictable oxen inspire the plains nomads' most colorful curses.

name: Welkin Tern
text:
"It preys on other birds. And drakelings. And drakes. Pretty much anything that crosses its flight path is fair game."
—Amira, skycaptain of Thune

name: Guided Strike
text:
"If you can kill your enemy with the first stroke, you save yourself the labor of the second."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Graceful Cat
text: Though they are held in high regard as symbols of the god Oketra, cats often lack her sense of solidarity.

name: Horn of Ramos
text: Ramos touched, and there was life.

name: Goblin Lackey
text: All bark, someone else's bite.

name: Thrasios, Triton Hero
text: Beneath crashing waves lies an ocean of secrets waiting to be explored.

name: Relic Ward
text: Asmira's prayers alone should have freed Mangara from the amber prison . . .

name: Flip the Switch
text:
"Works every time! Well, every time they don't explode, anyway."
—Barton, stitcher

name: Rule of Law
text: The law is meant to ensure that people kill each other with only the utmost fairness.

name: Falcon Abomination
text: The foulest of fowl.

name: Greater Mossdog
text: Man's best fungus.

name: Strategic Planning
text: Alrund sees the future as a whorl of signs and symbols, omens interwoven in an intricate knotwork only he can decipher.

name: Spelltithe Enforcer
text: His assistants calculate the amount of the tribute. He measures out the punishment for delinquency.

name: Divine Arrow
text: Ravnica's defenders watched in horror as Oketra's shot pierced the body of the pegasus. Gideon tumbled through the air, Blackblade in hand.

name: Neglected Heirloom // Ashmouth Blade
text:
"Its previous owners had some stories to share, I'm certain."
—Old Rutstein

name: Murder
text: Ob Nixilis decided the fastest way to seize control of New Capenna would be to usurp the networks of power already hidden there. Xander's Maestros were the first to fall.

name: Curse of Exhaustion
text:
"I do believe your heresy will prove more difficult now that you have more pressing concerns."
—Bishop Argust

name: Perimeter Sergeant
text: "Get in there, soldier! I want a pelt on my wall before lunch!"

name: Patchwork Automaton
text: It dwells happily near the ever-burning forges of Sokenzan City, crafting small things of beauty from discarded scraps.

name: Coastal Breach
text: The sea filled the villagers' nets until the day it cast its own.

name: Ineffable Blessing
text: "Hallowed be this assemblage of various stuff!"

name: Dimir Informant
text: The letters arrive, all sealed and read.

name: Devious Cover-Up
text: First, dispose of the evidence. Then dispose of your knowledge of its disposal.

name: Whirlermaker
text:
"Our creations are more than mere things. They have life in them, little bits of ourselves."
—Saheeli Rai

name: Balthor the Defiled
text: He remembers enough of his life to weep for what he has lost.

name: Rooftop Storm
text:
"Let those idiot priests tremble! A new era in unlife begins here and now. Oglor, raise the lightning vane!"
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Flunk
text:
"I assure you, no one fails my course more than once."
—Embrose, Silverquill dean

name: Aspect of Lamprey
text: "Some aspire to be mighty like the lion or the hydra. I am the parasite that feeds on them all."

name: Magma Vein
text:
Standing near a volcano
—Barbarian expression meaning "asking for it"

name: Commencement of Festivities
text: Never before have there been so many brilliant minds and wondrous inventions in one place. Denizens from every corner of Kaladesh will flock to the once-in-a-lifetime Inventors' Fair.

name: Dagger Caster
text: "Keep coming. I have knives enough for everyone."

name: Ponder
text: "Will the future be brighter?" asked the girl. Rielle smiled. "I will teach you how to make it so."

name: Inflame
text: Wound, maim, kill: it's all the same to a Keldon.

name: Brute Force
text: Blood, bone, and sinew are magnified, as is the rage that drives them. The brain, however, remains unchanged—a little bean, swinging by a strand in a cavernous, raving head.

name: Never Happened
text: Dimir assassins have the precision to slay a single memory.

name: Returned Centaur
text: Driven away by his living kin, he wanders mourning through the wilderness, seeking the dead city of Asphodel.

name: Penumbra Bobcat
text: "It was just a trick of the light," Dalis muttered to himself. "I've been patrolling alone too long. Got to stop jumping at shadows."

name: Rewards of Diversity
text:
"Everything is in place. Nothing can happen that isn't part of my plan."
—Urza

name: Ogre Siegebreaker
text:
"What he doesn't burn, he smashes."
—Captain Wellis, ogre wrangler

name: Unbridled Growth
text:
"If the Consulate has abandoned restraint, so too shall the wilds."
—Surash, keeper of the Cowl

name: Vengevine
text: "RARGLEARGLEARGLE!"

name: Fungus Elemental
text:
I rot growth and grow rot. What am I?
—Elvish riddle

name: Lone Missionary
text: His mission has become a grim pilgrimage, a tour of the Eldrazi-stricken outposts across Zendikar. But he marches on alone, stubborn as the daily dawn.

name: Revelation
text: "Many are in high place, and of renown: but mysteries are revealed unto the meek." —Ecclesiastes 3:19

name: Granite Gargoyle
text: "While most overworlders fortunately don't realize this, Gargoyles can be most delicious, providing you have the appropriate tools to carve them." —The Underworld Cookbook, by Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar

name: Obelisk of Esper
text: It is a monument as austere, unyielding, and inscrutable as Esper itself.

name: Coercive Recruiter
text: "Choose, vampire: our hat on your head, or no hat, no head."

name: Flowstone Giant
text:
When the first of these giants woke from the bedrock, he was still sleepy. He yawned and stretched until his legs grew so thin that they snapped like icicles in the sun.
—Vec lore

name: Felidar Sovereign
text: It surveys the withering landscape, waiting for a victory only it can see.

name: Armadillo Cloak
text: "Don't laugh. It works."

name: Spontaneous Generation
text: Saprolings always thrive on the ruins of others, and Mercadia ruins more than most.

name: Darkblade Agent
text: "I've seen your house, and you've been a lovely, if unwitting, host. But at last it's time for farewells."

name: Drop Tower
text: What goes up might come down.

name: Confiscate
text:
"I don't understand why he works so hard on a device to duplicate a sound so easily made with hand and armpit."
—Barrin, progress report

name: Shard of the Nightbringer
text:
"Aza'gorod, the Nightbringer. The embodiment of death. A killer of stars and of worlds."
—Illuminor Szeras

name: Riddlesmith
text: The Neurok see the artificer as an archaeologist, clearing away falsehoods to see the truth hidden beneath.

name: Graveyard Marshal
text:
"Rise and shine, my dears. We have work to do."
—Isareth the Awakener

name: Soldevi Adnate
text:
"An idiot cannot hear sense, even when a thousand people speak it."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Order of Leitbur
text:
"The powers of the corrupt will fade before the fury of the pure."
—Bethan Leitbur, "The Way"

name: Urza's Tower
text: Urza always put Tocasia's lessons on resource-gathering to effective use.

name: Sustaining Spirit
text:
"Faith is our greatest protector."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Phyrexian Soulgorger
text: The Phyrexian minds that constructed it did not live past its awakening.

name: Into the Night
text:
"When lost souls wander into the woods, the wilds have a way of showing them who they really are."
—Rahilda, Vildin-Pack alpha

name: Jodah, Archmage Eternal
text:
"Chronicles across the ages describe Jodah. They likely refer not to one mage, but to a family or an arcane title."
—Arkol, Argivian scholar

name: Blind Fury
text:
"Tell me . . . have you ever sung the Song of Blood?"
—Purraj of Urborg

name: Aron, Benalia's Ruin
text:
"He may look like my father, but the man I knew and loved is gone."
—Danitha

name: Decorated Griffin
text: The awards and medals of polis-dwellers mean nothing to griffins, but they repay acts of generosity.

name: Mortify
text:
"This sword has many names. You may call it 'Death.'"
—Kaldor Draigo, Supreme Grand Master of the Grey Knights

name: Shakedown Heavy
text: "Look, we both get what we want. I get your Halo. You get to keep your kneecaps."

name: Silklash Spider
text: By the time the spider comes to slurp up its dinner, its victims have been partially dissolved by acidic silk.

name: Intervene
text:
"At first I simply observed. But I found that without investment in others, life serves no purpose."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Implement of Examination
text: A tool to see the unseen.

name: Ironwright's Cleansing
text: "Impurities must be pounded out."

name: Elvish House Party
text: The party was going strong for nearly an hour past midnight—then all of a sudden it just petered out.

name: Knowledge and Power
text:
"Information is a powerful weapon."
—Cymede, queen of Akros

name: Rustmouth Ogre
text: It has an iron stomach. Literally.

name: Essence Flux
text: A spirit is both fettered and free—bound in some ways to its previous existence, yet able to transcend much of the corporeal.

name: Mana Confluence
text:
"Ravnica is not its buildings or markets, or even its guilds. Ravnica is its people. As long as we're here, we can rebuild the rest."
—Teysa Karlov

name: Omen of the Sea
text: "My time will come, when the rising tide will surge above the tallest mountain."

name: Rise from the Grave
text:
"Death is no excuse for disobedience."
—Liliana Vess

name: Manakin
text:
"Each night, the artificer tucked the little doll into a locked drawer. Each morning, she awoke to find it waiting beside her with some new bauble."
—"The Artificer's Apprentice"

name: Fire Ambush
text: "With fire he broke the battle at Bowang . . . . Striking fear deep into Cao Cao's soul, thus Kongming scored a coup at his debut."

name: School of Piranha
text: Some schools aren't worth getting into.

name: Lay of the Land
text: Victory favors neither the righteous nor the wicked. It favors the prepared.

name: Arcane Signet
text: After using the signet to finish the miniaturization spell, the novice wizard realized they'd have big shoes to fill.

name: Hellkite Hatchling
text: A killing machine from birth.

name: Aligned Hedron Network
text: The last hedron slotted into place, locking Ulamog in an infinite loop of binding energy.

name: Airdrop Condor
text: It has two kinds of droppings, neither of which is particularly pleasant.

name: Swords to Plowshares
text: "The arc of my blade has carved a path of light for the peace that will follow."

name: Consign to Dream
text:
"Dreams are fleeting. Reality even more so."
—Oona, queen of the fae

name: Alluring Scent
text: No earthly armor is protection against this sweetness.

name: Ulvenwald Bear
text:
Out chasing bears
—Kessig expression meaning "died in the woods"

name: Teysa Karlov
text: The Orzhov web of power stretches farther than you might think.

name: Sinstriker's Will
text: "Steel rusts. Arrows break. But righteousness is always strong, always sharp."

name: Mountain
text: Rumor holds that powerful artifacts and untold wealth are hidden away in Ramazith's Tower, and today you plan to find out for yourself.

name: Canopy Stalker
text: The forest's cover offers shade, shelter, and an increased risk of sudden death.

name: Null Chamber
text: Discovered by Femeref mages, the Null Chamber is the ultimate testing ground for the uncreative.

name: Claim the Firstborn
text:
"Will! They have a copy of *Tales of the Fae* here! Want me to read you a bedtime story?"
—Rowan Kenrith

name: Armageddon
text:
"'O miserable of happy! Is this the end
Of this new glorious world . . . ?'"
—John Milton, *Paradise Lost*

name: Longhorn Firebeast
text: Its blast can fuse armor to bone, leaving skeletons that glint brightly in the sun.

name: Consecrated Sphinx
text: A curse is just another name for an unwanted blessing.

name: Balduvian Conjurer
text:
"The very lands of Balduvia are alive."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

name: Phyrexian Arena
text: For a bittersweet moment, Jace believed he could still save his love. A moment was all Vraska needed. "For the glory of Phyrexia," she whispered.

name: Geothermal Kami
text: A mysterious kami will sometimes appear to overworked monks and offer them a warm, relaxing bath.

name: Goblin Haberdasher
text: An accessory in every sense of the word.

name: Thousand-Year Elixir
text: Paradoxically, to tilt the massive jug for a sip, you'd need the energy of the giant's tonic.

name: Quicksmith Rebel
text: "Let's add just a bit more stopping power."

name: Curtain of Light
text:
"Paint gold upon the wind, Shape the wind into a shield, And vanish behind the brightness."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Selesnya Evangel
text: "The clamor of the city drowns all voices. But together we can sing a harmony that will resonate from Ravnica's tallest spires to her deepest wells."

name: You Are Already Dead
text: So swift and sharp was his blade that the ogre never even felt the cut.

name: Beetleform Mage
text:
"When the Simic say to take command of your life, we don't mean just your career."
—Vorel of the Hull Clade

name: Grand Arbiter Augustin IV
text: To be Arbiter is to dispense few words and many judgments.

name: Whipflare
text: The slag-workers wasted no time in creating their own flare pulses to cleanse the area of the *incompleat*.

name: Malignus
text: It descended on Estwald like a sudden storm. Moments later, only ashes and agony remained.

name: Raze the Effigy
text: The folk of Kessig build up their courage by burning effigies of the things they fear.

name: Taunting Elf
text: Much to Multani's chagrin, Rofellos gleefully tutored Yavimaya's elves on the rudest and most vulgar words spoken in Llanowar.

name: An Incident Has Occurred
text: "So sorry, but per our waiver, we're not responsible for 'things happening.'"

name: Basilisk Collar
text: During their endless travels, the mages of the Goma Fada caravan have learned ways to harness both life and death.

name: Renegade Firebrand
text: "For freedom! For fame! For fire!"

name: Browse
text:
"Once great literature—now great litter."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Reach of Branches
text: Growth has no limits.

name: Final Death
text: The Underworld erodes memory, identity, and eventually the physical form, leaving only crumbling statues called misera—hollow monuments to mortal futility.

name: Grandmother Sengir
text:
"Rarely have power and madness been so delightfully wed as they have in our dear Grandmother."
—Baron Sengir

name: Sanguine Sipper
text: The midway offers every flavor under the sun, even to guests who need to stay out of it.

name: Pursuit of Flight
text:
"Watch the voltage. We don't need another charred, crashing viashino."
—Bori Andon, Izzet blastseeker

name: See the Truth
text: "What is this that is neither future nor past?"

name: Zodiac Rooster
text: ". . . But the time of Han had run—could he [Kongming] not tell?— / That night his master star fell past the hills. . . ."

name: Knollspine Dragon
text: It woke to find a vast world in need of a master.

name: Cultist of the Absolute
text: You embrace power at any cost, and if it consumes you, so be it.

name: Smitten Swordmaster // Curry Favor
text: "My quest? Why, to marry Ayara. Or die trying."

name: Nature's Blessing
text:
"Be open to the blessings, whatever their form."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Sanctuary Cat
text: Cats prowl the corridors of Avacyn's churches in search of devils or signs of their mischief.

name: Mana Reflection
text: Despite its darkness, Shadowmoor doesn't want for growth. Legions of creeping things thrive in the shade.

name: Foxfire
text:
"Only the foolish fear Foxfire."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Great-Horn Krushok
text: Perfectly suited for life in the Shifting Wastes, the krushok is well protected by its horn, its hide, and its temper.

name: Kiddie Coaster
text:
"The ride is clearly inspired by the Kolaghan clan's reign on Tarkir which makes the use of Ojutai's scale pattern on the seats very disappointing."
—Vorthos, Steward of Myth

name: Viashino Heretic
text: "The past is buried for good reason."

name: Path of Peril
text: To Olivia's guests, a welcome. To everyone else, a warning.

name: Mirran Mettle
text: "Our land will not yield to Phyrexian corruption!"

name: Ephara's Warden
text: "When you threaten the sanctity of the polis, you insult Ephara herself. If she doesn't smite you, I will."

name: Tyrant's Familiar
text: Nothing escapes its gaze—or its breath.

name: Force of Savagery
text:
"Life cannot be created and then abandoned. It must be nurtured and fed so that it may express its ripened might."
—Freyalise

name: Djinn of Infinite Deceits
text: The winds of change have a mind of their own.

name: Chillbringer
text: If you can see your breath, it's too late to run.

name: Hydra Omnivore
text:
"We should learn from the hydra. It never plays favorites; it devours everyone equally."
—Thrass, elder druid

name: Essence Scatter
text:
"I know the nightmares of Indatha seem scary, but when you break them down into their component parts, they're quite beautiful."
—Naireh, Ketria elementalist

name: Mind Rot
text:
"It saddens me to lose a source of inspiration. This one seemed especially promising."
—Ashiok

name: Fallen Angel
text: "Why do you weep for the dead? I rejoice, for they have died for me."

name: Felhide Brawler
text: Burial rites among the Felhide minotaurs involve devouring those who fell in battle, to remove their shame from memory and to fuel the survivors' revenge.

name: Evaporate
text:
"The body is a temple with a foundation of sand."
—Autumn Willow

name: Spireside Infiltrator
text: "The Consulate promised that we would all have access to aether. I'm just keeping them honest."

name: Blasphemous Act
text: In the roiling depths of the Eye of Terror, the bloodthirsty hordes of Chaos Marines plot the downfall of their loyalist brethren.

name: Easy Prey
text: The definition of "bite-sized treat" depends on who you ask.

name: Gitaxian Anatomist
text: An inconsistency in a routine vivisection sparked a revelation about the inner workings of the Orthodoxy's centurions.

name: Toxic Deluge
text:
"It's a difficult task to quarantine a plague that moves with the clouds."
—Esara, healer adept

name: Spiketail Hatchling
text: It dodges waves of water to prepare for waves of magic.

name: Needle Drop
text:
"First it was plovers and mulldrifters. Now it's knitting needles the size of javelins."
—Calydd, kithkin farmer

name: Storm Fleet Swashbuckler
text: "A bolt to the eye, a blade to the neck. That's the way to clear the deck!"

name: Akrasan Squire
text: Bant's armies are primarily composed of members of the Mortar caste, loyal commoners who haven't yet earned a sigil.

name: Greater Werewolf
text:
"The wolf-things are no mere beasts, but the lieutenants of the Baron."
—Taysir

name: Evanescent Intellect
text: The mind is a vessel that may be emptied like any other.

name: Devoted Druid
text: "Mana lurks in all things, even in the depths of one's own heart."

name: Wedding Security
text: In lieu of payment, he was granted permission to devour any unauthorized visitors.

name: Mishra's Self-Replicator
text: It has witnessed history's most significant events, one incarnation after another.

name: Foundation Breaker
text: The castle finally got vengeance for enduring years of royally bad taste.

name: Aquus Steed
text: In water, it's as graceful as a dolphin. On land, it darts and jerks so unpredictably that few can ride it for long.

name: Tormenting Voice
text: "You are undeserving of the afterlife. You will never feel the God-Pharaoh's embrace."

name: Kukemssa Pirates
text:
". . . pirates gambled with a djinn and lost the thing more dear than gold."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Mindculling
text:
"Why infiltrate their strongholds when what we seek resides in such a poorly guarded safe?"
—Malcator, Executor of Synthesis

name: Metamorphose
text: If it's not one thing, it's another.

name: Whirlwind Denial
text: "No, no, and ... no."

name: Press the Advantage
text:
"Show your enemies as much mercy as they would show you."
—Surrak, the Hunt Caller

name: Disciple of Griselbrand
text: The demon Griselbrand dared to stand against Avacyn, earning him the loathing of thousands and the admiration of a few.

name: Gorehorn Minotaurs
text: Some of the eleven minotaur clans of Mirtiin are expert crafters and learned philosophers. Others just like to hit stuff.

name: Dedicated Martyr
text:
"If he's so willing to suffer for his cause, then by all means, let us oblige him."
—Cabal Patriarch

name: Wall of Brambles
text: "What else, when chaos draws all forces inward to shape a single leaf." —Conrad Aiken

name: Grave Pact
text:
"The bonds of loyalty can tie one to the grave."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

name: Penumbra Bobcat
text: This cat has two lives and it's hunting for more.

name: Gorilla Chieftain
text:
"Oh, no—not *you* again?!"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Concussive Bolt
text: Shock one, awe the rest.

name: Staunch Shieldmate
text: "Gilded with gold from a dragon's trove, it is! And etched with the image of the dragon I slew to take it."

name: Beacon of Unrest
text:
"Rise and serve me once more."
—Trazyn the Infinite

name: Invigorating Surge
text: For hydras, most problems can be solved with the addition of a few extra heads.

name: Spiderwig Boggart
text: Auntie Flint was the first to pioneer the spiderwig, a mass of arachnids intended to be worn rather than eaten.

name: Hollow One
text: The embodiment of yearning, forever drifting the deserts to find what had once made it whole.

name: Assault Griffin
text:
"Griffins do not serve. They give freely to those they trust."
—Amira, skycaptain of Thune

name: Ezuri's Predation
text: Those who do not submit will be consumed."

name: Bountiful Harvest
text:
"When we fail to see the beauty in every tree, we are no better than humans."
—Saelia, elvish scout

name: Forest
text: As the sun reaches its zenith on the day of the solstice, a castle shimmers into view on the hilltop, just as the ancient text predicted.

name: Watercourser
text:
"Beware an eddy where there should be none or a stretch that flows too fast or too slow."
—Old Fishbones, Martyne river guide

name: Sivitri Scarzam
text: Even the brave have cause to tremble at the sight of Sivitri Scarzam. Who else has tamed Scarzam's Dragon?

name: Armor of Faith
text:
"Keep your chainmail, warrior. I have my own form of protection."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Jayemdae Tome
text: A true scribe devotes an entire lifetime to the creation of a single volume, a masterpiece as unique as its maker.

name: Glass Asp
text: Its venom induces a fever that causes its victims to relive the attack in recurring, haunting visions.

name: Fetid Heath
text:
"Do not linger in such places, child. There the gwyllions dance. If they find you, you will join in their revels for eternity."
—Talara, elvish safewright

name: Metallic Rebuke
text:
"Too little, too late. The machine is in motion."
—Tezzeret

name: Rishadan Footpad
text: "The best things in life are free. Money, for instance."

name: Axgard Cavalry
text:
Riding the goat
—Dwarven expression meaning
"a foolhardy act of bravery"

name: Beskir Shieldmate
text: "If we fall today, let us fall with honor, defending our realm from the horrors that would defile it. Forward, shieldmates! To Starnheim!"

name: Mother of Runes
text: "My family protects all families."

name: Dive Down
text: "Seeing the river is not the same as seeing the fish."

name: Ossification
text: Only Elesh Norn's most loyal servants are granted the honor of becoming part of her throne.

name: Voltaic Visionary // Volt-Charged Berserker
text: She finally realized that chaos was meant to run rampant, as was she.

name: Treacherous Blessing
text: Phenax is generous with gifts and unforgiving of debts.

name: Slippery Bogle
text: Ogle the bogle, or goggle the boggle? Doesn't matter. You weren't going to catch it anyway.

name: Rolling Earthquake
text: An empire can take centuries to build but mere moments to destroy.

name: Burst of Strength
text:
"Our fight is not about territory or revenge. It is about freedom, plain and simple."
—Ruric Thar, Ghor-Clan chieftain

name: Criminal Past
text: You've never cared much for laws or authority, especially when they get in your way.

name: Stasis Field
text: Old glitches in mage-ring function became critical tools in Vryn's defense.

name: Akki Raider
text: Akki were very territorial, attacking and destroying any settlements that came too close to their mountain homes. The more successful their raids, the bolder they became.

name: Rat Colony
text: No matter how crowded the den, everyone's welcome to squeak in for the festivities.

name: Blaze
text:
"This isn't what I meant by 'facing the heat of battle!'"
—Jefan, Talas ship captain

name: Ulvenwald Oddity // Ulvenwald Behemoth
text:
"We've learned enough! I say we run."
—Alena, Kessig trapper

name: Castle Locthwain
text: Without Locthwain's persistence, the realm would stagnate and die.

name: Kithkin Healer
text: The empathetic nature of the thoughtweft allows kithkin healers to treat the cause of an illness rather than fight its symptoms.

name: Burnout
text:
"GOTCHA!"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Angel of Despair
text:
"I feel in them a sense of duty and commitment, yet I can feel nothing else. It is as if their duty is to an empty void."
—Razia, Boros archangel

name: Song of the Worldsoul
text: "Mat'Selesnya sings out, and life flourishes in answer."

name: Starlight Invoker
text: The Mirari glows in her eyes.

name: Unlikely Aid
text: "I appreciate you not letting me fall to my death in the acid bogs. Now, can you let me down?"

name: Slipstream Eel
text: "It's a fine way to travel, if you don't mind the smell."

name: Skyshroud Elite
text:
"Civilization is a conspiracy to disguise the mutilation of nature."
—Skyshroud elite creed

name: Claustrophobia
text: Six feet of earth muffled his cries.

name: Gainsay
text:
"I'd be happy to stop contradicting you, Urza, just as soon as you start being right."
—Bo Levar, planeswalker

name: Wanderguard Sentry
text: It allows those with dangerous weapons to pass. But not those with dangerous thoughts.

name: Esper Sentinel
text: Action: Using the reference as inspiration, we'd like you to design a soldier who is a similar mix of flesh and etherium (a magical metal found only on Esper).

name: Ancient Crab
text: The banks of the Luxa River attract all manner of predator but only the most resilient of prey.

name: Rug of Smothering
text:
"No, not an accessory to murder—I'm looking for an accessory *for* murder."
—Nadja, Flaming Fist investigator

name: Sanctum Prelate
text: "This area is off-limits to you."

name: Steamflogger Temp
text: When you're dumber than a hammer, every problem looks like one of those things you hit with a hammer.

name: Seething Song
text:
"The purest ore is produced from the hottest furnace, and the brightest thunder-bolt is elicited from the darkest storm."
—Charles Colton

name: Polluted Delta
text: Where dragons once prevailed, their bones now sink.

name: Angelic Chorus
text: The very young and the very old know best the song the angels sing.

name: Mascot Exhibition
text:
"Don't just win the game. Win the crowd."
—Moriana, Mage Tower coach

name: Rubblebelt Raiders
text:
"This city will perish, and the Gruul will cheer as the boar-god crushes the last bricks into dust."
—Nikya of the Old Ways

name: Merrow Reejerey
text: Steady and silent as the deep current, the reejerey guides the course of the school.

name: Storm's Wrath
text: Distant thunder rumbled, a dread forewarning of Keranos's displeasure.

name: Acolyte of Affliction
text: The best healers are intimately familiar with death.

name: Swiftfoot Boots
text:
"Test 12: Boots now protect wearer from all hazards except blisters. Need to source better insoles."
—Development log of Willa, Yotian artificer

name: Endangered Armodon
text: These are its last days. Its doom to be remembered only until the hunters hunger again.

name: Kolaghan Skirmisher
text: Kolaghan's army rushes from kill to kill, desperate to avoid the dragon's wrath.

name: Fungal Plots
text: Thallids nurture saprolings, entertain them, and eat them.

name: Placid Rottentail
text: It had always loved munching on daisies and crystalweed, but lately its favorite snacks were the strange, round roots popping up everywhere.

name: Garna, Bloodfist of Keld
text: "Let's see who gets more kills, Radha."

name: Raging Redcap
text: Many tales of redcap terror begin with two simple things: bloodlust and stolen steel.

name: Sun-Blessed Mount
text: When Huatli chooses a mount, its eyes glow with the flames of the sun.

name: Deprive
text:
"That would have brought shame to you as a mage. Tell you what—I'll keep your secret."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

name: Revenant
text: It eats death and drinks pain.

name: Dark Maze
text:
"The path of faith is fortunately fraught with failure."
—Irini Sengir

name: Sen Triplets
text: They are the masters of your mind.

name: Gleeful Demolition
text: Urabrask encourages creativity in all its forms, even the destructive ones. Especially the destructive ones.

name: Implement of Improvement
text: A mystery in metal.

name: Symbiotic Beast
text:
I'll take the patrol through the hunting grounds. You take the caves. Give me an angry apex predator over those little creepy-crawlies any day."
—Oranes, Yavimaya hunter

name: Underworld Dreams
text: Dreams are just one more form of torment.

name: Sepulcher Ghoul
text: Ghouls devour the dead and any living creatures unwary enough to fall into their grasp.

name: Impervious Greatwurm
text: The ultimate answer to intrigue and subtlety.

name: Biolume Egg // Biolume Serpent
text: ...knowing their hatchlings are more fearsome than anything else that might come along.

name: Torens, Fist of the Angels
text: He seems absolutely imperturbable. I can fancy what a wonderful power he must have over his patients.

name: Ana Disciple
text: "The blessings of Gaea alone are no longer enough."

name: Eater of the Dead
text: Even the putrid muscles of the dead can provide strength to those loathsome enough to consume them.

name: Adamant Will
text: The shield took a year to craft, a month to enchant, and a decade to master—all for one glorious moment.

name: Ceaseless Searblades
text: Flamekins' fires burn cool until they decide otherwise.

name: Widespread Panic
text:
"How thin is the veneer of civilization! A modest measure of panic will wash it off completely."
—Guard Erdrud of An Karras

name: Underdark Basilisk
text:
"See how the statues all have chunks bitten out of them? We're dealing with a basilisk, or I'm a froghemoth."
—Larissa Kyriln, learned warlock

name: Drake Hatchling
text: There is beauty in the space between learning to fly and taking it for granted.

name: Amugaba
text: The aven claim it feeds on thunder and rainbows.

name: Petra Sphinx
text: What walks on four legs in the morning, two legs in the afternoon, and three legs in the evening?

name: Rimewind Cryomancer
text: "The Thaw brings flooding, disease, and death. We will do all in our power to bring frigid peace back to the world."

name: Thelonite Druid
text:
"The magic at the heart of all living things can bear awe-inspiring fruit."
—Kolevi of Havenwood, Elder Druid

name: Elspeth's Smite
text: Elesh Norn screamed as the light pierced her. Her nightmare had become flesh.

name: Sidar Kondo
text: Kondo served as guardian to the infant Gerrard and raised him alongside his own son, Vuel. He taught both boys to be strong and to lead, but whereas Gerrard became a champion of honor, Vuel's bitterness led him to become an equally devastating force of malice.

name: Sceptre of Eternal Glory
text: It burns with the very fire that doomed Szarekh's species, and channels it to devastate his foes.

name: Merfolk Pupil
text: Maintaining a personal bubble is even more important when you have gills.

name: Warrior Angel
text: She represents not hope, but hope's desperate fury.

name: Darkthicket Wolf
text: Werewolf slayers don't know for certain how werewolves are created. So they kill all the wolves, just to be safe.

name: Toxic Scorpion
text:
"You want that venom? Collect it yourself! I'm not losing another pair of dragonhide gloves."
—Old Rutstein

name: Reward the Faithful
text: "When you have drunk your fill, pass the cup to others who thirst."

name: Raiding Nightstalker
text:
"Our steeds need food, water, stabling. Theirs just need prey."
—Restela, Alaborn marshal

name: Wave of Reckoning
text: We shall suffer turmoil equal to that which we have wrought, whether in this life or the next.

name: Pistus Strike
text:
"Even a nuisance such as the pistus fly has a purpose in our new world."
—Glissa

name: Rottenheart Ghoul
text:
"To die failing to save a loved one is just so sad—or, more to the point, pathetic."
—Liliana Vess

name: Healing Grace
text:
"Whatever faith you have in Serra, she has more in you."
—Lyra Dawnbringer

name: Lay Claim
text: Initiates need worry only about the trials. Everything else is in the hands of the gods.

name: Bladed Pinions
text: Lacking trained pterons, the Auriok had to rely on other measures to gain the upper hand in the skies.

name: Wicked Reward
text:
"The blood on my hands is merely proof of my ambition."
—Kaervek

name: Witch-Maw Nephilim
text: When it awoke, it shattered the hillsides to make way for its passage.

name: Painsmith
text: The Moriok see the artificer as a taskmaster, forcing lazy metal into more potent shapes.

name: Ironclad Krovod
text:
"We need to block the exits from the plaza! What's big, heavy, and available?"
—Gideon Jura

name: Boros Guildgate
text: It promises protection to those in need and proclaims a warning to any who would threaten Ravnican law.

name: Loafing Giant
text: "Forget it. I'm not getting up today."

name: Kalastria Nightwatch
text:
"Kalitas may have returned to mindless servitude beneath the Eldrazi, but we say never again."
—Drana, Kalastria bloodchief

name: Execute
text:
"Any fool who would die for honor is better off dead."
—Cabal Patriarch

name: Hymn of Rebirth
text:
"There will come soft rains, and spring shall be amongst us, a welcome friend."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Parasitic Grasp
text: Some wicked souls linger only to consume the warmth of life.

name: Teferi's Moat
text:
"Isolation is not the answer."
—Urza, to Teferi

name: Daxos's Torment
text: The terrors of the Underworld travel alongside those who return to the mortal realm.

name: Warren Pilferers
text: "What do they need all this stuff for? They're dead. We're alive. Simple enough."

name: Lucent Liminid
text: It is a herald of the sun goddess, projected from the hallowed glass whenever her light passes through.

name: Setessan Champion
text: "A blessing is not a gift. It is a duty."

name: Drop Tower
text: Sixty stories above the Astrotorium, attendees often wonder if they've made a mistake. They have another two hundred stories to decide.

name: Mythic Proportions
text: The blood of Krosa turns rational beings into primal forces.

name: Mindcrank
text:
"Let go of your memories and be reborn."
—Argent Etchings, plate 106, passage 27

name: Curtains' Call
text:
"We give the audience what they want."
—Juri, proprietor of the Juri Revue

name: Martyr of Bones
text: Puppeteered by Heidar's icy hand, they were sacrificed to the Frost Marsh to raise Haakon's army.

name: Bane's Contingency
text: "My whims dictate the fate of nations. Your pitiful mortal magic is no more significant than a gnat buzzing in my ear."

name: Vile Deacon
text: "The Cabal and the Order really aren't that different. After all, we are both empowered by faith."

name: Stitcher's Apprentice
text: "Oglor create life, Oglor take it away. Oglor god! . . . until Master return."

name: Dalakos, Crafter of Wonders
text: His imagination soars from the depths of the sea to the heights of the heavens.

name: Fiery Finish
text: Negotiations reached an abrupt conclusion.

name: Initiates of the Ebon Hand
text: Ebon leaders soon realized that non-human races often had special talents that could be exploited.

name: Insurrection
text:
"Maybe they wanted to be on the winning side for once."
—Matoc, lavamancer

name: Combat Medic
text:
"We'd no sooner knock 'em back on their heels than that accursed sawbones would show up and patch 'em back together again."
—Ivra Jursdotter

name: Reconstructed Thopter
text: From above, the brothers noticed strange glyphs etched into the desert sand.

name: Takara
text: Takara banishes the shadow of her father's ignoble reputation through the dedication, plain speaking, and swift action of a warrior. By refusing Starke's path of self-interest and opportunism, she has learned what he never will know: the value of sacrifice for a worthy cause.

name: Zar Ojanen, Scion of Efrava
text: "I carry my home in my heart."

name: Dregs of Sorrow
text: Crovax gazed upon the dead, and for one dark moment he saw a banquet.

name: Vine Snare
text: Nissa found that the vines of the marsh could ensnare just as well as forest vines could—maybe even better.

name: Skyclaw Thrash
text: Their newfound wings shined elegantly and functioned partially.

name: Reflector Mage
text: Dressed to suppress.

name: Kagemaro's Clutch
text: The mist was thick, cloying, and constricting. Shiro fought his way to fresh air only to look back and see his comrades fallen on the battlefield behind him.

name: Nekrataal
text:
"I have seen the horrors Kaervek has freed. My Betrayal is certain—but of Kaervek or of Jamuraa, I cannot say."
—Jolrael

name: Haunter of Nightveil
text: The Dimir employ the spirits of Ravnica's ancient, nameless dead, guiding their malevolence toward selected victims.

name: Goblin Boom Keg
text: Dragonfire spawned many imitations. Some were more dramatic than others.

name: Wild Ceratok
text: Once part of a wealthy merchant's private zoo, the herd roams feral throughout the Tenth, where it will remain until the guilds can agree to relocate, cull, or befriend it.

name: Wake Thrasher
text: Anyone who thinks merrows have more brains than brawn has never been run over by one.

name: Emblem of the Warmind
text:
"It takes but one spark to ignite a parched forest. Our hearts, I fear, are too dry for this new visitor."
—Elek Longbeard

name: Wary Okapi
text:
"Be like the grazers of the Saruli. Keep your herd close, and stay alert for encroaching danger."
—Lalia, Selesnya dryad

name: Casting of Bones
text:
"Whether whole or not, still we serve Lim-Dûl's wishes."
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn

name: Goblin Medics
text:
"First, do some harm."
—Oath of Goblins

name: Shimmering Efreet
text:
Life or death: which is the illusion?"
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

name: Howl from Beyond
text:
"From the mouths of my servants, my voice shall emerge to shake the souls of my foes."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Goblin Picker
text: Countless generations of Shivan goblins have worked on the Mana Rig, giving them an unparalleled eye for useful relics.

name: Justiciar's Portal
text: With the new guildmaster's innovations, arresters can arrive on the scene moments before a crime is committed.

name: Viashino Slasher
text: Citizens of Ravnica stick to the main streets. Shortcuts may look tempting, but down each alley, dozens of hungry hands await, and screams do not carry into the busy market throng.

name: Horrifying Revelation
text:
"Ours is a glorious transmission! Behold a future where all bow to the Father of Machines."
—Isila, Priest of Sheoldred

name: Might of Murasa
text: The continent of Murasa is defined by irrepressible growth, both natural and otherwise.

name: Royal Trooper
text:
"Fortune does not side with the faint-hearted."
—Sophocles, *Phaedra*

name: Knight Watch
text:
"We lost respect after the battle for Barbu Rooftop. Send the troops to mingle respectfully with the citizens."
—Commander Yaszen of Boros

name: Infernal Darkness
text:
"I thought the day had brought enough horrors for our ragged band, but the night was far worse."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Vanquish the Horde
text: Odric took no joy in violence but neither did he mourn for the twisted things he dispatched. All that mattered were the lives he had saved.

name: Martyr of Frost
text:
"Do not call the Balduvians barbaric. Their magic is as potent as it is primal."
—Zur the Enchanter

name: Magus of the Coffers
text: All that remains of the Cabal are the echoes in its deepest vault. Yet those who hear the echoes feel a power undiminished by the dust of ages.

name: Nurgle's Rot
text: Each plaguebearer is formed from the blighted soul of a mortal slain by Nurgle's Rot.

name: Territorial Boar
text:
"The presence of the strong will make you stronger."
—Yeva, Nature's Herald

name: Memory Lapse
text:
"Um . . . oh . . . what was I saying?"
—Reveka, wizard savant

name: Tel-Jilad Defiance
text: The Viridian elves had purged their culture of the trolls' traitorous influence. In times of strife, however, the ancestral memories returned.

name: Nightsnare
text: Ravnica would be safer if mere coin was all the Dimir could steal.

name: Inhumaniac
text: For the mind-minded mastermind.

name: Marker Beetles
text: In case of emergency, crush bug.

name: Sages of the Anima
text: Godtrackers found new pantheons of beast-gods beyond Naya's borders.

name: Votary of the Conclave
text: An ageless order, the votaries receive the gift of rejuvenation from the temple gardens they guard.

name: Kor Sanctifiers
text: "Why keep such trinkets? They only add weight to your travels."

name: Crimson Mage
text:
"We wield the fires of rage. War is our blood and destruction our birthright."
—Crimson creed

name: Stalker Hag
text: Her hunt is silent until a bone snaps or flesh tears. Her victims never know to scream.

name: Dawntreader Elk
text: Silent as winter snow, it seeks wild places unspoiled by the walking dead.

name: Contract Killing
text: For a price, the floating city of High and Dry offers all the amenities a pirate could want: rest, recreation, and revenge.

name: Face to Face
text: Befuddled by this new game, Argg longed for the days of Rock, Rock, Rock.

name: Brushstrider
text: Magistrate Ludy agreed to designate land for the brushstriders only after several broken windows and dozens of missing blini-cakes.

name: Illusory Wrappings
text:
"No amount of strength can help you overcome my trial. You must be ready to forgo your body and favor your mind."
—Kefnet, god of knowledge

name: Nantuko Husk
text:
The soul sheds light, and death is its shadow. When the light dims, life and death embrace.
—Nantuko teaching

name: Stoic Builder
text: Some have returned to Hollowhenge, the ruins of Avabruck, to restore the lost capital of Kessig.

name: Fervor
text:
"If your blood doesn't run hot, I will make it run in the sands!"
—Maraxus of Keld

name: Russet Wolves
text:
"The wolves of our valley are bred to detest the scent of ghouls. For centuries they have kept our estates clear of such carrion."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Steel Wall
text:
"We sculpt the land into what we need—homes, armament, fortresses of war. Our strength comes not only from knowing, but from commanding the terrain."
—Raksha Golden Cub, leonin kha

name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
text: "The enemy is getting too close! Quick! Inflate the toad!"

name: Magus of the Bridge
text: "The dead know their place."

name: Grave Bramble
text: Nature abhors a zombie.

name: Quasiduplicate
text: "My greatest creation—me!"

name: Alexi's Cloak
text:
"Doesn't look like much, does it?"
—Alexi, zephyr mage

name: Drifter il-Dal
text: They study the deeds of their traitorous ancestors, hoping the stories may reveal a way back to the physical world.

name: Rock Badger
text:
"As it charged our keep, I mistook it for a bear. After it tore through our ramparts and half the guard, I wished it had been a bear after all."
—Ballista guard

name: Trespasser il-Vec
text: At the epicenter of the Rathi overlay, the City of Traitors did not align with Dominaria. Many of its inhabitants were caught between the two worlds.

name: Howlpack Resurgence
text: The renewed howling of werewolves announced the end of the Cursemute—and the beginning of Avacyn's madness.

name: Thirsting Shade
text:
"Your life is a blinding light, your breath a gale, your pulse a deafening drum. Be still. Be still."
—Dahlya Trul, "Irbitov Lament"

name: Shineshadow Snarl
text: A flickering beacon of righteous corruption.

name: Vampiric Tutor
text:
"I write upon clean white parchment with a sharp quill and the blood of my students, divining their secrets."
—Shauku, Endbringer

name: Rakdos, the Showstopper
text: "Entertain me."

name: Rosheen Meanderer
text: Night after night, Rosheen babbled about a bygone sunlit world, her every word dismissed as a madwoman's ravings.

name: Tasseled Dromedary
text: There is no dress code for the Inventors' Fair, but you'll be hard-pressed to find anyone or anything not done up in their finest.

name: A-Hobbling Zombie
text:
"I see someone tried to stop you, my pet. How delightful."
—Ghoulcaller Gisa

name: Snow Day
text:
"Advanced Elemental Manifestations is canceled until all students have thawed."
—Prismari dormitory notice

name: Lay Down Arms
text: She'll swing a blade all her life, but never again for war.

name: Soul's Fire
text: An avatar he sculpts of anger and flame.

name: Forgotten Ancient
text: Its blood is life. Its body is growth.

name: Rustvale Bridge
text: The path to strength is forged in stability.

name: Non-Human Cannonball
text: Designed for maximum impact, comedic and otherwise.

name: Manta Riders
text:
"Water is firmament to the finned."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Hedron Archive
text:
"You've begun to understand the hedrons' true purpose," said Ugin. "The Eldrazi can be imprisoned."
"And how did that work out last time?" asked Jace.

name: Filth
text:
"As the portal closed, Filth oozed through. The stench of evil followed it in."
—*Scroll of Beginnings*

name: Boreal Elemental
text: Winter's breath given form.

name: Boros Elite
text:
"First, you must fight among the rank and file. It is there I will discern your skills as a leader."
—Aurelia, to Gideon Jura

name: Stifle
text:
"If I wanted your opinion, I'd have told you what it was."
—Pemmin, Riptide survivor

name: Agent of Horizons
text: The light in the woods just before dawn reveals a glimmering network of branches, roots, and spiderwebs. The acolytes of Kruphix walk this lattice unseen.

name: Forced March
text: The Caterans call it a screening process. The dead are in no condition to argue.

name: Deathless Behemoth
text:
"Over and over it rose. Over and over we fell."
—Ganda, Goma Fada deserter

name: Steel Golem
text:
"Once you create perfection, what else is there to make?"
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

name: Skull Rend
text:
"We could never accept anyone with a face that pretty or a mind that sane."
—Nyoser, Gore-House ringleader

name: Kor Chant
text: Sacred rites repurposed to fight an ancient threat.

name: Choking Miasma
text: The Phyrexians were as surprised as anyone to discover they still needed to breathe.

name: Unmoored Ego
text: A well-chosen word can restore a mind or snap its tethers.

name: Skycat Sovereign
text: The bounty on its head is as old as Skysail, but no one has ever tried to collect.

name: Sojourner's Companion
text: Before Phyrexia's corruption, many of Mirrodin's creatures were more curious than cruel.

name: Troll Ascetic
text: It's no coincidence that the oldest trolls are also the angriest.

name: Festerhide Boar
text:
"Bury your dead deep. The boars are hungriest while the corpse is still warm."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald

name: Unified Strike
text: The tall, reedy grass of the Daru Plains rustles loudly in the winds, a perfect cover for any ambush.

name: Auriok Edgewright
text: Auriok soldiers craft their own weapons, forging a connection to the steel with each blow of the hammer.

name: Spirit Away
text: The fear of slipping from the geist's tenuous grip overwhelmed Tolo's joy at his first flight.

name: Slum Reaper
text: The outskirts of Golgari territory are guarded by more than just walls.

name: Quagmire Druid
text: As the druids had devoted their lives to preserving Dominaria, so did they devote their deaths.

name: Word of Seizing
text: "Obey!"

name: Rescue Retriever
text: It brings the two things weary soldiers need most: medicine and morale.

name: Kitchen Finks
text: Accept one favor from an ouphe, and you're doomed to accept another.

name: Giant Opportunity
text: They look tasty, but best to plant them.

name: Spikeshot Goblin
text:
"Proximity discouraged. Do not approach."
—Vulshok field guide

name: Sacred Nectar
text:
"Over the silver mountains, Where spring the nectar fountains, There will I kiss The bowl of bliss; And drink my everlasting fill. . . ."
—Sir Walter Raleigh, "The Pilgrimage"

name: Back to Nature
text: There will always be those who presume to improve nature, or dare to befoul it. And nature will always have a response.

name: Celestial Flare
text:
"You were defeated the moment you declared your aggression."
—Gideon Jura

name: Double Negative
text: They feared each other for their differences but were absolutely terrified at their similarities.

name: Lampad of Death's Vigil
text:
"Grief-struck, she weeps for each mortal's final death."
—Psemilla, Meletian poet

name: Dowsing Shaman
text: He combs the streets looking for the lost light, the discarded enigmas of the city.

name: Storrev, Devkarin Lich
text: In times of war, only death flourishes.

name: Copperline Gorge
text: Where fire meets ferocity, a greater evolution begins.

name: Sphere of Safety
text: The Rakdos believe that all are eager to join their revels, even when told otherwise.

name: Synchronized Strike
text: Khenra are almost always born as twins. Their instinctual connection lends itself well to their preferred fighting style.

name: Keep Safe
text: "Coppercoats think they understand duty and loyalty, but they can't begin to fathom the depths of my bond."

name: Chronatog
text: For the chronatog, there is no meal like the present.

name: Faithless Salvaging
text: Mood: A bit regretful but still looking for loot.

name: Every Last Vestige Shall Rot
text: "May bloodberries grow from your remains."

name: Polyraptor
text: An innumerable pack is concealed in a single reflection.

name: Talon Sliver
text: "Keep them at sword's length!" Gerrard's order fell flat as each sliver's talon suddenly grew longer. "Hold on—break out the polearms!"

name: Earthbrawn
text: Gremil finally felt in touch with nature—and felt a need to share the experience with others.

name: Biomantic Mastery
text:
"Look beyond, to the vascular awareness that all life is a map to greater knowledge."
—Momir Vig, *Biomancy*, vol. I

name: Young Wei Recruits
text:
"To send the common people to war untrained is to throw them away."
—Confucius, *The Analects* (trans. Lau)

name: Glistening Dawn
text: Unleashed on new worlds, the Phyrexians were driven by a simple imperative: spread and conquer.

name: Grizzled Outcasts // Krallenhorde Wantons
text: Seen as unsavory, the hunters were never allowed in town—until one night they vanished.

name: Contortionist Troupe
text: "Welcome to the greatest show in Kessig!"

name: Tyvar's Stand
text: "When they write songs about this battle, I will make sure your name is forgotten, devil."

name: Devil's Play
text: A devil's hands are never idle.

name: Morinfen
text:
"I looked into its eyes, and its soul was so empty I saw no reflection, no light there."
—Crovax

name: Snake Basket
text:
"Uh, does anyone have a flute?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

name: Knight of Glory
text: "I will uphold the law, and no manner of foe will stop me."

name: Pennon Blade
text: Draped with the pennon of a fallen outpost, the sword came to symbolize the peoples of Zendikar becoming one.

name: Scavenger Folk
text: "One piece? Now there's a hundred!"

name: Merfolk Falconer
text: "For generations, we have bred and trained falcons for expeditions into Emeria. Now more sky ruins open themselves to those with the means to reach the heights!"

name: Exhaustion
text: Starving and worn, Cao Cao escaped from the battle of Red Cliffs with only 27 of his original 800,000 men.

name: Guardian Gladewalker
text: The raiders' only warning was a whisper floating through the mist: "Trespassers."

name: Archetype of Finality
text: She sees mortals not as they wish to be, but as what they will become.

name: Manor Gargoyle
text: Nothing could break it but the fall.

name: Shifting Wall
text:
"You'd almost think Volrath doesn't want me here."
—Gerrard

name: Dwell on the Past
text:
None can find what hasn't been lost.
—Nantuko teaching

name: Lathliss, Dragon Queen
text: If you saw her, you'd go "AAAHHHH!"

name: Icatian Scout
text:
"Because the Orc hordes attacked along the entire border, Scouts were essential to Icatia's defense."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI*

name: Striped Riverwinder
text: The denizens of the Luxa River woke angry on the currents of blood.

name: Ruthless Predation
text: In the Hunter Maze, today's apex predator is tomorrow's prey.

name: Second Guess
text:
"I see where you're going with that. I don't like it."
—Dierk, geistmage

name: Venser, Shaper Savant
text: His marvels of artifice pale in comparison to the developing machinery of his mind.

name: Macabre Waltz
text: Liliana is never one to follow someone else's lead.

name: Plaguecrafter
text: "Looks like I need a new test subject. Any volunteers?"

name: Pitiless Pontiff
text: "Pay in gold. Pay in blood. Pay with the servitude of your spirit kin. But pay you must."

name: Mesa Pegasus
text: Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the mesa pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a mesa pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.

name: Exuberant Firestoker
text: The artistry of Etlan's firedancers is more spectacular when behemoths join in.

name: Caterwauling Boggart
text:
"As far as I can tell, that frog dangling from the stick serves absolutely no purpose whatsoever."
—Gaddock Teeg

name: Carnelian Orb of Dragonkind
text: The essence of red dragon burns within, always ready to rise with wrath.

name: Volunteer Militia
text: After making the Peach Garden Oath, the three brothers raised an army of 500 youths to fight the Yellow Scarves rebellion.

name: Abaddon the Despoiler
text: Under his rule, there is but one creed: Chaos shall reign.

name: Omen of the Hunt
text: "My time will come, when no road will divide the endless verdure of the trees."

name: Axegrinder Giant
text: Los gigantes más iracundos son normalmente los armeros más diestros. Sus agravios avivan interminables sesiones en la fragua, mientras se gruñen ferozmente a sí mismos.

name: Firmament Sage
text: The cause remained unclear, but the fact was undeniable: nights were lengthening faster than in any autumn past.

name: Worldfire
text: Even the smallest spark may set a world ablaze.

name: Cleaving Reaper
text: "I won't pollute my blade with your blood, demon. You'll die by your own axe!"

name: Condemn
text:
"No doubt the arbiters would put you away, after all the documents are signed. But I will have justice now."
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage

name: Annoyed Altisaur
text: It pairs a long neck with a short temper.

name: Predator Dragon
text: Dragons make for spiteful gods.

name: Colossal Dreadmaw
text: If you feel the ground quake, run. If you hear its bellow, flee. If you see its teeth, it's too late.

name: No Escape
text: Jace surmised that they were walking into Bolas's trap. He felt no joy in being right.

name: Hammerheim
text: "'Tis distance lends enchantment to the view,/ And robes the mountain in its azure hue." —Thomas Campbell, "Pleasures of Hope"

name: Hour of Promise
text: With the Hekma breached and its protection removed, the deserts swept in.

name: Meddling Mage
text: Meddling mages chant so loudly that no one can get a spell in edgewise.

name: Structural Collapse
text: The Gruul holiday of Rauck-Chauv always ends the same way.

name: Bog-Strider Ash
text: "If you want to test wisdom, offer it to fools and watch how they tear it up."

name: Molten Vortex
text: If you can't take the heat . . . well, that's going to be a problem.

name: Giant Mantis
text:
"I always thought the great insects of Tazeem were frightening until I saw the Eldrazi. Now I welcome the sight of mantises perched in the treetops."
—Ryza, Oran-Rief scout

name: Opportunity
text:
Little things like morals shouldn't hinder one's ambition.
—Pirate creed

name: Arena Trickster
text: "It's not enough to surprise your opponent. You have to delight the crowd as well."

name: Wrack with Madness
text: The skathul, spirits consumed by revenge, fester and seethe while looking for weak minds to assault.

name: Lady Zhurong, Warrior Queen
text:
"A man, and such a fool! I, a woman, will fight them for you."
—Lady Zhurong to her husband Meng Huo, before leading an army against the Shu

name: Tangle Hulk
text:
"A true Phyrexian predator. It will never know death, just as nature intended."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Overrule
text: With one commanding word, the spell was put down and a fine collected for its casting.

name: Izzet Signet
text: The Izzet signet is redesigned often, each time becoming closer to a vanity portrait of Niv-Mizzet.

name: City of Traitors
text:
"While we fought, the *il* surrendered."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Zodiac Goat
text: ". . . Near death in Baidi, having reigned three years, / Bei sadly placed his son in Kongming's care. . . ."

name: Gift of Fangs
text:
"You are one of the few to whom we offer our blessing. What fool would reject immortality?"
—Runo Stromkirk

name: Ornamental Courage
text: Inspired by the thorns and brambles of the untamed wilds, elvish armor is both beautiful and formidable.

name: Halo Hopper
text: Folded by an imaginative child, animated by a mischievous kami, and blessed by an otherworldly angel.

name: Keeper of Fables
text:
"Only the lion knows more stories than I do."
—Chulane, Teller of Tales

name: Venerable Monk
text: Age wears the flesh but galvanizes the soul.

name: Kira, Great Glass-Spinner
text: Each spell is an intricate tapestry, and Kira is the great unraveler.

name: The Shire
text:
"You must start somewhere and have some roots, and the soil of the Shire is deep."
—Merry

name: Inquisition of Kozilek
text: You will scream out your innermost secrets just to make it stop.

name: Animal Boneyard
text:
"The animal spirits are the Ancestor's grandchildren. Remember them."
—Mystic elder

name: Treeshaker Chimera
text: The wisdom of the past is written on the bones of ancients.

name: Double Header
text: Players that don't read flavor text aren't too bright, sorta smell, and dress funny. But let's just keep this between us, okay? They can get kind of violent.

name: Haazda Shield Mate
text: The Haazda shield is broad, protecting both the free and the guilded.

name: Silverquill Pledgemage
text: "I avoid violence. It is the last resort of the witless. But if you insist, I'll make an exception for you."

name: Fountain of Youth
text: Some say the fountain's waters are the first rains that fell over Dominaria.

name: Punish Ignorance
text:
"Amateurish. Nearsighted. A waste of my time and everyone else's."
—Indra, nullmage of Vectis

name: Eater of Hope
text: Gods can be appeased. Demons, however . . .

name: Spire Golem
text: The longer it soars above the shimmering swirls of the Quicksilver Sea, the more it adopts their unpredictability.

name: Woodland Druid
text: What is a tree? Slow hard thought. What is a flower? Swift soft flesh. What is a druid? Both.

name: Goblin Spelunkers
text: Chimney sweeps, explorers of abandoned buildings, spire climbers . . . goblin spelunkers have found countless niches within Ravnica's metropolis.

name: Titanic Growth
text: The massive dominate through might. The tiny survive with guile. Beware the tiny who become massive.

name: Viashino Fangtail
text:
"When the bony terminus gets too large, it's shed from the tail in coinciding periods of heightened aggression and hunger."
—Simic research notes

name: Pack Hunt
text: The one you see is just a diversion.

name: Test of Endurance
text: Most wars are won not by those with the best tactics or truest cause but simply by the ones left standing.

name: Fleeting Image
text:
"Beware lest you lose the substance by grasping at the shadow."
—Aesop, *Fables*, trans. Jacobs

name: To the Slaughter
text:
"Where has little Gossamer gone?"
—Thaniel, Gatstaf shepherd

name: Rod of Ruin
text: The rod is a relic from ancient times . . . cruel, vicious, mean-spirited times.

name: Renari, Merchant of Marvels
text: "Sure, you can get one elsewhere . . . if you want a knockoff that'll break the first time you use it."

name: Mystic Genesis
text:
"The Simic can grow anything out of a puddle of sludge. I just hope they never join forces with the Golgari."
—Teysa Karlov, Grand Envoy of Orzhov

name: Night Soil
text:
"There were often more Thallids after a battle than before."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*

name: Moonlight Bargain
text: At every fifth full moon, the Moon Market convenes to peddle Ravnica's most forbidden wares.

name: Swab Goblin
text: Though small, goblins can hold their own in a fight. Foolhardy confidence goes a long way.

name: Kami of Industry
text: It takes many arms to arm an army.

name: Invasion of Kaldheim // Pyre of the World Tree
text: The warriors of Kaldheim burned the soul of their world to keep it out of Phyrexia's hands.

name: Cabal Initiate
text: "Hear our prayers, oh Shadowed One, and bless us in bloody agony."

name: Timid Drake
text:
"I sneezed, and it bolted."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Arbiter of Knollridge
text: Though giants are mortal, they live so long and on such a grand scale that many small folk don't believe they ever truly die.

name: Turf Wound
text:
"I can't imagine how anyone lives in Shiv, let alone why they choose to stay."
—Sisay

name: Squall
text:
"To-night the winds begin to rise . . . The rooks are blown about the skies . . . ."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, In Memoriam

name: Drudge Skeletons
text: Bones scattered around us joined to form misshapen bodies. We struck at them repeatedly—they fell, but soon formed again, with the same mocking look on their faceless skulls.

name: Give No Ground
text: "Get behind me!"

name: Skyhunter Skirmisher
text:
"Like dawn's first light, blind the unprepared and banish the shadows."
—Skyhunter creed

name: Scroll Thief
text: Kapsho merfolk have infiltrated fortresses as remote as the desert citadel in Sunari in their relentless quest for arcane knowledge.

name: Mogg Sentry
text:
"Nobody stands in one place better than a mogg."
—Tahngarth

name: Drag to the Underworld
text: The more you struggle against death, the tighter its grip becomes.

name: Plummet
text:
"A creature of stone was never meant to fly. And I see the Ulvenwald agrees with me."
—Halana, Kessig ranger

name: Haunting Misery
text:
"I am condemned without end."
—Crovax

name: Ghostly Changeling
text: In desolate places, changelings may take the shape of fancies, or memories, or fears.

name: Cruel Witness
text:
"I escaped, so why do I still feel like I'm being watched?"
—Gregel, militia leader

name: Bag of Holding
text: Leave no treasure behind.

name: Stern Dismissal
text: Cities offer tribute to Ephara and carve her image into their walls, imploring her to protect them from the dangers of the wild.

name: Phantasmal Dreadmaw
text:
"That was perhaps the most terrifying thing I thought I almost saw."
—Captain Lannery Storm

name: Spiritualize
text:
"There is purity in all things. Even hatred."
—Lieutenant Kirtar

name: Thelon of Havenwood
text: "The sight of my thallids still thriving is a bittersweet welcome to this cold waste."

name: Tangle
text: Gaea battles rampant death with abundant life.

name: Multani's Presence
text: When a tree falls in the forest, Multani hears it.

name: Retaliation
text: A foul, metallic stench clogged Urza's senses. It was then he knew his brother was no more.

name: Anaba Bodyguard
text:
"Not all minotaurs are tribal. Some are freelance."
—Eron the Relentless

name: Broken Wings
text: New Capenna's demonic masters are quick to extinguish any hint of the angels' power reawakening.

name: Sigil of Valor
text:
"This war will be over quickly, so we can afford to make the medals out of gold."
—Dispatch from the Merchant Council of Korlis

name: Night's Whisper
text:
"I have seen things that would reduce a weaker person to blubbering and raving. Want to hear about them?"
—Vraska

name: Brainwash
text: "They're not your friends; they despise you. I'm the only one you can count on. Trust me."

name: Aquamoeba
text: Some tides need no moon.

name: Galedrifter // Waildrifter
text:
"Wait! That's no gryff—at least not anymore."
—Geor, Havengul fisher

name: Roller Coaster
text: Every rider leaves The Fluctuator happy—most because they're thrilled to still be alive.

name: Danitha Capashen, Paragon
text: Neave Blacktalon is a single-minded hunter and slayer of the enemy's most powerful lords.

name: Shambling Strider
text: Freyalise forbid that any stranger should wander into the Striders' territory.

name: See Beyond
text: Ancient lore locked in a mind driven mad is just as safe as when it was locked deep underground.

name: Lightning Strike
text: Danitha watched in shock as electricity lanced from Jaya's fingertips, obliterating the charging Phyrexians. "What?" said the pyromancer serenely. "I told you I'd learned some new tricks."

name: Show of Valor
text:
"Duty, honor, and valor are either in your heart or they are not. You will never know for certain until you are tested."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: No Way Out
text: In the maze-like passages of the Erdwal, a wrong turn can be fatal.

name: Steel Wall
text:
"We sculpt the land into what we need—homes, armament, fortresses of war. Our strength comes not only from knowing, but from *commanding* the terrain."
—Raksha Golden Cub, leonin kha

name: Desolate Lighthouse
text: A lonely sentinel facing gales, hurricanes, and tides of homicidal spirits.

name: Infernal Contract
text:
"But I signed nothing!"
—Taraneh, Suq'Ata mage

name: Reinforcements
text:
"Let them send their legions! I will show them that my truth is stronger than their swords."
—General Varchild

name: Elvish Scout
text: Even one whose ears were closely tuned to the sounds of Havenwood could miss hearing a Scout move past.

name: An-Havva Constable
text:
"Joskun and the other Constables serve with passion, if not with grace."
—Devin, Faerie Noble

name: Bioshift
text:
"It's all right if you change your mind. There's always a chance we can rearrange parts later."
—Zija, Simic mutationist

name: Rise to the Challenge
text: Plidius wagered that Arissa couldn't kill a chimera with her javelins alone. She proved him wrong in a way everyone could see for days to come.

name: Seismic Mage
text: The ground shakes when he walks. His customers shake if they're late with his fee.

name: Inflame
text: A Vulshok weapon strikes with the fire of the forge that made it.

name: Wintermoon Mesa
text: Dark is light and day is night When the winter moon shines.

name: Drannith Stinger
text: The first line of defense, and the last person you want to anger.

name: Countermand
text: The physical pain was nothing compared to the agony in his mind.

name: Soulblade Djinn
text: He grants endless wishes, as long as you always wish for a blade.

name: Silverflame Squire // On Alert
text: Beacons along the borderlands are lit at any incursion from the wilds.

name: Trazyn the Infinite
text: The Archaeovist of the Solemnace Galleries will not rest until every treasure in the galaxy is safely within his clutches.

name: Daring Leap
text: Most warriors think in only two dimensions. Agnate and his metathran brethren were trained to battle in three.

name: Kjeldoran Warrior
text:
"Give me a thousand such Warriors and I could change the world."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Destroy the Evidence
text: Everyone knew the Dimir had done the damage. Everyone suspected the Izzet had hired them.

name: Excruciator
text:
"Though used as a piercing weapon, the tusk is more akin to a stinger, spreading pain instantly throughout the body of its victim. This specimen deserves further study."
—Simic research notes

name: Chicken Troupe
text: Why did the chicken cross the park? To get to the other ride.

name: Standing Troops
text:
"Bant sentries were called the Angel Line. They never faltered, and they were ready to die defending their position."
—Elspeth Tirel

name: Grave Sifter
text: It claws at the earth in a vain attempt to reclaim what it once was.

name: Scryb Sprites
text: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.

name: Daughter of Autumn
text:
"Those who say that Serra is dead have never met the Autumn Willow's daughters. They are as kind and as generous as Serra would wish us to be."
—Gulsen, Abbey Matron

name: Lyna
text: One of the few Soltari who can cross the shadow barrier, Lyna serves as an emissary to the outside world. A quick thinker and convincing speaker, she does whatever she can to lead her people out of the shadows and into substance.

name: Wall of Brambles
text:
"What else, when chaos draws all forces inward to shape a single leaf."
—Conrad Aiken

name: Baleful Stare
text: "Though there is little to be learned from your dust and stones, I shall wring them dry nevertheless."

name: Shadowblood Ridge
text: The carnage of conflicts long past still stains the Otarian soil.

name: Silhana Starfletcher
text: In light he finds both gift and weapon.

name: Nimbus Wings
text: Explorers may find ways into the Sky Ruin, but they find its secrets well protected by shifting hedrons and Roil winds.

name: Ineffable Blessing
text: "Hallowed be this gathering of eclectic products!"

name: Springjaw Trap
text:
"Stop trying to pierce the hide. Hit where it's softest: ankle, sole, hamstring."
—Master Hunter Chevill

name: Straw Golem
text:
"Don't look at me. *I* didn't build it."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

name: Verdant Field
text: Jolrael tends the land so that the land will tend the beasts.

name: Wasp of the Bitter End
text: As the Second Sun glided into its final position in the sky, a chorus of wings sounded to herald the return of Nicol Bolas.

name: Panglacial Wurm
text:
"Step lightly and we might be able to use it as a bridge."
—Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician

name: Markov Purifier
text: The ceremonial "incense" was a concoction of Edgar's own design, a precise blend of blood from his favorite human lineages.

name: Swirling Spriggan
text: After its encounter with the spriggan, the patrol was red with anger, green with envy, white with fear, and painfully black and blue.

name: Bloodsoaked Champion
text: "Death is merely another foe the Mardu will overcome."

name: Burn Bright
text:
"From a great bonfire at the dawn of time, the first Gruul kindled their rage. The same flame burns in you."
—Kroshkar, Gruul shaman

name: Breath of Malfegor
text: The draconic demon loomed over Dack, and he suddenly sensed he wasn't the only Planeswalker that Malfegor had encountered.

name: Incite
text: The veneer of rationality peeled from the mage, revealing the spite and rage beneath.

name: Civilized Scholar // Homicidal Brute
text: For a moment his basest desires run free, unshackled by reason or conscience.

name: Phoenix Heart
