text:
"The minute I heard my first love story,
I started looking for you, not knowing
how blind that was.
Lovers don't finally meet somewhere.
They're in each other all along."
—Rumi

name: Labyrinth Minotaur
text:
"I doubt any labyrinth minotaurs still live—but then again, we minotaurs are stubborn beings."
—Onatah, Anaba Shaman

name: Willow Elf
text: The forest lives in the elf as the elf lives in the forest.

name: Reroute
text: Three hundred years of practice thwarted by an instant of mischief.

name: Hulking Devil
text: Fear the patient devil, the one who is calm in the midst of chaos. Beware the silent devil, the one whose cackle does not mingle with the others.

name: Hymn of Rebirth
text:
"There will come soft rains, and spring shall be amongst us, a welcome friend."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Godless Shrine
text: Sin is debt, and absolution is paid in tithes of gold and blood.

name: Desolation Twin
text:
"With precise coordination and enough blood spilled, one can be driven off, even brought down. But two . . . that's a lot of blood."
—Munda, ambush leader

name: Regrowth
text: While the root remains, the tree yet lives.

name: Biomass Mutation
text:
"A regression to ancient forms? A glimpse of future evolutions? Or a fleeting alteration of the present?"
—Vorel of the Hull Clade

name: Arena Rector
text: "I see something special in you—a bright ember that yearns to dance among the stars."

name: Bereaved Survivor // Dauntless Avenger
text: "It was Sigarda who lifted me from despair and gave me the strength to fight on."

name: Jinnie Fay, Jetmir's Second
text: She watches Jetmir's back while her companions watch hers.

name: Assassinate
text:
"This is how wars are won—not with armies of soldiers but with a single knife blade, artfully placed."
—Yurin, royal assassin

name: Elvish Warrior
text: As graceful as a deer leaping a stream and as deadly as the wolf waiting in ambush on the other side, elvish warriors are the eyes of the forest as well as its unsheathed claws.

name: Seeker of the Way
text: Ojutai sought to rewrite history. Those who disagreed sought the truth elsewhere.

name: Jareth, Leonine Titan
text: Light's champion in the stronghold of darkness.

name: A-Demon's Due
text: Ob Nixilis extends his hand not in partnership, but to affirm your subservience.

name: Spawning Kraken
text:
"I never imagined I'd lay eyes on a creature that makes Gyruda look small and harmless!"
—Lukka

name: Flooded Shoreline
text:
"Some say the sea is jealous of the land and wishes to climb its heights to meet the sky."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Battle Brawler
text: Every time he returns from battle unscathed, he feels a tinge of disappointment.

name: Generous Gift
text: Alas, the meowtropolis was struck by a devastating catastrophe, leaving the ground littered with debris.

name: Ingenious Leonin
text: Leonin claws were already deadly weapons of natural evolution before he improved upon them.

name: Tuinvale Treefolk // Oaken Boon
text: "Right now you are a feeble stick, but I will help you grow some rings."

name: Sol Ring
text:
"Of all the stars in the Galaxy, Sol is of the Emperor. Its heat is His might. Its light is His revelation."
—*Lectitio Divinitatus*

name: Heroes' Reunion
text: They share no bloodline, but a bond greater than family unites them. Such are the gifts of the Worldsoul.

name: Vantress Paladin
text: "Someone knows where the king is. They can't expect to keep it a secret from us."

name: World Queller
text:
"Why fight the world when you know who will win?"
—Nissa Revane

name: Hypnotic Specter
text:
"There was no trace
Of aught on that illumined face . . . ."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge, "Phantom"

name: Fountain of Ichor
text: Sun Empire priests thought they were digging a well. What they tapped was something different entirely.

name: Feral Animist
text: He chanted over a pot of boiling blood and honey. His brain buzzed like a nest of hornets, and his muscles rippled with the might of the bear.

name: Hailstorm Valkyrie
text: When the path to Starnheim was opened, vengeance rained down upon the enemies of Bretagard.

name: Maze Glider
text: The pattern of the Implicit Maze extends in more than two dimensions.

name: Copperline Gorge
text: Where the Tangle overruns the Oxidda mountains, metallic beasts scratch their territories in the verdigris.

name: D'Avenant Healer
text: "One arrow keenly fired might prevent more battlefield wounds than I could treat."

name: Fabled Passage
text: From here, the path to anywhere may be found.

name: Stroke of Genius
text: "Every thought is a star illuminating the darkness. Inspiration comes from finding the constellations that link them."

name: Pact of the Serpent
text: "Our quarrels behind us. Our foes before us. Death or triumph for us all!"

name: Voracious Null
text:
"These days, there's no shortage of food for the nulls of Guul Draz."
—Drana, Kalastria bloodchief

name: Skyfire Phoenix
text: Its fury sets the clouds alight.

name: Aysen Crusader
text:
"A renegade rallying the rabble does not a true crusader make."
—Irini Sengir

name: Anaba Shaman
text:
"The Shamans? Ha! They are mere craven cows not capable of true magic."
—Irini Sengir

name: Galvanic Iteration
text: Better potent than predictable.

name: Sun Clasp
text:
"And darkness shall be cast from me For my soul resides in the Sun."
—Femeref dirge

name: Myrkul's Invoker
text: "Your death will make a fine tribute for the Lord of Bones."

name: Withstand Death
text: On Mirrodin, every conflict ends in either death or darksteel.

name: Bumper Cars
text: Vehicular mischief's appeal is universal.

name: Master the Way
text:
"The Way has no beginning and no end. It is simply the path."
—Narset, khan of the Jeskai

name: Mothrider Patrol
text:
"Be proud, young pup! You've earned your wings. Rise and become the western wind."
—Swift-Arm, Golden-Tail headmaster

name: Storm Fleet Sprinter
text:
"Charge like a red-hot cannonball straight to your target. You slow down, you sink."
—Captain Lannery Storm

name: Furnace Scamp
text: Born of the core, and dying to stoke it.

name: Moonlit Scavengers
text: They comb the shallows of Lochmere for relics of a bygone era. And if they happen upon a lone traveler, all the better.

name: Tangleclaw Werewolf // Fibrous Entangler
text:
". . . because to be honest, I couldn't tell you."
—Halana, Kessig ranger

name: Urza, Prince of Kroog
text:
"At heart, Urza was an inventor, not a warlord. Over time, the burdens of leadership left him as cold and calculating as his mechanical creations."
—The Antiquities War

name: Shore Snapper
text: Kathari, the sickly aven of Grixis, have learned that the corpses by the shoreline are more trap than treat.

name: Beast of Burden
text: Though it was built as an instrument of labor, it wasn't long before it became an instrument of war.

name: Dictate of Heliod
text: "Daxos, I'm in need of a champion. Who else would I turn to but you?"

name: Breaching Hippocamp
text: Don't try to ride this steed unless you've got gills too.

name: Goliath Spider
text: The glittering strands of its complex web catch everything from a buzzing gnat to a passing bloatdrake.

name: Knight Exemplar
text: "If you think you are brave enough to walk the path of honor, follow me into the dragon's den."

name: Spell Counter
text: Playing *Unhinged*, . . .

name: Hazoret's Favor
text: Hazoret's gift is bestowed only once.

name: Backdraft Hellkite
text: Memories burn with the brightest flames.

name: Chromatic Sphere
text:
"As expected, this sphere's design reflects the colors of the four moons . . . plus another?"
—Pontifex, elder researcher

name: Attendant of Vraska
text: When the Erstwhile were unearthed from their tombs, they became a ready-made army for Vraska.

name: Lord of Atlantis
text: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

name: Knight of the Hokey Pokey
text: That's what it's all about.

name: Gaea's Anthem
text:
"To those who can hear it, Gaea's battle song brings power as swift as sunlight and as enduring as the deep roots of the forest."
—Gamelen, Citanul elder

name: Disentomb
text:
"I deal so often in rotting corpses that when I come across the freshly dead . . . why, it's like my birthday come early."
—Nevinyrral, necromancer

name: Wizard Mentor
text: Although some of the students quickly grasped the concept, the others could summon only blackboards.

name: Giant Badger
text: The wizard Greensleeves called a Giant Badger to her aid in an battle with the desert mage Karli.

name: Seedcradle Witch
text: She whispered a prayer for strength, and her wishes wafted away like seeds on the wind.

name: Mausoleum Turnkey
text: When he reaches for his key ring, you should be running for the exit.

name: Slashing Tiger
text:
"Unless you enter the tiger's lair, you cannot get hold of the tiger's cubs."
—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

name: Tavern Swindler
text: Rakdos cultists are her best customers. They never flinch at pain and are seldom good at math.

name: War Screecher
text: Soaring over Vitu-Ghazi, New Prahv, and Orzhova, the Conclave's trained falcons provided critical intelligence.

name: Terisiare's Devastation
text: In the end, the war had no winner.

name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
text:
"From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks!"
"Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"

name: Artistic Refusal
text: Errant wouldn't allow anything to stop her from decorating the streets of New Capenna.

name: Escape Routes
text:
"I'll get you to safety—or whatever passes for safety these days."
—Urborg ferry pilot

name: Sandstone Deadfall
text:
"Two or three tons of rock can really get you down—and keep you there."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

name: Leshrac's Rite
text:
"Bind me to thee, my soul to thine. I am your servant and your slave. Blood for blood, flesh for flesh, Leshrac, my lord."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Touch of Brilliance
text: "I don't want what I don't have. I want more of what I *do* have."

name: Wort, Boggart Auntie
text: Auntie always knows which berries to lick, which kithkin to trick, and what to do when either goes wrong.

name: Unknown Shores
text: Philosophers speak of a place where myths wash like tides upon the shores of the real.

name: Blood Vassal
text:
"They are bred to suffer and born to die. Much like humans."
—Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

name: Start Your Engines
text: Inventors from around the world have come to the Fair hoping their creations will fly, drive, or sail their way to a top prize.

name: Compelled Duel
text: "You might be four times my size, but I will not be ignored!"

name: Near-Death Experience
text: Lands ravaged, cities in ruins, so many lives sacrificed, and yet there was no other word for it but victory.

name: Gates Ablaze
text: When the Izzet's spirit of invention extends to the city's infrastructure, the results are sometimes explosive.

name: Icewind Stalwart
text: "Get behind my shield!"

name: Tenacious Dead
text: Raising the bones of Hekjek the Mad proved far easier than getting them to lie back down.

name: Tireless Hauler // Dire-Strain Brawler
text: The new hire proved more than enough to replace the three farmhands who disappeared the week before.

name: Geth, Thane of Contracts
text: "It seems someone forgot to read the fine print."

name: Grip of Amnesia
text:
"Would you abandon your past to save your future?"
—Ambassador Laquatus

name: Death's Shadow
text: The shadow of the candle looms tall even as its light grows dim.

name: Rootwater Shaman
text:
"Ugh! When did orcs and fish start having kids?"
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Vectis Gloves
text: Thieves love technological innovations almost as much as artificers do.

name: Cauldron Familiar
text: Every day the cat returns to kill the same mouse, which sinks again into the cauldron's brew.

name: Gratuitous Violence
text: What was supposed to be a quiet time in town turned into an adventure of its own.

name: Wellwisher
text: "Close your ears to the voice of greed, and you can turn a gift for one into a gift for many."

name: Sandstorm Charger
text:
"May our foes choke upon its horns!"
—Urdnan, Dromoka warrior

name: Immolating Souleater
text:
"We thank the souleaters for melting the sinful that we may be reminded of our own insignificance."
—Drones' hymn of gratitude

name: Dry Spell
text:
"My soul thirsts for Serra's salvation, as does my body for life's breath."
—Ihsan's Shade

name: Frilled Mystic
text: "Your arrival was expected...and unwelcome."

name: Amateur Auteur
text:
Elspeth, blessed by Heliod,
stepped up where the hydra trod.
Soon afterward, a lesson learned:
attack the Champion, get burned!
—*THEROS! The Musical*

name: Bayou
text: 2019 Asia Legacy Champion

name: Thoughtleech
text:
"Their thoughts flow through my mind, and I am healed."
—Fyndhorn elder

name: Baleful Ammit
text:
"Not all in our crop deserve the afterlife. We must leave the unworthy behind, Samut."
—Djeru, initiate of Tah crop

name: Giant Fan
text: Only a villain would unleash a giant fan on anyone!

name: Kazuul's Fury // Kazuul's Cliffs
text:
"The path up the cliffs is nothing but steep switchbacks and rickety lifts, made by elves, maintained by humans, and guarded by ogres. But it's the best way into the heart of Murasa."
—Samila, Murasa Expeditionary House

name: Candlelight Vigil
text: Selesnya guildmages do not sleep so the rest of the conclave can.

name: Bident of Thassa
text: The wills of mortals shift as the tide ebbs and flows.

name: Ineffable Blessing
text: "Hallowed be this compilation of mixed objects!"

name: Smokebraider
text: "Be silent and listen to your inner fire. Only then can you walk the Path of Flame."

name: Dark Triumph
text: All that's left is the coronation.

name: Coercion
text: Though he held the title of prime minister, Cao Cao used the emperor's name to exert his own influence on the empire.

name: Obelisk of Undoing
text: The Battle of Tomakul taught Urza not to rely on fickle reinforcements.

name: Phantom Warrior
text: It can pass through solid matter—but that doesn't mean it's harmless.

name: Nyxborn Seaguard
text:
"Storm-tossed and broken, Callaphe cried out to deep-dwelling Thassa.
Tritons came swiftly to save her, bringing her north to the Lindus."
—*The Callapheia*

name: Mossfire Valley
text: Lush growth spreads like a ferocious blaze across the Otarian hillsides.

name: Pull Under
text:
"Although nowhere on Kamigawa was safe during the war, the Takenuma Swamp was the most horrifying. The rotting bamboo itself rebelled against its mortal inhabitants, pulling them into unmarked graves."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Timbermare
text: Only nature wreaks such lovely havoc.

name: Solitary Hunter // One of the Pack
text: "Making a living in Kessig is hard, but I've learned some tricks of the trade."

name: Glory Seeker
text: "There's no contract to sign, no oath to swear. The enlistment procedure is to unsheathe your sword and point it at the enemy."

name: Rag Man
text: He hunts what might have been.

name: Wild Endeavor
text: The wilds consume, but they also create.

name: Protean Hulk
text:
"Meat *and* eggs. We eat!"
—Borborygmos

name: Lord of the Undead
text:
"All of life's problems can be solved—death included."
—Nymara, Rhodosi dreadlord

name: Mox Sapphire
text: 2010 Vintage Championship Winner

name: Okina Nightwatch
text: Only the most skilled budoka could protect the Okina Shrine. Only the best of these protectors took the night watch.

name: Tradewind Rider
text:
"'Tis a shame, in such a tempest, to have but one anchor."
—Laurence Sterne, *Tristram Shandy*

name: Subterranean Tremors
text: The market is now closed.

name: Bitterblade Warrior
text: "The vizier of poisons teaches an unconventional kind of strength."

name: Spiteful Repossession
text: Late payment shall be extracted however they see fit.

name: Millstone
text: Minds, like mountains, are never so grand and mighty that they can't be reduced to dust.

name: Heroic Reinforcements
text: Cries of anguish quickly spurred cries of action.

name: Stinkdrinker Daredevil
text: Boggarts constantly strive to outdo each other with the things they bring back to the warren, each hoping the exploit will become as well-known as those of Auntie Grub.

name: Wasteland
text: The library's scrolls have long since crumbled into swirling desert sands.

name: Auriok Champion
text: Mirrodin's deepest caverns conceal its brightest hopes.

name: Isolation Zone
text: When properly aligned, hedrons become powerful tools of binding.

name: Daggerback Basilisk
text: Its ventricles weep venom, and it consumes only poison.

name: Boros Guildgate
text: Enter with merciful hearts. Exit with battle cries.

name: Turn to Slag
text:
"If it wasn't a blackened, stinking, melted abomination before, it certainly is now."
—Koth of the Hammer

name: Gateway Shade
text: Tireless and merciless, shades are harnessed as spies by the Dimir.

name: Ghen, Arcanum Weaver
text: "Any apprentice with a spellbook and two sticks can churn out a fireball. This is different. This is art."

name: Scrappy Bruiser
text:
"My flesh is an affront to existence? Come say that to my fist, you bloated rust bucket."
—Koko, Riveteers welder

name: Morbid Bloom
text:
"From the damned I make my garden."
—Jorshu of Clan Nel Toth

name: Broodwarden
text:
"The least of gods shall tower over the mightiest of mortals, and death shall reign over all."
—Crypt of Agadeem inscription

name: Angel's Feather
text: If taken, it cuts the hand that clutches it. If given, it heals the hand that holds it.

name: Dread Slag
text: A thousand phobias sopped from the city and wrung from Rix Maadi as one.

name: Glacial Crevasses
text:
"We were chasing Lim-Dûl when the ridge in front of us suddenly crumbled. I can't believe it was mere coincidence."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Skyshroud Ranger
text:
"Just as you see the grave and remember the friend, I see this forest and remember Llanowar."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Guardians of Koilos
text: Archaeologists depend on automatons inspired by their previous discoveries at Koilos to guard the excavations.

name: Lifecrafter's Gift
text: The best engineers recognize when a problem has already been solved.

name: Iona, Shield of Emeria
text: No more shall the righteous cower before evil.

name: Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician
text: "Everybody but me—CHARGE!"

name: Cruel Revival
text: On Innistrad, Liliana embraced necromancy, honing her powers by practicing on scores of undead—and sometimes the living.

name: Spiraling Embers
text: The akki knew to stay indoors on the days the oni flew their kites.

name: Fire Drake
text: Brimstone marks this drake's territory. Unfortunately for travelers, all of the Burning Isles smell likewise.

name: Cliff Threader
text: "The crossing demands singular focus. Your life consists of these ropes, these hooks, and these rocky crags. Your past is miles below."

name: Lurker
text:
"Each night we felt it watching us from the darkness beyond our fire. We only had one pack horse left."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, *Memoirs of a Soldier*

name: Spirit Cairn
text: The most beautiful souls shine even in death.

name: Gale Force
text: Everything the kami had done, they did with more force. Gentle breezes became typhoons, rolling rivers turned to crushing rapids, and gentle growth became overnight masses of thorns and vines.

name: Gimme Five
text: "Up high! To the side! Down low! To the left! Other left! Over here—"

name: Specter's Shriek
text:
"Imagine having your skeleton extracted through your ear, one bone at a time."
—Corliss the Wanderer

name: Skinbrand Goblin
text:
"These Gruul skin-runes—discern whether their patterns evoke streets, leylines, or both. You have four days."
—Niv-Mizzet, to his assistant

name: Thunder Strike
text: Lightning reflexes, thunderous might.

name: Serra
text: Named for a benevolent goddess at birth, Serra fulfilled the prophecy of that goddess's coming. As a planeswalker, she embodies white mana and helps whole civilizations develop while both directly and indirectly inspiring countless individuals to be steadfast and strong in the service of light.

name: Grip of Desolation
text: As the hand closed, there was first terror, then numbness, and finally nothingness.

name: Your Temple Is Under Attack
text: "You trespass on sacred ground, monster. Leave while you still can."

name: Pull from Eternity
text:
It is best to conquer dragons before they hatch.
—Femeref adage

name: Revel of the Fallen God
text:
"Xenagos has fallen, and the world grows dark without him. What can ever fill that darkness but our rage?"
—Guruthes, disciple of Xenagos

name: Nature's Will
text:
"Without the kami to speak to nature on our behalf, we must beg help from nature directly."
—Seshiro the Anointed

name: Blood Price
text: Blood is the oldest currency.

name: Somber Hoverguard
text: The vedalken interrogate all intruders—once the hoverguards are done with them.

name: Boreal Griffin
text:
"More than snow falls from the Boreal skies."
—Arkin Egilsson, skycaptain

name: Wildfire Elemental
text:
"Fire is always dancing, leaping and whirling, seeking more fuel. It never rests, so why should I?"
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Sculpted Sunburst
text: A searing light that spares only the chosen.

name: Rumbling Slum
text: The Orzhov contract the Izzet to animate slum districts and banish them to the wastes. The Gruul adopt them and send them back to the city for vengeance.

name: Coronation of Chaos
text: When Sarevok's deception was unmasked, the cheering crowd erupted into an outraged mob.

name: Fang Dragon // Forktail Sweep
text:
"Watch out for its teeth, tail, claws, wings, back, and front."
—Olga, cavalier

name: Opt
text: "We need alternatives, Hanna," yelled Gerrard. "Now!"

name: Ashen Firebeast
text:
"I'm not sure which impresses me most, its thoroughness or its intensity."
—Matoc, lavamancer

name: Berserkers of Blood Ridge
text: They take a blood oath to die in battle. So far none have failed to fulfill the promise.

name: Crag Puca
text:
"Be happy when you see a puca shaped like mischief. It's far better than one shaped like death."
—Dindun of Kulrath Mine

name: Deathbellow War Cry
text: Deathbellow Canyon echoes with the roars of minotaurs calling each other to battle.

name: Death by Dragons
text: Suddenly, Eldo felt very alone.

name: Derelor
text:
"Strength it has, but at the cost of a continuous supply of energy. Such failure can bear only one result."
—Execution order of Endrek Sahr, master breeder

name: Granite Grip
text: There's beauty in the desert—but it's best to view it from afar.

name: Serpent Warrior
text: They're the fiercest of all the Western Paladin's soldiers. They're also the most fiercely loyal—but that loyalty comes at a price.

name: Tremor
text: Without a word, Gerrard and Sisay ran deeper into the mountain. Neither of them intended to leave Mercadia without the *Weatherlight* and its crew.

name: Traveler's Amulet
text:
"The best kind of treasure is the kind that leads to more treasure!"
—Captain Lannery Storm

name: Githzerai Monk
text: The githzerai dwell in the heart of Limbo, shaping the chaos of that plane with their powerful psionic abilities.

name: Dwarven Scorcher
text: Barbarians invented the blaze of glory. Dwarves perfected it.

name: Necrotic Fumes
text: When live specimens aren't readily available, Witherbloom mages make creative use of ragged spirits clinging to long-dead bodies.

name: Scoria Wurm
text: Late at night, ululations echo from deep under Shiv, as the wurms sing of times older than humanity.

name: Temporal Manipulation
text: Doing something at the last minute isn't so bad when you can make that minute last.

name: Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion
text: Sunhome—the stalwart shield, the towering sentinel, the seat of justice.

name: Gravel-Hide Goblin
text:
"No peace accord will save Ravnica. You don't build on rot. You burn it down and start again."
—Domri Rade

name: Time Walk
text: 2018 North America Vintage Championship

name: Sensation Gorger
text: More, more, more!

name: Gravebind
text: One foot in the grave, firmly planted.

name: Civic Stalwart
text: "These are your streets. Defend them! This is your neighborhood. Honor it! This is your city. Save it!"

name: Crushing Canopy
text:
"The Dimir may look all they want. We never grow tired of swatting their bugs."
—Heruj, Selesnya hierophant

name: Bestial Menace
text:
"My battle cry reaches ears far keener than yours."
—Saidah, Joraga hunter

name: Abzan Kin-Guard
text: "The Mardu rush headlong toward extinction. We ensure the longevity of our clan by protecting our territory, not rampaging through it."

name: Tangle Mantis
text: The fiercest hunters in the Tangle don't seek out the mantises. They *are* the mantises.

name: Ivory Guardians
text: The elite guard of the Mesa High Priests, the Ivory Guardians were created to protect the innocent and faithful.

name: Dormant Sliver
text:
"It triggers the hive's period of Ætheric fertility—a time when even feeding is a lower priority than reproduction."
—Rukarumel, field journal

name: Dawnhart Rejuvenator
text: "Wherever there is life, there is power for one who knows the old ways."

name: Shaman of Spring
text: Some shamanic sects advocate the different seasons, each working to preserve nature's cycles.

name: Wooden Sphere
text: Strengthened by a thousand limbs.

name: Blast of Genius
text: Ral Zarek's brainstorms bring actual thunder and lightning.

name: Gwafa Hazid, Profiteer
text: "Everyone has a price."

name: Enraged Ceratok
text: "There's no time to calm it down! Run!"

name: Cragcrown Pathway // Timbercrown Pathway
text:
"Walk quickly and ignore any roars from the undergrowth."
—Enwor, Sea Gate Expeditionary House

name: Shenanigans
text: Pricey baubles are no match for cheap tricks.

name: Rejuvenating Springs
text: When they're done pummeling each other, the fighters relax companionably in the springs, warming their sore muscles.

name: Haunting Wind
text: These devices lured so many spirits that sometimes entire battlefields would become haunted at once.

name: Laughing Hyena
text: "Two muffins are baking in an oven. One muffin says to the other muffin, 'It's getting hot in here, huh?' The other muffin says, 'Aagh! A talking muffin'"

name: Ognis, the Dragon's Lash
text: Ziatora's second-in-command has a habit of appearing when and where her enemies least expect her.

name: Mad Dog
text: The bones it buries may be yours.

name: Scuttling Doom Engine
text: A masterwork of spite, inspired by madness.

name: Traumatize
text:
"The educated mind is heavy with lore and knowledge. It's also the most likely to collapse under its own weight."
—Ambassador Laquatus

name: Duress
text:
"We decide who is worthy of our works."
—Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

name: Disdainful Stroke
text:
"I've known for a year that you would cast this exact spell, at this exact spot, at this exact time."
—Raffine

name: Relic Amulet
text: Old power finds new purpose.

name: Ogre Geargrabber
text: Long reach, short attention span.

name: Redeem
text:
"That they are saved from death is immaterial. What is important is that they know the source of their benefaction."
—Radiant, archangel

name: Nightmarish End
text:
"To think some believe it peaceful to die in one's sleep."
—Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver

name: Cutthroat Negotiator
text: "Either you two figure out how to share, or I'm going to share these swords with the insides of your skulls."

name: Aerial Caravan
text: Successful delivery is *not* guaranteed.

name: Anthroplasm
text: I never metamorphosis I didn't like.

name: Cremate
text: Cremation of the dead is not a religious ritual in Ravnica. It's a business designed to keep the Golgari from growing in numbers.

name: Surge of Thoughtweft
text: Kithkin weave together their very thoughts, creating a depth of cooperation unknown to other races.

name: Quicksilver Amulet
text:
"If powerstones are energy stored in material form, could we store matter as energy the same way?"
—Rayne, research notes

name: Magus of the Tabernacle
text: The Tabernacle's disciples channel the emanations from Pendrell Vale, spreading its paradoxical demand to be both worshipped and left alone.

name: Divination
text: Even the House of Galan, who takes the most scholarly approach to the mystic traditions, has resorted to exploring more primitive methods in Avacyn's absence.

name: Woodland Cemetery
text:
"They never found the body of young Josu, or that of his murderous sister."
—"The Fall of the House of Vess"

name: Network Terminal
text: Public access terminals around Towashi provide residents with up-to-date information on everything from traffic delays to hostile kami sightings.

name: Tragic Arrogance
text: The spear thrown by Kytheon's own hand was the weapon that felled his friends.

name: Sage Owl
text: The owl asks but never answers.

name: Grimdancer
text: Most monsters are more frightening when they skitter unseen in the dark. Most.

name: Command Tower
text: What did you do to the Zero Point?

name: Survivor of Korlis
text: At first, the merchant state of Korlis saw no need to involve itself in the conflict between Yotia and the Fallaji. Mishra's dragon engines changed that.

name: Provoke the Trolls
text:
"I like burning and pillaging as much as anyone, but sometimes it's just easier to throw a rock and let the trolls do the work."
—Urik, Tuskeri raid leader

name: Henge Guardian
text: Like so many Thran relics, the wurm engine kept operating long after its creators were gone.

name: Teshar, Ancestor's Apostle
text: "The Ancestor saved us for a purpose."

name: Vampiric Fury
text: Many peasants secretly admire vampires' glamour and elegance—until they witness a moment of pure bloodlust.

name: Mina and Denn, Wildborn
text: Greenweaver Mina and her twin brother Denn lead the last of the Mul Daya into an uncertain future.

name: Clash of Wills
text: Alhammarret rose to his feet, and the full force of his mind hit Jace like a storm front.

name: Slime Molding
text:
"Give me enough refuse and mana and I will summon an ooze that can engulf all of Ravnica."
—Cevraya, Golgari shaman

name: Bog Tatters
text: A wraith is a tale of brutal slaying told anew whenever it finds a victim.

name: Bloodshot Cyclops
text: After their first encounter, the goblins named him Chuck.

name: Drowsing Tyrannodon
text: What the rangers thought were warning growls turned out to be nothing but monstrous snoring.

name: Metropolis Angel
text:
"Angels are living proof that power does not always lead to corruption."
—Elspeth

name: Zhalfirin Commander
text:
"Command is the act of balancing on a vine and convincing others that it is firm ground."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Sea Serpent
text: Legend has it that serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?

name: Virulent Plague
text:
"This pestilence robs us of glorious death in battle. We starve to death with full bellies and drown trying to slake our unnatural thirst."
—Kerai Hatesinger, Kolaghan warrior

name: My First Tome
text: This card is named My First Tome.

name: Fatal Blow
text:
"What is crueler? To let a wound of the heart fester, or to simply cut it out?"
—Crovax

name: Whip Silk
text: Llanowar forges weapons of steel. Yavimaya grows her weapons within.

name: Searing Barb
text: "You always were such a sharp student. Shame it took you so long to get the point."

name: Anger of the Gods
text: Eating those clerics might have been a bad idea.

name: Bane of Bala Ged
text: The continent of Bala Ged was ravaged by massive Eldrazi of Ulamog's lineage, its lush jungles and cascading rivers reduced to dust.

name: Karplusan Giant
text:
"They aren't the brightest or the quickest of giants. For that matter, the same holds true if you compare them to rocks."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Elven Riders
text:
"Sometimes it is better to be swift of foot than strong of swordarm."
—Elven Proverb

name: True Conviction
text: Dozens of spells known only to the Auriok elders were lost, but the next generation, galvanized by war, devised even more potent magic.

name: Idyllic Tutor
text:
"I know she is somewhere in the Multiverse. I will find her no matter what, even if it means I have to travel all worlds that exist."
—Kaito Shizuki

name: Craven Giant
text:
What is high as a mountain and low as a snake?
—Dal riddle

name: Fungal Infection
text: To thallids, the whole world is just a pile of mulch to grow saprolings in.

name: Force of Will
text: "I alone determine my destiny."

name: Doomed Necromancer
text:
"His sacrifice shall not be forgotten. Now toss his body over there with the others."
—Phage the Untouchable

name: Shiv's Embrace
text: When you see the world as a dragon sees it, everything looks fit to burn.

name: You Find the Villains' Lair
text: "Give me just a moment! I almost have it."

name: Mounted Dreadknight
text: Markov vampires cultivate an image of such decadent elegance that it can be easy to forget they can field a deadly fighting force.

name: Haktos the Unscarred
text: "Many have sought my weakness. All have failed."

name: Howl of the Night Pack
text: The murderous horrors of Raven's Run are legendary, but even that haunted place goes quiet when the night wolves howl.

name: Ghostform
text: "Picking locks is for beginners."

name: Spin Engine
text:
"It will be battle-ready before our strike at Oxid Ridge, and it will guarantee our victory."
—Ketuc of the Helm

name: Knight of the White Orchid
text: Both guide and guard on open plain.

name: Deepwood Tantiv
text: A single tantiv is just as dangerous as a herd.

name: Seasoned Marshal
text:
"We are not interested in the possibilities of defeat."
—Queen Victoria

name: Timetwister
text: 2012 Vintage Championship Winner

name: Resurrection
text:
"Think of this new life not as a gift from the angels but as a command to fight for their cause once more."
—War blessing of Serra

name: Pretender's Claim
text: The surest way to lose your holdings is to plead for them in Mercadia City's courts.

name: Pernicious Deed
text: "Yawgmoth," Freyalise whispered as she set the bomb, "now you will pay for your treachery."

name: Soraya the Falconer
text:
"Soraya speaks with the hunters of the air, as do all of her family line."
—Autumn Willow

name: Phantom General
text: After his death, the general was reunited with fallen soldiers from over thirty of his campaigns.

name: Darling of the Masses
text: The people flocked to the glittering parade, turning their backs on the threats in the shadows.

name: Soldevi Digger
text:
"This ceaseless device has helped uncover marvels unreachable by mere flesh."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

name: Illumination
text:
"A brilliant light can either illuminate or blind. How will you know which until you open your eyes?"
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Thraxodemon
text: Urza and Mishra weren't the only denizens of Terisiare to covet the powerstones' energy.

name: Drown in Dreams
text:
"Within our minds are limitless depths. Dive down, but don't forget to surface."
—Teferi

name: Jailbreak
text: Obscura spies rarely stay locked up long enough to make it to trial.

name: Formation
text:
"I have been a warrior for over four hundred years, and yet each generation of Kjeldorans teaches me new tricks. There can be no better allies."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Enlarge
text: For Mittens, it was just another day at the beach.

name: Bloodthorn Taunter
text: Naya's celebrants stoke the gargantuans into a rage, loosing a tide of muscle with the precision of an arrow.

name: Sovereign's Bite
text:
"You have given all to your kingdom, dear knight. Serenity shall be your prize."
—Queen Lian

name: Sparksmith
text: "If it didn't hurt, how would I know it worked?"

name: Druid of the Cowl
text: "The wild tangle of the Cowl provides sanctuary to life that watched the first buildings rise."

name: Heiko Yamazaki, the General
text: "I prefer to let my sword do the talking."

name: Devouring Light
text: Into the light the good are welcomed, and with the light the evil are banished.

name: Vodalian Zombie
text:
"Every last one of you will become my servant. It's a shame you won't live to see the irony."
—Tsabo Tavoc, Phyrexian general

name: Syndicate Trafficker
text: "The price isn't negotiable, but I'm sure you'll agree it's fair."

name: Kinjalli's Caller
text: The people of the Sun Empire worship the sun in three aspects. Kinjalli is the Wakening Sun, who created humans from clay and baked them in the sun's warmth.

name: Fragmentize
text:
"Too much friction on your bearings, your countersinking is inconsistent, and there are lines in your casting. Dispose of it, and begin again."
—Dovin Baan

name: Howling Mine
text: The mine's riches never end, nor do the moans of the spirits doomed to haunt them.

name: Windfall
text: "Rich" is a relative term.

name: Creeping Mold
text: Sanctions, mandates, regulations . . . These things mean nothing to the natural world.

name: Reckless Spite
text:
"Death is such an exquisite sensation."
—Tsabo Tavoc, Phyrexian general

name: Train of Thought
text: "But then . . . oh, but . . . which means . . . which would lead to . . . exactly!"

name: Spineless Thug
text: These troops are only as strong as the evincar's control.

name: Dragon Appeasement
text:
"Look there—they carry that one upon a sedan chair. It must be their leader. Wait . . . Oh! Perhaps not."
—Kaeda, aven scout

name: Oyobi, Who Split the Heavens
text: Her angry call split the sky. From that rift descended her champions.

name: Ephemeron
text: From nothing came teeth.

name: Soldevi Sentry
text:
"Our newfound security enables us to turn more of our attentions to the wonders that lie deep within the soil."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Spirit Cairn
text: It marks the border between here and hereafter.

name: Life of Toshiro Umezawa // Memory of Toshiro
text:
"Some called him the hero of the Kami War, others a selfish thief. As ever, the truth is hidden somewhere in between."
—Reki, founder of the Living Historians

name: Bulwark
text:
"It will be the goblin's first bath, and its last."
—Fire Eye, viashino bey

name: Flamewave Invoker
text: The Mirari burns in his heart.

name: Jacques le Vert
text: Abandoning his sword to return to the lush forest of Pendelhaven, Jacques le Vert devoted his life to protecting the creatures of his homeland.

name: Lumbering Satyr
text:
The satyr carves the path that all of Rushwood follows.
—Cho-Arrim saying

name: Henge of Ramos
text:
It is the hub. We are the wheel.
—Dryad saying

name: Daybreak Chaplain
text: "May the light shine through me to guide the lost."

name: Anger
text:
"Molten earth has no anger of its own. Only by infusing it with your own rage can the magma seethe and take shape."
—Koth of the Hammer

name: Frenzied Fugue
text: Forever after, she lived in fear of the madness reclaiming her.

name: Cellar Door
text: As if anyone needed another reason to avoid dark, dank cellars.

name: Tamiyo's Journal
text: Entry 434: There's more to Avacyn's madness . . .

name: Mishra's Groundbreaker
text: The very ground yielded to Mishra's wishes.

name: Blood Researcher
text: "Dean Valentin warns us not to consume the samples for our safety, but I think he's just being greedy."

name: Aurelia, the Warleader
text: Leading from behind had never been her style.

name: Elemental Uprising
text:
"My heart and Zendikar's beat as one. Together we will endure."
—Nissa Revane

name: Highborn Vampire
text: With the bloodchiefs annihilated in the fight between the free and enthralled, the swamps around Malakir are full of dangerous, young vampires eager to make their marks.

name: Vengeful Vampire
text: He wields the full power of wrath unfettered by the sympathies of a soul.

name: Coral Merfolk
text: It is not unusual for a single family of coral merfolk to spend centuries carefully guiding the growth of the reefs where they make their home.

name: Winter Blast
text:
"Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!"
—William Shakespeare, King Lear

name: Carnophage
text:
"And in their blind and unattaining state their miserable lives have sunk so low that they must envy every other fate."
—Dante, *Inferno*, trans. Ciardi

name: Life from the Loam
text:
"When there is no one left but the ravens, the Swarm will rise and rule all."
—Lost prophecy of Svogthir

name: Harsh Scrutiny
text:
"If you've done nothing wrong, you have nothing to fear."
—Enforcer-Chief Ranaj

name: Suicidal Charge
text:
"They think they're winning. But they're just lining up to be dinner."
—Rakka Mar

name: Test of Endurance
text:
"If we have learned nothing else, we have learned to survive."
—Mystic elder

name: Blisterspit Gremlin
text:
"Ah, we have a critic."
—Orthion, Lavabrink captain

name: Jodah's Codex
text:
"If you remember nothing else of our world's history, remember this: Phyrexians can be defeated."
—Jodah

name: Kozilek's Shrieker
text: Listen to the sound of defeat.

name: Teach by Example
text:
"Learning to imitate a master is the first step in becoming one."
—Uvilda, Prismari dean

name: Knight of the Mists
text: Fear the mists, for they are armed.

name: Weave Fate
text: Temur shamans speak of three destinies: the now, the echo of the past, and the unwritten. They find flickering paths among tangled possibilities.

name: Thorn Thallid
text:
"The danger in cultivating massive plants caught the elves by surprise."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*

name: Sky Spirit
text:
"Like a strain of music: easy to remember but impossible to catch."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Pack Rat
text: A procession of gifts with no end in sight.

name: Terramorphic Expanse
text: The Cicatrix Maledictum split the galaxy asunder. The raw stuff of Chaos flooded into realspace, transforming whole planets in moments.

name: Beast of Burden
text: "If it is meant to be nothing but a machine," Karn finally asked Jhoira, "why did Urza build it to be like me?"

name: Bladewing's Thrall
text: A shadow of life chasing a husk of glory.

name: Aku Djinn
text:
"Your arrogance amazes me, Kaervek. Did you not know the price you would pay?"
—Mangara

name: Favor of the Overbeing
text: Enlightenment is the mundane seen from the vantage point of the divine.

name: Inspiring Overseer
text:
"This city could certainly use a bit more divine intervention."
—Inspector Jillard

name: Impact Tremors
text: "The only chance we have of getting out of this world is if we take care of Venger once and for all!"

name: Lord of the Pit
text: "My summoning begins your debt, Planeswalker."

name: City of Solitude
text:
"My horizon was the arcing petals, my new home resplendent with spires of weeds and pillows of fragrant pollen."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

name: Scheming Aspirant
text: "I have raised many of my own contenders for the Coliseum. This one will be fearsome one day, mark my words."

name: Irregular Cohort
text: Where fickle form meets lasting loyalty.

name: Rain of Embers
text: There's plenty to talk about in the marketplaces of Ravnica, be it the latest feud between guilds or the terrible weather.

name: Murder
text:
"By fate or by will, every reign must come to an end."
—Kethis, the Hidden Hand

name: Kami of Twisted Reflection
text: Its form reflected humanity as it stood during the Kami War: disjointed, confused, and incomplete.

name: Pyrite Spellbomb
text: You're gonna love this next one.

name: Allied Reinforcements
text: "Our formation was scattered after Sea Gate fell. If you're fighting the Eldrazi, consider us your newest recruits."

name: Traverse the Outlands
text: With such great footsteps, everything is within walking distance.

name: Vine Trellis
text: "We protect our own with our own."

name: Heroic Intervention
text:
"Wherever the strong would harm the weak, I will be there."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Crippling Chill
text: One breath of the geist turns veins to rivers of ice and freezes hearts midbeat.

name: Fen Hauler
text:
"Success is found where others fear to look."
—Ara, renegade smuggler

name: Argothian Elder
text:
Sharpen your ears
—Elvish expression meaning "grow wiser"

name: Repository Skaab
text: Created to capture the spark of genius for later use.

name: Pearled Unicorn
text: "'Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!' 'Well, now that we have seen each other,' said the Unicorn, 'if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'" —Lewis Carroll

name: Crimson Manticore
text: Noted neither for their good looks nor their charm, Crimson Manticores can be fearsome allies. As dinner companions, however, they are best left alone.

name: Vault of Whispers
text: Heretic cultists came to the planet Sovereign in search of resources and precious artifacts. They found something else.

name: Desperate Castaways
text: A pirate crew without a ship is a crew that will do anything to get one.

name: Thopter Pie Network
text: They all thought her dream was just pie in the sky.

name: Seek the Horizon
text: Raked by vertical spikes of glass and stone, Ravnica's vistas offer only a rare glimpse of the horizon.

name: Snuff Out
text: "The bigger they are, the faster they rot."

name: Servo Schematic
text: The Consulate prizes innovation when it is dependable and replicable.

name: Trained Caracal
text: Some Ravnicans consider carrying a sword to be beneath them, preferring instead a tooth-and-claw escort.

name: Concession Stand
text: Now serving Basri Kettle Corn, Taco Bolas, Karn Dogs, Koth of the Hamburger, Dovin Baan Mi, Oko Cola, Frozen Tamiyogurt, and more!

name: Lurking Predators
text: All are prey to the eyes of the wild.

name: Sawblade Scamp
text: Be the blade that severs hierarchy.

name: Giant Spider
text:
Watching the spider's web
—Llanowar expression meaning "focusing on the wrong thing"

name: Rust
text:
"How dull it is to pause, to make an end,/ To rust unburnished, not to shine in use,/ As though to breathe were life!"
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "Ulysses"

name: Divine Verdict
text: The last thing to go through the cyclops's mind was a twelve-ton block of marble.

name: Pearled Unicorn
text:
"'Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!' 'Well, now that we have seen each other,' said the Unicorn, 'if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'"
—Lewis Carroll,
*Through the Looking-Glass*

name: Cabal Coffers
text: Deep within the Cabal's vault, the Mirari pulsed like a dead sun-and its darkness radiated across Otaria.

name: Snarling Undorak
text: Most creatures in the Krosan Forest feared the Mirari's power. A few fed upon it.

name: Nezumi Ronin
text:
"Some nezumi became as skilled in the samurai arts as the humans and kitsune. Yet no lord would have them, so they sold their swords to the highest bidder."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Goblin Patrol
text:
"Take the sharp metal stick and make a lotta holes."
—Jula, goblin raider

name: Etali, Primal Conqueror // Etali, Primal Sickness
text: The contagion spreads and the Multiverse quakes.

name: Theoretical Duplication
text:
"You made it asymmetrical just to annoy me, didn't you?"
—Imbraham, Quandrix dean

name: Walking Wall
text:
"The fortress is not what it seems."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Harvestguard Alseids
text: Not all shields are forged of iron or bronze.

name: Shattered Angel
text: She preaches the blessings of the Machine Orthodoxy.

name: Winter Blast
text: "Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!" —William Shakespeare, *King Lear*

name: Leonin Elder
text:
"The wisdom of the elders is just as much a weapon as a sword or spear. We must learn to wield it."
—Ushanti, leonin seer

name: Question Elemental?
text: "What the . . . ?"

name: Despotic Scepter
text:
"We were not meant to have such terrible things. They should be left where we found them, if not destroyed!"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

name: Seraphic Greatsword
text: Light as a feather. Sharp as an angel's wrath.

name: Oasis Ritualist
text: "It's only the end if we allow it."

name: Breach the Multiverse
text:
"All worlds will know perfection."
—Elesh Norn

name: Griffin Protector
text:
"Here is a companion who will never falter, no matter how desperate the battle!"
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Avatar of Might
text: In their most desperate hour, the elves of Llanowar had one song left to sing.

name: Air Elemental
text: Where psycho meets cyclone.

name: War-Name Aspirant
text: No battle means more to a Mardu warrior than the one that earns her war name.

name: Rewind
text: "Let's go over this one more time. . . ."

name: Burnt Offering
text:
"My foes serve me twice: in dying, and in death."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Thaumatic Compass // Spires of Orazca
text:
". . . a cryptic objective."
—Jace Beleren

name: Evolving Wilds
text:
"What are ramparts, what are steeples, what are our machines worth in the teeth of this ceaseless hunger?"
—Magos Varnak

name: Dumb Ass
text: Envying the intelligence of goblins is a bad place to be.

name: Scroll of Fate
text:
"Our stories define our reality."
—Ugin

name: Sire of Stagnation
text: As the great scourge passed by, Zendikar shivered, then lay silent.

name: Descent of the Dragons
text: Dragons emerge from tempests fully formed and terribly hungry.

name: Harbin, Vanguard Aviator
text: "Yotia is my birthright, father. Let me fight for it."

name: Aegis of the Heavens
text: Inner strength is never seen until it makes all the difference.

name: Glacial Floodplain
text:
"A cliff once rose from the surf here—until Bjora Dawn-Greeter declared that it was blocking her view and pulled it down bare-handed."
—Iskene, Kannah storyteller

name: Feed the Infection
text: They wished to become vital parts of the Dross Pits. Azax-Azog granted their request.

name: Remorseful Cleric
text: A lifetime of keeping up appearances is not enough to earn an eternity of rest.

name: Mishra's Bauble
text:
"Arcum is a babbling fool! Phyrexian technology is our greatest blessing. Take this delightful trinket for instance . . ."
—Heidar, Rimewind master

name: Wild Aesthir
text:
"High in the Karplusans, death is swift and razor-clawed."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skycaptain

name: Pardic Swordsmith
text: A finely crafted blade will never meet as many blows on the battlefield as it did on the anvil.

name: Death's Caress
text: The faint smell of cloves, the rustling of the wind, and a paralyzing descent into an airless, fathomless tomb.

name: Skorpekh Destroyer
text: Nothing can override the hard-wired desire to kill that empowers these rage-driven Necrons.

name: Seed of Hope
text: Wrenn had given everything and asked for nothing. She deserved a monument, but rest in a quiet meadow is all she would've wanted.

name: Strength of Unity
text: All Dominarians agreed on one thing: they would not go down without a fight.

name: Lightbringer
text:
One thought opens a thousand eyes. One sun brings a thousand dawns.
—Lightbringer creed

name: Treetop Bracers
text: Gravity is truly what you make of it.

name: Lightning Bolt
text:
"Hasn't she heard of knocking?!"
—Snerd, Flaming Fist guard

name: Borrowing 100,000 Arrows
text: Kongming and Lu Su tricked Wei troops into shooting over 100,000 arrows at them to later use against the Wei at Red Cliffs.

name: Deathmark Prelate
text: Death is a secret he is willing to share.

name: Guildpact Informant
text: "Of course you're being followed!"

name: Noxious Assault
text: Even as they brought the beast down, they could feel its poison working into their blood, altering their bodies, and filling their minds with the thrill of the eternal hunt.

name: Glory-Bound Initiate
text:
"Fly as an arrow through the trials, and never waver in your course."
—Oketra, god of solidarity

name: Vault of Champions
text: Where victors are commemorated and moments of glory immortalized.

name: Timetwister
text: 2018 Asia Vintage Champion

name: Jungle Weaver
text: Weavers' webs wall off swaths of territory more effectively than any portcullis made of iron.

name: Stampede Rider
text: To a satyr, a stampede is just another kind of revelry.

name: Eastern Paladin
text:
"There is no worse enemy. His passion for death doesn't just border on insanity, it wallows in it."
—Southern paladin

name: Syncopate
text:
"Memories can't simply be washed away. The mind must be scrubbed clean."
—Ambassador Laquatus

name: Court Archers
text: The Sun-Dappled Court of Valeron stands secure behind a wall of steel-tipped arrows.

name: Wretched Camel
text: Perfectly adapted to cross the wastes in life, they bring the wastes with them in death.

name: Caustic Crawler
text: Novice explorers can mistake the acid-carved stone lairs for ancient ruins. They rarely survive to learn better.

name: Nest of Scarabs
text:
"They are small, but they always want more. Learn from them."
—Bontu, god of ambition

name: Bonders' Enclave
text: There is a sanctuary that reveals itself only to those graced by the *eludha*—the mystical connection between bonder and monster.

name: Leonin Squire
text:
"I may be kha, but without my soldiers, my people, I am nothing."
—Raksha Golden Cub

name: Artificer's Epiphany
text: The artificers of Kaladesh strive ceaselessly for perfection, progress, and the ultimate expression of elegance.

name: Stunt Double
text: No duelist is without equal in Paliano.

name: Tainted Monkey
text: "C'mon, choose 'monkey.' Everybody loves monkeys!"

name: Dwarven Soldier
text: There is a legend among present-day Dwarves that the Dwarves of Sarpadia will one day return to defend Dwarvenkind against a deadly peril.

name: Growing Rites of Itlimoc // Itlimoc, Cradle of the Sun
text: Before the Sun Empire was born, humans and merfolk joined their magic to invoke a blessing of fertility on the land.

name: Neutralize
text: On Ikoria, reactive magic can make the difference between barely grazed and really dead.

name: Pulse of the Tangle
text: Before predators or prey, there was life.

name: Trapjaw Tyrant
text:
"I would advise you not to struggle."
—Huatli

name: Tormented Pariah // Rampaging Werewolf
text: "Just look at him, groveling on all fours! What a pathetic—uh-oh."

name: Fallow Earth
text:
". . . and when the farmer awoke the next morning, all the seeds from his field were once again in their sacks."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Angel of Flight Alabaster
text: She endures without Avacyn but secretly asks each soul she guides if they have seen her.

name: Scrapyard Steelbreaker
text: "You've got about three seconds to get out of here before you get a faceful of metal."

name: Bishop of Wings
text: "Within every angel is a spirit of light that will fight as long as there is darkness."

name: Squallmonger
text: "Squall, gale, hurricane—it's all a matter of size . . . and price."

name: Wirewood Savage
text:
"She is truly Wirewood's child now."
—Elvish refugee

name: Mind Rake
text: Spells of madness often require a sacrifice of sanity.

name: Pithing Needle
text: Occasionally a skaab remembers too much of its former life. Luckily, there's an easy cure.

name: Savor the Moment
text: The merrow took a moment for herself. She never gave it back.

name: Choked Estuary
text: Centuries' worth of black iron lie beneath the soil of every Imperial world, their civilization built on never-ending strife.

name: Samut's Sprint
text: Samut's war was intensely personal. Every hour she faced enemies she once loved as friends and horrors she once revered as gods.

name: Mogis's Favor
text: Rage-crowned Mogis swiftly rewards the virtue of brutality.

name: Fiery Conclusion
text: The Boros legionnaire saw a noble sacrifice, the Rakdos thug a blazing suicide, and the Izzet alchemist an experiment gone awry.

name: Fellwar Stone
text:
Throw stones, and throw away the world.
—Dwarven proverb

name: The Abyss
text: "An immense river of oblivion is sweeping us away into a nameless abyss." —Ernest Renan, *Souvenirs d'Enfance et de Jeunesse*

name: Karlov of the Ghost Council
text: "Those who say money can't buy happiness clearly don't have enough."

name: Lurking Deadeye
text: "There's no roar so mighty that it can't be silenced."

name: Bloodstone Goblin
text: The stone whispers tales of darkness and fire. She replies, "Tell me more."

name: Stinging Shot
text: Initiates must train to resist the natural toxins they use as weapons.

name: Giant Spider
text: The welcoming appearance of the Arrow Bamboo Forest masks its deathly hostility.

name: Sacred White Deer
text: The pale deer are believed to have lived a thousand years, the pure white five hundred more. Those who seek them would gladly wander the wilds forever for the merest glimpse of these sacred beings.

name: Dewdrop Spy
text: Only in dew from Oona herself is there clarity enough to see a victim's mind.

name: Phyrexian Archivist
text: Silence quickly went from an annoying library rule to an imperative for survival.

name: Spell Pierce
text: A great wizard always has a few surprises up their sleeve.

name: Undead Minotaur
text:
"The work that went into creating this magnificent specimen. Horrific, deadly, well-balanced. Not all necromancers do elegant work like this."
—Lestin, necromancer

name: Sprite Dragon
text: ピクシー並みの体、ヘルカイト並みの怒り。

name: Faerie Miscreant
text: One faerie distracts the judge while a second steals the law.

name: Hold at Bay
text: It was Daeron's bravery that brought him to Odunos. But it was the magic of Meletis that brought him home.

name: Skirsdag Supplicant
text:
"I can no longer stand by as these Skirsdag infiltrators rot the church from within. Even the Lunarch Council is compromised. What a fool I've been."
—Odric

name: Horror of the Broken Lands
text: It feeds on dry bones in the sand and desperate pleas in the wind.

name: Curse of Verbosity
text: Idle chatter beckons many an attentive ear.

name: Amulet of Kroog
text: Among the first allies Urza gained were the people of Kroog. As a sign of friendship, Urza gave the healers of the city potent amulets; afterwards, thousands journeyed to Kroog in hope of healing, greatly adding to the city's glory.

name: Necroduality
text:
"Geralf's prowess continues to grow. He can now replicate my own creations with near-perfect accuracy."
—Ludevic's laboratory notes

name: Attended Healer
text: "My cats have taught me more about the sacred than anything in some old ruin."

name: Drown in Shapelessness
text: "From the swallows, I learned how to ride the winds to anywhere, and from my tears, I mastered how to harness the water."

name: Path of Peace
text:
"You could die famous or you could die old. I chose old."
—Former soldier

name: Razor Golem
text: The longer it stands among the deadly blades of the Razor Fields, the more it adopts their harsh exterior.

name: Ramosian Sergeant
text: Her commands are part rallying cry, part sermon, and wholly undeniable.

name: Weakstone
text: During the brothers' childhood, Tocasia took them to explore the sacred cave of Koilos. There, in the Hall of Tagsin, Mishra discovered the mysterious weakstone.

name: Pippa, Duchess of Dice
text: When it came to following her orders, it was do and die.

name: Extruder
text: As the invasion drew closer, Urza's means began to resemble Phyrexia's end.

name: Moonveil Dragon
text:
"Their hearts beat, their lungs draw breath, and they have one true form. I count them as allies of the living."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Deathgreeter
text: "The bones of allies grant wisdom. The bones of enemies grant strength. The bones of dragons grant life eternal."

name: Battle-Rattle Shaman
text: The shaman rattles not to inspire a battle fury but to drown out the shrieks of those fleeing the Eldrazi.

name: Vithian Renegades
text: "Here is the proof that what has been done may yet be undone. The hope we thought dead will be gloriously reborn."

name: Azure Drake
text: More so than "storm" or "pirate," "drake" is the word a sailor least wants to hear.

name: Leaf Gilder
text: Eidren, perfect of Lys Alana, ordered hundreds of trees uprooted and rearranged into a pattern he deemed beautiful. Thus the Gilt-Leaf Wood was born.

name: Blood Scrivener
text: Make sure you bleed the fine print.

name: Talrand, Sky Summoner
text: "The seas are vast, but the skies are even more so. Why be content with one kingdom when I can rule them both?"

name: Vodalian Soldiers
text:
"Vodalian Soldiers had some unique advantages. Often they would ride into battle on war machines rumored to have come from the far northern oceans."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. V*

name: Glacial Wall
text:
"We are farther west than any could have imagined possible, but I still wish to press on. Unfortunately, huge walls of ice block further travel. We can't believe they are natural."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Angler Drake
text: From the time they are hatchlings, river drakes are taught to pull the largest prey from the Luxa.

name: Fleshformer
text: Necromancers who discovered the new sources of mana were quick to dream up new nightmares with them.

name: Chariot of Victory
text: The greatest heroes are the first to stand, the first to take up arms, and the first to meet the enemy.

name: Rishadan Dockhand
text: It's not hard to find work in Rishada, so long as you've got a strong back and don't ask too many questions.

name: Union of the Third Path
text: Terisia City at last opened its ivory towers to all who sought respite from the endless war.

name: Gorilla Shaman
text:
"Each generation teaches the next that artifice is the enemy of natural order."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Grapple with the Past
text: Emrakul does not grant wishes. Desires simply align to her will.

name: Levitation
text: "We'll be easy targets if we remain on the ground. Let's take the fight to them."

name: Comparative Analysis
text:
"Our time grows short. If we wish to vanquish the Eldrazi, we must unlock the hedrons' secrets."
—Jace Beleren

name: Aether Burst
text: As fleeting as a cephalid's promise.

name: Flare
text: The secret of destruction is simple: everything burns.

name: In Oketra's Name
text:
"A single grain of sand is insignificant, but a sandstorm can reduce pyramids to dust. Stand with your crop. Become the storm."
—Oketra, god of solidarity

name: Expedite
text: "I run, and thunder follows."

name: Stromkirk Condemned
text:
"Blood from the vein is the finest vintage to accompany a feast of the mind."
—Runo Stromkirk

name: Mogg Cannon
text: Moggs never volunteer for anything twice.

name: Seek the Wilds
text: "In my downtime I used to paint the vistas. Now the vistas disappear faster than my downtime."

name: Orcish Veteran
text: Although models of courage for Orcs, the Veterans quickly learned to fear the swift justice of their Icatian enemies.

name: Platinum Angel
text:
"Adi Thandray's angel is a Priority One confiscation from the Fair. Once you see it, you'll understand why."
—Confiscation directive

name: Ground Seal
text:
"Let all we have buried be buried forever."
—Seton, centaur druid

name: Rise of Eagles
text: An offering to the sea brings an insight from the stars.

name: Wild Ox
text: It has the run of the swamps, and it knows it.

name: Drannith Magistrate
text: "Our sanctuaries must be beacons of reason and calm or else they will fall."

name: Behemoth's Herald
text: "Mine is an insatiable god, with appetites as magnificent as the jungle itself."

name: Darien, King of Kjeldor
text:
"With his dream of unification fulfilled, Darien became the last king of Kjeldor. Those who followed were known as the kings of New Argive."
—*Kjeldor: Ice Civilization*

name: Shocking Grasp
text: "Metal armor? A poor choice."

name: Sizzling Barrage
text:
"A thousand sparks can burn through your defenses just as quickly as one massive blaze."
—Attikar, Akoum elementalist

name: Evolving Wilds
text:
"Stensia blazes with new heat. Nephalia's tides are chaotic. And everywhere, this unnatural frost. The land is sending a warning."
—Katilda, Dawnhart Prime

name: Vodalian Mage
text:
"Vodalian Mages are remarkable. Their merchants bring them arcane lore and devices from across the seas."
—Lydia Wynforth, Mayor of Trokair

name: Clan Crafter
text: Trained by a dwarven master, you see the potential in every scrap of metal.

name: Colossal Dreadmaw
text:
"Remember when it was the most terrifying thing you'd ever seen?"
—Captain Lannery Storm

name: Infestation Expert // Infested Werewolf
text: There's only so many times she can take being asked . . .

name: Simic Initiate
text: Simic initiates begin their training as experimental subjects. Failures are flushed to the undersewers.

name: Nature's Lore
text: Every seed planted is another lesson the forest can teach us.

name: Cephalopod Sentry
text: Silent observers swim through the air of Norn's Seedcore, watching the nascent Invasion Tree for any signs of interference.

name: Silver-Inlaid Dagger
text: Magical etchings turned a whittler's tool into a wolfhunter's weapon.

name: Zhao Zilong, Tiger General
text: Zhao Zilong was a brave and noble warrior. Twice he rescued Liu Bei's son, Liu Shan.

name: Tibor and Lumia
text: Tracing the horizon in a dance of wind and fire.

name: Hand of Death
text: The touch of death is never gentle.

name: Oil-Gorger Troll
text: Metal or flesh, it didn't matter—seasoned with ichor, it all tasted so good.

name: Windwright Mage
text: She knows the names and secrets of each of Esper's twenty-three winds.

name: Grafted Identity
text: Autonomy is only skin deep.

name: Ball Lightning
text:
"Life, struck sharp on death,
Makes awful lightning."
—Elizabeth Barrett Browning,
"Aurora Leigh"

name: Ayula's Influence
text: Ayula's runic clawmarks ensure her territories are never left defenseless.

name: Jaded Sell-Sword
text: "Today? That'll cost you extra."

name: Confirm Suspicions
text: Everyone has something to hide.

name: Gnottvold Hermit // Chrome Host Hulk
text: The Hagi trolls stood little chance against Phyrexia, having killed everyone who came to Gnottvold to warn them.

name: Flood
text:
"A dash of cool water does wonders to clear a cluttered battlefield."
—Vibekke Ragnild, *Witches and War*

name: Sarcomite Myr
text:
"A horrible sight, yes, but the sounds . . . Its twanging tendons and grinding gears are almost musical."
—Brudiclad, Telchor engineer

name: Soratami Mirror-Mage
text: "The clouds obey my whims, and you'll obey theirs."

name: Veteran Soldier
text: You've always been happiest fighting for a cause you believe in alongside loyal comrades.

name: Done for the Day
text: Punchy was programmed to do two things: punch tickets and love punching tickets.

name: High Tide
text:
"May Svyelun's waves drown your memory."
—Traditional merfolk curse

name: Taste of Death
text:
"Hone the knife and mourn the least. Three chimes to sound the sweet, grim feast."
—Barrow witch incantation

name: Goblin Banneret
text: The Boros banner stands tall even if its bearer doesn't.

name: Scaled Wurm
text:
"Flourishing during the Ice Age, these wurms were the bane of all Kjeldorans. Their great size and ferocity made them the subject of countless nightmares—they embodied the worst of the Ice Age."
—*Kjeldor: Ice Civilization*

name: Feast of the Unicorn
text:
"Could there be a fouler act? No doubt the Baron knows of one."
—Autumn Willow

name: Ravenous Lindwurm
text:
"I'm no coward, but I'd sooner tangle with a rampaging Torga troll than a hungry lindwurm!"
—Yegar, Beskir warrior

name: Sheoldred, the Apocalypse
text: "Gix failed. I shall not."

name: Seal of Fire
text:
"I am the romancer, the passion that consumes the flesh."
—Seal inscription

name: Battering Craghorn
text: Their skeletons can be found all over Skirk Ridge, tangled in each other's horns.

name: Dusk Feaster
text: The Voldaren lands remained well protected when Olivia's army marched from Lurenbraum Fortress.

name: Haywire Mite
text:
"They're easy enough to squish, but they're a pain to wash out of a workbench."
—Tergel, goblin explosioneer

name: Freejam Regent
text: The dragons perching in Freejam's towers symbolize the zone's fierce independence.

name: Anarchy
text:
"The Shaman waved the staff, and the land itself went mad."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Revenant
text: Born from the slaughter of an entire army, it bears the wrath of a hundred souls.

name: A Display of My Dark Power
text: "What would you say is my greatest attribute? Is it my gluttonous lust for power?"

name: Second Thoughts
text: It suddenly dawned on Jorin that farming was quite a noble profession.

name: Game-Trail Changeling
text:
"I pity them, never knowing the pleasures of a single familiar form, but at least they find a noble shape at times."
—Desmera, perfect of Wren's Run

name: Wandering Tombshell
text: The crumbling temples on the tortoise's back are monuments to the decadence of the ancient Sultai. Though it harkens back to the era of the khans, Silumgar allows it to walk his territory as a warning to those who would oppose him.

name: Murasa Ranger
text: "If you're not prepared to fight, you'd best be prepared to die."

name: Living Destiny
text: "That our enemies are great only brings us greater hope."

name: Thran Dynamo
text: The power of the Arcane too often finds itself in the hands of those foolish enough to think themselves its master.

name: Wing Snare
text:
"We are the hands of the great trees, reaching out to ensnare what threatens their branches."
—Elvish hunter

name: Mulldrifter
text: "Be you, be free, live happily!"

name: Recruiter of the Guard
text: Before a cause can have supporters, it has to have a voice.

name: Time Warp
text:
"Chronomancers have a rather different definition of living in the moment."
—*The Millennium Tome*

name: Cat Warriors
text: These stealthy felines have survived so many battles that some believe they must possess many lives.

name: Blinding Fog
text: "I see you, shiny soldiers, but you won't see me."

name: Reckless Spite
text:
"My plan's elegance leads my enemies to believe it is spite that fuels me."
—Volrath

name: Day of Judgment
text:
"I have seen planes leveled and all life rendered to dust. It brought no pleasure, even to a heart as dark as mine."
—Sorin Markov

name: Desert Twister
text: Massive, mindless, and imbued with one terrible purpose.

name: Tarox Bladewing
text: Despising his siblings as insults to his line, he finds and devours each in turn.

name: Chandra's Flame Wave
text: "It's high tide."

name: Kindled Fury
text: The minotaur stared at the Eternal bearing down on him—the embodiment of deadly skill he had aspired to become.

name: Grove of the Burnwillows
text: Spring is the most beautiful season in the grove, when the new leaves open from their ember-buds in a race of leaping flames.

name: Haunted Mire
text: Some of the nature spirits and wraiths that haunt Urborg take offense at the term "ghost town."

name: Frostwalla
text: Glare from the snows in the boreal expanse hides its true size.

name: Challenger Troll
text: For most, war is a calamity. For some, an opportunity. And for the very few, a pleasure.

name: Cremate
text:
"Without a body, the soul is helpless to fight the terms of our contracts."
—Somhaur, Orzhov pontiff

name: Urgoros, the Empty One
text: As the phantom flies overhead, the city of Vhelnish screams in silence.

name: Boil
text: "When every reef is bared and every wave is dust—only then shall I rest."

name: Collected Company
text: Many can stand where one would fall.

name: Purify
text:
"We have no need for these trinkets. We need only the strength of our swords and the virtue of our hearts."
—The Northern Paladin

name: Keeper of Kookus
text: Wanted: Thick-skinned goblin for guarding mean ol' Kookus. Must like fires. Must heal quickly.

name: Revival Experiment
text: What goes into the vivipods never quite matches what comes out.

name: Llanowar Stalker
text: If you spot one elf in Llanowar, it's likely there's another with a knife at your back.

name: Selesnya Guildgate
text: Enter and rejoice! The Conclave stands united, open to one and all.

name: General's Enforcer
text: More stubborn than Drannith's walls.

name: Clever Lumimancer
text: "You're too dim to realize it, but you've already lost."

name: Brainstone
text: One day, it might provide a flash of insight that turns the tide of battle. Meanwhile, it looks lovely on an end table.

name: Relic of Progenitus
text: Elves believe the hydra-god Progenitus sleeps beneath Naya, feeding on forgotten magics.

name: Sacellum Godspeaker
text: Her connection to the gargantuans puts her in line to become Anima, a sacred but daunting duty.

name: Disallow
text:
"How easily your flames are quenched."
—Baral, Chief of Compliance

name: Spectral Force
text:
"The spirits of old have not left us unguarded."
—Uros, Pendelhaven elder

name: Royal Assassin
text: An assassin is a king's most trusted courier, ensuring his messages are heard by even the most unwilling recipients.

name: Labyrinth Champion
text: "It used to be a lair. Now it's just a tunnel."

name: Teferi's Protection
text: "I've walked a hundred worlds, but you are my universe."

name: Composite Golem
text: It binds the five suns in human form.

name: Aven Brigadier
text: He represents what little pride the Order has left.

name: Spell Blast
text: "Perhaps you could try throwing a rock? That might be better suited to your intellect."

name: Spiketail Drake
text: "The spell will have to wait," said Alexi, pointing up. "Drakes."

name: Sky Crier
text: "Breaking news! Lord Xander found dead! Suspect at large!"

name: Eerie Interlude
text: The barrier between existence and oblivion is thinner than you know.

name: Flesh Carver
text: "Just a taste?"

name: Shield Mate
text: They bear weightier burdens than the shields they carry.

name: Keldon Berserker
text: They fight beyond thought, beyond fear, and beyond mercy.

name: Herd Baloth
text: Baloth social structure is simple: the biggest one's the leader.

name: Lowland Tracker
text:
"I feed my hatred to the righteous and they join my crusade."
—Akroma, angelic avenger

name: Pia's Revolution
text: Pia's passion was directed at the big picture—at making real, lasting change.

name: Tajuru Blightblade
text: Ora Ondar, the Khalni Garden, is a lush tangle of growth in the harsh lands of Akoum. Its plant growth is marvelously diverse: a brilliant spectrum of vibrant life . . . and speedy death.

name: Reviving Melody
text: "Listen to my song, and you need never forge a golden mask to return to me."

name: Tormentor's Trident
text: To a demon there is no such thing as restraint.

name: Wretched Banquet
text:
"The meek inherit nothing."
—Sedris, the Traitor King

name: Stick Together
text: Every veteran adventurer will tell you to stick with your party, because the ones who split up aren't around to give advice.

name: Veteran's Reflexes
text: "Assume everything wants to kill you. At the very least, assume everything wants what's in your pack."

name: Master Skald
text: "All my scars have stories to tell."

name: Alloy Animist
text: "This metal belonged to Argoth before it was ripped from the ground. Now it belongs to Argoth again."

name: Law-Rune Enforcer
text:
"See that no one enters or leaves New Prahv today. And notify me at once of any Planeswalker activity."
—Dovin Baan

name: Valiant Knight
text: "Defeat is no reason for retreat. It is a sign we must redouble our efforts to win this fight."

name: Angelic Curator
text:
"Do not treat your people as you treat your artifacts. Let them go, and they will live; seal them here, and they will die."
—Urza, to Radiant

name: Lurking Nightstalker
text: The shadows know.

name: Reinforcements
text:
"We aided the Balduvians once before. They need but ask and we shall do so again."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

name: Odric's Outrider
text: Terms like "safe route" and "cleared district" are a source of dark humor to the cathars who patrol the ruins of Thraben.

name: Sculpting Steel
text: Necrodermis, the living metal from which all Necrons are made, is endlessly adaptive.

name: Azami, Lady of Scrolls
text:
"Choices belong to those with the luxuries of time and distance. We have neither. I recommend we proceed with the plan to destroy all shrines of the kami."
—Lady Azami, letter to Sensei Hisoka

name: Crystal Dragon // Rob the Hoard
text:
"Wait, it was just guarding a bunch of eggs! Where is the treasure?"
—Xalcorin the bard

name: Blood Pet
text: "You are wrong," Volrath said. "I do not hate the living. They often prove quite useful to me." And then he laughed.

name: Agoraphobia
text: "Everyone in this city is choosing sides. I choose inside."

name: Burning-Fist Minotaur
text: "There is no afterlife. Not for me, and not for you. So think again before getting in my way."

name: Vicious Rumors
text:
"The alliances were already frayed. All we do is find the loose threads and pluck."
—Lazav

name: Essence Scatter
text: Some wizards compete not to summon the most interesting creatures, but to create the most interesting aftereffects when a summons goes awry.

name: Seedborn Muse
text:
"The land echoes our intentions, and the kami echo the land. We must strive to live in harmony with the world even when it seems to rise against us."
—Diary of Azusa

name: Peach Garden Oath
text:
"We three, though of separate ancestry, join in brotherhood. . . . We dare not hope to be together always but hereby vow to die the selfsame day."
—Peach Garden Oath

name: Prismari Campus
text: Mage-students who see spellcraft as the highest form of expression choose Prismari, the college of elemental arts.

name: Pious Warrior
text: The Cho-Arrim make no distinction between healers and soldiers.

name: Blatant Thievery
text: "I'll leave subtlety to the rich."

name: Aboshan, Cephalid Emperor
text: "No one can fight the tide forever."

name: Chatterstorm
text:
"Friends, foragers, fuzzy fighters! Tonight we're after more than just acorns!"
—Larrel, Deep Forest hermit

name: Hunting Triad
text: "Eyeblights are easy to track. Just follow the imperfections."

name: Fiery Hellhound
text:
"I had hoped to instill in it the loyalty of a guard dog, but with fire's power comes its unpredictability."
—Maggath, Sardian elementalist

name: Rukh Egg
text: Called "stonefeathers" by many lowlanders, rukhs are thought to descend from a phoenix that sacrificed its flame for a body of stone.

name: Zof Shade
text: Shades are drawn to places of power, often rooting themselves in a single area to feed.

name: Battlefly Swarm
text: Having encountered the bitter Phyrexian battleflies before, Squee knew not to bother eating them—or at least to stop after the fifth.

name: Ember Gale
text:
"Terrible wind. It whipped sparks into our skin, then stoked them even hotter!"
—Bowen, Barrenton guardcaptain

name: Spectral Lynx
text: A shadowy version of its corporeal cousin, this lynx hunts souls, not meals.

name: Luminarch Aspirant
text: "Rally to my light, and together we will drive out this darkness!"

name: Tazeem Roilmage
text: "The Roil can be directed. Observe."

name: Fend Off
text: The best defense is to not get hit.

name: Kraul Foragers
text:
Feed on food, you eventually rot. Feed on rot, you live forever.
—Kraul saying

name: Equestrian Skill
text: From the jagged peaks of Stensia, to the tangled woods of Kessig, to the bogs of Nephalia, the Gavony Riders prepare for all terrain.

name: Invasion of New Capenna // Holy Frazzle-Cannon
text:
"They're using my Halo stockpile for what?"
—Jetmir

name: Kor Sky Climber
text: "With rope, I can fly as far as the rope can reach. But with light, the sky is the limit."

name: King Cheetah
text:
If you find yourself and a friend being chased by a king cheetah, you have but one chance: Trip your friend.
—Suq'Ata wisdom

name: Grafted Skullcap
text:
"Let go your mind. Mine is fitter."
—Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

name: Capashen Knight
