text: Don't venture into the darkness, lest it decide not to let you leave.

name: Gleam of Battle
text: Every soldier returns from battle changed: by hardship, by blood, by a glimpse of glory.

name: Angelic Blessing
text: The man who rose up to fight was not the same man knocked down.

name: Talruum Minotaur
text:
Don't insult a Talruum unless your mount is swift.
—Suq'Ata saying

name: Pack Attack
text: Kobold tactics rarely account for little things like diplomacy, mercy, or surrender.

name: Vampires' Vengeance
text: She was ghastly, chalkily pale; the red seemed to have gone even from her lips and gums, and the bones of her face stood out prominently; her breathing was painful to see or hear.

name: Rebuking Ceremony
text: From the Radix at the hub of the Tangle all the way out to the Edges of Forgetting, a Viridian elf's life is built around the temporary.

name: Exchange of Words
text: Before criticizing, walk a mile *(about 1.6 kilometers)* in their head. That way, when you do, you're a mile away and you have their head.

name: Vengeful Firebrand
text: The flame of a warrior is never extinguished.

name: Chrome Prowler
text: It can catch a rat and perform a spinal tap with one graceful swipe of its paw.

name: Cathar's Call
text: Some cathars succumbed to despair at Avacyn's unmaking. The rest redoubled their efforts to carry out her work.

name: Citanul Hierophants
text: From deep in the caves beneath the forest, the hierophants planned the druids' raids against the enemy.

name: Enslaved Scout
text:
"Even the basest creatures may serve a purpose. Still, their lives need be only as long as the paths we tread."
—General Varchild

name: Doom Whisperer
text: The sound of every twisted secret tempts you to hear another.

name: Dark Deal
text: The first khans of the Sultai relied on the magic of the rakshasa to ensure the survival of the clan.

name: Canker Abomination
text: Once the hideous disease takes hold, it spreads through both bark and mind.

name: Kykar, Wind's Fury
text: "The raging gale fans the flames of righteous wrath."

name: Reconstruction
text: Tedious research made the Sages of the College of Lat-Nam adept in repairing broken artifacts.

name: Sunlance
text:
"It's easy for the innocent to speak of justice. They seldom feel its terrible power."
—Orim, Samite inquisitor

name: Parting Thoughts
text:
"To spend your life seeking, only to find regret upon achieving . . . this is the most delicious irony of all."
—Leshrac, Walker of Night

name: Siege Veteran
text: "Steady, recruit. We fight in the light of justice. We cast no shadow."

name: Heronblade Elite
text: "When angels fall, humans must rise."

name: Loxodon Mystic
text: Elder mystics take their vow of silence so seriously that they impose it on any who enter their presence.

name: Angelic Chorus
text: The harmony of the glorious is a dirge to the wicked.

name: Test of Faith
text: Those who survive the test bear a mark of power anyone can recognize.

name: Servo Exhibition
text: Impressing a judge is one thing. Delighting a child is another.

name: Brindle Shoat
text: Hunters lure the stripling boar into the open, hoping to trap greater prey.

name: Mindslicer
text: It *is* the thing that goes bump in the night.

name: Vernal Bloom
text: Many cultures have legends of a lush, hidden paradise. The elves of Argoth had no need of such stories.

name: Enlightened Maniac
text: "At last! Proof that it's not all in my head!"

name: Tethered Skirge
text: It bites the hand that leads it.

name: Yuan-Ti Malison
text: Silent. Slithering. Sinister.

name: Spring of Eternal Peace
text: Bathing in this spring could cure ailments of body and mind alike.

name: I Delight in Your Convulsions
text: "I can't imagine what you're feeling right now, but I'll try my best."

name: Mana Drain
text: Enthusiasm is no match for preparation.

name: Blood Crypt
text: Vampires invited to a soiree at Markov Manor are expected to bring a guest or refreshments—or both.

name: Gnarled Effigy
text:
"Bits of fallen scarecrow, laces of elfskin leather, teeth of an axeshark merrow . . . An industrious soul can find new uses for the most mundane items."
—Mowagh the Gwyllion

name: Gitaxian Raptor
text: Bored with the ruins of Lumengrid, it migrated to the ruins of the Mephidross.

name: Five-Finger Discount
text: "Dognapping is such an ugly word. I would characterize this as a unilateral redistribution of pets."

name: Echo of Eons
text: The present is a matter of perspective.

name: Invasion of Theros // Ephara, Ever-Sheltering
text: When the sun falters and the seas disperse, when the wilds wither and the forges go cold, when death itself succumbs, she endures.

name: Blade Splicer
text: "Flesh is a betrayal of the self."

name: Deepwood Wolverine
text: The jhovalls are depleting its food sources, the Mercadians are eroding its home, and you're wondering why it's angry?

name: Cosmotronic Wave
text: "This sort of innovation occurs when you set out to improve an electric tea kettle and misplace a decimal."

name: Plummet
text: An arrow from Nylea's bow never fails to find its mark.

name: Shadowcloak Vampire
text: "My favorite guilty pleasure? Are there innocent ones?"

name: Wasteland
text: 2021 Legacy Champion

name: Viridian Scout
text: They know a hoverguard's only blind spot is directly above it.

name: Witch's Familiar
text: Some bog witches practice the strange art of batrachomancy, reading portents in the number, size, and color of warts on a toad's hide.

name: Brilliant Ultimatum
text: Revealing the truth only deepened Tezzeret's curiosity for the secrets still buried.

name: Unyielding Krumar
text: "The man whom I call father killed the orc who sired me, offering his world and his blade in return."

name: Stamp of Approval
text: A truly symbolic advantage.

name: Brimstone Volley
text: Peace had failed. War had failed. There was only one option left.

name: Mahamoti Djinn
text: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

name: Balthor the Defiled
text: He was once one of the mightiest pit fighters alive. That description is still mostly accurate.

name: Kingfisher
text: It's tastiest when served with the fish it stole.

name: Wirefly Hive
text:
"The lifespan of a wirefly can be precisely described as 'short.'"
—Bruenna, Neurok leader

name: Ordered Migration
text: "Birds reach all parts of the world," said Barrin. "They will make excellent scouts."

name: Sword of Truth and Justice
text:
"'The name of it,' said the lady, 'is Excalibur.'"
—Sir Thomas Malory, *Le Morte d'Arthur*

name: Aethergeode Miner
text: Gremlins in the wild feed on nodules of pure aether, which are also prized by miners.

name: Terminate
text: Like his mother before him, Darigaaz gave his life defending Dominaria from the tyranny of self-styled "gods."

name: Disenchant
text:
"The tools of evil are mere things. And like all things, they cannot last forever."
—*Song of All*, canto 881

name: Dusk Legion Dreadnought
text: It loomed up over the horizon, silent and dark as a grave.

name: Mind Stone
text:
"What is mana but possibility, an idea not yet given form?"
—Jhoira, master artificer

name: Pyre Spawn
text: Memories of the Harvesttide tragedy festered until they grew into an incarnate rage that set the world ablaze.

name: Glorious Enforcer
text: "You are unworthy of life, but take heart. You have earned a clean death."

name: Assquatch
text: Who wants to see a picture of a big hairy ass?

name: Secret Base
text: For the Goblin Explosioneers, there's no crater like home.

name: Temur Sabertooth
text:
"Kind of a glorified house cat, don't you think? Cool tattoos, though."
—Crocodile Jackson, legendary cowboy

name: Lazotep Chancellor
text: Mood: We will conquer you.

name: Fighting Drake
text: Two things are needed to survive the harsh skies of Rath: a thick hide and a thicker skull.

name: Dire Wolf Prowler
text: Large as horses, dire wolves must hunt often to satisfy thier ravenous hunger. A mere human does little more than blunt their appetite.

name: Goblin Hero
text: When you're a goblin, you don't have to step forward to be a hero—everyone else just has to step back.

name: Talus Paladin
text: "Why fill pockets with gold when you can fill hearts with conviction?"

name: Soot Imp
text:
"If one gets in your chimney, you're going to need a long wick and a barrel of bangstuff to get it out."
—Hob Heddil

name: Scourge Servant
text:
"The union of the oil and necrogen has produced many pleasing reactions."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Bladegriff Prototype
text: The new model has improved aerodynamics but introduced a few glitches in the targeting system.

name: Korlessa, Scale Singer
text: "Would you like a song of wing-wind and fire, or one of gentle heartbeats atop a golden hoard?"

name: Herald of Secret Streams
text: "You might as well try to stop the waterfall."

name: Helldozer
text: Sometimes you go to hell, and sometimes hell comes to you.

name: Court Homunculus
text: Mages of Esper measure their wealth and status by the number of servants in their retinues.

name: Revoke Existence
text:
"The time has come for us to throw off the chains of tyrannical gods and antiquated superstitions."
—Tikaia, disciple of Uremides

name: Choking Fumes
text:
"Fall to your knees and welcome our embrace."
—Qal-Sha, Priest of Norn

name: Facevaulter
text: Boggarts get so excited when they find something new to smash that they really don't notice who gets underfoot.

name: Involuntary Cooldown
text:
"Back to the ivory towers! This won't hold for long!"
—Vayor, Third Path cryomancer

name: Bouncing Beebles
text: Beebles are frequently hurled against stone surfaces at high speed but always zing back into the air with a giggle.

name: Thousand-Year Storm
text: Ral's storm crackled with mystical detections: Planeswalkers were infiltrating Ravnica.

name: Yavimaya Wurm
text: Anywhere else, colossal. In the forests of Yavimaya, commonplace.

name: Pressure Point
text: Everything has an off switch.

name: Ambitious Dragonborn
text: The raging green dragon left destruction—and at least one admirer—in its wake.

name: Lightning Blast
text:
"I'll climb down soon. Don't worry, it's just a thundersto—"
—Former elvish scout

name: Replenish
text: Treasures, trinkets, trash—the relics of the past are brought forth again.

name: Banshee
text: Some say Banshees are the hounds of Death, baying to herd their prey into the arms of their master.

name: Tree of Perdition
text:
"Trees are to be venerated and protected . . . except that one."
—Marel, Dawnhart witch

name: Setessan Starbreaker
text: "Who says you cannot touch the stars?"

name: Gadwick, the Wizened
text: His name is spoken only in whispers—but he hears just the same.

name: Silverquill Apprentice
text: She had spoken the words a hundred times, but under the spotlight, in front of everyone, something new emerged. And the crowd went wild.

name: Waterfall Aerialist
text: Form and function in perfect unity.

name: Elder Druid
text: "I may seem wise to you, but I'm merely a sapling among mighty oaks."

name: Bloom Hulk
text:
"Tread upon these flower beds at your own peril."
—Emmara

name: Incendiary Flow
text:
"What's your plan?" Gideon asked.
"Are you serious?" Chandra replied.

name: Embereth Paladin
text: "The king would die for the realm. I would not hesitate to do the same for him."

name: Brine Elemental
text: Water calls to water, and the world is left exhausted and withered in its wake.

name: Sejiri Shelter // Sejiri Glacier
text:
"It blocks the windswept salt and frigid air, but the loneliness of Sejiri remains."
—Enwor, Sea Gate Expeditionary House

name: Mass Production
text:
"I need an army, not a masterpiece. Accelerate output, whatever it takes."
—Urza, notes to his engineers

name: Kraken Hatchling
text: A spike and a maul are needed to crack their shells, but the taste is worth the effort.

name: Yavimaya Ancients
text:
"The Ancients teach us that if we can but last, we shall prevail."
—Kaysa,
elder druid of the Juniper Order

name: Spellseeker
text: "Want to know your future? Just three mana!"

name: Bond of Discipline
text: "We agree that order benefits everyone, but not until you enforce it."

name: Hydroblast
text:
"Heed the lessons of our time: the forms of water may move the land itself and hold captive the fires within."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran Royal Mage

name: Owlbear Shepherd
text: When your pack is nowhere to be found, you form a new one.

name: Syndic of Tithes
text:
"Entrance is free. Donations are required."
—Notice outside Vizkopa Bank

name: Words of Wind
text:
"Be logical in all things. Do not allow instinct or passion to cloud your mind."
—*Volume II, The Book of Insight*

name: Senate Griffin
text:
"The Senate griffins overhead used to make people think of order and safety. Not anymore."
—Lavinia

name: Captain of the Mists
text: "I am no mere ship's captain. The north wind is my accomplice. The tide is my first mate."

name: Shining Aerosaur
text:
"The invaders cloak themselves in the shadows of dusk. Aerosaurs hide in the brilliance of the noonday sun."
—Caparocti Sunborn

name: Whisk Away
text: The maneuvers of the Abzan formation intrigued Ojutai in both their complexity and their futility.

name: Temporal Machinations
text: The Cabal soldier blinked and found day had become night, he had a face full of thistle seeds, and the old man was nowhere to be seen.

name: Ironshell Beetle
text:
"Please don't feed the beetles."
—Promenade warning sign

name: Lairwatch Giant
text: A giant can brood over a grudge for decades, and woe to those who interrupt him.

name: Goblin War Strike
text: "Fire, aim, ready!"

name: Shock
text:
"I love lightning! It's my best invention since the rock."
—Toggo, goblin weaponsmith

name: Lorthos, the Tidemaker
text: When Lorthos emerges from his deepwater realm, the tides bow to his will and the coastline cowers in his presence.

name: Rite of Ruin
text: Skirsdag cultists refused to quietly accept Avacyn's ascendancy.

name: Leonin Skyhunter
text: The skyhunters were born when the first leonin gazed at the heavens and wished to hunt the birds overhead.

name: Dehydration
text:
"Cry to the sun and watch as even your tears forsake you."
—Acolyte of Marit Lage

name: Quarum Trench Gnomes
text:
"O Great Captain, all is lost. They tunneled, they burrowed, they trenched. They sapped the strength of our defenses."
—Sorgus, *Chronicles of the Quarum Plains*

name: Brown Ouphe
text:
"Ouphes love trinkets and love to take them apart. I only wish they wouldn't do so with the magical ones."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Thraben Gargoyle // Stonewing Antagonizer
text: Runechanters engrave their strongest wards on those that protect the church.

name: Foratog
text: Five hundred years to grow—barely a minute to eat.

name: Balm of Restoration
text:
"Not all armies enjoyed the services of a medic. For them, Balm of Restoration was that much more valuable."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. I*

name: Rootwater Mystic
text:
"Read the roots tell the tale
Future forms in waving weeds
Higher than truth is hope."
—*Rootwater Saga*

name: Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker
text: "Wanna see a neat trick?"

name: Phyrexian Revoker
text: Basic senses like sight and taste are reserved for those in power.

name: Gaddock Teeg
text: So great are his wisdom and spirit that many who have met him say that they stood before a giant of a man and talked to the wisest of the four winds.

name: Seasoned Tactician
text:
"The benefits of peace far outweigh the pride of Generals."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

name: Howlpack Wolf
text: Wolves and werewolves join together for the common cause of the hunt.

name: Temple of the False God
text:
"When gods become apathetic, the people will worship anyone who answers their pleas."
—Kiora

name: Jade Avenger
text:
"Froggy fighter at the gate.
Draw your sword and meet your fate."
—Traditional children's rhyme

name: Slaughter Singer
text: After giving in to the thrill of the hunt, he could never again return to the quiet of the Basilica.

name: Ritual of the Machine
text:
"Rumors persist of dark deeds performed in the depths of Soldev. When will Dagsson heed the danger therein?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Flay Essence
text:
"Your argument as to why I should spare you lacked substance. Now, so do you."
—Geyadrone Dihada

name: Swarmyard
text: Where scavengers nest in hollowed-out rib cages and chittering crawlers peer from empty eye sockets, few dare to trespass.

name: Merfolk Raiders
text:
"Turn your back for a second and they just vanish! As if they weren't shifty enough before."
—Rhirhok, goblin archer

name: Concordant Crossroads
text:
"Realms emerge and wither like autumn leaves, but the World Tree endures eternally."
—Esika, god of the Tree

name: Reduce in Stature
text: A dragon learns humility only in the moments before its death.

name: Telekinetic Bonds
text:
"Nature's been fired. The oceans are under new management."
—Ambassador Laquatus

name: Ondu Greathorn
text:
"May your horns get lodged in an Eldrazi's bony face, ornery brute!"
—Bruse Tarl, Goma Fada nomad

name: Reito Lantern
text: Lanterns carved from the mystic stones of the Reito Mines were said to light the way of lost souls.

name: Autumn's Veil
text: The rustling of leaves and a passing shadow are a dryad's only trace.

name: Ghastly Demise
text:
"Anyone can snap her fingers and yank a soul. I prefer to kill creatively."
—Braids, dementia summoner

name: Whitewater Naiads
text: Stand against the crash of the river's rapids and you will know the power of the naiads.

name: Longbow Archer
text: Some say they have the blood of hawks running through their veins.

name: Silverchase Fox
text:
"Be careful in your hunt. The clever little creature can steal your wards and lead you right into the werewolf's den."
—Britta, midwife of Gatstaf

name: Bulwark Giant
text:
"Where did *she* come from? More importantly, are there more like her?"
—Gideon Jura

name: Vesper Ghoul
text:
"Nature's exceptions remind us not to think in absolutes. Just as the orchid blossoms on blackened stone, so does the gift of mana occasionally manifest in the undead."
—Bougrat, druid of the Cult of Yore

name: Demonic Bargain
text:
"Do not try to negotiate with me, human. You want power? This is the price."
—Ormendahl

name: Katabatic Winds
text: Wind will win, whatever we wish.

name: Selhoff Entomber
text: It knows one fundamental truth: bodies belong in graves.

name: Archfiend of Depravity
text: "Why would I kill you all? Who then would be left to worship me?"

name: Orcish Lumberjack
text:
"Wood is wasted in the dirt."
—Orcish proverb

name: Glimmerdust Nap
text: The dreams of giants are as long as time and as deep as the earth. Thus they are prized by the dream-harvesting fae.

name: Natural Spring
text: Though many have come to this place to wash their wounds, the water has never turned red.

name: Gateway Plaza
text: The Chamber of the Guildpact stands as a reminder that even the bitterest struggles can end in cooperation.

name: Vine Mare
text: When it passes, the dead are displaced by flourishing life.

name: Sword of the Animist
text: The blade glows only for Zendikar's chosen.

name: Wicked Akuba
text: The sound of children weeping is a song that fills its heart with joy.

name: Duskfang Mentor
text: "What she sees, I see. What she tastes, I taste."

name: Ritual Guardian
text: "By ancient magics, by angels' grace, we will survive this night."

name: Somnomancer
text: "Are you tired? You look tired."

name: Prahv, Spires of Order
text: Prahv, where much work is done to make sure nothing is accomplished.

name: Overgrown Farmland
text: A few weed-choked gourd patches are all that remain of the proud, thriving farms that once blanketed the province.

name: Cornered Market
text:
Don't step on the livelihood of other vendors, or they may step on you.
—Mercadian saying

name: Coral Merfolk
text: Merfolk are best known for their subtle magic. But those who try to fight them in their own territory quickly realize that merfolk are hardly defenseless on the field of battle.

name: Zap
text: "All this time I thought Squee was useless," chuckled Sisay. "Who knew he'd be such a good shot?"

name: Territorial Hammerskull
text: From the eyes up, it's solid bone and stubbornness.

name: River Darter
text:
"Don't make splashes. Make progress."
—Tishana

name: Street Savvy
text: "It takes more than swift feet and dark shadows to slip by me unnoticed."

name: Untamed Hunger
text:
"Mindlessness is not weakness. When we are lost to hunger we are unstoppable."
—Drana, Kalastria bloodchief

name: Subjugator Angel
text: The remnants of Innistrad's corrupted angelic hosts collapsed to form the Flight of Nightmares.

name: Taniwha
text:
"Taniwha rolls in its sleep, and the land is awash with the waves."
—Poetics of Hanan

name: Baird, Steward of Argive
text: "The walls of Argive were built by a peaceful dynastic union that has guarded us against war for fifteen centuries. The lesson is clear."

name: Rhystic Study
text:
"I believe I've discovered something truly incredible: a way to harness magic through science!"
—Jayce Talis

name: Eyes of the Wisent
text:
Calm as a wisent's watch
—Elvish expression meaning "safe"

name: Sootwalkers
text: "Why allow the fires of others to burn, when ours do not? Why leave them content, while we suffer? If there is to be misery, let it be borne by all."

name: Artifact Mutation
text:
"From shards and splinters I call forth my living horde."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Double Cleave
text: "When in doubt, kill 'em twice."

name: Needle Storm
text: The rain is driven like nails.

name: Mistfolk
text:
"Although my official log will state there is no evidence pointing to the existence of the Mistfolk, my certainty is lessened by the cursed consistency of the expedition's eyewitness accounts."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Prized Statue
text: To the cultists, the sacred idol was priceless. To the adventurers, it was worth about two sturdy mules and a barrel of ale.

name: _____ _____ _____ Trespasser
text: "All you gotta do is walk with purpose. And run with purpose. And clear a five-foot gate with purpose."

name: Goblin War Drums
text: The War Drums enabled Goblin and Orcish armies to crush the sparsely defended Dwarven cities.

name: Sorcerer's Broom
text:
"Reynald wished for an army to sweep away his enemies. The fae king smiled."
—*Beyond the Great Henge*

name: Harvesttide Sentry
text: She patrols the darkness so that others can forget their worries for one bright evening.

name: Rapacious Dragon
text: It wasn't the first time the dragon's hoard had attracted a free lunch.

name: Draconian Cylix
text:
"There is no gain without sacrifice."
—Icatian proverb

name: Giant Adephage
text:
"To a creature like that, we must seem like, well, bugs."
—Dars Gostok, Firefist captain

name: Pathbreaker Ibex
text:
"Not only a wrecking ball, but a trendsetter in its own right."
—Crocodile Jackson, legendary cowboy

name: Kindled Fury
text: The only thing better than hitting hard is hitting first.

name: Pillarfield Ox
text:
"You old, immobile clod! If I could stuff your doltish head with knowledge, I'd do it just so someone else could fully comprehend what your stubbornness has cost me!"
—Bruse Tarl, Goma Fada nomad

name: Naturalize
text:
"Well, it also makes a very nice flower pot. . . ."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

name: Urza's Workshop
text: Urza eventually came to understand Tocasia's lessons on clarity of purpose. Perfection became his goal, and all other matters fell away in its pursuit.

name: Soothing Balm
text: Orim taught Ta-Karnst and the other Cho-Arrim healers a far less invasive method of healing.

name: Ghoulraiser
text:
"Come. Bring your brothers. Tonight, you feast on living flesh."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

name: Malevolent Hermit // Benevolent Geist
text: All his old grudges suddenly seemed laughably petty. So he laughed.

name: Drop Tower
text: The hardest working seat belts in the park.

name: Legacy Weapon
text: In a single blinding flash, Yawgmoth was obliterated, and Urza could finally rest.

name: Eidolon of the Great Revel
text:
"Nothing like a bit of arson to really get the party started."
—Xenagos, the Reveler

name: Ainok Artillerist
text:
"In the Tarkir I once knew, the Abzan revered their ancestor trees. Now, as Dromoka, they cut their finest groves to make weapons."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Voracious Greatshark
text: There is no boat big enough.

name: Piety
text:
"Whoever obeys God and His Prophet, fears God and does his duty to Him, will surely find success."
—*The Qur'an, 24:52*

name: Clairvoyance
text:
"As we followed the ice wall, we had the distinct feeling of being watched. Many of the party wanted to turn back."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Super Secret Tech
text: "Ooh . . . shiny!"

name: Birds of Paradise
text:
"The gods used their feathers to paint all the colors of the world."
—Yare-Tiva, warden of Gramur Forest

name: Wing Splicer
text: "Progress is our great inheritance, perfection our ultimate destination."

name: Loxodon Gatekeeper
text: The gatekeepers are so fastidious that even the winds must wait to pass.

name: Dregs of Sorrow
text:
"We live for a thousand years. The death of even one brings untold sorrow."
—Elvish elder

name: Thirst for Meaning
text: A sip of recollection, an ocean of regrets.

name: Surgeon General Commander
text: Likes: augmentation, fluffy animals, creative templating.

name: Marching Duodrone
text: "One-two! One-two! One-two! One-two!"

name: Juniper Order Ranger
text: To protect the alliance between Kjeldor and Yavimaya, they trained in the ways of both.

name: Skyblinder Staff
text: "If bats are the only thing between me and a mountain of Orzhov coins, then I'm about to be a very rich thief."

name: Shimmer
text:
To buy unseen land, pay in unseen coin.
—Suq'Ata maxim

name: Clear Shot
text: As werewolf attacks increased, brutal weapons not seen since the Travails were dusted off and put to work.

name: Extremely Slow Zombie
text: . . . aaaaaaiiii . . .

name: Depopulate
text: No screams rang out. No blood stained the streets. In an instant, the bustling metropolis simply fell silent.

name: Sublime Exhalation
text: Exhale, and let the winds carry your soul for all eternity.

name: Thespian's Stage
text: Amid rumors of war, the third act of *The Absolution of the Guildpact* was quickly rewritten as a tragedy.

name: Veteran Swordsmith
text: "Truth is a straight, keen edge. There are no soft angles or rounded edges. To fight for truth, we must forge in steel."

name: Sculptor of Winter
text: "I and my kin remember the old ways. The frost whispers to me in a language too ancient for the Skoti usurpers to comprehend."

name: Nested Shambler
text: Home is where the heart was.

name: Walking Desecration
text: Such sacrilege turns blinding grief into blinding rage.

name: Painter's Servant
text: It gathers hues from the twilight mist so that its master can paint a better world.

name: Dromoka Warrior
text: Dromoka has regard for the humans who serve under her. In return for her protection, they obey with steadfast loyalty, acting as weapons for her and her scalelords against the other clans.

name: Angus Mackenzie
text:
"Battles no longer served a purpose in Karakas."
—Angus Mackenzie, Diary

name: Psychic Trance
text: The Riptide Project was perhaps the only school devoted to preventing the spread of knowledge.

name: Lost Soul
text: She walks in the twilight, her steps make no sound,/ Her feet leave no tracks on the dew-covered ground./ Her hand gently beckons, she whispers your name—/ But those who go with her are never the same.

name: Sedraxis Alchemist
text: The problem with a liquid that can dissolve anything is finding something to carry it in.

name: Thrill of Possibility
text:
"If the prospect of what could be doesn't electrify you to your core, why attend Strixhaven at all?"
—Nassari, Prismari dean

name: Pious Interdiction
text: "Ours is the true and righteous path. You will bow before our might."

name: Smash
text:
"They're ugly, and they're in my way."
—Tahngarth

name: Boon of Erebos
text:
"Death is not a certainty. Erebos determines when a mortal's time is up."
—Iadorna, death priest of Erebos

name: Locust Swarm
text: Better a fierce thunderhead than a sky filled with locusts.

name: Doom Blade
text:
「天使は太陽のように輝き、弱者を鼓舞し、暗闇を脅かし勝利を手にすることできる。しかし、結局そんなことは重要ではない。それでも最後は他の害虫と同じように死ぬのだから。」
——オブ・ニクシリス

name: Uncaged Fury
text:
"It's right to fear those that you keep locked away."
—Rahilda, Vildin-Pack alpha

name: Vile Manifestation
text: The glyphs writhed and twisted, spewing out dark, vengeful magic.

name: Thought Reflection
text: Only when two oracles speak in unison is an omen accepted as truth.

name: Close Quarters
text: The Mercadians' ineptitude in close combat sometimes accidentally pays off.

name: Goblin Assault Team
text: Under the veneer of the various guilds, each goblin has the same basic need: to run screaming at the enemy and hit a bunch of stuff.

name: Fortunate Few
text: "... Is it over?"

name: Talas Researcher
text: From time, knowledge. From knowledge, power.

name: Platinum Angel
text: On shining argent wings she came, declaring that no harm would befall her charge.

name: Multani's Decree
text:
"This is my place of power. Nothing can take root here unless I allow it."
—Multani, maro-sorcerer

name: Zendikar Incarnate
text:
"Her people angered Zendikar, and they faced the land's wrath. That is why Nissa is the last of the animists."
—Numa, Joraga chieftain

name: Pterodon Knight
text: "To rise like the sun—there is no greater feeling."

name: Brawn
text:
"'I have arrived,' bellowed Brawn, and the plane shuddered."
—*Scroll of Beginnings*

name: Ominous Parcel
text: The rest of Anhelo's assistant arrived over the following week.

name: Krosan Beast
text: Those who see the squirrels go underground in the winter aren't ready for what emerges in the spring.

name: Kobold Taskmaster
text: The taskmaster knows that there is no cure for the common kobold.

name: Faithbearer Paladin
text:
"I've seen cathars riding to battle without a hint of fear. Perhaps that is its own sort of madness."
—Esler, Havengul mercenary

name: Summer Bloom
text: "All the treasures of this world are grown, not made."

name: Citanul Druid
text: Driven mad by the fall of Argoth, the Citanul Druids found peace only in battle.

name: Clown Extruder
text: One day, it will produce a clown that can itself produce a clown. Until that day, it will not rest.

name: Acrobatic Maneuver
text: Renegades find ever more creative ways to work around the Consulate's aether regulations.

name: Nishoba Brawler
text: Though native to cold climates, the nishoba have adapted to more temperate environments since the Ice Age ended.

name: Ogre Slumlord
text: "'Rat-infested' sounds so negative. I prefer 'rat-friendly.'"

name: Convicted Killer // Branded Howler
text: It is said that one of the most notorious werewolf howlpacks, the Vildin, only calls those whose hands are already stained with blood.

name: Mirari's Wake
text: Even after a false god tore the magic from Dominaria, power still radiated from the Mirari sword that slew her.

name: Crash Landing
text:
"The other guilds think they're untouchable. It's time we brought them back down to earth."
—Ghut Rak, Gruul guildmage

name: Savage Smash
text: A Gruul berserker is never unarmed.

name: Conquer
text:
"Why do we trade with those despicable Elves? You don't live in forests, you burn them!"
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Royal Assassin
text: Trained in the arts of stealth, the Royal Assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

name: Upwelling
text: Freyalise promised a dawn that would never end, a day of limitless life. As many dread her promise as revere it.

name: Override
text: "The Knowledge Pool has all the answers—especially 'No.'"

name: Blood Artist
text: From the veins of a peasant to the sketchbook of a master.

name: Order of Succession
text: "Long live . . . me."

name: Royal Trooper
text: "Loyalty guides me. Pride compels me. Anger sustains me. And the pay isn't bad."

name: Psionic Entity
text: Creatures of the Æther are notorious for neglecting their own well-being.

name: General's Regalia
text: A uniform fit for a goblin.

name: Cleaving Sliver
text: When it wriggled closer to a thrum of slivers, their talons hardened and glinted in the sun. One took a playful swipe at a tree trunk, and its new blade cut clean through.

name: Gruul Scrapper
text: The Gruul aren't satisfied with just smashing things. They continue smashing other things with the things they just smashed.

name: Slum Reaper
text: It's sent into unguilded districts by the Orzhov to collect the souls of those no one will miss.

name: Leeching Bite
text: A substantial portion of Vorinclex's forces became fuel for the rest.

name: Tainted Remedy
text:
"Drink this, brother. It will bring you rest."
—Liliana Vess

name: Gruul Charm
text:
"Not Gruul? Then die!"
—Borborygmos

name: Seismic Shift
text:
"Shiv is a restless land. It heaves ash, bleeds lava, and scabs over in black obsidian."
—*The First Eruption*

name: Goblin Kaboomist
text: Designed by Stone Librande

name: Onulet
text: An early inspiration for Urza, Tocasia's Onulets contained magical essences that could be cannibalized after they stopped functioning.

name: Discordant Piper
text: The death of the party.

name: Duress
text: Sarkhan was eager to take vengeance on Zurgo until he saw how lowly his old foe had become.

name: Voice of Grace
text:
"Opposite Law is Grace, and Grace must be preserved. If the strands of Grace are unraveled, its design will be lost, and the people with it."
—*Song of All*, canto 167

name: Nezumi Freewheeler // Hideous Fleshwheeler
text: Freedom became a distasteful memory, a thing to fear and destroy.

name: Chain Stasis
text:
"Here we go again."
—Kakra, Sea Troll

name: Arrester's Admonition
text: Law is the voice of reason.

name: Synod Centurion
text:
"We order them to stand, they stand. We order them to wait, they wait. We order them to die, they die."
—Pontifex, elder researcher

name: Act of Heroism
text:
"On every plane, there are those who run toward danger."
—Gideon Jura

name: Monstrous Step
text: Life is best taken one step at a time.

name: Ambush
text:
"Don't these goons have anything better to do?"
—Joskun, An-Havva Constable

name: Highland Weald
text:
"Our noble land, enslaved by Rime, Is it our fate to freeze through time? If this be true, oh wicked crime."
—*The Dynasty of Winter Kings*

name: Plague Engineer
text:
"The lasting effects are invariably fatal."
—Phyrexian progress notes

name: Loam Larva
text: The forest floor of Murasa is home to life as diverse and vibrant as that of the canopy above.

name: Darkwater Egg
text:
"Do you thirst for knowledge no matter the cost?"
—Watnik, master glassblower

name: Theft of Dreams
text:
"Volrath stole everything there was of me."
—Takara

name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
text: The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt Goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his Raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.

name: Shifting Loyalties
text:
"Show the enemy the true path, and the spirit will yearn to follow it."
—Houn, Jeskai elder

name: Bruvac the Grandiloquent
text: ". . . and furthermore . . ."

name: Riptide Biologist
text: "I gave it two choices: life in the lab or death in the hunt."

name: Gut Shot
text:
"Down here, we have a more pointed version of the scriptures."
—Urabrask's enforcer

name: Hada Freeblade
text: "I toiled in Kazuul's mines when I was eight. I think I'm tough enough for a little hiking."

name: Legion's Landing // Adanto, the First Fort
text:
"I claim this land in the name of the queen."
—Adrian Adanto of Lujio

name: Troll-Horn Cameo
text:
"I found a troll-horn fragment in the wooded foothills of Hurloon, and it keeps growing larger. I wonder, is the horn recreating itself or the troll?"
—Isel, master carver

name: Elven Fortress
text: Many Elven Fortresses weren't built by masons and carpenters, but created from the living forest itself.

name: Valorous Charge
text: Stand in the way of truth at your peril.

name: Magus of the Disk
text: Studying the journals of the necromage Nevinyrral leaves disciples gripped with the urge to exercise his draconian judgment.

name: Trespassing Souleater
text:
"We thank the souleaters for surveilling our lives that we may be preserved from our own ignorance."
—Drones' hymn of gratitude

name: Hungry Spriggan
text: If a spriggan's eyes are larger than its stomach, it has ways to remedy the situation.

name: Skywinder Drake
text: It's so light and fragile that it can glide where the air is thinnest.

name: Unknown Shores
text:
"Callaphe gazed on the coastline,
certain her destiny called her
here, where the mist-shrouded rocks sang,
promising glories undreamed of."
—*The Callapheia*

name: Clarion Ultimatum
text: Be worthy of a single blessing, and many more will follow.

name: Mind Drain
text: "The meal was exquisite. The conversation, less so."

name: Selesnya Guildgate
text:
"Everyone who crosses that threshold is our most cherished friend. Everyone who crosses it again is our bitterest enemy."
—Trostani

name: Super-Duper Death Ray
text: "Comin' through!"

name: Ghostly Prison
text: Though the spirits' bodies were ethereal, Agnur soon learned that their blades were quite solid—and razor-sharp.

name: Jungle Lion
text: The lion's only loyalty is to its hunger.

name: Dina, Soul Steeper
text: Her concoctions corroded metal and fortified organic tissue. They would be studied for generations.

name: Quicksilver Dagger
text: The dwarves call their quicksilver techniques "improvisational weaponsmithing."

name: The Lost and the Damned
text: The gods of Chaos bestow gifts of mutations upon their champions. Too many of these gifts transform their bearer into mindless, writhing chaos spawn.

name: Stave Off
text:
"Just a moment of perfect grace and sanctity is enough."
—Kal Lior, leonin elder

name: Angelic Page
text: If only every message were as perfect as its bearer.

name: Guardian of Cloverdell
text: Although they're protective of all creatures, many treefolk are especially fond of the empathic kithkin.

name: Field Research
text: "In the field, speed-reading is a survival skill."

name: Sidewinder Naga
text:
"Those who embrace the harsh land rather than fight it find they have a powerful ally."
—Nissa Revane

name: Volcanic Awakening
text: With a great roar, the land opened like a titan's yawn, with teeth of blackened rock and a lolling tongue of magma.

name: Kazuul's Toll Collector
text: Travelers are advised to bring extra swords, preferably shiny ones.

name: Futurist Sentinel
text:
"I folded a model in paper first to test the relative tensile strength of the plates."
—Katsumasa, the Animator

name: Sky Ruin Drake
text:
"Hold up your spears. And try not to look like food."
—Tarsa, Sea Gate sell-sword

name: Trusty Companion
text: It shows affection an automaton never could.

name: Boneyard Wurm
text: The only thing it likes more than discovering a pit of bones is adding to it.

name: Divest
text: Flittersprites collect unusually valuable things: coins of fallen empires, baby teeth, and memories of treasured names.

name: Generous Stray
text: Cats place their gifts with care, so that a bare foot will step on them in the middle of the night.

name: Auriok Salvagers
text: "Memnarch or the vedalken salvage most of the large machines, leaving us only scraps. Scraps are enough."

name: Thraben Sentry // Thraben Militia
text: "The time for grief is over. The time for retribution has begun."

name: Flavor Judge
text: "...and now they're trying to make a brick wall on my property fight a dinosaur to the death."

name: Wilt-Leaf Cavaliers
text: Every elf in Shadowmoor is charged from birth with a terrible duty: to strike back against the ugliness and darkness, even though they are all around and seemingly without end.

name: Concordia Pegasus
text:
"What makes a frog lizard any worse than a bird horse? Prejudice against the Simic, that's what. It's unfair!"
—Thados Arquef,
Guardian Project biomancer

name: Kindred Dominance
text: In the end, the lights fade, the land withers, and only the dead and vile remain.

name: Blood Tithe
text: The Crimson Throne may be empty, but its coffers are full.

name: Fledgling Djinn
text:
"The young can be quite dangerous. Trust me, I should know."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Taste of Paradise
text:
"There is, in each of us, the potential to heal and the gift of renewed life."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Elves of Deep Shadow
text:
"They are aberrations who have turned on everything we hold sacred. Let them be cast out."
—Ailheen, Speaker of the Council

name: Hull Breach
text: At the lash of the hive ship's feeder tentacles, the cruiser vented atmosphere, cargo, and crew members into the void.

name: Thrull Wizard
text:
"In crafting intelligent Thrulls to assist in sacrifices, Sahr inadvertantly set the stage for the Thrull Rebellion."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. II*

name: Zetalpa, Primal Dawn
text: The sky takes flight and the earth trembles.

name: Cutthroat Centurion
text: "We both serve the Demon Thane. Your parts would better serve with me."

name: Rise of the Hobgoblins
text: A river even the merrow dare not cross.

name: Noxious Grasp
text:
"The bog doesn't give a stinking bubble about your title, wealth, or piety. It's just hungry."
—Byaras, backwoods guide

name: Avacynian Missionaries // Lunarch Inquisitors
text: "We come bearing the word of Avacyn and the Lunarch Council."

name: Mox Pearl
text: 2019 Europe Vintage Champion

name: Keleth, Sunmane Familiar
text: She chooses her riders carefully and bears them to glory in battle after battle.

name: Humble Defector
text:
"You were once Mardu, so your body and will are strong. Now we must train your mind."
—Houn, Jeskai elder

name: Foam Weapons Kiosk
text: Not suitable for children . . . who aren't ready to have a lot of fun!

name: Stonebound Mentor
text: Quintorius beamed, his mind eager to absorb every historical fact the spirit wanted to divulge.

name: Sword-Point Diplomacy
text: "Take my blood if you want. Just don't take my gold!"

name: Bloodscale Prowler
text: It tracks its victims by the scent of their breath, preferring to dine on those who recently ate well.

name: Compulsive Research
text:
「プレインズウォーカーは皆、多元宇宙の驚異的な広大さに初めて精神が触れたときのことを覚えているわ。」
—-カズミな

name: Trespasser's Curse
text: Even in the relative safety of the city, there are places best left undisturbed.

name: Sol Ring
text: Deep within the forsaken cavern, a new shadow emerged to devour the light.

name: Protean Thaumaturge
text: "Once you see past the veil we call 'reality,' altering your own shape is elementary."

name: Floating-Dream Zubera
text: When the Honden of Seeing Winds was forgotten, its attendants swarmed Kamigawa to uncover mortal secrets.

name: Phyrexian Tyranny
text:
"He is Yawgmoth's reward to me. I shall kill him a hundred times a day."
—Crovax, to Ertai

name: Fulminator Mage
text: "Burn, suffer, and trouble me no more."

name: Finale of Devastation
text: Some spells sing a quiet tune. Others roar.

name: Demystify
text: Behind every mage is a trail of shattered lies.

name: Thornwind Faeries
text: Guarding the ship is the Thornwinds' first concern. Getting along with the locals ranks fourth or fifth at best.

name: Furtive Homunculus
text:
"In terms of intelligence, homunculi are somewhere between humans and skaabs—clever enough to follow more complex orders, but dim enough to not question them."
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Bound in Silence
text: A fight put off forever is already won.

name: Dire Mimic
text: Sometimes the closet *is* the monster.

name: Dying Wish
text: "I wish I could rewrite my every deed and kill you with my first breath instead of my last."

name: Reinforced Bulwark
text: Built of wood and iron. Held together by hope and prayer.

name: Advantageous Proclamation
text: "The beneficent council deems you worthy of favor. They hope this doesn't provoke envy from your peers."

name: Bird Admirer // Wing Shredder
text: She won't rest until she's collected specimens of every bird on Innistrad.

name: Dispersal Technician
text: As renegade forces closed in on the Aether Spire, Consulate blockades failed one by one.

name: Cold-Eyed Selkie
text: She follows the old tributaries built when merrows still shaped the tides.

name: Spinning Wheel Kick
text: Members of the Order of Jukai commune with kami to enhance their martial prowess.

name: Doomed Dissenter
text: The most dangerous place to be in Kessig is alone.

name: Gamble
text: When you've got nothing, you might as well trade it for something else.

name: Slingbow Trap
text: The Tajuru elves devised ways to let the forest defend itself.

name: Ghost Town
text:
"The air here smells like a grave."
—Crovax

name: Indatha Triome
text:
"These lowlands were formed thousands of years ago by behemoth Indath—its final footsteps before vanishing into the sea."
—*Tales of the Ozolith*

name: Anticipate
text: Divining the future is easy when you hold the power to sway it.

name: Heal
text:
"Sometimes even the smallest boon can save a life."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Domineer
text: Since they haven't seen their original master for millennia, golems are eager to take orders from anyone.

name: Tyranid Invasion
text: By the time the Blood Angels descended from the heavens, Phodia was a city transformed. Miles of flesh-filled rivers fed into the central digestion pools and up into the hive fleet above.

name: Peace Strider
text:
"The Vanished must have sent it from beyond to aid us in this struggle."
—Kessla, Sylvok shaman

name: Skyshroud Troll
text: The elves and merfolk have nothing but bitterness for each other. The trolls, however, find them both rather tasty.

name: Devils' Playground
text:
"The city is overrun. I would say burn it to the ground, but that won't be necessary."
—Inquisitor Delmund

name: False Cure
text:
"I do unto others as others have done unto me."
—Phage the Untouchable

name: Maritime Guard
text: To stand as a guardian of the sea, one must possess the resolve of a mounting wave.

name: Dragon's Claw
text: Though no longer attached to the hand, it still holds its adversary in its grasp.

name: Skirk Drill Sergeant
text: "I order you to volunteer."

name: Wall of Razors
text:
"In this blessed structure let the very walls baptize themselves in the blood of intruders."
—Stronghold architect, journal

name: Erase
text: Perception is more pleasing than truth.

name: Bloodrock Cyclops
text:
"He's big an' dumb an' ready to fight. A lot like ol' Hornhead here."
—Squee, goblin cabin hand, scouting report

name: Sacred Wolf
text:
"I raised my bow, and the wolf stared at me. Under its gaze, my finger would not release the string."
—Aref the Hunter

name: Winged Coatl
text: The nacatl called this new species "vetli," their word for poison arrows.

name: Zilortha, Strength Incarnate
text:
"Many thought they knew its weakness. They are dead."
—Kelsien, the Plague

name: Energy Arc
text:
"Relent, and you may transcend your situation."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Baleful Stare
text: He can drown you in his eyes.

name: Horde of Notions
text: Even the oldest treefolk was but an acorn when Lorwyn's first mysteries were born.

name: Nullstone Gargoyle
text: Nullstone absorbs and dampens most forms of magical energy, as well as light, sound, and heat.

name: Exultant Skymarcher
text: "We have come at last to this holiest of holy places. What was stolen from us long ago is ours once again."

name: Ember Weaver
text:
"Each night, the sun unravels and blows away. Each day, the spiders set a new one in the sky."
—Sunseeder myth

name: Caltrops
text: The Eastern Paladin knew how highly his southern rival valued horses, so he gleefully prepared a suitable welcome.

name: Alms Collector
text: "There is no justice when some profit and others go without."

name: Windgrace Acolyte
text: Acolytes of the lost Lord Windgrace fight to keep Urborg relics out of Cabal hands.

name: Spell Snare
text: With practice, the measurement of magic can lead to its mastery.

name: Thorn Thallid
text:
"Scholars still debate whether the Thallids were truly sentient."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*

name: Phyrexian Slayer
text: Benalia was only the first nation victimized by Tsabo Tavoc's specialized killers.

name: Mount Velus Manticore
text: Born from a stray spark that flew from Purphoros's forge.

name: Headlong Rush
text: A landslide of goblins poured toward the defenders—tumbling, rolling, and bouncing their way down the steep hillside.

name: Duress
text:
"It hurts more if you think about it."
—Hooks, Cabal torturer

name: Quandrix Cultivator
text: In the gardens spread across the Quandrix campus, fern turns to forest before class is even over.

name: Kismet
text:
"Make people wait for what they want, and you have power over them. This is as true for merchants and militia as it is for cooks and couples."
—Gwendlyn Di Corci

name: Zealous Persecution
text: "Rejoice! Your vile blood will help fulfill our righteous cause."

name: Guiding Voice
text: When honormancers work together, their compliments are complementary.

name: Tatyova, Benthic Druid
text: "Yavimaya is one being—one vastness of rippling leaves, one deepness of roots, and one chatter of animals—of which I am one part."

name: Cyclopean Mummy
text: The ritual of plucking out an eye to gain future sight is but a curse that enables the living to see their own deaths.

name: Frenzied Saddlebrute
text: The drumbeats of the horde echo in every heart.

name: Botanical Sanctum
text: Life inspires technology, which expands life's domain.

name: Goblin Piledriver
text: First name, Danger. Last name, also Danger.

name: Red Elemental Blast
text: Nothing restrains a burning passion.

name: Essence Flare
text: Never underestimate the power of the soul unleashed.

name: Magmatic Chasm
text: The Needle's Eye, a seldom-used passage that winds through Stensia's mountains, carries travelers close to Ashmouth—too close, some would argue.

name: Great Furnace
text:
"Molten blood runs through the ruins of the forge city of Phoenon, a still-beating heart whose body rotted centuries ago."
—*Fall of the Thran*

name: Peace of Mind
text:
Three are the paths of the soul:
One out—roam across the plain,
One back—dwell with tribe and tent,
One in—turn an enemy's hate.

name: Divine Verdict
text: Giants and pit spawn attempted to topple the cathedral's pillars. The fine grit of their remains still swirls in the breeze outside.

name: Atzocan Seer
text: Streams of gold and bright feathers flash in the orb, visions of past and future.

name: Ashiok's Adept
text:
"Every nightmare is a caged bird that yearns to be set free."
—Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver

name: False Defeat
text:
"All warfare is based on deception."
—Sun Tzu, *Art of War* (trans. Giles)

name: Volcanic Wind
text: The Cho-Arrim call it "the fury of Ramos."

name: Azorius Guildgate
text:
"If the populace fears our authority, then I'd say we have an appropriately sensible populace."
—Dovin Baan

name: Wrecking Ogre
text: If no opponent can be found, ogres of the Bolrac Clan will often pick fights with buildings.

name: Dismember
text:
"You serve Phyrexia. Your pieces would better serve Phyrexia elsewhere."
—Azax-Azog, the Demon Thane

name: Hungry Mist
text:
"All things must eat, after all. Even the air can hunger."
—Gemma, Willow priestess

name: Flicker of Fate
text: "Sure, I've got nine lives, but that doesn't mean I'm keen to waste one now."

name: Bog Imp
text: Don't be fooled by their looks. Think of them as little knives with wings.

name: Drogskol Infantry // Drogskol Armaments
text: He swore to protect the Moorlands. A little thing like death was no excuse to break his oath.

name: Adun Oakenshield
text:
". . . And at his passing, the bodies of the world's great warriors shall rise from their graves and follow him to battle."
—The Anvilonian Grimoire

name: Salvage Slasher
text: Esper artificers never imagined that one day their scraps would be pressed against their soft and fragile throats.

name: Dark Temper
text: When you've got the temperament of a dragon, every argument is one you'll win.

name: Giant Octopus
text:
"Before my eyes was a horrible monster, worthy to figure in the legends of the marvellous. . . . Its eight arms, or rather feet, fixed to its head . . . were twice as long as its body, and were twisted like the furies' hair."
—*Jules Verne, Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea*, trans. Lewis

name: Sidisi's Faithful
text: "I tire of your prattle, and your face."

name: The Big Top
text: The glow of the big top can be seen for light years, but its excitement can be felt in the hearts of everyone who's ever been there.

name: Graveyard Busybody
text: You have to hang around the graveyard if you want to catch the talking dead.

name: Morkrut Behemoth
text:
"Let's see my brother's stitched-up little toys compete with this."
—Ghoulcaller Gisa

name: Enraged Revolutionary
text: When every right is voted away, only rage remains.

name: An Incident Has Occurred
text: "So sorry, but, per our waiver, we're not responsible for 'things happening.'"

name: Blanchwood Armor
text:
"There's never been a dwarven smith who could match the marvels that Gaea herself forges."
—Elvish champion

name: Urza's Avenger
text: Unable to settle on just one design, Urza decided to create one versatile being.

name: Violet Pall
text: A faerie is the offspring of Oona and mischief.

name: Life's Finale
text: The feeble resistance of the flesh is over. Phyrexia spreads its shadow over all.

name: Cyclops Tyrant
text: A single eye, blinded by rage.

name: Agent of Stromgald
text:
"The Order of Stromgald spreads its poisonous lies from within Varchild's troops, and still she sees only visions of conquest."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Imaginary Pet
text: "It followed me home. Can I keep it?"

name: Knight of the Skyward Eye
text: The Order of the Skyward Eye does the bidding of an evil force, unwittingly stirring fear and mistrust across Bant in accordance with his plans.

name: Spectral Flight
text:
"The church looks down on binding spirits into armor, but now I can look down on them."
—Dierk, geistmage

name: Sprite Noble
text: "By thorn and by stone, we will fight to see the day when beauty returns to this world."

name: Arms Race
text: "You want it good, fast, or cheap? You can't have all three."

name: Crimson Fleet Commodore
text:
"Kindly steer your fleet clear of the waters west of Scrub Isle. It would be a shame to incinerate such exquisite maritime craftsmanship."
—Commodore Axurik, to Admiral Yelise

name: Semblance Anvil
text: Forged from what it forges.

name: Elves of Deep Shadow
text:
They are aberrations who have turned on everything we hold sacred. Let them be cast out."
—Ailheen, Speaker of the Council

name: Meng Huo's Horde
text: Through his allies, Meng Huo commanded several hundred thousand troops composed of cavalry, rattan-armored warriors, infantry, naked men with swords, and wild animals.

name: Spectral Procession
text:
"The dead have it easy. They suffer no more. If breaking their rest helps the living, so be it."
—Olka, mistmeadow witch

name: Ignite Disorder
text: The shaman prowled the academy halls, shaking his head at the pomp and babble of the sages inside. He knew just the spell to liven the place up.

name: Ambassador Oak
text: Treefolk and elves share a common interest in the forests, but really the elves just feel at home with the view from above.

name: Scab-Clan Giant
text: For the Gruul, bone-crushing rage is the first priority. Accuracy comes in a distant ninetieth.

name: Highland Game
text:
"Bring down a stag and fix its horns upon Arel's head. She hears the wisdom of our ancestors."
—Chianul, Who Whispers Twice

name: Mutiny
text: Pirate captains rarely enjoy a peaceful retirement.

name: Skarrg, the Rage Pits
text:
"This palace will be our fire-spit, and roasted prince our victory meal. Send in the torch-pigs!"
—Ghut Rak, Gruul guildmage

name: Lovisa Coldeyes
text: "I lead my horde to the northwest. I won't return until the ice wizards fall and their fiendish contraptions are crushed!"

name: Aven of Enduring Hope
text: "This storm will calm. We must believe that."

name: Symbiotic Deployment
text:
"You know your orders. I know your hearts. Now the stronghold will know defeat."
—Eladamri

name: Counterspell
text:
「効果を抑えるために、呪文の詳細を知る必要ありません。呪文が操作する現実の規則を再配置するだけでいいのです。」
——クアンドルクスの学部長、イムブラハム

name: Pillar of Light
text:
"The vaulted ceiling of our faith rests upon such pillars."
—Darugand, banisher priest

name: Night Revelers
text: Vampires think of themselves as the indisputable nobility of Innistrad, able to do as they please. There are few who can prove them wrong.

name: Rampant Growth
text:
"I've never *heard* growth before."
—Gowon, Femeref herder

name: Mana Tithe
text:
"Those who seek to upset the balance must be taxed for such ambitions."
—Verithain, mesa high priest

name: Jadar, Ghoulcaller of Nephalia
text: "Rise, my pretty thing. Why rot in the river when you can serve at my bidding?"

name: Brass Secretary
text: The students disliked the secretary for its unfailing memory—until they discovered it couldn't dodge thrown objects.

name: Busted!
text: "All you gotta do is panic with purpose. And plead your innocence with purpose. And have your mom bail you out with purpose."

name: Coldsteel Heart
text: "There is as much power in winter's chill as in summer's warmth."

name: Raiders' Wake
text: One was spared to tell the gruesome tale.

name: Implode
text: To save Dominaria, nine planeswalkers sought the annihilation of Phyrexia itself.

name: Darkwater Catacombs
text: The Chapter's honored dead are interred in the Hall of Heroes, where the mineral-rich water of the catacombs slowly fossilizes their bones, preserving them for all time.

name: Tormod's Crypt
text: The dark opening seemed to breathe the cold, damp air of the dead earth in a steady rhythm.

name: Surge of Salvation
text: No Meletian had ever laid eyes on an angel, but when protective Halo flooded the Multiverse, they knew a divine blessing was at hand.

name: Oakhame Adversary
text: The elves remember every secret path from the days when they ruled the realm.

name: Toxic Deluge
text: Armor dissolved into flesh. Flesh melted to bone. Bone fell away to nothing.

name: Veteran Dungeoneer
text: Her tales of glory light a fire in the souls of the next generation of adventurers.

name: Ancient Greenwarden
text: When the ruins awakened, so did their defenses.

name: Ichor Wellspring
text:
"Should a single drop take hold, the oil begins to consume organic tissue and will multiply until it overwhelms its host."
—Yawgmoth, collected writings

name: Future Sight
text: All times, all at once, collapsing to a single point: now, and what comes next.

name: Bartel Runeaxe
text: Thundering down from Hammerheim, no foe could slow Bartel's charge.

name: Intruder Alarm
text: One footstep among many is silent. One footstep alone is deafening.

name: Lash of Thorns
text:
"Another angry mob? When will they learn to leave me be?"
—Terryn, Edgewall outcast

name: Kuldotha Rebirth
text: All goblin rituals serve a dual purpose as fertility rites, even the destructive ones. Especially the destructive ones.

name: Revenant
text:
"Not again."
—Hans

name: Crypt Rats
text:
Beware anything born among the dead.
—Tolarian saying

name: Mirrormade
text:
"Share your darkest secret and the Mirror will reveal your soul's essence."
—Ceri, royal mirrorkeeper

name: Aether Flash
text: As the foul beast appeared, arcane lightning crackled around it.

name: Zo-Zu the Punisher
text: He does not tolerate intruders.

name: Deface
text:
"Leave no stone unturned."
—Ruric Thar

name: Wu Warship
text: Both Wu and Wei warships patrolled the Yangtze River, the natural border between the two kingdoms.

name: Citanul Flute
text: Each note of the flute mimics the call of a different beast.

name: Flowering Field
text: Some lands are soothing, and their peace can be felt in the soul.

name: Forsaken Drifters
text: It is a terrible thing when the path of the Returned leads them back to the Underworld.

name: Vodalian Mystic
text:
"Sometimes when I look at the ocean, I could swear it changes colors."
—Sisay

name: Fauna Shaman
text: "I call on both predators and protectors, for now is a season of war."

name: Biting Tether
text: A chain of lies as strong as steel.

name: Tin Street Market
text:
"Sometimes I stroll along Tin Street and watch citizens busy with their daily lives. It reminds me why I do my job."
—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

name: Sip of Hemlock
text: Conspirators poisoned the oracle not because her visions were wrong, but because they were right.

name: Torpor Dust
text: "Some folk these days are too restless to dream the dreams we need. We need to teach them to stop and catch their breath."

name: Cloudchaser Eagle
text: Most eagles hunt small animals. The cloudchasers hunt magic.

name: Clamavus
text: "The star-born approach! Their holy angels descend! Take up arms, my brothers and sisters, for the Day of Ascension is upon us!"

name: Drey Keeper
text: He gave the squirrels acorns. They gave him vengeance.

name: Kozilek's Sentinel
text: It moves through the tunnels as slowly and surely as the shifting stones.

name: Sidewinder Sliver
text:
"They encircled our patrol with the stealth of snakes, corralling us like livestock."
—Merrik Aidar, Benalish patrol

name: Veteran of the Depths
text: In the backwaters of the Merrow Lanes lie stones scarred with tallies of countless generations, each representing a victory of merrow soldiers.

name: Divine Visitation
text: The angels appreciated the offer but politely declined to eat any birdseed.

name: Undead Warchief
text: It has the strength of seven men. In fact, it used to be seven men.

name: Vanquish
text:
"All beings have an inner light. Let me show you yours."
—Ushanti, leonin seer

name: Vraan, Executioner Thane
text: "Soon enough each praetor will have hired me to kill the others, and I will stand alone as the true Father of Machines."

name: Grollub
text: Mogglings caught in a misdeed often blame the grollub. Even though the creature is usually innocent, no taskmaster can resist an excuse to beat it.

name: Pyroclastic Elemental
text:
"Whoever thought of making mobile volcanoes was a genius."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Urborg Volcano
text: Deep in the heart of Urborg lie massive volcanoes whose thick black smoke covers the land with perpetual darkness.

name: Drown in Filth
text: The rot farmer's first rite of passage is to craft a pair of work stilts.

name: Stubborn Denial
text: The Temur have no patience for subtlety.

name: Ghostflame Sliver
text:
"This breed is on the cusp of evolution. It burns away the markings that connect it to a queen that no longer heeds its call. It seeks a new master. Perhaps I can give it one."
—Freyalise

name: Guild Summit
text: In a climate of suspicion, Isperia gathered the guilds to propose a radical idea: cooperation.

name: Warrior's Honor
text:
"We are to be bound together as the reeds of a basket."
—Asmira, Rashida, and Jabari, unity chant

name: Stone Rain
text:
「こうして、空槌のブルクはその燃える一瞬で称号と勝利の両方を手にした。」
—-戦呪文撮要

name: Coordinated Charge
text:
"Out here we're nothing but our training."
—Ethuk, Coppercoat mage

name: Just Desserts
text:
"It's time to put the 'die' in 'diameter!'"
—Flaky the Irrational

name: Frilled Oculus
text:
"Understand the Simic? That's about as easy as winning a staring contest with a homunculus."
—Dars Gostok, Firefist captain

name: Satyr Wayfinder
text: The first satyr to wake after a revel must search for the site of the next one.

name: Sanctum Prelate
text: "These halls are sacred. You *will* be silent."

name: Prowler's Helm
text:
"The youths prattle on about heroic deeds, but avoiding the noose is a feat more daring than their entire careers."
—Basarios the Blade

name: Vedalken Mesmerist
text: "There's no need to sound the alarm. You are minding your post admirably. I am authorized. All is well."

name: Kwain, Itinerant Meddler
text: "Why so slow, why so slow? Hurry up! You never know what you'll find."

name: Fade from History
text: After a long hibernation, Argoth began slowly recovering from the ravages of war.

name: Burnished Hart
text:
"The natural world has already solved our problems. Our challenge is to replicate the elegance of its solutions."
—Tawnos

name: Harness Infinity
text:
"As I stepped into the star arch, it all became perfectly clear. Life and death are not opposites, but an endless path, twisting around and back upon itself, never ending and never beginning."
—Zhaer, professor of biophilosophy

name: Duress
text: Solitude and starvation are brutal punishments, but even worse is all that time to think.

name: Curse Artifact
text: Voska feared the artifact had come too easily.

name: Skeletal Crocodile
text: The less flesh there is, the more teeth there seem to be.

name: Gutter Skulker // Gutter Shortcut
text: Geists have a knack for showing up wherever they're least expected.

name: Merfolk Thaumaturgist
text:
"Blasted fishtails! It's not enough that they meddle with my head, but they twist my body as well."
—Tahngarth of the *Weatherlight*

name: Meria, Scholar of Antiquity
text: "Why fear artifice? Is it not also of this world?"

name: Hotheaded Giant
text: As he races the moon each night, he draws a glowing equator across the world.

name: Global Ruin
text:
"The earth shook, the sky rained fire, and it seemed the world was ending."
—Benalish refugee

name: Gixian Skullflayer
text: "With every culling, we bring this world closer to *compleation*."

name: Sautekh Immortal
text:
"Nothing clears a battlefield like a Deathstrike missile. Wait. Is something moving out there?"
—Commmander Zander At'lan, Tallarn 115th Armoured Regiment

name: Initiates of the Ebon Hand
text:
"We are no longer Nature's children, but her masters . . . ."
—Oath of the Ebon Hand

name: Time Wipe
text:
"To comprehend the full answer requires years of temporal study. In short, they were now never born in the first place."
—Teferi

name: Tiamat
text: "My children will rule over all!"

name: Thick-Skinned Goblin
text: The shaman of the tribe is responsible for keeping track of all its treasures, including angry pets and cursed lamps of fiery doom.

name: Loyal Cathar // Unhallowed Cathar
text:
"I trust myself to do my duty, even unto death. It's what comes after that I'm afraid of."
—Constable Visil, to Thalia

name: Pyroblast
text: Water can be crushing, but it is predictable. Fire is always dynamic, its rage absolute and all-consuming.

name: Goblin Digging Team
text: "From down here we can make the whole wall collapse!" "Uh, yeah, boss, but how do we get out?"

name: Kemba's Legion
text: The squabble over succession was quickly replaced by the struggle to survive.

name: Boiling Blood
text:
Your father has no horns!
Your mother wears a bell!
You drink the milk of goats!
—Talruum taunts

name: Feast of Succession
text:
"Beware the eager host."
—Eligeth, crossroads augur

name: Sky Theater Strix
text: Courier owls joined the fray, attacking the Dreadhorde with a viciousness usually reserved for mail thieves.

name: Riot Devils
text: Devils are demons' unearthly desires made flesh. Let loose on the world, they satisfy their mad craving for destruction in a whirlwind of chaos.

name: Telim'Tor's Darts
text:
"People laughed at my darts—once."
—Telim'Tor

name: Blood Moon
text: Heavy light flooded across the landscape, cloaking everything in deep crimson.

name: Undercity Uprising
text:
"Now it's your turn to hide."
—Vraska

name: Bayou Dragonfly
text:
"Like a sugar stick with wings!"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

name: Opportunity
text: "Opportunity isn't something you wait for. It's something you create."

name: Tamiyo's Journal
text: Entry 653: There's more to Avacyn's madness . . .

name: Harbinger of the Hunt
text: An Atarka dragon's exhale cooks what its inhale consumes.

name: Glory
text:
"Glory was gone; Glory was everywhere."
—*Scroll of Beginnings*

name: Sphinx of Foresight
text: "I do not understand the future I see: the guilds subverted, the world at war, armies bent to a cruel conqueror's will."

name: Vodalian Mage
text: Vodalian Mages were invaluable in magical combat. Unfortunately, the Homarids raided with strength, numbers, and very little magic.

name: Tivadar of Thorn
text: His blade came down upon the neck of a goblin—but not the one he had charged. When Tivadar looked up, the world he had known was gone.

name: Goblin King
text: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok . . . .

name: Respite
text: "If they board us we're finished," warned Orim. Crovax nodded. "And if they don't . . . what then?"

name: Ankh of Mishra
text: Tawnos finally cracked the puzzle: the strange structures did not house Mishra's malevolent creations but were themselves among his creations.

name: Kozilek's Predator
text: It's difficult to outwit something that doesn't speak, strategize, or even think.

name: Roc of Kher Ridges
text: We encountered a valley topped with immense boulders and eerie rock formations. Suddenly one of these boulders toppled from its perch and sprouted gargantuan wings, casting a shadow of darkness and sending us fleeing in terror.

name: Grim Haruspex
text: "We all want to know what's going on in someone else's head. I simply open it up and look."

name: Triumph of the Hordes
text: I don't know how I got here, but I'l be the last one standing.

name: Foul-Tongue Shriek
text: Foul-Tongue shamans draw their powers from a dark twisting of the Draconic language.

name: Kraum, Ludevic's Opus
text:
"It lives . . . IT LIVES!"
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

name: Flame Slash
text: After millennia asleep, the Eldrazi had forgotten about Zendikar's fiery temper and dislike of strangers.

name: Safehold Elite
text: "I refuse to die—not at the hands of one such as you."

name: Maze Rusher
text:
"The maze seems to fight us at every turn, resisting our efforts to solve it."
—Niv-Mizzet

name: Mobilized District
text: Sometimes the strongest weapon you can hold in your hand is another hand.

name: Bury in Books
text: There are no weapons allowed in the Biblioplex, but a clever mage is never truly defenseless.

name: Kiss of the Amesha
text: Once a year, Akrasa holds a joust that draws knights and their leotaus from every nation on Bant. The prize is an Akrasan sigil, but the true reward is the angel's kiss.

name: Vengeant Vampire
text: "Those who stood in my path now lay behind me."

name: Rakdos Trumpeter
text:
"The louder their performance, the quieter we become in comparison. They are the perfect distractions, for only fools ignore the Rakdos."
—Lazav

name: Mogg Fanatic
text: "I got it! I got it! I—"

name: Simic Guildgate
text:
"When the Prime Speaker goes too far, I will be here in the safety of the deeps to correct her."
—Zegana

name: Biolume Egg // Biolume Serpent
text: Serpents leave their eggs in the cold and inky depths...

name: March of the Multitudes
text: "Our forces number more than the leaves of Vitu-Ghazi. Do not provoke us."

name: Sage-Eye Harrier
text: These winged warriors meditate in flight, tracing mandalas in the clouds.

name: Gruesome Scourger
text: His whips twist and tremble like living things, moved by the fury of the horde he commands.

name: Arc Trail
text:
"Don't try to hit your enemies. Concentrate on the space between them, and fill the air with doom."
—Spear-Tribe teaching

name: Vodalian Soldiers
text:
"You think you know everything there is to know about battle? You know Orc droppings! Underwater combat is three dimensional. Those thrice-damned Vodalians don't attack in ranks; they attack in schools."
—Ivra Jursdotter

name: Hushwing Gryff
text: An overwhelming sense of calm accompanies the gryffs that wheel above the roofs of Gavony.

name: Lesser Gargadon
text:
Trod on by a gargadon
—Kipamu expression meaning "wiped out"

name: Pelakka Predation // Pelakka Caverns
text:
"I knew we shouldn't have come this way."
—Sneeflebrix, expedition rogue

name: Asphyxiate
text:
"Some poisons enter through the blood. Some are ingested. Some are inhaled. All ways through which mortals draw strength are paths for poison."
—Agathe, priest of Pharika

name: Last-Ditch Effort
text:
"If you're gonna lose, at least make sure they don't win as much."
—Jula, goblin raider

name: Venser's Diffusion
text: "Each reality is but the dream of another, and each sleeper a god unknowing."

name: Copperhorn Scout
text: Fangren spur may sound louder, but Viridian resurgents claim that the horn of the vorrac creates a truer, more inspiring note.

name: Mox Sapphire
text: 2019 Asia Vintage Champion

name: Lord of the Pit
text: "My summoning begins your debt, planeswalker."

name: Final Fortune
text: A reward is worthless if you aren't around to enjoy it.

name: Vitu-Ghazi, the City-Tree
text: In the autumn, she casts her seeds across the streets below, and come spring, her children rise in service to the Conclave.

name: Abzan Battle Priest
text: "Wherever I walk, the ancestors walk too."

name: Esika, God of the Tree // The Prismatic Bridge
text: Starnheim awaits.

name: Keening Banshee
text: Her cold wail echoes in the alleys and under-eaves, finding the unfortunate and turning their blood to ice.

name: Balloon Stand
text: "INPUT ACCEPTED: SHIVAN DRAGON. INITIATING . . . ERROR! GIRAFFE. GIRAFFE. GIRAFFE."

name: Stomping Ground
text:
"Roots, ruins, and room to fight. All the comforts of home."
—Domri Rade

name: How Is This a Par Three?!
text: Against the infinite backdrop of space, isn't all golf miniature?

name: Steel Overseer
text:
"The world is already run by all manner of machines. One day, they'll remind us of that fact."
—Sargis Haz, artificer

name: Turnabout
text: The best cure for a big ego is a little failure.

name: Maalfeld Twins
text:
"Who am I to break up a family?"
—Gisa the Mad

name: Pygmy Troll
text: "Who you callin' 'shorty'?"

name: Jade Bearer
text: "Sisora wore this, who defeated the tyrant of Azcanta, and before her Natena of Vuhana's band. May it bring you their strength."

name: Glowrider
text: "It is not yet time."

name: Aladdin's Ring
text:
". . . [T]he magician drew a ring off his finger . . . , saying: 'It is a talisman against all evil, so long as you obey me.'"
—*The Arabian Nights*,
Junior Classics trans.

name: Empty the Warrens
text: It's never just *one* goblin.

name: Warning
text:
"The folk of the Karplusan mountains are impossible to ambush."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

name: Rampaging Baloths
text:
"When the land is angry, so are they."
—Nissa Revane

name: Merrow Wavebreakers
text: The merrows' prey have retreated from the shore, so they have learned to follow.

name: Double Cleave
text: If at first you don't succeed, hit them again.

name: Kill Shot
text: Mardu archers are trained in Dakla, the way of the bow. They never miss their target, no matter how small, how fast, or how far away.

name: Cloudpost
text:
"He watches from above. He watches from below. He watches from within."
—Inscription on Tel-Jilad, the Tree of Tales

name: Swamp
text: Your search for a stolen artifact has brought you to the edge of the Mere of Dead Men.

name: Taigam's Scheming
text: "The Jeskai would have me bow in restraint. So I have found a people unafraid of true power."

name: Finale of Revelation
text: Ugin saw the gem that connected Bolas to his Meditation Realm as the key to his brother's downfall.

name: Renegade's Getaway
text: You can't fight what you can't find.

name: Elite Vanguard
text: The vanguard is skilled at waging war alone. The enemy is often defeated before its reinforcements reach the front.

name: Glimmer of Genius
text: Creators live for that moment of inspiration: precious, profound, perfect.

name: Ravenous Rats
text: Nothing is sacred to the rats. Everything is simply another meal.

name: Elvish Handservant
text: The hardest lesson for any elf to learn is humility. It takes a giant to teach that.

name: Duskworker
text: At the setting of each sun, it emerges to clean Mirrodin's floor of the day's carrion.

name: Historian of Zhalfir
text: "Come and listen. I'll tell you the story of a nation lost to time, and of the man who caused it."

name: Vat Emergence
text: The first rebirth is a reward. The fifty-first is a punishment.

name: Rhystic Cave
text:
"All mages dip into the same well; some are just in more of a hurry."
—Alexi, zephyr mage

name: Holy Avenger
text: Divine light forged in steel.

name: Moldering Karok
text: Necroluminescence is common among the undead creatures of Sedgemoor, giving the midnight swamp an eerie glow. It's comforting—from a distance.

name: The Tarrasque
text: When it rises, nations fall.

name: Admiral's Order
text: "Damn the cannons, mates. Charge!"

name: Utter End
text:
"Target eradicated. That which burns shall never be blessed."
—Fusilave unit Tor-213

name: Elite Headhunter
text: Nothing remains of his foes but the gripping story of their downfall.

name: Cheap Ass
text: And you thought Yawgmoth drove a hard bargain.

name: Wardscale Crocodile
text:
"The Eternals had to endure Amonkhet's five trials. Let's see if they can pass the Trial of Ravnica."
—Jace Beleren

name: Parting Thoughts
text:
"To spend your life seeking, only to find regret upon achieving ... this is the most delicious irony of all."
—Leshrac, Walker of Night

name: Chivalric Alliance
text: "I dub thee Syr Hellraker. For now."

name: Aeon Engine
text:
"Paradox? Eh, we'll worry about that yesterday."
—Edorin, the Timesmith

name: Elvish Lyrist
text: Each pluck of the strings breaks the hold of the unnatural on the world.

name: Moment of Silence
text: The silence commemorates not those who've died, but those about to.

name: Iron Bully
text:
"Why would someone have built ... wait, never mind. Send it to the front lines!"
—Commander Grozdan

name: Lightning-Core Excavator
text:
"That's the third time this month it's exploded on site. Maybe we should switch to something a little less defective."
—Kerrin, archaeologist

name: Ebony Treefolk
text: Its roots are equally happy to drink the water of a clear stream or the oily blood of a Phyrexian warrior.

name: Master of the Feast
text: Any pleasure, when taken to excess, becomes torment. It's a formula that demons have perfected.

name: Havenwood Wurm
text: Time rifts bring tunneling beasts of old into the hard, dry earth of the present. Most die there, trapped, but the mightiest burst through the surface.

name: Kamahl's Summons
text: As Krosa unleashed the peace in Kamahl, he unleashed the fury in Krosa.

name: Crowd of Cinders
text: They envy the life-giving heat so much that they tear it from those who still possess it.

name: Psychic Corrosion
text:
"To break another's mind is to deliver a fate worse than death. It is a terrifying power."
—Jace Beleren

name: Helm of Awakening
text: Perhaps things would have ended differently had its first gasping breath not been lost in the susurrus of shifting sands.

name: Fallowsage
text: Memories of ages past are said to swim the minds of lounging fallowsages.

name: Orcish Artillery
