text: In a rare display of ingenuity, the orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.

name: Reckless Brute
text: His mind knows no fear, registering only the burning impulse to destroy.

name: Trinisphere
text:
"This exhibition of Nehra's Threshold Principle must be expropriated and examined for its potential applications in enforcement."
—Confiscation directive

name: Dread of Night
text:
"These moonless, foreign skies keep me in thrall. Dark whispers echo in the night, and I cannot resist."
—Selenia, dark angel

name: Veilstone Amulet
text: Sometimes it's ostentatious to go unseen.

name: Planebound Accomplice
text: "Told you I had friends."

name: Gamble
text: "What's the worst that could happen?"

name: Death Cloud
text: The swarm's million wings stir the foulest of breezes.

name: Durkwood Boars
text:
"And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine: and the herd ran violently . . . ."
—Mark 5:13

name: Mercadian Atlas
text: One may as well chart the clouds as try to map Mercadia.

name: Sram, Senior Edificer
text: "As this conflict grows, it gets harder to prevent the city from breaking down. How much longer can we keep this machinery balanced?"

name: Burden of Greed
text:
"The one who dies with the most toys is still dead."
—Geth, keeper of the Vault

name: Blighted Fen
text:
"We came to a place where the skin of Zendikar was peeled back and its bones lay bare to the sky."
—Greenweaver Mina

name: Mnemonic Wall
text:
"I'd build an entire fortress of them if I could."
—Mzali, Lighthouse archmage

name: Clash of Titans
text:
"Let the brutes fight. If they kill each other, we lose no more soldiers today."
—Orthion, Lavabrink captain

name: Hungry Mist
text:
"All things must eat, after all. Even the air can hunger."
—Gemma, Willow Priestess

name: Blurred Mongoose
text:
"The mongoose blew out its candle and was asleep in bed before the room went dark."
—Llanowar fable

name: Blistergrub
text:
"The sooner you join Phyrexia, the sooner you'll forget your painful rebirth."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Necrosavant
text: To the novice necromancers, it looked exactly like a regular human grave.

name: Stream Hopper
text: Like many who dwell in Shadowmoor now, he was robbed of his better half by the Aurora.

name: Infestation Expert // Infested Werewolf
text: . . . "What's bugging you?"

name: Goblin Assailant
text: What he lacks in patience, intelligence, empathy, lucidity, hygiene, ability to follow orders, self-regard, and discernible skills, he makes up for in sheer chaotic violence.

name: Faceless Haven
text: それはすべての場所、どこでもない場所。論理の束縛を超えた現実の向こう側。

name: Environmental Sciences
text: First-years quickly learn how the Vastlands earned its name.

name: Keen Sense
text: Crovax sensed that Mirri wasn't ready for the curse taking hold of her. Weeping in his heart, he fled.

name: Artillerize
text: Phyrexian or Mirran, most goblins stick to the job they know best.

name: Kor Chant
text: The true treasure no thief can touch.

name: Commune with the Gods
text: For the first time in many years, Elspeth asked for help.

name: Redcap Heelslasher
text: Biffle was delighted to have an excuse to use the nice cutlery he'd liberated from Edgewall.

name: Phyrexian Censor
text: Quintorius muffled a sob as he watched the thing that was once Professor Pitnik "confiscate" yet another priceless historical tome.

name: Hat Trick
text: "Behold the power of my hat and the ghosts of two other hats I used to own!"

name: Planar Void
text:
"Planeswalking isn't about walking. It's about falling and screaming."
—Xantcha, Phyrexian outcast

name: Igneous Cur
text: Some dogs just aren't meant to be indoor pets.

name: Winds of Rebuke
text: "I have foreseen that you will not pass my trial."

name: Haughty Djinn
text: "I adore your outfit. It's so . . . rustic."

name: Flaxen Intruder // Welcome Home
text: The middle blade was just right.

name: Zerapa Minotaur
text: There's no difference between bone and crystal when it's piercing your throat.

name: Modify Memory
text: Percival's clothes itched and his dinner was unpleasantly wriggly, but the kobold looked like he was having the time of his life.

name: Volunteer Militia
text: People fight hardest on their own soil.

name: Riverfall Mimic
text: Mimics don't hide their natural form well, but their disguises work well enough on boggarts.

name: Yennett, Cryptic Sovereign
text: She talks using riddles her disciples alone can unravel.

name: Shard Convergence
text: Alara is broken no more.

name: Resilient Wanderer
text: Nomads understand many cultures and therefore travel without fear.

name: Coastal Piracy
text: "I don't like to think of myself as a pirate. I'm more like a stimulator of the local economy."

name: Angel of Jubilation
text: "Though Innistrad is not cleansed of evil, we finally have cause to rejoice."

name: Faerie Duelist
text: Faeries are easily offended and quick to exact a quirky revenge.

name: Silkbind Faerie
text: "The bigger they are, the more fun it is to watch them fall flat on their faces."

name: Gilt-Blade Prowler
text:
"Let's just say my people are in the business of capital acquisition and intellectual property speculation."
—Er-Miral

name: Pyromancy
text:
Who harnesses fire controls the world.
—Ghitu proverb

name: Hall Monitor
text: "No unauthorized summoning. No writing in the library books. And absolutely no indoor dueling!"

name: Hallow
text: "Bend with the storm, then reply in kind."

name: Brilliant Spectrum
text: There are more sights on Zendikar than the eyes can see.

name: Goblin Chainwhirler
text: "The trick is, once you get moving, don't stop!"

name: Sky Diamond
text: The essence of wind to lift up the weary.

name: Raise the Alarm
text: Like blinking or breathing, responding to an alarm is an involuntary reflex.

name: Catalog
text:
Though those who study are as many as the hairs on an ox, those who succeed are as rare as unicorns' horns.
—Chinese proverb

name: Prophetic Prism
text: To understand Kaladesh, one must first understand how aether and invention flow together through the great Aether Cycle.

name: Fatal Frenzy
text:
"I hope to have such a death—lying in triumph upon the broken bodies of those who slew me."
—Radha, Keldon warlord

name: Safe Passage
text: As she shepherds the faithful, the angel's radiance is a shield of salvation.

name: Urza's Hot Tub
text: www.wizards.com/hottub

name: Rhonas's Last Stand
text: Rhonas continued to fight until his last breath and even beyond.

name: Mighty Leap
text:
"The southern fortress taken by invaders? Heh, sure . . . when elephants fly."
—Brezard Skeinbow, captain of the guard

name: Ad Nauseam
text: When the task spilled over into undeath, he stopped calling it his life's work.

name: Archivist
text: "Knowledge is a feast for the mind. Savor every swallow."

name: Alms Collector
text: "They say money can't buy happiness, but have you heard how loud I purr?"

name: Descent into Madness
text: The stairs lead down in both directions.

name: Tergrid, God of Fright // Tergrid's Lantern
text: Fear is her one true companion.

name: Boon of Emrakul
text: All around Emrakul, life re-formed in her image.

name: Carnage Gladiator
text: Not the foulest or bloodiest act at Rix Maadi by a stretch.

name: Repentant Blacksmith
text: "For my confession they burned me with fire And found that I was for endurance made." —*The Arabian Nights*, trans. Haddawy

name: Thran Vigil
text: Glacian built his automatons to last, and last they did, beyond even the Thran themselves.

name: Halo Scarab
text: It pulses with the colors that best complement the wearer's outfit.

name: Wine of Blood and Iron
text: Godo never revealed what went into his special brew, but he always had more of it after great victories.

name: No One Left Behind
text: Dying for the cause is overrated.

name: Spinny Ride
text: Located on the opposite side of the park from the food court, for obvious reasons.

name: Inaction Injunction
text:
"To prevent action is to prevent transgression."
—Azorius Arrester motto

name: Simoon
text: Hot wind whipped up as if the weather itself wanted to fight Phyrexians.

name: Wall of Lava
text:
"Now *there's* something you don't see every day."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Colossification
text:
"Turns out the case of the flattened outpost and the case of the missing kitten *were* related."
—Endris, Drannith magistrate

name: Kor Entanglers
text: "We came into this world together. We fight for this world together. We'll leave this world together."

name: Skirk Fire Marshal
text: He's boss because he's smart enough to get out of the way.

name: Abzan Guide
text: "These roads are desolate and changeable. Follow me, or die in the wastes."

name: Jagwasp Swarm
text:
"You know how to tell a sapling explorer from an old hardhead? See which one mistakes a swarm of jagwasps for the setting sun."
—Chadir the Navigator

name: Bulwark Giant
text:
"Where did she come from? More importantly, are there more like her?"
—Gideon Jura

name: Hunt the Weak
text:
"Death lizard approaching, cap'n!"
—Brint Doobin, last words

name: Spellweaver Duo
text: Synchronized spell weaving is a difficult but rewarding skill to master.

name: Blood for the Blood God!
text: Skulls for the Skull Throne.

name: Ghitu Lavarunner
text: Tolarians teach the theory of pyromancy. The Ghitu prefer applied research.

name: Hunted Nightmare
text:
"The cruelest monsters inspire the greatest tales. The greatest tales inspire the cruelest hunters."
—Rielle, the Everwise

name: Seal of Strength
text: When does majestic become ominous?

name: Spirit of the Spires
text: She breathes fair winds to tired griffins and lifts songbirds beyond the reach of stalking cats.

name: Gideon's Sacrifice
text: To Liliana's surprise, the cost of betraying Bolas did not fall on her.

name: Kindled Fury
text:
"All beings carry the fire inside them. The challenge is to unleash it before they dwindle into oblivion."
—Illulia, flamekin soulstoke

name: Trailblazer's Boots
text:
"Not idly do the leaves of Lórien fall."
—Aragorn

name: Spikefield Hazard // Spikefield Cave
text:
"Stop screaming! You'll only bring down more spikes."
—Raff Slugeater, goblin shortcutter

name: Spirit Mantle
text: The shield of unimpeachable purity is as strong as any wrought on the anvil.

name: Greed
text: An advisor once asked the Western Paladin how much gold would be enough. "I have no need of fools who can imagine 'enough,'" he told the advisor's corpse.

name: False Defeat
text:
"All warfare is based on deception."
—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

name: Giant Killer // Chop Down
text: "What size advantage? They never even see me coming."

name: Archers' Parapet
text: Every shaft is graven with a name from a kin tree, calling upon the spirits of the ancestors to make it fly true.

name: Malicious Advice
text:
"Rule through fear, Darigaaz. Only if the dragons feel terror will they truly be your servants."
—Tevesh Szat

name: Feral Ridgewolf
text:
"The wolves no longer hunt just to feed. They kill for sport, or for some madness behind their eyes."
—Elmut, crossway watcher

name: Wayfarer's Bauble
text: It is the forest beyond the horizon, the mountain waiting to be climbed, the new land across the endless sea.

name: Squirrel Wrangler
text: "Acorns? Again?"

name: Iron-Barb Hellion
text: When you feel a rumble in the ground, hold perfectly still. One sound will bring the hellion.

name: Hour of Glory
text: The gods of the trials also faced the opportunity to prove themselves worthy.

name: Siege-Gang Commander
text: "Ready . . . uh . . . fire!"

name: Mistform Wall
text: Fellowship, the fourth myth of reality: As the tides of war shift, so do loyalties.

name: Ragefire
text: "Your precious laws can't save you now!"

name: Exploding Borders
text: Reuniting a world is not a gentle process.

name: Rowen
text:
"I've dreamt of a second harvest but fear I will not see it."
—Asmira, holy avenger

name: Shepherd of Heroes
text: "Rest, friends. I will protect you."

name: Traveler's Amulet
text:
"What we call magic is nothing more than hope crystallized into a destination."
—Perisophia the philosopher

name: Queza, Augur of Agonies
text: Some try to unravel the tangled skeins of fate. She reweaves them to her own deadly design.

name: Rainbow Vale
text: In the feudal days of Icatia, finding the Rainbow Vale was often the goal of knights' quests.

name: Denying Wind
text:
"The third wind of ascension is Eliminator, clearing Keld's path to victory."
—*Keld Triumphant*

name: Galerider Sliver
text: Masters of adaptation, galeriders serve multiple purposes useful to the hive. When they're not patrolling their territories, their majestic wings serve to circulate cool air through the vast hive chambers.

name: Nantuko Shade
text:
"If the Nantuko only knew what awaits them beyond death, they would abandon all they hold dear."
—Cabal Patriarch

name: Hour of Eternity
text: To serve as an eternal is the afterlife granted to the worthy.

name: Winged Sliver
text:
"Everything around here has cut a deal with gravity."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Seasoned Marshal
text: She reads the battlefield like a map, always seeking the shortest route to victory.

name: Night of Souls' Betrayal
text:
"How can we wage war against ourselves? What happens when the kami of our very souls rise against us? I answer simply: We cannot. We die. There can be no victory in this war."
—Sensei Hisoka, letter to Lord Konda

name: Mass Appeal
text: "We have emerged triumphant from the darkness. Let our hard-won wisdom guide us to prosperity."

name: Birds of Paradise
text: A single vivid feather fetches a royal price—but who, having seen these magnificent creations of Nature, would settle for a feather?

name: Harvesttide Infiltrator // Harvesttide Assailant
text: When Tovolar's howl sounded from the woods, it was answered from the heart of the festival.

name: Phyrexian Rager
text: It takes no prisoners, but it keeps the choicest bits for Phyrexia.

name: Rhys the Exiled
text: Once a famed hunter and packmaster, now a renegade seeking his own path.

name: Evil Presence
text:
"The Accorders would lament the transformation of their cherished lands, had they lived to see it."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Outwit
text: The student asks how a spell is begun. The master ponders what ends it.

name: Dredge
text:
"I'd strip away the world to see what's under it, but I'd never just leave it to these Phyrexian parasites and their false god."
—Urborg witch

name: Vampire Champion
text: "These pirates must answer for their ancestors, who renounced the Church of Dusk and sailed from Torrezon as heretics."

name: Jhoira's Toolbox
text: It entertained Jhoira to craft a kit that could bring her the tools.

name: Wall of Spears
text: Even the most conservative generals revised their tactics after the Battle of Sarinth, during which a handful of peasant-pikemen held off a trio of rampaging Craw Wurms.

name: Boneknitter
text: Nothing comes together as easily as it comes apart.

name: Metallurgeon
text: "By the time I got there, the heart had stopped. Fortunately, I was able to replace it with something better."

name: Wind Strider
text: "Currents are currents, whether in sea or sky."

name: Uncharted Haven
text: Untouched by mortal or kami, unspoiled by their wars.

name: Flinthoof Boar
text: Through the smoke and flames it hunts, sniffing out the panicked and confused.

name: Nessian Hornbeetle
text:
"The first rule of politics can be learned from a lowly hornbeetle: it is wise to cultivate powerful friends."
—Pythamon, sage of Meletis

name: Fearless Pup
text: "Awooo!"

name: Selfie Preservation
text: "Be sure to get the tree in the picture."

name: Goblin Traprunner
text: The best traprunners know exactly where to step. The others . . . do their best.

name: Hulking Ogre
text: Once they realized the ogre had more size than speed, the soldiers simply went around it.

name: Razorgrass Screen
text: Hand-stitched, and marked by the blood of the Auriok.

name: Lava Axe
text: A strict upgrade over the cinder hatchet.

name: Sandblast
text: In the Shifting Wastes, more are killed by sand than by steel.

name: Death Speakers
text:
"Such innocent little birds. They sing a sweet song, sitting on their fragile branch."
—Grandmother Sengir

name: Paradise Mantle
text:
"It contains the wisdom of generations of our people. We permit only a chosen few to don the raiment."
—Imran, Viridian elder

name: Irreverent Revelers
text: To some satyrs, only blasphemy is sacred.

name: Gruul Locket
text:
"In life, it was a cunning survivor, fearless and quick. May its power pass to you as you wear its skull."
—Gna, Gruul shaman

name: Blessed Respite
text:
"Water the soil with blood, if you must. Eventually it must be tilled with forgiveness."
—Greensleeves

name: Uproot
text:
"We arrived at the battlefield too late. *Again*. Another error on your part, and you will have to answer to me personally."
—General Takeno, letter to the imperial mapmaker

name: Cinder Elemental
text: Their rage can grow to such proportions that they explode in a cloud of fire.

name: Uncontrollable Anger
text: A barbarian's heart pounds with the fury of a prisoner, threatening at any moment to break the bars of its cage.

name: Finale of Eternity
text: When you rule by fear, your greatest weakness is one who's no longer afraid.

name: Rotten Reunion
text: Aunt and Uncle Greyfeld loved dinner guests.

name: Hanna, Ship's Navigator
text: "I never thought I'd spend my life fighting. I'm a maker, not a destroyer."

name: Rakshasa Deathdealer
text: "Death fills me and makes me strong. You, it will reduce to nothing."

name: Pardic Firecat
text:
"I've heard of putting the cat out, but this isn't what I had in mind."
—Nomad sentry

name: Big Play
text:
"Quandrix is running out of time. If they're going to capture the Witherbloom mascot, they need something big here."
—Cremik, Mage Tower commentator

name: Shepherd of the Lost
text:
www.MagicTheGathering.com
www.mtg-jp.com

name: Inspired Charge
text: "We are armed with light and steel. Who can stand against us?"

name: Marauding Maulhorn
text:
"It's not just you. Everyone makes it angry."
—Ardenoth, elvish nature advocate

name: Master of Etherium
text: "Only a mind unfettered with the concerns of the flesh can see the world as it truly is."

name: One with the Stars
text:
"Take your place among the stars."
—Kruphix, god of horizons

name: Nahiri's Lithoforming
text: "Zendikar has suffered enough. It is time, at last, for my home to know peace."

name: Maggot Carrier
text:
"The mere sight of our undead allies sickens me. What unholy bargain have you struck?"
—Grizzlegom, to Agnate

name: Warped Devotion
text:
"The spirit of the devout is easily crushed by the loss of hope."
—Fallen angel

name: Tormod's Crypt
text: Dominaria's most extravagant crypt nevertheless holds an empty grave.

name: Crown of Vigor
text: "Life, be my shield."

name: Master of the Pearl Trident
text: "Let the land dwellers know the coast is no longer the border between our realms. A new age of empire has begun."

name: Magma Spray
text: The ancient dragon Thraxes sleeps in Purphoros's sacred peak. When he stirs in dreams, so does the mountain.

name: Golden Bear
text: The elvish scout was scrupulous about the truth. She told the traders that gold lay nearby.

name: Mox Ruby
text: 2008 Vintage Championship Winner

name: Negate
text:
"Shatter your opponent's spell with enough force, and you'll shatter their confidence with it."
—*Tome of Obstructions*, marginalia

name: Torsten Von Ursus
text: "How can you accuse me of evil? Though these deeds be unsavory, no one will argue: good shall follow from them."

name: Reach of Shadows
text:
"Is it better to be a fool or a coward? Fools may get things done occasionally, but cowards live longer."
—Ghelesh Shadowmane, rakshasa mage

name: A-Speakeasy Server
text: "Whatever ails you, friends, this will cure it for tonight! And leave you with a little inspiration for tomorrow."

name: Coppercoat Vanguard
text: It was a time for rebuilding, but first Ikoria's wrecked cities had to be cleared of monsters.

name: Hate Weaver
text: "Let my hate fuel your fury."

name: Soothsayer Adept
text: One of the first lessons divination students learn is how to recognize the difference between a portent and a simple surface ripple.

name: Lightning Blast
text:
"Those who fear the darkness have never seen what the light can do."
—Selenia, dark angel

name: Mage-Ring Bully
text: "Don't be rude, Beleren. We just want to enjoy the view with you."

name: Forgotten Creation
text:
"My earliest work escapes me."
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Vanishing Verse
text: "Whoever summoned that thing had better confess right this moment, or the whole class will be cleaning the ink receptacles for a month!"

name: Windreaper Falcon
text:
Watching the windreaper
—Zhalfirin phrase meaning "daydreaming"

name: Sokenzan Bruiser
text:
"We camped near the Sokenzan Mountains. Though I know its inhabitants are sparse, I hear cries coming from the highest peaks every night, as if the mountains themselves bellow for vengeance."
—Lost Battalion, message to General Takeno

name: Nature's Lore
text:
"Fyndhorn is our home."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Repel the Darkness
text: A boon to those who cannot see in the dark. A bane to those who live in it.

name: Vryn Wingmare
text: It's the favored mount of military commanders as well as anyone with a flair for the dramatic.

name: High Tide
text: "There's nothing like the high seas to clear your head or escape pursuers."

name: Evolving Wilds
text: The land is ever resilient. Should it die, it will be reborn.

name: Giant Spider
text:
"When I trained under Multani, he bade me sit for hours watching Yavimaya's spiders. From them I learned stealth, patience, and the best way to snare a wind drake."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Bloodsoaked Altar
text: Blood seeps into the stone, and darkness emerges.

name: Pit Keeper
text: "The undead are not 'awakened.' They are evicted when there is no room left in the pit for more bodies."

name: Bond of Flourishing
text: "We agree that life should flourish. We disagree on the optimal number of limbs."

name: Adarkar Sentinel
text:
"We encountered the sentinels in the wastes, near no living thing. Their purpose was inscrutable."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Wayward Servant
text: If one of the anointed fails to serve with perfect obedience, the desert is always ready to receive it.

name: Spindrift Drake
text: Sea brine for blood, washing foam for laughter.

name: Hellfire Mongrel
text: There is no fondness between the hound and its master. There is only a common appreciation of the hunt.

name: Tawnos's Weaponry
text: When Urza's war machines became too costly, Tawnos's weaponry replaced them.

name: Chaos Terminator Lord
text: "Charge brothers! Death to the false Emperor!"

name: Clone
text: He knows your strengths, your weaknesses, and the shape of that unfortunate birthmark on your backside.

name: Underdark Explorer
text: "Keep your fancy magic. All I need is a hook and a sturdy length of rope."

name: Forge Devil
text: A bit of pain never hurts.

name: Juniper Order Druid
text:
"The filthy towns of Kjeldor are no place for anyone to live. Fyndhorn is our home now."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Makeshift Mannequin
text:
"This vulgar mimicry will end now."
—Desmera, perfect of Wren's Run

name: Nightwing Shade
text:
"There is one hour of the night even we do not watch."
—Sedva, captain of the watch

name: Dawnhart Disciple
text: "Our coven finds strength in nature and purpose in serving our communities."

name: Rush of Vitality
text: Short lives lead to forbidden choices.

name: Oath of Nissa
text: "For the life of every plane, I will keep watch."

name: Teferi's Protection
text:
"Someday, when the world is safe again, my homeland will return."
—Teferi

name: Rootborn Defenses
text: "No harm can come to me while the Worldsoul shelters me."

name: Exalted Angel
text:
"She is a theme of honor and renown, ...Whose present courage may beat down our foes."
—William Shakespeare, *Troilus and Cressida*

name: Citadel Castellan
text: "I am the first line of defense. You will not encounter the second."

name: Drumbellower
text: By the second night after the kami had drifted into town, the local general store was completely sold out of earplugs.

name: Two-Headed Zombie
text:
"Thread the torsos together with angel hair to ensure they will cooperate in battle."
—*The Stitcher's Tome*

name: Tocatli Honor Guard
text: The glorious city of Pachatupa is the center of the Sun Empire, and Tocatli, the emperor's palace, is its glowing heart.

name: Knollspine Invocation
text: Witches tempted by the power of flame gathered to study in the ruins of Spinerock Knoll.

name: Tower Drake
text: The first motion put forth in the pristine Jelenn Column was for severe restrictions on the airspace around New Prahv.

name: Common Courtesy
text: "You didn't say the Magic word."

name: Necrogen Scudder
text: Contrary to popular belief, it's kept aloft by necrogen gas, not the screaming agony of a thousand murdered souls.

name: Mana Tithe
text:
"The tyrant's bellow of rage trailed off into a whimper as the last of his fortune escaped his grasp."
—*The Dethroner's Grimoire*

name: Sigil Captain
text: "One sigil awarded for valor, the other awarded for surviving Hellkite's Pass."

name: Remember the Fallen
text: When the Mirrans had fallen, Planeswalkers carried the burden of remembrance.

name: Tovolar's Huntmaster // Tovolar's Packleader
text: "Do you smell that, friends? Fear and despair."

name: Angelic Shield
text:
"If only an angel's wings could shelter us all."
—Barrin

name: Dark Ritual
text:
"They distrust my methods, but when they want results, whom do you think they seek?"
—*Incantations of Lim-Dûl*

name: Driver of the Dead
text: Some vampires resorted to corpse trading after cathars burned their estates and drove them from their ancestral feeding grounds.

name: Falkenrath Aristocrat
text: "Your blood is quite pleasing. A pity there's not enough for both of us."

name: Ogre Recluse
text:
"Those ogres who did not embrace oni worship were cast out, cursed, and forced into hermitage, waiting for the day the oni would come for them."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Thran Foundry
text:
"What we do not use up, we use again."
—Urza

name: Blossoming Calm
text: Mood: A spell that protects her from her enemies.

name: Jwari Disruption // Jwari Ruins
text:
"You worry too much."
—Nys Dal, Sea Gate trapfinder

name: Emerald Dragonfly
text: "Flittering, wheeling, / darting in to strike, and then / gone just as you blink." —"Dragonfly Haiku," poet unknown

name: Talas Lookout
text:
"The Talas pirates are motivated by money, so we paid them twice what they could steal from us to spy for us instead."
—Jhoira

name: Avian Changeling
text: Today it flies with the flock. Tomorrow it may wake to find them gone, its body in an unfamiliar form.

name: Ionize
text: "Countermagic is a simple process of breaking matter into its elementary particles."

name: Myconid Spore Tender
text: Myconid colonies grow and expand at an aggressive rate, but they are friendly and peaceful unless provoked.

name: Waterfront District
text: The bottom of the dark canals is littered with countless corpses and treasures.

name: Magister Sphinx
text: "These benighted worlds are thick with ignorance. I will educate them. They will listen, or they will die."

name: Sunflare Shaman
text: A spark to light the guttered heart.

name: Duskrider Falcon
text:
"Seaborne ships have their dolphins to dance in their wakes; I have my duskriders."
—Sisay, journal

name: Spiketail Drakeling
text: Drakelings fish with their tails, angling to snare succulent thoughts and memories on their psychic hooks.

name: Season of Growth
text: "Awake, and lift your faces to the sun."

name: Atmosphere Surgeon
text: It is Jin-Gitaxias's deepest exasperation that any part of his domain still requires maintenance.

name: Savage Conception
text: Some beasts are born not of a mother, but of magic.

name: Dramatic Reversal
text:
"Megatron must be stopped. No matter the cost!"
—Optimus Prime

name: Carapace
text:
"Now, *that's* a fashion statement."
—Devin, Faerie Noble

name: Archweaver
text: The silk of the archweavers adds structural integrity to otherwise unstable Izzet building sites.

name: Transcendent Envoy
text:
"The first griffins were made by the gods to capture falling stars; they were given the keenest eyes and the swiftest wings, and sent to keep watch above the clouds."
—*The Cosmogony*

name: Culling Ritual
text: "Your own frailty is your undoing. I am merely the one to expose it."

name: Solve the Equation
text: Zimone's brilliance drew attention from many, including the sinister mages known as the Oriq.

name: Yotian Soldier
text: After Kroog was destroyed while most of its defenders were at his side, Urza vowed that none of his allies would ever need to fear for their own defense again, even while laying siege to a city far from their homes.

name: Nightscape Familiar
text: Nightscape masters don't stop at raising the spirit of a fallen battlemage. They raise the flesh along with it.

name: Carnifex Demon
text: Every contagion has a host.

name: Baral, Chief of Compliance
text: "What's behind my mask? My face, idiot."

name: Walking Sponge
text: Not only does it catch fish, it cleans them too.

name: Enervate
text:
"Worlds turn in crucial moments of decision. Make your choice."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran Royal Mage

name: Defiant Bloodlord
text:
"Despite their bravado, mortals are fragile. If Zendikar is to endure, its lords must save it."
—Drana, Kalastria bloodchief

name: Headless Skaab
text: A head is a needless encumbrance when muscle is all that's required.

name: Soar
text:
"Would you give up your hands to fly? That is what the birds have done."
—*The One Thousand Questions*

name: Leonin Snarecaster
text: Formerly oppressed by the polis of Meletis, leonin occasionally "mistake" their old enemies for game.

name: Sergeant-at-Arms
text: Knights get the glory. Soldiers get things done.

name: Chalice of Life // Chalice of Death
text: The sweet taste of hope's promise.

name: Beast in Show
text: "Not a surprise to see her on the podium. This paragon of tusk curvature is just the latest addition to the long championship lineage of Wildspeaker Ranch."

name: Desperate Farmer // Depraved Harvester
text: A tragic moment pushed him to a blasphemous act.

name: Vertigo
text:
"I saw the wizard gesturing, but I didn't guess his plan until my aesthir cried out and went into a dive."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

name: Charcoal Diamond
text: The essence of night to harden the soul.

name: Pay No Heed
text:
"Inhale life. Exhale pain."
—Mystic elder

name: Vortex Runner
text: "By using the vortex, I can study for at least fifteen extra minutes between every class. I wasn't being reckless, Dean Imbraham. I was being efficient."

name: Death's Duet
text: Life has always been a dance. It is only fitting that death sing the tune.

name: Makindi Shieldmate
text: The more who rely on him, the more resolute he becomes.

name: Pain Seer
text: Every twitching nerve and pulsing vein carries a message, discernible with the right tools.

name: Fertile Ground
text: As Phyrexians descended, Multani paused to reflect on the beauty that might never be seen again.

name: Remand
text: For the Azorius, the law can be a physical shield against chaos and anarchy.

name: Thunderherd Migration
text: The herds follow as new growth arises.

name: Infinity Elemental
text: It's so infinite that its flavor text says, "It's so infinite that its flavor text says, "It's so infinite that its flavor text says, "It's so infinite that its flavor text says, "It's so infinite that its flavor text says, "It's so infinite that its flavor text says, "It's so infinite that its flavor text says, "It's so infinite that its flavor text says, "It's so infinite that its flavor text says, "It's so infinite that its flavor text says,

name: Bear's Companion
text: "The Sultai came hunting for a bear hide. Now I have a belt of naga skin, and my friend has a full belly."

name: Roc Hunter
text: "Never track the roc itself with your eyes, for it will swoop with the sun at its back and blind you. Instead, track its shadow and, when it's almost upon you, heave your javelin upward with all your might."

name: No-Dachi
text: Not keen-edged enough for cutting armor, the no-dachi slew by folding its victim rapidly and violently under the weight of its impact.

name: Spare Supplies
text:
"It's better to carry a little extra weight than to find yourself halfway down a baloth's throat with no knife."
—Doral, Bala Ged guide

name: Synchronized Spellcraft
text: "Ready? One... two..."

name: Maze Skullbomb
text: It pulses with the might of an apex predator.

name: Treasure Trove
text: "Nope, there's nothing here either. You guys go on ahead, I'll catch up in a minute. . . . Whoo hoo!"

name: Air-Cult Elemental
text: Elemental Evil distorts the natural elements, limiting them to aspects of destruction.

name: Lurking Chupacabra
text:
"Shadow birthed it. The moon gave it eyes, and the jungle gave it teeth. But it was Death that taught it cruelty."
—Huatli

name: Channel
text:
「呼吸しているかぎり、お前にはまだ貢献できるものがある。」
—-ウィザーブルームの学部長、ヴァレンティン

name: Vinelasher Kudzu
text: It grows to hate you.

name: Mist-Cloaked Herald
text: With matchless stealth, the River Heralds fought a running battle against the three enemy forces.

name: Commander's Sphere
text: It harmonizes with the essence of its master.

name: Begin the Invasion
text:
Across many worlds, millions of eyes
witnessed the same impossible horror.

name: Adventurous Impulse
text: Every odyssey begins with a single step.

name: Rubblebelt Recluse
text: Joining a guild, even the Gruul, would mean giving up some of his independence. He'd rather smash what he wants to smash.

name: Tocasia's Dig Site
text: Sent by their noble parents to toughen up and learn something of the world's past, Urza and Mishra instead uncovered Terisiare's future.

name: Third Path Iconoclast
text: "When all you have is a hammer, everything looks like a nail. I merely propose expanding our toolbox."

name: The Dead Shall Serve
text: "Tell your old master I said hello."

name: Elusive Tormentor // Insidious Mist
text: Older vampires are usually more cautious than the newly-sired, calling upon ancient magic for which neonates lack patience.

name: Fountain of Youth
text: The fountain had stood in the town square for centuries, but only the pigeons knew its secret.

name: Orcish Librarian
text: Us hungry, need food . . . . Lots of books . . . . Hmm . . . .

name: Settle the Score
text:
"You bound me with a contract only your death could end—and you thought me the fool?"
—Liliana Vess

name: Needlethorn Drake
text: As they learn to fly, young drakes have a tendency to accidentally impale trees, cliffs, and unsuspecting students.

name: Plated Rootwalla
text:
" . . . And the third little boar built his house out of rootwalla plates . . . ."
—Skyshroud children's story

name: Faerie Impostor
text: Many Tin Street shops display a sign on the door: "No cloaks allowed."

name: Inspirit
text:
"The hour of your redemption is here. . . . Rally to me. . . . rise and strike. Strike at every favorable opportunity. For your homes and hearths, strike!"
—General Douglas MacArthur, to the people of the Philippines

name: Azorius Guildgate
text: Enter the Senate, the seat of justice and the foundation of Ravnican society.

name: Persecute Artist
text: The torches and pitchforks were no match for Rebecca's fans.

name: Flame Spirit
text:
"The spirit of the flame is the spirit of change."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Escape to the Wilds
text: The guards kindled the hearth and locked the door to Ellwen's chamber. By morning, the fire was out and Ellwen was gone.

name: Incursion Specialist
text: "Work for the Dimir again? That depends. Tell me more about this maze."

name: Priest of Gix
text:
"Gix doesn't want a people to rule but puppets to entertain his madness."
—Xantcha, Phyrexian outcast

name: Reconnaissance Mission
text:
"The bonders work with creatures that fly, slink, and burrow. Assume they know everything."
—Jirina Kudro

name: Bioluminary
text: The Gargantikari astroserpent hated the taste of merfolk, but the audience didn't need to know that.

name: Traitorous Instinct
text: The horror lurched about like a puppet from a madman's nightmare, squeezing the life from its own kind.

name: Brazen Freebooter
text: Finders, keepers.

name: Plummet
text: The elf's blade carved deep into the Eldrazi drone's fleshy lattices. Without a sound, the drone lost equilibrium and tumbled from the sky.

name: Island
text: In crystal-studded waters far below the surface, you've discovered an incubating egg of mysterious origin.

name: Pattern Matcher
text:
"Good! Now put it with the other widdle bunnies."
—Sargis Haz, artificer

name: Blackblade Reforged
text:
"Tempered in the blood of ten thousand sacrifices? Superstitious drivel."
—Mishra, note to his researchers

name: Indatha Crystal
text: Crystals nestle in the roots of Indatha's helica trees as if being nurtured by their embrace.

name: Howling Fury
text: I howl my soul to the moon, and the moon howls with me.

name: Yavimaya Sojourner
text: To the long-lived treefolk, the Phyrexians invading again after only three centuries was as though they never left.

name: Aladdin's Ring
text: Some say Aladdin's third wish was for this ring.

name: Chivalrous Chevalier
text: "I treat every foe according to the highest codes of conduct. Then I kill them."

name: Vrock
text:
"Don't try to bribe them. They'll take your gold *and* your liver."
—Volo's field notes

name: Patrol Signaler
text: Many a keen-eared bogle has run afoul of a clever and silently orchestrated kithkin ambush.

name: Ronin Cavekeeper
text: The akki were surprised to encounter a human who could fight in the caves as well as they.

name: Arena Rector
text: Her call echoes across worlds, calling the loyal to battle.

name: Fading Hope
text: "At least I won't become one of . . . those things."

name: Beast of Burden
text: The heavier the load, the harder it works.

name: Urza, Prince of Kroog
text:
"At heart, Urza was an inventor, not a warlord. Over time, the burdens of leadership left him as cold and calculating as his mechanical creations."
—*The Antiquities War*

name: Seasoned Marshal
text: There are only two rules of tactics: never be without a plan, and never rely on it.

name: Giant Octopus
text:
"Before my eyes was a horrible monster, worthy to figure in the legends of the marvellous. . . . Its eight arms, or rather feet, fixed to its head . . . were twice as long as its body, and were twisted like the furies' hair."
—Jules Verne, *Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea*, trans. Lewis

name: Dragon Whelp
text:
"O to be a dragon . . . of silkworm size or immense . . ."
—Marianne Moore, "O to Be a Dragon"

name: Time Stretch
text: There's lots of time like the present.

name: Vexing Beetle
text: As the Mirari's mutating effects grew out of control, centaurs and druids fled—but insects swarmed closer.

name: Aura Flux
text: To some, the Tolarian sunrise was a blinding flash; to others, a lingering glow.

name: Memory Lapse
text:
"To sculpt a mind is to see every memory and thought as an individual piece that can be rearranged—or removed."
—Jace Beleren

name: Ritual of the Returned
text: A mask forged to avenge a death forgotten.

name: Arboria
text:
"I have never before felt so unwelcome in a forest."
—Jolrael

name: Inspired Tinkering
text: "What do you mean 'Does it work?' What an insulting question."

name: Harmonic Prodigy
text: Each note strikes with deadly precision.

name: Bala Ged Scorpion
text: Fast and lethal, with a penchant for the weak and infirm.

name: Waveskimmer Aven
text: The greatest gift you can give a sea aven is solitude.

name: Squirrel Squatters
text: Such plush accommodations.

name: Centaur Courser
text:
"The centaurs are truly free. Never will they be tamed by temptation or controlled by fear. They live in total harmony, a feat not yet achieved by our kind."
—Ramal, sage of Westgate

name: Memory Lapse
text:
"The caliph was so intelligent he could not remember what he knew."
—Azeworai, "Three Riddles"

name: Lightwalker
text:
"The greatest gift Dromoka gives is the ability to fly without wings."
—Urdnan, Dromoka warrior

name: Sunfall
text:
"Let the light scour away your imperfect flesh."
—Heliod

name: Utter End
text:
"Target eradicated. That which burns shall ever be blessed."
—Fusilave unit Tor-213

name: Horseshoe Crab
text:
"Hmm . . . It looks kinda like a bug. Let's crack it open an' see if it tastes like one!"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

name: Vengeful Reaper
text: "Starnheim is closed to you, coward."

name: Kithkin Mourncaller
text: Eidren's hunts are dangerous affairs. All dread the inevitable recounting of those who died while flushing out his prey.

name: Abundant Harvest
text: Mood: Surrounded by the abundance of nature.

name: Jade Statue
text:
"The paradox of jade statues is that their victims never really expect attack, but they are never completely surprised either."
—Kabel, Tolarian archivist

name: Admiral Beckett Brass
text: "You and your ship will make a fine addition to my fleet."

name: Quiet Disrepair
text:
"Artifice has always stood upon nature's shoulders. Let us watch nature take a turn."
—Freyalise

name: Zombie Musher
text: The World Spell thawed their icy graves, promising rest in soft, quiet earth at last. But Heidar called them to duty for a twisted cause.

name: Naturalize
text: "From here, let the world be reborn."

name: Llanowar Vanguard
text: Llanowar rallied around Eladamri's banner and united in his name.

name: Protomatter Powder
text:
"There is no such thing as scrap metal. All such material can be repaired with the proper bonding agent."
—Quennus, metallurgeon

name: Corpse Hauler
text:
"He expects a reward, but the only piece of silver he'll get from me is my blade in his gut."
—Shelac, necromancer

name: Passionate Archaeologist
text: You can't remember a time when you didn't feel the pull of forgotten stories and buried secrets.

name: Sythis, Harvest's Hand
text: "Through every verdant field, every bough that hangs heavy with fruit, Karametra shows her love."

name: Wizened Snitches
text:
"Be careful what information you ask them to find, for it will likely be the subject of tale time at the alehouse."
—Sirislav, Dimir spy

name: Lord of the Undead
text: "Do not weep at your defeat, my dear. In death, you will serve a greater purpose—mine."

name: Path to Exile
text:
"Jayce Talis, you are accused of illegal experimentation and endangering the citizens of Piltover."
—Cassandra Kiramman

name: Dark Ritual
text:
"Leshrac, my liege, grant me the power I am due."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Rhet-Crop Spearmaster
text: "In the afterlife, I'll have no need of sleep. And until then, I have no time for it!"

name: Vindicate
text: "I am the mad one!"

name: Gerrard's Verdict
text: A heart of light and a soul of darkness cannot coexist.

name: Staff of the Death Magus
text: A symbol of ambition in ruthless times.

name: Panicked Bystander // Cackling Culprit
text: "Ha! They fall for it every time."

name: Gerrard's Wisdom
text:
"Fighting without an army is called a duel, and you'll lose a duel if your enemy comes expecting a war."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Orcish Cannonade
text:
"Crispy! Scarback! Load another volcano-ball."
—Stumphobbler Thuj, orcish captain

name: Opt
text: The choice isn't whether to eat, but when to stop.

name: Imperial Lancer
text: "Together my mount and I are stronger than either of us apart."

name: Sabretooth Tiger
text: To a sabretooth, all men are mice.

name: Thraben Purebloods
text:
"I've learned to trust my dogs' instincts. When they're calm, I'm calm. And when they get nervous, I get my crossbow."
—Hinrik of House Cecani

name: Dismiss into Dream
text:
"You trust in the shadows of a breeze."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

name: Rootwalla
text: They make terrible pets . . . unless you don't like your other pets.

name: Irresistible Prey
text: The baloth's instincts boiled, its muscles pulled taut, and its razor-spines bristled, as it turned to face—a runt meepling.

name: Segovian Leviathan
text:
"Leviathan, too! Can you catch him with a fish-hook or run a line round his tongue?"
—Job 40:25

name: River's Rebuke
text: Carefully following the thaumatic compass Bolas had given her, Vraska blundered straight into the River Heralds' trap.

name: Jadecraft Artisan
text: "A blade is not fully forged until it is given."

name: Merrow Levitator
text: He fancies himself a master thief, claiming to "steal the ground" from his victims.

name: Megrim
text:
"It's a vicious circle. Stress breeds pain. Pain breeds stress. It's simply beautiful, wouldn't you agree?"
—Vradeen, vampire nocturnus

name: Twinblade Assassins
text: Rumors swirl of a pair of deadly Golgari assassins known only as the Left and Right Hands of the Ochran.

name: Arrogant Wurm
text: It's hard to be humble when the whole world is bite size.

name: Dissipate
text:
"Morning light, morning light,
Chase away the fears of night."
—Gavony children's rhyme

name: Asmira, Holy Avenger
text:
"Omens lie in this early harvest's fruit."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Arrogant Outlaw
text: The debased remnants of the Falkenrath bloodline prowl the passes near their ruined castles.

name: Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore
text: The highway of fear is the shortest route to defeat.

name: Arctic Wolves
text:
"No matter where we cat warriors go in the world, those stupid slobberers find us."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Prosperity
text:
"Wealth is a good thing, compared to poverty—your food is better, your robes are softer, and your companions have bathed more recently."
—Kukemssa pirate

name: Noble Steeds
text:
"Only an animal born in the wild has sufficient heart to be a true Knight's steed."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

name: Sunrise Sovereign
text: A hundred generations has he mentored, a hundred armies has he crushed beneath his feet, yet only a hundred words has he ever spoken, each more revered than a hundred books.

name: Saproling Infestation
text: "My army took centuries to gather," remarked Urza. "Yavimaya seems to conjure hers out of thin air."

name: Dapper Shieldmate
text: Descended from Old Capenna's paladins, the Brokers are masters of defensive combat.

name: Baki's Curse
text:
"Those who fling spells too quickly should have reason to regret it."
—Baki, Wizard Attendant

name: Midnight Reaper
text: No one welcomes his visit, yet all must grant him tribute.

name: Twin-Silk Spider
text: A forest-wide network of webs brings a hungry couple to captured prey.

name: Door to Nothingness
text:
"I have re-created a Thran portal at last! Before I inform Lord Urza, I'll test it myself."
—Oryan, Urzan artificer, final research note

name: Blood Clock
text: In an age of war, time is measured not by sand but by blood.

name: Steadfast Guard
text: "Best leave your tongue in its yap-hole, Mercadian scum, for your silvered words and golden bribes do not sparkle so brightly outside your city."

name: Scab-Clan Mauler
text: They inflict pain to forget their own and break foes to feel whole.

name: Synchronized Eviction
text: "I told you this one would be a handful."

name: Corrupted Roots
text: The bones of Jund's dead resurfaced in Naya, poisoning the jungle and killing the sunseeders' crops.

name: Elfhame Palace
text: Llanowar has seven elfhames, or kingdoms, each with its own ruler. Their palaces are objects of awe, wonder, and envy.

name: Oust
text:
"'Invincible' is just a word."
—Gideon Jura

name: Faerie Noble
text:
"Faeries talk all in riddles and tricky bits, 'cept the Nobles. Now, there's some straight talkers."
—Joskun, An-Havva Constable

name: Terminal Agony
text: His mouth melted to slag, yet somehow he kept screaming.

name: Niv-Mizzet, Dracogenius
text: He has no patience for minds that do not inspire him or explode by trying.

name: Chrome Steed
text: According to Auriok myth, it collects scrap in order to reassemble its lost rider.

name: Sandbar Merfolk
text: You are not prey until a predator knows of your existence.

name: Shackles of Treachery
text: In that instant, Toralf felt only the power of the storm and the need to destroy.

name: Essence Scatter
text:
"What you attempt to pull from the Æther, I can spread onto the wind."
—Jace Beleren

name: Abbey Griffin
text:
"The darkness crawls with vampires and ghouls, but we are not without allies."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch

name: Wreak Havoc
text:
"Crush them!"
—Borborygmos

name: Neurok Commando
text: "There's no more time for secluded study. Answers are there only for those with the courage to take them."

name: Witness the End
text:
"Ulamog stood before us at Sea Gate, ready to succumb . . . and then Kozilek arose. Whatever hope I had for our world died."
—Vandri, Kalastria emissary

name: Scorch the Fields
text:
"Your fields will turn as black as a ghoul's tongue and fire shall be your only harvest."
—Minaldra, the Vizag Atum

name: Krosan Grip
text:
"Give up these unnatural weapons, these scrolls. Heart and mind and fist are enough."
—Zyd, Kamahlite druid

name: Celestial Purge
text:
"A world without evil? Boring. Give me vile fiends to smite and banish any day."
—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge

name: Slingshot Goblin
text: It's most effective when it doesn't eat the ammunition.

name: Sly Spy
text: The Agents of S.N.E.A.K.—Serious, Nonstop Espionage and Kidnapping.

name: Cultivate
text:
「たったひとつの植物が教えてくれることの多さに驚くと思います。」
――ウィザーブルームの学部長、リセッテ

name: Mitotic Manipulation
text:
"They can't even comprehend nature. How could they improve it?"
—Venser

name: Parapet
text: There is no wall that can't be improved by making it taller.

name: Gobsmacked
text: You haven't see it until you see it in 6-D.

name: Meddling Mage
text: "This violent wasteland is an indictment of its people. These cowards lack the will to oppose disorder."

name: Meria's Outrider
text: Arrows fashioned from the living wood of Yavimaya carry all of the forest's rage in their fire-hardened points.

name: Fugue
text: "My ship . . . ," Sisay mumbled. "Intact," Gerrard reassured her, "which is more than I can say for you, my friend." Sisay laughed despite the pain.

name: Primal Order
text:
"My sorrow: to dream of simple times, and wake in mine . . . ."
—Ola DaRiol, "Regrets"

name: Nahiri's Machinations
text: "Sorin, I'm going to take everything from you."

name: Scrounge
text: When leonin settlers abandon their homes to the nim, items of value are often left behind.

name: Quicksilver Amulet
text: "Wonderful! You got a lion on your first try. Now put it back."

name: Sanctuary Raptor
text: The song of the Worldsoul can take on life in the most unlikely places.

name: Dominate
text:
"I've come to reclaim what is mine. And you, Greven, are mine."
—Volrath

name: Sandstorm
text: Even the landscape turned against Sarsour, first rising up and pelting him, then rearranging itself so he could no longer find his way.

name: Essence Sliver
text: The slivers would survive, even at the expense of every other creature on Otaria.

name: Ranger's Hawk
text: Swift eyes to scout the way ahead.

name: Granny's Payback
text: Few remember the exploits of Dakkon's grandmother, Eunice Blackblade.

name: Soul's Grace
text: An avatar he sculpts of fellowship and light.

name: Bonesplitter
text:
"It puts an end to what ails you."
—Jeorg, Valla battlemaster

name: Perilous Voyage
text: For the first time in her life, Vraska tried to prevent death.

name: Sacrifice Play
text: In recursive chess, one piece can capture another only after beating it in a game of recursive chess.

name: Burrowing Razormaw
text:
"That's odd. I don't remember seeing plans to dig a trench near here."
—Lognell, Argivian scout

name: Stone Calendar
text: The Pretender Mairsil ordered a great Calendar drawn up to show when the paths to the Dark Lands were strongest.

name: Cogwork Archivist
text:
"It's the largest library in the Multiverse. Of course it has the largest librarians."
—Kasmina

name: Eye of Vecna
text: "I see all things as they truly are! I see . . . decay in all flesh, and betrayal in every heart."

name: Gustcloak Skirmisher
text: They're trained in the art of pressing their luck.

name: Runed Servitor
text: Scholars had puzzled for centuries over the ruins at Tal Terig. Its secrets had always lived within one rune-carved head.

name: Rakdos Signet
text: Made of bone and boiled in blood, a Rakdos signet is not considered finished until it has been used as a murder weapon.

name: Razorfoot Griffin
text: Like a meteor, it strikes from above without warning. Unlike a meteor, it then carries you off and eats you.

name: Cagemail
text:
"Power often costs too high a price."
—Commander Eesha

name: Disenchant
text: Where the holy light of the angels has shone, only purity remains.

name: Flurry of Wings
text: "We are born soldiers. The call to battle is a homecoming."

name: The Restoration of Eiganjo // Architect of Restoration
text:
"A visionary looks at rubble and sees not only what was, but also what could be."
—Onyx-Eye, architect of Eiganjo

name: Popular Entertainer
text: The last thing anyone would describe you as is shy. You love the spotlight, and it loves you back.

name: School of the Unseen
text: After the terrible retribution visited upon Lat-Nam, this school of mages chose to hide from the eyes of the world.

name: Perpetual Timepiece
text: Do not be so caught up in keeping track of time that you forget to make use of it.

name: Bloodtracker
text: "Flee all you like. The further you run the more firmly I feel your heartbeat."

name: Sporecrown Thallid
text:
"The identifying ornamental growths of alpha thallids may be hereditary, or catalyzed by some chemical signal."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*

name: Grasp of Darkness
text:
"I welcome the use of even the foulest magic if it will rid us of the monstrosities that plague our world."
—Munda, ambush leader

name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
text:
"The paladins would be wise not to forget about the Pearl Trident. The merfolk warriors have turned the tide of more than one human war . . . and I have no doubt they shall do so again."
—Onean scholar

name: Primal Huntbeast
text:
"To the unskilled, it appears as blurred patches of distorted light. Few have seen its true form."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Ignite the Beacon
text:
"If you can't save yourself, you fight to give someone else a chance."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Go for the Throat
text: Having flesh is increasingly a liability on Mirrodin.

name: Forbidden Friendship
text: The two looked at each other, and neither fled. "I see," the soldier murmured. "We're both just fighting for survival out here, aren't we?"

name: Symbiosis
text: Although the elves of Argoth always considered them a nuisance, the pixies made fine allies during the war against the machines.

name: Crackling Club
text: It adds injury to injury.

name: Transcendent Message
text: Wrenn reached out to Teferi through the Blind Eternities, and an impossible connection flared across the vast emptiness.

name: Plumb the Forbidden
text: Strixhaven forbade all magic from the Blood Age, so that is where Extus began his research.

name: Lotleth Giant
text:
"I prefer the big and looming to the small and skittering."
—Cevraya, Golgari shaman

name: Footbottom Feast
text: The scent of rot and vinegar fills the marsh, inviting boggarts from every warren to reunite and feast.

name: Trip Wire
text: Trip wire, hooked poles, and sunken pits were commonly used to unhorse riders during the Three Kingdoms period.

name: Wall of Frost
text:
"I have seen countless petty warmongers gaze on it for a time before turning away."
—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge

name: Gobbling Ooze
text: The furious citizens blamed the Simic for releasing it in their district. The Simic pointed out that rats were no longer a problem.

name: Wall of Blossoms
text: Each flower identical, every leaf and petal disturbingly exact.

name: Mirran Crusader
text: A symbol of what Mirrodin once was and hope for what it will be again.

name: Sign in Blood
text:
「最悪の決断をするのは、いつも最も優秀な生徒です。」
——シルバークイル学部長、シェイル

name: Mindeye Drake
text: They can map both the cityscape and the minds of its architects.

name: Pyrotechnics
text:
"Who says lightning never strikes twice?"
—Storm shaman

name: Booster Tutor
text: "You saved that *Urza's Saga* pack all these years for *this*?"

name: Stolen Grain
text: At the battle of Guandu, Cao Cao defeated Yuan Shao by raiding his grain depot, leaving him with no way to feed his troops.

name: Counsel of the Soratami
text: "Wisdom is not the counting of all the drops in a waterfall. Wisdom is learning why the water seeks the earth."

name: Just the Wind
text: "There's nothing to worry about."

name: Dwynen's Elite
text:
"Come, my beautiful brothers and sisters. Let us hunt."
—Dwynen, Gilt-Leaf daen

name: Frankie Peanuts
text: Don't cross him or you'll end up sleeping with the merfolk.

name: Declaration of Naught
text: Every story, even a faerie tale, comes to an end.

name: Darkest Hour
text:
"Yawgmoth spent eons wrapping Phyrexians in human skin. They are the sleeper agents, and they are everywhere."
—Xantcha, to Urza

name: Meng Huo, Barbarian King
text: The stubborn Meng Huo was captured and released by Kongming seven times before finally surrendering.

name: Eldrazi Monument
text:
"Gods don't die. They merely slumber."
—Ayli, Kamsa cleric

name: Swift Silence
text:
"This world may not know peace, but in my presence you *will* know quiet."
—Augustin IV

name: Priest of the Blessed Graf
text: The honored dead who lie in blessed grafs are not easily stirred, but the threat of eternal night called many from their rest.

name: Index
text: "What good is having all the right answers if you have them at all the wrong times?"

name: Gloomlance
text: Death stings the victim only once, but those left behind feel the pain of loss with every passing memory.

name: Soulless Jailer
text:
"Lock the door and eat the key."
—Vraan, Executioner Thane

name: Aladdin's Ring
text:
"A good lamp will light your way. A good ring will clear it."
—Nervan, royal jeweler

name: Vraan, Executioner Thane
text: Do not fear death. Fear failure.

name: Supernatural Stamina
text:
"All are not equal—neither in life nor after death. Bontu's favorites will stand highest in eternity."
—Senifet, vizier of Bontu

name: Redwood Treefolk
text:
"In the heart of Llanowar the magic is so strong that trees cannot stay rooted."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Dimir Guildgate
text:
"Every guild dreads infiltration. I should know—I've been a member of all of them."
—Lazav

name: Ardent Recruit
text: "We lost our homes and our kin. We won't let those rotters take our future as well."

name: Blinding Light
text:
"My shield will bear a shining sun so you will always be with me. / Inlaid with gold, it will shine like glowing embers."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Villainous Wealth
text: Gold buys death. Death earns gold.

name: Leonin Iconoclast
text: "The stars belong in the night sky. This is our world, and we are our own masters."

name: Take Down
text: The drake flew true. The arrow flew truer.

name: Soldevi Sage
text:
"To hide the truth is more than folly—it is fatal."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Tah-Crop Skirmisher
text: Initiates live and train with their crop, the unit that begins the trials together.

name: Skyhunter Prowler
text: As tireless as her mount, a skyhunter's vigil is measured in days.

name: Bloodline Keeper // Lord of Lineage
text: Every mouth gets fed, no matter how large or pointy.

name: Caltrops
text: Toward the end, Gatha struggled to keep his experiments in and his patrons out.

name: Impending Doom
text: "Feast, for your next meal may be your last!"

name: Slaughter Cry
text:
"Since when did 'AIIIEEEE!' become a negotiation tactic?"
—Nikou, Joraga bard

name: Drifting Shade
text: It stalks the fens by the light of the full moon, gathering shadows as it floats among them.

name: Malicious Affliction
text:
"Such an affliction appears to seek out the pure."
—Byro, plague doctor

name: Tempted by the Oriq
text: To exact his vengeance, Extus needed followers. His infiltrators recruited promising mage-students from the very halls he sought to destroy.

name: Donal, Herald of Wings
text: He sees a flicker of Avacyn's grace in every wingbeat.

name: Windstorm
text:
"When the last dragon fell, its spirit escaped as a roar into the wind."
—Temur tale

name: Sentinel of the Eternal Watch
text: The portcullis is superfluous.

name: Necrologia
text:
"My enemies' death yields threefold benefit: removal, reuse, and research."
—Volrath

name: Soulcatcher
text:
"Holy couriers guide aven spirits up to the home of the Ancestor."
—Mystic elder

name: Stitcher's Supplier
text: No part goes to waste.

name: Tempest of Light
text:
"This world reeks of another's hand. Someone or something is defying the power of the gods and shaping this planet. I intend for it to stop."
—Glissa Sunseeker

name: Eye Gouge
text: One chance. One throw. One perfect hit.

name: Goblin Ski Patrol
text:
"AIIIEEEE!"
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

name: Tree of Tales
text: Tel-Jilad, sanctum of the ancient trolls, keepers of the secret of Mirrodin's origin.

name: Slinking Skirge
text: Davvol encouraged the skirges; they made excellent sentries and were quite edible if properly seasoned.

name: Psychogenic Probe
text: The same devices sold as surgeons' tools in Lumengrid are sold as implements of torture in Mephidross.

name: Privileged Position
text: There's no better defense than simply being out of reach.

name: Armorcraft Judge
text: Were she not a judge, she'd win the division herself.

name: Vigor Mortis
text: After fear and weakness rot away, that which remains is stronger than its living form.

name: Shadow-Rite Priest
text: Backstabbing is common within demonic cults. So are front- and side-stabbing.

name: Liability
text: Gerrard realized that the helpless woman they'd rescued from Rath was nothing of the sort.

name: One-Eyed Scarecrow
text: Farmhands and priests mutter curses at the ragged thing; it unnerves more than just the crows.

name: Blood Moon
text: Bathed in deep crimson, the land that once gave comfort and shelter now yielded nothing but hostility.

name: Into the Earthen Maw
text: "You may even see them again. Full digestion takes three hundred years."

name: Hinata, Dawn-Crowned
text: Hope races on sunlit hooves.

name: Inviolability
text: A soldier's faith is magic strong enough to protect against any blade.

name: Arrest
text:
"Unfortunately, it doesn't restrain the beast's smell."
—Glissa Sunseeker

name: Arni Brokenbrow
text: "I headbutted a troll. And won."

name: Urborg Shambler
text: A writhing mass of rot, with sharp claws and a vicious spirit.

name: Ogre Taskmaster
text: Ogres learn how to smash stuff even before they learn how to walk.

name: Enigma Drake
text: Many initiates believe it possesses secrets beyond imagining. Many have become meals trying to learn them.

name: Public Enemy
text: Every Halo smuggler walks a razor's edge between untold riches and sudden disaster.

name: Wee Dragonauts
text:
"Something's causing electrospheric disruption in the blazekite's spire-vanes. Find the cause, and tell them to keep it up!"
—Juzba, Izzet tinker

name: Component Collector
text: "Keep master busy with new bits or else maybe she wonders if I'm made of bits too."

name: Ley Druid
text: After years of training, the druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

name: Quilled Sliver
text:
"They have long kept us under attack, but we do not lack for ammunition. The very bodies of our foes arm us against them."
—Adom Capashen, Benalish hero

name: Chandra's Fury
text: "They started it."

name: Fendeep Summoner
text: "What is drowned is not forgotten. I will fulfill my oath. Come back to me, my brethren, as I have come back for you."

name: Morgue Thrull
text: It's so hard to find good help these days.

name: Gustcloak Runner
text: Cabal spies trying to follow the Order's movements are constantly frustrated by tracks that stop dead.

name: Dark Ritual
text:
"From void evolved Phyrexia. Great Yawgmoth, Father of Machines, saw its perfection. Thus the Grand Evolution began"
—*Phyrexian Scriptures*

name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
text: They patched the holes, loaded their sharpest rocks, spanked their children one last time, and lurched off into the sunset.

name: Night's Whisper
text: The Moriok call the black moon the Whisperer. At her apex, she whispers of power.

name: Baloth Woodcrasher
text: Its insatiable hunger quickly depletes a region of prey. It must migrate from place to place to feed its massive bulk.

name: Laboratory Maniac
text: "They claim that dog is man's best friend. But according to my calculations, it's actually this guy!"

name: Buried Alive
text: The scrape of shovels and the tumble of cold dirt soon muffled their pleas.

name: Mr. Orfeo, the Boulder
text: Once he was jumped by a dozen Maestros agents. You can still see their imprints in the pavement if you know where to look.

name: Maulfist Doorbuster
text: "Knock, knock . . . too late."

name: Davriel's Shadowfugue
text: Shadows coiled around the witness's mind. Then the moment vanished, leaving only the sting of its loss.

name: Triangle of War
text: The Zhalfirin war triangle represents a trinity of might, faith, and guile.

name: Fling
text: Masters of the sword know the blade is not the only weapon at their disposal.

name: Brindle Boar
text: The war lasted for generations. The boars didn't need to hunt for food anymore. They fed on the fallen corpses, and the living fed off of them.

name: Expedition Skulker
text: Rogues bring an array of useful skills to the work of an adventuring party: stealth, agility, the ability to locate and disarm traps, and a subtle, deadly fighting style.

name: Illusory Demon
text: In the Maelstrom, a trick of the light can feast on human flesh.

name: Blessing
text:
"Virtue can't survive without strength."
—Ardanna of the Angelic Council

name: Brineborn Cutthroat
text: "I always attack from where their spyglasses can't see."

name: Preeminent Captain
text: "If you need an example to lead others to the front lines, consider the precedent set."

name: Hostile Realm
text: Lorwyn's crust explodes with power when the greater elementals are born. The flamekin use the fallout as cover for forays into enemy territory.

name: Pyroblast
text: "Told you it would melt."

name: Flying Carpet
text: Woven from strands of griffin mane and pegasus tail.

name: Great Oak Guardian
text: His roots reach deep and grip hard.

name: Heir of the Wilds
text: In the high caves of the Qal Sisma mountains, young hunters quest to hear the echoes of their fierce ancestors.

name: Steeple Creeper
text:
"If the Fin Clade cannot produce a reliable venomous krasis, mobile in both air and water, then the Guardian Project will absorb its resources."
—Vannifar

name: Stratadon
text: Designed like the gargadons of Keld—big and brutal.

name: Epic Downfall
text: The dragon had a lot of things going through his mind that day. He didn't expect a sword to be one of them.

name: Forbidding Spirit
text: "You will respect the dead."

name: Witherbloom Campus
text: Mage-students fascinated by the energies of life and death choose Witherbloom, the college of essence studies.

name: Keeper of the Nine Gales
text: "You cannot fight the storm."

name: Kargan Dragonrider
text: "Only those who give the dragons the respect they deserve may bear our title."

name: Blanchwood Armor
text: Some armor is forged, some is forested.

name: Ineffable Blessing
text: "Hallowed be this potpourri of sundry goods!"

name: Weary Prisoner // Wrathful Jailbreaker
text: "And now I'm coming for you!"

name: Silversmote Ghoul
text: Being trapped between two forms of unlife is a fate worse than mere death.

name: Trade Routes
text: The wise, the righteous, the mighty—the merchant feeds them all.

name: Shriekdiver
text:
"It's faster than we are. Draw its attention while the Ledev take aim!"
—Shauntal, Boros legionnaire

name: Inside Out
text: Seyden's temperament didn't take well to the puca's magic. Nor did his face.

name: Fabricate
text: Megatron is no more . . . there is only Galvatron.

name: Fling
text: Sometimes the cannoneer must become the cannonball.

name: Repeated Reverberation
text: It's in the nature of fire to grow.

name: Invasion of Pyrulea // Gargantuan Slabhorn
text: To the slabhorn, the branches of the Invasion Tree were as brittle as the stems of a Pyrulean fern.

name: Darklit Gargoyle
text: It shines in the darkness of its master's ambitions.

name: Curiosity
text: "You know that secret? The one that wakes you up at night in a cold sweat? The one you think no one else in the world knows? Well, guess what."

name: Tooth and Claw
text:
"You deify nature as female—kind and gentle—yet you cringe at what is natural."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Ransack the Lab
text:
"I think someone is stealing from my laboratory. It had better not be you!"
—Geralf, letter to Gisa

name: Steamcore Weird
text: Like many Izzet creations, weirds are based on wild contradictions yet somehow manage to work.

name: Bone to Ash
text:
"I can think of worse ways to go. On second thought, maybe not."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

name: Etherwrought Page
text: An unbound page is a riddle, free of cover and of context, a favorite token of the hegemon.

name: Squirrel Mob
text: An army of squirrels is still an army.

name: Highborn Ghoul
text:
"All the dead sleep lightly here, no matter how refined their beds may be."
—Grafdigger Wulmer

name: Lhurgoyf
text:
"Ach! Hans, run! It's the lhurgoyf!"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words

name: Skywise Teachings
text: Ojutai's words must be translated from Draconic before his students can benefit from their wisdom.

name: Pristine Talisman
text:
"Tools and artisans can be destroyed, but the act of creation is inviolate."
—Elspeth Tirel

name: Mephitic Ooze
text: In Mephidross, refuse doesn't last long—it's all scavenged, reanimated, or consumed.

name: Eviscerate
text:
"Fear the dark if you must, but don't mistake sunlight for safety."
—Josu Vess

name: Erase (Not the Urza's Legacy One)
text: Synonyms for "erase" we haven't used: ablate, a̶b̶r̶a̶d̶e̶, chafe, fray, f̶r̶a̶z̶z̶l̶e̶, scuff, and scrub.

name: Blighted Agent
text:
"Urabrask may suspect our surveillance, but he cannot stop it."
—Avaricta, Gitaxian sective

name: Bronze Sable
text:
The Champion stood alone between the horde of the Returned and the shrine to Karametra, cutting down scores among hundreds. She would have been overcome if not for the aid of the temple guardians whom Karametra awakened.
—*The Theriad*

name: Dryad Arbor
text:
"Touch no tree, break no branch, and speak only the question you wish answered."
—Von Yomm, elder druid, to her initiates

name: Impaler Shrike
text:
"Interrogation is an unnecessary step for acquiring information."
—Politus, Gitaxian morphologist

name: Narstad Scrapper
text:
"Finally, the principles of corpse animation applied to bloodless materials!"
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

name: Open the Graves
text: It was a night like any other. It would soon become a night no one would ever forget.

name: Gravespawn Sovereign
text: The Cabal never expected its creations to create servants of their own.

name: Ihsan's Shade
text: No mortal could atone for Ihsan's betrayal. Redemption required him to become something else.

name: Crosstown Courier
text: Information travels quickly through Ravnica's network of messengers and thought agents.

name: Mortify
text: The eyes let flow with tears, then blood, then the very soul—the whole wrung inside out, dripping down into the blackened puddle of the past.

name: Ferrovore
text: The Vulshok use its digestion to break down the most obstinate artifacts, from darksteel myr to seastrider plates.

name: Marshland Bloodcaster
text: Blood magic is more artery than science.

name: Winged Portent
text:
"No, no, it's just a murder of crows, not an omen of murder . . . I think."
—York, Kessig tracker

name: Chromatic Lantern
text: It exemplifies the motto of the Luminary League: "Innovation requires insatiable curiosity and a good source of light."

name: Gruul Ragebeast
text:
"If the other guilds want a war, they should know we've been ready the whole time."
—Ruric Thar, Ghor-Clan chieftain

name: Warren Weirding
text:
"And that's when it was discovered that boggarts have just half a brain."
—*The Book of Other Folk*

name: Tidings
text:
"Many wearing rapiers are afraid of goose-quills."
—William Shakespeare, *Hamlet*

name: Mirri, Cat Warrior
text:
"Full of beauty and grace, with a predator's instincts. . . Although she wanders, I have always thought Mirri belongs in Llanowar most of all."
—Rofellos, Llanowar emissary

name: Wild Aesthir
text:
"High in the Karplusans, death is swift and razor-clawed."
—Arna Kennerüd, skycaptain

name: Pharika's Cure
text:
"The venom cleanses the sickness from your body, but it will not be pleasant, and you may not survive. Pharika's blessings are fickle."
—Solon, acolyte of Pharika

name: Yixlid Jailer
text: He holds the keys to a tombful of incarcerated secrets.

name: Ashes of the Abhorrent
text: "Let no trace of the vampires' foulness remain."

name: Parcel Myr
text:
"Crack it open. Maybe it knows something we can use."
—Kara Vrist, Mirran resistance

name: Jungle Wayfinder
text: She is adept at navigating the stadium's ever-changing landscape.

name: Krenko, Mob Boss
text:
"He displays a perverse charisma fueled by avarice. Highly dangerous. Recommend civil sanctions."
—Agmand Sarv, Azorius hussar

name: Phyrexian Gargantua
text: Other Phyrexians have nightmares about the gargantua.

name: Orzhov Signet
text: The sigil holds different meanings depending on its form and presentation. While some wear it as a sign of status, others wear it as a sign of debt.

name: Protection of the Hekma
text: Part of the acolytes' training is to walk along the Hekma, staring out at the ravenous horrors kept at bay by the God-Pharaoh's barrier.

name: Tragic Poet
text: "I would weep, but my tears have been stolen; I would shout, but my voice has been taken. Thus, I write."

name: Marisi's Twinclaws
text:
"Looks like we're completely outnumbered."
"Lucky for us. I thought we'd be bored."

name: Shrapnel Blast
text: From trinket to trauma.

name: Minamo Scrollkeeper
text: The scrollkeepers never stepped an inch away from the doors of the Great Library, not even when the ogres and their oni masters swept through Minamo.

name: Frost Ogre
text: Mountain ogres allowed blizzards to sheathe them in ice, both to reinforce their armor and to hide their pungent musk from potential prey.

name: Thran Dynamo
text: Urza's metathran children were conceived, birthed, and nurtured by an integrated system of machines.

name: Hurloon Wrangler
text: "Nothing comes between me and my Didgeridoos™."

name: Ribbons of the Reikai
text:
"If wisdom is a river, then we cup our hands, reach in, and drink from it in sips. The kami, however, are like fish, swimming, breathing, surrounded in its presence."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf

name: Crenellated Wall
text: Mercadian soldiers excel at finding things to stand behind.

name: Canyon Wildcat
text: In the warrior kingdom of Keld, the cats used in the hunt are prized for their tracking sense and ability to climb walls.

name: Reciprocate
text:
"Just as the noble soul calls virtue to itself, the evil soul summons harm."
—Teachings of Eight-and-a-Half-Tails

name: Spark Elemental
text: Vulshok shamans could never keep them alive for more than a few seconds, yet those few seconds seemed to be enough.

name: Piper's Melody
text: Those who follow nature's path eventually walk in a circle.

name: Cranial Plating
text: The flesh of the Necrontyr is a memory so distant as to be nearly mythical.

name: Scythe Leopard
text: Eldrazi are not the leopard's preferred prey, but they are better than no prey at all.

name: Darting Merfolk
text: You might as well try to catch water with a net.

name: Joust
text:
"Life is a tournament that rewards the bold."
—Syr Layne, knight of Embereth

name: Toil to Renown
text: The last survivor of her patrol, the warrior returned expecting disappointment and scorn. Instead she found gratitude. "You are alive. That is reason to celebrate."

name: Minotaur Abomination
text:
"Look at that. Shuffling, wobbling, entrails placed haphazardly. It's shameful. Who would let that kind of work flap about for all to see?"
—Lestin, necromancer

name: Viashino Shanktail
text: The Slizt Clan's battle cry is an impressive display of fury, defiance, and spit.

name: Horror of the Dim
text:
"Lesser minds can scarcely imagine such a marriage of necromancy and mind magic."
—Strava, Dimir mage

name: Honden of Life's Web
text: To the sorrow of all, its web became a net that strangled those who helped weave it.

name: Noxious Groodion
text:
"Behold the groodion! Ichor-slurper, oozing fiend. Foulest wonder underground. Grandest vermin of them all!"
—Zalin the Gutter Bard

name: Ornithopter
text:
"It has been my honor to improve on the Thran's original design. Perhaps history will remember me in some small part for my work."
—Urza, in his apprenticeship

name: Godhunter Octopus
text:
"I will match Thassa drop for drop and show a god what true power is."
—Kiora

name: Psychic Membrane
text: The vedalken always put their best thought forward.

name: Sword of Vengeance
text: When wielded by a true believer, it matters little whether the sword is a relic or a replica.

name: Fleeting Aven
text: "Don't become so enthralled with magic that you forget you can fly without it."

name: Rhystic Tutor
text: Any lock can be undone, any secret revealed.

name: Ignoble Hierarch
text: He protects the fetid bog from light, life, and the hideous sound of laughter.

name: Armored Ascension
text: "The meadow sprang up beneath me, and I perceived a path from our people's defeat to our highest glory."

name: Harmonize
text:
"Life's greatest lessons don't come from focus or concentration. They come from breathing and simply noticing."
—Seton, centaur druid

name: Brink of Disaster
text:
"When you find yourself teetering on the edge of oblivion, mine will be the hands taking pleasure in giving you the final push."
—Liliana Vess

name: Myr Galvanizer
text:
"We can't quite determine what they're doing, but they seem to be doing it quite well."
—Vedalken research notes

name: Telim'Tor
text:
"The curious merely amass knowledge. The ambitious use it."
—Telim'Tor

name: Riot Gear
text: Any meeting between guilds requires proper equipment.

name: Indatha Triome
text:
"These lowlands were formed thousands of years ago by the behemoth Indath—its final footsteps before vanishing into the sea."
—*Tales of the Ozolith*

name: Task Force
text: Keeping the streets of the Sixth District safe, one escaped Simic mutant at a time.

name: Waker of the Wilds
text: "Our foes are many and mighty, but not as many as the trees or as mighty as the sea."

name: Kefnet's Monument
text:
"The worthy shall cultivate a nimble mind to perceive the glorious wonders that await them."
—Monument inscription

name: Haunted Library
text: The library of Moormanor had been open to all before the Travails, and it continues to attract curious visitors.
