name: Esper Panorama
text: Esper is an expansive canvas painted by precise, controlling hands.

name: Kaervek the Merciless
text:
"Rats and jackals feast in his swath, but even they will not walk with him."
—Mangara

name: Sir Shandlar of Eberyn
text:
"Remember Sir Shandlar! Remember and stand firm!"
—rallying cry of the Eberyn militia

name: Demonic Tutor
text: Beware the generosity of demons.

name: Unsummon
text: Tolarian apprentices learn to liberate Ætheric energy long before they are taught to bind it.

name: Pacifism
text: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.

name: Maniacal Rage
text: The spikes of sangrite made the goblin stronger, but they didn't make him any smarter.

name: Ninja's Kunai
text: A point to pierce flesh and spirit alike.

name: Vedalken Entrancer
text: "Don't get any ideas."

name: Embodiment of Agonies
text: "I feel your pain. It's exquisite."

name: Facet Reader
text: "Every flaw in the crystal represents a moment where our strategy might go wrong."

name: Hope and Glory
text:
"Serra ruled by faith. I cannot afford that luxury."
—Radiant, archangel

name: Zodiac Tiger
text: ". . . Three kings no more-Chenliu, Guiming, Anle. / The fiefs and posts must now be filled anew. . . ."

name: Treefolk Seedlings
text: The year that the brothers landed on Argoth, the trees produced five times as many seeds as normal.

name: Mossbeard Ancient
text: Older than the mountains, the dragons, and the wars of humans and machines.

name: Fissure
text:
"Must not all things at the last be swallowed up in death?"
—Plato

name: Wild Mongrel
text: It teaches *you* to play dead.

name: Sage Aven
text: From their mountain aeries, aven scholars see far more than the distant horizon.

name: Giltspire Avenger
text: "To trespass so far from home is to ask for a lonesome grave."

name: Lyra Dawnbringer
text: "You are not alone. You never were."

name: Ragnar
text: "On the field of honor, a soldier need have no fear."

name: Erhnam Djinn
text: He provides a safe path to nowhere.

name: Armageddon
text:
"'O miserable of happy! Is this the end Of this new glorious world . . . ?'"
—John Milton, Paradise Lost

name: Human Frailty
text:
"I have seen a hundred mortal families rise and fall. I shall outlast a thousand more."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Violent Ultimatum
text:
"Words are a waste of time. Destruction is a language everyone understands."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Sliversmith
text: After centuries of labor, its creations outnumber those they were to mimic.

name: Foriysian Brigade
text:
"A double-edged sword lets you cut down your enemies with the backswing as well."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Carapace Forger
text: "Bows and whips cannot save us from these new horrors of the Mephidross."

name: Ion Storm
text: When enough artifacts lie too long in the same place, their magical radiation weakens reality, opening rifts of unpredictable destructive power.

name: Dance with Devils
text: Devils sow chaos and reap panic.

name: Embodiment of Spring
text: Arel dreamed of winter's end. The next morning she followed a strange trail and found a seedling in the snow.

name: Curse of Marit Lage
text:
"Our world has not felt her thundering steps in lifetimes, but Marit Lage's presence is still with us."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Fireball
text: The spell fell upon the crowd like a dragon, ancient and full of death.

name: Rustrazor Butcher
text: A Bloodwort's blade is salted with blood and peppered with rust, seasoning and slaughtering in a single swipe.

name: Scathe Zombies
text:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,/ Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;/ It had been strange, even in a dream,/ To have seen those dead men rise."/
—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Flock of Rabid Sheep
text: And their bleating was like a wet salmon slapped upon the land—slap! slap! slap!

name: Blunt the Assault
text:
"Much can be gained from the appearance of vulnerability."
—Ezuri, renegade leader

name: Searchlight Companion
text: The merging of the spirit and material realms has resulted in some unusual friendships.

name: Guardian Project
text: Simic's strength comes from its diversity.

name: Heal the Scars
text: Elvish battle-magic has evolved two specialties: inflicting wounds that scar, and healing wounds without scarring. Politics determines the recipients of each.

name: Sea Gate Banneret
text: The Sea Gate Expeditionary House was founded after the discovery of the Skyclave over Tazeem. Now its banners fly over every corner of Zendikar.

name: Wolverine Riders
text: "We'll break their lines. The rest of you, follow!"

name: Warpath Ghoul
text: The battle was over, but the carnage continued for days.

name: Brightflame
text:
"Let the pyres of the unbelievers light our way."
—Razia

name: Stitched Drake
text:
"The best skaab are more powerful and more beautiful than the sum of their parts."
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Wee Dragonauts
text:
"The blazekite is a simple concept, really-just a vehicular application of dragscoop ionics and electropropulsion magnetronics."
—Juzba, Izzet tinker

name: Mind Slash
text: "I can't think with all that screaming."

name: Pegasus Refuge
text:
The first Rath-born pegasus was so offended by the sky that it hid its eyes in the earth.
—Vec lore

name: Obsidian Acolyte
text:
The truthful will stand in the gaze of death and escape unharmed.
—Obsidian acolyte creed

name: Mayael the Anima
text: The sacred Anima's eyes are blind to all but the grandest truths.

name: Arcane Signet
text:
"To feel no constraint but the four points of a compass, to tread a path that only you can find . . . these are the flavors of power I've learned to savor."
—Keon, horizon walker

name: Azorius Knight-Arbiter
text: Thanks to the magic in his Writ of Passage, alms beasts lumbered aside, anarchs bowed their heads, and even Rakdos acrobats rolled their spikewheels out of his way.

name: Improbable Alliance
text:
"I agreed to light his way as long as he always had my back."
—Squill, Mistford pixie

name: Liliana's Devotee
text: Liliana inspires horror in many and fanatical admiration in a few.

name: Duskmantle Operative
text: Gideon eyed the Dimir emissary warily. "Could your agents slip inside Bolas's citadel?" The figure met his gaze with icy resolve. "We already have."

name: Needlebite Trap
text: The traps around the vampire city of Malakir hint at the thirst of its inhabitants.

name: Molten Influence
text: Lavamancers make simple requests: obey or die.

name: Elemental Masterpiece
text: Rootha passed with flying, living colors.

name: Squire
text:
"Of twenty yeer of age he was, I gesse.
Of his stature he was of even lengthe,
And wonderly deliver, and greete of strengthe."
—Geoffrey Chaucer, *The Canterbury Tales*

name: Witches' Eye
text: The price of prophecy is a vacant eye socket.

name: Pyretic Ritual
text:
"Sometimes, students, rite makes might."
—Mother Luti

name: Timeless Lotus
text: Urza exploited nature to power his war machines; in time, nature exploited his war machines to renew itself.

name: Reiterate
text:
"Echoes of the Mirari's power yet linger."
—Zyd, Kamahlite druid

name: Crushing Disappointment
text: Most students could barely endure Dean Embrose's scrutiny for a semester or two; Killian lived with it his entire life.

name: Laughing Hyena
text: "Two muffins are baking in an oven. One muffin says to the other muffin, 'It's getting hot in here, huh?' The other muffin says, 'Aagh! A talking muffin!'"

name: Nashi, Moon's Legacy
text: The story circle continues.

name: Flumph
text: Flumphs siphon thoughts and energy from evil aberrations, and are often eager to share the dark knowledge they obtain with friendly adventurers.

name: Primal Plasma
text: Tocasia brushed the gears and cogs from the table. There, before two wide-eyed brothers, she began a lesson on raw elemental magic.

name: Accomplished Automaton
text: Was it just lonely, or was some form of evolution inevitable?

name: Elite Archers
text: They fletch their arrows with the feathers of angels.

name: Lull
text: The clamor of war ceased as both armies stood and marveled at the beauty of Gaea's work.

name: Sleeper Dart
text:
"Sleep now, you big brute."
—Kelsien, the Plague

name: Hollowborn Barghest
text: It leaves a trail of crumpled trees and dashed dreams.

name: Shanna, Sisay's Legacy
text:
"The *Weatherlight* gave so much. It deserved justice as much as any of us."
—Shanna

name: Curse of the Nightly Hunt
text: When the moon rises and the bloodlust takes hold, nothing matters but the kill.

name: Glade Gnarr
text: Long thought merely a legend, the appearance of the gnarr was seen by the defenders as a sign of good luck.

name: Pulse of Llanowar
text:
"Gaea's memory is eternal, and she exists in all things."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Shield of the Ages
text:
"This shield is a true rarity: an artifact whose purpose is obvious."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

name: Blight Mound
text: Pests feed on carrion, mud, and one another.

name: Dark Maze
text:
"Stray not onto the path of darkness, or be lost forever."
—Baki, wizard attendant

name: Wall of Pine Needles
text: The power of the forest takes a hundred forms. Some are more surprising than others.

name: Thrill of Possibility
text: As the infection spread, Nahiri's thoughts grew tangled. She needed to protect what she loved from Phyrexia... or maybe only Phyrexia could protect what she loved.

name: Mountain Goat
text: Only the heroic and the mad follow mountain goat trails.

name: Sewer Crocodile
text:
"Quick, let's hide in the sewer!"
—Ginsi the Thief, now deceased

name: Benthic Explorers
text: Distant Atlantis charged these Explorers with the task of venturing into unknown waters to track the despised Viscerids.

name: Leveler
text: Once a century, the levelers rip through every corner of Mirrodin, obeying the commands of an unseen master.

name: Urborg
text:
"Resignedly beneath the sky/The melancholy waters lie./So blend the turrets and shadows there/That all seem pendulous in air,/While from a proud tower in town/Death looks gigantically down."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The City in the Sea"

name: Release the Gremlins
text:
"Being an inventor means knowing how to use the tools at hand to make something great—or to bring it down."
—Pia Nalaar

name: Root Snare
text: The roots run deep under stone and street, with strength that needs but a whisper to awaken.

name: Rend Flesh
text:
"The Reito Massacre was a testament to the kami's unstoppable power. The human defenders might as well have been moths battling a forest fire."
—*Great Battles of Kamigawa*

name: Wing Snare
text:
"Argoth's doom rained from a clear sky. Yavimaya will not share that fate."
—Multani, maro-sorcerer

name: Scourge of Geier Reach
text: Stensian villagers mourned the loss of human life. Thraben vampire slayers mourned the loss of living wood.

name: Izzet Cluestone
text: It holds within it an unsolvable riddle. A creative answer yields an invitation to the guild.

name: War Elephant
text:
"When elephants fight it is the grass that suffers."
—Kikuyu proverb

name: Drain the Well
text: Trows have learned that it's not wise to eat cinders without a bucket or two of water nearby.

name: Sacred Ground
text:
"That which knows itself cannot be shaped to another's will."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Young Blue Dragon // Sand Augury
text: "I see the far side of tomorrow and the lost memories of queens. What do you wish to learn?"

name: Kessig Prowler // Sinuous Predator
text: A different kind of transformation has taken place.

name: Dawn to Dusk
text: "The numbers of Nyxborn among us have swelled. Is this a sign of the gods' favor, or does it portend something else?"

name: Fluctuator
text:
"It generates power by harnessing the nature of possibility itself."
"But will it work?"
". . . Possibly."

name: Emrakul's Hatcher
text: Wordlessly it leads its abhorrent brood.

name: Shacklegeist
text: The Blessed Sleep doesn't come easily to a mind chained by regrets.

name: Scavenger Folk
text:
"Stoop, pick, turn, toss. This is the way we mourn our loss."
—Scavenger dirge

name: Mogg Conscripts
text:
"Torahn's horns! They've seen us. Now, statue, you must fight to save yourself!"
—Tahngarth, aboard the *Predator*

name: Flaccify
text: "Don't worry about it. It happens to every mage sooner or later."

name: Gorilla Warrior
text: The gorilla beat its chest and threw great handfuls of leaves into the air. It howled challenge and showed its teeth. The mechanical soldier, not understanding, simply killed it.

name: Harabaz Druid
text: "I care nothing for treasure. The land beckons me, and I cannot rest until my feet have touched every inch of it."

name: Homestead Courage
text: "C'mon, fiend. I'll carve you up like a Harvesttide ham."

name: Flaming Fist
text: You carry the security of Baldur's Gate on your shoulders, and you welcome the weight of responsibility.

name: Serra Sphinx
text: Sphinxes drink from the mystic meres of Serra's realm, where their keen eyes watch reflections of what is and what is yet to come.

name: Sand Strangler
text: The bombardment of sand disorients, chokes, and ultimately tenderizes its prey.

name: Dancing Scimitar
text: Bobbing merrily from opponent to opponent, the scimitar began adding playful little flourishes to its strokes; it even turned a couple of somersaults.

name: Karn's Temporal Sundering
text: Centuries ago, a quest to harness time became a spiral into chaos.

name: Burst of Speed
text: Great generals inspire by example. Goblin chieftains inspire by electrifying the barracks.

name: Wall of Bone
text: The Wall of Bone is said to be an aspect of the Great Wall in Hel, where the bones of all sinners wait for Ragnarok, when Hela will call them forth for the final battle.

name: Vedalken Anatomist
text: "Specimen 211 examination report. Observation: graft sublimation incomplete. Result: death. Prepare specimen 212."

name: Costume Shop
text: Dressed to the 9/9s.

name: Tajuru Snarecaster
text: Elves of the Tajuru Nation spend their lives in the ancient jaddi trees' expansive canopy, some living and dying without ever touching the ground.

name: Child of Alara
text: The progeny of the Maelstrom shows no allegiance—and no mercy—to any of the five shards.

name: Return to Nature
text:
"Far-seeing Kruphix glimpsed the end: Heliod's spear cast down and broken."
—*The Cosmogony*

name: Cruel Finality
text: Bitter the bite of a demon's steel, and deep the abyss it opens.

name: A-Fires of Invention
text: "Just tell us how many you want and get out of the way."

name: Profane Prayers
text: "We have ways to make you talk, but you have nothing interesting to say."

name: Balshan Griffin
text: It helps to have an extra direction in which to run.

name: Timberpack Wolf
text:
"The need for the pack is bred in their bones. Their true strength will not show itself for any other purpose."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Tamiyo's Immobilizer
text: Visitors to the Surgical Bay often become permanent residents.

name: Inquisitive Puppet
text:
"The strings were gone, but he still felt the pull of invisible forces tugging at his mind."
—*Beyond the Great Henge*

name: Air Elemental
text: Pray that it doesn't seek the safety of your lungs.

name: Revitalize
text:
「騎士カスリンは目を閉じ、最期を覚悟すました。再びめを開けると、勝利を勝ちっていたのです。」
—-癒し手のタダス、回顧録

name: White Knight
text: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the Knight had just laid waste.

name: Druid's Deliverance
text: "So many oppose us, but we are the reed that bends without breaking."

name: Fearless Fledgling
text: Griffins nest in precarious places, so fledglings often find themselves taking their first flights at surprising moments.

name: Geistlight Snare
text: Tamil had always wanted a closer look at a geist's lantern. Now he had an eternity to study one.

name: Deathbellow Raider
text:
"The temple has been rededicated. It belongs to Mogis now."
—Rastos, disciple of Mogis

name: Ethersworn Canonist
text: "The noble work of our order is to infuse all life on Esper with etherium. Our goal will be reached more rapidly if new life is . . . suppressed."

name: Coercion
text: "Of all I that I have lost, I miss my mind the most."

name: Plains
text: Searching for a vanished caravan that was bound for Silverymoon, you've come to a bank of mysterious fog.

name: Vessel of Malignity
text: From within its prison, the book endlessly whispers words of cruelty and spite.

name: Wizard's Lightning
text:
"The study of magic began when the first mage taught herself to throw lightning."
—Naban, dean of iteration

name: Urza's Mine
text: Mines became common as cities during the days of the artificers.

name: Twinstrike
text: They're dying left and right.

name: Gaea's Might
text:
"Why fight over the lumber in a tree's trunk when its branches have room for all?"
—Multani

name: Longtusk Cub
text: It won't be small forever.

name: Iridescent Blademaster
text: Her arm and spirit were weary, but as the Halo flowed across her blade, it became weightless, and new strength flooded through her. She would fight on.

name: Entourage of Trest
text:
"The dim resort to violence, for which the nimble prepare."
—Leovold, emissary of Trest

name: Winter Orb
text:
"How could anyone survive this? There is some force at work that stifles even the will to go on."
—Naromin, veteran explorer

name: Call to the Feast
text: By the law of church and crown, vampires feed only on the blood of the guilty—those declared heretics, rebels, or enemies of war.

name: Pyrokinesis
text:
"Anybody want some . . . *toast*?"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Village Elder
text:
"Enchant me with your tale-telling. Tell about Tree, Grass, River, and Wind. / Tell why Truth must fight with Falsehood, and why Truth will always win."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Search for Azcanta // Azcanta, the Sunken Ruin
text: The Sunken Ruin houses all the learning of a long-forgotten age.

name: Swashbuckling
text: The pirates of the Brazen Coalition are the descendants of those displaced by the Legion of Dusk, and they are eager for vengeance.

name: Overwhelmed Archivist // Archive Haunt
text: "Bah! As if I had time to preserve everything."

name: Aven Soulgazer
text: "Every question has a proper answer. Every soul has a proper place."

name: Concession Stand
text: Eating here is always a concession.

name: Eidolon of Rhetoric
text: Theros's human philosophers were at a marked disadvantage due to their need to pause for things like food or sleep.

name: Viashino Warrior
text:
"When traveling the Great Desert avoid wearing the scales of lizards, for the Viashino rule the sands and look poorly on the skinning of their cousins."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

name: Wing Shards
text: Her feathers cut the air, as sharp as they are silent.

name: Heat Ray
text: It's not known whether the Thran built the device to forge their wonders or to defend them.

name: Icatian Scout
text:
"Of course I'm not a spy! The enemy has spies. I am a Scout."
—Ailis Connaut
{1}: This card's flavor text becomes the flavor text of your choice. (This ability doesn't work because it's flavor text, not rules text (but neither does this reminder text, so you figure it out).)

name: Reprisal
text:
"The meek shall fight as one, and they shall overcome even the greatest of foes."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Plains
text: You've heard rumors of bandits along the Coast Way, but your journey so far has even surprisingly uneventful.

name: Cloak of Feathers
text: A thousand feathers from a thousand birds, sewn with magic and song.

name: Chained Brute
text: A momentary lapse is all it needs to break free.

name: Temple Thief
text: "I don't know if the gods watch over their temples, but I figure it's best to be stealthy just in case."

name: Fervent Paincaster
text: "Everyone here is a honed fighter. We'll respond the only way we know how."

name: Cosmic Hunger
text: The Copper Host sought only the strongest converts. In Koma, it found perfection.

name: Welding Jar
text: The wires crawl over broken metal and heat themselves to melting, filling cracks quickly and efficiently.

name: Groundbreaker
text: The earth's memory is long, its retribution brief.

name: Mist Dragon
text:
"Across the plains, farmers who braved the mists began to vanish. Most blamed the goblins; none guessed the truth."
—Hakim, Loreweaver

name: Rimewind Taskmage
text: "Find solace in the sun? Burning, blinding, laying secrets bare? No, solace is found under the blanket of cold."

name: Mishra's Helix
text: The helix was the finest example of Mishra's campaign strategy: if he couldn't have Argoth, no one could.

name: Phantom Wings
text: "But you *said* 'when goats fly!'" Squee whined.

name: Ancestral Recall
text: 2018 Europe Vintage Champion

name: Eliminate
text:
「人を消すのにほとんどエネルギーはいらない。稀で宇宙がその存在を全く気にしてないかのようにな。」
——エクスタス・ナー

name: Feed the Machine
text: "Even you have a purpose. Your blood will oil the gears."

name: Goblin Gardener
text: "Grow food in dirt? Save time—eat dirt."

name: Yavimaya Iconoclast
text: Steel weapons hold a forbidden allure to some of the younger Yavimayans.

name: Skirk Outrider
text: Once the goblins thought about it, they preferred being atop a slateback to being in front of, behind, or underneath one.

name: Hurkyl's Recall
text: This spell, like many attributed to Drafna, was actually the work of his wife Hurkyl.

name: Annihilating Fire
text:
"The most impressive performances can be done only once."
—Mote, Rakdos madcap

name: Conflux
text:
"It's self-indulgent, I admit, but I do like to watch my own symphony play itself out."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Dancing Scimitar
text: A blade that has never known sheath, a hilt that has never known hand.

name: Conclave Equenaut
text: Equenauts are the seeds of the Conclave, scattered on the four winds, searching for new places to take root.

name: Air Elemental
text: These spirits of the air are winsome and wild and cannot be truly contained. Only marginally intelligent, they often substitute whimsy for strategy, delighting in mischief and mayhem.

name: Hellkite Igniter
text: Its flight sets the sky itself on fire.

name: Crushing Pain
text: It is said that the mere touch of a kami is like embracing the sun itself.

name: Prodigal Sorcerer
text: Occasionally a member of the Institute of Arcane Study acquires a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

name: Mentor's Guidance
text: Kasmina had encouraged the twins to apply. Strixhaven would test not only their magical potential, but also their character.

name: Awaken the Woods
text:
"We expected the Argothians to stand their ground. We didn't expect the ground itself to stand."
—Myrel, Shield of Argive

name: Timberpack Wolf
text: Their strength is no mere numbers game. An intangible force augments the wolves when they run together.

name: Ertai, the Corrupted
text: Altered by Phyrexian science, corrupted by black mana, and twisted by rage, Ertai still looked in the mirror and saw only glory.

name: Annihilate
text:
"Whatever Yawgmoth marks, dies. There is no escape."
—Tsabo Tavoc, Phyrexian general

name: Warmth
text:
"Flame grows gentle with but a little distance."
—Orim, Samite healer

name: Scathe Zombies
text: "They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,/ Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;/ It had been strange, even in a dream,/ To have seen those dead men rise."/ —Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Stone Spirit
text:
"The spirit of the stone is the spirit of strength."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Feywild Caretaker
text: "Hello, my fluttering friends! Isn't it a beautiful day?"

name: Nekrataal
text:
"You can't protect them all, Jace."
—Vraska

name: Seal of Cleansing
text:
"Find the dens of evil and flood them with light."
—Hulo, the Penitent Wanderer

name: Wall of Souls
text:
"It is the nature of evil to turn you against yourself."
—Starke

name: Mind Sculpt
text:
"Your mind was a curious mix of madness and genius. I just took away the genius."
—Jace Beleren

name: Molting Harpy
text: Shed harpy feathers leave painful wounds—which explains the harpies' mood.

name: Deep-Sea Kraken
text: The rift remained open for days, sluicing ancient seawater. It closed only after the last great tentacle squirmed its way through.

name: Wolf-Skull Shaman
text: A chorus of howls answers his call.

name: Fountain of Renewal
text: Entrepreneurs have attempted to sell the water, but to no avail. Whatever magic it contains disappears upon bottling.

name: Army of Allah
text: On the day of victory no one is tired. —Arab proverb

name: Blister Beetle
text: Warriors of the Rip Clan wear their beetle-acid scars proudly, even modifying clothing and armor to better display the trophy.

name: Kessig Wolf Run
text: When a werewolf changes for the first time, that first howl is said to echo through the wilds till moonset.

name: Exhilarating Elocution
text: His words poured forth on waves of golden light, scouring all fear from his audience's hearts and minds.

name: Leaf-Crowned Visionary
text: "The seedling you save today may be the sheltering boughs of generations to come."

name: Nettling Curse
text:
"I call them 'Poke' and 'Prod.'"
—Chagrach, Rakdos cursemage

name: Praetor's Counsel
text: As the Phyrexian contagion corroded Karn's body, the praetors whispered psalms to corrupt his mind.

name: Mahamoti Djinn
text: Of royal blood amongst the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

name: Knight of the Reliquary
text:
"Knowledge of Bant's landscape and ruins is a weapon that the invaders can't comprehend."
—Elspeth

name: Ghoulcaller Gisa
text:
"Come now, dear brother. If you wanted rules, you should have called it a *game*, not a *war*."
—Gisa, to Geralf

name: Psionic Snoop
text: She knows your next move before you do.

name: Dreamshaper Shaman
text: Magic is the true artist's medium.

name: Panicked Bystander // Cackling Culprit
text: "Help! There's been a horrible murder!"

name: Abrupt Decay
text: The Izzet quickly suspended their policy of lifetime guarantees.

name: Abzan Beastmaster
text: His beasts move the great siege towers of the Abzan across the endless sands.

name: Gallant Cavalry
text: "Our duty does not stop at our borders."

name: Overrun
text:
The dance of angry feet
—Nantuko expression meaning "stampede"

name: Regress
text:
"Never look too deep, where the waters turn dark. What the sea has hidden there may not stay down forever."
—Jaby, Silundi Sea nomad

name: Stormsurge Kraken
text: Most see krakens as wantonly violent, failing to notice their meticulous attention to detail when dismantling a vessel.

name: Gudul Lurker
text: The small are mostly ignored by dragons.

name: Selvala, Explorer Returned
text: "The Lowlands refuse to suffer at the whims of the High City."

name: Rummaging Goblin
text: Goblins' eager curiosity leads them to scavenging, petty theft, and the rigging of sleek pirate ships. Some stop at scavenging.

name: Crux of Fate
text: Ugin's whispered summons led Sarkhan Vol to the moment that would echo down the centuries and seal Tarkir's fate: the primal battle between Ugin and Nicol Bolas.

name: Spined Karok
text:
"The bogs are deeper than you realize. Most of the space beneath the surface is taken up by these enormous karoks. You might think your feet are touching the bottom. They're probably not."
—Gyome, Witherbloom chef

name: Rally the Forces
text:
"Drive them back! Make their underworld into their grave!"
—Koth of the Hammer

name: Arachnoid Adaptation
text:
"Deploy the blightwidows. Rankle's pests should make for a delicious meal."
—Ayara, Furnace Queen

name: Hedron Detonator
text: "*Compleat* this!"

name: Chambered Nautilus
text: What's merely a home for the nautilus can become exquisite jewelry in the hands of Saprazzan artisans.

name: Bone Saw
text: Once a simple tool, it—like everything else on Zendikar—has been turned into a weapon against the Eldrazi.

name: Hypothesizzle
text:
"It's like blowing up an arcane library in a thermobaric explosion. But in a good way."
—Bori Andon, Izzet blastseeker

name: Emancipation Angel
text: "You have done your best. I give you leave to rest."

name: Hero of Precinct One
text: When the established order falters, what remains are ordinary people and their struggle to survive.

name: The Autonomous Furnace
text: In Urabrask's domain, mighty forges echo day and night with the clangor of the Great Work.

name: Unholy Strength
text:
"Born under the moon, the second child will stumble on temptation and seek power in the dark places of the heart."
—Codex of the Constellari

name: Reckless Waif // Merciless Predator
text: Before she just wanted to snatch your purse; now she'll take the whole arm.

name: Exploration
text:
"Only when we journey into the unknown can we find the impossible."
—Cyrul the Wanderer

name: Saddled Rimestag
text: Horns of hoarfrost grow every night, gleam at dawn, and melt by dusk.

name: Weatherseed Faeries
text: Two days after the forge was completed, the faeries were immune to its flames.

name: Cathartic Adept
text: "Forget. Only then will there be space for hope between the pain and fear."

name: Frontier Mastodon
text: Each bronze disk on its harness is an offering from a young Temur hunter, a sign of respect to the spirits of the wild.

name: Frost Marsh
text:
"Now caged in Winter's bitter chill, Our people cry, their voices shrill— Eternal cold breaks down their will."
—*The Dynasty of Winter Kings*

name: Sol Ring
text:
"As Horus once besieged the Sol System, we shall bring the rotting Imperium to its knees."
—Abaddon the Despoiler

name: Gravedigger
text: A grave is not always for burial.

name: Goblin Raider
text: He's smart for a goblin. He can do *two* things: hit *and* run.

name: Markov Blademaster
text: "Mortals practice swordplay for a few decades at best. How can they ever attain the exquisite mastery that eternity has to offer?"

name: Resourceful Return
text: When the salvage team brought in the shattered gearhulk, a wave of excitement swept through the renegade foundry.

name: Brightwood Tracker
text: "Many have walked here, but there is only one trail I seek."

name: Nahiri's Stoneblades
text: The ancient Planeswalkers Sorin and Nahiri battled across Ravnica, their blows cutting as deep as their grudge.

name: Energy Refractor
text:
"Raw energy contains infinite possibility."
—Urza

name: Gate to Phyrexia
text: "The warm rain of grease on my face immediately made it clear I had entered Phyrexia." —Jarsyl, *Diary*

name: Urza's Ruinous Blast
text: Centuries ago, one man's vengeance plunged the world into ice and darkness.

name: Rishadan Port
text: Rishada is the gateway to free trade-but the key will cost you.

name: Fairgrounds Trumpeter
text:
"What is that horrible flesh-noise?! We must silence it before it grows even louder!"
—Thxmir, Machine Legion scout

name: Tempting Witch
text:
"Murder clad in crimson beauty,
An end to life and love and duty."
—Barrow witch incantation

name: Valduk, Keeper of the Flame
text: The hammer strikes. The Flame awakens.

name: Boggart Brute
text: He has the biggest bashing stick, so it's a safe bet he's the leader.

name: Feed the Swarm
text:
"On vile wings and bloody wind, the swarm will rise."
—Skyclave inscription

name: Cybernetica Datasmith
text: "Engaging Protector protocol."

name: Haunted House
text: Putting the "oo" in "spooky" and the "fun" in "no refunds!"

name: Gang of Devils
text:
"Well, how could I know they'd explode?"
—Gregel, township militia

name: False Mourning
text: Zhou Yu, Sun Ce, and other famous generals feigned their deaths in order to later surprise their opponents.

name: Aurochs
text: One auroch may feed a village, but a herd will flatten it.

name: Dense Canopy
text: The orochi learned how to move swiftly and surely along the forest floor, like fish darting through gull-watched waters.

name: Goblin Artillery
text: Most goblins get their turn firing the catapult, but few achieve the coveted title of Ammunition Holder.

name: Peregrine Griffin
text: A griffin is not just an eagle's wings and a lion's claws. It is also the fiercest of hearts.

name: Glademuse
text:
"Rage can be heard throughout the world, but wisdom comes at a whisper."
—Rielle, the Everwise

name: Cloak of Invisibility
text:
"Useful . . . if you can find it."
—Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader

name: Grappling Hook
text: Part tool, part weapon, part of the kor.

name: Brassclaw Orcs
text:
"A whole skin is worth a thousand victories."
—Orcish Veteran of the Battle of Montford

name: Bhaal's Invoker
text: "The Lord of Murder has freed me from the shackles of mortal laws and gifted me with fire to carry out his will."

name: Seeds of Strength
text: Beneath the beauty of light and seed is the might of Vitu-Ghazi.

name: Celebrity Fencer
text: After a brief but memorable incident at her first performance, she was never heckled again.

name: Bone Splinters
text: "Looks like they're just piling on now."

name: Horde of Boggarts
text: Strategies don't come easily to the boggarts' feral minds, but full-on assault hasn't failed them yet.

name: Luminous Guardian
text: "There is no victory without virtue."

name: Sigiled Starfish
text: Kruphix hid the most dire prophecies about humankind where humans would never find them and tritons wouldn't care to read them.

name: Faceless Haven
text: It is everywhere and nowhere, a place unbound by logic, just beyond the real.

name: Plague Sliver
text: A sliver shares everything with its hive—even its afflictions.

name: Putrefy
text:
"All matter, animate or not, rots when exposed to time. We merely speed up the process."
—Ezoc, Golgari rot farmer

name: A Good Day to Pie
text:
"What could be funnier than one big pie to the face? Unless . . . no. Could it be that simple?"
—Pietra, Crafter of Clowns

name: Skinrender
text:
"Your creations are effective, Sheoldred, but we must unite the flesh, not merely flay it."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

name: Prize Wall
text:
"That bear's been there since the Astrotorium opened. I've seen it move."
—Ernst, deep fry cook

name: Combat Medic
text:
"Time enough to become a Medic once you're hurt too badly to fight. For now, Icatia needs your strength more than your compassion."
—Lydia Wynforth, Mayor of Trokair

name: Rakdos Firewheeler
text: Ever wonder why you never see an old Rakdos cultist?

name: Fortress Cyclops
text:
"They think they tamed him, but he will always be a wild titan, a force of nature."
—Nedja, Gruul shaman

name: Ostracize
text: Kerrick was to find that some borders can never be crossed.

name: Cast Down
text:
「誰でも死後に思い出してもらえるかは心配なもの。でも心配ないわ、死は名も無き者のものよ。あなたに名前がある限リ、それを堂々と掲げなさい。」
――リリアナ

name: Booster Tutor
text: Real men use *Arabian Nights* boosters.

name: Kabira Takedown // Kabira Plateau
text:
"Wise adventurers—and clever beasties—stick to the higher ground."
—Kreq of Sunder Bay

name: Broodmate Dragon
text: Frozen in fear, the goblins stared upward at the circling hunter—and were promptly eaten by its diving mate.

name: Mistvault Bridge
text: The path to knowledge is forged in hunger.

name: Screeching Skaab
text: Its screeching is the sound of you losing your mind.

name: Vow of Lightning
text:
"Ruhan would never agree to such terms."
—Ruhan of the Fomori

name: Clockwork Drawbridge
text: Argivia's clockwork fortifications are the stuff of legend, reminding all on Dominaria that ingenuity has saved them before and can do so again.

name: Combat Medic
text:
"Without combat medics, Icatia would probably not have withstood the forces of chaos as long as it did."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI*

name: Giant Strength
text:
"O! it is excellent
To have a giant's strength, but it is tyrannous
To use it like a giant."
—William Shakespeare, *Measure for Measure*

name: Scale Blessing
text:
"Your bravery honors us all."
—Dromoka, translated from Draconic

name: Savage Twister
text:
"Frozen, we watched the funnel pluck up three of the goats—pook! pook! pook!—before we ran for the wadi."
—*Travelogue of Najat*

name: Trained Orgg
text:
"That arm's for bashin'. That one's for smashin'. That one's for scratchin'. And that one . . . I don't know what that one's for."
—Orgg trainer

name: Serra Ascendant
text: Her faith in Serra reached new heights.

name: Costume Shop
text: Outfits you'll love at prices you'll tolerate.

name: Corrupt
text: Yawgmoth brushed Urza's mind, and Urza's world convulsed.

name: Wailing Ghoul
text:
"Don't worry, sweet brother. Help is on the way."
—Ghoulcaller Gisa

name: Pack's Favor
text: Selesnya grows its ranks in more ways than one.

name: Stun Sniper
text: The tips of her bolts are blunt, but her aim is deadly sharp.

name: Mystic Decree
text:
"Curse Reveka, and curse her coddled conjurers. Their sorcerers' school shall yet be ours."
—Irini Sengir

name: Armored Whirl Turtle
text: Not all enormous beasts are quick to anger.

name: Thundering Sparkmage
text: "Stay away from my friends!"

name: Krazy Kow
text: "I got your milk right here!"

name: Ainok Bond-Kin
text: "Hold the line, for family and the fallen!"

name: Release to the Wind
text: "Here and gone like a fleeting breeze."

name: Cry of the Carnarium
text: If your ears bleed, it's a party. If your eyes bleed, it's a Rakdos party.

name: Seismic Spike
text: Natural disasters in Ravnica are largely nullified by the Izzet. Unnatural disasters, on the other hand, happen all the time.

name: Inquisition of Kozilek
text:
"To dwell within the Blind Eternities is unthinkable. To encounter those who do could shatter the mind."
—*Chronicle of the Titans*

name: Reverence
text:
"Despite the massive forces that allied against him, Konda never once believed he would lose the Kami War."
—Masako the Humorless

name: Atrocious Experiment
text: There is no line Jon Irenicus would not cross to regain his lost immortality.

name: Centaur's Herald
text: The farther they go from Vitu-Ghazi, the less willing the crowd is to part for them.

name: Stomping Ground
text:
"Atarka and her subjects congregate in Ayagor, the Dragon's Bowl. It is my duty to keep that bowl full."
—Surrak, the Hunt Caller

name: Hypnotic Specter
text: Its victims are known by their eyes: shattered vessels leaking broken dreams.

name: Dawnstrike Paladin
text: She crushes darkness beneath her charger's hooves.

name: Glasspool Mimic // Glasspool Shore
text:
"Past and possibility come together in the vastness of infinite reflection."
—Ashen Wal, Akoum Expeditionary House

name: Hazardous Blast
text: The Machine Orthodoxy finds strength in numbers. The Quiet Furnace finds that amusing.

name: Meddle
text:
"Shadimir was as surprised as he was relieved when the blow turned aside."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Thunderwolf Cavalry
text: The practice of tracking and training Thunderwolves is a sort of initiation ritual into the upper echelons of the Wolf Guard.

name: Cutthroat Maneuver
text: "Our ambition drives us forward. Together we will claim what is ours, no matter who holds it."

name: Augmenter Pugilist // Echoing Equation
text: "Hold still. I have a theory about what's going to happen to your face."

name: Tetsuko Umezawa, Fugitive
text: "My ancestor Toshiro used to say, 'Life is a series of choices between bad and worse.' I'm a master of making great bad choices."

name: Raptor Hatchling
text:
"Every little hatchling has a parent's claws to guard it."
—Sun Empire saying

name: Krosan Groundshaker
text: You know it's coming when you hear the distant thunder. You know where it's been when you see the path of broken trees.

name: Ant Queen
text:
"Kill the queen first, or we'll be fighting her drones forever. It is not in a queen's nature to have enough servants."
—Borzard, exterminator captain

name: Festercreep
text: A single festercreep isn't alone. It's already an infestation.

name: Raffine's Informant
text: "I've analyzed the vault schematic. Do you want the fast way, the easy way, or the secret way in?"

name: Light of Sanction
text: The Legion looks after its own.

name: Mishra
text: Both complement and antithesis to his older brother Urza, Mishra also mastered the intricacies of artifice. It was Mishra's strength that first gave rise to the massive Phyrexian war engines on Dominaria, and it was his weakness that pushed him, Urza, and Dominaria itself to the point of annihilation.

name: Kami of Ancient Law
text:
"Duty and law are the foundation on which civilization stands. They must not fall, for when they do, they take everything with them."
—Lord Konda

name: Bloodletter
text:
"That's not really an A. It's an Æ. They changed it! Wait, don't—"
—Hœbrus Væm, Aerathi librarian, last words

name: Kithkin Zealot
text: The more his flock fears, the more power he wields.

name: Juzám Djinn
text: "Expect my visit when the darkness comes. The night I think is best for hiding all." —Ouallada

name: Shivan Dragon
text:
"It's just playing with us, Marsden."
—Dafynne the Radiant, last words

name: Sphinx's Herald
text: He calls a riddle through the gaps of cloven clouds, hoping for an answer.

name: Dawnstrider
text: Morning's mists can hide many things.

name: Karlov of the Ghost Council
text: "Does Teysa think me blind to her scheming? Ambition runs in our family."

name: Defense Grid
text:
"We've managed to keep the goblins in their assigned areas, but there's little we can do about the smell."
—Whip Tongue, viashino technician

name: Command Tower
text:
"Approach my tower on bended knee or depart from it as ash upon the wind."
—Gadwick, the Wizened

name: Blade of the Sixth Pride
text: "My pride may be gone, but our hunt is not over."

name: Into the Roil
text: In theory, the death of the Eldrazi should have stilled the Roil. It did not.

name: Hinterland Logger // Timber Shredder
text:
"She even had the audacity to criticize my wares as inferior."
—Old Rutstein

name: Buried Alive
text:
"Is it worse to walk while dead, or to be buried alive? I have witnessed both."
—Crovax

name: Myr Welder
text: Memnarch designed some myr to follow the levelers and reaffix lost parts. Mirran partisans put that instinct to good use.

name: Zhur-Taa Druid
text: "Only the decadent think magic should be pristine and without cost."

name: Arguel's Blood Fast // Temple of Aclazotz
text: Arguel's vision led him into the jungles of Ixalan ...

name: Mutilate
text:
"It's only torture if you're strong enough to survive. Otherwise, it's a simple, gruesome death. I'm happy either way."
—Liliana Vess

name: Volrath
text: The son of Gerrard's surrogate father, Sidar Kondo, Volrath stole Gerrard's Legacy and rose to power selling it off piece by piece. Now, he is an evincar, or agent, of the Lord of the Wastes. Armed with exceptional magical powers, he plots to conquer the entire multiverse.

name: Crovax
text: How does one escape a curse? For Crovax, a wealthy noble, the answer may lie in joining the crew of the *Weatherlight* as they seek to rescue their abducted captain Sisay. Secretly, he hopes in his journeys to find Selenia, the angelic being who abandoned him and his family years ago.

name: Gaea's Embrace
text: The forest rose to the battle, not to save the people, but to save itself.

name: Deep Analysis
text: "No fact escapes me. Why do you think you can?"

name: Soul Seizer // Ghastly Haunting
text: The body often twists and flails spasmodically as the spirit explores its new home.

name: Dragon's Herald
text: The penultimate step of the ritual involves bathing in a delicious glaze.

name: Gaea's Courser
text: "Even the leaves oppose your being here. What hope have you against nature's might?"

name: Forge Devil
text: Devils infiltrated the lower levels of Thraben Cathedral, making cracks in load-bearing pillars and setting fire to precious archives.

name: Staggering Insight
text:
「真実から逃げ出すのは臆病者だけ。」
――哲人ペリソフィア

name: Custody Battle
text: Goblins resolve disputes by splitting everything straight down the middle.

name: Stumpsquall Hydra
text: In preparation to grow new heads, a hydra may rid itself of older ones.

name: Ancestral Mask
text: The masks, like the ancient trees they're grown from, lend strength to the dryads.

name: Scuttling Sliver
text: A living fossil active after eons of dormancy.

name: Diamond Lion
text:
"The merchant asked for riches no one had ever dreamed of. The djinn, smiling, granted his wish."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Naya Sojourners
text: The elves had entered a land like an open grave—an act of fortitude or folly?

name: Uncontrollable Anger
text: To an akki warrior, gravity is the direction of the nearest unsmashed face.

name: Goliath Paladin
text: "Why do you cower in the darkness, little gnolls? If you would challenge me, step into the light."

name: Drill-Skimmer
text: In close proximity, their magnetic energies merge and form a field of protection.

name: Forsaken Sanctuary
text:
"Prayers will curdle on the tongue and be heard by rotting ears."
—Minaldra, the Vizag Atum

name: Mountain
text: Lord Jannath sent you to secure the mine from gnoll raiders, but so far you haven't seen any gnolls . . . or, for that matter, any miners.

name: Obstinate Familiar
text:
"Lizards make excellent familiars. They never know when they've lost."
—Matoc, lavamancer

name: Magnifying Glass
text: Palmistry is much more effective when you read the fine print.

name: Dream Fighter
text: Not only the sleeping should fear dreams.

name: Thragtusk
text: For a crash course in addition, hunt a single thragtusk.

name: Faerie Invaders
text: Small enough to penetrate the narrowest crack in a castle wall and numerous enough to hack apart a griffin.

name: Viashino Spearhunter
text: Viashino lack the majesty of their draconic ancestors, but they lash out with equal rage and twice the spite.

name: Salvager of Ruin
text:
"The next model should be able to achieve a rescue without self-destruction."
—Sargis Haz, artificer

name: War Historian
text: All children on Kamigawa learn of the Kami War. Hostilities with beings from another reality were understood, and no time was wasted in disbelief.

name: Seal of the Guildpact
text:
"I'd rather see the guilds contend together with words in the halls of power, than in the streets with swords."
—Jace Beleren

name: Barbarian Outcast
text:
"We offer power to anyone willing to take it. Sadly, few are unburdened enough by their prejudices to accept."
—Cabal surgeon

name: Fen Stalker
text: As silent as a shadow, and just as hard to flee.

name: Tattered Mummy
text: The dead who wander beyond the safety of the city crave only to spread their curse.

name: Harried Artisan // Phyrexian Skyflayer
text: As strange portals roared open across Theros, Lydus gathered his prototype and fled. He was so close to perfecting his design.

name: Battle Cry
text:
"In the thick of battle, you must keep your wits about you. Yelling a lot helps, too."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Cosi's Ravager
text:
"Cosi has many followers. Even the volcano finds a way to do his bidding."
—Zakken, Enclave cleric

name: Panacea
text: A drop numbs the tongue. A sip sends the heart racing. A draught reforges the body.

name: Precognition
text: A gleam like struggling sunlight penetrated Selenia's dark thoughts.

name: Oath of Chandra
text: "If it means that people can live in freedom, yeah, I'll keep watch."

name: Annul
text:
"Murder of the living is tragic, but murder of the idea is unforgivable."
—Janus, speaker of the synod

name: Arborea Pegasus
text: The noble steeds of the elven gods can sometimes be persuaded to allow mere mortals on their backs.

name: No One Will Hear Your Cries
text: "Your companions were lucky to have died first."

name: Aurelia, the Warleader
text: Where Razia was aloof and untouchable, Aurelia is on the frontlines, calling for war.

name: Nogi, Draco-Zealot
text: "Glory to the Burning Ones! May their mighty fangs devour all foes!"

name: Light from Within
text:
"Muscle does not make one strong. It only masks the soul's light. True strength lies in purity of purpose."
—Donal Alloway, cenn of Kinscaer

name: Sunrise Cavalier
text: "Like us, the morning fights for survival."

name: Prodigal Pyromancer
text: "What am I looking at? Ashes, dead man."

name: Breakthrough
text: The ideas came flooding in so fast that they couldn't all be contained.

name: Bladetusk Boar
text: Deathbellow Canyon is home to minotaurs and many other creatures that share a love for the taste of human flesh.

name: Downpour
text:
"The sky holds vast oceans. They are at your fingertips if you know how to call them."
—Talrand, sky summoner

name: Headless Horseman
text: ". . . The ghost rides forth to the scene of battle in nightly quest of his head . . . he sometimes passes along the Hollow, like a midnight blast . . ." —Washington Irving, *The Legend of Sleepy Hollow*

name: Koskun Keep
text: Treachery and anarchy make poor partners.

name: Regeneration
text:
"Death is not a debt I am yet willing to pay."
—Purraj of Urborg

name: Witherbloom Apprentice
text: "All we are—every feeling, every action—powered by a single, delicate little organ. Life is so terrifyingly, beautifully fragile."

name: Drannith Healer
text: "The glowstones shine and dinosaurs roar to the south. Business will be brisk tonight."

name: Ashnod's Altar
text: The Brothers' War scarred the land, but Ashnod left her mark in the bloodlines of those she tortured.

name: Revoke Existence
text:
"There will come a time when the gods will look at mortals and shudder."
—Uremides the philosopher

name: Serra Angel
text: Perfect justice in service of a perfect will.

name: Roar of Reclamation
text:
"Yesterday's relics will determine the outcome of tomorrow's war."
—Ushanti, leonin seer

name: Reverberate
text: "Not bad, but I can think of a better use for that."

name: Elves of Deep Shadow
text: "They are aberrations who have turned on everything we hold sacred. Let them be cast out." —Ailheen, Speaker of the Council

name: Mystical Dispute
text: "Poor, lost mage. Your feet are on land, yet you're in over your head, aren't you?"

name: Wanderlust
text:
"How terrible to wander wishing only to escape oneself."
—Taysir

name: Mire's Grasp
text: Those caught attempting to escape the Underworld spend the rest of their existence trapped in the Mire of Punishment.

name: Kethis, the Hidden Hand
text: "The pen is mightier than the crown."

name: Selesnya Guildgate
text: The Selesyna welcome all to help them heal the city's wounds. The price, however, is devotion to the guild and a selfless belief in Trostani.

name: Invasion of Gobakhan // Lightshield Array
text: The weight of Phyrexia crashed down upon Gobakhan, but the will of its people endured.

name: Warped Devotion
text:
"Before the glory of Yawgmoth, yes, even this makes sense."
—Urza, to Gerrard

name: Infernal Tribute
text:
"I would not barter my soul for any of the filth that they called power. So they took it from me and damned me to solitude."
—Crovax

name: Kalonian Behemoth
text:
"Do not fire upon it—it is bad luck. And a waste of arrows."
—Alera Benath, Kalonian ranger

name: Mystic Snake
text: Its fangs are in your flesh before its hiss leaves your ears.

name: Captain Vargus Wrath
text: "To be a successful cutthroat, you have to truly enjoy the work."

name: Ticket Turbotubes
text: "WE ARE FILLED WITH TICKETS. WE ARE FILLED WITH PURPOSE."

name: Destructive Tampering
text:
"I don't think they'll appreciate my . . . adjustments."
—Karavin, renegade saboteur

name: Unblinking Observer
text:
"Day 77: The homunculus within the crystal continues to mimic my every movement. I wonder what they are writing?"
—Laboratory notes of Yzlkpk

name: Resistance Reunited
text: "Well, aren't you a sight for sore eyes!" said Koth. "I was about to say the same, my friend," Elspeth replied.

name: Turret Ogre
text: Common Gruul career aspirations: berserker, shaman, catapult.

name: Ugin's Insight
text:
"You speak to me of the threat of Ulamog. But do not forget: they came as three."
—Ugin, to Jace Beleren

name: Sylvan Scrying
text:
"As long as there is a single shred of life, there is hope."
—Nissa Revane

name: Trial of Solidarity
text: "You will succeed as one or fail as many."

name: Moonrager's Slash
text: The cathars fell like leaves as Tovolar himself joined the fray.

name: Vexing Shusher
text: The stench of bloodcap mushrooms on the breath is enough to ward off even the most potent magics, especially when combined with a special chant: "Hushhh."

name: Thalia, Guardian of Thraben
text: "Our dear Madam Mina is once more our teacher. Her eyes have been where we were blinded. Now we are on the track once again, and this time we may succeed."

name: Verduran Enchantress
text:
"Graceful? Yes. Beautiful? Absolutely. Harmless? Definitely not."
—Fyndhorn elder

name: Glorious Anthem
text: Once heard, the battle song of an angel becomes part of the listener forever.

name: Bishop of the Bloodstained
text: "They shall give us all they have as penance for their resistance. Their ships. Their goods. Their rebellious blood."

name: Sengir Autocrat
text:
"Evil is relative. Do sheep think any better of the shepherd?"
—Baron Sengir

name: Steam Blast
text: The viashino knew of the cracked pipes but deliberately left them unmended to bolster the rig's defenses.

name: Frostboil Snarl
text: A smoldering storm of chilling fire.

name: Skirk Shaman
text: In a shaman's grimy hands, a concoction of dried Skirk Ridge herbs can become the face of panic.

name: Sands of Delirium
text: It counts down your last few moments of sanity.

name: Obsessive Search
text: The question strained his sanity. The answer snapped it in half.

name: Frenzied Tilling
text:
"Izzet contraptions pollute our lands. Burn them down, kill the makers, cleanse the earth."
—Nedja, Gruul shaman

name: Fry
text:
"I'm afraid your dinner got a little . . . overcooked."
—Marlan Farthwald, innkeeper

name: Glimmerbell
text:
"Their paths aren't random, but they don't float with the wind. Could they be following surges in crystalline energy?"
—Naireh, Ketria elementalist

name: Ruin Rat
text: From every shadow came the dull scratch of teeth on bones.

name: Countless Gears Renegade
text: "Go forth and cause trouble, my little one!"

name: No Mercy
text:
"Leave no survivors. Let the other worlds see what befalls those who attempt to resist the might of Phyrexia."
—Sheoldred

name: Silent-Chant Zubera
text: When the Honden of Cleansing Fire was abandoned, its attendants swarmed Kamigawa to erode mortal will.

name: Kher Keep
text:
"I swear, for every one Prossh devours, three more pop out of a hole somewhere."
—Jaya Ballard

name: Electrodominance
text: "Basically, we turn a bunch of little lightnings into one big lightning."

name: Giant Scorpion
text: Its sting hurts, but death is strangely painless.

name: Expendable Lackey
text:
"Altonio? No, I'm sorry. No one by that name works here."
—Raffine

name: Amulet of Vigor
text:
"After years of study, I've learned an important lesson: the relics we watch may be watching us back."
—Anowon, the Ruin Sage

name: Disentomb
text: The armies of the dead always report well rested.

name: Combat Medic
text:
"Although Icatia's Combat Medics borrowed much of their knowledge from other societies, their skills were their own."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI*

name: Warped Landscape
text: Each cryptolith twists the plane's mana, bending its flow to a singular purpose.

name: Isperia, Supreme Judge
text: "I serve only justice. But through that duty, I serve all of Ravnica."

name: Hoodwink
text: The youths of Rishada's marketplace are always ready for a quick footrace.

name: Disperse
text: It's pointless to hold on when you have nothing to hold on with.

name: Unholy Heat
text: "The devils use fire. Why shouldn't we?"

name: Kydele, Chosen of Kruphix
text: She bears the greatest burden of all: that of knowing.

name: Swift Warden
text: A warning shout would take too long.

name: Heedless One
text: "Channel your vitality through me."

name: Breath of Life
text:
"Nothing can stop the power of life—not even death."
—Onean cleric

name: Stormbind
text:
"Once, our people could call down the storm itself to do our bidding."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Goblin Razerunners
text: Finding themselves in a new and unexplored world, they immediately set it on fire.

name: Season's Beatings
text: Arriving home, he suddenly longed for the bloodsoaked battlefields behind him.

name: Final Judgment
text:
"The clashing warriors turned to face O-Kagachi, the greatest kami, and their sigh of awe was their last breath."
—*Great Battles of Kamigawa*

name: Hope of Ghirapur
text: The renegades mounted an aether disruptor aboard a lightweight thopter to destroy Tezzeret's Planar Bridge.

name: Giant Growth
text:
"The prohibition of unnecessary tossing of the citizenry by giants shall also extend to spontaneous giants."
—Isperia's Edict, provision VII.789.2

name: Infiltration Lens
text: Neurok spies carry devices that let them look a few moments into the future, giving them an almost insurmountable edge.

name: Stupor
text:
There are medicines for all afflictions but idleness.
—Suq'Ata saying

name: Hellhole Rats
text:
"I must speak with Momir Vig about creating a water-spouting watchdog."
—Mathvan, Prahv scrollwarden

name: Recommission
text: "Put your backs into it! If we don't lay claim to it, the Fallaji will!"

name: Instill Furor
text:
"The Rakdos know little of technology, but they definitely know how to push buttons."
—Trivaz, Izzet mage

name: Containment Construct
text: Automated units are deployed to stabilize merge sites deemed too dangerous even for trained intercessors.

name: Steelshaper Apprentice
text: Theirs is a craft brought about by necessity, now raised to the level of art.

name: Aesi, Tyrant of Gyre Strait
text:
"To sail through those waters is to offer oneself as tribute."
—Captain Hoyrik

name: Jhessian Thief
text: "Where's the fun in an escape if it's not at least a little daring?"

name: Celestial Sword
text:
"So great is its power, only the chosen can wield it and live."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Odric, Master Tactician
text: "Fear holds no place in faith's battle plan."

name: Merfolk Traders
text:
"As much as I hate water, I *do* love fish . . . ."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Goblin King
text: "The King" set out to assemble the most kaboomiest goblin team in the land.

name: Silverclad Ferocidons
text:
"Control them? No. I gird them in armor and let them loose."
—Yacha, Otepec huntmaster

name: Flowstone Channeler
text: With the evincars gone, flowstone became erratic and wild, a source of power for mages more desperate than wise.

name: Statecraft
text:
"Inside these walls, peace; outside, sharks. You choose."
—Saprazzan vizier

name: Sol Ring
text:
"Once, the C'tan sought to rule us. Now it is they who serve us, their shards powering our great machines."
—Szarekh, the Silent King

name: Heavy Ballista
text:
"Soldiers wear down and enemies collapse—but the ballista never tires."
—Ballista captain

name: Wild Griffin
text:
"I abandoned my dream of a squadron of griffin-riders when the cost proved too high. Three trainers were eaten for every griffin broken to the bridle."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

name: Prairie Stream
text: The continent of Ondu is a vast plateau crisscrossed by deep trenches and meandering rivers.

name: Triumph of Cruelty
text:
"I've seen corpses prettier than you, beastmage."
—Liliana Vess

name: Sphere of Purity
text: Purity rejects artifice.

name: Spidersilk Armor
text: It hardly weighs anything, but it takes all day to remove.

name: Skullscorch
text:
"A good whack on the head usually has the same effect."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

name: Stronghold Assassin
text: The assassin sees only throats and hears only heartbeats.

name: Phyrexian Snowcrusher
text: Its plow wasn't designed for snow, but to carve a path through shrieking armies.

name: Ignite Disorder
text: "Bant is a world imprisoned by polished stone and tyrannical rule. It yearns to strike back against those who restrain it."

name: Phalanx Vanguard
text: The cool, sleek automatons beside her mirrored her own iron resolve.

name: Solfatara
text:
"A burst of hot air tossed the moon into the air, and the moon liked it up there so much it never needed the ground again."
—Azeworai, "Glitter Moon"

name: Cowardice
text:
"Cowards die many times before their deaths; The valiant never taste of death but once."
—William Shakespeare, *Julius Caesar*

name: Cloud Djinn
text:
As elusive as the footprint of a djinn
—Suq'Ata expression

name: Oxidda Scrapmelter
text: It subsists on a diet rich in screaming metal and molten blood.

name: Sadistic Skymarcher
text: "I will catch you, child of the sun. I will drink your life and leave you a husk, discarded in the shadows."

name: Afflict
text: One rarely notices a heartbeat, save when it is stolen.

name: Magmaw
text:
"The purpose of existence is simple: everything is fuel for the magmaw."
—Jaji, magmaw worshipper

name: Hatchet Bully
text: "It's not much for eating, but I think we can find somethin' to do with it."

name: Faithless Looting
text:
"How did you get your hands on that? Wait, never mind. I don't want to know."
—Plargg, Lorehold dean

name: Order of the Golden Cricket
text:
"Should you take it in mind to ride a springjack, remember: there are easier ways to fly, and harder ways to break your skull."
—Lann of Cloverdell

name: Righteous War
text:
"This is a war without neutrality."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Hekma Sentinels
text: "The God-Pharaoh created the Hekma to protect us from the horrors beyond and to surround us in his love."

name: Reality Spasm
text: From the moment the first Eldrazi spawn squirmed free, everything on Zendikar took on an adjusted meaning, a new slant toward or away from the waking giants.

name: Axgard Artisan
text: Skodreg knew the Phyrexians wouldn't appreciate his craftsmanship, but they'd get an up-close look just the same.

name: Gix's Caress
text: "Show me all the delicious misery you've sown."

name: Necromancer's Stockpile
text: The experiments decided to perform some research of their own.

name: Mirri, Cat Warrior
text:
"Full of beauty and grace, with a predator's instincts . . . Although she wanders, I have always thought Mirri belongs in Llanowar most of all."
—Rofellos, Llanowar emissary

name: Thunderhead Squadron
text: Just as all seemed lost, the griffin riders of Zhalfir arrived with the force of a gathered storm.

name: Aura Extraction
text: Every day, Order clerics contain as much of the Mirari's energy as possible, hoping to delay Otaria's demise.

name: Thought Scour
text:
"As you inject the *viscus vitae* into the brain stem, don't let the spastic moaning bother you. It will soon become music to your ears."
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Thaumaturge's Familiar
text: Meletian mages can't claim the title of thaumaturge until they have received a gift or omen from the gods. Ephara likes to give tangible tokens of her favor.

name: Vigilant Drake
text: It can stay aloft for weeks with little or no sleep.

name: Barkchannel Pathway // Tidechannel Pathway
text:
"Listen! The trees tell tales of their ancestors in the whisper-song of leaves."
—Inga Rune-Eyes

name: Elvish Doomsayer
text: "From a tiny doubt, the greatest fears grow and flourish. May the weeds of your mind be equally fruitful."

name: Skyblade of the Legion
text: Vampires call the gift of flight "exultation." For their enemies, it brings only sorrow.

name: Thumbscrews
text:
"We will start small, I think."
—Volrath

name: Artificer's Hex
text:
"Some treasures aren't worth finding, let alone stealing."
—Dack Fayden

name: Scroll of Origins
text: The words from which language sprang, the knowledge from which thought was born, the story from which history was woven.

name: Gnoll Hunter
text: Yipping and cackling, the hunters tore through the village, leaving nothing but snapped bones and burning homes in their wake.

name: Myr Adapter
text:
"The simplest way to plan ahead is merely to be ready for everything."
—Pontifex, elder researcher

name: Synod Artificer
text: Memnarch shared a touch of his power with the vedalken in return for their service. It is a debt he intends to collect.

name: River Kaijin
text:
"Since the war began, fishermen don't sing to the kaijin to ask for full nets. They guard the shore with thrice-blessed spears, saving the nets for their wives to pack their belongings and leave."
—Hayato, master sailor

name: Meishin, the Mind Cage
text: It's dangerous indeed to be lost in someone else's thoughts.

name: Stormrider Spirit
text: The weary travelers mistook the flickering lights for a candleguide pointing the way to Harvesttide. Their relief turned to terror as lightning lit the sky.

name: Pulse of the Dross
text: Before tyrants or torturers, there was evil.

name: Frogify
text: That gnat was still hovering by the venison, and now both looked delicious.

name: Whispering Wizard
text: Ivold was aghast when his device revealed the full scope of the geist infestation.

name: Invasion of Shandalar // Leyline Surge
text: Shandalar's wild magic stripped away the unnatural Phyrexian carapaces, reclaiming the true forms hidden underneath.

name: Aerie Worshippers
text: They can conjure stars from a clear sky.

name: Last Word
text: "Someday, someone will best me. But it won't be today, and it won't be you."

name: Lotus Vale
text: At what price beauty?

name: Stone-Seeder Hierophant
text: Her touch brings to bare stone what water and sun bring to rich soil.

name: Blood Artist
text: "No! It's all wrong! I need more. Bring me more!"

name: Panther Warriors
text:
"When you run you're graceful and swift, sleek as a powerful panther."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Capashen Templar
text: Their shields are Benalia's outermost battlements.

name: Egon, God of Death // Throne of Death
text: Egon ages backward, his wisdom soured by youthful spite.

name: Cerebral Vortex
text: Izzet brains and Izzet boilers: contents under pressure.

name: Child of Thorns
text:
"The soratami scoff at the perils of Jukai, calling the forest an 'unruly garden.' Perhaps we should send them a rose such as this."
—Dokai, Weaver of Life

name: Drawn Together
text:
"My Pete Venters theme deck is nearly complete. Then I shall be unstoppable! Bwahahahaaa!"
—Pete Venters

name: Xantcha
text: A Phyrexian "sleeper agent," Xantcha has developed an inviolate sense of self. This aberration earned her a death sentence, but she was rescued by Urza and joined his crusade. Her Phyrexian credo of "Waste not, want not" has helped Urza more than even he comprehends.

name: Dismal Failure
text:
"Two magi could trade spells all day and never crown a victor. The real battle is not one of power but of will. If your confidence breaks, so too shall you."
—Venser

name: Necrogen Spellbomb
text:
"Forget that which was never known."
—Spellbomb inscription

name: Territorial Allosaurus
text: A living remnant of the Ice Age.

name: Rambunctious Mutt
text: Emphatic words with powerful gestures. Clearly this was playtime.

name: Schema Thief
text: "An intriguing design, but it would be much better without all that oil."

name: Voice of the Provinces
text: Her horn is heard across Innistrad, lifting the hearts of the righteous.

name: Blessed Reversal
text:
"A battle's outcome is never certain."
—The Southern Paladin

name: Blanchwood Armor
text:
"There's never been a dwarven smith who could match the marvels that Gaea herself forges."
—The Elvish Champion

name: Forced Fruition
text: Imagination's weight is memory's end.

name: Solemn Offering
text:
"A relic donation is suggested."
"The suggestion is mandatory."
—Temple signs

name: Lotus Path Djinn
text: "The lotus takes root where body and mind intersect. It blooms when body and mind become one."

name: Ironhoof Boar
text:
"I'm glad she can run again, but this might have been a bit much."
—Kenji, Sokenzan artisan

name: Rakish Heir
text: "If you're not having fun, what's the point of living forever?"

name: Primal Frenzy
text:
"Don't dismiss its anger as mindless fury. I assure you, it has purpose."
—Seton, centaur druid

name: Orc Sureshot
text: "Words have yet to halt an arrow."

name: Pest Infestation
text: A thousand years of history undone by one juvenile prank.

name: Tectonic Edge
text:
"We move because the earth does."
—Bruse Tarl, Goma Fada nomad

name: Hill Giant Herdgorger
text: A shepherd's crook is useful for cleaning bits of wool out of the teeth.

name: Frenzied Raider
text: "Arrogant maggot. You won't be so proud when I rip out your tongue and drink from your skull!"

name: Midnight Duelist
text: Avacyn's return did not rid him of his desire for revenge.

name: Sage of Epityr
text: Clairvoyants across Dominaria were driven mad by the overload from the widening time rifts, while other random folk gained the gift of future sight.

name: Vildin-Pack Outcast // Dronepack Kindred
text: These new terrors will not recede with the setting of the moon.

name: Suntail Hawk
text:
"They are the finest companions in the realm. Swift, clever, and easily trained to hunt intruders."
—Almira, falconer

name: Wild Celebrants
text: "You can tell something's really valuable by the sound it makes when you slam your staff into it."

name: Ranger's Path
text: The forest can seem like a dense maze. Those who travel the canopy know otherwise.

name: Invading Manticore
text:
"Fall back! You are no match for this."
—Samut

name: Deathless Angel
text:
"I should have died that day, but I suffered not a scratch. I awoke in a lake of blood, none of it apparently my own."
—*The War Diaries*

name: Marauding Looter
text: "I'll be taking that."

name: Disorder
text:
"Fire hurts them almost as much as the chaos that follows. Almost."
—The Western Paladin

name: Prophetic Flamespeaker
text: Fire to destroy. Fire to create.

name: Prismatic Ward
text:
"These, of all spells, must have common components I can isolate and use."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Jace's Sanctum
text:
"For all our lofty talk of keeping watch, we had no idea what we were getting into."
—Jace Beleren

name: Electrostatic Field
text:
"It's both an ingress-denial mechanism and an attractive hallway light!"
—Daxiver, Izzet electromancer

name: Siren Reaver
text: "Prepare to be boarded."

name: Evasive Action
text: Effective use of terrain is a lesson good commanders learn quickly.

name: Hill Giant
text: Fortunately, Hill Giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

name: Unearthly Blizzard
text:
"We are trapped. The mountains and blinding kami storms have made us hopelessly lost. We are starving. In the name of all things sacred, please, send help . . . ."
—Lost Battalion, final message to General Takeno

name: Llanowar Elves
text: Llanowar covers a million square miles, yet nobody enters the forest without the elves knowing it.

name: Pit Fight
text:
"All the coins in Ravnica can't save his soul now."
—Narbulg Nine Fingers

name: Deploy to the Front
text:
"When the door drops, give them a taste of the Emperor's fire!"
—Commissar Yarrick

name: Wake of Vultures
text:
"So the vulture said to the griffin, 'You gonna eat that?'"
—Azeworai, "The Ugly Bird"

name: Jawbone Skulkin
text:
"Ah, skull of shrew—a very potent substance. In powdered form, it gives thrice the zing of noggle hoof pulp."
—Boghald, Barrenton medic

name: River of Tears
text:
"The Westfolk wept, and their tears wore winding rivers into the cheek of the world."
—Glem the Lonebard, "Origins of Kholon"

name: Untamed Wilds
text: No forest is so remote that the elves don't know its secrets.

name: Tobias, Doomed Conqueror
text: Tobias spent decades tormenting pirates on the open sea and decades more dancing lifelessly beneath it.

name: Simic Guildgate
text: Enter and comprehend the perfection of orchestrated life.

name: Psychic Transfer
text:
"The memory of your existence will fade like the final stars of morning."
—Kaervek

name: Purple-Crystal Crab
text: A precious shell without, a delicious taste within.

name: Devout Harpist
text: The notes themselves are irrelevant. The music's effect, however, is worth ten armies.

name: Urborg Stalker
text:
"May you be a stalker's dream."
—Urborg curse

name: Mischief and Mayhem
text:
"The false god Xenagos treats the whole world as his rollick site. If his whims are left unchecked, Theros will be reduced to rubble and ashes."
—Elspeth

name: Gyre Engineer
text: "As I contemplate what is, I dive ever deeper into the depths of possibility. Then I set an experiment in motion and watch the truth rise to the surface."

name: Choking Sands
text:
"The people wiped the sand from their eyes and cursed—and left the barren land to the hyenas and vipers."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Mishra, Tamer of Mak Fawa
text:
"With the Brotherhood of Gix whispering in his ear, Mishra's drive to prove himself was slowly twisted into an insatiable hunger for power."
—The Antiquities War

name: Sacred Foundry
text: After the Consulate's defeat, the forges were opened to all. Now inventions pour forth from Ghirapur as freely as molten metal from the foundry.

name: Bile Blight
text: Not an arrow loosed, javelin thrown, nor sword raised. None were needed.

name: Chub Toad
text:
Chub Toad, Chub Toad
At the door.
Run away quick
Or you'll run no more.
—Traditional children's rhyme

name: Bone Sabres
text: Charged with psychic energy, the melee weapons of the Tyranid are far more than bone and chitin.

name: Awe for the Guilds
text: When the guilds cooperate, the guildless celebrate their peaceful society. When the guilds clash, the guildless just try to keep out of the way.

name: Prismatic Wardrobe
text:
"Spring in Dominaria means pastels!"
—Excerpt from *Mage's Home Journal*

name: Zhalfirin Crusader
text:
"War is the crucible of leadership."
—Rashida Scalebane

name: Barbed Battlegear
text:
"One need only look at the inhabitants of this world to see that they are forged halfway to perfection. All they need is a whisper of the Glorious Word."
—Urabrask the Hidden

name: Brazen Upstart
text: "Trust me, you want to deal with me. My associates are much less pleasant."

name: Basilica Guards
text: "None may pass . . . for free."

name: Dakmor Plague
text: The tiniest cough can be deadlier than the fiercest dragon.

name: Salvage Scuttler
text: A hermit crab goes through many shells in its lifetime, and not all are natural in origin.

name: Withered Wretch
text: Once it consecrated the dead. Now it desecrates them.

name: Enormous Baloth
text: Its diet consists of fruits, plants, small woodland animals, large woodland animals, woodlands, fruit groves, fruit farmers, and small cities.

name: Griptide
text:
"Beware the seagrafs just off the shore. These waters are filled with hungry geists looking for an easy meal."
—Captain Eberhart

name: Thelonite Monk
text:
"As the climate worsened, some Thelonites turned to fertilizing with fresh blood in an attempt to keep Havenwood alive and growing."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*

name: Humongulus
text: Searching the city for Fblthp felt like sifting the rain for a single drop of blood.

name: Acidic Sliver
text: The first sliver burst against the cave wall, and others piled in behind to deepen the new tunnel.

name: Kari Zev, Skyship Raider
text: Aboard her ship, the *Dragon's Smile*, Kari follows no one's rules but her own.

name: Netherborn Altar
text: It is spoken of only in whispers, visited only by the desperate.

name: Damnation
text: All deeds once committed, repaid now in kind.

name: Collective Unconscious
text: Gerrard knew little of Ramos, the sky god they worshiped. But he felt the power of the chant.

name: Concordant Crossroads
text: The endless spectral procession crashed against the Envoy's hiding spot. "What are you," they taunted, "fighter or failure? Give in, daughter of the dead, and join your ancestor in eternal slumber."

name: Jerren, Corrupted Bishop // Ormendahl, the Corrupter
text: "Ah, Jerren. You've been such a faithful, useful insect."

name: Sulfurous Blast
text: The Keldons used the toxic vents in the cracked earth to bolster their home's defenses.

name: Vampires' Vengeance
text: Olivia was quick to make an example of any village that refused to pay her blood tithe.

name: Reach Through Mists
text:
"Know one part of the name, obsession begins. Know two parts, paranoia sets in. Know three parts, madness descends. Know all, and only the kami know what will become of you."
—Lady Azami

name: Signal Pest
text: It leaps from tree to tree, revealing the enemy's positions.

name: Deluge
text:
"From the sea came all life, and to the sea it will return. The sooner the better."
—Emperor Aboshan

name: Extremely Slow Zombie
text: Brrrrrrrrrrrr . . .

name: Urabrask's Anointer
text: "You were so eager to spy on my work, I assume you'll appreciate a hands-on demonstration."

name: Lady Orca
text: "I do not remember what he said to her. I remember her fiery eyes, fixed upon him for an instant. I remember a flash, and the hot breath of sudden flames made me turn away. When I looked again, Angus was gone." —A Wayfarer, on meeting Lady Orca

name: Accursed Spirit
text: Many have heard the slither of dragging armor and the soft squelch of its voice. But only its victims ever meet its icy gaze.

name: Symbol of Unsummoning
text:
". . . inviting the soul to wander for a spell in abysses of solitude . . . ."
—Kate Chopin, *The Awakening*

name: Supply Drop
text: New armaments, fresh provisions, and best of all, dry socks.

name: Magus of the Moon
text: Tidal forces of the blood moon wrench and buckle the land, drawing monoliths of stone and soil toward the flaming orb.

name: Watchful Automaton
text:
"Before we can destroy our enemies, we must find them. We must peer into every wretched hovel and every teeming market."
—Baral, Chief of Compliance

name: Star-Crowned Stag
text: White as starlight on snow, it appears only on the eve of the winter solstice.

name: Livaan, Cultist of Tiamat
text: Her hunger for power consumes what the fire cannot.

name: Orzhov Guildgate
text:
"If you think the cathedral is impressive, you should see what's down below."
—Teysa

name: Barrow Ghoul
text:
"They killed my family to deny me a future. They fed on my ancestors to deny me a past."
—Crovax

name: Logic Knot
text: "Such sloppy work. Let's unravel it and try again!"

name: Niall Silvain
text: This is his domain, and while you remain here you must value all life as you value your own.

name: Kobold Overlord
text:
"One for all, all for one; we strike first, and then you're done!"
—Oath of the Kobold Musketeers

name: Doom Blade
text:
"An angel can shine like the sun, inspire the weak, and even threaten victory over darkness. But in the end it matters not, for it still dies like any other pest."
—Ob Nixilis

name: Dragonstalker
text:
"When the skies are filled with flames, the brave shall step forward to quench them."
—Order prophecy

name: Holy Justiciar
text: Her eyes see through the rotting flesh and glimpse a soul in agony, begging for the Blessed Sleep.

name: Vineweft
text: Fortified by the wilds.

name: Enchanted Evening
text: In the reflection, she saw the rough shell of the world sloughing away, revealing the truth shining underneath.

name: Norn's Wellspring
text:
"Drown, so you may breathe again."
—Atraxa

name: Treasure Hunt
text:
"Some call me a thief. I prefer to think of myself as a discreet borrower."
—Dack Fayden, Planeswalker

name: Propaganda
text:
