"You've failed Gerrard. You've failed the Legacy. You've failed yourself. I can do no more."
—Volrath, to Karn

name: Corridor Monitor
text: Castle Vantress has no locks on its doors, but interlopers rarely make it past the foyer.

name: Memory Lapse
text:
"Um...oh...what was I saying?"
—Reveka, wizard savant

name: Angelic Exaltation
text:
"If we cannot have peace, we will have justice."
—Aurelia

name: Silver Knight
text: Otaria's last defense against the wave of chaos threatening to engulf it.

name: Galedrifter // Waildrifter
text:
"If you're lost in a storm, follow a gryff. They always know which way calmer waters lie."
—Geor, Havengul fisher

name: Insolence
text:
"Sacrificing mortal dragons to satisfy your immortal hunger ends here."
—Darigaaz, to Rith

name: Phyrexian Pegasus
text:
"It is glory, exalted and *compleat*."
—Cymede, regent of the Alabaster Host

name: Lightning Diadem
text: "I fight for Keranos and for mortals. I see no contradiction."

name: Krosan Grip
text:
「時がばらばらに引き裂かれた世界では、破壊がすべての心を支配した。」
—-多元宇宙の形而上史学

name: Dire Fleet Ravager
text: His fists fume with the decay of death, each strike a plague on the hearts of his enemies.

name: Minotaur Sureshot
text: "Those wings are no advantage. I will pin them to the ceiling of the Hekma."

name: Gideon's Battle Cry
text: "Break their formation! Thin their ranks! I'm right behind you!"

name: Cleansing Beam
text:
"Justice is toothless without punishment. Righteousness cannot succeed without the suffering of the guilty."
—Razia

name: Abandoned Sarcophagus
text: Although long since dead, the banished dissenters finally took their vengeance.

name: Loxodon Partisan
text:
"On every plane I've encountered loxodons, I've found stalwart and loyal friends."
—Elspeth

name: Counterspell
text: "If only there were a way to counter your inevitable whining."

name: Precinct Captain
text: "In troubled times, we all need someone to watch our back."

name: Kabira Outrider
text: Ondu moas make wildly uncomfortable mounts, but for determined warriors, their speed is enough to make up for it.

name: Wild Cantor
text: They are the voice of the wild, crying out with nature's fury and bringing forth its primeval might.

name: Barbary Apes
text: Unpredictable in the extreme, these carnivorous apes will prey even upon their own kind.

name: Necromantic Selection
text: It shambled from the cloud of ash and bone dust, undeterred by its own extinction.

name: Sigil Blessing
text: "For unwavering commitment and unflinching strength, the Order of the White Orchid confers its sigil. Rise, knight-captain, and do your duty."

name: Boon-Bringer Valkyrie
text: Her blades were twin beacons, calling the worthy to glory and the wretched to despair.

name: Gloom Pangolin
text:
"They say it survives on a purely bioluminescent diet. It's only active during the darkest of Indatha nights, making verification highly challenging."
—Gannet, Skysail zoologist

name: Gloom Stalker
text: "I'll make sure you never mistake a roper for a stalagmite again."

name: Barbarian Lunatic
text:
"I once saw a single barbarian charge a band of twenty nomads. I've seen some crazy ones, too."
—Nomad sentry

name: Numa, Joraga Chieftain
text: His blade carves a path for his people. His words guide them along it.

name: Qal Sisma Behemoth
text:
"It hunts grand game for Atarka, and when the time comes, it will become a mighty feast."
—Surrak, the Hunt Caller

name: Gideon's Triumph
text: His triumph came not from victory over his enemies, but from the salvation of those who survived.

name: Gift of Strength
text:
"When the sky screams, when the ground groans, the End-Raze will soon begin."
—Nikya of the Old Ways

name: Cleansing Nova
text: In their final moments, the demons gazed upon grace in its purest form.

name: Marsh Goblins
text: Even the other Goblin races shun the Marsh Goblins, thanks to certain unwholesome customs they practice.

name: Arc Spitter
text: "I'm fresh out of mercy today. Why don't you ask Sparky here for forgiveness?"

name: Tectonic Fiend
text: The barbarians of Pardia are long dead, but its mountains still smolder with rage.

name: Scrivener
text: A good memory is no match for a good scribe.

name: Fungal Sprouting
text:
"Saprolings need only a host to feed upon. Numbers will take care of the rest."
—Ghave, Guru of Spores

name: Goblin Spelunkers
text:
"It only short jump. You go first."
"AIIIEEEE!"
"Hmm . . . we go different way now."

name: Tolarian Winds
text:
Why not ask the winds?
—Tolarian expression meaning "Who knows?"

name: Magus of the Future
text: Those gifted with the sight have one eye in the present and the other in the future.

name: Goblin Javelineer
text: Hate gets you only so far. A pointy stick can close the rest of the distance.

name: Turn Against
text: "No, don't! Nal, it's me—"

name: Radiant Fountain
text:
"All peoples treasure a place where the weary traveler may drink in peace."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Goblin War Paint
text: War paint made from kolya fruit heightens senses and lessens fear. Unfortunately, fear is usually what keeps you alive.

name: Hot Fix
text: It's not a carpet moth, it's a feature.

name: Vedalken Dismisser
text:
"I crept up on him, quiet as a guttermouse. And then suddenly I found myself facedown in a latrine pit behind Tin Street Market."
—Sirislav, Dimir spy

name: Eaten by Spiders
text: After sampling many victims, the spider developed a preference for the undead and their accoutrements.

name: Phantasmal Dragon
text: 嘘と霧から生み出されたものにも関わらず、その飢えと怒りは力を持つ。

name: Epistolary Librarian
text: "Bolters? Chainswords? All fine weapons, however I wield a far more dangerous power."

name: Tahngarth
text: Tahngarth, first mate of the *Weatherlight* under Sisay, knows that there are really only two forms of life: the ugly ones and the minotaurs. A narcissist, he considers the condition of his hide as important as the accuracy of his blade.

name: Cosmic Rebirth
text:
"When all the stories find their ends, a new one shall begin."
—*The Endsaga*

name: Lotus Guardian
text: Lotus fields are too valuable to leave undefended.

name: Telepathy
text: "Secrets? What secrets?"

name: Hyalopterous Lemure
text:
"I was wrong! Not harmless at all!"
—Norin the Wary

name: Wall of Swords
text: Sharper than wind, lighter than air.

name: Festival Crasher
text: So many candles. So many flammables. So little time.

name: Crypt Rats
text:
"Shoo, you little worm tails—go away! My corpses aren't your dinner!"
—Ghoulcaller Gisa

name: Jeweled Lotus
text:
"I've seen my share of baubles, minister. Whatever ostentatious bit of glitter you have there won't convince me to ... Oh my."
—Emperor Ayrelion

name: Skirk Alarmist
text: "I treat each day as your last."

name: Ravenous Leucrocota
text: Hunger makes a leucrocota dangerous. A full belly makes it angry and dangerous.

name: Bucknard's Everfull Purse
text: As long as it's never left empty, this magic pouch produces coins every dawn.

name: Thought Courier
text: "There's an assortment to satisfy all your needs: deep, fleeting, dirty, pure, scientific, philosophical, after, and even fore. For a price."

name: Resolute Veggiesaur
text: This dinosaur doesn't know what will kill him, but he's determined it won't be heart disease.

name: Call to Serve
text: Grace is a gift, never a reward.

name: Tradewind Rider
text: It is said that the wind will blow the world past if you wait long enough.

name: Steel Exemplar
text: Reports differed on whether the figure was an automaton or a mage, mostly because few who saw it survived.

name: Scarscale Ritual
text: Some words are too important to trust to something as fragile as memory.

name: Hooded Horror
text: Insidious fear can be the undoing of the greatest of armies.

name: Banefire
text: For Sarkhan Vol, the dragon is the purest expression of life's savage splendor.

name: Wrecking Beast
text:
"The best construction makes the most satisfying destruction."
—Domri Rade

name: Lava Burst
text:
"Overkill? This isn't a game of Kick-the-Ouphe!"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Reclusive Taxidermist
text: We want no proofs; we ask none to believe us! This boy will some day know what a brave and gallant woman his mother is.

name: Scavenged Weaponry
text: "The Phyrexians have progressed," admired Urza. "Their parts are interchangeable."

name: Scion of Halaster
text: Most see the Mad Mage as a deranged menace, but you recognize the genius behind his paranoia

name: Smolder Initiate
text: "Life is a circle. Death is a vicious circle."

name: Fact or Fiction
text: "Try to pretend like you understand what's important."

name: Undercellar Myconid
text: Water, barley, yeast, darkness—the tavern cellar had everything a growing mold could need.

name: Vivisection
text: Though their work is widely reviled, stitchers see themselves as being on the cutting edge of science.

name: Alpine Grizzly
text: The Temur welcome bears into the clan, fighting alongside them in battle. The relationship dates back to when they labored side by side under Sultai rule.

name: Reality Twist
text:
"Nothing is as it seems."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Hope Tender
text: Some refused to leave their shattered homes, vowing to rebuild at any cost.

name: Hero of the Pride
text: Leonin fight for neither god nor polis; their loyalty is to their pride.

name: Hussar Patrol
text:
"You think no one is watching, you think you're smart enough to escape, and most foolish of all, you think no one cares."
—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

name: A-Celebrity Fencer
text: After a brief but memorable incident at her first performance, she was never heckled again.

name: Pressure Point
text: By studying dragon anatomy, Jeskai monks have learned how to locate clusters of nerves that will incapacitate even the mightiest dragons.

name: Spiteful Blow
text:
"Only a fool takes Phenax at his word. What do you expect from a god born of lies and betrayal?"
—Verenes, priest of Iroas

name: Canyon Minotaur
text: On Jund, the deep canyons were the best places to hide. When the goblins wandered into Naya, they found that was not so true.

name: Goblin War Drums
text: When creating a new War Drum, Goblin designers sought out the highest quality skulls. Serra Angel skulls were most highly prized, although most acknowledged that the skull of the exotic Sea Serpent made for a richer tone.

name: Rebound
text: Insult, like an arrow, is beyond control once loosed.

name: Griffin Sentinel
text: Once a griffin sentinel adopts a territory as its own, only death can force it to betray its post.

name: Urabrask the Hidden
text: While the other praetors eagerly prepared for invasion, Urabrask retreated to the Furnace Layer, defying Elesh Norn's commands.

name: Roiling Regrowth
text:
"Roots find their way through rock, and even mountains must give way to new growth."
—Nissa Revane

name: Mystic Skull // Mystic Monstrosity
text: It waited on the barn wall for decades, forgotten, looking for the perfect opportunity.

name: Treespring Lorian
text: No matter your strength, the Krosan Forest is stronger. No matter your speed, the Wirewood Forest is faster.

name: Twincast
text: Sometimes you have to search for inspiration, and sometimes it's right there in front of you.

name: You Come to the Gnoll Camp
text:
"Easy now, everyone. I'll take care of this."
—Nadaar

name: Drill Bit
text: Never boring.

name: Aura Blast
text: "None of your history books mention me?" laughed Daria. "They will now."

name: Pir, Imaginative Rascal
text: Pir always had a *very *big imagination.

name: Vorthos, Steward of Myth
text: "Just wait, my Madara deck isn't all Emperor Bolas. There's an Umezawa subtheme!"

name: Monsoon
text:
"No one in her right mind would venture off the coast of Kjeldor during this season."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Merciless Repurposing
text: As the harvesters bore away the last of his limbs, what remained of Urabrask heard Elesh Norn say, "Leave the traitor be."

name: Candelabra of Tawnos
text: Tawnos learned quickly from Urza that utter simplicity often led to wondrous, yet subtle utility.

name: Hail of Arrows
text:
"Do not let a single shaft loose until my word. And when I give that word, do not leave a single shaft in Eiganjo."
—General Takeno

name: Hunt the Weak
text: Dragons scorn the weak, even among their own kind.

name: Huddle Up
text: "Are you sure this is going to work?" asked Will. "No," said Rowan. "But if it does, it's going to be spectacular."

name: Mine Worker
text: Following his hunger for knowledge and power from the past, Urza starved Dominaria's future.

name: Decompose
text:
"Sheesh! How am I supposed to make a decent living around here?"
—Cabal grave robber

name: Retaliator Griffin
text: For every eye, an eye. For every tooth, a tooth. Griffins are nothing if not fair.

name: Ulvenwald Captive // Ulvenwald Abomination
text:
"Even on a plane as dark as this one, nature will organize a defense against the unnatural."
—Nissa Revane

name: Oona's Grace
text: Oona grants her favored subjects a dream from her own guarded heart.

name: Primordial Wurm
text:
"You can hear its tail thrashing from a mile away. Keep in mind that its jaws may already be half a mile closer."
—Jenson Carthalion, Yavimaya exile

name: Elvish Soultiller
text: Mutated elves wondered if this was their final form, or if it was just another step.

name: Squee, the Immortal
text:
Squee had never wanted to be a king or a symbol of defiance against Phyrexians. Naturally, he found himself as both.
—*Heroes of the Second Invasion*

name: Cathartic Reunion
text: The soldier had given up his wealth, his title, even his home, but he had no room for regret. At last, he had saved his friend.

name: Carpet of Flowers
text: Winds through silent bloom

name: Nightmare
text: The Nightmare arises from its lair in the swamps. As the poisoned land spreads, so does the Nightmare's rage and terrifying strength.

name: Coat of Arms
text: A banner for bonds of blood or belief.

name: Legions of Lim-Dûl
text:
"I have seen the faces of my dead friends among that grim band, and I can bear no more."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter,
leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Leyline Invocation
text:
"Do you still believe my work is nothing but dry, boring equations?"
—Cairu, Quandrix mage-student

name: Riveting Rigger
text: "Turn a blender into an arc welder with a portable fusion reactor and a frozen yogurt dispenser? We can do it!"

name: Rockfall Vale
text: Cries of panic echo along Kessig's narrow ravines as howlpacks herd their prey.

name: Might of the Masses
text:
"There is nothing stronger than many hearts united for a single cause."
—Emmara

name: Invasion of Innistrad // Deluge of the Dead
text: The eerie magic animating Innistrad's zombies rendered them immune to phyresis, making them crucial to the plane's defense.

name: Guma
text: When the giant returned for the night, he found a dead merfolk on his pillow. Although he praised the little guma, he inwardly wondered where she had hid the head.

name: Wring Flesh
text:
"Don't blame me. You're the one walking around with skin."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

name: Pillar of War
text: Just because a temple has no guards doesn't mean it's undefended.

name: Frost Lynx
text: If you feel a strange chill within the temperate Quartzwood, look up.

name: Black Market Tycoon
text: "I have exactly what you need. The question is, how badly do you need it?"

name: Guardians of Akrasa
text:
"Only by the bravery of those who put loyalty above glory is our home kept safe."
—Elspeth Tirel

name: Simic Ragworm
text:
"Infused with autochthon blood for size and hellion cells for speed, the ragworm is perfect for clearing the undergardens of both rats and vagrants."
—Yolov, Simic bioengineer

name: Dakmor Lancer
text: The darkness of his shield reflects the inky blackness of his soul.

name: Great Desert Prospector
text: "Hello, beautiful."

name: Evolutionary Leap
text: The essence of nature is change.

name: Cascade Bluffs
text: Travelers bathe in the falls to wash away curses from the pucas who lurk nearby.

name: Linvala, Keeper of Silence
text:
"Mother of Light! Her warm embrace extends through ev'ry plane, for person and beast alike."
—*Song of All*, canto 702

name: Piercing Rays
text: The forecast calls for pain.

name: Kroxa and Kunoros
text: When the Invasion Tree reached the Underworld, it found only teeth and fury.

name: Entrapment Maneuver
text:
"Greed, rage, and bloodlust all lead to death at the hands of those who keep their heads."
—Sergeant Eyra

name: Red Dragon
text: Red dragons consider the world and every creature in it as theirs to command.

name: Champion of the Perished
text: He rose from the graf for every cobbler, tanner, and fool who'd been slaughtered in the parish—and they rose and shambled after him.

name: Command Tower
text: On the Planet of Sorcerers in the Eye of Terror lies the Tower of the Cyclops, the redoubt of Magnus the Red.

name: Glory of Warfare
text: "Their hopes dashed on our shields! Their victory slashed by our swords!"

name: Skyway Sniper
text: "No sight is more beautiful than a clear sky."

name: Shoe Tree
text: It grows several feet a year.

name: Sweep Away
text: The Roil takes many forms. It also takes many victims.

name: Mnemonic Sliver
text:
"A jigsaw puzzle that lives, breeds, and thinks."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

name: Crazed Firecat
text:
"The longer it's caged, the madder it gets."
—Firecat handler

name: Maraleaf Pixie
text: Neither hostile nor friendly, pixies flit through the forest seeking the treasures of the wilds.

name: Primordial Wurm
text: Elite training, single-minded devotion, and lazotep coating help only so much for invaders who are fundamentally bite-sized.

name: Selective Memory
text:
"I of all people know that memory is not a safe place to hide valuables."
—Jace Beleren

name: Darkness
text: By the physical laws of the universe, darkness is merely the absence of light. Necrons can harness the power of other dimensions, where darkness is tangible and moldable.

name: Warstorm Surge
text: "Listen to the roar! Feel the thunder! The Immersturm shouts its approval with every bolt of lightning!"

name: Magmatic Sinkhole
text: Opening like the maw of a hellion, the earth swallowed the traveler whole.

name: Segovian Leviathan
text:
"Leviathan, too! Can you catch him with a fish-hook or run a line round his tongue?"
—*The Bible*, Job 41:1

name: Unlikely Alliance
text:
"Strange alliances are alliances still, and provide the same protection."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

name: Delver of Secrets // Insectile Aberration
text: "If my hypothesis is correct . . ."

name: Dwarven Bloodboiler
text: His battle cry unleashes an avalanche of dwarves.

name: Slag Strider
text: Imbued with life by a stray bolt of spellcraft, it began to wander about the foundry, to the blacksmiths' alarm.

name: Speaker of the Heavens
text: "All are welcome in the angels' light."

name: Clear the Mind
text:
"The best way to keep a secret is to forget it."
—Lazav

name: Commander Eesha
text: "War glides on the simplest updrafts while peace struggles against hurricane winds. It is the way of the world. It must change."

name: Knucklebone Witch
text: Each bone honors its owner's best pranks.

name: Grindstone
text: Memory is a burden that wears at the soul as weather wears at stone.

name: Distracting Geist // Clever Distraction
text: "Me neither."

name: Hand of Justice
text:
"The Hand of Justice will come to cleanse the world if we are true."
—Oliver Farrel

name: Flicker
text: Who is truer: you who are, or you who are to be?

name: Silverquill Campus
text: Mage-students drawn to the power of language choose Silverquill, the college of eloquence.

name: Silvergill Douser
text: The Silvergill school monitors traffic on the Lanes, ensuring that the riffraff don't interfere with travelers.

name: Kazandu Nectarpot
text:
"The scythe-like forelegs are crucial for its survival, because it tastes really good and every inhabitant of Murasa knows it."
—Arhana, Kazandu trapfinder

name: Stadium Vendors
text: "Potions! Mana potions, health potions, energy potions—get your potions here!"

name: Krark's Thumb // Krark's Thumb
text: The thumb is said to bring its owner good luck up until the end of their life. That duration has yet to be specified.

name: Crystal Chimes
text: As Serra was to learn, the peace and sanctity of her realm were as fragile as glass.

name: Ascended Lawmage
text: A lawmage's runic script is an act of governance given form: legislation written directly onto the air itself.

name: Clockwork Gnomes
text:
"Until I came to the Floating Isle, I never had to oil the servants."
—Baki, Wizard Attendant

name: Golgari Findbroker
text: "We gather the past from surface dwellers and sell it right back to them."

name: Doorkeeper
text: One piercing stare usually convinces thieves to go elsewhere.

name: Commander's Sphere
text: Clutching the orb it found in the lake, the frog let out a croak of enlightenment.

name: Blackcleave Cliffs
text: Where ambition meets industry, passion is poisoned by greed.

name: Frilled Sandwalla
text:
"Even the smallest creatures are fierce in defense of their own territory."
—Vivien Reid

name: Deafening Clarion
text:
"Commander, what's the signal to attack?"
"You'll know."

name: Skyscythe Engulfer
text:
"I bet even Skithiryx would take the long way around this one."
—Kara Vrist, resistance spymaster

name: Izzet Guildgate
text: Beyond lies the culmination of all Izzet projects, a grand experiment led by the dragon Niv-Mizzet himself.

name: Tremor
text: One little goblin shook up the ground. When the dust cleared, no one was found.

name: Ornithopter of Paradise
text:
"Through even our darkest days, we must never cease creating. Each new invention brings value to the world, be it beauty, utility, or both."
—Rashmi, aether-seer

name: Shared Discovery
text: Riches must be divided, but real wealth can be shared.

name: Sanguine Glorifier
text: For the Legion of Dusk, the Immortal Sun is a source of eternal life. When they reclaim it, they will no longer be forced to subsist on the blood of the wicked.

name: Knighthood
text: Kings don't make knights. Actions do.

name: Divine Gambit
text: There are rules, and then there are gods.

name: Lure
text: Deepwood's reach is not long, so it invites its enemies in.

name: Phantom Warrior
text: The phantom warrior comes from nowhere and returns there just as quickly.

name: Jandor's Saddlebags
text: Each day of their journey, Jandor opened the saddlebags and found them full of mutton, quinces, cheese, date rolls, wine, and all manner of delicious and satisfying foods.

name: Cephalid Snitch
text: The cautious are wary of their enemies. The wise are also wary of their friends.

name: Eternal Scourge
text:
"It has latched onto this place like an infestation. All efforts at eradication have proved futile."
—Yeter, Trostad villager

name: Wall of Wonder
text: They wondered at the size of it. It wondered which to eat first.

name: Disenchant
text:
"I implore you not to forget the horrors of the past. You would have us start the Brothers' War anew!"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

name: Lavakin Brawler
text: She swings with the ease of flowing lava and hits with the force of a meteor.

name: Urbis Protector
text:
"Guilds be damned. We can fend for ourselves."
—Vennick of the Gateless

name: Okiba Reckoner Raid // Nezumi Road Captain
text: United by defiant pride in their outsider status, the nezumi of the Okiba Reckoners boast the most advanced cyberbikes and the best riders of all the Reckoner gangs.

name: Sound the Call
text:
"If you call the wolves, ensure you have a worthy hunt, or you may become the hunted."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

name: Mind Ravel
text: An end to reason, an end to order. Forget all that has been.

name: Goblin Turncoat
text:
"Goblins won't betray their own kind for any price. They'll do it for a very specific price."
—Phage the Untouchable

name: Heartwarming Redemption
text: Kytheon had known war every day of his life. Now he finally knew peace.

name: Elder of Laurels
text: Hopes and prayers can carry the same force as swords and torches.

name: Archon of Justice
text: In dark times, Truth bears a blade.

name: Scepter of Fugue
text: One goes to Tidehollow either to forget or to be forgotten. Either way, the scullers will oblige.

name: Vicious Shadows
text:
"Thrashes of the ancient past still linger in spirit and shadow, desperate to sink their claws into our souls."
—Rakka Mar

name: Phyrexian Altar
text:
"Your life was meaningless, but your death will glorify Yawgmoth."
—Tsabo Tavoc

name: Ray of Dissolution
text: The works of one god last only as long as the patience of another.

name: Conflux
text: After years of world-bending machinations, Bolas's triumph is at hand.

name: Earthshaker Giant
text: "Come, my wild children. Let's give the interlopers a woodland welcome."

name: Wingsteed Rider
text: Trust is the only bridle a pegasus will accept.

name: Rack and Ruin
text:
"My people are bound by masters centuries dead. Each artifact we destroy is another link broken in that chain."
—Barb Tail, viashino heretic

name: Safewright Quest
text: Elves search for sources of beauty in a nighted world. Meanwhile, the nighted world searches for the blood of elves.

name: Metal Fatigue
text: The Auriok have fought the metal hordes for so long now that knowing how to cripple them has become an instinct.

name: Party Crasher
text: No rest. No mercy. No reservations.

name: Ostracize
text: "You won't be needing this."

name: Irini Sengir
text:
"That cruel being brings shame to all her fellow Dwarves and misery to all the land. She is Sengir's daughter in spirit if not in blood."
—Reveka, Wizard Savant

name: Necrite
text: Necrites killed Jherana Rure, ending the counter-insurgency.

name: Solemn Offering
text:
"You will be reimbursed for your donation.""The reimbursement is spiritual."
—Temple signs

name: Cancel
text:
"Even the greatest inferno begins as a spark. And anyone can snuff out a spark."
—Chanyi, mistfire sage

name: River Serpent
text: Though the Luxa River brings life to Naktamun, it's not without dangers.

name: Vermin Gorger
text:
"Once, vampires ruled this world, commanding the fear and respect that befit our noble blood. Have we truly sunk so low?"
—Sorin Markov

name: Weaver of Blossoms // Blossom-Clad Werewolf
text: . . . does not always mean living in peace.

name: Slaughter Cry
text: It's rather embarrassing to end up with your head mounted over his hearth.

name: Night Shift of the Living Dead
text: At the Astrotorium, even the dead make a living wage.

name: Handcuffs
text:
"That was fun! Now me."
—Gwendlyn Di Corci

name: Brainstorm
text:
"I reeled from the blow, and then suddenly, I knew exactly what to do. Within moments, victory was mine."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran royal mage

name: Ravnica at War
text: The heart of Ravnica disappeared before anyone could strike a blow in its defense.

name: Scrollshift
text: Bim lashed out with the only weapon she'd never run out of: lecture notes.

name: Glacian, Powerstone Engineer
text:
"His energy is as boundless as the powerstones'."
—Rebbec, architect of ascension

name: Closing Statement
text: "In conclusion . . ."

name: Bombard
text:
"Want to sink a ship? Blow a hole in the hull. Want to kill a regisaur? Same answer."
—Captain Brandis Thorn

name: Jukai Messenger
text: Dosan's monks, deep in spiritual thought, could walk through the thickest of forests without leaving a mark, even the leaves beneath their feet unaffected by their passing.

name: Rings of Brighthearth
text:
"Without flame, there would be no iron tools, no cooked meals, no purge of old growth to make room for new."
—Brighthearth creed

name: Undead Augur
text:
"To see past the veil of death, cross it."
—*The Red Book of Mezdrithalik*

name: Heap Doll
text:
"I know one night it won't come back. Then I'll know it's truly done its job."
—Braenna, cobblesmith

name: Wall of Fire
text: Mercy is for those who keep their distance.

name: Secret Base
text:
"WARNING: Do not feed the rhinopus."
—Crossbreed Labs campus advisory

name: Valakut Awakening // Valakut Stoneforge
text:
"I can hear the echo of their hammers, long stilled."
—Tars Olan, stoneforge mystic

name: Sulfurous Springs
text: Everything is flammable in the Burning Isles, even the mana itself.

name: Scavenger Grounds
text: When the last scrap of flesh is scoured away, the Curse of Wandering ends. Then the dead may sleep.

name: Chosen by Heliod
text:
"Training and studies aid a soldier in meager amounts. The gods do the rest."
—Brigone, soldier of Meletis

name: Cloudcrown Oak
text:
"Clever folk build their homes near cloudcrowns. If a hawk or even just a faerie tries to swoop in, it'll get swatted from here to Cloverdell."
—Calydd, kithkin farmer

name: Cytoshape
text:
"Though highly effective at reshaping flesh, these specially bred cytoplasts leave the subject reeking of omnibian mucus."
—Simic research notes

name: Revive
text: Even what is lost beyond recall returns when coaxed by a dryad's hand.

name: Azorius Guildgate
text:
"If you want to know what's really going on in any building, you don't walk in the front door. You stake out the back."
—Lavinia

name: Animation Module
text: Design leads to progress.

name: Extremely Slow Zombie
text: . . . nnnnnssssss!

name: Borrowed Time
text: Teferi stepped calmly into the fray. Suddenly the sun paused in the sky and the werewolves' snarls froze on their faces.

name: Organ Harvest
text: "Lucy, you've got some spleenin' to do."

name: Myr Mindservant
text: It knows what you are planning, and does not approve.

name: Juntu Stakes
text:
"Those who can't survive are of no consequence."
—Tsabo Tavoc

name: Grizzled Leotau
text:
"There is no glory in a death of age, as even the leotau know. As winter steals into their coats, they seek the deadliest lands, that they may die as they lived."
—Aarsil the Blessed

name: Herbal Poultice
text:
"Apply orange leaf to a wound at dawn to clean it, at dusk to prevent the same injury from happening again."
—Kithkin superstition

name: Tangleclaw Werewolf // Fibrous Entangler
text:
"What has long, flesh-rending claws and enormous, bone-crushing teeth?"
—Halana, Kessig ranger

name: Jace's Ruse
text: "The Eternals can recognize faces. They just think I look like a blue minotaur."

name: Scrambleverse
text: Sometimes a little chaos is in order.

name: Sacred Nectar
text:
"For he on honey-dew hath fed, And drunk the milk of Paradise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge, "Kubla Khan"

name: Kharis & The Beholder
text: #sponsored

name: Mob Justice
text: A single stone can start an avalanche.

name: Narwhal
text:
"Who needs a spear? Ya break off the horn, and ya stab the fish with it. Easy!"
—Kakra, Sea Troll

name: Tombstalker
text: When it ran out of bodies, it broke down the crypt door and sought new sustenance.

name: Thrull Champion
text:
"Those idiots should never have bred thrulls for combat!"
—Jherana Rure

name: Hellkite Courser
text: The charge was heralded not by horns, but by the dragon's echoing roar.

name: Fathom Fleet Boarder
text: Without frequent raids, orcs sometimes get bored and plunder their own ships.

name: Disorient
text:
"If it has a brain, even a primitive one, we can most surely scramble it."
—Garild, merfolk mage

name: Starke
text: Starke believes in situational ethics—the situation determines the ethics. He's switched sides so often that he has become everyone's ally yet no one's friend. This former merchant of Rath accompanies the *Weatherlight* crew on their journey to his home world.

name: Nature's Resurgence
text:
"The dead whisper to the living. If you listen, you will learn."
—Maro

name: Wave of Indifference
text:
"Darius?"
"Yeah?"
"There's a goblin sneaking up on you."
"So?"
"Just sayin'."

name: Convincing Mirage
text: "Where are we? You must learn to ask more useful questions than that."

name: Blessed Orator
text: His quiet words fade into the night's chill, yet they burn into his listeners' minds with all the power of a thousand suns.

name: Incisor Glider
text:
"You think it's creepy now? You should see how it eats."
—Melira

name: Urborg
text: "Resignedly beneath the sky/The melancholy waters lie./So blend the turrets and shadows there/That all seem pendulous in air,/While from a proud tower in town/Death looks gigantically down." —Edgar Allan Poe, "The City in the Sea"

name: Donate
text: Campus pranksters initiate new students with the old "beeble bomb" routine.

name: Nyxathid
text: Born of volcanic forces, it thrives on the absolute panic it inspires.

name: Negate
text:
"It's frustrating, isn't it, to be so weak and ineffectual? Don't worry, you'll be *compleat* soon enough."
—Rona

name: Rootha, Mercurial Artist
text: "Art is never finished. Merely abandoned."

name: Primeval Protector
text: The earth shook in support of their cause, offering a champion of its own.

name: Invisibility
text: Verick held his breath. Breathing wouldn't reveal his position, but it would force him to smell the goblins.

name: Grasping Giant
text: Mirinthes thought death was seconds away when the giant's fist closed around him. Two days later, he was praying for death's release.

name: Malachite Golem
text: Centuries before the first branches of the Tangle gave shelter from the suns' cold light, the shadows of golems were Mirrodin's only shade.

name: Sigil of Sleep
text: Arrows are only one way to remove an enemy.

name: Bleak Coven Vampires
text: As the shadow of the Mephidross spread over the Tangle, the vampires' territory expanded.

name: Guardian Automaton
text: The wealthy in the city of Ghirapur outfit their lives with grand machines, entrusting even their children to filigree and gears.

name: Plague Myr
text: They watch for a new master, one more sinister than the last.

name: Telim'Tor's Edict
text:
"Execution awaits the dissenter."
—Kasib ibn Naji, *Letters*

name: Infiltrator's Magemark
text:
"In secrecy is strength. None can oppose one who cannot be found."
—Szadek

name: Implements of Sacrifice
text: Relics of the Order of the Ebon Hand, the bowl and dagger bespeak the hideous cruelty of its rituals.

name: Cyclonic Rift
text: The Izzet specialize in unnatural disaster.

name: Sangrophage
text: The living is all it eats.

name: Diversionary Tactics
text: "It's the oldest trick in the book," said Guff. "And I ought to know—I wrote it."

name: Dryad of the Ilysian Grove
text:
"Vine-wreathed, he nurtures life among the dead."
—Psemilla, Meletian poet

name: Emergence Zone
text: The Planar Bridge opened over the Chamber of the Guildpact, reducing the symbol of Ravnica's endurance to rubble.

name: Recruit the Worthy
text: For peace of mind, they mustered for war.

name: Sea God's Revenge
text:
"What has neither mouth nor throat, yet swallows captain, crew, and boat?"
—Sphinx's riddle

name: Claim the Firstborn
text:
「ヴィル！フェイの物語があるわ！寝る前に読み聞かせてあげましょうか？」
—-ローアン・ケンリス

name: Oakheart Dryads
text:
"I do not know if the forest was different after they passed. But I know I was."
—Ianthe, Setessan hunter

name: Lodestone Golem
text:
"Somehow it warps the Æther. It brings a strange weight, a blockade in the flow of spellcraft."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

name: Silverbluff Bridge
text: The path to genius is forged in creativity.

name: Squall Drifter
text:
"The scouts claim the cold has malice, and a mind. I begin to believe them. Impassable drifts seem to appear before us at every turn."
—Aevar Borg, northern guide, journal entry

name: Blossoming Defense
text: Those who move harmoniously with the flow of aether can channel the power of the natural world.

name: Call the Bloodline
text: At Sorin's appeal, Olivia Voldaren summoned the full might of her bloodline to gather at Lurenbraum Fortress.

name: Dregscape Sliver
text:
"A colony of horrors lurks beneath the mire. One must move deliberately with every ste—"
—Loamlair guide, last words

name: Phyrexian Driver
text: Although the abuse was initially effective, the troops soon became numb to it.

name: Youthful Knight
text: Idealism fits him better than his armor.

name: Gifts Given
text: "Thanks! You shouldn't have."

name: Belligerent Whiptail
text:
"Whiptails can sense a traveler's footsteps from a great distance. Measuring that distance has been . . . difficult."
—Jalun, Affa sentry

name: Reflexes
text:
"Be as fast as lightning, and you will be just as deadly."
—Combat trainer

name: Fulminator Mage
text:
"Unsafe Terrain Ahead—Turn Back"
—Sign near the former location of Pyrtagh Cairn

name: Ravenous Rats
text:
"For all the priceless tomes they have destroyed, one would think they would taste better."
—Davvol, Evincar of Rath

name: Gray Harbor Merfolk
text: Harbormasters tend to forget that security shouldn't stop at the surface.

name: Sulfur Falls
text:
"We have inherited the mysteries of the Thran, but few of the answers."
—Jhoira

name: Shield-Wall Sentinel
text: "Unit alpha-6 locking into position!"

name: Phantasmal Bear
text:
"You know it to be false, but when its claws find you, what you know won't matter much at all."
—Pol Jamaar, illusionist

name: Choice of Damnations
text:
"Life is a series of choices between bad and worse."
—Toshiro Umezawa

name: Earth Servant
text:
"Fire. Air. Water. These elements spread, filling in the spaces they are not. But earth is implacable like a sullen child."
—Jestus Dreya, *Of Elements and Eternity*

name: Hinterland Drake
text:
"As a kid, I dreamed of flying on those wild drakes. They inspired me to build wings of my own."
—Nadja Cloudtoucher, aerowright

name: Drana's Silencer
text: "Hush."

name: Umara Wizard // Umara Skyfalls
text:
"The source of the Umara River sits high above Oran-Rief, ever weeping on the jungle below."
—Ko Dari, expedition wizard

name: Elvish Ranger
text: It's up to you if you enter their woods—and up to them if you leave.

name: Azorius Signet
text: The maze-like design embodies the core of Azorius law—strict structure designed to test wills and stall change.

name: Soulless One
text: "Surrender your soul to me."

name: Lead by Example
text: Gideon and Nissa carved a path through the Eldrazi swarm, and their Zendikari allies charged into the fray behind them.

name: Shadow of Doubt
text:
"Your ignorance is my bliss."
—Szadek

name: Ruthless Sniper
text: "You may feel a slight sting."

name: Paradise Mantle
text: Express yourself and the world will follow you anywhere.

name: Swords to Plowshares
text:
"The so-called Barbarians will not respect us for our military might—they will respect us for our honor."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Alpha Guard
text: "Whimsy overflow in sector G! The gremlins are rampaging and the beebles are on fire!"

name: Thought Devourer
text: Thinking is hard.

name: Darkslick Shores
text: Where the Mephidross leaches into the Quicksilver Sea, the waves writhe with necrogen.

name: Orim's Prayer
text:
"As usual, there will be time for prayer only *after* the worst happens."
—Orim, Samite healer

name: Stirring Bard
text: At the first sign of danger, she breaks out the power chords.

name: Vedalken Archmage
text:
"The Knowledge Pool knows. Memnarch understands."
—Janus, speaker of the synod

name: Gaea's Protector
text: Fallen Phyrexians were transmuted into elementals by Gaea long ago, but Yavimaya's other inhabitants still regard them with unease.

name: Geist Snatch
text: Angels and demons aren't the only ones listening to your prayers.

name: Recruitment Officer
text: "Every name on this list is already a hero! Will you add your own to it?"

name: Hour of Reckoning
text: The Battle of Baal was the bloodiest and most costly in the entire noble history of the Sons of Sanguinius.

name: Arcane Subtraction
text: The class learned little that day.

name: Tranquil Grove
text:
"Even the fiercest storm has a peaceful eye."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

name: Lagonna-Band Storyteller
text: "Our stories are full of ancient wisdom; they tell us who we are."

name: Worldly Counsel
text: Every horizon hides a new possibility.

name: Temple Bell
text: Enlightenment is not gained by striking the bell or hearing its toll. It's found in the silence that follows.

name: Cephalid Scout
text: The more they survey the dreadful dry expanses, the more the cephalids thirst to tame them.

name: Eldritch Pact
text: The Night Serpent tasted the warlock's ambition and savored the dark hunger in her soul.

name: Brave the Sands
text: Enduring the most desolate and dangerous conditions, Abzan sentries unfailingly guard the stronghold gates.

name: Viashino Bladescout
text: "Find your courage in a desperate moment, and you turn the tide of history. So sayeth the bey."

name: Shivan Branch-Burner
text: The New Coalition gave Shiv time to prepare a warm welcome for the invaders.

name: Fresh Meat
text: A scavenger's favorite appetizer is death.

name: Crystalline Sliver
text: Bred as living shields, these slivers have proven unruly—they know they cannot be caught.

name: Inferno Jet
text: "When the whole world is crazy, it's important to find something you can rely on."

name: Vandalize
text:
"As we have learned from Kolaghan, to ruin is to rule."
—Shensu, Kolaghan rider

name: Merchant of Secrets
text: To scrape out a living in Aphetto, wizards are reduced to selling rumors, lies, forgeries, or—if they get desperate enough—the truth.

name: Underdome
text: In that battleground of a ring, the rules aren't nearly so black and white.

name: Bind the Monster
text: Sarulf's snarl of rage shook the World Tree.

name: Civil Servant
text: "Together we can build a safer, brighter New Capenna!"

name: Repulse
text: "You aren't invited."

name: Ridgetop Raptor
text:
"The Skirk Ridge has many wonderful things to discover—like escape routes."
—Foothill guide

name: Mercurial Geists
text:
"Procedural misstep: provocation of geists for the purpose of yielding more energy can compromise containment units. Next action: clean up mess."
—Laboratory notes

name: Run Aground
text:
"That's the first time I've seen the ground do the running."
—Captain Brinely Rage

name: Coiling Woodworm
text: Only the elves know where the woods end and the woodworm begins.

name: Rugged Prairie
text: Hobs bury their kin far from home. They believe the dry, open ground keeps hags from stealing the bones and gwyllions from stealing the spirits.

name: Strip Mine
text: Unlike previous conflicts, the war between Urza and Mishra made Dominaria itself a casualty of war.

name: Torment of Hailfire
text: "Your God-Pharaoh has returned."

name: Proven Combatant
text: "It's not wise to keep glory waiting."

name: Throne of the God-Pharaoh
text:
"When the Second Sun rests between the horns on the horizon, so begins the Hour of Revelation. Then the Hour of Glory, the Hour of Promise, and finally the Hour of Eternity."
—*The Accounting of Hours*

name: Angrath's Rampage
text: "Grand city? No. This is nothing but another squalid cage."

name: Dutiful Servants
text: Buildings crumbled and monuments fell. The river bled and the sky wept tears of fire. All the while, servants silently continued their work, oblivious to it all.

name: Nylea's Huntmaster
text: Nature is stillness and savagery in equal measure.

name: Highway Robber
text: "Tonight, madam, it's your money *and* your life."

name: Illuminated Folio
text: Most such relics remain clasped shut for fear of what ominous truths might be carved into the diptych inside.

name: Elvish Ranger
text:
"How can any Human hope to match our skills? We are children of Fyndhorn, and its sap runs in our veins."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Daru Spiritualist
text: He lifts the spirits of his people so they may descend in wrath upon their foes.

name: Selesnya Eulogist
text: "Let the example of the fallen inspire us all to greater courage."

name: Griselbrand
text: Power over death was Griselbrand's gift. Liliana's formidable necromancy was now unparalleled.

name: Thought Nibbler
text: Balshan wizards have long used them to gnaw away the memories they wish to forget.

name: Nullify
text:
"Those who incur Thassa's anger will be swallowed whole by her waves, or torn asunder by her bident."
—Thrasios, triton hero

name: Draconic Muralists
text: "We must never allow the deeds of our great ancestors to be forgotten."

name: Titan's Presence
text: Dust and memory are all that remain in Ulamog's wake.

name: Embraal Bruiser
text: In Embraal, inventor gangs defend their turf with ingenious devices and blunt objects.

name: Ashcoat Bear
text: The bears wade into time rifts to feed. They do not fear the storms, and they are quick enough to snatch prey just as it blinks in or out of time.

name: Alirios, Enraptured
text: "Why would I ever want to look away?"

name: Tattermunge Witch
text: The Tattermunge gang has no words for the spell that whips their instinctual rage into a frenzy. They only know they like it.

name: Heed the Mists
text: "Once, I looked to the mists for wisdom. Now I wish only for understanding."

name: Dominating Vampire
text: "You can join me or feed me. Choose fast."

name: Ruthless Deathfang
text:
"Bring forth the dead, their skull-grins and rattle-bones. We will feast upon their wailing ghosts."
—Silumgar, translated from Draconic

name: Amphin Pathmage
text:
"There are those who do not believe in the existence of the amphin. This seems somehow to be of their own design."
—Gor Muldrak, *Cryptohistories*

name: Cleaver Riot
text: Measure once, cut twice.

name: Inner Sanctum
text: "Save me from Maraxus," Starke pleaded, "or condemn me to his wrath. Either way, do not ignore me!"

name: Monoskelion
text: An unfinished body with unfinished business.

name: Mire Shade
text:
"We realized the bog had not given up a soul but had come to claim a new one."
—Scout Ekemet, final journal

name: Brainbite
text: An Esper mage will leave a hole in your memory with surgical precision. A Grixis mage sees no reason to be so kind.

name: Dregscape Zombie
text: The undead of Grixis are fueled by their hatred of the living.

name: Rebel Informer
text: The problem with mercenaries is that if you can buy their loyalty, others can too.

name: Infernal Scarring
text: One who is marked by a demon in life is sure to be remembered as one in death.

name: Living Tempest
text:
"If you don't like the weather, just wait a few minutes and it'll change ... probably for the worse."
—Amandi, kitesail expert

name: Skullcrack
text: The lawmage's argument was clever and well reasoned, but Blunk's response proved irrefutable.

name: Worldly Tutor
text:
"A single chord brings them to heel. A whole song, and they dance."
—Yisan, the wanderer bard

name: Super-Duper Lost
text: Fblthp decided to get some sleep, nestled among the plush Ajanis until morning.

name: Scheming Symmetry
text:
"One for you, one for me. What could be more fair?"
—Kethis, the Hidden Hand

name: Urza's Filter
text: "It's a tool for aiding my other tools," explained Urza. "Now they'll work in harmony."

name: Mana Skimmer
text: They traverse the mana-starved wastes in search of richer lands.

name: Swooping Lookout
text:
"It's hard to tell with this glare, but those must be the skyhunter reinforcements! They have arrived at last!"
—Prahan, Mirran rebel

name: Flameborn Hellion
text:
"The most reliable omen of a future hellion attack is a past hellion attack."
—Spear-Tribe teaching

name: Splatter Thug
text: The mask isn't meant to hide his identity. It's meant to keep the viscera out of his eyes.

name: Disenchant
text: "One down, several thousand more to go."

name: Polar Kraken
text:
"It was big. Really, really, big. No, bigger than that. It was *big!*"
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

name: Convolute
text: The words came to the sorcerer's lips but refused to budge any further.

name: Emancipation Angel
text: "I'll take it from here, soldier."

name: Raise Dead
text: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.

name: Child of Night
text: Sins that would be too gruesome in the light of day are made more pleasing in the dark of night.

name: Skymark Roc
text:
"Try not to look guilty. Or delicious."
—Thorpe, street urchin

name: Glimpse the Unthinkable
text: He spent his life searching for the Locked Tome of Eremil. In the end, his mind held together just long enough to decipher a single word.

name: Plow Through Reito
text: The paths of the kami crisscrossed Kamigawa like scars left by a maddened surgeon.

name: Treasure Nabber
text: The Law of Givesies Backsies is respected by every noble pursuer of shiny things.

name: Willbreaker
text: "Master your mind, or I shall master it for you."

name: Souldrinker
text: Don't drink and thrive.

name: Shepherd of the Lost
text:
"Should you fall in the wilds, lift your voice to the Sky Realm. The one who answers will be your salvation."
—Emeria's Creed

name: Void Stalker
text: Now you see it, now you're gone.

name: Auntie's Hovel
text: The Stinkdrinker warren's hill of salvaged trinkets is large enough to cut a door in.

name: Decimate
text:
"There is no sweeter sound than the deafening thunder of utter destruction."
—Kamahl, Pit Fighter

name: Kjeldoran Elite Guard
text: The winged helms of the guard are put on for pageants—but taken off for war.

name: Glint Hawk
text: Its eyes burned nearly blind by the Whitesun, it hunts by metallic gleam.

name: Gnarled Mass
text:
"On the fifty-seventh day of the Battle of Silk, the bell again tolled in hopes of summoning mortal aid. This time, a new breed of kami rose to answer its call."
—*Great Battles of Kamigawa*

name: Oppression
text:
"Do not presume to speak for yourself."
—Gix, to Xantcha

name: Catastrophe
text: Radiant's eyes flashed. "Go, then," the angel spat at Serra, "and leave this world to those who truly care."

name: Nimbleclaw Adept
text: "Don't worry, I can reach it."

name: Armed Response
text: Raksha watched as the goblins continued to pour onto the Razor Fields. "They just don't know when to stop, do they?"

name: Rescuer Sphinx
text: "Now, little fighter, show me you deserved this second chance."

name: Siege Mastodon
text:
"The walls of the wicked will fall before us. Ready the siege engines. We proceed to war!"
—General Avitora

name: Audacity
text: Bravery outlives the brave.

name: Thalia, Guardian of Thraben
text: "I would rather be a heretic than betray my conscience."

name: Startling Development
text: Remarkably, dinner continued with no further interruptions.

name: Explosive Vegetation
text: Despite the flames and devastation of the dragons, Tarkir continued to thrive.

name: Riverwheel Aerialists
text: Adepts of the Riverwheel Stronghold can run through rain and never get wet; masters use the raindrops as stepping stones.

name: Twisted Justice
text: In Otiev's mind, he ruled in favor of the accused. But in his courtroom he was only a spectator, watching his hand deliver the sign of death.

name: Wind Drake
text:
"No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings."
—William Blake,
*The Marriage of Heaven and Hell*

name: Hornet Cobra
text:
"Then inch by inch out of the grass rose up the head and spread hood of Nag, the big black cobra, and he was five feet long from tongue to tail."
—Rudyard Kipling, *The Jungle Books*

name: Entrancing Lyre
text: Its strings are wayward threads of fate.

name: Nantuko Cultivator
text: "Every seed holds strength and teaches patience."

name: Ashes to Ashes
text:
"All rivers eventually run to the sea. My job is to sort out who goes first."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, *Memoirs of a Soldier*

name: Dormant Grove // Gnarled Grovestrider
text: Far from the bloodsoaked wedding, unseen by human eyes, a long-slumbering force arose to protect its home.

name: Pith Driller
text: After boring up through the crust of Mirrodin, it turned its expertise upon the surface dwellers.

name: Serene Sunset
text: The armies paused, silent, as the warriors reflected on the sunsets of their youth.

name: Wall of Air
text:
"Let the air itself protect you, for it is everywhere."
—Master wizard

name: Plague Wind
text:
"The second wind of ascension is Reaver, slaying the unworthy."
—*Keld Triumphant*

name: Dwarven Sea Clan
text:
"No dwarf alive can best one of my crew dead."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate

name: Mind Rot
text: With no memories left to compare to his present situation, Andalum was finally content.

name: Rebel Salvo
text: "That Great Work of yours is looking pretty fragile, Urabrask!"

name: Havengul Vampire
text: "That slowly decreasing pulse—that's the beat I waltz to."

name: Lotus Cobra
text: Its scales contain the essence of thousands of lotus blooms.

name: Skullport Merchant
text: "Buy something or get out."

name: Ghirapur Aether Grid
text: The city of Ghirapur is a living thing, and living things defend themselves.

name: Giant Badger
text: Disturb a sleeping badger and the snapping of your bones will awaken the countryside.

name: Feed the Serpent
text: He spent the final moments of his existence tumbling down the length of the serpent's jaws, driven mad by the magnitude of the Cosmos.

name: Ward of Piety
text: Reluctant to strike at the kami directly, some kitsune trained in more passive fighting techniques.

name: Rings of Brighthearth
text: Crafted in emulation of dwarven hearth decorations, these devices doubled the output of Amrit Vatyam's forges.

name: Ornithopter
text: Regardless of the century, plane, or species, developing artificers never fail to invent the ornithopter.

name: Covert Cutpurse // Covetous Geist
text:
"It has no need of wealth in the afterlife. It steals and kills purely for its own spiteful amusement."
—Kaya

name: Celestial Mantle
text: Upon such armor, even a mountain would break.

name: Silverback Ape
text: It does not wear a crown or sit on a throne of gold, but those who have witnessed its power hail it nonetheless.

name: Ben-Ben, Akki Hermit
text: Some akki thought of Ben-Ben as a kami of trickery in disguise. They hunted for him in the maze of warrens, often falling prey to his traps.

name: Silver Myr
text: The myr are like quicksilver: malleable in function and adaptable in form.

name: Hotshot Mechanic
text: "If your mech is factory standard, you might as well be walking."

name: Predatory Advantage
text: Those who forget their past are doomed to be eaten by it.

name: Bladed Sentinel
text: The Mirran partisans created hundreds of patrol sentinels to divert Phyrexian assaults from the Tangle.

name: Canopy Vista
text: The continent of Murasa lies beneath a blanket of dense vegetation, its enormous branches tangled so thickly that some inhabitants never see the ground.

name: Charisma
text: It was Gerrard's nature to lead and the Mercadians' to follow.

name: Thoughtbound Primoc
text: Efforts to use them as spies failed when they kept reporting to the enemy.

name: Deepwood Ghoul
text: They feed on the living to stay undead.

name: Songstitcher
text: The true names of birds are songs woven into their souls.

name: Riot Spikes
text: Most auramancers would have let the spikes hover just above the skin. Having the spikes rip through the skin from beneath was a touch added by Rakdos himself.

name: Mishra's Toy Workshop
text: Even though Urza tried to apologize, Mishra continued to bear a grudge.

name: Elvish Clancaller
text: No single root feeds the forest.

name: Vengeful Strangler // Strangling Grasp
text: The next day, the executioner was found with ashen handprints on his throat.

name: Tidal Force
text:
"Do not speak the name of the sea, for if it should hear you and rise up, no fortress in the world could hide you."
—Gimara of Halimar

name: Endbringer's Revel
text: First death. Then Shauku.

name: Jalum Tome
text: This timeworn relic was responsible for many of Urza's victories, though he never fully comprehended its mystical runes.

name: Wolverine Pack
text: "Give them great meals of beef and iron and steel, they will eat like wolves and fight like devils." —William Shakespeare, *King Henry V*

name: Errand of Duty
text:
"May they speed to their task, for the Skyknights alone cannot hold Kjeldor safe."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skycaptain

name: Aether Gust
text: The chill wind extinguishes flame, and frosts the leaf on the branch.

name: Rakdos Roustabout
text:
"That one has a bright future—perfect instincts for the rhythm of mayhem."
—Judith

name: Harsh Judgment
text:
"At least they remember me."
—Gerrard

name: Typhoon
text: Fierce winds ripped across the tropical landscape. What they did not destroy with their fiery breath was washed away by torrential rain.

name: Aerial Responder
text: Dwarves have an instinct for repair, an inherent understanding of how systems work, and a reputation for fearlessness. They're perfect candidates for the Fair's emergency response team.

name: Gush
text: Eternal Weekend 2022 Vintage

name: Fabricate
text: "I'll have just the right tool for the job!"

name: Spirit of the Season
text: Summoned for all the wrong seasons.

name: Dwindle
text: The collection didn't have room to expand, so the wizard improvised a solution.

name: Cutthroat il-Dal
text: Her blades slashed across the noble's shadow. He scoffed, then fell over dead.

name: Alesha's Vanguard
text: Boundaries drawn on maps or marked with stone have no meaning for the Mardu.

name: Deep-Sea Terror
text: After stripping the sunken ships, it rises to the surface for another helping.

name: Kragma Warcaller
text: A warcaller merely brings the herd together. After that, the meat-hunger is all the encouragement they need.

name: Goblin Lackey
text: At the first sign of enemy scouts, Jula grinned and strapped on his diplomacy helmet.

name: Rain of Daggers
text: Knives in the sky, cries in the air, and blood on the ground.

name: Evacuation
text: Which is more unsettling: the roar of battle or the silence that follows?

name: Bloodfire Dwarf
text: For them, the only honorable death is one that leaves a crater.

name: Keensight Mentor
text: Through the *eludha*, bonders share the powerful abilities of their chosen companions.

name: Wandering Graybeard
text: His tales are as tall as he is, and only a giant's life is long enough to listen to them all.

name: Hurricane
text:
"Don't envy the grandeur of drakes. Their impression of grace fades when the first gust sends them crashing into one another."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Captain's Maneuver
text: Sisay discovered that the mirrored hull of the *Weatherlight* could be used as a defensive weapon.

name: Rancid Rats
text: "They're in the walls! Can't you hear them?"

name: Briarberry Cohort
text: A clique can cause far more mischief than one faerie on its own.

name: Reptilian Reflection
text: Danger often lurks in the allure of crystal shards.

name: Timely Reinforcements
text: The gods are not always kind, but they do have a soft spot for plucky underdogs.

name: Scale the Heights
text: "Ever onward, ever skyward."

name: Path to Exile
text: Her resentment vanished as strange, unknown lands opened up before her.

name: Siege Wurm
text: Suddenly, all the haggling didn't seem so important.

name: Thorned Moloch
text: Those who fled the destruction of the city stumbled into the territory of their prickly neighbors.

name: Springmane Cervin
text: Cervins feed on the mana-rich plants around the star arches, imbuing their bodies with extraordinary grace and vitality.

name: Dementia Bat
text:
"When terror outweighs all other thoughts, they will understand that I am the true Father of Machines."
—Azax-Azog, the Demon Thane

name: Shieldmage Advocate
text: "Our unity conquers all fears."

name: Divide by Zero
text: "Misery. Inadequacy. Failure. The common denominator is you."

name: Sapphire Drake
text: Sapphire drakes can communicate over great distances, their calls resonating in the gems fixed in their skulls.

name: Cabal Coffers
text: Deep within the Cabal's vault, the Mirari pulsed like a dead sun—and its darkness radiated across Otaria.

name: Letter Bomb
text: "Dear Magic R&D, . . ."

name: Wildfire
text: Fire is always at the top of the food chain, and it has a big appetite.

name: Tamiyo's Journal
text: Entry 922: There's more to Avacyn's madness . . .

name: Jace's Projection
text: "Pardon me if I seem distracted. Part of me is reconnoitering the Tenth District."

name: Shake the Foundations
text: A threefold calamity with a single will.

name: Bewilder
text:
"Teferi snapped his fingers, and the viashino started clucking like a chicken. Silly, yes, but exactly the thing we needed to break the stifling tension."
—Jhoira, master artificer

name: Sol, Advocate Eternal
text: Heroes endure; legends prevail.

name: Pathmaker Initiate
text: "The expected way through the trial is far too tedious."

name: Mana Vapors
text: The scent of magic can rob you of your senses, blinding you to the world.

name: Bronzebeak Moa
text: They fight for their home with more loyalty than any conscript.

name: Ore-Scale Guardian
text: A dragon's loyalty cannot be earned, but it can be bought.

name: Bog Witch
text: The world is the body. The mana is the blood. The witch is the surgeon.

name: Brittle Effigy
text:
"In my early experiments in phylactery, I found that fragile forms have their uses."
—Rocati, Duke of Martyne

name: Galvanoth
text: It chews open Mirrodin's husk and feeds on the outpouring of energy.

name: Fallow Wurm
text:
The wurm's wake
—Elvish expression meaning "ruined crops"

name: Stallion of Ashmouth
text: Echoing hoofbeats can no longer be assumed to be help from the Gavony Riders.

name: Sanctum Spirit
text:
"When history becomes too mournful, even good souls may choose to forget."
—Shalai, voice of Plenty

name: Inkshield
text: Silverquill's elite know how to offer a scathing rebuttal without uttering a word.

name: Verdant Force
text: Left to itself, nature overflows any container, overthrows any restriction, and overreaches any boundary.

name: Ulvenwald Tracker
text: "Okay, listen, it's 'GRAAAAAR!' not 'rawr.' 'Rawr' isn't going to scare anyone. Now, let's try again...."

name: Jungle Hollow
text: On the surface of Ixalan's vast tar pits, Phyrexian oil glistened, and old bones began to stir.

name: Coral Colony
text: The seafloor is strewn with the wreckage of Vodalia's would-be conquerors.

name: River Sneak
text: No ripples, no splashes, no warning.

name: Spear Spewer
text:
"Don't waste time aiming, you lazy gob-slug! Fire!"
—Krenko, mob boss

name: Oboro Breezecaller
text:
"I feel their unnatural influence in the weary, weeping land. Do they care nothing for the creatures who walk below their clouds?"
—Eight-and-a-Half-Tails

name: Commander's Sphere
text: "This cogitator provides a strategic overview of the battlefield. By which I mean, of course, the entire planet."

name: Savaen Elves
text: "Purity of magic can only come from purity of the land. How can a meal nourish if the ingredients are spoiled?" —Sidaine of Savaen

name: Tormod's Cryptkeeper
text: It guards not a body, but a secret.

name: Merciless Eternal
text:
"My work here is complete. The people have done everything required of them."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Jester's Cap
text:
"Know your foes' strengths as well as their weaknesses."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Centaur Peacemaker
text: "Please accept this offering. I sincerely hope to leave my mace at my side."

name: Norwood Ranger
text: The song of the forest is in perfect harmony. If a single note is out of place, the elves will find its source.

name: Counterspell
text:
"One need not know the specific details of a spell to suppress its effect. Simply rearrange the rules of the reality within which the spell operates."
—Imbraham, Quandrix dean

name: Magma Mine
text: BOOM!

name: Mesa Unicorn
text: The unicorns of Sursi are a manifestation of Serra's joy and compassion. They frolic and dance like children, offering blessings to anyone they encounter.

name: Rally to Battle
text: The guildmasters loom large in the political sphere, but in the end, the rulers of Ravnica are its people.

name: Outmaneuver
text:
"Push one goblin into sight, an' run a lot. That's tactics."
—Jula, goblin raider

name: Spidery Grasp
text:
"Nobody's seen the Lady of Videns for years. Poor dear, no companions at all in that old castle."
—Yonda of Gavony

name: Plateau
text: 2018 Asia Legacy Champion

name: Bellowing Mauler
text: He's pretty sure he can't get charged with murder if he calls it "organic demolition."

name: Fist of Suns
text:
"It is all in my grasp. Every petty dream, every grand scheme, every soul, every fear. It all flows through me and from me."
—Memnarch

name: Geistwave
text: Necro-alchemists gained popular support during the Travails, when geist-fueled weapons helped defend towns against mad cultists and Eldrazi monstrosities.

name: Lunar Mystic
text:
"I'm pleased this world has learned the moon affects more than the tides."
—Tamiyo, the Moon Sage

name: Crypt Ripper
text: The tender light of the living quickens the pulse of the dead.

name: Cartographer
text: "Finding the way once is luck. Finding the way twice takes a good map."

name: Reprisal
text: "Fear this no more!"

name: Delirium Skeins
text: There came a rush, a sudden fire in the mind. Then the two saw only the sooty fog of madness, heard only the crackling of their last thoughts burning away.

name: Stronghold Discipline
text: In Urborg, the instigators of each new rebellion are soaked in the blood of the last.

name: Sunspire Griffin
text:
"For each griffin wounded by an arrow, there's a corpse with a bow nearby."
—Pel Javya, Wojek investigator

name: Break Through the Line
text:
"If the Mardu were more in tune with their beasts, they would not scare so easily."
—Jilaya, Temur whisperer

name: Juggernaut
text: Built with neither a way to steer nor a way to stop, the juggernauts were simply aimed at an enemy's best defenses and told to charge.

name: Crumble
text: The spirits of Argoth grant new life to those who repent the folly of enslaving their labors to devices.

name: Glimpse the Unthinkable
text: He spent his life searching for the *Locked Tome of Eremil*. In the end, his mind held together just long enough to decipher a single word.

name: Lightning Blow
text:
"If you do it right, they'll never know what hit them."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Infuriate
text:
"Some mages duel using intricate spellcraft and superior tactics. Others just get really, really mad."
—*Secrets of the Feradorn Sorcerers*

name: Floodbringer
text: "Such a small thing, a drop of water . . . And yet enough of them together can flood a field, cleanse a mire, or choke a forest."

name: Searing Light
text:
"Light can lay bare our fears. It can also make them go away."
—Nazra of the Stone Havens

name: Riptide Chronologist
text: The wizard consulted the Riptide Project about how to further his research. He wasn't prepared for what they told him.

name: Suture Spirit
text: Is her need to heal born out of compassion or penance?

name: Cataclysm
text: The *Weatherlight* dragged the *Predator* behind it, the cradle hauling the casket.

name: Intimidation
text: "If they move, kill them. In fact, kill one now to make sure the other understands."

name: Bastion of Remembrance
text: Lives taken are lives not easily forgotten.

name: Expedition Champion
text: Warriors are combat specialists who bring their deadly skills to bear against the many foes that adventurers face in the course of their journeys.

name: Palace Guard
text: "I'm not nearly as bothered by being outnumbered as I am by their foul stench."

name: Leyline of the Meek
text: Where strength and humility converge.

name: Curse of Shaken Faith
text: Even within the chapel's hallowed halls, the devils' laughter pierced his prayers.

name: Watchful Blisterzoa
text: After a series of ambushes, Uulbrek demanded a sentry with no blind spots.

name: Highland Forest
text:
"Tread carefully! The last time I walked this path, half the snowdrifts were, in fact, sleeping trolls. I've never run so fast in my life!"
—Iskene, Kannah storyteller

name: Ignoble Soldier
text: Cowardice is a term invented by those with no cunning.

name: Drossforge Bridge
text: The path to ruin is forged in pain.

name: Side to Side
text: His friends at the gym never knew Garanth's secret shame. For years he had tried to walk away from professional arm wrestling, but hey—free monkeys.

name: Viashino Sandswimmer
text: Few swim in a place of such thirst.

name: Daring Apprentice
text: In front of every great wizard is a doomed apprentice.

name: Honor Troll
text: First in his clan to attend Strixhaven, and now first in his class.

name: Reckless Impulse
text: A stitcher looks at their creation and sees the result of years of study and hours of toil. A devil sees a new plaything.

name: Adventurous Impulse
text: An adventure without a companion is hardly an adventure at all.

name: Gateway Plaza
text: The Chamber of the Guildpact has fallen silent, its bright promise broken.

name: Lithomancer's Focus
text:
"Even in the hands of amateurs, Nahiri's hedrons can harm the Eldrazi."
—Ugin

name: Aven Flock
text: Just as each added feather steadies the wing, so does the flock grow stronger with each new member.

name: Krosan Colossus
text: When it walked, it altered geography. When it bellowed, it changed the weather.

name: Victorious Destruction
text:
"The refugees look at these structures with hope. We must relieve them of this burden."
—Juex, tormentor exarch

name: Affectionate Indrik
text: The problem isn't the indrik's enthusiasm, it's Ravnica's lack of guardrails.

name: Compleated Huntmaster
text: The elves of Lorwyn sought perfection. The Etched Host supplied it.

name: Bramblecrush
text: Nature abhors a lot of things.

name: Rise from the Grave
text:
"For my enemies, one death. For my allies, many."
—Liliana Vess

name: Vindicate
text:
"Hol visto intere civiltà. sorgere e crollare. Voi mortali non siete che polvere per me."
—Sorin Markov

name: Open the Armory
text: "Once Avacyn returned, I hoped I'd never need these things again. I didn't think I'd be dusting them off to use against angels."

name: Zuberi, Golden Feather
text:
"If the griffins tell of their gods, perhaps they speak of feathers bright as the Sun."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Hitchclaw Recluse
text: Nearly invisible strands of web reach far beyond its lair to alert it of the approach of prey.

name: Orim, Samite Healer
text:
"The silkworm spins itself a new existence. So the healer weaves the threads of life."
—Orim, Samite healer

name: Strategic Planning
text:
"Bolas remade this place in his image. He has the advantage here. We must approach carefully."
—Jace Beleren

name: Sunlit Hoplite
text: "Even in her absence, the light Elspeth kindled in our hearts never faltered."

name: Grand Melee
text: Hot blood washes away cold reason.

name: Heat of Battle
text: "Takara, it's me!" shouted Starke. It was no use—she obeyed Volrath.

name: Giant Cockroach
text: Toren had stepped on a lot of bugs during his life, so he couldn't help feeling embarrassed when a bug stepped on him.

name: Goblin Taskmaster
text: For some reason, goblin fighting school isn't as crowded on day two.

name: Myr Propagator
text:
"We will ingest and remake this world in our image, not unlike some admirable designs I have seen here."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Boon of the Wish-Giver
text:
"There is no law of nature that I have not seen Illuna break. Makes you wonder what is truly possible, does it not?"
—Rielle, the Everwise

name: Terra Stomper
text: Its footfalls cause violent earthquakes, hurtling boulders, and unseasonable dust storms.

name: Clever Impersonator
text:
"Our own selves are the greatest obstacles to enlightenment."
—Narset, khan of the Jeskai

name: Weapon Rack
text: No weapon stays on the rack for long in the Burning Yard.

name: Purge the Profane
text: The Orzhov hear the plans of the other guilds through the guilty thoughts of the disloyal.

name: Opaline Unicorn
text: Purphoros once loved Nylea, the god of the hunt. His passion inspired his most astounding works of art.

name: Lapse of Certainty
text: Without a connection of mind and body, magic is just an idea stuck in the head, a word on the tip of a tongue.

name: Nebelgast Beguiler
text: A moment of distraction, an hour off course.

name: Kill Switch
text: Success is largely a matter of knowing which lever to pull.

name: Oni of Wild Places
text: The oni leapt easily from peak to peak, toying with its victims, its voice a purr from the rumbling depths of nightmare.

name: Fatal Lore
text:
"All knowledge has its price."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Tyrannize
text:
"I can stab you where it hurts, or where you will feel absolutely nothing."
—Illulia of Nighthearth

name: Plasma Elemental
text:
"I watched a ship sail right through it. I thought it was harmless . . . until I saw what it had done to the crew."
—Bruenna, Neurok leader

name: Norwood Archers
text:
"'Air superiority?' Not while our archers scan the skies."
—Elvish scout

name: Spawn of Rix Maadi
text:
"Straight from the blood-drenched imagination of our illustrious parun!"
—Nyoser, Gore-House ringleader

name: Army of the Damned
text: Sometimes death comes knocking. Sometimes it tears down the walls.

name: Fyndhorn Brownie
text:
"I've been insulted by drunks in a hundred inns, but never as skillfully or annoyingly as by those blasted Brownies."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Protean Raider
text: Imitation is the sincerest form of piracy.

name: Giant Spider
text: While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.

name: Razortide Bridge
text: The path to unity is forged in understanding.

name: Mistwalker
text:
"To escape Littjara, follow a bird."
—Tuskeri folklore

name: Caravan Hurda
text:
"Not too bright, but good enough for the job required—carrying and walking in a straight line."
—Bruse Tarl, Goma Fada nomad

name: Plagued Rusalka
text:
"Look at her, once filled with innocence. Death has a way of wringing away such . . . deficiencies."
—Savra

name: Prismatic Boon
text:
"How ironic that the greatest forge of civilization is battle."
—Mangara

name: Falkenrath Torturer
text: "There was a time when our cages rang with wailing. Now only a handful of these whimpering fools remain."

name: Aboroth
text: The *Weatherlight* banked sharply as the colossal beast rose up to crush the lone rider. "My bet's on the dirt," Gerrard said flatly.

name: Sanctum Seeker
text: The Sanctum Seekers were the first of the knightly orders to cross the sea and are still the most zealous.

name: Rending Volley
text: The sky offers few hiding places.

name: Ouphe Vandals
text: The ouphes finally managed to still the clockwork monstrosity by catching themselves in its cogs.

name: Veteran Cavalier
text:
Spirit is the sword and experience the sharpening stone.
—Arabian proverb

name: Melting
text:
"Who needs the sun when you've got me around?"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Essence Drain
text:
"Life's essence is a nectar unlike any I tasted when I lived as a mortal."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

name: Deathbloom Ritualist
text: Each fallen friend was a seed of regret, eager to blossom again in Gaea's name.

name: Gruul Guildgate
text: Enter and leave the shackles of society behind.

name: Splendid Reclamation
text:
"No matter how much a plane has suffered, there is a way to restore it."
—Nissa Revane

name: Azorius Signet
text: The maze-like design embodies the core of Azorius law-strict structure designed to test wills and stall change.

name: Ensnaring Bridge
text:
"When I said I needed a hand, I didn't mean this."
—Gerrard Capashen

name: Moonsilver Key
text: To restore the day-night balance, the Celestus mechanism's Sungold Lock must be reunited with its long-lost key.

name: Pierce Strider
text:
"Pain isn't a negative stimulus. Pain is a sign of your imperfection."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Sylvan Echoes
text: It takes a huntmaster's eye to discern the contours of mythical prey.

name: Putrefy
text:
「王から肥料に、できるだけ早く。」
—-退位させる者のグリモワール

name: Mirari's Wake
text: Even after a false god tore magic from Dominaria, power still radiated from the Mirari sword that slew her.

name: Dwarven Soldier
text:
"Although the Dwarves staunchly defended their walled city-states against the Orcs, their civilization was the first to fall, and its name was sadly lost."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. I*

name: Tanglewalker
text: In bringing life to Mirrodin, Memnarch was more successful than he knew—for Mirrodin began to take on a life of its own.

name: Volcanic Fallout
text:
"How can we outrun the sky?"
—Hadran, sunseeder of Naya

name: Towering Gibbon
text: "Don't worry, folks. We're perfectly safe here. That's a banana processing plant."

name: Frontier Warmonger
text: She cares little for leaders or loyalties, so long as the battle rages on.

name: Sandsteppe Mastodon
text: A mastodon's path always leads to an oasis.

name: Poultrygeist
text: Farmer Brown never ate eggs again.

name: Genestealer Locus
text: Harrowing visions, paralyzing pain, and terrifying brain spasms await those who challenge the cult.

name: Lawbringer
text:
One injustice starts a thousand riots. One law stops a thousand crimes.
—Lawbringer creed

name: Carnival Hellsteed
text: Its favorite treats are candied hands and sweet hearts.

name: Blacksmith's Skill
text: Before he was subjugated by demonic forces, Dakkon was a master smith of unrivaled artistry.

name: Clawing Torment
text: A kami's anger never fades, never sleeps, never loosens its grasp.

name: Bastion Enforcer
text: Headquartered at the Bastion of the Honorable, the Consulate's enforcers are charged with the impossible task of keeping the peace.

name: Spell Suck
text: S-U-C-K

name: Swamp
text: You expected to meet hostile drow in this ancient ruin . . . but they fled long ago. What darkness could have driven them out?

name: Diabolic Edict
text:
"Mere death brings no pleasure. Pleasure comes from watching fools scratch and claw to save their wretched lives from the inevitable."
—Ob Nixilis

name: Dark Revenant
text: The murderer faced justice in the Azorius courts, but his soul was set free on a technicality.

name: Saiba Trespassers
text: One to clear the way, another to erase their trail.

name: Beaming Defiance
text:
"I've lived too long in my father's shadow. It's time to find my own light."
—Killian, Silverquill mage-student

name: Convalescence
text: Selenia had hurt Mirri terribly, but injuries of the flesh could be treated. The wounds she had torn in Crovax's soul would never close.

name: Seraph of New Capenna // Seraph of New Phyrexia
text: With her Halo reserves exhausted, she began to change, and she made a new promise to bless New Capenna with glistening perfection.

name: Sigardian Priest
text: Many whose faith was destroyed by Avacyn turned to the only angel who remained true to humanity.

name: Security Rhox
text: Unlucky assassins find out why he's called "Brick Wall" Balzano.

name: Kjeldoran Escort
text:
"We willingly trade with Kjeldor, but the peace we build must come from both our lands."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Brightclimb Pathway // Grimclimb Pathway
text:
"My mother wanted me to take over the family dry goods business, but no. I had to come here."
—Yavotz, Sea Gate Expeditionary House

name: Explore the Underdark
text:
"Careful near those pretty glowing plants. What do you think they feed on?"
—Talin, Underdark guide

name: Balan, Wandering Knight
text: "What weapon will you bear against one who's mastered them all?"

name: Lady Sun
text: Sister to Sun Quan and wife to Liu Bei, Lady Sun often felt her loyalty to both tested.

name: Mossdog
text: The more you look at it, the more dangerous it becomes.

name: Phalanx Tactics
