text: Every soldier has a place to stand and a role to play.

name: Atraxa, Praetors' Voice
text:
"Teach these people to pay the price of their insolence."
—Elesh Norn

name: Atzocan Archer
text: His arrows are fletched with feathers from the greatest of the winged dinosaurs.

name: Raging Minotaur
text: The only thing worse than a minotaur with an axe is an angry minotaur with an axe.

name: Abzan Banner
text: Stone to endure, roots to remember.

name: Krosan Grip
text: The Atlas Gauntlets did little to dissuade Vi of the notion that everything could be solved by punching.

name: Goblin Test Pilot
text:
"All pilots and prototypes destroyed. Extensive collateral damage inflicted. Conclusion: flawless design."
—*Manual of Melek*

name: Adarkar Sentinel
text:
"We encountered the Sentinels in the wastes, near no living thing. Their purpose was inscrutable."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Blood Ogre
text:
"Ogres taunt the dragons by moving into their territory, but even the hellkites find them too much trouble to hunt."
—Marza, mountain scout

name: Force of Will
text: "Amateur."

name: Aether Gust
text: The cleansing winds swept away all traces of the demon, until not even his legend remained.

name: Filthy Cur
text: Some things even fleas won't bite.

name: Braids, Conjurer Adept
text: The rifted multiverse became a sea of conflicting realities, each peopled by possible versions of every living being.

name: Myr Kinsmith
text:
"Our resistance is like the myr: small and easily overlooked, but loyal and resilient beyond measure."
—Melira

name: Firebrand Archer
text: A word of vengeance, and her arrows awaken in flame.

name: Knight-Captain of Eos
text: The strength of Bant's caste system is the unfailing loyalty of its meekest members.

name: Squirrel Wrangler
text: "Gnawed to death. Bad way to go."

name: Orcish Bloodpainter
text: Blood calls to blood.

name: Knight of Malice
text: A shadow to swallow the light.

name: Armor Thrull
text:
"They gave their lives to strengthen the Order's armies, until they declined this honor in favor of joining the Thrull Rebellion."
—Jherana Rure, Counter-Insurgency Commander

name: Spawnwrithe
text: Its victims feel only an itchy, wriggling feeling just under their skin. By then, it's far too late.

name: Shield of Duty and Reason
text: The duty: to defend. The reason: to survive.

name: Crystal Shard
text: The vedalken know it is not of this world, so they know that this world is not the only one.

name: Serum Raker
text: The serum from the blinkmoths they gather greases the joints of witch engines.

name: Spirited Companion
text: She formed a friendship with several playful spirits, and soon "the pack" was known as the source of much mischief in Eiganjo.

name: Geralf's Messenger
text: The message is "Run."

name: Skyrider Trainee
text: "Of course I plan on going up. Kang here is the most trusted 'fin on the squad. Afraid? Me? No, I'm just . . . waiting for the right wind conditions."

name: Giver of Runes
text: She provides marks of protection to those she chooses as family.

name: Western Paladin
text:
"Expect nothing but scorn, flattery, and lies. And never turn your back on him."
—Northern paladin

name: Hexplate Golem
text:
"Use everything. Iron, rust, scrap . . . even the ground must join our cause."
—Ezuri, renegade leader

name: God-Pharaoh's Statue
text: A dictator's infuriating smirk, an affront to everything Ravnica stood for.

name: Cabal Coffers
text: The Cabal required a suitably immense space to house the lucrative fruits of their religious zeal.

name: Heir of Falkenrath // Heir to the Night
text: The Falkenrath have relinquished all pretense at nobility, losing themselves completely to their all-consuming thirst.

name: Oreskos Sun Guide
text: "Let the humans have their pantheon. We need no gods to thrive. Even a mortal such as I can capture a part of the sun's power."

name: Lord of the Accursed
text: "To die for a cause and continue to serve it is the truest mark of loyalty."

name: Roil Elemental
text: A vortex that devours everything—even the souls of the living.

name: Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur
text: "It is not a goal, but a process—the process of creating the perfect Phyrexia."

name: Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore
text: "The highway of fear is the shortest route to defeat."

name: Energizer
text: Like a kettle set to boil, it must eventually go off—on someone.

name: Alrund, God of the Cosmos // Hakka, Whispering Raven
text: Alrund's raven soars between realms; no secret is beyond his grasp.

name: Servant of Nefarox
text: "My cause is power, and at the altar of power I will gladly forfeit my soul."

name: Tethered Griffin
text: Poorly trained griffins sometimes attack the noble audiences that gather to watch their progress.

name: Farsight Mask
text: It turns the adversity of the moment into the knowledge of a lifetime.

name: Xorn
text: Xorns are native to the Elemental Plane of Earth, where gems and rare stones are plentiful. When summoned elsewhere they can be quite destructive in search of food.

name: Golgari Guildgate
text: Enter those who are starving and sick. You are welcome among the Swarm when the rest of Ravnica rejects you.

name: Sacred Boon
text:
"Divine gifts are granted to those who are worthy."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Disrupt
text: Oh, I'm sorry—did I break your concentration?

name: Bad Deal
text: There are still places where a smile and a handshake are all you need to seal a deal.

name: Seal of Doom
text:
"I am the banisher, the ill will that snuffs the final candle."
—Seal inscription

name: Laid to Rest
text:
"We are not here to mourn their loss. We are here to celebrate their lives."
—Vesna, Dawnhart witch

name: Brought Back
text:
"As long as your courage remains, your life will not falter."
—Sephara, Sky's Blade

name: Muck Rats
text: The difference between a nuisance and a threat is often merely a matter of numbers.

name: Nekrataal
text: His victims don't have time to feel despair.

name: Void Winnower
text:
"Have you ever seen a world fall to its knees? Watch, and learn."
—Ob Nixilis

name: Ancestral Mask
text: "I pass to you all we have ever been. Go forth and become all we never could."

name: Soulsurge Elemental
text: It draws its strength from those around it, but the pleasure of destruction is all its own.

name: Lord of the Unreal
text: "The dream does not end until I say so."

name: Pacification Array
text: The Consulate had access to thousands of innovative devices displayed at the Inventors' Fair. A few small changes transformed some of them from marvels of ingenuity to instruments of oppression.

name: Wall of Heat
text: At a distance, we mistook the sound for a waterfall . . . .

name: Hand to Hand
text: The match between Tahngarth and Greven was close only in the mind of the minotaur.

name: Rime Transfusion
text: The unfortunates so transformed hungered not for flesh, but for warmth.

name: Threads of Disloyalty
text: "Every thought is a string. You just have to find the right ones to pull."

name: Shambling Strider
text: Freyalise forbid that any stranger should wander into the striders' territory.

name: Game Trail
text:
"It appears Old One Eye is on the hunt."
—Marneus Calgar

name: Isolate
text: Threefold were his crimes, doubled were his pleas, singular was his fate.

name: Defensive Maneuvers
text: "Only on the battlefield can we repay all the Order has given us."

name: Tamiyo's Journal
text: Entry 855: There's more to Avacyn's madness . . .

name: Pyretic Prankster // Glistening Goremonger
text: When it realized the symbol's true, glorious meaning, it began marking every surface on Innistrad with oil-soaked claws.

name: Rending Flame
text:
"It is our duty to bring the Blessed Sleep to the dead, even if they resist that gift."
—Grete, Order of Saint Traft

name: Virtus's Maneuver
text: Brutality had never been so exquisite.

name: Wall of Diffusion
text:
"The injury was being caught between this world and our own; the insult was to find walls within."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

name: Firja, Judge of Valor
text: Invader after invader fell before her, and to each she spoke a single word: "Unworthy."

name: Momentous Fall
text: It wasn't long until the elves had developed a use for every part of the Eldrazi.

name: Yarok, the Desecrated
text:
"Its blighted heart, its spinous hands To break the hosts that foul its lands."
—*Triumph of Bala Ged*, stanza 6

name: Disarm
text: "Be thankful I left you your clothes."

name: Symmetry Sage
text: "By my calculations, I should be able to achieve true enlightenment before graduation."

name: Misstep
text:
The feet have no eyes.
—Saprazzan saying

name: Reanimate
text:
"You will learn to earn death."
—Volrath

name: Control of the Court
text: "Power-hungry eunuchs, the curse of the dynasty, have thrown the masses of the people into the depths of misery."

name: Crawling Chorus
text: "We need not be swift. We are inexorable."

name: Steadfast Armasaur
text:
"Like the mighty armasaur, we will defend against all who invade our shores."
—Itzama the Crested

name: Speakeasy Server
text: "Whatever ails you, friends, this will cure it for tonight! And leave you with a little inspiration for tomorrow."

name: Howling Golem
text: It wails of buried riches and the souls lost seeking them.

name: A-Narfi, Betrayer King
text: To serve the god of death, Narfi forfeited the warmth of life.

name: Thorn Elemental
text: The first law of Yavimaya is that guests may kill only to survive. As fires aren't needed in the warm weather, cutting trees for wood means death.

name: Foot Soldiers
text: Infantry deployment is the art of putting your troops in the wrong place at the right time.

name: Bladegraft Aspirant
text: "To dance to the music of Juex, leap like the flickering flame and hit like the hammer."

name: Board the Weatherlight
text: A new gathering for a new age.

name: Khenra Eternal
text: For many years, servant mummies toiled in the mines to extract lazotep. The emergence of the Eternals revealed the sacred substance's true purpose.

name: Early Harvest
text:
"Tonight we'll eat a farewell feast. Cold corn porridge is not enough. / Let's peel papayas, pineapples, and mangoes, drink coconut milk, / and bake bananas."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Lotus Petal
text: Each of these intricate mechanical petals stores enough power to supply all of Ghirapur, if only for a fleeting moment.

name: Reveka, Wizard Savant
text:
"It's nice to see a sister Dwarf in a position of such power, but why'd it have to be one of those seafaring muleheads?"
—Halina, Dwarven Trader

name: Rolling Stones
text:
"We spent three weeks trying to knock that wall down. Now it's knocking us down."
—Onean sergeant

name: Call the Skybreaker
text: It hears and answers every orison across Shadowmoor.

name: Scrubland
text: 2022 North America Legacy Championship

name: Finishing Move
text: What the show lacks in historical accuracy, it makes up for in awesome submission holds.

name: Boros Charm
text:
"Practice compassion and mercy. But know when they must end."
—Aurelia

name: Lumengrid Sentinel
text: The vedalken order their Neurok sentinels to watch over the shores of the Quicksilver Sea, as if they know of intruders yet to come.

name: Sanctum of Stone Fangs
text:
Renounce all limits,
False chains binding potential.
Power knows no bounds.

name: Yotian Soldier
text: Poets dream the verses of otherworldly stories. Artificers dream the blueprints of otherplanar artifacts.

name: Invade the City
text: Death greeted the world with a roar of desert air.

name: Filigree Familiar
text:
"It's the must-have gift for everyone on your list. Get one for yourself, too!"
—Chammi, curio vendor

name: Shredding Winds
text:
"Enemies of the wood! Your presence here is a slap in Nylea's face. Do not be surprised if she slaps back."
—Telphe, druid of Nylea

name: Unwinding Clock
text:
"Heat from the rotating mechanism is captured and converted into energy, allowing it to operate in perpetuity."
—*Rusko's Compendium of Clockwork"

name: Skeleton Shard
text: Metal permeates the marrow of every bone in Mephidross—except one.

name: Yavimaya Barbarian
text: Not all elves embrace the pastoral life. Some still roam the forest's edge, forever making war against their hated enemies.

name: Devout Decree
text:
"It is not punishment. I am simply making things as they should be."
—Sephara, Sky's Blade

name: Talisman of Creativity
text:
"It is my cry that wakes you in the night, and my body that crouches in the shadow. I am Tzeentch and you are the puppet that dances to my tune."
—*The Book of Tzeentch*

name: Spell Snip
text:
"Magic cast through a hand of flesh is just as weak as the flesh itself."
—Lodus of the Ethersworn

name: Casting of Bones
text:
"Only a necromancer would create such a foul form of divination."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Blisterpod
text: A blisterpod's corpse is a scion's cradle.

name: Orcish Spy
text:
"Orcish armies often employed the smaller, swifter, and less intelligent Goblins as spies."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. I*

name: Lightning Helix
text: Though lesser well-known than its army of soldiers, the Boro Legion's mage-priests are as respected by the innocent as they are hated by the ghosts of the guilty.

name: Nissa's Defeat
text:
"The soul of this world is gone, Nissa, and I would gladly kill it again."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Chardalyn Dragon
text: First discovered in ancient Netheril, chardalyn stones absorb and hold magical energy, enabling constructs to be infused with fearsome power and unnatural malice.

name: Ancient Grudge
text: The time rifts remind Yavimaya of the enemies of its past and provide fresh fuel for its fires.

name: Hullbreacher
text: "I don't need a map to find riches."

name: Wash Out
text:
"It's not the darkness I fear but dull and numbing shades of gray."
—Sydri, galvanic genius

name: Beast in Show
text: "Something really special in the baloth category this season, in terms of spike density and quality. We'd like to get a word with the handler, but are unable to locate her at this time."

name: Blood Mist
text: "Some claim that rage is a cloud that obscures thought and vision. But I can assure you—I've never seen with greater clarity."

name: Cartographer's Survey
text: She monitors the roads in every province, mapping safe routes through hunting grounds and haunting grounds alike.

name: Boarded Window
text:
"Sturdy nails make for sound sleep."
—Cosper Lowe of the Silbern Guard

name: Jacob Hauken, Inspector // Hauken's Insight
text: "Our world may be dark, but there's still plenty to see."

name: Void Rend
text: Bits of the missing agent were discovered in various alleys across all three boroughs.

name: Agent of Masks
text: "You say that I am two-faced? Enough with the flattery. We have business to conduct."

name: Eastern Paladin
text:
"Their fragile world. Their futile lives. They obstruct the Grand Evolution. In Yawgmoth's name, we shall excise them."
—Oath of the East

name: Elite Archers
text: Arrows fletched with the feathers of angels seldom miss their mark.

name: Kozilek's Translator
text: From nothingness, sustenance.

name: Sylvok Explorer
text: Any creature on a druid's shoulder is his family, any land under his feet his home.

name: Azra Oddsmaker
text: "I never give odds on my own fights. Unless, of course, you want to bet *against* me . . ."

name: Wind Drake
text: Orim regarded Gerrard coolly. "You are like the drake," she said, her expression unchanging. "It works hard to maintain its position, but to us it seems to glide along effortlessly. You must do the same."

name: Celestial Kirin
text: All bow at its visitation—some in awe, some in honor, some in fear.

name: Burning Shield Askari
text:
"Any day that I ride my horse up to my ankles in the remains of my enemies is a good day."
—Akin, seasoned askari

name: Aether Barrier
text:
"Creatures fade in and out of existence. It's an unfortunate side effect. The losses are tolerable."
—Belbe

name: Field Surgeon
text: Commanders order soldiers to attack. Field surgeons order them to heal. Both are obeyed without question.

name: Leadership Vacuum
text:
"While they scramble to fill the sudden vacancy at the top, we strike."
—Sedris, the Traitor King

name: Yavimaya Sapherd
text:
"When their community grows cluttered, thallids begin a traditional bobbing dance, then trek out in all directions."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*

name: Havoc
text: As Orim put the lightning rod into place on the bow, she cast a spell of protection to shield herself from the heat. That's when the Furnace got personal.

name: Wall of Bone
text: A skeletal wall, strengthened by the souls of traitors, rings the city of the Eastern Paladin.

name: Force Spike
text:
"Unknown spears / Suddenly hurtle before my dream-awakened eyes . . . ."
—William Butler Yeats, "The Valley of the Black Pig"

name: Abyssal Specter
text: It rides to a chorus of whispers that are more felt than heard.

name: Burrenton Bombardier
text: The flasks provide ballast, a means of steering, and—with a little luck—a way to deliver ward-spells to cohorts below.

name: Dub
text: "Rise, knight of New Benalia."

name: Prison Term
text: Clear out the cell. Bring in the next prisoner.

name: Liturgy of Blood
text:
"You harbor such vast potential. It would be such a shame to let you die of old age."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

name: When We Were Young
text: Since Imperial custom strictly forbade the Emperor to reveal her name—even to Kaito, her closest childhood friend—she had to suffer him calling her "your emperorness" for much of their shared youth.

name: Gathering Throng
text: A plus-one is simply not enough.

name: Kaya's Ghostform
text: The Eternals found some sparks to be quite slippery.

name: Gaze of Pain
text: Remove the guardians to ensure your victory.

name: Alabaster Host Sanctifier
text: "Heliod shines his light on all things, excising the shadows of doubt. Rejoice, for beneath his purifying eyes, Theros is united as one!"

name: Selfless Glyphweaver // Deadly Vanity
text: He offered his light to make sure no others would be dimmed.

name: Solemn Offering
text:
"You will be reimbursed for your donation."
"The reimbursement is spiritual."
—Temple signs

name: Llanowar Elves
text: As patient and generous as life, as harsh and merciless as nature.

name: Vulpine Harvester
text:
"Fear the fox given strength to match its cunning."
—Vivien Reid

name: Volo, Guide to Monsters
text: "The beholder told me I had a good eye for details. Who was I to argue?"

name: Scorching Dragonfire
text: As the blaze raced toward her, Syr Ameril closed her eyes and pictured Castle Ardenvale so her last thoughts would be of home.

name: Spark Reaper
text:
"I know they're unstoppable fighters created to harvest souls—it's just they're so rude about it."
—Kaya

name: Agent of Shauku
text: "Go ahead. Take it. You'll be so very powerful . . . and what harm can it do?"

name: Number Crunch
text: Can you digit?

name: Scouting Trek
text:
"I have chosen my path. Who will walk it with me?"
—Eladamri

name: Leonin Skyhunter
text: "The infection has spread farther than we could glimpse from the heights of Taj-Nar."

name: Command Tower
text: Durlag's Tower is filled with enough treasure to last a lifetime, and enough traps to drastically shorten that lifetime.

name: Krark, the Thumbless
text: "Double or nothing."

name: Glissa's Scorn
text:
"If it were fit to survive, it wouldn't have been so easily put down."
—Glissa

name: Kaza, Roil Chaser
text: "What sort of life is that, huddling in the familiar and safe? No thanks. Put me right in the center of the action."

name: Jolrael, Empress of Beasts
text: "I need no army. I have Jamuraa."

name: Hand of Cruelty
text: "The sword is just a tool. It is the samurai's hand that delivers death."

name: Resolute Survivors
text: "We are crops no longer. Reap elsewhere."

name: Double Cross
text: "You're in for a nasty butt-kickin'."

name: Academy Ruins
text: The Tolarian Academy was home to some of the greatest discoveries in Dominaria's history—as well as its greatest tragedies.

name: Kavu Mauler
text: To the kavu, all Phyrexians are merely crunchy snacks.

name: Call to the Void
text: Bhaal's mortal children carried within them a darkness that, left unchecked, would devour them all.

name: Deputy of Acquittals
text: "Everyone deserves a day in court."

name: Fauna Shaman
text: She wears the talismans of every creature she can evoke.

name: Faithless Salvaging
text: All that's left are broken beliefs.

name: Edge of the Divinity
text: The divinity's patronage confers both wicked grace and graceful wickedness.

name: Teroh's Faithful
text: The light of reason follows them even into battle.

name: Flame-Kin Zealot
text: Boros soldiers are like a cache of bombs ready to explode, and the flame-kin light their fuses.

name: Wanderwine Hub
text: Below the great river, a bustling hub channels the flow of merrow trade.

name: Noggle Bridgebreaker
text: "It's always funny till someone gets hurt. Then it's hilarious."

name: Tezzeret's Simulacrum
text: Tezzeret's command of living metal has nothing to do with intricate gearcraft or aether supplies.

name: Ghoulsteed
text: It once served a cathar roadwatcher, patrolling the crossways between villages. Its hooves still carry it along the same path.

name: Invigorated Rampage
text: Gremlins can change from pest to problem to plague in the span of a moment.

name: That Which Was Taken
text:
"This god held prisoner in human hands has put all humanity in the hands of angry gods."
—Masako the Humorless

name: Drownyard Temple
text:
"This is it! All the cryptoliths point here!"
—Jace Beleren

name: Squeeze
text: Any pirate would prefer Rishada's swift and cruel justice to Saprazzo's patient punishments.

name: Leafkin Druid
text: "I am rooted in the life of all that thrives around me. You cannot move me."

name: Tower of Eons
text: Its etchings tell the ur-golems' stories of an entity able to force life into a lifeless plane.

name: Dauthi Marauder
text:
"The dauthi came from beneath the ruins one night, and the darkness cast them in the best possible light."
—Soltari Tales of Life

name: Lightning Hounds
text: Quick enough to avoid jhovalls when alone and fierce enough to attack them in packs, the hounds were as at home in the mountains as the Mercadians were atop theirs.

name: Cabal Slaver
text: "In its natural habitat, the goblin is stupid, yet devious. Now it's stupid, devious, and powerful."

name: Blood Crypt
text: Where the dead serve as diversion, decor, and dessert.

name: Bloodrage Brawler
text: To Hazoret, those who fight for her are her beloved children.

name: Berserkers' Onslaught
text:
"Atarka's people starve while she feasts upon the bounty of their hunts. They must conquer ever more lands just for the sake of their own subsistence."
—Arel, Unseen Whisperer

name: Goblin Shrine
text:
"I knew it weren't no ordinary pile of—you know."
—Norin the Wary

name: Show of Valor
text: Cowards watch. Heroes act.

name: Dungeon Shade
text: A sickness stirs in its eyes, a nightmare born in darkened wails.

name: Soul Shred
text: It would be a shame to let life slip away to nothing.

name: Orcish Farmer
text:
"Yes, the Farmers keep our soldiers fed. But why do they have to make every battlefield a pigpen?"
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain

name: Jade Idol
text: Before the Kami War, the shishi were symbolic guardians, protecting the shrines where they stood. But after the kami turned on the material world, shishi began pouncing from their perches to attack would-be supplicants.

name: Judith, the Scourge Diva
text: She protected Ravnica with the same things that thrilled her fans: courage, charisma, and a grand assortment of spiked chains.

name: Conquer
text:
"Every field watered in warriors' blood is sacred ground. Lay it not to waste, but claim it for our own—for glory, and for Stromgald!"
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Telepathic Spies
text: "Do try to keep an open mind, would you?"

name: Shameless Charlatan
text: You see your next disguise in every stranger's smile.

name: Might of the Masses
text: The Joraga elves never need ask a troll to leave their territory. They merely grant it their combined strength, and it can't resist embarking on a merry rampage.

name: Coast Watcher
text: The aven came to fear the forest's clawing branches, but the watchers quickly renewed their courage.

name: Wayfarer's Bauble
text: When Chaos makes a tool that isn't specifically for destroying things, it's usually for finding new things to destroy.

name: Patchwork Gnomes
text:
"Just when I get them working, they always start fighting and tearing at each other for spare parts."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

name: Rotting Giant
text: Wracked with rot, it wrecks and ruins.

name: Aura Graft
text: "It's not really stealing. It's more like extended borrowing."

name: Force Spike
text: "I don't *think* so."

name: Gorilla Pack
text:
"We learned this at a dear price: once you cross the great river, get through the Yavimaya forest at top speed."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Urza's Rebuff
text:
"As usual, my brother's maneuvers are brash and impulsive."
—Urza

name: Offering to Asha
text:
"His body belongs to Bant now. His soul? I honestly don't know. I expect it belongs to the angels."
—Rafiq of the Many

name: Merchant of the Vale // Haggle
text: "Buying old, worn-out junk. Selling marvels of real value."

name: Attended Knight
text: The virtues of knighthood are best taught in the field.

name: Bloodmist Infiltrator
text: Blood seeks blood, and nothing shall hold back its hunger.

name: Whip-Spine Drake
text:
"I swear the clouds were created just so the drakes would have a place to lurk."
—Kasharri, skyknight

name: Death Stroke
text: For a sharp second, Selenia froze, and Crovax's blade found home. As the angel shattered like glass, Crovax felt his mind collapse—the curse had been fulfilled.

name: Assassinate
text: The rulers of old Dominaria kept assassins on retainer. However, the true loyalty of these master killers was always to their peers. This elite community survived the fall of the old royal order.

name: Silence
text:
"All the wizardry in the world has to pass through one small and easily sealed door."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Reflex Sliver
text:
"This sliver comes into the world a perfect predator. It's ready to hunt and devour its first meal within seconds of hatching."
—Rukarumel, field journal

name: Rona, Herald of Invasion // Rona, Tolarian Obliterator
text: "At last, I am *compleat*."

name: Touch of the Eternal
text:
"Time is a vigilant tyrant, but there are those who have broken free of its gaze."
—Laikas, Erunian monk

name: Wrenn's Resolve
text: Even as she burned, Wrenn bent Realmbreaker to her will.

name: Two-Headed Sliver
text:
"That which would be a fatal mutation in any other species is merely a source of new powers. I am intrigued, yet too fearful to examine it more closely."
—Rukarumel, field journal

name: Queen's Commission
text:
"Let the blood of the impure flow through you. Only the blessings of the golden city will purge its acrid taste from your mouth."
—High Marshal Arguel

name: Exhume
text:
"Death—an outmoded concept. We sleep, and we change."
—Sitrik, birth priest

name: Plate Spinning
text: For extra style points, spin them.

name: Canopy Spider
text:
"We know our place in the cycle of life—and it is not as flies."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Lightning Bolt
text:
"The first mages witnessed the fury of the raging storm and wished to answer back."
—*The Stormwright Texts*

name: Defense Grid
text:
"A good deal of tyranny goes by the name of protection."
—Crystal Eastman, "Equality or Protection"

name: Torpor Orb
text:
"Phyrexia is certainly dangerous, but I have to admire some of its innovations."
—Tezzeret

name: Indebted Samurai
text: "Forgive me, Saburo. I could not save you. But your blade will not rest in my hand."

name: Automated Artificer
text:
"I sometimes watch them build more of their kind and wonder: Will there come a day when they no longer need us?"
—Saku, Futurist technician

name: Granulate
text: There aren't *that* many ways to destroy a solid steel weapon, but somehow the goblins keep finding new ones.

name: Platoon Dispenser
text:
"Hear that thud-clank, thud-clank? We're saved."
—Ani, Urzan soldier

name: Dragonspeaker Shaman
text: "We speak the dragons' language of flame and rage. They speak our language of fury and honor. Together we shall weave a tale of destruction without equal."

name: Lost in the Mist
text: The secrets she carried could have saved many lives, but they quietly drowned with her.

name: Dripping-Tongue Zubera
text: When the Honden of Life's Web was destroyed, its attendants swarmed Kamigawa to ensure mortal defeat.

name: Aura of Dominion
text:
"Lies and deceit do yield results, but legitimate authority is the ultimate form of control."
—Meloku the Clouded Mirror

name: Mwonvuli Ooze
text: "Ewww!"

name: Ornithopter
text:
"Consider all confiscated items hostile until proven otherwise."
—Confiscation directive

name: Abbey Gargoyles
text:
"They don't move, do they?"
"Only for the wrong sort of people."
"Are *we* the wrong sort of people?"

name: Stop That
text: Now for a squirt of lemon juice.

name: Ancient Hellkite
text: When a dragon attacks, there are no bystanders.

name: Mortal Combat
text: The crowd roared, the fighters bled, and the dead piled high in the pits. Only the Cabal could win.

name: Worms of the Earth
text: The ground collapsed, leaving nothing but the great Worms' mucous residues.

name: Mother of Runes
text: Her boundless love has moved many. Her confidence has moved mountains.

name: Relentless Pursuit
text: Calix was patient, steadily following Elspeth until their destined confrontation.

name: Skaab Goliath
text: Three heads are better than one.

name: Cyclopean Snare
text: The spoiled, gluttonous halls of the Orzhov teem with gaudy, needless wealth. Even their security measures are made for beauty first, efficiency second.

name: Jewel Thief
text: "They can afford the loss. They build it into their prices."

name: Calamity's Wake
text: The sylex's blast had razed the land, leaving behind only snow and sorrow. Urza stood alone in the sudden silence.

name: Armada Wurm
text: No one in the Conclave acts alone.

name: Vicious Conquistador
text:
"He is ambitious. Tireless. And utterly ruthless. Ideal for the frontier."
—Viceroy Elia Sotonores, report to the queen

name: Captain Ripley Vance
text: The Spitfire Bastion bristles with cannons claimed from every ship she's conquered.

name: Maro
text: No two draw the same Maro.

name: Wolfkin Outcast // Wedding Crasher
text: He raged not just against vampires, but against civilization itself.

name: Torch Breath
text: "Fried squid, comin' up!"

name: Smogsteed Rider
text:
"An entire order of mages who draw their power from Ravnica's smog? Yet another indicator of our world's decay."
—Dravash, dowsing shaman

name: Tezzeret's Strider
text:
"More obedient than any dog."
—Tezzeret

name: Farrel's Zealot
text: Farrel, a former priest, believed Icatia was far too complacent toward the Order of the Ebon Hand.

name: Reckoner Shakedown
text:
"That's a start. What else do you have for us?"
—Takumi, Reckoner enforcer

name: Time Ebb
text:
"The ogre had come from out of the blue, so that's where I sent it back."
—Talas wizard

name: Cho-Arrim Bruiser
text: He doesn't know why the Cho-Arrim fight the Mercadians, but he's happy to bash heads for them anyway.

name: Demonspine Whip
text: Using a spine to break a slave's back appeals to the Grixis sense of irony.

name: Reprocess
text: The battle's end is the meal's beginning.

name: Pyroclasm
text: Chaos does not choose its enemies.

name: Felhide Minotaur
text:
With spear held high, the Champion came to meet Thyrogog of the Ashlands, who wore the old king's skin as a cloak and fed on the flesh of innocents. The foul minotaur raised the great axe called Goremaster and charged.
—*The Theriad*

name: Fierce Guardianship
text:
"Hunt somewhere else. This is your only warning."
—Gavi, nest warden

name: Verdigris
text:
"Only the most sophisticated inventions can survive nature's unsophisticated motivations."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

name: Azorius Signet
text: The maze-like design embodies the core of Azorius law —strict structure designed to test wills and stall change.

name: Vraska's Fall
text: The dull, creeping pain of phyresis curdled in Vraska's blood. She knew as soon as it took her, she would betray everything—even Jace.

name: Gaseous Form
text:
". . . [A]nd gives to airy nothing A local habitation and a name."
—William Shakespeare, *A Midsummer-Night's Dream*

name: Hookhand Mariner // Riphook Raider
text: They weren't entirely wrong.

name: Tura Kennerüd, Skyknight
text: "The sky is my birthright. I dare you to try and take it from me."

name: Two-Headed Hellkite
text: Eons ago, the ur-dragon roared. Its descendants still carry the echo across the Multiverse.

name: Sauron, the Lidless Eye
text: There is an Eye in the Dark Tower that does not sleep.

name: Force of Nature
text:
"It blinked, and flower petals fell like tears. Harthar, sensing weakness, attacked—and his blood fell like petals."
—Shesul Fass, faerie bard

name: Shuko
text:
"One scratch on a wall meant safe passage, two that the target had already been raided, and three warned of a trap."
—*Weaponry of Kamigawa*

name: Beacon of Unrest
text: "The light of my master's guidance traverses all boundaries, even those separating life and death."

name: Faces of the Past
text: The ties that bind can also strangle.

name: Tenth District Veteran
text: "I keep reminding myself we do this because others can't, because we love this city. If we don't save it, no one will."

name: Kranioceros
text:
"A surly beast, the kranioceros will raise its defenses at the smallest threat. Stay out of sight and downwind, or you'll disrupt its natural migrations."
—Ebrel, godtoucher mentor

name: Solitary Camel
text: Deserts are inhospitable, not uninhabitable.

name: Full Moon's Rise
text: Some lycanthropes wish they could abandon their weak human shapes and revel in the power of the wolf.

name: Mysterious Egg
text:
"A good forage if you can find it, but eat it before you get back to sanctuary. The guards won't let you bring it through the gates."
—Dennae, Savai hunter

name: Droning Bureaucrats
text: " . . . and you must also apply for an application license, file documents 136(iv) and 22-C and -D in triplicate, pay all requisite fees, request a . . ."

name: Boots of Speed
text: Click your heels and become the wind.

name: Firebreathing
text:
"And topples round the dreary west
A looming bastion fringed with fire."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "In Memoriam"

name: Thirst for Knowledge
text: "To truly know something, you must become it. The trick is to not lose yourself in the process."

name: Mardu Woe-Reaper
text: "Those who died in battle deserve their rest."

name: Savage Lands
text: Jund is a world as cruel as those who call it home. Their brutal struggles scar the land even as it carves them in its image, a vicious circle spiraling out of control.

name: Torture
text:
"It helps you pass the time until you die."
—Grandmother Sengir

name: Melira's Keepers
text: Her warriors are the last defense against the coming storm.

name: Uncanny Speed
text:
"To survive, we must embrace the savagery we knew in our race's infancy."
—Edgar Markov

name: Weldfast Monitor
text: The avant-garde among Ghirapur's inventors disregard the Consulate's safety standards completely.

name: Contaminated Bond
text: This leash disciplines the master.

name: Plated Slagwurm
text: Beneath the Tangle, the wurm tunnels stretch . . . wide as a stone's throw, long as forever, deep as you dare.

name: Urza's Armor
text: Urza protected his body well, but neglected his soul.

name: Culling Drone
text: Silence rules Bala Ged, broken only by the skittering of Eldrazi.

name: Serra Paladin
text:
One light, one blade, one purpose.
—Vow of the Serra Paladins

name: Slip Out the Back
text: "I was never here."

name: Rebuke
text:
"No one chooses to be stitched together into a skaab. If it could speak, it would beg for its own destruction."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Kor Line-Slinger
text:
"I tried to tell her to stay behind, that this fight was too dangerous. I spent the next hour tied to the rafters."
—Zahr Gada, Halimar expedition leader

name: Molten Blast
text: Life among the sudden tremors and violent eruptions of Akoum demands a healthy fear of both.

name: Reckless Racer
text: Illegal street races turned out to be perfect practice for avoiding Consulate patrols.

name: Steal Enchantment
text:
"Why should I flatter another with imitation when I can satisfy myself through possession?"
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Emberwilde Captain
text: "You are bold, challenger, but flammable."

name: Stand Together
text: Strange times make for strange allies.

name: Unwilling Ingredient
text:
"Don't look at me like that. It was either this or being eaten by a groff."
—Dina, Witherbloom mage-student

name: Feeling of Dread
text: People only say "I'm sure it was nothing" when they're sure it was something.

name: Trostani's Judgment
text:
"Some cannot be saved as they are, but all can serve the Worldsoul."
—Trostani

name: Storm Herd
text:
"When you hear thunder on a cloudless day, take cover and brace for the coming of the storm herd."
—Skotov, Tin Street basket vendor

name: Bloodforged Battle-Axe
text: She awoke with blood on her brow, an axe in her hand, and heads at her feet.

name: Idyllic Grange
text: Every hero's journey starts somewhere.

name: Teller of Tales
text: Words never uttered by mortals flowed incessantly from its many mouths.

name: Uninvited Geist // Unimpeded Trespasser
text: Knocking was simply a formality.

name: Hour of Devastation
text:
"Everything here exists or perishes at my whim. Including you, Gatewatch."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Mystical Tutor
text: The student searches the world for meaning. The master finds worlds of meaning in the search.

name: Dragonskull Summit
text: When the Planeswalker Angrath called dinosaurs "dragons," the name stuck in certain pirate circles.

name: Goblin Raider
text:
"I seen lots o' fights. To win ya gotta bash hard and not get bashed back."
—Goblin grunt

name: Glistening Deluge
text: As oil began to pour from Ikoria's crystals, some monsters developed strange mechanical mutations. Others were simply pulled under.

name: Dread Defiler
text: It left behind an echoing emptiness more horrible than the grave.

name: Trapped in the Tower
text: "At least up here I have some peace and quiet."

name: Thorn of the Black Rose
text: If bribery and intimidation fail, Marchesa turns to her favorite form of bureaucracy.

name: Scorching Dragonfire
text: As the blaze raced towards her, Syr Ameril closed her eyes and pictured Castle Ardenvale so her last thoughts would be of home.

name: Chandra's Outrage
text:
"Her mind is an incredible mix of emotion and power. Even if I could grasp it, I couldn't hold it for long."
—Jace Beleren, on Chandra Nalaar

name: Elderfang Venom
text: "The Cosmos Serpent favored us with his venom. As thanks, we sink fangs into those who dishonor the old ways."

name: Shamble Back
text: Lost loved ones are never truly gone.

name: Nantuko Shade
text: In life, the nantuko study nature by revering it. In death, they study nature by disemboweling it.

name: Glacial Wall
text:
"Huge walls of ice block further travel. We can't believe they are natural."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Goblin Instigator
text: "We can take 'em. You go first!"

name: Titania
text: Voice of the Argoth forest, defender of its creatures, and enforcer of its laws, Titania is literally an aspect of the forest itself. Her power and her very existence are linked to the land: when the forest is healthy, Titania is ascendant. When Argoth suffers, Titania also bleeds.

name: Camaraderie
text:
"Within the song of Mat'Selesnya, one becomes all."
—Heruj, Selesnya hierophant

name: Ardent Electromancer
text: "Trust me, we won't need torches."

name: Jabari's Influence
text:
"Common soldiers can't understand what a sidar knows: the enemy can be a resource."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Incinerate
text:
"Yes, I think 'toast' is an appropriate description."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Counterspell
text:
"It was probably a lousy spell in the first place."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Lim-Dûl's High Guard
text:
"The Guard will forever stand ready. For them, death is merely an inconvenience, not an ending."
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn

name: Sin Collector
text: "That must weigh heavily on your soul. Let me purge it for you."

name: Hydrosurge
text:
"Thirsty?"
—Drunvalus, hydromancer

name: Necrotic Wound
text: The assassins of the Ochran distill toxins from the remains of their previous victims.

name: Glass Casket
text: Fate will decide whether it's a bed or a tomb.

name: Frenzied Raptor
text:
"Though the road through Raugrin is lined with alarm crystals, some monsters seem to be adapting. We've had raptors feigning attacks on provision caravans, while others try to sneak through the lava curtain."
—Dol, Lavabrink quartermaster

name: Agent of the Fates
text: "You are breathing borrowed air."

name: Soulbright Flamekin
text: When provoked, a flamekin's inner fire burns far hotter than any giant's forge.

name: Carnivorous Plant
text: "It had a mouth like that of a great beast, and gnashed its teeth as it strained to reach us. I am thankful it possessed no means of locomotion." —Vervamon the Elder

name: Eutropia the Twice-Favored
text: Nylea speaks to her in the windblown leaves; Thassa in the rushing tides.

name: Flux
text:
"Every spell has the potential to be worthless."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Munitions Expert
text: When dealing with goblins, if it isn't nailed down, it's headed your way.

name: Roots of Wisdom
text: Though imprisoned in Jaspera trees, the elvish gods known as the Einir still whisper through the ages.

name: Venom
text:
"I told him it was just a flesh wound, but the next time I looked at him, poor Tadhg was dead and gone."
—Maeveen O'Donagh,
*Memoirs of a Soldier*

name: Benthic Behemoth
text:
"Deep devourer concealed in darkhome
Shrouded it seeks all becomes fodder
Once we swam alone and asea
But no more."
—*Rootwater Saga*

name: Tower Defense
text:
"We've been practicing for this all our lives. This is the final test!"
—Korun Nar, Rubblebelt hunter

name: Archetype of Endurance
text: Despite its fearsome stature, it is as elusive as a shadow, circling round to stalk those who presume to hunt it.

name: Squash
text: The troll had recently crushed a human in much the same way. Sadly, he expired too quickly to appreciate the irony.

name: Serra's Blessing
text:
"I have seen your strength imbued in angels' wings, and I have felt your sorrow rain down on the ruins brought by the Lord of the Wastes."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

name: Stonefury
text: Akoum can make any intruder look small.

name: Bone Flute
text: After the Battle of Pitdown, Lady Ursnell fashioned the first such instrument out of Lord Ursnell's left leg.

name: Convalescent Care
text: Enlightenment comes most swiftly at life's end.

name: Bala Ged Recovery // Bala Ged Sanctuary
text:
"I know it's around here somewhere."
—Doral, Bala Ged guide

name: Felidar Cub
text: Felidars that make it through their first year of life can easily live to see a hundred years more.

name: Flametongue Kavu
text:
"For dim-witted, thick-skulled genetic mutants, they have pretty good aim."
—Sisay

name: Decoction Module
text: Progress leads to inspiration.

name: Errand of Duty
text:
"May they speed to their task, for the skyknights alone cannot hold Kjeldor safe."
—Arna Kennerüd, skycaptain

name: Seismic Strike
text:
"Life up here is simple. Adapt to the ways of the mountains and they will reward you. Fight them and they will end you."
—Kezim, prodigal pyromancer

name: Social Climber
text: "It's all about who you know, darling. And now you're lucky enough to know me."

name: Market Festival
text: Commerce is always the basis for peace.

name: Fungal Bloom
text:
"Thallids could absorb energy from the forest itself. Even elves were at a disadvantage in fighting them."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. III*

name: Azorius Guildgate
text: The Azorius symbol stares down like a great eye, reminding visitors of the watchful presence of Isperia and her lawmages.

name: Lens Flare
text: Intent: The spell shows a creature being damaged by powerful rays of light.

name: Sanguine Bond
text:
"Blood is constant. Every drop I drink, someone must bleed."
—Vradeen, vampire nocturnus

name: Taste for Mayhem
text: The taste of blood breaks down what little self-control the Rakdos possess.

name: Western Paladin
text:
"Their weak laws. Their flawed systems. They inhibit the Grand Evolution. In Yawgmoth's name, we shall erase them."
—Oath of the West

name: Unlawful Entry
text:
"Glaxxar, Security Bot 254 has wandered off. After lunch, throw on a spacesuit and go find it."
—Truss, chief engineer.

name: Ambush Krotiq
text: The Abzan merchants soon discovered why this route was clear of dragons.

name: Glorybringer
text: What the initiates face in the final trial is completely at Hazoret's discretion.

name: Into Thin Air
text:
"Perhaps I should take Mirrodin apart and begin again."
—Memnarch

name: Douse in Gloom
text: Orzhov prisoners are steeped in a blackened brew that robs their souls of strength. Patriarchs drink that brew to extend their own lives.

name: Cerulean Wisps
text:
"If you see ghostly lights by the river, eat three twigs of marshroot to ward off kelpies."
—Kithkin superstition

name: Foul Renewal
text: The cycle of life and death is rarely pretty.

name: Tireless Tracker
text:
"Tell me, Muse, of that man, so ready at need, who wandered far and wide."
—Homer, *The Odyssey*

name: Druid of Horns
text: No welcome for those who trespass. Only fang and horn and claw.

name: Fireblade Charger
text: "Down in flames" isn't a destination, but a journey.

name: Infernal Plunge
text: "Oh mighty Griselbrand, Scourge of the Heedless World, gladly I consume myself for thee!"

name: Noggle Bandit
text: Noggles believe that they were the first race ever to walk Shadowmoor. They don't "steal." They just take back what's rightfully theirs.

name: Reassembling Skeleton
text:
"I can't bear to watch these things put themselves back together, Geralf. They remind me of the time you tried to cut your own hair: a tragic abomination!"
—Ghoulcaller Gisa

name: Stoneforge Masterwork
text: The nomadic kor carry only necessities on their long treks. The coming of the Eldrazi redefined "necessities."

name: Thoughtflare
text: "If this is thinking, I don't know what I was doing before."

name: Hana Kami
text: It grew in lands lit by pride and watered by tears.

name: Nyxborn Brute
text:
"One-eyed and frightful, the cyclops
lifted a boulder and hurled it
seaward from cliff's edge, shattering
masts and scattering sailors."
—*The Callapheia*

name: Mortify
text: Many who cross Sorin's path come down with a sudden and fatal case of being-in-the-way-of-a-millennia-old-vampire.

name: Avacyn's Pilgrim
text: "Avacyn's protection is everywhere. From the holy church to the sacred glade, all that we see is under her blessed watch."

name: Blink Dog
text: Blink dogs protect the wild places of the world, driving away evil influences.

name: Inspiring Call
text: The voice of a clamavus commands all who carry the genetic legacy of the Tyranids in their blood.

name: Cinderclasm
text: Every inferno begins with a spark.

name: Firefist Adept
text: The versatile "fiery gauntlet" is among the first spells young Ghitu mages learn.

name: Jeskai Banner
text: Discipline to persevere, insight to discover.

name: Profane Procession // Tomb of the Dusk Rose
text: . . . resting in the splendor of the dead.

name: Thopter Arrest
text: The Consulate's eyes—unblinking, unsleeping—are everywhere.

name: Dramatic Rescue
text:
"I never thought I'd be so glad to see two tons of beak and claws bearing down on me at the speed of an arrow."
—Mirela, Azorius hussar

name: Volcanic Geyser
text:
My thunder comes before the lightning; my lightning comes before the clouds; my rain dries all the land it touches. What am I?
—Femeref riddle

name: Makindi Aeronaut
text: "The Eldrazi have surprised us before. It's my job to make sure that never happens again."

name: Divine Gambit
text:
"Evil is to be unshackled, not slain. Unlock your foe and release the miracle within."
—Keevan, docent of Kollema Hall

name: Towering Baloth
text: The Mirari twisted all that lived in the Krosan Forest into gross mockeries of their former selves.

name: Thorncaster Sliver
text: Every inch of a sliver's body is a potential claw, appendage, or projectile.

name: Heartwood Shard
text: Like all other relics, it was left on the Radix by the elves to be destroyed. Unlike all other relics, it persisted.

name: Alpine Watchdog
text:
"On the eighth day, a blizzard hit. Supplies were lost, and morale plummeted. On the ninth day, Dover found us."
—*To the Summit: A Tale of Survival*

name: Font of Return
text: Drink deep, and death will recoil from you.

name: Arenson's Aura
text:
"Cloak me in mystery, hide my names from my enemies, and let me draw from the well of power."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Agent of Treachery
text: "The more secrets you have, the more easily you become my pawn."

name: Beast Hunt
text:
"Surely we could tame something besides hurdas and pillarfield oxen!"
—Sheyda, Ondu gamekeeper

name: Infernal Darkness
text:
"I thought the day had brought enough horrors for our ragged band, but the night was far worse."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Triskelion
text:
"What's got three legs and three heads and wants to kill us? That's not a riddle!"
—Jayeen, Fallaji scout

name: Weldfast Engineer
text: "Let's err on the side of glorious mayhem."

name: Mesa Enchantress
text: "Scholars seek to understand the way the world is. I wish to shape the world into what it should be."

name: Bad Ass
text: He wanders the land in search of Good Ass.

name: Eldrazi Mimic
text: It is consistently inconsistent.

name: Razor Pendulum
text:
"Amazing thing, gravity. It seems to work every time."
—Telim'Tor

name: Whirlpool Rider
text: Where the wind meets the water, change is inevitable.

name: Overwhelming Instinct
text: The biggest difference between a victory and a massacre is which side you're on.

name: Dwarven Patrol
text: Dwarves never worry about who watches their backs.

name: Technomancer
text:
"Witchcraft or technology, it is blasphemous, and it must be stopped."
—Inquisitor Greyfax

name: Nim Lasher
text: The rotting metal feeds the necrogen mists, and in turn the mists feed the nim.

name: Angelic Blessing
text: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.

name: Sinister Strength
text:
"I bless the living with a song of death."
—Lord Dralnu

name: Behold the Multiverse
text: Countless worlds unfolded before Niko, every one in need of heroes.

name: Wall of Faith
text:
"This is a fine suit, armorsmith. I will be safe from harm. If only you could forge rings to mail the rest of my people . . ."
—Lord Hilneth

name: Wooded Ridgeline
text: The power of long-forgotten empires still pulses in the earth of Dominaria, giving rise to strange, mana-rich pockets of growth.

name: Lore Seeker
text: Each volume contains wonders.

name: Prickleboar
text:
"Canyons in the Phoberos badlands are essentially gates to the Underworld."
—Mirinthes, Akroan captain

name: Barrage Tyrant
text: Terrible fury. Excellent aim.

name: Orochi Leafcaller
text: "Only orochi hatched from eggs 'touched by the kami' may become shamans. These days, there are fewer and fewer new shamans being born."

name: Goblin Grenadiers
text: For once, Squee realized, *he* wasn't the dumb one.

name: Thresher Lizard
text: The sound of its plated tail beating on desert rocks is often mistaken for the footfalls of a much larger predator.

name: Revelation
text: "Many are in high place, and of renown: but mysteries are revealed unto the meek." —Ecclesiasticus 3:19

name: Cloudkill
text: As the acrid fumes drifted through the Lower City, even the vermin ceased to stir.

name: The Hive
text:
"Their buzzing makes my bones hum from a mile away."
—Galenti, treasure hunter

name: Quicken
text: A skilled Izzet Chronarch can carry out an epic vendetta between the fall of one hourglass grain and the next.

name: Jwari Scuttler
text:
"Yeah, they've got a lot of meat. The only downside to eating 'em is that you often find human bones and body parts inside."
—Jaby, Silundi Sea nomad

name: Mystic Familiar
text: They soar, and the mystics follow.

name: Emperor Crocodile
text: The king of Yavimaya's waters pays constant attention to his subjects . . . and thrives on their adulation.

name: Rest in Peace
text: Some corpses the Golgari cannot claim. Some souls the Orzhov cannot shackle.

name: Skull Collector
text: "Your blood I'll use. Your skull I'll keep."

name: Fleetfeather Sandals
text:
"The gods gave us no wings to fly, but they gave us an even greater gift: imagination."
—Daxos of Meletis

name: Dark Salvation
text: Countless ghouls surged through Thraben's streets, and with them came the city's salvation.

name: Oketra's Avenger
text: "Oketra's arrow is my spear, and her love my shield."

name: Sidar Jabari
text:
"Prophecy is whatever one makes of it, but destiny cannot be changed."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Ghost Warden
text:
"I thought of fate as an iron lattice, intricate but rigidly unchangeable. That was until some force bent fate's bars to spare my life."
—Ilromov, traveling storyteller

name: Junktroller
text:
"Hey, wait! That's my boot!"
—Darijo, Ivy Street ruffian

name: Infernal Kirin
text: The kirin bellowed—an echoing, twisted parody of its once-inspirational call.

name: Gatherer of Graces
text: "Garb is for common folk. I prefer to wear insight and zeal, ambition and flame."

name: Fists of Flame
text:
"Fire has always been my most faithful companion."
—Jared Carthalion

name: Blaze
text: "Spreading flames illumined cloud and sea: Cao Cao went down; 'twas Zhou Yu's victory."

name: Boompile
text:
"Fuses? We have more than enough! Now . . . which one was it?"
—Flearan One-Eye, goblin engineer

name: Runeboggle
text:
"Ever try to count hyperactive schoolchildren while someone shouts random numbers in your ear? It's like that."
—Geetra, frustrated mage

name: Voltaic Servant
text: A missing piece in search of a puzzle.

name: Mystic Repeal
text:
"No power is too great to be undone."
—Karametra, god of harvests

name: Dragon Fodder
text: Goblins journey to the sacrificial peaks in pairs so that the rare survivor might be able to relate the details of the other's grisly demise.

name: Opportunity
text:
"He cocooned himself alone in his workshop for months. When he finally emerged, all broad grins and excited chatter, I knew he'd found his answer."
—Barrin, master wizard

name: Lila, Hospitality Hostess
text: As far as Lila was concerned, all courtesy should be common.

name: Zephyr Scribe
text:
"Ojutai's rule has allowed Tarkir's monks to learn from the truly enlightened."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Defiant Khenra
text: There were those who saw the death of the gods and the city's collapse as a final test of worth. Some believed it meant the God-Pharaoh had been killed. Only a few realized they had been deceived.

name: Craterize
text:
"'Utterly' is my favorite way to destroy something."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Juri, Master of the Revue
text: "Sure, the invasion was violent, but where was the beauty? As an artist, I had to intervene."

name: Rage Weaver
text: "Let my passion spur your victory."

name: Arms Dealer
text: He has the weapons, he has the connections, and he knows the hangar's dark secret.

name: Ignorant Bliss
text:
"A quick step beyond oblivion lies a place so full of thoughts that it leaves no room for your own."
—Quyzl, chronarch prodigy

name: Essence Scatter
text:
"Phyrexians pollute everything they touch, so the solution is simple: don't let them touch anything."
—Teferi

name: Soul Sear
text: There was no witty retort, no confident boast to accompany the attack. There was only pain.

name: Vanish into Memory
text: Out of sight, into mind.

name: Wildheart Invoker
text:
"Life as we know it dangles on the brink of extinction. We must show the strength they would steal from us."
—*The Invokers' Tales*

name: Honor's Reward
text: It seldom rains in Abzan lands. When it does, the khan marks the occasion by honoring the families of the fallen.

name: Hero's Demise
text:
"What will it say on our graves, Lord Konda? Will it say we led our world to conquer immortal forces or that we were crushed by our own arrogance? At each defeat, I wonder."
—Sensei Hisoka, letter to Lord Konda

name: Mana Geode
text:
"I don't care if it's an all-powerful relic or a street vendor's lucky charm. If it brings you courage, wear it."
—Saheeli Rai

name: Naturalize
text:
"Nature does not need adornment."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Zur the Enchanter
text: Zur remained aloof from Terisiare's suffering, intent only on his own perfection.

name: Hallowed Fountain
text: The ever-watchful center of a growing web of eyes.

name: Wirewood Pride
text: "Though you may leave this haven we have found, may our strength never leave you."

name: Sensory Deprivation
text: They call it "stitcher's anesthesia," a spell to deaden the senses while the mad doctors begin their grisly work.

name: Sentinel Spider
text:
"Your first reaction may be to stand very still and hope she didn't see you. Trust me, she did."
—Endril, Kalonian naturalist

name: Khenra Spellspear // Gitaxian Spellstalker
text:
"Bolas's methods were crude and inefficient, taking generations to refine the population into a reliable source of combat units. Still, it offers us something of a head start."
—Jin-Gitaxias

name: Warmonger's Chariot
text: The best defense is a good offense.

name: Dragon Cultist
text: You know that mighty dracoliches will one day rule over this world. For you, that day can't come soon enough.

name: Obelisk of Bant
text: Whether incorporated into the structure of castles or admired as lone symbols, the obelisks stand for Bant's values of loyalty, honor, and truth.

name: Advance Scout
text:
"The soldier's path is worn smooth by the tread of many feet—all in one direction, none returning."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Titan's Strength
text: "One last push, and then my task is done."

name: Steelgaze Griffin
text:
"If we didn't guard our secrets, they wouldn't remain secrets for long."
—Gadwick, the Wizened

name: Conifer Wurm
text: During seasonal thaws, the wurms slough their skin against trees to promote growth.

name: Stone Quarry
text: The bedrock has many gifts to give.

name: Fireborn Knight
text: He endured the white-hot blaze of the Circle and the sweltering heat of the Irencrag, and he emerged victorious.

name: Whispersilk Cloak
text: Such cloaks are in high demand both by assassins and by those who fear them.

name: Courier Hawk
text: The Orzhov started using hawks as messengers in order to bypass the many toll roads and bridges that dot Ravnica. Soon the service became one of their most profitable businesses.

name: Convolute
text:
"There's no sense arguing with insanity."
—Levana, Midnight Duelist

name: Diabolic Edict
text:
"Always give your foes a choice when they have none."
—Ob Nixilis

name: Teferi's Curse
text:
"Stepping through time is like riding a camel. It may get you where you want to go, but the ride is rarely pleasant."
—Teferi

name: Blossom Dryad
text: The only force on Ixalan not interested in finding the golden city is Ixalan itself.

name: Crystal Slipper
text:
"After the death of her mother, Cassia found that things that appear fragile can be very strong indeed."
—*Beyond the Great Henge*

name: Stonehorn Chanter
text: With the Stonehorn, piety and power are one.

name: Coalition Warbrute
text: Anger is his greatest weapon, and he sharpens it daily.

name: Orcish Spy
text:
"Yeah, they're ugly, they desert in droves, and their personal habits are enough to make you sick. But I'll say this for Orcs: they make great spies."
—Ivra Jursdotter

name: Bloodcrazed Paladin
text: When a paladin undertaking the Blood Fast finally gives in to hunger, the violence is sudden, explosive, and complete.

name: Trash Bin
text: Standing knee-deep in unsorted Astrotorium garbage, Gurnt couldn't help but feel his trip was finally starting to turn around.

name: Loxodon Stalwart
text: Long ago, the Auriok attempted peace with the loxodons. The leonin attempted war. Neither succeeded.

name: Darksteel Juggernaut
text: One part unstoppable force, one part immovable object.

name: Leaping Master
text: "Strength batters down barriers. Discipline ignores them."

name: Swift Reconfiguration
text: On the bright side, the bear now had cupholders.

name: Rotcrown Ghoul
text:
"Don't look into its eyes. It's thinking things no dead thing should think."
—Captain Eberhart

name: Aeronaut Tinkerer
text: Magic.Wizards.com

name: Grizzled Angler // Grisly Anglerfish
text: ". . . it's that the lure of the sea is impossible to ignore."

name: Pirate's Pillage
text: Goblins can carry their body weight in loot.

name: Unstoppable Ogre
text: Touma never met a door he didn't hate.

name: Gilt-Leaf Palace
text: Dawn's Light, greatest palace of Gilt-Leaf Wood, is built on tiers of wood and power.

name: Underworld Dreams
text: "In the drowsy dark cave of the mind dreams build their nest with fragments dropped from day's caravan." —Rabindranath Tagore

name: Silvercoat Lion
text:
"In the wild, white fur like mine is an aberration. We lack natural camouflage, but the inability to hide encourages other strengths."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Rubblebelt Maaka
text:
"The maaka remain loyal to us in this time of strife. We don't even have to feed them—our enemies do."
—Nedja, Gruul shaman

name: Risen Riptide
text:
"Most days the sea is my friend. But only most days."
—Jori En, expedition leader

name: Thunder Drake
text: The arrival of the Planar Bridge caused eddies in the aether, creating some entirely new species while transforming others.

name: Visions
text:
"Visions of glory, spare my aching sight,
Ye unborn ages, crowd not on my soul!"
—Thomas Gray, "The Bard"

name: Brainstorm
text:
"I reeled from the blow, and then suddenly, I knew exactly what to do. Within moments victory was mine."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter
Kjeldoran royal mage

name: Smoldering Butcher
text: A cinder's axe bears no marks from parrying a foe's blade.

name: Barbed-Back Wurm
text:
"The Mwonvuli Jungle has given the darkness teeth for tearing the gift of life from the weak."
—Jolrael

name: Crimson Manticore
text: Manticores divide all beings into two categories: other manticores and dinner.

name: Skeletal Grimace
text:
"And then I realized we all have skeletons on the inside. Why wait until the bodies are dead to control them?"
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

name: Dragon Bell Monk
text: He has spent years training his eyes and ears to detect the subtle signs of a dragon's approach.

name: Aphotic Wisps
text: Merrows skulk the silty bogs around the Wanderbrine, their very thoughts stained with evil.

name: Demolish
text: Most came to Ghirapur for the Fair. Gremlins came for the feast.

name: Marshmist Titan
text: A favorite of Erebos, for it has sent many to the Underworld.

name: Twilight Panther
text: A pet that can hunt both flesh and spirit is precious in a place where smiling assassins keep company with ghostly shadows.

name: Stingmoggie
text: A path vexed by the stingmoggie was probably the wrong path anyhow.

name: Raven's Crime
text: It plucks away memories like choice bits of carrion.

name: Rootwater Diver
text:
"Drop a dagger into the murky deep and the merfolk will cut your throat with it."
—Skyshroud saying

name: Disciple of Malice
text: The lantern he carried did not light his way—it signaled his approach.

name: Regrowth
text:
"Centuries of war had broken Arcavios, but a single seed began the long process of renewal."
—*The Mystic Age: A Saga of Spells*

name: Flames of the Firebrand
text:
"You're in luck. I brought enough to share."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Demon of Catastrophes
text: A pit yawned open, a column of oily smoke arose, and a towering form hissed, "I accept this offering."

name: Chandra's Spitfire
text: "I've lit most everything on fire—trees, rocks, even the water. Now it's time to burn the clouds."

name: Silent Observer
text: It's not just a feeling—you *are* being watched.

name: Kelinore Bat
text: The nesting bats of Kelinore sleep soundly while the sun passes, nestled among their grisly collections.

name: Planar Ally
text: Her light touches every corner and her wings brush either wall, leaving no place for evil to lurk.

name: Citywatch Sphinx
text: All those who trade in questions must answer to the Dimir.

name: The Mighty Will Fall
text: "Cry out for your comrades so that they may join you in misery."

name: Aerial Guide
text:
"Kefnet taught us to turn obstacles into advantages."
—Neponem, vizier of Kefnet

name: Brand
text:
"By this glyph I affirm your role."
—Urza, to Karn

name: Stun
text:
"Fortunately, merfolk aren't used to opponents with feet."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Shadowstorm Vizier
text: She can coil a breeze like a string around her finger—or twist it into a noose.

name: Lion's Eye Diamond
text:
Held in the lion's eye
—Zhalfirin saying meaning "caught in the moment of crisis"

name: Anaba Shaman
text: Just try taking *this* bull by the horns.

name: Reya Dawnbringer
text: "You have not died until I consent."

name: Main Event Horizon
text: "Anna and Blaine said the ride was awesome. Yolanda and Zachary aren't back yet."

name: Enter the Infinite
text: There is no knowledge that is not power.

name: Esika, God of the Tree // The Prismatic Bridge
text: "I know this world, from canopy to roots."

name: Temur Sabertooth
text: The Temur see themselves as a pack, their bonds more primal than the Abzan's.

name: Fork in the Road
text:
"This is as far as I go."
—Beckram, Skiltfolk escort

name: Evra, Halcyon Witness
text:
"Light from the Null Moon took form—a mirage made real, alone in grandeur, isolated in a world that once had been its own."
—*Fall of the Thran*

name: Temp of the Damned
text: "Not the graveyard shift again!"

name: Nest Robber
text:
"These sailors on our shores are like the dinosaurs that plunder eggs from nests. They live on the labors of others."
—Itzama the Crested

name: Stifle
text:
"Superior force meets woefully inadequate object. What paradox were you expecting?"
—Azguri, archmage of Evos Isle

name: Knight of the Kitchen Sink
text: "Whew. For a minute, I thought I'd forgotten the olive forks."

name: Spark Jolt
text: Acolytes of Purphoros hammer the world until they see the sparks of change.

name: Thrull Surgeon
text: "Just take a little off the top."

name: Lightning Shrieker
text: Dragonslayers learned to keep silent about their deeds after seeing the terrible vengeance wrought by Kolaghan and her brood.

name: Plains
text: Seeking to learn why the ancestors have fallen silent, you've made your way to their ancient cairns.

name: Apothecary Geist
text: For some customers, the old apothecary shop still opens its doors.

name: Commander's Sphere
text: The arcane sphere that hovers near Magnus's staff imbues it with the power to transform enemies into mindless chaos spawn.

name: Gruul Cluestone
text: Forgotten under rocks and vines, Gruul symbols mark the sites of primitive rituals where shamans once chanted to the wild.

name: Guttural Response
text: A savage cry with the power to shatter minds.

name: Priest of Titania
text: Titania rewards all who honor the forest by making them a living part of it.

name: Wildfire Emissary
text:
"The efreet is a striding storm with a voice that crackles like fire."
—Qhattib, vizier of Amiqat

name: Fortifying Provisions
text: "To the king, to the Circle, and to the realm! And to not dying."

name: Deadly Insect
text:
"There is no time for pain when this beast leaves its terrible sting."
—Jaeuhl Carthalion, Juniper Order Advocate

name: Kindred Discovery
text: A family that welcomes birds of all feathers.

name: Angel of Flight Alabaster
text: She endures without Avacyn but secretly asks each soul she guides if it has seen her.

name: Eldrazi Conscription
text: The barest taste of Eldrazi power shatters both realms and identities.

name: Debtor's Pulpit
text:
"You may not be able to pay. But you can still kneel."
—Milana, Orzhov prelate

name: High Tide
text:
"By the time their enemies noticed the sea's changing mood, the Vodalians had often shifted formation and were ready to attack."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. V*

name: Savannah
text: 2017 North American Legacy Champion

name: Dragon Blood
text: Fire in the blood, fire in the belly.

name: Thrill of Possibility
text:
「何ができるかという可能性に心が揺さぶられないなら、なぜストリクスヘイヴンに来たのか？」
—-プリズマリの学部長、ナサーリ

name: Black Cat
text: Its last life is spent tormenting your dreams.

name: Savannah Lions
text:
Even the brave are scared by a lion three times: first by its tracks, again by its roar, and one last time face to face.
—Somali proverb

name: Shower of Sparks
text: The viashino had learned how to operate the rig through trial and error—mostly error.

name: Absolute Grace
text: In pursuit of Urza, the Phyrexians sent countless foul legions into Serra's realm. Though beaten back, they left it tainted with uncleansable evil.

name: Rumbling Aftershocks
text:
"I like it here. You always get a little more for your mana."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Ohran Yeti
text: When a snowdrift shows you its eyes, it's already too late.

name: Diver Skaab
text: It doesn't need to breathe, but the suit does help keep the parts together.

name: Sigil of the Empty Throne
text: When Asha left Bant, she ensured that the world would have protection and order in her absence.

name: Ruthless Cullblade
text: She wields a blade as bloodthirsty and elegant as herself.

name: Town Gossipmonger // Incited Rabble
text: "You'll never believe what I heard."

name: Tamiyo's Safekeeping
text: To keep the Reality Chip out of Jin-Gitaxias's hands, the Wanderer entrusted it to Tamiyo.

name: Frantic Purification
text: By definition, madness ends in one of two ways: clarity . . . or death.

name: Nim Shambler
text: Called "the Dross" by its inhabitants, Mephidross is home to the nim, Mirrodin's mindless, ravenous undead.

name: Control Magic
text:
"Do as I think, not as I do."
—Jace Beleren

name: Knight in _____ Armor
text: The lucky armor stopped lightning and lasers, but sadly, also love.

name: Nimana Skydancer
text: The Free City of Nimana is a great place to recruit adventurers with shady skill sets.

name: Desert Drake
text: Never doubt a dragon just because of its size.

name: Ambush Party
text:
"The roads to Koskun Keep are mostly safe these days. Mostly."
—Joskun, An-Havva Constable

name: Sculpting Steel
text:
"Based on his early work with primal clay, Tawnos refined the rare metals in the earth into self-assembling strands."
—*After the War*

name: Meltdown
text: Catastrophes happened so often at the mana rig that the viashino language had a special word to describe them.

name: Patriar's Seal
text: Only a fool ignores a letter bearing the official mark of a patriar family.

name: Diving Griffin
text:
To outrace the griffin
—Kipamu expression meaning "to do the impossible"

name: Urborg Syphon-Mage
text: "I have become a gourmet of sorts. Each soul has its own distinctive flavor. The art is in inviting the right company to the feast."

name: Lace with Moonglove
text:
"Which is more filled with poison: the flower of the moonglove or the minds of elves?"
—Vessifrus, flamekin demagogue

name: Syndicate Enforcer
text: Even the darkest corners of Ravnica still lie in the shadow of the Church.

name: Predator's Howl
text:
"And Muzzio says my arguments have no teeth."
—Selvala, ranger of the Lowlands

name: Whitesun's Passage
text: All over the Razor Fields, Whitesun is celebrated. Even the followers of the rebel Juryan, far from the Cave of Light, bow their heads in reverence.

name: Decisive Denial
text: "I've heard enough."

name: Vile Rebirth
text: Grave robbers digging down cautiously listen for anything digging up.

name: Zodiac Dragon
text: ". . . The kingdoms three are now the stuff of dream,/ For men to ponder, past all praise or blame."

name: Worship
text:
"Believe in the ideal, not the idol."
—Serra

name: Painful Quandary
text:
"For each word spoken, one forgotten. For each thought, a memory rotten."
—Moriok incantation

name: Fyndhorn Bow
text:
"With a bow like this, the hunting is always good."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

name: Chitinous Cloak
text:
"If we're going to survive, we have to use every tool at our disposal. Especially the disgusting ones."
—Ryza, Oran-Rief scout

name: Wings of the Guard
text: Within the city walls, Adriana's falcons hunt vermin of all kinds.

name: Reality Smasher
text: New perspectives are often fleeting.

name: Forest
text: As you venture deeper under the boughs of Neverwinter Wood, arrows in a tree trunk suggest you might not be welcome.

name: Bronze Sword
text: Every strike of the smith's hammer infuses a sword with the determination of its creator.

name: Akoum Flameseeker
text: In the face of extinction, the most perilous endeavors can be cause for hope.

name: Brilliant Plan
text: A heaven-sent vision is like a lantern to guide the way.

name: Dark Bargain
text: "I have pustules of the great Ratadrabik, very cheap. No? Surely you'll want a tincture of Nevinyrral's pulverized remains. Genuine!"

name: Colossal Badger // Dig Deep
text: Rip through enough dirt and you'll eventually find something edible.

name: Ixalan's Binding
text: Jace awoke to the certainty that he was lost.

name: Goblin Grenade
text:
"I don't suppose we could teach them to *throw* the cursed things?"
—Ivra Jursdotter

name: Tezzeret's Betrayal
text:
"You can't hope to comprehend the plans that are in motion."
—Tezzeret

name: Ulcerate
text:
"If it were merely lethal, that would be sufficient. The art, however, is in maximizing the suffering it causes."
—Liliana Vess

name: Plated Crusher
text:
"It might fight the Eldrazi, but don't mistake it for a companion, Gideon. It's not interested in your concept of strength through unity."
—Najiya, leader of the Tajuru

name: Aven Sentry
text: "My flock flew from a distant continent ruined by cataclysm and war. Benalia gave us shelter to end our exodus."

name: Violent Impact
text: Initiates in the heat of combat must be able to adapt to changing conditions.

name: Spinnerette, Arachnobat
text: High-wire injuries are down 95%. Spider-related injuries are up 3000%.

name: Soul Warden
text:
Count carefully the souls and see that none are lost.
—Vec teaching

name: Eastern Paladin
text:
"There is no worse enemy. His passion for death doesn't just border on insanity, it wallows in it."
—The Southern Paladin

name: Chilling Trap
text:
"Serves you right for rushing ahead."
—Kaliea, Sea Gate trapfinder

name: Blaster Mage
text: "Don't get up. I'll show myself out."

name: Marauder's Axe
text: A sharp axe solves most problems.

name: Mass Calcify
text: The dead serve as their own tombstones.

name: Horizon Chimera
text:
"Do not try to make sense of the chimera. Impossibility is its habitat."
—Kydele, prophet of Kruphix

name: Militant Inquisitor
text: "I am an instrument of the church wielded against Avacyn's enemies."

name: Charismatic Vanguard
text: "This battlefield is an anvil, my mace a forging hammer . . . and you, Phyrexian scum, are the scrap metal that's about to be reshaped as I see fit."

name: Stealth Mission
text:
"What they don't know will definitely hurt them."
—Lazav

name: Castle
text:
". . . Our castle's strength
Will laugh a siege to scorn."
—William Shakespeare,
*Macbeth*

name: Valorous Steed
text: A unicorn chooses only the most virtuous and noble of knights to be its companion.

name: Sealed Fate
text: It's good to know more about your enemy's fate than your enemy does.

name: Pearled Unicorn
text:
"'Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!' 'Well, now that we *have* seen each other,' said the Unicorn, 'if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'"
—Lewis Carroll

name: Oracle
text: Known simply by her title, Oracle uses her gift of prophecy to aid her people. She believes Gerrard to be the *Korvecdal*, the one who will unite the people of Rath against Volrath's tyranny. Her only doubt is whether she will be strong enough to guide him to his destiny.

name: Flanking Troops
text: Following the battle of Redcliffs, both Liu Bei and Sun Quan coveted the province of Jingzhou. After Sun Quan's troops failed to capture it, Liu Bei's succeeded.

name: Fierce Invocation
text: Anger can empower those who embrace it.

name: Arjun, the Shifting Flame
text: He speaks directly into his supplicants' minds using fiery words that inflame their thoughts and incite their passions.

name: Blistering Dieflyn
text: Any kithkin smith would love to catch a dieflyn for her kiln, relieving her of ever having to gather fuel again.

name: The Council of Four
text: Ambition has a price in Baldur's Gate, and it is paid to the Council.

name: Morality Shift
text: The mind sings, though at times it sings a dirge.

name: Jukai Trainee
text: "The Order of Jukai accepts only the strongest of body and spirit. I will train until I meet their expectations."

name: Summary Judgment
text: Any challenge to Azorius authority is met with swift and potent retribution.

name: Soul Reap
text: Their thoughtweft carried Darial's last thoughts back to his doun. They sorely wished it had not.

name: Greater Werewolf
text:
"Two legs by day, four legs by night, eyes raging in storm-gotten might."
—Ancient Northland riddle

name: Keeper of Secrets
text: To look upon one is to surrender every last shred of self-will.

name: Time Warp
text: Just when you thought you'd survived the first wave.

name: Merfolk Looter
text: When you sink a lot of ships, it's easy to find sunken treasure.

name: Everbark Shaman
text: "May you rise again, from seed to sapling to sentience."

name: Herald of Kozilek
text:
"Some Eldrazi, their purpose is obvious: suck the life out of the land, birth new Eldrazi. Others aren't so obvious, and those are the ones that make me really nervous."
—Chadir the Navigator

name: Synthetic Destiny
text: To Jin-Gitaxias, perfection is not a goal, but a process.

name: Animist's Might
text: The creature was unlike any Nissa had seen, but she dealt with it as she would any threat.

name: Mavren Fein, Dusk Apostle
text: In the rapture of his Blood Fast, he destroyed the navigator's tools and steered the ship to shore by faith alone.

name: Krosan Avenger
text: She'd have a fearsome reputation if she left any survivors.

name: Indomitable Will
text:
"Charge bravely. Fight selflessly. Act honorably. Iroas will watch over you."
—Verenis, priest of Iroas

name: Hellish Rebuke
text: "Then we burn together!"

name: Sleep
text:
"I give them dreams so wondrous that they hesitate to return to the world of the conscious."
—Garild, merfolk mage

name: Greenwheel Liberator
text: "I will not rest until every vestige of the Consulate—every banner, flag, and standard—has fallen."

name: Seeker of Insight
text: The Trial of Knowledge challenges and broadens the minds of initiates.

name: Shatter
