text: Days of planning. Weeks of building. Months of perfecting. Seconds of smashing.

name: Telepathy
text:
"The most disappointing thing about learning telepathy is finding out how boring people really are."
—Teferi, fourth-level student

name: Yavimaya Coast
text: As magnigoth trees expanded across the sea into Almaaz and New Argive, it became clear Yavimaya's borders were never confined by its coastline.

name: Storm Spirit
text:
"Come to us, with your lightning. Come to us, with your thunder. Serve us with your strength, and smite our foes with your power."
—Steinar Icefist, Balduvian Shaman

name: Territorial Baloth
text: Its territory is defined by wherever it is at the moment.

name: Goblin Soothsayer
text:
"I see a great victory and rivers of blood. And . . . hmm, looks like a spleen."
—Grishnak, goblin soothsayer

name: Mutual Destruction
text: Hunter and hunted both died thinking they had outwitted the other.

name: Kobolds of Kher Keep
text: Kher Keep is unique among fortresses: impervious to aerial assault but defenseless from the ground.

name: Tournament Grounds
text: No one knows when the tournament began. All they know is that it will never end.

name: Containment Priest
text: Some protection requires a bit of finesse.

name: Pavel Maliki
text: We all know the legend: Pavel wanders the realms, helping those in greatest need. But is this a measure of his generosity, or of his obligation to atone?

name: Granny's Payback
text:
R&D Comments
BB 10/10: Why does a life-gaining card show an old lady killing people?
MR (10/10/03): We'll fix it in the flavor text.

name: Silver Erne
text:
"I've seen a larger Erne knock a Giant to the ground and stay airborne. They move not with the wind, but as the wind."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

name: Cradle Guard
text: Mother, sleep / Dream our lives Our roots your soul / Our leaves your bed.

name: Screaming Shield
text: Shhh . . .

name: Oxidda Daredevil
text: His goggles spattered with grime and his mouth full of bugs, he tossed the engines another priceless relic.

name: Streetwise Negotiator
text: Like the laws, the rules of engagement always seem to bend in the Brokers' favor.

name: Strength of Cedars
text:
"No sooner had the beast collapsed under the blows of Takeno's sword than the earth rippled and the creature rose again to face him."
—*Battle of Akagi River: A Survivor's Tale*

name: Iridian Maelstrom
text: A thousand years ago, Phyrexia poisoned Serra's Realm and engineered its collapse. On shimmering waves generations in the making, the angels finally took their revenge.

name: Stenchskipper
text:
"Many believe it to be the manifestation of all that is vile about the boggarts. I believe it should be avoided—from upwind, if possible."
—Cenn Deagan

name: Rhystic Syphon
text: Jamuraan wizards are linked together by magic, a bond that only the wicked dare exploit.

name: Reckless Scholar
text: "Any good prospector must sift the gold from the sand."

name: Soltari Crusader
text:
"Carry war to the Dauthi, no matter the way, no matter the world."
—Soltari battle chant

name: Blinding Spray
text:
"The stronger our enemies seem, the more vulnerable they are."
—Sultai secret

name: Ecstatic Awakener // Awoken Demon
text: "Great Ormendahl, I kneel before you, a fragment of your will, a servant of your tyrrany. I beg you, release the strength within me!"

name: Herald of Faith
text: The clerics prayed for salvation. The soldiers prayed for victory. Both prayers were answered.

name: Briarknit Kami
text: One thorn to warn, ten thorns to defend, a hundred thorns to destroy.

name: Molten Frame
text: The metal filigree in his body glowed red-hot, and his flesh soon followed.

name: Consulate Crackdown
text:
"The workshops are silent. Our creations have been seized. They have killed what made us alive."
—Pia Nalaar

name: Gloom Surgeon
text: He roams the streets of Havengul seeking the sick and delirious so that he may cure them of their lives.

name: Monkey Monkey Monkey
text: Many matches make more madcap monkey mayhem.

name: Kithkin Daggerdare
text: The kith dance their elaborate reels not merely to celebrate the events of their lives but to form an unbreakable bond of loyalty with their kin, a bond stronger than the fear of death itself.

name: Trygon Prime
text: The walls of the Necron tomb were unbreakable. The ground beneath it was not.

name: Capashen Unicorn
text: Capashen riders were stern and humorless even before their ancestral home was reduced to rubble.

name: Nosy Goblin
text: To his surprise, Furt discovered that the strange creatures were not at all like bugs.

name: Frightful Delusion
text: Whether he actually exists is in question, but the terror she feels is excruciatingly real.

name: Rushwood Dryad
text: To a dryad, every tree in the forest is both a doorway and a window.

name: Slither Blade
text: Some naga initiates move as silently as the suns' reflections on the water.

name: Detonate
text: The goblins have forty-two different words for "ow."

name: Inspired Charge
text: One dwarf on a build team ensures competence. All dwarves on the team ensures brilliance.

name: Indestructibility
text: "By all means, keep trying."

name: Fire Snake
text: The snake's final thrashings only spread the fire within it.

name: Incorrigible Youths
text:
"Ah, to be young again."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Youthful Knight
text:
"In the wilds, your true training will begin."
—Syr Alin, the Lion's Claw

name: Stone Haven Outfitter
text: The makers and menders are the first called to battle and the last to leave.

name: Norika Yamazaki, the Poet
text: "The blades will have their say, but peace is built with words."

name: Enlightened Tutor
text: The path offered by the academy is long and difficult, but those who brave it arrive at wisdom beyond compare.

name: Molten Ravager
text:
"Only the foolhardy would venture into the Akoum Mountains without a lullmage to tame the raging rocks and living fires."
—Sachir, Akoum Expeditionary House

name: Lava Axe
text: "Catch!"

name: Temple Acolyte
text: Young, yes. Inexperienced, yes. Weak? Don't count on it.

name: Elvish Guidance
text: "Old home never forgotten, new home ours forever."

name: Stampeding Rhino
text:
"Sometimes I wonder if our weapons and armor are a step backward."
—Soron, rhox pikemaster

name: Resolute Reinforcements
text: Morale rarely survives the sudden appearance of a squad of Sursi skirmishers at an army's flank.

name: Prismatic Vista
text: There is beauty in the uncertainty of potential.

name: Kamahl, Pit Fighter
text: "I didn't come to play. I came to win."

name: Rimeshield Frost Giant
text: Frost giants carry the trophies of their greatest victories into battle, fashioned into armor of strength and savage beauty.

name: Malevolent Awakening
text: The most popular pit fighters are brought back for encore performances.

name: Dross Golem
text: The longer it skulks through the corrosive gases of Mephidross, the more it adopts their thirst for death.

name: Bravado
text:
"We drive the dragons from our home. Why should we fear you?"
—Fire Eye, viashino bey

name: Zephyr Charge
text:
"The knights charged forward on wings of wind, and the necromancer's horde roared in helpless rage."
—Krinnea, *Siege of the Bone Spire*

name: Dusk Imp
text: Imps are just intelligent enough to have an understanding of cruelty.

name: Gibbering Hyenas
text:
Hyenas laughing—what's the joke?
—Femeref phrase meaning "that's not funny"

name: Thrun, the Last Troll
text: His crime was silence, and now he suffers it eternally.

name: Fortress Crab
text: Unbreakable and unappetizing, the crab grows uninterrupted, sometimes to the size of a cottage and beyond.

name: Smothering Tithe
text: A witch once foretold that Glavin would die surrounded by unimaginable wealth. Until that moment, he'd taken that to mean he'd be rich.

name: Goblin Welder
text: "I wrecked your metal guy, boss. But look! I made you an ashtray."

name: Vedalken Engineer
text: Art is unknown to the vedalken—for them, all creations must serve a purpose.

name: Roots of All Evil
text: "I assure you, these are not the kind that thrive on sunlight and water."

name: Aspirant's Ascent
text: For the aspirants of the Progress Engine, being launched into the sphere's upper reaches is a great honor. Some are even granted wings beforehand.

name: Orzhov Signet
text: The form of the sigil is just as important as the sigil itself. If it's carried on a medallion, its bearer is a master. If it's tattooed on the body, its bearer is a slave.

name: Foundry Hornet
text: Its buzzing is easily mistaken for the hum of a thopter's wings.

name: Contaminated Ground
text:
"The Na Plateau is lost. Do not ask what happened, and never return there."
—Nirthu, lone missionary

name: Call to Glory
text:
"General Takeno glared at us as if we were the enemy. 'The day is not over yet,' he shouted, 'and unless you have a nezumi's heart, you *will* stand and fight!'"
—*Battle of Akagi River: A Survivor's Tale*

name: Takeno's Cavalry
text: At night he perfected his aim, shooting spiderwebs by starlight.

name: Aim High
text:
"A slayer gets by on wits and reflexes."
—Higa, slayer-captain of Gatstaf

name: Zzzyxas's Abyss
text: Tired of always being picked last, the wizard Zzzyxas created the ultimate revenge.

name: Salvaged Manaworker
text:
"When weapons of war are repurposed for peaceful ends, you know society has advanced."
—Jodah

name: Frenzied Rage
text:
"The heat in our hearts sometimes rises to the surface."
—Valduk, keeper of the Flame

name: Tanglebloom
text: Druids converted swaths of the Tangle into tanglebloom orchards. Though heavy tools are needed to cut a leaf in the Tangle, tanglebloom fruit is easily plucked by hand.

name: Lavabelly Sliver
text: Warm enough to incubate eggs or incinerate those who would eat them.

name: Feral Thallid
text:
"Born and bred of fungus, Thallids were nearly impossible to kill."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. I*

name: Gorilla Berserkers
text:
"Beneath serenity may lie a hidden rage."
—Jaeuhl Carthalion, Juniper Order Advocate

name: Manglehorn
text:
"Rely too much on your weapons and watch your dreams shatter in your hands."
—Rhonas, god of strength

name: Fuel for the Cause
text: "Your ideas will be discarded and your will repurposed."

name: Moonlight Geist
text: Wails and whispers are the only weapons she has left.

name: Woodland Wanderer
text:
"The elements understand better than anyone that actions speak louder than words."
—Gideon Jura

name: Gorilla Chieftain
text: A gorilla chief must always be prepared to defend his crown. This leads to some pretty tough apes.

name: Crystal Seer
text: "Surprise is a useless, untidy emotion—the plaything of goblins and fools."

name: Gift of Granite
text: The blessing adds both protection to the recipient and weightlessness to the stone.

name: Anointed Chorister
text: "I sing of benevolence and mercy, of golden wings bringing comfort to the meek and downtrodden."

name: Unsubstantiate
text:
"Nicely done, Jace. You always were good at disappearing acts."
—Liliana Vess

name: Blight Grenade
text: Blight grenades—which induce horrendous effects on their victims—have no impact on the Death Guard, who gladly use the devices in extreme close quarters with the enemy.

name: Lightning Cloud
text:
The mightiest clouds sit upon spires of fire.
—Femeref adage

name: Trusted Pegasus
text: "Would you give your life to save this world?" Gideon murmured. The pegasus snorted and spread wide its mighty wings.

name: Void Attendant
text: The Eldrazi don't merely extinguish life—they supplant it.

name: Dovin's Acuity
text: Dovin ticked the Planeswalkers off on his fingers: himself, Domri, Kaya, Ral, Vraska . . . and Bolas made an even six.

name: Ornithopter
text:
"You want to know what we are fighting for? Look at the wonder in that child's eyes."
—Pia Nalaar

name: Atalya, Samite Master
text: "Healing is a gift the divine ones have shared with us. It is a sacred trust."

name: Price of Glory
text:
"True strength lies in action. Let the weak react to me."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

name: Crimson Wisps
text: The whispers are incomprehensible, yet cinders always hear a message of urgency.

name: Scroll Thief
text: The arcane academies along the coast were powerless to protect themselves from the brazen raiders of the Kapsho Seas.

name: Ram Through
text:
"Need a medic! And some stonemasons!"
—Wyllon, Drannith merchant

name: White Knight
text:
"When good men die their goodness does not perish, / But lives though they are gone."
—Euripides, *Termenidae*, trans. Morgan

name: Spinal Villain
text:
"Striking silent as a dream, Cutting short the strangled scream . . ."
—Tobrian, "Watchdragon"

name: Foresee
text: Two eyes to see what could be, two eyes to see what will.

name: Temple of Abandon
text: Places of worship become frenzies of violence as the psychic call of the Hive Mind stirs Genestealer Cults to action.

name: Savai Crystal
text: The same crystals that root deep enough to pierce Savai's catacombs also soar high enough to change its weather.

name: Sengir Connoisseur
text: "We cannot afford to let the Phyrexians win. They taste terrible."

name: Dazzling Ramparts
text: When Anafenza holds court under the First Tree, the gates of Mer-Ek are sealed. No safer place exists in all of Tarkir.

name: Shu Farmer
text:
"The common folk are ceaselessly active. The fields are fertile and the soil productive, and neither flood nor drought plagues us."
—A Shu diplomat

name: When Fluffy Bunnies Attack
text:
"Get it? Bunnies, letters, -X/-X? Me neither."
—Bucky, flavor text writer

name: Narfi, Betrayer King
text: To serve the god of death, Narfi forfeited the warmth of life.

name: Mwonvuli Beast Tracker
text: "The more dangerous, the better."

name: Gitaxian Probe
text:
"My flesh holds no secrets, monster. The spirit of Mirrodin will fight on."
—Vy Covalt, Mirran resistance

name: Felhide Petrifier
text: It's common practice among minotaurs to collect the heads of their victims as trophies. Sometimes the trophies prove more than ornamental.

name: Touch of the Void
text: Some wounds never heal.

name: Zephyr Net
text: Faeries hang beings that interest them as ornaments in the sky, each clique competing to outshine the prize of the last.

name: Mind Stone
text:
"Pain is an ally. Pain is a friend. Pain is truth."
—Sister Erynica N'botu, Order of the Valorous Heart

name: Acquire
text: Sometimes "innovation" means "stealing another's secret before anyone else can."

name: Light the Way
text: "That way lies death. This way, a chance."

name: Kaya's Wrath
text: Teysa convened the meeting of the Obzedat. Kaya ended it.

name: Living Airship
text: The ship has a crew of three: the pilot, the gunner, and the ship itself.

name: Mountain
text: You've ventured deep into the heart of the mountain to determine what can calm its quaking rage.

name: Ponder
text: "We see the same sky as you, just through a different lens."

name: Infected Defector
text: The diamond storms of Gobakhan hampered Phyrexia's progress until they recruited some of the local shieldmages.

name: Masked Blackguard
text: Her footsteps are whispers, her passage a last breath.

name: Mind Control
text:
"The mind: a great weapon and an even greater weakness."
—Jace Beleren

name: Talas Air Ship
text:
"Their ships pollute our air as they themselves pollute our forest."
—Arathel, elvish queen

name: Gang Up
text:
"Well, who do we have here, Gorm?"
"No one, Virtus. No one at all."

name: Elven Cache
text:
"The elves can hide better than most can look."
—Mwani, Mtenda herder

name: Volatile Claws
text: Whether modeled after bear, bird, or baloth, all claws send the same message.

name: Common Bond
text: Wolf riders hone their skills traversing the perilous rooftops, each dizzying step bringing elf and wolf closer together.

name: Graceful Reprieve
text: "In my moment of death, I had a vision of the world, dark and unwelcoming. I wanted to hide in the deepest meander, but the light pulled me back."

name: Soulsworn Jury
text: In death, as in life, they protect the Grand Arbiter from exposure to contrary points of view.

name: Vengeful Strangler // Strangling Grasp
text: As the flames consumed the killer, his eyes remained fixed on the executioner's face, his hands twitching like angry spiders.

name: Bounty Hunter
text: "Once they've marked you," Starke said, "the world is made of glass."

name: Azusa, Lost but Seeking
text: "I do not miss Jukai Forest. It is not my home. My home is Kamigawa, its people my family. Wherever I set my pack and rest my head, I am home."

name: Tarfire
text:
"After Auntie brushed the soot from her eyes, she discovered something wonderful: the fire had turned the goat into something that smelled delicious."
—A tale of Auntie Grub

name: Grim Draugr
text: She was a ragged shadow of her living form, but she had lost none of her deadly prowess.

name: Soliton
text: The gemini engines had lost connection with each other and wandered apart, developing an independent awareness of their surroundings.

name: Jungle Barrier
text: A massive pull of mana caused all of Dominaria to pause—Multani had transplanted Yavimaya to Urborg's edge.

name: Viridian Lorebearers
text: A small band of elves pledged many years ago to avoid the Edges of Forgetting. They have remained hidden until now.

name: Sporecap Spider
text:
"They don't move much, but then again, if you get caught in its web, it has all the time in the world to get to you."
—Saidah, Joraga hunter

name: Disciple of Grace
text: Beauty is beyond law.

name: Didgeridoo
text:
"Play the song of he who delivered us. Play the song of Feroz."
—Onatah, Anaba Shaman

name: Elvish Spirit Guide
text:
"The spirits of the Whispering Woods are mysterious and mercurial. Follow one, and you're just as likely to end up at the center of the forest as you are at your own front door."
—Greensleeves, High Wizard of the Domains

name: Proud Mentor
text: "Get ready, son."

name: Pay No Heed
text: "My course is before me. There is nothing behind me."

name: Loxodon Partisan
text: "This war is not about loxodon or leonin, Sylvok or Auriok. To defeat these rotters, we must do it together."

name: View from Above
text: "This air feels so heavy and thick. There are no winds to speak of. I fear the knowledge that comes from a place like this."

name: Consulate Skygate
text: All skyships entering or leaving the fairgrounds must pass through the security checkpoint.

name: Mass Hysteria
text: The sooner you see the whites of their eyes, the sooner you'll spill the red of their blood.

name: Horned Troll
text: Sword hilts jut from some trolls' bodies where wounds healed so fast that the weapons were trapped inside.

name: Ghoultree
text: It uproots entire fengrafs to add to its twisted frame.

name: Mantis Engine
text:
"It's a clever design. You should look closely at its gearing after it swallows your head."
—Jhoira, master artificer

name: Silence
text:
"Take a quiet moment to reflect on your sins."
—Cleph, Order of Redeemed Souls

name: Fearless Liberator
text: "No one else had the spine for it, so I ran right between that giant's legs and hauled poor Valdir back to Axgard!"

name: Gaea's Embrace
text: The forest rose to the battle, not to save the people but to save itself.

name: Deadly Insect
text: With his newfound sense of self-importance, Squee set his sights on ever-bigger bugs.

name: Go for the Throat
text: When Titania offered peace, Urza merely turned her down. Mishra made her people pay for the insult.

name: Viashivan Dragon
text: The Viashivan understand that cruelty arises from opportunity.

name: Brushwagg
text:
"Defiantly, the young cyclops popped the brushwagg into his mouth. His cheeks suddenly puffed, his eye bulged, and he was forced to agree with his elder."
—Afari, *Tales*

name: Herbology Instructor // Malady Invoker
text: "As you see, these flowers . . . can have either restorative or poisonous . . . what is that?"

name: Agonizing Memories
text:
"An innocent man died because of my anger. That knowledge will haunt me for all eternity."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Evolving Wilds
text:
"There's a certain beauty in destruction. Some will consider this war a masterpiece."
—Ashnod

name: Pulse of the Grid
text: Before labs or lectures, there was insight.

name: Inspiring Bard
text: "Wake up, my friends! There are deeds to be done and treasures to be won!"

name: Drastic Revelation
text: Every disaster holds mystery, for lack of a sane witness.

name: Path of Peace
text: As Hedrax stepped into oblivion, he welcomed the unwavering silence.

name: Cached Defenses
text: The glittering scales in the Abzan vaults represent mighty deeds of the past and protection for generations to come.

name: Wish
text:
"If you had just one wish, what would it be? Gold, or angel song? Finding a lost love, or finding your way back home? Let me sing a song about one wish that came true . . ."
—Ellywick Tumblestrum

name: Ronin Houndmaster
text: Some samurai fell so far out of grace that only dogs would keep them company.

name: Ivory Tower
text:
"Ringed by white stone, Terisia was a city of scholarship and knowledge, where magic promised a brighter future to a world devoured by artifice."
—*The Antiquities War*

name: Shortcut Seeker
text: "Ah, the old 'trap door under a rug' trick. This is almost too easy."

name: Pearled Unicorn
text:
"'Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!'
'Well, now that we *have* seen each other,' said the Unicorn, 'if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'" —Lewis Carroll, *Through the Looking-Glass*

name: Wilderness Reclamation
text:
"Walls crack. Buildings fall. Always the wilds return."
—Domri Rade

name: Screeching Buzzard
text:
"A shrill creature that delights in the misery of others—what's not to love?"
—Braids, dementia summoner

name: Phyrexian Rager
text:
"Resist if you must. It makes no difference. As with Mirrodin, your world will bow to Phyrexia."
—Sheoldred

name: Nim Grotesque
text: In the swirling mists, you could walk right up to one and not know until its teeth are in your throat.

name: Bake into a Pie
text: "My secret ingredient? Well, I can't tell you that. But here's a hint. It's not love."

name: Sporemound
text:
"If you threaten its territory, it produces spores. Actually, no matter what you do, it produces spores."
—Hadi Kasten, Calla Dale naturalist

name: Marble Diamond
text: Every facet a benediction of Lathander's light.

name: Conclave Cavalier
text: "Just as leaves fall and the tree blooms again, one day I will fall and the Conclave will endure."

name: Wirewood Symbiote
text:
"Let the wild in. Channel its strength."
—Freyalise

name: Unfriendly Fire
text: Disputes within the Brazen Coalition can escalate from insult to broadside in the blink of an eye.

name: Bosk Banneret
text: Deep in a murmuring bosk, where the trees' memories span centuries, the simple banner of green and copper signifies an elder whose rings number more than a faerie's days.

name: Harvester Troll
text: Having no interest in the greater conflict, the trolls continue to prey upon whatever wanders into their domain.

name: Kami of Old Stone
text:
"There was a wall here. Now it is dust. A tower rose here. Now it is fallen. An army fought here. Now it is dead. A spirit was here. It is all that remains."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Sire of the Storm
text: This storm blows gales through the dreams of men.

name: Black Oak of Odunos
text: Phenax promised the newly dead souls they would be spared from Erebos. In this, he did not lie.

name: Last Breath
text: He gasped in wonder even as his body crumbled away.

name: Words of War
text:
"Passions can't be shackled by laws or mastered with logic. The choice is freedom or death."
—*Volume IV, The Book of Fire*

name: Kor Firewalker
text: "A river of lava is just another river to cross."

name: Wall of Air
text: "This 'standing windstorm' can hold us off indefinitely? Ridiculous!" Saying nothing, she put a pinch of salt on the table. With a bang she clapped her hands, and the salt disappeared, blown away.

name: Hexgold Slash
text:
"No matter how tough they are, even Phyrexians prefer to keep their guts on the inside."
—Jor Kadeen

name: Followed Footsteps
text: Æther can turn a footprint into a blueprint.

name: Darkness
text: "If I must die, I will encounter darkness as a bride,/ And hug it in my arms." —William Shakespeare, *Measure for Measure*

name: Sunseed Nurturer
text: Sunseeders quest for areas of open sky. They train plowbeasts to beat back the dense jungle long enough to cultivate a crop.

name: Slice and Dice
text: Tahngarth relished the chance to bloody his blades on those who had ravaged his home.

name: Capture of Jingzhou
text: The province of Jingzhou was the fulcrum of the three kingdoms. At separate times it was coveted and controlled by the Wu, the Shu, and the Wei.

name: Blinding Mage
text: "I carry the light of truth. Do not pity those it blinds, for they never had eyes to see."

name: Squire
text:
"Of twenty yeer of age he was, I gesse.
Of his stature he was of evene lengthe.
And wonderly delyvere, and of greete strengthe."
—Geoffrey Chaucer,
*The Canterbury Tales*

name: Krond the Dawn-Clad
text: Krond, the personification of the dawn's light, lives to exact justice on his nemesis Vela.

name: Angelic Guardian
text: "No single arrow can pierce an entire flock."

name: Wordmail
text:
"Suck on it, Stangg!"
—Sol'kanar the Swamp King

name: Ancient Tomb
text:
There is no glory to be gained in the kingdom of the dead.
—Vec tomb inscription

name: Signpost Scarecrow
text:
"Accursed scarecrow! Sending folk in every direction is the same as sending them nowhere at all."
—Corliss the Wanderer

name: Kami of Terrible Secrets
text: It feeds on things better left unknown, savoring the bitterness of lies and regrets.

name: Deadeye Harpooner
text: "It seems there's even better hunting down here."

name: Metallic Sliver
text: When the clever counterfeit was accepted by the hive, Volrath's influence upon the slivers grew even stronger.

name: Derelor
text:
"Strength it has, but at the cost of a continuous supply of energy. Such failure can bear only one result."
—From the execution order for Endrek Sahr, Master Breeder

name: Roilmage's Trick
text: Weather on Zendikar is unpredictable—unless you're the one telling it what to do.

name: Devour Flesh
text: His twisted mind concluded that if he was what he ate, and he wanted to stay human, . . .

name: Crop Rotation
text: "Hmm . . . maybe lotuses this year."

name: Last Gasp
text: "Allow me a moment to catch your breath."

name: Dark Banishing
text:
"Hence 'banishèd' is banished from the world, / And the world's exile is death."
—William Shakespeare,
*Romeo and Juliet*

name: Skycloud Expanse
text: Remote but always watching, the soaring city of Otawara moves over Kamigawa with a purpose that few understand.

name: Cryptic Serpent
text: It slithers through the senses, constricting consciousness and poisoning perceptions.

name: Ixidor's Will
text: "Some dreams should not come to be."

name: Reject Imperfection
text:
"Your theory holds merit. You do not."
—Sarnvax, Gitaxian sective

name: Reckless Air Strike
text: "I have a *great* idea!"

name: Goblin Mutant
text: If only it had three brains, too.

name: Goblin Assault
text: A goblin raid is a delicate gambit—a blend of stealth, precision, and screaming death.

name: Pyre-Sledge Arsonist
text: Everything from damaged furniture to inconvenient corpses becomes fuel for Ziatora's ever-burning foundry.

name: Clearwater Pathway // Murkwater Pathway
text:
"Here, at least, the danger is usually in plain sight."
—Zahr Gada, Halimar expedition leader

name: Warmind Infantry
text: Before Aurelia denounced Niv-Mizzet, the two guilds had collaborated on the Warmind Initiative in pursuit of the ultimate soldier.

name: Collateral Damage
text: It is much easier to create fire than to contain it.

name: Royal Herbalist
text:
"It's not so easy anymore. Nothing grows in Kjeldor but seaweed."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Demanding Dragon
text: A knight's devotion to their steed goes only so far.

name: Flood
text: "A dash of cool water does wonders to clear a cluttered battlefield." —Vibekke Ragnild, *Witches and War*

name: Skull of Ramos
text: Ramos fell, and there was night.

name: Firehoof Cavalry
text: "What warrior worth the name fears to leave a trail? If my enemies seek me, let them follow the ashes in my wake."

name: Impromptu Raid
text: For the Scuzzback gang, it's always "raid o'clock."

name: Pest Summoning
text:
"Step 1: Put the pests in mud.
"Step 2: Wait."
—*Gyome's Guide to Pest Breeding*

name: Barbtooth Wurm
text: In its lair lies a carpet of bones.

name: Karakas
text:
"To make a prairie it takes a clover and one bee,/ One clover, and a bee,/ And revery."
—Emily Dickinson

name: Naya Panorama
text: Between the thunderous footfalls of Naya's behemoths lie moments of perfect quiet.

name: Hate Mirage
text: A trick of the light, though momentary, can still be deadly.

name: Order of the Sacred Bell
text: "My brother, it may now be time to ring the bell and put out the call for aid."

name: Gaze of Granite
text: "Show yourself, thief."

name: Explore
text: An explorer's reward is a view of tomorrow's possible meals.

name: Black Sun's Zenith
text:
"Under the suns, Mirrodin kneels and begs us for perfection."
—Geth, Lord of the Vault

name: Misfortune's Gain
text: The mourning families of commanders and generals were often given land, valuables, or money to compensate for their losses.

name: Irencrag Pyromancer
text: "Fear of fire is a sensible instinct. If I were you, I'd be terrified."

name: The Lady of the Mountain
text: Her given name has been lost in the mists of time. Legend says that her silent vigil will one day be ended by the one who, pure of heart and spirit, calls out that name again.

name: Rift Elemental
text:
"It's difficult to heal a rift after it begins wandering about on its own."
—Teferi

name: Godless Shrine
text: The Second Sun brought nothing but darkness.

name: Kira, Great Glass-Spinner
text: The samurai struck the fragile-looking bubble, and her sword shattered into countless pieces.

name: Barony Vampire
text: "Poor little sun-dweller out past curfew. And to think, you might have survived if it wasn't so close to suppertime."

name: Prismite
text: Even its shadow is a dazzling rainbow.

name: Weaver of Lightning
text: "Lightning in a bottle? That's not where I need it."

name: Leonin Battlemage
text: The strongest of the pride are measured not by the steel in their hands but by the steel in their souls.

name: Filigree Attendant
text:
"The perfect assistant is one that's responsive, dextrous, and capable of reaching all the high shelves."
—Coruk, Esper artificer

name: Sokenzan Smelter
text: Among the artisans of Sokenzan City, reusing every scrap of metal is a point of pride.

name: Kaleidostone
text: Once broken, who knows what worlds might grow from its shards?

name: Curse of Thirst
text:
"May you drink until you drown but never be sated."
—Odila, witch of Morkrut

name: Oreskos Swiftclaw
text:
After the Battle of Pharagax Bridge, the Champion spent many months among the leonin of Oreskos. She found that they were quick to take offense, not because they were thin-skinned, but because they were always eager for a fight.
—*The Theriad*

name: Labyrinth Minotaur
text:
"Legend says they got a treasure cave, but it don't say where to find it."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate

name: Enlightened Tutor
text:
"Organization is often undervalued but rarely unjustified."
—Frasio, royal archivist

name: Uktabi Orangutan
text:
"Is it true that the apes wear furs of gold when they marry?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

name: Visions
text:
"Visions of glory, spare my aching sight,/ Ye unborn ages, crowd not on my soul!"
—Thomas Gray, *The Bard*

name: Topan Freeblade
text: "My scars are my sigils. I will wear them with pride long after you're gone."

name: Touch of Darkness
text:
"Black spirits and white, red spirits and gray,/
Mingle, mingle, mingle, you that mingle may."
—Thomas Middleton, The Witch

name: Rubinia Soulsinger
text: "Take up the quill, and feel your future flow into the runes."

name: Nyxborn Colossus
Oakgnarl Warrior
text: "Roam as you will, your roots remain in the strong earth of your Rising."

name: Veteran Cathar
text: "Prayers can be powerful, but I prefer to put faith in my own two hands."

name: Reaver Ambush
text: Onora knew with sudden, grim certainty he would never see the Great River again.

name: Orcish Veteran
text: Unsuccessful in their early battle for Montford, the Orcs quickly tempered their bloodlust with cowardice.

name: Samite Blessing
text:
Knit bone, darn flesh, Stitch skin, weave breath.
—Samite healing ritual

name: Omen of the Sun
text: "My time will come, when every soul will bask in my glory and obey my law."

name: Mnemonic Nexus
text: True enlightenment comes not with a new thought, but with understanding of all the old ones.

name: Back to Basics
text:
"A ruler wears a crown while the rest of us wear hats, but which would you rather have when it's raining?"
—Barrin, *Principia*

name: Prophet of Distortion
text: It doesn't twist words. It twists worlds.

name: Stone Calendar
text: The Pretender Mairsil ordered a great calendar drawn up to show when the paths to the Dark Lands were strongest.

name: Llanowar Druid
text:
"This forest means more to the druids than their own kin. The loss of a tree is like the loss of a child."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Balduvian Horde
text:
"We earn no medals and fight for no titles. Blood is proof of our victory."
—Lovisa Coldeyes

name: Humble Naturalist
text: "The key to bonding with monsters, no matter their size, is knowing where they like to be scratched."

name: Ogre Sentry
text:
"You have to appreciate the genius of it. Why bother building defenses when you can just fill the pass with angry ogres?"
—Javad Nasrin, Ondu relic hunter

name: Caustic Hound
text: At first, the Mirrans aimed for its exposed gut. The survivors quickly learned to do otherwise.

name: Darkbore Pathway // Slitherbore Pathway
text:
"Hush, and stay still. No matter how dreary the darkness, a light in the Skelle Mire is never a good sign."
—Haugar, Kannah wayfinder

name: Excommunicate
text: Rebels and other malcontents forced into the ritual awake lost in Topa's vast savannahs. Those who find their way back return humble and repentant.

name: Goblin War Cry
text:
"Goblins cry, soldiers fly.
Stones fly, soldiers die!"

name: Ravenous Vampire
text: Eternal life brings eternal hunger.

name: Jade Leech
text:
"It took magic to extract one of the stones and five people to carry it."
—Tolarian research notes

name: Hoard Robber
text: "And to think, a year ago I was picking pockets in Waterdeep."

name: Sungrass Prairie
text: The ancient magic of the sun elves keeps these lands in an eternal summer.

name: Mystical Dispute
text: 「哀れな迷える魔道士よ。足は地についていても、手は届かない。そうだろう？」

name: Death Denied
text: Takenuma was filled with a chorus of moans, shrieks, and wails. Some came from the living, some from the dying, and some, most horribly, from the dead.

name: Saprazzan Heir
text: Within the walls of the floating city, Saprazzan wealth is like Saprazzan water: abundant, free-flowing, and accessible to all.

name: Favor of the Woods
text: Feeling abandoned by Avacyn, some Kessigers turned to the pagan rituals of their ancestors.

name: Spiteful Motives
text: Having infiltrated the Lunarch Council, the Skirsdag await the perfect moment to strike.

name: Introduction to Annihilation
text:
"I've never seen a student fail quite so spectacularly. There's potential in that."
—Hostram, professor of arcanochemistry

name: Utopia Vow
text: "I'll guard this fruit and its seedling until the land is healed. My life now belongs to Dominaria."

name: Phyrexian Defiler
text:
"The third stage of the illness: muscle aches and persistent cough."
—Phyrexian progress notes

name: Exponential Growth
text: Most Quandrix students fundamentally disagree with the concept of "enough."

name: Gilded Light
text: Whoever survives the first blow lives to land the second.

name: Invoke the Divine
text: "Let's see how brave you really are behind all that oak and steel."

name: Wasitora, Nekoru Queen
text: Once a fierce foe, she would become one of Madara's greatest protectors.

name: Etched Champion
text: Its predecessors were etched with the wisdom of ancients; its own etchings bear warnings of a future fraught with war.

name: Fynn, the Fangbearer
text: "I always said I had a score to settle with that serpent. I'm a man of my word."

name: Finders, Keepers
text: The S.N.E.A.K. Code clearly permits looting corpses for parts. That just meant Agent 47.3 had to make sure her target was dead first.

name: Harmonious Emergence
text: Where the spirit and mortal realms overlap, the laws of reality are rewritten.

name: Halo-Charged Skaab
text: Innistrad's stitchers were practiced at incorporating magical substances into undead creations.

name: Coercion
text:
"Human tenderness is simply weakness in a pretty package."
—Tojira, swamp queen

name: Zhentarim Bandit
text:
"The Zhentarim are ruthless, unscrupulous, and dishonest. But I must admit, they are effective."
—Commander Liara Portyr

name: Bearer of the Heavens
text: To hold the heavens from the earth is no curse, but a titanic responsibility.

name: Plummet
text:
"Even the pterodon, who chases the clouds from its skies, must bow to the great forest below."
—Mahuiz, Sun Empire archer

name: Wake the Reflections
text:
"You see a bird, an oak, a packbeast. I see the potential for an army."
—Lalia, Selesnya dryad

name: Funeral March
text:
"Turn the key deftly in the oiled wards, And seal the hushed casket of my soul."
—John Keats, "To Sleep"

name: Flameborn Viron
text:
"Large or small, all will toil for the Great Work."
—Decree of Urabrask

name: Parhelion Patrol
text: "Too many have disappeared in these dark days. I am the light that will lead them home."

name: Tireless Tribe
text: "We've survived starvation, dwarf attacks, and heatstroke. Why should a little sandstorm bother us?"

name: Render Inert
text: As New Phyrexia phased out of existence, glistening oil all across the Multiverse was cut off from its source. The *compleated* invaders ceased to function and crumpled to the ground.

name: Crookshank Kobolds
text: The Crookshank military boasts a standing army of nearly twenty-four million, give or take twenty-two million.

name: Celestial Enforcer
text: "I look to the heavens for hope, but you will kneel."

name: Pheres-Band Warchief
text: The renowned warchiefs of Pheres Band fight with the might of minotaurs and the sagacity of sphinxes.

name: Redcap Raiders
text:
"I admire their courage as much as I despise their savagery."
—Syr Carah, the Bold

name: Builder's Blessing
text:
"Mix the mortar with holy wards, or blood will run in the streets."
—Vadvar, Thraben stonewright

name: Nightshade Stinger
text:
"Most faeries are harmless pranksters. Every now and again, though, you get one that crosses over from mischievous to malicious."
—Gaddock Teeg

name: Dormant Sliver
text:
"It triggers the hive's period of aetheric fertility—a time when even feeding is a lower priority than reproduction."
—Rukarumel, field journal

name: Crypt Creeper
text:
"I guess what they say is true. What doesn't kill you makes you stronger. Or at least stranger."
—Captain Eberhart

name: Treasure Hunt
text:
"The longer the journey, the more one learns."
—Isanke, Halimar seastalker

name: Desecrated Earth
text:
"The land is swollen with mana, cursed relics, and secrets. If you puncture it, you never know what will burst out."
—Javad Nasrin, Ondu relic hunter

name: Baleful Strix
text: Some superstitious persons believe that owls, being creatures of the night, are agents of Evil; but those who make such claims see only the reflection of their own guilty Consciences.

name: Wirecat
text: Its purr is the sound of iron filings sliding down satin.

name: Avatar of Discord
text: Such is the power of Rakdos that even his shadow takes on a cruel life of its own.

name: Transmogrant's Crown
text: Fallaji soldiers hated seeing loved ones' faces among the transmogrants. Ashnod devised a solution.

name: Fungal Rebirth
text:
"We're all food for something in the end."
—Cevraya, Golgari shaman

name: Sundering Growth
text:
"One day every pillar will be a tree and every hall a glade."
—Trostani

name: Danitha Capashen, Paragon
text: "I will protect the less fortunate. I will love bravely. I will face despair and fight on. As a Capashen, I can do no less."

name: Icatian Priest
text: Grelden knelt and felt the cool, dry hand of the priest on his brow. Hours later, when his wits returned, he was covered in his enemies' blood on the field of victory.

name: Contradict
text: Those who question Ojutai may not like the answers they receive.

name: Greenside Watcher
text: "The Izzet may incite war, but my duty is here. I will not abandon the wild."

name: Catapult Squad
text: Together they could hit anything between the heavens and the horizon.

name: Circuits Act
text: Another day, another item Pietra has to add to the "do not juggle" database.

name: Timbermaw Larva
text:
"You can't trust your eyes. A tree might look healthy, but its insides tell a different tale."
—Zahr Gada, Halimar expedition leader

name: Frazzled Editor
text: The pen is mightier than the sword.

name: Agonizing Remorse
text: The sharp memory of Daxos's death stabbed into Elspeth's soul.

name: Xenograft
text:
"I despise Vorinclex and his slobberings about 'evolution.' Only I know true progress."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

name: Feral Shadow
text: Not all shadows are cast by light—some are cast by darkness.

name: Unearth
text: Don't dig up the past if you're not prepared for the consequences.

name: Wingspan Mentor
text: Their bond grew over time, as did the height of their jumps.

name: Luminous Wake
text:
"If destiny's champions have arisen to fight the Ancient Ones, then let me, too, do my part."
—Ravuel of Graypelt

name: Strength of Solidarity
text: "This expedition doesn't succeed unless we all succeed!"

name: Arena Athlete
text: The Iroan Games award no medals. Athletes vie for a visit from Iroas, god of victory.

name: Sands of Time
text:
"But once, with a magician's help, Time was stopped and Day stood still."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Scorned Villager // Moonscarred Werewolf
text: ". . . and I will bring the fury of the wild back to my village."

name: Nahiri's Wrath
text: "You brought this upon yourself, Sorin!"

name: Skyclave Aerialist // Skyclave Invader
text: With her guidance, the oil coursed freely across the world.

name: Oneirophage
text: It manifests at wizard academies to siphon inspiration from young prodigies.

name: Spire Barrage
text: Goblin lessons include the 2,071 tips for survival. Frek only remembered 2,070.

name: Viper's Kiss
text:
"I could heal a snakebite. Looks like you got bitten by a constellation."
—Aescalos, healer of Pharika

name: Valakut Invoker
text:
"As long as we have walked this world, we have known it as a harsh and unforgiving place."
—*The Invokers' Tales*

name: Orchard Elemental
text: Fruits for friends, fists for foes.

name: Auger Spree
text:
"Finally, a weapon the Boros can't confiscate!"
—Juri, proprietor of the Juri Revue

name: Zombie Boa
text: It doesn't need to feed, but still it hungers.

name: Blorbian Buddy
text: When Captain Nebula tragically destroyed the planet Blorb-12 in a parking accident, Myra compensated the survivors with lifetime passes.

name: Mystic Redaction
text: Action: Show GLOWING BLUE GLYPHS being TORN out of a GRIMOIRE, leaving BLANK PAGES behind.

name: Obliterate
text:
"The enemy has been destroyed, sir. So have the forest, the city, your palace, your dog . . ."
—Keldon soldier

name: Linden, the Steadfast Queen
text: "Until my last breath, I will defend the realm."

name: Marrow-Gnawer
text: A sumptuous feast with friends starts the new year off on a good paw.

name: Amnesia
text:
"When one has witnessed the unspeakable, 'tis sometimes better to forget."
—Vervamon the Elder

name: Dream Leash
text: The tendrils of sorcery find easy purchase on the soft underbelly of dreams.

name: Tatterkite
text:
"I rigged it together from wicker and scrap, yet somehow I find it unalterably perfect."
—Braenna, cobblesmith

name: Abundant Harvest
text: "Gaea knows what you need. Do you?"

name: Skyknight Legionnaire
text:
"I do not know which gives me more pride: the legions of soldiers marching in thunderous lockstep, or the cry of the skyknights riding their rocs like jagged lightning overhead."
—Razia

name: Voidslime
text:
"It is technically an ooze, but its life span measures only seconds. In that short time, its appetite for magic is extraordinary."
—Simic research notes

name: Witherbloom Pledgemage
text: "Death is just a transfer of energy. Those pests I harvested have the honor of becoming pure magic. What could be more beautiful?"

name: Mistfire Adept
text: "The quieter the skies, the calmer the mind."

name: Death's-Head Buzzard
text: Infested with vermin, ever hungering, dropping from night's sky.

name: Contagion Engine
text:
"Deep into that darkness peering, long I stood there wondering, fearing."
—Edgar Allen Poe, "The Raven"

name: Eternal of Harsh Truths
text:
"If creating the Eternals was Bolas's plan here, what is his plan for the Eternals?"
—Jace Beleren

name: Tuktuk the Explorer
text: Remade by Eldrazi magic, Tuktuk inspired an entire clan of misguided goblins.

name: Warcry Phoenix
text: War begins with one red ember.

name: Goblin War Drums
text:
"Goblins charge with a deafening war cry. The cry doesn't mean anything—it just drowns out the drums!"
—Reod Dai, mercenary

name: Gearsmith Prodigy
text: Young artificers on Kaladesh let their imaginations run wild.

name: Zhalfirin Knight
text:
"You returned a warrior. . . . Your hair was cut, your eye tattooed with the red triangle of war."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Mythos of Nethroi
text:
"And then the shadow took living form, and the shadow devoured the man whole—body, mind, and soul."
—*Tales of the Ozolith*

name: Separatist Voidmage
text:
"As long as each side thinks it can win, the balance holds, and the mage-rings stand."
—Alhammarret

name: Sagittars' Volley
text:
"My bowstring hums in tune with the song of the Worldsoul."
—Alcarus, Selesnya sagittar

name: Kemba, Kha Regent
text: "I am not Raksha. I never will be. But I refuse to be the kha who watched her pride be torn asunder."

name: Blightning
text: While the smell of burning flesh is common in Grixis, the odor of smoldering brain matter is a rare treat.

name: Protector of the Crown
text: "I gladly offer my weapon and my life to the glory of my sovereign."

name: Bring the Ending
text: Kaya watched in horror as the illusion vanished from her hands. Jace held the real Sylex—and had activated it before phyresis claimed his mind.

name: Mudbrawler Cohort
text: Before a raid, the members of Wort's gang egg each other on with tales of their hunger and what they'll do to sate it, each outdoing the last.

name: Gilded Cerodon
text: The plating of its horns is a token of honor from Hazoret, who favors creatures with great hearts.

name: Vampire Nocturnus
text: "Your life will set with the sun."

name: Kodama of the North Tree
text:
"The monks of the North Tree rarely saw their kodama until the Kami War, when it woke like a slumbering, angry bear."
—"Poem of the Five Trees"

name: Flare
text:
"In the forest, fires light the sky as black clouds unfold their weight."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Chromatic Lantern
text: The shamans' souls were drawn to the astral lantern like moths to a kaleidoscopic flame.

name: Brine Giant
text: The oracles of Meletis foresaw neither its rise from the depths nor the destruction it would leave in its wake.

name: Pore Over the Pages
text: "'I'm certain that the fate of Markov Manor is connected to these cryptoliths . . .' This Tamiyo was on to something."

name: Prodigal Pyromancer
text:
"Learn to burn!"
—Institute of Arcane Studies motto

name: Cliffside Lookout
text: Though losses run high among the scouts of the Stone Havens, they never flinch from their duty.

name: Razortooth Rats
text:
"Men and rats both hunger: we for our playthings; they, for us."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

name: Silkenfist Fighter
text: Simple wooden staff Made from life, protecting life, Stronger than cold steel.

name: Ego Erasure
text: When all is taken away, all are equal.

name: Ordruun Commando
text: Thick of muscle, stout of heart, and possessing a burning love of justice and the battlefield, the Ordruun minotaurs are the foundation of the Boros Legion.

name: Spike, Tournament Grinder
text: "Just wait—I have a response."

name: Starfall
text:
"The most brilliant stars are not born of Nyx."
—Rhexenor, Akroan flamespeaker

name: Raking Claws
text:
"How many claws does a monster have? Exactly one more than you've accounted for."
—Alux, Skysail defender

name: Cloudstone Curio
text: It *wants* to remain a mystery, banishing the curious in favor of less inquisitive company.

name: Sire of Insanity
text: Its victims become mindless lunatics. Conveniently, that's the first step in joining the Cult of Rakdos.

name: General Ferrous Rokiric
text: "The Boros Legion always stands for justice, but it never stands alone."

name: Brain Gorgers
text: In spite of their hunger, they're slow eaters.

name: Life Goes On
text:
"If you believe the God-Pharaoh tests you, charge with me to prove yourself. If you believe he betrayed us all, join with me to fight for tomorrow!"
—Samut, former Tah-crop initiate

name: Triton Fortune Hunter
text: "Thassa has blessed me with power and insight. I am careful not to disappoint her."

name: Allied Assault
text: A common foe is the death of old hatreds.

name: Glistener Seer
text: "The oil is all-knowing. The trick is to ask the right questions."

name: Emberwilde Caliph
text: The fire breathes while the air burns.

name: Spitemare
text:
"I knew a creature carved from a dream of wild freedom. Any attempt to leash or exploit it failed, and at terrible cost."
—Ashling

name: Immortal Servitude
text:
"The fine print of countless contracts has ensured we are never defenseless."
—Teysa Karlov, Grand Envoy of Orzhov

name: Sleep Paralysis
text: Sleep doesn't always mean rest.

name: Shock
text:
"Once I saw a goblin shouting at a thunderstorm. He lost the argument pretty quickly."
—Wandering mage

name: Chasm Guide
text: With a single act of bravery, she went from expendable to indispensable.

name: Spirit Shield
text: At times, survival must outweigh all other considerations.

name: Packsong Pup
text: A wolf pup is always dangerous, because a wolf pup is never alone.

name: Reality Anchor
text:
"See how *you* like it."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Flamebreak
text:
"Now I'm thirsty."
—Korva, Vulshok battlemaster

name: Keen-Eyed Archers
text: "If it has wings, shoot it. If it doesn't, shoot it anyway."

name: Sky Weaver
text: "Let my wisdom give you wings."

name: Mishra's Workshop
text: Though he eventually came to despise Tocasia, Mishra listened well to her lessons on clarity of purpose. Unlike his brother, he focused his mind on a single goal.

name: Charging Slateback
text: Goblins prize its hide for building rock sled runners.

name: Quicksilver Wall
text: "Ogg hit wall. Ogg no kill wall. Ogg hate wall!"

name: Odious Trow
text: Trows are the vile trolls that lurk in the bogs of Shadowmoor. They reappear each night to frighten the living and gnaw the dead.

name: Cancel
text:
"Hold your fire, obviously."
—Captain Brandis Thorn

name: Darkness
text: By the physical laws of our universe, darkness is merely the absence of light. Necrons can harness the power of other dimensions, where darkness is tangible and moldable.

name: Dukhara Peafowl
text: Elegant filigree birds perch along the eleven bridges that cross Canal Dukhara.

name: Phyrexian Battleflies
text: After encountering them, Squee finally lost his appetite for bugs.

name: Adarkar Windform
text: Terisiare has only two kinds of weather: cold and weird.

name: Bogardan Dragonheart
text: A hunger to soar must be sated.

name: Apostle of Purifying Light
text: Waves of gloom crash in vain against his unyielding light.

name: Kris Mage
text: Her blade draws blood without ever touching its target.

name: Necrogenesis
text:
"Those may be the squirms of one life ending or of another beginning. Either way, I'd leave it alone."
—Rakka Mar

name: Dead Weight
text: All things considered, his first day on patrol could have gone better.

name: Daggerclaw Imp
text: The Simic use the claws as scalpels, while the Rakdos use them for tattooing and torture. The Gruul use them to pick their teeth after lunching on the rest of the carcass.

name: Renewed Faith
text: "To see gods among the people, part of their daily lives . . . It's inspiring."

name: Bog Rats
text: Their stench was vile and strong enough, but not nearly as powerful as their hunger.

name: Door to Nothingness
text: Only a madman could create such a door. Only an imbecile would open it.

name: Hurricane
text:
"This was quite possibly the least pleasant occurrence on the entire expedition."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Assault Intercessor
text: A foe without honour is a foe already beaten.

name: Shamanic Revelation
text: First, whispers of ancient days. Then, visions of things to come.

name: Assassinate
text: The rulers of old Dominaria kept assassins on retainer. However, the true loyalty of these master killers was always to their peers. This elite brotherhood survived the fall of the old royal order.

name: Whirling Catapult
text:
"Direct confrontation never was to the Orcs' taste."
—General Varchild

name: Dread Presence
text: It beckons silently, waiting in the darkness.

name: Consuming Bonfire
text:
"The elves use treefolk to drive us away. It is time to remove their tools."
—Vessifrus, flamekin demagogue

name: Orcish Settlers
text: They wouldn't know their house from a charred hole in the ground.

name: Balloon Stand
text: There is a very real danger that the squeaking will rally nearby squirrels to battle.

name: Prophet of the Peak
text: It frequently predicts imminent death by devouring.

name: Totem-Guide Hartebeest
text: The kor track hartebeests in hopes of finding magic to help fight the Eldrazi.

name: Aether Tradewinds
text: Consulate engineers have developed safe methods of harvesting aether, but renegades aren't always so careful.

name: Atarka Beastbreaker
text: He scorns the heavy winter garb of lesser warriors, trusting his anger to keep him warm.

name: Burning-Tree Emissary
text: The lawmage served her a warrant as long as Niv Mizzet's tail. She thanked him, then used it as kindling to burn down his house.

name: Kingpin's Pet
text:
"Debt and death sound so similar, and thrulls are so hard of hearing. Mistakes are inevitable."
—Milana, Orzhov prelate

name: Bond of Agony
text: The Rakdos are unique in designing torture equipment they can operate while "suffering" alongside their victims.

name: Spire of Industry
text: A beacon of prosperity to some, a shadow of oppression to others.

name: Frontline Devastator
text: The God-Pharaoh's benevolence concealed the factory he created to produce an army of Eternals.

name: Squirrel Farm
text:
"And the ignorant shall fall to the squirrels."
—Chip 2:54

name: Steam Spitter
text: Its belly produces a boiling-hot fluid it can spit as a weapon or spin slowly enough to freeze into a defensive web.

name: Lava Blister
text:
To treat flesh wounds, use earth. To treat earth wounds, use flesh.
—Barbarian saying

name: Double Major
text: "Now I can dedicate myself fully to zoetimancy and void theory!"

name: Oko's Accomplices
text: They function as everything from assassins to jesters in the name of their fae king.

name: Keeper of the Cadence
text: "What you call magic, I call the power of memory."

name: Ashen Powder
text:
"What you call decay, I call ripening. You'll gain no sustenance from this harvest."
—Kaervek

name: Dark Ritual
text:
「奴らは私の方法を信用していない。しかし成果が必要なとき、奴らが探すの誰だと思う？」
——リム＝トゥールの決まり文句

name: Stranglehold
text: The correct answer to a barbarian's riddle is to choke on your cleverness and die.

name: Glinting Creeper
text: Natural crystalline growths filter and refract light in dazzling displays that attract pollinators and daze predators.

name: Mikokoro, Center of the Sea
text:
"Center of the Sea, Eye of the World, Shrine of Enlightenment. Seek it for answers. Seek it for healing. Seek it and return transformed."
—Scroll fragment from the ruins of Minamo

name: Memory Lapse
text: "Eri phar phesta … um, phistor … er, phistara …"

name: Karok Wrangler
text:
"She showed up to class on a what?"
—Valentin, Witherbloom Dean

name: Volcanic Upheaval
text: Like a living organism, Zendikar rids itself of infection, and it does so abruptly and ruthlessly.

name: Swordsworn Cavalier
text: The Royal Knights of Belenon are equally practiced in courtesy and combat.

name: Abolish
text: As war raged on, the young mages became more direct in their tactics, often at great cost.

name: Baneful Omen
text: "Ah, again it does not bode well for you."

name: Ghostly Prison
text:
"May the memory of our fallen heroes ensnare the violent hearts of lesser men."
—Great Threshold of Monserkat inscription

name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
text: Most human scholars believe that merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

name: Reveille Squad
text: "To arms! To arms! The Lion roars!"

name: Thoughtleech
text:
"A resourceful mage has many sources of information. The best one is your foe."
—Zur the Enchanter

name: Imposing Sovereign
text: Some are born to rule. The rest are born to bow before them.

name: Calculating Lich
text: "We share a common enemy. Does that not make us friends?"

name: Wall of Caltrops
text: "Ow! Ow ow ow! Oooh, ow, OW!"

name: Benalish Veteran
text: "One day I will rest and join my comrades in the afterlife, but not while scum like you still sully this world."

name: Phyrexian Plaguelord
text:
"Even after death, a wealth of serviceable biomass remains."
—Phyrexian progress notes

name: Urborg Phantom
text: A chilling fog with teeth of ice.

name: Vibrating Sphere
text:
"Unearthly and invisible fibers emanate from this sphere, entangling all who draw near."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Thaumatic Compass // Spires of Orazca
text:
"Clearly, it indicates the aetheric azimuth of ..."
—Jace Beleren

name: Curse of Chains
text: The giant's real punishment was the fleeting moment when he was allowed to stand before being dragged down to his knees again.

name: Topple
text:
"Let all witness the fate of those who defy me."
—Crovax

name: Fell the Mighty
text:
"They had it coming."
—Squire Imalia, savior of Thiswick

name: Yeva, Nature's Herald
text: Their favorite place in all of Ravnica was still the glade where they first met.

name: Secrets of the Golden City
text: Stolen knowledge can never be stolen back.

name: Bloodfire Kavu
text: Heart of fire, blood of lava, teeth of stone.

name: Fledgling Osprey
text: It isn't truly born until its first flight.

name: Debt of Loyalty
text: "I killed him because I had to," Starke lied to Gerrard. "But now I pledge my loyalty to you."

name: Bloodrage Vampire
text: The most genteel facades hide the most abominable desires.

name: Brokers Initiate
text: Regarding the relative might of pen and sword, the official position of the Brokers is "Why choose?"

name: Navigation Orb
text: Travel the world without ever leaving the comfort of home.

name: Giant Ladybug
text: It's bad luck to step on one, but worse luck to have one step on you.

name: Bottle Gnomes
text: Reinforcements . . . or refreshments?

name: False Floor
text:
"That performance was truly the pits."
—Jetmir

name: Baba Lysaga, Night Witch
text: Better the cold night than her warm hospitality.

name: Walk the Plank
text: When Captain Thorn adds a new ship to his fleet, he gives the crew a simple choice: follow me, or fall in the sea.

name: Ashnod
text: Ashnod served as Mishra's confidante while he led Fallaji weapons development before the Brothers' War. Whereas Mishra works in metals and stone, however, Ashnod works in living flesh. She sees all living things as prototype machines; her "improvements" to them make her as feared by allies as by enemies.

name: Frost Breath
text: If you have to be stuck somewhere for a while, it's better to be stuck there with a friend.

name: Crashing Boars
text: Bores ruin a party. Boars are party to ruin.

name: Dragon Mage
text: "I've forgotten more spells than you will ever know."

name: Battering Ram
text: By the time Mishra was defeated, no mage was foolish enough to rely heavily on walls.

name: Gorion, Wise Mentor
text: "You are safest in Candlekeep, Abdel, but I cannot keep you from the world forever."

name: Thunder-Thrash Elder
text: Viashino thrashes are led by elders who have survived countless challenges.

name: Arvad the Cursed
text: "I won't abandon the *Weatherlight*. My destiny is to serve at Jhoira's side. This 'illness' means I must trust my faith more and myself less."

name: Tangletrap
text:
"It's like that old saying: what goes up . . . feeds the arboretum."
—Lisette, Witherbloom dean

name: Kinsbaile Balloonist
text: Even when a giant's tantrum turns the sky into a chaotic gale, the path of the balloonist never falters.

name: Faerie Mastermind
text: Yuta Takahashi, World Champion XXVII

name: Winding Wurm
text: Entire trees were stripped of their bark and branches by the wurm's writhing path.

name: Laboratory Drudge
text:
"Many hands make light work."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

name: Shield of the Realm
text: Benalish glazeplate is stained with salts from the Rift Era and enchanted to deflect blows.

name: Chaos Warp
text: Confused but undeterred, the butterflies charged into battle.

name: Wishcoin Crab
text:
"What wishes do they grant? Mostly pinching-related ones."
—Omik, superintendent of waterworks

name: Rishadan Airship
text: The view is truly spectacular—as long as you don't look at Rishada itself.

name: Iron Maiden
text: The maiden is a jealous lover.

name: Reckless Barbarian
text: The best defense is not even knowing what the word "defense" means.

name: Demonic Tutor
text:
"Demons prefer to deal with those who believe themselves too wise to be fooled."
—Scroll case inscription

name: Waterspout Djinn
text:
"Fly us higher, out of its storm."
—Sisay, captain of the *Weatherlight*

name: Destroy Evil
text: Serra's grace most often manifests as a healing touch, but it may also grant a merciful death.

name: Fallaji Excavation
text: Few relics excited Fallaji archaeologists more than Thran powerstones, which they called "eyes of the Old Ones."

name: Twilight's Call
text:
Twilight falls. We rise.
—Necropolis inscription

name: Pestilence Demon
text: "I have schemed too long to be supplanted by dead gods. If I cannot have this world, no one can."

name: Pygmy Razorback
text: As a rite of passage, Kipamu youths taunt razorbacks with long sticks . . . then flee.

name: Bond of Passion
text: "Why don't we fight for what's right and let bureaucrats argue over details?"

name: Varchild's Crusader
text:
"Every patch of land must belong to Kjeldor, no matter what the cost!"
—General Varchild

name: Living Hive
text: In its center is a single red ant, a queen that regulates the hive's movements.

name: Vanquish the Weak
text: The clerics known as condemners punish those who do not recognize the righteous authority of the church.

name: Dragon Mage
text:
"Yes, it's huge and strong and breathes fire. But we're smart!"
—Tadith the Wise, last words

name: Mana Leak
text: The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.

name: Cathartic Pyre
text: "Leave behind this sorrow of this body. Be blessed, being of light."

name: Grasping Thrull
text: "Debt due! Debt due!" The thrull's screeching makes children flinch and debtors quail. "Debt due!"

name: Valentin, Dean of the Vein // Lisette, Dean of the Root
text: "Life is as fleeting as it is vibrant. Embrace the brief blessing of a flower before it withers."

name: Arachnogenesis
text: Every movement is a summons—even your screams.

name: Whirlwind Denial
text:
"If they try to storm your palace, you must become the storm."
—*Handbook of Imperial Spellcraft*

name: Soul Snare
text:
"Body and spirit are sworn enemies. They will take any excuse to be rid of each other."
—Tariel, Reckoner of Souls

name: Shallow Grave
text: Good help is hard to dig up.

name: Jewel-Eyed Cobra
text:
"Sure, they're worth a lot, but I'd rather survive to spend my earnings."
—Mokgar, Kalonian hunter

name: Maritime Guard
text: Once common in the Kapsho Seas, merfolk were hunted almost to extinction. They survived those dark days and emerged calculating and determined to endure.

name: Acquire
text: "'Ownership' is such a gray area."

name: Invasion of Muraganda // Primordial Plasm
text: Before the tree of life branched into predators and prey, there was only shapeless hunger.

name: Scrapyard Mongrel
text: Trespassers are welcome to try.

name: Silvergill Adept
text: "I bring baubles of lore, lost secrets seined from the listening waves."

name: Fabricate
text:
"I'm one masterpiece away from ruling this pathetic world."
—Saldrath, master artificer

name: Gustcloak Harrier
text: Banking steeply, the aven streaked toward the ground—and vanished.

name: Bruenor Battlehammer
text: "Knew I'd find ye in trouble if I came out an' looked for ye!"

name: Walking Corpse
text:
"Is it hopeless? When wave upon wave of our dead return as mindless flesh-eaters to claw upon Thraben's walls? We're too busy cutting them down to indulge ourselves in such philosophical foppery."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch

name: Strength of the Pack
text: The pack that ambushes, eviscerates, and devours together stays together.

name: Candlekeep Inspiration
text: Tales of heroes past galvanize the heroes of the future.

name: Spirit of the Labyrinth
text: Students at the Dekatia Academy learn that being sent to study with her is a lesson in itself.

name: Sweatworks Brawler
text: The residents of Embraal were never known for finesse, just for getting things done.

name: Inner Struggle
text:
"Reflect upon your evils lest they reflect upon you."
—Inquisitor Laerin

name: Invoke the Firemind
text: To those in tune with the Firemind, there is no difference between knowledge and flame.

name: Urza's Power Plant
text: Artifact construction required immense resources.

name: Aurochs
text: One Auroch may feed a village, but a herd will flatten it.

name: Bar the Gate
text: "This path is closed to you!"

name: Tangleroot
text: As if there's glitch in the system, the Tangle sometimes folds in on itself, throwing off sparks of mana in a mystifying display.

name: Swords to Plowshares
text:
"The so-called barbarians will not respect us for our military might —they will respect us for our honor."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Reyav, Master Smith
text: "There's always room for improvement."

name: Lavafume Invoker
text:
"Then the ancient masters themselves, towers of rapacity, rose and began their calamitous feast."
—*The Invokers' Tales*

name: Lagonna-Band Trailblazer
text: Go forth with honor, return with glory.

name: Moorish Cavalry
text: Members of the elite Moorish Cavalry are very particular about their mounts, choosing only those whose bloodlines have been pure for generations.

name: Hornet Harasser
text:
"And though she didn't get her honey, Auntie found something far more interesting."
—A tale of Auntie Grub

name: Lurching Rotbeast
text: The dead that swept across Naktamun came in all shapes and sizes.

name: Nightbird's Clutches
text: Shiny polished silver can ward off many creatures, but it attracts others.

name: Hydromorph Gull
text:
"The only kind of water that should fly through the air is rain."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

name: Alley Strangler
text: "You never know what day might be your last."

name: Racers' Ring
text: Purchasing chrome racehorses with cash is a common means of dispersing mysterious income.

name: Dihada's Ploy
text: The last piece was finally in place.

name: Vampire Opportunist
text: "I think I cracked a fang."

name: Xathrid Necromancer
text: "My commands shall echo forever in their dusty skulls."

name: Sifter Wurm
text:
"Rhonas's monument belongs to the wurms now. Look elsewhere for refuge."
—Arnun, vizier of the menagerie

name: A-Vampire Scrivener
text: No one remains on her list for long.

name: Stone Rain
text: Soldiers often blocked off the steep mountain passes to ambush enemy troops in western and central China.

name: Rite of Flame
text: As the flames engulfed her, Chandra opened her heart and offered up her greatest regrets to be consumed by the inferno.

name: Convolute
text: "No, thank you."

name: Magus of the Abyss
text: He climbs a staircase of falling souls, fighting the continuous pull of the void.

name: Crack Open
text: What no spell or lockpick could open, the forest coaxed apart.

name: Sea Gate Loremaster
text:
"He's a living library. He remembers everything our band of explorers has seen, and we can use that to our advantage."
—Zahr Gada, Halimar expedition leader

name: Redirect
text:
"Your strategy is marvelous. I've just made a few minor adjustments."
—Veris, watcher of Indi Keep

name: Bottomless Pit
text:
"I'm sure it came with the place. I don't think you build one on purpose."
—Gerrard

name: Hour of Eternity
text: To serve as an Eternal is the afterlife granted to the worthy.

name: Lotus Cobra
text: Its hood blossoms as a warning: receive your gift, but stray no closer.

name: Blood Seeker
text: A drop now is all he needs to find you later.

name: Clarion Spirit
text: To the living, the horn sounds faint and mournful, but to the spirits of Istfell, it is a thunderous call that must be obeyed.

name: Drana, Liberator of Malakir
text: "I will not live as a slave. If you would be free, then fight alongside me."

name: Brothers of Fire
text: Fire is never a gentle master.

name: Glorious Charge
text:
"One's blade is only as sharp as one's conviction."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Wingfold Pteron
text:
"Its weak spot is easily spotted, but only if it's swooping down on you."
—Jonald, mission naturalist

name: Crystalline Sliver
text: Bred as living shields, these slivers have proven unruly-they know they cannot be caught.

name: Rotted Ones, Lay Siege
text: "Don't come back until you've got brains in your teeth."

name: Loxodon Wayfarer
text: The Mirran elders vanished with Memnarch, leaving behind a generation of wayward orphans.

name: Sling-Gang Lieutenant
text: Freshly promoted to "first rock," Zaz was eager to make an impact.

name: Thalia, Heretic Cathar
text: "Salvation will not be granted by the Lunarch Council. It must be earned-at the edge of a sword, if necessary."

name: Cosmic Epiphany
text:
"All knowledge, past and future, is etched upon reality. Every answer we seek is out there, hidden only by the limits of our minds."
—Jodah

name: Draugr Thought-Thief
text: The worst part is that you won't even remember how much he's taken from you.

name: Corrupt
text: There are things beneath the murk for whom the bog is a stew, a thin broth in need of meat.

name: Dampening Pulse
text:
"Quiet now, you dreadful vermin."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem roilmage

name: Bloodstained Mire
text: Where dragons once triumphed, their bones now molder.

name: Groundskeeper
text: "Soldiers speak of defending the soil, but they care only for their nations. I care nothing for their nations and everything for the soil."

name: Hamza, Guardian of Arashin
text: "I stand with every member of my clan, and they stand with me."

name: Mana Geyser
text: The Quicksilver Sea hissed and bubbled at the indignity. The Vulshok shaman just smiled.

name: Kelsinko Ranger
text:
"Rangers not trained by the Elves just aren't the same."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Weight of the Underworld
text: Proud Alkmenos, who would not bow to Erebos in death, is now bowed by his own hubris for all eternity.

name: Traitorous Blood
text:
"I can make you dance to my tune like a puppet, your very blood eager to obey."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Clot Sliver
text:
"One would think I would be accustomed to unexpected returns."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

name: Ogre Jailbreaker
text: It took three years for it to occur to him to use the chain as a weapon, but once it did, he made up for lost time.

name: Mammoth Spider
text: Most spiders of Llanowar disdain elvish alliances. No elf has as many beautiful eyes or as many strong arms.

name: Zombie Apocalypse
text:
"There will come a day so dark you will pray for death. On that day your prayers will be answered."
-Minaldra, the Vizag Atum

name: Deepchannel Mentor
text: The rivers can no longer provide safe passage for travelers and commerce. They serve only as highways for raiders and channels for blood and woe.

name: Blackbloom Rogue // Blackbloom Bog
text:
"The Raimunza River flows along the branches of jaddi trees for miles before plunging down to feed Blackbloom Lake."
—Exena, expedition rogue

name: Ember-Eye Wolf
text: No howl. No snarl. Just the roar of flames.

name: Outflank
text:
"With the drum of hooves and a flash of blades, the monster's terrifying roar changed to a cry of fear."
—*Legend of the Gilded Knights*

name: Their Name Is Death
text:
"When the Silent King saw what had been done, he knew at last the true nature of the C'tan, and the doom they had wrought in his name."
—*The Book of Mournful Night*

name: Anaconda
text: Something soft bumped against the rowboat, then was gone.

name: Kapsho Kitefins
text:
"It's a truly disconcerting sight to see their shadows cast upon the deck."
—Captain Triff

name: Ojutai Monument
text: Ojutai spends time at all his strongholds, but he most favors Cori Stronghold for his meditation.

name: Peema Aether-Seer
text: "The Great Conduit connects us all."

name: Necrite
text:
"Ever see a wall drop dead of fright, kid? It ain't pretty."
—Cpl. Dobbs

name: Cerulean Wyvern
text:
"Once, a Quirion asked why I was so cautious when the day was clear. I told him of the sky-blue hide of the cerluean wyvern, and he offered me double if I could conjure a strong tailwind!"
—Sisay, Captain of the *Weatherlight*

name: Godtracker of Jund
text: "The behemoths are content to graze like cattle, while dragons rage and conquer. I know which example I'll follow."

name: Crossroads Consecrator
text: "May the steel of your blade match the steel in your soul."

name: Baron Sengir
text:
"Beast. Defiler. The source of all my pain."
—Ihsan's Shade

name: Voldaren Ambusher
text: "Gotcha."

name: Thriving Turtle
text: Aether shapes everything on Kaladesh, from the sky to the sea.

name: Benalish Honor Guard
text:
"The true measure of all heroes is not what they achieve, but who they inspire."
—*Triumph of Gerrard*

name: Blessed Wine
text:
"May the bounty of Kjeld enrich your days."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Rising Populace
text: Grief is a crucible where resolve is tempered.

name: Spectral Sliver
text:
"Sure, I've seen agents of the Cabal here and there. Well, not here, and certainly not in any of the sliver labs. Oh dear, I've said too much."
—Apprentice researcher

name: Blanket of Night
text:
"Kaervek imprisoned Mangara out of jealousy, but he taints Jamuraa simply out of spite."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Roterothopter
text:
"The Roterothopter is as insidious as it is ingenious. It is one of the few creations of our school that I take no pride in."
—Baki, Wizard Attendant

name: Festering Newt
text: Its back bubbles like a witch's cauldron, and it smells just as vile.

name: Heirloom Mirror // Inherited Fiend
text: "Speak my name thrice, and be rewarded."

name: Quick Sliver
text: The directors of the Riptide Project wanted instant results on the sliver experiments. They got their wish.

name: Lightning Axe
text: Spirits disturbed by ghoulcallers become geists driven by restless anger.

name: Creeping Mold
text:
"Mold could catch you."
—Suq'Ata insult

name: Curse of the Bloody Tome
text: After seeing his life's work drip away, the mage decided it was a good time to go crazy.

name: Pestilent Spirit
text: Its stench corrodes steel. Its miasma sickens angels. Its finality ends hope.

name: Carrion Thrash
text: Viashino hunt in gangs called thrashes. Not all thrashes hunt the freshest game.

name: Ragged Recluse // Odious Witch
text: "Forgive my manners. It's been so long since I had a guest for dinner."

name: Rain of Salt
text: It pelts the land with its fury, spoiling what was once sweet.

name: Sorin's Guide
text: "My people serve the dragon Kolaghan, but I give my blood for a greater lord."

name: Phyrexian Digester
text:
"Our cause will ripen in the fertile flesh of the unworthy."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Mercurial Chemister
text: What some see as "distracted" is really "fathoming the unfathomable."

name: Deep-Slumber Titan
text: Do not disturb.

name: Magnigoth Sentry
text: When one of Yavimaya's enormous magnigoth trees awakens into a treefolk, it is a towering presence of physical strength and ancient wisdom.

name: Gaea's Cradle
text:
"Here sprouted the first seedling of Argoth. Here the last tree will fall."
—Gamelen, Citanul elder

name: Distress
text:
"Today I asked Master Dosan what the ogre mages did with the humans they sacrificed. He gave me a hard look and said to think no more on the matter."
—Meditation journal of young budoka

name: Thalakos Drifters
text: They drift in and out of shadow and ever on toward madness.

name: Engulfing Eruption
text:
"Compared to the hunger of the fires within the earth, the appetite of a mere wurm is nothing."
—Phelgis Ojin, Keral Keep acolyte

name: Predation Steward
text:
"Best we move on. That gurgling means it's feeding time."
—Melira

name: Ukud Cobra
text:
"The Silumgar hide behind the deadly wildlife of their swamps. They'd rather scheme in their jungle palaces than face us."
—Khibat, Kolaghan warrior

name: Goblin Sharpshooter
text: "Gunner" can't hear you over the sound of his swagger.

name: Valor Singer
text: "There is only one way forward: into legend."

name: Chandra's Pyrohelix
text: "This one's for my mom, and this one's for me."

name: Cleansing Nova
text:
An opal that holds limitless fire … my love.
Leaving the world anew
With its cleansing embrace.

name: Argivian Archaeologist
text: Fascinated by the lore of ancient struggles, the Archaeologist searches incessantly for remnants of an earlier, more powerful era.

name: Sootfeather Flock
text: They pick at the remains of the city's corpse.

name: Croaking Counterpart
text: Frog is the sincerest form of flattery.

name: Omniscience
text:
"In the arrogance of my youth, I believed I knew all there was to know. Now, my greatest wisdom is a humble awareness of all I have yet to learn."
—Teferi

name: Anaba Bodyguard
text:
"Not all Minotaurs are tribal. Some are freelance."
—Eron the Relentless

name: Scuttletide
text:
"We're going to need more butter."
—Ghoulcaller Gisa

name: Ravenous Demon // Archdemon of Greed
text: His twisted words entice the weak.

name: Dwarven Weaponsmith
text:
"Work with zeal as hammers peal! Melt, anneal, and pound the steel!"
—Old Dwarvish forge-chant

name: Waste Away
text: Chainer's insanity touched nearly every living thing—including viruses.

name: Earthlore
text:
