"Even the ground is our friend."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Veteran Bodyguard
text: Good bodyguards are hard to find, mainly because they don't live long.

name: Tundra Wolves
text: I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains.

name: Gatecreeper Vine
text: Every inch of Ravnica is home to something.

name: Anarchist
text: Those who will not follow are doomed to lead.

name: Smuggler's Copter
text: Don't forget to thank the Bus Driver.

name: Arisen Gorgon
text:
"I'm not picky about what comes up, but the less decay, the better."
—Liliana Vess

name: Phyrexian Negator
text: They exist to cease.

name: Chaos Maw
text: The food chain doesn't end at sandwurms.

name: Cleric of the Forward Order
text: War after war, a healer's enemy is always the same—death itself.

name: Mana Flair
text:
What began as black
Has slowly shifted to red.
Fickle color pie.

name: Tragic Poet
text: "In a healing world I write—I, who will never be healed. Let my last gift be one of memory: from a thousand lost thoughts, choose one, and remember my name."

name: Rampaging Brontodon
text: Not even the tallest tree stands a chance against the underside of a dinosaur's foot.

name: Finishing Blow
text: "In this world, it's kill or be killed. I'd rather not be the latter."

name: A-Case the Joint
text: Steel doors and iron bars are child's play for an Obscura operative.

name: Abstract Iguanart
text: Another moving piece by the artist El Gecko.

name: Fatal Fumes
text: Travelers in the undercity dread the horrors and assassins of the Dimir, but nearly as many die from more mundane hazards.

name: Anger of the Gods
text:
"Toralf struck the ground with his hammer, and the force of a thousand storms tore through the demonic horde."
—Birgi, god of storytelling

name: Body Count
text: "Your friends stayed quiet, and look what happened to them. You feeling a little more talkative yet?"

name: Myr Servitor
text: The Krark Clan enjoys pulling them apart just to watch them reassemble one another.

name: Messenger Drake
text: The more important the message, the larger the messenger.

name: Obsianus Golem
text:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone..."
—*Song of the Artificer*

name: Trudge Garden
text:
"Sure, trudges smell like soggy death, but the mushrooms on their backs are the tastiest delicacy in Sedgemoor!"
—Gyome, Witherbloom chef

name: Overtaker
text: "It's no challenge to master a Mercadian."

name: Vanquisher's Axe
text: When a Keldon takes a trophy from an enemy, it's usually something they can use to kill more enemies.

name: Shanodin Dryads
text: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.

name: Rummaging Wizard
text: "I've got everything you'd ever need right here. Just give me some time to find it."

name: Malicious Intent
text: As peace returned to Thraben, some cathars made the mistake of letting down their guard.

name: Feral Shadow
text:
"The night stalkers are such a minor power in Urborg. Their sad eagerness to elevate themselves makes them willing tools in the plundering of little Femeref."
—Kaervek

name: Tenement Crasher
text: Nothing was going to stop it—not the narrow alleys, not the Boros garrison, and certainly not the four-story Orzhov cathedral.

name: Sporecap Spider
text: After years of taunts and aerial assaults from Rankle's minions, the witches of Maraleaf Forest acquired new familiars.

name: Order of the Mirror // Order of the Alabaster Host
text: Soon she understood that it was not the vision that had been twisted, but her own mind.

name: Zealous Strike
text: "Cower, fiend. The night is yours no longer."

name: Jared Carthalion, True Heir
text: "I'm here for what's mine."

name: Malakir Rebirth // Malakir Mire
text:
"Those who fail to escape Malakir become part of the city's defense."
—Doros, expedition guide

name: Sonic Burst
text: Music scythes the savage beast.

name: Invasion of Tarkir // Defiant Thundermaw
text:
"The Phyrexians are fools if they believe they can weather such a storm."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Wall of Essence
text:
The ceiling and the floor fell in love, but only the wall knew.
—Dal saying

name: Ethereal Guidance
text:
"The call of the Blessed Sleep is not so strong as the call to protect those in need."
—Saint Traft

name: Barl's Cage
text: For a dozen years the Cage had held Lord Ith, but as the Pretender Mairsil's power weakened, so did the bars.

name: Icing Manipulator
text: Her most popular flavors are vanilla, maple pecan crunch, and Glurgian galactopod.

name: Curse of Obsession
text: He ripped up board after board until his hands were bloody. Still, he could not find whatever it was he sought.

name: Concealed Courtyard
text: Where high society and dark opportunity intersect.

name: Crackling Triton
text: He calls upon both the currents in the sea and the current in the clouds.

name: Inspiring Captain
text: "Our enemies will soon discover that we are not as meek as they had believed."

name: Kami of the Crescent Moon
text:
"He's a lot like me, that masterless little kami . . . unimpressed by grandeur and never at a loss for a trick."
—Toshiro Umezawa

name: Border Patrol
text:
"We have been victims of treachery, of the Cabal, and of our own ambitions. No more."
—Commander Eesha

name: Sandsteppe Scavenger
text: "Sad what passes for a dragon among the Silumgar."

name: Aven Trailblazer
text:
"The bird wore the form of a man, bereft of filigree. Why do the Texts not speak of it?"
—Belator of Esper

name: Stromgald Cabal
text:
"Kjeldor must be supreme at any cost."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Angel of Mercy
text: Every tear shed is a drop of immortality.

name: World-Weary
text: Intent: This is an abstract depiction of a spell that causes a person to rapidly age.

name: Burdened Aerialist
text: "Curse this glorious golden weight!"

name: Hagra Mauling // Hagra Broodpit
text:
"Din, turn around! Now!"
—Doros, expedition guide

name: Soothsaying
text: The vizier's wisdom proved invaluable in untangling the Mercadian knot of lies.

name: Screeching Silcaw
text: It's adaptively deaf to its own cries.

name: Information Booth
text: The information booth can answer over thirty-seven billion questions. Half the guests ask where the bathroom is.

name: Thought Reflection
text: Knowledge fills the mind of a fool and opens the mind of the sage.

name: Caldera Kavu
text: As powerful and malleable as the molten rock it calls home.

name: Tuktuk Rubblefort
text: As with everything else, goblins believe fortifications benefit from as many spiky bits as possible.

name: Aeronaut Admiral
text: The Consulate recruits its best pilots from the League of Aeronauts. Many go on to command entire fleets.

name: Axebane Guardian
text: Only a worthy few are permitted within the sentient forest known as Axebane.

name: Sanguine Praetor
text:
"Our fealty to guilds dooms us. The old gods shall resurface. Our skins will wave upon the guild-masts over emptied streets, and our bones will clatter in the wind."
—Ilromov, traveling storyteller

name: Sedge Sliver
text: Their flesh is as sodden as the fens in which they live, oozing to fill any wound and squishing to absorb any blow.

name: Battle Mastery
text:
"There is elegance in all the Ojutai do—even their killing."
—Kirada, Silumgar enforcer

name: Double Vision
text: "Your eyes aren't playing tricks on you. I am."

name: Ritual of Subdual
text:
"That which does not bend to the will of Freyalise shall surely break."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Roil Eruption
text:
"Our feeble villages and tiny encampments stand only at the whim of the Roil."
—*The Invokers' Tales*

name: Storm of Forms
text: Beware the fine print.

name: Scornful Egotist
text: "Once I was human. Now I am far more."

name: Wound Reflection
text: The mission of the Nighthearth, Illulia's cult of murderous cinders, is to intensify every pain suffered in Shadowmoor.

name: Incendiary Oracle
text: The flamespeakers of Akros live passionately, devoted to Purphoros and the cycle of destructive creation.

name: Soul Manipulation
text:
"Birth and death are both reversible."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Gatebreaker Ram
text: So-called "battering rams" pale in comparison to the real thing.

name: Dying to Serve
text:
"I used to have hired hands, but I discovered they make better waitstaff with the rest of the body attached."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Fraying Sanity
text: Those wound tightest are first to unravel.

name: Turn Aside
text:
"There are tides beyond those in the sea that are driven by Innistrad's silver moon. If you learn their patterns, you can channel them in fascinating ways."
—Tamiyo

name: Dauthi Trapper
text: Merfolk tell their young of Dandân, humans of Rag Man. Dal tell tales of the Dauthi, and they are far worse.

name: Bayou Groff
text:
"Groffs are great for tracking pests through the muck, but securing the pests before the groff devours them is a dicey endeavor."
—Lisette, Witherbloom dean

name: Naban, Dean of Iteration
text: "Perfect. Now do it again."

name: Woodland Cemetery
text: Farmers cut the trees and buried their dead. The dead rose up and killed the farmers. The trees grew back and strangled the dead.

name: Glory
text:
"Glory was gone; Glory was everywhere."
—Scroll of Beginnings

name: Rakshasa Vizier
text: Rakshasa offer deals that sound advantageous to those who forget who they are dealing with.

name: Guard Dogs
text:
"A good guard is alert. A great guard is also loyal."
—Benalish kennelmaster

name: Wasteland Viper
text:
"The Gruul embrace all things poisonous and living in the cracks of society."
—Teysa Karlov, Grand Envoy of Orzhov

name: Nature's Spiral
text:
"As Argoth's last defenders fell to Urza's juggernauts, Titania said, 'Nature cannot be destroyed, only changed.'"
—*The Antiquities War*

name: Yavimaya Scion
text: Each time the saw blade bit, the tree spat it out.

name: Alchemist's Apprentice
text: Side effects may include foul odors, scalding steam, and spontaneous nonexistence.

name: Hellion Eruption
text: Just when you thought you'd be safe, in the middle of an open field with no Eldrazi around for miles.

name: Amass the Components
text: "I knew I'd find a use for all that newt spittle!"

name: Ravenous Slime
text: Death eventually wiggles toward us all.

name: Heir of the Ancient Fang
text: On the last day of a Jukai agent's training, they are bequeathed a powerful relic blessed by the kami.

name: Keldon Arsonist
text:
"Fields can be replanted. Settlements can be rebuilt. Burn it all."
—Latulla, Keldon overseer

name: Phyrexian Grimoire
text: Every page cost a life; every secret cost a thousand more.

name: Devout Lightcaster
text:
"Goddess, grant us light to banish the world's shadows."
—Prayer to Kamsa

name: Loxodon Warhammer
text:
"A crafter must imbue her weapon with part of her soul—something the Phyrexians are incapable of doing."
—Melira, sylvok outcast

name: Dramatic Entrance
text: Some things aren't worth waiting for.

name: Mirari's Wake
text: The land drank power from the Mirari as though it had thirsted forever.

name: Lay Bare the Heart
text:
"True intentions lie not in the head but in the heart."
—Bontu, god of ambition

name: Hunting Drake
text: Even the fiercest beast will flee when faced with the possibility of becoming dinner.

name: Armor Thrull
text:
"Except for a bare spot at the base of their skulls, Armor Thrulls bear interlocking plates and spikes with the strength of steel. Their design is almost artistic."
—Endrek Sahr, "Thrulls"

name: Chaos Warp
text:
"Be careful when handling old magical trinkets. You never know who they've been."
—Augusta, Lorehold dean

name: Quicksilver Fisher
text: Phyrexia will stretch from sea to sky, across worlds and realities, inescapable and perfect.

name: Drake Haven
text:
"If you want to truly test your survival skills, walk the Obelisk Path when the drakes are feeding."
—Etha, initiate of Rhet crop

name: Wildfire Emissary
text:
"The efreet is a striding storm with a voice that crackles like fire."
—Qhattib, Vizier of Amiqat

name: Wall of One Thousand Cuts
text: Families of the fallen donate the swords of their loved ones to bolster the city's defenses.

name: Vega, the Watcher
text: One eye sees the past, one the present, and one the future—and none can be deceived.

name: Ancient Grudge
text: If there's anything a werewolf hates, it's a collar—especially Avacyn's Collar, the symbol of her church.

name: Al-abara's Carpet
text: Al-abara simply laughed and lifted one finger, and the carpet carried her high out of our reach.

name: Invasion of Ulgrotha // Grandmother Ravi Sengir
text: "I do enjoy a good apocalypse."

name: Riptide Chimera
text:
"I want one."
—Kiora

name: Arguel's Blood Fast // Temple of Aclazotz
text: ... to the lost temple of a bat-god of night, eternal enemy to the Threefold Sun.

name: Consume Strength
text:
"You are correct. This is going to hurt."
—Vraska

name: Scrap Welder
text: "This big metal guy will make some amazing wind chimes!"

name: Drover of the Mighty
text: "I do not lead. They do not follow. We walk together."

name: Ramroller
text: As unstoppable as it is unsteerable.

name: Amateur Auteur
text:
So Griselbrand was bound,
his rage brought to a halt.
'Til Lili Vess came 'round
asking, "Hey, what's in the vault?"
—*INNISTRAD! The Musical*

name: Conviction
text: "There is no greater coward than one who believes in nothing."

name: Swirling Torrent
text:
"Oops!"
—Grupgrup, sluiceway technician

name: Blossoming Wreath
text:
"I place this wreath for you, my kin. Even in death, you give me strength to avenge you."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Wall of Distortion
text: It reflects only nightmares.

name: Briarpack Alpha
text:
"The wolves turned on us and a chill swept over me. The pack had a new leader."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

name: Carnage Tyrant
text: Sun Empire commanders are well versed in advanced martial strategy. Still, the correct maneuver is usually to deploy the giant, implacable death lizard.

name: Hammerhead Shark
text: Cross the eyes of a hammerhead and you'll dot its teeth.

name: Swell of Courage
text: "Tideshaping is more than creating a few new puddles."

name: Tolarian Scholar
text: The Tolarian Academies embrace a tradition of study and research while discouraging the kinds of experiments that ruined the original island of Tolaria.

name: Towashi Songshaper
text: Most Uprisers augment their bodies for speed, strength, or protection, but a few just want to be one with the music.

name: Essence Drain
text:
"The elves are right: Death inevitably leads to life. But the truly powerful don't just experience this cycle. They control it."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

name: Panther Warriors
text: The dogs of war are nothing compared to the cats.

name: Mind Stone
text:
"I don't study it because I want answers; I study it because there is beauty in pursuing the unknown."
—Masvaad, Candlekeep librarian

name: Constricting Sliver
text: Slivers are often seen toying with enemies they capture, not out of cruelty, but to fully learn their physical capabilities.

name: Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir
text: To save this plane, he must forsake all others.

name: This World Belongs to Me
text: "Little insects, I have created entire worlds and extinguished twice as many."

name: _____ Bird Gets the Worm
text: It's not like anyone else really wanted it.

name: Stormcarved Coast
text: Frequent, violent storms shape the Nephalia coastline, sculpting cliffs and caves where monsters often lurk.

name: Tundra
text: 2015 Legacy Championship Winner

name: Arboria
text: As the world steeled itself for the New Phyrexian invasion, the heart of the Pinelands awoke, and a new maro-sorcerer strode forth to join the fight.

name: Spellbound Dragon
text: A king in Jund, a serf in Esper.

name: Cabal Paladin
text:
"The Demonlord has ruled every age. Every ruin, myth, and nightmare proves his power."
—"Rite of Belzenlok"

name: Raging Kronch
text:
"Seeing so much easy prey makes her crazy. See how she snorts and drools?"
—Dhuuz, kronch wrangler

name: Aven Mimeomancer
text: "If the skies are our only refuge, I will see all of us take wing."

name: Remorseless Punishment
text:
"I have suffered a thousand lifetimes of agony on this wretched world. I've far less time to share with you, but I assure you, no less pain."
—Ob Nixilis

name: Veiled Shade
text:
"I sang songs of sorrow for my lost love. Imagine my horror when, one night, they were answered."
—Milana, Orzhov prelate

name: Vampire Lacerator
text: The lacerators cut themselves before each hunt. They must feed before the sun rises or bleed to death.

name: Wall of Ice
text: "And through the drifts the snowy cliffs Did send a dismal sheen: Nor shapes of men nor beasts we ken— The ice was all between." —Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Wurmskin Forger
text: It takes three weeks for a patrol of hunters to down a slagwurm. It takes just as long to make a single cut in its hide.

name: Venser's Sliver
text: Venser admired his handiwork and smiled. His first prototype had joined with the hive mind all too well, running with the brood and becoming a predator itself. This one, he thought, would be accepted into the hive but still obey his commands.

name: Pyrokinesis
text:
"Anybody want some . . . toast?"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Sorcerer of the Fang
text: "The Great Serpent slumbers now, but all warmbloods will grovel in the dirt at its awakening!"

name: Ice Over
text:
"Slow the Consulate with whatever you've got!"
—Jasi Ganin, master siphoner

name: Beacon of Tomorrows
text: To look into its light is to meet the gaze of history.

name: Death's Presence
text: The Genestealer Cults rejoiced at the arrival of their gods . . . at first.

name: Righteous Aura
text:
"Good is not a 'thing.' You can neither touch nor own it. No, Good is a vision we all share and strive to make real."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Affa Protector
text: "Through all the terrors we face, I hold on to the memory of the world before the Eldrazi came. I'd like to see that world again."

name: Benalish Marshal
text:
"Some aspire to climb the mountain of Honor. The Benalish are born upon its peak, and from there ascend among the stars."
—*History of Benalia*

name: Tel-Jilad Wolf
text: Thanks to the wolves, Tel-Jilad is the one area of Mirrodin the myr don't see often.

name: Arrogant Bloodlord
text: "I would rather take my own head than be thwarted by a presumptuous wretch with a shield and a dream."

name: Nim Shrieker
text: As imps they were an annoyance. As nim they are a pestilence.

name: Wall of Blood
text: Blood is thicker than mortar.

name: Goblin Settler
text: The safer outcroppings were already claimed by goblin overachievers.

name: Dark Banishing
text:
"Femeref was guided by the wisdom of the Council of Voices. But in one terrible instant, they were slain, leaving Asmira as the sole voice of leadership."
—Hakim, Loreweaver

name: Forlorn Pseudamma
text:
"More children taken. This is an evil we will track without mercy."
—Anthousa of Setessa

name: Razia, Boros Archangel
text: Her sword burns with such brightness that foes avert their eyes and arrows divert their paths.

name: Moat Piranhas
text:
"Come on, it's not even that deep!"
—Gorin the Brazen

name: Meteor Golem
text: The impact sent the soldiers scattering—then something came out of the crater.

name: Cordial Vampire
text: "Please, come in! Hors d'oeuvres are on the table."

name: Minotaur Warrior
text: The herd's patience, the stampede's fury.

name: Rolling Thunder
text: "Such rage," thought Vhati, gazing up at the thunderhead from the *Predator*. "It is Greven's mind manifest."

name: Tide Skimmer
text: Fishing boats often follow hunting drakes to find the largest schools of fish.

name: Zhur-Taa Swine
text: Gurley was the first to domesticate one, though his widow didn't take much solace in that accomplishment.

name: Thought Eater
text: The first memory it sucks out of its host is how to get rid of it.

name: Vizier of Tumbling Sands
text: "Time is like the Luxa River—though it flows in one direction, it can be diverted."

name: Bumper Cars
text: For those needing instructions how to drive the bumper cars, there's a crash course.

name: Kruin Outlaw // Terror of Kruin Pass
text: "Hold tight. I've got a surprise for them."

name: Great Whale
text:
"As a great whale dies, it flips onto its back. And so an island is born."
—Mariners' legend

name: Stitcher's Apprentice
text: "Oglor create life, Oglor take it away. Oglor god! ... until Master return."

name: Hurricane
text:
"The raging winds . . . , settling on the sea, the surges sweep, / Raise liquid mountains, and disclose the deep."
—Virgil, *Aeneid, Book I*, trans. Dryden

name: Clambassadors
text: "Sorry we shelled your village—here's some gold."

name: Briber's Purse
text: Victory is certain. The price, negotiable.

name: Alchemist's Retrieval
text: To most, a terrifying apparition. To a necro-alchemist, a potent fuel source.

name: Extremely Slow Zombie
text: . . . iiiiiiinnnn . . .

name: Feroz's Ban
text:
"Without the protection of Feroz's Ban, I fear the Homelands are lost."
—Daria

name: Monitor Monitor
text: Nine fires, a hull breach, and a Quafloovian meganibbler escaped from the petting zoo. Things were suspiciously quiet.

name: Axgard Braggart
text: "Heavy? Ha! The Trollking of Mossrun was heavy, and I tossed him five miles!"

name: Vine Trellis
text: Nature twists knots stronger than any rope.

name: Dread Cacodemon
text: Those who hear its roar perish. The lucky ones only feel its fetid breath.

name: Tattered Apparition
text:
"Ah yes, I remember that one. I turned him inside out and cast his soul into an endless nightmare a few centuries ago."
—Braids

name: Clamor Shaman
text:
"Little goblin. Big noise."
—Ruric Thar

name: Disciple of Kangee
text: When no birds are available, Kangee's disciples fill the sky with anything that's willing to fight.

name: Restore
text:
"See, the land itself raises an altar to the ascendancy of nature."
—Mayael the Anima

name: Kalamax, the Stormsire
text: Its mood changes with the weather, and vice versa.

name: Crown of Flames
text: It is the forge of kings.

name: Indulgent Aristocrat
text: "If you're not surrounded by decadence, my question to you is—why not?"

name: Curse of Stalked Prey
text:
"Innocent thorns can fill the air with your bloodscent. Don't stray from the path."
—Elmut, crossway watcher

name: Tilling Treefolk
text: He digs his roots into barren ground, searching for old seeds that never had the chance to sprout.

name: Distant Memories
text:
"The fleeting shadows of his primitive self have all but vanished."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

name: Clone
text: One face, two minds.

name: Supreme Inquisitor
text: "It's hard to fight on an empty mind."

name: Dauntless Onslaught
text:
"The people of Akros must learn from our leonin adversaries. If we match their staunch ferocity with our superior faith, we cannot fail."
—Cymede, queen of Akros

name: Palace Familiar
text:
"The most profound secrets lie in the darkest places of the world. It can be prudent to make use of another set of eyes."
—Sidisi, Silumgar vizier

name: Ancestral Recall
text: 2005 Vintage Championship Winner

name: Vines of the Recluse
text: "The most elegant solutions are found in nature. You just have to know where to look."

name: Lunge
text: Cho-Arrim righteousness was no match for Benalish combat training.

name: Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite
text: "Rejoice, blessed evangels! The glorious light of *compleation* is nigh. Soon, we shall awaken the Multiverse from its slumber."

name: Brainstorm
text: "I have a plan. Actually, I have three."

name: Root Sliver
text:
"It would take another apocalypse to stop the slivers now."
—Riptide Project researcher

name: Slobad, Goblin Tinkerer
text:
"I used to joke that he had been exiled for being too smart. Now I know why he never laughed."
—Glissa Sunseeker

name: Carrion Crow
text: When carrion feeds on carrion, dark days approach.

name: Call to Heel
text: On Bant, a sigil is both a prize of honor and a bond of duty. The one who bears it may be called to fulfill that charge at any moment.

name: Rush of Blood
text: Sometimes it's not for sustenance or to feed the dependence. Sometimes it's just to feel again.

name: Liliana's Scrounger
text: "This arm's got plenty of use left in it. Who'd throw such a nice thing away?"

name: Attentive Skywarden
text: The same sturdy kitesail that once carried her safely through the Roil now allows her to monitor the pods' progress from above.

name: Empty the Catacombs
text: When the dead are laid to rest in Ravnica, it's usually just a nap.

name: Horn of Greed
text:
"Rath grows, and I am nourished."
—Volrath

name: Riveteers Initiate
text: Young viashino flock to the Riveteers for Ziatora's leadership, eager to unleash their own inner dragons.

name: Phyrexian Rebirth
text: As long as one drop of the oil exists, the joyous work continues.

name: Chub Toad
text:
"Chub toad, chub toad At the door. Run away quick Or you'll run no more."
—Traditional children's rhyme

name: Subversion
text: Kerrick's corrupt domain swelled like a blister on Tolaria's skin.

name: The Space Family Goblinson
text: The goblin word for "vacation" translates roughly to "a battered landscape of noise and violence."

name: Defective Detective
text: Nothing gets by her . . . except the evidence, the motive, and the culprit.

name: Spikefield Hazard // Spikefield Cave
text:
"Silence until we're through. Even a whisper's echo can dislodge death from above."
—Raff Slugeater, goblin shortcutter

name: Nef-Crop Entangler
text: "If you do not feel the thrill of battle, alive like a flame, you will never triumph."

name: Dire Fleet Captain
text: Orcs are happiest under captains who steer toward battle. Orcs of the Dire Fleet are downright jovial.

name: Femeref Scouts
text:
"The days before the war were filled with strange portents: scouts and herders spoke of villages reduced to ash, of farmers taken from their fields, and of foul beasts roaming the plains in packs. I know, for I spoke to them all."
—Hakim, Loreweaver

name: Burnished Hart
text: Not born of nature, but deeply connected to it nonetheless.

name: Join Shields
text: "We are the shield that never breaks, the bough that never burns, the song that can never be silenced."

name: Arrows of Justice
text: Archers from the Horizon Military Academy hone their skills by targeting pickpockets blocks away.

name: Lay Bare
text:
"It's good to learn from your failures, but I prefer to learn from the failures of others."
—Jace Beleren

name: Battle of Wits
text: The wizard who reads a thousand books is powerful. The wizard who memorizes a thousand books is insane.

name: Auramancer's Guise
text: "Consider not what the mask hides, but what it can reveal."

name: Pyrrhic Blast
text: Only the quartermaster wept for their loss.

name: The Fallen
text: Magic often masters those who cannot master it.

name: Call the Cavalry
text: Benalish citizens born under the same constellations share a star-clan. Their loyalty to one another interlaces the Seven Houses.

name: Sudden Storm
text: No matter how big and strong you are, the sea is bigger and stronger.

name: Shoreline Salvager
text:
"They search for treasures that wash up from the depths. Tracking one could lead you to riches. Or in circles."
—Javad Nasrin, Ondu relic hunter

name: Cabaretti Courtyard
text: So long as the Halo keeps flowing, the festivities never end.

name: Sanity Gnawers
text: The last thought to go through their victim's mind is the one they tear out through the scalp.

name: Goblin Striker
text: There's no word in the goblin language for "strategy." Then again, there's no word in the goblin language for "word."

name: Step Right Up
text:
"Ah, the midway, beating heart of the—well, maybe the big top is the heart. If there were two hearts then the midway—or the lungs. Lungs or stomach!"
—Captain Rex Nebula

name: Krark-Clan Engineers
text: "Well, I jammed the whatsit into the whackdoodle, but I think I broke the thingamajigger."

name: Nausea
text: No fear. No sense. And soon, no lunch.

name: Crested Herdcaller
text:
"Our survival, like theirs, depends on our ability to work together."
—Huatli, to Tishana

name: Aragorn and Arwen, Wed
text: Aragorn the King Elessar wedded Arwen Undómiel, and the tale of their long waiting and labors came to fulfillment.

name: Last One Standing
text: Some train all their lives for a shot at the title. Some just get really, really lucky.

name: Trained Jackal
text: To taunt a man into action, call him a coward. To insult him beyond forgiveness, call him a jackal.

name: Eternal Witness
text: She remembers all those who would otherwise be forgotten.

name: Esper Sentinel
text: The more Esper changes, the more he refuses to.

name: Riptide Turtle
text:
"As the storm waves crushed my sailors, I cried out to Thassa. The next time I saw them, hard shells encased them, and they swam away to safety."
—Siona, captain of the *Pyleas*

name: Blood-Chin Fanatic
text: "We are as brutal as our dragonlord. We strike like wild lightning and feast on human flesh."

name: Apex of Power
text:
"As I desire, so it shall be."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Reconnaissance Mission
text: "We've reached the xenos HQ. Transmitting coordinates now."

name: End Hostilities
text: Her palm flared like the eye of a waking dragon. Then all was calm.

name: Raging Gorilla
text:
"Every temper tantrum makes another angry gorilla."
—Femeref children's myth

name: Feast on the Fallen
text: He only paused to catch his breath, not knowing that it would be his last.

name: Victual Sliver
text: "We are kinfolk," explained Karn to the sliver queen. "Just as you need your progeny to complete you, so do I need the pieces of the Legacy to make me whole."

name: Vampire Nighthawk
text: As they fought the Eldrazi, many vampires learned to live among humans. Others were unable to make the adjustment.

name: Thriss, Nantuko Primus
text: "When you live for others, you live for yourself."

name: Shivan Dragon
text: Неоспоримый хозяин Шиванских гор.

name: Splatter Goblin
text:
"For some, perfection is but a single moment when form and purpose converge."
—Rona

name: Azorius Cluestone
text: Its three sides represent the Sova, judges and arbitrators; the Jelenn, scribes and elocutors; and the Lyev, lawmages and enforcers.

name: Unhallowed Pact
text: Agreements with demons seldom end at the grave.

name: Johtull Wurm
text:
"To bring her down we must be on all sides at once—leave one avenue open and we'll all be dead."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

name: Rix Maadi Guildmage
text: Insatiable, irresistible, and insane.

name: Garrison Sergeant
text: In the Legion, no flagpole is merely decorative, and every ceremonial sword bears an edge.

name: Falkenrath Reaver
text:
"Each day there are new reports of homes along Getander Pass and Hofsaddel falling to vampires of a more savage nature. I've even heard tell that Anje Falkenrath has returned. Please send whatever help you can."
—Sterin Gorn, letter to Thalia

name: Soul Conduit
text:
"You have an unhealthy attachment to your selfhood. I can help you with that."
—Malcator, Executor of Synthesis

name: Psychic Barrier
text:
"I tolerate Phyrexians because the dragon requires it. But I have no patience for uninvited guests."
—Tezzeret

name: Grim Flowering
text:
"Nothing in nature goes to waste, not even the rotting corpse of a good-for-nothing, blood-sucking vampire."
—Halana of Ulvenwald

name: Skull Saucer
text: No body is ready for this kind of power.

name: Empress Galina
text: "Above the waves you may be mighty indeed, but down here you belong to me."

name: Song-Mad Treachery // Song-Mad Ruins
text:
"I'm not proud of the things I did. But all I could think about at the time was how to make the noise stop."
—Yavotz, Sea Gate Expeditionary House

name: Sister Hospitaller
text:
"Ours is to honour the martyr, tend the fallen, defend the innocent, and walk always in the light."
—*The Hospitaller's Book of Hours*

name: Geistcatcher's Rig
text: The rigs were outlawed except in Nephalia, where malign spirits are as plentiful as crazed inventors.

name: Memory Lapse
text:
"Um … oh … what was I saying?"
—Reveka, Wizard Savant

name: Stonybrook Banneret
text: Made from trout scales and crawfish whiskers, merrows' shimmering banners flash in the water like lightning.

name: Disperse
text: Gryffid found his way home and resumed life as best he could, constantly hiding his newfound fear of clouds.

name: Goblin Snowman
text:
"Strength in numbers? Right."
—Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician

name: Llanowar Loamspeaker
text: Twigs broken underfoot in Llanowar tend to return the favor.

name: Pang Tong, "Young Phoenix"
text: "...It was Pang Tong's boat-connecting scheme That let Zhou Yu accomplish his great deed."

name: Tainted Aether
text: Gix despised the sylvan morass. The gouge that the portal had torn in the forest was the only pleasing sight.

name: Perilous Research
text: When the School of the Unseen fell, so many magical treasures lay abandoned that no amount of death could deter the stream of thieves and desperate scholars.

name: Firedrinker Satyr
text: Attending a satyr revel requires a high tolerance for pain.

name: Snapping Creeper
text: Its vast network of roots and vines keeps it aware of distant dangers.

name: Alchemist's Vial
text: A weapon best suited for those with good aim and steady hands.

name: Golgari Raiders
text: What the Golgari can't claim through patient undercity expansion, they seize in brazen topside sorties.

name: Teysa Karlov
text: Her uncanny predictions of Phyrexian movements saved countless lives, though she never revealed the source of her information.

name: Dense Foliage
text:
"Big plants not only good for hidin', but full o' tasty bugs, too."
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

name: Faerie Swarm
text: Untouched by the Aurora, Oona's faeries greeted the night like any other day.

name: Izzet Guildgate
text:
"Yesterday I didn't recognize my own guild. Today I see why. And for tomorrow I must be prepared."
—Niv-Mizzet

name: Fall of the Titans
text: As Gideon kept the brood lineages at bay, Chandra incinerated the bound Eldrazi titans.

name: Grinning Ignus
text:
"Take care what you offer the ignus. Food, perhaps. Coins. But nothing flammable!"
—Stovic, village eccentric

name: Arachnoid
text: It follows the green sun over Mirrodin's surface, spinning massive webs of whispersilk as it goes.

name: Command Tower
text:
"The war will be decided here, where the planet's defences are strongest."
—Marneus Calgar

name: Awakening
text:
"There are times when destiny calls forth a people and demands an action. *Now* is the time. *We* are the people. *This* is our action. Charge!"
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Metamorphic Wurm
text: Only a handful have seen it transform. Or, from the wurm's perspective, only a mouthful.

name: Fleeting Distraction
text: The first spell taught to young mages, it has spared the lives of many whose hands are too small to hold a sword.

name: Lurking Skirge
text: They never miss a funeral.

name: Thought Collapse
text:
"I can think of no greater punishment than answering your question in full."
—Lazav

name: Sachi, Daughter of Seshiro
text: "The warriors deal in poison and fangs. We shamans remember why our ancestors crawled with their bellies to the earth."

name: Barge In
text: The giant had heard of locks, but he had yet to discover a door he couldn't open.

name: Plague Dogs
text: They're not just retrievers, they're carriers.

name: Memory Leak
text:
"By halves does youth depart. I remember halves of names, halves of years, halves of myself."
—Ogaro, wandering sage

name: Rakdos Ickspitter
text:
"Our thrulls dissolve from the inside out in a matter of days. Shoddy work, but they're a scream while they last."
—Uzric, Rakdos guildmage

name: Nylea's Intervention
text: "I bring a wilderness no law can tame."

name: Chimeric Staff
text: The staff unraveled in a chaotic chorus of clanging, becoming an improbable beast of hissing blades.

name: Liliana's Indignation
text: "Days ago, you came to my door asking for help, Jace. Yet now here you are with accusations?"

name: Pacifism
text:
"If I fight, I might step on a butterfly. That would be sad."
—Krowg of Qal Sisma

name: Drafna, Founder of Lat-Nam
text: Alongside his wife, Hurkyl, Drafna built a legacy of scholarship that endured for millennia.

name: Make Mischief
text: A tidy desk is as good as an invitation.

name: Mandate of Abaddon
text:
"I am the Arch-fiend, the Despoiler of Worlds, and by my hands shall the false Emperor fall."
—Abaddon the Despoiler

name: Nearheath Stalker
text: "Do not speak of this to the elders. They look unfavorably upon my indulgences."

name: Slaughter Pact
text: Death is only the beginning of the end.

name: Lose Focus
text: The spell wavered, caught on the tip of his tongue and at the edge of his awareness.

name: Commander Liara Portyr
text: "It's a ghoul-eat-you world out there. Follow my orders if you want to survive."

name: Simic Sky Swallower
text:
"We've bred out the shortcomings of the species' natural form and replaced them with assets of our own design."
—Momir Vig

name: Archetype of Imagination
text:
"Is it not the embodiment of our aspirations?"
—Prokopios, astronomer of Meletis

name: Whisper, Blood Liturgist
text: "Look how they beg for the knife! The Demonlord has trained them well."

name: Pristine Talisman
text:
"A rakalite core paired with a powerstone matrix has significantly increased the healing effects of my original amulet designs."
—Urza, research notes

name: Titania's Chosen
text:
"What do a hero and an arrow have in common? In times of war are many more made."
—Elvish riddle

name: Final-Sting Faerie
text: Many heroes' last sight is a grin at the other end of a rapier.

name: Untaidake, the Cloud Keeper
text: Untaidake is the needle that weaves the fabric of creation.

name: Extortion
text: The enforcers make no effort to distinguish gold from flesh.

name: Liliana's Defeat
text:
"All the power you have gathered for yourself, Liliana, I can take away."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Insidious Dreams
text: Chainer dreams of ultimate knowledge.

name: Crush Contraband
text: The Izzet mage knew she would neither get her thermoinverter back nor have the satisfaction of exploding it herself.

name: Aven Tactician
text: The aven are admired, for they are able to fly with the dragons.

name: Walking Dream
text: Dreams, by definition, live shorter lives than those who dream them.

name: Triarch Stalker
text:
"Scour this world of these impudent trespassers!"
—Lord Traedrekkh of the Sekemtar Dynasty

name: Duress
text: Resistance is unthinkable.

name: Forced Retreat
text:
"Leadership, not numbers, determines victory."
—A Wu commander, before his 5,000 troops forced 15,000 Wei troops to retreat from Ruxu

name: Village Watch // Village Reavers
text: With no guards to be seen, the cobbled streets of Gatstaf echoed with howls.

name: Dragonmaster Outcast
text: "This world will be ruled by its rightful sovereigns, not these hideous pretenders."

name: Hidden Retreat
text: After an hour in the hidey-hole, Squee seriously pondered the advantages of danger over boredom.

name: Creepy Doll
text: A child's porcelain doll went missing one night, as did a pair of kitchen shears and the town magistrate.

name: Peregrine Drake
text:
"Always a welcome sight breaking through the clouds."
—Talrand, sky summoner

name: Bat Whisperer
text: "My little winged friends tell me which of these townsfolk are worth tasting for myself."

name: Inkling Summoning
text:
"Think of an insult so vicious, so vulgar, that you hesitate to speak it aloud. The strongest, most aggressive inklings are born from such scorn."
—Embrose, Silverquill dean

name: Curse of Clinging Webs
text: Clare realized too late why no one ever took the shortcut through the abandoned mill.

name: Darkwater Catacombs
text: Underdark flooding has swallowed ancient drow burial chambers, which are now haunted . . . and infested with oozes.

name: Snapping Drake
text: Drakes claim to be dragons—until the dragons show up.

name: Berserk
text: Das Erste, was ich spüre, ist die Wut — und dann kommt die Kraft.

name: Basal Thrull
text:
"Above all, a well crafted Thrull should be hideous—blasted of countenance and twisted of limb—to inspire fear and revulsion."
—Endrek Sahr, Master Breeder

name: Fae Offering
text:
"Beware the gift when you do not know the giver."
—Chulane, Teller of Tales

name: Sift
text: Dwell longest on the thoughts that shine brightest.

name: Hedgewitch's Mask
text: In Kessig, even celebration wears a fearsome face.

name: Sage of Fables
text: "There is no secret that cannot be sold."

name: Phyrexian Reaper
text: It desires only to help others shed the itchy wet skin of life.

name: Wall of Mist
text: Fog haunts the streets, rendering the familiar as otherworldly, changing neighbors into shadows, and muffling cries for help.

name: Deeproot Champion
text: "No good will come from what you seek. Turn back now or suffer an ignoble death far from your home."

name: Lure
text:
"When the forest wants something, no mortal mind can resist her."
—Maro

name: Rosethorn Acolyte // Seasonal Ritual
text: "Old battlefields make great gardens. So rich from the blood of the fallen."

name: Frostpeak Yeti
text: Some heroes line their coats with yeti fur. More yetis line their bellies with heroes.

name: Tormentor Exarch
text:
"Tend the molten slag, or be the molten slag."
—Urabrask's enforcer

name: Obliterate
text: For his family, Barrin made a funeral pyre of Tolaria.

name: Topaz Dragon // Entropic Cloud
text: What its gaze doesn't wither, its breath surely will.

name: Dance of the Skywise
text: The Ojutai believe in the Great Wheel: those who best serve the dragonlord are destined to be reborn as dragons.

name: Rhystic Deluge
text:
"I'll rain down on you with the power of magic itself. Then we'll see who prevails."
—Alexi, zephyr mage

name: Troubled Healer
text: "Which is worse: nothing to defend, or no one to defend it?"

name: Tawnos's Weaponry
text: When war machines became too costly, Tawnos's Weaponry replaced them.

name: Essence Feed
text: Eldrazi grow wherever something else dies.

name: Fire-Lit Thicket
text: Occupancy of the den changes from night to night as boggart gangs fight for control of a place they aren't willing to simply eat.

name: Kor Scythemaster
text: The kor of Zendikar are known for quiet determination in the face of overwhelming odds.

name: Rush of Battle
text: The Mardu charge reflects the dragon's speed—and its hunger.

name: Greater Stone Spirit
text: Having charted their way up the difficult face, the two mountaineers had to contend with the mountain's decision to stand up.

name: Viridian Harvest
text:
"In the midst of horror beyond imagining, I still see things that lift my heart."
—Ezuri

name: Wurmweaver Coil
text: Some use magic to spy through walls. Others use it to crush them.

name: Barrier of Bones
text: The Dimir rarely make statements, but when they do, the message is clear.

name: Gallows Warden
text: The spirit cares nothing for the crimes or triumphs of the slain. It shelters all beneath its stormy cloak.

name: Riptide Crab
text: It sleeps with its claws open.

name: Skullcage
text: Only a focused mind can survive it.

name: Hedron Scrabbler
text:
"I don't care when the hedrons awoke. *Why* is the question that really matters."
—Anowon, the Ruin Sage

name: Mob Mentality
text:
"Why is loud stupidity so infectious?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

name: Deranged Whelp
text:
"When you confront a wolf scorned by its pack, extra caution is the order of the day."
—Raf Gyel of the Quiver of Kessig

name: Tuya Bearclaw
text: "Send in your cavalry! Diaglu loves horsemeat."

name: Ohran Frostfang
text: Even the smallest drop of its deadly venom will subtract decades from your lifespan.

name: Mise
text: mise 'mīz v [alter. of might as well] (1997) 1: to win when you don't deserve to 2: to top-deck the "tings" you need 3: to be rewarded by an opponent's bad luck 4: to coin a phrase that spreads through the tournament scene like wildfire 5: to fling a monkey 6: to split firewood using a sharp instrument 7: To burn

name: Bone Pit Brute
text: Welcome to the club.

name: Innocent Traveler // Malicious Invader
text: I looked at her throat just now as she lay asleep, and the tiny wounds seem not to have healed.

name: Wreath of Geists
text: Before you travel the woods of Kessig, first get permission from those who died trying.

name: Godtoucher
text: "Gargantuans die not in moments but in moons. There is still time to aid this noble ancient."

name: Ruin Processor
text: The Eldrazi continue to sweep through the wastes, compounding destruction that already seemed absolute.

name: Planar Incision
text: Jin-Gitaxias had long coveted the secrets of planeswalking. Spirits that could pass between worlds made for perfect test subjects.

name: Oraxid
text:
"I'm constantly amazed by the tenacity of living creatures on this plane. Even in the stronghold's white-hot core, life persists."
—Ertai

name: Traveling Minister
text: Priests of the Sigardian Sect travel to the farthest reaches to spread hope and healing, even in the darkest times.

name: Goblin Outlander
text: Egbol stared in wonder at Naya's landscape. So much to eat. So much to steal.

name: Civilized Scholar // Homicidal Brute
text: "Me, angry? Of course not. Thanks to my research, I'm above such petty emotions now."

name: Radical Idea
text: Genius is finding the edge of what's possible, then jumping over it.

name: Marshal of Zhalfir
text: "How kind of our foes to move in such perfect, predictable unison. Split into squadrons and execute the Lion's Claw!"

name: Thryx, the Sudden Storm
text: Even in their mountain fortresses, the Akroans have learned not to anger Thassa.

name: Extravagant Replication
text: "Just one aether tiger? What do I look like, a peasant?"

name: Primitive Etchings
text: Ancient carvings in the trees of Krosa glow with power once again.

name: Reliquary Monk
text: A thing of Serra's realm exists only by the grace of her followers' faith.

name: Keiga, the Tide Star
text: The pull of the tide star holds eternal sway.

name: Mistmeadow Witch
text: Olka collected the evening mist for years, studying its secrets. Once she learned its essence, she could vanish with a thought.

name: Catalyst Stone
text: The gems' incandescence invades the dreams of all who see them.

name: Relentless Assault
text: With only 70,000 men under his command at the battle of Guandu, Cao Cao was able to defeat Yuan Shao and his 700,000.

name: Diabolical Salvation
text: To succeed, the wizards made a deal with devils.

name: Mana Crypt
text: At first they thought the vault was empty. Then the walls began to glow.

name: Incinerate
text:
"Spontaneous combustion is a myth. If you burst into flame, someone wanted you to."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Devour in Flames
text: Ob Nixilis had prepared for every eventuality—except Chandra Nalaar.

name: Skyshroud Condor
text:
Condor's flight augurs sleepless night.
—Skyshroud proverb

name: Pyromancer's Gauntlet
text: An inferno is just a gesture away.

name: Spell Burst
text: The brutish mage's version of thinking.

name: Silent Observer
text: It's not just a feeling—you are being watched.

name: Blightreaper Thallid // Blightsower Thallid
text: Mudcreep loved the taste of the funny oil that leaked from the wrecked machines in Urborg.

name: Knight of the Kitchen Sink
text: "Whew. For a minute, I thought I'd forgotten the gravy boat."

name: Lavaborn Muse
text:
"Her voice is disaster, painful and final."
—Matoc, lavamancer

name: Virtue's Ruin
text: All must fall, and those who stand highest fall hardest.

name: Tandem Tactics
text: In times of infestation and war, Zendikar favors the blades that strike in unison.

name: Master of Arms
text:
"Being the best usually means proving it to everyone."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Twinferno
text:
"More fire?" Jaya asked.
"More fire," Jodah agreed.

name: Skyline Predator
text:
"It will dodge your first arrow and flatten you before there's a second."
—Alcarus, Selesnya archer

name: Kangee, Sky Warden
text: "Let their horrors and machines come. We will meet them blow for blow."

name: Folk of the Pines
text:
"Our friends of the forest take many forms, yet all serve the will of Freyalise."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

name: Academy Journeymage
text: "We don't choose who comes here. We choose how long they stay."

name: Warrior's Oath
text: "I swear this before all gods old and new: I will fight to my last breath."

name: Orcish Cannoneers
text:
"It's a thankless job, and you'll probably die in an explosion. But the pay is pretty good."
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain

name: Pang Tong, "Young Phoenix"
text: ". . . It was Pang Tong's boat-connecting scheme That let Zhou Yu accomplish his great deed."

name: Mana Leak
text:
"If a man will begin with certainties, he shall end in doubts."
—Sir Francis Bacon,
*The Advancement of Learning*

name: Dragon Mage
text: "You'll bend to my will—with or without your precious sanity."

name: Vow of Duty
text:
"I prefer loyalty to be a matter of respect, not of magic. But one does what one must."
—Kaalia of the Vast

name: Spark Rupture
text: Phyrexia was defeated, but the repercussions of the invasion rippled through the Blind Eternities.

name: First Pick
text: Picking hammers is dangerous, but it's still safer than harvesting saw bushes.

name: Invasion of Dominaria // Serra Faithkeeper
text: "I was there when Phyrexia doomed Serra's realm with a single touch. I was there when Yawgmoth tried and failed to conquer Dominaria. And I will still be here when Elesh Norn lies dead."

name: Pardic Wanderer
text:
"To the head of Archaeological Findings: The excavation schedule at dig site 93-beta must be revised. Part of the site has walked off."
—Tolarian field dispatch

name: Bounding Wolf
text: With their usual prey scared off by werewolves, the wolves of the Ulvenwald adopted inventive new hunting techniques.

name: The Pieces Are Coming Together
text: "Cretins build machines. I construct destiny."

name: Cut a Deal
text:
"It's a win-win arrangement. I just happen to win the most."
—Duke Thalamra Vanthampur

name: Bloodhaze Wolverine
text:
"Build a moat. If we're lucky, it can't swim."
—Syr Branigan, knight of Ardenvale

name: Stasis
text: The universe let out a sigh of relief.

name: Ancestral Anger
text: "One vampire for every family member I've lost."

name: Junk Diver
text: Garbage in, treasure out.

name: Glistener Elf
text: "Beg me for life, and I will fill you with the glory of Phyrexian perfection."

name: Scour the Desert
text: Even in the most barren wastelands, every death feeds more life.

name: Invisible Stalker
text: "All that concerns me is the vampires' sense of smell and those freezing Nephalian nights."

name: Rousing of Souls
text: "We remember. We rise."

name: Battle Screech
text: All sounds harmonize with the Worldsoul.

name: Umara Raptor
text: Messenger, weapon, friend.

name: Behemoth Sledge
text:
"May this grant you all the strength of the behemoths and none of their serenity."
—Ajani

name: Qasali Slingers
text: No matter how hard they tried, they could never catch that red dot in the sky.

name: Lurking Arynx
text: Once it has your scent, it will hunt you from the Gurmag Swamp to Ayagor.

name: Defender of Law
text: "It is not my place to question Radiant's rule. I exist to enforce her will."

name: Mana Breach
text: The wizard had it all—until she tried to use it.

name: Olivia, Crimson Bride
text: Her grand wedding had one goal: to unite the vampire bloodlines under her rule.

name: Dawnray Archer
text: Their shots are fired most often as signals—or at those who didn't get the message.

name: Sludge Strider
text: Underneath the cities of Esper are cycles of life unseen by those who feed them.

name: Urbis Protector
text:
"I hear that Boros is losing its angels to the Gateless Movement. I'm sure this comes as no surprise to you."
—Teysa, to Lazav

name: Fervor
text: The intensity of their glare was soon surpassed by the intensity of their attack.

name: Dimir Signet
text: An emblem of a secret guild, the Dimir insignia is seen only by its own members—and the doomed.

name: Step Through
text: Doors open both ways.

name: Blight Mamba
text: Its venom drips with Phyrexia's hate.

name: Seed the Land
text: With a sadness and a sense of hope, Senka left the colony of her birth and, with her attendants, set out to serve as broodmistress, founder of a new colony.

name: Navigator's Ruin
text: "You won't be needing this. Or this. Or these . . ."

name: Eyeblight Massacre
text:
"I've already seen so much evil, so much darkness. Why do you insist on adding more?"
—Nissa Revane, to Dwynen

name: Early Harvest
text: "Give it a week and it will feed an army."

name: Woodland Chasm
text:
"Is this the grave of a god? A tunnel carved by the Cosmos Serpent? It matters not. It is no place for us."
—Iskene, Kannah storyteller

name: Merrow Commerce
text: Schools meet and mingle on Lorwyn's riverways. In the bustling interplay, the merrow renew their sense of community as they sharpen their wits and hone their trading skills.

name: Teardrop Kami
text:
"Do not fall into the trap of thinking you understand the kami. Cannot a drop of water be dew on the meadow, a glacier's thaw, or the tear of a child?"
—Sensei Hisoka

name: Murderous Betrayal
text: Which hurts more: a sword in the gut or a dagger in the back?

name: Weapons Trainer
text: "When I'm done training you, anything will be a deadly weapon."

name: Death Pits of Rath
text:
"Neither could I forget what I had read of these pits—that the sudden extinction of life formed no part of their most horrible plan."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The Pit and the Pendulum"

name: Keldon Raider
text: Keldon raiders' spoils are limited to what their colos can carry. No matter the value, the rest goes up in smoke.

name: Rhox Brute
text:
"In this new world, I have seen the once-devout rhoxes take up arms with the savages of Jund. I would be offended, but I see the wisdom in their choice."
—Gernan, Dawnray archer

name: Dream Fracture
text:
"Creation is a paradox. It hatches from its opposite."
—Olka, Mistmeadow witch

name: Icatian Crier
text: A thousand years removed from her home, her news of war had lost its context, but not its relevance.

name: Carrier Thrall
text:
"Later we will mourn those we have lost. First we must end their suffering."
—Drana, Kalastria bloodchief

name: Breeding Pool
text: Uncharted depths. Unbounded hopes. Unfathomable mysteries.

name: Gavony Ironwright
text: "I wish my work could shelter everyone, yet I pray we are never so few that it does."

name: Always Watching
text:
"We pray to Avacyn on high. On snow-white wings fearless you fly. Keep safe our souls. Keep safe our lives. May angels watch us from the skies."
—Children's prayer

name: Virus Beetle
text:
"They'll be debugging their code for days before they figure out what happened!"
—Eita, Futurist agent

name: Krark-Clan Shaman
text: "What do you mean, we're out of stuff to melt down? Give me your leg."

name: Knight of Grace
text: A light to pierce the shadows.

name: Chillerpillar
text: From its cocoon, a flurry takes flight.

name: Lightning Strike
text:
"The hand of Keranos can be seen in every rumbling storm cloud. Best not to stand where he points."
—Rakleia of Shrine Peak

name: Balefire Dragon
text: If it comes for you, die boldly or die swiftly—for die you will.

name: Auramancer
text: Beauty stirs the memory like a sweet perfume excites the air.

name: Carrion Call
text: The natural order is out of order.

name: Infantry Veteran
text:
"The true dishonor for a soldier is surviving the war."
—Telim'Tor

name: Hallowed Ground
text:
"On this site where Kjeld's blood was spilled, let none raise a fist or deny a beggar."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Hillcomber Giant
text: The giants believe the fossils they find in Lorwyn's rocky heights are dreams frozen in time, and they treasure them.

name: Scalding Cauldron
text: "It's a witch's trick, this cauldron full of pain. I wouldn't dump it on any but the wicked."

name: Always Watching
text:
"We pray to Avacyn on high.
On snow-white wings fearless you fly.
Keep safe our souls. Keep safe our lives.
May angels watch us from the skies."
—Children's prayer

name: Fyndhorn Elves
text: "We could no more abandon the forest than the stars could abandon the night sky."

name: Plots That Span Centuries
text: "I don't expect you to understand the myriad ways in which you're about to die."

name: Nightmare
text: As the poisoned land spreads, so does the nightmare's rage and terrifying strength.

name: Fiery Justice
text:
"The fire of justice burns like nothing else."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Gloom Sower
text:
"First, the darkness fell. Terror came next. After that, only despair remained."
—*The Tragedy of Morein*

name: Arcane Laboratory
text:
Too many wizards spoil the spell, but too many spells spoil the wizard.
—Sign on entry to arcane lab

name: Windrider Wizard
text: "It's an ideal method for exploring sky ruins. The drakes sniff me briefly but then lose interest."

name: Sun Quan, Lord of Wu
text: "One score and four he reigned, the Southland king: / A dragon coiled, a tiger poised below the mighty Yangtze."

name: Goatnapper
text: Kith goats are just for practice. The real prize, of course, is a giant's cloudgoat.

name: Fecundity
text: Life is eternal. A lifetime is ephemeral.

name: Call of the Ring
text: "The Ring is mine!"

name: Steward of Solidarity
text: In the midst of disaster, heroic acts became almost ordinary, and ordinary warriors became heroes.

name: Woodwraith Corrupter
text:
"Its darkened sap penetrates natural fibers and spreads its own genes. Emulation experiments are underway."
—Simic research notes

name: Wanderlight Spirit
text: The towers and catwalks of the Voldaren fortress are lit by the lanterns of geists endlessly seeking a way out.

name: Dehydration
text:
"You say Saprazzo is a city built on water? I hope they have enough to wash the dust from my throat."
—Sisay

name: Ripscale Predator
text: Dinosaurs rarely understand the idea of boundaries between the wild and the urban landscape.

name: Tunneling Geopede
text: As Ulamog's brood reduces the earth to dust, geopedes burst from their tunnels in search of solid ground.

name: Icehide Golem
text: In colder climates, ice is more obedient than stone.

name: Whipgrass Entangler
text: "Now that I have your attention, perhaps I can tell you of the Order."

name: Malakir Cullblade
text: Each cut stains his blade with fresh blood that he samples to increase his strength.

name: Volt Charge
text:
"There's a war brewing between Norn and Urabrask. Exploit the chaos, and we can take them both down for good."
—Koth

name: Benalish Hero
text: Benalia has a complex caste system that changes with the lunar year. No matter what the season, the only caste that cannot be attained by either heredity or money is that of the hero.

name: Naga Oracle
text: "All questions will be answered during the Hour of Revelation."

name: Debtors' Transport
text: By design, the sarcophagus muffles the debtors' moans but does not silence them.

name: Exquisite Blood
text: "Blood is too precious a thing in these days of dishonourable peace."

name: Michiko Konda, Truth Seeker
text:
"Watch over my father. Tell him I'm safe, but I won't come home until I find out how to bring him back to his senses, and Kamigawa is again at peace."
—Michiko Konda, last letter to General Takeno

name: Slayers' Stronghold
text: Its courtyards are lit during every hour of the day so that night may never fall within its walls.

name: Glen Elendra Pranksters
text: Victims spirited through a faerie ring find themselves stranded miles away.

name: Kabuto Moth
text:
"Many great warriors died in the first days of the war, as the spirits of their weaponry turned against them with terrifying rage."
—*Observations of the Kami War*

name: Mulch
text:
"Tread carefully. You remember what happened in the last quiet, peaceful clearing."
—Halana, to Alena

name: Dig Up
text: Things buried on Innistrad rarely seem to stay that way.

name: Wicker Picker
text: "Unless you're quicker, I wouldn't snicker."

name: Choking Tethers
text: A wizard can be outnumbered but never outsmarted.

name: Scavenging Scarab
text: The beetles feed not on the flesh of corpses but on the metal, grinding out the iron and steel to add to their own bulky shells.

name: Benalish Missionary
text:
"These horn-haters say no gods but theirs exist. I say let him find out for himself—right now!"
—Tahngarth of the *Weatherlight*

name: Magus of the Bazaar
text: "Some trade in goods, some in secrets. My soul has walked the futures, and I offer the rare coin of possibility."

name: Ground Rift
text: Some time rifts didn't take away the people but just the ground they stood on.

name: A-Sepulcher Ghoul
text: Ghouls devour the dead and any living creatures unwary enough to fall into their grasp.

name: Makindi Sliderunner
text: After a battle, it breaks the hillsides into manageable pieces to prepare for next time.

name: Undercity's Embrace
text: The undercity is always hungry.

name: Kami of False Hope
text:
"Across the rift of battle, a bridge of gossamer. And for one moment, it holds."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Cunning Wish
text: He wished for knowledge, but not for the will to apply it.

name: Illusionary Forces
text:
"This school was founded in secret, operates in secret, and exists for the teaching of secrets. Those who would alter reality must first escape it."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Hurkyl's Recall
text: Hurkyl's research at the College of Lat-Nam wasn't enough to stop the two brothers, but for centuries thereafter her spellcraft taught artificers restraint.

name: Voldaren Bloodcaster // Bloodbat Summoner
text: "Do you mean to tell me that Lucy was bitten by such a bat . . . ?"

name: Overgrown Battlement
text:
"Our enemy is nothing less than the end of all life. We shall not want for allies."
—*The War Diaries*

name: Glen Elendra Liege
text: Those who displease Oona soon learn the extent of the armies she commands.

name: Daybreak Coronet
text:
"Let the deception of the gods yield to the pure light of day."
—Brimaz, king of Oreskos

name: Dimir Charm
text:
"Dangerous to recognize. Deadly not to."
—Lazav

name: Repercussion
text: Not all Keld's warriors are found on the battlefield.

name: Spellskite
text:
"Let's show Vorinclex that progress doesn't always need teeth or claws."
—Malcator, Executor of Synthesis

name: Giant's Ire
text: The only feeling greater than hurling something a mile is crushing something else with it that was really, really irritating you.

name: Laquatus's Champion
text: Темный дар Чейнера еще более темной душе.

name: Horned Turtle
text: It's a mistake to say turtles hide in their shells. They merely need time to contemplate how best to bite your head off.

name: Humble
text:
"It is not your place to rule, Radiant. It may not even be mine."
—Serra

name: Fervent Cathar
text: "I'll put my sword down only to die. And I don't plan on doing that today."

name: Rescuer Chwinga
text: Fortunately for lost travelers, chwingas' curiosity often gets the better of their shyness.

name: Yawgmoth's Edict
text:
"Phyrexia's purity permits no other."
—Xantcha, Phyrexian outcast

name: Shadow in the Warp
text: The astropath collapsed, his empty eye sockets aglow. He spoke three words before falling lifeless to the ground: "They . . . are . . . coming!"

name: Angelic Ascension
text: Within her battalion she was known as the Angel of Arkvale. Until now, that was only a metaphor.

name: Gnat Miser
text: Nezumi insect-shamans enjoyed solitary lives, which was fortunate since no other nezumi could stand to live within half a mile of their foul stench.

name: Blinding Souleater
text:
"We thank the souleaters for inscribing our souls with subservience, to reinforce the sacred order."
—Drones' hymn of gratitude

name: Ceremonious Rejection
text: The judges at the Fair are held in such high esteem that a nod of recognition can inspire an inventor for a lifetime—and a wave of dismissal can end a career.

name: Murk Dwellers
text: When Raganorn unsealed the catacombs, he found more than the dead and their treasures.

name: Cloak of the Bat
text:
"How about the power of silent flight? Does that suit your needs, cutthroat?"
—Rivalen Blackhand, proprietor of Sorcerous Sundries

name: Apothecary Initiate
text: Kithkin jealously hoard their knowledge of poultices and remedies so that no outside threat can benefit from their wisdom.

name: Spirit en-Kor
text:
Death free throat from thirst, mouth from speech, feet from earth.
—Kor requiem

name: Browse
text:
"Once great literature—now great litter."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Headless Rider
text: He wanders the Moorlands hoping to one day chop off a head worthy of replacing his own.

name: Imposing Vantasaur
text: Raugrin's coastline can be quite beautiful, as long as you avoid the volcanic dinosaurs, the sea dinosaurs, and the roaming beach dinosaurs.

name: Qarsi High Priest
text: "Hear me, nameless, and obey."

name: Commander's Sphere
text: Within it rests the power of a sun, and none of the warmth.

name: Vault of Whispers
text:
"Koilos, the Thran prison-city, built to house their outcasts and dissidents. It was that Phyrexia's influence first festered."
—*Fall of the Thran*

name: Bonethorn Valesk
text: Barbarians weave its spurs into ceremonial charms to proclaim their hardiness in battle.

name: Anticipate
text: "When I have meditated on all outcomes, my opponent has no recourse."

name: Talisman of Dominance
text:
"As swift as a lash mamba, as sharp as a spineleaf, as stubborn as a wild grox."
—Colonel Pannet, in praise of the Catachan warrior

name: Angus Mackenzie
text: "Battles no longer served a purpose in Karakas." —Angus Mackenzie, *Diary*

name: Buy Your Silence
text: Mikey "the Mouth" kept his nickname after he struck his deal with Gregorio, even though he never spoke another word.

name: Thraben Heretic
text: "Let them decry me for burning the dead. I'm not giving those ghoulcallers any more fuel for their madness."

name: Tuskeri Firewalker
text: "Toralf blessed me with fire. I am worthy of Starnheim!"

name: Lightning Helix
text: Though less well-known than its army of soldiers, the Boros Legion's mage-priests are as respected by the innocent as they are hated by the ghosts of the guilty.

name: Yarok's Wavecrasher
text:
"Yarok's waters rush and rage
Where armies bled into the sand."
—*Lament for Bala Ged*, stanza 2

name: Inferno
text:
"Some have said there is no subtlety to destruction. You know what? They're dead."
—Wandering mage

name: Agonizing Syphon
text:
"Your death will take a mere moment, but it will feel like an eternity."
—Vilis, Broker of Blood

name: Wall of Spears
text:
"A stick is your friend. A pointed stick is your good friend. An army of pointed sticks is your best friend."
—Onean sergeant

name: Funeral Longboat
text:
"Cast onto the windless water, he drifted until the sea turned to sky."
—*Saga of the Lost King*

name: Angelic Overseer
text: From mortal hope immortal power springs.

name: Scrabbling Claws
text: Feed it steel. Feed it gold. Feed it bone. In the belly of the furnace, the flames know no difference.

name: Swamp
text: As a plague ravages the world above, you've made your way into the Underdark in search of a fungal panacea.

name: Swords to Plowshares
text: He stood transfixed, able to do nothing but ponder a life of peace and redemption. It was the worst five minutes of his life.

name: Urza's Armor
text:
"Tawnos's blueprints were critical to the creation of my armor. As he once sealed himself in steel, I sealed myself in a walking crypt."
—Urza

name: Storm Crow
text:
"Watch for it! Right on its tailfeathers will be a storm from your nightmares."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skycaptain

name: Desert of the Glorified
text: On countless frontier worlds, below silica sand, blasted chalk, or bubbling marsh, slumbering Necrons wait.

name: Talas Merchant
text: The trader let loose a laugh that made all around him check their purses.

name: Ravenous Giant
text: The might of an army with the restraint of a child.

name: Ornithopter
text: Once a year, the skies over Paliano fill with the flying machines of those who hope to be taken on as pupils by the artificer Muzzio.

name: Cold Snap
text: Who knows from whence the winter comes?

name: Primordial Sage
text: For each creature that arrives in its audience, the sage imparts another piece of ancient wisdom for all to hear.

name: Yarok, the Desecrated
text:
"Yarok grieves within the waste
Of Bala Ged's corrupted land."
—*Lament for Bala Ged*, stanza 1

name: Sheltering Prayers
text: "It matters not if the gods hear my prayers. Jamuraa does."

name: Tamanoa
text: When Freyalise spoke the World Spell, the tamanoa rose to bring a new morning to Terisiare.

name: Planeswalker's Favor
text: Freyalise strengthens her faithful.

name: Screaming Fury
text: He's got an axe to grind.

name: Baloth Null
text:
"Humans use pigs to hunt for mushrooms, don't they? It's like that."
—Harak, Malakir bloodwitch

name: Conduit of Storms // Conduit of Emrakul
text: As without, so within.

name: Terashi's Grasp
text:
"The jeweler, the potter, the smith . . . They all imbue a bit of their souls into their creations. The kami destroy that crafted mortal shell and absorb the soul within."
—Noboru, master kitemaker

name: Vindictive Flamestoker
text: Her faith burns hot enough to sear away the flesh of the heretic.

name: Beloved Princess
text: Sometimes a gentle slipper can travel where an armored boot's been denied.

name: Blackblade Reforged
text: It spilled the blood of one elder dragon. In Gideon's hands, it may yet taste another's.

name: Sakura-Tribe Elder
text: 大蛇の領地には墓石が無い。死んだ戦士は木の苗と共に埋められ、死して後に森の一部となるのだ。

name: Floodtide Serpent
text:
"Pray to Thassa for *what*? A bigger monster to eat it? A wave that can wash it away? What then?"
—Lindos, merchant of Meletis

name: Terror
text:
"A simple trap in a dark corner of the mind, and their nightmares catch up with them."
—Geth, keeper of the Vault

name: Airborne Aid
text:
"We help our Southern Order comrades as much as we can. But the Cabal's insidious influence spreads, dividing our forces and leaving new arrivals to fend for themselves."
—Commander Eesha

name: Shyft
text:
"Capturing this specimen was not easy. Study it well, that you someday might be as versatile."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Pinion Feast
text:
"Even paradise is not without tragedies."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Diplomacy of the Wastes
text:
"Our emissaries are gifted negotiators."
—Alesha, Who Smiles at Death

name: Cemetery Puca
text:
"'Tis a strange creature indeed that chooses the vanquished over the victor."
—Awylla, elvish safewright

name: Humbler of Mortals
text: The anger of the gods multiplied in Nyx, and the land awoke in dark echoes of their rage.

name: Penregon Strongbull
text: His child-lifting act was second only to his cauldron-punting routine.

name: Coiled Tinviper
text: The bite of the tinviper feels most like a razor drawn across the tongue.

name: Die Young
text: "When the time comes, let go. Nothing lasts forever."

name: Heat Stroke
text:
"Stroke of heat or stroke of blade. Choose your fate, traitor."
—Maraxus of Keld, to Starke

name: Theft of Dreams
text: "First they fight, then they sleep, then they dream. And finally I receive my reward."

name: Femeref Knight
text:
"I will return / with lizard skins for your sandals. Paint your eyes black and wait for me."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Coat of Arms
text:
"Hup, two, three, four,
Dunno how to count no more."
—Mogg march

name: Relearn
text: The hardest lessons to grasp are the ones you've already learned.

name: Coat of Arms
text:
"Hup, two, three, four,
Dunno how to count no more."

name: Ajani's Comrade
text: "I will go where the lion-man leads."

name: Fire Diamond
text: The essence of flame to stoke the spirit.

name: Kill-Suit Cultist
text: Dressed to kill.

name: Life Burst
text: As uplifting as a mystic's dreams.

name: Naga Eternal
text:
"I recognize that headdress. This one was feared even by her fellow initiates."
—Samut

name: Ghostway
text:
"I watched its blade swing through me, but I was hollow, empty. I saw its face contort in rage but could not hear it snarl."
—Klattic, Boros legionnaire

name: Baton of Morale
text:
"The Goblins would kill to get ahold of this one."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Grotag Bug-Catcher
text: "Everybody grab a leg!"

name: Fiery Fall
text: Jund feasts on the unprepared.

name: Smash to Smithereens
text: The giant Tarvik dreamed that trinkets and machines caused all the world's woe. When he awoke from his troubled sleep, he took the name Tarvik Relicsmasher.

name: Qarsi Sadist
text: Dying for the greater good still hurts.

name: Bogbrew Witch
text: "The hardest thing is finding the right ingredients."

name: Laccolith Warrior
text: The screams are brief. The silence lingers.

name: Armor of Shadows
text:
"What's softer than silk, stronger than steel, and quieter than thought?"
—Warlock riddle

name: Timberland Ancient
text: Only the trees were old enough to remember what happened when Moag ignored warnings of Phyrexia millennia ago. They were determined not to repeat the mistake.

name: Lu Su, Wu Advisor
text: Lu Su served as an intermediary between the Wu and Shu kingdoms until Zhou Yu's death in 210, when he became Wu's supreme commander.

name: Wash Out
text:
"Rest now. You've neither won nor lost, but this battle is over for you just the same."
—Teferi

name: Timber Wolves
text: Though many think of Wolves as solitary predators, they are actually extremely social animals. During a hunt they often call to each other, which can be quite unsettling for their prey.

name: Diregraf Captain
text: Though its mind has long since rotted away, it wields a sword with deadly skill.

name: Despoiler of Souls
text: Rats and vultures devour. It desecrates.

name: Mox Ruby
text: 2017 European Vintage Champion

name: Vodalian Merchant
text: Not choosing sides in a war can be dangerous—but lucrative.

name: Essence Warden
text: "Life begets life."

name: Rumbling Baloth
text: In the dim light beneath the vast trees of Deepglade, baloths prowl in search of prey. Their guttural calls are more felt than heard, but their attack scream carries for miles.

name: Ichor Synthesizer
text: "I've isolated the chirality of the glistening oil, so there will be no wasted precursors."

name: Primaris Chaplain
text: Every kill is a sacrament of the Emperor's glory.

name: Arguel's Blood Fast // Temple of Aclazotz
text: Arguel's vision led him into the jungles of Ixalan . . .

name: Copper Myr
text: The myr are like verdigris: an ever-present patina on the surface of a metal world.

name: Seal of Doom
text:
"A basilisk's gaze is effective, but disposing of physical remains is a tiresome task. It's far more discreet to dissolve one's victim entirely."
—Szadek

name: Brave the Elements
text:
"Trust me, your lost fingers and toes are nothing compared to the lost treasures of Sejiri."
—Zahr Gada, Halimar expedition leader

name: Acolyte of Xathrid
text: Like all priests, she gives her blessings only to those truly worthy of them.

name: Spear of Heliod
text: Legend speaks of the Sun Spear, the mighty weapon that can strike any point in Theros, even the depths of the Underworld.

name: Ruinous Ultimatum
text:
"Strike those abominations down. Let their names rot with their remains."
—General Kudro

name: Blow Your House Down
text:
"You think these walls will protect you?
My, you have a dim view of the power of the wilds."
—Marawen, barrow witch

name: Order of the White Shield
text: A shield of light admits no shadow.

name: Decimate
text:
"Anyone can admire creation. Only a barbarian sees the beauty in demolition."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

name: Pacifism
text: Even those born to battle could only lay their blades at Akroma's feet.

name: Chronicler of Heroes
text: She paints pictures with words, though not all pictures show the truth.

name: Spell Snare
text: Every culture has its unlucky numbers. In a city where you're either alone, in a crowd, or being stabbed in the back, two is the worst number of all.

name: Crow of Dark Tidings
text:
"Well, this can't be a good sign."
—Old Rutstein

name: Codespell Cleric
text: "Today we are not Beskir or Tuskeri. We must fight as one clan, shoulder to shoulder, to defend our rightful home!"

name: Seascape Aerialist
text: "The sky is like another sea. It teems with currents, life, and endless possibility."

name: Tuktuk Grunts
text: Goblins are more aggressive with a crowd to cheer them on.

name: Lat-Nam's Legacy
text:
"Lat-Nam has bequeathed us its secrets. With them we shall attain true enlightenment."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

name: Serum Visions
text: "Why stop at the third eye?" came a whisper from the cup. "Drink more, and open them all."

name: Bloodhunter Bat
text: It returns eager to share the feast of blood and gore with its ghoulish master.

name: Stampeding Rhino
text: The quickest way to get through the jungle is to agitate a rhino and run in its wake.

name: Sailor of Means
text: In the Brazen Coalition, the wheels of business are greased with plunder.

name: Krovikan Sorcerer
text:
"These sorcerers always seem to have another surprise up their sleeves."
—Zur the Enchanter

name: Aesthir Glider
text:
"Sacrilege! A noble ally in life, made nothing more than a glorified kite in death!"
—Arna Kennerüd, Skycaptain

name: Ayumi, the Last Visitor
text: Before Shinka's walls were built, before the torii at Okina stood, she was there, tall and proud against the sky, and she will be there long after they have fallen into dust.

name: Krovikan Mist
text: Plague-induced dreams became real as they swirled above Krov, mingling with the magical residue of the World Spell.

name: Lion's Eye Diamond
text: Held in the lion's eye -Zhalfirin saying meaning "caught in the moment of crisis"

name: Get the Point
text:
"Vraska sees the grandeur in death but misses the hilarity."
—Judith

name: Ensnaring Bridge
text: Bridges usually get you from one place to another. This one just gets you.

name: Journey to Eternity // Atzal, Cave of Eternity
text: . . . but every end is a new beginning.

name: Orzhov Guildgate
text:
"So much wealth. So much splendor. So much temptation to believe the gilded lie."
—Kaya

name: Khalni Ambush // Khalni Territory
text:
"The difference between life and death in Ora Ondar is about three seconds of startled screaming."
—Raff Slugeater, goblin shortcutter

name: Chandra's Embercat
text:
"Furballs? Try dealing with fireballs."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Saltblast
text: Dominaria erodes with each passing gust.

name: War Priest of Thune
text: "The sacred might of Thune thunders in my soul."

name: Castle Embereth
text: Without Embereth's courage, the realm would falter and fall.

name: Into the North
text:
"Our border lands fall under the grip of Heidar's second winter. Go forth and reclaim them for Yavimaya."
—Kaysa, elder druid of the Juniper Order

name: Talisman of Hierarchy
text:
"You'll never get to the top if you don't know who's already there."
—Kaya

name: Time Reversal
text:
