"Any oaf can conquer a kingdom. It takes true power to conquer time."
—Shai Fusan, archmage

name: Bramblewood Paragon
text: Those who seek to escape her blades succeed only in dying on their stomachs.

name: Fires of Victory
text: The drums and horns were expected, but the goblin dance was a pleasant surprise.

name: Greater Auramancy
text: "The wonders of Nyx do not belong solely to the gods."

name: Befuddle
text:
"The trick to talking sense into Keldons is getting them to hold still. I learned that from Radha."
—Jhoira

name: Urban Utopia
text: Ravnica's diversity produces blossoms of opinion in a rich soil of perspectives.

name: Champion's Drake
text:
"'Fraid of heights? Ride a horse. 'Fraid of missing out? Rein up a drake."
—Trinda, Hada spy patrol

name: Lashknife
text: Those it won't scare, it scars.

name: Kraum, Ludevic's Opus
text:
"It lives ... IT LIVES!"
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

name: Otherworld Atlas
text:
"Any fool can open it. But it takes a genius to decipher the blank pages."
—Kordel the Cryptic

name: Benalish Faithbonder
text: "A single light can hold back endless darkness."

name: Goblin Digging Team
text:
"From down here we can make the whole wall collapse!"
"Uh, yeah, boss, but how do we get out?"

name: Swift Maneuver
text: Darien's call to Yavimaya would have fallen red to the snow had it not been for the agility of the aesthir.

name: Ekundu Griffin
text:
"My goat was a small price to pay for the chance to see the hunting griffin dive and seize it."
—Suq'Ata trader

name: Bonded Herdbeast // Plated Kilnbeast
text: Now, united by the Great Work, they knew what it meant to be truly bonded.

name: Rubblebelt Rioters
text:
"If the system is broken, break the system."
—Domri Rade

name: Rabid Rats
text: Every sentence in Volrath's prisons ends the same way.

name: Wings of Aesthir
text:
"For those of courage, even the sky holds no limit."
—Arnjlot Olasson, sky mage

name: Empyrial Armor
text:
"An angel appeared in the smoldering skies above the fray, her clothes as flames, her armor as fire."
—"Hymn of Angelfire"

name: Invasion of Vryn // Overloaded Mage-Ring
text:
"On my signal, disable the safeguards. Let's blow these metal freaks right back to their own world!"
—Gav Beleren, mage-ring engineer

name: Flame-Kin War Scout
text:
"The forward flame-kin are popping. We have incoming!"
—Svar, Boros signaler

name: Joyride Rigger
text: chitty-chitty-BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG BANG!

name: Carrion Screecher
text: The banished have come home to roost.

name: Brood Weaver
text: Travelers in the Somberwald scan the ground for werewolves and other threats, unaware of what lurks above.

name: Mossfire Valley
text: The battle at Ganzan Pass left the land so saturated with blood and twisted kami magic that it was a century before a single blade of grass could take root.

name: Saltfield Recluse
text: He remembers a past of light and healing. But he lives the bitter present—parching salt, scouring wind, and the withering heat of the desert.

name: Deglamer
text: The more pleasant an illusion's garb, the more indecent its form laid bare.

name: Blazing Hope
text:
"No shadow remains for you to hide in."
—Caparocti Sunborn

name: Wind Dancer
text: "Take my hand and dance to the music of the winds."

name: Looming Altisaur
text: Nature can't be tamed, but the Sun Empire believes that humans are made stronger when they test themselves against the wild strength of the dinosaurs.

name: Havoc Sower
text: It grew with a terrible swiftness.

name: Keen-Eared Sentry
text: "You're not the first to underestimate me."

name: Veil of Birds
text: When wind marries sky, even the bride's veil sings her praises.

name: Spark Spray
text: It's the only kind of shower goblins will tolerate.

name: Conclave Mentor
text: "I have faith in your potential."

name: Harrier Naga
text: She trusts that the potent poisons of her darts will reach the enemy before the enemy reaches her.

name: Tendrils of Corruption
text: Darkness doesn't always send its minions to do its dirty work.

name: High Seas
text:
Bend as the wave breaks or it will break you as well.
—Saprazzan saying

name: Eternal Isolation
text: "Well, at least it's a lovely view."

name: Shambling Goblin
text:
"The Kolaghan send them at us. We kill and raise them. They fight the next wave the Kolaghan send. It's a neat little cycle."
—Asmala, Silumgar sorcerer

name: Erstwhile Trooper
text:
"The Erstwhile—rotten of body and outmoded in dress, but unfailing in loyalty."
—Vraska

name: Wind Sail
text: It pays to be at home both on the sea *and* in the sky.

name: Carrion Imp
text: No scrap of nutrition goes to waste in the undercity.

name: Sliver Queen, Brood Mother
text: Though long held captive beneath Volrath's stronghold, the sliver queen is actually freer than most of Rath's denizens. Her maternal instincts always take precedence—even when they conflict with the evincar's agenda—and through her numerous litters, she ranges across all of Rath.

name: Giant Spider
text:
"It has a quickness about it that seems unnatural for its large size, yet its hunger is about right."
—Endril, Kalonian naturalist

name: Grave Consequences
text:
"You call *that* a nightmare?"
—Braids, dementia summoner

name: Spire Serpent
text: A mirror to draw its eye, a rod to rouse its rage, and a sword to break its bonds.

name: Roots
text:
"That which nourishes can also bind."
—Gemma, Willow Priestess

name: Robe of the Archmagi
text: It offers the power to shape worlds and the elegance to do so with style.

name: Sandskin
text: "Those who live by the sword will die by the sword. I choose to do neither."

name: Dredge the Mire
text: Fortunately, the reanimation spell just missed the long-dead colony of dung scorpions.

name: Hedron Rover
text:
"Now that it has woken up and wandered off, we should go see what it was guarding."
—Gotzen, Bulwark explorer

name: Raging Goblin
text: Volrath has bred them to fear only him. Are they charging into battle, or merely fleeing his wrath?

name: Delight in the Hunt
text: "Pain is a delusion of the weak. I'll demonstrate."

name: Magus of the Moat
text: "The spirits of the mythic ones ever circle their beloved keep, forbidding entry to all who come with the heavy tread of hate."

name: Barktooth Warbeard
text: He is devious and cunning, in both appearance and deed. Beware the Warbeard, for this brute bites as well as he barks!

name: Elminster's Simulacrum
text:
"Why simply sit back and applaud the good ideas of others when I can improve upon them?"
—Elminster

name: Singe-Mind Ogre
text: Even the balmgivers of Bant couldn't heal the incurables, but sharing their torment helped.

name: Eagle of the Watch
text:
"Even from miles away, I could see our eagles circling. That's when I knew we were needed at home."
—Kanlos, Akroan captain

name: Awakening of Vitu-Ghazi
text: The Eternal armies advanced on Vitu-Ghazi. At Nissa's command, Vitu-Ghazi advanced on them.

name: Ursine Champion
text: "Would you rather feel the edge of blade or the sharpness of my fangs?"

name: Chill of the Grave
text: Frozen is frozen, whether it's with cold, terror, or both.

name: Managorger Hydra
text:
"Whoever said two heads are better than one never met a hydra before."
—Crocodile Jackson, legendary cowboy

name: Skybridge Towers
text: New Capenna's districts are a series of tiers; wealth and power always rise to the top.

name: Aether Hub
text: It powers the dreams of Ghirapur.

name: Spirebluff Canal
text: There's so much more to Ghirapur than can be accessed by traditional roads.

name: Ancestral Memories
text:
"Even the ancient storytellers proclaimed Zhalfir to be dominant over all Jamuraa. Kaervek's invasion shocked us all."
—Hakim, Loreweaver

name: Loch Dragon
text: Despite its ferocity, its favor can be won with a gift of something it's never seen before.

name: Meekstone
text: When the mighty sleep, the lowly prowl.

name: Brightstone Ritual
text: Wizards fought over the stone to exploit its power. Goblins fight over it because it's shiny.

name: Evacuation
text:
"How many people can you save in that thing?"
"All of them," replied the mage with a smile.

name: Breath of Dreams
text:
"Get up, blast you! They're attacking! Why are you all so slow?"
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Hokori, Dust Drinker
text: "Dust Drinker," "The Swirling Storm," "The Searing Wind"—Hokori had many names, but none of them was "The Merciful."

name: Well of Life
text:
When you have given everything, then you have everything to gain.
—Well inscription

name: Boneclad Necromancer
text: "Living or dead, everyone responds to the proper motivation."

name: Story Seeker
text: Dwarven skalds are the most renowned storytellers in all of Kaldheim. They travel across the realms, seeking out heroic deeds and chronicling them in epic sagas.

name: Wizened Cenn
text: "Thoughtweft binds us together as one, part of an intricate pattern that would unravel if even one thread came loose."

name: Undersea Invader
text:
"The currents are strange today, and the fish are fearful. Something's stirring in the depths."
—Rathstaf, Kannah fisherman

name: Oath of Jace
text: "For the sake of the Multiverse, I will keep watch."

name: Skyshroud Troopers
text:
"We were not made for war. Like flowstone, Volrath shaped us to it."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Spined Wurm
text: Its spines act like the teeth of a saw, scoring distinctive marks in the vegetation of its territory.

name: Dauthi Slayer
text:
"They have knives for every soul."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

name: Joraga Invocation
text:
"A single tree does not a forest make. We are stronger when we stand together."
—Numa, Joraga chieftain

name: Gaze of Granite
text: Golgari reclaimers resent the gorgons, begrudging the loss of so many fine nutrients locked away in stone.

name: Embersmith
text: The Vulshok see the artificer as a catalyst, bringing the spark of creation that ignites change.

name: Merry-Go-Round
text: Ensconced in a slow time bubble that makes a five-minute ride take nine hours, the carousel is a very popular childcare option.

name: Shrink
text:
"The smallest beast can yet have the greatest heart."
—Gemma, Willow Priestess

name: Growth Cycle
text:
"Shed your faded husk! Emerge sleeker and stronger!"
—Tyris, fauna shaman

name: Fog Patch
text: Realizing they weren't getting past the fog, the elves did the only thing they could do: wait.

name: Seal of Fire
text:
"If it breathes, it will burn."
—Rakdos pyromancers' creed

name: Kird Ape
text: It puts the "fur" in "fury."

name: Mana Seism
text:
"It is the nature of humanity not to worry about tomorrow, especially when there's a good chance they won't live to see the end of today."
—Kiku, Night's Flower

name: Alesha, Who Smiles at Death
text: "Our history is one hand reaching out to another."

name: Karakas
text: "To make a prairie it takes a clover and one bee,/ One clover, and a bee,/ And revery." —Emily Dickinson

name: Giltgrove Stalker
text: "The only gold I need is the sheltering shimmer of the trees."

name: Ashes to Ashes
text:
"Kings and beggars, they end the same— Surrounded by stench, rot, and blame."
—Aline Corralurn, "Legacy"

name: Temporal Trespass
text: Few truly live in the moment.

name: Regal Force
text: It rarely moves, standing stock still in its clearing. When it does stir, ravens stop their cawing and crickets their chirping. All of nature watches in awed silence.

name: Mardu Hateblade
text: "There may be little honor in my tactics, but there is no honor in losing."

name: Venomous Breath
text: The dryads need neither size nor strength to defeat their enemies in battle.

name: Waxing Moon
text:
"Show them what it means to be the source of nightmares!"
—Ulrich, Krallenhorde alpha

name: Wasteful Harvest
text: Once the brothers discovered the pristine island of Argoth, the war came down to who could plunder it faster.

name: True Believer
text: So great is his certainty that mere facts cannot shake it.

name: Tidal Barracuda
text: It lurks in the spaces between moments.

name: Search the Premises
text: Mood: Determined to find evidence of wrongdoing.

name: Steelform Sliver
text:
"Though the slivers may sometimes resemble us, they are not human. Anyone who fights them must remember this."
—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge

name: Weed-Pruner Poplar
text:
"When Byoog reached down to pull up a bit of root for the stew, he didn't expect the root to pull back."
—A tale of Auntie Wort

name: Gang of Elk
text:
"I felt the ground shake, so I hid in my tent until the earthquake passed. It passed all right, and it left hoofprints."
—Femeref explorer

name: Disembowel
text:
"We thought we found the victim's clothes lumped in the street. As it turned out, it *was* the victim, insides sucked out—just a sack of skin and robes."
—Agrus Kos

name: Kiddie Coaster
text: The only ride that's never failed a safety inspection.

name: Reckless Spite
text: "The end is justified in being mean. Or something like that."

name: Orcish Captain
text: There's a chance to win every battle.

name: Consecrated Sphinx
text: Blessed by the lands of winter.

name: Standard Procedure
text: Can it be Lightning Bolt yet?

name: Street Riot
text:
"They said obey and you'll be happy. They said you'll be safe. But we're not safe. We're not happy. And we will not obey."
—Domri Rade

name: Great Furnace
text: Kuldotha, wellspring of molten metal, temple of the goblin horde.

name: Morbid Opportunist
text: On Innistrad, one person's windfall usually starts with another person lying face down in the mud.

name: Ghost Quarter
text: Where wasted life cries out to be reborn.

name: Tread Upon
text:
"Boasting impenetrable defenses only draws the most tenacious of attackers."
—Yikaro, Atarka warrior

name: Hypnotic Specter
text:
"...There was no trace
Of aught on that illumined face...."
—Samuel Coleridge, "Phantom"

name: Polar Kraken
text:
"It was big. Really, really, big. No, bigger than that. It was big!"
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

name: Kjeldoran Frostbeast
text:
"Two of my Warriors found that the creature was dangerous not only in combat, but also in simple proximity."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Lightning Helix
text:
「血の時代の魔術師は、敵に雷雨の降らせていたという。我々もその技を模倣できるはずだ。」
—-ロアホールドの魔道生徒、ドラディエル

name: Hired Hexblade
text: "I'll take care of it. You just be sure to hold up your end of the deal."

name: White Sun's Zenith
text: After the Battle of Liet Field, the white sun crested above Taj-Nar, bringing hope to all who survived the carnage.

name: Earthshaker
text: It scaled the Sokenzan Mountains in search of Kumano's secret. The mountain shook for two days, and the kami never returned.

name: Prey Upon
text:
"You don't find many old werewolf hunters."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald

name: Mirror Sheen
text: Even treefolk witches steer clear of the unpredictable woods near Glen Elendra. Spells refract off the glamer-polished trees and the eyes of lurking pucas.

name: Liliana's Caress
text: "This might hurt less if you don't fight so hard. But I doubt it."

name: Nine-Tail White Fox
text: It has waited a millennium just for you, and for a millennium will it watch over your descendants.

name: Pull from the Deep
text: Ideas, not stones, form the true foundation of Meletis.

name: Swords to Plowshares
text: 「刃使いは新たな敵へと怒りを向けた。根腐りとキャベジのナメクジだ。」 ー神話と奇跡、第七巻

name: Eruth, Tormented Prophet
text: She is cursed with visions of monsters and suffering . . . and all her visions come true.

name: Blue Sun's Zenith
text:
"Five suns! Can you even imagine how complicated the orbital calculations must be? What I wouldn't give to tackle an equation like that!"
—Zimone, Quandrix mage-student

name: Akroma, Angel of Wrath
text: "Wrath is no vice when inflicted upon the deserving."

name: Shimmer of Possibility
text:
"There's something peculiar about the rain today."
—Janoc, Tin Street tinker

name: Zodiac Rat
text: " . . . Cao Pi, Cao Rui, Fang, Mao, and briefly, Huan- / The Sima took the empire in their turn. . . ."

name: Null Caller
text: Zendikar's defenders include both healers and vampires. One way or another, the fallen will return to the fight.

name: Bogardan Firefiend
text:
"The next one who tells me to relax and curl up by a fire is dead."
—Mirri of the *Weatherlight*

name: Pondering Mage
text: "Never leave the future to fate."

name: Collector Ouphe
text:
"He steals power from treasure after treasure, and what does it do for the ouphe? Nothing."
—Jhoira

name: Scampering Scorcher
text:
"Keep your flammables out of reach."
—Kerin, watch sergeant

name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
text:
"The merfolk of the Pearl Trident have risen from the waves since the earliest days, at times allies to humans, other times enemies. Now their power is cresting again, and who can say which way the new tide will flow."
—Kalis, Onean scholar

name: Fleshgrafter
text: Necrogen enflames certain emotional centers in the Morioks' brains: hate, aggression, and especially greed.

name: Mother of Runes
text: She weaves an elaborate spell of love, care, and protection, enveloping her people in soothing warmth.

name: Leery Fogbeast
text: It emerges from the mists only to feed.

name: Isshin, Two Heavens as One
text: Trained by the Imperials but disillusioned by their rigidity, he gave his heart—and his swords—to the Asari Uprising.

name: Wind Drake
text:
"No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings."
—William Blake, *The Marriage of Heaven and Hell*

name: Skalla Wolf
text:
"This imprint was the familiar of a friend."
—Vivien Reid

name: Neurok Replica
text: All the curiosity of the Neurok with only a trace of their duplicity.

name: Trapfinder's Trick
text:
"At some point, every trapfinder will lose a hunk of flesh. It's just a question of how much—and whether it'll grow back."
—Arhana, Kazandu trapfinder

name: Breeding Pool
text: Where Jin-Gitaxias's ingenuity meets Vorinclex's inhumanity.

name: Roiling Waters
text:
"The Roil may be unpredictable, but it is not uncontrollable."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem roilmage

name: Moldgraf Scavenger
text:
"When I was a child, we worried about picking the wrong mushrooms for the cook pot. Now we must worry about being picked ourselves."
—Halana, Kessig ranger

name: Dark Banishing
text:
"It is the way of most wizards to begin by exiling themselves and to end by exiling everyone else."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

name: Audacious Thief
text: "Skill, imagination, smarts: none of it matters unless you have the nerve to use it."

name: Seafloor Stalker
text: "Sunken ruins? My specialty."

name: Nykthos Paragon
text: Though Heliod turned against humanity in his hunger for power, the ideals he once championed still stand strong.

name: Bone Mask
text:
"The protection offered comes at a price. How numerous are your kin?"
—Purraj of Urborg

name: Hoof Skulkin
text: It hunts with the memory of a long lost herd.

name: Rise and Shine
text: Mood: "You can't keep us locked away anymore. To battle!"

name: Kess, Dissident Mage
text: "Loss has no meaning here. You cannot take from those who have nothing."

name: Mazirek, Kraul Death Priest
text: The clicks and buzz of the undercity proclaim him the incarnation of decay.

name: Decanter of Endless Water
text:
"Now, remember: Under no circumstances should you utter the word 'geyser' in the same room as—oh, blast it!"
—Bindlehaim, Upper City merchant

name: Extract
text: To say Nixar had a splitting headache would be a bit of an understatement.

name: Growth Spiral
text:
"I've gleaned greater insight from the spiraling of a single fern than I have from all the books I've ever read."
—Kianne, Quandrix dean

name: Sir Shandlar of Eberyn
text: "Remember Sir Shandlar! Remember and stand firm!" —rallying cry of the Eberyn militia

name: Withstand
text:
"Defense is as much a part of war as offense, the shield as important a tool as the sword."
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage

name: Byway Courier
text: A good courier travels fast and asks no questions.

name: Pyromantic Pilgrim
text: "From the volcanoes of Shiv to the Balduvian steppes, I have sought a worthy teacher. At last, I have found one."

name: Child of Night
text: A vampire enacts vengeance on the entire world, claiming her debt two tiny pinpricks at a time.

name: Sentinels of Glen Elendra
text: Some say the valley of Glen Elendra is mythical, and that rumors of its existence are nothing but a faerie prank. Others say it is the fae's most fiercely guarded secret.

name: Breakneck Berserker
text: "Go for the knees! The last giant who tried to get past us got rolled back down the mountain in a dozen pieces."

name: Reckless Wurm
text: Bred for battle in the Grand Coliseum, these wurms annihilated whole ecosystems when released into the wild.

name: Stormcloud Spirit
text: The spirits of all the rivers and oceans came together as an unstoppable force, unleashing their fury as lightning and thunder.

name: Gravespawn Sovereign
text: The warlocks never expected their creations to create servants of their own.

name: Memnarch
text: "An imperfection in the perfect world? We can't allow that."

name: Aether Gale
text: The militia formed up in the central plaza awaiting the onslaught, but the giants never quite made it.

name: Enervate
text:
"Worlds turn in crucial moments of decision. Make your choice."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran royal mage

name: Oblivion Strike
text: It's bad enough to be torn to pieces. It's worse by far to be torn from the world itself.

name: Mindblade Render
text: "There will be no secrets between us... like it or not."

name: Scepter of Insight
text:
"The road to truth has many branches, and so must the cane with which I walk it."
—Voln the Elder

name: Meditation Puzzle
text: Find your center, and you will find your way.

name: Jhovall Rider
text: Don't be fooled by the riders' fluid grace—it takes years of practice to ride these beasts.

name: Soul Sculptor
text: Does the stone mimic life, or did it once live?

name: Angelic Renewal
text: Angels watch over mortals with heavy hearts, knowing what fate awaits them in the end.

name: Awaken the Erstwhile
text: In preparation for the conflict all foresaw, the Golgari called upon an army that had slept for millennia beneath the city.

name: Primal Surge
text: With Avacyn's return, the flow of life became a tidal wave.

name: Desiccated Naga
text:
"The nature of this plane makes it almost too easy for me to command the dead."
—Liliana Vess

name: Mox Jet
text: 2016 European Vintage Champion

name: Vedalken Plotter
text: "Fair? At what point in our negotiations did you convince yourself my goal was to be fair?"

name: Day of Judgment
text:
"This must not become common knowledge. The consequences of such a spell are too great. Lock it away in the restricted archive, and destroy its record in the catalog."
—Director Taiva, to Isabough

name: Ravenous Chupacabra
text:
"Why do these guys get such a bad rap? Is it the giant golden claws and teeth? The terrible stench? I think they're kinda cute."
—Crocodile Jackson, legendary cowboy

name: Novellamental
text: "My grandmother had sold the rest of her jewelry long ago, but she left a particular necklace in my care: a golden chain, bearing a raven-shaped charm."

name: Goblin Skycutter
text: He takes out his fear of heights on anything above his head.

name: Discerning Taste
text: "Everyone loves a dash of crushed pixie . . . except the pixie."

name: Quirion Ranger
text:
"Respect the earth, for it will one day be your shield and another day your blanket."
—Liefellen, Quirion exarch

name: Inspirit
text: "We will force the Cabal into their own pits!"

name: Shambling Ghoul
text: Once he gets up and going, he will forever shamble on.

name: Meekstone
text:
"When it oscillated above a particular frequency, the stone induced acute listlessness in several researchers."
—Consulate engineer's log

name: Bontu's Last Reckoning
text: To the last, Bontu wanted only to be first among the God-Pharaoh's subjects.

name: Urza
text: An artificer of unparalleled renown, Urza was a powerful cipher even before he was able to planeswalk. Seeing the world as a large, integrated machine is his greatest strength and weakness, enabling him to solve almost any problem but blinding him to his solutions' effects on others.

name: Glowspore Shaman
text: From death she grows living grandeur.

name: Varchild's War-Riders
text:
"What tries to crush our spirit only strengthens our resolve."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

name: Skymarch Bloodletter
text: From the perpetual shadowsmoke that hung above the ship, a silent form emerged, lips curled with malice and anticipation.

name: Akroan Hoplite
text: "Fair fight? How could it be a fair fight? We're Akroans. They're not."

name: Woodwraith Strangler
text:
"Nothing could be more natural than roots sucking nourishment from the dead."
—Savra

name: Rampant Growth
text: Nature grows solutions to its problems.

name: Humility
text:
"One cannot cleanse the wounds of failure."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Impassioned Orator
text: In times of unrest, the crowd is eager for the comfort of strong convictions.

name: Auriok Bladewarden
text: The Auriok have learned through constant struggle that allies are more precious than water.

name: Light Up the Stage
text:
"Places, everyone!"
—Judith

name: Magmatic Chasm
text:
"Our shamans assert their mastery over the land, thwarting the lesser clans' attempts to stand in the way of our dragonlord."
—Allek, Atarka hunter

name: Arclight Phoenix
text: Some storms never blow over.

name: Skin Invasion // Skin Shedder
text:
"Patient complained of burning sensation in upper back and at base of neck. Bed rest recommended. In a couple days, he should feel like a new man."
—Lagra, hamlet physician

name: Solidarity
text: Their commitment to Serra is as solid as any shield.

name: Aeolipile
text:
"Although fragile, the aeolipile could be quite destructive."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. I*

name: Samite Archer
text: "I can preserve ten lives by taking one."

name: Thriving Moor
text: Beauty appears in strange places for those with eyes to see it.

name: Consult the Necrosages
text: Dimir rank and file never see nor hear their guildmaster. All orders are given through mysterious necrosages who appear from the shadows, tersely toss out a command, and then melt into the darkness.

name: Impending Disaster
text:
"The goblins are in charge of maintenance? Why not just set it on fire now and call it a day?"
—Whip Tongue, viashino technician

name: Stunning Reversal
text: The line between victory and defeat can be as slim as a razor's edge.

name: Unholy Indenture
text:
"Don't think of it as selling your soul. It's more like you're bequeathing it to me."
—Vilis, Broker of Blood

name: Rumbling Rockslide
text:
"When monsters walk, the earth knows its place and yields."
—Rielle, the Everwise

name: Mannichi, the Fevered Dream
text:
"Early in his reign, Konda fell ill. His head burned with fever, and he saw visions of his future. In them, he saw a spirit-child, and, in that child's eyes, a way to make his empire last forever."
—*The History of Kamigawa*

name: Terramorphic Expanse
text:
"The land has its own intentions, beyond the understanding of those who live on it."
—Nissa Revane

name: Strafe
text:
"All right, let's light 'em up!"
—Gerrard

name: Shivan Devastator
text: There were many reasons why Shiv was not high on Sheoldred's list of places to conquer: big, fiery reasons.

name: Elbrus, the Binding Blade // Withengar Unbound
text: Those who grasp its hilt soon hear the demon's call.

name: Chance Encounter
text:
"What are the odds, indeed?"
—Yusri, to Desera

name: White Dragon
text: White dragons are unparalleled hunters, keenly focused on slaughtering their enemies.

name: Myr Landshaper
text: One thing the myr can't do is enjoy the scenery.

name: Electrolyze
text: The Izzet learn something from every lesson they teach.

name: Butcher Orgg
text: It can kill you with three arms tied behind its back.

name: Entrapment Maneuver
text: "Now!"

name: Greater Auramancy
text: A delicate veil of glamers can prove as sturdy as iron.

name: Hill Giant
text: Hill giants are mostly just big. Of course, that does count for a lot!

name: Nighthawk Scavenger
text: Under Drana's leadership, vampires are finding new strength in unity.

name: Moroii
text:
"Touched by moroii"
—Undercity slang meaning "to grow old"

name: Damping Matrix
text: The priests tried cursing it. The mages tried dispelling it. In the end, they all obeyed it.

name: Giant Ambush Beetle
text: It waits with absolute stillness. One might think it a statue if it weren't occasionally seen chewing on its victims.

name: Covenant of Minds
text: Before signing anything on Grixis, always read the fine print.

name: Infectious Bite
text:
"Let me tell you why you must never close your eyes when on watch. Not even for a second."
—Jor Kadeen

name: Master of Predicaments
text: Designed by David Sirlin

name: Journey for the Elixir
text: "As my hands touched it, I realized that I had not found it—it had been leading me here."

name: Price of Progress
text: Enthusiasm can be tempered in the furnace of the earth.

name: Simic Guildgate
text: Simic biomancers don't concern themselves with guarding a gate. Their ever-present creations are enough to ward off trespassers.

name: Fathom Fleet Firebrand
text: As she charges into battle, her arcane tattoos stir and crawl like fiery serpents.

name: Rubble Reading
text: Gruul oracles see omens in all forms of destruction: the entrails of a maaka's prey, the flight of vultures over a battlefield, the scattering of toppled stone.

name: Teachings of the Archaics
text: Mages seek out the ancient beings known as the Archaics for their boundless knowledge of history and magic, dispensed only in cryptic metaphors.

name: Seller of Songbirds
text:
"Lady Wren is the one merchant in Keyhole Downs who isn't running a scam."
—Mirela, Azorius hussar

name: Crown of Empires
text:
"With this crown, assert your authority."
—Crown inscription

name: Lethal Vapors
text: The vapors infiltrate every crevice, poison every lung, and snuff out every life.

name: Scathe Zombies
text:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose, Nor Spake, nor moved their eyes; It had been strange, even in a dream, To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Rotwidow Pack
text: For each one you see, ten see you.

name: Salvager of Secrets
text: The greatest treasure of the deep is an echo from above.

name: Root Cage
text: The Vintara Forest welcomes its enemies with a crushing embrace.

name: Golden-Tail Disciple
text: Students of the kitsune-led Golden-Tail Academy in Eiganjo are unparalleled in both martial skill and dedication to the Imperial cause.

name: Python
text:
"How can you claim the gods are merciless when they robbed the snake of its limbs to give the other creatures a sporting chance?"
—Hakim, Loreweaver

name: Worldly Tutor
text: All of us, from the tiny leaf-mite to the towering baloth, are vital threads in the weave of life."

name: Filter Out
text: The glistening oil had been rendered inert, but planes wouldn't begin to truly heal until every last drop was purged.

name: Barbarian Bully
text: "Out of my way!"

name: Nurturer Initiate
text: The elves alone preserve the few shreds of beauty left. There is no one else who cares.

name: Feywild Trickster
text: Unlike most warlocks, those who make pacts with archfey are drawn to pranks and whimsy moreso than death and darkness.

name: Glasspool Mimic // Glasspool Shore
text:
"When I touched the Glasspool, I tasted infinite possibility."
—Ashen Wal, Akoum Expeditionary House

name: Standing Troops
text:
"Bant sentries were called the Angel Line. They never faltered, and they were ready to die defending their position."
—Elspeth

name: Mesmeric Orb
text: A step in one direction is two steps away from another.

name: Lethal Sting
text: Initiates once believed defeat was the worst fate possible—a sentiment they quickly abandoned.

name: Thundersteel Colossus
text:
"*This* is what I needed all that alloy for."
—Arima, to Emire

name: Silverclaw Griffin
text: It patrols the grafs for miles around Thraben, ensuring that the unhallowed do not wake for long.

name: Stormwatch Eagle
text: When eagles leave the sky, sailors leave the sea.

name: Grafted Skullcap
text: "Every day, I fight for my life and win. Every night, I fight to remember my name and lose."

name: Burning-Tree Vandal
text: The ostentatious splendor of the Orzhov church was just asking to be smashed.

name: Beyeen Veil // Beyeen Coast
text:
"Stay close to my light. You don't want to get lost on the rocks."
—Jejenar, Silundi lullmage

name: Lava Axe
text: Meant to cut through the body and burn straight to the soul.

name: Thresher Beast
text: It destroys everything in its path, including the path itself.

name: Vindicate
text: Some convictions are so strong that the world must break to accommodate them.

name: Duskborne Skymarcher
text: "The hour of Dusk is come."

name: Kami of Fire's Roar
text:
"I can hear the shamans chanting in the hills. They say their magic will protect us from the kami, that our gold has bought our safety. But no one sleeps soundly tonight."
—Scroll fragment from the ruins of Reito

name: Tranquil Expanse
text: Beyond the chaos of Ghirapur lies a vibrant world where aether flows through nature.

name: Feudkiller's Verdict
text:
"There are all kinds of strengths, but if you have strength of soul, the others will follow."
—Galanda Feudkiller

name: Rage-Scarred Berserker
text: The fury of the slaughter god Mogis burns within him.

name: Remove Soul
text: Nethya stiffened suddenly, head cocked as if straining to hear some distant sound, then fell lifeless to the ground.

name: Herald of Slaanesh
text:
"I can show you indulgence without regret, delight without boundaries, gratifications beyond count."
—Sha'ris, Deacon of Lust

name: Elturel Survivors
text: They fought with the desperate courage of those who have nothing left to lose.

name: Mindswipe
text:
"The past and the unwritten are frozen. To understand their meaning requires heat."
—Arel the Whisperer

name: Cultbrand Cinder
text: "Your seared flesh will be the first step in your journey to dark enlightenment."

name: Resistance Squad
text:
"It's not that I didn't expect some defiance, but I did hope it wouldn't be so heavily armed."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Immersturm Raider
text: The demons took no captives and claimed no spoils; they sought only to destroy.

name: Vizier of the True
text: Outnumbered, but not outmatched.

name: Waiting in the Weeds
text: The trees have ears, eyes, and teeth.

name: Forgeborn Oreads
text: Purphoros shaped the oreads out of stray coals from his forge.

name: Vulshok Refugee
text: "I will carve my people's vengeance on the face of Phyrexia."

name: Crushing Canopy
text:
"Do not mistake your lofty vantage point for safety."
—Shaper Tuvasa

name: Brassclaw Orcs
text:
"The Brassclaws delighted in lightning raids on Icatian and Dwarven towns; an unprepared enemy is easier to defeat."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV*

name: Flameblade Adept
text: The time for training was done. Only one final trial stood between Amin and his place among the honored dead.

name: Kor Dirge
text: Rath's new evincar eliminated the brutish moggs and took a new slave race, one more reminiscent of her own feline grace.

name: Harvester of Souls
text:
"The entire parish is gone. This was no execution. This was a massacre."
—Bishop Cawle of Elgaud

name: Valorous Stance
text:
"Every choice alters the path of fate."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Edgewall Innkeeper
text: "Warmth. Safety. A fully-stocked larder. You'll find nothing like Edgewall Keep in the wilds, I promise you that!"

name: Angel of Mercy
text:
"In times like these, people need to be reminded of compassion."
—Sisay

name: God-Pharaoh's Faithful
text: "This is the final trial! Rejoice, for the God-Pharaoh soars among us!"

name: Plated Wurm
text:
"I'd hate to see the bird that could get *this* wurm!"
—Alaborn soldier

name: Selfless Cathar
text: "If I fail to offer myself, we will surely be overrun. My fate would be the same."

name: Wildcall
text: A howl on the wind hides many dangers.

name: Chandra's Fury
text: www.MagicTheGathering.com

name: Charge of the Forever-Beast
text: The Zagoth wetlands are fertilized by centuries of Brokkos's former challengers.

name: Wand of Denial
text: You'll never miss what you never had.

name: Animate Land
text: Irony is getting walked on by the earth instead of the other way around.

name: Scoria Elemental
text: A single molten cord links it to the subterranean furnaces, drawing heat and metal from beneath Kuldotha. Until that bond is cut, it carves a swath of raw destruction.

name: Professor of Zoomancy
text: She's brilliant, if a bit overbearing.

name: Opal Guardian
text: It was a moment in time, cast in stone—a moment whose time had come again.

name: Wound Reflection
text: The greater the suffering, the sweeter the taste.

name: Ravenous Baboons
text: Build something and the baboons will tear it down. Leave the pieces lying and they will scatter them.

name: Sacred Foundry
text: Burning fervor and fearsome skill create a lethal beauty terrible to behold.

name: Karmic Guide
text: Just one moment more

name: Eager Cadet
text: "Training? Seeing my crops burnt to cinders was all the 'training' I needed."

name: Biomathematician
text: "I will reach infinity."

name: Flashfires
text: Dry grass is tinder before the spark.

name: Sunken Ruins
text: Without the care of the tideshapers, the Lanes lie neglected. Some have flooded entire towns; others dried to cracked mud.

name: Curse of Wizardry
text:
"We must all push through the pain to heal our world."
—Ayli, Kamsa cleric

name: Thundering Tanadon
text:
"We do not need beakers and vials to test our predators."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Underworld Dreams
text:
"In the drowsy dark cave of the mind, dreams build their nest with fragments dropped from day's caravan."
—Rabindranath Tagore

name: Bone Splinters
text:
"Steel may be more durable, but nothing channels the spite of the unjustly dead like bone."
—Braids

name: Dead Weight
text: The crueler vampires' idea of free-range farming.

name: Skittering Surveyor
text: Though no bigger than a hand, the surveyors were as vital to the resistance as the largest war constructs.

name: Wardscale Dragon
text: Dromoka's brood emerge from the dragon tempests covered with tough scales that protect them from most clan weapons and magic.

name: Turntimber Sower
text: "Zendikar's wounds can be healed."

name: Legions to Ashes
text:
"For the love of the seven brass gods, it's a city of academics! How are they doing this?"
—Sharaman, Urzan lieutenant

name: Goblin Freerunner
text: There are old goblins and ambitious goblins, but very few old, ambitious goblins.

name: Vampire Bats
text:
"For something is amiss or out of place When mice with wings can wear a human face."
—Theodore Roethke, "The Bat"

name: Iceberg Cancrix
text: Its shell can withstand anything but a thaw.

name: Forgotten Cave
text: In the hearts of mortals, in the pages of ancient lore, in the deep, forgotten places of the universe . . . Chaos awaits.

name: Ride Guide
text: "When riding Erebo's Whip, remember to keep your arms, legs, and any strange flailing appendages inside the vehicle at all times."

name: Fodder Launch
text: Leave it to a boggart to come up with a projectile as disgusting as it is deadly.

name: Orzhov Guildgate
text: Enter to find wealth, security, and eternal life . . . for just a small price up front.

name: Cat Burglar
text: The *il*-Kor no longer roam the open plains, but they are still hunters.

name: Mana Cylix
text: Overflowing with visions of the possible future, it lends power to those in the present.

name: Tavern Brawler
text: The only thing you love more than a good drink is a good fight. Luckily, one usually follows the other.

name: Peacewalker Colossus
text: One way to keep the peace is to make war look like a really bad idea.

name: Arcane Flight
text: The Tolarian Academies are known for their magical research, powerful sorcerers, and accidental destruction of ecosystems.

name: Minotaur Aggressor
text: The smelting district is home to many who see the guilds as not for them.

name: Mogg Bombers
text: Behind every great mogg bomber is another mogg with a shovel and a basket.

name: Battlewise Valor
text: It's never good to walk into an ambush, but with the right spell you might walk out again.

name: Worship
text: Even after all that befell Amonkhet, Gideon never believed that his trust in Oketra was misplaced.

name: Yahenni's Expertise
text: "The Consulate pushed me to my limit, darling, and this is the result."

name: Harvester Druid
text: "In the end, the same soil lies atop the field, within the mountain, and under the sea."

name: End the Festivities
text: When the defenses around Lurenbraum Fortress faltered, the Crimson Ballroom received some unexpected guests.

name: Kodama's Reach
text:
"The land grows only where the kami will it."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf

name: Swat
text: Few who cross Phage have the chance to repeat the mistake.

name: Stern Lesson
text:
"The brothers are brilliant, but their quarreling will be the death of me."
—Tocasia, journal entry

name: Withercrown
text:
"We'll see each other again soon."
—Egon, god of death

name: The Long Reach of Night // Animus of Night's Reach
text: The dark myojin's gifts were instrumental in ending the Kami War.

name: Kunoros, Hound of Athreos
text: Three sharp barks announce an attempt to escape the Underworld. Three sharp bites end it.

name: Maja, Bretagard Protector
text: "Our enemies have breached our realm. To survive, the clans must fight as one!"

name: Revitalize
text:
"Knight Kathryn closed her eyes, bracing herself for the end. When she opened them again, she stood triumphant over her foe."
—Thadus the Healer, *Memoirs*

name: Realms Befitting My Majesty
text: "Look around you. All you behold is mine to rule. It's the natural way."

name: Overmaster
text:
"Trickery can't defeat raw power."
—Matoc, lavamancer

name: Leaping Lizard
text:
"I never question the Autumn Willow about her motives, not even when she turns people into Lizards. It's her way."
—Devin, Faerie Noble

name: Battle Squadron
text: The goblins made an unruly pile with military precision.

name: Bloodtallow Candle
text:
"Bring me an angel feather, and I will give you one death in return. There can be no turning back once the candle is lit."
—Whisper, blood liturgist

name: Helm of Chatzuk
text: Whether inspired by fear or by honor, all loyalty lends might.

name: Rusted Slasher
text:
"It's a beautiful vision. Discarded debris is reborn as a singular entity."
—Urabrask the Hidden

name: Jugan, the Rising Star
text: The light of the rising star empowers the champions of tomorrow.

name: Aegis Turtle
text:
"The endurance of the ancient turtles in a land so harsh makes a strong case for patience, tranquility, and composure."
—Gavi, nest warden

name: Myth Unbound
text: There are precious few names that echo throughout the Multiverse.

name: Training Drone
text:
"Vulshok flail, Viridian shield, loxodon blade . . . Tazzir, bring the Moriok hook and assemble the rookies."
—Vy Covalt, Neurok agent

name: Lost Legacy
text:
"That name shall not be spoken."
—Baral, Chief of Compliance

name: Nature's Resurgence
text:
Spring follows winter
—Elvish expression meaning "all things pass"

name: Mirri
text: Mirri and Gerrard have been the best of friends since they trained together under the maro-sorcerer Multani. A fierce and agile warrior, she rejoined Gerrard aboard the *Weatherlight* as his unofficial first mate shortly after he assumed command of the flying ship.

name: Darba
text: Legend has it the darba gave up its wings in return for an extra stomach.

name: Opal Avenger
text: As the sun grew cold in the realm, the statue grew warm.

name: Kindred Discovery
text: Few things are truly "lost" at sea.

name: Isamaru, Hound of Konda
text: The hound sniffed the air and let slip a low growl. General Takeno looked down at the faithful Isamaru and calmed him with a touch. "Alert the men. The kami are coming."

name: Remedy
text: "Take this. I know it's bitter, but it will ease the fever and get you back on your feet."

name: Weather the Storm
text:
「刃も嵐も、穏やかな心の静けさを攻撃することはできない。」
—-ターラウの彫刻

name: Mox Pearl
text: 2014 Vintage Championship Winner

name: Seismic Rupture
text: The shaman opened the earth beneath their feet, trapping the survivors within the crevices of Ayagor for Atarka to devour at her leisure.

name: Elvish Impersonators
text: "Uh-hunh."

name: Furor of the Bitten
text: Those who only believe themselves infected with lycanthropy can be as dangerous as those who really are.

name: Rune-Cervin Rider
text: Things of beauty are in constant peril. The riders whisk them to safety, ahead of the encroaching darkness.

name: Grizzled Outcasts // Krallenhorde Wantons
text: The boot prints became paw prints, and they led right back into town.

name: Smelt-Ward Minotaur
text:
"Don't arrest him—enlist him!"
—Commander Yaszen

name: Imperious Perfect
text: In a culture of beauty, the most beautiful are worshipped as gods.

name: Time Walk
text: 2011 Vintage Championship Winner

name: Maelstrom Colossus
text:
"Nothing of the Maelstrom is quiet or easy."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Concordant Crossroads
text: The wolf closed in. But then a strange wind whispered through the leaves, and with a burst of speed, the deer surged forward out of reach.

name: Geist-Fueled Scarecrow
text:
"It'll keep the crows away. Works on neighbors too."
—Old Rutstein

name: Plover Knights
text: The knights are a major attraction at every Lammastide festival. Teams of riders perform daring feats of flight to the delight of all below.

name: Unholy Officiant
text:
"Is this twisted ceremony simply a mockery of the human rite, or has Olivia fallen for her own charade?"
—Sorin Markov

name: Quickchange
text: Most Ravnicans lead lives of desperate survival. Those who thrive are malleable enough to change with the ever-shifting politics of the guilds.

name: Lys Alana Scarblade
text: In beauty-obsessed Lys Alana, one cut of her blade means the difference between a high society feast and raking through the dungheap for scraps.

name: Soul of the Harvest
text: It's there when a seed sprouts, when gourds ripen on the vines, and when the reapers cut the grains under the Harvest Moon.

name: You See a Guard Approach
text: "Looks like we've got company."

name: Howling Giant
text: He and his pack sing the same mournful song to the moon.

name: Murder Investigation
text: "Every death has a web of consequences. Our job is to find the spider."

name: Vassal's Duty
text: "My life is yours, my lord. There is no greater service than to yield it for your safety."

name: Unsummon
text: Skills mastered by initiates are preserved within cartouches, so Eternals remain adept at their preferred combat styles.

name: Call the Gatewatch
text:
"I've heard it said that a Planeswalker is someone who can always run from danger. But Gideon's right: we're also the ones who can choose to stay."
—Jace Beleren

name: Armored Pegasus
text:
"I always charge a little extra to take on a pegasus. They fly like eagles, kick like mules, and hide like hermits."
—Tahli *en*-Dal, bounty hunter

name: Dauthi Slayer
text:
"They have knives for every soul."
—Lyna, soltari emissary

name: Larder Zombie
text: The cathars arrived at the abandoned lab to find many of the unfinished projects gnawing on one another.

name: Golgari Keyrune
text: Like a single ant, it only hints at the colony below.

name: Grim Physician
text: The Returned retain no memory of their identities, but sometimes they mindlessly attempt familiar tasks.

name: Ashnod's Intervention
text: "Listen, Duck. Gix is everywhere, playing every side. Mishra won't listen . . . but perhaps Urza will."

name: Sacellum Archers
text: "Our arrows are aimed not at the sacred behemoths but at those who dare to dream of such a trophy."

name: Reckless Embermage
text: Those who play with fire are bound to get burned.

name: Chastise
text:
"Why do we pray to the Ancestor? Because She listens."
—Mystic elder

name: Archway Angel
text: A ray of hope breaks through the shroud of rain.

name: Thistledown Liege
text: The thoughtweft is his informant, and he its devoted guardian.

name: Judge's Familiar
text:
"It misses nothing and it has no sense of humor."
—Barvisa, courtroom scribe

name: Pristine Skywise
text: The elite of Ojutai's brood, the skywise see their enemies as puzzles to be solved.

name: Dwynen's Elite
text: Call one, call them all.

name: Ancestral Memories
text:
"It's a poor sort of memory that only works backwards."
—Lewis Carroll,
*Through the Looking Glass*

name: Wild Growth
text:
"Here in Fyndhorn, where Freyalise's power is strongest, the forest has its own opinion."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

name: Druidic Ritual
text: Bone, root, and seed—the past, the present, and future in one handful of earth.

name: Mirror Mockery
text: Who you are constantly runs toward who you will be.

name: Oathsworn Vampire
text: "Neither time nor death could keep me from upholding our pact."

name: Gnarlback Rhino
text:
"I think it's trying to tell us that the forest is angry."
—Vivien Reid

name: Leonin Arbiter
text: "Our people are torn by infighting. Until the two sides reconcile, our laws can carry no meaning."

name: Poisonbelly Ogre
text: Some claim it's a failed Simic experiment, others say a Golgari creation. Both guilds deny all responsibility, while secretly studying its strange virulence.

name: Pyroblast
text:
"Just the thing for those pesky water mages."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Dusk Charger
text: Stories say demon blood runs in its veins, making it fearless and bloodthirsty.

name: Sphinx of the Final Word
text: He answers questions as readily as he asks them, but his answer is always "no."

name: Enslave
text: Phyrexia extended its command until there was nothing left to take.

name: Shell Skulkin
text: Skulkins confer strange benefits on unsuspecting patrons.

name: Oversold Cemetery
text:
"Of course we can squeeze in a few more! It's not like corpses need personal space."
—Orson, cemetery baron

name: Anvilwrought Raptor
text:
"I know its lightness, for I have seen it fly. I know its weight, for I have seen it strike."
—Brigone, soldier of Meletis

name: Mysteries of the Deep
text:
"The Roil is destructive, but not random. It's Zendikar's way of revealing secrets."
—Ilori, merfolk falconer

name: True Conviction
text:
"Now light our darkest hour."
—Rodimus Prime

name: Enfeeblement
text:
"If it is weak, either kill it or ignore it. Anything else honors it."
—Kaervek

name: Island
text: Alarmed by the news you brought, the storm giant king of the Maelstrom has called his kin to council.

name: Wildslayer Elves
text: Some elves battled too long in the deep shadow, their swords dipped too often in tainted flesh and poisoned blood.

name: Seeker of the Way
text: "I don't know where my destiny lies, but I know it isn't here."

name: Ingot Chewer
text: Elementals are ideas given form. This one is the idea of "smashitude."

name: Cryptek
text: There are those who draw false comparisons between the tech-magi of the Adeptus Mechanicus and the xenotechnologists of the necron race. There can be no mercy for such heretics.

name: Academy Loremaster
text: As a young student, she dusted the shelves of Tolaria's great library. Now, she writes the books that line them.

name: Fiendish Duo
text: 大きさは半分、悪事は二倍。

name: Feign Death
text: A drastic measure for dangerous times.

name: Scion of Glaciers
text:
"There is nothing so free as the spring river born of winter's ice."
—Nitula, the Hunt Caller

name: Liquimetal Coating
text:
"They'll soon become accustomed to wearing skin that is not their own."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

name: Archdemon of Unx
text: The necropolis at Unx was once a living city, its streets untrodden by death.

name: Mardu Blazebringer
text:
"Make sure he's pointed in the right direction before you light him. And don't let the goblins anywhere near the torch."
—Kerai Suddenblade, Mardu hordechief

name: Ornithopter
text: Many scholars believe that these creatures were the result of Urza's first attempt at mechanical life, perhaps created in his early days as an apprentice to Tocasia.

name: Late to Dinner
text: "I knew you were set in your ways, friend, but even I didn't expect you to keep our engagement, under the circumstances."

name: Soul Rend
text:
"Since I cannot stop death, I choose to stop life."
—Kaervek

name: Scorchwalker
text:
"Borborygmos's elemental launched an assault, but the Izzet wards held and experiments continue."
—Skyknight report on the Rubblebelt

name: Smother
text:
"Before I hire new recruits, I test how long they can hold their breath. You'd be surprised how often it comes up."
—Zahr Gada, Halimar expedition leader

name: Sedge Scorpion
text:
Thakolides the Mighty
Slayer of minotaurs
Vanquisher of giants
Killed by a scorpion
—Inscription on an Akroan grave

name: Yosei, the Morning Star
text: The caress of the morning star frees all from the clutch of darkness.

name: Multani
text: In mentoring apprentice mages, the forest spirit Multani teaches each to respect nature while making use of its gifts. Multani taught Gerrard, Mirri, and Rofellos to hone their spellcasting in tandem with more physical disciplines so that both would be improved.

name: Warmonger Hellkite
text: Its wings beat to the howls of war and fan the fires of rage.

name: Diabolic Vision
text:
"I have seen the true path. I will not warm myself by the fire—I will become the flame."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Latulla, Keldon Overseer
text:
"Everything around her suffers."
—Haddad, Kipamu soldier

name: Stonecoil Serpent
text: Cast out of Garenbrig for his crimes, Ennor turned to fae magic to fashion the perfect weapon for his revenge.

name: Crown of Flames
text:
"All my life I've fought these monsters. Today I finish that fight."
—Barrin

name: Strider Harness
text:
"Sometimes being fast is as important as being smart."
—Ryza, Oran-Rief scout

name: Orcish Artillery
text: In a rare display of ingenuity, the Orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most Orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.

name: Face of Fear
text:
"It's only frightened five people to death. Not my best work."
—Braids, dementia summoner

name: Molten Birth
text:
"Few can coax the creatures within the magma to be cooled and take form."
—Koth of the Hammer

name: Guardian of the Guildpact
text: The magic of the Guildpact gives aegis to the spirits pressed into its service. Upon entering the afterlife, they find new focus and are charged with defending the Guildpact against those who would see it broken.

name: Emmessi Tome
text: It is like life and destiny: we think we know the story, but we have read only half the tale.

name: Barbed Sliver
text: Spans of spines leapt from one sliver to the next, forming a deadly hedge around the Weatherlight.

name: Champion's Helm
text: Adi Thandray designed this helm as a tribute to his mentor, the great Daljit Gavaskar.

name: Drafna's Restoration
text: Drafna, founder of the College of Lat-Nam, could create a working model from even the smallest remnants of a newly unearthed artifact.

name: Serra Angel
text: The angel remembers her past lives like dreams. Her song held up meadows. Her blade drove back darkness. Her wings carried her across the ages.

name: Symbiotic Elf
text: The elves arriving in Wirewood had no homes, let alone weapons, but they knew that the forest would always provide.

name: Spiritual Asylum
text: Trapped in safety is still trapped.

name: Air Elemental
text:
"The East Wind, an interloper in the dominions of Westerly Weather, is an impassive-faced tyrant with a sharp poniard held behind his back for a treacherous stab."
—Joseph Conrad, *The Mirror of the Sea*

name: Cast into Darkness
text: In desperation the soldier prayed to Phenax, begging for the power to cheat the gorgon's gaze.

name: Nightsquad Commando
text: "The big fella sounds hungry. Let's send him to bed without his supper."

name: Plaguebearer
text: Its respiration is your expiration.

name: Umbral Juke
text: The sport of Mage Tower was conceived as a playful testing ground for young spellcasters.

name: Overrun
text:
"You want to know your enemy? Look at your feet while you trample him."
—Tahngarth of the *Weatherlight*

name: Mountain Goat
text:
"Folklore has it that to capture a mountain goat is a sign of divine blessing. I just know it's a sign that dinner is on the way."
—Klazina Jansdotter, Leader of the Order of the Sacred Torch

name: Charity Extractor
text: "War or no war, your donations are due, as always."

name: Wooded Foothills
text: Where dragons' breath once burned, their bones now freeze.

name: Accelerate
text:
"I've seen lightning move slower."
—Nomad sentry

name: Goblin Electromancer
text: When asked how much power is required, Izzet mages always answer "more."

name: Thopter Mechanic
text: "You want me to install a seat belt? Please. You're lucky to get a seat!"

name: Lancer Sliver
text:
"These polearms were supposed to help!"
—Merrik Aidar, Benalish patrol

name: Syphon Mind
text: When tempers run high, it's easy to lose your head.

name: Hero's Heirloom
text:
"A blade is just a tool. Its power comes from the hand that wields it."
—Danitha

name: Runechanter's Pike
text:
"Harmonic resonance infusions amplify the natural abilities of the song mages of Smifa."
—Drafna, research notes

name: Screeching Harpy
text:
"They are called 'fowl' for a reason."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

name: Cao Ren, Wei Commander
text: Cao Cao's cousin, Cao Ren was known throughout the three kingdoms as the fiercest of warriors.

name: Rootwater Commando
text: Rootwater merfolk are seldom seen these days, but elf corpses are as numerous as ever.

name: Sacred Peaks
text: Everyone is welcome in the floating Serran cities, though few but the most faithful attempt the ascent.

name: Smash to Smithereens
text:
"All these old relics have one thing in common. Every last one of them is made of smithereens."
—Zada of Slab Haven

name: Arcbound Worker
text: The parts are as strong as the whole.

name: Academic Dispute
text: "I'll show you original research, you hack!"

name: Fertile Ground
text: Pretty, valuable, and delicious—a boggart thief's trifecta.

name: Lucky Offering
text: The playful kami reserved its greatest blessings for those who brought not wealth or rare delicacies, but particularly amusing trinkets.

name: Angel's Tomb
text:
"Faith can quicken the stones themselves with life."
—Writings of Mikaeus

name: Tocasia's Welcome
text: "Your father was a dear friend to whom I owe much. He wanted me to look after you, to care for you should something happen to him."

name: Commence the Endgame
text:
"Even gods shall kneel."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Putrefaction
text:
"Do you want to be alive or whole?"
—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer

name: Hedron Archive
text: "You've begun to understand the hedrons' true purpose," said Ugin. "The Eldrazi can be imprisoned.""And how did that work out last time?" asked Jace.

name: Cultivate
text:
"You'd be amazed how much a single plant has to teach you."
—Lisette, Witherbloom dean

name: Glacial Crevasses
text:
"We were chasing Lim-Dûl when the ridge in front of us suddenly crumbled. I can't believe it was mere coincidence."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Copper Gnomes
text: Start with eleven gnomes and a room of parts, and come morning you'll have ten and a monster the likes of which you've never seen.

name: Sister Repentia
text:
"I shall seek the Emperor's forgiveness in the darkest places of the night."
—Oath the Penitent

name: Volcanic Geyser
text: "The mountain's fire surges beneath your feet, demanding release. Can you not feel it?"

name: Joiner Adept
text: A talented apprentice makes all things. The master makes all things possible.

name: Wandermare
text:
"A good steed will carry you home. A great steed will carry you to glory."
—Syr Alin, the Lion's Claw

name: Swimmer in Nightmares
text: Ashiok's minions plumb the depths of the ocean and the psyche.

name: Thran Turbine
text: When Urza asked the viashino what it did, they answered: "It hums."

name: Hermit of the Natterknolls // Lone Wolf of the Natterknolls
text: . . . but he'll have you for lunch.

name: Radiant Grace // Radiant Restraints
text:
"Even in times of brutal darkness, never mistake beauty and delicacy for weakness."
—Thalia, Guardian of Thraben

name: Scaled Wurm
text:
"Flourishing during the Ice Age, these Wurms were the bane of all Kjeldorans. Their great size and ferocity made them the subject of countless nightmares—they embodied the worst of the Ice Age."
—*Kjeldor: Ice Civilization*

name: Murasa Pyromancer
text: "Fire is my accomplice. For enough coin, it can be yours as well."

name: Mistform Mutant
text: Familiarity, the first myth of reality: What you know the best, you observe the least.

name: Aura Finesse
text:
"Although armor and auras can be similar, the brains required to use them are worlds apart."
—Zilan, Makindi auramancer

name: Ophidian
text:
"I will . . . tell thee more than thou hast wit to ask."
—Christopher Marlowe, *Doctor Faustus*

name: Roller Coaster
text: The Time Spiral goes so fast it causes a paradox. Myra uses this opportunity to sell guests their souvenir photos while they're still waiting to board.

name: Neutralizing Blast
text: "To defeat your enemies, you must remove their ability to make war against you."

name: Chromatic Lantern
text: Dimir mages put the lanterns to good use, creating shapeshifters and sleeper agents from mana foreign to them.

name: Sphere of Resistance
text:
"At the outset, we weren't aware of Chief Baral's motives for the project. It's now apparent that he intends to use the device to hamper the 'mages' among the ranks of the renegades."
—Consulate engineer's log

name: Saproling Migration
text: Thallids herd saprolings from place to place in search of detritus to feed them.

name: Icy Manipulator
text: In fire there is the spark of chaos and destruction, the seed of life. In ice there is perfect tranquility, perfect order, and the silence of death.

name: Cinderheart Giant
text: What fire giants lack in arcane prowess, they make up for with reckless, explosive rage.

name: Subterranean Spirit
text:
"Air hot with sulfur. / Earth heaves beneath me. / Could it be the mountain / ate something bad?"
—Dwarven mining song

name: Drag Under
text: Some took to their boats to escape the unfolding nightmare. The remains of their vessels now litter the shores of Nephalia.

name: Cherished Hatchling
text: Despite its appearance, it's anything but defenseless.

name: Storm of Souls
text: Devotion does not end with death.

name: Heart of Light
text: For those who reach enlightenment, violence is an unnecessary distraction.

name: Feast or Famine
text:
"We are not yet free of Lim-Dûl's terrors."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Mishra's Domination
text: Power radiated from the Weakstone, binding the dragon engine to Mishra's command.

name: Tome Shredder
text:
"Quintorius, would you care to explain why you didn't complete your homework?"
—Augusta, Lorehold dean

name: Tectonic Reformation
text: Alone in the charred desolation of her kingdom, she regretted many things—most of all not acting sooner.

name: Sylvan Ranger
text: "Not all paths are found on the forest floor."

name: Overwhelming Forces
text: By the year 208, Cao Cao commanded more than 1,000 experienced generals and a million infantry, cavalry, and naval troops.

name: Kazandu Blademaster
text: "If you hire a sell-sword, you'd better watch your back. Hire me, and I'll watch it for you."

name: Corsair Captain
text: "Lungs full of sea air and a hold full of loot. Ah, what a life!"

name: Accorder's Shield
text: An Auriok shield is polished to a mirror finish even on the inside, enabling its bearer to watch foes ahead and behind.

name: Jinxed Idol
text: "Here."

name: Dromoka, the Eternal
text:
"The bane of countless shattered weapons, each a failure to slay her."
—Daghatar the Adamant

name: Tangled Florahedron // Tangled Vale
text:
"We would do well to open our eyes and remember what it is to wonder."
—Doral, Bala Ged guide

name: Blazing Crescendo
text:
"They call themselves the Quiet Furnace? Ironic."
—Tyvar

name: Orzhov Keyrune
text: You only need to wield it once to appreciate the power of control.

name: Kavu Chameleon
text:
"They weren't part of my plan, but Gaea insisted."
—Urza

name: Dragonlord Dromoka
text: Dromoka's followers forsake blood ties so that they may join a greater family.

name: Lumengrid Augur
text: Information pumps like blood through vedalken society.

name: Ironhoof Ox
text: The good news is it's vegetarian. The bad news is it just doesn't like you.

name: Strongarm Thug
text: "No, I insist—let *me* carry all that heavy jewelry."

name: Mawcor
text: From its maw comes neither word nor whisper—only wind.

name: Big Winner
text: The results of the test of strength were: Yes.

name: Leaf Dancer
text: A leaf dancer sweeps through the forest like a spring breeze, evading even the sharpest eyes and ears.

name: Inquisition
text: Many of those entrusted to Primata Delphine's care tended to express themselves with screams.

name: Chandra's Outrage
text:
"There's plenty of fire to go around."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Pride of Lions
text: There's only one thing worse than a hungry lion—many hungry lions.

name: Condescend
text: "Shame we'll never see what all the fuss was about."

name: Gift of Orzhova
text:
"Remember by whose gift you ascend."
—Milana, Orzhov prelate

name: Raging Poltergeist
text: Some tried cremating their dead to stop the ghoulcallers. But the dead returned, furious about their fate.

name: Optimus Prime, Inspiring Leader
text: "Roll out!"

name: There Is No Refuge
text: "The dunes smell spilled blood."

name: Stalking Vengeance
text: Something roams the killing places, sniffing the guilt of the slayers, stalking them on iron paws.

name: Hanweir Watchkeep // Bane of Hanweir
text: Technically he never left his post. He looks after the wolf wherever it goes.

name: Barrier Breach
text:
"They cast wards, thinking it will protect them, but the biggest monsters find a way through."
—Kinnan, bonder prodigy

name: Primoc Escapee
text: Though a completely artificial species, primocs are a natural fit for the skies of Otaria.

name: Malicious Malfunction
text:
"That? A minor test, nothing more. Incompleat flesh is weak."
—Jin-Gitaxias

name: Military Intelligence
text: To know the battlefield is to anticipate the enemy. To know the enemy is to anticipate victory.

name: Urza's Incubator
text:
"In my dark moments, I think Urza may have been more of a father to his creations than he ever was to his own son."
—Tawnos

name: Explosive Impact
text:
"Such boorish noise is what passes for subtlety among the Boros."
—Vraska

name: Vial of Dragonfire
text:
"The artificer assured me that the vial is strong enough to contain the dragon's breath. I just need to make sure to throw it far enough."
—Kunh Mei, last words

name: Auramancer
text: "In memories, we can find our deepest reserves of strength."

name: Consider
text: Ivold gasped in surprise. Either a very strange insect had crawled onto one of the lenses or he was seeing geists at last!

name: Flying Carpet
text: "Wheeeeeeeeeeeeeee!"

name: Death's Shadow
text: It's said that death mourns every soul it claims and lovingly crafts a mask for each of the departed.

name: Darkslick Shores
text: Where curiosity meets cruelty, hideous innovations arise.

name: Riveteers Overlook
text: Along the outer girders, in gold filigree, are inscribed the names of all those who fell to their deaths during construction.

name: Tempered Sliver
text: The question isn't whether slivers will adapt to a world's perils but whether the world's perils will adapt to slivers.

name: Barrenton Medic
text: His dreams are filled with noxious powders and clinking vials.

name: Goblin Cavaliers
text: They get along so well with their goats because they're practically goats themselves.

name: Relief Captain
text: Sometimes gestures of support are small. Sometimes not.

name: Gaea's Cradle
text: 2022 Asia Legacy Championship

name: Curious Pair // Treats to Share
text: "It's gingerbread, like Mother makes. What is there to be afraid of?"

name: Reef Pirates
text:
"Corpses for crew don't sit well with me. Zeki and his dead ship had best keep their distance."
—Joskun, An-Havva Constable

name: Winnow
text:
"Strength in numbers? I think not."
—Gerrard

name: On Serra's Wings
text:
"The spirit of Serra raised Brindri high and commanded her to keep the balance."
—*Song of All*, canto 524

name: Zombie Scavengers
text:
"Pick a shell upon my shore and put it to your ear. That sound isn't the sea, but the whispers of the fallen."
—Crovax

name: Iron Verdict
text: "You'll raid nothing but mist in Istfell."

name: Corpseweft
text: Sidisi hated to limit her options.

name: Thought Scour
text:
"Sleep and dream, dream and snore,
While we fae complete our chore."
—Fae rhyme

name: Crazed Armodon
text: These are its last days. Mourning is over. Rage remains.

name: Bone Shaman
text:
Rattle me bones as I cross the floor
And the bones in your grave will rattle no more.

name: Disciple of Law
text: A religious order for religious order.

name: Zealot of the God-Pharaoh
text: The God-Pharaoh's most devoted took it upon themselves to follow his example.

name: Wall of Spears
text: Even the most conservative generals revised their tactics after the Battle of Sarinth, during which a handful of peasant-pikemen held off a trio of rampaging craw wurms.

name: Keeper of the Lens
text:
"It sees all, but it reveals what it sees only to a chosen few."
—Taigam, Ojutai master

name: Absorb
text: "It's a shame to see such potential wasted on petty evil. Let's correct that, shall we?"

name: Combat Medic
text:
"Without Combat Medics, Icatia would probably not have withstood the forces of chaos as long as it did."
—*Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI*

name: Argivian Find
text:
"We often bury our pasts, and then someone comes along and digs them up."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Thrashing Wumpus
text: Young wumpuses are malevolent and vicious—but they grow out of it.

name: Hero of Iroas
text: "My left has felled a cyclops. My right has slain a giant. I bring both to every fight."

name: Sultai Flayer
text: "You can have the body, necromancer. I just want the skin."

name: Corrupt
text: The power of the fens sleeps lightly, and always awakens hungry.

name: Giant Turtle
text:
"The turtle lives 'twixt plated decks/ Which practically conceal its sex./ I think it clever of the turtle/ In such a fix to be so fertile."
—Ogden Nash, "The Turtle"

name: Honeymoon Hearse
text: A carriage crafted from the finest materials. Horses bred from the finest stock. Skulls taken from the finest foes.

name: Krovikan Mist
text:
"It's as strong as you believe it is, and it's very convincing."
—Jace Beleren

name: Reprisal
text:
"The meek shall fight as one, and they shall overcome even the greatest of foes."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Puppet Strings
text: "Have no illusions," Volrath warned Greven, "about free will."

name: Dockside Extortionist
text: The fine print is illegible scribbles, but it is legally binding.

name: Matopi Golem
text: Some potmakers claim to use the mud of such creatures to make their finest bowls—and that the bowls scream when fired.

name: Furious Resistance
text:
"At least the Gateless rebels have ideals. Rakdos just mocks, defiles, and kills all we hold dear."
—Libuse, Boros sergeant

name: Burrenton Forge-Tender
text: "We are a clachan of smiths. The forge is as comfortable to us as a small fire during a cool winter's evening."

name: Grave Titan
text: Death in form and function.

name: Whispers of Emrakul
text: Your thoughts are no longer your own.

name: Annul
text:
"Why pray to the gods, who feed on your worship? Dissolve your illusions and see the true nature of things."
—Xenagos, the Reveler

name: Expedition Map
text:
"I use maps to find out where explorers have already been. Then I go the other way."
—Javad Nasrin, Ondu relic hunter

name: Terminate
text:
"I've seen death before. My mother succumbing to illness, my comrades bleeding on the battlefield . . . But I'd never seen anything as dreadful as that."
—Taani, berserker of Etlan

name: Bramblecrush
text:
"Civilization is fertilizer."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Storm the Citadel
text:
"If we die, we die. But we cannot let him win."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Automatic Librarian
text: Enforcing absolute quiet with extreme prejudice since 3285 AR.

name: Meddle
text: Strength may win the fight, but style wins the crowd.

name: Clutch of Undeath
text: The hand of death recognizes its own.

name: Winged Sliver
text:
"Everything around here has cut a deal with gravity."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

name: Rarity
text: "I simply cannot let crimes against fabulosity go uncorrected."

name: Silklash Spider
text: The only thing that flies over the Krosan Forest is the wind.

name: Halimar Tidecaller
text: "Quiet the waves? Why would I want to do that?"

name: Filigree Fracture
text: The sphinx tyrannized Bant until a rhox mage tested the hardiness of her shiny parts.

name: Thassa's Rebuff
text: To resist Thassa is to deny the rising tide.

name: Street Urchin
text: Your harsh upbringing on the streets of the city left you crafty, resilient, and wise beyond your years.

name: Familiar's Ruse
text: Because of their capricious nature, faeries can serve as living lenses for disruptive magic.

name: Invoke the Ancients
text: After large sections were clear-cut to build Towashi, the once-peaceful Jukai Forest grew violently hostile to outsiders.

name: Deepwood Elder
text: They'd guarded the Henge so long that they were as attuned to the powerstones as they were to the trees.

name: Ceremonial Guard
text:
"These guards are the most disciplined military unit in the city. They couldn't fight their way out of a broom closet, but they've got discipline."
—Gerrard, to Sisay

name: Tranquility
text:
"Peace will come, but whether born of harmony or entropy I cannot say."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

name: Diligent Excavator
text: Archaeologists don't just dig in the dirt. They excavate time, scraping off the years grain by grain.

name: Auriok Champion
text:
"Her will shall banish the shadows. Her might shall punish the lawless. Her beauty shall restore the light."
—Ushanti, leonin seer

name: Overmaster
text: "My, what a pretty little trick. At least you'll die with style."

name: Unburial Rites
text: All crave the Blessed Sleep. Few receive it.

name: Sylvan Brushstrider
text: The mournful lowing of brushstriders warns of changing weather and ill winds.

name: Retrieval Agent
text: The humming tome burned his leather glove, nearly taking his hand along with it. Then a strange power coursed through him.

name: Windswept Heath
text: Where dragons once roared, their bones now keen.

name: Thornglint Bridge
text: The path to growth is forged in balance.

name: Veiled Crocodile
text: Some roads are paved with bad intentions.

name: Ornithopter
text:
"It has been my honor to improve on Thran's original design. Perhaps history will remember me in some small part for my work."
—Urza, in his apprenticeship

name: Dosan the Falling Leaf
text:
"Each night as Master Dosan prays to the kami, the hate he receives in return withers his body a little more. Though the kami are slowly killing him, still he continues his prayers."
—Meditation journal of a young budoka

name: King of the Pride
text: His kind were once hunted to near-extinction. Now, under his protection, they rule the savannah.

name: Scuzzback Scrapper
text: The Scuzzback gang scavenges rusty armor covered in barbed protrusions. No threat is more effective than the threat of infection.

name: Pariah
text: "It is *not* sad," Radiant chided the lesser angel. "It is right. Every society must have its outcasts."

name: Greatbow Doyen
text: "My arrows will ever find you."

name: Pulse of Murasa
text: "Little flower twirl and bloom, arise from this your rocky tomb. Little warrior slash and brawl, be born again to free us all."

name: No Mercy
text: "If you wish to assassinate a master assassin, you'll have to do better than that."

name: Fierce Retribution
text: "It won't bring them back, but it will bring me peace."

name: Cobblebrute
text: The most ancient streets take on a life of their own. A few have decided to move to nicer neighborhoods.

name: Chariot of the Sun
text:
"Sun follows Moon until she tires, then carries her until she's strong / and runs ahead of him again."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Charging Tuskodon
text: It doesn't hold grudges. It runs them down and impales them.

name: Evolving Door
text: In with the old, out with the new.

name: Dance with Calamity
text: It was just another day on Innistrad.

name: Feast of the Unicorn
text:
"Could there be a fouler act? No doubt the baron knows of one."
—Autumn Willow

name: Mephitic Vapors
text: Ravnica's safest strongholds are often neither.

name: Volcanic Spite
text: None may approach the Ashen Idol without an offering—an edict fortuitously absent from Phyrexian intelligence concerning the world of Azgol.

name: Mothdust Changeling
text:
"Ever seen a changeling fly into a lantern?"
—Calydd, kithkin farmer

name: Slavering Nulls
text: Having lost their minds, they now want yours.

name: Fossil Find
text:
"Some secrets want to be revealed. They burst through the soil of their own accord."
—Dindun of Kulrath Mine

name: Bog Imp
text: On guard for larger dangers, we underestimated the power and speed of the Imp's muck-crusted claws.

name: Candles of Leng
text:
"A tome stored in its light is as crisp as the day it was written."
—Ettovard, Tolarian archivist

name: Devkarin Dissident
text: "This is Mileva, in the Tenth. We've got an elf in the plaza with a chip on her shoulder. Actually, it's more of a morningstar."

name: Fiery Impulse
text: "Well, this got out of hand."

name: Ivory Guardians
text:
"But who is to guard the guards themselves?"
—Juvenal, *Satires*

name: Wrath of Marit Lage
text: Dread Marit Lage lies dreaming, not dead.

name: Banishing Knack
text: Suddenly he realized that everything was connected by invisible strings, strings that could be pulled—or cut.

name: Pyretic Ritual
text: The Multiverse is filled with limitless power just waiting for someone to reach out and seize it.

name: Gruul Keyrune
text: As perilous and unpredictable as the wilds themselves.

name: Raging Regisaur
text: Its breath is a gale. Its roar is a volcano. Its anger tears soul from flesh.

name: Distorting Lens
text:
"The Eye altering alters all."
—William Blake, "The Mental Traveller"

name: Act of Treason
text:
"Rage courses in every heart, yearning to betray its rational prison."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Stitcher's Supplier
text:
"Heel! Wait, no—fetch the whole leg!"
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Undead Slayer
text: "My motive is not vengeance but mercy. I deliver the soulless back to their severed souls."

name: Unsummon
text: Not to be. That is the answer.

name: Fell the Mighty
text: The battle began with an overwhelming wave of Tyranids and ended with Canoness Lucretia standing atop a huge pile of charred alien corpses.

name: Generous Visitor
text: It is said that one must modestly refuse a gift three times before accepting it to show humility before the kami.

name: Lier, Disciple of the Drowned
